
000 
FXUS64 KMRX 010305
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 PM EST MON DEC 31 2007

.DISCUSSION...A COLD FRONT WILL TRACK ACROSS THE REGION 
TONIGHT...INCREASING WINDS ACROSS THE AREA.  BREEZY TO LOCALLY WINDY 
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED WITH NORMALLY FAVORED LOCATIONS SEEING 20 TO 
NEAR 30 MPH SUSTAINED AND GUST OF 35 MPG...LOCALLY 40 MPG POSSIBLE.  
LACK OF MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT WILL LIMIT PRECIP. WITH 
MUCH COLDER AIR FILLING IN BEHIND THE FRONT...PRECIP MAY BEGIN AS 
RAIN BUT WILL SWITCH OVER TO SNOW...MAINLY FLURRIES.  THE AREA WITH 
THE BEST CHANCE OF SNOW WILL BE FAR NORTHERN LOCATIONS AND OVER 
HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW WILL AID IN THE DYNAMICS.  NO 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED BUT SOME FAVORED LOCATIONS COULD SEE A 
DUSTING BY SUNRISE.  ALL LOOKS GOOD THE CURRENT FORECAST WILL UPDATE 
TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN    32  42  21  35  17/  10  10   0  0  0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN      31  38  21  26  15/  20  20  30  10  0 
OAK RIDGE, TN              31  38  20  29  15/  40  20  20  10  0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN     28  36  19  24  15/  20  30  60  40  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
     AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

VA...NONE.
&&

$$

MJB

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 312028
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EST MON DEC 31 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND NEW YEARS DAY)...A COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED 
TO PUSH INTO THE CWA TONIGHT BRINGING SCATTERED PRECIPITATION AND 
BREEZY CONDITIONS TONIGHT.  BEST CHANCES SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...BUT ADDED LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE EVENING HOURS FOR OUR 
WESTERN COUNTIES WITH BETTER CHANCES FOR THE REST OF THE CWA AFTER 
MIDNIGHT AS THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH.  THICKNESS ANALYSIS INDICATE 
PRECIPITATION THIS EVENING WILL BE LIQUID AND CHANGING TO SNOW 
OVERNIGHT AS COLD AIR FILTERS IN BEHIND THE FRONT.  FRONT IS EAST OF 
THE AREA BY TUESDAY MORNING BUT A DEEP SHORTWAVE APPROACHES ON 
TUESDAY AFTERNOON.  WILL KEEP THE HIGHEST POPS IN THE NORTH WHERE 
THE BEST MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  WITH THE COLD AIR IN PLACE...SHOULD 
BE ALL SNOW ON TUESDAY.  THE BEST SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD HOLD OFF 
UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT.  WITH THE STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION EXPECTED... 
STAYED BELOW MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MAIN WEATHER FEATURE 
WILL BE COLD AIR POURING INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY. FAST MOVING ALBERTA-CLIPPER SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TUESDAY NIGHT BRING WITH IT
COLDER AIR ALOFT. THE COLDER AIR ALOFT WILL STEEPEN THE LOW LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES WITH CAPES OF 50-100 J/KG PRODUCING SCATTERED-BROKEN 
SNOW SHOWERS. THE WAVE WILL ALSO STRENGTHEN THE NORTHWEST FLOW INTO 
THE MOUNTAINS ENHANCING NORTHWEST SNOWFALL. BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE 
IS SUFFICIENT TO PRODUCE 3 TO 5 INCH SNOWFALLS FOR THE NORTH AND 
CENTRAL EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE LOCALIZED 6 INCHES 
AT PLACES LIKE MOUNT LECONTE. WILL ISSUE A WINTER STORM WATCH FOR 
THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.

ELSEWHERE...SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS AND OCCASIONAL FLURRIES 
ANTICIPATED WITH LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING. WAVE MOVES QUICKLY EAST WEDNESDAY WITH 
SKIES BECOMING CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY FOR CHA EARLY...THEN TYS 
DURING THE AFTERNOON. EVEN SO...COLD 850MB TEMPERATURES BETWEEN -15 
AND -20C WILL PRODUCE BONE-CHILLING COLD. ADDING BRISK NORTHWEST 
WINDS IN THE MIX PRODUCES WIND CHILLS OF 8 TO 18 DEGREES ACROSS THE 
LOWER ELEVATIONS TO MINUS 5 TO 15 DEGREES C FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

ADVISORY FOR WIND AND POSSIBLE WIND CHILLS MAY BE REQUIRED FOR THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN...BESIDES THE SNOWFALL. WILL HIGHLIGHT IN AN SPS FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

AS SHORT-WAVE LIFTS NORTHEAST SO WILL LONG-WAVE TROUGH FOR THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY. A MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES IN STORE FOR THE LATER HALF 
OF THE WEEK AS THE UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL WITH A SERIES OF 
WEAK SHORT-WAVES MOVING ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
LITTLE TO NO PRECIPITATION IS ANTICIPATED GIVEN CONTINUED DRY AIR 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  32  42  21  35  17/  10  10   0  0  0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  31  38  21  26  15/  20  20  30  10  0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  31  38  20  29  15/  40  20  20  10  0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  28  36  19  24  15/  20  30  60  40  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
     AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

VA...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 311509
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1009 AM EST MON DEC 31 2007

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT SURFACE OBSERVATIONS INDICATING PATCHY DENSE 
FOG STILL OCCURRING AT A FEW SITES IN THE CWA.  BUT WITH THE DRIER 
AIR EXPECTED THE FOG SHOULD DISSIPATE SHORTLY.  WILL UPDATE ZONE 
FORECAST TO REMOVE MORNING FOG.  THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST 
APPEARS ON TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER THIS 
MORNING FOLLOWING YESTERDAYS LIGHT RAINFALL AND CLOUDY/DREARY 
CONDITIONS. HOWEVER...SEEMS TO BE JUST ENOUGH LIGHT W OR SW WINDS IN 
SOME LOCATIONS TO INHIBIT FOG FROM BECOMING WIDESPREAD...AND ALSO 
LOW CLOUD DECK IN TRI VICINITY HAS HINDERED FOG DEVELOPMENT. 
THUS...I OPTED AGAINST A DENSE FOG ADVISORY THIS MORNING...BUT WILL 
CARRY PATCHY DENSE FOG IN ZONES AND ISSUED A SHORT TERM FORECAST FOR 
THE FOG.

CERTAINLY MUCH MORE SUNSHINE ON TAP FOR TODAY...WITH MOS MAX TEMPS 
QUITE CLOSE AND ACCEPTED. INTERESTING WEATHER EVENT BEGINS LATE 
TONIGHT...BUT DONT SEE A GREAT THREAT OF ANY SIGNIFICANT WINTRY 
PRECIPITATION (PCPN) UNTIL AFTER 12Z TUESDAY...SO TRIMMED BACK POPS 
JUST A BIT FOR LATE TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY IN CENTRAL AND NRN VALLEY 
COUNTIES OF EAST TN. IN FACT...SNOW ACCUMULATIONS COULD BE DELAYED 
UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING AND OVERNIGHT...WHEN STRONG SHORTWAVE/VORT MAX 
SWINGS ACROSS. MOS MINS TEMP ALSO VERY CLOSE WITH NO REASON TO STRAY 
FROM.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAIN FORECAST PROBLEM IS
COLD AND NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS BEHIND INITIAL COLD FRONT EARLY 
TUESDAY. FLOW IS INITIALLY FROM THE SOUTHWEST AS LONG WAVE TROUGH 
SINKS SOUTH THROUGH THE MS VALLEY AND THEN THE TN VALLEY BY LATE IN 
THE DAY AND EVENING. BEST CHANCE FOR ACCUMULATION AFTER THE WARM 
TEMPERATURES OF LATE WILL BE TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY AS 
TEMPERATURES DROP BELOW FREEZING AND UPPER FLOW SHIFTS TO THE NW. 
WIND CHILL TEMPERATURES ALSO DROP BELOW ZERO IN SW VA AND HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AS NW WINDS INCREASE AND TEMPERATURES DROP INTO THE 
TEENS. LOOKS LIKE SNOW ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR PARTS OF THE AREA AND 
WARNINGS IN THE NE TN MOUNTAINS AND PARTS OF SW VA TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. WILL ISSUE SPS TO HIGHLIGHT SNOW AND COLD 
TEMPERATURES. WIND ADVISORY ALSO MAY BE REQUIRED TUESDAY AND TUESDAY 
NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE AT SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL MODIFY COLD AIRMASS 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS TROUGH MOVES EAST. NEXT SYSTEM WILL SPREAD 
CLOUDS AND CHANCE OF RAIN TO AREA SUNDAY.     
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

$$

GH/TG/TD

.DISCUSSION...CONTINUING TO SEE A FEW PATCHES OF VERY LIGHT RAIN AND 
SPRINKLES ACROSS FAR EASTERN AND NORTHERN AREAS.  THIS SHOULD END 
OVERNIGHT AS A SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN.  ALL ON TRACK IN THE CURRENT

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 302046
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 PM EST SUN DEC 30 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BUILD IN FROM THE SW TONIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY BEFORE SLIDING 
EAST MONDAY EVENING. DEEPENING EASTERN TROUGH THROUGH THE REMAINDER 
OF THE PERIOD. DEVELOPING SFC LOW MOVES EAST ACROSS OHIO MONDAY WITH 
COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON MONDAY NGT.
PCPN WILL LIKELY START OFF AS RAIN BUT CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW BY 
TUESDAY MORNING. TEMPERATURE AND MOISTURE PROFILE ARE FAVORABLE FOR 
DECENT SNOW PRODUCTION BEHIND THE FRONT THROUGH THE PERIOD. VERY 
COLD AIR WITH H85 TEMPS BELOW -10C MOVES INTO THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT 
AS TROUGH DEEPENS. WINDS WILL BE STRONG AIDING UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS 
AND DRIVING WIND CHILLS BELOW ZERO ACROSS ELEVATED AREAS. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SHORTWAVE CONTINUES 
TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...WITH MOISTURE LINGERING 
ACROSS THE AREA...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES ACROSS OUR NORTHERN AREAS AND THE MOUNTAINS ON WEDNESDAY.  
THICKNESS ANALYSIS INDICATE SNOW CONTINUING...MAINLY ACROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS.  SHORTWAVE EXITS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  MOISTURE 
LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SO KEPT LOW POPS FOR THE NORTHERN 
AREAS AND THE MOUNTAINS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  A WEAK SHORTWAVE 
PASSES THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY...MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO KEPT 
SATURDAY DRY.  A FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA ON SUNDAY...WITH STILL 
SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING... WILL ADD ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SUNDAY.  STAYED NEAR MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.   
    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  31  59  32  43  22 /  10   0  10  10  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  33  55  32  37  20 /  10  10  30  20  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN  32  54  31  38  20 /  10  10  40  20  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  29  53  29  35  17 /  10   0  40  30  40

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 301559
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST SUN DEC 30 2007

.DISCUSSION...RAIN SHIELD WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST THIS AFTERNOON. 
UPDATED TODAYS FORECAST TO INCREASE CLOUDS AND LOWER MAX TEMPS A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WATCHING RAIN/SHOWERS DEVELOPING 
TO OUR SOUTH ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES...WHILE MAINLY JUST MID 
AND HIGH CLOUDS REACHING THE FORECAST AREA SO FAR THIS MORNING. THIS 
AREA OF RAIN/SHOWERS IS SPREADING MORE EAST THAN NORTH...BUT MOST 
30/00Z MODELS (AND EVEN ENSEMBLES) SUGGEST LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL 
CLIP PERHAPS ALL BUT FAR NWRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER 
TODAY. DEW POINT TEMPS ONLY IN THE 30S FOR BULK OF THE REGION...AND 
SATURATION OCCURS JUST BRIEFLY LATE THIS MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON 
BEFORE SURFACE LOW MOVES NE ACROSS CAROLINAS AND PULLS AWAY FROM THE 
REGION. HOWEVER...GIVEN 00Z MOS POPS AND NEIGHBORING OFFICES GRIDS 
HAD TO INCREASE POPS FOR TODAY...BUT KEPT A TIGHT GRADIENT FROM JUST 
LOW SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NW TO LOWER END OF LIKELY POPS EXTREME SE TN 
AND SWRN NC. 

OTHERWISE...NEAR GFS MOS OR A BLEND FOR MAX AND MINS TEMPS...ALTHO 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS QUITE CLOSE AND ACCEPTABLE.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MONDAY WILL BE THE NICEST DAY
OF THE WEEK AS BRIEF HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS A SUNNY AND ABOVE NORMAL
DAY THEN LONG WAVE TROUGH DROPS OUT OF CANADA MONDAY EVENING INTO
THE EASTERN US. SEVERAL SHORTWAVES ROTATE AROUND THE BASE OF THE
TROUGH THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY.
THE FIRST SHORTWAVE MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY WILL DRAG A COLD
FRONT ACROSS THE REGION. VERY COLD AIR BEHIND IT WILL DROP
TEMPERATURES TO NEAR FREEZING MONDAY NIGHT AND KEEP HIGHS MOSTLY
30S OR COLDER TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW
MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL NOT BE
SIGNIFICANT INITIALLY DUE TO WARM TEMPERATURES THIS WEEKEND AND
MONDAY. HOWEVER LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE TUESDAY IN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS TEMPERATURES DROP AND STAY LOW. ACCUMULATIONS
SHOULD BE MORE SIGNIFICANT TUESDAY NIGHT AS NW FLOW BEHIND THE
FRONT KICKS IN. TOTAL SNOW AMOUNTS MAY REACH 1 TO 3 INCHES IN SW
VA AND THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN WITH HIGHEST ELEVATIONS EVEN MORE
BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. STRONG NW WINDS WILL PRODUCE WIND CHILLS
BELOW 10 IN THE MOUNTAINS TUESDAY AND BELOW ZERO TUESDAY NIGHT WITH
SINGE DIGITS IN SOME OF THE NORTHERN VALLEYS. A WIND ADVISORY MAY
BE NEEDED MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THE SHORTWAVE ENERGY AND
TROUGH LIFTS OUT LATE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. COLD ARCTIC
HIGH PRESSURE BEHIND UPPER TROUGH WILL SLOWLY MODIFY THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY BUT LOWS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY MORNING WILL BE THE COLDEST
OF THE SEASON IN THE TEENS AND SINGLE DIGITS HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A
NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS FRIDAY NIGHT AND SPREADS CLOUDS
AND RAIN INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY AND WESTERN TN VALLEY SATURDAY.
SOME CLOUDS SPREAD INTO EAST TN BUT PRECIPITATION WILL NOT REACH
FORECAST AREA UNTIL SATURDAY NIGHT. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  53  31  60  32  44 /  60  10   0  30  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    52  33  56  32  38 /  30  10  10  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN            52  32  55  31  39 /  20  10  10  40  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   50  29  53  29  36 /  30  10   0  30  30 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
441 AM EST SUN DEC 30 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WATCHING RAIN/SHOWERS DEVELOPING 
TO OUR SOUTH ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES...WHILE MAINLY JUST MID 
AND HIGH CLOUDS REACHING THE FORECAST AREA SO FAR THIS MORNING.
THIS AREA OF RAIN/SHOWERS IS SPREADING MORE EAST THAN NORTH...BUT
MOST 30/00Z MODELS (AND EVEN ENSEMBLES) SUGGEST LIGHT PRECIPITATION 
WILL CLIP PERHAPS ALL BUT FAR NWRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER 
TODAY. DEW POINT TEMPS ONLY IN THE 30S FOR BULK OF THE REGION...AND 
SATURATION OCCURS JUST BRIEFLY LATE THIS MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON
BEFORE SURFACE LOW MOVES NE ACROSS CAROLINAS AND PULLS AWAY FROM THE 
REGION. HOWEVER...GIVEN 00Z MOS POPS AND NEIGHBORING OFFICES GRIDS 
HAD TO INCREASE POPS FOR TODAY...BUT KEPT A TIGHT GRADIENT FROM JUST 
LOW SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NW TO LOWER END OF LIKELY POPS EXTREME SE TN 
AND SWRN NC. 

OTHERWISE...NEAR GFS MOS OR A BLEND FOR MAX AND MINS TEMPS...ALTHO 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS QUITE CLOSE AND ACCEPTABLE.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MONDAY WILL BE THE NICEST DAY
OF THE WEEK AS BRIEF HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS A SUNNY AND ABOVE NORMAL
DAY THEN LONG WAVE TROUGH DROPS OUT OF CANADA MONDAY EVENING INTO
THE EASTERN US. SEVERAL SHORTWAVES ROTATE AROUND THE BASE OF THE
TROUGH THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY.
THE FIRST SHORTWAVE MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY WILL DRAG A COLD
FRONT ACROSS THE REGION. VERY COLD AIR BEHIND IT WILL DROP
TEMPERATURES TO NEAR FREEZING MONDAY NIGHT AND KEEP HIGHS MOSTLY
30S OR COLDER TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW
MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL NOT BE
SIGNIFICANT INITIALLY DUE TO WARM TEMPERATURES THIS WEEKEND AND
MONDAY. HOWEVER LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE TUESDAY IN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS TEMPERATURES DROP AND STAY LOW. ACCUMULATIONS
SHOULD BE MORE SIGNIFICANT TUESDAY NIGHT AS NW FLOW BEHIND THE
FRONT KICKS IN. TOTAL SNOW AMOUNTS MAY REACH 1 TO 3 INCHES IN SW
VA AND THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN WITH HIGHEST ELEVATIONS EVEN MORE
BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. STRONG NW WINDS WILL PRODUCE WIND CHILLS
BELOW 10 IN THE MOUNTAINS TUESDAY AND BELOW ZERO TUESDAY NIGHT WITH
SINGE DIGITS IN SOME OF THE NORTHERN VALLEYS. A WIND ADVISORY MAY
BE NEEDED MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THE SHORTWAVE ENERGY AND
TROUGH LIFTS OUT LATE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. COLD ARCTIC
HIGH PRESSURE BEHIND UPPER TROUGH WILL SLOWLY MODIFY THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY BUT LOWS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY MORNING WILL BE THE COLDEST
OF THE SEASON IN THE TEENS AND SINGLE DIGITS HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A
NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS FRIDAY NIGHT AND SPREADS CLOUDS
AND RAIN INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY AND WESTERN TN VALLEY SATURDAY.
SOME CLOUDS SPREAD INTO EAST TN BUT PRECIPITATION WILL NOT REACH
FORECAST AREA UNTIL SATURDAY NIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 300303
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1003 PM EST SAT DEC 29 2007

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE REGION 
OVERNIGHT....PROVIDING A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN OVER THE AREA.  DRY 
AIR WILL MOVE IN AS WELL...LOWING DUE POINTS AND LIMITING POTENTIAL 
FOR FOG DEVELOPMENT.  ALL ON TRACK IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...NO 
UPDATES EXPECTED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    35  53  33  56  32 /  10  10  10  10  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN            34  52  32  54  31 /  10  10  10  10  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   32  51  31  53  29 /  10  20  10   0  40

FXUS64 KMRX 292022
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST SAT DEC 29 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WEST OF THE 
AREA MOVES NE TONIGHT. UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST WITH 
JET SEGMENT STRENGTHENING AHEAD OF THE TROUGH ACROSS THE TN VLY ON 
SUN. LITTLE CHANGE IN LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES TONIGHT. HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS WILL STREAM NE ACROSS THE AREA IN UPPER SW FLOW. CURRENT DPS 
REMAIN FAIRLY HIGH BUT EXPECT SOME DRYING IN THE LOW LEVELS 
OVERNIGHT. LEANED ON THE COOL SIDE OF SIMILAR MOS MINS. ISENTROPIC 
LIFT THROUGH SUNDAY APPEARS VERY WEAK. 1000-850 MB REMAINS 
RELATIVELY DRY SO WENT BELOW MOS POP GUIDANCE FOR SUNDAY. MODELS 
RUNS HAVE BEEN VERY AGGRESSIVE WITH HIGH POPS FOR SUNDAY WITH BIG 
SPREADS IN THE ENSEMBLE DATA. RAINFALL AMOUNTS THAT DO OCCUR SHOULD 
BE LIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAIN WEATHER FEATURE 
WILL BE DEVELOPING LONG-WAVE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION. A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES DIVING INTO THE MID-WEST WILL CARVE 
OUT A TROUGH OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WITH A COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL SPILL INTO THE 
REGION TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT PRODUCING A GOOD BET OF SNOW SHOWERS 
(ESPECIALLY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS) AND SNOW FLURRIES. 
ACCUMULATION OF SNOW IS POSSIBLE FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...GENERALLY IN THE ADVISORY RANGE...FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.

THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON...THUS FAR...WILL EFFECT THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA FOR MID-WEEK. GENERALLY HAVE GONE A TAD COLDER THAN 
GMOS.

AS TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST LATE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...A MODERATION 
IN TEMPERATURES IS ANTICIPATED WITH RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT 
PRODUCING DRY CONDITIONS UNTIL NEXT WEEKEND.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  38  54  29  60  32 /  10  10  10   0  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  35  53  33  56  32 /  10  10  10  10  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN  34  52  32  54  31 /  10  10  10  10  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  32  51  31  53  29 /  10  20  10   0  40

FXUS64 KMRX 291530
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST SAT DEC 29 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT WORKING EVER SO SLOWLY 
THROUGH THE REGION THIS MORNING...HAVING PASSED THROUGH ALL BUT THE 
EASTERN MOST COUNTIES AT FORECAST TIME. SPOTTY TO SCATTERED LIGHT 
SHOWERS CONTINUE ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SO SOME LOW POPS 
CARRIED OVER FOR JUST A FEW MORE HOURS. CURRENT TEMPS AND MOS 
FORECAST TEMPS FOR 12Z TODAY MUCH MILDER THAN PREVIOUS GRIDS...SO 
ADJUSTMENTS WERE MADE TO REFLECT THIS. MAX TEMPS A BIT TRICKY GIVEN 
FRONTAL PASSAGE...MORNING CLOUDS AND AT LEAST WEAK COLD AIR 
ADVECTION THIS AFTERNOON. TRIED TO STAY CLOSE TO GFS MOS MAX TEMPS.

FOR TONIGHT...CLOUDS QUICKLY INCREASE ESPECIALLY AFTER MIDNIGHT...
BUT 29/00Z MODELS AND ENSEMBLES DELAY ANY PRECIPITATION UNTIL MAINLY 
AROUND OR AFTER DAYBREAK SUNDAY. LOWERED POPS BASED ON THIS CHANGE. 
ADDED SOME PATCHY VALLEY FOG SINCE RADIATIONAL COOLING WILL SET UP 
EARLY TONIGHT BEFORE CLOUDS INCREASE AHEAD OF THE DEVELOPING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TO OUR SOUTHWEST. MOS GUIDANCE QUITE CLOSE FOR MINS 
TONIGHT...AND SAW LITTLE REASON TO STRAY FROM.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS A LITTLE SLOWER WITH 
BRINGING WAVE NORTH SUNDAY FROM THE GULF ALONG FRONT THAT PASSES 
THROUGH TODAY. HAVE LOWERED POPS ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
EXCEPT NORTH CAROLINA AND DELAYED START OF PRECIPITATION. SUNDAY 
NIGHT SKIES CLEAR AND WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL BRING A SUNNY DAY 
MONDAY. COLD CORE UPPER LOW DROPS SOUTH OUT OF CANADA BRINGING A 
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY ABOUT 12Z TUESDAY. NEW 
GUIDANCE HAS TEMPERATURES ABOVE FREEZING TUESDAY EXCEPT MOUNTAINS SO 
ADDED CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS SOUTHERN AREAS. CHANCE OF SNOW WILL 
CONTINUE AS DEEPENING SURFACE LOW MOVES SLOWLY EAST TOWARDS THE 
NORTHEAST COAST OF THE US AND UPPER TROUGH HANGS OVER THE EASTERN 
STATES THROUGH WEDNESDAY. SEVERAL SHORTWAVES ROTATE THROUGH THE BASE 
OF THE TROUGH KEEPING THE FORECAST AREA IN A COLD NW FLOW PATTERN. 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AS TROUGH SHIFTS TO THE NE AND UPPER FLOW 
BECOMES MORE ZONAL. TEMPERATURES WARM TO NEAR NORMAL FRIDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  58  39  52  31  58 /  10  30  40  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    54  38  53  33  56 /  10  20  50  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            54  36  51  32  55 /  10  10  40  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   55  33  49  31  53 /  10  10  50  20  10

FXUS64 KMRX 282036
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST FRI DEC 28 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...WARM FRONT HAS REMAINED 
SOUTH OF MRX CWA TODAY. GOOD LOW LEVEL SWRLY JET ABOVE 3000 FEET 
STREAMING ACROSS THE AREA. 88D VWP SUPPORT WIND ADVISORY THIS 
EVENING. FAIRLY STRONG INVERSION BELOW STRONG WINDS HAS HINDERED 
WARMING TODAY AND HAS RESULTED IN FOG FORMATION. THIS SHOULD PERSIST 
AT LEAST TIL FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE THIS EVENING AND POSSIBLY ALL 
NIGHT. WIDESPREAD SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS. 
POST FRONTAL SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL TAPER OFF OVERNIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN SATURDAY. AIRMASS HAS WESTERN SOURCE REGION AND IS NOT 
VERY COLD. SAT NGT THRU SUNDAY NGT...WENT WITH GFS SOLUTION RATHER 
THAN DRIER NAM. STRENGTHENING SW-NE JET ACROSS MID TN PROVIDES GOOD 
LIFT AND DRAWS MOISTURE NORTH INTO AREA SAT NGT THROUGH MID DAY SUN 
WHEN JET AXIS SHIFTS EAST OF AREA.    


.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE AREA 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY.  A SHORTWAVE TRACKS INTO THE REGION 
ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH AND THE 
MOUNTAINS WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  THICKNESS ANALYSIS 
INDICATE SNOW FOR MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...BUT MOISTURE TOO 
LIMITED FOR SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS.  A DEEPER SHORTWAVE FOLLOWS 
ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR THE NORTHERN 
AREAS AND THE MOUNTAINS ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  THICKNESS 
ANALYSIS INDICATE SNOW AGAIN.  WITH THE INCREASED MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE...SHOULD HAVE A BETTER CHANCE FOR ACCUMULATION SNOW... 
MAINLY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS.  SHORTWAVE EXITS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.  MOISTURE LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SO ADDED LOW POPS 
FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS AND THE MOUNTAINS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  RIDGE 
BUILDS IN ON THURSDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  
STAYED NEAR MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       41  53  35  51  32 /  70  10  20  50  10

FXUS64 KMRX 281538 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED WORDING
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1040 AM EST FRI DEC 28 2007

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO LOWER MAX TEMPS N AREAS. LOW LEVEL JET
MOVING NE THROUGH E TN COUPLED WITH UPPER DIVERGENCE FOSTERING WIDESPREAD
CONVECTION. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW CLOUDS HAVE ONLY REACHED SE 
TN THUS FAR...WITH QUITE A DIFFERENCE IN CURRENT TEMPS FROM SE TN TO 
SW VA AND NE TN AREAS WHERE SKIES HAVE STAYED MOSTLY CLEAR WITH NEAR 
CALM WINDS. CLOUDS INCREASING QUICKLY THIS MORNING...SO A BLEND OF 
MOS MAX TEMPS PROBABLY BEST BET...ESPECIALLY GIVEN COOL START SW 
VA/NE TN AND THICKENING OF CLOUDS FOR SE TN AND PLATEAU COUNTIES.

LITTLE CHANGES MADE TO POPS OR TIMING OF SHOWERS AND CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS...AS PREVIOUS GRIDS LOOKED ON TRACK. DEW POINT TEMPS 
HAVE TO RISE A GOOD DEAL...AND SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY IS VERY 
LIMITED (ALTHOUGH ELEVATED INSTABILITY LINGERS INTO THE EVENING).
DAY ONE CONVECTIVE OUTLOOK HAS SHIFTED SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE STORMS 
TO OUR SOUTH...BUT WILL CONTINUE A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS AND SOME 
POTENTIAL FOR GUSTY WINDS AS FRONT APPROACHES AND WITH ANY STRONG 
STORMS. STRENGTH OF LOW LEVEL JET FROM MID AFTERNOON THROUGH FRONTAL 
PASSAGE JUSTIFIES A WIND ADVISORY FOR MOST OF OUR MTN COUNTIES ALONG 
EAST TN AND NORTH CAROLINA LINE. ISSUED THIS ALREADY SINCE THIS IS A 
LATE FIRST AND EARLY SECOND PERIOD FEATURE. 

OTHERWISE...CLOSELY FOLLOWED PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR LATE TONIGHT FOR ALL 
ELEMENTS...AND WENT CLOSE TO MOS BLEND FOR MIN TEMPS. 

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN 
WITH SKIES CLEARING AS FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES EAST. AS HIGH IS FROM 
THE SOUTHWEST TEMPERATURES STAY MILD. A WAVE ALONG THE FRONT TO THE 
SOUTH WILL SPREAD MOISTURE BACK NORTH SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY FOR 
A CHANCE OF SHOWERS WITH SOME SNOW POSSIBLY SW VA AND NE TN. 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD STILL BE MILD. MONDAY HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
AGAIN FOR ANOTHER MILD DAY. MONDAY A DEEP UPPER LOW DROPS SOUTH OUT 
OF SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA AN INITIAL COLD FRONT MONDAY EVENING WILL 
BRING A CHANCE OF SNOW AS THE LEADING EDGE OF A VERY COLD AIRMASS 
MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. MORE MOISTURE ROTATING AROUND THE 
LARGE UPPER LOW AND THEN AS THE LOW DEVELOPS INTO A DIGGING UPPER 
TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY THE  CHANCES FOR SNOW 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE MOSTLY 
30S AND LOWER THROUGH WEDNESDAY. UPPER TROUGH AND WEATHER MOVES OUT 
THURSDAY AND TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM SEVERAL DEGREES.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  60  41  57  35  53 /  90  70  10  40  40 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    59  42  52  34  52 /  90  80  10  20  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN            57  40  53  34  51 /  90  80  10  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   56  39  53  32  50 /  90  90  10  20  30 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WIND ADVISORY FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM EST THIS 
EVENING      FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...     
SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...     UNICOI.

TEMPERATURES MOSTLY BELOW FREEZING THROUGH WEDNESDAY. UPPER TROUGH
AND WEATHER MOVES OUT WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM
SEVERAL DEGREES.

.DISCUSSION...

COVER. LATEST MODEL RUNS SHOW THE DEEP MOISTURE HOLDING TO THE WEST
OF OUR AREA BEFORE 12Z...AND SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS THE SYSTEM IS
STILL WELL TO THE WEST...SO THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE SW TONIGHT

301 PM EST THU DEC 27 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...A STRONG COLD FRONT APPROACHING 
THE REGION COULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE MRX CWA LATE TONIGHT AS 
ASSOCIATED CLOUDS PUSH IN AND POSSIBLY A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS REACH 
INTO OUR SOUTHWESTERN AREAS TOWARDS MORNING.  MAIN BAND OF SHOWERS 
WITH THE POTENTIAL A FEW SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE INTO THE 
AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON.  THE FRONT IS MOVING RATHER QUICKLY WHICH 
COULD TRANSLATE INTO SOME STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.  ADDITIONALLY...SUSTAINED WINDS WILL 
BECOME BREEZY...EVEN SOME LOCALLY WINDY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED WITH 
AND BEHIND THE FRONT.  TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN SEASONALLY WARM 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM KEEPING ALL PRECIP FRIDAY AFTERNOON AS RAIN.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...FRONT TRACKING THROUGH 
THE AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT. SHOULD HAVE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT 
TO KEEP HIGH POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT.  THICKNESSES INDICATE 
PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE LIQUID.  FRONT TRACKS EAST OF THE CWA ON 
SATURDAY.  SOME LINGERING MOISTURE REMAINS ON SATURDAY MORNING... 
BUT WILL KEEP SATURDAY DRY FOR NOW.  FRONT SHIFTS NORTH ON SATURDAY 
NIGHT ALONG WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE SOUTH.  COULD 
SEE A WINTRY MIX IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY MORNING.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  A 
SHORTWAVE TRACKS IN ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH AND THE MOUNTAINS WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE IS 
AVAILABLE.  THICKNESS ANALYSIS INDICATE SNOW FOR MONDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.  SHORTWAVE EXITS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  WILL 
KEEP LOW POPS FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS AND THE MOUNTAINS ON 
WEDNESDAY.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  
STAYED NEAR MEX AND HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 AM EST THU DEC 27 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PATCH OF RAIN SHOWERS MOVING 
NORTHEAST AND DISSIPATING RAPIDLY, LARGELY OUT OF AREA, THOUGH SOME 
VERY LIGHT SHOWERS OR DRIZZLE MAY STICK AROUND FOR A FEW HOURS, 
UNDER THE RADAR. IN WATER VAPOR IMAGERY, DRY SLOT FROM SOUTHWEST NOT 
OVER AREA WITH DRIEST AIR STILL TO COME THIS AFTERNOON. STILL, LOW 
LEVEL RH VERY HIGH AND SO STRATOCU WILL STILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY 
CLOUDY, UNTIL  MID AFTERNOON. EXPECT SOME SUN AS IT FINALLY ERODES 
THE TOPS OF THE SC DECK. 

NAM SHOWS CURRENT SHORT WAVE LIFTING OUT TO NORTHEAST AND BEING 
REPLACED BY A NARROW RIDGE TODAY. BY ABOUT 03Z TONIGHT, NEXT SHORT 
WAVE STARTING TO MOVE IN, THOUGH ITS NOT SO ROBUST, YET. A 
SPLATTERING OF VORTICITY WILL APPROACH THE AREA BY ABOUT 6Z BUT WILL 
ONLY SUFFICE TO PRODUCE ANOTHER ROUND OF CLOUDS BY THIS TIME. EVEN 
BY 12Z FRIDAY DO NOT EXPECT MUCH PRECIP. HAVE ADJUSTED POPS UP JUST 
A HAIR BETWEEN 6-12Z ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTHWEST BUT ONLY TO LOW 
CHANCE LEVELS. 

DO NOT EXPECT THUNDER WITH THIS SYSTEM IN THIS TIME FRAME. CAPE AS 
WELL AS LIS VERY LOW.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AN ACTIVE EXTENDED PERIOD.
STARTING WITH FRIDAY...ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE OHIO
VALLEY WITH STRONGER CYCLO-GENESIS MOVING THROUGH KENTUCKY FRIDAY.
TRAILING COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE
AFTERNOON-EARLY EVENING. STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER JET OF 50+ KNOTS
WILL BRING IN UNSEASONABLY MOIST AIR IN THE LOWER LEVELS WITH VERY
STRONG SHEAR AS WELL. CAPES APPROACH 500 J/KG AT CHA AND 300 J/KG
AT TYS LATE IN THE DAY. ANY CONVECTION HAS THE CHANCE (ESPECIALLY
CONVECTION WITH STRONGER UPDRAFTS) OF PULLING THE HIGH WINDS TO THE
SURFACE. SPC HAS INCLUDED A GOOD PART OF THE AREA UNDER A SLIGHT
RISK FOR FRIDAY. HAVE INTRODUCED A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS DURING
THE AFTERNOON.

RIDGING PULLS INTO THE AREA FOR SATURDAY...BUT ANOTHER FAST
SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE AND PRESSURE FALLS ASSOCIATED WITH RIGHT
ENTRANCE OF 130KNOT 300MB JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL INCREASE
THE ISENTROPIC LIFT FOR LATE SAT-SUN. GREATEST CHANCE OF RAIN WILL
BE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...A DEVELOPING LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WILL PULL THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. PLENTY OF WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE AND
COLD AIR (850MB TEMPERATURES BETWEEN -14 AND -20C) TO PRODUCE A
CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES BOTH TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...
ESPECIALLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FXUS64 KMRX 261934
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
234 PM EST WED DEC 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE TRACKING TO THE 
NORTHEAST...BRINGING PRECIP INTO OUR AREA TONIGHT. PRECIP APPEARS TO 
BE ASSOCIATED MAINLY WITH A COLD FRONT ALOFT AND MIDLEVEL 
FRONTOGENESIS. POSITIVE 700 MB THETA-E ADVECTION BEGINS TO MOVE INTO 
THE WESTERN PART OF OUR AREA AROUND 03Z...AND WILL BRING POPS UP TO 
LIKELY IN THE WEST AT THAT TIME. WILL RAISE POPS TO CATEGORICAL WEST 
AND CENTRAL AFTER 06Z AS THE CFA PASSES THROUGH...ALONG WITH SOME 
UPPER LEVEL DIFFLUENCE. THE BEST DYNAMICS DO PASS JUST TO THE NORTH 
AND HIGH THETA-E AIR AT 850 MB REMAINS TO OUR SOUTH...AND THE SYSTEM 
MOVES THROUGH QUICKLY...SO EXPECT QPF AROUND QUARTER INCH MAX. 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS MAY BE IN THE MID 30S AT THE 
ONSET...SO A LITTLE SNOW CANNOT BE RULED OUT...BUT WARM ADVECTION 
SHOULD QUICKLY CHANGE IT TO ALL RAIN. PRECIP SHOULD END ACROSS THE 
AREA BY AROUND 12Z WITH THE UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE AND ADVECTION OF 
DRY AIR IN THE MID/UPPER LEVELS. SOME LOW CLOUDS MAY LINGER IN THE 
SOUTH AS THE NEAR-SURFACE FLOW REMAINS FROM THE SOUTHEAST. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THERE REMAINS 
SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES IN MODEL AND RUN CONSISTENCY AND CONFIDENCE 
QUITE LOW THROUGH THE EXTENDED.  HOWEVER...FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD 
SHOULD BE UNSETTLED.  STRONGEST OF INCOMING SYSTEMS WILL BE A COLD 
FRONT PUSHING THROUGH THE REGION AROUND THE FRIDAY TIME FRAME.  FOR 
THE WEEKEND...A DECENT SHORT WAVE WILL TRACK FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO 
INTO THE CAROLINAS...POSSIBLY CLIPPING THE MRX CWA...ESPECIALLY 
SOUTHERN AND EASTERN AREAS.  FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...AN UPPER 
TROUGH SLIDES INTO THE EASTERN U.S.  MAIN MOISTURE AND LIFT 
CURRENTLY APPEAR TO REMAIN TO OUR NORTH AND HAVE THEREFORE LEFT 
MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY DRY...THOUGH HAVE KEPT SOME LOW POPS 
NORTHERN 2/3RD ON TUESDAY NIGHT.  MAIN CONCERN WITH THIS TROUGH WILL 
BE COOLER AIR PUSHING IN AND LOWING TEMPERATURES TO MORE SEASONAL 
LEVELS.

1005 AM EST WED DEC 26 2007

.DISCUSSION...
AS SKIES CLEARED EARLY THIS MORNING...DENSE FOG QUICKLY FORMED IN
VALLEYS ACROSS CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. THE FOG
REMAINS AROUND A 1/4 MILE IN SOME SPOTS. WITH WINDS REMAINING
CALM...THE FOG WILL HAVE TO BE MIXED OUT BY SOLAR RADIAITON...WHICH
COULD TAKE A COUPLE MORE HOURS GIVEN THE LOW SUN ANGLE. THE FOG
SHOULD LIFT AROUND NOON...SO AT THIS POINT WILL NOT ADD FOG TO THE
ZONES. TEMPS ARE RUNNING MUCH COOLER THAN FORECAST IN AREAS THAT
CLEARED OUT THIS MORNING...AND WILL UPDATE TO LOWER TEMPS. PRECIP
HAS ALSO MOVED OUT OF THE NE SECTIONS...AND WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE
POPS. ONCE THE FOG BREAKS...MOST AREAS SHOULD SEE MOSTLY CLEAR
SKIES THROUGH THE AFTERNOON EXCEPT FOR THE NE AS AN UPPER LEVEL
RIDGE BUILDS OVERHEAD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 AM EST WED DEC 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW QUITE VISIBLE IN WATER 
VAPOR IMAGERY, CENTERED JUST NORTHEAST OF ATLANTA AND MOVING 
NORTHEAST RAPIDLY. CLOUD TOPS ARE IN THE 35K FEET RANGE JUST TO THE 
EAST OF OUR AREA, WITH TOP TEMPS AROUND -52C, COLD ENOUGH TO PRODUCE 
THE SNOW APPEARING IN THE OBS OVER THERE. HOWEVER, FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT 
DOWNSLOPING HAS BEEN OCCURRING OVER THE MOUNTAINS TO THE EAST 
TENNESSEE SIDE. SOME RAIN HAS FALLEN, BUT MAINLY ITS CLOUDS. WEAK 
INVERTED TROUGH SITS OVER EAST TENNESSEE, AND HAS DEEPENED A LITTLE 
BUT EXPECT IT WILL MOVE WITH UPPER LOW.

NAM HAS UPPER LOW A LITTLE FURTHER SOUTH THAN I THINK IT IS, AND HAS 
IT MOVING A LITTLE EAST OF WHERE I WOULD MOVE IT THROUGH TONIGHT. 
NOT FAR THOUGH. AS A RESULT, THE NAM RH FIELDS SEEM TO DRY THE AIR 
OUT A LITTLE MUCH IN MY OPINION FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. HAVE 
THEREFORE KEPT A FEW MORE CLOUDS IN THROUGH TONIGHT THAN THE MODEL 
SEEMS TO DEPICT. HAVE KEPT POPS HIGH (LIKELY) IN THE FAR NORTHEAST 
PART OF THE FORECAST AREA, WITH CHANCE IN MOST OF NORTHEAST TN AND 
EXTREME SOUTHWEST VA. POPS DROP OFF RAPIDLY TOWARD THE CENTRAL 
VALLEY GOING TO SINGLE DIGITS BEFORE HITTING CHATTANOOGA AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A BUSY EXTENDED PERIOD WITH NEXT
STRONGER UPPER TROUGH MOVING OUT OF THE ROCKIES THURSDAY NIGHT. ASSOCIATED
CYCLO-GENESIS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE WESTERN OHIO VALLEY INTO THE GREAT
LAKES FRIDAY WITH TRAILING COLD FRONT PULLING THROUGH FORECAST AREA BY
EVENING. LIKELY CHANCES OF SHOWERS ANTICIPATED WITH FROPA. RIDGING
BEHIND SYSTEM WILL PRODUCE A DRY DAY FOR SATURDAY. 

FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...STALLED FRONT ACROSS THE GULF COAST
STATES COMBINED WITH ANOTHER FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE WILL INCREASE
THE ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. RIGHT ENTRANCE
REGION OF JET ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WILL PRODUCE DIFFLUENCE ALOFT
AS WELL ENHANCING LIFT.

WEAK RIDGING WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR MONDAY WITH A NORTHERN
STREAM WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES PULLING A COLD FRONT
SOUTH OVER THE AREA BY TUESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST TUE DEC 25 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CLOUDS HAVE INCREASED 
RAPIDLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL FORECAST AREA WITH LIGHT 
RAIN AND SOME SLEET DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON. THIS HAS HAD A BIG 
AFFECT ON TEMPERATURES TODAY AS WELL WITH READINGS IN THE UPPER 30S 
TO LOWER 40S SOUTH AND MID 40S TO MID 50S ELSEWHERE. DEW POINTS ARE 
STILL IN THE MID 20S WHERE IT HAS NOT RAINED AND IN THE LOWER TO MID 
30S IN RAIN AREAS. UPPER LOW OVER THE MS/AL BORDER HAS DEVELOPED 
MORE AND FASTER THAN EXPECTED WITH THE NAM TAKING IT MOSTLY EAST 
ACROSS AL AND GA THIS EVENING AND INTO THE WESTERN CAROLINAS EARLY 
WEDNESDAY WITH SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION WITH IT. THE GFS MODEL IS 
NOT AS DEVELOPED AND KEEPS THE PRECIPITATION CLOSER TO THE 
MOUNTAINS. THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY SHOULD BE 
THIS AFTERNOON WITH AXIS SHIFTING MORE TOWARD THE MOUNTAINS THIS 
EVENING. SOUNDINGS SHOW PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE MOSTLY RAIN SOUTH 
BUT WHERE THERE IS COLDER DRIER AIR NORTH THERE IS A BETTER CHANCE 
OF SNOW AND AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS. GRIDS ONLY SHOW MINOR 
ACCUMULATIONS OVERNIGHT. SYSTEM PULLS OUT WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH 
TEMPERATURES WARMING BACK TO THE 50S AND CLOUDS SLOWLY 
DECREASING.     

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODEL CONSISTENCY 
RATHER POOR...BUT GENERALLY LOOKING AT A RATHER UNSETTLED WEATHER 
PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED.  TIMING ON THE GFS CURRENTLY SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT PROGGED THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT....A STRONGER SYSTEM 
ON FRIDAY...A SHORT WAVE WITH MAIN MOISTURE AND ENERGY KEEP TO OUR 
SOUTH AND EAST DURING THE WEEKEND...AND FINALLY ANOTHER SYSTEM 
APPROACHING THE REGION AROUND THE TUESDAY TIME FRAME.  WILL TREND 
TOWARD THIS TIMING THOUGH CONFIDENCE IN TIMING AND ACTUAL TRACK OF 
EACH DISTURBANCE IS QUITE LOW.  TEMPERATURE PROFILES THROUGH THE 
PERIOD SHOULD KEEP PRECIP AS RAIN WITH THE EXCEPTION OF AN 
OCCASIONAL RAIN/SNOW MIX OR BRIEF LIGHT SNOW OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
DURING THE SOME OVERNIGHT EVENTS.

CHANGES.



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 250757
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 AM EST TUE DEC 25 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
AREA WILL DRIFT NORTHEAST DURING THE SHORT TERM.  MODELS HAVE FLIP 
FLOPPED ON WEAK SYSTEM FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT.  PREVIOUS 
TREND HAD BEEN DRIER...WITH MOISTURE STAYING MAINLY EAST.  LATEST 
RUNS NOW CUTTING UPPER SYSTEM OFF A BIT FURTHER WEST...AND BRINGING 
MORE MOISTURE TO OUR AREA...EVEN THOUGH BULK OF PRECIP STILL STAYS 
TO OUR EAST.  WILL INCREASE CLOUDS CONSIDERABLY FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND LOOKS LIKE SOME LIGHT PRECIP MAY WORK ITS WAY INTO OUR 
AREA.  WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW A GFS/NAM BLEND...AND FOR NOW 
WILL KEEP LOW POPS CONFINED TO THE SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ZONES THIS 
AFTERNOON...AND THE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT. THERMAL PROFILES INDICATE 
THERE MAY BE SOME LIGHT SNOW OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...ESPECIALLY 
TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL ONLY MAKE A 
FEW MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.   

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A BIT TRICKY SCENARIO
AS FAIRLY PROGRESSIVE PATTERN DEVELOPS AND SENDS WAVE AFTER WAVE
OVER US IN SOUTHWEST FLOW. TEMPS WILL BE WARMER THAN NORMAL AND SO
SNOW NOT REALLY A FACTOR, EXCEPT PERHAPS IN THE HIGHEST TERRAIN, IN
THE COLDEST PART OF THE EARLY MORNING, ASSUMING AMPLE CLOUDS, AND
THEN ONLY VERY BRIEFLY, WITH NO ACCUMULATIONS.

FIRST SHORT WAVE MOVES QUICKLY ACROSS WEDNESDAY TAKING MOST OF THE 
CLOUDS WITH IT AND PRODUCING ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN, BUT THE 
RESPITE IS SHORT LIVED AS ANOTHER WAVE MOVES INTO THE AREA EARLY 
THURSDAY AND QUICKLY CROSSES THE REGION, WITH ABOUT THE SAME RESULTS 
AS THE WEDNESDAY STORM.  FRIDAY IS ANOTHER MATTER AS THE SYSTEM 
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL DRIVE UP RHS AND PRECIPITABLE WATER 
AMOUNTS WILL RANGE FROM ONE INCH IN THE NORTHEAST TO ABOUT 1.25 IN 
THE SOUTHWEST NEAR CHATTANOOGA. THIS, COUPLED WITH A LITTLE 
MID-LEVEL DYNAMICS AND A WEAK JET STREAK TO THE NORTH WILL ALLOW 
MODERATE RAIN AMOUNTS, ESPECIALLY IN THE MORNING. AGAIN, THINGS MOVE 
QUICKLY OUT AND POPS DROP BY LATE AFTERNOON BACK DOWN TO LOW 
CHANCE/SLIGHT CHANCE. EVEN WITH PASSAGE OF COLD FRONT, TEMPS WILL 
NOT MODERATE MUCH AS THE AIRMASS ORIGINATES IN THE PACIFIC. 
PERSISTENT CLOUDS WILL KEEP MINS UP OVERNIGHT. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  50  33  61  35  56 /  30  10  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  34  57  34  55 /  10  10  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  50  34  56  34  56 /  10  10  10  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  50  30  54  34  55 /  10  10  10  20  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 250238
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
938 PM EST MON DEC 24 2007

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING.  A FEW HIGH CLOUDS 
ARE DRIFTING ACROSS THE CWA.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND CHRISTMAS)...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES AT
THE SURFACE WITH A NEGATIVELY TILTED WEAK UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPING
OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES THIS AFTERNOON. SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW
ALOFT WAS BRINGING MOISTURE FROM THE WESTERN GULF INTO THE SOUTHERN
MS VALLEY AND SOME HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDINESS INTO THE TN VALLEY
INCLUDING THE FORECAST AREA. THIS WAS KEEPING TEMPERATURES DOWN
SLIGHTLY ALTHOUGH DRY AIR IN PLACE WAS KEEPING DEWPOINTS IN THE
UPPER TEENS TO LOWER 20S. NAM/GFS AND CLOSE OFF TROUGH ACROSS MS
AND AL TUESDAY AND BRING IN MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTH OVER THE
FORECAST AREA CHRISTMAS DAY. CROSS SECTION DATA INDICATE MID AND
HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE WITH SOME WEAK LATE IN THE DAY MAINLY EASTERN
MOUNTAINS. WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR NOW WITH JUST VARIABLE
CLOUDINESS. WITH DRY AIR IN PLACE TONIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL DROP
BELOW FREEZING EXCEPT NEAR FREEZING SOUTHERN VALLEY. HIGHS
CHRISTMAS SIMILAR TO TODAY WITH MORE CLOUDS DUE TO UPPER SYSTEM
MOVING THROUGH.

.LONG TERM (CHRISTMAS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE FROM 
PREVIOUS PACKAGE. LARGER FEATURES ARE SHORT WAVE OVER DEEP SOUTH BUT 
HAS LITTLE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH. AFTER THIS EXITS AREA LATER 
WEDNESDAY, SHORT WAVE RIDGING SETS UP, ALSO DRY, THROUGH EARLY 
THURSDAY. PREDOMINANTLY SOUTHWEST FLOW SETS UP AFTER WITH SMALL 
WIGGLES PASSING OVER AREA. A SERIES OF THESE WILL ATTRACT ENOUGH 
MOISTURE AND LIFT TO PRODUCE ISOLATED SHOWERS ON THURSDAY THROUGH 
ROUGHLY THE WEEKEND. HOWEVER, THE BIGGEST CHANCES WILL OCCUR ON THE 
WEEKEND, AND EVEN THESE ARE BY NO MEANS CERTAIN. POPS IN THE MID 
CHANCE RANGE (40ISH) MOST PLACES. THERE ARE GAPS IN THE TRAIN OF 
SHORT WAVES WHICH WILL DETERMINE WHEN THE RAIN FALLS, BUT THESE GAPS 
ARE ON THE ORDER OF A FEW HOURS AND TOO FINE DETAIL TO ACCURATELY 
FORECAST. HENCE, A BIT OF A BROAD BRUSH IN THE POPS AND CLOUD COVER 
THU-SUN.  SOME SIGNS OF DRYING AGAIN ON MONDAY, BUT THE PATTERN OF 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WITH EMBEDDED WAVES STILL HOLDS, SO LEFT IN A LOW 
CHANCE OF POPS THAT DAY, TOO.

MAX TEMPS APPEARED A BIT LOW IN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW PATTERN. ANY 
FRONTS WILL BE RATHER MILD, SO HAVE UPPED MAX TEMPS A FEW DEGREES 
AND LARGELY LEFT MINS ALONE.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

$$

FXUS64 KMRX 240926
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST MON DEC 24 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE OVER THE REGION IN THE SHORT TERM.  AN LEVEL UPPER TROUGH 
WILL APPROACH BUT WILL HAVE LIMITED MOISTURE TO WORK WITH...AND 
SHOULD BRING LITTLE MORE THAN SOME HIGH CLOUDS TO THE AREA.  MAV 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.    

.LONG TERM (CHRISTMAS THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHORTWAVE TREKS EAST ACROSS 
THE DEEP SOUTH ON CHRISTMAS WITH LITTLE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN BEHIND THIS SYSTEM. FORECAST STAYS DRY OR IS 
NOT THREATENED WITH PRECIP UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHEN A SHORTWAVE 
SWINGS NORTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY WITH AN ASSOCIATED WEAK FROPA. 
USED SLIGHT CHANCE POP AND USED IT ONLY DURING THIS PERIOD. PULLED 
THE POPS AGAIN THROUGH MUCH OF THURSDAY AWAITING STRENGTHENING WARM 
AIR AND MOISTURE ADVECTION AHEAD OF NEXT WAVE AND SURFACE LOW WHICH 
DRAGS ANOTHER FRONT INTO THE NEIGHBORHOOD. THIS FRONT DOESNT GET 
VERY FAR SOUTH AND EAST FROM THE FORECAST AREA AS HIGH PRESSURE 
HOLDS ITS OWN JUST OFF THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. COAST. MAINTAINED 
MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE POPS FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AS SEVERAL WAVES OF 
LOW PRESSURE RIDE ALONG STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY. FRONT FINALLY GETS 
A DECENT PUSH OFF THE COAST BY SUNDAY NIGHT. WITH AIR ORIGINATING 
FROM THE PACIFIC MOST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD...TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL DURING THE LONG TERM.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 232017
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 PM EST SUN DEC 23 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...COLD FRONT TRACKING EAST OF THE 
CWA...WITH DECREASING CLOUDS EXPECTED. STILL SOME STRONG 
GUSTY WINDS ACROSS OUR NORTHERN ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS BEING 
REPORTED.  WINDS SHOULD DIMINISH A BIT TONIGHT AS THE GRADIENT 
RELAXES...BUT SHOULD STILL HAVE BREEZY CONDITIONS IN THE NORTH 
TONIGHT.  WINDS SHOULD WEAKEN MORE ON MONDAY. HIGH PRESSURE PUSHING 
IN BEHIND THE FRONT BRINGING COLD AND DRY WEATHER TONIGHT.  HIGH 
PRESSURE LINGERS ACROSS THE AREA ON MONDAY BRINGING MORE DRY WEATHER 
UNDER A MOSTLY SUNNY SKY.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE AT THE 
SURFACE WILL GIVE WAY TO WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH PROGGED TO MOVE 
THROUGH THE SOUTHEAST CHRISTMAS OR CHRISTMAS NIGHT. GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS CLOSE OFF AN UPPER LOW OVER AL/MS CHRISTMAS MORNING BUT NO 
SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE GETS WRAPPED UP INTO IT UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT SE 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. TOOK OUT PRECIPITATION EXCEPT EASTERN TN AND 
SW NC MOUNTAINS. OTHERWISE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
WITH RIDGING ALOFT WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF NEXT TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER 
THE CENTRAL US. TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILD DURING THE DAY UPPER 40S 
AND 50S WITH COLD NIGHTS IN THE 20S TO LOWER 30S MONDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST FOLLOWED CLOSE TO 
ECMWF WHICH IS WETTER THAN GFS AS IT DEVELOPS TROUGH TO THE WEST BY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WHICH BRINGS MOISTURE IN FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN. GFS MOVES THIS FIRST SYSTEM 
TO THE NORTH OF THE OHIO RIVER KEEPING HIGHER PRESSURE IN CONTROL 
ANOTHER DAY. BOTH MODELS SIMILAR AFTER THAT WITH BROAD WESTERN 
TROUGH AND A STRONGER SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE MS VALLEY FRIDAY. WARM 
FRONT AHEAD OF IT SHOULD INCREASE RAIN CHANCES THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY THEN LOWER PRESSURE MOVING UP ALONG FRONT AND UPPER RIDGE 
OVER CUBA KEEPS FRONT MOVING SLOWLY EAST THROUGH SUNDAY. GOOD CHANCE 
OF RAIN FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES LOOK WARM ENOUGH FOR 
ALMOST ALL RAIN EXCEPT LATE NIGHT AND EARLY MORNING HOURS THURSDAY 
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL TN MOUNTAINS.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN  29  52  28  52  29 /   0   0  10  10  10

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 231520
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EST SUN DEC 23 2007

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT TRACKING THROUGH THE CWA.  SHOWERS HAVE 
BEEN SHIFTING TO THE EAST.  WILL UPDATE ZONES TO LOWER POPS A BIT 
TOO AND KEEP BEST POPS IN THE EAST.  BREEZY CONDITIONS ARE STILL 
EXPECTED...BUT SHOULD BE BELOW ADVISORY LEVELS IN THE SOUTHERN 
PLATEAU...SO WILL LET THAT GROUP EXPIRE AT 1000 AM.  BUT WILL LET 
THE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS CONTINUE UNTIL 1 PM.    

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONT WILL EXIT THE AREA BY EARLY 
THIS AFTERNOON...BRINGING AN END TO THE SHOWERS.  COLDER AIR WILL 
PUSH IN...BUT LOW LEVEL WIND FLOW WILL BE MORE WESTERLY AND CORE OF 
COLDER AIR WILL STAY NORTH OF OUR AREA.  CLEARING SHOULD BEGIN IN 
SOUTHWEST ZONES BY THIS AFTERNOON...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKY FOR 
TONIGHT ALL AREAS.  WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO BE STRONG AND GUSTY THIS 
MORNING...ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL CONTINUE WIND 
ADVISORY AS IS FOR NOW.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO  
ONLY SOME MINOR TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH BUILDS OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. ON MONDAY WHILE SHORTWAVE MOVES QUICKLY EAST 
TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY DURING THE DAY. THIS TROF MOVES ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA LATE CHRISTMAS EVE THROUGH ABOUT MID DAY ON 
CHRISTMAS. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE MOISTURE STARVED WITH HIGHER PRESSURE 
LIMITING ANY LOW LEVEL RETURN FROM THE GULF. ALMOST HAS THE 
APPEARANCE OF SOMETHING THAT MAY NEED TO BE REMOVED FROM THE 
FORECAST ENTIRELY WITH MODEL SOLUTIONS INDICATING LOWER PROBABILITY 
OF PRECIP WITH EACH RUN. HOWEVER WANTED TO MAINTAIN SOME CONTINUITY 
FOR NOW AND WITH OVERNIGHT/EARLY MORNING TIMING SPRINKLED IN SNOW 
FLURRIES AS LOW LEVEL AIRMASS WILL REMAIN JUST COLD ENOUGH PRIOR TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PRECIP GENERATION. AT ANY RATE WHATEVER PRECIP OR 
CLOUDS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROF WILL BE PRETTY MUCH GONE BY MID 
TO LATE AFTERNOON ON CHRISTMAS TO BE FOLLOWED BY MORE EXCELLENT 
BENIGN WEATHER WHICH CONTINUES THROUGH ABOUT MID DAY WEDNESDAY. 
ACTIVE PATTERN BRINGS YET ANOTHER WEAK WAVE TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA 
LATER WEDNESDAY INTO THE EVENING HOURS AND HAD TO APPLY A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR -SHRA HERE AND KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE GOING WELL INTO 
THURSDAY AS THE ATMOSPHERE TRIES TO CRANK UP THE SOUTHWEST FLO ALOFT 
FOR A PERIOD OF ISENTROPIC LIFT WELL AHEAD OF STRONGER WEEKEND 
STORM SYSTEM. USED GRADUALLY INCREASING POPS THROUGH SATURDAY 
MORNING FOR AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM. THE 
GOOD NEWS THROUGH THE LONG TERM IS THAT ATMOSPHERE REMAINS 
CONFIGURED TO SUPPLY THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. WITH NEAR TO PLEASANTLY 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE END OF THE YEAR.               

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  51  29  55  30  55 /  40   0   0  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  50  28  52  29  52 /  70   0   0  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  49  29  52  29  53 /  60   0   0  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  55  26  50  26  49 /  90   0   0  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST 
     MONROE...UNICOI.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
131 AM EST SUN DEC 23 2007

.DISCUSSION...FRONT TRACKING EAST OUT OF CWA...WILL UPDATE ZONES TO 
LOWER POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON.  STILL PRETTY BREEZY ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE AREA...THINK WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO DIMINISH AS FRONT HEADS 
EAST...SO LET THE WIND ADVSIORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS EXPIRE ON TIME. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONT WILL EXIT THE AREA BY EARLY 
THIS AFTERNOON...BRINGING AN END TO THE SHOWERS.  COLDER AIR WILL 
PUSH IN...BUT LOW LEVEL WIND FLOW WILL BE MORE WESTERLY AND CORE OF 
COLDER AIR WILL STAY NORTH OF OUR AREA.  CLEARING SHOULD BEGIN IN 
SOUTHWEST ZONES BY THIS AFTERNOON...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKY FOR 
TONIGHT ALL AREAS.  WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO BE STRONG AND GUSTY THIS 
MORNING...ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL CONTINUE WIND 
ADVISORY AS IS FOR NOW.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO  
ONLY SOME MINOR TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH BUILDS OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. ON MONDAY WHILE SHORTWAVE MOVES QUICKLY EAST 
TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY DURING THE DAY. THIS TROF MOVES ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA LATE CHRISTMAS EVE THROUGH ABOUT MID DAY ON 
CHRISTMAS. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE MOISTURE STARVED WITH HIGHER PRESSURE 
LIMITING ANY LOW LEVEL RETURN FROM THE GULF. ALMOST HAS THE 
APPEARANCE OF SOMETHING THAT MAY NEED TO BE REMOVED FROM THE 
FORECAST ENTIRELY WITH MODEL SOLUTIONS INDICATING LOWER PROBABILITY 
OF PRECIP WITH EACH RUN. HOWEVER WANTED TO MAINTAIN SOME CONTINUITY 
FOR NOW AND WITH OVERNIGHT/EARLY MORNING TIMING SPRINKLED IN SNOW 
FLURRIES AS LOW LEVEL AIRMASS WILL REMAIN JUST COLD ENOUGH PRIOR TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PRECIP GENERATION. AT ANY RATE WHATEVER PRECIP OR 
CLOUDS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROF WILL BE PRETTY MUCH GONE BY MID 
TO LATE AFTERNOON ON CHRISTMAS TO BE FOLLOWED BY MORE EXCELLENT 
BENIGN WEATHER WHICH CONTINUES THROUGH ABOUT MID DAY WEDNESDAY. 
ACTIVE PATTERN BRINGS YET ANOTHER WEAK WAVE TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA 
LATER WEDNESDAY INTO THE EVENING HOURS AND HAD TO APPLY A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR -SHRA HERE AND KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE GOING WELL INTO 
THURSDAY AS THE ATMOSPHERE TRIES TO CRANK UP THE SOUTHWEST FLO ALOFT 
FOR A PERIOD OF ISENTROPIC LIFT WELL AHEAD OF STRONGER WEEKEND 
STORM SYSTEM. USED GRADUALLY INCREASING POPS THROUGH SATURDAY 
MORNING FOR AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM. THE 
GOOD NEWS THROUGH THE LONG TERM IS THAT ATMOSPHERE REMAINS 
CONFIGURED TO SUPPLY THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. WITH NEAR TO PLEASANTLY 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE END OF THE YEAR.               

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

TN...NONE.

VA...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 230235
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 PM EST SAT DEC 22 2007

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT TRACKING THROUGH EASTERN MO WITH SHOWERS 
ENTERING WESTERN TN/KY AHEAD OF IT.  WINDS AND PRECIPITATION WILL 
INCREASE TONIGHT AS THE FRONT MOVES INTO OUR CWA.  WITH 50-60KT 850 
JET EXPECTED...WILL KEEP THE CURRENT WIND ADVISORY GOING FOR TONIGHT 
AND SUNDAY.   FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK...WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE 
EVENING AND MIDNIGHT WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER 
ARKANSAS WILL TRACK TO THE EAST...BRINGING STRONG WINDS AND PRECIP 
TO THE AREA TONIGHT AND SUNDAY. ACARS SOUNDING FROM CHA SHOWS WINDS 
AT 2600 FT AGL HAVE ALREADY INCREASED TO 45 KTS. SOME OBSERVATIONS 
FROM THE MOUNTAINS HAVE INDICATED GUSTS TO AROUND 25 MPH SO FAR. 
WITH NIGHT FALL THE LLJ WILL STRENGTHEN...AND THE MODELS SHOW 
SOUTHEASTERLY 850 MB WINDS UP TO 60 KTS LATE TONIGHT. WILL HAVE A 
WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS OF TN AND SW NC...AND FOR THE 
SOUTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES TONIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING UNTIL THE 
FROPA. THE MOISTURE REMAINS SHALLOW BELOW 850 MB WITH A VERY DRY 
LAYER ABOVE...SO CHANCES OF MEASURABLE PRECIP ARE EXPECTED TO HOLD 
OFF UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT. PRECIP WILL BE DELAYED EVEN FURTHER IN THE 
NORTH WHERE DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS WILL KEEP THE LOW LAYERS DRY. BY 
09Z...SHOWERS JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL ENTER THE AREA. THE SHEAR 
WILL BE STRONG BUT DUE TO A LACK OF INSTABILITY...DO NOT EXPECT ANY 
THUNDER. VALLEY LOCATIONS COULD BRIEFLY SEE SOME STRONG WIND GUSTS 
WITH THE SHOWERS AND FROPA. THE FRONT WILL PUSH EAST OF OUR AREA 
AFTER 18Z...ENDING ALL PRECIP AND SHIFTING WINDS TO THE WEST. COLD 
ADVECTION SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES NEARLY STEADY OR SLIGHTLY FALLING 
THROUGH THE DAY ON SUNDAY.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...PROGRESSIVE PATTERN 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH WRAPPED UP SURFACE LOW MOVING INTO 
ONTARIO AND TRAILING COLD FRONT IN THE EASTERN CAROLINAS BY 00Z 
MONDAY. DRIER AND COLDER AIR BEHIND FRONT SPREADS ACROSS THE OHIO 
AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL OVER THE SOUTHERN 
STATES SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. THE ECMWF AND GFS SWING THE NEXT 
TROUGH INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT AND THROUGH 
THE TN VALLEY TUESDAY. MAINLY MID AND HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE WITH THE 
SYSTEM WITH GFS KEEPING BULK OF SYSTEM SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA.
ONLY HAVE 20 PERCENT CHANCE OF RAIN OR POSSIBLY SNOW IF 
PRECIPITATION STARTS EARLY ENOUGH TUESDAY. NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED. 
PRONOUNCED TROUGH ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY SLIDES EAST 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY INTO THE CENTRAL STATES. THIS WILL CAUSE 
BRIEF RIDGING IN THE SOUTHEAST AND BRING DRYING TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. BUT ANOTHER DEVELOPING SYSTEM MOVES QUICKLY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING FOLLOWED BY A SLOWER AND 
STRONGER SYSTEM EARLY FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. WILL HAVE POPS IN MOST 
PERIODS FROM CHRISTMAS ON AND TEMPERATURES WILL BE MAINLY ABOVE 
NORMAL DUE TO CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION.            
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WIND ADVISORY FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST SUNDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WIND ADVISORY FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST SUNDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLEDSOE...MARION...SEQUATCHIE.

     WIND ADVISORY FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST SUNDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...
     UNICOI.

VA...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 221448 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
948 AM EST SAT DEC 22 2007

.DISCUSSION...
NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES ARE NEEDED FOR THE MORNING UPDATE. A LOW
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL MERGE WITH THE NORTHERN STREAM LOW
OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS...PUSHING A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE AREA
LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT. HIGH CLODUS ARE MOVING IN AHEAD OF THE
SYSTEM...AND THE LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL INCREASE. AREA
RADARS SHOW SOME LIGHT SHOWERS EAT OF THE MOUNTAINS...WHICH MAY
REACH OUR BORDER BEFORE DISSIPATING. DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS SHOULD
PROVIDE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES IN THE NORTHERN VALLEY AND SW VA...WITH
HIGHS THERE REACHING CLOSE TO 60.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 220911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST SAT DEC 22 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO LIFT 
NORTHEAST OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION...WITH A COLD FRONT PUSHING INTO OUR AREA BY LATE TONIGHT.  
STRONG SOUTHEAST WINDS AHEAD OF THIS FRONT WILL LEAD TO DOWNSLOPE 
DRYING AND WARMING FOR THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS TODAY 
INTO TONIGHT. STRONG GUSTY WINDS CAN ALSO BE EXPECTED IN THE 
MOUNTAINS LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND ESPECIALLY TONIGHT.  A WIND 
ADVISORY OR HIGH WIND WARNING WILL LIKELY BE NEEDED FOR HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS BY TONIGHT...WILL ADD MENTION OF STRONG WINDS IN HWO.  
WILL CONTINUE TO CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS FOR 
TODAY...BUT MAIN PRECIP WILL BE TONIGHT.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
NORTHEAST VALLEY...WITH CATEGORICAL SOUTHWEST ZONES FOR LATE 
TONIGHT. SOME THUNDER MAY OCCUR...BUT INSTABILITY LOOKS UNIMPRESSIVE 
SO WILL KEEP MENTION OUT FOR NOW.  WILL GENERALLY GO ABOVE MAV TEMPS 
FOR DOWNSLOPE AREAS BOTH TODAY AND TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED FRONT 
BLAST THROUGH MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE MORNING FOLLOWED 
BY DRYING. SURFACE RIDGE EXTENDS ACROSS THE REGION ON MONDAY 
WITH DRY SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AS ANOTHER SHORTWAVE DEVELOPS IN 
ACTIVE SOUTHERN STREAM ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. SURFACE LOW WILL 
SHIFT EAST NEAR THE GULF WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT CREATING THE 
POSSIBILITY FOR PRECIP LATER CHRISTMAS EVE INTO CHRISTMAS. THERE 
COULD BE A FEW SNOWFLAKES WITH THE COLDER AIR IN PLACE AHEAD OF THE 
SYSTEM AT LEAST UNTIL MID DAY WHEN WARMING LEAVES PRECIP IN THE FORM 
OF RAIN. THIS WAVE EXITS BY THE EVENING ON CHRISTMAS ALLOWING FOR A 
BRIEF DRY PERIOD WHICH EXTENDS THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING. HOWEVER 
NEXT WAVE APPROACHES THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH 
INCREASING CHANCES FOR RAIN LATER WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON INTO THE 
EVENING. MAINTAINED CHANCE FOR RAIN ON THURSDAY WITH PROBABILITIES 
DROPPING DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS AS SHORTWAVE EXITS. WENT MUCH 
CLOSER TO ECMWF DEPICTION FOR FRIDAY WITH ANOTHER SYSTEM BUILDING 
INTO THE EASTERN U.S. WITH INCREASING CHANCES FOR RAIN FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS. USED A BROAD BRUSH APPROACH WITH 
POPS DURING THIS LATE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST AND DUE TO PRECIP 
FALLING INTO COLDER AIR AT NIGHT...SPRINKLED SOME SNOW BACK IN 
ACROSS MAINLY NORTHERN PARTS OF THE REGION. THERE WILL CERTAINLY BE 
CHANGES MADE TO THIS ACTIVE LONG TERM FORECAST IN THE COMING DAYS AS 
SHORT WAVE TIMING AND STRENGTH OF TEMPERATURE AND MOISTURE ADVECTION 
WITH EACH SYSTEM COME INTO BETTER FOCUS.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  56  48  52  28  53 /  10  90  40   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  49  53  26  49 /  10  80  70  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  59  48  51  26  50 /  10  80  50  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  60  44  53  25  47 /  10  50  90  10   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 220143
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
843 PM EST FRI DEC 21 2007

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING.  CLOUDS REMAIN ACROSS 
MOST OF THE CWA.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST APPEAR ON 
TRACK.  NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
DOWNSLOPE WINDS HAVE ERODED CLOUDS ACROSS THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SW VA. HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL REMAIN 
ENTRENCHED EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS...KEEPING A E-SE FLOW IN PLACE 
ALOFT. THIS WILL RESULT IN CONTINUED CLOUDS IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY 
AS THE LOW LEVEL WIND TRAJECTORY IN THAT AREA IS FROM THE ATLANTIC. 
WITH CLEARING IN THE NORTH AND CENTRAL SECTIONS AND A MOIST GROUND 
FROM LAST NIGHTS RAINFALL...FOG WILL BE A POSSIBILITY...THOUGH IT 
MAY BE OFFSET BY THE DOWNSLOPE FLOW. WILL NOT MENTION FOG AT THIS 
TIME IN THE ZONES. 

A STRENGTHENING 850 MB FLOW WILL BRING HIGHER THETA-E AIR TO THE 
AREA TOMORROW. EXPECT OVERCAST SKIES IN THE SOUTH...AND BROKEN 
CLOUDS NORTH. THE LLJ INCREASES OVERNIGHT...UP TO AROUND 60 KTS IN 
THE GFS AND NAM...AND HIGH WINDS COULD BE A PROBLEM IN THE MOUNTAINS 
SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING. CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH ENOUGH YET TO 
PUT OUT A HIGH WIND WATCH...BUT LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED AT LEAST AN 
ADVISORY. DEEP LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE 
FRONT ENTERS THE AREA AROUND 06Z. STRONG DOWNSLOPE WINDS MAY INHIBIT 
PRECIP MOVEMENT INTO NE TN/SW VA...BUT BY 12Z THE ENTIRE AREA WILL 
SEE PRECIP. WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS AFTER 06Z SOUTH AND 
WEST...AND AFTER 12Z NORTH AND EAST. POPS END QUICKLY BEHIND THE 
FRONT...WHICH WILL BE TO OUR EAST BY THE AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES MAY 
BE FALLING DURING THE DAY ON SUNDAY AS COLD ADVECTION KICKS IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...PROGRESSIVE PATTERN 
CONTINUES SUNDAY NIGHT WITH MODELS LIFTING SYSTEM TO THE NE AT 00Z 
MONDAY SURFACE LOW IS OVER LAKE SUPERIOR AND UPPER CENTER TO THE SE 
NEAR LAKE HURON. EXPECT PRECIPITATION TO BE OVER AND COLDER DRIER 
AIR WITH TROUGH MOVING IN. HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE SOUTH CENTRAL 
GULF COAST WILL BRING FAIR WEATHER TO THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 
MONDAY. MONDAY NIGHT A WEAK TROUGH DEVELOPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS AND LOWER MS VALLEY AHEAD OF DEEPER TROUGH OVER THE ROCKIES 
AND NORTHWEST. MOISTURE WILL SPREAD RAPIDLY BACK INTO THE AREA AND 
WITH COLDER AIR IN PLACE BRING SOME SNOW EARLY TUESDAY BEFORE THE 
ATMOSPHERE WARMS. AT THIS TIME DO NOT THINK THERE WILL BE ANY 
ACCUMULATION IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS BEFORE THE SNOW CHANGES TO 
RAIN. HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY SEE SLIGHT ACCUMULATIONS BUT EVEN THERE 
THE WARMER AIR ALOFT SHOULD MOVE IN FAIRLY QUICKLY TUESDAY. TUESDAY 
NIGHT THIS SYSTEM MOVES OUT AS DEEP TROUGH MOVES INTO THE PLAINS 
STATES THIS NEXT SYSTEM COULD PRODUCE MORE SIGNIFICANT RAIN 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY WITH A BRIEF BREAK BEFORE THE TROUGH 
IN THE CENTRAL STATES SENDS ANOTHER SYSTEM INTO THE TN VALLEY 
FRIDAY. THE FRIDAY SYSTEM WILL BRING ENOUGH COLDER AIR FOR A CHANCE 
OF SNOW AT LEAST AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS NORTH AND 
MOUNTAINS. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  44  58  50  50  30 /   0  10  90  40  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    41  58  50  53  28 /   0  10  90  70  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            42  57  47  49  28 /   0  10  90  50  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   34  56  50  55  27 /   0  10  50  90  10 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

THE GFS AND NAM...AND HIGH WINDS COULD BE A PROBLEM IN THE MOUNTAINS

ATMOSPHERE WARMS. AT THIS TIME DO NOT THINK THERE WILL BE ANY 
ACCUMULATION IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS BEFORE THE SNOW CHANGES TO

THE WARMER AIR ALOFT SHOULD MOVE IN FAIRLY QUICKLY TUESDAY. TUESDAY 
NIGHT THIS SYSTEM MOVES OUT AS DEEP TROUGH MOVES INTO THE PLAINS

WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY WITH A BRIEF BREAK BEFORE THE TROUGH 
IN THE CENTRAL STATES SENDS ANOTHER SYSTEM INTO THE TN VALLEY 
FRIDAY. THE FRIDAY SYSTEM WILL BRING ENOUGH COLDER AIR FOR A CHANCE

MOUNTAINS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 211458 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
958 AM EST FRI DEC 21 2007

.DISCUSSION...
MOST OF THE RAIN HAS EXITED THE ARE WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM. HOWEVER A FEW SHOWERS REMAIN ALONG THE MOUNTAIN
RIDGES AS A STRONG SURFACE HIGH OVER NEW ENGLAND PRODUCES A MOIST
SOUTHEAST UPSLOPE FLOW. PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD REMAIN LIGHT IN OUR
AREA...AND WILL ADD ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP TO THE NE TN MOUNTAINS
AND THE SMOKIES TODAY. DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE
MOUNTAINS SHOULD PROVIDE SOME PARTIAL CLEARING OF CLOUDS IN THE TN
VALLEY AND SW VA. HOWEVER WITH LITTLE DRY AIR ADVECTION TO ASSIST
CLOUD EROSION...EXPECT CLOUDS TO HANG IN LONGER THAN THE MODELS
INDICATE. WILL INCREASE CLOUD COVER GRIDS A BIT. TEMPERATURES ARE
RUNNING CLOSE TO FORECAST AND WILL NOT BE CHANGED.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

$$

DGS

FXUS64 KMRX 210914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST FRI DEC 21 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL PULL OUT 
QUICKLY THIS MORNING...FOLLOWED BY UPPER LEVEL RIDGING.  SURFACE 
HIGH TO THE NORTHEAST WILL BUILD IN.  DEEP MOISTURE WILL EXIT 
QUICKLY. WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS NORTHEAST AND SLIGHT CHANCE CENTRAL 
THIS MORNING...THEN DRY.  APPEARS SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL 
LINGER...ALTHOUGH LOW LEVEL WINDS SHOULD BE PRIMARILY SOUTHEAST SO 
MAY SEE DOWNSLOPE FLOW HELP TO DIMINISH CLOUDS WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS 
BY THIS AFTERNOON.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY A  
FEW MINOR TWEAKS. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...QUITE AN ACTIVE PERIOD 
HEADING TOWARD THE END OF 2007 WITH THE SOUTHERN STREAM BRINGING 
THREE SHORTWAVE FEATURES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THE FIRST FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY HAS A STRONG FRONTAL SYSTEM WITH FROPA 
AROUND DAYBREAK SUNDAY WITH SOME POST FRONTAL PRECIP. NEXT WAVE 
CENTERED AROUND TUESDAY WITH GFS A LITTLE STRONGER THAN ECMWF WITH 
LIFT AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP. LEANED A CLOSER TO THE GFS USING SMALL 
CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE WITH SYSTEM EXITING MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
BY TUESDAY NIGHT. NEXT WAVE APPROACHES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
ON WEDNESDAY AND ALLOWED FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AS WAA STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF DEEPENING TROF. BEST SHOT AT 
RAIN WITH THIS SYSTEM APPEARS TO BE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY 
AND USED SMALL AND MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR THIS EXTENDED PERIOD OF 
THE FORECAST. HAD TO MENTION POSSIBILITY OF MAINLY HIGHER ELEVATION 
SNOW MONDAY NIGHT...WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY NIGHT WITH LOW 
LEVEL AIRMASS COOLING TO AROUND FREEZING AND JUST BELOW IN THESE 
AREAS. OF COURSE AS MODEL SOLUTIONS WITH SOME OF THESE SHORTWAVES 
COME INTO BETTER FOCUS WE WILL HAVE A BETTER IDEA CONCERNING THE 
REQUIREMENT TO ADD SNOW TO THE FORECAST.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  42  60  47  53 /  20  10  10  70  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN  56  41  61  46  50 /  10  10  10  60  60

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 210254
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
946 PM EST THU DEC 20 2007

.DISCUSSION...MID/UPR LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE SE THROUGH AREA 
TONIGHT. BROAD SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SW OF AREA HAS BEEN WRESTLING
WITH HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING DOWN APPALACHIANS. SURFACE LOW WILL 
RESPOND TO MOVEMENT OF UPPER LOW AND TIGHTEN OVERNIGHT ON S SIDE OF 
RIDGE AXIS WELL S OF MRX. MODERATELY STRONG SOUTHERLY H85 FLOW HAVE 
HINDERED PCPN ACROSS MRX CWA THIS EVENING. SUFFICIENT LIFT AND 
MOISTURE WITH UPPER LOW SHOULD ALLOW FOR WIDESPREAD LIGHT PCPN 
OVERNIGHT. SON  

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM NEAR
MEMPHIS WILL TRACK TO THE EAST TONIGHT. A LARGE AREA OF RAIN OVER
MIDDLE TN...ASSOCIATED WITH DEEP ISENTROPIC LIFT...UPPER
DIVERGENCE...AND 500 MB PVA...WILL BEGIN TO ENTER OUR AREA THIS
EVENING. A STRENGTHENING 850 MB FLOW FROM THE SOUTH WILL LIKELY
CREATE A DOWNSLOPE EFFECT IN THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THAT
WILL DELAY PRECIP. HOWEVER PRECIP SHOULD COVER THE ENTIRE AREA
AFTER MIDNIGHT. THOUGH THERE ARE SOME EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS IN
MIDDLE TN...THE AIR MASS IS MORE STABLE OVER EAST TN...AND DO NOT
EXPECT ELEVATED INSTABILITY TO BE ADEQUATE TO SUPPORT
THUNDERSTORMS. CONVECTION ALONG THE GULF COAST MAY ALSO SERVE TO
REDUCE QPF IN OUR AREA...WITH GENERALLY A TENTH TO A QUARTER INCH
OF RAIN EXPECTED IN MOST SPOTS. PRECIP SHOULD BEGIN TO TAPER OFF IN
THE SW AROUND 09Z...AND END FRIDAY MORNING. PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE REMAINS INTO FRIDAY AFTERNOON...AND THERE IS NO STRONG
PUSH OF DRY AIR BEHIND THE SYSTEM...SO EXPECT MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES
TO PERSIST.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...PATTERN CONTINUES TO 
LOOK QUITE CHANGEABLE THROUGH THE WEEKEND INTO NEXT WEEK. THERE WILL 
BE BRIEF DRYING FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY AS SOME UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING REPLACES FRIDAYS SYSTEM. NEXT SYSTEM THAT TODAY IS MOVING 
INTO THE ROCKIES FROM THE WEST COAST WILL SPREAD MOISTURE INTO THE 
TN VALLEY SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT WITH RAIN SHOWERS BECOMING 
LIKELY BY SATURDAY NIGHT OR SUNDAY. MILD AIR AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM 
WILL PUSH TEMPERATURES UP TO NEAR AND ABOVE 60 SATURDAY. COLDER AIR 
BEHIND SUNDAY SYSTEM SHOULD DROP TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES. 
ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL PASS JUST TO THE SOUTH TUESDAY AND WITH COLDER 
AIR IN PLACE MAY BRING A LITTLE SNOW TO THE NORTH AND RAIN WITH 
POSSIBLY SOME SNOW MIXED IN SOUTH. THIS SYSTEM DOES NOT LOOK AS 
STRONG AND WILL PASS MOSTLY TO THE SOUTH SO NO SIGNIFICANT SNOW IS 
EXPECTED. RIGHT BEHIND THAT SYSTEM WILL FOLLOW ANOTHER SOUTHERN 
SYSTEM AS THE SOUTHERN JET REMAINS ACTIVE.      
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  44  56  42  61  46 / 100  10   0  20  60 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    43  52  41  60  44 / 100  20   0  20  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN            43  53  40  61  43 / 100  10   0  20  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   37  48  35  58  42 / 100  30  10  20  50 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1008 AM EST THU DEC 20 2007

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPDATE HAS BEEN ISSUED TO ADJUST THE AREA AND TIME OF THE DENSE
FOG ADVISORY. ALLOWED THE CENTRAL VALLEY TO EXPIRE AT 10 AM AS THE
FOG THERE HAS LIFTED IN MOST PLACES. THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...NE
TN...AND SW VA ZONES CONTINUE TO SEE DENSE FOG IN THE VALLEYS PER
VISIBLE SATTELITE IMAGERY...AND WILL KEEP THE ADVISORY GOING IN
THOSE AREAS UNTIL NOON. ISENTROPIC LIFT IS BRINGING LOW CLOUDS TO
THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...AND PRECIP CHANCE SHOULD
INCREASE AFTER NOON AS MOISTURE ADVECTION INCREASES AHEAD OF THE
APPROACHING LOW.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 200922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
422 AM EST THU DEC 20 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SURFACE OBSERVATIONS IN THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY INDICATING VISIBILITIES NEAR ZERO ACROSS 
THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY FROM THE RECENT RAIN.  WILL ISSUE A 
DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR THOSE AREAS.  THE SOUTHERN AREAS OF THE CWA 
SHOULD ONLY SEE PATCHY FOG...SO WILL NOT INCLUDE THOSE AREAS IN THE 
ADVISORY.  MODELS TRACK A SHORTWAVE AND SURFACE LOW FROM THE WEST 
INTO THE REGION LATE TODAY.  SHOULD HAVE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE WITH TO 
KEEP LIKELY POPS IN THE WEST FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND DRY IN THE 
NORTHERN AREAS.  BEST CHANCES SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL TONIGHT AS THE 
DISTURBANCE TRACKS THROUGH THE CWA.  MODELS INDICATING GOOD LIFT AND 
DEEP MOISTURE WITH IT...WILL KEEP 80 POPS FOR TONIGHT.  THICKNESSES 
INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID.  UPPER LOW SHIFTS TO  
THE EAST ON FRIDAY.  WILL CARRY LOW POPS FOR ONLY FRIDAY MORNING... 
WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN OUR EASTERN ZONES.  STAYED NEAR MOS 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL EVOLUTION OF THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY...BUT HAVE SOME TIMING 
DIFFERENCES AS THE WRF MODEL REVEALS A FASTER EASTWARD PROGRESSION 
OF THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT (COMPARED TO THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS). 
WITH A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH PROGGED...WILL TREND 
TOWARD THE SLOWER GFS/ECMWF SOLUTION WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE EXPECTED 
AROUND 12Z SUNDAY MORNING. THESE THREE MODELS TEND TO AGREE THAT 
COLDER SUB-FREEZING AIR WILL NOT ARRIVE ON SUNDAY BEFORE MOISTURE 
EXITS THE REGION. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT THERE WILL NOT BE MUCH (IF 
ANY) SNOWFALL WITH THIS SYSTEM. 

BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS INDICATE A PROGRESSIVE PATTERN THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM QUICKLY MOVING INTO 
THE REGION BY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. A MORE SOUTHERLY TRACK TO 
THIS SYSTEM APPEARS TO FAVOR A COLDER AIR MASS FOR THE FORECAST AREA 
AND THE POSSIBILITY OF SNOW. SINCE BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM AND BOTH HAVE SHOWN SHOWN SOME 
CONSISTENCY (THE LAST FEW MODEL RUNS) OF THE POSSIBILITY OF 
WIDESPREAD SNOWFALL...WILL GO AHEAD AND MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SNOW FOR CHRISTMAS (MAINLY DURING THE MORNING HOURS). IT REMAINS TO 
BE SEEN IF TEMPS CAN REMAIN COLD ENOUGH FOR MUCH ACCUMULATIONS... 
SINCE RIGHT NOW IT APPEARS THAT TEMPS WILL RISE ABOVE FREEZING IN 
THE VALLEYS...LIMITING THE AMOUNT OF POSSIBLE SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS 
FOR THE VALLEYS. YET ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM QUICKLY MOVES INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...SO WILL MENTION A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PRECIP ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS 
THAT TEMPS MAY BE A LITTLE WARMER WITH THIS SYSTEM.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  55  44  58  42  62 /  60  80  20   0  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  53  43  55  40  60 /  30  80  20   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN  52  43  55  40  60 /  30  80  20   0  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  52  38  52  35  58 /  10  80  30   0  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...GRAINGER...
     HAMBLEN...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...JOHNSON...KNOX...
     LOUDON...MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST 
     CARTER...NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST GREENE...ROANE...SCOTT 
     TN...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST 
     GREENE...SULLIVAN...UNICOI...UNION...WASHINGTON TN.

VA...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.

FXUS64 KMRX 200237
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 PM EST WED DEC 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO FORECAST. NE TN VALLEY LOCATIONS HAVE 
SUNK TO THE FCST LOW. WILL LOWER MINS THOSE AREAS A COUPLE DEGREES 
BUT DONT EXPECT TEMPS TO FALL MUCH MORE. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
ADVECTION UNDERWAY FM SW AND EXPECT CLOUD COVER TO INCREASE 
OVERNIGHT. UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR EVENING SKIES TEMPS HAVE COOLED TO 
NEAR SATURATION AND WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FOG ALL AREAS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT TROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...MUCH OF THE LOW CLOUDS 
THAT COVERED THE AREA THIS MORNING HAVE DISSIPATED AS DRY AIR ALOFT 
HAS MOVED EAST. HOWEVER PLENTY OF CLOUDS REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA AND IN NRN AL/GA...IN THE VICINITY OF A 850 
THETA-E GRADIENT. MEANWHILE A TROUGH OVER THE SW CONUS WILL MOVE 
EAST AND INDUCE CYCLOGENESIS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. AN INCREASING 
SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL PUSH THE HIGHER THETA-E AIR NORTHWARD LATE 
TONIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING...BRINGING A RETURN OF LOW CLOUDS. LIFT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE 500 MB VORT MAX AND UPPER DIFFLUENCE WILL 
PROVIDE LIFT LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR PRECIP. EXPECT THE PRECIP 
TO BEGIN IN THE SOUTH FIRST...PROBABLY AROUND NOON...THEN SPREAD 
NORTHWARD. MOUNTAIN SHADOWING MAY DELAY ONSET OF PRECIP IN THE NORTH 
UNTIL AROUND 00Z FRIDAY. THE LIFT AND DEEPEST MOISTURE APPEAR 
MAXIMIZED IN BOTH THE GFS AND NAM AFTER 00Z...AND WILL HAVE 
CATEGORICAL POPS OVERNIGHT. THE MID AND UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS WILL 
BE JUST EAST OF OUR AREA AT 12Z...AND POPS WILL TAPER OFF IN THE 
EARLY MORNING HOURS. FOR TEMPERATURES...LEANED TOWARD THE WARMER 
LOWS TONIGHT AND THURSDAY NIGHT AND THE COOLER HIGHS DUE TO EXPECTED 
CLOUD COVER AND RECENT MODEL WARM BIAS FOR HIGHS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER 
OVER THE AREA FRIDAY MORNING AS THE THRUSDAY/S SYSTEM EXITS THE 
REGION.  WILL BRIEFLY BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH AT 
LEAST SATURDAY MORNING.  MODEL AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY VERY POOR 
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED THOUGH GFS SEEMS TO BE TRENDING 
SLOWER WITH SYSTEMS.  CURRENT RUN BRINGS THE NEXT SYSTEM INTO THE 
MRX CWA LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  HAVE THEREFORE... KEPT 
JUST LOW POPS FOR LATE SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND LOWERED POPS SLIGHT 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND INCREASE POPS A BIT FOR EARLY SUNDAY.  
ADDITIONALLY...THE OPERATIONAL GFS PULLS IN ANOTHER WEATHER SYSTEM 
AROUND THE MONDAY/ MONDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME...THIS IS NOT CONSISTENT 
WITH MANY OF THE OTHER MODELS AND CONFIDENCE IS VERY LOW WITH THIS 
FEATURE.  FOR NOW...HAVE ADDED LOW POPS TO MONDAY NIGHT...LEAVING 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY DRY.  HAVE ALSO LEFT THE REST OF THE PERIOD DRY 
THOUGH MODELS HINTING AT ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHING THE REGION 
AROUND WEDNESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   41  55  43  58  43 /   0  70  80  20  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     37  53  42  54  38 /   0  40  80  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             36  52  42  54  38 /   0  40  80  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    30  52  37  51  35 /   0  10  80  20  10
