AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EST WED DEC 19 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT TROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...MUCH OF THE LOW CLOUDS 
THAT COVERED THE AREA THIS MORNING HAVE DISSIPATED AS DRY AIR ALOFT 
HAS MOVED EAST. HOWEVER PLENTY OF CLOUDS REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA AND IN NRN AL/GA...IN THE VICINITY OF A 850 
THETA-E GRADIENT. MEANWHILE A TROUGH OVER THE SW CONUS WILL MOVE 
EAST AND INDUCE CYCLOGENESIS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. AN INCREASING 
SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL PUSH THE HIGHER THETA-E AIR NORTHWARD LATE 
TONIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING...BRINGING A RETURN OF LOW CLOUDS. LIFT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE 500 MB VORT MAX AND UPPER DIFFLUENCE WILL 
PROVIDE LIFT LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR PRECIP. EXPECT THE PRECIP 
TO BEGIN IN THE SOUTH FIRST...PROBABLY AROUND NOON...THEN SPREAD 
NORTHWARD. MOUNTAIN SHADOWING MAY DELAY ONSET OF PRECIP IN THE NORTH 
UNTIL AROUND 00Z FRIDAY. THE LIFT AND DEEPEST MOISTURE APPEAR 
MAXIMIZED IN BOTH THE GFS AND NAM AFTER 00Z...AND WILL HAVE 
CATEGORICAL POPS OVERNIGHT. THE MID AND UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS WILL 
BE JUST EAST OF OUR AREA AT 12Z...AND POPS WILL TAPER OFF IN THE 
EARLY MORNING HOURS. FOR TEMPERATURES...LEANED TOWARD THE WARMER 
LOWS TONIGHT AND THURSDAY NIGHT AND THE COOLER HIGHS DUE TO EXPECTED 
CLOUD COVER AND RECENT MODEL WARM BIAS FOR HIGHS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER 
OVER THE AREA FRIDAY MORNING AS THE THRUSDAY/S SYSTEM EXITS THE 
REGION.  WILL BRIEFLY BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH AT 
LEAST SATURDAY MORNING.  MODEL AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY VERY POOR 
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED THOUGH GFS SEEMS TO BE TRENDING 
SLOWER WITH SYSTEMS.  CURRENT RUN BRINGS THE NEXT SYSTEM INTO THE 
MRX CWA LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  HAVE THEREFORE... KEPT 
JUST LOW POPS FOR LATE SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND LOWERED POPS SLIGHT 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND INCREASE POPS A BIT FOR EARLY SUNDAY.  
ADDITIONALLY...THE OPERATIONAL GFS PULLS IN ANOTHER WEATHER SYSTEM 
AROUND THE MONDAY/ MONDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME...THIS IS NOT CONSISTENT 
WITH MANY OF THE OTHER MODELS AND CONFIDENCE IS VERY LOW WITH THIS 
FEATURE.  FOR NOW...HAVE ADDED LOW POPS TO MONDAY NIGHT...LEAVING 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY DRY.  HAVE ALSO LEFT THE REST OF THE PERIOD DRY 
THOUGH MODELS HINTING AT ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHING THE REGION 
AROUND WEDNESDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 191507 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1007 AM EST WED DEC 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...
PRECIP THAT MOVED THROUGH THE AREA THIS MORNING WAS ASSOCIATED WITH
500 MB VORTICITY ADVECTION AND DIFFLUENCE AHEAD OF THE UPPER JET.
WITH THE PASSAGE OF THESE FEATURES TO OUR EAST...PRECIP HAS ENDED
IN OUR AREA. 12Z OHX RAOB SHOWS DRY AIR ABOVE 800 MB...WITH A MOIST
LAYER BELOW. SATELLITE TRENDS SHOW BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS OVER MIDDLE
TN. SO EXPECT MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS THE AREA UNTIL LATE IN THE
AFTERNOON. UPDATE WILL REMOVE POPS AND TWEAK TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY. 

&&


.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 190824
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 AM EST WED DEC 19 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING ISOLATED AREAS OF 
VERY LIGHT RAIN TRACKING THROUGH THE CWA ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK COLD 
FRONT AND SHORTWAVE.  MODELS AGREE ON TRACKING THE FRONT THROUGH THE 
REGION QUICKLY TODAY WITH DRY WEATHER RETURNING TONIGHT.  
TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN RISING AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SO FREEZING RAIN 
AND SLEET HAVE NOT BEEN REPORTED YET.  BUT MAY STILL SEE A BRIEF 
WINTRY MIX EARLY THIS MORNING...BUT PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS SHOULD BE 
VERY LIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN LATER TODAY BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER FOR TONIGHT.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE BLEND NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LONG-RANGE MODELS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH AN OVERALL SLOWER PROGRESSION OF THE NEXT 
SEVERAL SYSTEMS THAT ARE PROGGED TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. ON THURSDAY...A SHORT-WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP A WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. AN INVERTED TROUGH TO THE NORTH OF 
THIS LOW SHOULD HELP TO TRIGGER SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA...MAINLY ON THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS SYSTEM WILL QUICKLY 
MOVE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...WITH A LONG-WAVE UPPER 
TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHWEST DEVELOPING ANOTHER STRONGER LOW PRESSURE 
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON FRIDAY NIGHT. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
WITH THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS CURRENTLY PROGGED TO BRING SHOWERS 
TO THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY NIGHT... BUT WITH SUCH AN AMPLIFIED 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH...WOULDNT BE SURPRISED IF LATER MODEL RUNS 
SLOW-DOWN THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THIS FRONT A LITTLE MORE. 
TEMPS WILL QUICKLY WARM AHEAD OF THIS FRONT...WITH NOT MUCH COLD AIR 
EXPECTED BEHIND IT. THUS...DONT EXPECT MUCH OF A CHANCE FOR SNOW ON 
SUNDAY MORNING...AS MOISTURE QUICKLY EXITS THE REGION BEHIND THE 
FRONT. ECMWF AND GFS MODELS REVEAL SOME LARGE DISCREPANCIES FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK...SO WILL NOT CHANGE PREVIOUS FORECAST VERY MUCH FOR 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST TUE DEC 18 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...RELATIVELY LOW AMPLITUDE 
SHORT WAVE PRESSING EAST TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON. NICE AREA OF STRATUS ADVANCING AT A RAPID PACE ACROSS THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE REGION. ALWAYS DIFFICULT TO 
DETERMINE HOW MUCH WARMING WILL OCCUR IN ADVANCE OF A WEAK WINTER 
SYSTEM. WENT AHEAD AND USED MINS TEMPS AT FREEZING OR BELOW MAINLY 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AS WELL AS HIGHER TERRAIN 
AREAS. WEAK LIFT AND MOISTURE NOT VERY DEEP SO STAYED WITH SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS. SPRINKLED IN A BIT OF LIGHT RAIN AND A FEW SLEET 
PELLETS LOWER ELEVATIONS AND THEN A MIXTURE OF LIGHT SLEET/SNOW/RAIN 
HIGHER TERRAIN FOR THE WEAK SYSTEM WHICH RIPS ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY LATE MORNING. NEXT SYSTEM BRINGS ANOTHER SHOT AT 
RAIN ON THURSDAY BUT NOT UNTIL LATER IN THE AFTERNOON AND MAINLY 
AFFECTING THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA BEFORE SUNSET. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...FORECAST TIMING LEANS 
TOWARD ECMWF WHICH CARVES A SHARPER AND DEEP TROUGH WEST OF THE AREA 
THIS WEEKEND. MAIN RESULT OF THIS SOLUTION IS SLOWER PROGRESSION AND 
A NOTABLY WARMER SATURDAY. 

SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH THU NGT BRINGING CLOUDS AND A GOOD CHANCE 
OF PCPN WITH ITS PASSING. TEMPS WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL. RIDGING FROM 
THE NE MAINTAINS FRI AND SAT AS DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
DEVELOPS TO THE W. STRONG LOW MOVES NE THROUGH GRTLKS ON SUN WITH 
COLD FRONT MOVING EAST THROUGH S APPALACHIANS EARLY SUN. BEST PCPN 
CHC SAT NGT INTO SUN MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FM THE WEST 
SUN WITH REINFORCING SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FM THE NW MON 
NGT. LIGHT UPSLOPE SNOW SHWRS PSBL THROUGH MON NGT.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 180834
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EST TUE DEC 18 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE UPPER MS 
RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MOVING THIS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM QUICKLY ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION TODAY...WITH 
ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING TOWARDS THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY LATE 
TONIGHT. MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE LIMITED AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT... 
BUT BOTH THE GFS AND WRF MODELS INDICATE THAT IT WILL BE ENOUGH FOR 
SOME DEVELOPMENT OF PATCHY LIGHT PRECIP LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY 
WEDNESDAY. OF CONCERN IS THE FACT THAT TEMPS WILL BE HOVERING AROUND 
FREEZING AS THIS LIGHT PRECIP BEGINS TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA. 
HOWEVER...BOTH MODELS INDICATE THAT SOUTHERLY WINDS AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT WILL PUSH TEMPS ABOVE FREEZING AS THE LIGHT PRECIP MOVES INTO 
THE AREA. ALTHOUGH SOME EVAPORATIVE COOLING SHOULD OCCUR DUE TO THE 
DRY BOUNDARY LAYER...MODELS INDICATE THAT SURFACE WET-BULB TEMPS 
WILL RISE ABOVE FREEZING MOST EVERYWHERE...EXCEPT ACROSS NORTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. HOWEVER...EXPECT PRECIP TO REMAIN WEST OF THESE 
AREAS UNTIL AFTER SUNRISE ON WEDNESDAY MORNING. THUS...WILL ONLY 
MENTION RAIN AS THE PRECIP TYPE FOR LATE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH THE PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING 
INTO THE AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. A SHORTWAVE IS EXPECTED TO PUSH INTO THE REGION LATE ON 
THURSDAY. MODELS AGREE ON KEEPING THE BEST MOISTURE TO THE WEST AND 
SOUTH OF OUR CWA ON THURSDAY...SO WILL LOWER POPS ON THURSDAY WITH 
THE BEST POPS IN THE SOUTH. MOISTURE INCREASES ON THURSDAY NIGHT AS 
THE SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT. SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION 
ON THURSDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ON FRIDAY BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. A FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA ON 
LATE SATURDAY ALONG WITH INCREASING MOISTURE. WILL KEEP 20-30 POPS 
FOR SATURDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN OUR WESTERN ZONES. FRONT 
PASSES THROUGH ON SATURDAY NIGHT ALONG WITH DEEPER MOISTURE...WILL 
KEEP 40 POPS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT. SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL 
LIQUID PRECIPITATION ON SATURDAY NIGHT AS WELL. COLDER AIR PUSHES IN 
ON SUNDAY AS THE DEEPEST MOISTURE EXITS THE CWA...WILL KEEP LOW POPS 
FOR SUNDAY. UPPER LOW FOLLOWS TO THE NORTH ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY. BEST MOISTURE REMAINS TO THE NORTH...BUT WILL KEEP LOW POPS 
FOR OUR NORTHERN ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS. SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR 
SNOW FOR BOTH PERIODS...BUT MOISTURE TOO LIMITED FOR SIGNIFICANT 
ACCUMULATIONS. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

330 PM EST MON DEC 17 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE RIDGE MOVES SLOWLY 
EAST TOWARD THE ATLANTIC COAST DURING THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS WHILE A 
WEAK SHORTWAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. INITIALLY HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE ON THE 
INCREASE BRINGING A SMATTERING OF CI TO THE REGION ON TUESDAY. THE 
LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL TURN SOUTHWESTERLY LATER TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY BRINGING AN INCREASE IN LOW CLOUDS AS ISENTROPIC LIFT 
BUILDS AHEAD OF THE WAVE. STAYED WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY/PARTLY SUNNY 
SKIES ON WEDNESDAY BUT DROPPED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AS BELIEVE MOISTURE/LIFT NOT DEEP ENOUGH. STAYED PRETTY 
CLOSE TO BLEND OF MOS TEMP GUIDANCE FOR THE SHORT TERM.    

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT 
WAVE AND WEAK SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE TN VALLEY ON 
THU. BEST PCPN CHANCES REMAINING S OF MRX CWA. WARM CONVEYOR AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT DOES SET UP E AND N OF LOW WHICH SHOULD BRING SOME 
LIGHT PCP ACROSS THE AREA INTO EARLY FRI MORNING. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE RIDGING FROM THE NE GETS A NUDGE FROM THE PASSING LOW THEN 
BUILDS BACK IN WITH INCREASING HEIGHTS ALOFT ON FRI. LARGE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVR THE NATIONS MIDSECTION ON SAT WITH 
MODELS TRENDING FOR A WARMER SAT WITH A LOW CHC FOR SHWRS. STRONG 
FRONT AND WIDESPREAD SHWRS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH EARLY SUN. 
SECONDARY COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON MONDAY WITH UPSLOPE SHWRS 
PSBL.

FXUS64 KMRX 170730
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 AM EST MON DEC 17 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH COLD 
AND DRY AIR ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS 
CLEARING SKIES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH ONLY A FEW 
HIGH CLOUDS FURTHER UPSTREAM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS AREA OF 
HIGH PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO BECOME CENTERED OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
BY TONIGHT...BRINGING CLEAR SKIES...LIGHT WINDS...AND VERY COLD 
TEMPS DUE TO EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS. TEMPS SHOULD 
FALL CLOSE TO THE DEWPOINTS TONIGHT...AND WITH RELATIVELY WARM WATER 
TEMPS COMPARED TO THE AIR TEMPS...WILL MENTION PATCHY FOG FOR LATE 
TONIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF STEAM FOG DEVELOPMENT 
ALONG THE WATERWAYS. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SERIES OF SYSTEMS WILL AFFECT 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD. INITIAL SHORT WAVE WILL APPROACH ON TUESDAY BUT APPEARS 
QUITE WEAK AT THIS TIME. NEVERTHELESS...HAVE INTRODUCED SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE SOUTHERN TIER WITH THIS FEATURE AS GFS HAS BEEN 
CONSISTENT WITH LIGHT PRECIP AND IS NOW BEING SUPPORTED BY SOME OF 
THE OTHER MODELS AND ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM 
APPROACHES ON THURSDAY. HAVE CONTINUED HIGH CHANCE POPS WITH THIS 
SYSTEM. AFTER A BRIEF RESPITE ON FRIDAY...ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL 
APPROACH ON SATURDAY. SOME UNCERTAINTY WITH RESPECT TO TIMING AND 
STRENGTH OF THIS FEATURE AS GFS HAS BEEN INCONSISTENT AND ENSEMBLES 
EXHIBIT A WIDE SPREAD AMONG THE ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE VALUES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 PM EST SUN DEC 16 2007

.DISCUSSION...DEEPENING SURFACE LOW HAS NOW MOVED TO THE MAINE COAST 
WITH UPPER SYSTEM OVER NEW YORK. PRESSURE GRADIENT IS STILL TIGHT 
AND PRODUCING NW WINDS OF 15 TO 20 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 30 MPH ACROSS 
NE TN AND SW VA THIS EVENING. AREA VAD WIND PROFILES SHOW 
NORTHWESTERLY WINDS STILL IN THE 25 TO 35 MPH RANGE ABOVE THE 
SURFACE. SNOW FLURRIES ARE STILL OCCURRING IN THE NORTHERN VALLEY 
AND POSSIBLY HEAVIER IN THE MOUNTAINS. CLOUDS HAVE DEPARTED THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY BUT ARE MOSTLY CLOUDY NE. CLOUD COVER 
SHOULD BE SLOW TO ERODE OVER SW VA AND NE TN AREAS...AS UPPER FLOW 
CONTINUES FROM THE GREAT LAKES TOWARDS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. 
TEMPERATURES ARE VERY CLOSE TO CURRENT HOURLY GRIDS SO WILL KEEP 
CURRENT LOWS. UPDATE WILL REDUCE CLOUD COVER SOUTH AND KEEP FLURRIES 
SLIGHT CHANCE SNOW IN MOUNTAINS SW VA AND NE TN A FEW MORE HOURS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 162010
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST SUN DEC 16 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM LIFTING NE 
AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON...AND AREA VAD 
WIND PROFILES SHOW WESTERLY WINDS DECREASING INTO THE 25 TO 35 MPH 
RANGE. SURFACE OBSERVATIONS INDICATE GUSTS FALLING BELOW 40 MPH AS 
WELL. THUS...CANCELED THE WIND ADVISORIES BEFORE 3PM EST.

LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW NEVER QUITE MAXIMIZED THIS AFTERNOON...AND 
INSTABILITY OF 50 TO 100 J/KG THIS MORNING HAS GIVEN WAY TO STABLE 
CONDITIONS. SO FAR...A COUPLE REPORTS OF A DUSTING OF SNOW COVER
...GENERALLY OUTSIDE OF ADVISORY AREA. BASED ON AREA RADARS AND 
LACK OF UPSLOPE...ALSO CANCELED THE SNOW ADVISORY BEFORE 3PM EST.

CLOUD COVER MAY BE SLOW TO ERODE OVER SWRN VA AND NE TN AREAS...
WHILE ELSEWHERE SKIES SHOULD GRADUALLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT. WENT CLOSER 
TO COLDER GFS MOS MINS EXCEPT FOR TRI WHERE WINDS AND CLOUDS ARE A 
FACTOR. FOR MONDAY...SHOULD SEE AMPLE SUNSHINE BUT 850 MBS REMAIN 
COLD AND SURFACE FLOW NORTHERLY...SO I BLENDED BETWEEN GFS AND 
NAM-WRF MOS MAX TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...LOOKS LIKE A 
PROGRESSIVE PATTERN IN THE LONG TERM...AS HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
AREA MONDAY NIGHT GIVES WAY TO THE NEXT SYSTEM BY THURSDAY...AND 
THEN ANOTHER SYSTEM FOR THE WEEKEND.  WILL KEEP THINGS DRY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...ALTHOUGH MODELS HINTING THAT THERE MAY BE ENOUGH 
ISENTROPIC LIFT A CLOUDY DAY WITH SPRINKLES OR A LITTLE LIGHT RAIN.  
SINCE WE HAVE BEEN ADVERTISING MOSTLY SUNNY...WILL JUST BEEF UP THE 
CLOUDS CONSIDERABLY FOR NOW AND ALLOW LATER SHIFTS TO ADD PRECIP IF 
THAT STILL LOOKS PROBABLE.  WILL CARRY HIGHEST POPS 
THURSDAY...TAPERING TO SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH AND MOUNTAINS FRIDAY 
MORNING.  SHOULD BE PRIMARILY A LIQUID EVENT.  MORE UNCERTAINTY IN 
TIMING WEEKEND SYSTEM.  PLENTY OF SPREAD AMONG MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES...AND RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY NOT GREAT. FOR NOW WILL GO 
CLOSE TO THE 06Z GFS MODEL...AND BRING POPS IN SAT THROUGH SUNDAY.
GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY SOME MINOR
ADJUSTMENTS.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 161434
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
933 AM EST SUN DEC 16 2007

.DISCUSSION...VERY STRONG WESTERLY WINDS ACROSS THE FORECAST THIS 
MORNING...WITH SUSTAINED SPEEDS FROM 20 TO 35 MPH AND OCCASIONAL 
GUSTS AS HIGH AS 45 TO 55 MPH AT AND ABOVE 3000 FEET. VAD WIND 
PROFILERS FROM AREA NWS DOPPLER RADARS SHOW LOW LEVEL WINDS IN THE 
35 TO 45 MPH RANGE...WHICH IS A LITTLE BELOW THE NAM-WRF PREDICTION 
FOR THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON. THUS...WIND ADVISORIES FOR ENTIRE 
AREA LOOK ON TRACK.

WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS SHOW DRY SLOT PASSING ACROSS THE REGION
...LEAVING JUST VERY SHALLOW MOISTURE FOR COLD AIR ADVECTION AND 
SOME DEGREE OF UPSLOPE FLOW TO SQUEEZE OUT SOME LINGERING LIGHT 
WINTRY PRECIPITATION. 850 MB TEMPS HAVE TUMBLED PER UPPER AIR PLOTS 
THIS MORNING...DOWN TO -2 DEGS C IN NE CORNER OF TN TO -8 DEGS C 
ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. WHERE RADAR ECHOES PASS ACROSS WE ARE 
GETTING SPOTTY RAIN CHANGING TO OR MIXING WITH VERY LIGHT SLEET OR 
SNOW PELLETS. 

IF LOW LEVEL FLOW VEERS MORE TO NW DIRECTION THEN UPSLOPE WOULD BE 
ENHANCED...BUT STILL SUFFICENT TO POSSIBLY ALLOW SOME LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THE SNOW ADVISORY AREAS THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON.
FORECAST IS IN GREAT SHAPE THIS MORNING...BUT WILL FRESHEN THE 
HOURLY CONDITIONS IN THE GRIDS AND ADJUST PRECIPITATION WORDING AS 
NEEDED. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             42  26  49  25  55 /  30   0   0   0   0

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 AM EST SUN DEC 16 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER NORTHERN KENTUCKY...WITH AN OCCLUDED FRONT 
EXTENDING FROM IT SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. CURRENT AREA 
RADARS REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF SHOWERS ALONG THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY...BUT ONLY VERY LIGHT AND SCATTERED ACTIVITY BEHIND IT. 
STRONG NORTHWESTERLY WINDS AND STEEP LOW-LEVEL LAPSE RATES SHOULD 
GENERATE SOME ADDITIONAL SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS LATER THIS 
MORNING...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WITH THIS SYSTEM SWINGS ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. CURRENT TEMPS REMAIN WARM IN THE FORECAST AREA... 
WITH SUB-FREEZING AIR STILL WEST AND NORTHWEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI 
AND OHIO RIVERS. ALTHOUGH TEMPS WILL BE FALLING THROUGH THE DAY... 
VALLEY TEMPS WILL LIKELY REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING FOR MOST OF THE 
DAY...PREVENTING MUCH (IF ANY) SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. WARM GROUND TEMPS 
SHOULD ALSO PREVENT MUCH SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS IN THE VALLEYS. 
MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 850 MB TEMPS WILL 
QUICKLY DROP BELOW FREEZING AROUND SUNRISE...SO IT STILL APPEARS 
THAT ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
ABOVE 2500 FEET. IN ADDITION...A LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION UP TO AN 
INCH APPEARS TO BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. 
UPSLOPE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW SHOULD ALSO HELP TO GENERATE MORE INTENSE 
SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH THIS EVENING. AS A 
RESULT...WILL PLAN TO REISSUE THE WIND AND SNOW ADVISORIES FOR 
TODAY. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...PROGRESSIVE AND SOMEWHAT 
UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN CONTINUES THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. UPPER TROUGH WILL CONTINUE 
TO PULL AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY EARLY MONDAY AS 
WEAK UPPER RIDGING BUILDS IN. THIS WILL RESULT IN GENERALLY BENIGN 
WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY WITH SLOWLY MODERATING 
TEMPS. A WEAK UPPER WAVE WILL APPROACH ON WEDNESDAY...BUT ONLY THE 
GFS AND A FEW ENSEMBLE MEMBERS PROJECT ANY MEASURABLE PRECIP WITH 
IT. WILL LEAVE OUT POPS WITH THIS EVENT FOR NOW. MORE SIGNIFICANT 
SYSTEM APPROACHES ON THURSDAY. TIMING IS BIGGEST ISSUE WITH THIS 
EVENT WITH LATEST GFS RUN SOMEWHAT FASTER THAN ECMWF AND ENSEMBLE 
MEAN. WILL KEEP POPS IN CHANCE CATEGORY FOR BOTH LATE THURSDAY AND 
EARLY FRIDAY PENDING BETTER AGREEMENT BETWEEN MEDIUM RANGE MODELS 
AND ENSEMBLES. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES 
CLOSELY AS THEY SEEM REASONABLE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
854 PM EST SAT DEC 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS MOVING OVER THE MRX CWA 
THIS EVENING.  MAIN BAND OF SHOWERS EXPECTED LATE EVENING INTO 
OVERNIGHT AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA.  SHOWERS WILL STAY 
RAIN THROUGH MUCH OF THE NIGHT...SLOWLY CHANGING OVER TO SNOW 
TOWARDS MORNING AS COLD AIR PUSHES IN BEHIND THE FRONT.  DRIER AIR 
WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE FRONT AS WELL...LIMITING SNOWFALL CHANCES.  
HOWEVER ...SOME ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
WITH AID OF UPSLOPE FLOW.  A SNOW ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR 
SUNDAY FOR THESE LOCATIONS WHERE 1 TO 3 INCHES OF SNOW IS POSSIBLE.  
ADDITIONALLY ...BREEZY TO WINDY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED BEHIND THE 
FRONT.  A WIND ADVISORY WILL BE IN EFFECT FOR THE AREA SUNDAY.  ALL 
LOOKS GOOD IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...NO UPDATES EXPECTED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 PM EST SAT DEC 15 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SYSTEM APPROACHING AND
GENERALLY AS EXPECTED. DID INCREASE POPS FOR LATE AFTERNOON AND
EARLY EVENING FOR SE TN AND SW NC...AS SHOWERS WORK NORTH FROM GA
AND SC. OTHERWISE MAIN AREA OF CONVECTION STILL SPREADING SLOWLY
EAST INTO MIDDLE TN...AND KEPT A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS OVERNIGHT
GIVEN LIFT AND SLIGHT INSTABILITY.

NO CHANGES FROM EARLIER THOUGHTS ON PRECIPITATION TYPE...WITH
MAINLY UPSLOPE AND COLD AIR ADVECTION GENERATING A LIGHT SNOWFALL
ON SUNDAY FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SWRN VA...NRN AND SMOKY
MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN. WENT AHEAD AND ISSUED A SNOW ADVISORY FOR
THOSE AREAS STARTING WITH THE MORNING PACKAGE ISSUANCE TIME...
AND MAINLY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET.

BASED ON STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT AND LOW LEVEL JET OVERNIGHT INTO
SUNDAY...EXPANDED AND EXTENDED THE WIND ADVISORY.

MOST WEB PRODUCTS AND ZFPMRX ALREADY ISSUED...NEED TO NOW FOCUS
ATTENTION ON GETTING THE NPW AND WSW PRODUCTS OUT TO THE PUBLIC.
THANKS TO SURROUNDING OFFICES FOR COORDINATION TODAY.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MORE OF A ZONAL FLOW 
DEVELOPS BEHIND WEEKEND STORM SYSTEM WHICH PROVIDES FOR DRY WEATHER 
ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. NEXT SYSTEM BUILDS EAST ACROSS THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY WITH SURFACE LOW 
SHIFTING EAST FROM MISSOURI TO NORTHEAST OHIO BY 12Z FRIDAY. SOME 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN GFS AND ECMWF BUT STAYED WITH MORE PROGRESSIVE 
GFS WHICH BRINGS A SHOT OF RAIN TO THE FORECAST AREA WITH MENTION OF 
A SNOW SHOWER OR TWO IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. TAPERED POP BACK TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE ON FRIDAY DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN RAPID DEPARTURE OF 
UPPER TROF. NEXT SHORT WAVE MAKES A MOVE TOWARD THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS LATER ON SATURDAY. BROAD BRUSHED A SMALL CHANCE POP FOR 
-SHRA AT THIS DISTANT PERIOD OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
954 AM EST SAT DEC 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...MAIN AREA OF SHOWERS IS STILL WELL TO OUR WEST THIS 
MORNING...AND IS PROGGD TO REACH AT LEAST WRN MOST PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY LATE AFTERNOON. MODELS ALSO SEEM INTENT ON 
DEVELOPING SHOWERS ACROSS ERN AREAS IN THE STRENGTHENING SE LOW 
LEVEL FLOW. HOWEVER...THIS SE FLOW WILL BE DOWNSLOPING FOR NRN AND 
CENTRAL VALLEY LOCATIONS...SO THIS WOULD INHIBIT ANY SHOWERS EXCEPT 
FOR CHEROKEE/CLAY COUNTIES OF NC AND HIGHEST PEAKS IN THE SMOKIES.
CURRENT FORECAST POP GRIDS REALLY REFLECT THIS SCENARIO QUITE WELL
...AND SHOULD NOT REQUIRE ANY CHANGES THIS MORNING.

OTHER ITEM OF CONCERN IS THE STRENGTHENING SE LOW LEVEL WINDS...
AND WE ARE ALREADY GETTING SPEEDS OF 15 TO 25 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS 
ABOVE 3000 FEET. WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT LOOKS RIGHT ON TRACK.

850 MB ANALYSIS OF UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOWS STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION 
AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS ARE WARMER THAN VALLEY LOCATIONS. WILL UPDATE 
THE HOURLY GRIDS TO BETTER REFLECT THIS...AND ALSO MAKE SLIGHT 
ADJUSTMENTS TO THE MAX TEMP GRID FOR TODAY IF NEEDED.

FOR LATER PERIODS...GFS MODEL FINALLY CAME AROUND TO AGREE ON TRACK 
AND TIMING OF THE APPROACHING SYSTEM...AND REALLY DONT SEE MUCH IF 
ANY THREAT OF WINTRY PRECIPITATION THROUGH 12Z SUNDAY. THIS WOULD 
LEAVE THE POSSIBILITY FOR SOME LIGHT SNOWFALL IN THE MTNS ON SUNDAY
...AS ADVERTISED.

FXUS64 KMRX 150815
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EST SAT DEC 15 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER TEXAS...WITH QUITE A BIT OF 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY OCCURRING WITH IT ACROSS EAST TEXAS AND 
ARKANSAS. MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE 
EVOLUTION AND PROGRESSION OF THIS SYSTEM...AS AN AMPLIFIED UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS DEEPENS OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY BY 
THIS EVENING. AS A RESULT...THE SURFACE LOW WILL RAPIDLY STRENGTHEN 
OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON...AS IT CONTINUES 
MOVING NORTHEAST INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY THIS EVENING. STRONG 
SOUTHEASTERLY 850 MB WINDS ARE PROGGED TO DEVELOP LATER THIS MORNING 
ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS...AND CONTINUE THROUGH TONIGHT. IN ADDITION TO 
THESE SOUTHEAST WINDS BECOMING PERPENDICULAR TO THE MOUNTAINS...A 
STABLE BOUNDARY LAYER WILL EXTEND UP ABOVE THE RIDGES...THE REGION 
WILL BECOME LOCATED UNDER THE RIGHT-EXIT REGION OF A 250 MB JET 
STREAK...AND A FAIRLY STRONG 850 MB JET WILL DEVELOP TO OVER 
NORTHERN MIDDLE TN. THE COMBINATION OF THESE FACTORS SHOULD RESULT 
IN MOUNTAIN WAVE FORMATION WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF STRONG WINDS IN 
THE FOOTHILLS. THUS...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS...BUT WILL ALSO MENTION THAT STRONG GUSTY WINDS WILL ALSO 
BE POSSIBLE IN THE FOOTHILLS. WILL KEEP THIS ADVISORY IN EFFECT 
THROUGH TONIGHT SINCE 850 MB WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO BE FAIRLY STRONG 
WITH THE ARRIVAL OF THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. STRONG WEST TO 
NORTHWEST WINDS WILL DEVELOP AREAWIDE BEHIND THE COLD FRONT ON 
SUNDAY...AND THIS ADVISORY MAY NEED TO BE EXPANDED FOR THE VALLEYS 
BY LATER SHIFTS. 

LATEST MODEL RUNS ARE TRENDING SLOWER WITH THIS SYSTEM AS THE UPPER 
TROUGH BECOMES HIGHLY AMPLIFIED AND NEGATIVELY-TILTED. AS A 
RESULT...IT APPEARS THAT MOST OF THE INITIAL RAIN WILL WAIT UNTIL 
THIS EVENING TO SPREAD OVER THE FORECAST AREA. STRONG SOUTHEASTERLY 
WINDS DOWNSLOPING OFF OF THE MOUNTAINS WILL ALSO HELP TO LIMIT THE 
AMOUNT OF RAINFALL THIS AFTERNOON. THUS...WILL LOWER POPS SOME FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON...BUT WILL KEEP HIGH POPS FOR THIS EVENING. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS REVEAL SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY THIS EVENING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA...SO WILL ADD A MENTION OF A FEW TSTORMS AREAWIDE. 
WILL ALSO TREND WARMER WITH MAXES THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
AND NORTHERN VALLEY ZONES...WHERE ADIABATIC WARMING SHOULD BE 
MAXIMIZED FROM THE SOUTHEASTERLY DOWNSLOPING WINDS. AS A RESULT OF 
THE SLOWER EVOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM...MODELS INDICATE THAT RAIN WILL 
CHANGE TO SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATER (TOWARDS SUNRISE) 
ON SUNDAY...AS 850 MB TEMPS BEGIN TO FALL BELOW FREEZING. HOWEVER... 
TEMPS IN THE VALLEYS WILL LIKELY REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING UNTIL LATER 
IN THE DAY ON SUNDAY...PREVENTING MUCH (IF ANY) SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. 
WARM GROUND TEMPS SHOULD ALSO PREVENT MUCH SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS IN 
THE VALLEYS. OVERALL...IT APPEARS THAT MOST OF THE MOISTURE WILL 
QUICKLY EXIT THE REGION BY THE TIME THE RAIN CHANGES TO SNOW ON 
SUNDAY...BUT LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS STILL APPEAR TO BE POSSIBLE 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. IN ADDITION...UPSLOPE 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL HELP KEEP SNOW SHOWERS LINGERING ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING. WILL PLAN TO REFRESH THE 
SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT WITH THE LATEST FORECAST TENDS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...STORM SYSTEM OVER WEEKEND MOVES 
ON TO THE EAST BY MONDAY A.M. AND LEAVES A ZONAL FLOW BEHIND. THIS 
FLOW WILL PREVENT ANY SUBSTANTIAL WARMING/COOLING THROUGH WEDNESDAY, 
BUT WILL ALSO PROVIDE A DRY AIRMASS FOR FAR FEWER CLOUDS. HAVE LEFT 
PREVIOUS FORECAST PACKAGE AS IS FOR MONDAY-WEDNESDAY.

BEGINNING THURSDAY, ANOTHER SHORT WAVE MOVES ACROSS OHIO-TENNESSEE 
VALLEYS FAIRLY QUICKLY. THIS SYSTEM LACKS SIGNIFICANT COLD AIR. 
EXPECT THAT SOME COOL ADVECTION WILL CREATE SOME FLURRIES TO LIGHT 
SNOW IN FAVORED UPSLOPE AND HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF THE MOUNTAINS, 
AND NORTHERN SECTION OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU, SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA, 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE ON THURSDAY MORNING, BUT NO ACCUMULATIONS. 
SLIGHT RIDGING IN WAKE OF TROF PASSAGE WILL ALLOW ENOUGH WARMING TO 
BRING TEMPS UP WELL INTO 40S AND 50S ALL AREAS TO CHANGE ANY PRECIP 
TO RAIN. STILL, AM NOT EXPECTING ANYTHING APPROACHING CATEGORICAL 
POPS, BUT HAVE UPPED THE POPS SOME OVER PREVIOUS FORECAST PACKAGE 
FOR THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY TO BETWEEN SLIGHT CHANCE AND AROUND 50%. 
QPFS VERY LOW.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN      62  38  40  24  46 /  60 100  50  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN              58  36  38  24  45 /  60 100  40  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN     60  37  39  20  39 /  60 100  60  30  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

908 PM EST FRI DEC 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE IS DEEPENING OVER TEXAS THIS 
EVENING AS UPPER TROUGH DIGS INTO NEW MEXICO. HIGHER CLOUDS ARE 
STARTING TO MOVE IN TO THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THE DEVELOPING

SO WILL DROP LOWS A COUPLE DEGREES AS WELL. AS CLOUDS THICKEN 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD HOLD STEADY OR RISE THE REST OF THE NIGHT.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 142026
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EST FRI DEC 14 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...GENERALLY THE ONLY QUIET
PERIODS WILL BE TONIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY. CONSENSUS WAS TO FAVOR
THE NAM-WRF HANDLING OF THE STRONG SYSTEM DEVELOPING...WHICH REALLY
WOULD BRING STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS INTO PLAY...AND A LATER ARRIVAL
OF SHOWERS ON SATURDAY. GENERALLY HAD TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE TO
CHANCE POPS EARLIER ON SATURDAY TO BETTER BLEND WITH NEIGHBORING
OFFICES. 

GFS MODEL DOES SEEM TO BE SLOWING DOWN THE STORM SYSTEM THIS WEEKEND
...AND EVEN ITS SURFACE LOW PRESSURE PLACEMENT IS MUCH CLOSER TO
OTHER MODELS SLOWER AND MORE WRN LOCATION...ALTHO GFS IS STILL
FASTER WITH PRECIPITATION (PCPN) AND ARRIVAL OF COLD AIR ON SUNDAY
MORNING. CONSIDERED GFS TO BE AN OUTLIER...SO TRENDED FORECAST AND
ESPECIALLY PCPN TYPES IN LINE WITH THE WARMER/SLOWER NAM-WRF
SOLUTION. DONT SEE MUCH THREAT OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS FOR LOWER
ELEVATIONS WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND IN FACT INITIAL DOWNSL0PING MAY
EVEN INHIBIT RAINFALL AMOUNTS IN THE CENTRAL AND SRN VALLEY.

WILL INCLUDE SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS FOR MAINLY HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF SWRN VA (2500 FEET AND ABOVE)...AND ALSO FOR THE NRN
AND SMOKY MTNS OF EAST TN...DUE MAINLY TO COLD AIR ARRIVAL AROUND
DAYBREAK WHEN DEEPER MOISTURE IS STILL AVAILABLE...AND ALSO FOR
UPSLOPE LOW LEVEL FLOW AND COLD AIR ADVECTION DURING THE DAY
SUNDAY. 

OTHER CONCERN WILL BE STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS BY LATE SATURDAY AND
OVERNIGHT INTO SUNDAY. POPULATED GRIDS WITH NAM WINDS...AND
MIDNIGHT SHIFT MAY NEED TO ISSUE WIND ADVISORIES FOR MOST OF THE AREA.
WILL HIGHLIGHT THIS UPCOMING WEATHER IN A BRIEF SPECIAL WEATHER
STATEMENT SHORTLY.

DUE TO SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES BETWEEN GFS AND NAM MODELS...THE
COLDER MOS GUIDANCE FROM GFS WAS NOT FOLLOWED FOR THIS PACKAGE
...EXCEPT FOR FALLING TEMPS ON SUNDAY.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...STRONG STORM SYSTEM MOVES 
STEADILY AWAY FROM THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT BUT NOT BEFORE 
PROVIDING A FEW HOURS OF UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE TERRAIN ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MUCH OF THE MOUNTAINOUS TERRAIN NEAR THE 
NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR -SHSN GOING 
THROUGH MIDNIGHT HERE. MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WILL BE A DRY PERIOD 
AWAITING ARRIVAL OF NEXT SYSTEM WHICH IMPACTS THE FORECAST AREA ON 
THURSDAY WITH SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR RAIN SHOWERS DURING THE 
DAY AS LIFT AND MOISTURE ADVECTION INCREASE AHEAD OF SYSTEM COLD 
FRONT. USED HIGHEST POP FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AS UPPER TROF DEEPENS 
WITH SURFACE LOW PRESSING EAST TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. HAD 
TO MIX IN A MENTION OF THE POSSIBILITY OF FROZEN PRECIP IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN THURSDAY NIGHT MAINLY SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE 
SMOKY MOUNTAINS AS SOME COLDER AIR FLOWS INTO THE REGION BEHIND 
UPPER TROF. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE RAIN GOING THROUGH THE DAY FRIDAY 
WRAPPING UP THE EVENT AT NIGHT. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS WHICH 
ARE CLOSER TO SEASONAL NORMS FOR MID DECEMBER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
933 AM EST FRI DEC 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS SHOW JUST A FEW BREAKS IN THE 
LOW CLOUD DECK OVER CENTRAL AND SRN PARTS OF THE TN VALLEY. THIS LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE IS QUITE SHALLOW PER OHX/RNK 12Z SOUNDINGS...BUT AS 
PREVIOUS SHIFT NOTED...THE INVERSION ABOVE THE CLOUD LAYER WILL MAKE 
IT VERY DIFFICULT FOR SUFFICIENT MIXING TO OCCUR TO ERODE THESE LOW 
CLOUDS. ANOTHER FACTOR...ALTHO STILL WELL UPSTREAM...IS THE 
DEVELOPING MID AND HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE DEEPENING LOW 
OVER THE SRN PLAINS. DECISION TO UNDERCUT GFS MAX TEMPS WAS A GOOD 
ONE...AND I WILL MAKE SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO HOURLY TEMPS AND MAX 
TEMP AS NEEDED. 12Z NGM/FWC MOS SHOWS HIGHS ONLY REACHING THE UPPER 
40S TO MID 50S.

FOR LATER PERIODS...WILL BE INTERESTING TO SEE IF 12Z RUN OF GFS 
MODEL SLOWS DOWN OUR WEEKEND SYSTEM IN LINE WITH SLOWER NAM-WRF.
NAM-WRF PLACEMENT OF SURFACE LOW IS A LITTLE FURTHER WEST AND WOULD 
PRODUCE MORE DOWNSLOPING AND WARM AIR ADVECTION. NAM-WRF SURFACE AND 
BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS WOULD REALLY INHIBIT MUCH SNOWFALL...IF ANY...
UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 

THUS...AT THIS POINT APPEARS ANY SNOW AMOUNTS SHOULD FALL INTO THE 
ADVISORY RANGE AND FOR MAINLY ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 OR 3000 FEET.
MORE ON THIS IN THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

FXUS64 KMRX 140829
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST FRI DEC 14 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE CAROLINAS...WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR SLOWLY 
ADVECTING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS SOME LOW 
CLOUDS ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING...WHICH SHOULD BE 
SLOW TO DISSIPATE TODAY SINCE A STRONG MID-LEVEL INVERSION WILL 
LIKELY PREVENT MUCH VERTICAL MIXING. THUS...WILL BE A LITTLE MORE 
PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD COVER TODAY AND WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER 
WITH MAXES. A DEEPENING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE ROCKIES IS 
PROGGED TO DEVELOP A SURFACE LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE LOWER MS 
RIVER VALLEY LATE TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING...WITH THIS SYSTEM 
MOVING NORTHEAST INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY SATURDAY EVENING. 
LATEST SHORT-RANGE MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
PROGRESSION AND TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM...AND NOW INDICATE THAT THIS 
SYSTEM WILL BE SLOWER TO EVOLVE THAN EARLIER EXPECTED. AS A 
RESULT...WILL PLAN TO KEEP TONIGHTS FORECAST DRY AND MENTION 
SHOWERS BECOMING LIKELY BY LATE SATURDAY AFTERNOON. WITH THE HIGHLY- 
AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH EXPECTED TO BECOME NEGATIVELY-TILTED BY 
SATURDAY EVENING...WOULDNT BE SURPRISED IF LATER MODEL RUNS SLOW 
DOWN THE PROGRESSION OF THIS SYSTEM SOME MORE. ALTHOUGH POPS WILL BE 
HIGH FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD BE 
LIGHT IN THE VALLEY ZONES DUE TO STRONG DOWNSLOPING SOUTHEASTERLY 
WINDS DESCENDING THE MOUNTAINS. IN ADDITION...WILL TREND A LITTLE 
WARMER WITH HIGHS ON SATURDAY ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY 
ZONES WHERE ADIABATIC WARMING SHOULD BE MAXIMIZED FROM THESE 
DOWNSLOPING WINDS. WITH A STABLE LAYER ALSO EXPECTED TO EXTEND ABOVE 
THE MOUNTAIN RIDGES...MOUNTAIN WAVES APPEAR TO BE POSSIBLE IN THE 
FOOTHILLS...AND A WIND ADVISORY WILL LIKELY BE NEEDED. SINCE THESE 
WINDS SHOULD DEVELOP BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON...WILL LET LATER SHIFTS 
MAKE THE ISSUANCE DECISION.

BY LATE SATURDAY NIGHT...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT AS 850 MB TEMPS FALL BELOW FREEZING. HOWEVER...TEMPS IN THE 
VALLEYS WILL LIKELY REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING UNTIL LATER IN THE DAY ON 
SUNDAY...PREVENTING MUCH (IF ANY) SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. WARM GROUND 
TEMPS SHOULD ALSO PREVENT MUCH SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS IN THE 
VALLEYS. OVERALL...IT APPEARS THAT MOST OF THE MOISTURE WILL QUICKLY 
EXIT THE REGION BY THE TIME THE RAIN CHANGES TO SNOW AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...BUT SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. IN ADDITION...UPSLOPE 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL HELP KEEP SNOW SHOWERS LINGERING IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR A FEW MORE HOURS ON SUNDAY MORNING. FOR NOW... 
WILL ONLY MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...NOT MANY CHANGES IN 
SUNDAY NIGHT TO WEDNESDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME. DRY AIRMASS WORKS IN 
WITH SOME ZONAL-ISH FLOW ALOFT AFTER MAIN TROF MOVES NORTHEAST. 
TEMPS COOL WITH POST FRONTAL AIR, ALSO. KEPT MAX/MIN REGIME FROM 
PREVIOUS FORECAST WITH ONLY MINOR TWEAKS. NO CATEGORY CHANGES.

ON THURSDAY  NEXT TROF APPROACHES AREA BUT MOISTURE APPEARS SOMEWHAT 
LIMITED AT THIS VIEWING. HOWEVER TROF IS QUITE ORGANIZED AND 
NEGATIVELY TILTED, SO HAVE OPTED TO RAISE POPS ON THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU, SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE, AND IN WESTERN TIP OF NORTH CAROLINA. 
KEPT PRECIP AS RAIN AT THIS POINT, OWING TO LENGTH OF TIME THIS 
FORECAST SITS OUT IN THE FUTURE, ALTHOUGH THERE APPEARS TO BE A 
POSSIBILITY FOR LIGHT SNOW IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. WELL SEE WHAT 
DIFF A WEEK MAKES.
&&

339 PM EST THU DEC 13 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT ALMOST EXITING 
ERN MOST PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA AT ISSUANCE TIME...AND WINDS
DECREASED SIGNIFICANTLY TO ALLOW LAKE WIND AND WIND ADVISORIES TO BE 
CANCELLED ABOUT AN HOUR AND A HALF EARLY. SCATTERED POST FRONTAL 
SHOWERS LINGER...WHICH GENERALLY FIT THE PREVIOUS FORECAST POP AND 
WEATHER GRIDS FOR LATE AFTERNOON AND THIS EVENING. SHOWERS ARRIVED 
LATER THAN EXPECTED...BUT GOT A QUICK ONE QUARTER INCH AT THE OFFICE 
IN MORRISTOWN...WHICH WAS APPRECIATED. LATE ARRIVAL OF SHOWERS 
ALLOWED RECORD MAX TEMPS AT TYS AND OQT...WITH CHA TIEING THE RECORD 
OF 72 DEGREES.

MOSTLY CLOUDY OVERNIGHT...WITH POSSIBLY PARTIAL CLEARING IN WRN MOST 
AREAS BEFORE DAYBREAK. FOLLOWED GFS MOS MINS BOTH TONIGHT AND FRIDAY 
NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL ONLY VERY BRIEFLY CONTROL OUR WEATHER...
AS NEXT SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOP. 
MODELS SHOW GOOD ISENTROPIC LIFT BY 06Z TO 12Z SATURDAY...SO KEPT 
GOOD CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. THIS LEADS TO HIGH 
POPS BY LATE SATURDAY MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. IF 
PRECIPITATION DEVELOPS AS QUICKLY AS SUGGESTED...THEN A BLEND OF GFS 
AND NAM-WRF MOS FOR MAX TEMPS SATURDAY SEEMS BEST CHOICE.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...DEEP TROF DRIVES 
EAST TOWARD THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. SATURDAY NIGHT WITH SURFACE LOW 
TRACKING NORTHEAST FROM THE TENNESSEE VALLEY OF NORTHERN ALABAMA TO 
EASTERN OHIO BY 12Z SUNDAY. USED THE CATEGORICAL POP FOR THE EVENT 
WITH CHILLY AIR SPILLING SOUTHEAST BEHIND SYSTEM COLD FRONT. USED 
RAIN SHOWERS CHANGING TO SNOW SHOWERS MAINLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
INCLUDING CUMBERLAND PLATEAU/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MOUNTAINS 
BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA. SUFFICIENT ENERGY DROPPING THROUGH THE 
BASE OF THE SLOWLY DEPARTING UPPER TROF TO KEEP A POPS ALIVE WELL 
INTO SUNDAY. MIX IN A FEW -SHSN WITH THE RAIN ACROSS THE GREAT 
VALLEY FROM THE KNOXVILLE VICINITY NORTHEAST TO THE TRI-CITIES 
SUNDAY MORNING. SOME OROGRAPHIC LIFT ONGOING LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON 
INTO SUNDAY EVENING AS NORTHWESTERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW WORKS ON 
MOISTURE AROUND 800 MB AND BELOW. BEST SHOT AT A BIT OF SNOW WILL BE 
IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHEST VIRGINIA AND IN THE MOUNTAINS 
BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA. PAINTED IN SOME LIGHT SNOWFALL IN THESE 
AREAS WITH HIGHEST AMOUNTS AT THIS POINT TOPPING OUT AROUND ONE 
INCH. LATER MODEL RUNS WILL CLARIFY HOW QUICKLY MOISTURE AND LIFT 
DEPART THE FORECAST AREA FOR A BETTER FOCUS ON WINTER PRECIP. KEPT 
THE DRY FORECAST GOING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD 
WITH HIGHER PRESSURE MAKING ITS WAY GRADUALLY EAST ACROSS THE 
EASTERN U.S. AS ANOTHER UPPER TROF APPROACHES THE REGION BUT NOT 
UNTIL LATE THURSDAY AND POSSIBLY FRIDAY. LEFT POPS OUT FOR NOW WITH 
THIS NEXT SYSTEM BUT ADDED AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS. DIDNT STRAY TOO 
FAR FROM SUGGESTED MOS TEMPS GUIDANCE DURING THE LONG TERM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
423 AM EST THU DEC 13 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A LARGE LOW PRESSURE AREA ACROSS 
KY AND MIDDLE AND WEST TN MARKED A COLD FRONT THAT EXTENDED SW TO 
THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO. A LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS WAS MOVING NE TO 
THE WEST OF THE FRONT WEST OF A JKL TO BNA LINE. SKIES WERE MOSTLY 
CLOUDY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH VERY MILD TEMPERATURES IN THE 
UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. THE FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON DROPPING TEMPERATURES FROM MOSTLY MORNING 
HIGHS A FEW DEGREES ABOVE CURRENT TEMPERATURES. THE RAIN SHOWERS 
WILL FOLLOW THE FRONT BUT SHOULD MOVE OUT BY AROUND 14/00Z WEST AND 
DURING THE EVENING EAST. WINDS HAVE PICKED UP TO 10 TO 15 MPH WITH 
HIGHER GUSTS AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND COULD INCREASE TO 20 TO 25 MPH 
WITH GUSTS TO 35 MPH BEFORE THE FRONT MOVES THOUGH TODAY. RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS WILL NOT BE THAT HIGH WITH THE HIGHEST AMOUNTS ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. A SIGNIFICANT DROP IN 
TEMPERATURES TONIGHT AS WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION AND CLEARING SKIES 
OCCUR. STILL LOWS WILL ONLY BE IN THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S...STILL 
ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN
ON FRIDAY WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND MILD TEMPS. PATTERN CHANGES 
RAPIDLY FRI NIGHT WITH ELEVATED WAA AND MOISTURE ADVECTION IN 
STRENGTHENING SW FLOW. CLOUD COVER WILL INCREASE OVERNIGHT. BACKED 
OFF SOME ON RAIN CHANCES BUT LIGHT RAIN COULD MOVE IN LATE. 
DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES NE THROUGH TN RVR VLY ON SAT. 
LOW TRACK WILL BE CRITICAL IN RESULTING WEATHER FOR SAT. STRENGTH 
AND TRACK OF LOW COULD RESULT IN GOOD DOWNSLOPE WIND EVENT FOR NE 
TN. BESIDE STRONG WINDS...TEMPS MAY BE WARMER AND PCPN LESS THAN MOS 
NUMBERS AND GRIDDED FCST. COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH SAT EVENING. RAIN 
WILL CHANGE TO SNOW SAT NIGHT BUT POST FRONTAL MOISTURE LOOKS 
SHALLOW AND ACCUMULATION SHOULD BE LIMITED TO HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. 
LIGHT SNOW AND FLURRIES LINGER INTO SUNDAY WITH BREEZY NW WINDS. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN THROUGH REMAINDER OF PERIOD WITH 
SEASONABLE TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 PM EST WED DEC 12 2007

.DISCUSSION...
A FRONT HAS BECOME STATIONARY ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND SOUTHEAST KY
INTO SOUTHERN WV. AREA OF RAIN OVER MIDDLE TN APPEARS TO BE
ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT AND WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT AT THE 300 K
LEVEL. THE MODELS SHOW A SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT IN
MIDDLE TN OVERNIGHT...TAKING THE BOUNDARY AND THE ISENTROPIC LIFT
FARTHER NORTH. THIS WILL RESULT IN THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA SEEING THE MOST RAIN OVERNIGHT...WHILE THE
MOUNTAINS WILL LIKELY SEE VERY LITTLE RAIN. WILL ADJUST THE POPS TO
RAISE NORTHWEST AND LOWER IN THE EAST. ONLY SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS WILL
BE NEEDED TO TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 122035
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EST WED DEC 12 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHOWERS...MOSTLY LIGHT...
CONTINUE TO DEVELOP ALONG THE COLD FRONT TO OUR WEST AND MOVE E TO
NE ACROSS MAINLY PARTS OF EAST TN THIS AFTERNOON. INCREASED THE
LATE AFTERNOON POP GRIDS TO LIKELY CATEGORY FOR THE MOST LIKELY
AREAS THAT THESE SHOWERS WILL PASS ACROSS. NO THREAT OF RECORD
HIGHS TODAY AS CLOUDS AND SHOWERS HAVE HELD TEMPS IN THE UPPER 50S
TO UPPER 60S ...WITH CHA STILL RUNNING 3 TO 4 DEGREES BELOW THE
RECORD HIGH OF 72 DEGS SET IN 1931.

SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER NEW MEXICO WILL LIFT NE OVERNIGHT AND SHOULD 
SPREAD SHOWERS INTO ALL AREAS AFTER MIDNIGHT. SURFACE LOW 
DEVELOPMENT WILL PUSH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY NORTH INTO KY AND SW VA 
OVERNIGHT...FOLLOWED BY COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON. PREVIOUS POP GRIDS WERE GENERALLY RIGHT ON TRACK WITH 
SLIGHT INCREASES LATE TONIGHT AND CLOSER TO 100 PERCENT ON THURSDAY 
MORNING. PRECIPITATION SHOULD END BY THURSDAY EVENING...BUT CARRIED 
VERY LOW POPS FOR ERN AREAS UP TO MIDNIGHT AS BEFORE. 

MOS TEMPS VERY CLOSE ALL PERIODS...WITH A SLIGHT PREFERENCE FOR 
COOLEST MAX TEMPS THURSDAY AND MILDER MINS THURSDAY NIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS INDICATING A 
SURFACE LOW AND ITS ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH PUSHING INTO THE AREA 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  BEST MOISTURE HOLDS OFF UNTIL SATURDAY.  
WILL KEEP ONLY 20-40 POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT WITH BEST CHANCES IN THE 
WEST CLOSER TO THE LOW.  SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR MAINLY RAIN ON 
FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP THE RAIN/SNOW WORDING IN THE NORTHERN 
AREAS AND THE MOUNTAINS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT.  AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKS ACROSS THE AREA ON SATURDAY ALONG WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE... 
WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS FOR SATURDAY.  UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWS ON 
SATURDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP 40-60 POPS WITH BEST CHANCES IN THE 
NORTH.  COOLER TEMPERATURES ARE ALSO EXPECTED...SHOULD SEE SNOW 
SHOWERS BY SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT BEST MOISTURE ALREADY EAST...SO 
SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL IS NOT EXPECTED.  SHORTWAVE EXITING THE AREA ON 
SUNDAY...BEST CHANCES SHOULD BE IN THE MORNING HOURS.  KEPT LOW POPS 
FOR THE MOUNTAINS ON SUNDAY NIGHT WITH WEAK UPSLOPE POSSIBLE.  HIGH 
PRESSURE PUSHES IN ON MONDAY.  ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH 
THE AREA ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...TOO DRY TO ADD ANY 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES AT THIS TIME.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS ON TUESDAY 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN            56  63  40  60  41 /  80 100  10  10  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN 56  63  39  58  39 /  80  90  20  10  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                      55  60  39  57  37 /  80  90  10  10  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN             52  63  37  56  34 /  80  90  20  10  20

.DISCUSSION...SHOWERS OCCURRING ALONG FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR WEST 
WERE MOVING EAST ACROSS OUR NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES...WHILE A FEW 
SPRINKLES HAD REACHED THE SEQUATCHIE VALLEY. TIMING OF INCREASING 
POPS IN FORECAST GRIDS LOOKS GOOD...AND CURRENT COVERAGE DOES NOT 
INDICATE A NEED TO INCREASE POPS AT THIS TIME.

SOME HIGHER ELEVATION SPOTS HAD BRISK AND GUSTY SW WINDS EARLIER
...BUT THESE SPEEDS WERE DECREASING WITH VAD WIND PROFILES NOT 
SHOWING MUCH CONCERN FOR GUSTY WINDS TODAY.

LATEST NGM/FWC MOS SUGGESTS MAINLY 60S FOR TODAY...SO NO RECORD 
HIGHS IN JEOPARDY. WILL ADJUST HOURLY AND MAX TEMPS AS NEEDED
BY 10 TO 11 AM...AND REMOVE MORNING WORDING FROM ZFPMRX.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
423 AM EST WED DEC 12 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT TO THE WEST WAS NOW 
MOVING WEST OF THE OHIO AND MISSIPPI RIVERS WITH MOST OF THE 
PRECIPITATION ALONG AND BEHIND IT. STRONG HIGH PRESSURE AT THE 
SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL SHIFT EAST AS THE FRONT MOVES SLOWLY TOWARDS 
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILD AGAIN 
TODAY AND POSSIBLY NEAR A RECORD AT CHATTANOOGA. SHOWERS SHOULD 
BEGAN TO AFFECT THE WESTERN SECTIONS LATE THIS MORNING AND THE REST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. THE FRONT WILL NOT MOVE VERY 
FAR AS LOW PRESSURE MOVES UP FROM THE SOUTH ALONG THE FRONT. 
FOLLOWED THE HIGHER MAV NUMBERS FOR HIGHS AND ADDED A DEGREE AND 
WENT BELOW POP GUIDANCE TODAY DUE TO THE SLOW EASTWARD PROGRESS OF 
THE PRECIPITATION WHICH WAS STILL WEST OF BNA EARLY THIS MORNING.   

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...COLD FRONT AND WIDESPREAD 
CONVECTION MOVES ACROSS THE AREA ON THURSDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
IN FRI WITH BRIEF COOLING TREND. FAST MOVING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
MOVES UP FROM THE SW SAT BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF WIDESPREAD 
PRECIPITATION. THE LOW IS PROGGED TO MOVE EAST THOUGH THE 
APPALACHIANS BY SAT EVENING. FREEZING LEVEL LOWERS TO THE SURFACE 
AROUND SAT MIDNIGHT. MAJORITY OF MOISTURE WILL BE EAST OF THE AREA 
BY THEN AS RAIN CHANGES TO SNOW. WARM INITIAL SURFACE TEMPS SHOULD 
HINDER ACCUMULATIONS OUTSIDE THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE UPSLOPE 
FLOW WILL ENHANCE SNOW SHOWERS. A COUPLE OF INCHES OF SNOW IS 
POSSIBLE BY SUNDAY ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN. COLD HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. A CLIPPER MAY AFFECT 
NORTHERN AREAS LATE MONDAY BUT WILL HANDLE AS INCREASED CLOUD COVER 
FOR NOW.

FXUS64 KMRX 120230
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EST TUE DEC 11 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY...A WARM FRONT EXTENDING ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
APPALACHIANS...AND AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES 
ACROSS THE ENTIRE REGION...WITH A FEW HIGH CLOUDS OVER MIDDLE TN AND 
SOUTHEAST KY. THINK THAT TEMPS SHOULD FALL CLOSE TO THE CURRENT 
DEWPOINTS...WHICH THE CURRENT FORECAST HAS COVERED. DECENT LOW-LEVEL 
MOISTURE SHOULD COMBINE WITH THE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES TO PRODUCE SOME 
PATCHY DENSE FOG LATER TONIGHT...MAINLY NEAR THE WATERWAYS AND IN 
LOW LYING AREAS. 

WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS 
EVENING TO MAINLY TWEAK SKY CONDITIONS...WINDS AND TEMPS A LITTLE 
ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&

DMG





000 
FXUS64 KMRX 111917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
217 PM EST TUE DEC 11 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...FOR TONIGHT...PLENTY OF LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE COMBINED WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKY WILL ALLOW PATCHY 
DENSE FOG TO REDEVELOP.

A UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE UPPER GREAT LAKES WILL AID IN 
DROPPING COLD FRONT...CURRENTLY OVER THE OHIO VALLEY...SOUTH INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA BY WEDNESDAY. MODELS SHOW THE BAROCLINIC ZONE 
WEAKENING AS IT PUSHES INTO THE REGION...BUT WILL BE ENOUGH 
FRONTOGENETIC LIFT TO PRODUCE SCATTERED-BROKEN LIGHT SHOWERS.

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...A SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE WILL MOVE 
QUICKLY ALONG THE BAROCLINIC ZONE WITH WEAK CYCLOGENESIS EXPECTED 
OVER/NEAR THE FORECAST AREA. THE TIGHTENING BAROCLINIC ZONE WILL 
STRENGTHEN BOTH ISENTROPIC LIFT FOR LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH A 
DECENT FRONTAL PASSAGE FOR THURSDAY. ALSO...A STRONG UPPER LEVEL JET
MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TO THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL 
PLACE THE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION.
HAVE UPPED POPS FOR THURSDAY TO CAT AREA-WIDE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
FOR THURSDAY NIGHT...THE COLD FRONT WILL BE NEAR THE MOUNTAINS 
AROUND 00Z FRIDAY...AND WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP EAST BEFORE 
MIDNIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE 
NORTHWEST...BRINGING DRIER AND COOLER AIR...WITH HIGHS ON FRIDAY IN 
THE 50S. 

THE MODELS ARE SHOWING A POTENTIALLY SIGNIFICANT STORM AFFECTING THE 
AREA OVER THE WEEKEND. THE ECMWF SHOWS AN UPPER LOW CLOSING OFF OVER 
THE OHIO VALLEY...RESULTING IN A SLOWER SYSTEM AND A SURFACE LOW 
PASSING TO OUR NORTH...WHICH IS ABLE TO DRAW WARMER AIR FARTHER 
NORTH. THE GFS SHOWS A FASTER OPEN TROUGH WITH A SLIGHT NEGATIVE 
TILT...RESULTING IN A DEEPER SURFACE LOW PASSING TO OUR SOUTH AND 
COLDER 850 MB TEMPS. THESE DIFFERENCES WILL HAVE IMPLICATIONS ON QPF 
AND P-TYPE THAT ARE DIFFICULT TO SPECIFY THIS FAR OUT. COMPARED TO 
THE 06Z GFS...THE 12Z GFS HAS TRENDED WEAKER WITH THE SURFACE LOW 
AND NOT AS DEEP/NEGATIVELY TILTED WITH THE UPPER TROUGH. GIVEN THE 
BETTER CONSISTENCY OF THE ECMWF AND HPCS PREFERENCE FOR IT...WILL 
LEAN TOWARD A WARMER AND SLOWER SOLUTION. 

ONSET OF PRECIP LOOKS TO BEGIN FRIDAY NIGHT IN ASSOCIATION WITH 
MIDLEVEL ISENTROPIC LIFT AND WARM ADVECTION. PRECIP WILL HAVE TO 
OVERCOME SOME DRY AIR AT THE LOW LEVELS...AND RESULTING EVAPORATIVE 
COOLING MAY CREATE A DEEP NEAR-FREEZING ISOTHERMAL LAYER. THUS 
PRECIP MAY BEGIN AS SNOW IN NORTHERN SECTIONS BEFORE THE 850 WARM 
FRONT PASSES AND CHANGES PRECIP TO RAIN. SINCE THE WARMER ECMWF IS 
PREFERRED...PRECIP WILL BE FORECAST AS ALL RAIN ON SATURDAY. RAISED 
POPS TO LIKELY ON SATURDAY. THE SLOWER ECMWF SOLUTION MOVES THE 
850/700 MB TROUGH ACROSS ON SATURDAY NIGHT...BRINGING STRONG COLD 
ADVECTION AND A CHANGE TO SNOW. MOISTURE ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
LOW...STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES...AND STRONG UPSLOPE FLOW WILL 
KEEP A CHANCE OF SNOW IN THE NORTHERN 2/3 AND MOUNTAINS INTO SUNDAY. 
DEPENDING ON THE TRACK AND SPEED OF THE LOW...SIGNIFICANT SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS COULD BE POSSIBLE IN THE MOUNTAINS. A RIDGE BUILDS 
INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THE BEGINNING OF 
THE WEEK WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  72  55  62  42 /  10  30  50  90  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  53  71  55  61  40 /   0  40  40  90  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       52  68  54  59  40 /   0  50  50  90  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              46  68  50  60  37 /   0  50  40  90  20

CHA 73 IN 1918...TYS 69 IN 1918...67 IN 1971
RIDGE FLATTENS SOME TONIGHT WITH CONTINUED WARM OVERNIGHT TEMPS.

MILD WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS ANOTHER WAVE MOVES UP ALONG
COLD FRONT. HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE NW WILL BRING END TO RAIN
FRIDAY. A NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER TEXAS FRIDAY WILL INTENSIFY
AND MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. MUCH COLDER
AIR WRAPS IN BEHIND THIS SYSTEM SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY AS IT
DEEPENS WHICH SHOULD CAUSE SNOW LEVELS TO DROP TO THE SURFACE
ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH SNOW POSSIBLE SATURDAY NIGHT
AND SUNDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
210 PM EST MON DEC 10 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...
FOR TONIGHT...PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND BREAKS IN THE
CLOUDS TO PRODUCE AT LEAST PATCHY DENSE FOG AGAIN TONIGHT.

A STATIONARY FRONT REMAINS ACROSS KENTUCKY SOUTHWEST TO WEST 
TENNESSEE. THE FRONT WILL MOVE LITTLE THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WITH 
WARM SOUTHWEST WINDS CONTINUING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. RECORD 
WARMTH IS ANTICIPATED TUESDAY WITH ENOUGH DAYTIME SUNSHINE AND
WARMING SOUTHWEST WINDS TO PRODUCE HIGHS IN THE 70S.

RECORD HIGHS FOR TUESDAY:
CHA    73 DEGREES     1918
TYS    69 DEGREES     1918
TRI    67 DEGREES     1971

STATIONARY FRONT WILL BE FAR ENOUGH NORTH AND WEST OF THE AREA 
THROUGH TUESDAY TO LIMIT FORCING FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. WILL 
REMOVE POPS MOST LOCATIONS FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
CLOSED LOW OVER THE DESERT SW EJECTS NORTHWARD AND BECOMES AN OPEN 
WAVE. IN RESPONSE A SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS OVER TX ALONG A BAROCLINIC 
ZONE. THE STATIONARY FRONT THAT IS LOCATED OVER THE OHIO VALLEY TO 
THE MID MS VALLEY WILL REMAIN TO OUR NORTH AND WEST THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT AS THE ATLANTIC RIDGES HOLDS STRONG. THE RIDGE GIVES WAY ON 
WEDNESDAY...AND WARM ADVECTION AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING LOW WILL 
BRING A CHANCE OF PRECIP WEDNESDAY. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE LOWER POPS 
OF THE NAM...WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH. THE SURFACE FRONT 
PASSES THROUGH THE AREA FROM THE WEST ON THURSDAY. MODELS ARE IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT ON THE TIMING BEING ON THURSDAY...SO WILL RAISE 
POPS TO LIKELY. ADVECTION OF COLDER/DRIER AIR BEGINS FRIDAY EVENING. 

CONFIDENCE IS LOW BEYOND FRIDAY AS THE GFS HAS BEEN INCONSISTENT 
WITH ITSELF FROM RUN TO RUN AND WITH OTHER MODELS. THE 12Z GFS HAS 
COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ECMWF...SHOWING A DEEP TROUGH 
MOVING THROUGH ON SATURDAY. THE ECMWF IS MUCH DEEPER WITH THE 
SURFACE LOW AND MORE AMPLIFIED WITH THE TROUGH. FOR NOW WILL JUST 
INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY. IF THE GFS IS CORRECT THE 
PRECIP WILL BE ALL SNOW...BUT GIVEN THE LOW CONFIDENCE...WILL ONLY 
MENTION RAIN AT THIS TIME. A BUILDING RIDGE LOOKS TO PROVIDE DRY 
WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. 

&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VARIABLE CLOUD COVER AND OCCASIONAL 
LIGHT WINDS RESULTING IN WIDESPREAD VISIBILITY FLUCTUATIONS THIS MORNING.
ISSUED DENSE FOG ADVISORY AREAWIDE SINCE VISIBILITY SPORADICLY PLUMMETS
TO NEAR ZERO. WELL DEFINED SURFACE FRONT PERSISTS NORTH AND WEST OF MRX
CWA. LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES AND PRECIPITABLE WATER WELL ABOVE NORMAL
FOR DEC. VERY WARM AND HUMID DAY WITH RECORD HIGH AT CHA ...70 IN 1971
ONCE AGAIN THREATENED. TYS 73 IN 1971 AND TRI 76 IN 1971 RECORD HIGHS
SHOULD STAND. MODELS PROG FRONT TO SAG SE TODAY WITH BEST PCPN CHCS
FAVORING NW AREAS. TOWARD THE SE...MOS GUIDANCE APPEARS OVERDONE SO
UNCUT THOSE NUMBERS THROUGH PERIOD FOR LACK OF TRIGGER. TONIGHTS MIN 
TEMPS WILL LIKELY BE ABOVE NORMAL MID DEC HIGHS. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT 
IN KEEPING FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH TUESDAY.  SCATTERED SHOWERS 
WILL MOVE ALONG THE BOUNDARY AND MAY OCCASIONALLY CARRY SOME LIGHT 
SHOWERS INTO THE MRX CWA...MAINLY OVER NORTHERN ZONES.  CONFIDENCE 
IS LOW ON TIMING...BUT BOUNDARY SHOULD PUSH THROUGH THE AREA AS A 
COLD FRONT SOME TIME LATE WEDNESDAY IN THURSDAY FOR OUR BEST CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS.  MODEL CONSISTENCY VERY POOR FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 
EXPENDED AND CONFIDENCE QUITE LOW.  FOR NOW WILL LEAVE SOME 
LINGERING SHOWERS IN ON FRIDAY AND DRY FOR THE WEEKEND.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 100108
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
810 PM EST SUN DEC 9 2007

.DISCUSSION...STRONG COLD FRONT LIES NEAR OHIO RIVER AND MOVING 
SLOWLY SOUTHWARD-ISH ATTM. TEMP/DEWPOINTS AHEAD OF THE FRONT MORE 
LIKE OCTOBER AROUND HERE. FRONT IS PRODUCING FAIRLY STRONG 
CONVECTIVE CELLS TO THE NORTH, WITH SOME TRAINING EFFECTS OBVIOUS 
AND POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING IN PLACES UP THERE. DOWN HERE, THOUGH, 
THERE HAS NOT BEEN AS MUCH RAIN, AND SO THERE IS NO REAL FLOOD 
POTENTIAL, ESPECIALLY WITH THE CURRENT DROUGHT CONDITIONS MAKING 
SOILS SO DRY.

BIGGER THREAT HERE IS LACK OF WIND WITH GRADIENT DYING OFF AT NIGHT, 
AND CLOUDS BREAKING APART ENOUGH TO ALLOW SERIOUS RADIATIVE COOLING. 
FOG IS PRETTY THICK IN PLACES BUT IS STILL VERY SPOTTY. HERE AT THE 
OFFICE IN MORRISTOWN IT ALTERNATES BETWEEN NEARLY ZERO VISIBILITY 
AND A FEW MILES. HAVE MENTIONED DENSE FOG IN ZONE FORECASTS FOR 
TOMORROW MORNING AND IN THE SHORT TERM FORECASTS. I BELIEVE THIS 
WILL SUFFICE, AT LEAST FOR NOW, WITHOUT GOING TO A FULL BLOWN DENSE 
FOG ADVISORY, BUT WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP AN EYE ON THINGS AND WILL 
ISSUE ONE LATER IF NECESSARY. CURRENT ZONE FORECASTS LOOK FINE AND 
WILL NOT NOT ISSUE UPDATE AT THIS TIME.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 092019
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EST SUN DEC 9 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...A FAIRLY STRONG COLD FRONT...
CURRENTLY ACROSS NORTHERN KENTUCKY WILL MOVE SLOWLY SOUTH INTO THE
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST MONDAY. SATELLITE AND AREA
OBSERVATIONS SHOWS CLOUDS HAVE BROKEN OUT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF
OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT EXPECT A MOSTLY CLOUDY SKY AREA-WIDE
TONIGHT DUE TO THE DECENT BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE.

FOR MONDAY...SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED ALONG AND
JUST BEHIND FRONT PLACING BEST CHANCES OF RAIN OVER THE NORTHERN
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. INSTABILITY SHOWS AN ISOLATED CHANCE OF
THUNDER FOR MONDAY.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN
ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE FRONT...PER GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS PUSH FRONT NORTH 
ON MONDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP BEST POPS DURING THE EVENING HOURS. 
FRONT HANGS TO THE NORTH OF THE CWA ON TUESDAY...WITH THE BEST 
MOISTURE  IN THE NORTH.  WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY WITH 
THE BEST CHANCES IN OUR NORTHERN ZONES.  ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES 
FROM THE WEST ON TUESDAY NIGHT.  FRONT SHOULD STILL BE WEST OF THE 
CWA UNTIL WEDNESDAY...BUT WILL KEEP 20 POPS IN FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
FOR OUR WESTERN ZONES.  MOISTURE INCREASING AS FRONT APPROACHES ON 
WEDNESDAY...BEST MOISTURE STILL TO THE WEST OF THE CWA.  WILL KEEP 
20-30 POPS FOR WEDNESDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN OUR WESTERN 
ZONES.  FRONT PUSHES THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...WILL 
KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH PERIODS.  FRONT IS EAST OF THE AREA BY 
THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT STILL SOME LINGERING MOISTURE BEHIND IT...WILL 
KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.  UPPER TROUGH 
PUSHING THROUGH ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  BEST MOISTURE STAYS 
TO THE EAST OF THE CWA...SO WILL KEEP BOTH PERIODS DRY FOR NOW.  
HIGH PRESSURE PUSHES IN ON SUNDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH DRY 
WEATHER INTO SUNDAY.  STAYED NEAR MAV/MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 091427
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
927 AM EST SUN DEC 9 2007

.DISCUSSION...
UPDATED FORECAST FOR TODAY...ESPECIALLY THIS MORNING...FOR AN AREA OF
SHOWERS MOVING UP THE VALLEY. ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER SHALLOW COLD AIR
AT/NEAR THE SURFACE IS AIDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS. LATEST
NAM MODEL IS HANDLING THIS AREA OF SHOWERS FAIRLY WELL AND MOVES IT
ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST THROUGH 18-19Z. HAVE UPPED
CHANCES OF RAIN TO LIKELY THERE. 

HAVE ALSO RAISED TEMPERATURES OVER MOST LOCATIONS WITH LNP ALREADY
AT 61 DEGREES. UPDATED ZFP OUT.

HAVE A GOOD DAY...

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WARM FRONT POSITIONED FROM WEST
TN TO SOUTHERN WV. SHALLOW COOL AIRMASS ENTRENCHED OVER N 1/2 OF THE
EAST TN VALLEY. WIDESPREAD FOG ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING. PATCHY
DENSE FOG IS OCCURRING...MAINLY IN THE COOLER N VALLEY LOCATIONS. OTHER
AREAS ARE SEEING SOME MIXING AND ARE MORE INCLINED TO LOW STRATUS. 
MOS POP GUIDANCE AGAIN VERY HIGH FOR TODAY. LOW LEVEL SPEED MAX MOVING
NE INTO AREA EARLY TODAY. ENHANCED LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS WEAK
FEATURE PRODUCING SCT SHOWER ACTIVITY. LATEST NAM INDICATES THIS 
FEATURE WILL MARCH NORTH THROUGH MRX CWA THIS MORNING. CANT FIND MUCH
ELSE TO HANG LIKELY MOS POPS ON SO HAVE UNDERCUT GUIDANCE TODAY AND
ESPECIALLY TONIGHT. LOW LEVEL COOL POOL WILL EVENTUALLY MIX OUT LATER 
TODAY. DESPITE INCREASING THICKNESS VALUES KEPT FCST MAX TEMPS BELOW
GUIDANCE...ESPECIALLY N AREAS WITH FOGGY START AND ENTRENCHED COOL POOL.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO KEEP 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  A SERIES OF 
WEAK WAVES TRACKING ALONG THE BOUNDARY WILL PROVIDE SCATTERED 
SHOWERS.  THE LOCATION OF THE BOUNDARY WILL DETERMINE AMOUNT OF 
INFLUENCES OVER THE MRX CWA...AND WILL KEEP POPS AT 20-30 PERCENT. 
THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO PUSH INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY...BRINGING OUR BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP.  MODEL RUN 
CONSISTENCY VERY POOR BEYOND THIS TIME FRAME.  GFS HAS CHANGED 
SIGNIFICANTLY FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...KEEPING THE BOUNDARY 
OVER THE REGION.  THIS NEW SCENARIO WOULD PROVIDE A CHANCE OF PRECIP 
OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK.  SINCE THIS IS SUCH A 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGE FROM PRIOR RUNS...AND CONFIDENCE QUITE LOW...HAVE 
KEPT THINGS DRY FOR THIS PERIOD FOR NOW.     

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             71  56  69  52  70 /  30  10  20  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  53  68  51  69 /  60  10  40  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  55  64  51  69 /  40  30  40  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              61  52  62  50  67 /  60  10  40  20  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EST SAT DEC 8 2007

.DISCUSSION...RADAR TRENDS SHOW -RA/DZ ADVANCING AT A STEADY PACE 
NORTH AND EAST OUT OF MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA. ALTHOUGH STILL 
ONGOING ACROSS EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. 
SURFACE BOUNDARY TRYING TO MOVE NORTH THIS EVENING. CURRENTLY IN 
PLACE BETWEEN CHATTANOOGA AND KNOXVILLE. MOST LIKELY VERY LITTLE 
FURTHER NORTHWARD PROGRESS WILL BE MADE IN THE MOUNTAINS AND VALLEYS 
OF EAST TENNESSEE TONIGHT. SOME MINOR IMPROVEMENT IN CEILINGS AND 
VISIBILITY HAS BEEN NOTED IN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA DUE TO THE 
DEPARTURE OF SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN AND DRIZZLE. WILL LOWER 
PROBABILITIES FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. A SHOWER COULD DEVELOP ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA TOWARD DAYBREAK AS WEAK 
VORT PRESSES NORTHEAST ACROSS ALABAMA. AREAS OF FOG LOOKS GOOD AS 
NEAR SURFACE AIRMASS REMAINS SATURATED FROM THE DAYS LIGHT RAIN. 
TEMP FORECAST STILL DECENT AND WONT CHANGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EST SAT DEC 8 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
OVER THE AREA...BUT LIFT STILL WEAK...RESULTING IN PATCHES OF LIGHT 
RAIN TODAY...ESPECIALLY NORTH AND CENTRAL.  THIS SHOULD CONTINUE 
INTO TONIGHT...WITH PLENTY OF CLOUDS AND AREAS OF FOG EXPECTED ALONG 
WITH SOME PATCHY LIGHT PRECIP.  WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
SOUTH TO CHANCE NORTH AND CENTRAL TONIGHT.  THINK THE STUBBORN LOW 
LEVEL COLDER AIR MAY FINALLY ERODE OVER THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL 
AREAS TOMORROW...BUT STILL EXPECT SOME LIGHT SHOWERS. WILL GO WITH 
40 POP TOMORROW...AND WILL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM THE VERY MILD MAV 
TEMPS. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
GENERALLY PROJECT CONTINUATION OF UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH 
MUCH OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. PROXIMITY OF SURFACE BOUNDARY WHICH 
REMAINS NEAR THE NORTHWESTERN PERIPHERY OF SOUTHEASTERN UPPER RIDGE 
WILL DETERMINE COVERAGE AND INTENSITY OF PRECIP. MODELS CONTINUE IN 
SOME DISARRAY WITH RESPECT TO THIS SCENARIO SO CONFIDENCE REMAINS 
LOW. APPEARS BOUNDARY WILL BRIEFLY BE PUSHED FAR ENOUGH NORTH ON 
TUESDAY BY AMPLIFYING UPPER FLOW TO ALLOW FOR MINIMAL POPS
TEMPORARILY...ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTHERN TIER OF THE FORECAST AREA.
ULTIMATE PASSAGE OF SURFACE COLD FRONT HAS BEEN DELAYED TO THURSDAY
BY PAST FEW MODEL RUNS AND WILL RESULT IN BEST COVERAGE OF PRECIP.
OVERALL...HAVE NOT MADE MANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING
GRIDS/FORECAST DUE TO THIS PERVASIVE UNCERTAINTY.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL 
CONTINUE TO AFFECT THE AREA AT TIMES IN THE SHORT TERM...WITH BEST 
CHANCES FOR LIGHT RAIN IN THE NORTHWESTERN ZONES.  WILL CARRY LIKELY

SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTHEAST FOR SATURDAY.  MOS INDICATES QUITE MILD 
TEMPS FOR SATURDAY...BUT AM CONCERNED THAT SOME STUBBORN LOW LEVEL 
COLDER AIR MAY BE HARD TO GET RID OF IN THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL 
VALLEY. CONFIDENCE LOW...BUT WILL ONLY SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS 
FOR NOW. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...RATHER UNSETTLED 
WEATHER REMAINS IN THE OFFING AS SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IS 
PROJECTED TO REMAIN ON THE SOUTHERN EDGE OF PERSISTENT AREA OF 
PRECIP ALONG A MEANDERING SURFACE BOUNDARY AND PERIPHERY OF UPPER 
RIDGING CENTERED OFF THE SOUTHEAST ATLANTIC COAST. MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES REMAIN SUFFICIENTLY DIFFERENT TO MAKE POPS FORECAST 
PROBLEMATIC AT BEST. BASED ON THIS UNCERTAINTY...HAVE NOT MADE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST. APPEARS BEST CHANCE 
OF PRECIP WILL OCCUR NEXT WEDNESDAY AS FRONT IS FINALLY PUSHED SOUTH 
AND EAST IN RESPONSE TO APPROACHING SHORT WAVE TROUGH.

THE SURFACE...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTHWEST 
ZONES FOR FRIDAY.  BY THEN SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR PRECIP TO BE 
LIQUID...ALTHOUGH IF ANY REACHES THE GROUND EARLY ENOUGH FOR SURFACE 
TEMPS STILL TO BE BELOW FREEZING COULD BE FREEZING RAIN/SPRINKLES.  
MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.    


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SOMEWHAT UNSETTLED 
WEATHER WITH GENERALLY ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS CHARACTERIZES THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD. AREA WILL REMAIN NEAR PERIPHERY OF UPPER RIDGE THAT IS 
PROJECTED TO DEVELOP OFF THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS COAST AND PERSIST 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD WITH BEST MOISTURE CONFINED TO THE 
PERIPHERY OF THIS FEATURE. EXACT LOCATION AND AMPLITUDE OF UPPER 
RIDGE UNCLEAR AT THIS TIME BUT WILL BE CRITICAL IN COVERAGE AND
PLACEMENT OF PRECIP. SURFACE FRONT WILL ALSO BE MEANDERING NEAR
THIS AREA. APPEARS AT THIS TIME THAT BEST COVERAGE WILL GRADATE
FROM SOUTHEAST TO NORTHWEST OVER OUR FORECAST AREA. AT ANY
RATE...PRECIP DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE GENERALLY VERY SIGNIFICANT AT
THIS TIME...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO CARRY CHANCE POPS THROUGH MUCH OF
THE LONG TERM PERIOD. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES FAIRLY
CLOSELY FOR TEMPS.

FXUS64 KMRX 060823
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EST THU DEC 6 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...
AT THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE MOVING FROM THE OHIO VALLEY 
TO THE MID ATLANTIC COAST TODAY. ALOFT...THE FLOW WILL BE NEARLY 
ZONAL IN THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS. CLOUDS OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING 
WILL CONTINUE TO DISSIPATE AS DRIER LOW LEVEL ADIR ADVECTS INTO THE 
AREA. HIGH CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE TONIGHT AHEAD OF A UPPER 
JET AND A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH. THE JET AND TROUGH WILL PASS TO OUR 
NORTH ON FRIDAY...KEEPING MOST PRECIP TO OUR NORTH...BUT WITH A 
STRENGTHENING 850 FLOW FROM THE SOUTHWEST...WARM ADVECTION AND WEAK 
CONVERGENCE COULD PRODUCE SOME LIGHT RAIN FRIDAY. LOW LEVELS REMAIN 
FAIRLY DRY AND THE LIFT IS VERY WEAK...SO WILL KEEP POPS AT A SLIGHT 
CHANCE IN THE NORTH...BELOW MOS GUIDANCE WHICH APPEARS OVERDONE. 
WARM ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT PROVIDE A CONTINUTED SLIGHT 
CHANCE IN THE NORTH ON FRIDAY NIGHT. A BUILDING RIDGE TO OUR SOUTH 
WILL PUSH THE JET AND ASSOCIATED LIFT FARTHER NORTH...KEEPING OUR 
AREA DRY. AGAIN...MOS POPS APPEAR WAY OVERDONE. TEMPS WILL ALSO BE 
UNSEASONABLY WARM...WITH HIGHS REACHING WELL INTO THE 60S ON 
SATURDAY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT IN THIS PORTION OF THE FORECAST.
STAYED WITH CONTINUITY KEEPING POPS CLOSE TO PREVIOUS PACKAGE WITH
SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE WITH THE HIGHER PROBABILITIES OVER NORTHERN
AND WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY THROUGH DAYTIME
PERIOD TUESDAY AS UPPER RIDGE GRADUALLY GETS BEAT INTO SUBMISSION
FROM THE PASSAGE OF NUMEROUS WAVES OF LOW PRESSURE RIDING RAPIDLY
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY
DRAPED JUST NORTHWEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. BOUNDARY DROPS INTO
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA BY MONDAY BUT GETS A SHOVE BACK NORTH OF THE
REGION BY TUESDAY AS ANOTHER WAVE BUILDS NORTHEAST FROM THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. NUDGED POPS UP A BIT ON WEDNESDAY AS BOTH ECMWF
AND GFS FINALLY ALLOW PASSAGE OF LONG WAVE TROF. TIMING IS QUITE A
BIT OFF WITH THIS FEATURE AND BROAD BRUSHED POPS BACK TO SLIGHT
CHANCE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO ESTABLISH AN IMPROVING TREND IN THIS LATE
PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. POPULATED THE GRIDS WITH MAX/MIN TEMPS
FAIRLY CLOSE TO MOST PLEASANT WELL ABOVE NORMAL MEX MOS.

THROUGH TUESDAY AHEAD OF SECOND STRONGER SYSTEM.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 050836
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 AM EST WED DEC 5 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
A BAND OF LIGHT PRECIP ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE EXIT REGION OF THE UPPER JET AND Q-VECTOR 
CONVERGENCE. WITH DRY AIR IN THE LOW LEVELS...SNOW WILL HAVE A HARD 
TIME REACHING THE GROUND...SO QPF WILL BE MINIMAL. WARM ADVECTION 
AND ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF A SURFACE LOW OVER THE MID MS VALLEY IS 
GENERATING MORE SIGNIFICANT PRECIP OVER IL. THIS WILL MOVE INTO OUR 
AREA AFTER 12Z. STILL...WITH PLENTY OF DRY LOW LEVEL AIR TO BE 
OVERCOME...THERE WILL NOT BE MUCH MEASURABLE PRECIP. WILL KEEP POPS 
IN THE CHANCE RANGE IN SW VA AND NE TN...TAPERING TO NO POPS IN THE 
SOUTH. WITH THE WARM ADVECTION OFFSETTING ANY EVAPORATIONAL 
COOLING...TEMPS WILL RISE DESPITE THE CLOUD COVER...GIVING ALL RAIN 
OUTSIDE THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TODAY. 

AS THE UPPER JET MOVES FARTHER SOUTH...COOLING MIDLEVEL TEMPS WILL 
CREATE STEEP LAPSE RATES LATE THIS AFTERNOON. WINDS WILL ALSO SHIFT 
TO THE NORTHWEST BEHIND THE 850 MB TROUGH PASSAGE AROUND 00Z. THIS 
WILL CREATE FAVORABLE UPSLOPE FLOW CONDITIONS TONIGHT. THE 850 MB 
WINDS ARE NOT VERY STRONG...AND GROUND TEMPS ARE STILL RELATIVELY 
WARM...SO ANY SNOW ACCUMULATION SHOULD BE LIGHT...LESS THAN ONE 
INCH. DRIER AND WARMER MIDLEVEL AIR WILL END ANY PRECIP BEFORE 12Z 
THURSDAY. 

ON THURSDAY...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND A 850 MB RIDGE BUILD OVER 
THE AREA. AS THE RIDGE MOVES EAST AND A LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE 
PLAINS...A SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS ON FRIDAY. THIS WILL INCREASE 
CLOUDS OVER THE AREA AND GIVE A WARMING TREND...BUT WITH A 
STRENGTHENING RIDGE TO OUR SOUTHEAST AND A ZONAL MID/UPPER LEVEL 
FLOW...THE MOISTURE AND LIFT STAYS NORTH OF OUR AREA.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
EARLY PERIOD OF THE FORECAST WHICH PRIMARILY ENCOMPASSES THE
WEEKEND GFS/ECMWF MODELS RELATIVELY CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF UPPER
RIDGE AMPLIFYING OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WITH ASSOCIATED DRY AND
WARMER WEATHER AS SOUTHERLY FLOW STRENGTHENS. ALTHOUGH FRONTAL
BOUNDARY JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY ON SATURDAY AND
MODELS TRY TO CREATE SOME LIFT NEAR THIS BOUNDARY. MAINTAINED DRY
FORECAST WITH POPS BELOW 15 PERCENT FOR THIS PERIOD. ECMWF MORE
AMPLIFIED THAN GFS WITH ADVANCE OF PLAINS STATES UPPER TROF LATE IN
THE WEEKEND AND THEREFORE GFS ALLOWS SURFACE COLD FRONT TO MAKE
PROGRESS WELL SOUTH OF THE OHIO VALLEY WHILE ECMWF KEEPS FRONT WELL
NORTH AND WEST OF THIS POSITION AS FRONTAL WAVE RIPS THROUGH THE
GREAT LAKES DRAGGING FRONTAL BOUNDARY CLOSE TO THE WESTERN EDGE OF
THE FORECAST AREA. WHILE THE GFS IN ITS LESS AMPLIFIED FASHION
KEEPS SURFACE BOUNDARY MUCH CLOSER TO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT OCCURRING JUST NORTH OF
THE BOUNDARY ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY ON TUESDAY. ECMWF DEPICTION
RAISES PROBABILITY OF PRECIP TOWARD THE END OF THE LONG TERM LATE
TUESDAY NIGHT WITH STRONG SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT
BUILDING ACROSS THE REGION BY MID MORNING WEDNESDAY. NEEDLESS TO
SAY QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY TOWARD THE END OF THIS FORECAST AND
TRIED TO MAINTAIN SOME CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST KEEPING
SLIGHTLY HIGHER CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SOUTH AWAITING BETTER MODEL
AGREEMENT. AT ANY RATE IT APPEARS THAT PLEASANT WARM UP IS IN STORE
THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM AS RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS THE EASTERN
U.S. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  57  30  51  32  56 /  10  10   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  53  28  46  29  52 /  10  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  53  28  46  28  54 /  10  10   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  47  27  43  24  53 /  40  30   0   0  10

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 PM EST TUE DEC 4 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. EXIT REGION OF 
APPROACHING AND DEVELOPING JET STREAK WILL BRING MOISTURE AND SUPPLY 
LIFT FOR LIGHT SNOW ACROSS NORTH PART OF CWA OVERNIGHT. SON


PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK LOW WILL BE TRACKING 
THROUGH TO OUR NORTH DURING THE SHORT TERM.  MAIN ENERGY AND 
MOISTURE WILL STAY NORTH AS WELL.  HOWEVER...COULD SEE SOME ISOLATED 
TO SCATTERED PRECIP AT TIMES...BY FAR...THE BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP 
WILL BE FAR NORTHERN ZONES.  ANY PRECIP THAT FALLS OVER THE AREA 
LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING SHOULD FALL AS SNOW.  
TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM ENOUGH FOR AFTERNOON PRECIP TO BE RAIN.  


LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THESE PERIODS ARE MAINLY DRY AFTER LOW LEVEL W-NW UPSLOPE FLOW AND 
COLD AIR ADVECTION SQUEEZE OUT PERHAPS SOME SCATTERED RAIN OR SNOW 
SHOWERS WEDNESDAY NIGHT...ACROSS MAINLY HIGHER TERRAIN OF SWRN VA 
AND NE TN (INCLUDING SMOKIES). THIS LOOKS TO BE NOT MUCH MORE THAN A 
TRACE EVENT...GIVEN FACT THAT SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES WOULD LIKELY 
MELT. NONE OF THE SHORT RANGE MODELS GENERATE MUCH INSTABILITY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SO DECIDED TO MAINTAIN CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS 
FORECAST GRIDS. GFS AND NAM-WRF DIFFER CONSIDERABLY ON THE AMOUNT OF 
COLD AIR ADVECTION...BUT UPSTREAM ANALYSIS WOULD SUGGEST A BLEND OF 
MOS MINS BEST FOR NOW.

OTHERWISE...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES SEEM IN BETTER AGREEMENT OVERALL ON 
HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE SOUTH DOMINATING THE WEEKEND INTO AT LEAST 
LATE MONDAY OR TUESDAY. MEANWHILE AT THE SURFACE...A FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH NRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY THEN 
LIFT NORTH AS A WARM FRONT. THIS KEEPS OUR AREA IN AN ABOVE NORMAL 
PERIOD FOR TEMPS...AND FORECAST GRIDS ALREADY REFLECTED THIS WITH 
MAX TEMPS MOSTLY IN THE 60S FROM SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. A COLD 
FRONT MAY GRADUALLY REACH NRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY 
NIGHT OR TUESDAY...SO INTRODUCED POPS TO NRN TWO THIRDS ON TUESDAY 
AND ALL AREAS BY TUESDAY NIGHT.

NOTE...CORRECTION TO TEMPERATURE AND PRECIPITATION DATA BELOW:

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 040849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 AM EST TUE DEC 4 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...
HIGH CLOUDS COVER THE AREA THIS MORNING AHEAD OF A STRONG UPPER 
LEVEL JET OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND NRN MS VALLEY. THIS JET WILL 
PUSH FARTHER SOUTH AS THE FLOW ALOFT BECOMES LESS AMPLIFIED AS THE 
LOW OVER NEW ENGLAND PULLS AWAY. EXPECT PLENTY OF HIGH AND MIDLEVEL 
CLOUDS TO PERSIST THROUGH THE DAY...AND LEANED TOWARD THE COOLER MET 
GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPS. 

THE MAIN CORE OF THE UPPER JET WILL MOVE TOWARD OUR AREA TONIGHT. 
Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE AND UPPER DIFFLUENCE AT THE NOSE OF THE STRONG 
JET WILL PROVIDE LIFT FOR PRECIP TONIGHT...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
MOST OF THE MOISTURE WILL BE LOCATED ABOVE THE 800 MB LEVEL WITH DRY 
AIR BELOW...SO MUCH OF THE PRECIP WILL EVAPORATE BEFORE REACHING THE 
GROUND. BEST CHANCES OF MEASURABLE PRECIP WILL BE IN SW VA AS LIGHT 
SNOW. WARM GROUND TEMPS AND LIGHT PRECIP RATES WILL LIMIT ANY 
ACCUMULATIONS. DESPITE OVERCAST MIDLEVEL CLOUDS...TEMPS WILL RISE 
DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY DUE TO WARM ADVECTION AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING SURFACE LOW...CHANGING PRECIP TO ALL RAIN. BEST MOISTURE 
AND LIFT REMAIN NORTH...THOUGH BOTH ARE LIMITED...SO WILL KEEP POPS 
IN THE CHANCE RANGE. THE LOW MOVES EAST BY 00Z AND THE UPPER TROUGH 
SWINGS THROUGH IN THE EVENING. A WIND SHIFT TO NORTHWEST WILL 
PROVIDE A GOOD UPSLOPE FLOW...AND COOL AIR ALOFT WILL PROVIDE STEEP 
LAPSE RATES FOR SOME SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. EXPECT LESS THAN ONE INCH IN MOST SPOTS DUE TO WARM 
GROUND TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AT START OF PERIOD SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE IS IN CONTROL OF AREA AS UPPER SHORT WAVE EXITS TO EAST
LEAVING ZONAL FLOW ACROSS THE AREA.

MODELS IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT OVERALL WITH BUILDING UPPER RIDGE
OVER AREA THAT SHOULD HELP TO KEEP THINGS DRY. FRONTAL BOUNDARY
SAGGING TO SOUTH ON SATURDAY SHOULD BE NEAR OR IN CWA...BUT BY
SUNDAY LIFTS TO NORTH. MAIN COLD FRONT WAITS UNTIL AFTER END OF
FORECAST TO ENTER AREA. LAST SEVERAL POSSIBLE PRECIP EVENTS HAVE
GENERALLY WAITED ON MAIN COLD FRONT APPROACH/PASSAGE FOR
MEASURABLE PRECIP. SINCE COLD FRONT HOLDING OFF TILL AFTER FORECAST
PERIOD...AND RIDGE BUILDING IN...HAVE DROPPED POPS THAT WERE IN THE
FORECAST FOR FRIDAY AND MONDAY. ALSO HAVE CUT BACK ON SKY COVERB AND
WARMED UP TEMPS FOR SEVERAL PERIODS IN EXTENDED FORECAST.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  53  32  56  33  51 /   0   0  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  48  31  52  29  48 /   0  10  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  48  31  51  28  46 /   0  10  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  43  29  45  26  43 /   0  20  40  20  10
