FXUS64 KMRX 031939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 PM EST MON DEC 3 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WINDS DIMINISHING ACROSS THE 
AREA AND WILL ALLOW THE WIND ADVISORY TO EXPIRE.  OTHERWISE... 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD IN WHICH SHOULD ALLOW FOR 
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING OVERNIGHT AND COOL OVERNIGHT LOWS.  HIGH 
PRESSURE STAYS IN CONTROL TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR GENERALLY CLEAR AND 
DRY CONDITIONS.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THREE SYSTEMS DURING THESE 
PERIODS WHICH MAY (OR MAY NOT) OFFER SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION (PCPN) 
TO THE REGION. FIRST SYSTEM IS A FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE IN NW FLOW 
ALOFT TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...WITH HPC FAVORING GFS OVER 
NAM-WRF. THIS LOOKS MAINLY TO BE A LIGHT PCPN EVENT FOR MAINLY SW VA 
AND NE TN...WITH MEASURABLE AMOUNTS POSSIBLY LIMITED TO UPSLOPE 
AREAS. GENERALLY KEPT CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR THIS EVENT
...WITH MIXED PCPN TYPE WORDING WEDNESDAY MORNING.

NEXT SYSTEM IS INDICATED FOR FRIDAY...BUT SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES 
BETWEEN GFS AND NAM-WRF...WITH LATEST MODEL RUNS TRENDING A LITTLE 
DRIER THAN 03/00Z GFSX MOS POPS. UPPER FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL AND 
SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPING...BUT NOTHING THAT SUPPORTS MORE 
THAN MINIMAL POPS FOR NOW. GENERALLY BLENDED POPS WITH NEIGHBORS 
GRIDS.

WEEKEND LOOKS DRY FOR NOW AS RIDGING DOMINATES...BUT DID INTRODUCE 
LOW POPS FOR MONDAY NRN AREAS...AND ALL AREAS BY MONDAY NIGHT IN LINE
WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES. WAS TOLD THAT GFSX MOS TEMPS HAVE BEEN 
INCONSISTENT FROM 00Z TO 12Z RUNS. 12Z GUIDANCE CAME IN MUCH WARMER 
ON BOTH MINS AND MAXES...SO FOR NOW I TRENDED TEMPS A LITTLE BELOW 
WARMER CHOICES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 030841
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 AM EST MON DEC 3 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT IS CURRENTLY MOVING 
THROUGH THE AREA...AND SHOULD BE EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS BY 10Z. 
TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS WILL DROP RAPIDLY BEHIND THE FRONT...AND 
THE COLD DRY AIR IS JUST BEGINNING TO ENTER THE NORTHERN PLATEAU 
COUNTIES. PRECIP AHEAD OF THE FRONT HAS PUSHED EAST...AND NO 
ADDITIONAL PRECIP IS EXPECTED TODAY. SHALLOW MOISTURE WILL REMAIN 
BEHIND THE FRONT AND PROVIDE OVERCAST SKIES FOR MOST OF THE AREA 
THIS MORNING...WITH GRADUAL CLEARING THROUGH THE DAY FROM SW TO NE. 
TEMPS MAY RISE SLIGHTLY IN THE SOUTH AND WEST...OTHERWISE EXPECT 
NEARLY STEADY TEMPS AFTER A QUICK DROP THIS MORNING. WINDS WILL 
INCREASE BEHIND THE FRONT...WITH VALLEY LOCATIONS SEEING WINDS OF 15 
TO 25 MPH WITH GUSTS TO AROUND 30 MPH..WHILE THE MOUNTAINS COULD SEE 
20 TO 30 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 40 MPH BASED ON UPSTREAM OBSERVATIONS AND 
MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS. WILL ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE SMOKIES 
AND NE TN MOUNTAINS THROUGH 4 PM. A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL BUILD 
INTO THE AREA THIS EVENING...WHICH SHOULD LOWER WINDS. SKIES SHOULD 
BE MOSTLY CLEAR BY EVENING...EXCEPT FOR THE EXTREME NE PORTIONS OF 
THE AREA AND THE MOUNTAINS WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW MAY PROVIDE MORE 
CLOUDS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE AREA 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON TUESDAY.  MODELS BRING A FRONT INTO THE 
REGION ON TUESDAY NIGHT.  BEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...BUT WILL 
KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES.  SHOULD BE COLD 
ENOUGH FOR LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
MORNING...BUT ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE MINOR.  THE FRONT SAGS SOUTH 
ON WEDNESDAY...BEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH OF THE CWA...BUT SHOULD 
BE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE TO KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR OUR 
NORTHERN ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS ON WEDNESDAY.  THE FRONT SHIFTS 
SOUTH AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT ALONG WITH ADEQUATE MOISTURE TO 
INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE CENTRAL PORTIONS OF OUR CWA ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  THICKNESSES INDICATE POSSIBLE SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE PUSHES IN 
ON THURSDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER TO THE AREA.  ANOTHER FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY...MOISTURE LIMITED BUT WILL KEEP SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS GOING FOR FRIDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS ON SATURDAY 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THE WEEKEND.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
FOR TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  47  28  56  35  57 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  26  52  34  53 /  10   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  43  27  52  34  51 /   0   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  40  22  48  29  48 /  10   0   0  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 3 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

FXUS64 KMRX 021938
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST SUN DEC 2 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION... 
WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ACROSS THE MID MS 
RIVER VALLEY AND INTO THE OZARKS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
THE PROGRESSION OF THIS COLD FRONT TONIGHT...WITH THE FRONT EXPECTED 
TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE THIS EVENING TOWARDS MIDNIGHT. 
STRONG 850 MB WINDS AROUND 50 TO 60 KT ARE PROGGED TO DEVELOP AHEAD 
OF THIS FRONT...SO WILL GO AHEAD AND ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR TONIGHT. THERE IS SOME CONCERN THAT A SOLID 
LINE OF SHOWERS ALONG THE FRONT COULD BRING SOME OF THESE HIGH WINDS 
DOWN INTO THE VALLEYS...BUT WILL FOREGO THE ISSUANCE OF A SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT FOR NOW...SINCE MODELS INDICATE THAT A LOW-LEVEL 
INVERSION WILL BE PRESENT FOR MOST OF THE EVENING WHICH SHOULD HELP 
KEEP THESE WINDS FROM DESCENDING. MODEL SOUNDINGS ALSO INDICATE THAT 
SOME WEAK INSTABILITY WILL DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT AS IT MOVES INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA LATE THIS EVENING. THUS...WILL MENTION A CHANCE OF 
TSTORMS...BUT THINK THAT SHOWERS WILL BE THE PREDOMINATE PRECIP 
TYPE. 

THIS FRONT WILL QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...SO 
THERE WONT BE MUCH OF A CHANCE FOR A SOAKING RAINFALL. HOWEVER...IT 
STILL APPEARS THAT BETWEEN A QUARTER AND A HALF OF AN INCH WILL BE 
POSSIBLE FOR MOST AREAS. MOISTURE SHOULD RAPIDLY DIMINISH AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...WITH ONLY A FEW LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. HOWEVER...DONT 
EXPECT ANY SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS...SINCE MOST OF THE MOISTURE WILL 
HAVE EXITED THE REGION BY THE TIME THE SUB-FREEZING AIR ARRIVES. 
ANOTHER QUICK-MOVING CLIPPER-TYPE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO AFFECT 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN BY TUESDAY NIGHT...BRINGING MAINLY 
LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL 
MOVE THROUGH...MAINLY TO OUR NORTH ON WEDNESDAY. ASSOCIATED DYNAMICS 
AND MOISTURE OVER THE MRX AREA MINIMAL AND WILL GENERALLY KEEP LOW 
POPS GOING FOR NORTHERN AND CENTRAL CWA LOCATIONS WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ADDITIONALLY...THE COOL AIR MASS IN PLACE MAY ALLOW 
FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AS THE SYSTEM MOVES AWAY FROM THE AREA. A SURFACE 
HIGH WILL PUSH THROUGH THE REGION ON THURSDAY. RUN CONSISTENCY 
REMAINS POOR BUT GFS IS CONTINUING THE TREND OF BRINGING A FRONT 
THROUGH ON FRIDAY. WHILE CONFIDENCE IS LOW...HAVE ADDED 20 POPS 
ACROSS THE AREA. KEPT THINGS DRY FOR THE WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN      38  44  27  53  34 / 100  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN              37  44  27  53  34 / 100   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN     35  42  22  49  29 / 100  20   0   0  20

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION...WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST 
ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. RADARS INDICATE SOME LIGHT ECHOES 
OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT SURFACE OBS REVEAL 
THAT MOST OF THIS MOISTURE IS NOT REACHING THE GROUND DUE TO A VERY 
DRY AIR MASS AT THE SURFACE. SOUTHWEST WINDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO 
INTENSIFY THIS AFTERNOON AS THE FRONT APPROACHES...WITH DEWPOINTS 
GRADUALLY RISING AS WELL. MOST MEASURABLE RAINFALL SHOULD HOLD OFF 
UNTIL LATER TOWARDS SUNSET...AS THE COLD FRONT GETS CLOSER AND LIFT 
INCREASES. 

AFTER A WARM START TO THE DAY THIS MORNING...THINK THAT MAXES MAY BE 
A LITTLE WARMER THIS AFTERNOON THAN CURRENTLY FORECASTED. THUS... 
WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST TO RAISE MAXES AND WINDS A LITTLE.

411 AM EST SUN DEC 2 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK 
EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. WARM 
ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL LEAD TO INCREASING LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE THROUGH THE DAY OVER OUR AREA. EXPECT OVERCAST SKIES BY 
AFTERNOON...THOUGH WITH LITTLE TO NO LIFT...MEASURABLE PRECIP IS NOT 
LIKELY UNTIL LATE AFTERNOON. STRONGER LIFT WILL ENTER THE AREA 
AROUND 00Z...ASSOCIATED WITH THE 500 MB VORT MAX AND 850 MB 
CONVERGENCE. WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS IN THE EVENING...THOUGH AS 
THE SYSTEM IS FAST-MOVING...QPF SHOULD NOT BE TOO HIGH...GENERALLY 
AROUND A HALF INCH. BY 09Z THE FRONT WILL BE THROUGH THE AREA AND 
PRECIP WILL END QUICKLY. STRONG GUSTY WINDS WILL ACCOMPANY THE 
FROPA...AND A WIND ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED FOR TONIGHT...AT LEAST FOR 
THE MOUNTAINS AND POSSIBLY THE VALLEY. WILL HOLD OFF ON ISSUING THIS 
NOW AS THE FROPA IS STILL 24 HOURS OUT...AND LET THE DAY SHIFT 
EVALUATE FURTHER. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE FRONT IS EAST OF THE AREA 
BY MONDAY...BUT WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING AND SOME 
LINGERING MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR OUR 
NORTHERN ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS FOR MONDAY MORNING.  DRY WEATHER 
RETURNS ON TUESDAY.  MODELS BRING A FRONT INTO THE REGION ON 
WEDNESDAY...ALONG WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE TO KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS GOING FOR WEDNESDAY FOR OUR NORTHERN ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS.   
WILL INCLUDE THE CENTRAL PORTIONS OF OUR CWA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS 
THE FRONT SHIFTS SOUTH.  THICKNESSES INDICATE POSSIBLE SNOW SHOWERS 
FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE PUSHES 
IN ON THURSDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER TO THE AREA.  ANOTHER 
DISTURBANCE MOVES THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY...BUT WITH LIMITED 
CONTINUITY WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON 
SATURDAY.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST SAT DEC 1 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM STRENGTHENING OVER THE 
CENTRAL ROCKIES. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE PROGRESSION 
OF THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO THE NORTHEAST TONIGHT AND SUNDAY... 
WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY 
EVENING. BOTH THE GFS AND WRF MODELS INDICATE THAT THERE WILL BE 
SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH THIS FRONT TO MENTION HIGH POPS 
FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND ESPECIALLY ON SUNDAY EVENING. THIS COLD 
FRONT WILL QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT... 
WITH MOISTURE RAPIDLY DIMINISHING AFTER MIDNIGHT. IT APPEARS THAT A 
FEW SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS MAINLY THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN AROUND SUNRISE ON MONDAY 
MORNING...BUT MODELS INDICATE THAT MOST OF THE MOISTURE WILL HAVE 
EXITED THE REGION BY THE TIME THE SUB-FREEZING AIR ARRIVES. THUS... 
DONT EXPECT ANY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THESE AREAS. WINDS ARE 
EXPECTED TO BE STRONG ALONG AND BEHIND THIS FRONT AS IT MOVES 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY EVENING. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS 
THAT A WIND ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND ETA MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS APPEARS TO BE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD...WHILE THE NGM MOS NUMBERS REMAIN 
WARMER. WILL TREND TOWARD THE COOLER GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE PERIOD 
SINCE THERE SHOULD BE PLENTY OF CLOUDS AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND DECENT 
COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND THE FRONT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WILL BE BETWEEN WEATHER 
SYSTEMS ON TUESDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS. A WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL TRACK THROUGH TO OUR NORTH WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MAIN 
DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE STAYS NORTH...BUT MAY BE SUFFICIENT OVER 
NORTHERN AND POSSIBLY CENTRAL CWA LOCATIONS FOR SOME ISOLATED 
SHOWERS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT...TEMPERATURE PROFILE SUCH THAT COULD SEE 
SOME LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES LATE AS THE WEAK LOW EXITS THE AREA. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY. A SYSTEM WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA ON SATURDAY...BUT 
SHOULD REMAIN TO OUR WEST THROUGH THE END OF THE EXTENDED...SO HAVE 
KEPT SATURDAY DRY. DIDN/T STRAY FAR FROM TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE 
THROUGH THE PERIOD.

INCREASING ON SATURDAY NIGHT...WILL TREND WARMER WITH LOWS AND 
COOLER WITH MAXES ON SUNDAY.

LINGER OVER THE AREA ON MONDAY AS THE COLD FRONT EXITS THE REGION.

NORTHERN ZONES AND SHOULD END DURING THE DAY. A RETURN TO DRY 
CONDITIONS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. ANOTHER WEAKER FRONT IS PROGGED 
INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THERE HAS BEEN POOR 
CONSISTENCY WITH THIS FEATURE...THOUGH THE TREND HAS BEEN TO BRING 
IT FURTHER SOUTH INTO PARTS OF THE MRX CWA. HAVE THEREFORE...ADDED 
SOME LOW POPS TO NORTHERN AND EASTERN AND SOME CENTRAL PORTIONS OF 
THE CWA. THERE IS POTENTIALLY A WAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA 
DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED...BUT MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT 
AND HAVE LEFT THINGS DRY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

THROUGH THROUGH THE AREA ON EARLY MONDAY.  WITH SOME LINGERING 
MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR OUR NORTHERN 
ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS ON MONDAY MORNING.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON 
TUESDAY.  ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY.  BEST 
MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...SO WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY DRY FOR 
NOW.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST THU NOV 29 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
APPALACHIANS...WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OZARKS BUILDING INTO THE 
TN RIVER VALLEY. ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY EVENING...BUT MODELS INDICATE THAT 
MOISTURE WILL BE LACKING WITH ONLY A SMALL INCREASE IN CLOUDS 
EXPECTED. HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED. 
AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE APPEARS TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD AND LOOKS REASONABLE. WITH A DRY AIR MASS IN 
PLACE...WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER AT NIGHT AND A LITTLE WARMER 
DURING THE DAY. MOISTURE SHOULD GRADUALLY INCREASE BY SATURDAY NIGHT 
AS WINDS BECOME SOUTHERLY BEHIND THE DEPARTING HIGH PRESSURE AREA.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON 
MOVING A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION DURING THE EARLY PART OF THE 
EXTENDED. THERE REMAINS SOME DIFFERENCES IN THE TIMING...LEANING 
TOWARDS A BIT SLOWER TRACK AND HAVE ADJUSTED POPS FOR BEST CHANCE OF 
PRECIP CENTERED AROUND SUNDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP SOME LINGERING LOW 
POPS INTO MONDAY. BEHIND THE FRONT...EXPECT A RETURN TO DRY 
CONDITIONS THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. HOWEVER...WILL KEEP 
AN EYE ON A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES TRACKING THROUGH THE REGION... 
MAINLY TO OUR NORTH. GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOKS REASONABLE...AND STAYED 
CLOSE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
356 AM EST THU NOV 29 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...COLD FRONT HEADED THIS 
WAY...MOVING TO THE ESE ABOUT 23 KT.  THIS PUTS FROPA AT NW CWA 
ABOUT 13Z...KCHA AND KTYS ABOUT 16-17Z...AND AT KTRI ABOUT 18Z.  
STRATOCU DECK SLOW TO GET FORMING...SO MAY BE MORE MORNING SUN 
PEEKING THROUGH THE CIRRUS THIS MORNING THAN EARLIER ANTICIPATED.  
RAIN SHOWERS LOOK TO BE SAFELY LOCATED WELL TO THE NORTH.  HAVE GONE 
A LITTLE BELOW GUIDANCE TEMPS FOR MUCH WESTERN AND CENTRAL 
AREAS...DUE TO NATURE OF FROPA YESTERDAY IN PLAINS WHERE FAIRLY 
RAPID POST-FRONTAL COOLING OCCURRED.  

FOR TONIGHT...CONSIDERING HOW DRY DEW POINTS ARE AND HOW THE RIDGE 
SHOULD SETTLE INTO THE AREA LATE TONIGHT...WENT COLDER THAN GUIDANCE 
AT ALL LOCATIONS.  FOR FRIDAY...STUCK PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
TEMPS.  RETURN FLOW STARTS TO GET WARMER AIR INTO REGION...BUT NOT 
TOO MUCH YET.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MOS POPS AND MILDER 
MIN TEMPS FROM NAM-WRF FOR FRIDAY NIGHT LOOK A BIT QUIRKY TO ME... 
STILL THINKING THAT ANY MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION (PCPN) WILL MAINLY 
OCCUR WELL TO OUR NORTH IN AN AREA OF STRONG LOW LEVEL WARM AIR 
ADVECTION ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. TWEAKED SATURDAY NIGHT 
POPS A BIT...RESISTING TEMPTATION TO DROP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
THAT PERIOD...BASED ON THE LATEST OPERATIONAL MODEL RUN AND 
AVAILABLE ENSEMBLE DATA.  

TIMING FOR MAIN PERIODS OF SHOWERS FROM SUNDAY THROUGH EARLY MONDAY 
LOOKED GENERALLY RIGHT ON TRACK WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS...SO LITTLE TO 
NO CHANGES FOR THOSE PERIODS. FRONTAL PASSAGE EXPECTED WELL BEFORE 
12Z MONDAY...AND APPEARS TO BE LESS COLD AIR ADVECTION ON MONDAY 
THAN INDICATED 24 HOURS AGO. STILL...AGREED WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES 
THAT THERE IS SUFFICIENT COLD AIR ADVECTION INDICATED ON MONDAY TO 
UNDERCUT THE LATEST GFSX MOS MAX TEMPS.

OTHERWISE...DRY WEATHER ON TAP FOR MID WEEK AS ADVERTISED EARLIER...
WITH MAX TEMPS RUNNING JUST A FEW DEGREES BELOW SEASONAL VALUES.
OVERALL TRENDED TEMPS RELATIVELY CLOSE TO 29/00Z GFSX MOS GUIDANCE.  
SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS MADE FOR THE NEW DAY 7 (THURSDAY) AS DRY WITH 
MIN AND MAX TEMPS NEAR CLIMATOLOGICAL VALUES.

THE FORECAST AREA. SOME MID AND HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE WILL STREAM INTO 
THE REGION FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT ASSOCIATED WITH THE FAST 
MOVING SOUTHERN STREAM.

ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY ALLOWING FOR A CONTINUATION OF 
DRY WEATHER. STAYED WITH PREVIOUS TIMING OF WARM AIR ADVECTION 
PRECIP LATE SATURDAY NIGHT EARLY SUNDAY AS UPPER TROF BUILDS EAST 
TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. KEPT POPS HIGH AGAIN SUNDAY AFTERNOON 
INTO SUNDAY NIGHT WITH FROPA OCCURING EARLY SUNDAY EVENING. 
MAINTAINED EXTENSIVE WRAP AROUND PRECIP THROUGH AT LEAST MID DAY 
MONDAY BEHIND FRONT CLOSER TO ECMWF DEPICTION WHICH FEATURES QUITE A 
BIT OF ENERGY TRAILING AS LONG WAVE TROF SLOWLY MIGRATES EASTWARD. 
HIGHER SURFACE PRESSURE IN COLDER AIRMASS BUILDS SOUTHEAST INTO THE 
DEEP SOUTH WITH DRIER NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. 
TRENDED TEMPS RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE.

FXUS64 KMRX 281455
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EST WED NOV 28 2007

.DISCUSSION...
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL HELP MAINTAIN CLEAR SKIES OVER THE AREA
TODAY. PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND DRY AIRMASS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES
TO WARM NICELY TODAY. CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING A LITTLE
HIGHER THAN THE HOURLY FORECAST...SO HAVE RAISED MAX TEMPERATURES A
DEGREE OF TWO MOST LOCATIONS.

HAVE A GOOD DAY.

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...VERY QUIET AT START OF 
FORECAST WITH LOW LEVEL RIDGE OVER AREA.  SHOULD BE DECENT WARM-UP 
TODAY...ESPECIALLY IN WESTERN SECTIONS WHERE SOUTHERLY FLOW PICKS UP 
FASTER.

FOR TONIGHT...CLOUDS AND LOW LEVEL PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL INCREASE 
KEEPING TEMPS A LITTLE WARMER THAN LEVELS THIS MORNING.  COLD FRONT 
SHOULD JUST BE EDGING INTO CWA ABOUT THE END OF THIS PERIOD.

FOR THURSDAY...FRONT PLOWS THROUGH IN THE MORNING HOURS.  THINK THAT 
PRECIP WILL MOSTLY STAY TO NORTH OF CWA...BUT WILL FORECAST MOSTLY 
CLOUDY CONDITIONS FOR MUCH OF THE AREA DURING THE MORNING HOURS.  
PLAN ON BAND OF POST-FRONTAL STRATOCUMULUS TO COVER THE AREA DURING 
THE MORNING THEN ERODE WEST TO EAST IN THE AFTERNOON.  UPSLOPE FLOW 
INTO THE APPS SHOULD KEEP THINGS MOSTLY CLOUDY IN HIGHER TERRAIN 
INTO THE EARLY AFTERNOON.  FOR HIGH TEMPS...WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
OVERALL...A LITTLE COOLER NORTHWEST...AND A LITTLE WARMER SOUTHEAST.

NAM TRAJECTORY FORECAST SHOWS 500 METER SOURCE REGION FOR THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON BEING FROM WRN SD/SE MT WHERE DEW POINTS ARE IN THE 
TEENS.  WILL BE LOWERING POST-FRONT DEW POINTS A FEW DEGREES.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MAIN PERIODS 
ADJUSTED THIS MORNING WERE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. REMOVED POPS 
ACROSS SRN MOST AREAS SATURDAY NIGHT DUE TO OUR AREA PROGGD TO BE 
STILL UNDER THE EFFECTS OF UPPER RIDGE...AND MOST OF THE MOISTURE 
AND PRECIPITATION (PCPN) STILL WELL TO OUR WEST. MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES START OUT IN GOOD AGREEMENT...THEN STRAY A BIT AFTER 
SUNDAY...THUS CONFIDENCE WAS LOW IN MAKING MAJOR CHANGES. FRONTAL 
PASSAGE RIGHT NOW INDICATED TO BE SUNDAY EVENING...BUT ONLY SLIGHTLY 
RAISED POPS (MAX OF 54 PERCENT) FOR NOW FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. REMOVED 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY...BUT KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE...LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE AND MODERATE COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WHICH YIELDS STEEP LAPSE RATES. NOT TOO FANCY WITH PCPN 
TYPES JUST YET FOR MONDAY.

OTHERWISE...ADJUSTED MIN AND MAX TEMPS GENERALLY EACH PERIOD MORE IN 
LINE WITH LATEST GFS/GFSX MOS GUIDANCE...EXCEPT WHERE ADJUSTMENTS 
WOULD BE TOO DIFFERENT WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES GRIDS. THANKS TO ALL 
FOR GOOD COORDINATION ON CHANGES MADE THIS MORNING. SOME PRELIMINARY 
GRIDS WERE ALSO MADE FOR THE NEW DAY 7. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  59  37  55  28  53 /   0  10  10   0  10

FXUS64 KMRX 271924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
224 PM EST TUE NOV 27 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE AREA 
SHOULD BRING DRY WEATHER TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY UNDER A MOSTLY CLEAR 
SKY.  WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO DIMINISH TONIGHT AS THE GRADIENT 
RELAXES.  WITH THE LIGHT WIND AND CLEAR SKY...MAY SEE PATCHY FOG 
DEVELOPING.  BUT...PRETTY DRY IN THE LOW LEVELS SO DENSE FOG IS NOT 
ANTICIPATED.  THE CLEAR SKY WILL ALLOW GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING 
TONIGHT.  ALL THE GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TONIGHT 
FAIRLY CLOSE...SO DIDNT STRAY TOO FAR.  

.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH TUE)...WEAK COLD FRONT TO PUSH IN
LATE WED NIGHT...AND EXIT EARLY THU. FORCING UNIMPRESSIVE AND
APPEARS BETTER MOISTURE WILL STAY NORTH...SO WILL GO WITH JUST SOME
CLOUDS WITH THIS FEATURE. SHOULD BE DRY FOR FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY...THEN NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES. FAIRLY HIGH CONFIDENCE FOR
PRECIP EVENT SOMETIME IN THE SUN/MON TIME FRAME...BUT MODELS STILL
IN POOR AGREEMENT ON DETAILS LEADING TO FAIRLY HIGH UNCERTAINTY FOR
THE TIMING. GFS IS RATHER FAST...AND TREND HAS BEEN FASTER. GFS
ENSEMBLE MEMBERS LEND IT ONLY TEPID SUPPORT. ECMWF IS MUCH SLOWER.
WITH THAT IN MIND...WILL GO WITH A BLEND THAT IS AROUND 12 HOURS
SLOWER THAN THE GFS. WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SAT NIGHT...THEN
CHANCE SUN THROUGH MON. WILL GO DRY FOR TUE. WILL BUMP GFS MOS
TEMPS UP A BIT FOR MON...OTHERWISE MOSTLY JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1002 AM EST TUE NOV 27 2007

.DISCUSSION...SATELLITE INDICATING CONSIDERABLE CLOUD COVER OVER THE 
CWA THIS MORNING....BUT CLEARING EVIDENT TO THE WEST.  WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN...SHOULD SEE A MOSTLY SUNNY SKY BY AFTERNOON.  
ALSO...NOT MUCH SHOWING UP ON RADAR.  WILL UPDATE ZONE FORECAST TO 
REMOVE MORNING CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES.  TEMPERATURES AND 
THE REST OF THE FORECAST APPEAR ON TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...  

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...POST FRONTAL LOW CLOUDINESS 
LINGERS AS FAR WEST AS W TN AND CENTRAL KY THIS MORNING...WHILE MID 
AND HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE/CLOUDS (ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK TROUGH AND SRN 
JET AXIS) WERE ALSO STREAMING EASTWARD ACROSS TN AND THE GULF COAST 
STATES. A FEW WEAK RETURNS ON AREA RADARS WARRANTS KEEPING A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP WHERE LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW MAY SQUEEZE OUT SOME 
SPRINKLES OR DRIZZLE. 

EXPECT VARIABLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THIS MORNING...THEN 
DECREASING CLOUDS OR GRADUAL CLEARING WOULD BEST DESCRIBE SKY COVER 
TODAY. FAIR AMOUNT OF COLD AIR ADVECTION THIS AFTERNOON...SO KEPT 
MAX TEMPS IN THE 40S TO MID/UPR 50S. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT AS 
SURFACE RIDGE MOVES QUICKLY EAST FROM SRN PLAINS AND LOWER MS VALLEY.
PREFERRED A NAM-WRF/GFS MOS BLEND ON MIN TEMPS OVER PURE GFS NUMBERS.
GENEROUS RAINFALL OVER SRN AND WRN AREAS YESTERDAY...PLUS SUFFICIENT 
BOUNDARY LAYER RH ELSEWHERE...SUPPORTS AT LEAST PATCHY LATE NIGHT 
FOG TOWARD WEDNESDAY MORNING.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...NEXT SYSTEM DUE IN IS A 
CLIPPER SYSTEM THAT RACES THROUGH THE AREA LATE WEDNESDAY/EARLY 
THURSDAY.  ALL MODELS A LITTLE FASTER THIS RUN...SO AM EXPANDING 
LIGHT POPS FOR THURSDAY MORNING BACK INTO LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  
WILL LEAVE LIGHT POPS AS IS FOR THURSDAY MORNING.  

CONDITIONS DRY OUT AFTER CLIPPER UNTIL LARGER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM 
WEST OVER THE WEEKEND.  HPC FORECASTER STATED THAT GFS LOOKED A 
LITTLE TOO FAST WITH THIS SYSTEM.  THINK PRESENT LIGHT POPS FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT REASONABLE.  WILL UPDATE WEATHER GRIDS TO HAVE ONLY 
RAIN SHOWERS...AS IT LOOKS LIKE WEST SIDE OF APPALACHIANS WILL 
WARM-UP PRETTY QUICKLY...WHEREAS EAST SIDE COULD HAVE SOME COLD AIR 
DAMMING.  

TRACK OF PRECIP QUITE DIFFERENT DURING WARM ADVECTION PHASE WITH 
SOME MODELS (ESP. GEM) SWEEPING IN LARGE PRECIP FIELD OVERTAKING 
AREA WHILE OTHER MODELS (ECMWF) SHOWED STRONGER RIDGE TO SOUTH 
DIVERTING MUCH OF THE EARLY PRECIP TO THE NORTH AND SLOWING FRONTAL
APPROACH. WITH SLOWER MOVEMENT...AM PLANNING ON FROPA AROUND
MONDAY NIGHT...THEREFORE AM BUMPING UP LOWS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY AND THE HIGHS FOR MONDAY...AND EXTENDING POPS TO LATER IN
FORECAST. ALSO SLOWER MOVEMENT WILL ALLOW MORE MOISTURE TO BUILD
INTO AREA...SO WILL HAVE ISOLD THUNDER AS WELL FOR MONDAY AND
MONDAY NIGHT.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

$$

GH/TG/GM

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EST TUE NOV 27 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...POST FRONTAL LOW CLOUDINESS 
LINGERS AS FAR WEST AS W TN AND CENTRAL KY THIS MORNING...WHILE MID 
AND HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE/CLOUDS (ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK TROUGH AND SRN 
JET AXIS) WERE ALSO STREAMING EASTWARD ACROSS TN AND THE GULF COAST 
STATES. A FEW WEAK RETURNS ON AREA RADARS WARRANTS KEEPING A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP WHERE LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW MAY SQUEEZE OUT SOME 
SPRINKLES OR DRIZZLE. 

EXPECT VARIABLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THIS MORNING...THEN 
DECREASING CLOUDS OR GRADUAL CLEARING WOULD BEST DESCRIBE SKY COVER 
TODAY. FAIR AMOUNT OF COLD AIR ADVECTION THIS AFTERNOON...SO KEPT 
MAX TEMPS IN THE 40S TO MID/UPR 50S. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT AS 
SURFACE RIDGE MOVES QUICKLY EAST FROM SRN PLAINS AND LOWER MS VALLEY.
PREFERRED A NAM-WRF/GFS MOS BLEND ON MIN TEMPS OVER PURE GFS NUMBERS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
700 PM EST MON NOV 26 2007

.DISCUSSION...A COLD FRONT IS TRACKING ACROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING 
WITH ASSOCIATED PRECIP MOVING THROUGH.  THE FRONT HAS ALSO GENERATE 
BREEZY WINDS ACROSS THE MRX CWA.  THESE WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE 
EVENING WITH THE STRONGEST WINDS EXPECTED OVER THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS...ESPECIALLY AROUND THE SMOKY MOUNTAIN AREA.  A WIND 
ADVISORY IS IN PLACE UNTIL MIDNIGHT FOR THIS AREA.  WINDS WILL 
DIMINISH OVERNIGHT AND AS THEY SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST...DRIER AIR 
WILL BE PULLED IN.  WILL UPDATE FORECAST PACKAGE LATE THIS EVENING 
TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST MON NOV 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE AND A COLD 
FRONT CURRENTLY OVER NORTHERN KY WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK NORTHEAST 
TONIGHT.  RADAR SHOWING AN AREA OF SHOWERS ASSOCIATED WITH IT.  WILL 
KEEP LIKELY POPS FOR OUR NORTHERN AREAS AND THE MOUNTAINS FOR THIS 
EVENING...WITH LOWER POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT AFTER THE SYSTEM CONTINUES 
TRACKING OUT OF THE AREA.  WITH SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE LINGERING IN 
THE NORTH ALONG WITH SOME WEAK UPSLOPE...WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS FOR TUESDAY MORNING.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE AREA BY AFTERNOON.  SHOULD BE A MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY NIGHT 
TONIGHT WITH SUN RETURNING BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON.  WINDS SHOULD BEGIN 
TO DIMINSH TONIGHT AS GRADIENT RELAXES.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM...(TUE NIGHT THROUGH MON)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE   WILL 
PROVIDE A DRY START TO THE PERIOD FOR TUE NIGHT AND WED.  A COLD 
FRONT WILL PUSH IN LATE WED NIGHT AND QUICKLY EXIT THE REGION EARLY 
THURSDAY.  APPEARS BEST DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE WILL STAY WELL TO OUR 
NORTH...SO WILL JUST CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP THU MORNING IN THE 
NORTH.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN AGAIN BEHIND THE FRONT...AND 
APPEARS THINGS WILL STAY DRY FOR THU NIGHT INTO SATURDAY.  QUITE A 
BIT OF UNCERTAINTY FOR THE LATTER PERIODS.  MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT THAT ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIP IS IN STORE FOR SOMETIME IN 
THE SAT NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY TIME FRAME...BUT DISAGREE ON THE 
DETAILS.  FOR NOW WILL TREND TOWARD A GFS/ECMWF BLEND WITH SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR SAT NIGHT AND CHANCE SUN THROUGH MON.  GFS MOS TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.  

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 261525
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1024 AM EST MON NOV 26 2007

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATE AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
CURRENTLY OVER SOUTHWEST KY.  RADAR INDICATING HEAVIEST RAIN ACROSS 
THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE CWA...BUT ANOTHER AREA OF RAIN IN NORTHERN 
GA MOVING NORTH.  MODELS TRACK LOW TO THE NORTHEAST WITH THE DEEPEST 
MOISTURE SHIFTING EAST THIS AFTERNOON. WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO LOWER 
RAIN CHANCES IN THE WEST A BIT FOR TODAY.  TEMPERATURES AND WINDS 
LOOK ON TRACK...SO NO NEED TO CHANGE THEM. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER NW MS AND 
SW TN (SURFACE) AND ERN OK/WRN AR (ALOFT) WAS MOVING NE THIS MORNING
...GENERALLY AS MODELS INDICATED. LEADING EDGE OF RAIN AND SHOWERS 
HAS SPREAD INTO ALL BUT FAR NE TN AND EXTREME SW VA. AREA VAD WIND 
PROFILES SHOW MORE OF A S-SW FLOW ABOVE THE SURFACE...SO NOT A 
PROMINENT AMOUNT OF DOWNSLOPING SUGGESTED (ALTHO TRI HAS LIGHT SE 
SFC WIND AND WARMED UP TO 61 DEGS).  WIND PROFILES ALSO SHOW WIND 
SPEEDS A LITTLE LOWER THAN GFS OR NAM-WRF PROGD SPEEDS FOR LOW LEVEL 
JET THIS MORNING...AND ONLY A COUPLE OF SURFACE LOCATIONS CURRENTLY 
SHOW GUSTS OF ANY CONCERN. THUS...KEPT WIND SPEEDS AND GUSTS JUST 
BELOW LAKE WIND OR WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

LIFT AND UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE INCREASE FROM 12Z TO 18Z TODAY...AND 
AN AREA OF ELEVATED INSTABILITY (SURFACE BASED INDICES SHOW STABLE)
APPROACHES...SO ADDED A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS TO ALL BUT NE TN AND 
SW VA. NEAR 100 PERCENT POPS LOOKS GOOD FOR TODAY...AND KEPT POPS 
TONIGHT IN LINE WITH A MOS BLEND AND PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS.

MAX TEMPS TRICKY TODAY GIVEN VERY MILD CURRENT TEMPS...BUT GENERALLY 
WENT CLOSE TO WARMER GFS MAXES OR A LITTLE ABOVE FOR NE AREAS WHERE
LESS RAIN OCCURS THIS MORNING. JUST SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO MIN TEMP 
GRID FOR TONIGHT...WITH ALL MOS NUMBERS QUITE CLOSE. 


.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

425 AM EST MON NOV 26 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER NW MS AND 
SW TN (SURFACE) AND ERN OK/WRN AR (ALOFT) WAS MOVING NE THIS MORNING
...GENERALLY AS MODELS INDICATED. LEADING EDGE OF RAIN AND SHOWERS 
HAS SPREAD INTO ALL BUT FAR NE TN AND EXTREME SW VA. AREA VAD WIND 
PROFILES SHOW MORE OF A S-SW FLOW ABOVE THE SURFACE...SO NOT A 
PROMINENT AMOUNT OF DOWNSLOPING SUGGESTED (ALTHO TRI HAS LIGHT SE 
SFC WIND AND WARMED UP TO 61 DEGS).  WIND PROFILES ALSO SHOW WIND 
SPEEDS A LITTLE LOWER THAN GFS OR NAM-WRF PROGD SPEEDS FOR LOW LEVEL 
JET THIS MORNING...AND ONLY A COUPLE OF SURFACE LOCATIONS CURRENTLY 
SHOW GUSTS OF ANY CONCERN. THUS...KEPT WIND SPEEDS AND GUSTS JUST 
BELOW LAKE WIND OR WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

LIFT AND UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE INCREASE FROM 12Z TO 18Z TODAY...AND

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHOWERS MOVE OUT OF THE NE
TN MOUNTAINS TUESDAY MORNING AS WRAP AROUND MOISTURE BEHIND COLD
FRONT MOVES OUT OF THE AREA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL TAKE CONTROL
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH COOLER NIGHTS AND MILD DAYS. A WEAK
SYSTEM THURSDAY WILL BRING ONLY A BRIEF CHANCE OF RAIN. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL RESUME FRIDAY AND REMOVED RAIN CHANCES SATURDAY AS
HIGH PRESSURE HANGS ON ANOTHER DAY. NEXT SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM BEGINS TO
AFFECT THE TN VALLEY SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY AS STRONG SYSTEM
DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES AND THEN MOVES IN TO THE PLAINS
STATES SUNDAY. MOST OF THE RAIN MOVES NORTH OF THE AREA SUNDAY SO
WILL ONLY HAVE LOW CHANCES SUNDAY. FOLLOWED A NAM/GFS BLEND FOR
TEMPERATURES TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 PM EST SUN NOV 25 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...WARM FRONT WILL MOVE 
NORTH THROUGH MRX CWA AS SURFACE LOW PRESSURE MOVES NE TO WEST
MIDDLE TN. ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE AREA SHOULD RESULT IN LIGHT PCPN 
OVERNIGHT. PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL TIGHTEN OVERNIGHT BETWEEN RIDGING 
TO THE EAST AND NEARING LOW. WINDS ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL 
INCREASE BY EARLY MONDAY. DOWNSLOPING EFFECTS WILL MATERIALIZE 
ACROSS NE TN VLYS REDUCING CLOUDS...PCPN SOMEWHAT AND RESULT IN 
HIGHER TEMPS THOSE AREAS ON MONDAY. LOW MOVES TO SW OH BY MON AFTN 
RESULTING IN A MORE UP VALLEY SW FLOW AND BETTER CHANCE FOR DEEPER 
CONVECTION. WEAK FRONT AND LAYER DRYING MOVES THROUGH MON EVENING
AND PCPN CHC WILL TAPER OFF. A SECONDARY FRONT AND ADDITIONAL DRYING 
WILL MOVE THROUGH EARLY TUE.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE PUSHES IN ON 
WEDNESDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR EARLY IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD. A 
WEAK FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA ON THURSDAY WITH LIMITED MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE.  WILL KEEP 20-30 POPS FOR THURSDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES 
IN THE NORTH AND MOUNTAINS.  THICKNESSES INDICATE WINTERY 
PRECIPITATION WILL BE POSSIBLE THURSDAY MORNING ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS.  FRONT TRACKS EAST OF THE AREA ON THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT 
WITH SOME MOISTURE LINGERING BEHIND THE FRONT ALONG WITH SOME 
UPSLOPE FLOW...WILL KEEP 20 POPS IN FOR OUR NORTHERN AREAS AND THE 
MOUNTAINS.  THICKNESSES INDICATE WINTERY PRECIPITATION IS POSSIBLE 
ON THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS ARE NOT 
EXPECTED.  HIGH PRESSURE PUSHES IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY.  
A SHORTWAVE APPROACHES THE AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  BEST 
MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...BUT WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  THICKNESSES AND TEMPERATURES INDICATED 
PRECIPITATION TYPE WILL BE ALL RAIN ON BOTH FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT.  A FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY WITH 
SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT TO ADD LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY.  
STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 251615
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST SUN NOV 25 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ISENTROPIC LIFT OCCURRING THIS 
MORNING AND SOME VERY LIGHT PRECIPITATION HAS BEEN DEVELOPING. 
HOWEVER...AIRMASS REMAINS RATHER DRY OVER NE TN AND SWRN VA WHERE 
DEW POINT TEMPS REMAIN IN THE 20S. KMRX AND KHTX WIND PROFILES DONT 
SHOW MUCH IN THE WAY OF DOWNSLOPING LOW LEVEL WINDS...BUT GIVEN LOW 
DEW POINTS AND LACK OF SIGNIFICANT ECHOES OVER SW VA AND NE 
TN...CONTINUED TO UNDERCUT MOS POPS FOR TODAY IN THOSE AREAS.

OTHERWISE...SLIGHTLY ADJUSTED MOS POPS FOR TODAY IN SOME AREAS TO 
BETTER MESH WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES. RAISED POPS SLIGHTLY TONIGHT 
IN MOST AREAS...GIVEN CATEGORICAL MOS POPS AND GOOD POSSIBILITY OF 
ALL AREAS MEASURING AT LEAST A FEW HUNDRETHS RAINFALL LATE TONIGHT.
PRECIPITATION TYPE TODAY LOOKS TO BE STRATIFORM SO CHANGED TYPE TO 
RAIN VERSUSES SHOWERS. WARM FRONT WELL TO OUR SOUTH CURRENTLY...
WILL LIFT NORTH TO NEAR THE TN-AL-GA LINE BY 12Z MONDAY. SOME 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY DOES APPROACH WESTERN AND SOUTHERN COUNTIES 
TOWARD DAYBREAK...BUT FOR NOW KEPT TYPE AS SHOWERS TONIGHT WITH NO 
MENTION OF THUNDER.

FOR TEMPS...OPTED FOR MORE OF A BLEND ON MAX TEMPS TODAY SINCE RAIN 
IS NOT LIKELY TO BE SOLID OR CONTINUOUS...WITH GFS MOS THE COOLEST 
OF THE AVAILABLE CHOICES. FOR TONIGHT...CLOUDS AND SOUTHERLY FLOW 
WOULD FAVOR MILDER MINS THAN GFS SUGGESTS...SO AGAIN WENT FOR A 
BLEND. 

LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A STRONG UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY TO THE OHIO VALLEY ON 
MONDAY. STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER JET AROUND 50 KNOTS WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A WIND ADVISORY WILL 
LIKELY BE REQUIRED FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS MONDAY. THE STRONGEST 
UPPER DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH JET DYNAMICS AND QG-FORCING WILL BE 
NORTH AND WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...STRONG LOW LEVEL 
FORCING ALONG AND AHEAD OF FRONT MONDAY AS WELL AS DECENT UPPER 
DIFLUENCE OVER THE SOUTHEAST WILL PRODUCE A LINE OF SHOWERS 
AREA-WIDE. MOST LOCATIONS WILL SEE ONE-HALF INCH OR RAINFALL...BUT 
LOCALIZED AREAS OF 1 INCH+ ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS.

DO NOT EXPECT THUNDER MONDAY SINCE INSTABILITY REMAINS WELL SOUTH
OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

FOR MONDAY NIGHT-EARLY TUESDAY MORNING...WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE AND
NORTHWEST UPSLOPE FLOW WILL PRODUCE LIGHT PRECIPITATION...
ESPECIALLY NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES.

FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...WEAK RIDGE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL
PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS AND MILD AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES. FOR
THURSDAY...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA BUT MOISTURE
AND LIFT LIMITED...SO MINIMAL POPS. FOR FRIDAY...SURFACE RIDGING
RETURNS.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 AM EST SUN NOV 25 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ISENTROPIC LIFT OCCURRING THIS 
MORNING AND SOME VERY LIGHT PRECIPITATION HAS BEEN DEVELOPING. 
HOWEVER...AIRMASS REMAINS RATHER DRY OVER NE TN AND SWRN VA WHERE 
DEW POINT TEMPS REMAIN IN THE 20S. KMRX AND KHTX WIND PROFILES DONT 
SHOW MUCH IN THE WAY OF DOWNSLOPING LOW LEVEL WINDS...BUT GIVEN LOW 
DEW POINTS AND LACK OF SIGNIFICANT ECHOES OVER SW VA AND NE 
TN...CONTINUED TO UNDERCUT MOS POPS FOR TODAY IN THOSE AREAS.

OTHERWISE...SLIGHTLY ADJUSTED MOS POPS FOR TODAY IN SOME AREAS TO 
BETTER MESH WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES. RAISED POPS SLIGHTLY TONIGHT 
IN MOST AREAS...GIVEN CATEGORICAL MOS POPS AND GOOD POSSIBILITY OF 
ALL AREAS MEASURING AT LEAST A FEW HUNDRETHS RAINFALL LATE TONIGHT.
PRECIPITATION TYPE TODAY LOOKS TO BE STRATIFORM SO CHANGED TYPE TO 
RAIN VERSUSES SHOWERS. WARM FRONT WELL TO OUR SOUTH CURRENTLY...
WILL LIFT NORTH TO NEAR THE TN-AL-GA LINE BY 12Z MONDAY. SOME 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY DOES APPROACH WESTERN AND SOUTHERN COUNTIES 
TOWARD DAYBREAK...BUT FOR NOW KEPT TYPE AS SHOWERS TONIGHT WITH NO 
MENTION OF THUNDER.

FOR TEMPS...OPTED FOR MORE OF A BLEND ON MAX TEMPS TODAY SINCE RAIN 
IS NOT LIKELY TO BE SOLID OR CONTINUOUS...WITH GFS MOS THE COOLEST 
OF THE AVAILABLE CHOICES. FOR TONIGHT...CLOUDS AND SOUTHERLY FLOW 
WOULD FAVOR MILDER MINS THAN GFS SUGGESTS...SO AGAIN WENT FOR A 
BLEND. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A STRONG UPPER LEVEL TROUGH
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY TO THE OHIO VALLEY ON MONDAY.
STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER JET AROUND 50 KNOTS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A WIND ADVISORY WILL
LIKELY BE REQUIRED FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS MONDAY. THE STRONGEST
UPPER DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH JET DYNAMICS AND QG-FORCING WILL BE
NORTH AND WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...STRONG LOW LEVEL
FORCING ALONG AND AHEAD OF FRONT MONDAY AS WELL AS DECENT UPPER
DIFLUENCE OVER THE SOUTHEAST WILL PRODUCE A LINE OF SHOWERS AREA-
WIDE. MOST LOCATIONS WILL SEE ONE-HALF INCH OR RAINFALL...BUT
LOCALIZED AREAS OF 1 INCH+ ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS.

DO NOT EXPECT THUNDER MONDAY SINCE INSTABILITY REMAINS WELL SOUTH
OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

FOR MONDAY NIGHT-EARLY TUESDAY MORNING...WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE AND
NORTHWEST UPSLOPE FLOW WILL PRODUCE LIGHT PRECIPITATION...
ESPECIALLY NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES.

FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...WEAK RIDGE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL

FXUS64 KMRX 242046
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST SAT NOV 24 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES TO MOVE EAST WHILE WEAK INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH DEVELOPS
TO THE SW. CONTRAILS EVIDENT OVERHEAD AS HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE 
BEGINNING TO MOVE NE INTO THE AREA. HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL 
INCREASE OVERNIGHT. LOW LEVEL WILL REMAIN FAIRLY DRY BUT SOME LIGHT 
RAIN WILL BEGIN TO BLEED INTO THE AIRMASS AFFECTING SOUTHERN AREAS. 
WARM AIR ADVECTION ALOFT SHOULD OFFSET EVAPORATIVE COOLING AND MINS 
WILL BE ABOVE FREEZING MOST AREAS THAT GET PCPN. SOME VERY LIGHT 
SNOW BRIEFLY POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. ELEVATED WARM FRONT 
CONTINUES ON SUNDAY AS ISENTROPIC LIFT LOWERS IN HEIGHT. PCPN CHC 
INCREASES AS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES NE INTO WEST TN BY EARLY 
MONDAY. 850MB SOUTHERLY WINDS PROGGED TO INCREASE TO 40-55 KTS ON 
MON AS WARM FRONT MOVES N THROUGH AREA. WIND ADVISORIES OR WIND 
WARNINGS MAY BE REQUIRED. DEEP CONVECTION LIKELY S OF THE AREA BUT 
MAY ADVANCE FAR ENOUGH NE TO AFFECT MRX CWA. DRY SLOT PUSHES MON NGT 
IN ADVANCE OF COLD FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS TRACK UPPER LOW TO 
THE NORTHEAST OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  WITH STILL SOME LINGERING 
MOISTURE IN THE NORTH...WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR THE MORNING HOURS IN 
THE NORTH AND DRY ELSEWHERE.  HIGH PRESSURE PUSHES IN TUESDAY NIGHT 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY.  A FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY WITH SOME MOISTURE STILL AVAILABLE.  WILL 
KEEP 20-30 POPS FOR THURSDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH AND 
MOUNTAINS.  THICKNESSES ALSO INDICATE WINTERY PRECIPITATION WILL BE 
POSSIBLE THURSDAY MORNING ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  FRONT 
TRACKS EAST OF THE AREA ON THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT WITH SOME MOISTURE 
LINGERING BEHIND THE FRONT ALONG WITH SOME UPSLOPE FLOW...WILL KEEP 
20-30 POPS IN FOR OUR NORTHERN AREAS ALONG WITH THE MOUNTAINS.  
THICKNESSES INDICATE WINTERY PRECIPITATION IS AGAIN POSSIBLE...BUT 
SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS ARE NOT EXPECTED.  HIGH PRESSURE 
PUSHES IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY.  ANOTHER FRONT TRACKS IN 
ON SATURDAY ALONG WITH ADEQUATE MOISTURE AND LIFT TO ADD LOW CHANCE 
POPS FOR SATURDAY.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 241602
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST SAT NOV 24 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FORECAST AREA DOMINATED BY SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE AND RIDGING ALOFT THIS MORNING...RESULTING IN 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND SEASONABLY COOL TEMPERATURES.

SHORT RANGE MODELS AND ENSEMBLES SEEM IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF SW UPPER LOW...WHICH MOVES INTO SOUTHERN PLAINS BY 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MUCH OF SE STATES FALL UNDER A WARM 
AIR ADVECTION PATTERN WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT SPREADING SOME LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION INTO THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY AND APPALACHIANS BY 12Z 
SUNDAY. THINK THAT THIS INITIAL WAVE OF MOISTURE WILL TAKE A BIT TO 
REACH THE SURFACE...WITH ANY MEASURABLE RAIN UNLIKELY OVER SWRN VA 
THROUGH 12Z SUNDAY. DID SLIGHTLY RAISE POPS FOR POSSIBILITY OF ONE 
OR TWO HUNDRETHS RAINFALL...AND TO BETTER MESH WITH NEIGHBORING 
OFFICES TO OUR WEST...SOUTH AND EAST.

OTHERWISE...TRENDED QUITE CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY
AND AGAIN TONIGHT. POPS CHOSEN FOR TONIGHT WERE MORE OF A BLEND 
RATHER THAN HIGHEST VALUES FROM GFS MOS...GIVEN INITIALLY DRY 
AIRMASS.  

LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN SYSTEM DURING THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD IS A DEVELOPING CYCLOGENSIS OFF THE TEXAS COAST SUNDAY. GFS 
AND ECMWF ARE IN FAIRLY CLOSE AGREEMENT IN PULLING MOISTURE NORTH 
INTO THE AREA FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT DEVELOPING 
LIGHT RAINFALL MOST LOCATIONS BY SUNDAY MORNING. QG FORCING...JET 
DYNAMICS...AND CONTINUED ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL PRODUCE PERIODS OF 
RAIN SUNDAY NIGHT. FOR MONDAY...UPPER TROUGH PASSES NORTHWEST OF THE 
AREA WITH FROPA DURING THE DAY. A SOLID LINE OF SHOWERS WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT. AN ABRUPT END TO 
THE RAIN IS ANTICIPATED AS A DRY SLOT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION MONDAY 
AFTERNOON.

BESIDES RAINFALL...50 KNOT BOUNDARY LAYER JET FOR MONDAY WILL
PRODUCE WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MOUNTAINS. A WIND ADVISORY WILL
LIKELY BE NEEDED FOR MONDAY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY...WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE AND
BOUNDARY LAYER NORTHWEST FLOW WILL PRODUCE SOME LIGHT
PRECIPITATION...ESPECIALLY FOR NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES.

ANOTHER WEAK RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR LATE TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY. ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION BY
THURSDAY. CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON TIMING OF FRONT AND AMOUNT OF
PRECIPITATION ALONG AND BEHIND FROPA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             52  39  51  51  64 /   0  40  60  80  90 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  36  50  49  62 /   0  30  50  70  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       50  35  51  48  65 /   0  30  50  70  90

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST FRI NOV 23 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
MOVES ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT. SKIES CLEAR AND WINDS DECOUPLE FOR A
CHILLY NIGHT AND A COOL DAY SATURDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT GETS GOING BY 
SAT NGT BRINGING MID/HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS INTO THE AREA. INVERTED 
TROUGH BUILDS NORTHWARD THROUGH THE MS RVR VLY ON SUNDAY. LIFT 
AND MOISTURE INCREASE OVER MRX CWA SUN WITH CHANCE OF RAIN. 
SOME UPSLOPE SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVER SW NC. WENT BELOW MOS GUIDANCE
AND EXPECT PCPN AMOUNTS TO BE LIGHT. LOW PRESSURE DEEPENS AND MOVES 
NNE TO W TN SUN NGT. WARM FRONT WILL MOVE N THROUGH THE AREA BY SUN 
NGT WITH INCREASES CHC OF RAIN.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS INDICATING A COLD FRONT 
MOVING INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY...WITH AMPLE MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH 
IT.  WILL BUMP UP POPS TO 70 PERCENT FOR MONDAY.  A 40-60KT 850MB 
JET ACCOMPANIES TO FRONT...BRINGING BREEZY CONDITIONS FOR MONDAY AS 
WELL.  FRONT SHOULD BE EAST OF THE REGION BY MONDAY NIGHT...BUT 
UPPER LOW TRACKS TO THE NORTH WITH STILL LINGER MOISTURE AVAILABLE.  
WILL KEEP 20-40 POPS ON MONDAY NIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE 
NORTH NEARER THE UPPER LOW.  LOW LEVEL TEMPERATURES AND THICKNESSES 
INDICATE THAT IT SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION 
ON MONDAY NIGHT. UPPER LOW TRACKS NORTHEAST OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  
WITH STILL SOME LINGERING MOISTURE IN THE NORTH...WILL KEEP 20 POPS 
FOR THE MORNING HOURS IN THE NORTH AND DRY ELSEWHERE.  HIGH PRESSURE 
PUSHES IN TUESDAY NIGHT BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY.  ANOTHER 
FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA ON THURSDAY WITH DECENT MOISTURE SUPPORT.  
WILL KEEP 30-40 POPS FOR THURSDAY.  FRONT TRACKS SOUTH OF THE AREA 
ON THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT WITH SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP 
20 POPS GOING FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 231553
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST FRI NOV 23 2007

.DISCUSSION...CLOUDS THAT HELD TEMPS UP A COUPLE OF DEGREES HANGING 
IN THIS MORNING BUT SHOULD DECREASE SOME THIS AFTN. ADJUSTED SKY 
COVER TO INCREASE COVERAGE N AND ELEVATED AREAS THIS AFTN. A FEW 
FLURRIES POSSIBLE BUT TOO LOW FOR MENTION IN FORECAST. DECREASED 
CLOUD COVERAGE SOME IN THE SOUTH. LOWERED MAX TEMPS A COUPLE OF 
DEGREES SOUTHERN 2/3RDS FOLLOWING CURRENT TREND AND LATEST LAV MOS. 
SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT WITH NORTHERLY 
LOW LEVEL FLOW BRINGING MOISTURE AND COLD AIR ADVECTION THIS 
MORNING. VARYING AMOUNTS OF LOW CLOUDINESS CONTINUE FROM OHIO VALLEY 
SOUTHWARD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS...WHICH HAS 
OFFSET THE COLD AIR ADVECTION AND HELD MIN TEMPS UP THUS FAR.

THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MIXES OUT THIS AFTERNOON AND UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
BECOMES ANTICYCLONIC BY EVENING...BUT SCATTERED CLOUDS MAY LINGER AT 
LEAST ACROSS SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN. OPTED FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY JUST 
BELOW THE WARMER GFS NUMBERS.

SKIES BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT AND NORTHERLY SURFACE WINDS 
DIMINISH...SO I TRENDED JUST BELOW THE NOT AS COLD GFS MOS MINS 
WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS SATURDAY AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT PRODUCING DRY CONDITIONS. BY SUNDAY...SURFACE RIDGE 
WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA WITH A DEVELOPING CYCLOGENESIS OFF THE 
TEXAS COASTS IN REPONSE TO AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS NORTHERN 
MEXICO-TEXAS. IN RESPONSE...BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS WILL BECOME 
SOUTHERLY WITH INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT SPREADING ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY.

FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...INVERTED UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE
RAPIDLY NORTHEAST TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES. MODELS
SHOW ENOUGH WEDGING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS TO KEEP WARM FRONT
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA...THUS INSTABILITY IS LIMITED. WILL
INCREASE SHOWERS CHANCES FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...BUT GFS AND ECMWF
DRY SLOT MOVING OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON WHICH
WILL LIKELY DIMINISH RAIN CHANCES. SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE MOVES
OVER THE NORTHERN AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY.
OVERALL...RAIN FROM SYSTEM WILL BE ONE-QUARTER TO ONE-HALF INCH AT BEST.

FOR LATE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL
PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS AND NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES. NEXT UPPER
TROUGH MOVES TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND
THURSDAY.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 230818
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 AM EST FRI NOV 23 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT WITH NORTHERLY 
LOW LEVEL FLOW BRINGING MOISTURE AND COLD AIR ADVECTION THIS MORNING.
VARYING AMOUNTS OF LOW CLOUDINESS CONTINUE FROM OHIO VALLEY 
SOUTHWARD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS...WHICH HAS 
OFFSET THE COLD AIR ADVECTION AND HELD MIN TEMPS UP THUS FAR.

THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MIXES OUT THIS AFTERNOON AND UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
BECOMES ANTICYCLONIC BY EVENING...BUT SCATTERED CLOUDS MAY LINGER AT 
LEAST ACROSS SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN. OPTED FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY JUST 
BELOW THE WARMER GFS NUMBERS.

SKIES BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT AND NORTHERLY SURFACE WINDS 
DIMINISH...SO I TRENDED JUST BELOW THE NOT AS COLD GFS MOS MINS 
WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS SATURDAY AND
SATURDAY NIGHT PRODUCING DRY CONDITIONS. BY SUNDAY...SURFACE RIDGE
WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA WITH A DEVELOPING CYCLOGENESIS OFF THE
TEXAS COASTS IN REPONSE TO AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS NORTHERN MEXICO-
TEXAS. IN RESPONSE...BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS WILL BECOME SOUTHERLY
WITH INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT SPREADING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY.

FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...INVERTED UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE
RAPIDLY NORTHEAST TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES. MODELS
SHOW ENOUGH WEDGING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS TO KEEP WARM FRONT
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA...THUS INSTABILITY IS LIMITED. WILL
INCREASE SHOWERS CHANCES FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...BUT GFS AND ECMWF
DRY SLOT MOVING OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON WHICH
WILL LIKELY DIMINISH RAIN CHANCES. SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE MOVES
OVER THE NORTHERN AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY.
OVERALL...RAIN FROM SYSTEM WILL BE ONE-QUARTER TO ONE-HALF INCH AT BEST.

FOR LATE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL
PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS AND NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES. NEXT UPPER
TROUGH MOVES TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND
THURSDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  30  53  41  55 /   0   0  10  40  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  27  50  37  52 /   0   0  10  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  28  52  38  50 /   0   0  10  30  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              43  21  50  30  49 /  10   0  10  10  20

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 PM EST THU NOV 22 2007

.DISCUSSION...NO CHANGES. MAIN ISSUE FOR UPDATE IS CLOUD COVER.
TEMPS ALSO SOMEWHAT DEPENDENT ON DEGREE OF CLOUD COVER. IR SATELLITE
IMAGES SHOW A BROKEN CLOUD DECK UPSTREAM BUT SOME BREAKS IN
OVERCAST HAVE OPENED OVER THE CENTRAL VALLEY LOCATIONS IN OUR FORECAST
AREA. NEVERTHELESS...AM RELUCTANT TO MAKE ANY CHANGES TO SKY COVER
AS MODELS STILL PROJECT AT LEAST BROKEN CLOUDS OVERNIGHT. THUS
WILL MAKE NO CHANGES AT THIS TIME.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 222007
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST THU NOV 22 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...GOOD POST-FRONTAL 
COLD AIR ADVECTION UNDERWAY THIS AFTERNOON. FORECAST SOUNDINGS AND 
PIREPS INDICATE SUPER COOLED WATER IN 3000-6000 FT LAYER RESULTING 
IN SOME ICING. ICING IS ALSO LIKELY OCCURRING ON SOME TREE LIMBS IN 
THE SMOKIES. LIGHT DRIZZLE REMAINS POSSIBLE THIS EVENING MAINLY 
ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SHALLOW MOISTURE 
TRAJECTORY LOOKS TO KEEP CLOUD COVER PRETTY SOLID OVERNIGHT. 
ANTICYCLONIC CURVATURE OF THE FLOW AND NORTHERLY DIRECTION NOT 
FAVORABLE FOR MUCH UPSLOPE SNOW TONIGHT. COOL AND DRY CONDITIONS 
CONTINUE THROUGH SAT AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES EAST ACROSS THE 
AREA. SAT NIGHT ISENTROPIC LIFT BRINGS CLOUDS AND INCREASING CHANCE 
FOR LIGHT PCPN. GFS APPEARS TOO FAST SO WENT CLOSER TO NAM AND NCEP 
SOLUTION.    

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS INDICATING A 
DISTURBANCE PUSHING UP FROM THE SOUTH ON SUNDAY WITH DECENT MOISTURE 
AND LIFT.  WILL KEEP 30-50 POPS FOR SUNDAY WITH THE BEST POPS IN THE 
SOUTH WHERE THE DEEPEST MOISTURE RESIDES.  A COLD FRONT FOLLOWS ON 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  MODELS BRINGING AMPLE MOISTURE AND LIFT 
WITH IT.  WILL KEEP 50-60 POPS ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND 60 POPS FOR 
MONDAY.  TEMPERATURES AND THICKNESSES INDICATE THAT IT SHOULD BE 
WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION ON SUNDAY NIGHT.  FRONT 
SHOULD BE EAST OF THE REGION BY MONDAY NIGHT...BUT UPPER LOW TRACKS 
TO THE NORTH WITH STILL LINGER MOISTURE AVAILABLE.  WILL KEEP 30-50 
POPS ON MONDAY NIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH NEARER THE 
UPPER LOW.  UPPER LOW TRACKS NORTHEAST OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  WITH 
STILL SOME LINGERING MOISTURE IN THE NORTH...WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR 
THE MORNING HOURS IN THE NORTH AND DRY ELSEWHERE.  HIGH PRESSURE 
PUSHES IN TUESDAY NIGHT BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             36  50  30  52  38 /  10   0   0  10  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  34  46  28  49  35 /  10   0   0  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       33  45  27  50  34 /  10   0   0  10  10


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 221553
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 AM EST THU NOV 22 2007

.DISCUSSION...COLD AIR BUILDING IN BEHIND EXITING FRONT. LOWERED 
POPS FOR THIS AFTN AS MOST PCPN IS DRIZZLE. ANY ADDITIONAL AMOUNTS 
WILL BE LIGHT. AIRCRAFT AND FCST SOUNDINGS DEPICT WARM LAYER AROUND 
700 MB SO MIXED SNOW NOT MUCH OF A THREAT HOWEVER SOME ICING 
POSSIBLE AROUND 3500 FEET WHERE FREEZING LAYER RESIDES. SON 
 
PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT IS PASSING THROUGH THE MRX CWA EARLY THIS 
MORNING.  MAIN LINE OF CONVECTION WILL EXIT THE AREA DURING THE 
MORNING HOURS AS THE COLD FRONT TRACKS THROUGH.  BEHIND THE 
FRONT...FLOW WILL BE A BIT TOO NORTHERLY FOR PRIME UPSLOPE PRECIP 
BUT SHOULD STILL SEE SOME LINGERING SHOWERS OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
INTO TONIGHT.  WITH A GOOD PUSH OF COOLER AIR MOVING 
IN...TEMPERATURES WILL DROP SUFFICIENTLY FOR THE LIGHT RAIN TO TURN 
TO LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES.  MOST FAVORED LOCATIONS COULD SEE A 
DUSTING OF SNOW ON GRASSY AREAS...THOUGH A WARM GROUND MAY LIMIT 
THIS.  A FEW ISOLATED LOCATIONS MAY SEE A COUPLE TENTHS OF AN INCH 
OF SNOW.  OF ADDITIONAL CONCERN WILL BE INCREASING WINDS WITH AND 
BEHIND THE FRONT.  BREEZY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE 
DAY...SLOWLY TAPERING OFF DURING THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT.  WITH 
THE STRONG COLD ADVECTION... TEMPERATURES WILL STRUGGLE TO RISE MUCH 
DURING THE DAY TODAY AND OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL FALL INTO THE 30S 
ACROSS MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD ADVECTION WEAKENS ON 
FRIDAY...SO SHOULD SEE DECREASE IN CLOUDS.  MODELS IN A LITTLE 
BETTER AGREEMENT FOR WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK THAN THEY WERE 
THIS TIME LAST NIGHT...BUT STILL SIGNIFICANT UNCERTAINTY IN THE 
DETAILS.  WILL CONTINUE TO TREND TOWARD A GFS AND GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN 
SOLUTION.  LOOKS LIKE SOUTHERN STREAM ENERGY WILL STAY MORE 
SUPPRESSED TO THE SOUTH EARLY ON...SO WILL REMOVE POPS FOR 
SATURDAY...LOWER POPS SAT NIGHT EXCEPT REMOVE FROM NORTHERN 
ZONES...AND LOWER POPS A BIT ON SUNDAY AS WELL.  MAIN EVENT LOOKS 
LIKE IT WILL BE IN THE LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY NIGHT TIME 
FRAME.  WILL HAVE HIGHEST POPS ON MONDAY...WHEN WILL GO LIKELY ALL 
ZONES.  NOT A LOT OF COLD AIR BEHIND THE FRONT FOR TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY...SO AFTER ANY LINGERING SHOWERS EXIT EARLY TUESDAY SHOULD 
BE DRY AND FAIRLY MILD. 


&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 220205
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EST WED NOV 21 2007

.DISCUSSION...STRONG COLD FRONT THAT EXTENDS FROM EVANSVILLE INDIANA 
TO JACKSON TENNESSEE TO MONROE LOUISIANA AT THIS TIME WILL MOVE 
FAIRLY RAPIDLY ACROSS TENNESSEE TONIGHT BRINGING THUNDERSTORMS AND 
RAINSHOWERS TO THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT.  CURRENT FORECAST 
TIMING OF THE THUNDERSTORMS REACHING EAST TENNESSEE 2-4 AM AND 
EXITING THE AREA SOMETIME TOMORROW MORNING APPEARS RIGHT ON TRACK.  
TEMPERATURES WILL BE TRICKY AS THEY WILL LIKELY STAY SOMEWHERE 
GENERALLY IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOW 60S FOR MUCH OF THE NIGHT...THEN 
FALL RAPIDLY WHEN THE FRONT PASSES...SO THE EXACT TIMING OF THE 
FRONT PASSING WILL BE CRITICAL ON HOW FAR THEY DROP FOR LOWS 
TONIGHT.  AGAIN FEEL THE CURRENT FORECAST HAS AS GOOD A HANDLE ON 
THE MOST LIKELY LOWS AS POSSIBLE.  THANKSGIVING WILL BE A COOL AND 
WINDY DAY WITH TEMPERATURES SEEING LITTLE RISE AND POSSIBLY EVEN 
FALLING DURING THE DAY.

ALL THIS TO SAY...NO CHANGES PLANNED TO CURRENT PACKAGE AT THIS TIME.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...STRONG 
COLD FRONT NORTH AND WEST OF THE OHIO AND MISSISSIPPI RIVERS THIS 
AFTERNOON. SHORT WAVE MOVING NORTHEAST THROUGH MID TN THIS AFTN 
AIDING IN THE STRENGTH AND COVERAGE OF CONVECTION FROM N AL NORTH 
INTO KY. EXPECT THIS ACTIVITY TO WEAKEN SOME AS IT MOVES EAST INTO 
MRX CWA THIS EVENING AS SHORT WAVE MOVES AWAY FROM AREA. UPPER JET 
STRENGTHENS OVERNIGHT AND THU CARVING TROUGH OVER GRTLKS. SURFACE 
LOW PRESSURE DEEPENS OVER OH RVR VLY TONIGHT AND MOVES NE ON THU. 
STRONG COLD FRONT MOVES SE INTO S APPALACHIANS EARLY THU. INCREASING 
WAA IN ADVANCE OF FRONT WITH GOOD LAYER SHEAR SHOULD RESULT IN 
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND SCT TSTMS. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD TAPER OFF 
EARLY THU.  TEMPS WILL BE WARM OVERNIGHT...NEARLY STEADY EARLY THU 
THEN FALLING THU AFTN. BREEZY SW WINDS IN THE MNTS TONIGHT WITH 
BREEZY POST FRONTAL NW WINDS AREAWIDE ON THU. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SOMEWHAT MORE 
ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN SETTING UP AS A SERIES OF SOUTHERN STREAM 
SYSTEMS APPROACHES THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. INITIAL SYSTEM 
WILL APPROACH BY LATE SATURDAY...BUT ITS MAIN EFFECTS ARE PROJECTED 
TO STAY GENERALLY SOUTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA. NEVERTHELESS... 
MAINTAINED LIKELY POPS IN THE SOUTHERN TIER AND CHANCE POPS 
ELSEWHERE FOR THIS EVENT. A MORE SIGNIFICANT SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM 
WILL APPROACH IN THE LATE SUNDAY/EARLY MONDAY TIME FRAME. HOWEVER... 
PROFOUND TIMING DIFFERENCES AMONG MEDIUM RANGE MODELS CAST QUITE OF 
BIT OF UNCERTAINTY ON THE ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE OF THIS EVENT. THUS 
HAVE NOT MADE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST. TEMPS 
ARE PROJECTED TO MODERATE FROM BELOW CLIMO EARLY IN THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD TO ABOVE CLIMO BY LATE IN THE PERIOD.
  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  56  37  52  32 / 100  50  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  55  35  48  30 / 100  60  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       51  54  35  50  29 / 100  60  10  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  53  31  46  24 / 100  80  10  10  10



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 211447
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 AM EST WED NOV 21 2007

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TODAY TO DROP POPS ACROSS NE AREAS FOR 
TODAY. OTHERWISE...WARM DAY ON TRACK WITH PCPN ADVANCING EAST INTO 
AREA LATER THIS AFTN. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS SHOWING REASONABLE 
CONSISTENCY IN THE SHORT TERM WITH THE APPROACH OF A SIGNIFICANT 
COLD FRONT.  BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON...GULF MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO 
REACH INTO THE REGION AS A SHORT WAVE MOVES IN AHEAD OF THE 
APPROACHING FRONT.  COULD SEE SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOP WITH 
THIS FEATURE LATE IN THE DAY THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS.  
HOWEVER...THE MAIN PRECIP WILL BE A DEVELOPED LINE OF CONVECTION 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLD FRONT.  THIS SHOULD PUSH THROUGH THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT.  MODELS TRENDING TOWARD GREATER STABILITY...DIMINISHING 
THE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE STORMS...HOWEVER...MODELS DO CONTINUE TO 
INDICATE SOME WIND SHEAR.  WILL KEEP CATEGORICAL POPS IN THE 
FORECAST.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL EXIT THE 
AREA ON THURSDAY...WITH MUCH COLDER AIR PUSHING IN. WILL CARRY HIGH 
CHANCE TO LOW CAT POPS EARLY...THEN TAPER OFF. PROSPECTS FOR 
SHOWERS/SNOW SHOWERS IN THE COLD ADVECTION AND UPSLOPE FLOW DO NOT 
LOOK IMPRESSIVE...WITH MOISTURE NOT THAT DEEP AND LOW LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES NOT ALL THAT STEEP. HOWEVER...WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW 
CHANCE POPS IN NORTH AND MOUNTAINS THU NIGHT...AND LINGER SLIGHT 
CHANCE INTO EARLY FRI FOR SOME OF HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SHOULD BE DRY 
FRI NIGHT...THEN A LOT OF UNCERTAINTY IN THE DETAILS FURTHER OUT. 
CONFIDENCE HIGH THAT WE WILL SEE SOME RAIN IN THE SATURDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY TIME FRAME...BUT TIMING WHEN MAJORITY OF RAIN WILL FALL 
DIFFICULT GIVEN LACK OF MODEL AGREEMENT. FOR NOW WILL TREND TOWARD 
GFS AND GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN SOLUTION. WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW 
CHANCE POPS MOST ZONES SATURDAY...THEN POPS GENERALLY IN THE 40 TO 
60 RANGE FOR SAT NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. WILL KEEP TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  71  54  54  36  49 /  50 100  40  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  70  52  53  36  46 /  30 100  50  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  71  52  52  35  46 /  40 100  50  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  69  50  54  33  44 /  10  80  70  20  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 AM EST WED NOV 21 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS SHOWING REASONABLE 
CONSISTENCY IN THE SHORT TERM WITH THE APPROACH OF A SIGNIFICANT 
COLD FRONT.  BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON...GULF MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO 
REACH INTO THE REGION AS A SHORT WAVE MOVES IN AHEAD OF THE 
APPROACHING FRONT.  COULD SEE SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOP WITH 
THIS FEATURE LATE IN THE DAY THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS.  HOWEVER...THE 
MAIN PRECIP WILL BE A DEVELOPED LINE OF CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE COLD FRONT.  THIS SHOULD PUSH THROUGH THE AREA OVERNIGHT.  
MODELS TRENDING TOWARD GREATER STABILITY...DIMINISHING THE POTENTIAL 
FOR SEVERE STORMS...HOWEVER...MODELS DO CONTINUE TO INDICATE SOME 
WIND SHEAR.  WILL KEEP CATEGORICAL POPS IN THE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL EXIT THE
AREA ON THURSDAY...WITH MUCH COLDER AIR PUSHING IN. WILL CARRY HIGH
CHANCE TO LOW CAT POPS EARLY...THEN TAPER OFF. PROSPECTS FOR
SHOWERS/SNOW SHOWERS IN THE COLD ADVECTION AND UPSLOPE FLOW DO NOT
LOOK IMPRESSIVE...WITH MOISTURE NOT THAT DEEP AND LOW LEVEL LAPSE
RATES NOT ALL THAT STEEP. HOWEVER...WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW
CHANCE POPS IN NORTH AND MOUNTAINS THU NIGHT...AND LINGER SLIGHT
CHANCE INTO EARLY FRI FOR SOME OF HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SHOULD BE DRY
FRI NIGHT...THEN A LOT OF UNCERTAINTY IN THE DETAILS FURTHER OUT.
CONFIDENCE HIGH THAT WE WILL SEE SOME RAIN IN THE SATURDAY THROUGH
MONDAY TIME FRAME...BUT TIMING WHEN MAJORITY OF RAIN WILL FALL
DIFFICULT GIVEN LACK OF MODEL AGREEMENT. FOR NOW WILL TREND TOWARD
GFS AND GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN SOLUTION. WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW
CHANCE POPS MOST ZONES SATURDAY...THEN POPS GENERALLY IN THE 40 TO
60 RANGE FOR SAT NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. WILL KEEP TUESDAY DRY FOR
NOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  71  54  54  36  49 /  50 100  40  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  70  52  53  36  46 /  30 100  50  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  71  52  52  35  46 /  40 100  50  10  10

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
855 PM EST TUE NOV 20 2007

.DISCUSSION...SKIES GENERALLY CLEAR ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
EVENING...ALTHO SOME SCATTERED LOWER MID DECK CLOUDS DID BRIEFLY 
PASS ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND SKIRT THE NE PLATEAU COUNTIES.

FOG FINALLY LIFTED ALL AREAS AND ALLOWED SOME SUNSHINE TO DRY OUT 
THE BOUNDARY LAYER DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. FOR THIS REASON...
AGREE WITH DAY SHIFT THAT DENSE FOG OVERNIGHT SHOULD BE MORE OF THE 
PATCHY VARIETY. STILL LIKE THE WORDING WITH VSBY REDUCED 1/4 MILE OR 
LESS AT TIMES. TEMP AND DEW POINT SPREADS DECREASING ACROSS SW VA 
AND NE TN ALREADY...AND THESE AREAS WOULD APPEAR TO BE MORE 
FAVORABLE FOR PATCHY DENSE FOG.

OTHERWISE...FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK. WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX AND 
RE-PHRASE THE AFTER MIDNIGHT WORDING ON THE FOG...AND ALSO WILL 
FRESHEN THE HOURLY TEMPS AND DEW POINTS IN THE FORECAST GRIDS.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 202050
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 PM EST TUE NOV 20 2007

.SHORT-TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS UPPER TROUGH DIGGING EAST SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN ROCKIES TOWARD THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PLAINS/GREAT 
LAKES BY THURSDAY. GULF MOISTURE WILL STREAM NORTH AHEAD OF PRESSURE 
FALLS OVER THE MISSISSSIPPI AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF 
AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. BOTH THE GFS AND NAM DEPICT INCREASING 
ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY 00Z THURSDAY. 

ALSO...MODELS SHOW UPPER DIVERGENCE ALOFT AT 300MB ASSOCIATED WITH 
LEFT EXIT REGION OVER SOUTHERN STREAM JET AND RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION 
OF NORTHERN STREAM JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. FAIRLY DECENT UPPER 
DIVERGENCE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA EARLY WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

AT THIS TIME...INSTABILITY-BOUYANCY IS MARGINAL AT BEST WITH CAPES 
OF 500 J/KG OR LESS...HOWEVER...SHEAR WILL BE STRONG. 0-3KM SRH WILL 
BE BETWEEN 200-300M2/S2. ALSO...FAIRLY STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER JET 
BETWEEN 35-40 KTS. SPC DAY2 OUTLOOK SHOWS A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE 
STORMS FOR THE FAR WESTERN COUNTIES.

THERE ARE DIFFERENCE IN TIMING OF COLD FRONT PASSAGE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH THE GFS BEFORE 12Z AND NAM AFTER. WILL TREND 
TOWARD THE FASTER GFS SOLUTION WITH HIGHS THURSDAY OCCURING EARLY IN 
THE MORNING WITH STEADY OR FALLING TEMPERATURES DURING THE DAY.

MODELS SHOW WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE FOR NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT WITH POTENTIAL OF MIXED PRECIPITATION 
(RAIN/SNOW) FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...PERIOD STARTS OUT QUIET AS 
THANKSGIVING STORM SYSTEM CONTINUES TO MOVE AWAY.  NEXT SYSTEM 
HEADING TOWARD THE AREA WITH MODELS KIND OF ALL OVER THE PLACE WITH 
VARIED ONSETS OF PRECIPITATION IN CWA.  GFS RUSHES A SHORT WAVE EWD 
TOWARD AREA ON SATURDAY THAT WOULD POTENTIALLY CAUSE A MIX OF PRECIP 
AT SOME LOCATIONS IF IT OCCURS...BUT OTHER MODELS HOLD BACK PRECIP 
CLOSER TO MAIN SYSTEM AND LOOK MORE ORDERLY WITH THEIR TAPPING OF 
GULF MOISTURE, ETC.  SO WILL INTRODUCE SOME SLGT CHC POPS IN SWRN 
CWA FOR SATURDAY...BUT WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL SATURDAY NIGHT FOR ONSET 
IN REMAINDER OF CWA.  ONSET SHOULD HAVE TO DEAL WITH SOME 
EVAPORATION FOR A FEW HOURS...AND WITH STRONG WAA AT ALL LEVELS THIS 
THIS SIDE OF APPALACHIANS SHOULD BE MOSTLY LIQUID.  HAVE SHIFTED 
HOURLY TEMPERATURE GRIDS FOR MIN TEMP SATURDAY NIGHT NEAR MIDNIGHT 
AND STEADY TO RISING TEMPS AFTERWARDS.

DYNAMICS AND LIFT MOVE IN FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH MUCH OF 
THE AREA GETTING WET THOSE TWO PERIODS.  DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE 
PEAKING SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY WITH RIBBON OF INSTABILITY 
ROTATING NNW ON BACKING LLJ.  IF ENOUGH MOISTURE COULD SURGE 
NORTHWARD...COULD HAVE SOME WELL ORGANIZED STORMS...ALBEIT POSSIBLY 
ELEVATED.  AT THIS POINT...MAY BE RESTRICTED CLOSER TO SRN PARTS OF 
CENTRAL GULF STATES FOR ORGANIZED STORMS...BUT WILL PUT IN SLGT CHC 
OF STORMS OVER WRN AREAS SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  FOR REMAINDER OF 
PERIOD THIS SYSTEM EXITS LEAVING CWA DRY.  ALTHOUGH POPS STILL IN 
GFS FOR TUESDAY...ALL MODELS AGREE ON SYSTEM WELL TO NORTHEAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             48  70  52  54  36 /   0  50 100  50  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  48  70  52  54  34 /   0  30 100  70  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  70  50  53  34 /   0  40 100  70  10

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
918 AM EST TUE NOV 20 2007

.DISCUSSION...
SATELLITE AND AREA OBSERVATIONS SHOW DENSE FOG IS SLOWLY
DISSIPATING WITH ONLY PATCHY AREAS LEFT. HAVE ALLOWED DENSE FOG
ADVISORY EXPIRE...BUT WILLL CONTINUE TO MENTION PATCHY FOG UNTIL
LATE MORNING. AFTER FOG DISSIPATES...PLENTY OF SUNSHINE ANTICIPATED
WHICH WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM TO CURRENT FORECAST HIGHS.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREAS OF FOG...SOME OF IT 
DENSE...HAVE FORMED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY NORTHERN 
ZONES.  WILL ISSUE DENSE FOG ADVISORY TO COVER THIS.  UPPER RIDGE 
WILL BE IN CONTROL IN THE SHORT TERM...SO MILD TEMPS AND MOSTLY 
CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKY.  CLOUDS SHOULD BEGIN TO INCREASE LATE 
TONIGHT AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM. GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE AGAIN 
BOTH PERIODS...SO WILL STAY CLOSE TO MAV NUMBERS.  

.LONG TERM(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A PATTERN CHANGE EXPECTED 
DURING THE EARLY PART OF THE EXTENDED.  HIGH PRESSURE MOVING AWAY 
FROM THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY WILL MAKE WAY FOR AN APPROACHING COLD 
FRONT LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  WILL SEE MAINLY RAIN 
SHOWERS WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A 
STRAY THUNDERSTORM OR TWO.  SHOWERS WILL LINGER IN THURSDAY NIGHT 
OVER THE FAR NORTHERN AND EASTERN AREAS.  WITH COLDER AIR PUSHING IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT...COULD SEE RAIN CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND POSSIBLY A FEW FLURRIES INTO FRIDAY MORNING.  ANOTHER 
SYSTEM MOVES IN...BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION FOR 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 200225
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EST MON NOV 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...CLOUDS EXITING THE AREA THIS EVENING AS HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS INTO THE AREA.  WILL UPDATE ZONE FORECAST TO LOWER CLOUDS 
COVER FOR THE REST OF TONIGHT.  VISIBILITY AT TRI-CITIES HAS DROPPED 
TO ONE-QUARTER OF A MILE IN FOG DUE TO THE RECENT RAIN.  WILL ALSO ADD 
PATCHY FOG WORDING FOR TONIGHT.  COVERAGE SHOULD BE PATCHY SO AN 
ADVISORY NOT NEEDED.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
APPEAR ON TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...WEAK LIFT ACROSS THE 
NE HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA BROUGHT SOME LIGHT SHOWERS TO NE TN AND 
SW VA THIS MORNING AND SHIFTED SLOWLY NE OUT OF SW VA THIS 
AFTERNOON. SKIES PARTED ACROSS THE SW SECTIONS LATE THIS MORNING AND 
WAS STILL CLOUDY NE AT MID AFTERNOON BUT BREAKS IN THE LOW 
CLOUDINESS WAS BEGINNING IN MOST AREAS. UPPER RIDGING WILL BUILD IN 
TONIGHT AHEAD OF TROUGH ALONG WEST COAST AND NORTHERN ROCKIES...SO 
DRY AND MILD CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER THAN NORMAL THE NEXT 3 
PERIODS. MAV GUIDANCE LOOKED GOOD TONIGHT AND TUESDAY SO WILL ONLY 
MAKE A FEW CHANGES TO THE MAV NUMBERS. TUESDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE A FEW 
DEGREES WARMER WITH A LITTLE MORE CLOUD COVER EXCEPT IN THE COOLER 
VALLEYS OF NE TN SO FOLLOWED CLOSER TO NAM NUMBERS.     

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...BY THE START OF THIS PERIOD 
RIDGE HAS MOVED OFF TO THE EAST AND TROUGHS ARE LINING UP TO MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA.  FIRST TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT DUE TO 
MOVE THROUGH ON THURSDAY.  NCEP FORECASTERS LIKE THE TIMING OF GFS 
AS MUCH OF MORE THAN ANY OTHER MODEL AND ITS FROPA LOOKS TO BE 
BETWEEN 12Z AND 18Z THURSDAY.  BIG IMPACT ON LOW TEMPS THU WITH 
RESPECT TO FRONTAL LOCATION...WILL PLAN ON ONE MORE MILD MORNING FOR 
CWA.  

FOR POST-FRONTAL UPSLOPE SNOWS IN THE APPALACHIANS...GFS CONTINUES 
TO SHOW ONLY ABOUT 12 HOURS WORTH OF MOIST UPSLOPE IN THAT AREA...SO 
WILL GO WITH POPS/LIGHT SNOWS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT BUT WILL DRY OUT 
CONDITIONS FOR FRIDAY.  WILL NEED TO WATCH SHORT WAVE PASSING TO 
NORTH FOR ANY LIFT EXTENDED FARTHER SOUTHWARD IN FUTURE MODEL RUNS.

COMPACT SYSTEM SUNDAY INTO MONDAY MAY OFFER SOME MORE PRECIP...BUT
STILL A LONG WAY AWAY. WILL BRING UP POPS SOME...BUT NOT UP TO GFS
VALUES.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  48  74  51  72  60 /   0   0   0  30  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  48  73  51  71  58 /  10   0   0  20  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN  48  73  50  71  58 /  10   0   0  20  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  42  71  42  71  52 /  10   0   0  10  50

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST MON NOV 19 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT COMBINED 
WITH SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY BROUGHT ISOLATED SHOWERS TONIGHT.  
MAY BE ADDITIONAL FEW SHOWERS ESPECIALLY NORTH TODAY...SO WILL 
INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SHOWER NORTHERN HALF.  UPPER RIDGE WILL 
BUILD IN TONIGHT...SO EXPECT DRY AND MILD CONDITIONS. GUIDANCE TEMPS 
GENERALLY IN DECENT AGREEMENT AND LOOK REASONABLE...WILL ONLY MAKE A 
FEW MINOR TWEAKS TO THE MAV NUMBERS.     

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...DID NOT DO ANY SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGES TO THE EXTENDED AS MODEL FORECASTS APPEAR TO BE IN AGREEMENT 
MAINLY DURING THE FIRST TWO THIRDS OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. DRY WEATHER 
STILL PROGGED FOR TUESDAY WITH RIDGE IN PLACE AS AMPLIFYING PLAINS 
UPPER TROF BUILDS STEADILY EAST. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION 
INCREASES DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY AS A COUPLE OF WEAK VORT MAXES 
SHIFT NORTHEAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. STAYED 
WITH THE CHANCE TYPE POPS FOR SHOWERS HERE WHILE KEEPING LIKELY POPS 
FOR SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THANKSGIVING MORNING. FRONT MOVES AWAY DURING THE HOLIDAY BUT 
MAINTAINED CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AS SIGNIFICANT LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE CONTINUES TO ADVECT INTO THE REGION IN CYCLONIC FLOW. 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT INCREASES IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW REGIME AND WITH 
SUFFICIENT CAA MIXED IN SOME SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING. THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST 
STAYED SOMWHAT CLOSER TO THE ECMWF AND ENSEMBLE MEAN AS THE GFS 
APPEARS TO BE TOO AMPLIFIED WITH WAVE DEVELOPMENT OVER THE GULF OF 
MEXICO AT THIS TIME. MAINTAINED SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR A SHOWER ON 
SUNDAY WITH WEAK UPPER LEVEL WAVE AND INDICATION OF SOME LOW LEVEL 
INVERTED TROFFING. DID NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM MEX MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS 
WHICH FEATURE WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS FIRST COUPLE DAYS TRENDING 
BACK TO A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG 
TERM FORECAST.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 190210
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 PM EST SUN NOV 18 2007

.DISCUSSION...RADARS INDICATING SCATTERED SHOWERS TRACKING THROUGH 
MIDDLE TN ALONG A WEAK SHORTWAVE.  WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO ADD 20 
POPS FOR SHOWERS FOR OUR CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN COUNTIES.  
TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST SEEM ON TRACK...NO OTHER 
CHANGES PLANNED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE SLOWLY SLIPPING TO THE
EAST WITH A LITTLE WARMER MOISTER AIRMASS COMING INTO PLAY FOR
TONIGHT AND MONDAY. MONDAY MORNING WILL SEE SOME SIGNIFICANT
CLOUDINESS PARTICULARLY IN THE SOUTH TO BEGIN THE DAY AND A FEW
SPRINKLES CANNOT BE RULED OUT. FEEL THERE IS NOT ENOUGH MOISTURE OR
LIFT TO GENERATE MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION SO KEPT POPS AT 14 OR
BELOW. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES APPEARED REASONABLE SO DID NOT DEVIATE
GREATLY THERE.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT TOO MANY CHANGES IN
FORECAST AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING STILL WILL STRENGTHEN OVER THE
FORECAST AREA THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF WESTERN STATES UPPER
TROF. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT EAST TUESDAY AND
TUESDAY NIGHT. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE VERY SLOWLY UNTIL WEDNESDAY AND
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILD AND ACTUALLY 10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE
NORMAL TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. BEST WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL TAKE
PLACE WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED
FRONTAL SYSTEM ADVANCES TO THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY.
BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE WEDNESDAY NIGHT
AND THURSDAY AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. LOOKS LIKE TEMPERATURES WILL
BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL RAIN FOR THE MOST PART THURSDAY NIGHT. ONLY
THE HIGHEST MOUNTAINS MAY SEE SOME SNOW THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY
WITH NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BEFORE THE PRECIPITATION ENDS. HAVE
WARMED THURSDAY NIGHTS LOWS A FEW DEGREES WITH NEW MOS GUIDANCE
WITH HIGHS FRIDAY MID 40S TO LOWER 50S WHICH MAY BE TOO WARM
DEPENDING ON CLOUD COVER AND COLD AIR ADVECTION. SATURDAY LOOKS DRY
BUT HAVE PUT IN A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR RAIN SUNDAY AS MOISTURE MOVES
BACK NORTH ACROSS FRONT THAT BECOMES STATIONARY TO THE SOUTH OVER
THE WEEKEND.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  49  71  49  74  50 /  10  10   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  68  49  73  49 /  10  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  46  67  48  72  48 /  10  10   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  40  63  42  69  44 /  10  10   0   0  10
