AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EST SUN NOV 18 2007

.SHORT TERM...HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE SLOWLY SLIPPING TO THE
EAST WITH A LITTLE WARMER MOISTER AIRMASS COMING INTO PLAY FOR
TONIGHT AND MONDAY. MONDAY MORNING WILL SEE SOME SIGNIFICANT
CLOUDINESS PARTICULARLY IN THE SOUTH TO BEGIN THE DAY AND A FEW
SPRINKLES CANNOT BE RULED OUT. FEEL THERE IS NOT ENOUGH MOISTURE OR
LIFT TO GENERATE MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION SO KEPT POPS AT 14 OR
BELOW. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES APPEARED REASONABLE SO DID NOT DEVIATE
GREATLY THERE.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT TOO MANY CHANGES IN
FORECAST AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGING STILL WILL STRENGTHEN OVER THE
FORECAST AREA THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF WESTERN STATES UPPER
TROF. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT EAST TUESDAY AND
TUESDAY NIGHT. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE VERY SLOWLY UNTIL WEDNESDAY AND
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILD AND ACTUALLY 10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE
NORMAL TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. BEST WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL TAKE
PLACE WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED
FRONTAL SYSTEM ADVANCES TO THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY.
BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE WEDNESDAY NIGHT
AND THURSDAY AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. LOOKS LIKE TEMPERATURES WILL
BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL RAIN FOR THE MOST PART THURSDAY NIGHT. ONLY
THE HIGHEST MOUNTAINS MAY SEE SOME SNOW THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY
WITH NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BEFORE THE PRECIPITATION ENDS. HAVE
WARMED THURSDAY NIGHTS LOWS A FEW DEGREES WITH NEW MOS GUIDANCE
WITH HIGHS FRIDAY MID 40S TO LOWER 50S WHICH MAY BE TOO WARM

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 181605
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST SUN NOV 18 2007

.DISCUSSION...MODELS CONTINUE IN AGREEMENT AND CURRENT FORECAST 
SEEMS REASONABLE.  NO CHANGES PLANNED

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK FRONT OVER THE 
REGION WILL BECOME NEARLY STATIONARY AND WILL GRADUALLY DISSIPATE.  
MODELS SHOWING SOME WEAK VORT ENERGY MOVING ACROSS TONIGHT. SHOULD 
SEE VARYING AMOUNTS OF CLOUDS SHORT TERM...AND WHILE WEAK ISENTROPIC 
LIFT MAY BRING A FEW SPRINKLES TONIGHT...LOOKS LIKE BEST FORECAST 
FOR NOW IS TO KEEP THINGS DRY.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.      

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...TRENDED FORECAST TOWARD THE 
00Z GFS MODEL WHICH IS A LITTLE SLOWER WITH LONGWAVE PATTERN AND 
FEATURES MORE ACTION IN THE SOUTHERN STREAM LATE IN THE PERIOD ALONG 
WITH MILDER AIR DURING THIS LATER PORTION OF THE FORECAST. UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGING STRENGTHENS OVER THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY AND TUESDAY 
AHEAD OF DEVELOPING WESTERN STATES UPPER TROF WHILE SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE GRADUALLY SHIFTS EAST. THIS WILL RESULT IN A CONTINUATION 
OF THE RATHER PLEASANT WARMING TREND ALONG WITH LITTLE REQUIREMENT 
FOR THE USE OF PROBABILITY OF PRECIP. BY WEDNESDAY UPPER TROF AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM ADVANCES INTO THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES AND 
OHIO VALLEY. SOUTHERLY FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE RETREATING 
SURFACE HIGH ALLOWS FOR DECENT MOISTURE/WARM AIR ADVECTION AHEAD OF 
COLD FRONT. USED STAYED WITH PROGRESSION OF SLIGHT AND CHANCE POPS 
FOR SHOWERS WITH A SHORTWAVE FEATURE AHEAD OF MAIN SYSTEM ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH LIKELY POPS FOR THE FROPA LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT/EARLY 
THURSDAY. TRAILING SHORTWAVE ENERGY WITH RELATIVELY DEEP MOISTURE 
BEHIND DEPARTING SURFACE FRONT ALLOWS FOR CHANCE OF LIGHT SHOWERS ON 
THANKSGIVING TRANSITIONING INTO SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS THURSDAY NIGHT AS COLDER 
AIR SLIPS INTO THE FORECAST AREA. UPPER FLOW GOES SOUTHWESTERLY 
FAIRLY QUICKLY AHEAD DEVELOPING SOUTHERN PLAINS TROF AND AIDS IN 
MODIFICATION OF LOW LEVEL AIRMASS ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND 
APPALACHIANS. STAYED CLOSE TO NEW MEX MOS TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD 
WHICH FEATURE THE MILDER TEMPS IN THE LATER PORTION OF THE 
EXTENDED.      

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 180152
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
852 PM EST SAT NOV 17 2007

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING.  CLOUDS SHOULD BE ON 
THE INCREASE TONIGHT.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
APPEARS ON TRACK.  NO CHANGES NEEDED. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MIDLEVEL CLOUDS WILL GIVE
WAY THIS EVENING AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES THROUGH. A LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE OHIO VALLEY/GREAT LAKES REGION WILL DRAW
SOME HIGHER THETA-E AIR AT 925 AND 850 MB TOWARD THE AREA TONIGHT
IN A SOUTHWEST FLOW. THIS SHOULD BRING SOME LOWER CLOUDS TO THE
AREA...MAINLY IN THE SOUTH. DEWPOINTS WILL BE ON THE RISE AS
WELL...AND SHOULD KEEP TEMPS UP IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S IN MOST
SPOTS. THE MOISTURE REMAINS VERY SHALLOW SO PRECIP IS EXPECTED. A
SURFACE TROUGH LINGERS OVER THE AREA TOMORROW WHILE WINDS ALOFT
BECOME MORE NORTHWESTERLY...WHICH SHOULD DECREASE CLOUDS SLIGHTLY
THROUGH THE DAY AND ALLOW TEMPS TO RISE INTO THE UPPER 50S TO MID
60S.

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 PM EST SAT NOV 17 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MIDLEVEL CLOUDS WILL GIVE
WAY THIS EVENING AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES THROUGH. A LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE OHIO VALLEY/GREAT LAKES REGION WILL DRAW
SOME HIGHER THETA-E AIR AT 925 AND 850 MB TOWARD THE AREA TONIGHT
IN A SOUTHWEST FLOW. THIS SHOULD BRING SOME LOWER CLOUDS TO THE
AREA...MAINLY IN THE SOUTH. DEWPOINTS WILL BE ON THE RISE AS
WELL...AND SHOULD KEEP TEMPS UP IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S IN MOST
SPOTS. THE MOISTURE REMAINS VERY SHALLOW SO PRECIP IS EXPECTED. A
SURFACE TROUGH LINGERS OVER THE AREA TOMORROW WHILE WINDS ALOFT
BECOME MORE NORTHWESTERLY...WHICH SHOULD DECREASE CLOUDS SLIGHTLY
THROUGH THE DAY AND ALLOW TEMPS TO RISE INTO THE UPPER 50S TO MID
60S.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...QUIET FIRST PART OF
PERIOD...STILL LOOKING WET NEAR THANKSGIVING. MODELS AND NCEP
FORECASTERS TRYING TO SLOW DOWN PROGRESSION OF SYSTEM FOR MID WEEK.
HAVE PUSHED BACK WIND SHIFT AND ASSOCIATED DEWPOINTS AS WELL AS
ONSET OF PRECIP CHANCES. WEDNESDAY MORNING AND POSSIBLY THURSDAY
MORNING COULD HAVE LOW TEMPS WELL ABOVE SEASONAL AVERAGES DUE TO
STRONG PUSH OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. RIGHT NOW FRONT TOO CLOSE TO
CALL FOR THURSDAY MORNING...SO HAVE LOW TEMP AND DEW POINTS HIGHER
THAN NORMAL...BUT NOT AS HIGH AS IF FRONT FOR SURE WOULD STAY WEST
ALL NIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

HAVE TRIMMED BACK ON EXTENT OF THUNDER SLIGHTLY AT MID WEEK...WITH IT
LOOKING LIKE RICHEST LOW LEVEL DEWPOINTS AND FRONTAL PASSAGE
OCCURING AT COOLER TIME OF THE DAY ON THURSDAY. IF FRONT SPEEDS UP
OR SLOWS DOWN...THEN MIGHT HAVE A BETTER CHANCE OF STORMS UTILIZING
SURFACE HEATING EITHER WED AFTN OR THU AFTN.

STILL KEEPING IN MENTION OF POST-FRONTAL SHRA/SHSN IN HIGHER
ELEVATIONS THURSDAY NIGHT AND INTO FRIDAY.


&&

.DISCUSSION...
A SURFACE LOW LOCATED OVER IL THIS MORNING WILL TRACK EAST ACROSS
THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH THE DAY. ALOFT...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH AT 700
MB IS PROVIDING SOME MIDLEVEL CLOUDS. THESE CLOUDS APPEAR THIN
BASED ON AREA SOUNDINGS...AND WE SHOULD STILL SEE A FAIR AMOUNT OF
SUNSHINE. COMBINED WITH A SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW...EXPECT TEMPS TO
RISE INTO THE 60S IN THE VALLEY. THE CURRENT FORECAST REFLECTS
THESE TRENDS AND NO UPDATE WILL BE NEEDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST SAT NOV 17 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORT WAVE ENERGY PASSING BY 
MAINLY TO OUR NORTH AND TO OUR SOUTH TODAY INTO TONIGHT.  A WEAK 
COLD FRONT WILL SAG INTO THE AREA LATER TONIGHT.  NOT MUCH FORCING 
AND MOISTURE LACKING...SO SHOULD SEE MORE CLOUDS BUT NOT MUCH ELSE 
IN THE SHORT TERM.  GUIDANCE TEMPS GENERALLY IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND 
LOOK REASONABLE...WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW THE MAV.   

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT 
HELPS TO DRAG A DRY FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY WITH 
HIGHER SURFACE PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE REGION THROUGH MONDAY. 
NEXT SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM ADVANCES 
INTO THE GREAT LAKES/MIDWEST STATES LATER TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. 
SOUTHERLY FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE RETREATING SURFACE HIGH 
ALLOWS FOR DECENT MOISTURE/WARM AIR ADVECTION AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. 
STAYED WITH PROGRESSION OF SLIGHT AND CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WITH LIKELY POPS FOR THE 
FROPA LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT/EARLY THURSDAY. TRAILING SHORTWAVE ENERGY 
WITH RELATIVELY DEEP MOISTURE BEHIND DEPARTING SURFACE FRONT ALLOWS 
FOR CHANCE OF LIGHT SHOWERS ON THANKSGIVING TRANSITIONING INTO SOME 
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT AS COLDER AIR INVADES THE FORECAST 
AREA. UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL BY FRIDAY WITH A DRY DAY 
EXPECTED. STAYED CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS EVENING.  HIGH PRESSURE 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER TONIGHT.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST APPEAR ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
A LOW LEVEL RIDGE AXIS OVER THE AREA TODAY WILL SHIFT TO THE EAST 
TONIGHT. A SURFACE LOW AND A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE 
OUT OF THE PLAINS TO THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS FAST-MOVING TROUGH WILL 
BRING SOME HIGH CLOUDS TO THE AREA ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE 
SKIES WILL BE CLEAR THROUGH THE NEXT 24 HOURS. WITH THE RIDGE MOVING 
EAST AND THE LOW OVER THE OHIO VALLEY...THE FLOW WILL BECOME 
SOUTHWESTERLY...BRINGING WARMER TEMPS TOMORROW. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE 
LOWER 50S TO LOWER 60S.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 162046
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
346 PM EST FRI NOV 16 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
A LOW LEVEL RIDGE AXIS OVER THE AREA TODAY WILL SHIFT TO THE EAST 
TONIGHT. A SURFACE LOW AND A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE 
OUT OF THE PLAINS TO THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS FAST-MOVING TROUGH WILL 
BRING SOME HIGH CLOUDS TO THE AREA ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE 
SKIES WILL BE CLEAR THROUGH THE NEXT 24 HOURS. WITH THE RIDGE MOVING 
EAST AND THE LOW OVER THE OHIO VALLEY...THE FLOW WILL BECOME 
SOUTHWESTERLY...BRINGING WARMER TEMPS TOMORROW. EXPECT HIGHS IN THE 
LOWER 50S TO LOWER 60S.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE TO MOVE
THROUGH AREA SUNDAY WITH GFS STILL HOLDING ONTO SOME
SPRINKLES...BUT OTHER MODELS DRY OVER CWA. WITH NCEP FORECASTERS
NOT FAVORING GFS WILL LEAVE FORECAST DRY FOR SUNDAY. ALL MODELS
AGREE THAT SHORTWAVE WILL BE PAST AREA BY MONDAY...WITH RIDGE OVER
AREA BY TUESDAY 12Z. 

NEXT CHANCE FOR GOOD PRECIP COVERAGE COMES MID WEEK WHEN MAJOR
TROUGH TRACKS ACROSS THE U.S.  MODELS FAIRLY CONSISTENT ON PRESENCE
OF TROUGH...BUT CHARACTER OF TROUGH QUITE DIFFERENT BETWEEN MODELS.
AT ANY RATE LOOKS LIKE GOOD LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN BY THAT TIME
SO WILL INTRODUCE SOME THUNDER INTO WEATHER GRIDS STARTING
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.

LOOKS LIKE FRONTAL PASSAGE AIMED AT THANKSGIVING DAY RIGHT NOW.  
DEPENDING ON TIMING MIGHT STILL HAVE A CHANCE OF THUNDER AGAIN FOR 
THANKSGIVING DAY...BUT ALL MODELS AGREE THAT COLD FRONT AND DEEP 
MOISTURE WILL BE OUT OF AREA BY 00Z FRIDAY.

MOIST AND COLD LOW-LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW EXPECTED THU NIGHT AND 
POSSIBLY INTO FRIDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE MENTION OF SHSN FOR HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS INTO FRIDAY.  AS OF NOW...GFS SUBSIDENCE ERODES MOUNTAIN 
MOISTURE WITHIN 12 HOURS...IF THATS THE CASE THEN SHOW AMOUNTS IN 
MOUNTAINS WOULD BE VERY LIMITED.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  32  62  44  65  44 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  30  59  40  62  41 /   0   0   0  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST FRI NOV 16 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD ADVECTION COMING TO AN 
END...AND WITH COLDEST AIR PULLING OUT...RISING HEIGHTS AND SURFACE 
HIGH BUILDING IN SHOULD SEE THE REMAINING LOW CLOUDS DISSIPATE 
FAIRLY QUICKLY.  SHOULD HAVE PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TODAY...AND A MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKY TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY A 
FEW MINOR TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAINTAINED DRY FORECAST 
OVER THE WEEKEND WITH SOME DISAGREEMENT BETWEEN THE WRF AND THE 
SIMILAR GFS/ECMWF AS A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORTWAVES DROP SOUTHEAST OUT 
OF THE GREAT LAKES WHILE A SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE TRIES TO FORM OVER 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP WOULD BE OVER 
THE DEEP SOUTH WHERE HIGHER MEAN RH WILL BE AVAILABLE WITH THE 
SOUTHERN STREAM FEATURE PER THE GFS AND ECMWF SO STAYED THE COURSE. 
AWAIT THE ARRIVAL OF DEEPENING PLAINS UPPER TROF AROUND MID WEEK 
WHICH GFS HANDLED SIMILAR TO PREVIOUS MODEL RUN HOWEVER...WITH 
FASTER FROPA LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THANKSGIVING MORNING. WENT 
AHEAD AND ADJUSTED POPS A LITTLE HIGHER FOR THE APPROACH AND FROPA 
WHILE DROPPING POPS OFF QUICKER DURING THE DAY THURSDAY. GFS SHOWS A 
WRAP AROUND TRAILING ENERGY PRECIP SCENARIO FOR LATER IN THE DAY 
INTO THE EVENING HOURS AND TRENDED THIS WAY. DID NOT STRAY TOO FAR 
FROM MEX MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EST THU NOV 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM 
THE WEST. WIND BECOMING MORE WESTERLY AND DECREASING. LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE ON THE DECLINE OVERNIGHT. HAVE DROPPED WIND AND SNOW 
ADVISORIES FOR THIS EVENING. SCATTERED FLURRIES REMAIN POSSIBLE. 
FORECAST MINS ON TRACK. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
A DEEP UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IS CURRENTLY MOVING ACROSS THE AREA. COLD 
MIDLEVEL TEMPERATURES ARE CREATING STEEP LAPSE RATES...RESULTING IN 
PLENTY OF CLOUDS AND SOME SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF 
THE AREA. MODERATE SNOW WAS REPORTED AT NEWFOUND GAP WITH UP TO ONE 
INCH ON ELEVATED SURFACES...AND SNOW WAS FALLING IN MUCH OF NE TN 
AND SW VA...THOUGH THERE WAS NO ACCUMULATION ON THE GROUND YET. HAVE 
SEEN SOME LIGHT FLURRIES HERE AT THE OFFICE. WITH A PERSISTENT 
STRONG UPSLOPE FLOW...COLD MIDLEVEL TEMPS THROUGH MIDNIGHT...AND 
ADDITIONAL UPSTREAM MOISTURE...EXPECT THAT THERE WILL BE SOME 
ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL KEEP THE SNOW ADVISORY 
GOING...BUT END IT AT MIDNIGHT. WILL ALSO MENTION FLURRIES IN THE 
VALLEY AS FAR SOUTH AS KNOXVILLE BASED ON RADAR TRENDS. DECREASING 
MOISTURE SHOULD END MOST OF THE ACCUMULATING PRECIP AFTER 06Z...AND 
WILL CARRY ONLY SCATTERED FLURRIES AFTER THAT TIME. 

WINDS HAVE NOT BEEN QUITE AS STRONG AS EXPECTED...WITH 15-20 MPH IN 
THE VALLEY AND 20-30 MPH IN THE MOUNTAINS. WILL CANCEL THE LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY AND KEEP THE WIND ADVISORY GOING IN THE MOUNTAINS UNTIL 
MIDNIGHT. CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY DECREASE AFTER MIDNIGHT AS THE UPPER 
TROUGH MOVES AWAY AND MIDLEVEL TEMPS WARM. EXPECT CLEAR TO MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES BY SUNRISE. UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE SEEN IN WV IMAGERY OVER 
THE NORTHERN PLAINS WILL BRING SOME HIGH CLOUDS TO NORTHERN SECTIONS 
TOMORROW AFTERNOON...BUT OVERALL FRIDAY SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THANKSGIVING)...
PERIOD STARTS QUIET WITH SHALLOW UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN THAT
LASTS UNTIL ABOUT MONDAY...THEN MAJOR TROUGH BUILDS INTO PLAINS
NEXT WEEK. MODELS FAIRLY CONSISTENT THROUGH ABOUT 12Z
WEDNESDAY...AFTERWARDS ECMWF LEAVES TROUGH OUT WEST WHILE OTHER
MODELS MARCH TROUGH TO THE EAST. SINCE ECMWF SEEMS TO BE ODD ONE
OUT...AND NCEP WAS ONLY GOING WITH BLENDS...WENT AHEAD WITH WETTER
SCENARIO FOR MID WEEK RATHER THAN DRIER ECMWF. ALSO...SINCE
TRENDING AWAY FROM ECMWF ALSO IVE PULLED LIGHT POPS FOR SUNDAY.

FOR TEMPS...HAVE KEPT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE WITH EXCEPTION OF LATTER 
PERIODS WHEN DEW POINTS SHOULD RISE AND WINDS PICK UP TO KEEP 
OVERNIGHT LOWS WARMER.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  30  55  33  62  39 /  10   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  28  53  32  60  38 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  28  52  32  60  38 /  10   0   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1003 AM EST THU NOV 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...
DEPARTING LOW PRESSURE AND A HIGH BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST ARE
CREATING A STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT ACROSS THE AREA. NORTHWEST
WINDS ARE BEGINNING TO INCREASE TO 15-20 KTS IN THE VALLEY...WITH A
FEW MOUNTAINS LOCATIONS REPORTING AROUND 20 KTS. WILL KEEP THE WIND
ADVISORY AND LAKE WIND ADVISORY GOING. THE UPSLOPE FLOW IS ALSO
GENERATING SOME SNOW SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS. GSMNP HAS ALREADY REPORTED
A DUSTING AT NEWFOUND GAP AND MT. LECONTE. ADDITIONAL UPSTREAM
MOISTURE...STEPP LAPSE RATES WITH VERY COLD MIDLEVEL AIR...AND
INCREASING UPSLOPE FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SNOW SHOWERS IN
THE MOUNTAINS THROUGH THE EVENING. WILL RAISE POPS TO A HIGH CHANCE
AND BUMP UP SNOW ACCUMULATION AMOUNTS TO 2 INCHES IN THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. UPDATE WILL ALSO ADJUST TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY TO
ACCOUNT FOR STEEPER LAPSE RATES. 

&&

     EAST POLK...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

FXUS64 KMRX 150840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST THU NOV 15 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING SOME LIGHT RAIN 
IN THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA WITH THE FRONT PUSHING THROUGH.  
MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD CONTINUE TO PUSH EAST OF THE AREA. 
COLD AIR PUSHING IN BEHIND THE FRONT.  PROBABLY WONT SEE 
TEMPERATURES RISE MUCH TODAY. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  WITH THE TIGHT GRADIENT...WILL PROBABLY SEE WINDY 
CONDITIONS TODAY.  WILL KEEP WIND ADVISORY GOING FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS... BUT WILL ADD A LAKE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE VALLEY FOR 
TODAY.  A SHORTWAVE TRACKS IN TONIGHT.  BEST MOISTURE REMAINS TO THE 
NORTH....BUT MAY SEE MINOR ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
SOUTHWEST VA AND EAST TN TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
ACROSS THE REGION FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND 
SEASONAL TEMPS EXPECTED. ON SUNDAY...LONG-RANGE MODELS REMAIN IN 
DISAGREEMENT WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF RAIN. GFS MODEL HAS REMAIN 
CONSISTENT THE LAST SEVERAL RUNS WITH KEEPING SUNDAY DRY...BY 
INDICATING ONLY A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. HOWEVER...THE ECMWF 
MODEL HAS ALSO BEEN CONSISTENT WITH INDICATING A STRONGER UPPER- 
LEVEL SHORT WAVE THAT PRODUCES A GOOD CHANCE FOR RAIN SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. SINCE ITS DIFFICULT TO KNOW WHOS 
RIGHT (AND NOBODY WANTS TO BUDGE)...WILL KEEP A SMALL CHANCE POP FOR 
SUNDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA (WHICH ALSO MAINTAINS 
CONSISTENCY WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECASTS). BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS AGREE THAT A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE 
REGION AROUND THE THANKSGIVING TIMEFRAME. THERE REMAINS DISAGREEMENT 
WITH THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...BUT FOR NOW...WILL MENTION A CHANCE 
OF RAIN FOR WEDNESDAY...WHICH IS IN LINE WITH THE GFS MODEL AND THE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST. HOWEVER...WOULDNT BE SURPRISED IF THIS SOLUTION 
IS TOO QUICK AND THE SLOWER ECMWF SOLUTION ACTUALLY VERIFIES BETTER. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARD THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGH 
THE FORECAST PERIOD. 

&&

OAK RIDGE, TN  46  30  52  32  60 /  10  10   0   0   0

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 150314
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 PM EST WED NOV 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
TONIGHT. BREEZY NW WINDS WILL GET GOING BEHIND THE FRONT. WIND 
ADVSRY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON TRACK FOR THIS THU MORNING.
TEMPS WILL FALL DURING THE DAY THU. WILL UPDATE AFT 1100 PM EST TO 
LOWER POPS OVRNGT. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
A DIGGING TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS WILL PUSH A STRONG COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT. THE FRONT IS NOW MOVING INTO WEST TN...AND 
IS PROJECTED TO MOVE ACROSS EAST TN BETWEEN 04Z AND 09Z. SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE INCREASING AHEAD OF THE FRONT IN MIDDLE TN AS A 
MIDLEVEL CAP WEAKENS. WILL ALSO SEE INCREASING UPPER DIFFLUENCE WITH 
FAVORABLE POSITIONING OF THE POLAR AND SUBTROPICAL JETS. SURFACE 
HEATING HAS BROUGHT TEMPS INTO THE LOWER TO MID 70S IN THE CENTRAL 
AND SOUTHERN VALLEY...RESULTING IN GOOD INSTABILITY...BUT THE BEST 
DYNAMICS WILL PROVIDE LIFT AFTER SUNSET. THIS TIMING DIFFERENCE MAY 
LIMIT THE SEVERE POTENTIAL...BUT ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS WILL STILL 
BE POSSIBLE WITH DAMAGING WINDS BEING THE MAIN THREAT. POPS WILL BE 
CATEGORICAL BEFORE 06Z.

BEHIND THE FRONT...WINDS WILL INCREASE AND BECOME GUSTY FROM THE 
NORTHWEST...AND DEWPOINTS WILL QUICKLY FALL. TEMPS THROUGH THE DAY 
TOMORROW WILL HOLD NEARLY STEADY FROM MORNING LOWS. EXPECT CLOUDS TO 
BECOME SCATTERED IN THE MORNING WITH LOW TO MIDLEVEL DRY 
ADVECTION...BUT BECOME BROKEN AGAIN IN THE AFTERNOON AS COLD TEMPS 
ALOFT GENERATE STRATOCU. AN UPSLOPE FLOW IN THE MOUNTAINS WILL KEEP 
A CHANCE OF SHOWERS THERE. WINDS WILL BE QUITE STRONG...25 TO 35 MPH 
WITH GUSTS OF 40 TO 50 MPH IN THE MOUNTAINS...AND A WIND ADVISORY 
WILL BE ISSUED FROM 6 AM UNTIL MIDNIGHT. WIND IN VALLEY LOCATIONS 
WILL BE BETWEEN 15 AND 25 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 30 MPH.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
TEMPERATURES TAKE A PLUNGE AFTER THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH IN THE
SHORT TERM. A LITTLE WRAP AROUND SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS NOT
OUT OF THE QUESTION BUT FEEL EVEN THERE THIS TIME OF YEAR ONLY
LIMITED AMOUNTS. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM SLIGHTLY INTO THE WEEKEND
THEN A LIMITED RE-ENFORCING SHOT OF COOL AIR AGAIN ON MONDAY TO
KEEP HIGHS GENERALLY HOVERING IN THE 50S TO LOW 60S AND LOWS IN THE
30S TO LOW 40S.

ON THE PRECIPITATION FRONT...HAVE BACKED OFF THE RAIN CHANCES OVER 
THE WEEKEND AND EARLY PART OF THE WEEK AND LOOKS LIKE THE BEST SHOT 
IS TOWARDS THE END OF THE PERIOD NEXT WEDNESDAY.  GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
APPEAR REASONABLE AND VERY SMALL DEVIATION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  48  52  34  56  33 / 100   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  46  32  51  32 / 100   0  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  45  46  31  53  32 / 100   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  45  45  29  47  25 / 100  10  10   0   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WIND ADVISORY FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST THURSDAY NIGHT 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WIND ADVISORY FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST THURSDAY NIGHT 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST

DYNAMICS WILL PROVIDE LIFT AFTER SUNSET. THIS TIMING DIFFERENCE MAY 
LIMIT THE SEVERE POTENTIAL...BUT ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS WILL STILL 
BE POSSIBLE WITH DAMAGING WINDS BEING THE MAIN THREAT. POPS WILL BE 
CATEGORICAL BEFORE 06Z.

BEHIND THE FRONT...WINDS WILL INCREASE AND BECOME GUSTY FROM THE 
NORTHWEST...AND DEWPOINTS WILL QUICKLY FALL. TEMPS THROUGH THE DAY 
TOMORROW WILL HOLD NEARLY STEADY FROM MORNING LOWS. EXPECT CLOUDS TO 
BECOME SCATTERED IN THE MORNING WITH LOW TO MIDLEVEL DRY 
ADVECTION...BUT BECOME BROKEN AGAIN IN THE AFTERNOON AS COLD TEMPS 
ALOFT GENERATE STRATOCU. AN UPSLOPE FLOW IN THE MOUNTAINS WILL KEEP 
A CHANCE OF SHOWERS THERE. WINDS WILL BE QUITE STRONG...25 TO 35 MPH 
WITH GUSTS OF 40 TO 50 MPH IN THE MOUNTAINS...AND A WIND ADVISORY 
WILL BE ISSUED FROM 6 AM UNTIL MIDNIGHT. WIND IN VALLEY LOCATIONS 
WILL BE BETWEEN 15 AND 25 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 30 MPH.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
TEMPERATURES TAKE A PLUNGE AFTER THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH IN THE
SHORT TERM. A LITTLE WRAP AROUND SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS NOT
OUT OF THE QUESTION BUT FEEL EVEN THERE THIS TIME OF YEAR ONLY
LIMITED AMOUNTS. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM SLIGHTLY INTO THE WEEKEND
THEN A LIMITED RE-ENFORCING SHOT OF COOL AIR AGAIN ON MONDAY TO
KEEP HIGHS GENERALLY HOVERING IN THE 50S TO LOW 60S AND LOWS IN THE
30S TO LOW 40S.

ON THE PRECIPITATION FRONT...HAVE BACKED OFF THE RAIN CHANCES OVER 
THE WEEKEND AND EARLY PART OF THE WEEK AND LOOKS LIKE THE BEST SHOT 
IS TOWARDS THE END OF THE PERIOD NEXT WEDNESDAY.  GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
APPEAR REASONABLE AND VERY SMALL DEVIATION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  46  32  51  32 / 100   0  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  45  46  31  53  32 / 100   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  45  45  29  47  25 / 100  10  10   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
949 AM EST WED NOV 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...
A SURFACE COLD FRONT IS CURRENTLY MOVING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY.
AHEAD OF THE FRONT...VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS CONVECTIVE CLOUDS OVER
WEST AND MIDDLE TN...INDICATING AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS. BEFORE
THUNDERSTORMS AFFECT OUR AREA...A STRONG MIDLEVEL INVERSION BETWEEN
650 AND 600 MB MUST ERODE. ACARS SOUNDINGS SHOW THIS INVERSION IS
WEAKER TO THE WEST...AND MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW IT WEAKENING LATE
THIS AFTERNOON WHEN A 600 MB TEMPERATURE GRADIENT PASSES THROUGH. UNTIL
THEN WE SHOULD SEE SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS...MAINLY IN NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE AREA. PLENTY OF SUN IN THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL
TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS MORNING WILL LIKELY ENHANCE THUNDERSTORMS
AND SEVERE POTENTIAL THIS EVENING. WILL ISSUE AN SPS TO MENTION THE
THREAT OF SEVERE THIS EVENING IN SOUTHERN AND WESTERN COUNTIES. THE
FORECAST UPDATE WILL ALSO RAISE TEMPS IN THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE
AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EST WED NOV 14 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WITH THE RECENT RAIN...DENSE 
FOG IS STILL BEING OBSERVED.  WILL KEEP THE DENSE FOG GOING...BUT 
NOT PLANNING ON EXTENDING IT.  A COLD FRONT CURRENTLY APPROACHING 
THE OHIO VALLEY...WILL TRACK SOUTHEAST INTO OUR AREA LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT ON HOLDING OFF 
THE BEST MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS UNTIL THIS EVENING. WILL KEEP THE 
50-60 POPS GOING FOR TODAY AND THE 80-90 POPS GOING FOR TONIGHT.  
SOME INSTABILITY ALSO EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT ALONG WITH A 30-40KT 
LOW LEVEL JET...MAY SEE A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  STAYED NEAR MAV GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL SWING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY...WITH SOME LIGHT 
PRECIP POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS 
THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... 
SOME UPSLOPE SHOWERS SHOULD DEVELOP ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT MOISTURE WILL BE SHALLOW ACROSS 
THE AREA...SO WILL ONLY MENTION LOW POPS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. WITH 
TEMPS FALLING BELOW FREEZING IN THE MOUNTAINS...EXPECT SNOW SHOWERS 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS (GENERALLY ABOVE 2500 FEET) BUT WITH LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS OF LESS THAN AN INCH. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD 
ACROSS THE REGION FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND 
SEASONAL TEMPS EXPECTED. BEYOND SATURDAY...MODELS ARE NOT IN VERY 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE LATEST GFS MODEL RUN DEVIATING APPRECIABLY 
FROM ITS PREVIOUS SOLUTIONS. WITH A WIDE VARIANCE IN THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS BEYOND SATURDAY...WILL PLAN TO NOT CHANGE THE EXTENDED 
FORECAST TOO MUCH. ECMWF MODEL CONTINUES TO INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY 
OF RAIN ON SUNDAY...SO WILL KEEP POPS IN THE FORECAST. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARD THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE 
FORECAST PERIOD...WHICH ARE FAIRLY CLOSE TO THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

THURSDAY NIGHT WITH LIMITED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE COULD PRODUCE LIGHT

RETURN FLOW ON SATURDAY. LIGHT PCPN POSSIBLE ALONG WEST SIDE OF MRX

TROUGH WORKS NORTHEAST INTO TN VLY. LOW PRESSURE PROGGED TO DEVELOP 
ALONG TROUGH AND MOVE EAST ACROSS S PART OF MRX CWA EARLY MON. HIGH

SYSTEM LATER ON MON BUT WAA RETURNS BY TUESDAY.

TO THE FRONT. FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE CWA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH

LIKELY FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT. FRONT TRACKS QUICKLY EAST ON THURSDAY... 
BUT STILL SOME LINGERING MOISTURE IN THE NORTHERN ZONES AS UPPER 
TROUGH PASSES. WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR THURSDAY MORNING FOR THE NORTH 
AND OUR EASTERN MOUNTAINS. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ON THURSDAY NIGHT 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. ANOTHER 
FRONT PUSHES IN FROM THE WEST ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND LINGERS INTO 
MONDAY. MODELS INDICATING SUFFICIENT MOISTURE TO CONTINUE THE CHANCE 
POPS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
FOR TEMPERATURES.

TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND LOOK 
REASONABLE...BUT WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WARMER NGM NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT 
AS CLOUDS AND DEWPOINTS GRADUALLY INCREASE DUE TO SOUTHERLY WINDS. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES NOW ARE 
IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH TIMING OF UPCOMING MID WEEK EVENT. 
ACTUALLY...LATEST MODEL RUNS SUGGEST TWO SEPARATE EVENTS WILL 
TRANSPIRE AS WEAK SHORT WAVE TROUGH MOVES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION IN THE LATE TUESDAY/EARLY WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME
FOLLOWED CLOSELY BY A MORE SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH IN THE LATE
WEDNESDAY/EARLY THURSDAY TIME FRAME. THE SECOND EVENT WILL FEATURE
A COLD FRONT WHICH WILL USHER IN A SIGNIFICANTLY COOLER AIR MASS.
MODELS ALSO HINT THAT ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL APPROACH SOMETIME NEXT
WEEKEND...BUT TIMING IS UNCERTAIN AND THERE IS LITTLE SUPPORT FROM
THE ENSEMBLES. NEVERTHELESS...HAVE INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
FOR NEXT SUNDAY. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES
FAIRLY CLOSELY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST AND CARRY THE LOW POPS FOR NOW.

WARM...BUT PATTERN FOR TONIGHT SUPPORTS STICKING CLOSE TO GFS MOS
MINS.

STAYS FROM THE SOUTHWEST THROUGH TUESDAY. HARD TO FIND ANY FOCUS FOR 
SHOWER DEVELOPMENT FOR THESE PERIODS...UNLESS A WEAK VORT MAX MOVES 
THROUGH THE FLATTENING NEAR ZONAL FLOW ALOFT MONDAY NIGHT OR 
TUESDAY. PREFER TO KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR REMAINDER OF SHORT TERM FOR 
NOW. OTHERWISE...IT HAS BEEN TOUGH TO REACH THE WARMER MOS HIGHS 
THIS WEEKEND...SO WILL STICK A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW THE WARMER HIGHS. 
MIN TEMPS CLOSE MONDAY NIGHT AND ACCEPTED.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...GFS RATHER NICELY 
DEPICTS UPPER TROF/SURFACE COLD FRONTAL APPROACH TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING. CONTINUE TREND OF RAISING POPS FOR THE 
FROPA LATER IN THE DAY WEDNESDAY WITH LOWER CHANCE POPS TUESDAY 
NIGHT ENDING UP IN THE MEDIUM CHANCE RANGE BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 
TAPER POPS BACK WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS DRIER NORTHWEST FLOW BUILDS IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT. REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST WAS KEPT DRY ALTHOUGH 
THERE ARE MODEL DIFFERENCES WHICH PROVIDE FOR ANOTHER FRONTAL SYSTEM 
WITH A SMALL CHANCE OF RAIN AROUND SATURDAY. STAYED ON THE DRY SIDE 
FOR NOW AWAITING MODEL AGREEMENT FOR THE LATTER PORTION OF THE LONG 
TERM FORECAST.

GRIDS/FORECAST. STILL APPEARS TEMPS WILL BE ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH MUCH

OUR REGION THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON.

OR A SLIGHT BLEND.

ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA IN WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN AHEAD OF MAIN 
UPPER TROF FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS TUESDAY. TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT MAINTAINED HIGHER CHANCE POPS AS MID LATITUDE 
SYSTEM DRIVES EAST WITH FROPA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. STAYED WITH A SLIGHT 
CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR A NORTHWEST FLOW EVENT ON FRIDAY AND THEN 
DRIED IT OUT ON SATURDAY WITH SURFACE RIDGING BUILDING INTO THE DEEP 
SOUTH. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MEX MOS EXCEPT UNDERCUT ON THURSDAY IN 
HEALTHY COLD AIR ADVECTION AND WENT A LITTLE HIGHER THAN MOS ON 
SATURDAY.

HIGH AT THIS POINT. APPEARS TEMPS WILL GENERALLY BE ABOVE CLIMO

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST FRI NOV 9 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SO FAR THIS AFTERNOON 
PRECIPITATION HAS MAINLY OCCURRED ACROSS PARTS OF WISE...RUSSELL
AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES OF SWRN VA. CEILINGS HAD LOWERED THIS 
MORNING WITH A FEW SPRINKLES AT TRI...BUT GENERALLY HAVE SEEN CLOUDS 
THIN OVER ALL BUT SWRN VA AND THE NE TIP OF TN THIS AFTERNOON.

UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT WILL BE EXITING THIS EVENING...WITH SOME LOW 
LEVEL FORCING DEVELOPING BEHIND THE WEAK COLD FRONT. WEAK LOW LEVEL 
UPSLOPE FLOW AND LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SEEMS TO JUSTIFY LOW 
POPS FOR SWRN VA...EXTREME NE TN AND SMOKY MTNS. TYPE WOULD HAVE TO 
BE LIQUID UNTIL LATE TONIGHT...WHEN WILL WORD TYPE AS RAIN OR SNOW
(ACTUALLY PERHAPS JUST SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES BEFORE ENDING). HAVE 
COORDINATED WITH RNK AND GSP ON THE ADDITION OF LOW POPS TO COVER 
THIS POSSIBILITY...BUT STAYED BELOW THE NAM-WRF POPS AND CLOSER TO 
GFS MOS.  

OTHERWISE...UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE REGION THIS WEEKEND...WITH
NO RETURN FLOW OF SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE...THUS MORE DRY WEATHER.
TEMPS GENERALLY STAY AROUND TYPICAL/CLIMO VALUES FOR NOVEMBER...
UNTIL LATE SUNDAY WHEN WEAK S-SW LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS ON BACK SIDE
OF SURFACE RIDGE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THERE WERE SIGNIFICANT 
MODEL DIFFERENCES IN THE LONG TERM. A MULTI-MODEL BLEND WAS USED TO 
CREATE A SCENARIO WHICH ALLOWS FOR RIDGING AHEAD OF WESTERN STATES 
UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED DRY WEATHER. INCREASING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
AHEAD OF TROF PROVIDES MOST PLEASANT ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS THROUGH AT 
LEAST WEDNESDAY. ALONG WITH THE MILDER AIR COMES HIGHER DEWPOINT AIR 
AND A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS IN THE WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN 
AHEAD OF MAIN FRONTAL SYSTEM DUE LATE WEDNESDAY. WITH UNCERTAINTY A 
BIG PLAYER IN THIS FORECAST INCREASED POPS ONLY TO 30 PERCENT FOR 
MUCH OF THE AREA FOR THE FRONTAL PUSH WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND THEN DROP BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR POSSIBLE SLOW SYSTEM 
MOVEMENT/WRAP AROUND EARLY THURSDAY. USED A DRY FORECAST FOR FRIDAY 
AS WE AWAIT NEXT SYSTEM OVER THE WEEKEND.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS

LAYER...SO WILL KEEP POPS LOW ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN

GUIDANCE NUMBERS TODAY WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS EXPECTED...AND WILL GO
WITH A BLEND FOR TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...WARMING TREND IN
THE OFFING WITH TEMPS RISING TO WELL ABOVE CLIMO BY THE MIDDLE OF
NEXT WEEK AS HEIGHT RISE IN RESPONSE TO DEPARTING EASTERN CONUS
TROUGH AND ADVANCING UPPER RIDGING FROM THE WEST. SOUTHWEST FLOW
ACCOMPANYING WARMING TREND WILL ALSO BRING INCREASING MOISTURE TO
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION SETTING THE STAGE FOR SOMEWHAT
UNSETTLED WEATHER. THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS ALONG WITH SEVERAL
MEMBERS OF THE CANADIAN AND GFS ENSEMBLES PROJECT AT LEAST SOME
LIGHT PRECIP PERIODICALLY FOR MOST OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK.
GENERALLY USED GFS GUIDANCE AS BASIS FOR BOTH TEMPS AND POPS AS THE
GFS SEEMS TO REPRESENT A REASONABLE CONSENSUS OF THE OTHER MODELS
AND ENSEMBLES.

902 PM EST THU NOV 8 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA OVERNIGHT AS AN UPPER JET OVER
THE NORTHERN PLAINS DIVES SOUTHEAST. MOST OF THE CLOUDS WILL BE IN
THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS...AS UPSTREAM LOW LEVEL AIR REMAINS QUITE
DRY. THIS SHOULD PREVENT ANY PRECIP FROM REACHING THE GROUND
OVERNIGHT. UPPER DIFFLUENCE AND VORTICITY ADVECTION SHOULD PROVIDE
SOME ADDITIONAL LIFT FOR LIGHT PRECIP DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY IN
NORTHERN SECTIONS. NO UPDATE IS NEEDED AT THIS TIME.

THROUGH THE INITIAL PART OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD KEEPING THE 
FORECAST DRY WITH MILDER TEMPS. PRECIP BACK IN THE FORECAST MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WITH SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS WITH APPROACH OF 
NEXT UPPER TROF WHICH IS NOT HANDLED SIMILARLY BY MODELS. WENT WITH 
THE 12Z GFS FOR MID WEEK NEXT WEEK WHICH SHOWS MID LATITUDE SYSTEM 
WITH COLD FRONT DEPARTING THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY EVENING 
LEAVING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MEX MOS 
GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST THU NOV 8 2007

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLOWLY WEAKEN ALLOWING CLOUDINESS 
TO SPREAD INTO THE REGION TODAY.  THIS IS REFLECTED NICELY WITH 
CURRENT FORECAST SO NO CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A WEAK DISTURBANCE 
WAS MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM THE MID MS VALLEY TOWARDS THE OHIO VALLEY 
EARLY THIS MORNING AND BRINGING IN HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE OVER THE TN 
VALLEY INCLUDING THE NORTHERN AND WESTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS WAS HAVING LITTLE EFFECT ON TEMPERATURES WHICH WERE IN 
THE MID 20S TO LOWER 30S. WINDS WERE CALM AS BROAD HIGH PRESSURE 
COVERED THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY. AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
EASTERN STATES WAS KEEPING TEMPERATURES COLD ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. THE WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL PASS TO THE NORTH TODAY WITH 
INTERMITTENT MOSTLY HIGH AND POSSIBLY A FEW MID CLOUDS BUT 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM AS SOUTHWEST WINDS DEVELOP WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE SHIFTING EAST. A SECOND SYSTEM A LITTLE STRONGER WILL DROP 
SOUTHEAST OUT OF SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA TONIGHT TOWARDS THE OHIO 
VALLEY AND BRING A FEW SHOWERS TO NE SECTIONS FRIDAY. NOW IT LOOKS 
THAT THE PRECIPITATION WILL START LATER AND TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
WARM ENOUGH THAT IT WILL BE MOSTLY RAIN ALTHOUGH A FEW SNOW SHOWERS 
COULD FALL FRIDAY MORNING IN THE NE TN HIGH MOUNTAINS. HIGHS FRIDAY 
SHOULD BE EVEN A FEW DEGREES WARMER WITH CONTINUED SOUTHWEST WINDS 
AHEAD OF THE WEAK FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS NEXT SYSTEM.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ZONAL-ISH FLOW 
DOMINATES THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH SURFACE HIGH COMING IN
FAST AND MOVING OUT BY MONDAY MORNING. H8 WINDS INCREASE
DRAMATICALLY IN ADVANCE OF NEXT FRONT ON TUESDAY WITH POSSIBLE LOW
LEVEL JET AROUND 50 KNOTS. THIS WILL BEAR WATCHING BUT BEST
STREAMLINES APPEAR TO BE COMING FROM THE SOUTHWEST OUT OF DRIER
AIR. MOISTURE WILL PROBABLY BE LIMITED, THEREFORE. AFTER THIS LOW
MOVES OUT LATE WEDNESDAY RIDGE AND DRIER AIR MOVE IN AGAIN. ANY
RAINS WILL NOT BE DROUGHT BUSTERS BUT WE WILL BE THANKFUL FOR
THEM.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 071933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 PM EST WED NOV 7 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE RIDGE TO OUR WEST WILL 
SLIP EAST ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT...AND POSSIBLY END UP ACROSS 
THE MID ATLANTIC STATES BY THURSDAY MORNING. THIS WILL SET UP LIGHT 
OR CALM WINDS FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT...BEFORE VERY WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW 
LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS ACROSS AT LEAST THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AREAS.
BASED ON THIS SCENARIO...I GENERALLY BLENDED BETWEEN THE NAM-WRF 
MINS AND THE SLIGHTLY COOLER GFS MIN TEMPS. CLOSELY FOLLOWED GFS MOS 
FOR MAX TEMP THURSDAY.

AFTERNOON CUMULUS SHOULD DISSIPATE THIS EVENING...THEN A SLIGHT 
INCREASE IN HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS LATE TONIGHT IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT. MID LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD REACH THE REGION BY THU AFTERNOON
WITH ALSO A FEW TO SCATTERED CUMULUS CLOUDS. NO CHANCE OF ANY 
PRECIPITATION UNTIL LATE THURSDAY NIGHT. 


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
THE POLAR JET WILL BE DIVING SOUTHEAST ON THURSDAY NIGHT...PLACING 
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF OUR AREA IN THE LEFT EXIT REGION OF THE JET AND 
500 MB VORTICITY ADVECTION. THE RESULTING LIFT SHOULD BE ADEQUATE TO 
PRODUCE SOME PRECIP IN SW VA/NE TN LATE THURSDAY NIGHT AND INTO 
FRIDAY. THE NAM IS A BIT FASTER THAN THE GFS WITH THE SYSTEM...BUT 
OTHERWISE THE MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT. WILL BRING POPS IN AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. THERE COULD BE A BRIEF PERIOD OF SNOW IN ELEVATED 
AREAS...MAINLY ABOVE 2000 FT. DO NOT EXPECT ACCUMULATIONS OF ANY 
SIGNIFICANCE GIVEN WARM GROUND TEMPS. THE JET WILL BE TO OUR EAST BY 
FRIDAY EVENING...ENDING PRECIP CHANCES. A RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD 
OVER THE AREA ON SATURDAY...KEEPING THE WEEKEND DRY.

MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE WITH THEIR DEPICTION OF AN APPROACHING 
LOW/TROUGH FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK. THE GFS SHOWS A SPLIT 
STREAM PATTERN WITH A CLOSED LOW FORMING IN THE SOUTHERN 
STREAM...HOLDING OFF PRECIP UNTIL WEDNESDAY. THE ECMWF SHOWS A 
NORTHERN STREAM LOW DIVING SOUTH AND CLOSING OFF OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS...BRINGING PRECIP IN ON MONDAY NIGHT. THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN 
SHOWS AN OPEN TROUGH WITH A POSITIVE TILT. GIVEN THE WIDE SPREAD OF 
THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS AND THUS LOW CONFIDENCE...WILL STICK CLOSER 
TO THE MEAN AND HAVE LOW CHANCE POPS IN ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY.

NW FLOW ALOFT. SURFACE RIDGE SLIDES NE OF THE AREA AND WEAK
RETURN FLOW GETS UNDERWAY THU. SHORT WAVE APPROACHES THE AREA IN NW
FLOW ON FRI WITH BROAD WEAK LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPING OVER THE OH RVR
VLY. THIS SYSTEM MOVES SE THROUGH NE MRX CWA BY FRI EVE BRINGING
LOW CHC OF LIGHT PCPN ACROSS N PART OF MRX CWA. HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEKEND WITH MILD WARMING TREND.
COMPLICATED AND TRANSITIONING JET STREAM DEVELOPING NEXT WEEK.
PRESENTLY LOOKS LIKE CUT OFF SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH TN RVR
VLY TUE-WED INITIATING NEXT CHC OF PCPN. STAYED CONSERVATIVE
REGARDING POPS FOR NOW.

245 PM EST TUE NOV 6 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...COLD AIR MASS CONTINUES TO 
PUSH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BEHIND DEPARTING COLD 
FRONT. HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING EXPECTED TO BUILD IN AT THE SURFACE

OVERNIGHT. THUS WILL UPDATE FREEZE WATCH TO FREEZE WARNING FOR ALL 
AREAS THAT HAVENT YET EXPERIENCED WIDESPREAD FREEZING TEMPS. TEMPS 
WILL REMAIN BELOW CLIMO ON WEDNESDAY AS RELATIVELY COLD AIR MASS 
REMAINS IN PLACE OVER THE REGION.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE AND NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL BE THE MAIN WEATHER MAKERS
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY CONTINUING THE DRY AND UNSEASONABLY COOL
CONDITIONS. MODELS SHOW ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE MOVING SOUTHEAST IN FAST
NORTHWEST FLOW THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. THE LATEST 12Z
GFS SHOWS A MORE SIGNIFICANT WAVE...WHILE THE ECMWF AND 00Z GFS
SHOWS THE SYSTEM MAINLY NORTH AND EAST OF THE AREA. WILL FOLLOW THE
OLD GFS AND ECMWF AND KEEP ONLY SLIGHT POPS FOR THE NORTHEAST AND
HIGH ELEVATIONS. WILL ALSO INTRODUCE A MIXER OF RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS.

RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL DOMINATE FOR THE WEEKEND WITH DRY
CONDITIONS AND MORE SEASONAL TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. ECMWF
AND GFS SHOWS A MORE SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH MOVING TOWARD THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY BY LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. CONFIDENCE WITH
THIS SYSTEM IS LOW GIVEN THAT IT IS DAY 7...BUT WILL INTRODUCE LOW
POPS AREA-WIDE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
416 AM EST TUE NOV 6 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG COLD FRONT MOVING EAST 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING. PRECIPITATION AND 
CLOUDS MAKING A RAPID EXIT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN 
THROUGH SHORT TERM WITH DPS FALLING INTO THE 20S. TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE NEARLY STEADY TODAY AND WITH BREEZY NORTHWEST WINDS...WIND CHILL
READINGS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 30S AND LOWER 40S FOR MUCH OF THE DAY. 
NEAR FREEZING TEMPS WILL PERSIST ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF 
THE SMOKYS. WENT ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE ON WIND SPEEDS BUT STAYED BELOW 
ADVISORY CRITERIA. WIDESPREAD FREEZE TONIGHT. CONTINUED FREEZE WATCH 
TONIGHT FOR PREVIOUSLY UNFROZEN THIS SEASON SOUTHERN AREAS. UPPER 
LOW OVR GRTLKS PROGGED TO MOVE NE TONIGHT. THIS RESULTS IN ENOUGH OF 
A WESTERLY COMPONENT TO KEEP GREAT LAKES MOISTURE TRAJECTORY TO THE 
NORTH OF MRX CWA. SOME SNOW FLURRIES WILL TEASE WISE AND RUSSELL 
COUNTIES IN SW VA. 
 
.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...TROUGH OVER THE EAST WITH 
RIDGING IN THE WEST CONTINUES WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE COOL WITH HIGHS ABOUT THE SAME AS TUESDAY AND THEN SLIGHTLY 
WARMER THURSDAY. WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL BE JUST AS COLD WITH A HARD 
FREEZE IN ALL LOCATIONS EXCEPT POSSIBLY IN THE KNOXVILLE AND 
CHATTANOOGA URBAN AREAS. A NEW SYSTEM DROPPING SOUTHEAST IN THE NW 
FLOW LATE THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY WILL AFFECT MAINLY THE NORTHERN PART 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. PRECIPITATION MAY BE COLD ENOUGH FOR A FEW 
SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN FOR SNOW AS TROUGH DEEPENS BUT 
WILL KEEP RAIN IN FOR NOW. UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST SATURDAY AND 
TEMPERATURES WILL WARM AS HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST. A WEAK SYSTEM 
SHOULD PASS MAINLY TO THE NORTH SUNDAY AND A STRONGER SYSTEM WILL 
APPROACH BY LATE MONDAY. LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO ADD A CHANCE OF 
RAIN IN MONDAY.    
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             56  30  55  31  60 /  10   0  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  51  28  52  30  55 /  10   0  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       53  29  52  30  56 /  10   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              49  27  48  27  53 /  10  10  10  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

     FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...GRAINGER...
     HAMBLEN...HAMILTON...JEFFERSON...KNOX...LOUDON...MARION...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 060217
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST MON NOV 5 2007

.DISCUSSION...A COLD FRONT CURRENTLY LOCATED FROM NEAR LONDON 
KENTUCKY TO NASHVILLE TENNESSEE TO JUST SOUTH OF MEMPHIS IS MOVING 
EAST AT AROUND 40 MILES AN HOUR.  THIS FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT WITH SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS IN 
ADVANCE OF THE FRONT.  TEMPERATURES WILL DROP GENERALLY AROUND 20 
DEGREES FROM MONDAYS TEMPERATURES.  THIS DROP WILL BRING OVERNIGHT 
TEMPERATURES TUESDAY NIGHT-WEDNESDAY MORNING INTO THE LOW 30S AND 
EVEN UPPER 20S IN SOME AREAS OF THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY 
WHICH WILL BRING THE THREAT OF THE FIRST HARD FREEZE OF THE SEASON 
FOR THESE AREAS.  WITH THIS IN MIND...HAVE ISSUED A FREEZE WATCH FOR 
TOMORROW NIGHT.  UPPED PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION SLIGHTLY FOR THE 
PRE-MIDNIGHT PERIOD.  NO OTHER CHANGES.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...BREEZY AFTERNOON 
ACROSS THE AREA TODAY THREATENING TO SPREAD ANY FIRES THAT START UP. 
GULF MOISTURE NOW FLOWING INTO AREA WITH DEW POINT RISING FROM 30 
DEGREES TO 47 DEGREES IN LAST FOUR HOURS AT KTYS. ALSO SAW AIRCRAFT 
SOUNDINGS FROM KTRI SHOWING DEW POINT AT 1230 UTC WAS -14 DEG 
C...VERSUS +1 DEG C AT 1845 UTC. NOT THAT WILD FIRE THREAT HAS GONE 
AWAY...BUT FIRE BEHAVIOR WONT BE QUITE AS BAD NOW THAT MOISTURE IS 
MOVING IN.  

SHOULD BE WINDY ENOUGH TO WARRANT WIND ADVISORY IN E TN/W NC
MOUNTAINS...AND THINK THIS WILL BE FURTHER ALERT TO FIRE AND
FORESTRY AGENCIES FOR POSSIBLE FAST SPREADING FIRES AT HIGHER
ELEVATIONS.

WITH DEW POINTS RISING...INSTABILITY WILL BE GETTING BETTER FOR
STORMS...BUT THINK THAT TIMING WILL KEEP MOST OF ACTIVITY AS JUST
SHOWERS. FOR QPF...THINK 0.2 TO 0.3 INCH BASIN-AVERAGE AMOUNTS WILL
BE ABOUT IT SINCE MOVEMENT WILL BE PRETTY FAST.

WENT ON WARM SIDE OF GUIDANCE FOR LOWS AND HIGHS THESE TWO PERIODS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AFTER COLD FRONT EXITS
AREA TUESDAY, EXPECT SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT TO STAY A LITTLE
TIGHT UNTIL MIDNIGHT OR SO, PROVIDING SOME BREEZY CONDITIONS INTO
THE NIGHT. BUT WINDS WILL DIE DOWN THROUGH THE NIGHT. STILL, WITH
COLDER AIR AND A LITTLE WIND IT WILL BE THE RAWEST NIGHT OF THE
SEASON SO FAR. SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH
DRIER AND COOLER AIR, BUT THEN ANOTHER WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE NORTH
PORTIONS AND PROVIDES JUST ENOUGH LIFT TO BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS. PREVIOUS PACKAGE HAD DRY WITH A LITTLE DOUBT, AND I HAVE
OPTED TO BRING LOW POPS INTO THE PICTURE LATE THURSDAY AND EARLY
FRIDAY. AFTER THIS ANOTHER DRY PERIOD. TEMPS MORE LIKE SEASONAL.
RAIN AMOUNTS NOT EXPECTED TO BE ANYTHING TO WRITE HOME ABOUT AND
WILL SAY THAT THE DROUGHT WILL CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY WORSEN FOR
ANOTHER WEEK.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  46  56  30  55  33 /  50  10   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  43  50  28  52  32 /  60  10   
0  10  10 OAK RIDGE, TN  43  55  29  52  32 /  70  10   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  41  51  27  50  29 /  80  10  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 051645
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1145 AM EST MON NOV 5 2007

.DISCUSSION...
HAVE MADE A FEW UPDATES IN TEMP...DEW POINT...AND RH GRIDS...BUT
VERY FEW CHANGES AFFECT WHAT IS IN THE ZONES. LOOKING CLOSELY AT
FIRE WEATHER SITUATION...WINDS WILL BE PICKING UP THIS AFTERNOON AS
RIDGE SLIDES AWAY TO EAST...BUT PRETTY QUICKLY AFTER WINDS PICK UP
HUMIDITIES WILL BE RISING AS WELL. SOME MOUNTAIN PEAKS MAY GET RED
FLAG CRITERIA BRIEFLY...BUT MOISTURE WILL RUSH IN QUICKLY ENOUGH
THAT THESE CONDITIONS WILL NOT BE PREDOMINANT THIS AFTERNOON. WITH
ON-GOING DROUGHT AND DRY FUELS...CLOSE WATCH SHOULD BE KEPT ON
SITUATION BY FORESTRY AND FIRE FIGHTING AGENCIES...EVEN WITH
HUMIDITY LEVELS RISING.

LOOKING AT THUNDER POTENTIAL...BEST CHANCES AFTER SUNSET THIS
EVENING...MOVING IN FROM NORTHWEST. NIGHT-TIME COOLING WILL BE
TAKING EFFECT BY THEN...THINKING L.I. VALUES WILL PROBABLY ONLY BE
ABOUT -1 TO -2 IN NORTHWEST ZONES...THEN GETS EVEN MORE STABLE
LATER TONIGHT AS PRECIP MOVES FARTHER EAST AND SOUTHEAST. BEST
CHANCES FOR ANYTHING CLOSE TO SEVERE IS STRONG OUTFLOW WINDS BEING
TRANSPORTED DOWNWARD IN RAIN SHAFT...POSSIBLY ONLY FROM A SHOWER
RATHER THAN A THUNDERSTORM.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST MON NOV 5 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT) ...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING OVER THE 
AREA WILL SUPPRESS SOUTH TODAY. SW FLOW AND WAA WILL GET UNDERWAY
THIS MORNING AND GET MODERATELY STRONG BY THIS AFTN. WITH MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES...TEMPS WILL RISE >= 30 DEGREES BEFORE SUNSET. STAYED 
CONSERVATIVE WITH MAX TEMPS BUT THESE MAY HAVE TO BE UPPED IN 
MORNING UPDATE. DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER GRTLKS WITH 
STRONG JET CARVING INTO OH RVR VLY THROUGH PERIOD. SIGNIFICANT COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE RAPIDLY SE INTO THE S APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. RIDGING 
TO THE SOUTH HAS GLFMEX PRETTY WELL CUT OFF AND LCH 05/00Z SOUNDING 
SUPPORTS THE LACK OF UPSTREAM MOISTURE. THE MODELS HOWEVER ARE VERY 
AGGRESSIVE IN THETA-E RIDGING WORKING ITS WAY INTO MRX CWA THIS 
EVENING IN ADVANCE OF THE COLD FRONT. INSTABILITY IS ON THE LOW SIDE 
BUT DECENT BULK SHEAR ASSOCIATED WITH DEEP JET WILL LIKELY AID 
SHOWER DEVELOPMENT ALONG FRONT. LEFT POPS ON THE HIGH SIDE AND NEAR 
MOS GUIDANCE. PCPN EVENT WILL BE BRIEF WITH FAST MOVING SHOWERS AND 
SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL AMOUNTS ARE NOT EXPECTED. WARM SECTOR AND POST 
FRONTAL WINDS WILL BE BREEZY. LAKE WIND OR WIND ADVISORIES MAY BE 
NEEDED TONIGHT FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WIND CHILLS BY DAYBREAK WILL 
BE IN THE 30S MOST AREAS. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED 
PRECIP WILL QUICKLY EXIT THE REGION EARLY TUESDAY.  WILL KEEP SOME 
LOW POPS EARLY...THEN DRYING OUT BY AFTERNOON.  WINDS WILL BE BREEZY 
DIRECTLY BEHIND THE FRONT ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON.  ALSO BEHIND THE 
FRONT...A STRONG SURFACE HIGH WILL SLIDE IN PROVIDING A RETURN TO A 
DRY WEATHER PATTERN.  A COUPLE OF LOWS TRACK THROUGH TO OUR NORTH 
DURING THE LATER HALF OF THE EXTENDED.  THESE ARE GENERALLY PROGGED 
TO STAY TO OUR NORTH...ONLY BRINGING US OCCASIONAL BANDS OF CLOUDS.  
WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE TRACK OF THESE LOWS BUT FOR NOW WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR THIS PERIOD.  GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
LOOKS GOOD AND DIDN/T STRAY FAR.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST SUN NOV 4 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
DOMINATE OUR WEATHER TONIGHT...PROVIDING MAINLY CLEAR AND CHILLY 
CONDITIONS.  A COLD FRONT WILL BE APPROACHING LATE TOMORROW FROM THE 
NORTHWEST.  MODELS DIFFER A BIT ON SPEED OF THIS SYSTEM...AND THINK 
A COMPROMISE LOOKS GOOD FOR NOW.  WITH THAT IN MIND...SHOULD SEE AN 
INCREASE IN CLOUDS TOMORROW AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY NORTHWEST 
ZONES...AND WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS LATE FOR NORTHERN PLATEAU 
AND SOME OF SW VA.  ONLY SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS.  WILL 
MENTION PATCHY FROST AGAIN IN AREAS THAT ARE STILL IN THE FALL 
FREEZE PROGRAM. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS FAIRLY AGREEABLE 
ON BRINGING A COLD THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT. WILL BUMP UP 
POPS TO 50 TO 70 PERCENT FOR MONDAY NIGHT WITH THE BEST POPS IN THE 
NORTH WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH 
FOR ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION.  FRONT EXITS THE AREA QUICKLY ON 
TUESDAY...WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR ONLY THE MORNING HOURS.  HIGH 
PRESSURE BRINGING COOLER AND DRY WEATHER WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  A 
SHORTWAVE APPROACHES THE AREA ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...BEST 
MOISTURE  REMAINS TO THE NORTH OF OUR CWA...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A 
DRY FORECAST FOR BOTH PERIODS.  RIDGING BUILDS IN ON SATURDAY.  GFS 
INDICATING ANOTHER FRONT ENTERING THE REGION ON SUNDAY.  WITH THE 
RIDGE IN PLACE...WILL KEEP THE WEEKEND DRY FOR NOW.  STAYED NEAR 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EDT SAT NOV 3 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
DOMINATE OUR WEATHER THROUGH SUNDAY.  A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT WAVES 
WILL BRING A SOME MID/HIGH CLOUDS EARLY THIS EVENING AND AGAIN LATE

PATCHY FROST AGAIN FOR TONIGHT IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY ZONES 
WHERE FREEZE PROGRAM HAS NOT ENDED YET.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAIN FOCUS IN LONG TERM 
REMAINS LATE MONDAY/EARLY TUESDAY RAIN EVENT. STILL SOME MINOR 
TIMING ISSUES BETWEEN MODELS AND ENSEMBLES...BUT BEST CHANCE STILL 
APPEARS TO BE BETWEEN 00Z AND 12Z TUESDAY. UNFORTUNATELY...THIS 
STILL DOES NOT LOOK TO BE A MAJOR RAIN EVENT. NEVERTHELESS...HAVE 
BUMPED UP POPS SOMEWHAT AS COVERAGE NOW APPEARS WILL BE SOMEWHAT 
BETTER THAN PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED. THE GFS HINTS AT ANOTHER MINOR 
EVENT BY LATE THURSDAY...BUT HAS NO SUPPORT FROM THE ENSEMBLES AND 
WILL BE DISCOUNTED AT THIS TIME. AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH WITH 
CONSIDERABLE NEGATIVE HEIGHT ANOMALIES FOLLOWS MONDAY NIGHTS EVENT 
AND PORTENDS WELL-BELOW-CLIMO TEMPS FOR MID WEEK BEFORE REBOUNDING 
TO NEAR CLIMO BY THE END OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...

MORNING. A RIDGE AXIS EXTENDS FROM NORTHEAST TO SOUTHWEST ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...PREVENTING ANY DEEP MOISTURE FROM FEEDING 
INTO THE AREA AHEAD OF THE FRONT. WITH MOISTURE CONFINED BELOW 800

SPRINKLES IN NORTHERN SECTION OF THE AREA...AND WILL LEAVE THIS IN 
THE FORECAST AS RADAR CURRENTLY SHOWS SOME VERY LIGHT RETURNS IN 
CENTRAL KY. WINDS SHIFT TO THE NORTH BEHIND THE FRONT AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA. SKIES SHOULD CLEAR IN THE EVENING AS 
THE 850 MB FRONT PASSES THROUGH. THE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE MOVES 
QUICKLY EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES...BUT IS FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER 
HIGH. THIS WILL KEEP CLEAR SKIES AND DRY WEATHER FOR THE AREA 
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT WITH TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO NORMAL.


.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AN UPPER TROF MOVES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY WITHOUT
MUCH CONSEQUENCE OTHER THAN A FEW CLOUDS AND A SLIGHT DROP IN MAX
TEMPS. NEXT SHORT WAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES ON
TUESDAY WITH COLD FRONT ADVANCING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA DURING
THE DAY. WENT AHEAD AND INTRODUCED SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR
MAINLY HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING TUESDAY EVENING AS WRAP
AROUND PRECIP DEVELOPS WITH COLDER AIR BUILDING IN ALOFT. DRIER
NORTHWEST FLOW FORMS BEHIND THIS SYSTEM ALLOWING FOR A DRY AND
COOLER WEDNESDAY.

IN TEMPERATURES. A SOMEWHAT MORE SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROF/FRONT

TO THE NORTH ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. NOT READY TO ADD ANY CHANCE OF
RAIN AT THIS POINT. WITH THIS NEXT TROF ANOTHER SLIGHT DROP IN
TEMPERATURES. A MORE SIGNIFICANT FRONT DEVELOPS ON THE HEELS OF THE
TUESDAY SYSTEM WHICH COULD GIVE THE FIRST RAIN OF THE MONTH. STAYED
CLOSE TO A BLEND OF MET AND MAV GUIDANCE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH
FRIDAY NIGHT AND THE MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE FOR THE WEEKEND THROUGH
MID WEEK.

AND GFS/ECMWF INDICATES 500 MB TROF NOT QUITE AS AMPLIFIED AS 
PREVIOUS MODEL SOLUTION. THE JURYS STILL OUT ON THIS SYSTEM AND

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 AM EDT TUE OCT 30 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
CONDITIONS ARE IDEAL FOR RADIATIONAL COOLING THIS MORNING...AND 
EXPECT A SOLID FREEZE IN MUCH OF THE WARNING AREA. THE NPW AND SPS 
WILL BE CONTINUED. HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE CAROLINAS AND VIRGINIA 
THIS MORNING WILL DRIFT TO THE EAST...WITH A RIDGE AXIS EXTENDING 
SOUTHWEST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO A 
SLIGHT WARMING TREND TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. A TROUGH AND UPPER JET 
APPROACH FROM THE WEST...PUSHING A FRONT INTO OUR AREA ON THURSDAY. 
THE RIDGE AXIS TO OUR SOUTH AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL PREVENT ANY 
RETURN OF GULF MOISTURE...AND THE FROPA WILL BE DRY. EXPECT ONLY AN 
INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND A WIND SHIFT WITH THE FRONT. ANOTHER CANADIAN 
HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO BUILD INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY 
NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...
.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
PERIOD CHARACTERIZED BY HARMLESS WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT
COMPLETE WITH A COUPLE OF WEAK IMPULSES. HOWEVER...SOUTHEASTERN
U.S. LOW LEVEL RIDGING KEEPS GULF OF MEXICO SHUT DOWN IN TERMS OF
MOISTURE RETURN AND THEREFORE...POPS BELOW 15 PERCENT. STAYED CLOSE
TO GUIDANCE WHICH DOESNT TREND TOO FAR FROM SEASONAL MAX/MIN TEMPS
FOR THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND APPALACHIAN REGION.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL

ONCE AGAIN TONIGHT...LOWS WILL DROP DOWN TO NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE MRX CWA.  WILL CONTINUE THE FREEZE WARNING FOR 
TUESDAY MORNING FOR MUCH OF THE AREA...EXCEPT SOUTHERN ZONES.  
OTHERWISE... EXPECT CONTINUED CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS.  
TUESDAY/S HIGHS WILL BE A BIT WARMER THAN TODAY/S WITH TEMPERATURES 
CLIMBING TO AROUND 70 ACROSS MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A COUPLE OF WEAK SYSTEMS 
DUE INTO THE AREA LATER THIS WEEK...BUT MAINLY AFFECTING AREAS TO 
THE NORTH WITH RESPECT TO PRECIP.  THINK BEST CHANCES WITH SECOND 
SYSTEM DUE IN ON FRIDAY...ESPECIALLY IN UPSLOPE AREAS...BUT HAVE 
LEFT POP GRIDS BELOW 15% FOR NOW.  AT END OF PERIOD ANOTHER SYSTEM 
SHOULD BE APPROACHING...BUT FOR NOW LOOKS TO JUST AFTER THE END OF 
THIS FORECAST.  FOR TEMPS...WENT PRETTY CLOSE TO GFS MOS...EXCEPT 
HAVE WARMED UP A LITTLE IMMEDIATEDY PRE-FRONTAL AND COOLED A LITTLE 
IMMEDIATELY POST-FRONTAL TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT MON OCT 29 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL CONTINUE TO SETTLE TO THE 
SOUTHEAST OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THE COLDEST TEMPS OF THE SEASON 
ARE UPON US...WITH TEMPS CURRENTLY IN THE UPPER 30S IN SW VA...NE 
TN...THE MOUNTAINS AND SW NC. AREAS IN THE FREEZE WARNING THIS 
MORNING LOOK TO BE ON TRACK FOR A FREEZE...AND WILL KEEP THE CURRENT 
WARNING AS IS. TODAY...TEMPS SHOULD RISE QUICKLY IN A DRY AIR 
MASS...INTO THE 60S IN MOST SPOTS WITH 50S IN THE MOUNTAINS. DRY AIR 
ALOFT WILL MIX DOWN...AND MAY CAUSE DEWPOINTS TO DROP QUICKLY DURING 
THE DAY...PROBABLY WELL BELOW MOS GUIDANCE VALUES. RH VALUES SHOULD
DROP WELL INTO THE 20% RANGE. LOWS TONIGHT SHOULD BE EVEN
COLDER THAN THIS MORNING...WITH THE FREEZE AREA EXPANDING TO THE
SOUTH. WILL ISSUE A FREEZE WARNING FOR MUCH OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY
AND NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. IT IS POSSIBLE THAT THE SOUTHERN
PLATEAU COULD FREEZE TONIGHT...BUT WILL LET THE DAY SHIFT EVALUATE
AND EXPAND THE WARNING IF NEEDED. WILL CONTINUE THE SPS FOR
SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL ON TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR BOTH DAYS. A WEAK FRONT TRACKS
INTO THE REGION ON THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO FRIDAY. MOISTURE AND
LIFT IS LIMITED...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR THURSDAY
AND FRIDAY. GFS INDICATING ANOTHER WEAK FRONT PUSHING THROUGH THE
AREA ON SATURDAY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED AGAIN AS IT TRACKS THROUGH
THE CWA...SO WILL KEEP SATURDAY DRY FOR NOW. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS
IN ON SUNDAY...PROVIDING ANOTHER DRY DAY TO END THE WEEKEND. STAYED
NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SUN OCT 28 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID 
MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR FILTERING INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL THAT THE EARLIER CLOUDS THIS 
MORNING ARE GRADUALLY EVAPORATING THIS AFTERNOON. THIS AREA OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BECOME CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
TONIGHT...WITH EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS PRODUCING 
THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON. WITH LOW DEWPOINTS EXPECTED 
TONIGHT...IT APPEARS THAT TEMPS WILL FALL TO AROUND FREEZING TOWARDS 
SUNRISE ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND 
EXTREME SOUTHWEST NC. THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE FREEZE WARNING IN 
THESE AREAS FOR MONDAY MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE LINGERS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY...WITH SUB-FREEZING TEMPS EXPECTED AGAIN ON 
TUESDAY MORNING IN THE WARNED AREA. IN FACT...GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
SUGGEST THAT TEMPS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES COLDER ON TUESDAY MORNING. 
WILL NOT PLAN TO ISSUE A FREEZE WATCH FOR TUESDAY MORNING TO AVOID 
ANY CONFUSION WITH THE WARNING FOR TONIGHT. BESIDES...THE GROWING 
SEASON MAY END MONDAY MORNING IN THE WARNED AREA ANYWAYS. WILL PLAN 
TO CONTINUE THE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR THE REST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...WHERE TEMPS SHOULD FALL INTO THE 30S ALLOWING 
SCATTERED AREAS OF FROST TO FORM AROUND SUNRISE BOTH MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY MORNINGS. SOUTHERLY FLOW COMMENCES OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON 
TUESDAY...WITH TEMPS QUICKLY WARMING SEVERAL DEGREES ON TUESDAY 
NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH 
THE FORECAST PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...CONTINUED DRY AND MILD ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE REMAINING THE DOMINATE WEATHER FEATURE. 
MODELS INDICATE A VERY WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIDING ACROSS THE 
REGION AROUND THE THURSDAY/FRIDAY TIME FRAME. THERE HAS BEEN POOR 
MODEL RUN CONSISTENCY IN TIMING AND STRENGTH OF THIS FEATURE...AND 
AT THIS POINT...FRONTAL PASSAGE LOOKS TO BE DRY WITH MAYBE A FEW 
CLOUD BANDS MOVING THROUGH THE AREA. THEREFORE...HAVE KEPT FORECAST 
DRY. FOR THE WEEKEND...MODELS SHOWING A SECOND WEAK FRONT TRACKING 
THROUGH. MOISTURE AND ENERGY LOOK TO BE QUITE LIMITED AND WILL KEEP 
THE FORECAST DRY ONCE AGAIN. AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
LOOK REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
412 AM EDT SUN OCT 28 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE ROTATING
THROUGH THE AREA BRINGING BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUDS TO THE CWA THIS
MORNING.  MOISTURE AND LIFT IS LIMITED...SO WILL NOT ADD ANY
PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR TODAY. THE CLOUDS SHOULD DISSIPATE BY
AFTERNOON AS THE SHORTWAVE HEADS EAST AND DRIER AIR BUILDS IN
BEHIND IT. HIGH PRESSURE PUSHES IN TONIGHT AND LINGERS INTO
TUESDAY...BRINGING A CLEAR TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKY AND COOLER
TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE PERIOD. MAY SEE FREEZING TEMPERATURES TONIGHT
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE MOUNTAINS OF
EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. WILL KEEP THE
FREEZE WATCH GOING FOR THE COUNTIES CURRENTLY IN THE WATCH. IN
ADDITION...AREAS OF FROST WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER THE REST OF THE
CWA. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

IN CONTROL TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER. A
WEAK FRONT TRACKS INTO THE REGION ON THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO

FXUS64 KMRX 271832
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT SAT OCT 27 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE PLAINS...WITH 
A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID WEST. THIS WEAK COLD FRONT SHOULD 
HELP PUSH THE CLOUDS CURRENTLY OVER MIDDLE TN AND SOUTHEAST KY OUT 
OF THE REGION LATER TONIGHT. BEFORE THEN...SOME OF THIS MOISTURE MAY 
MOVE OVER THE VALLEYS LATER THIS EVENING AS DOWNSLOPE FLOW BEGINS TO 
DIMINISH. THE HIGH PRESSURE AREA OVER THE PLAINS IS PROGGED TO 
BECOME CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY SUNDAY 
NIGHT...WITH GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS PRODUCING THE 
COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON. IT APPEARS THAT A WIDESPREAD FREEZE WILL 
BE POSSIBLE TOWARDS SUNRISE ON MONDAY MORNING ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VA...NORTHEAST TN... THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST 
NC...SO WILL ISSUE A FREEZE WATCH FOR THESE AREAS. WILL ALSO ISSUE A 
SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA WHERE 
TEMPS SHOULD FALL INTO THE 30S...ALLOWING FOR SCATTERED AREAS OF 
FROST TO FORM AROUND SUNRISE. SIMILAR TEMPS ARE EXPECTED AGAIN ON 
TUESDAY MORNING...BUT WILL NOT EXTEND THE WATCH PAST SUNDAY 
NIGHT/MONDAY MORNING AT THIS TIME TO AVOID ANY CONFUSION. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL FOR 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. MODEL CONSISTENCY REMAINS POOR BEYOND THAT. 
THERE IS SOME INDICATION A WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SLIDE 
THROUGH AROUND THE THURSDAY TIME FRAME...BUT MOISTURE/LIFT QUITE 
WEAK SO WILL LEAVE FORECAST DRY THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD. 
STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EDT SAT OCT 27 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS YESTERDAYS AREA OF LOW PRESSURE NOW 
IN THE GREAT LAKES REGION...WITH A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE PLAINS EXTENDING INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY. SATELLITE IMAGES 
REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDINESS OVER MIDDLE TN BEING 
GENERATED BY A STRONG SHORT WAVE ASSOCIATED WITH THE DEPARTING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES. MESO-WRF MODEL INDICATES THAT 
THE MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SHORT WAVE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE 
EASTWARD THIS AFTERNOON...SO WILL PLAN TO INCREASE CLOUD COVER 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FOR THIS AFTERNOON. DOWNSLOPE FLOW OFF OF 
THE PLATEAU SHOULD HELP TO CREATE BREAKS IN THIS CLOUD COVER...SO 
WILL ONLY MENTION PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS THE VALLEY ZONES...AND 
MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS THE PLATEAU ZONES WHERE CLOUDS SHOULD 
REMAIN MORE EXTENSIVE. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO TWEAK 
CLOUDS...TEMPS AND WINDS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 AM EDT SAT OCT 27 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT IS MOVING THROUGH THE

MOMENT. LOWER DEWPOINTS ARE MOVING INTO THE AREA BEHIND THE 
FRONT...ALONG WITH A WIND SHIFT TO THE WEST AND NORTHWEST. DAYTIME 
MIXING SHOULD SCOUR OUT MOST OF THE LINGERING CLOUDS IN NE TN AND SW 
VA THIS MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE BUILDING INTO THE AREA 
THROUGH THE DAY. SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY...AND 
WILL GO WITH THE WARMER GFS MOS FOR TEMPS TODAY. THE MODELS INDICATE 
CLOUDS RETURNING IN NORTHERN SECTIONS TONIGHT ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
850 MB TROUGH. WILL INCREASE CLOUDS IN THE NORTH AFTER 00Z TO MOSTLY 
CLOUDY AND HAVE TEMPS A BIT ABOVE GUIDANCE THERE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE IS EXPECTED TO 
TRACK THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY.  WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AND 
LIFT AVAILABLE...WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN ON 
MONDAY KEEPING DRY WEATHER INTO WEDNESDAY ALONG WITH TEMPERATURES 
CLOSER TO SEASONAL LEVELS.  TWO DISTURBANCES APPROACH THE REGION ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON THE 
TIMING AND STRENGTH OF THE FEATURES...WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY 
FORECAST FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  STAYED NEAR MOS GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

APPALACHIANS. AN EXTENSIVE MID-LEVEL DRY SLOT CURRENTLY OCCUPIES THE 
FORECAST AREA...AND SHOULD CONTINUE TO PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS 
THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES NORTHEAST INTO THE 
GREAT LAKES REGION. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS INTO THE REGION FOR 
THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD...WITH TEMPS COOLING TO NEAR 
NORMAL LEVELS BY SUNDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT AND LOOK REASONABLE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...QUIET WEATHER PATTERN 
DEVELOPING OVER THE REGION FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD. HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE...PROVIDING DRY CONDITIONS AND 
SEASONAL TEMPERATURES. ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...MODELS INDICATE THE 
APPROACH OF A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES MOVING THROUGH THE REGION. 
HOWEVER...MODEL AND RUN CONSISTENCY POOR...SO FOR NOW WILL LEAVE THE 
FORECAST DRY UNTIL THERE IS A BETTER HANDLE ON TRACK...TIMING AND 
OVERALL STRENGTH OF THE WAVES.

FXUS64 KMRX 260737
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT FRI OCT 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE CLOSED LOW OVER WEST TN WILL 
BEGIN TO LIFT TO THE NORTH TODAY. THE MAIN PRECIPITATION BAND 
REMAINS TO OUR EAST...WITH A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS OVER ALABAMA AND 
MIDDLE TN. WV IMAGERY INDICATES A SLIGHT WESTWARD MOVEMENT OF THE 
MOIST TONGUE TO OUR EAST. AS A RESULT...PRECIP COULD MOVE INTO 
EXTREME NORTHEAST TN AND SW VA TODAY. THE POP GRADIENT WILL BE TIGHT 
ALONG OUR NORTHEAST BORDER COUNTIES...BUT WILL INCLUDE CHANCE POPS 
FOR THAT AREA ONLY. WITH PLENTY OF DRY AIR IN THE MID LEVELS AND A 
STRONG INVERSION BETWEEN 800 AND 700 MB...DO NOT EXPECT ANY PRECIP 
IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS. MOS GUIDANCE IS SHOWING 
OVERCAST CLOUDS THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY...BUT IT WILL LIKELY BE 
MAINLY BROKEN...ALLOWING MORE SUN AND WARMING TEMPS. WILL LEAN TEMPS 
TO THE WARMER SIDE OF MOS. AS THE LOW LIFTS TO THE NORTH...HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD IN FROM THE WEST...SHIFTING WINDS FROM 
SOUTH TO WEST AND ADVECTING DRIER AIR INTO THE LOW LEVELS. WILL KEEP 
SOME LINGERING CLOUDS NORTHEAST...WHILE THE REST OF THE AREA SHOULD 
SEE DECREASING CLOUDS OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE IS 
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO MOVE WELL NORTH OF OUR CWA ON SATURDAY 
KEEPING THE DEEPEST MOISTURE NORTH... WILL KEEP SATURDAY DRY.  A 
WEAK FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY.  WITH ONLY LIMITED 
MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS AVAILABLE...WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW.  
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION ON MONDAY AND LINGERS INTO 
THURSDAY.  WILL CONTINUE WITH THE DRY FORECAST FOR THE REST OF THE 
PERIOD.  STAYED NEAR MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE

SATURDAY MORNING...AS THE DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE LOWER MS 
RIVER VALLEY FINALLY LIFTS NORTH INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION. AS FOR

WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS EXPECTED. OTHERWISE...MOS GUIDANCE APPEARS TO 
BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND LOOKS REASONABLE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW THAT HAS INFLUENCED 
WEATHER FOR THE PAST WEEK FINALLY PICKED UP BY NORTHERN STREAM AND 
MOVES OUT OF THE REGION WITH CLEARING SKIES RETURNING.  TEMPERATURES 
WILL REMAIN MODERATE AND NEAR SEASONAL NUMBERS THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 250734
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
334 AM EDT THU OCT 25 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
REMAINS UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF PESKY UPPER LOW WHICH CONTINUES TO 
MEANDER OVER THE EASTERN MISSISSIPPI/WESTERN ALABAMA AREA. 
OPERATIONAL MODELS AND SREF PROJECT THIS FEATURE WILL BEGIN TO DRIFT 
TO THE NORTHWEST OVER THE SHORT TERM. THIS WILL RESULT IN ASSOCIATED 
DRY SLOT BEING POSITIONED GENERALLY OVER OUR FORECAST AREA. 
ANTICIPATE PRECIP WILL BECOME INCREASINGLY WIDELY SCATTERED WITH 
BEST CHANCE REMAINING IN OUR NORTHEASTERN ZONES. FOR TEMPS...GFS 
GUIDANCE APPEARS REASONABLE AND DID NOT VARY SIGNIFICANTLY FROM 
THOSE VALUES.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...VERY GOOD CONSENSUS AMONGST
GFS...NAM-WRF...AND ENSEMBLES IN HANDLING THE CLOSED UPPER LOW WHICH
LIFTS N TO NE BY FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. THUS...WAS CONFIDENT
ENOUGH TO LOWER POPS FOR EARLY PERIODS FROM FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY
NIGHT. ALSO...ADJUSTED SKY COVER A BIT DOWN AS WELL...WITH TIME
HEIGHT SECTIONS SHOWING DRYING EXCEPT FOR SURFACE TO AROUND 600 MB
LEVEL BY SATURDAY. LOW LEVEL FLOW KEEPS AN E OR SE PATTERN FOR
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY TO PROVIDE SOME DOWNSLOPING...AND SUPPORTS
WARMER MAX TEMPS FOR BOTH TYS AND TRI (ALSO CHA AREA GETS BETTER
LOW LEVEL COLD AIR ADVECTION).  

OTHERWISE...CONTINUED DRY WEATHER WITH VERY NEAR SEASONAL TEMPS FOR
SUNDAY AND MONDAY...THEN A BIT ABOVE CLIMO VALUES BY TUESDAY INTO
THURSDAY AS HEIGHTS RISE AND LOW LEVEL COLD AIR ADVECTION GIVES WAY
TO WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MAX/MIN TEMPS
ADJUSTED IN LINE WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS AND 25/00Z GFSX MOS NUMBERS.

VAPOR SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A DRY SLOT OVER MIDDLE TN AND MOST 
OF ALABAMA AHEAD OF THIS UPPER LOW. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT THIS DRY SLOT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TOMORROW... 
WITH ONLY A FEW SCATTERED AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN EXPECTED. THIS UPPER 
LOW IS PROGGED TO MEANDER ACROSS THE LOWER AND MID MS RIVER VALLEY 
THROUGH FRIDAY...BEFORE SLOWLY LIFTING NORTH ON FRIDAY NIGHT. THE 
LOCAL ATMOSPHERE APPEARS TO REMAIN STABLE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD...SO WILL PLAN TO MENTION LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN 
WHERE THE OCCLUDED FRONT SHOULD CONTINUE TO RESIDE. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL BASICALLY GO WITH A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE THREE SET OF MOS 
GUIDANCE THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LOW/TROF CONTINUES 
ITS TREK ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY 
SATURDAY AND MAINTAINED SOME SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE 
POSSIBILITY OF A SHOWER WITH THE DEPARTING LOW. KEPT THE REMAINDER 
OF THE FORECAST UNEVENTFUL WITH A DRY WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
AND SURFACE RIDGING BUILDING SLOWLY SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE REGION. 
STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGHOUT.

WET WEATHER...AND ALSO NOT MUCH DEVIATION FROM ENSEMBLES. PREVIOUS
FORECAST GRIDS FOR THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED...
AND STILL (UNFORTUNATELY) SEE OUR RAIN CHANCES DECREASING FOR THESE
PERIODS AS THE UPPER LOW DRIFTS SLIGHTLY W AND NW. SURFACE LOW
DEVELOPMENT STILL LOOKS TO SET UP A SE LOW LEVEL FLOW FROM THURSDAY
INTO FRIDAY...WHICH SHOULD ALSO INHIBIT RAIN CHANCES IN DOWNSLOPE
AREAS. 

OTHERWISE...SOME LINGERING CHANCE POPS INTO SATURDAY AS CLOSED LOW
OPENS UP AND LIFTS NE...FOLLOWED BY A DRY PERIOD FROM SAT NIGHT TO
THE NEW DAY 7 (WEDNESDAY). LOW LEVEL FLOW BEHIND THE EXITING UPPER
LOW/TROUGH FAVORS THE LATEST AND COOLER MOS MAX/MIN TEMPS. THUS...
TEMPS WERE TWEAKED IN LINE WITH 24/00Z GFSX MOS GUIDANCE.

833 PM EDT TUE OCT 23 2007

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE ANALYSIS...VWP DATA...AND OUR ANEMOMETER INDICATE THAT THE
FRONT HAS JUST PASSED OVER OUR OFFICE. WINDS IN THE ADVISORY AREA
HAVE DECREASED AND SHIFTED TO THE WSW. THUS WILL ALLOW THE WIND
ADVISORY TO EXPIRE AT 9 PM. THE BAND OF RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH THE
FRONT AS BEEN PRODUCING GENERALLY BETWEEN A QUARTER AND A HALF INCH
OF RAIN...THOUGH ITS INTENSITY HAS BEEN DIMINISHING AS IT MOVES
EAST. AS THE FRONT MOVES AWAY FROM THE UPPER LOW...IT WILL LIKELY
SLOW AND STALL NEAR THE MOUNTAINS. LIGHTER SHOWERS ASSOCIATED WITH
THE UPPER JET STREAK OVER AL WILL AFFECT SOUTHERN AND WESTERN
PORTIONS OF THE ARA OVERNIGHT. THE MODELS DONT SHOW MUCH STRONG
LIFT OVER THE AREA OVERNIGHT BEHIND THE FRONT...SO EXPECT QPF TO BE
LOW. WILL ADJUST THE POPS TO RAISE THEM IN THE NE AND LOWER
SLIGHTLY IN THE SW.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 PM EDT TUE OCT 23 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SLUGGISH UPPER LOW AND 
ASSOCIATED MOIST PLUME APPEAR TO BE HEADED EWD NEXT 24 
HOURS...BRINGING HEART OF PLUME THROUGH AREA.  THINKING THAT KCHA 
AREA TO TN/NC/GA BORDER AND POINTS NORTHWARD WILL GET BEST 
RAINS...AS ANY LOCATIONS FARTHER TO THE NORTHEAST WILL HAVE PRECIP 
AMOUNTS CUT DOWN BY HIGH TERRAIN AS THE SOUTHERLY FLOW PASSAGE OVER 
MOUNTAINS.  JUST MARGINAL INSTABILITY AND VERY VERY LITTLE LIGHTNING 
SO FAR...SO HAVE LEFT PRECIP AS SHOWERS FOR THIS EVENING WITH NO 
MENTION OF THUNDER.

FOR WEDNESDAY MOIST AXIS ROTATES INTO NORTHEAST TN...BUT 
ONCE AGAIN LOTS OF MOUNTAINS TO CONTEND WITH...SO JUST GOING WITH 
40-50 PERCENT POPS IN THE NORTHEAST VALLEY.  FARTHER WEST...LOOKS 
LIKE KCHA WILL GET INTO DRY SLOT FOR THE AFTERNOON...SO HAVE CUT 
BACK POPS FOR PM TO JUST SLIGHT CHANCE.  WENT ON HIGH SIDE OF 
GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPS WEDNESDAY FOR NORTHEAST DOWNSLOPE AREAS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...FORECAST FOR LONG 
TERM PERIOD STILL HAS VERY HIGH UNCERTAINTY LEVEL. BIGGEST ISSUE IS 
WHERE UPPER LOW ENDS UP BEFORE IT BEGINS TO LIFT OUT.  UNCERTAINTIES 
IN HOW MUCH INTERACTION THERE WILL BE WITH THE NORTHERN STREAM 
CONTINUE...AND MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT. 12Z NAM A WESTERN 
OUTLIER...WHILE 12Z GFS HAS SHIFTED MUCH FURTHER EAST.  00Z ECMWF 
FAIRLY FAR EAST BUT FARTHER SOUTH...AND OTHER MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
HAVE VARYING SOLUTIONS.  WHERE THIS UPPER LOW SETS UP HAS HUGE 
IMPLICATIONS FOR OUR FORECAST...AND SINCE THERE IS SUCH UNCERTAINTY 
WILL TEND TO BROAD BRUSH THINGS.  SINCE RECENT MODEL TRENDS HAVE 
GENERALLY BEEN EAST...WILL GO WITH A BLEND BUT LEAN CLOSER TO THE 
GFS THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT.  LATEST GFS IS DRYING THINGS OUT QUICKLY 
BY FRIDAY...BUT FOR NOW WILL STAY CLOSER TO CONTINUITY AND THE 00Z 
GFS...KEEPING POPS INTO SATURDAY.  WILL GO DRY FOR SUNDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY.  WILL ADJUST MAV MOS TEMPS UP QUITE A BIT FOR WED NIGHT 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...THEN JUST A FEW TWEAKS TO 00Z MEX NUMBERS 
LATER PERIODS.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RAIN AFFECTING MOST OF THE

WIND PROFILES FROM AREA RADARS...AND PROGGED TO STAY STRONG INTO
THE AFTERNOON PER GFS AND NAM-WRF MODELS. THUS...EXTENDED THE WIND
ADVISORY FOR THE SMOKIES INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. ALSO...INCREASED
WINDS ACROSS THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA INTO 15 TO 25 MPH RANGE.

OTHER CHANGES MADE WERE TO ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS
THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE PLATEAU AREAS AND CHA VICINITY. MAX TEMPS
TODAY NOT LIKELY TO RISE MUCH...EXCEPT FOR DOWNSLOPING AREAS SUCH
AS TRI.

NOT MANY CHANGES NEEDED FOR TONIGHT CONCERNING POPS AND WEATHER...
BUT DID TWEAK MIN TEMPS CLOSER TO A BLEND OF NEW MOS NUMBERS 
(GENERALLY A LITTLE MILDER THAN PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID).


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY 
ASSOCIATED WITH TRACK OF MEANDERING CUT-OFF UPPER LOW OVER THE NEXT 
SEVERAL DAYS. VIRTUALLY ALL OF THE ENSEMBLE MEMBERS KEEP THE CENTER 
OF THE UPPER LOW SOUTHWEST OF THE POSITION DEPICTED BY GFS AND 
FARTHER AWAY FROM THE FORECAST AREA. THEREFORE...HAVE OPTED TO 
GENERALLY UNDERCUT THE GFS GUIDANCE POPS FOR THE BALANCE OF THE WORK 
WEEK BUT SCATTERED SHOWERS CANT BE RULED OUT. UPPER LOW WILL 
FINALLY PULL OUT BY THIS WEEKEND WITH A SLOW DRYING TREND EXPECTED. 
FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STUCK CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE WHICH KEEPS TEMPS 
CLOSE TO SEASONAL.
