FXUS64 KMRX 221937
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 PM EDT MON OCT 22 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MOIST PLUME NOW ENTRENCHED
OVER AREA BUT MOUNTAINS BLOCKING/FILTERING LOWER LEVEL OF TRANSPORT
MOISTURE OVER EASTERN SECTIONS OF CWA.

MODELS SHOW MOISTURE NOT ALL THAT DEEP DURING THESE TWO 
PERIODS...BUT THERE IS PLENTY OF MOISTURE IN THE LOWER LEVELS AND 
THERE SHOULD BE SLOW INSENTROPIC LIFT AND UPPER DIVERGENCE TO 
PRODUCE SOME UPWARD MOTION.  THINKING OVERNIGHT THAT THERE WILL BE 
ENOUGH SUBTLE LIFT TO SATURATE DEEP ENOUGH TO GET MEASURABLE 
PRECIPITATION FROM A HEAVY DRIZZLE/LIGHT RAIN OVER MUCH OF THE CWA.  
THE NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS WILL HAVE A MORE DIFFICULT TIME GETTING 
MEASURABLE PRECIP DUE TO DISRUPTION TO THIS SETUP BY MOUNTAINS TO 
THE SOUTH.  SO WILL GO WITH CATEGORICAL POPS OVER PLATEAU AND SWRN 
HALF OF VALLEY AND TAPER OFF TO NORTHEAST TO CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN IN 
THE NORTHEAST TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.  NOT PLANNING ON HIGH QPF NUMBERS 
FOR THESE TWO PERIODS AS MAIN FOCUS APPEARS TO WEST.  

LOOKING AT MANY MODELS...CONSENSUS SHOW A GRADIENT OF HIGH PRECIP 
AMOUNTS WEST VERSUS EAST...AND THE HEAVIEST RAINS STAY TO WEST.  
FORECASTING 2-PERIOD AVERAGE QPF OF ABOUT 1/2 INCH IN WESTERN AREAS 
AND LESS THAN A TENTH OF AN INCH IN EXTREME NORTHEAST.



.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...REASONABLE CONFIDENCE 
IN THE BIG PICTURE...WITH CUT OFF UPPER LOW TO OUR WEST AND 
SOUTHWEST EVENTUALLY LIFTING OUT TO THE NORTH AND NORTHEAST.  
HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE IN THE DETAILS AND TIMING QUITE LOW...WITH 
CONSIDERABLE SPREAD IN THE MODELS AND ENSEMBLES.  LOOKS LIKE UPPER 
LOW WILL BE IN THE ARKLATEX REGION BEFORE LIFTING OUT 
FRIDAY/SATURDAY.  THIS WOULD BRING A FRONT THROUGH HERE AROUND 
THAT TIME FRAME.  UNTIL THEN...NOT IMPRESSED WITH CHANCES FOR MUCH 
SIGNIFICANT PRECIP.  LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCES WILL BE TUESDAY 
NIGHT...WHEN WILL GO WITH LIKELY POP.  BETTER CHANCES ALSO SHOULD BE 
WESTERN AND SOUTHERN ZONES...AS SOUTHEAST DOWNSLOPE FLOW SHOULD 
LIMIT PRECIP IN THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEYS FOR LATE WEDNESDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY. FURTHER OUT...EXACT TIMING OF FRONT PROBLEMATIC. 
FOR NOW WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS FRIDAY AND SLIGHT CHANCE FRIDAY 
NIGHT...THEN DRY SATURDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD PROVIDE DRY 
CONDITIONS SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  GFS MOS TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE 
MOST PART...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.

FXUS64 KMRX 220835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
435 AM EDT MON OCT 22 2007

.SHORT TERM...22/00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW 150 
KNOT UPPER LEVEL WINDS ON BACK SIDE OF ROCKIES/PLAINS DEEPENING 
TROUGH...WHICH TENDS TO SUPPORT FURTHER DEVELOPMENT AND POSSIBLE 
LINGERING OF THE CLOSED LOW WELL TO OUR SOUTHWEST. MOISTURE 
ADVECTION IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM IS LIKELY...BUT THE DRY AIRMASS 
ACROSS THE REGION SHOULD TAKE LONGER TO REACH SATURATION AND 
EVENTUAL LIGHT PRECIPITATION REACHING THE SURFACE. ISENTROPIC LIFT 
IS NOTED...BUT GENERALLY WEAK WITH CONDENSATION PRESSURE DEFICITS 
REMAINING TOO HIGH FOR SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION UNTIL MAINLY THIS 
EVENING. 

THUS...CONTINUED PREVIOUS TREND OF POPS WELL BELOW MOS GUIDANCE FOR 
TODAY. 22/06Z TEMPS HAD FALLEN WELL BELOW MOS GUIDANCE BUT SHOULD 
LEVEL OUT WITH THE APPROACHING CLOUDS TOWARD DAYBREAK. GENERALLY 
WENT AT OR ABOVE THE WARMER MOS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY...GIVEN SLOWER 
ONSET OF RAIN/SHOWERS. INSTABILITY LACKING TO SUPPORT THUNDERSTORMS 
FOR TODAY OR TONIGHT. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPMENT...LOCATION... 
AND STRENGTH A BIT UNCERTAIN...SO DIFFICULT TO PIN DOWN SPECIFICS. 
THUS...TRENDED WITH GFS MINS ALTHOUGH ALL GUIDANCE MINS SIMILAR IN 
SPITE OF DIFFERING MODEL SOLUTIONS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...CROSS SECTION DATA AND 
SOUNDINGS VERY MOIST TUESDAY AS MOISTURE WITH A STRONG SOUTHWEST 
FLOW AT ALL LEVELS BRINGS RAIN INTO THE FORECAST AREA. NAM/WRF 
KEEPING HIGHS ONLY IN THE 60S TO NEAR 70 BUT PREFER STRONGER FLOW OF 
GFS WITH HIGHS MOSTLY 70S. COMPLICATED FORECAST NEXT SEVERAL PERIODS 
WITH MUCH UNCERTAINTY AS MODELS NOW TRYING TO KEEP UPPER LOW 
SPINNING ACROSS THE CENTRAL STATES FOR A COUPLE DAYS BEFORE MOVING 
IT NE INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND EASTERN CANADA BY THE WEEKEND. LOW 
PRESSURE AREA TUESDAY TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL CAUSE 
SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS TO INCREASE. AS COLD FRONT MOVES EAST  
TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT THE FRONT WILL LIKELY WEAKEN WITH CLOSED 
LOW TO THE WEST AND THEN BREAK UP WEDNESDAY. HAVE KEPT RAIN CHANCES 
MOSTLY UNCHANGED FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH THE POSSIBILITY 
OF SHOWERS CONTINUEING DEPENDING ON WHERE THE UPPER LOW IS AND THE 
SOUTHERLY FLOW FROM THE GULF ALSO CONTINUEING AS HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
REMAINS OFF THE EAST COAST. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN AFTER UPPER 
LOWS MOVES NE SO STILL HAVE THE WEEKEND DRY. GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE 
WARMER MAV GUIDANCE FOR LOWS TUESDAY NIGHT AND A BLEND 
WEDNESDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 211933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT SUN OCT 21 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WEAKENS 
SLIGHTLY OVERNIGHT WITH SOME HIGH CLOUDS MOVING INTO THE AREA.
MODELS APPEAR TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH LATE RETURN FLOW. LOW DPS IN 
PLACE SO UNDERCUT MOS MINS. SURFACE RIDGE WILL MOVE ENE ON MONDAY AS 
LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS TO THE SW. LIFT AND INSTABILTY LOOK WEAK. MOS 
POP GUIDANCE HAS BEEN RUNNING HIGH FOR THIS PERIOD BUT HAS BACKED 
OFF ON THE 12Z RUN. CUT BACK ON MON POPS. RAINFALL AMOUNTS THAT DO 
OCCUR SHOULD BE LIGHT. WARM DAY ON TRACK WITH DOWNSLOPING EXPECTED 
...ESPECIALLY ACROSS NE TN VALLEY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DIFFICULT EXTENDED 
FORECAST THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO BIG TIME CHANGE-DISAGREEMENTS IN 00Z 
AND NEW 12Z GFS RUNS AND DIFFERENCES BETWEEN ECMWF AND UKMET. THE 
PREVIOUS GFS AND ECMWF TRACKED THE UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY MID AND LATE WEEK. LOW THICKNESS 
AND 850MB TEMPERATURES SUGGESTED A FAIRLY CHILLY WEEK WITH LIKELY 
RAINFALL THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK.

NEW GFS AND UKMET PAINT A MUCH DIFFERENT PICTURE IN KEEPING THE 
UPPER TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAIN STATES...THEN LIFTING NORTHEAST
BY LATE WEEK. THE MODELS STILL PAINT DECENT ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE 
AREA FOR LATE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. A NORTHERN STREAM WAVE 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEAST BY MID-WEEK. 
A WEAK COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION BY TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY 
WEDNESDAY...WHICH ENDS THE CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION. RIDGING 
RE-ESTABLISHES ITSELF FOR LATE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY ALLOWING FOR 
WARMER TEMPERATURES TO RETURN. ANOTHER FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
AREA FRIDAY AS SOUTHERN PLAINS UPPER TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST.

QUESTION IS...WHICH SOLUTION SEEMS BEST. NCEP IS GOING WITH THE 
UKMET SOLUTION...SO WILL RAISE TEMPERATURES TO MORE OF THE 12 GFS 
SOLUTION AND SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCE POPS AND QPF AMOUNTS FOR EARLY AND 
MID WEEK.

SURFACE RIDGING BUILDS IN FOR NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT SUN OCT 21 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE 
ACROSS SW VA...NE TN AND SMOKIES THIS MORNING...WITH LIGHT TO NEAR 
CALM WINDS GENERALLY. LIGHT SOUTHERLY FLOW ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND 
POSSIBLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. LOWS MOSTLY IN 
THE 40S UNDER CLEAR SKIES AND THESE VERY LIGHT WINDS.

PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TODAY WITH LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION AND RISING 
700 TO 500 MB HEIGHTS...BUT UNDERCUT WARMER MOS TEMPS BY A DEGREE OR 
SO...BASED ON GFS MOS PERFORMANCE FOR SATURDAY MAX TEMPS. WENT MORE 
IN LINE WITH GFS MODEL ON HOW FAST CLOUDS MOVE IN (MAINLY VERY LATE 
TONIGHT EVEN FROM THE LESS AMPLIFIED AND FASTER NAM-WRF SOLUTION).
THUS...LOWER ELEVATIONS OF NE AREAS SHOULD SEE COOLER MOS MINS...AND 
GENERALLY A MOS BLEND ELSEWHERE WHERE LARGE DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED 
IN MOS MIN TEMPS. NO POPS NEEDED THROUGH DAYBREAK MONDAY.

LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAIN STORY THIS WEEK IS STRONG 
SYSTEM THAT MODELS ARE BRINGING DIGGING TROUGH INTO THE PLAINS 
MONDAY AS LARGE HIGH PRESSURE AREA SHIFTS EAST INTO THE ATLANTIC AND 
MOVES SLOWLY EAST. GULF MOISTURE IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE RAPIDLY 
FROM THE SOUTH MONDAY WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT CAUSING RAIN TO DEVELOP 
MONDAY AND SPREAD NE INTO SW VA BY EVENING. THE NAM IS ABOUT 6 HOURS 
FASTER THAN THE GFS AND ECMWF STARTING THE RAIN ABOUT 6 HOURS 
EARLIER. THE GFS IS SLOWER AND CLOSES OFF A MID LEVEL LOW OVER THE 
MS VALLEY TUESDAY WHICH WOULD KEEP THE RAIN AROUND LONGER AS IN THE 
CURRENT FORECAST. THE PRECIPITATION WILL BECOME MORE INTERMITTENT 
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT TUESDAY NIGHT. THE CLOSED MID LEVEL LOW BEHIND 
THE FRONT SHOULD HAVE ENOUGH MOISTURE AND COLD AIR ALOFT FOR SHOWERS 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS IT MOVES SLOWLY EAST AND THEN NORTHEAST 
WITH THE SHOWERS LINGERING THE LONGEST NE SECTIONS. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE MUCH COOLER MONDAY WITH CLOUD COVER EXCEPT ACROSS THE NE 
WHERE CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN LAST. MONDAY NIGHT CLOUDS AND RAIN WILL 
KEEP TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. FOR TUESDAY RAISED 
TEMPERATURES ABOUT 5 DEGREES WHICH WAS SLIGHTLY ABOVE MOST GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS. FOR POPS HAVE CATEGORICAL SOUTH TO CHANCE NORTH MONDAY AS 
RAIN MOVES IN AND THEN LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL THE NEXT THREE PERIODS 
BEFORE LOWERING AFTER FRONT PASSES. HAVE GENERALLY FOLLOWED CLOSE TO 
NEW MOS GUIDANCE AFTER TUESDAY.
&&

TENNESSEE VALLEY BY EARLY MONDAY MORNING WITH RAIN SPREADING INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE GULF COAST STATES FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

BECOME NEARLY STATIONARY AND WEAKEN OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY KEEPING THE BEST CHANCE OVER THE NORTHEAST 
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST BY MID-WEEK. ALSO...DRIER AIR WILL BECOME 
ENTRAINED AROUND THE SYSTEM WHICH WILL ALSO DECREASE SHOWER COVERAGE 
OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE WEDNESDAY.

THE CUTOFF LOW LIFTS NORTHEAST BY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY ENDING THE 
CHANCES OF RAINFALL.

COMBINING TO KEEP MIN TEMPS UP ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE.

THIS MOISTURE IS JUST PASSING ACROSS THE AREA AND WONT BE A FACTOR
FOR LATER TODAY...SO EXPECT MOSTLY SUNNY TO SUNNY SKIES AND
WESTERLY WINDS OF AROUND 5 TO 15 MPH. THIS WOULD SEEM TO FAVOR
GOING WITH THE WARMER MAX TEMPS IN LINE WITH THE GFS MOS NUMBERS.

LIGHTER SURFACE WINDS TONIGHT AND CLEAR SKIES...BUT WEAK SOUTHERLY
FLOW MAY DEVELOP ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND OTHER HIGHER ELEVATIONS
BY 12Z SUNDAY. THUS...TRENDED MIN TEMPS RIGHT IN LINE WITH A MOS
BLEND.

DIFFERENT THAN PREVIOUS FORECAST PACKAGE. UPPER RIDGE APPEARS TO 
GIVE WAY TO CUT OFF LOW FORMING OVER LOWER MS VALLEY. LOW THEN 
PROCEEDS TO GO NOWHERE UNTIL ABOUT FRIDAY WHEN IT SHOWS SIGNS OF 
OPENING UP AND MOVING NORTHEAST. BUT THATS ANOTHER STORY. BY MONDAY 
AFTERNOON, MORE MOISTURE SHOULD ADVECT FROM GMEX AND POPS RETURN TO 
AREA. HAVE LEFT ALL PERIODS AS IS FOR POPS. ADJUSTED QPF A HAIR DOWN 
DURING THE LATTER PERIOD (TUESDAY) FROM GFS.

FXUS64 KMRX 191910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT FRI OCT 19 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT EXITING EXTREME
NE PART OF MRX CWA THIS AFTN. CLEARING CONTINUES THIS EVENING.
POST FRONTAL TROUGH WILL SWING THROUGH THE N PART OF THE MRX CWA 
TONIGHT. STRATO-CU DECK EMBEDDED IN THE TROUGH WILL AFFECT N AREAS
INTO EARLY SAT. OTHERWISE LOWERING DPS THROUGH THE PERIOD. COOLER 
TONIGHT BUT TEMPS REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE UPPER FLOW WILL 
BEGIN TO AMPLIFY AS A RIDGE BUILDS ALONG THE EAST COAST AND A TROUGH 
DEEPENS OVER THE PLAINS. CLEAR SKIES ARE EXPECTED THROUGH 
SUNDAY...THEN A STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL ADVECT MOISTURE 
INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY NIGHT. WARM ADVECTION AND DEEP ISENTROPIC 
LIFT MOVE INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA...BRINGING CHANCE POPS 
ON MONDAY MORNING. THE TROUGH EVOLVES INTO A CLOSED LOW OVER THE 
MISSOURI VALLEY...AND A DEEP FEED OF GULF MOISTURE WILL OVERRUN A 
WARM FRONT TO OUR SOUTH. BEST DYNAMICS WITH THE UPPER JET REMAIN TO 
OUR WEST AS THE LOW BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY...SO WILL HAVE LIKELY 
POPS WEST. WILL ALSO MENTION ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS 
IN THE SOUTH AND WEST AS INSTABILITY REMAINS SOUTH WITH THE WARM 
FRONT. MAY SEE A MOUNTAIN SHADOW EFFECT IN SW VA AND NE 
TN...ESPECIALLY AT THE ONSET OF PRECIP ON MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT...SO 
WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS THERE. THE PROGRESSION OF THIS SYSTEM IS 
HIGHLY UNCERTAIN...WITH VARIOUS MODELS SHOWING DIFFERING 
SOLUTIONS...AND HIGH SPREADS AMONG THE ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. THUS 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW FOR DAYS 5 THROUGH 7. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE 
RANGE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...THOUGH IF THE GFS IS CORRECT 
THERE WILL BE A ROUND OF STRONG STORMS POSSIBLE ON THURSDAY 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER JET AND DRY SLOT. THERE SEEMS TO BE SOME 
GENERAL AGREEMENT AMONG THE MODELS THAT THE LOW WILL LIFT NORTHEAST 
ON THURSDAY NIGHT...LEAVING OUR AREA DRY ON FRIDAY. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  77  45  83  55 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  50  76  45  80  50 /   0   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       50  74  44  80  50 /   0   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              48  71  40  80  43 /  10   0   0   0  10 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1120 AM EDT FRI OCT 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT MOVING EAST THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. POP
GRIDS HAVE BEEN LOWERED FOR THIS AFTERNOON. POST FRONTAL WINDS WILL 
BECOME GUSTY...OTHERWISE SLOW CLEARING TREND UNDERWAY. UPDATE WILL
BE ISSUED TO LOWER POST FRONTAL DPS AND RHS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS 
CURRENTLY MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. FORECAST SOUNDING SHOWS 
CAPE NEAR 1000 J/KG. CURRENT LAPS SHOWS LIFTED INDICES BETWEEN -2 
AND -3 OVER THE REGION. FAIRLY STRONG LOW LEVEL JET WITH 850 MB 
WINDS OF 35 TO 40 KNOTS...SO POTENTIAL OF DAMAGING WINDS EXISTS. 
SATELLITE SHOWS CLEARING LINE ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE WHICH WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE MORNING WEST AND OVER THE REST 
OF THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON.

GFS AND NAM SHOWS SOME WRAP-ARND CLOUDS SWEEPING ACROSS THE
NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL DOMINATE THE FORECAST FOR SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY. THICKNESS VALUES ARE FAIRLY HIGH FOR THIS TIME OF THE YEAR 
SUPPORTING ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES THIS WEEKEND.

LATEST GFS AND ECMWF AND GFS ENSEMBLES AGREE WITH PULLING IN
ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH AND FRONT OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND
TENNESSEE VALLEY BY MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. MODELS DIFFER IN
POSITIONING OF UPPER TROUGH WITH A MORE CLOSED SYSTEM BY THE ECMWF.
HAVE INCLUDED CHANCE POPS FOR MOST AREA FOR TUESDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 190635
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 AM EDT FRI OCT 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...
A SOLID LINE OF STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS MOVING INTO THE
FORECAST AREA. SPC JUST ISSUED A TORNADO WATCH UNTIL 12Z FOR THE
WESTERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA. CAPES ARE AROUND 1000 J/KG
WITH STRONG WINDS ALOFT PRODUCING A CHANCE OF DAMAGING WINDS.

WCN HAS BEEN ISSUED. UPDATED ZFP OUT SOON.

&&

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH A LINE OF STRONG CONVECTION DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT 
OVER WEST TN. CURRENT AREA RADARS INDICATE THAT THIS LINE OF 
CONVECTION IS BECOMING MORE SOLID...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
AMPLIFIES OVER THE OZARKS. A STABLE AIR MASS CURRENTLY RESIDES OVER 
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...AND MODELS ALSO INDICATE 
THAT THIS CONVECTION SHOULD WEAKEN OVERNIGHT AS IT MOVES EAST. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE VERTICAL WIND FIELD SHOULD STAY FAIRLY 
STRONG AHEAD OF THE FRONT OVERNIGHT...SO THINK THAT SOME SEVERE 
WEATHER WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH A FEW STORMS. DAMAGING WINDS APPEAR TO 
BE THE MAIN THREAT...BUT AN ISOLATED TORNADO MAY BE POSSIBLE ACROSS 
THE WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA (MAINLY THE PLATEAU). HAVE 
UPDATED THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO REFLECT THIS.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
RAISE POPS SOME SINCE THE LINE OF CONVECTION OVER WEST TN APPEARS TO 
BE PRETTY SOLID AT THE MOMENT. SINCE THIS LINE SHOULD WEAKEN AS IT 
MOVES IN THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT...WILL ONLY KEEP POPS IN 
THE SCATTERED CATEGORY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             78  50  78  46  84 /  20   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  77  50  77  46  78 /  40   0   0   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 181924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT THU OCT 18 2007

.DISCUSSION...ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN NEXT WEEK...BUT STILL MINIMAL 
AMOUNTS OF RAIN EXPECTED.  SYSTEM HEADED OUR WAY TONIGHT AND FRIDAY 
LIKELY TO GET PRETTY GOOD COVERAGE OF PRECIP WEST OF AREA 
TONIGHT...BUT AS IT LIMPS IN TO THIS AREA FRIDAY MORNING DURING
COOLEST PART OF THE DAY...FOCUS STARTS TO SHIFT SOUTH AND EAST OF
HERE AS LOW LEVEL FLOW GETS DISRUPTED BY MOUNTAINS. ONLY EXPECTING
ABOUT 2 TENTHS OF AN INCH IN OUR SOUTHWEST AREAS AND LESS FARTHER
TO THE NORTHEAST WEHRE MOUNTAINS HAVE MORE OF AN EFFECT. GOING
BELOW GUIDANCE POPS FOR THE MOST PART WITH THIS SYSTEM.

TIMING OF FRONT LOOKS TO BE NEAR KCHA AROUND 12Z AND NE CORNER OF TN 
BY 00Z...BUT WINDS VEERING AND MOISTURE ERODING DURING THE DAY...SO
THINK ACTIVITY ALONG FRONT WILL BE LESS AND LESS DURING THE DAY IN
OUR AREA...SO ONCE AGAIN POPS/QPF NOT VERY HIGH.

AREA DRIES BACK OUT OVER THE WEEKEND...THEN NEXT SYSTEM DUE TO 
APPROACH AREA HAS ALL KINDS OF ISSUES IN THE MODELS...WITH UPPER TROF
PLACEMENT VARYING BY >1000 MILES BETWEEN GFS AND EURO BY MIDDLE OF
NEXT WEEK. ALL MODELS DO AGREE ON COLD FRONT WASHING THROUGH
AREA...SO WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO COOL DOWN...BUT NOT AS MUCH AS THE
GFS MOS IS PREDICTING. EXPECTING SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS
AROUND TIMING OF FRONTAL PASSAGE NEAR TUESDAY...THEN DRYING OUT
AGAIN AS FRONT SAGS FARTHER SOUTH LATER IN THE WEEK.

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
100 PM EDT THU OCT 18 2007

.DISCUSSION...SECOND UPDATE SENT TO FURTHER REDUCE PRECIPITATION
CHANCE FOR THIS AFTERNOON. ISOLATED STRONG OR SEVERE STORMS STILL
POSSIBLE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STILL SEEING OCCASIONAL STRONG 
WIND GUSTS NEAR 35 TO 40 MPH AROUND THE GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAIN AREA... 
SO WILL KEEP THE WIND ADVISORY IN PLACE FOR THE MORNING HOURS.  AS 
FOR PRECIPITATION...PER RADAR...LOOKS LIKE MAIN BAND OF RAIN SHOWERS 
CURRENTLY OVER MIDDLE TN WILL DRIFT TO OUR NORTH.  HOWEVER...AREAS 
OF SCATTERED LIGHT RAINFALL OVER NORTHERN AL SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE 
MRX CWA THIS MORNING...WITH BEST CHANCES OVER THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU.  SHOULD CONTINUE TO SEE FEW ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND EVEN A FEW THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE AREA LATER TODAY AND THIS 
EVENING.  MODELS SLOWING DOWN APPROACHING FRONT...BUT COULD SEE 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT MOVE THROUGH 
OVERNIGHT...AND WILL KEEP SOME HIGH CHANCE POPS IN FOR THIS PERIOD. 

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT TO EXIT THE AREA 
FRIDAY MORNING.  WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS MORNING...TAPERING TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE IN AFTERNOON.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND RIDGING ALOFT SHOULD 
DOMINATE OUR WEATHER FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH DRY AND WARM WEATHER.  
STILL QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY FOR THE LATER PERIODS.  GFS 
INDICATES SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT TO PUSH THROUGH THE REGION 
MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME.  WILL TREND THAT WAY...WITH CHANCE 
POPS BOTH PERIODS...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE ON TUE.  DRY WED FOR NOW.  
WILL MAKE SOME TWEAKS TO GFS MOS TEMPS...BUT GENERALLY WILL STAY 
CLOSE.    


&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SEVIER 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST GREENE.

VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT THU OCT 18 2007

.DISCUSSION...LEADING EDGE OF SW-NE JET SEGMENT IN ADVANCE OF LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM HAS PUSHED NE OF AREA THIS MORNING. LAYER DRYING
UNDERWAY. WILL REDUCE POPS AND CLOUD COVER FOR THIS AFTERNOON.
SCATTERED TSTMS STILL EXPECTED WITH A SLIGHT CHC FOR STRONG TO SEVERE
STORMS MAINLY ALONG N PLATEAU WHERE BEST INSTABILITY WILL OCCUR 
COUPLED WITH BOUNDARY COLLISIONS WITH LOW LEVEL INFLOW. WINDS WILL 
BECOME GUSTY IN THE VALLEYS WITH AFTN MIXING. WIND ADVSRY FOR MNTS 
WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AT NOON. WILL BUMP TEMPS UP A DEGREE OR 
TWO ACCOUNTING FOR PERIODS OF SUNSHINE AND WARM START. SON



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 180100
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT WED OCT 17 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRENGTHENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT EXTENDING 
EAST ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THETA-E ANALYSIS INDICATES THAT 
THIS WARM FRONT MAY ALSO EXTEND SOUTHEAST INTO CENTRAL EAST TN...BUT 
THE BOUNDARY BECOMES MORE DIFFUSE IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION IS CURRENTLY OCCURRING ACROSS THE 
LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY...AND SHOULD CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MOVE EAST AND 
WEAKEN OVERNIGHT AS IT APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA. A WARM AIR 
ADVECTION PATTERN IS PROGGED TO STRENGTHEN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
OVERNIGHT...WITH THE RESULTING ISENTROPIC LIFT HELPING TO MAINTAIN A 
DECENT AREA OF RAIN ACROSS THE AREA. OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST 
LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK IN REGARDS TO POPS AND TEMPS.

HOWEVER...MAIN CONCERN TONIGHT IS WITH THE WIND FORECAST. SOUTHEAST 
850 MB WIND FLOW OVER THE MOUNTAINS...COMBINED WITH A STABLE BOUNDARY 
LAYER EXTENDING ABOVE THE MOUNTAIN RIDGES...SHOULD HELP TO CREATE 
THE POSSIBILITY OF MOUNTAIN WAVES OVERNIGHT IN THE FOOTHILLS. LOW- 
LEVEL WIND FLOW IS NOT EXPECTED TO BECOME TOO STRONG OVERNIGHT...BUT 
WITH 850 TO 700 MB WINDS AROUND 40 KTS...THINK THAT WIND GUSTS COULD 
EXCEED ADVISORY CRITERIA IN THE FOOTHILLS OF THE MOUNTAINS. THUS... 
WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS ZONES 
INCLUDING THE GREENE COUNTY FOOTHILLS FOR OVERNIGHT AND THURSDAY 
MORNING.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN    66  77  64  76  50 /  90  90  70  40  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN      63  77  63  78  51 /  60  60  60  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN              63  76  61  76  50 /  70  60  60  40  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN     59  76  59  79  47 /  50  50  50  50  10 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WIND ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 12 PM EDT THURSDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST GREENE.

VA...NONE.
&&

DMG





000 
FXUS64 KMRX 171913
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT WED OCT 17 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...FEATURES ARE SETTING UP NICELY
FOR PRECIPITATION CHANCE IN THE SHORT TERM. SURFACE RIDGE WEAKENS 
AND MOVES EAST OVERNIGHT AS WARM FRONT MOVES NORTH THROUGH THE AREA. 
LOWER AND MID LEVELS MOISTEN UP LATE TONIGHT IN ADVANCE OF SHORT 
WAVE WHICH MOVES NE INTO THE AREA EARLY THURSDAY. MODERATE WINDS
AND GOOD SHEAR SHOULD SUPPORT SUSTAINED UPDRAFTS. A FEW STRONG 
DOWNDRAFTS ARE POSSIBLE. FREEZING LEVEL REMAINS HIGH SO HAIL THREAT 
LOOKS SMALL. SHORT WAVE SWINGS THROUGH BY MID DAY WITH RAPID MID 
LEVEL DRYING BY AFTERNOON. BEST CHANCES ARE ALONG SOUTHERN AND WESTERN
PORTIONS OF MRX CWA. TEMPS REMAIN WELL ABOVE CLIMO.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT STILL 
PROJECTED TO PASS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA SOMETIME THURSDAY NIGHT 
IN ADVANCE OF AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH. AS SUCH HAVE CONTINUED LIKELY 
POPS FOR MOST LOCATIONS. ANY LINGERING PRECIP SHOULD EXIT THE AREA 
BY MID-DAY FRIDAY AS MOISTURE AXIS MOVES WELL EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS. DRY WEATHER EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND UPPER RIDGING BUILD BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. CONFIDENCE TAKES A NOSE DIVE BY EARLY NEXT WEEK 
AS MEDIUM RANGE MODEL AND ENSEMBLE SOLUTIONS DIVERGE SIGNIFICANTLY. 
HAVE OPTED TO NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST 
AT THIS TIME DUE TO THESE PROFOUND MODEL/ENSEMBLE DIFFERENCES. 
APPEARS TEMPS WILL GENERALLY REMAIN ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH THE LONG 
TERM PERIOD.


&&

OAK RIDGE, TN                       63  76  61  76  50 /  70  60  60  40  10

VIRGINIA INTO THE MORNING HOURS.  A BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS IS 
EXPECTED TONIGHT AS A WARM FRONT LIFTS THROUGH THE AREA.

WIND FLOW BECOMES SOUTHERLY AHEAD OF THE FRONT.  SCATTERED SHOWERS 
SHOULD DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT...AND SPREAD FROM SOUTH TO 
NORTH ACROSS THE MRX CWA LATE TONIGHT.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MAIN BAND OF WARM FRONTAL 
PRECIP SHOULD LIFT OUT THURSDAY MORNING...WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS FOR 
MORNING WITH CHANCE IN THE AFTERNOON.  COLD FRONT FORECAST TO PUSH 
INTO THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT...SHOULD EXIT FRIDAY MORNING.  WIND 
FIELDS STILL IMPRESSIVE FOR SEVERE...ALTHOUGH INSTABILITY A LITTLE 
LESS SO. WILL CONTINUE TO HIGHLIGHT SEVERE THREAT IN HWO. LOOKS LIKE 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND BUILDING UPPER RIDGE WILL PROVIDE DRY 
WEATHER FOR THE WEEKEND.  FURTHER OUT...UNCERTAINTY RATHER HIGH.  
GFS INDICATE POSSIBILITY OF PRECIP FOR THE EARLY PART OF THE 
WEEK...SO WILL MAKE ONLY SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO ONGOING POPS.  GFS 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY MINOR TWEAKS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 161902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT TUE OCT 16 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS HAVE 
DEVELOPED ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON AS 
THE ATMOSPHERE HAS BECOME SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE IN WESTERN SECTIONS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. WAS NOT EXPECTING MUCH ACTIVITY AS MAIN ENERGY 
WITH WEAK COLD FRONT ALONG THE MS RIVER HAD SHIFTED NORTH INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES TODAY. TEMPERATURES DID WARM INTO THE 
MID 70S TO NEAR 80 AT MOST LOCATIONS...WITH DEW POINTS IN THE UPPER 
50S TO LOWER 60S. THE SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE LATE AFTERNOON TO AROUND SUNSET...BUT QUICKLY 
END AS HEATING ENDS. MODELS SHOW DRYING LATER TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
SO ENDED POPS FOR THE LATE NIGHT AND MORNING HOURS. FOR WEDNESDAY 
WEAK RIDGING ALOFT COMES AHEAD OF MUCH STRONGER SYSTEM DEVELOPING 
ACROSS THE PLAINS. THINK MOST OF THE DAY WILL BE DRY BUT SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY MOVING UP FROM THE SOUTHWEST MAY TRIGGER A FEW SHOWERS AND A 
POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM...MAINLY ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST AND WEST DURING 
THE AFTERNOON. EXPECTING SOUTHWEST WINDS TO WARM TEMPERATURES INTO 
THE LOWER 80S...EVEN WITH FILTERED SUNSHINE ACROSS MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS COULD BE CLOSE TO RECORD HIGHS IN SOME PLACES. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH MOVING A WARM FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM STRENGTHENS OVER THE 
UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. SHOWERS SHOULD INCREASE AHEAD OF THIS WARM 
FRONT AS A SHORT WAVE UPPER TROUGH SWINGS OVER THE REGION. THE LONG 
WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS IS PROGGED TO DEEPEN ON 
THURSDAY...AND IS PROGGED TO PUSH A COLD FRONT INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA BY THURSDAY NIGHT. MODELS STILL INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF A 
SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY 
NIGHT...AS A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL COMBINE WITH A STRONG 
VEERING WIND PROFILE AND STRONG DIFLUENCE ALOFT. THIS COLD FRONT 
SHOULD EXIT THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY MORNING...WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING INTO THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS NOW INDICATE THAT ANOTHER STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY...SO WILL 
INTRODUCE CHANCE POPS FOR THESE TIME PERIODS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE ENSEMBLE MEAN NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT OF KEEPING UPPER RIDGE ACROSS SOUTHEAST STATES 
TONIGHT AND WEAKENING IT ONLY SLIGHTLY TUESDAY AS CENTRAL STATES 
UPPER LOW MOVES NORTH. CONVECTION AHEAD OF FRONT IN AR THIS 
AFTERNOON IS FORECAST TO MOVE VERY SLOWLY EAST INTO W TN TONIGHT AND 
MIDDLE TN TUESDAY. ENERGY SHIFTS QUICKLY NORTH AFTER 18Z TUESDAY 
WITH FRONT BREAKING UP. PREFER GFS AS IT WEAKENS SYSTEM SLIGHTLY 
MORE THAN THE NAM/WRF. HAVE MADE FEW CHANGES TO TONIGHTS AND 
TUESDAYS FORECAST...FOLLOWING THE MAV GUIDANCE WITH SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS TO MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER CHANCES 
PLATEAU COUNTIES. INSTABILITY VERY LOW SO TOOK OUT THUNDER.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH DEEPENING AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ACROSS THE PLAINS ON 
WEDNESDAY...WHICH WILL IN TURN DEVELOP A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THIS LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM SHOULD PUSH A WARM FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING...WITH SHOWERS INCREASING 
AHEAD OF THIS WARM FRONT AS A SHORT WAVE TROUGH ROTATES OVER THE 
REGION. THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS IS PROGGED TO DEEPEN 
EVEN FURTHER OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY NIGHT...PUSHING A 
COLD FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL POTENTIALLY BE IN PLACE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA...ALONG WITH A STRONG VEERING WIND PROFILE. THUS...IT APPEARS 
RIGHT NOW THAT SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY WITH THIS COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS FRONT IS PROGGED 
TO EXIT THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY MORNING...WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS INDICATE THAT ANOTHER STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL AFFECT 
THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...BUT FOR NOW...WILL 
KEEP MONDAY NIGHT DRY SINCE TIMING COULD CHANGE WITH SUCCESSIVE 
MODEL RUNS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT SUN OCT 14 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA TODAY WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EAST OF THE AREA 
THROUGH MONDAY. THERE MAY BE SOME THIN CIRRUS OVER NORTHERN PORTIONS 
OF THE AREA...BUT FOR THE MOST PART SKIES WILL BE CLEAR. WILL STAY 
CLOSE TO MOS TEMPS FOR TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. THE WARMING TREND WILL 
CONTINUE...WITH LOWS TONIGHT AROUND 50 IN THE VALLEY...AND HIGHS ON 
MONDAY IN THE UPPER 70S AND LOWER 80S OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE ALONG 
EAST COAST WILL SLOWLY SINK SOUTH TO ALLOW A WEAKENING COLD FRONT TO 
MOVE TOWARD THE TN VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. CLOUD COVER 
SHOULD SLOWLY INCREASE MONDAY NIGHT BUT STILL BE PARTLY CLOUDY AT 
BEST. MAIN ENERGY WITH THE SYSTEM MOVES NE INTO OHIO VALLEY FROM THE 
MS VALLEY FROM MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY. AM TEMPTED TO LOWER 
POPS CURRENTLY IN FORECAST WITH GUIDANCE BELOW 20 PERCENT AT SOME 
SITES WILL KEEP CURRENT NUMBERS WITH CHANCE POPS PLATEAU AND SLIGHT 
CHANCE ELSEWHERE. MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM MOVING ONTO THE NW COAST 
MONDAY NIGHT WILL CARVE OUT A TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN STATES 
WEDNESDAY WITH SOUTHWEST FLOW TO THE EAST OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS TO THE 
WESTERN GREAT LAKES THURSDAY AND BRING GULF MOISTURE NORTHEAST INTO 
THE TN VALLEY. TROUGH MAY DEEPEN EVEN MORE AND DEVELOP ANOTHER AREA 
OF LOW PRESSURE IN THE PLAINS THURSDAY NIGHT BEFORE MOVING INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
SHOULD PASS THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR 
THE WEEKEND. HAVE INCREASED POPS THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT. THIS COULD THE MOST SUBSTANTIAL RAIN FOR THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS MONTH. NIGHT TIME TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILDER MONDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK WITH MORE CLOUD COVER AND SOUTHERLY 
WINDS. DAYTIME HIGHS TUESDAY SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN 
MONDAY AND HAVE FOLLOWED THE HIGHER GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA 
IN THE SHORT TERM. SOME HIGH AND MID CLOUDS DRIFTING ACROSS MAINLY 
NORTHERN AREAS...BUT THESE SHOULD MOVE OUT LEAVING CLEAR TO MOSTLY 
CLEAR CONDITIONS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO ONLY A FEW MINOR TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...RIDGING STRENGTHENS ON MONDAY 
WITH DRY AND WARM WEATHER EXPECTED. PLAINS STATES UPPER TROF TRIES 
TO PUT A DENT IN THE PERSISTANT SOUTHEASTERN U.S. RIDGE WITHOUT MUCH 
SUCCESS ON TUESDAY SO STAYED WITH SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR A 
SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM WITH HIGHER PROBABILITIES MAINLY ON THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHERE WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY/SURFACE TROF  
MAY GENERATE SOMEWHAT BETTER LIFT. STAYED IN A LOW CHANCE REALM FOR 
PRECIP PROBABILITY ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW 
CONTINUES WITH SEVERAL WEAK IMPULSES IN WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN 
GENERATE WEAK LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA SO USED A BROAD BRUSH 
APPROACH WITH SMALL POPS FOR THIS PERIOD. ECMWF AND GFS AGREE 
STRONGER UPPER SYSTEM AND COLD FRONT MOVE THROUGH THE REGION LATER 
FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY BUT BECAUSE THIS IS NEAR THE END OF THE 
EXTENDED FORECAST LEFT POPS IN A CHANCE CATEGORY. GENERALLY FOLLOWED 
MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE WHICH KEEPS ABOVE NORMAL WARMTH GOING FOR YET 
ANOTHER WEEK EARLY IN THE FALL SEASON. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  81  49  83  55  78 /   0   0   0  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  78  50  81  53  77 /   0   0   0   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN  79  50  82  53  76 /   0   0   0  10  20

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EAST ACROSS THE REGION OVER 
THE NEXT 24 HOURS. SOME MIDLEVEL CLOUDS MAY MOVE ACROSS NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA TONIGHT AS A WEAKENING SHORTWAVE ASSOCIATED 
WITH CONVECTION OVER MO PASSES BY. EXPECT CLOUDS WILL BE SCATTERED 
AT BEST...AND SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR. FOG SHOULD FORM AGAIN 
TONIGHT NEAR AREA LAKES WITH WARM WATER TEMPS AND COOL AIR TEMPS. 
LOWS SHOULD BE IN THE 40S...CLOSE TO MAV GUIDANCE. HIGHS THE PAST 
FEW DAYS HAVE BEEN TOO HIGH IN THE MAV AND TOO LOW IN THE MET...SO 
WILL SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE AND HAVE HIGHS FROM NEAR 80 SOUTH TO LOWER 
70S NORTH AND 60S IN THE MOUNTAINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT SAT OCT 13 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL SLOWLY DRIFT EAST ACROSS THE REGION OVER 
THE NEXT 24 HOURS. SOME MIDLEVEL CLOUDS MAY MOVE ACROSS NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA TONIGHT AS A WEAKENING SHORTWAVE ASSOCIATED 
WITH CONVECTION OVER MO PASSES BY. EXPECT CLOUDS WILL BE SCATTERED 
AT BEST...AND SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR. FOG SHOULD FORM AGAIN 
TONIGHT NEAR AREA LAKES WITH WARM WATER TEMPS AND COOL AIR TEMPS. 
LOWS SHOULD BE IN THE 40S...CLOSE TO MAV GUIDANCE. HIGHS THE PAST 
FEW DAYS HAVE BEEN TOO HIGH IN THE MAV AND TOO LOW IN THE MET...SO 
WILL SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE AND HAVE HIGHS FROM NEAR 80 SOUTH TO LOWER 
70S NORTH AND 60S IN THE MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
RIDGING ALOFT AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTING EAST SUNDAY NIGHT 
WILL BRING WARMER LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT AND WARMING HIGH TEMPERATURES 
MONDAY. THEN NEXT SYSTEM DEVELOPING IN THE PLAINS STATES WILL MOVE 
INTO THE MS VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT AND INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY 
TUESDAY EVENING WITH MOST OF THE ENERGY TO THE NORTH. DO NOT EXPECT 
MUCH MEASURABLE RAIN AT THIS POINT WITH MID WEEK SYSTEM. CLOUDS 
SHOULD STILL INCREASE LATE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. ECMWF BRINGS ANOTHER SURGE OF 
MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTH THURSDAY BUT WILL FOLLOW GFS WHICH DRIES 
AREA OUT THURSDAY AND THEN NEW SYSTEM MOVES QUICKLY EAST WITH ZONAL 
FLOW FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE OHIO AND TN VALLEYS FRIDAY 
INTO SATURDAY. WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW GFS TRENDS SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
MONDAY NIGHT WHICH HAS MUCH LOWER TEMPS AT NIGHT FOR RHP AND TRI AND 
WARMER MAX TEMPS MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY MILD TUESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY WITH WARMER SOUTHWEST FLOW.

FXUS64 KMRX 130821
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EDT SAT OCT 13 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
REGION WILL DOMINATE OUR WEATHER IN THE SHORT TERM.  A WEAK SHORT 
WAVE WILL SWING BY LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT SHOULD JUST BRING 
SOME HIGH AND MID CLOUDS...MAINLY NORTH ZONES.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK TO BE IN THE BALLPARK...SO JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY MAINTAINING A DRY FORECAST AS WESTERN STATES 
SYSTEM SHIFTS EASTWARD. WEAKENING TREND STILL ADVERTISED BY MODELS 
WITH THIS SYSTEM AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE MID SOUTH. WEAK BOUNDARY 
TAKES A WHILE TO MOVE ACROSS THE REGION AS SYSTEM MINORS OUT WITH 
UPPER FLOW GOING SOUTHWESTERLY RATHER QUICKLY AHEAD OF NEXT WESTERN 
STATES TROF. BECAUSE OF UNCERTAINTY KEPT SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS 
FOR TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. FOR THURSDAY GFS DRIES 
OUT THE FORECAST AREA BEHIND DEPARTED SYSTEM BUT ECMWF TRIES TO 
CREATE PUSH A WAVE FROM THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO NORTHEAST ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR A ROUND OF SHOWERS AT THIS TIME BUT 
DISCOUNTED THIS SCENARIO AWAITING ARRIVAL OF NEXT WESTERN STATES 
UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM. ONCE AGAIN STAYED WITH 
SLOWER GFS WHICH DEPICTS DEEPENING GREAT LAKES UPPER LOW/TROF AND 
LATER ARRIVING COLD FRONT DUE FRIDAY NIGHT OR SATURDAY SO CRANKED 
POPS FROM SLIGHT CHANCE ON FRIDAY TO LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY FRIDAY 
NIGHT. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS WHICH FEATURE 
ANOTHER WARMING TREND NEXT WEEK WITH BOTH MAX AND MIN TEMPERATURES 
HOLDING SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. 

&&

.DISCUSSION...THE LOW CLOUDS ACROSS OUR NORTHERN ZONES ARE ERODING

OTHER CHANGES NEEDED.  

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
PLENTY OF MOISTURE REMAINS TRAPPED BELOW A STRONG INVERSION THIS 
AFTERNOON. THE MODELS SHOW THIS MOISTURE DISSIPATING THROUGH THE 
NIGHT. THE GFS HAS NOT DONE WELL TO DEPICT THE MOISTURE TODAY...AND 
LIKELY ERODES THE CLOUDS TOO FAST. SATELLITE AND SOUNDINGS SHOW 
UPSTREAM MOISTURE...AND WITH THE STRONG INVERSION IN PLACE THE 
MOISTURE WILL LIKELY STAY TRAPPED WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS. WILL KEEP 
BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUDS IN THE NORTH OVERNIGHT...WITH SOME 
CLEARING TOWARD SUNRISE. CLOUDS WILL ALSO HOLD TEMPS UP IN THE 
LOWER/MID 40S. SOUTHERN LOCATIONS SHOULD BE CLEAR...AND COLDEST 
TEMPS WILL LIKELY BE IN SW NC. WILL KEEP THE MENTION OF PATCHY FROST 
IN SW NC AND THE SMOKIES. WITH LOWS IN VALLEYS IN THE MID 
30S...SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS...WILL MENTION AREAS 
OF FOG IN SW NC. ISSUED AN SPS MENTIONING THE FROST/FOG
POTENTIAL. SCATTERED CU ARE EXPECTED TO FORM TOMORROW
AFTERNOON...WITH HIGHS REACHING THE LOWER/MID 70S SOUTH AND CENTRAL
TO MID/UPPER 60S NORTH.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT FRI OCT 12 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
PLENTY OF MOISTURE REMAINS TRAPPED BELOW A STRONG INVERSION THIS 
AFTERNOON. THE MODELS SHOW THIS MOISTURE DISSIPATING THROUGH THE 
NIGHT. THE GFS HAS NOT DONE WELL TO DEPICT THE MOISTURE TODAY...AND 
LIKELY ERODES THE CLOUDS TOO FAST. SATELLITE AND SOUNDINGS SHOW 
UPSTREAM MOISTURE...AND WITH THE STRONG INVERSION IN PLACE THE 
MOISTURE WILL LIKELY STAY TRAPPED WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS. WILL KEEP 
BROKEN TO OVERCAST CLOUDS IN THE NORTH OVERNIGHT...WITH SOME 
CLEARING TOWARD SUNRISE. CLOUDS WILL ALSO HOLD TEMPS UP IN THE 
LOWER/MID 40S. SOUTHERN LOCATIONS SHOULD BE CLEAR...AND COLDEST 
TEMPS WILL LIKELY BE IN SW NC. WILL KEEP THE MENTION OF PATCHY FROST 
IN SW NC AND THE SMOKIES. WITH LOWS IN VALLEYS IN THE MID 
30S...SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS...WILL MENTION AREAS 
OF FOG IN SW NC. ISSUED AN SPS MENTIIONING THE FROST/FOG
POTENTIAL. SCATTERED CU ARE EXPECTED TO FORM TOMORROW
AFTERNOON...WITH HIGHS REACHING THE LOWER/MID 70S SOUTH AND CENTRAL
TO MID/UPPER 60S NORTH.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
STILL SOME POSSIBLE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SUNDAY IN NORTHWEST FLOW AS RIDGING BUILDS 
NORTH. A NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPING IN THE ROCKIES COULD BRING SOME HIGH 
LEVEL CLOUDS INTO THE NORTHERN SECTIONS AT THE SAME TIME. OTHERWISE 
A COOL NIGHT BUT SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN TONIGHT. SUNDAY WARMING TREND 
CONTINUES WITH RIDGE BUILDING ACROSS SOUTHEAST. FORECASTING ABOUT A 
5 DEGREE RISE TO MOSTLY 70S. SUNDAY NIGHT SOUTHWEST FLOW WARMS 
NIGHTTIME TEMPERATURES ABOUT 5 DEGREES WITH THE NORMALLY COOLER 
SPOTS AT TRI AND RHP STILL IN THE MID 40S. MONDAY UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING SHIFTS EAST BUT WARM SOUTHWEST FLOW AND DRY AIR STILL IN 
PLACE KEEPING RAIN OUT AND TEMPERATURES WARMING INTO THE UPPER 70S 
TO LOWER 80S. MODELS DIVERGE FOR MID TO LATE WEEK. STILL LOOKS LIKE 
FRONT MOVING INTO CENTRAL US WILL BRING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
LATE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY TO THE FORECAST AREA WITH GULF MOISTURE 
SPREADING NORTH AHEAD OF THE FRONT. GFS DRIES AREA OUT WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY WITH WEAK HIGH PRESSURE AND ZONAL FLOW AND THEN 
FRIDAY PLAINS SYSTEM WINDS UP AND BRINGS A TRAILING COLD FRONT INTO 
THE MS AND TN VALLEY FOR MORE SHOWERS. ECWMF MOVES TUESDAY SYSTEM 
THROUGH FASTER WITH WEDNESDAY DRY AND THEN BRINGS A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM FROM THE GULF NE INTO THE SE STATES THURSDAY AND KEEPS 
MOISTURE OVER AREA THROUGH FRIDAY WITH EVEN STRONGER PLAINS SYSTEM. 
PREFERRED THE GFS SOLUTION.

FXUS64 KMRX 120751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT FRI OCT 12 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME STRATOCU AROUND IN THE LOW 
LEVEL NORTHWEST FLOW AND COLD ADVECTION. THIS FLOW IS FORECAST TO 
WEAKEN AND TURN A BIT MORE WESTERLY IN THE SHORT TERM.  EXPECT SOME 
CLOUDS AROUND TODAY...ESPECIALLY NORTH AND MOUNTAINS...BUT EXPECT A 
DIMINISHING TREND LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT.  TEMPS WILL 
LIKELY DIP INTO THE UPPER 30S IN SOME MOUNTAIN VALLEYS AND NORTHERN 
LOCATIONS TONIGHT...SO WILL KEEP MENTION OF PATCHY FROST.  WILL 
GENERALLY GO A BIT BELOW MAV TEMPS FOR TODAY...WILL STAY CLOSER FOR 
TONIGHT.       

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF 
GRADUALLY SHIFTS EAST ALLOWING RIDGE TO ADVANCE INTO THE REGION 
DURING THE FIRST THREE DAYS OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. THIS WILL ALLOW 
FOR A GRADUAL WARMING TREND BRINGING TEMPS VERY CLOSE TO NORMAL FOR 
MID OCTOBER ON SATURDAY AND THEN FOR THE PERIOD SUNDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY THE MERCURY WILL WARM A GOOD 5 TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. 
THE RIDGE GIVES WAY TO AN UPPER TROF TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AND 
RAISED POPS SLIGHTLY FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AS WEAKENING COOL FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. HELD ONTO SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR WEDNESDAY 
AS MODELS STILL INDICATE POSSIBILITY OF A TRAILING WEAK SHORT WAVE 
IN UPPER FLOW WHICH GOES QUICKLY ZONAL OR EVEN SOUTHWESTERLY AHEAD 
OF ANOTHER CENTRAL U.S. TROF AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM POSSIBLY 
ARRIVING BEFORE THE WEEKEND.  

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 120153
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT THU OCT 11 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE 
TO PROVIDE DRY WEATHER AND SEASONABLY COOL TEMPERATURES THROUGH 
FRIDAY...WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS THE 
HIGH MOVES EAST. FOR TONIGHT...LOW TO MID 40S MIN TEMPERATURES IN 
THE VALLEYS WILL BE RATHER UNIFORM DUE TO CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE N 
PART OF THE FORECAST AREA.

LONG TERM....(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW WILL HAVE 
MOVED NORTH TO ONTARIO CANADA BY FRIDAY NIGHT BUT UPPER TROUGH WILL 
STILL BE BRINGING COLDER AIR FROM THE NORTHWEST WITH SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVING OVER THE FORECAST AREA RESULTING IN GOOD RADIATIONAL 
COOLING CONDITIONS. THERE MAY STILL BE SOME MOISTURE WITH THIS FLOW 
WITH A FEW CLOUDS MOVING IN FROM THE OHIO VALLEY BUT THINK 
TEMPERATURES STILL WILL DROP INTO THE MID TO UPPER 30S ACROSS SW 
VA...NE TN...THE SMOKY MTNS...AND EXTREME SW NC. PATCHY FROST WILL 
BE POSSIBLE IN THESE AREAS. SATURDAY TEMPERATURES STILL WILL BE COOL 
WITH THE GFS MOS NUMBERS STILL APPEARING TO WARM. PREFER A BLEND OF 
THE NAM/GFS SATURDAY. AFTER ANOTHER COOL TO COLD NIGHT SATURDAY 
NIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
SUNDAY WITH SOUTH WINDS DEVELOPING. WARMING TREND CONTINUES MONDAY 
AS RIDGING REDEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHEAST WITH TEMPERATURES ABOVE 
NORMAL. SURFACE LOW AND COLD FRONT IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MOVES NE 
INTO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES TUESDAY. THIS COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY BUT WEAKEN AS IT MOVES INTO UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEAST. WILL KEEP POPS LOW NOW WITH TIMING UNCERTAINTIES ON 
FRONT. RAIN CHANCE OVER THURSDAY BUT A NEW AND STRONGER SYSTEM 
DEVELOPS OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS BY THURSDAY NIGHT. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 111332 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
932 AM EDT THU OCT 11 2007

.DISCUSSION...
UPSLOPE FLOW AND COOL MIDLEVEL TEMPERATURES ARE RESULTING IN BROKEN
CLOUDS ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS...NE TN...AND SW VA. UPSTREAM MOISTURE
APPEARS MINIMAL...BUT WITH SURFACE HEATING UNDER ADDITIONAL MIDLEVEL
COOLING WITH THE 500 MB TROUGH PASSAGE...SCATTERED TO BROKEN CU
SHOULD DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE REST OF THE AREA. WITH
MOISTURE LIMITED TO A THIN LAYER AROUND 800 MB WITH A STRONG
INVERSION ABOVE AS SHOWN IN AN ACARS SOUNDING FROM TRI...DO NOT
EXCEPT MUCH SHOWER DEVELOPMENT TODAY. UPDATE WILL REMOVE THE
SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN SW VA. TEMPERATURES APPEAR ON TRACK. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 110800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT THU OCT 11 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SATELLITE DEPICTING AN UPPER LOW 
ROTATING ACROSS OHIO.  MODELS IN FAIRLY DECENT AGREEMENT ON THE 
TRACK OF THIS FEATURE WHICH IS EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO WV 
BY AFTERNOON AND INTO VA BY THIS EVENING.  BEST DYNAMICS AND 
MOISTURE STAYING CLOSE TO THIS FEATURE...SO BEST CHANCES WILL BE 
NORTH OF OUR CWA.  BUT...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SOUTHWEST 
VA FOR TODAY AND INCLUDE THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS AND SMOKIES FOR 
TONIGHT.  WITH THE LOW DEW POINTS IN PLACE...NOT EXPECTING 
DENSE FOG AGAIN THIS MORNING.  UNDERCUT MAVMOS TEMPERATURES AGAIN 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO THE NGM/MET/MAVMOS BLEND 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON FRIDAY...AND BECOME CENTERED 
OVER THE REGION BY FRIDAY NIGHT RESULTING IN EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL 
COOLING CONDITIONS. IN FACT...TEMPS MAY FALL INTO THE MID TO UPPER 
30S ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...SMOKY MOUNTAINS...AND 
EXTREME SOUTHWEST NC...AND WILL PLAN TO MENTION PATCHY FROST IN 
THESE AREAS. WILL CONTINUE TO UNDERCUT THE WARM GFS MOS NUMBERS A 
LITTLE ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WHICH WILL BE IN BETTER AGREEMENT 
WITH THE MUCH COOLER ETA AND NGM MOS NUMBERS. AS THE HIGH SLIDES 
EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL COMMENCE 
A RAPID WARMING TEND WITH TEMPS REMAINING ABOVE NORMAL FOR MOST OF 
NEXT WEEK. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN CONTINUES TO INDICATE A CHANGE TO A 
MORE PROGRESSIVE PATTERN FOR NEXT WEEK...WITH LOW PRESSURE SYSTEMS 
AFFECTING THE REGION ON TUESDAY AND AGAIN ON THURSDAY NIGHT. ECMWF 
MODEL ALSO INDICATES A PROGRESSIVE BUT SLOWER PATTERN...WITH RAIN 
CHANCES DEVELOPING BY WEDNESDAY. WILL COMPROMISE FOR NOW BY 
MENTIONING RAIN CHANCES STARTING TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND CONTINUING 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. BOTH MODELS STILL INDICATE THAT A STRONGER LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE POSSIBLE FOR THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  69  45  71  46  75 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  43  68  45  72 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  64  42  68  45  72 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  59  42  61  39  67 /  10  10  10   0   0

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 110227
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 PM EDT WED OCT 10 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER CENTRAL CANADA IS BUILDING TOWARD OUR 
AREA. THIS AIR MASS IS THE COLDEST AND DRIEST WE HAVE SEEN IN SOME 
TIME...WITH UPSTREAM DEWPOINTS IN THE 30S AND HIGHS IN THE 50S 
ACROSS IL. SURFACE PARCEL TRAJECTORIES ARE FROM THIS AREA...WHERE 
LOWS THIS MORNING WERE IN THE MID 40S. EXPECT SIMILAR LOWS IN OUR 
AREA TONIGHT. SOME CLOUDS IN THE OHIO VALLEY THIS 
AFTERNOON...ASSOCIATED WITH COLD TEMPS ALOFT WITH AN UPPER CLOSED 
LOW...WILL MOVE INTO NORTHERN SECTIONS TONIGHT. CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE 
TO INCREASE TOMORROW MORNING AS THE CLOSED LOW PASSES TO THE
NORTH...WITH CLOUDS REMAINING MAINLY IN THE NORTHERN HALF. CLOUDS
ARE CONFINED MAINLY TO THE 850-750MB LAYER WITH AN INVERSION
ABOVE...AND SHOULD NOT BE THICK ENOUGH DURING THE DAY FOR ANY
PRECIP. THERE COULD BE A LARGE HIGH TEMP DIFFERENCE FROM NORTH TO
SOUTH TOMORROW DUE TO THE CLOUDS...WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 60S AT
CHA TO LOWER/MID 50S IN SW VA.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE MID-ATLANTIC AND NORTHEAST STATES 
WILL PULL SOME WRAP-AROUND CLOUDS ACROSS MAINLY THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. WILL MAINTAIN A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND FAR EAST TENNESSEE.

ANOTHER FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE WILL DIVE INTO THE UPPER TROUGH LATE
FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT SYSTEM IS MOISTURE STARVED WITH BEST
DYNAMICS NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. LITTLE IF ANY EFFECT FROM THIS
WAVE IS ANTICIPATED.

FOR THE WEEKEND THROUGH MID-WEEK NEXT WEEK...RIDGING SURFACE AND 
ALOFT WILL DOMINATE THE FORECAST WITH MOSTLY SUNNY-PARTLY CLOUDY SKY 
WITH A RETURN OF ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES BY MONDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  83  46  69  45  73 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  80  46  64  44  68 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  78  45  64  44  69 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  78  43  58  40  66 /   0   0  10  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 AM EDT WED OCT 10 2007

.DISCUSSION...
DENSE FOG CONTINUES TO COVER MUCH OF SW VA...NE TN...AND THE
CENTRAL TN VALLEY THIS MORNING. ACARS SOUNDING FROM TYS SHOWS THE
INVERSION EXTENDS FROM THE SURFACE TO 1000 FT AGL...SO IT WILL TAKE
SOME TIME FOR THE FOG TO COMPLETELY DISSIPATE. SOME FOG MAY REMAIN
UNTIL NOON...BUT WILL ALLOW THE ADVISORY TO EXPIRE AT 10 AM AND
COVER THE REMAINING FOG WITH NOWCASTS. THE REST OF THE FORECAST
LOOKS GOOD...WITH HIGH TEMPS IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S IN MOST
SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS. UPDATE WILL ONLY BE NEEDED TO REMOVE
DENSE FOG ADVISORY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 100951
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
551 AM EDT WED OCT 10 2007

.DISCUSSION...WITH VISIBILITIES REDUCED TO LESS THAN ONE-QUARTER OF 
A MILE AT OAK RIDGE AND TYS...HAVE ISSUED A DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR 
THE CENTRAL VALLEY.  THE REST OF THE CWA SHOULD BE OK. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATING COLD 
FRONT ACROSS VIRGINIA AND THE CAROLINAS.  MODELS AGREE ON FRONT 
HEADING EAST OUT OF THE REGION TODAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN 
BEHIND IT.  AFTER SOME PATCH FOG EARLY THIS MORNING...SHOULD SEE 
PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TODAY ALONG WITH DRY AND COOLER WEATHER TODAY AND 
TONIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL.  THERE WERE SOME DIFFERENCES 
IN THE GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY.  STAYED NEAR TO SLIGHTLY 
BELOW THE MAVMOS NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ON 
THURSDAY...BRINGING MUCH COLDER AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
TEMPS THAT ARE ACTUALLY A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. 
WILL PLAN TO UNDERCUT THE WARM GFS MOS NUMBERS A LITTLE ON THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY...WHICH WILL BE IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE COOLER ETA 
AND NGM MOS NUMBERS. SHORT-RANGE MODELS INDICATE THAT THE BULK OF 
THE MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS UPPER LOW WILL REMAIN NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...BUT SINCE STEEP LAPSE RATES ARE EXPECTED...THINK 
THAT A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. HIGH PRESSURE 
THEN BUILDS OVER THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH TEMPS BEGINNING A 
WARMING TREND BY SUNDAY AS WINDS BECOME SOUTHERLY ON THE WESTERN 
SIDE OF THIS HIGH. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN INDICATES ANOTHER PATTERN 
CHANGE BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...TO MORE OF A PROGRESSIVE PATTERN WITH 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY AND 
AGAIN BY THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS NEW GFS SOLUTION ALSO HAS SOME SUPPORT 
FROM THE ECMWF MODEL...SO WILL INTRODUCE RAIN CHANCES FOR TUESDAY.


.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  83  48  68  45  71 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  80  46  65  44  68 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  78  45  65  44  68 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  78  43  60  40  63 /   0   0  20  10  10 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT TUE OCT 9 2007

.SHORT TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...COOL FRONT WILL 
MOVE ONTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU DURING THE NEXT HOUR BRINGING AN 
END TO THE LIGHT SHOWERS BEFORE 6 PM. FRONT PROGRESSES ACROSS MUCH 
OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE EVENING WITH CLEARING 
SKIES BY DAYBREAK. DRY AND SLIGHTLY COOLER WEATHER EXPECTED FOR 
WEDNESDAY WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AS UPPER LOW SHIFTS SLOWLY 
SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY. UPPER 
LOW/TROF CONTINUES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS BY THURSDAY 
EVENING WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ON THE INCREASE. LAPSE RATES 
INCREASE DURING THE DAY WITH MUCH COLDER AIR ALOFT AND MAINTAINED 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR A SHOWER ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE 
MOUNTAINS OF EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR BOTH THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT. FAIRLY RADICAL DIFFERENCES BETWEEN MET/MAV MOS TEMP 
GUIDANCE AND STAYED CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR THE SHORT TERM 
FORECAST.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING 
FROM THE NORTH WILL PERSIST ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
THE DRY AIRMASS WILL RESULT IN A FAIRLY WIDE DIURNAL TEMPERATURE 
RANGE. COOL MORNINGS WITH ABOVE NORMAL AFTERNOON READINGS CAN BE 
EXPECTED. A COLD FRONT AND NEXT PRECIPITATION CHANCE IS POSSIBLE BY 
TUESDAY BUT WILL LEAVE DRY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT TUE OCT 9 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH WEAKENING CONVECTION 
AHEAD OF IT. MODELS ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT TODAY WITH THE AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE EXPECTED ALONG THIS FRONT...WITH THE GFS MODEL NOW 
INDICATING MORE MOISTURE WITH THIS FRONT AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA (WHICH IS QUITE A CHANGE FROM YESTERDAYS SOLUTION). 
WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP THIS 
AFTERNOON...EXPECT SCATTERED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA ALONG THE COLD FRONT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO TREND A 
LITTLE WARMER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND CENTRAL 
EAST TN THIS AFTERNOON...SINCE SOME DOWNSLOPE WARMING MAY OCCUR WITH 
WESTERLY WINDS OFF OF THE PLATEAU. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS INDICATE THE COLD 
FRONT IS EAST OF OUR CWA BY WEDNESDAY SO WILL CONTINUE WITH THE DRY 
FORECAST. MODELS ADVERTISING AN UPPER LOW TRACKING TO THE NORTH OF 
OUR CWA ON THURSDAY. NAM BRINGING MORE MOISTURE INTO OUR AREA THAN 
GFS. WILL FOLLOW THE DRIER GFS AND ADD ONLY 20 POPS FOR NORTHEAST TN 
AND SOUTHWEST VA FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AND KEEP THE 
REST OF THE CWA DRY FOR NOW. INSTABILITY IS LIMITED SO DID NOT 
MENTION THUNDER. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS ON FRIDAY BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES.
&&

.DISCUSSION...ANOTHER WARM AND MOSTLY CLEAR NIGHT ACROSS THE

THAN LAST NIGHT AT THE SAME TIME ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
VALLEY. DEWPOINTS ARE ABOUT THE SAME IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. 
BOTH NAM AND GFS BRING SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE/CLOUD COVER AHEAD OF 
FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY MORNING. 18Z GFS MOS GUIDANCE 
MIN TEMPS LOWER THAN CURRENT FORECAST WITH LIGHT WINDS AND NO CLOUDS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 081923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT MON OCT 8 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...HOT AND DRY WEATHER 
WILL GRADUALLY TRANSITION THROUGH A SMALL CHANCE FOR A FEW RAIN 
DROPS ON TUESDAY BACK TO DRY AND EVER SO SLIGHTLY COOLER THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM PERIOD. PREFERRED SLIGHTLY WEAKER LOOK TO GFS IN TERMS OF 
THE FROPA FOR TUESDAY. THIS SYSTEM LOOKS LIKE THE ONE THAT TRIED TO 
CREATE A BIT OF RAIN ACROSS THE REGION A COUPLE OF WEEKS AGO BUT HAD 
MAJOR DIFFICULTY DAMPENING THE SOIL. LIFT IS WEAK WITH LITTLE IN THE 
WAY OF CONVERGENCE AND LIMITED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. THEREFORE TWEAKED 
POPS BACK SOMEWHAT. WHAT PRECIP OCCURS SHOULD WRAP UP IN MOST AREAS 
DURING THE SECOND PERIOD BUT LINGERED A SLIGHT CHANCE INTO TUESDAY 
NIGHT OVER THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. DRY WEST 
TO NORTHWEST FLOW BUILDS IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM FOR WEDNESDAY. 
CONCERNING TEMPS STAYED A LITTLE ON THE HIGHER SIDE OF GUIDANCE 
BLEND WITH MORE SIGNIFICANT COOLING EXPECTED LATER IN THE WEEK.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS
IN FROM THE NORTHWEST AND BECOMES CENTERED NORTH OF THE AREA BY THE
END OF THE PERIOD. UPPER LOW DROPS SE FROM THE GREAT LAKES THU AND FRI.
MODELS NOT IN AGREEMENT WITH STRENGTH AND POSITION OF THIS FEATURE BUT
BEST BET IS ANY CLOUDS AND WEATHER WILL REMAIN NE OF MRX CWA. THE LOW
SHOULD MOVE FARTHER AWAY BY SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH HEIGHTS BUILDING 
ALOFT. OVERALL...DRY AND WARM FORECAST IN STORE.

WEATHER TO MORE SEASONAL REGIME IN THE OFFING AS UPPER FLOW PATTERN 
SHIFTS FROM AMPLIFIED RIDGING OVER THE EASTERN CONUS TO DEEP 
TROUGHING. SURFACE FRONT STILL APPEARS UNREMARKABLE AS IT PASSES 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON TUESDAY. GFS HAS ACTUALLY 
BACKED OFF ON POPS FROM ITS PREVIOUS RUNS...BUT WRF HAS SOMEWHAT 
HIGHER POPS THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY SREF. HAVE OPTED TO GO WITH BLEND 
OF THE MAV AND MET GUIDANCE WHICH RESULTS IN LITTLE CHANGE FROM
PREVIOUS PACKAGE. AT ANY RATE...NOT EXPECTING MUCH HELP FROM THE
LINGERING DROUGHT FROM THIS EVENT. REMAINDER OF LONG TERM WILL BE
CHARACTERIZED BY GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS WITH TEMPS NEAR CLIMO.

TRANSPIRES. UPPER LOW CURRENTLY LOCATED IN THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN REGION 
IS PROJECTED TO MOVE INTO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES BY EARLY TUESDAY 
AND THEN DRIFT SOUTHEASTWARD TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS 
WILL RESULT IN DRAMATIC HEIGHT FALLS OVER OUR GENERAL AREA WITH 
TEMPS ACTUALLY FALLING TO BELOW CLIMO. PRECIP WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE 
ON TUESDAY STILL APPEARS WILL HAVE SCATTERED COVERAGE AT BEST. LIGHT 
INSTABILITY SHOWERS APPEAR POSSIBLE LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD 
DEPENDING ON PROXIMITY OF UPPER LOW. HAVE INCLUDED SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR OUR NORTHEASTERN ZONES FOR THU AND FRI AFTERNOONS TO 
ACCOUNT FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. UPPER LOW PULLS OFF TO THE EAST 
ALLOWING TEMPS TO RECOVER TO NEAR CLIMO BY EARLY NEXT WEEKEND.

MEMBERS AND GFS WITH TIMING THIS EVENT...WITH VIRTUALLY ALL OF THE 
ENSEMBLE MEMBERS SOMEWHAT SLOWER THAN THE OPERATIONAL GFS. GIVEN THE 
UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING...GENERALLY KEPT SAME TIMING AS PRECEDING 
FORECAST BUT DID BUMP UP POPS SLIGHTLY. FEATURE STILL NOT REAL 
IMPRESSIVE FROM A PRECIPITATION PERSPECTIVE...BUT EXPECT TO SEE A 
LEAST SCATTERED COVERAGE WITH ITS PASSAGE. UPPER TROUGH BECOMES 
CLOSED CIRCULATION AND DRIFTS SOUTH FROM THE GREAT LAKES REGION BY 
LATE IN THE WORK WEEK RESULTING IN SIGNIFICANT HEIGHT FALLS OVER OUR 
AREA. TEMPS ARE PROJECTED TO FALL TO OR EVEN BELOW BELOW CLIMO BY 
LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES 
FAIRLY CLOSELY ON TEMPS.

MAX TEMPS ON BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WITH UPPER RIDGE BUILDING
ACROSS THE REGION...AND ALSO DOWNSLOPE EASTERLY WINDS. OTHERWISE...

THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AND MAINTAINED THE

THUNDERSTORM. DRIER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER WEATHER EXPECTED BEHIND THE

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE NORTHEAST...WITH EASTERLY FLOW 
BRINGING ATLANTIC MOISTURE INTO THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL AGAIN DEVELOP BY THIS

LIKELY POPS ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN...WITH LOWER POPS FURTHER NORTHEAST. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARD A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH 
TONIGHT...SINCE THE AIR MASS REALLY SHOULDNT CHANGE MUCH. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT 
FEATURE OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE CONUS. THIS PATTERN WILL 
PERSIST UNTIL TUESDAY WHEN A SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED 
SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL PROGRESS EASTWARD FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS 
AND APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. POPS STILL NOT VERY 
IMPRESSIVE AND DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PREVIOUS PACKAGE. 
SOME UNCERTAINTY WITH TIMING THIS EVENT AS BULK OF ENSEMBLE MEMBERS 
DELAY PROGRESSION OF COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA UNTIL WEDNESDAY. 
HEIGHT FALLS ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER TROUGH SUGGEST SOMEWHAT COOLER 
TEMPS BY THE LATTER HALF OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK...BUT STILL
ABOVE CLIMO. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE CLOSELY AS THEY SEEM
REASONABLE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  67  87  65  86 /  60  20  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  86  66  88  64  87 /  50  20  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       86  66  89  63  87 /  50  20  10   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              84  62  88  59  88 /  20  20  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 050132
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT THU OCT 4 2007

.DISCUSSION...SHOWERS CONTINUE BUT ARE BEGINNING TO WEAKEN.  THIS IS 
IN LINE WITH CURRENT FORECAST SO NO CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...COVERAGE OF 
SHOWERS FINALLY DECREASING OVER SWRN VA...WITH WATER VAPOR SATELLITE 
PICS SHOWING AN ASSOCIATED VORTICITY MAX MOVING NORTH JUST ABOUT OUT 
OF THE REGION AT THIS TIME. HOWEVER...ELSEWHERE AREA RADARS SHOW 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUING TO 
RE-DEVELOP AS ABUNDANT MOISTURE TO OUR SOUTHEAST FLOWS INTO THE 
REGION. WOULD EXPECT THE COVERAGE TO PEAK SHORTLY THEN DIMINISH 
SIGNIFICANTLY WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING. KEPT IN SLIGHT CHANCE 
SHOWERS OVERNIGHT IN A FEW AREAS...WITH PATCHY FOG OR DRIZZLE 
WORDING ELSEWHERE. MAX TEMPS HAVE REACHED VERY NEAR FORECASTED 
HIGHS...AND THE AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER OVERNIGHT WOULD SEEM TO FAVOR 
THE MILDER MIN TEMPS.

DONT EXPECT RAIN CHANCES TO LINGER MUCH BEYOND FRIDAY...WITH
SPOTTY SHOWERS...SPRINKLES OR DRIZZLE IN THE MORNING GIVING WAY TO
SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS BY THE AFTERNOON. GFS MOS HIGHS SEEMED
TOO WARM...ALTHO ACTUALLY NOT NEAR RECORD HIGHS ANYWHERE (LOWER 90S)
...SO I FAVORED A MOS BLEND. MOS BLEND PREFERRED FOR FRIDAY NIGHT
ALSO AS SOME CLOUDINESS LINGERS...AND SOMEWHAT OF A BLEND ALSO FOR
SATURDAY MAX TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...BIG RIDGE SHIFTS 
ONLY SLOWLY EAST AS DEEP UPPER LOW MAKES ITS WAY INTO THE GREAT 
LAKES. THIS MEANS THE FIRST COUPLE DAYS OF EXTENDED WILL REMAIN DRY. 
COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LOW PRESSES INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING AND USED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR WEAK CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON TUESDAY WITH SLIGHT 
THROUGH LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE FROPA TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. GFS CONTINUES TO DEEPEN MAJOR LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
THROUGH THURSDAY WHICH MAY MEAN THE POSSIBILITY OF LOW LEVEL 
TROUGHING BEHIND SURFACE FRONT AND POSSIBLE -SHRA BUT STAYED AWAY 
FROM THIS IDEA AT THIS DISTANT POINT IN THE LONG TERM FORECAST. WENT 
FAIRLY CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT FORECAST PERIOD.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

HAVING STATED ALL OF THE ABOVE...WILL UPDATE FORECAST GRIDS AND 
ZFPMRX TO REFLECT CURRENT WEATHER...WITH RUC MODEL SUPPORTING OUR 
HIGHER POPS ACROSS MAINLY SRN AREAS LATER TODAY. WILL ALSO ADDRESS 
THE POSSIBILITY OF NEEDING TO LOWER MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 040828
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
428 AM EDT THU OCT 4 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE AREA AT THE SURFACE
AND ALOFT IN THE GULF CONTINUES TO MOVE SLOWLY NORTHWEST THIS
MORNING. A MOIST SOUTHEAST TO EAST FLOW CONTINUES TO BRING
CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS FROM THE ATLANTIC ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AND
WEAK LIFT IS PRODUCING LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS EAST TN AND SW NORTH
CAROLINA. THE ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THIS MORNING AND
AFTERNOON AND THEN DECREASE TONIGHT AS THE LOW MOVES FARTHER AWAY.
THE CHANCE OF MEASURABLE RAIN IS GREATEST TO THE SOUTH ALTHOUGH
THERE IS THE POSSIBILITY OF A TRACE TO A FEW HUNDREDTHS EVEN ACROSS
NORTHEAST TN THIS MORNING AS SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVES
NORTHWEST. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING ARE VERY MILD FOR THIS TIME OF
YEAR IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S. CLOUD COVER SHOULD HOLD
TEMPERATURES DOWN A FEW DEGREES FROM YESTERDAY BUT STILL BE ABOVE
NORMAL. DOWNSLOPING COULD SCOUR CLOUD COVER OUT OF THE NORTHEAST
AND WARM TEMPERATURES MORE THAN FORECAST LATER TODAY. FOR TONIGHT
SKIES SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY AND TEMPERATURES AGAIN MILD.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THROUGH THE WEEKEND...SURFACE
HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO RIDGE INTO THE AREA FROM THE EAST NORTHEAST.
UPPER RIDGING BUILDS OVERHEAD. MAIN JET POSITIONED WELL TO THE
NORTH. TEMPERATURES REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL. A CUT-OFF LOW WORKS ITS
WAY NORTHEAST THROUGH THE ROCKIES EARLY NEXT WEEK. BY THIS TIME
TEMPERATURES SHOULD RISE TO NEAR RECORD VALUES. CUT-OFF LOW SHOULD
MOVE INTO THE GREAT LAKES BY MID WEEK. A SURFACE COLD FRONT
APPROACHES FROM THE WEST AND MOVES THROUGH THE AREA AROUND
WEDNESDAY BRINGING NEXT CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION. &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 040226
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 PM EDT WED OCT 3 2007

.DISCUSSION...SHOWERS REMAINING OVER THE MOUNTAINS...AND SOME 
ISOLATED ACTIVITY IN GEORGIA THAT AN OUTSIDE CHANCE OF MOVING INTO 
THE AREA SO PREVIOUS FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK.  NO CHANGES PLANNED.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MOISTURE 
WORKING IN FROM THE SE INTO THE REGION...WITH LIGHT PRECIPITATION 
DUE TO ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER MAINLY PARTS OF SC AND NRN HALF OF GA. 
DOUBTFUL IF ANY SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION WILL REACH SE TN EARLY 
TOIGHT...BUT WOULD NOT RULE OUT A FEW SPRINKLES FOR SW NC. ADDED A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT FOR SE TN...SW NC AND SMOKY 
MTNS. MOS BLEND FOR MIN TEMPS LOOKED GOOD...AS GFS MINS PROBABLY TOO 
COOL GIVEN INCREASING CLOUDS. SKY GRIDS ADJUSTED UP THIS EVENING TO 
BETTER FIT LATEST SURFACE OBSERVATIONS AND SATELLITE PICS.  

INCREASED POPS A BIT FOR THURSDAY...BUT I FEAR THAT THE INITIALLY 
DRY AIRMASS PLUS SOME DEFINITE DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS...WILL HINDER RAIN 
FROM REACHING THE SURFACE FOR TOMORROW. DID ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
ALONG AND JUST NORTH OF I-40 FOR THURSDAY...AND A FINAL ADJUSTMENT 
OF POPS UPWARDS FOR SE TN AND SW NC TO BETTER MESH WITH GRIDS FROM 
FFC AND GSP.

GULF OF MEXICO LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES FURTHER AWAY BY THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH PERHAPS LOW CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR MAINLY 
DIURNAL CONVECTION FOR THOSE PERIODS. THUS...CONTINUED TO UNDERCUT 
MOS POPS FOR THOSE PERIODS. DOWNSLOPING AGAIN ON FRIDAY...WHICH 
SUPPORTS WARMER MOS MAX TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE 
TRACKING OVER THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...COULD BRING SOME DIURNAL 
ACTIVITY DURING THE EVENING HOURS.  BEST CHANCES IN THE SOUTH WHERE 
THE BEST MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY RESIDES.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
INTO AREA ON SATURDAY KEEPING THE BEST MOISTURE TO THE WEST OF OUR 
CWA THROUGH THE WEEKEND...SO DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED SATURDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY.  A COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE WEST ON TUESDAY.  
THINK BEST CHANCES SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
WHEN THE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH BRINGING THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND 
LIFT...BUT WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP LOW 
POPS IN OUR WESTERN ZONES FOR TUESDAY.  STAYED NEAR MEX GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             66  82  67  84  66 /  20  60  30  30  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  84  67  87  64 /  10  20  20  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  83  66  86  64 /  10  20  20  20  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
959 AM EDT WED OCT 3 2007

.DISCUSSION...WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT OCCURRING BETWEEN THE GULF OF 
MEXICO LOW PRESSURE AREA AND HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER THE SRN 
APPALACHIANS AND MID ATLANTIC STATES. HOWEVER...DONT EXPECT THIS 
LIGHT PRECIPITATION TO REACH OUR SRN AREAS TODAY. I WILL INCREASE 
CLOUD COVER ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC TO AT LEAST A PARTLY CLOUDY SKY.
MAY ALSO NEED TO MONITOR MAX TEMP FORECAST ACROSS SRN AREAS FOR 
TODAY. 

FOR LATER PERIODS...AGREE THAT AT LEAST SOME SPRINKLES OR CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS MIGHT REACH AS FAR NORTH AS I-40 AREAS...BUT THE EASTERLY 
LOW LEVEL FLOW USUALLY CREATES DOWNSLOPING WHICH HINDERS ANY 
SIGNIFICANT RAINS.

WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX...FORECAST GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS BY 11 AM EDT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
425 AM EDT WED OCT 3 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE HOLDS OVER
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY BUT MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE LATER
TODAY AND TONIGHT FROM THE SOUTH AND EAST AS LOW PRESSURE OVER THE
GULF OF MEXICO MOVES NORTHWEST TOWARDS THE LOUISIANA COAST. COLD
FRONT THAT IS APPROACHING THE OHIO VALLEY WILL BREAK UP AS IT MOVES
INTO THE RIDGE. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING ARE SEVERAL DEGREES
WARMER THAN TUESDAY MOSTLY IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. HIGHS
SHOULD STILL REACH THE LOWER TO MID 80S EVEN WITH CLOUD COVER
INCREASING ACROSS THE SOUTH AND MOUNTAINS BY THIS AFTERNOON AND
TONIGHT. LOWS TONIGHT WILL BE MILDER WITH CLOUD COVER BUT STILL
GOING A FEW DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE WITH DRY GROUND. NO POPS THROUGH
TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
CONTINUES TO RIDGE INTO THE AREA FROM THE ENE. LOW PRESSURE OVER
THE GLFMEX WITH BROAD MID LEVEL TROUGHING PUMPS MOISTURE INTO
SOUTHERN CWA THURSDAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY. INCREASED CLOUDS S AREAS
AND SCT CU OCCASIONALLY NEAR UPGLIDE AREAS OF NC. GFS MOS POPS
APPEAR WELL OVERDONE DUE TO CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK. WEAK ISENTROPIC
LIFT COULD RESULT IN A FEW SPRINKLES MOST AREAS BUT CONFINED LOW
CONVECTIVE POPS TO S 1/3 OF MRX CWA INTO FRI. A SECOND TROPICAL
WAVE/LOW TRACKS W WELL SOUTH OF AREA OVER THE WEEKEND WITH DRY
CONDITIONS AND HIGH PRESSURE PERSISTING. A BACKDOOR FRONT MAY SNEAK
INTO AREA FROM THE NE BY TUE SO ADDED ISOLD POPS ACROSS SW VA/NE
TN. GFS HAS BEEN HANDLING TEMPS WELL OF LATE AND WITH LITTLE CHANGE
IN AIRMASS STUCK CLOSE TO THOSE NUMBERS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 030117
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
917 PM EDT TUE OCT 2 2007

.DISCUSSION...
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS FIRM ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. HOWEVER...MOISTURE FROM A TROPICAL SYSTEM OVER THE
SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES IS PULLING MOISTURE EAST INTO THE FOOTHILLS
OF THE CAROLINAS AND NORTHERN GEORGIA. LATEST NAMM AND GFS SHOWS
THIS MOISTURE MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES OF THE FORECAST
AREA OVERNIGHT SO HAVE CHANGED SKY COVER TO PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY
FOR SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE.

MADE SOME MINOR CHANGES TO HOURLY TEMPERATURES TO REFLECT CURRENT CONDITONS.

HAVE A GOOD NIGHT...

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE REMAINS ENTRENCHED 
OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS SUGGESTING MORE OF THE SAME AND THAT A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST IS THE OPTIMUM APPROACH. EASTERLY CIRCULATION 
AROUND DISTURBANCE IN THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO MAY ADVECT ENOUGH 
MOISTURE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TO INCREASE CLOUDS 
SOMEWHAT...BUT OTHERWISE VERY LITTLE CHANGE EXPECTED. MAV TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT THOSE VALUES TO 
ACCOUNT FOR TEMP PERSISTENCE ALSO.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE
CONTINUES TO BE THE DOMINATE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. SOME
HINT OF TROPICAL MOISTURE WORKING INTO THE REGION AND GFS BRINGING
FAIRLY HIGH POPS IN THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. WITH THE MODELS
TRACK RECORD ON BRINGING IN RAIN WHEN IT DOES NOT RAIN AM HOLDING
OFF ONTO 14 POPS AND KEEPING THE FORECAST DRY THROUGH THE PERIOD.
ECMWF SUPPORTS THIS APPROACH.  

STAYED CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES. DID INCREASE CLOUD
COVERAGE ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY TO REFLECT THE INFLUX OF
MOISTURE.

$$

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

STRENGTHENS FOR THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY. HAVE INCREASED CLOUD COVER 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES. FOR THE REST OF 
THE EXTENDED EXPECTING CONTINUED MOISTURE WITH MOSTLY LOW CLOUDS AT 
TIMES BUT NO REAL MECHANISM FOR PRODUCING ANY PRECIPITATION. 
FOLLOWED A PERSISTENCE FORECAST WITH HIGHS MOSTLY IN THE 80S AND 
LOWS IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...HOW MANY WAYS CAN YOU 
SAY DRY? HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH MUCH OF
THE PERIOD. A DRY FRONT IS ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AT MID DAY
TODAY AND WILL BE SWINGING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT.
MOST OF THE MODELS ARE SWINGING SOME ATLANTIC MOISTURE INTO THE
REGION BY THURSDAY BUT WITH INSUFFICIENT QUANTATIES AND LIFT TO
MERIT INTRODUCING PRECIPITATION TO THE REGION. THE NEXT DECENT
SYSTEM IS NEXT SUNDAY...BUT WITH THE MODELS TRACK RECORD FOR
OVERPLAYING THE CHANCE OF RAIN AT THAT TIME...AM HOLDING POPS AT 14
PERCENT AT THIS TIME.

TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO MODERATE AS WE MOVE FURTHER INTO THE 
FALL SEASON WITH EACH PASSING SYSTEM.

WILL HAVE LITTLE SUCCESS IN PENETRATING THE UPPER RIDGE. THE WRF
MODEL PROJECTS MOIST EASTERLY FLOW SETTING UP BY MID WEEK AROUND
DISTURBANCE IN GULF OF MEXICO. HOWEVER...THIS SCENARIO IS NOT
SUPPORTED BY GFS AND WILL BE DISREGARDED FOR NOW. GFS SUGGESTS A
MORE SIGNIFICANT WAVE/FRONT WILL APPROACH BY LATE NEXT
WEEKEND...BUT WILL HAVE TO SEE SOME RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY AND
SUPPORT FROM OTHER MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AND ENSEMBLES BEFORE JUMPING
ON THAT EVENT. FOR TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE APPEARS REASONABLE AND
GENERALLY DID NOT STRAY FAR FROM THOSE VALUES.

AFTERNOON. TWEAKED A FEW MAX/MINS FOR THE DIGITAL PRODUCTS BUT THE 
ZONES AND GRAPHICS WILL LIKELY NOT DEPICT MUCH CHANGE IF ANY. WINDS 
SEEMED A LITTLE OFF, EVEN FOR THE RELATIVELY LOW SPEEDS, SO USED GFS 
TO POPULATE THE WIND FIELDS THROUGH THE PERIOD, WITH SOME MINOR 
ADJUSTMENTS.

PATTERN THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUING TO 
DOMINATE.  A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES/FRONTAL BOUNDARIES TRY TO PUSH

233 AM EDT SAT SEP 29 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH CENTERED NORTH OF US,

THIS AFTERNOON, BUT NOTHING SERIOUS. STILL WARM AND VIRTUALLY NO 
CLOUDS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...PERSISTENCE BEST WAY TO GO 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED WITH HIGH PRESSURE REMAINING IN CONTROL.  A 
COUPLE OF WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARIES DO APPROACH THE AREA...HOWEVER... 
DO NOT EXPECT THEM TO REACH AS FAR SOUTH AS THE MRX CWA AND EXPECT 
THEM TO HAVE VERY LITTLE AFFECT ON AREA WEATHER.  MAIN CONCERN WILL 
BE THE VERY DRY CONDITIONS ON SOME DAYS WITH THE DRIEST LOCATIONS 
HAVING RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES IN THE TEENS AND 20S PERCENT RANGE 
DURING THE HOTTEST PART OF THE DAY.

DROUGHT CONDITIONS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...PERSISTENT DRY 
FORECAST SEEMS BEST BET THROUGH FRIDAY.

HAVE TRENDED A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE GFS HIGHS THROUGH THE PERIOD 
GIVEN EXTREMELY DRY SOIL MOISTURE CONDITIONS. PERSISTENT SURFACE 
RIDGING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL KEEP DEWPOINTS 
LOW...ESPECIALLY DURING THE AFTERNOONS.  THE LOW AFTERNOON 
HUMIDITIES WILL PRODUCE AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES IN THE 20S 
WITH SOME TEENS POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY FOR SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.

SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES BY MID-WEEK NEXT WEEK. BY THURSDAY...THE 
MOISTURE AND ASSOCIATED CLOUDS/PRECIPITATION MOVES INTO THE FORECAST

END OF THE WEEK AND THE WEEKEND WHICH CONTINUES THE TREND OF MOSTLY
SUNNY SKIES AND ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ALTHOUGH NOT QUITE AS
WARM. THE RIDGE IS STRONGEST ON SUNDAY. MODELS DEVELOP AN UPPER LOW
OVER THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL ROCKIES AND BRING IT NORTHEAST ACROSS
THE GREAT LAKES BY MONDAY WHICH NUDGES THE RIDGE NORTH AND EAST.
THE RIDGE KEEPS THE FRONT FROM MOVING VERY FAR EAST OF THE OHIO AND
MS RIVERS BEFORE BREAKING APART MONDAY. THE FORECAST AREA WILL
STILL BE DRY EVEN WITH WEAKER RIDGE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST AND MID
ATLANTIC. BY THE LAST DAY EASTERLY FLOW MAY BRING MOISTURE CLOSE TO
THE FORECAST AREA. GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE HIGHER GUIDANCE VALUES
FOR TEMPERATURES THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. THEN A
PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR THE SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY PERIOD.
