FXUS64 KMRX 260711
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 AM EDT WED SEP 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE THAT HAS PERSISTED OVER THE AREA FOR THE PAST SEVERAL 
DAYS FINALLY MOVES EAST TODAY AS AN UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE 
WEST. A PLUME OF MOISTURE SEEN IN WV IMAGERY OVER WEST TN THIS 
MORNING WILL MAKE MORE EASTWARD PROGRESS...INCREASING CLOUD COVER 
AND THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS THIS AFTERNOON. A VORT MAX OVER NRN MS IS 
PROGGED BY THE MODELS TO CROSS THE AREA LATE IN THE AFTERNOON AND IN 
THE EVENING. INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON LOOKS SUFFICIENT FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS...WITH MLCAPE NEAR 1500 J/KG. WILL CARRY A SLIGHT 
CHANCE DURING THE DAY...INCREASING TO CHANCE POPS NORTH AND WEST 
WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE VORT MAX. TEMPS MAY REACH TO NEAR 90 AGAIN 
IN THE VALLEY. TONIGHT...EXPECT FALLING HEIGHTS AND INCREASING 
MOISTURE AHEAD OF A MORE SIGNIFICANT TROUGH. THE MODELS HAVE SLIGHT 
TIMING DIFFERENCES WITH THE BEST LIFT...WITH THE NAM BEING ABOUT 3 
HOURS FASTER THAN THE GFS. WILL CONTINUE TO LEAN TOWARD THE SLOWER 
GFS. HOWEVER BOTH SHOW GOOD LIFT AND WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS IN MOST 
SPOTS WITH CATEGORICAL NORTHWEST FOR THURSDAY. INSTABILITY WILL BE 
LIMITED BY CLOUD COVER SO WILL ONLY HAVE A CHANCE OF THUNDER. THE 
UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE IN THE GFS OCCURS AROUND 00Z...AND WILL QUICKLY 
DECREASE POPS THURSDAY NIGHT. SURFACE FROPA OCCURS BETWEEN MIDNIGHT 
AND 10Z. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
HIGHER PRESSURES BUILD OVER THE REGION DEEP INTO THE WEEKEND. 
SUBSIDENCE AND LITTLE IN THE WAY OF MOISTURE ADVECTION KEEPS THIS 
PERIOD OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST UNEVENTFUL. ON MONDAY A WEAK 
SHORTWAVE TRAVERSES THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEASTERN U.S. 
WHILE LOWER PRESSURE MAKES A SLOW MOVE WEST ACROSS THE FLORIDA 
PENINSULA AND SOUTHERN GEORGIA INCREASING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE A BIT 
ACROSS THESE AREAS AND MAY SEE A FEW CU ACROSS SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. BY TUESDAY LOW LEVELS MOISTEN A LITTLE MORE AS 
SUBTROPICAL LOW EDGES SLOWLY WEST ACROSS THE GULF OF MEXICO BUT ALL 
THIS MEANS FOR NOW WILL BE SCATTERED CU. ADJUSTED MAX/MIN TEMPS 
TOWARD THE NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE WHICH FEATURES ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS 
THROUGH THE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
WEAK COLD FRONT LOOKS TO PROVIDE THE MAIN RAIN CHANCES...ESPECIALLY 
ON THURSDAY. NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO GO WITH LIKELY POPS IN ANY AREA 
JUST YET...SO KEPT HIGH CHANCE POPS WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WORDING DURING THE DAY THURSDAY. THREAT OF ANY
PRECIPITATION MAY END AS EARLY AS 06Z FRIDAY.

OTHERWISE...FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD THE SURFACE RIDGING 
HOLDS STRONG AND LIMITS ANY SIGNIFICANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASE. 
UPPER RIDGE ALSO REBUILDS ACROSS THE REGION...UNTIL SHORTWAVE ENERGY 
FAR TO OUR NORTH FLATTENS THE UPPER RIDGE A BIT ON MONDAY...THEN A 
MORE SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVE TROUGH BEGINS TO DEVELOP OVER THE NRN AND 
CENTRAL PLAINS ON TUESDAY. HOWEVER...AT THIS POINT PREFERRED TO KEEP 
POPS BELOW 14 PERCENT FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...AND MORE DRY WEATHER. 

THIS ALL RESULTS IN MORE ABOVE CLIMO MIN AND MAX TEMPS THROUGHOUT 
THE LONG TERM PERIODS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  68  88  65  83  61 /  10  30  30  50  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    66  86  64  80  59 /  10  20  20  50  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN            66  87  64  80  59 /  10  30  30  50  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   63  84  58  80  56 /  10  20  20  50  30 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 250708
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 AM EDT TUE SEP 25 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
PERSISTENT RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WILL GRADUALLY 
SHIFT TO THE EAST TODAY. TODAY SHOULD BE MUCH LIKE YESTERDAY...WITH 
SCATTERED CU AND TEMPERATURES WELL ABOVE NORMAL. HIGH TEMPS WILL 
FLIRT WITH RECORD HIGHS...WHICH ARE 94/92/90 FOR CHA/TYS/TRI TODAY. 
MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS THE HIGH 
MOVES OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST...AND A MIDLEVEL CAPPING INVERSION 
WEAKENS. THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR ENOUGH DESTABILIZATION FOR ISOLATED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. THE NAM IS MUCH 
FASTER TO BRING HIGHER POPS INTO THE AREA THAN THE GFS...MAINLY DUE 
TO ITS FASTER EASTWARD PROGRESSION AND WEAKENING OF THE RIDGE. GIVEN 
THE STRENGTH AND PERSISTENCE OF THE RIDGE...WILL LEAN TOWARD THE GFS 
AND KEEP POPS IN THE LOW/SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH WILL PROVIDE 
BETTER LIFT ACROSS THE AREA ON THURSDAY. DYNAMICS WITH THE TROUGH 
ARE NOT IMPRESSIVE...AND THE FLOW OF GULF MOISTURE IS LIMITED...SO 
WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE FOR THURSDAY. STICKING WITH THE 
SLOWER GFS...WILL KEEP SOME POPS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT...TAPERING DOWN 
TO A SLIGHT CHANCE AFTER MIDNIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
COOL FRONT MAKES ITS WAY EAST TO THE ATLANTIC COAST DURING THE DAY 
FRIDAY WITH DRIER NORTHERLY COMPONENT DEVELOPING AS SURFACE RIDGE 
PRESSES ONLY SLOWLY EAST. RIDGING KEEPS THE FORECAST DRY THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND AND BEYOND. GFS CONTINUES TO HINT AT LOW AMPLITUDE SHORT 
WAVE SHIFTING EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. 
ON MONDAY WITH POSSIBILITY OF SURFACE TROF DROPPING SOUTHEAST TOWARD 
THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...PATTERN DOESNT LOOK TOO PROMISING ATTM 
FOR THE INTRODUCTION OF A POP. WILL HOLD ONTO CONTINUITY AT THIS 
EXTENDED PERIOD OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST. TRENDED TEMPERATURE 
FORECAST TOWARD MEX MOS GUIDANCE THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  92  67  87  67  81 /   0  10  20  20  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN  90  67  86  67  80 /   0  10  30  30  50

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
858 PM EDT MON SEP 24 2007

.DISCUSSION...RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT REMAINS ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS KEEPING TROPICAL MOISTURE SOUTH AND WEST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. ISOLATED SHOWERS DID DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN 
VALLEY THIS EVENING BUT HAS DISSIPATED. MOSTLY CLEAR SKY WILL 
DOMINATE ONCE AGAIN WITH DEWPOINTS SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHT. ANTICIPATE
LOWS TONIGHT TO BE SIMILAR TO THIS MORNINGS.  CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS
GOOD AND PLAN NO CHANGES.

.SHORT TERM(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
CONTROL AREA WEATHER THROUGHOUT THE SHORT TERM AS IT SLOWLY BEGINS 
TO SHIFT EASTWARD.  THEREFORE...WILL SEE LITTLE CHANGE IN THE 
WEATHER WITH GENERALLY MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND SEASONABLE WARM 
TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE FROM 
PREVIOUS FORECAST AS GFS AND NAM IN CLOSE ENOUGH AGREEMENT ON TIMING 
OF FRONT VERY LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HAVE RAMPED UP QPF SOME ON 
THURSDAY, BUT STILL NOT TO HEAVY RAIN AMOUNTS. SOME LOCATIONS WILL 
SEE MODERATE AMOUNTS STRETCHED OVER A TWELVE HOUR PERIOD AND THIS 
WILL BE BENEFICIAL BUT NOT A DROUGHT BUSTER. FRONT WILL MOVE IF NOT 
RAPIDLY, AT LEAST STEADILY THROUGH THE REGION AND EXIT BY LATE 
THURSDAY, LEAVING FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY LARGELY SUNNY. ADJUSTED MINS 
ON THURSDAY (WEDNESDAY NIGHT) UP A DEGREE OR TWO DUE TO CLOUDS AND 
PRECIP.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT MON SEP 24 2007

.SHORT TERM TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WITH A LARGE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
REMAINING DIRECTLY OVER THE FORECAST AREA...A PERSISTENCE FORECAST 
WILL BE FOLLOWED. BASED ON 1000-850 MB THICKNESS AND MOS 
GUIDANCE...HIGH TEMPS TODAY WILL AGAIN REACH INTO THE LOWER 90S. 
RECORDS HIGHS AT TRI/TYS/CHA ARE 91/93/92...AND THESE COULD 
CERTAINLY BE BROKEN TODAY. THE RIDGE SHIFTS SLIGHTLY TO THE EAST AND 
BECOMES ELONGATED EAST-TO-WEST TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD ONLY SERVE TO 
PUSH THE TROPICAL MOISTURE FEED OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY FARTHER TO 
THE WEST.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE AREA 
WILL BRING WARM AND DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.  
MODELS INDICATING A WEAK SHORTWAVE ROTATING OVER THE RIDGE ON 
WEDNESDAY ALONG WITH SOME INSTABILITY...BUT MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO 
WILL GO WITH ONLY 20 POPS FOR WEDNESDAY.  A FRONT PUSHES INTO THE 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND LINGERS INTO THURSDAY.  IT SHOULD HAVE 
SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT TO KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  THE FRONT EXITS THE CWA ON THURSDAY NIGHT... 
WILL KEEP ONLY 20-30 POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCES 
IN THE EVENING HOURS.  THE UPPER TROUGH TRACKS THROUGH EARLY 
FRIDAY.  WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS FOR FRIDAY WITH SOME 
RESIDUAL MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY LINGERING.  UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN 
ON LATE FRIDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SUNDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
810 PM EDT SUN SEP 23 2007

.DISCUSSION...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SURFACE AND ALOFT REMAINS CENTERED OVER THE
FORECAST AREA SUPPRESSING ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. THE RIDGE WILL 
ALSO KEEP THE TROPICAL MOISTURE OVER THE GULF COAST STATES SOUTH AND 
WEST OF THE REGION PRODUCING ANOTHER QUIET NIGHT OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS.  WILL FOLLOW PERSISTENCE FOR TONIGHTS LOWS. CURRENT
FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND PLAN NO CHANGES.

HAVE A GOOD NIGHT...

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT IN 
KENTUCKY...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONT IS EXPECTED TO BASICALLY DISSIPATE AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL HIGH CONTINUES OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. 
THIS UPPER HIGH SHOULD SUPPRESS ANY POSSIBLE CONVECTION ON MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY AFTERNOONS...AND ALLOW TEMPS TO CONTINUE TO RISE TO 
UNSEASONABLY WARM LEVELS. IN FACT...AFTERNOON MAXES WILL BE 
APPROACHING RECORD-SETTING VALUES. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO 
CONTINUE WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST...AS THE AIR MASS SHOULD REMAIN 
ESSENTIALLY THE SAME THROUGH TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE REGION DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED. DEEP 
MOISTURE AND SUFFICIENT LIFT SHOULD PRODUCE A DECENT BAND OF 
SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE MRX CWA. THERE REMAINS SOME 
DISCREPANCY IN TIMING...SO WILL KEEP SIMILAR CHANCE TYPE POPS OVER 
THE AREA BOTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. WILL LEAVE SOME ISOLATED 
EASTERN MOUNTAIN CONVECTION INTO FRIDAY AS THE SYSTEM EXITS THE 
REGION. KEEPING THINGS DRY FOR THE WEEKEND. GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK 
REASONABLE AND DIDN/T STRAY FAR.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...

HIGH BUILDING ACROSS THE REGION AND CREATING SOME SUBSIDENCE...WILL 
KEEP THE DRY FORECAST GOING. OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST SEEMS TO BE 
ON TRACK AND WILL NOT PLAN TO UPDATE THIS MORNING.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT IN THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A FEW 
SHOWERS OCCURRING ALONG THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE PLATEAU AND 
MOUNTAINS. THIS COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO REACH THE NORTHERN

STATIONARY AND ULTIMATELY WASHING-OUT AS AS UPPER-LEVEL HIGH BUILDS 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. MODELS INDICATE THAT MAY BE ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON 
(AND AGAIN ON MONDAY AFTERNOON) TO PRODUCE A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS. 
THUS...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST NC ON SUNDAY...AND WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY 
AFTERNOON ACROSS THESE SAME AREAS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL CONTINUE WITH 
A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR THE MOST PART...BUT WITH A SLIGHT RISE IN 
BOTH MAXES AND MINS EACH SUCCESSIVE DAY. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THERE REMAINS SOME 
INCONSISTENCY WITH DETAILS...ESPECIALLY TIMING OF APPROACHING COLD 
FRONT...AND CONFIDENCE IS LOW. HAVE TRENDED TOWARD A SLOWER FRONTAL 
PASSAGE AND HAVE MADE TUESDAY DRY. WILL CONTINUE WITH THE BEST 
CHANCE OF PRECIP EXPECTED WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THE FRONT 
WILL BE PULLING AWAY FROM THE REGION ON FRIDAY AND WILL LEAVE SOME 
LOW POPS FOR THE TIME FRAME...MAINLY OVER EAST MOUNTAINS...AND WILL 
KEEP THINGS DRY FOR SATURDAY. KEPT TEMPS NEAR GUIDANCE.

955 AM EDT SAT SEP 22 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY...WITH A WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS FRONT IS EXPECTED TO REACH THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON...BEFORE BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY AS 
AS UPPER-LEVEL HIGH BUILDS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. GFS MODEL 
INDICATES THAT THERE WILL BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR A FEW SHOWERS 
THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...WHILE THE WRF 
MODEL INDICATES THAT A FEW SHOWERS MAY DEVELOP ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE FRONT. 

WILL ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST TO ADD A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA FOR THIS AFTERNOON. 
IN ADDITION...EXPECT TEMPS TO BE FAIRLY SIMILAR TO YESTERDAYS 
VALUES OVERALL...BUT WILL TWEAK TEMPS ACCORDING TO THE LATEST 
TRENDS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AT THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE MISSOURI VALLEY REGION WILL MOVE EAST OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. 
THE SUBTROPICAL DEPRESSION NEAR THE GULF COAST WILL TRACK TO THE 
WEST. ALOFT...A RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
THROUGH TONIGHT. WITH THE SUBTROPICAL LOW MOVING AWAY AND A WEAKER 
EASTERLY FLOW...THERE SHOULD BE LESS CLOUDS TODAY THAN YESTERDAY. 
SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA COULD SEE SOME LOW CLOUDS THIS MORNING 
BUT THESE SHOULD LIFT AND SCATTER AROUND SUNRISE. TEMPS CONTINUE 
ABOVE NORMAL...AND HIGHS COULD REACH TO NEAR 90 IN THE VALLEY TODAY. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THE MOST OF THE AREA ON SUNDAY.  A WEAK 
SHORTWAVE TRACKS ACROSS OUR SOUTHERN ZONES ON SUNDAY...WILL KEEP LOW 
POPS FOR THOSE AREAS WHERE THE SOME MOISTURE RESIDES.  HIGH PRESSURE 
RETURNS ON MONDAY KEEPING THE BULK OF THE PRECIPITATION WEST OF OUR 
CWA ON MONDAY.  MOISTURE INCREASES A BIT ON TUESDAY...WILL KEEP THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE GOING FOR OUR WESTERN COUNTIES ON TUESDAY.  A FRONT 
PUSHES INTO THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS INTO THURSDAY.  IT 
SHOULD HAVE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT TO KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING 
FOR BOTH DAYS.  THE FRONT PUSHES EAST OF THE CWA ON FRIDAY.  WILL 
KEEP 20 POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS FOR FRIDAY WITH SOME RESIDUAL 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY LINGERING IN THAT AREA THROUGH THE DAY.  
STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT FRI SEP 21 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING OVER THE APPALACHIANS...WITH 
AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE STRENGTHENING OVER THE NORTHERN GULF OF 
MEXICO. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL THAT EASTERLY WINDS OVER THE 
CAROLINAS ARE ADVECTING MOISTURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THINK THAT 
MOST OF THESE CLOUDS SHOULD DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET...BUT WILL MENTION 
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES FOR TONIGHT THROUGH MOST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD 
TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS MOISTURE. MOISTURE SHOULD CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY 
INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH SOME 
MARGINAL INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC 
BY SUNDAY. THUS...WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ON 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR THESE AREAS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR THE MOST PART...BUT WITH A 
SLIGHT RISE IN BOTH MAXES AND MINS EACH SUCCESSIVE DAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...REMNANTS OF THE DEPRESSION 
CURRENTLY TO OUR SOUTH WILL SLIDE NORTHWARD WITH UPPER FLOW DURING 
THE EARLY PART OF THE EXTENDED. WITH HIGH PRESSURE STILL DOMINATING 
OUR WEATHER ON MONDAY...WILL STAY DRY AND WARM...GENERALLY KEEPING 
ASSOCIATED PRECIP FROM THE DEPRESSION TO OUR WEST. WHAT/S LEFT OF 
THE DEPRESSION WILL MERGE WITH AN APPROACHING FRONT AROUND THE 
TUESDAY TIME FRAME. CURRENT GFS HAS HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY SHIFTING 
EASTWARD BUT MAINTAINING CONTROL OVER THE MRX CWA EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD. MAIN FRONTAL PRECIP COULD HOLD OFF AS LATE AS WEDNESDAY OR 
THURSDAY. WITH POOR MODEL CONSISTENCY...ESPECIALLY IN TIMING...WILL 
NOT DRASTICALLY CHANGE CURRENT FORECAST...BUT HAVE TRENDED TOWARD A 
SLOWER FRONTAL PASSAGE.

CHANGES DIRECTION...FROM WEAK EASTERLY TO SOUTHERLY BY LATE THIS
WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...SEE NO REASON TO ADD ANY
LOW POPS FOR THIS PACKAGE...AS A DRY FORECAST SEEMS ON TRACK WITH
HIGHS MOSTLY IN THE 80S AND LOWS IN THE MID 50S TO MID 60S. A BIT
OF CLOUDINESS AND THE SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW WOULD FAVOR THE
MILDEST MIN TEMPS WHERE MOS DIFFERS SLIGHTLY...AND STAYED VERY NEAR
TO THE LATEST GFS/GFSX MOS FOR MAX TEMPS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             85  60  87  63  87 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  57  85  62  85 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  56  85  60  87 /   0   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              82  50  83  56  84 /   0   0   0  10  10

246 PM EDT TUE SEP 18 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  SATELLITE 
INDICATING A FEW CUMULUS CLOUDS DEVELOPING ALONG THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS WHICH SHOULD DISSIPATE THIS EVENING.  SHOULD HAVE A CLEAR 
TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKY FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  MAVMOS TEMPERATURES 
LOOKED FAIRLY REASONABLE...SO DIDNT STRAY TOO FAR. 

.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH TUE)...APPEARS RIDGE WILL CONTINUE 
TO PROVIDE DRY AND MOSTLY CLEAR WEATHER THROUGH THURSDAY.  
CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH IN THE LONGER TERM.  12Z GFS HAS MADE A 
CONTINUITY BREAK...AND NOW BRINGS A BAND OF MOISTURE UP ACROSS THE 
AREA BY THE WEEKEND AS LOW MOVES NORTHWEST ACROSS NORTHERN GULF AND 
ONSHORE WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.  IT THEN KEEPS CONSIDERABLE 
MOISTURE OVER THE AREA INTO THE EARLY PART OF THE WEEK.  EVEN IF 
CORRECT...PRECIP WOULD PROBABLY BE LIMITED...BUT CLOUDS WOULD BE 
ENHANCED CONSIDERABLY.  WILL NOT JUMP ON THIS SOLUTION YET WITH JUST 
ONE MODEL RUN...BUT IF THIS TREND CONTINUES LATER SHIFTS WILL HAVE 
TO MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO LATER PERIODS OF FORECAST.  FOR NOW 
WILL GO MORE WITH MORE OF A 00Z ECMWF/06Z GFS BLEND.  THIS HAS 
BETTER  CONTINUITY AND AGREES WITH HPC GUIDANCE IN KEEPING FORECAST 
DRY.

FXUS64 KMRX 180656
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 AM EDT TUE SEP 18 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE TO OUR WEST BEGINS
A PERIOD OF STRONG AMPLIFICATION TODAY...AND SURFACE RIDGE AXIS HAS
CHANGED VERY LITTLE FROM YESTERDAY KEEPING A VERY WEAK EASTERLY LOW
LEVEL FLOW. THE EASTERLY FLOW HAS PRODUCED A FEW PATCHY AREAS OF
LOW CLOUDS THIS MORNING...SIMILAR TO MONDAY MORNING. HOWEVER...
EXPECT ONLY A FEW CUMULUS CLOUDS LATER TODAY...SO JUST A MATTER OF
TWEAKING MAX AND MIN TEMPS FOR THE SHORT TERM.

MOS TRACK RECORD OF LATE HAS BEEN TO GENERALLY RUN ABOUT 1 TO 2
DEGREES TOO COOL FOR MAXES...AND RUN A FEW DEGREES TOO COOL ON
MINS. THIS WAS ALREADY REFLECTED IN PREVIOUS MAX/MIN GRIDS...SO
JUST SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS BASED ON YESTERDAYS TEMPS AND LATEST
MOS NUMBERS.


.LONG TERM...(WED THROUGH MON)...NAM SEEMS TO WANT TO MOVE GMEX LOW 
ACROSS FL PENINSULA TO ATLANTIC AND THEN UP COAST JUST ENOUGH TO 
CYCLONICLY ROTATE RH INTO THE REGION, WITH LOW POPS ACROSS 
MOUNTAINS. THIS IS THE ONLY MODEL DOING THIS. GFS BUILDS UPPER RIDGE 
OVER US, AND ALLOWS GMEX LOW TO RETROGRADE WESTWARD, KEEPING RIDGE 
EVEN STRONGER. PATTERN TEMPORARILY TAKES ON OMEGA BLOCK 
CHARACTERISTICS. BELIEVE THIS IS MORE LIKELY WHAT WILL HAPPEN AND SO 
HAVE KEPT POPS OUT OF THE ENTIRE LONG TERM PACKAGE. HAVE ADJUSTED 
MAX TEMPS WED AND MINS WED NIGHT TO BE MORE ALIGNED WITH MODEL 
BLENDS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             84  58  84  60  86 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  83  57  82  58  83 /   0   0   0   0  10

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              81  51  81  51  82 /   0   0   0   0  10

LOW THAT MOVES WEST ACROSS FLORIDA INTO THE GULF....GFS SOLUTION 
LOOKS MORE REASONABLE. OTHER MODEL DIFFERENCES EXIST HANDLING ENERGY 
IN THE NORTHERN STREAM IN THE LATER PERIODS...BUT SHOULD  NOT MATTER 
MUCH FOR OUR AREA.  APPEARS HIGH PRESSURE AND A LACK OF MOISTURE 
SHOULD KEEP THINGS MAINLY DRY FOR THE PERIOD.  WILL KEEP PRECIP OUT 
OF THE FORECAST...AND MAKE JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO GFS MOS TEMPS.

.DISCUSSION...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL PRODUCE
ANOTHER DRY DAY WITH NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.  CURRENT FORECAST
LOOKS GOOD AND DO NOT PLAN ANY CHANGES.

HAVE A GOOD DAY...

&&

.SHORT TERM...SURFACE RIDGE EXTENDS FROM NE STATES ACROSS MID-
ATLANTIC STATES TO THE CAROLINAS THIS MORNING. WEAK EASTERLY LOW
LEVEL FLOW WAS SPREADING A FEW SCATTERED TO BROKEN LOW CLOUDS FROM
WRN NC JUST INTO THE SMOKIES AND SRN MTNS OF THE FORECAST AREA.
THESE CLOUDS SHOULD NOT BE A MAJOR FACTOR...WITH MOSTLY SCATTERED
CUMULUS CLOUDS EXPECTED LATER THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON.
OTHERWISE...UPPER RIDGE EXPECTED TO BUILD EASTWARD TODAY AND
TOMORROW...WITH RISING HEIGHTS AND WEAK LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION
EACH DAY. GFS MOS PLUS ABOUT A DEGREE OR TWO LOOKED BEST FOR HGIHS
TODAY...THEN SOMEWHAT OF A BLEND OF MOS FOR TONIGHTS MIN TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...PERSISTENT UPPER RIDGE
ACROSS EASTERN US WILL KEEP FORECAST AREA DRY AND WARM TUESDAY
THROUGH THURSDAY. MODELS STILL DEVELOPING CUTOFF UPPER LOW OVER
FLORIDA WEDNESDAY THAN MOVING IT SLOWLY WEST THURSDAY THROUGH
SATURDAY INTO THE GULF TOWARD THE LOUISIANA COAST. ECMWF KEEPS MOST
OF THE MOISTURE SOUTH WITH RIDGE STAYING STRONG WHILE GFS BRINGS
CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION INTO THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE
RIDGE FRIDAY AND SATUDAY THEN STRENGTHENS RIDGE SUNDAY. WILL FOLLOW
A PERSISTENCE FORECAST TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY BUT KEEP A SLIGHT
CHANCE OF SHOWERS MOUNTAINS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 161427
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EDT SUN SEP 16 2007

.DISCUSSION...SOME CLOUDINESS ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE 
WILL SWING THROUGH THE AREA LATER TODAY BUT BASICALLY NO IMPACT ON 
THE FORECAST.  CURRENT FORECAST ON TRACK SO NO CHANGES PLANNED.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FALL LIKE MORNING 
NOTED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH TEMPS IN THE 40S TO MID 50S.  
WARM AIR ADVECTION TO OUR NORTHWEST AND UPPER JET AXIS HAS BEEN 
PRODUCING SOME MID TO HIGH CLOUDS OVER IL/IN AND ERN KY.  THESE 
CLOUDS SHOULD AFFECT AT LEAST NRN MOST AREAS IN OUR REGION THIS 
MORNING...SO SKY COVER GRIDS INCREASED SLIGHTLY FOR TODAY.

EXPECT THE MID TO HIGH CLOUDS TO BE GONE OR THINNED OUT TONIGHT...SO
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES LOOKS GOOD. GFS MAX TEMPS WERE RIGHT ON FOR MAXES 
YESTERDAY...AND CLOSELY FOLLOWED FOR HIGHS TODAY.  BLEND FOR MINS 
TONIGHT WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES NOTED.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE
EXPANDS OVER EASTERN US MONDAY WITH THICKNESSES INCREASING.
HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL WARM ABOUT 5 DEGREES WITH LOWS A FEW DEGREES
WARMER ALSO. THE RIDGE STAYS STRETCHED FROM THE NORTHEAST SOUTHWEST 
TO THE CENTRAL GULF COAST THROUGH WEDNESDAY. ON WEDNESDAY THE LONG 
RANGE GFS BRINGS A NEWLY FORMED CUT OFF LOW FROM FLORIDA WEST TOWARD 
THE NORTH CENTRAL GULF BY THE WEEKEND. THIS WOULD BRING MOISTURE 
NORTH IN THE FORM OF CLOUDS THURSDAY AND A CHANCE OF RAIN FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY. PREFER ECMWF MODEL WHICH KEEPS BULK OF THE MOISTURE SOUTH 
OF THE FORECAST AREA AND RIDGE STRONG THROUGH SATURDAY. INCREASING 
CLOUD COVER THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH WARMER NIGHT TIME TEMPERATURES 
AS SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE MOVES UP FROM THE SOUTH.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  
GFS INDICATING A DISTURBANCE MOVING UP FROM THE SOUTH ON THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY.  LATEST RUNS HAVE LOW TRACKING FURTHER EAST THAN 
PREVIOUS ONES WHICH IS IN LINE WITH HPC AND THE ECMWF...SO WILL 
CONTINUE TO KEEP THURSDAY AND FRIDAY DRY.  A WEAK FRONT APPROACHES 
THE REGION ON SATURDAY...WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WILL 
KEEP SATURDAY DRY.  STAYED NEAR GFS/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EDT SAT SEP 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK.  WILL REMOVE 
MORNING FOG WORDING.


.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AREAS...APPEARING TO BE NEARING A CHA TO OQT 
LINE. MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS THE PREVALENT AREAS OF FOG THAT 
DEVELOPED OVERNIGHT AS SKIES CLEARED. EXPECT FOG TO LIFT BEFORE 
DAYBREAK WITH PASSAGE OF COLD FRONT...BUT KEPT IN SOME AREAS OF FOG 
IN THE FORECAST GRIDS FOR THE NEXT FEW HOURS. REMOVED FEW SPOTS OF 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AS THREAT OF ANY SHOWERS WITH FRONT HAS GREATLY 
DIMINISHED. WILL COVER FOG IN SHORT TERM FORECAST ALSO.

OTHERWISE...A VERY PLEASANT WEEKEND AHEAD AS TEMPS ACTUALLY STAY 
BELOW SEASONAL NORMALS FOR A CHANGE. SAW LITTLE REASON TO STRAY FROM 
GFS MAXES OR MINS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...COOL HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES
SUNDAY AS IT MOVES INTO THE NORTHEAST STATES WITH UPPER TROUGH
ALONG EAST COAST. AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS EAST FROM THE MS VALLEY
TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO ABOVE NORMAL READINGS THROUGH THE REST OF
THE WEEK. LOOKS LIKE ONE MORE COOL NIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT WITH LOWS
IN THE UPPER 40S TO MIDDLE 50S. WARMED HIGHS BACK INTO THE 80S FOR
THE REST OF THE FORECAST FROM TRI CITIES SOUTH TO CHATTANOOGA. GFS
AND ECWMF BRING IN MOISTURE WITH CUT OFF UPPER LOW FORMING OFF THE
FLORIDA COAST AND THEN MOVING WEST INTO THE GULF. FOR NOW THINK THE
RAIN WILL STAY SOUTH OF TN BUT CLOUD COVER MAY INCREASE WITH THE
FLOW AROUND THE LOW. WILL WAIT FOR MORE MODEL RUNS TO CHANGE THE
LAST FEW DAYS OF THE FORECAST.

ACCELERATING IN ITS PROGRESS.  MAIN AREA NOW PAST KCHA...AND UPDATED 
EXTRAPOLATION CLEARS THE BACK EDGE OF PRECIP BY THE SE CORNER OF TN 
BY 4PM...KTYS BY 5PM...KMOR BY 6PM...KTRI BY 7PM...NE CORNER OF TN 
BY 8PM.  

AFTER THIS AREA EXITS...THE NEXT CHANCE OF PRECIP WILL BE THE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE TONIGHT.  THINK FRONT WILL ENTER NWRN CWA 
AROUND 04Z AND EXIT SERN CWA AROUND 12Z.  WITH NO DIURNAL HEATING 
DURING ITS PASSAGE AND NO PRESENT ACTIVITY BUILDING ALONG THE IN THE 
OHIO VALLEY...HAVE CUT BACK TO MINIMAL POPS FOR LATE TONIGHT FOR 
FROPA AND JUST WORDING AS SHOWERS.  HAVE LEFT IN SOME PINPOINT POPS 
IN HIGHER TERRAIN OF APPALACHIANS FOR SATURDAY MORNING.  

MODEL TEMPS LOOK GOOD OVERALL...BUT HAVE SHAVED BACK HIGH TEMPS OVER 
SOUTHERN AREAS DUE TO AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE IN TOP LAYERS OF SOIL AND 
ASSOCIATED EVAPORATION SATURDAY AFTERNOON.  HAVE CUT BACK DEW POINT 
READINGS DUE TO SOURCE REGION...MO/IL/IA AREA...HAVING SUCH LOW DEW 
POINTS.  HAVE LEFT THEM A LITTLE HIGHER OVER THE SOUTHERN AREAS DUE 
TO AFOREMENTIONED EVAPORATION.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE AREA BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  
GFS INDICATING A DISTURBANCE MOVING UP FROM THE SOUTH ON THURSDAY 
AND LINGERING INTO FRIDAY...WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON THE PATH 
OF THE LOW...WILL KEEP THURSDAY AND FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW.  STAYED NEAR

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1125 AM EDT FRI SEP 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...REMNANTS FROM HUMBERTO MOVING SLOWLY ENEWD NEAR CENTRAL
MS/AL BORDER. COUPLE OF LARGE SHIELDS OF RAIN TO NORTHEAST OF
HUMBERTO THAT STRETCH THROUGH AND PAST OUR CWA. NORTHERN EDGE OF
HUMBERTO SHIELD IN SOUTHERN TN SLIDING TO THE ENE. LOOKING AT
PRESENT MOVEMENT AND MODEL TRENDS THINK IT IS SAFE TO BACK OFF POPS
SOMEWHAT IN THE NW CORNER OF CWA FOR THE REST OF AFTERNOON. HAVE
BACKED POPS TO 40 PERCENT IN THAT CORNER. ELSEWHERE HIGH POPS RULE
WITH 100 PERCENT POPS FOR ABOUT THE SOUTHERN 20 PERCENT OF THE AREA
AND 80+ PERCENT POPS FOR ABOUT THE SOUTHEASTERN 1/2 OF AREA.

MODELS SHOW HUMBERTO CENTER CONTINUING TO WEAKEN AND TURN ALMOST
DUE EAST...AND NCEP FORECASTER STATED AN EXPECTED LESSENING FROM
THE OVERNIGHT RAIN RATES NORTHEAST OF HUMBERTO. SO HAVE KEPT QPF
VALUES FAIRLY CONSERVATIVE...WITH BASIN-AVERAGE AMOUNTS AROUND 0.50
INCH ALONG THE GA BORDER. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED BY SOME 1-3 INCH
ISOLATED AMOUNTS...BUT THINK THAT PRIME FOCUS OF HEAVY RAIN WILL BE
SOUTH OF ARE TODAY AND SOUTHEAST OF AREA TONIGHT.

06Z GFS MOVEMENT OF BACK EDGE OF RAIN IS WAY TOO FAST...NAM AND RUC
LOOK MUCH MORE REASONABLE. PURE RADAR EXTRAPOLATION PUTS BACK EDGE
OF PRECIP AT KCHA ABOUT 530 PM...AT KTYS AT 800 PM...CORNER OF SE
TN 700 PM...AND NE CORNER OF TN AT 100 AM. THINK ENTIRE SHIELD WILL
SHIFT EASTWARD AND ACCELERATE THE BACK EDGE A LITTLE FASTER THAN
THESE ESTIMATES...ESPECIALLY FOR THE 100 AM ESTIMATE FOR NE CORNER
OF TN.

COLD FRONT STILL PRETTY FAR NORTHWEST AND WILL NOT AFFECT WEATHER
FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

CURRENT TEMPS IN FORECAST FOR THIS AFTERNOON LOOK VERY GOOD.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...REMNANTS OF HURRICANE HUMBERTO

CONTINUED A SLIGHT MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS (ABUNDANT
MOISTURE...LIFT AND SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY). ANOTHER ROUND OF
SOME MUCH NEEDED RAINFALL FOR ALL AREAS.

EXPECT THE SHOWERS TO BE ENDING BY OR BEFORE MIDNIGHT...THEN GRADUAL 
CLEARING BEHIND PASSAGE OF STRONGER COLD FRONT. GFS MOS MAXES AND 
MINS CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

...LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...STRONG COLD FRONT WITH 
CANADIAN ORIGIN WILL BRING SHOWERS TO AN END EARLY FRIDAY AND CLEAR 
OUT CLOUDS. HIGHS SHOULD STAY IN THE 60S AND 70S BEHIND THE FRONT 
EVEN WITH THE SUNSHINE. NIGHT TIME TEMPERATURES WILL BE MUCH COOLER 
THE COLDEST OF THE MONTH SO FAR. FOLLOWED MORE CONSERVATIVE NAM 
GUIDANCE. FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED A SLOW WARMING TREND WITH 
HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUING AS UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE SOUTH CENTRAL 
STATES EXTENDS NORTHEAST OVER THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS WHICH 
WARMS TEMPERATURES BACK INTO THE 80S. BY THURSDAY THE RIDGE MAY 
BREAK DOWN AS EASTERLY FLOW BRINGS MOISTURE INTO THE SOUTHEAST. FOR 
NOW WILL KEEP FORECAST AREA DRY.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE CENTER OF THE REMNANTS OF 
HUMBERTO OVER CENTRAL LA...WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT EXTENDING 
NORTHEAST ACROSS CENTRAL AL AND INTO NORTHERN GA. HUMBERTO IS ONLY 
EXPECTED TO DRIFT TO AROUND CENTRAL MS BY SUNRISE TOMORROW 
MORNING...BUT ITS ASSOCIATED MOISTURE SHOULD CONTINUE TO MOVE 
NORTHEAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT...AS SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
DEVELOPS AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. AREA 
RADARS ALREADY REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS WITH SOME EMBEDDED 
TSTORMS ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH...WITH SOME ISOLATED ACTIVITY MOVING 
INTO SOUTHWEST NC AND SOUTHEAST TN.

CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK FOR THE MOST PART...BUT WILL 
UPDATE THIS EVENING TO RAISE POPS A LITTLE...AND TO TWEAK THE 
WORDING AND TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

313 PM EDT THU SEP 13 2007

...SHORT-TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...THE REMAINS OF HUMBERTO
WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYER IN THE WEATHER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THE
NEXT 24-36 HOURS. MODELS SHOW THE MAIN EFFECTS FROM HUMBERTO WILL
BE SOUTH AND WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA.  A STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS 
THE GULF COAST STATES WILL KEEP BEST LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SOUTH OF THE
REGION WITH STRONGEST CONVECTION FROM HUMBERTO MAINLY SOUTH. 
HOWEVER...ENOUGH SYNOPTIC SCALE FORCING FROM ISENTROPIC LIFT...
DIVERGENCE ALOFT FROM RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF JET...TROPICAL 
MOISTURE...LIMITED INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS WITH 
EMBEDDED STORMS. 

A NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WILL PULL A
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT WITH DRIER AIR AND SLIGHTLY
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR THE WEEKEND.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS INDICATE A COLD 
FRONT ALONG WITH ITS ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH WILL PUSH QUICKLY EAST 
OF OUR CWA ON EARLY SATURDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN BEHIND 
IT.  WILL KEEP ONLY LOW POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS FOR SATURDAY MORNING 
THEN DRY ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA BY AFTERNOON.  GFS INDICATING AN 
INVERTED TROUGH PUSHING INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY...BUT WITH ONLY 
LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY.  UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS IN ON MONDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY.  GFS INDICATING A DISTURBANCE MOVING UP FROM THE SOUTH ON 
THURSDAY.  WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON MOVEMENT...WILL KEEP 
THURSDAY DRY FOR NOW.  STAYED NEAR GFS/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 131413
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1013 AM EDT THU SEP 13 2007

.DISCUSSION...
TROPICAL STORM HUMBERTO CONTINUES TO MOVE SLOWLY NORTH ACROSS
LOUISIANA THIS MORNING. PLENTY OF TROPICAL MOISTURE IS SPREADING
NORTHEAST ALOFT WITH A GOOD DEAL OF CI/CS ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY.
BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS ARE BECOMING MORE EASTERLY ACROSS THE
CAROLINAS AND WILL SPREAD MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY BACK INTO THE
EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. LATEST RUC AND NMM SHOWS
SUFFICIENT CAPE FOR WIDELY SCATTERED DEVELOP OF THUNDERSTORMS THIS
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HAVE INCLUDED A 20 POP FOR THE EASTERN
MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.

LATEST NMM CONTINUES TO SHOW PRECIPITATION FROM THE REMAINS OF
HUMBERTO MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY.
WILL ADDRESS THE POTENTIAL OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS THIS AFTERNOON.

HAVE A GOOD DAY...

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ISOLATED CONVECTION TO OUR EAST IS 
NOT EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE MRX CWA...AND HAVE LEFT MENTION OF POPS 
OUT OF MORNING FORECAST.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BE THE 
MAY WEATHER FEATURE OVER THE AREA TODAY AND WILL KEEP GENERALLY DRY 
AND WARM CONDITIONS IN THE FORECAST FOR THIS AFTERNOON.  FOR 
TONIGHT...REMNANTS OF HUMBERTO WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA.  THERE 
REMAINS SOME QUESTIONS AS TO TIMING AND NORTHERN EXTENT OF HUMBERTO 
AND HAVE CONTINUED WITH THE IDEA IN THE PREVIOUS FORECAST WITH 
SLOWLY INCREASING SKY COVER AND POPS FROM SOUTH TO NORTH THROUGHOUT THE 
NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...REMAINS OF TROPICAL STORM 
HUMBERTO SHOULD SPREAD RAINS ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON 
FRIDAY BRINGING MUCH NEEDED RAIN.  STILL ENOUGH UNCERTAINTY TO KEEP 
POPS BELOW THE CATEGORICAL RANGE BUT IN THE HIGH LIKELY CATEGORY.  
TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN MODERATE...MUCH COOLER THAN PREVIOUS 
WEEKS.

UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS BACK INTO THE REGION SATURDAY AND BEYOND 
BRINGING A RETURN OF DRY WEATHER AND TEMPERATURES SLOWLY CLIMBING 
EACH DAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

830 PM EDT WED SEP 12 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION...WITH A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. 
WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES...CALM WINDS...AND A COOL AND DRY AIR MASS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...THINK THAT FOG SHOULD DEVELOP OVERNIGHT... 
ESPECIALLY ALONG THE WATERWAYS WHERE WATER TEMPS REMAIN WARM 
COMPARED TO THE AIR TEMP. WITH A FAIRLY DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE... 
THINK THAT PATCHY FOG WORDING WILL SUFFICE. OVERALL...CURRENT 
FORECAST APPEARS TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE AND WILL NOT PLAN TO UPDATE 
THIS EVENING.

FXUS64 KMRX 121924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT WED SEP 12 2007

.SHORT-TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...INTERESTING FORECAST FOR
THE NEXT TWO DAYS AS A TROPICAL SYSTEM...CURRENTLY JUST OFF THE COAST
OF TEXAS (NEAR THE GALVESTON AREA)...MOVES SLOWLY NORTHEAST THE
NEXT 24-48 HOURS. A FRONT OVER THE GULF COASTS STATES WILL REMAIN
NEARLY STATIONARY THROUGH FRIDAY. TROPICAL MOISTURE WILL ADVECT NORTHEAST
TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY. HAVE TRENDED FORECAST TOWARD THE GFS SOLUTION DUE TO
BETTER CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS RUN AND ECMWF AND UKMET. ALSO...PER
NCEP DISCUSSION SEEMS TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE OF CURRENT CONDITIONS.

GFS SHOWS SURFACE RIDING OVER THE AREA WEAKENING THURSDAY GIVING WAY 
TO INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT ABOVE STATIONARY FRONT FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT. MODELS SHOW A SERIES OF 60-70 KNOT 300MB JETS MOVING ACROSS 
THE OHIO VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY PLACING THE FORECAST AREA 
UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT REAR ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET. THE DIRECT 
CIRCULATION ENHANCES FRONTOGENETIC LIFT OVER THE REGION FOR FRIDAY.

HAVE TRENDED POPS LATE THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY TOWARD THE GFS 
SOLUTION. SINCE BEST LOW LEVEL FORCING WILL BE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...I DO NOT EXPECT RAINFALL TO BECOME TOO HEAVY.

HAVE ALSO TRENDED TOWARD THE GFS TEMPERATURE SOLUTION AS WELL.

.LONG-TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT SHOULD BE 
MOVING THROUGH THE AREA DURING FIRST PART OF PERIOD...MARGINAL 
INSTABIITY AT BEST IN AREA...BUT WILL LEAVE THUNDER IN FORECAST FOR 
NOW FOR FRIDAY EVENING.  PRECIP SHOULD BE SHUTTING DOWN PRETTY 
QUICKLY FRIDAY NIGHT...EXCEPT FOR SOME UPSLOPE PRECIP IN THE HIGHER 
MOUNTAINS.  HAVE ALL POPS GONE BY DAYBREAK SATURDAY AND DONT RETURN 
FOR BALANCE OF FORECAST.  

AFTER THE FRONT PASSES THE RIDGE OVER W TX SHOULD BUILD THIS WAY FOR 
THE NEXT FEW DAYS...BUT IT FORECAST TO STAY SLIGHTLY W OR SW OF 
US...RESULTING IN A NWLY UPPER LEVEL FLOW.  AIR MASS LOOKS TOO DRY 
FOR ANY PRECIP...BUT SEVERAL AFTERNOONS SHOULD SEE GOOD GRADIENT 
NE-SW OF CLOUD COVER AS WEAK SHORT WAVES RACE THROUGH BACK SIDE OF 
GREAT LAKES TROUGH.

ALTHOUGH MODELS HAVE BEEN COOL FOR PAST SEVERAL MONTHS...WENT 
SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN MOS GUIDANCE FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...THINKING 
THAT GROUND WILL BE PRETTY WELL SOAKED FROM FRIDAY RAINS...FROM 
WHICH EVAPORATION WILL EAT UP A LOT OF ENERGY.  SLOWLY WARMING 
THINGS UP AT THE FIRST OF THE WEEK...BUT BACK-DOOR FRONT LOOKS TO 
SURGE DOWN EAST OF THE APPS.  ALSO...NEED TO WATCH TO SEE IF SYSTEM 
OFF CAROLINA/GA COASTS DOES INDEED DEVELOP AS FORECAST BY GFS/DGEX.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1001 AM EDT WED SEP 12 2007

.DISCUSSION...
AREA OBSERVATIONS AND VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS PATCHY FOG IS
DISSIPATING WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA.
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN FIRM OVER THE REGION TODAY
WITH PLENTY OF CLEAR SKIES. GIVEN PLENTY OF SUNSHINE WILL REMAIN ON THE
HIGH SIDE OF MAX TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE FOR TODAY.

AS FOR HOURLY GRIDS...HAVE LOWERED DEWPOINTS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF
OF THE FORECAST AREA. DEWPOINTS HAVE DROPPED INTO THE UPPER 40S
OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.

HAVE A GREAT DAY...

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY AIR SLOW TO MOVE IN BEHIND 
YESTERDAY/S COLD FRONT.  AS SUCH...HAVE SEEN SOME PATCHY FOG FORM 
OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING.  THIS SHOULD DISSIPATE DURING THE 
MORNING HOURS AS A SURFACE HIGH BEGINS TO INFLUENCE THE REGION.  THE 
RESULT WILL BE A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS AND VALLEY DAYTIME 
TEMPERATURES GENERALLY IN THE 80S. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE 
NEARLY STATIONARY TO OUR SOUTH ON THURSDAY...WITH HIGH PRESSURE TO 
THE NORTH AND NORTHEAST.  SHOULD BE A DRY DAY...ALTHOUGH CLOUDS WILL 
LIKELY INCREASE ESPECIALLY SOUTH DURING THE DAY.  MODELS IN POOR 
AGREEMENT IN HANDLING SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND NEXT COLD FRONT THAT 
AFFECTS OUR AREA THU NIGHT INTO FRIDAY NIGHT.  LOOKS LIKE MORE 
CONSISTENT GFS MAY HAVE BETTER HANDLE...NAM LIKELY HAS CONVECTIVE 
FEEDBACK PROBLEMS.  GOING WITH THE GFS SOLUTION...WILL BRING CHANCE 
SOUTH TO SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH POPS IN FOR THU NIGHT...WITH 40 TO 50 
POPS FOR FRIDAY. COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL BEGIN TO MOVE IN BEHIND 
THE FRONT FOR SATURDAY...AND APPEARS WE WILL REMAIN DRY THROUGH 
TUESDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATES OUR WEATHER. WILL ONLY MAKE SOME 
MINOR TWEAKS TO GFS MOS TEMPS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 111911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT TUE SEP 11 2007

.SHORT TERM....SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT 
IS MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON. DOPPLER 
RADAR SHOULD WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND SOME THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE 
EASTERN TWO THIRDS WITH SOME SCATTERED ACTIVITY JUST AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT TO THE WEST OF THE MORE SOLID COVERAGE. SCATTERED CONVECTION 
HAS NOW DEVELOPED WELL SOUTH OF THE FRONT IN AL AND GA. RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS OF A THIRD TO OVER ONE INCH HAVE OCCURRED ACROSS THE CWA 
TODAY. TEMPERATURES HAVE BEEN COOL AFTER THE RAIN BEGAN WITH MOST 
LOCATIONS AT MID AFTERNOON IN THE UPPER 60S AND LOWER 70S. MODELS 
END RAIN SHORTLY AFTER 00Z AS FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE WHOLE FORECAST 
AREA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD SE FROM THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY WITH SKIES CLEARING. BECAUSE OF THE RAINFALL TODAY ADDED 
PATCHY FOG TO ALL ZONES FOR LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY. LOWS 
TONIGHT WILL BE MUCH COOLER IN THE MID 50S TO MID 60S. FOLLOWED THE 
WARMER MAV GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS WEDNESDAY WHICH WILL FEEL QUITE 
COMFORTABLE WITH UPPER 70S NORTH TO MID 80S SOUTH AND DEW POINTS AS 
MUCH AS 10 DEGREES COOLER IN THE 50S.        

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BUILD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...WITH 
ZONAL UPPER-LEVEL FLOW CAUSING THE WEAK COLD FRONT TO BECOME QUASI- 
STATIONARY ACROSS CENTRAL AL AND CENTRAL GA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
SHOULD BEGIN TO SLOWLY MOVE NORTH THURSDAY NIGHT...AS SOUTHERLY LOW- 
LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS ON THE WESTERN PERIPHERY OF THE HIGH PRESSURE 
AREA. IN ADDITION...GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT THIS SOUTHERLY FLOW 
WILL PRODUCE SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT AND A FEW SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER STRONGER COLD FRONT IS PROGGED 
TO APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION 
EXPECTED AS THE GFS MODEL INDICATES MODERATE INSTABILITY DEVELOPING 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT. THIS NEXT FRONT IS PROGGED TO BRING A STRONGER 
SURGE OF COOL AIR FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO ACTUALLY 
BE BELOW NORMAL (FOR A CHANGE). HOWEVER...WILL STILL TREND SLIGHTLY 
WARMER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS...SINCE THE GFS HAS HAD A COOL 
BIAS OF LATE. HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD DOMINATE THE REGION THROUGH EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...WITH MINIMAL CHANCES FOR RAIN. 
&&

TEMPERATURES SOUTHEAST AS PRECIPITATION MAY NOT OCCUR THERE UNTIL 
EARLY TO MID AFTERNOON. ALSO WILL UPDATE HOURLY TEMPERATURE AND DEW 
POINT GRIDS FOR CURRENT TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EDT MON SEP 10 2007

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING SCATTERED ACTIVITY ASSOCIATED WITH A 
FRONT SAGGING INTO THE AREA TONIGHT.  COVERAGE HAS BEEN DECREASING 
AS IT MOVES INTO THE DRIER AIR OVER THE AREA.  BUT IT SHOULD 
GRADUALLY INCREASE OVER MUCH THE CWA TONIGHT AS MOISTURE INCREASES 
WITH THE FRONT.  STILL UNCERTAIN ABOUT THE AMOUNT OF DEEP MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE...SO WILL KEEP THE CURRENT POPS GOING FOR TONIGHT WITH 50 
POPS FOR MOST OF THE CWA AND 40 POPS IN SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST 
NC.  TEMPERATURES LOOK ON TRACK.  WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE 
EVENING WORDING...NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED THIS EVENING. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS COVERED 
THE REGION THIS MORNING BUT THE CLOUDS BROKE LATE THIS MORNING 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA AND TEMPERATURES SHOT UP INTO THE MID 80S TO 
LOWER 90S. CONVECTION DEVELOPED ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU EARLY 
THIS AFTERNOON WHERE DIFFERENTIAL HEATING WAS STRONGEST AND THIS 
ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MOVING STEADILY NORTHEAST. OTHER SHOWERS ARE 
STARTING TO DEVELOP IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. A WEAK COLD 
FRONT/BOUNDARY WAS LOCATED OVER THE OHIO VALLEY IN NORTHERN KY AND 
EXTENDED SOUTHWEST INTO AR. THE BEST INSTABILITY IS ALONG AND SOUTH 
OF THE FRONT WITH LIS FROM -2 TO -4. THE FORECAST AREA IS ALONG THE 
SOUTHERN EDGE OF THIS INSTABILITY AXIS THIS AFTERNOON. DEW POINTS 
ARE IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S A FEW DEGREES HIGHER THAN SUNDAYS. THIS 
FRONT WILL SAG SLOWLY SOUTH TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. MAIN SHORTWAVE WILL 
MOVE THE FRONT SOUTH OF THE AREA BY TUESDAY EVENING. HAVE HIGHEST 
POPS NW SECTIONS LATE TODAY AND EARLY EVENING AND THEN EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS TUESDAY AFTERNOON AHEAD OF FRONT. WENT ABOUT 10 PERCENT 
BELOW THE AVERAGE 60 TO 70 POPS PRODUCED BY THE MODEL DUE TO THE 
ONGOING DROUGHT AND CONVECTIVE NATURE OF THE PRECIPITATION. LOWERED 
POPS TONIGHT ABOUT 10 PERCENT BUT COVERAGE MAY BE VERY LOW AFTER 
SUNSET BEFORE PICKING UP AGAIN TUESDAY MORNING. LOWS TONIGHT SHOULD 
AGAIN BE VERY WARM NEAR THE NAM GUIDANCE AROUND 70. HIGHS TUESDAY I 
AM EXPECTING WILL BE ONLY IN THE 80S UNLIKE TODAY WITH NO SUN.

RIVER VALLEY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD ACROSS THE REGION ON

SLIGHT COOL-DOWN FOR THE WEEKEND. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS AGAIN 
ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE WARMER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED...WHICH HAS BEEN THE VERIFYING TREND OF LATE.

LATER TONIGHT.  MODELS SOMEWHAT BULLISH ON PRECIP FOR THE SHORT 
TERM...BUT MODELS ALSO INDICATE THERE SHOULD BE CONSIDERABLE PRECIP 
TO OUR WEST RIGHT NOW WHICH IS NOT HAPPENING.  NOT IMPRESSED WITH 
FORCING...AND GIVEN POOR INITIALIZATION COMBINED WITH FACT THAT WE 
ARE IN A DROUGHT WILL GENERALLY UNDERCUT MOS POPS AND KEEP THINGS IN 
THE CHANCE CATEGORY. SHOULD BE QUITE A BIT OF CLOUDS AROUND...SO 
TEMPS SHOULD BE A BIT LOWER THAN RECENT DAYS.  WILL GENERALLY STAY 
CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MIDWEST COLD FRONT BUILDS 
SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA ON TUESDAY AND USED A GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH THE FROPA DROPPING BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE FROM 
NORTH TO SOUTH AS BOUNDARY PROGRESSES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. 
BASICALLY STAYED WITH A DRY DAYTIME PERIOD WEDNESDAY BUT ADJUSTED 
PROBABILITIES BACK INTO THE CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT FROM SOUTH TO NORTH AS 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY RIDES NORTHEAST FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
TOWARD THE MID SOUTH. ISENTROPIC LIFT DEVELOPS NORTH OF THE OLD 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY DURING THIS PERIOD AWAITING ARRIVAL OF YET ANOTHER 
COLD FRONT FRIDAY NIGHT. STAYED WITH LOW CHANCE PROBABILITIES 
THROUGH THIS PERIOD ADJUSTING TO SLIGHT CHANCE ON SATURDAY FOR 
POSSIBLE SLOWER FRONTAL MOVEMENT. FINALLY BACK TO A DRY FORECAST 
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND 
SURFACE RIDGING BUILDS IN BEHIND FRONT. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE TEMPS FOR THE LONG TERM FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  88  69  83  65  85 /  50  50  50  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  87  69  81  63  83 /  50  50  50  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  86  68  80  62  83 /  50  50  50  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  84  65  78  60  81 /  50  50  40  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
932 PM EDT SUN SEP 9 2007

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING ACTIVITY TO THE WEST IS DISSIPATING 
AS IT MOVE INTO THE DRY AND STABLE AIR ACROSS OUR CWA.  STILL SOME 
MOISTURE LINGERING WITH AN UPPER TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA...WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING AND KEEP SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WHERE THE BEST 
MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF FORECAST ON 
TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION... 

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
PERSISTENT RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IS FINALLY GIVING 
WAY...AND A TROUGH OVER WEST TN IS BEGINNING TO MOVE TO THE EAST. 
SOME SHOWERS ARE NOW MOVING THROUGH THE PLATEAU COUNTIES...AND WILL 
CARRY CHANCE POPS THERE. WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP DOWN INTO THE 
VALLEY. HOWEVER THE LIFT REMAINS WEAK AND EXPECT DECREASING COVERAGE 
AFTER MIDNIGHT. ON MONDAY THE TROUGH BECOMES ORIENTED MORE EAST-WEST 
ACROSS THE AREA. CONVERGENCE AT 850 AND 700 MB WILL LIKELY PRODUCE 
BROKEN CLOUD COVER AND SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS IN THE AFTERNOON. NAM 
GIVES LIKELY POPS...BUT AM NOT CONVINCED THAT THE LIFT WILL BE 
ENOUGH FOR THAT MUCH COVERAGE...SO WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR 
MONDAY. CLOUDS SHOULD ALSO HOLD TEMPS BACK FROM WHAT THEY HAVE BEEN 
LATELY...WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EDT SUN SEP 9 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
PERSISTENT RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IS FINALLY GIVING 
WAY...AND A TROUGH OVER WEST TN IS BEGINNING TO MOVE TO THE EAST. 
SOME SHOWERS ARE NOW MOVING THROUGH THE PLATEAU COUNTIES...AND WILL 
CARRY CHANCE POPS THERE. WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP DOWN INTO THE 
VALLEY. HOWEVER THE LIFT REMAINS WEAK AND EXPECT DECREASING COVERAGE 
AFTER MIDNIGHT. ON MONDAY THE TROUGH BECOMES ORIENTED MORE EAST-WEST 
ACROSS THE AREA. CONVERGENCE AT 850 AND 700 MB WILL LIKELY PRODUCE 
BROKEN CLOUD COVER AND SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS IN THE AFTERNOON. NAM 
GIVES LIKELY POPS...BUT AM NOT CONVINCED THAT THE LIFT WILL BE 
ENOUGH FOR THAT MUCH COVERAGE...SO WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR 
MONDAY. CLOUDS SHOULD ALSO HOLD TEMPS BACK FROM WHAT THEY HAVE BEEN 
LATELY...WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
BASE OF UPPER TROUGH LIES ALMOST EAST WEST ACROSS THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY WITH COLD FRONT NEARLY STATIONARY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
MONDAY NIGHT. MODELS BRING SHORT WAVE ENERGY ALONG THE FRONT MONDAY
NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AND THEN SHIFT THE FRONT TO THE SOUTH OF THE
FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. RAINFALL AMOUNTS DO NOT LOOK EXCESSIVE
AND MAY NOT BE MORE THAN ONE INCH IN MOST PLACES FOR THE TWO DAYS.
GFS TRIES TO BRING DRIER AIRMASS WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT
LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY INTO FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY BUT
MODELS FORM A WAVE ALONG FRONT TO THE SOUTHWEST OVER MS AND BRING
IT NORTHEAST TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE NAM/WRF FORMS AN
UPPER LOW ACROSS THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN PLAINS AT MID WEEK AND MOVES
IT INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. DUE TO MODEL DIFFERENCES WILL HAVE NW HALF
DRIER AND SE HALF FORECAST AREA WITH RAIN CHANCES THROUGH
WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY. AT THE END OF THE WEEK A MORE SIGNIFICANT
TROUGH DIGS SOUTH INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND BRINGS ANOTHER COLD
FRONT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY. HAVE CHANCE POPS IN
FOR MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT DUE TO TIMING UNCERTAINTIES
WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AND HAVE TEMPERATURES AT OR CLOSE TO
WARMER NAM/WRF NUMBERS. WEEKEND TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE ABOUT 5
DEGREES COOLER WITH LOWS POSSIBLY EVEN LOWER THAN CURRENT FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1009 AM EDT SUN SEP 9 2007

.DISCUSSION...
AREA RAOBS AND ACARS SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THERE IS A TRANSITION
ZONE OVER EAST TN FROM DEEP MOISTURE TO THE WEST TO A DRY AIR MASS
TO THE SOUTH AND EAST. PW FROM 12Z OHX SOUNDING WAS OVER 2
INCHES...WHILE RNK WAS WELL UNDER 1 INCH. WITH THE 850 MB RIDGE
OVERHEAD...THE PRECIP IN MIDDLE TN WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE EASTWARD.
EXPECT THAT THE RIDGE WILL BREAK DOWN THROUGH THE DAY AND ALLOW THE
MOISTURE TO MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE. THE NAM SHOWS SOME SHOWERS
DEVELOPING OVER THE PLATEAU BETWEEN 18Z AND 21Z...BUT THIS APPEARS
OVERDONE GIVEN THE DRY AIR OVER THE AREA AND THE STABILITY IN AREA
SOUNDINGS. THE PLATEAU COUNTIES COULD SEE AN ISOLATED SHOWER LATE
THIS AFTERNOON...SO THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR THAT AREA SEEMS
WARRANTED. CURRENT HIGH TEMP FORECAST IN THE 85 TO 90 RANGE LOOKS
GOOD...AS CLOUDS SHOULD GRADUALLY INCREASE THROUGH THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SHORTWAVE TROF WILL DROP 
SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE WESTERN CANADIAN PROVINCES AND HELP TO PUSH A 
COOL FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY. THE FRONT MAKES 
PROGRESS JUST SOUTH OF THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY BUT THE UPPER LEVEL 
FLOW BECOMES PARALLEL TO THE BOUNDARY FAIRLY QUICKLY AND IMPULSES 
WILL RIDE NORTHEAST ALONG THE FRONT KEEPING THE FORECAST RATHER 
UNSETTLED THROUGH MID WEEK FOR THE FIRST TIME IN A LONG TIME. THIS 
FRONT FINALLY SHIFTS WELL SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY. 
HOWEVER...ANOTHER FRONT MAY MAKE PROGRESS INTO THE REGION LATER 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. THEREFORE HELD ONTO CHANCE PROBABILITIES FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE ENTIRE PERIOD.

CLOUDS SUNDAY NIGHT SO LOWS AROUND 5 DEGREES WARMER THAN TONIGHT.
NAM/WRF MUCH COOLER WITH HIGHS MONDAY BUT PREFER WARMER GFS WHICH
KEEPS DEEPER MOISTURE AWAY UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT AND WITH DRY GROUND
AND ON GOING TREND OF UNDER FORECASTING HIGHS DURING THIS DRY LATE
SUMMER. COLD FRONT FINALLY COMES THROUGH TUESDAY BUT A DEVELOPING
LOW ALONG THE FRONT WILL KEEP CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION POSSIBLE
WITH THE FRONT JUST TO THE SOUTH. MAY NEED TO REMOVE POPS WEDNESDAY
IF FRONT MOVES FAR ENOUGH SOUTH. THURSDAY AND FRIDAY A NEW FRONTAL
SYSTEM APPROACHES AND SLOWS AS IT MOVES THROUGH. WILL KEEP CHANCE
OF SHOWERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED DUE TO THE CONTINUED UNCERTAINTY OF
THESE SYSTEMS.

THROUGH THURSDAY. STILL NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH OF THE TIMING OF THE

GOING ABOVE GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS AND CLOSE TO HIGHER NAM/WRF GUIDANCE
FOR LOWS WITH MORE NIGHTTIME CLOUD COVER THROUGH AT LEAST MID WEEK.
BY WEDNESDAY CLOUD COVER AND PRECIPITATION ALONG WITH COLD FRONT
WILL BRING MUCH WELCOMED COOLER TEMPERATURES.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...APPEARS UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN

REMAINS NORTH OF THE AREA WITH SHORT WAVES PASSING THROUGH THE 
MIDWEST AND NORTHEASTERN U.S. OVER THE WEEKEND. WENT AHEAD AND 
DROPPED TERRAIN POPS FOR SATURDAY AND TRIMMED BACK POPS ACROSS MOST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR SUNDAY LEAVING A SLIGHT CHANCE ON THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHERE TERRAIN AND SLIGHTLY HIGHER INSTABILITY IN 
THIS REGION MAY LEAD TO ISOLATED CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON. 
STAYED WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE ON MONDAY AND USED LOW 
CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AS GFS INDICATES A 
SLOW FRONTAL MOVEMENT INTO THE REGION BY TUESDAY NIGHT. FRONT CLEARS 
THE APPALACHIANS BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND DROPPED POPS GRADUALLY FROM 
WEST TO EAST WITH FRONTAL MOVEMENT. MAINTAINED DRY FORECAST FOR 
THURSDAY WITH TEMPERATURES CLOSER TO NORMAL FOR EARLY SEPTEMBER.

FXUS64 KMRX 070225
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 PM EDT THU SEP 6 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. WEAK SHORT
WAVE TO THE NW CONTINUES TO LIFT MID LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. 
SOME VIRGA SHOWING UP ON RADAR BUT LOW LEVELS REMAIN VERY DRY. CLOUDS 
WILL LIKELY THIN SLOWLY OVERNIGHT ENOUGH TO ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP TO 
FCST MINS LATE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN THE WEATHER 
PATTERN IS EXPECTED OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. A STRONG HIGH PRESSURE 
RIDGE REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE CAROLINAS AND 
VIRGINIA...THOUGH IT DOES BECOME MORE SW-NE ORIENTED. THIS RIDGE 
WILL PREVENT THE EASTWARD PROGRESS OF AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY...AND WE SHOULD ONLY SEE HIGH TO MIDLEVEL CLOUDS 
AS A RESULT. LIKE TODAY...THE CLOUDS SHOULD BE THICKEST IN WESTERN 
PORTIONS OF OUR AREA. TEMPERATURES HAVE CONTINUED TO VERIFY HIGHER 
THAN MOS...SO WILL GO A BIT HIGHER THAN GUIDANCE ON TONIGHTS LOWS 
AND FRIDAYS HIGHS.

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE 
EASTERN SEABOARD AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND EASTERN TN VALLEY 
GETS SQUEEZED BY COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND 
TROPICAL/SUB TROPICAL SYSTEM OFF THE CAROLINA COAST THIS WEEKEND. 
NAM/WRF BRINGS THE SYSTEM IN AROUND MYRTLE BEACH BY SUNDAY EVENING 
WITH THE GFS FARTHER NORTH ALONG THE OUTER BANKS. EITHER SCENARIO 
WILL KEEP COLD FRONT TO THE WEST AND NORTHWEST THIS WEEKEND. GFS 
INCREASES MOISTURE ESPECIALLY OVER WESTERN SECTIONS BY SUNDAY AND 
THERE COULD BE ENOUGH LIFT FOR ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 
NAM/WRF BRINGS MOISTURE FARTHER EAST WITH TROPICAL SYSTEM SUNDAY 
EVENING BUT STILL DRIER AIR ACROSS FORECAST AREA AND COLD FRONT TOO 
FAR WEST AND NORTHWEST. NOT VERY CONFIDENT THAT THERE WILL BE 
CONVECTION SUNDAY OR MONDAY BUT WILL KEEP LOW POPS IN FOR NOW. MAIN 
CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AFTER POTENTIAL 
TROPICAL SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEAST AND FRONT APPROACHES. FOLLOWING 
PERSISTENCE SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY FOR HIGHS AND LOWS WITH HIGHS 
AROUND 90 AND LOWS IN THE 60S WHICH IS STILL ABOVE NORMAL. FROM 
TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY PRECIPITATION AND FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL DROP 
TEMPERATURES AROUND 5 DEGREES POSSIBLY MORE NE TN AND SW VA. &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  70  89  68  92  67 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    69  90  66  90  67 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            67  89  66  91  67 /   0   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   60  90  62  88  60 /   0   0   0  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
958 AM EDT THU SEP 6 2007

.DISCUSSION...
BROKEN HIGH CLOUDS ARE STREAMING ACROSS EAST TN THIS MORNING AHEAD
OF AN UPPER LOW OVER MISSOURI. A STRONG HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE LOCATED
OVER THE CAROLINAS AND VIRGINIA WILL DIRECT THIS LOW TOWARD THE
NORTH-NORTHEAST...KEEPING OUR AREA DRY. WILL UPDATE TO INCREASE THE
CLOUD COVER SLIGHTLY...AS PARTLY SUNNY WORDING IS MORE APPROPRIATE
FOR MOST OF THE AREA. CURRENT OBSERVED TEMPS ARE A LITTLE HIGHER
THAN FORECAST...BUT WITH THE CLOUD COVER WE SHOULD TOP OUT NEAR
CURRENT FORECAST HIGHS IN THE LOWER 90S.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 060726
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 AM EDT THU SEP 6 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION 
WILL BRING ANOTHER WARM AND DRY TODAY.  SATELLITE SHOWING SOME HIGH 
CLOUDS TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ASSOCIATED WITH A SHORTWAVE.  BEST  
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY REMAINS TO THE WEST OF OUR CWA...SO WILL 
KEEP THE FORECAST DRY FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.  CLOUDS SHOULD BE THIN 
ENOUGH NOT TO AFFECT TEMPERATURES TOO MUCH.  STAYED ABOVE GFS MOS 
GUIDANCE AGAIN FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LATEST MODEL RUNS CONTINUE 
TO INDICATE THAT WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...WITH A POSSIBLE PATTERN CHANGE BY TUESDAY. IN ADDITION...A 
LOW PRESSURE AREA OFF THE CAROLINA COAST IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY 
DEVELOP INTO A TROPICAL SYSTEM AND SLOWLY APPROACH THE OUTER BANKS 
OF NC ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. RIGHT NOW...THE MODEL CONSENSUS IS FOR 
THIS SYSTEM TO REMAIN EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A WEAK COLD 
FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY BEFORE 
REACHING THE FORECAST AREA. THIS SCENARIO...UNFORTUNATELY...KEEPS 
THE FORECAST AREA DRY UNTIL TUESDAY...WHEN AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS 
PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY AND PUSH A STRONGER COLD 
FRONT INTO THE REGION. WILL PLAN TO KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE 
FORECAST FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME RAIN FROM THE TROPICAL SYSTEM OVER THE CAROLINAS. WILL GO WITH 
HIGHER POPS ON TUESDAY...WITH THE PASSAGE OF A STRONGER COLD FRONT 
EXPECTED. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS SEEM TO BE TOO LOW 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WHICH HAS BEEN THE VERIFYING TREND OF LATE. 
ALTHOUGH THE UPPER HIGH BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN ON FRIDAY...THE LOCAL 
AIR MASS DOESNT REALLY CHANGE MUCH...WITH MOISTURE ONLY SLOWLY 
INCREASING. THUS...WILL LOWER MAXES AND RAISE MINS SOME EACH DAY 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND TO ACCOUNT FOR AN EXPECTED INCREASE IN CLOUD 
COVER...BUT OVERALL...WILL KEEP TEMPS WARMER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. TEMPS SHOULD COOL BY 
TUESDAY AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION...BUT WILL NOT 
COOL TEMPS AS MUCH AS THE GFS GUIDANCE...SINCE THE GFS HAS BEEN TOO 
AGGRESSIVE LATELY WITH COOL-DOWNS BEHIND THE COLD FRONTS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  93  67  94  68  92 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  93  66  92  66  90 /   0   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  93  66  92  66  90 /   0   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  91  61  90  61  88 /   0   0   0   0  10

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 060221
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 PM EDT WED SEP 5 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER THE AREA TODAY WILL SHIFT SLIGHTLY TO THE 
EAST TOMORROW. CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH A MIDLEVEL DEFORMATION ZONE 
OVER MIDDLE TN TODAY WILL ALSO BEGIN TO MOVE EASTWARD...AND MAY 
BRING PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES TO WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA LATE 
TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. DO NOT EXPECT THAT THE CLOUDS WILL BE AS 
OVERCAST TOMORROW AS THEY HAVE BEEN TODAY. THE EAST SHOULD STAY 
MOSTLY CLEAR. DO NOT EXPECT THE LIFT OR MOISTURE TO BE ENOUGH TO 
PRODUCE ANY PRECIPITATION. MOS GUIDANCE HAS VERIFIED TOO WARM WITH 
LOW TEMPS AND TOO COOL WITH HIGH TEMPS LATELY...SO WILL ADJUST FROM 
MOS ACCORDINGLY. 

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...PATTERN EXPECTED TO 
SLOWLY CHANGE WITH RIDGE BREAKING DOWN AND LARGE TROUGH SLIDING INTO 
AREA.  OTHER PLAYER IS THE LOW PRESSURE AREA ABT 500 MILES EAST OF 
JACKSONVILLE.  THIS AREA HAS BEEN DRIFTING EASTWARD FOR THE PAST 
COUPLE OF DAYS...BUT ALL MODELS TURN IT BACK TO THE U.S. OVER THE 
WEEKEND.  STILL LOOKS LIKE THIS SYSTEM OFFERS NO RELIEF TO DRY 
CONDITIONS AS IT STAYS TOO FAR EAST BEFORE RE-CURVING TO THE NORTH 
ALONG THE COAST.

COLD FRONT SHOULD SIFT THROUGH AREA SUNDAY OR MONDAY AND SETTLE A 
COUPLE 100 MILES TO THE SOUTH.  EXPECTING LOW POPS IN AREA WITH 
FROPA AS MUCH OF THE MOISTURE WILL BE BROUGHT INTO THE TROPICAL 
SYSTEM ALONG THE EAST COAST.  MODELS DIVERGE STRONGLY AROUND TUESDAY 
WITH GFS BRINGING STRONG FRONT AND PRECIP TO AREA...WHILE OTHER 
MODELS LEAVE OLD FRONT SOUTH OF THE AREA AND NEXT WAVE/FRONT STILL 
IN PLAINS.  WITH GFS THE OUTLIER AND ITS LOSING THE OLD FRONT...HAVE 
OPTED AWAY FROM GFS...AND WILL KEEP ONLY LOW POPS IN AREA...WITH A 
GRADIENT FROM SOUTH TO NORTH.

FOR TEMPS...STAYING ABOVE GUIDANCE ON HIGH TEMPS PRE-FROPA...AND 
HAVE GONE A LITTLE BELOW GUIDANCE ON MINS POST-FROPA.  DEWPOINT/RH 
GRIDS WILL CONTINUE TO REFLECT THE DIURNAL DRYING EACH DAY...WITH 
MORE MUTED EFFECT POST-FROPA.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  66  90  67  94  68 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  64  92  66  92  67 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  64  89  66  92  67 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  57  92  61  90  62 /   0   0   0   0   0 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 050730
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT WED SEP 5 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.  FAIRLY STABLE ACROSS 
THE CWA TODAY...SO SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY IS NOT EXPECTED 
TODAY OR TONIGHT.  SATELLITE INDICATING SOME HIGH CLOUDS PUSHING 
INTO AREA. THEY SHOULD BE THIN ENOUGH TO NOT AFFECT TEMPERATURES TOO 
MUCH THIS AFTERNOON.  WITH ITS PAST PERFORMANCE...STAYED ABOVE GFS 
MOS NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LATEST MODEL RUNS CONTINUE 
TO INDICATE THAT WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MOST 
OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE AREA OFF THE 
CAROLINA COAST IS PROGGED TO STRENGTHEN AND SLOWLY APPROACH THE 
OUTER BANKS OF NC ON SATURDAY. HOWEVER...IT APPEARS RIGHT NOW THAT 
IT WILL HAVE NO DIRECT EFFECT ON THE FORECAST AREA...OTHER THAN TO 
POSSIBLY SLOW THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF A WEAK COLD FRONT THIS 
WEEKEND. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL GO WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR MOST OF 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT WILL KEEP A CHANCE FOR RAIN ON SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY WITH A SLOW-MOVING COLD FRONT EXPECTED TO BE IN THE VICINITY. 
GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED WITH THIS FRONT... 
SO WILL KEEP POPS LOW FOR THIS WEEKEND. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS SEEM TO BE TOO LOW FOR THE END OF THIS WEEK...WHICH HAS BEEN 
THE VERIFYING TREND OF LATE. THUS...WILL TREND TOWARD A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST ON THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY (WITH WARMER TEMPS THAN GFS 
MOS)...SINCE THE AIR MASS IS NOT EXPECTED TO CHANGE MUCH UNTIL THE 
COLD FRONT ARRIVES. BY SUNDAY...WILL BEGIN TO TREND A LITTLE COOLER 
BECAUSE OF THE EXPECTED INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER 
AIR WITH THE FRONT. HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP TEMPS SLIGHTLY 
WARMER THAN GFS MOS ON SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  94  67  94  67  94 /  10  10   0   0   0

OAK RIDGE, TN  93  67  92  66  92 /   0  10   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 PM EDT TUE SEP 4 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...RIDGE SHIFTS VERY SLOWLY 
EAST THROUGH THE SHORT TERM KEEPING THE FORECAST AREA DRY. 
CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN SUPPRESSED WITH DRY LOW LEVEL AIRMASS. WILL 
PROBABLY NOT EVEN SEE FORMATION IN THE MAJOR TERRAIN AREAS. TRIED TO 
INDICATE INCREASE IN HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE FROM HENRIETTE BUT STILL 
BANKING ON A MOSTLY SUNNY FORECAST IN THE SHORT TERM. TEMP FORECAST 
A LITTLE TRICKY WITH LOW DEWPOINT AIR BUILDING INTO THE REGION. 
GUIDANCE WAS WAY OFF FOR TODAYS MORNING LOWS MOST AREAS. DECIDED TO 
STAY CLOSER TO THE MET MOS FOR MIN TEMPS WHILE HOLDING CLOSE TO A 
GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAXES. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...PATTERN SLOWLY 
CHANGING DURING THIS PERIOD AS RIDGE OVER MOST OF U.S. NOW WILL BE 
REPLACED BY TROUGH MOVING THROUGH MIDDLE OF NATION.  ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT EXPECTED TO PASS THROUGH REGION AROUND MONDAY.  LOW PRESSURE 
AREA OFF FLA COAST NOW MOVING AWAY FROM COAST IS EXPECT TO MOVE BACK 
TOWARD COAST IN A FEW DAYS.  ITS PRESENT LOCATION AND EXPECTED PATH 
DOESNT FAVOR BRINGING ANY MEANINGFUL PRECIP TO THE AREA...BUT IT 
COULD PLAY A ROLE IN TIMING OF COLD FRONT...COULD POSSIBLY 
ACCELERATE ITS PASSAGE.  

THINK BEST CHANCES OF PRECIP LOOK TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH 
FROPA...OTHERWISE CONTINUED MOSTLY DRY.

FOR HIGH TEMPS...HAVE GENERALLY GONE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE GUIDANCE ON 
WARMEST DAYS...BASED ON MODEL BIASES RECENTLY.  AFTER FROPA...HAVE 
KEPT PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE VALUES.

BUILD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY THIS AFTERNOON. THIS UPPER 
HIGH SHOULD COMBINE WITH THE VERY DRY AIR MASS TO WARM TEMPS A 
LITTLE MORE THAN YESTERDAY...WITH NO CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT 
EXPECTED. WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARD PERSISTENCE WITH MINS TONIGHT... 
BUT A FEW DEGREES LOWER THAN THIS MORNING SINCE DEWPOINTS ARE 
EXPECTED TO BE A LITTLE LOWER TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS AREA 
BRINGING DRY CONDITIONS ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY. A WEAK SHORTWAVE ROTATES OVER THE RIDGE ON THURSDAY. DEEPEST 
MOISTURE REMAINS TO THE WEST OF OUR CWA...BUT WILL CONTINUE THE 20 
POPS FOR THE PLATEAU COUNTIES FOR THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS 
FOR NOW. MOISTURE INCREASING ON SATURDAY AS A FRONT APPROACHES TO 
REGION...WILL KEEP THE 20 POPS GOING FOR SATURDAY. FRONT LINGERS 
ACROSS THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY ALONG WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE 
AND LIFT TO KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING BOTH DAYS. BASED ON LATEST 
TRENDS...STAYED ABOVE GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

TROUGH/SURFACE COLD FRONT WHICH APPROACHES THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION NEXT WEEKEND. LATEST GFS RUN HAS THIS FEATURE STALLING OUT 
JUST TO OUR WEST AND LINGERING IN THE AREA THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK 
WHILE VARIOUS ENSEMBLES MOVE THE FEATURE THROUGH OVER THE WEEKEND. 
THIS UNCERTAINTY IMPACTS BOTH TEMPS AND POPS. BASED ON UNCERTAINTY...
OPTED TO NOT MAKE ANY DRAMATIC CHANGES TO PRECEDING GRIDS/FORECAST
THROUGH THE LATTER PART OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

UPCOMING WORK WEEK. THIS WILL RESULT IN THE RETURN OF GENERALLY DRY
WEATHER WITH WELL ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS. UPPER RIDGE GRADUALLY DRIFTS
EASTWARD BY LATE WEEK ALLOWING SOMEWHAT BETTER MOISTURE FLOW INTO
THE REGION WITH DIURNAL MAINLY HIGHER TERRAIN SCATTERED CONVECTION
EXPECTED. MODELS/ENSEMBLES STILL HINT THAT MORE ORGANIZED SYSTEM
WILL APPROACH OUR AREA BY SOMETIME NEXT WEEKEND. HOWEVER...TIMING
THIS EVENT IS PROBLEMATIC AT BEST AS MODELS AND ENSEMBLE MEMBERS
VARY CONSIDERABLY WITH RESPECT TO THE PROGRESSION OF THIS FEATURE.
WILL BE CONSERVATIVE WITH POPS FOR NOW...STAYING IN THE SLIGHT
CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE CATEGORY UNTIL TIMING ISSUES ARE RESOLVED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
545 PM EDT SAT SEP 1 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...CONVECTION ALIGNED LARGELY 
ALONG TERRAIN IN THE BLUE RIDGE MTNS AND ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
ESCARPMENT, BUT MOVEMENT IS VERY SLOWLY TOWARD THE SOUTHWEST TOWARD 
AN INVERTED SURFACE TROF. TROF IS EXTENDING OUT OF A WEAK LOW OVER 
THE DEEP SOUTH. HOWEVER, STORMS/SHOWERS ARE STILL SPOTTY DUE TO LACK 
OF STRONG SURFACE FUEL. THETA E TROF LIES OVER CENTRAL VALLEY WITH 
COMPLICATED PATTERN OF RIDGING NORTHEAST AND SOUTHWEST. HENCE, 
MOVEMENT OF CELLS WILL DEPEND AS MUCH ON OUTFLOW BOUNDARY 
INTERACTION AS POSITION OF THETA E RIDGES AND PRESSURE TROFS. EXPECT 
THIS CONVECTIVE ACTION TO CONTINUE PAST SUNSET A LITTLE UNTIL HEAT 
SOURCE DIES AWAY. DO NOT EXPECT SEVERE WEATHER, HOWEVER A FEW 
STRONGER STORMS COULD PUSH THE ENVELOPE, AND SOME COULD PRODUCE 
ISOLATED SMALL STREAM/URBAN FLOODING IF THEY HOVER TOO LONG OVER ONE 
SPOT.

MODELS HAVE PULLED BACK ON THE POPS AND SO HAVE I IN THE FORECAST, 
EXCEPT FOR THIS EVENING, WHERE I HAVE INCREASED THEM TO ACCOUNT FOR 
CURRENT SITUATION. EXPECT THAT DRAINAGE FROM NORTHEASTERN SURFACE 
WILL KEEP AIR DRIER AND MORE STABLE THROUGH MONDAY, WITH MAINLY THE 
MTNS GETTING SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY TO WARRANT MENTION OF MOST 
PRECIP.

HAVE ALSO ADJUSTED OVERNIGHT MINS UP JUST A HAIR BECAUSE OF 
LIKELIHOOD OF A FEW MORE CLOUDS AND PATCHES OF RAIN. KEPT MENTION OF 
PATCHY FOG IN THE MORNING HOURS SUNDAY. ADJUSTED MAXES THROUGH 
MONDAY TO MATCH MORE A MIX OF MODELS.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...GFS CONTINUES TO 
TREND TOWARD A DRIER AND WARMER UPCOMING WORK WEEK AS UPPER RIDGING 
STRENGTHENS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH A LOW LEVEL EASTERLY FLOW 
PERSISTING THROUGH FRIDAY. WHAT THIS MEANS FOR PRECIPITATION 
PROBABILITY IS ZERO POPS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH MAINLY MAJOR 
TERRAIN AREA POPS FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. WITH THIS SLIGHT 
CHANGE TO A DRIER FORECAST COMPLETE WITH MORE UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING...TRIED TO BOOST MAX TEMPERATURES A LITTLE ABOVE GUIDANCE 
THROUGH THE PERIOD.

CLIMO UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF THE UPPER RIDGE. UPPER RIDGE DRIFTS
EAST ALLOWING MOIST RETURN FLOW BY LATE IN THE PERIOD. APPEARS THAT
A MORE ORGANIZED SYSTEM MAY APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
REGION ON FRIDAY...BUT TIMING BECOMES AN ISSUE THIS FAR OUT. THUS
MAINTAINED CHANCE POPS FOR THAT TIME PERIOD. GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE
TO GFS GUIDANCE FOR BOTH TEMPS AND POPS AS THEY SEEM REASONABLE
GIVEN THE EXPECTED SYNOPTIC PATTERN.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DEEP CONVECTION SLUGGISH TO
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON EVEN THOUGH INSTABILITY VALUES SUGGEST
STORMS. THINK MID LEVEL TEMPS HAVE PROBABLY WARMED A LITTLE MORE
THAN ANTICIPATED. 

COLD FRONT AND ORGANIZED LIFT TO THE SOUTH OF THE AREA...BUT LIFT
IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY ROTATE ITS WAY BACK OVER CWA FROM SOUTHEAST
TOWARD SUNDAY. HAVE HIGH POPS OVER SERN SECTIONS ON SUNDAY BUT
TAPER OFF PRETTY QUICKLY DUE TO MOUNTAINS AND MOISTURE/LIFT
GRADIENT. HAVE FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT QPF OVER SERN SECTIONS AS WELL.
SUNDAY PRECIP OVER SERN PARTS MAY BE ALMOST STABLE MUCH OF THE DAY
RAIN WITH A LITTLE EMBEDDED TS...BUT FOR NOW UNTIL MORE
CONFIDENT...WILL LEAVES AS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...EASTERLY FLOW WILL REMAIN 
IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD SUPPLYING 
MOISTURE AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT IN THE TERRAIN AREAS. WILL KEEP SLIGHT 
AND LOW CHANCE POPS GOING MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AS WELL AS THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH 
CAROLINA WHICH TYPICALLY WILL SEE SOME CONVECTION IN THIS TYPE OF 
PATTERN. LATER IN THE PERIOD ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY EXPAND SLIGHT 
AND LOW CHANCE PROBABILITIES ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA AS 
SOUTHERLY FLOW BECOMES ESTABLISHED WELL AHEAD OF MIDWEST UPPER TROF 
AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. STAYED NEAR TO SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN MEX 
MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS.

DEVELOPMENT...COULD HAVE A SOME ISOLATED DOWNBURSTS.

FXUS64 KMRX 310652
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 AM EDT FRI AUG 31 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES 
THAT A WEAK COLD FRONT IS LOCATED GENERALLY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS...ACCORDING TO THE ISOBARS AND WINDS. HOWEVER...THETA-E 
ANALYSIS REVEALS THAT THE DRIER AIR WITH THIS FRONT RESIDES FARTHER 
NORTH IN THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A MOIST AIR MASS REMAINING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT...A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
SHOULD DEVELOP AGAIN BY THIS AFTERNOON...WITH THE BEST INSTABILITY 
RESIDING OVER THE MOUNTAINS. THUS...WILL SCATTERED CONVECTION WITH 
THE HIGHEST POPS OVER THE MOUNTAINS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE THREE SETS OF GUIDANCE WITH COOLER TEMPS 
(THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE) ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...GENERAL PATTERN OF RIDGING 
WEST/WEAK TROUGHING EAST EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF 
THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK BEFORE THE PATTERN ONCE AGAIN SHIFTS TO 
RIDGING OVER THE EASTERN CONUS BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK PER GFS. NO 
ORGANIZED PRECIP EVENT IN THE OFFING THROUGH THE LONG-TERM PERIOD 
WITH ONLY TYPICAL SCATTERED MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION EXPECTED EACH 
DAY. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE CLOSELY FOR BOTH POPS AND 
TEMPS...ALTHOUGH TENDED TO UNDERCUT POPS SLIGHTLY AS THEY SEEM 
GENERALLY OVERDONE...ESPECIALLY DURING THE OVERNIGHT PERIODS. TEMPS 
EXPECTED TO REBOUND TO ABOVE CLIMO NEXT WEEK AS THE RIDGING ONCE
AGAIN BECOMES ESTABLISHED OVER THE REGION.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1009 PM EDT THU AUG 30 2007

.DISCUSSION...
AREA SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT DRY AIR IN THE MID LEVELS IS MOVING
INTO OUR AREA FROM THE NORTH. PRECIPITABLE WATER AT OHX HAS DROPPED
BELOW 1.5 INCHES...WHILE FFC REMAINS ABOVE 2 INCHES. THE INFLUX OF
DRY AIR AND THE LOSS OF SURFACE HEATING HAVE LED TO MOST OF THE
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DISSIPATE. WITH A SURFACE FRONT ACROSS
KENTUCKY SLOWLY MOVING TO THE SOUTH...AN ISOLATED SHOWERS CANNOT BE
RULED OUT OVERNIGHT...SO WILL LOWER POPS TO A SLIGHT CHANCE ACROSS
THE AREA. TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING CLOSE TO FORECAST...THOUGH LOWS
IN THE NORTH MAY NEED TO BE LOWERED A BIT DUE TO SOME CLEARING AND
FALLING DEWPOINTS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT THU AUG 30 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SURFACE FRONT STILL LINGERS WELL
TO THE NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AND MODELS BRING IT SLOWLY
SOUTHWARD. HAVE KEPT FAIRLY HIGH POPS FOR TONIGHT IN AS A BLEND
BETWEEN DRIER GFS AND WETTER NAM MODEL GUIDANCE. TEMPERATURES WILL
REMAIN MODERATE TONIGHT WITH NOT A LOT OF RADIATIONAL COOLING.
FRIDAY SHOULD AGAIN SEE SOME SCATTERED ACTIVITY BUT LESS COVERAGE
THAN TODAY WITH LESS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO WORK FROM.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...LOWER PRESSURES WILL 
BE PRESENT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH THROUGH THE PERIOD WHILE IN THE LOW 
LEVELS...HIGHER PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN POSITION FROM THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE WESTERN ATLANTIC. THIS WILL KEEP AN EAST TO 
SOUTHEAST FLOW IN PLACE FOR MUCH OF THE DURATION WHICH WILL FEATURE 
A FLUX OF MOISTURE FROM THE ATLANTIC. USED SLIGHT AND CHANCE POPS 
AREAWIDE FOR SUNDAY AS MODELS INDICATE THAT AN INVERTED TROF WILL 
EXTEND NORTH AND NORTHEAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE FLORIDA 
PANHANDLE. GENERALLY STAYED WITH LESS THAN FIFTEEN PERCENT POPS FOR 
THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY DUE TO 
DOWNSLOPING IN THIS FLOW PATTERN WHILE MAINTAINING SLIGHT OR CHANCE 
POPS IN THE TERRAIN WHERE EASTERLY FLOW WILL ENABLE FOR OROGRAPHIC 
LIFTING. CONCERNING TEMPS...BASICALLY WENT A LITTLE HIGHER THAN 
GUIDANCE MAXES DUE TO THE DRY SURFACE CONDITION ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE IF NOT A DEGREE HIGHER THAN SUGGESTED MIN 
TEMPS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 301449
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1046 AM EDT THU AUG 30 2007

.DISCUSSION...WEAK UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM SWINGING THROUGH THE MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY OF EAST TENNESSEE BRINGING LIGHT RAINS FOR ABOUT AN 
HOUR TO MOST AREAS.  WILL UPDATE ZONES TO INCREASE POPS TO THE 
LIKELY CATEGORY...BUT WILL TRY TO WORD IT TO INDICATE BRIEF NATURE 
OF PRECIP.  WILL ALSO LOWER MAX TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES WITH 
EXISTING AND EXPECTED CLOUD COVER KEEPING TEMPS DOWN FROM PREVIOUS 
RUN EXPECTATIONS.



.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD 
FRONT WAS LOCATED OVER THE OHIO VALLEY THIS MORNING AND NUMEROUS 
SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUED INTO THE EARLY MORNING 
HOURS ACROSS KY AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT WITH A FEW ACROSS EAST 
CENTRAL TN AND SW VA. CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE LIES ACROSS THE TN 
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN THE FORM OF MOSTLY MID LEVEL 
CLOUD COVER. UPPER RIDGE OVER THE INCREASING LIFT AND SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY AHEAD OF UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90 WITH 
INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND PRECIPITATION. GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE 
HIGHER MAV GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES AND LOWER POPS. HAVE 40 TO 50 
PERCENT FOR POPS TODAY AND AROUND 40 PERCENT TONIGHT. SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL LIKELY CONTINUE THROUGH THE NIGHT AS THE FRONT 
MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL BE NEAR 
2.00 INCHES SO HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE IN SOME AREAS AS STORMS WILL HAVE 
A SLOW MOVEMENT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MID-UPR TROUGH SHIFTS
EAST OF THE AREA ON FRIDAY. UPPER FLOW REMAINS VERY WEAK THROUGH
THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD AS AREA LIES IN WEAKNESS BETWEEN SW
U.S. RIDGE AND ATLC RIDGE TO THE SE. AT THE SURFACE...FRONTAL
BOUNDARY STALLS ACROSS S PART OF MRX CWA ON FRI. HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN FROM THE NE THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH INVERTED TROUGH
DEVELOPING JUST W OF AREA. GOOD CHC OF PRECIPITATION CONTINUES FRI
DECREASING FROM THE NW DURING THE DAY. SLOW DRYING TREND INTO EARLY
NEXT WEEK WITH SCATTERED AFTN TSTMS FAVORING HIGHER
ELEVATIONS...MAINLY S. MOS TEMP FCST NOTICEABLY LOWER THAN 24HRS
AGO THROUGH THE EXTENDED. TWEAKED TEMPS DOWN SOME BUT WILL STAY ON
THE WARM SIDE OF GUIDANCE. LATER PACKAGES MAY HAVE TO ADJUST
DEPENDING ON DEEP THE RIDGE BUILDS IN AND/OR HOW FAR WEST INVERTED
TROUGH DEVELOPS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
