000 
FXUS64 KMRX 291844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EDT WED AUG 29 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH WEAKENS AS A
WEAK COOL FRONT APPROACHES THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ON THURSDAY. SHOWER
ACTIVITY WILL BE INCREASING WITH THE APPROACH OF THE
FRONT...HOWEVER THERE ARE SOME MINOR DIFFERENCES ON HOW THE NAM AND
GFS HANDLE THIS PRECIPITATION. FEELING IS THAT BOTH ARE OVERDONE AS
WITH PREVIOUS SYSTEMS AND HAVE UNDERCUT GUIDANCE ON POPS.  

IF THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH AS PROJECTED TOMORROW WILL SEE THE FIRST
DAY IN ALMOST A MONTH WITH SUB 90 DEGREE HIGH TEMPERATURES...BUT
THAT IS BY NO MEANS A CERTAINTY.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CENTER OF UPPER 
RIDGE RETROGRADES WESTWARD WITH WEAK NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. SURFACE 
RIDGE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY FRIDAY WILL CONTINUE TO 
MOVE EAST TO THE EASTERN SEABOARD THIS WEEKEND ALLOWING DRIER AIR TO 
FILTER INTO FORECAST AREA.  SURFACE RIDGING REMAINS OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE EXTENDED LIMITING CHANCES OF 
CONVECTION. DUE TO THE CONTINUED DROUGHT CONDITIONS AND EXTREMELY 
DRY SOIL MOISTURE CONDITIONS...DAYTIME INSOLUTION WILL REMAIN MORE 
EFFICIENT IN HEATING THE AIR.

LOCAL VERIFICATION SOFTWARE (IVERIFY) CONTINUES TO SHOW THAT MODEL 
BIAS REMAINS TOO COOL...SO WILL TREND A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER FOR 
MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES THROUGH MOST OF THE EXTENDED.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  72  87  71  90  68 /  30  50  50  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  71  89  68  89  66 /  20  40  40  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  72  89  68  90  66 /  20  40  40  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  66  89  62  87  62 /  20  30  30  20  10

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT WED AUG 29 2007

.DISCUSSION...TEMPERATURES PARTICULARLY IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY 
RUNNING A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN YESTERDAY WITH MORE CLOUD COVER.  
EXPECT THIS TREND TO CONTINUE AND CURRENT FORECAST REFLECTS THIS.  
DO THINK IT IS A LITTLE LOW AND WILL BUMP UP A FEW DEGREES.  NO 
OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS SHOW INCREASING 
MOISTURE ADVECTION INTO THE FORECAST AREA TODAY ACROSS SOUTHERN AND 
CENTRAL SECTIONS AROUND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO THE EAST 
AND SOUTH. A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES WILL 
MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT. THE VERY HIGH POPS OF 
THE NAM/WRF IN THE FIRST PERIOD HOWEVER ARE I THINK OVERDONE AND 
WILL FOLLOW CLOSER TO THE GFS IN THE SOUTH AND A BLEND CENTRAL. 
NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS AND SW VA WILL KEEP POPS OUT TODAY ALTHOUGH A 
FEW SHOWERS ARE OCCURRING THERE EARLY THIS MORNING. THE NAM/WRF IS 
ALSO TOO LOW FOR MAXES TODAY IN THE SOUTH SO AGREE MORE WITH GFS 
GUIDANCE. POPS FOR THE SECOND PERIOD WILL BE CLOSE TO GFS AGAIN. GFS 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS TONIGHT LOOK GOOD SO NO BIG CHANGES THERE EITHER.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE SHIFTS WEST 
WITH WEAK TROUGHING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE 
PERIOD. MAIN JET STAYS WELL NORTH OF THE AREA. WEAK SURFACE FRONT 
MOVES SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE AREA ON THURSDAY. MODELS TRENDING COOLER 
AND WETTER. GOOD PRECIP CHCS AREAWIDE THU WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE. DP 
BOUNDARY AND HIGHER PWS LINGER ALONG SW PART OF MRX CWA. REMAINDER 
OF PERIOD FAIRLY DRY WITH BEST PCPN CHCS ALONG SOUTHERN MRX CWA. 
OPENED DIURNAL TEMP RANGE SOME WEEKEND AND BEYOND ANTICIPATING DRY 
CONDITIONS.

CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
NORTHEAST EXTENDING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...RESULTING IN 
A SOUTHERLY FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA AND HIGHER DEWPOINTS THIS 
EVENING (COMPARED TO THIS TIME YESTERDAY). AREA RADARS INDICATE A 
FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS CONTINUING THIS EVENING...AND WITH A MARGINALLY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS IN PLACE...WILL PLAN TO KEEP SOME SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS IN THE FORECAST OVERNIGHT. THE HIGHER DEWPOINTS AND EARLIER 
CONVECTION WILL LIKELY COMBINE TO PRODUCE SOME PATCHY FOG TONIGHT... 
AND WILL INCLUDE A MENTION OF THIS IN THE ZONES. OTHERWISE...TEMPS 
LOOK TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL UPDATE ONLY FOR SOME MINOR TWEAKS.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 281845
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT TUE AUG 28 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...
OPERATIONAL MODELS AND SREF PROJECT INCREASING MOISTURE ADVECTION
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AS RETURN FLOW AROUND SURFACE
HIGH PRESSURE NEAR THE ATLANTIC COAST COMMENCES. HOWEVER...AM
SKEPTICAL OF THE RELATIVELY HIGH POPS PROJECTED BY GFS GUIDANCE IN
THE FIRST PERIOD AND HAVE GENERALLY UNDERCUT THOSE SOMEWHAT. POPS
FOR THE SECOND PERIOD LOOK MORE REASONABLE AS SCATTERED DIURNAL
CONVECTION DEVELOPS IN MOIST ATMOSPHERE REGIME...WITH SOMEWHAT
BETTER COVERAGE EXPECTED IN THE SOUTHERN TIER. GFS GUIDANCE TEMPS
LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE MOST PART AND DID NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM
THOSE VALUES. ANTICIPATE THE EXPECTED INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND THE
CORRESPONDING INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER WILL TEND TO HOLD TEMPS DOWN
IN THE SECOND PERIOD TO SOME DEGREE AS DEPICTED IN THE GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
MORE ORGANIZED LIFT SHOULD INCREASE THE CHANCES OF RAIN ON THURSDAY 
AS THE UPPER RIDGE IS SUPPRESSED TO THE SOUTH AND WEST BY AN UPPER 
TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION. THE FLOW REMAINS WEAK AND THE 
TROUGH IS RATHER BROAD...SO WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE FOR 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. BEST PRECIP CHANCES LOOK TO BE IN 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS CLOSER TO A WEAK 850 MB LOW. SURFACE COLD FRONT 
LOOKS LIKE IT STALLS ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND NEVER REACHES OUR 
AREA...SO THERE WILL BE NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGE IN AIR MASS THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND. THE GFS TAKES A WEAK 850 LOW OVER ALABAMA TO THE 
WEST...WHICH SUPPLIES MOISTURE TO THE AREA THROUGH TUESDAY. THE DEEP 
MOISTURE FROM THIS LOW IS A NEW FEATURE ON THE 12Z GFS...AND GIVEN 
THE DRY PATTERN WE HAVE BEEN STUCK IN...WILL AWAIT BETTER MODEL 
CONTINUITY BEFORE BITING ON HIGH POPS.


&&

INCREASING MOISTURE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST WILL CONTRIBUTE TO MORE 
SCATTERED COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AND CONTINUE THROUGH 
FRIDAY AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER EACH DAY 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS RIDGE BREAKS DOWN AND 500 MB HEIGHTS FALL. 
BEHIND THE FRONT DRIER HIGH PRESSURE MOVES IN. LATEST GFS TRIES TO 
KEEP MOISTURE ACROSS SOUTH AND WEST SUNDAY AND MONDAY BUT FOR NOW 
WILL KEEP DRIER. WILL KEEP HIGH TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY ABOVE GUIDANCE 
WITH ON GOING DROUGHT AND LOWS NEAR GFS GUIDANCE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT MON AUG 27 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
MOST OF THE DEEP MOISTURE HAS BEEN PUSHED WELL SOUTH OF OUR CWA BY
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTH. ENOUGH LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE
REMAINS TO ALLOW ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION TO DEVELOP THIS
AFTERNOON...MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN. ANTICIPATE MOST OF THIS
ACTIVITY TO DISSIPATE BY SUNSET...BUT DID CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS IN THE SOUTHERN TIER BASED ON PROXIMITY TO BETTER MOISTURE.
MUCH THE SAME STORY FOR TOMORROW. GENERALLY FAVORED LOWER GFS
GUIDANCE POPS GIVEN THE VERY DRY CONDITIONS BEING EXPERIENCED OVER
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. ALSO FOLLOWED THE GFS GUIDANCE
VALUES CLOSELY FOR TEMPS AS THEY SEEM REASONABLE GIVEN THE EXPECTED
CONDITIONS AND PERSISTENCE.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
A WEAK RIDGE WILL REMAIN OVER MUCH OF THE EAST COAST ON 
WEDNESDAY...THEN BEGIN TO RETROGRADE ON THURSDAY. THE NAM SHOWS A 
NICE FEED OF GULF MOISTURE FROM LOUISIANA TO MIDDLE TN ON 
WEDNESDAY...BUT THE GFS IS DRIER. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE DRIER GFS AND 
HAVE ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR WEDNESDAY IN THE SOUTHERN AND 
WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. 500 MB HEIGHTS BEGIN TO FALL ON 
THURSDAY AS THE RIDGE MOVES WEST AND A TROUGH DIGS SOUTH OVER NEW 
ENGLAND WITH EAST TN IN A 700 MB DEFORMATION ZONE. THIS SHOULD 
PROVIDE A LITTLE MORE ORGANIZED LIFT...AND WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS 
THURSDAY NIGHT. A SURFACE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH ON FRIDAY...AND 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY. THIS SHOULD BRING TEMPERATURES DOWN CLOSER TO NORMAL FOR THE 
WEEKEND. THE GFS SHOWS SOME PRECIP WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH ON 
SUNDAY...BUT WILL KEEP THE WEEKEND DRY FOR NOW AS SUCH WEAK FEATURES 
ARE DIFFICULT TO PREDICT THIS FAR OUT.

TIMING OF EXPECTED PATTERN CHANGE REMAIN IN QUESTION.  THEREFORE

END OF THE EXTENDED.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT SUN AUG 26 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...HARD TO LOCATE VERY WEAK 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY...BUT WEAK SURFACE TROUGH HAS MOVED THROUGH AND IS 
NOW TO OUR SOUTHEAST.  WEAK HIGH PRESSURE MOVES BY TO OUR NORTH IN 
THE SHORT TERM...AND HEIGHTS BEGIN TO RISE AGAIN.  LOOKS LIKE BEST 
CHANCE FOR ANY CONVECTION TOMORROW WILL BE SOUTH AND IN THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THOSE AREAS...DRY 
ELSEWHERE. WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...LATEST RUNS OF GFS HAVE 
SLOWED DOWN THE TRANSITIONAL PATTERN CHANGE AND ALSO PROJECT LESS 
AMPLITUDE TO THE TROUGH THAT EVENTUALLY DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN 
CONUS. THERE ARE ALSO PROFOUND DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE OPERATIONAL 
GFS AND THE GFS ENSEMBLES REGARDING PRECIP PATTERNS FOR THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION...WITH THE ENSEMBLES PROJECTING TYPICAL 
SCATTERED...MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION THROUGH THE LATER PART OF WORK 
WEEK AND INTO THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. THE OPERATIONAL GFS PROJECTS 
MORE ORGANIZED PRECIP FOR LATE IN THE WEEK AND WEEKEND WHICH WOULD 
BE A WELCOMED RELIEF TO THE AREA-WIDE DROUGHT CONDITIONS. THE 
ENSEMBLE SOLUTION SEEMS MORE REASONABLE...BUT BECAUSE OF THE 
RUN-TO-RUN DIFFERENCES IN THE GFS...DIVERGING SOLUTIONS OF OTHER 
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AND A LARGER-THAN-NORMAL SPREAD BETWEEN THE GFS 
ENSEMBLE MEMBERS...AM INCLINED TO NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO 
PREVIOUS FORECAST PACKAGE. STILL APPEARS TEMPS WILL SLOWLY FALL TO
NEAR CLIMO BY LATE IN THE UPCOMING WEEK AS HEIGHTS FALL IN RESPONSE
TO THE RIDGE WEST/TROUGH EAST TRANSITION.

ENSEMBLES ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT AND GENERALLY CONTINUE TO 
ADVERTISE A PATTERN SHIFT TOWARD THE END OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. 
UPPER RIDGE THAT HAS PERSISTED OVER THE SE CONUS IS PROJECTED TO 
RETROGRADE WELL TO THE WEST ALLOWING A TROUGH TO SET UP OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS. SURFACE FRONT THAT WILL USHER IN COOLER AIR MASS BY 
NEXT FRIDAY DOES NOT APPEAR TOO ACTIVE FOR THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
AT THIS TIME...BUT ANTICIPATE ENOUGH LIFT WITH THIS FEATURE TO 
WARRANT CHANCE POPS. TYPICAL DIURNAL CONVECTION EXPECTED FOR MOST 
DAYS PRECEDING THIS EVENT...WITH BEST CHANCE IN THE EASTERN TIER OF 
OUR FORECAST AREA NEARER THE MOISTURE AXIS TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST. 
FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY USED A COMBINATION OF GFS GUIDANCE AND 
ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE. TEMPS MAY ACTUALLY FALL TO NEAR 
CLIMATOLOGY...OR EVEN SLIGHTLY BELOW IN SOME AREAS...BY LATE IN THE 
LONG TERM PERIOD.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONVECTION OVER MIDDLE TN IS 
SLOWLY SPREADING EAST INTO THE MRX CWA TODAY...A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
ARE CURRENTLY OVER THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU.  BELIEVE 
COVERAGE WILL LESSEN AND HAVE THEREFORE KEPT POPS AT 20 TO 30 
PERCENT.  WITH THE ASSOCIATED CLOUD COVER...SHOULD SEE AFTERNOON 
HIGHS A COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER TODAY.  HOWEVER... MOST VALLEY 
LOCATIONS WILL STILL REACH INTO THE LOWER TO MID 90S.
 
.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A WEAKENING COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY.  WITH ADDED MOISTURE AND LIFT 
COUPLED WITH A WEAK TO MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS...EXPECT TO SEE 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT ACROSS THE AREA.  ISOLATED 
CONVECTION SHOULD LINGER OVER THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS ON TUESDAY AS 
THE FRONT EXITS THE REGION.  A RETURN TO NORMAL SUMMERTIME 
CONVECTIVE PATTERN EXPECTED TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  GFS CONTINUES TO 
INDICATE A PATTERN CHANGE FOR THE END OF THE WEEK WITH AN UPPER 
TROUGH MOVING IN.  CONFIDENCE IN THIS REMAINS SOMEWHAT LOW...SO WILL 
CONTINUE WITH LOW POPS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  MODEL GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 241835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT FRI AUG 24 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO 
FLATTEN OUT IN THE SHORT TERM...AND A WEAK COLD FRONT EDGES CLOSER.  
MODELS INDICATE A BETTER CHANCE OF PRECIP TOMORROW...AND MORE 
CLOUDS...WITH TEMPS LOWER THAN RECENT DAYS.  AM NOT OPTIMISTIC FOR A 
DRAMATIC CHANGE...SO WILL ONLY GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS...AND WILL 
GENERALLY GO A BIT ABOVE MAV TEMPS BOTH TONIGHT AND TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...FRONT CURRENTLY
CAUSING  CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY IN THE MIDWEST WILL TRY TO ASSERT
ITSELF HERE ON SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY, BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW. GFS
HAS A HUGE PRECIP BULLS EYE OVER THE CWA, BUT THIS APPEARS TO
CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK, SO WILL PARTLY IGNORE. BELIEVE FRONT WILL
DESTABILIZE AIR MASS ENOUGH TO RAISE POPS A HAIR, AND SOME SPOTS
WILL RECEIVE BOUNTIFUL WELCOME RAIN, BUT IT WILL BE LARGELY A GOOSE
EGG FOR MOST PLACES, AGAIN. UPPER RIDGE RETURNS TO DOMINANCE
TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY, UNTIL THE NEXT POSSIBLE LITTLE SYSTEM
MOVES THROUGH. THIS LATER TIME PERIOD IS REALLY THE PROBLEM BECAUSE
MODELS SHOW A DRAMATIC PATTERN CHANGE WITH UPPER TROF SETTLING IN
OVER EASTERN NOAM, AND RIDGE MOVING WEST. THIS WOULD PUT US IN MUCH
COOLER TEMPERATURE REGIME. HOWEVER USUAL CAVEATS APPLY THIS FAR
OUT. PLUS, WEVE ALL BEEN BURNED BEFORE WITH THIS TYPE OF
ADVERTISED CHANGE DURING THE DEEPENING DROUGHT, SO I AM GUN SHY.
HAVE LEFT TEMPS FROM PREVIOUS PACKAGE ALONE PRETTY MUCH. AT THIS
POINT, COOLER MEANS JUST SEASONALLY HOT, NOT BLISTERING RECORDS.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 231835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT THU AUG 23 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...RIDGE BEGINS TO FLATTEN OUT 
JUST A BIT IN THE SHORT TERM...BUT STILL WILL BE OUR DOMINANT 
FEATURE IN THE SHORT TERM.  RADAR SHOWS A BIT MORE COVERAGE OF 
PRECIP TODAY THAN YESTERDAY...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EARLY 
THIS EVENING. WILL ALSO GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN FOR TOMORROW.  WILL GENERALLY GO A BIT ABOVE GFS MOS 
TEMPS...BUT EVEN GOING ABOVE LEADS TO SLIGHTLY LOWER NUMBERS FOR 
TOMORROW THAN TODAY.  HOWEVER...RECORDS STILL IN JEOPARDY...SO WILL 
MENTION NEAR RECORD HIGHS.  MIXING CONTINUES TO PUSH RH VALUES LOWER 
THAN GUIDANCE INDICATES...AND EXPECT THE SAME TOMORROW. BASED ON 
THIS...HEAT INDEX VALUES SHOULD STAY BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA 
TOMORROW AFTERNOON.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE EXPECTED TO 
PERSIST THROUGH EARLY WEEKEND BEFORE GRUDGINGLY GIVING WAY TO AN 
UPPER TROUGH APPROACHING FROM THE WEST. THIS WILL RESULT IN MARGINAL 
HEIGHT FALLS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ALONG WITH PUSHING A 
WEAK SURFACE FRONT INTO THE AREA BY LATE SATURDAY/EARLY SUNDAY. 
MOISTURE ACCOMPANYING THIS FEATURE NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE PER MODEL 
TIME-HEIGHTS...BUT SCATTERED CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE AS SURFACE FRONT 
STALLS OUT. SUFFICIENT MOISTURE PERSISTS TO PERMIT WIDELY SCATTERED 
MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION TO DEVELOP THROUGH MUCH OF THE UPCOMING
WORK WEEK BEFORE ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE FRONT COUPLET
APPROACHES ON THURSDAY RESULTING AGAIN IN THE POSSIBILITY OF
SOMEWHAT BETTER COVERAGE OF PRECIP. THERE ARE SOME INDICATIONS IN
THE ENSEMBLE DATA THAT THIS FEATURE MAY BE A PRECURSOR TO A GENERAL
PATTERN SHIFT...BUT TOO EARLY TO MAKE ANY DEFINITIVE PROJECTIONS AT
THIS TIME. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE
VALUES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 AM EDT THU AUG 23 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)... A RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE ENTRENCHED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL REMAIN
THE DOMINATE WEATHER FEATURE. PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TODAY WILL ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB TO NEAR RECORD HIGHS. THE FOLLOWING ARE THE
CURRENT RECORDS:

CHA 102 SET BACK IN 1968...FORECAST HIGH OF 102 TODAY.
TYS 99 SET BACK IN 1968...FORECAST HIGH OF 100 TODAY.
TRI 94 SET BACK IN 1968...FORECAST HIGH OF 95 TODAY.

DUE TO THE CONTINUED DROUGHT CONDITIONS...AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS WILL
MIX OUT INTO THE 60S...WHICH WILL LIMIT HEAT INDICES TO THE UPPER
90S TO 105 SOUTH. HAVE ISSUED A HEAT ADVISORY FOR THE SOUTHERN
TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR TODAY.

GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN GUIDANCE HIGHS DUE TO
THE EXTREMELY DRY SOIL MOISTURE.

UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WILL LIMIT CONVECTION
DEVELOPMENT DUE TO CONTINUED PRESENCE OF MID-LEVEL CAP.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE REMAINS ANCHORED OVER THE SOUTHEAST THROUGH 
MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES BY TO THE 
NORTH ON SUNDAY...AND WILL INCLUDE LOW CHANCE POPS WITH THIS 
FEATURE. THE RIDGE STRENGTHENS AND EXPANDS...BECOMING CENTERED OVER 
TN FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THIS SHOULD KEEP THE AREA DRY...AND 
WILL REMOVE THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EACH DAY. TEMPERATURES WILL 
CONTINUE ABOVE NORMAL.

FXUS64 KMRX 221913
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 PM EDT WED AUG 22 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO 
DOMINATE OUR WEATHER...WITH MAINLY DRY WEATHER AND HOT AFTERNOONS.
RADAR SHOWS A FEW SHOWERS HAVE TRIED TO GET GOING...BUT THEY HAVE
BEEN SMALL AND SHORT LIVED SO FAR. DO NOT EXPECT MUCH COVERAGE...BUT
WILL CARRY MINIMAL POPS FOR AFTERNOON HOURS BEFORE DROPPING BELOW
15% BY BEGINNING OF TONIGHT PERIOD. EXPECT SIMILAR CONDITIONS
TOMORROW...WITH RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES ONCE AGAIN IN JEOPARDY.
WILL GO WITH SILENT (BELOW 15%) POPS AS EXPECT VERY LITTLE COVERAGE
OF CONVECTION. DESPITE NEAR RECORD TEMPS...MIXING SHOULD KEEP DEW
POINTS LOW ENOUGH TOMORROW TO STAY BELOW HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA
ONCE AGAIN.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)... UPPER RIDGE
BEGINS TO MOVE TO THE SOUTHWEST TOWARDS THE DEEP SOUTH AND LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY FRIDAY AS A TROUGH MOVES TOWARD THE WESTERN
GREAT LAKES. NOT MUCH CHANGE FOR THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY EXCEPT
TEMPERATURES A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN THURSDAY (BUT STILL HOT)
DUE TO MORE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE AFTERNOON MOUNTAINS AS WEAK SHORT WAVE
ENERGY MOVES ACROSS. SATURDAY MOISTURE INCREASES A LITTLE MORE
AHEAD OF WEAK COLD FRONT SO SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
AREAWIDE LOOKS GOOD AND HIGH TEMPERATURES MOSTLY LOWER TO MID 90S
MOST PLACES. MINOR TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN STATES SUNDAY WITH FRONT
ACROSS FORECAST AREA SHOULD ALLOW FOR BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE EXTENDED AND MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES UPPER
80S TO LOWER 90S. MONDAY AND TUESDAY RIDGE STRENGTHENS AGAIN OVER
THE OH AND TN VALLEYS BUT FRONTS LEFT OVER MOISTURE SHOULD ALLOW
FOR MORE CLOUD COVER AND WITH A SOUTH FLOW EXPECTING TEMPERATURES
ABOUT THE SAME AS SUNDAY WITH AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE
END OF THE EXTENDED.
&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 AM EDT WED AUG 22 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
THE STRONG, VERTICALLY STACKED HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER AL THIS 
MORNING WILL REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY THROUGH TODAY...WITH A SLIGHT 
WESTWARD DRIFT ON THURSDAY. A SHORTWAVE RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER OUR 
AREA TODAY...GIVING A MORE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT AND KEEPING THE 
AREA DRY. THE NAM SHOWS MUCH MORE MOISTURE TODAY THAN THE GFS...AND 
THUS GIVES MUCH HIGHER POPS. THERE APPEARS TO BE LITTLE FORCING FOR 
LIFT...AND GIVEN THE DRY PATTERN OF LATE...WILL GO WITH THE DRY GFS. 
AN UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL CONTINUE TO EXTEND OVER THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...THOUGH IT DOES BEGIN TO WEAKEN ON FRIDAY. A 
LOW LEVEL FLOW FROM THE EAST-SOUTHEAST MAY GIVE SOME ISOLATED 
SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AFTERNOON...BUT MOST OF 
THE AREA WILL STAY DRY. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO BE ABOVE NORMAL...AND 
WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WARMER SIDE OF THE MOS GUIDANCE. 

THE RED FLAG WATCH FOR CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES WILL BE 
CONTINUED...AND WILL WAIT UNTIL A MORNING CONFERENCE CALL WITH NC 
STATE FORESTRY OFFICIALS BEFORE MAKING ANY CHANGES.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
OPPRESSIVE UPPER RIDGE BECOMES FURTHER SURPRESSED INTO THE DEEP
SOUTH AND LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AS TROUGH MAKES ITS WAY EAST
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEAST U.S. THROUGH THE PERIOD.
DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PREVIOUS FORECAST SCENARIO WHICH
FEATURES MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION WITH MINOR
EMPHASIS IN THE TERRAIN FOR SATURDAY. AS UPPER TROUGH MAKES
PROGRESS THROUGH THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY ON
SUNDAY...COOL FRONT DROPS SOUTHEAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA. WITH
SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY BUILDING SOUTH WENT AHEAD AND ADJUSTED POPS UP TO
LOW CHANCE. KEPT PRIMARILY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION FOR THE
REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST AS FRONT WEAKENS AND LOW LEVEL
FLOW BECOMES SOUTHERLY AGAIN. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO SUGGESTED
GUIDANCE TEMPS.

.DISCUSSION...VORT CENTERED HAS MOVED EAST OF AREA. A FEW ISOSLATED

RAISED MIN TEMPS S 2/3 OF CWA LEANING TOWARD PERSISTENCE AND PROGGED

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...WEDNESDAY...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL WITH ANOTHER 
WEAK IMPULSE DRIFTING THROUGH TO OUR NORTH...FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS.  OTHERWISE...CONTINUED HOT AND HUMID THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM.  

DUE TO THE VERY DRY FUEL CONDITIONS...WILL CONTINUE RED FLAG WARNING
UNTIL 8 PM TODAY AND FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR WEDNESDAY.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE WILL REMAIN CENTERED ACROSS THE GULF COASTS STATES INTO
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THROUGH FRIDAY. ONLY FORCING FOR CONVECTION
WILL BE OROGRAHICS...SO WILL MAINTAIN A SLIGHT POP FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...A SHORT-WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY FLATTENING THE RIDGE ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA
FOR SUNDAY BEFORE STALLING AND DISSIPATING. WILL CALL FOR CHANCE
POPS FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND SLIGHT POPS IN THE VALLEY FOR
SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. HAVE TRENDED A DEGREE OR TWO HIGHER THAN
GFX MAX TEMPERATURES DUE TO DRY SOIL CONDITIONS. UPPER RIDGE RE-
BUILDS OVER THE REGION FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 AM EDT TUE AUG 21 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
STRONG HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE REMAINS ENTRENCHED ACROSS THE THE 
SOUTHEAST U.S. THE RIDGE BECOMES SLIGHTLY ELONGATED EAST TO WEST 
TODAY...WHICH MAY ALLOW A SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER THE MS VALLEY TO 
CROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF OUR AREA THIS AFTERNOON. GOOD INSTABILITY 
AND MORE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD LEAD TO SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE NORTHERN SECTIONS. THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SW 
NC MAY STAY DRY AS WARMER MID LEVEL TEMPS CLOSER TO THE RIDGE WILL 
GIVE MORE STABLE CONDITIONS IN THE SOUTH. ON WEDNESDAY THE RIDGE 
RETROGRADES FROM THE COAST TO MS/AL/GA...WHICH SHOULD FURTHER 
STABILIZE THE AIR MASS IN THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. THE NAM HAS A SLIGHTLY WEAKER RIDGE AND GIVES HIGH 
CHANCE POPS IN THE NORTH ON WEDNESDAY...BUT WILL GO WITH THE 
GFS...WHICH IS DRY...AS THE NAM SEEMS TO BE TOO WET LATELY. 
CONTINUED SUBSIDENCE UNDER THE RIDGE SHOULD KEEP THE AREA DRY AGAIN 
ON THURSDAY. LEANED TOWARD THE WARMER MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH 
THE PERIOD FOR TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
RIDGE AXIS GRADUALLY SLIPS SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA
DURING THE LONG TERM ALLOWING FOR A SLOW INCREASE IN MOISTURE. IN
ADDITION...TEMPERATURES ALOFT WILL BE A LITTLE COOLER ALLOWING FOR
BETTER INSTABILITY. STILL A LITTLE QUESTIONABLE AS TO THE
POSSIBILITY OF A WEAK FROPA SOMETIME DURING THE WEEKEND AS RIDGE
RETREATS A BIT. BASICALLY KEPT FORECAST THE SAME FROM PREVIOUS
PACKAGE BUT KEPT POPS AT SLIGHT CHANCE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD DUE TO
THE UNCERTAINTY OF SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY HAVING MUCH OF AN IMPACT ON
THE FORECAST AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
232 PM EDT MON AUG 20 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP 
OVER THE REGION FOR THIS EVENING...WITH BEST CHANCES ACROSS OUR 
NORTHERN ZONES.  A SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH...CONTINUING THE 
CHANCE FOR A STRAY THUNDERSTORM THROUGH AT LEAST MIDNIGHT.  HIGH 
PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL ON TUESDAY.  HOWEVER...A WEAK WAVE 
MOVING THROUGH COULD ALLOW FOR SCATTERED TO ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS 
DURING THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...PERSISTENCE. RIDGE STAYS 
PUT OVER SOUTHEAST, WITH WIMPY FRONT ON THE WEEKEND. I REALLY HAVE 
NO CONFIDENCE THIS FRONT WILL ACTUALLY MAKE IT THROUGH THE AREA, 
THOUGH IT COULD...REPEAT COULD...MOVE WHAT LITTLE MOISTURE WE HAVE 
UP A LITTLE AND MAKE SOME CLOUDS BIG ENOUGH IN THE MOUNTAINS AND 
NORTHEAST TO DROP SOME LIGHT WATER AS A TEASE IN SOME SPOTS. OTHER 
THAN THAT, ITS MORE HOT AND HUMID UNTIL THE WEEKEND. IF THE FRONT 
DROPS THIS FAR SOUTH, IT MAY ACTUALLY DRY THINGS A HAIR, WHICH WILL 
HELP WITH THE HEAT INDICES BUT HURT THE FIRE SITUATION. STAY TUNED.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 200803
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 AM EDT MON AUG 20 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SOUTHWEST FLOW AROUND THE 
PERIPHERY OF A STRONG RIDGE OFF THE EAST COAST BROUGHT INCREASING 
MOISTURE TO THE AREA YESTERDAY...LEADING TO SOME SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE PLATEAU. WITH THE RIDGE REMAINING NEARLY 
STATIONARY...EXPECT SIMILAR CONDITIONS AGAIN TODAY. THERE SHOULD BE 
A LITTLE MORE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH TODAY...SO THERE MAY BE A LITTLE 
MORE SHOWER COVERAGE. HOWEVER WILL OPT TO KEEP POPS IN THE SLIGHT 
CHANCE RANGE OVER THE MOUNTAINS...SW VA...AND THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. AS WE ARE SEEING THIS MORNING...SHOWERS MAY PERSIST AFTER 
SUNSET...SO WILL KEEP POPS GOING IN NORTHERN SECTIONS UNTIL 06Z. 
WITH SLIGHTLY MORE MOISTURE IN PLACE...HIGH TEMPS SHOULD BE A BIT 
LOWER THAN PREVIOUS DAYS...BUT WILL STILL LEAN TOWARD THE HIGHER END 
OF MOS FOR TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN 
CONTROL DURING THE FIRST PART OF THE PERIOD.  A FEW WEAK SHORTWAVES 
ARE EXPECTED TO ROTATE OVER RIDGE FOR TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.  WITH 
WEAK INSTABILITY EXPECTED...WILL KEEP THE 20 POPS FOR MAINLY THE 
NORTHERN AREAS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  A FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION ON SATURDAY... 
WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP JUST SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  THE WARM WEATHER IS EXPECTED TO 
CONTINUE FOR MOST OF THE WEEK.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  HEAT INDEX VALUES IN THE 100 TO 105 RANGE ARE 
EXPECTED IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY ON TUESDAY AND JUST THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY.  SOMEWHAT COOLER TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
ARRIVE BY THE END OF THE WEEK. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  95  73  97  73  97 /  10  10  20  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  94  73  96  72  95 /  10  10  20  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN  94  72  96  72  95 /  10  10  20  20  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EDT SUN AUG 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...SOMEWHAT BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION EXPERIENCED IN

INCREASE. LATEST MODEL DATA INDICATE THAT THIS WIDELY-SCATTERED
ACTIVITY MAY CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY MORNING. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO
REMOVE EVENING WORDING...BUT OTHERWISE MAKE NO MAJOR CHANGES AT
THIS TIME.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT SUN AUG 19 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WARM FRONT STRETCHING FROM NEAR CHICAGO SOUTHEAST 
ACROSS WEST VA INTO CENTRAL VA. SOUTHWEST WIND FLOW BEHIND THIS 
FRONT SHOULD HELP TO GRADUALLY INCREASE MOISTURE LEVELS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA INTO MONDAY. AS A RESULT...WILL MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED CONVECTION AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR 
TONIGHT AND MONDAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE REMNANTS 
OF ERIN (CURRENTLY OVER OK) MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY...WITH MOST OF ITS MOISTURE REMAINING 
NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...MOISTURE SHOULD INCREASE 
ENOUGH ON TUESDAY TO JUSTIFY MENTIONING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION AREAWIDE...WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA 
AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. UNFORTUNATELY...MODELS AGREE THAT THE 
UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER THE SOUTHEAST WILL BUILD BACK TOWARD THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY BY THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...BRINGING WARMER TEMPS AND A 
CONTINUATION OF STAGNANT CONDITIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO 
KEEP TEMPS A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN GUIDANCE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD...SINCE THIS HAS BEEN THE TREND FOR A WHILE. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN THE WEATHER 
PATTERN EXPECTED THROUGH THE EXTENDED WITH HIGH PRESSURE REMAINING 
THE DOMINATE WEATHER FEATURE. STRONG DIURNAL HEATING AND WEAK 
INSTABILITY COMBINED WITH A COUPLE OF WEAK IMPULSES WILL PROVIDE US 
WITH NORMAL SUMMER CONVECTION WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY FOR A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT...MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN. 
MODELS INDICATED A COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND. 
CONFIDENCE LOW IN TIMING AND STRENGTH...BUT WILL KEEP GENERALLY 20 
POPS FOR THE PERIOD TO COVER.

IN CONTROL THROUGH THE PERIOD...BUT A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES ROTATING 
OVER THE RIDGE COMBINED WITH THE WEAK INSTABILITY COULD TRIGGER 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS.  SO WILL CONTINUE WITH THE SLIGHT CHANCE

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS THAT THE COLD FRONT MAY HAVE MOVED THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA (JUDGING FROM THE ISOBAR PATTERN AND WIND FIELD)... 
ALTHOUGH THE LATEST THETA-E ANALYSIS REVEALS THAT DRIER AIR REMAINS 
NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...THE FRONT MAY ACTUALLY EXTEND 
ALONG THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND ALONG THE KY/VA BORDER. 
THIS FRONT SHOULD CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH AN ISOLATED TSTORM STILL POSSIBLE 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN BEFORE SUNSET. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD 
INTO THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH GENERALLY DRY AND 
UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS CONTINUING. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ENOUGH ON SUNDAY TO TRIGGER A 
FEW ISOLATED TSTORMS ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TEMPS SHOULD 
DECREASE A FEW DEGREES FOR THE WEEKEND...BUT WILL STILL REMAIN 
UNSEASONABLY WARM. WILL PLAN TO TREND A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN 
GUIDANCE THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN 
CONTROL OF AREA WEATHER THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED. A WEAKENING FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL BE TO OUR NORTH ON MONDAY AND MAY SEE SOME ASSOCIATED 
CONVECTION...THOUGH GENERALLY CONFINED TO HIGHER TERRAIN. A WEAK 
SHORT WAVE WILL BE ROTATING AROUND THE HIGH ON TUESDAY AND WILL 
CONTINUE THE LOW POPS ACROSS THE AREA. NORMAL SUMMERTIME DIURNAL 
CONVECTION EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY OVER FAVORED AREAS. FINALLY...LOW 
POPS THROUGHOUT THE AREA ON FRIDAY WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHING 
THE REGION. GUIDANCE LOOKS GOOD AND KEPT TEMPS CLOSE.

.DISCUSSION...

DRIER THAN THE CURRENT AIR MASS. MORNING BNA SOUNDING REVEALS MORE 
MID-LEVEL MOISTURE THAN YESTERDAY...WITH A VERY DRY BOUNDARY LAYER 
REMAINING. THIS MID-LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD BE ENOUGH FOR SOME 
ISOLATED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON...WITH THE DRY 
AIR IN THE LOWER-LEVELS POSSIBLY PRODUCING SOME DAMAGING WINDS WITH 
A FEW STORMS. ALTHOUGH MINS WERE VERY WARM THIS MORNING...MORE CLOUD 
COVER TODAY SHOULD HELP TO KEEP MAXES A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN 
YESTERDAY.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK. WILL PLAN TO UPDATE 
THE ZONES THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING. RECORD HIGHS FOR 
THIS DATE ARE HIGHER THAN PREVIOUS DAYS: CHA (102)...TYS (101)...OQT 
(99)...TRI (100). THUS...WILL NOT MENTION NEAR RECORD HIGHS IN THE 
ZONES WITH MAXES EXPECTED TO BE A LITTLE COOLER TODAY THAN PREVIOUS 
DAYS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EDT FRI AUG 17 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME SHOWERS HAVE LINGERED IN THE 
AREA PAST SUNSET DUE TO UPPER SUPPORT FROM A WEAK VORTICITY AXIS AND 
UPPER DIVERGENCE. A WEAK SURFACE FRONT...WHICH IS REALLY MORE OF A 
WIND SHIFT THAN A TEMPERATURE DISCONTINUITY...IS LOCATED IN THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY. SOME SHOWERS ARE AHEAD OF THE TROUGH ACROSS KY. THE 
TROUGH WILL PUSH SOUTH INTO OUR AREA TODAY. THIS TROUGH AND 
LINGERING OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM CONVECTION THIS MORNING WILL HELP 
PROVIDE A LITTLE MORE FOCUS FOR THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON. 
ALTHOUGH SURFACE DEWPOINTS WILL LIKELY FALL WITH DAYTIME 
MIXING...AND ARE PROBABLY TOO HIGH IN THE MODELS AS HAS BEEN THE 
CASE THE PAST FEW DAYS...850 THETA-E VALUES ARE HIGH AND SHOULD 
SUPPORT SOME STRONG THUNDERSTORMS. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES ARE 
ALSO A LITTLE HIGHER TODAY. WILL GO ABOVE MOS POPS TODAY...AND SHOW 
SCATTERED STORMS IN THE SOUTH WITH ISOLATED NORTH. WILL ALSO HAVE 
HIGH AND LOW TEMPS ON THE HIGHER SIDE OF GUIDANCE...AS THE MOS HAS 
VERIFIED TOO COOL THE PAST FEW DAYS...ESPECIALLY WITH LOW TEMPS....

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN 
ON SATURDAY ALONG WITH AN INCREASE IN STABILITY...WILL KEEP SATURDAY 
DRY.  A FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION FROM THE NORTH ON SUNDAY AND 
LINGERS INTO MONDAY.  BEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...BUT INSTABILITY 
IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR OUR 
NORTHERN ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS FOR BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  GFS 
INDICATING A SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  
MOISTURE LIMITED BUT STILL SOME WEAK INSTABILITY PRESENT...WILL GO 
WITH 20 POPS FOR THE ENTIRE CWA.   HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL ON 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  BUT SOME DIURNAL INSTABILITY IS EXPECTED ON 
BOTH DAYS...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY 
WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT THU AUG 16 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A 
HOT AND DRY AIR MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THE WRF MODEL HAS 
INITIALIZED WELL WITH THE COMPLEX OF TSTORMS CURRENTLY OVER SOUTHERN 
ILLINOIS AND INDIANA...AND IT INDICATES THAT THIS COMPLEX WILL 
AFFECT SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN LATER TONIGHT. THIS COMPLEX 
SHOULD DIMINISH IN COVERAGE AS IT NEARS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST

DRY BOUNDARY LAYER...THINK THAT SOME OF THESE TSTORMS COULD GENERATE 
STRONG DAMAGING WINDS. WILL KEEP A MENTION OF PRECIP FOR TONIGHT 
EVERYWHERE...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST 
TN. MODELS INDICATE THAT A BROAD UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST 
WILL PUSH THE COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNRISE 
TOMORROW MORNING...BUT THINK THIS MAY BE TOO AGGRESSIVE (CONSIDERING 
SO FAR THE FRONT HASNT MOVED AS FAST AS THE MODEL HAVE BEEN 
INDICATING). THINK THAT THE COLD FRONT WILL BE SLOWER TO MOVE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...AND SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS IN THE FORECAST FOR FRIDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...TEMPS SHOULD 
GRADUALLY DECREASE A FEW DEGREES EACH DAY AS WINDS BECOME NORTHERLY 
BEHIND THE FRONT. HOWEVER...THIS COLD FRONT WILL NOT BRING MUCH OF A 
COOL DOWN...WITH TEMPS REMAINING ABOVE NORMAL INTO THE WEEKEND.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS THE 
DOMINATE WEATHER FEATURE THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED. WEAK MOISTURE 
RETURN FLOW SETTING UP SUNDAY AND MONDAY. WILL KEEP LOW POPS 
CONFINED TO HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH MONDAY AND ACROSS THE CWA 
TUESDAY. FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...CONFIDENCE LOW ON TIMING AND 
STRENGTH OF APPROACHES WEAK WAVE/BOUNDARY...FOR NOW WILL HAVE LOW 
POPS OVER HIGHER TERRAN WEDNESDAY AND INTO THE VALLEY THURSDAY. 
GUIDANCE NUMBER LOOK REASONABLE...WILL STAY CLOSE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 AM EDT THU AUG 16 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY...WITH A DRY AIR MASS REMAINING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
MORNING BNA SOUNDING REVEALS A VERY DRY BOUNDARY LAYER WITH SOME 
MOISTURE IN THE MID LEVELS AROUND 700 MB. THIS MOISTURE MAY BE 
ENOUGH FOR SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AS THE 
COLD FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHES. WITH A FAIRLY DEEP LAYER OF DRY AIR IN 
THE LOWER-LEVELS...THINK THAT DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH 
ANY STORMS THAT MANAGE TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON. AN UPPER-LEVEL 
HIGH CENTERED OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY WILL CONTINUE CREATE HOT 
CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON...WITH TEMPS FAIRLY SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY. 

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK. WILL PLAN TO UPDATE 
THE ZONES THIS MORNING FOR MAINLY MINOR COSMETIC CHANGES OF 
MENTIONING HOT CONDITIONS AND NEAR RECORD HIGHS EVERYWHERE. RECORD 
HIGHS FOR THIS DATE INCLUDE: CHA (101)...TYS (100)...OQT (100)...TRI 
(98). 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 160808
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
408 AM EDT THU AUG 16 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MORE HIGH TEMPERATURE RECORDS 
MAY FALL BY THE WAYSIDE THIS AFTERNOON...IF AIR MASS CAN REMAIN 
FAIRLY DRY.  HEART OF WARMEST AIR WAS STILL SLIGHTLY TO WEST OF AREA 
WEDNESDAY...BUT TRAJECTORY FORECASTS SHOW FLOW FROM SFC THROUGH 1500 
METERS RIGHT FROM THAT AREA...SO THINK KCHA WILL BE RIGHT BACK ABOUT 
103 TODAY AND KTYS AND KTRI SHOULD BE EVEN WARMER THAN YESTERDAYS 
READINGS RESPECTIVELY.  DEW POINTS RIGHT NOW RIDING PRETTY 
HIGH...BUT SHOULD MIX OUT AGAIN AND DROP OFF TO LOWER LEVELS.  WITH 
RELATIVELY DRY AIR...HEAT INDEX VALUES SHOULD BE RIGHT NEAR AIR 
TEMPS THIS AFTERNOON...AND SHOULD MOSTLY STAY BELOW 105 DEGREES...SO 
NOT PLANNING A HEAT ADVISORY AT THIS TIME.

CONVECTION CHANCES FOR THIS AFTERNOON LOOK LESS THAN THEY DID AT 
THIS TIME YESTERDAY...DUE TO LACK OF LOW-LEVER RICH MOISTURE.  
KEEPING SOME LOW POPS IN FOR MUCH OF THE AREA...BUT THERE MAY NOT BE 
ANY STORMS THIS AFTERNOON.  

WEAK COLD FRONT SHOULD BE ENTERING NORTHERN AREAS THIS EVENING AND 
IT WILL BE BRINGING SOME MOISTURE WITH IT.  SO KEEPING SOME POPS IN 
OVERNIGHT AND EVEN THROUGH FRIDAY AS DEW POINTS SHOULD BE 5-10 
DEGREES HIGHER FRIDAY AFTERNOON VERSUS THIS AFTERNOON.

FRONT WILL STRUGGLE TO MAKE IT THROUGH THE AREA FRIDAY...AND MAY 
LINGER IN THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...INITIAL PERIOD OF 
FRIDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE MOSTLY DRY DUE TO LITTLE FASTER TIMING OF 
WEAK COLD FRONT...ALTHO CANT RULE OUT AN ISOLATED TSRA FRI EVENING 
OVER AT LEAST SE TN/SW NC...KEPT POPS AT 14 PERCENT OR LESS TO BE 
CONSISTENT WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES. 

NORTHEAST U.S. TROUGH LIFTS NE OVER THE WEEKEND AND ALLOWS THE UPPER 
RIDGE TO FLEX/BUILD BACK ACROSS THE REGION. THIS SHOULD EQUATE TO A 
DRY AND SEASONABLY HOT SATURDAY...AND DRY FOR MOST OF SATURDAY NIGHT.
SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW RETURNS FROM SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...WITH 
TIME HEIGHT SECTIONS SHOWING AN INCREASE IN BOTH LOW LEVEL AND UPPER 
LEVEL MOISTURE. THIS WILL FAVOR AT LEAST ISOLATED TO WIDELY 
SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION THESE DAYS...SO HARD TO MAKE ANY REAL 
IMPROVEMENTS TO PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. MOS POPS INCREASED SLIGHTLY 
ON MONDAY INTO TUESDAY...BUT NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO RAISE ANY AREAS 
ABOVE 30 PERCENT POPS FOR NOW. TWEAKED MIN AND MAX TEMPS A BIT EACH 
PERIOD IN LINE WITH LATEST GFSX MOS AND NEIGHBORS TEMP GRIDS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN 101  72  95  69  91 /  20  20  20  10  10

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 151849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT WED AUG 15 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH 
A HOT AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH 
CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS SHOULD CONTINUE TO AFFECT THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY FOR ONE MORE DAY...BEFORE GRADUALLY SHIFTING FURTHER 
SOUTH AS AN UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE NORTHEAST. THIS UPPER 
TROUGH WILL HELP PUSH THE WEAK COLD FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY 
THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH MID-LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THIS FRONT. AS A RESULT...THINK THAT SOME 
ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP DURING THE AFTERNOON AS INSTABILITY 
LEVELS BEGIN TO RISE. GFS AND WRF MODELS INDICATE SOME LARGE 
DISCREPANCIES WITH THE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY POSSIBLE TOMORROW...AND 
WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE WITH THE TWO SOLUTIONS BY INTRODUCING LOW 
POPS AREAWIDE. WITH THE COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT...THINK THAT SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE 
AREAWIDE. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A FAIRLY DEEP INVERTED-V SHAPED 
BOUNDARY LAYER...SO THINK THAT A FEW SEVERE TSTORMS WITH DAMAGING 
WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE TOMORROW AFTERNOON AND TOMORROW NIGHT. THIS 
SLOW-MOVING COLD FRONT SHOULD STILL BE LINGERING AROUND THE FORECAST 
AREA ON FRIDAY...SO WILL KEEP SMALL POPS IN THE FORECAST ON FRIDAY. 

AS FOR TEMPS...EXPECT SIMILAR TEMPS TOMORROW TO THOSE OBSERVED 
TODAY...ALTHOUGH SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION MAY INTERRUPT WARMING IN A 
FEW AREAS. MOISTURE LEVELS SHOULD BE A LITTLE HIGHER TOMORROW...BUT 
WILL NOT ISSUE A HEAT ADVISORY SINCE HEAT INDICES SHOULD BRIEFLY 
REACH 105 DEGREES ONLY AROUND THE CHATTANOOGA VICINITY. HOWEVER... 
WILL CONTINUE THE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT HIGHLIGHTING THE HOT 
CONDITIONS. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MAINTAINED A DRY FORECAST 
FOR SATURDAY AS MODEL SOLUTIONS INDICATE AMPLIFICATION OF 
NORTHEASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF ON FRIDAY. THIS WILL HELP TO PUSH COOL 
FRONT THROUGH THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY. ABILITY TO KEEP 
POPS FOR CONVECTION OUT OF THE FORECAST IS GONE THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY MAKES ITS WAY 
BACK THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY. SURFACE THROUGH UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE SLIPS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE FIRST THREE DAYS OF THE WORK 
WEEK ALLOWING FOR THE RETURN OF GULF AND ATLANTIC MOISTURE. SEVERAL 
WEAK IMPULSES AS WELL AS LATER SUMMER INSOLATION WILL PROVIDE 
SUFFICIENT LIFT TO KEEP THE CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT 
GOING THROUGH THIS PERIOD. STAYED RATHER CLOSE TO SUGGESTED GUIDANCE 
TEMPS IN THE LONG TERM. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN    72 100  73  98  71 /   0  20  30  20  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN      68  98  70  95  68 /   0  20  30  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN              68  98  70  95  68 /   0  20  30  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN     63  95  65  91  62 /   0  30  30  20  10

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID 
WEST...WITH A DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AN UPPER-LEVEL 
HIGH CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS IS PROGGED TO SHIFT TOWARDS

WARMER THAN YESTERDAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A VERY DRY AIR MASS 
THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE LOCAL ATMOSPHERE...SO DONT EXPECT ANY 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 150724
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT WED AUG 15 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE EXPECTED TO SWELL 
BACK OVER AREA TODAY AND EXPECTING TEMPERATURES TO RESPOND A COUPLE 
OF DEGREES HIGHER.  ALSO...RELATIVELY DRY LOWER AIRMASS WITH DEW 
POINTS IN THE 50S YESTERDAY AFTERNOON STILL BE OVER AREA FOR TODAY.  
AFTER DEEP MIXING STARTS...THINK MOST DEW POINTS WILL LOWER AGAIN.

FORECASTING RECORD HIGH TEMP FOR KCHA TODAY...BUT SHOULD NOT 
NEED A HEAT ADVISORY DUE TO COOLER MORNING TEMPS AND LOWER 
HUMIDITIES KEEPING HEAT INDEX VALUES NEAR THE ACTUAL AIR TEMP.

LOW LEVEL MOISTURE STARTS TO FLOW BACK INTO THE AREA TONIGHT AND 
THURSDAY.  WILL INTRODUCE SOME POPS INTO NORTHERN SECTIONS FOR 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON AS CAP SHOULD BE WEAKENING AS GREAT LAKES UPPER 
TROUGH BUILDS SOUTHWARD.  LOOKS LIKE TEMPS WILL BE 1-2 DEGREES 
COOLER THURSDAY...BUT HEAT INDEX READINGS WILL BE 1-2 DEGREES HOTTER 
DUE TO ADDITION OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...INITIAL FEATURE FOR 
THESE PERIODS THAT MAY AID DEVELOPMENT OF CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION 
(PCPN) IS THE WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHING FROM THE NW THURSDAY NIGHT 
INTO FRIDAY. KEPT POPS IN THE SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY FOR NOW GIVEN 
LATE NIGHT AND EARLY DAYTIME TIMING...NOT DURING PEAK HEATING. THIS 
FEATURE IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH BY EARLY FRIDAY EVENING...SO 
OPTED TO REMOVE POPS FOR ALL BUT SE TN/SW NC FOR FRIDAY NIGHT.

OTHERWISE...UPPER RIDGE REMAINS RATHER STRONG AND GENERALLY IN 
CONTROL FROM PLAINS STATES ACROSS THE SRN STATES FOR THE 
PERIOD...WITH A FEW PERIODS OF CONVECTION POSSIBLE AS SHORTWAVE 
ENERGY PASSES THROUGH THE MIDWEST STATES AND OHIO VALLEY. ALSO...
WEAK LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW INTO THE REGION BY MONDAY INTO TUESDAY 
SHOULD BRING AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE...BUT THE TROPICAL MOISTURE 
LOOKS TO REMAIN TO OUR WEST. TWEAKED A FEW AREAS UP TO LOWER END OF 
CHANCE POPS...BUT FOR THE MOST PART KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING.

MIN AND MAX TEMPS ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY EACH DAY IN LINE WITH THE LATEST 
GFS/GFSX MOS GUIDANCE...AND TO REMAIN IN TOLERANCE WITH NEIGHBORING 
GRIDS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  98  71  95  72  91 /  10   0  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN  98  70  97  71  92 /  10  10  10  10  20

929 PM EDT TUE AUG 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...
SOME BROKEN MID LEVEL CLOUDS FROM DISSIPATED CONVECTION ARE MOVING
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS EVENING. THESE CLOUDS
WILL BE OUT OF THE AREA WITHIN THE NEXT FEW HOURS...LEAVING MOSTLY
CLEAR SKIES...AND TEMPS SHOULD DROP INTO THE 60S WITH 50S NORTH AND
IN THE MOUNTAINS. CURRENT FORECAST IS ON TRACK AND NO UPDATE WILL
BE NEEDED.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 141900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT TUE AUG 14 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE AREA 
BRINGING WARM AND DRY WEATHER FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  WITH THE 
WEAK INSTABILITY AND LIMITED MOISTURE...PROBABLY NOT SEE ANY 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY THIS EVENING.  A DYING MCS MAY TRACK SOME 
DEBRIS CLOUDS INTO THE AREA EARLY THIS EVENING...BUT SHOULD NOT 
AFFECT TEMPERATURES.  A SHORTWAVE ROTATES ACROSS THE RIDGE LATE ON 
WEDNESDAY.  BEST DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH OF THE CWA...SO 
KEPT WEDNESDAY DRY.  WITH THE QUESTIONABLE PERFORMANCE OF THE GFS 
MOS...TENDED MORE TOWARD THE WRF AND NGM FOR TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER
THE AREA WED NIGHT INTO THURSDAY WILL GRADUALLY GIVE WAY TO DIGGING
GREAT LAKES TROUGH...WITH NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. COLD FRONT EXPECTED
TO PUSH INTO THE AREA LATE THU NIGHT OR FRIDAY. WILL KEEP THINGS
DRY UNTIL THU NIGHT...WHEN WILL BRING SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INTO
NORTH. FORCING AND MOISTURE NOT IMPRESSIVE...SO STILL JUST SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY. DRIER AIR EXPECTED FOR SATURDAY...THEN
MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE FOR
SUNDAY AND THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEK. GIVEN THE DROUGHT WE ARE
IN...WILL NOT GO HIGHER THAN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY THROUGH
TUESDAY. MOST SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO GFS MOS TEMPS WILL BE TO GO
HIGHER FOR KTRI WED NIGHT...AND TO LOWER SOME MAX TEMPS FOR KRHP.
OTHERWISE...MAINLY JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 141410
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EDT TUE AUG 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING.  HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE REGION SHOULD BRING A WARM AND DRY DAY TODAY.  THE FORECAST 
APPEARS ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE PROGS PROBABLY PUSH 
WEAK COLD FRONT MUCH TOO FAR SOUTH THIS MORNING...GIVEN BEST AND 
MOST CONSISTENT FALLING DEW POINT TEMPS ACROSS KY...EXTREME SWRN VA 
AND W VA. HOWEVER...BY THIS AFTERNOON EXPECT THE BOUNDARY TO HAVE 
DISSIPATED OR BE A NON-FACTOR. CANT RULE OUT A STRAY TSRA DURING 
PEAK HEATING...BUT MODELS DONT DEPICT MUCH IN THE WAY OF SURFACE 
BASED OR ELEVATED INSTABILITY TODAY INTO WEDNESDAY...SO OPTED TO 
KEEP OUR DRY FORECAST INTACT FOR THESE PERIODS. 

GENERALLY TRENDED TOWARD PERSISTENCE FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY AND ALLOWED 
FOR SLIGHTLY WARMER ON WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON GIVEN INCREASING HEIGHTS 
ALOFT AND WEAK LOW LEVEL WARMING. DEW POINT TEMPS AND MIN TEMPS MORE 
DIFFICULT GIVEN DIFFERING MODEL CHOICES (DRY/COOL GFS VERSUS LESS 
DRYING AND MILDER MINS FROM NAM-WRF). SINCE THE AMOUNT OF DRYING PER 
GFS SOLUTION SEEMS UNREALISTIC...AND ALSO POOR GFS MOS PERFORMANCE 
OF LATE ON MINS TEMPS (COOL BIAS)...OPTED FOR CLOSER TO NAM-WRF 
(WHICH WAS BETTER SUPPORTED BY NEIGHBORING OFFICES AND ALSO CREATED 
SMOOTHER GRIDS).  

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EDT TUE AUG 14 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE PROGS PROBABLY PUSH 
WEAK COLD FRONT MUCH TOO FAR SOUTH THIS MORNING...GIVEN BEST AND 
MOST CONSISTENT FALLING DEW POINT TEMPS ACROSS KY...EXTREME SWRN VA 
AND W VA. HOWEVER...BY THIS AFTERNOON EXPECT THE BOUNDARY TO HAVE 
DISSIPATED OR BE A NON-FACTOR. CANT RULE OUT A STRAY TSRA DURING 
PEAK HEATING...BUT MODELS DONT DEPICT MUCH IN THE WAY OF SURFACE 
BASED OR ELEVATED INSTABILITY TODAY INTO WEDNESDAY...SO OPTED TO 
KEEP OUR DRY FORECAST INTACT FOR THESE PERIODS. 

GENERALLY TRENDED TOWARD PERSISTENCE FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY AND ALLOWED 
FOR SLIGHTLY WARMER ON WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON GIVEN INCREASING HEIGHTS 
ALOFT AND WEAK LOW LEVEL WARMING. DEW POINT TEMPS AND MIN TEMPS MORE 
DIFFICULT GIVEN DIFFERING MODEL CHOICES (DRY/COOL GFS VERSUSES LESS 
DRYING AND MILDER MINS FROM NAM-WRF). SINCE THE AMOUNT OF DRYING PER 
GFS SOLUTION SEEMS UNREALISTIC...AND ALSO POOR GFS MOS PERFORMANCE 
OF LATE ON MINS TEMPS (COOL BIAS)...OPTED FOR CLOSER TO NAM-WRF 
(WHICH WAS BETTER SUPPORTED BY NEIGHBORING OFFICES AND ALSO CREATED 
SMOOTHER GRIDS).  


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...PERIOD STARTS OUT WITH 
DOMINANT RIDGE SWELLING BACK OVER THE AREA...BUT BY FRIDAY GREAT 
LAKES TROUGH DIGS INTO RIDGE INDUCING A NWLY FLOW OVER THE AREA.  
ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO AREA THURSDAY 
NIGHT OR FRIDAY...GFS WAS THE SLOWEST OF THE MODELS SO THINKING THAT 
POPS ASSOICATED WITH FRONAL PASSAGE SHOULD BE INTRODUCED A LITTLE 
EARILER.  ALL MODELS PUSH FRONT WELL SOUTH OF AREA AND ALLOW DRIER 
AIR TO COME INTO CWA FOR THE WEEKEND.  DEWPOINTS AND POPS EXPECTED 
TO RETURN AGAIN MONDAY.

MODELS HAVE BEEN HAVING A COOL BIAS WITH THE HEAT WAVE EXCEPT AT 
KRHP WHERE A STRONG WARM BIAS HAS BEEN SEEN ON MIN TEMPS.  MADE 
TWEAKS TO TEMPS ACCORDINGLY...BUT ONLY SUBTLE CHANGES SINCE PATTERN 
IS CHANGING.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 131908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT MON AUG 13 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A WEAK FRONT WILL DROP SLOWLY 
SOUTH INTO THE REGION THIS EVENING...WITH A FEW SHOWERS DEVELOPING 
WITH IT.  WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WILL KEEP THE POPS 
OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT.  WILL HANDLE ANY STRAY PRECIP THAT 
MAKES IN INTO THE CWA WITH A NOWCAST.  HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE OLD MCS SHOULD WORK ITS WAY OUT THE AREA.  STAYED NEAR THE 
NGM/MET/MAV BLEND TEMPERATURES FOR OVERNIGHT LOWS.  FOR TUESDAY... 
WITH RIDGE DOMINATING THE AREA...SHOULD SEE ANOTHER HOT AND DRY DAY.  
STAYED NEAR THE BLEND TEMPERATURES FOR HIGHS ON TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE SHOULD 
DOMINATE OUR WEATHER INTO THURSDAY...WITH MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS AND 
VERY HOT AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES. AT LEAST AFTERNOON HUMIDITY LEVELS 
SHOULD NOT BE ESPECIALLY HIGH...KEEPING HEAT INDEX VALUES NEAR ACTUAL 
TEMPERATURES.  A WEAK COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO PUSH IN ON FRIDAY.  
MOISTURE AND LIFT DO NOT LOOK UNIMPRESSIVE WITH THE FRONT...SO JUST 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT FOR NOW WITH THIS 
FEATURE.  WILL GO DRY SATURDAY...THEN MODELS INDICATE BETTER CHANCE 
FOR PRECIP SUNDAY AND ESPECIALLY MONDAY.  WITH THE UNCERTAINTY IN 
THE LATER PERIODS...WILL JUST GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS BOTH SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY FOR NOW.  WILL ADJUST MAV TEMPS UP A BIT FOR TUE 
NIGHT...OTHERWISE WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS. 


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 131400
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT MON AUG 13 2007

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING.  HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE REGION SHOULD BRING ANOTHER WARM AND DRY DAY TODAY.  FORECAST ON 
TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGING STILL DOMINANT OVER MOST 
OF THE U.S. THIS MORNING...BUT UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES WEAK NW TO N 
TODAY INTO TUESDAY ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS. WEAK 
COLD FRONT TO THE NORTH WILL DROP SLOWLY SOUTH INTO THE REGION BY 
THIS EVENING...BUT LITTLE THREAT OF ANY CONVECTION DEVELOPING DUE TO 
LIMITED MOISTURE AND WARM TEMPS ALOFT. MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX 
DROPPING SE INTO THE MID MISS VALLEY IS WEAKENING BUT MIGHT SEND A 
FEW THINNING HIGH CLOUDS OUR WAY. ALSO...WITH WEAK FRONT APPROACHING 
THIS AFTERNOON THERE MAY BE A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MOISTURE AROUND 850 
MB LEVEL TO SUPPORT FEW TO SCATTERED CUMULUS CLOUDS.

HOWEVER...IN SPITE OF THESE SUBTLE CHANGES...STILL LOOK FOR MAX 
TEMPS JUST A DEGREE OR SO BELOW PERSISTENCE FROM PAST FEW DAYS.
THE AIRMASS LOOKS TO BE DRIER OVERNIGHT...BUT IT IS HARD TO GO WITH 
THE COOLEST MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT...GIVEN THE POOR MOS PERFORMANCE 
(COOL BIAS OF 3 TO 6 DEGREES) OF LATE. THUS...KEPT MIN TEMPS CLOSER 
TO A BLEND OF NAM-WRF AND GFS WHERE BIGGEST DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 AM EDT MON AUG 13 2007

.SHORT TERM....SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGING STILL
DOMINANT OVER MOST OF THE U.S. THIS MORNING...BUT UPPER LEVEL FLOW
BECOMES WEAK NW TO N TODAY INTO TUESDAY ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AND SRN
APPALACHIANS. WEAK COLD FRONT TO THE NORTH WILL DROP SLOWLY SOUTH
INTO THE REGION BY THIS EVENING...BUT LITTLE THREAT OF ANY
CONVECTION DEVELOPING DUE TO LIMITED MOISTURE AND WARM TEMPS ALOFT.
MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX DROPPING SE INTO THE MID MISS VALLEY
IS WEAKENING BUT MIGHT SEND A FEW THINNING HIGH CLOUDS OUR WAY.
ALSO...WITH WEAK FRONT APPROACHING THIS AFTERNOON THERE MAY BE A
SLIGHT INCREASE IN MOISTURE AROUND 850 MB LEVEL TO SUPPORT FEW TO
SCATTERED CUMULUS CLOUDS.

HOWEVER...IN SPITE OF THESE SUBTLE CHANGES...STILL LOOK FOR MAX 
TEMPS JUST A DEGREE OR SO BELOW PERSISTENCE FROM PAST FEW DAYS.
THE AIRMASS LOOKS TO BE DRIER OVERNIGHT...BUT IT IS HARD TO GO WITH 
THE COOLEST MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT...GIVEN THE POOR MOS PERFORMANCE 
(COOL BIAS OF 3 TO 6 DEGREES) OF LATE. THUS...KEPT MIN TEMPS CLOSER 
TO A BLEND OF NAM-WRF AND GFS WHERE BIGGEST DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER AIR PATTERN IS SHOWING 
A CHANGE AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGE RETROGRADES WEST AND FLOW BECOMES MORE 
NW OVER FORECAST AREA. SYSTEMS TO THE NW MAY MOVE CLOSER AND BRING 
CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY A SHOWER INTO NE TN AND SW VA ON WEDNESDAY. 
THURSDAY BOTH THE NAM/WRF AND GFS STRENGTHEN RIDGE AGAIN AS SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY MOVES FROM THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES 
HAVE TRIMMED POPS BACK TO JUST INCLUDE NE TN AND SW VA THURSDAY. 
FRIDAY A COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA AND LINGERING 
MOISTURE NEXT WEEKEND WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS. 
FOLLOWED A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR HIGHS AND LOWS TUESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES ON THE WEEKEND BEHIND THE 
COLD FRONT.  
&&

UPPER LEVEL FLOW INCREASES AND VEERS TOWARD THE N. A SURFACE 
FRONT MOVES SOUTH THROUGH THE AREA TOMORROW LEADING SUBTLE AIRMASS 
CHANGE AS SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM THE NORTH. AIRMASS REMAINS IN 
PLACE WITH WEAK PRESSURE GRADIENT THROUGH TUESDAY. WILL CONTINUE 
WITH A DRY FORECAST THOU AN ISOLATED SHOWER IS POSSIBLE WITH FRONT 
ON MONDAY. ABOVE NORMAL TEMP TREND REMAINS THE SAME. GFS CONTINUES A
BIT DRY IN THE LOW LEVELS AND TOO COOL WITH FCST MINS. WILL LEAN 
TOWARDS THE WRF ON MINS BUT SWING BACK TO WARMER GFS FOR MAXS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER RIDGE DOMINATING THE 
AREA BRINGING WARM AND DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY.  GFS INDICATING A 
WEAK FRONT APPROACHING ON LATE THURSDAY AND LINGERING ACROSS THE 
REGION ALONG WITH SEVERAL SHORTWAVES INTO SUNDAY.  WITH STILL SOME 
UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING AND THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE AVAILABLE WITH THE 
RIDGE IN PLACE...WILL KEEP ONLY 20 POPS FOR THURSDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY.  STAYED NEAR GFSX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 121527
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1130 AM EDT SUN AUG 12 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. WILL KEEP 
E TN MNTS AND NC ZONES DRY. LAVRHP SHOWING LOWER POP #S IN LATEST 
RUN. W EDGE OF DEVELOPMENT SHOULD STAY JUST OUTSIDE MRX CWA. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SMALL CLUSTER OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS OCCURRING OVER NW SC AND WRN NC...DUE TO LOW LEVEL 
EASTERLY UPSLOPE FLOW AND IN AN AXIS OF INSTABILITY. THIS CONVECTION 
HAS SHOWN LITTLE WESTWARD MOVEMENT OVERNIGHT...AND THUS DID NOT ADD 
ANY POPS FOR OUR EASTERN MOST AREAS THIS MORNING. DID KEEP A BIT 
MORE CLOUD COVER...ESPECIALLY THIS MORNING NEAR THE CONVECTION. 

OTHERWISE...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATING AGAIN TODAY. DEW
POINT TEMPS LOWER...SO EVEN WITH PERSISTENCE MAX TEMPS THE HEAT
INDICES SHOULD REMAIN NO HIGHER THAN THE 90S THIS AFTERNOON.
STAYED NEAR PERSISTENCE AND GFS MOS FOR HIGHS TODAY...THEN
PREFERRED A BLEND OF NAM-WRF AND GFS MOS FOR MINS TONIGHT...GIVEN
COOL BIAS FROM GFS MOS FOR MINS LATELY.


LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE TO FORECAST 
AS UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES THE HOT DRY WEATHER. LOWER DEW POINTS WILL 
KEEP HEAT INDEX VALUES BELOW ADVISORY LEVELS. A WEAK FRONT PASSING 
THROUGH MONDAY WILL HAVE NO AFFECT. LATER IN THE WEEK ANOTHER FRONT 
WILL APPROACH FROM THE OHIO VALLEY AS THE RIDGE RETREATS TO THE 
SOUTH AND WEAKENS. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL INCREASE AND ALSO BRING A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE REGION FROM 
THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             97  70  98  70  97 /  10  10  10  10  10

OAK RIDGE, TN                       95  67  96  67  95 /  10  10  10  10  10

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 111527
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1125 AM EDT SAT AUG 11 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SLIGHTLY LOWER DEW POINT TEMPS 
NOTED THIS MORNING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...ALTHO TEMPS GENERALLY 
REMAIN VERY MILD TO WARM (CONTINUING THE TREND NOTED WITH GFS MOS 
MIN TEMPS A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES TOO COOL EACH NIGHT). LOOKED 
BACKED ON DEW POINT TEMP TREND FROM YESTERDAY...VIEWED NEW MOS AND 
MADE SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.

CERTAINLY ONLY FEATURE OF CONCERN IS MAX TEMPS AND ASSOCIATED HEAT 
INDICES. PERSISTENCE ON MAX TEMPS WAS CLOSER FOR FRIDAY MAX TEMPS
...AND OPTED FOR AGAIN TODAY. THESE MAX TEMPS AND ADJUSTED DEW POINT 
TEMPS PRODUCE HEAT INDICES BELOW ADVISORY VALUES...BUT MIGHT BE 
WORTHY OF ANOTHER SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT (SPSMRX). 

CONSIDERING GFS TRACK RECORD ON MINS (TOO COOL)...CHOSE TO USE A 
BLEND OF NAM-WRF AND GFS MOS FOR TONIGHTS LOWS. GENERALLY LESS THAN 
10 PERCENT POPS CARRIED OVER FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST...GIVEN THE 
STRENGTH OF THE UPPER RIDGE AND LIMITED MOISTURE FOR CONVECTION.


LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...VERY STRONG UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
CONTINUES OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES BUT EXTENDING THROUGH ALL 
THE SOUTHEAST. THE UPPER FLOW WILL BE FROM THE NORTHWEST WITH THE 
FORECAST AREA ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE RIDGE. WILL BE USING 
PERSISTENCE FOR THE FORECAST WITH TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL. HEAT INDEX VALUES WILL REACH NEAR 105 IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY 
AGAIN MONDAY. A WEAK FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH MONDAY BUT WITH 
STRENGTH OF RIDGE AM REMOVING CHANCE OF RAIN. HEAT INDEX VALUES WILL 
STILL REACH 100 TO 105 IN THE SOUTH THROUGH THURSDAY. ANOTHER 
STRONGER FRONT WILL APPROACH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AND SHOULD HELP 
INCREASE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FOR MORE CLOUDS AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             99  70  97  72  99 /  10  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  96  69  95  68  96 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       97  67  96  68  97 /   0   0  10  10  10

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EDT FRI AUG 10 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. WIND SHIFT
OF A SURFACE FRONT REMAINS NW OF AREA BUT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH 
THIS AFTERNOON. ISOLATED CONVECTION STILL POSSIBLE SO WILL LEAVE
IT IN FORECAST. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH WITH JUST SPOTTY CONVECTION CURRENTLY LOCATED 
ACROSS NE KY AND CENTRAL W VA. THIS FEATURE LOOKS TO JUST MINIMALLY 
AFFECT OUR WEATHER TODAY...DROPPING MAX TEMPS BY 1 TO 3 DEGREES AND 
MAINLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS.

SLIGHTLY LOWERED POPS AND SKY COVER IN THE FORECAST GRIDS...AND
TWEAKED MAX TEMPS UP CLOSER TO PERSISTENCE BUT KEPT A DEGREE OR TWO
BELOW LATEST GFS MOS. HEAT INDEX NEARS 105 DEGREES IN SRN VALLEY
THIS AFTERNOON BUT JUST IN A SPOT OR TWO FOR ONE HOUR...SO WILL
JUST ISSUE ANOTHER SPS TO MENTION PRECAUTIONS FOR CONTINUED HOT
WEATHER. 

CLEARING TONIGHT AND WENT JUST ABOVE COOLER MOS MINS...OPTING
CLOSER TO PERSISTENCE GIVEN WEAKNESS OF FRONT.


LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE UPPER LEVEL PATTERN 
CHANGES ONLY SLIGHTLY SATURDAY BEHIND COLD FRONT AS SLIGHTLY DRIER 
AND COOLER AIR AND RETROGRATION TO THE WEST OF THE RIDGE WILL ALLOW 
THE HIGHS TO BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER. RAISED CURRENT HIGHS SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY THOUGH AS RIDGE INFLUENCE STILL STRONG. WEAK SHORTWAVE 
MAY PRODUCE A FEW SHOWERS MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...BUT MOST OF THE AREA WILL BE DRY THROUGH MID WEEK. 
ANOTHER FRONT THURSDAY LOOKS TO BRING MORE OF A COOL DOWN. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

HAVE ALLOWED THE HEAT ADVISORY TO EXPIRE. WITH WIND SHIFT EXPECTING

TO MOVE THROUGH LATE TONIGHT. MODELS SHOW WEAK ELEVATED
INSTABILITY...BUT WIND FIELD LOOKS LIKE THERE WOULD BE ALMOST NO

TEMPS...THE CONVECTION MAY WELL FIZZLE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EDT THU AUG 9 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...SHORT WAVE TROUGH
MOVES SE THROUGH N PART OF MRX CWA LATE TONIGHT. A SURFACE FRONTAL
BOUNDARY WILL SWING ACROSS THE AREA EARLY ON FRIDAY WITH LITTLE 
CHANGE IN AIRMASS BEHIND NW WIND SHIFT. ISOLATED TSTMS WILL 
ACCOMPANY THESE FEATURES WITH BEST CHANCE IN THE MORNING HOURS. 
WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BEHIND THE FRONT FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. TEMPS FRI AND SAT WILL BE A FEW DEGREES 
COOLER THEN RESENT READINGS BUT REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL. A HEAT ADVISORY
IS NOT ANTICIPATED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE DOMINATING THE 
AREA BRINGING WARM AND DRY WEATHER THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD.  
MODELS BRING A WEAK SHORTWAVE THROUGH THE REGION ON MONDAY AND 
MONDAY NIGHT...BUT MOISTURE AND LIFT IS LIMITED....SO WILL KEEP ONLY 
20 POPS FOR SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE 
IS AVAILABLE...BUT MOST FOR THE AREA SHOULD BE DRY.  DRY WEATHER 
RETURNS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  GFS INDICATING A WEAK FRONT 
APPROACHING ON THURSDAY.  WITH SOME LIMITED MOISTURE AND WEAK 
INSTABILITY AVAILABLE...WILL ADD 20 POPS FOR THE ENTIRE CWA.  STAYED 
NEAR GFS/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 091450
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EDT THU AUG 9 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE REMAINS ENTRENCHED OVER 
THE REGION AND WILL SEE LITTLE CHANGE IN THE WEATHER PATTERN.  
THEREFORE...CONTINUE HOT...HUMID CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON WITH HEAT 
INDICES REACHING AROUND 105 DECREES AGAIN OVER PORTIONS OF THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY.  A HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT TODAY IN THIS 
AREA.  THE CENTRAL VALLEY IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN JUST BELOW ADVISORY 
CRITERIA...SO FOR NOW...WILL NOT EXPAND THE CURRENT ADVISORY BUT 
WILL MONITOR TEMP AND DEW POINT THIS AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...WILL 
REISSUE SPS FOR THE EXPECTED HIGH HEAT INDEX ACROSS THE ENTIRE MRX 
CWA.  CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL REMAINS UNCHANGED WITH GENERALLY A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF AN OROGRAPHICALLY INDUCED STORM.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HUGE RIDGE EXTENDS FROM 
EASTERN ATLANTIC TO EASTERN PACIFIC. THIS WILL DOMINTE THE WEATHER 
FOR THE PERIOD. MAJOR QUESTION FOR THE FIRST PART OF THIS PERIOD IS 
WHEN THE FRONT WILL DROP THROUGH THE AREA AND WHAT EFFECT IT WILL 
HAVE. MODELS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY CONSISTANT WITH FRONT CROSSING AREA 
EARLIER ON FRIDAY THAN LATER. THIS WILL TEND TO KEEP TEMPS DOWN A 
FEW DEGREES, AND WILL ALSO TEND TO SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR SOME 
CONVECTION IN FAVORED TERRAIN AND FURTHER NORTH. PW VALUES ARE VERY 
HIGH, CONVECTIVE TEMPS ARE IN THE UPPER 80S TO MID 90S, WITH 
FORECAST HIGHS WELL ABOVE THIS, AND LIS ARE WEAKLY TO MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE. ALL THINGS CONSIDERED, AM CONCERNED THAT EVEN WITH SLIGHT 
CHANCE AND LOW CHANCE POPS ON FRIDAY, ISOLATED NEAR-SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP IN THOSE ABOVE MENTIONED AREAS. WILL 
MENTION THIS IN THE HWO THIS MORNING. MAIN TSTM PROB WILL BE WINDS 
WITH INVERTED V SOUNDING IN THE LOW LAYERS. FREEZING LEVELS WILL BE 
AROUND 17K FEET AND THIS APPEARS TO BE TOO HIGH FOR LARGE HAIL, 
THOUGH BRIEF HEAVY RAIN COULD POSE A THREAT.

AFTER FRONT PASSES THROUGH AIRMASS STABILIZES AND THE REST OF THE 
PERIOD RETURNS TO HOT AND HUMID, THOUGH NOT AS HIGH OF HEAT INDEX 
VALUES AS WEVE HAD. HAD LEFT FORECAST MAXES ALONE, BUT DID BUMP UP 
FRIDAY NIGHT MINS A DEGREE OR TWO. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN 100  75  98  72  98 /  10  10  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    98  73  96  70  95 /  10  10  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            98  74  96  69  95 /  10  10  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   95  70  94  65  90 /  10  10  20  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY UNTIL 8 PM EDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BRADLEY...HAMILTON...MARION...MCMINN...
     MEIGS...RHEA...SEQUATCHIE.

VA...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 081921
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT WED AUG 8 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO CURRENT FORECAST.
PROJECTED THICKNESS VALUES RISE SLIGHTLY THROUGH SHORT TERM. INCHED UP
MIN AND MAX TEMPS ACCORDINGLY. HEAT ADVISORY MAY NEED TO BE EXPANDED
SOME THU BUT WILL LET LATTER SHIFTS IRON OUT NORTHERN EXTENT FOR THU.
ISOLATED MAINLY OROGRAPHIC TSTMS POSSIBLE AFTN/EVE ACROSS NORTH HALF 
OF MRX CWA.  
 
.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS 
AND ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT SPRAWLING UPPER RIDGE THAT HAS 
BEEN PARKED OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN QUADRANT OF THE COUNTRY WILL 
SLOWLY RETROGRADE WEST ALLOWING HEIGHTS TO FALL SLIGHTLY AND FLOW 
ALOFT TO BECOME MORE NORTHWESTERLY OVER OUR GENERAL AREA. WEAK COLD 
FRONT PROJECTED TO BE PUSHED SOUTH BY THE NORTHWEST FLOW REGIME INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON FRIDAY. ANTICIPATE ANY CONVECTION 
ASSOCIATED WITH WITH FRONT TO BE SCATTERED IN NATURE AT BEST. 
ANOTHER WEAK FRONT WILL APPROACH IN THE TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME 
BUT AGAIN COVERAGE OF ANY PRECIP IS EXPECTED TO BE RATHER SPARSE. 
OPTED TO GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WITH THIS EVENT. FOR BOTH TEMPS 
AND POPS...TENDED TO FAVOR A BLEND OF GFS GUIDANCE AND ENSEMBLE MEAN 
GUIDANCE. APPEARS TEMPS WILL EXPERIENCE A SLIGHT COOLING TREND IN 
RESPONSE TO THE MARGINAL HEIGHT FALLS...BUT GENERALLY REMAIN ABOVE 
CLIMO THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             76 100  74  98  70 /  10  10  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  75  98  74  96  68 /  10  10  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       75  97  72  96  67 /  10  10  10  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              69  94  63  94  63 /  10  20  10  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

SON/LCM








000 
FXUS64 KMRX 081436
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EDT WED AUG 8 2007

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO AFTN FCST. DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED JUST SW OF MRX CWA AND FARTHER E THEN TUE. FREEZING LEVELS
ABOVE 18000 ACROSS MUCH OF THE SOUTH. BUMPED TEMPS UP A DEGREE OR 
TWO ACROSS VALLEY LOCATIONS. THESE MAX TEMPS REMAIN JUST A FEW 
DEGREES BELOW RECORD VALUES. HEAT ADVSRY AREA WILL REMAIN UNCHANGED 
BUT CRITERIA WILL BE THREATENED OUTSIDE ADVSRY AREA. WILL ADD ISOLD 
TSTMS ACROSS N 1/3 OF AREA TO ACCOUNT FOR WEAK TROUGH IN THE 
THICKNESS HEIGHTS AND HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN CONCERN CONTINUES TO BE HOT 
TEMPERATURES AND CORRESPONDING HIGH HEAT INDICES.  EXPECT AFTERNOON 
HIGHS TO REACH INTO THE 90S ACROSS MUCH OF THE MRX CWA...WITH HIGH 
90S TO NEAR 100 POSSIBLE IN THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY.  DEW POINTS HAVE 
BEEN DROPPING INTO THE UPPER 60S IN THIS AREA DURING THE LATE 
AFTERNOON WHICH HAS HELPED KEEP THE HEAT INDEX BELOW ADVISORY 
CRITERIA.  HOWEVER...WITH THE STRENGTHENING HIGH AND TEMPS AND DEW 
POINTS SLOWLY INCREASING EACH DAY...MAY SEE A FEW AREAS REACH A HEAT 
INDEX OF 105 IN OUR SOUTHWESTERN COUNTIES AND WILL THEREFORE 
CONTINUE WITH THE HEAT ADVISORY FOR THIS LOCATIONS.  FOR THE REST OF 
THE AREA...AN SPS IS IN EFFECT WITH MANY PLACES EXPECTED TO SEE HEAT 
INDICES BETWEEN 100 AND 105.  AS FAR AS CONVECTION...AT BEST COULD 
SEE A STRAY STORM OVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...NOT MUCH TO CHANGE FROM 
PREVIOUS FORECAST. DOG DAY RIDGE FROM ROUGHLY THE AZORES TO HAWAII. 
EXTREME HEAT, BUT NOT RECORD HEAT, WILL BE THE MAIN FORECAST 
CHALLENGE. ON FRIDAY, A FRONT MOVES THROUGH, WHICH, DEPENDING ON 
ITS TIMING, WILL EITHER KEEP AFTERNOON HIGHS DOWN A FEW DEGREES FROM 
THURSDAY, OR WILL ALLOW TEMP CONVERGENCE IN PRE-FROPA ENVIRONMENT 
FOR EVEN HIGHER HIGHS. AM BANKING ON FRONT MOVING THROUGH EARLIER IN 
THE DAY AND SO HIGHS WILL DROP A LITTLE FROM THURSDAYS. THIS WILL 
(HOPEFULLY) ELIMINATE THE NEED FOR A HEAT ADVISORY ON FRIDAY. IF, IN 
FACT, THE FRONT ARRIVES LATER IN THE DAY, IT WILL CERTAINLY RAISE 
THE SPECTER OF TEMPERATURE CONVERGENCE IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT AND 
HIGHS WILL BE RIGHT UP THERE AGAIN AND WE WILL HAVE TO ENTERTAIN THE 
IDEA OF A FURTHER HEAT ADVISORY. KEEPING AN OPEN MIND.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  100  75 100  78  95 /  10  10  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    97  74  98  76  92 /  10  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN            98  74  97  75  91 /  10  10  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   94  71  94  71  88 /  20  10  20  10  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HEAT ADVISORY FROM 1 PM EDT /NOON CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM 
     EDT /7 PM CDT/ THURSDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BRADLEY...
     HAMILTON...MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...RHEA...SEQUATCHIE.

VA...NONE.
&&

ISSUED A HEAT ADVISORY EFFECTIVE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. THE MIDNIGHT
SHIFT WILL HAVE TO LOOK AT THE NEW GUIDANCE TO SEE IF THE ADVISORY
WILL STILL BE REACHED. THE DEW POINTS TODAY DROPPED INTO THE UPPER
60S BY MID AFTERNOON WHICH DROPPED THE HEAT INDECIES A FEW DEGREES.
IF THAT HAPPENS THE 105 HEAT INDEX VALUES MAY NOT OCCUR. 

.LONG TERM...(TOMORROW NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH THE PERIOD.  A WEAK CHANGE 
IN AIR MASS APPEARS TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA LATE FRIDAY WITH A 
LITTLE COOLER TEMPERATURES AND SLIGHTLY DRIER...HOWEVER NOT A HUGE 
CHANGE.  STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE NUMBERS AS THEY APPEARED 
REASONABLE.  

ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY THURSDAY WITH A LITTLE 
MORE COVERAGE FRIDAY...THEN BACKING DOWN AGAIN 
SATURDAY...SUNDAY...AND MONDAY.  KEPT TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 AM EDT TUE AUG 7 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE 
AREA IN THE SHORT TERM...GIVING US A HAZY...HOT AND HUMID DAY 
TODAY.  WARM TEMPERATURES ALOFT COMBINED WITH LIMITED MOISTURE DEPTH 
AND LACK OF SIGNIFICANT TRIGGERS SHOULD KEEP CONVECTION LIMITED...SO 
WILL ONLY CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN HIGHER TERRAIN AND NORTH FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING.  EXPECT HEAT INDEX VALUES TO REACH 
TO NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE 100 THIS AFTERNOON IN MANY LOCATIONS...BUT 
LOOKS LIKE WE WILL BE LOWER THAN ADVISORY CRITERIA. WILL CONTINUE 
SPS FOR NOW.  WILL GENERALLY TRIM MAV TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO FOR 
TODAY AS IT HAS BEEN RUNNING SLIGHTLY HIGH LATELY FOR MAX TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WILL SLOWLY SHIFT A BIT WESTWARD 
DURING THE WEEKEND...BUT WILL REMAIN THE DOMINATE WEATHER FEATURE 
ACROSS THE REGION.  LIMITED NORMAL SUMMERTIME CONVECTION PATTERN 
EXPECTED THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD.  THE BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION 
TO REACH INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL BE FRIDAY WHEN A VERY WEAK 
BOUNDARY MOVES THROUGH.  HOWEVER...THE MAIN WEATHER CONCERN FOR THE 
PERIOD CONTINUES TO BE THE HEAT.  WILL SEE CONTINUED HOT 
TEMPERATURE...WITH DEW POINTS IN THE UPPER 60S AND 70S FOR MUCH OF 
THE EXTENDED.  RESULTING HEAT INDEX IS EXPECTED TO REACH ABOVE THE 
CENTURY MARK ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON 
HOURS...AT LEAST THROUGH FRIDAY.  WILL CONTINUE WITH THE SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT TO HIGHLIGHT CONCERNS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EDT MON AUG 6 2007

.DISCUSSION...HIGH CLOUDINESS MOVING AROUND THE PERIMETER OF THE 
UPPER RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES AND LOWER MS 
VALLEY GAVE THE FORECAST AREA A MILD NIGHT WITH LOWS IN THE MID TO 
UPPER 70S ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. A FEW SHOWERS THIS 
MORNING FORMED IN THE EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS AND SW VA. BIGGEST 
QUESTION TODAY IS HOW HIGH WILL TEMPERATURES GO AND WHAT WILL HEAT 
INDEX VALUES BE. YESTERDAYS CLOUDS HELD TEMPERATURES DOWN ACROSS 
NORTH AND CENTRAL SECTIONS BUT NOT IN THE SOUTH. THINK THERE WILL BE 
LESS CLOUD COVER TODAY WITH THE HOTTEST TEMPERATURES CENTRAL AND 
SOUTH. ACROSS THE NORTH AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR. ADJUSTED HOURLY TEMPERATURES AND DEW 
POINTS UPWARD A COUPLE DEGREES TO MATCH CURRENT TRENDS. MAV GUIDANCE 
HAS DEW POINTS DROPPING INTO THE UPPER 60S MOST LOCATIONS BUT MET 
GUIDANCE KEEPS DEW POINTS IN THE LOWER 70S. I ADJUSTED HIGHS UP 
ABOUT A DEGREE CENTRAL AND SOUTH AND THINK HEAT INDEX VALUES WILL 
REACH OVER 100 THERE BUT IN THE 90 TO 100 RANGE IN AREAS FARTHER 
NORTH THIS AFTERNOON. UPDATE OUT SOON.

WILL BE THE NORM DURING MUCH OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST AS HIGH 
PRESSURE EXTENDS NORTH AND EAST INTO THE REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL WHILE THE CHANCE FOR A 
COOLING SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM WILL BE MINIMAL AND LIMITED TO THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN UNTIL FRIDAY/SATURDAY WHEN A COOL FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
SLIP STEADILY SOUTH INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. USED SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE FORECAST AREA 
FOR THIS POSSIBILITY AS UPPER TROF ESTABLISHES ITSELF AGAIN ACROSS 
THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. BY SUNDAY...MAINTAINED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA IN CASE FRONT DOESNT MAKE IT VERY FAR SOUTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA.

FXUS64 KMRX 051506 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1105 AM EDT SUN AUG 5 2007

.DISCUSSION...

LATE MORNING UPDATE TO INCREASE CLOUD COVER AND LOWER MAX 
TEMPERATURES FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA.

A SHORT-WAVE MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM THE OHIO VALLEY
INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS IS PRODUCING AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS OVER EAST KENTUCKY. SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WILL SEE INCREASE COVERAGE OF STORMS BY NOON AS
THE WAVE MOVES JUST NORTH OF THE AREA. HAVE INCREASED POPS FOR
THESE AREAS FOR THE REST OF THE DAY. ELSEWHERE...ISOLATED TO WIDELY
SCATTERED STORMS DUE TO THE MOIST AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS WITH
GREATEST COVERAGE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

HAVE ALSO INCREASED CLOUD COVER...ESPECIALLY NORTHEAST SECTIONS. 

&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME HIGH CLOUDS MOVING IN 
ESPECIALLY NORTH ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY.  THIS SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY WILL PASS BY TO OUR NORTH...BUT WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO 
WARRANT SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS NORTH.  INSTABILITY NOT 
IMPRESSIVE...BUT EXPECT MORE IN THE WAY OF CONVECTION TODAY THAN 
YESTERDAY.  WILL GO WITH LOW CHANCE POPS NORTH...SLIGHT CHANCE 
SOUTH.  WILL KEEP SOME LOW POPS INTO EARLY EVENING HOURS...THEN DRY 
LATER ON TONIGHT.  WILL MAKE A FEW TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS...BUT OVERALL 
THEY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW 
BUILDING HEIGHTS THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM. DID NOT CHANGE 
FORECAST THROUGH THIS PERIOD WHICH FEATURES SOMEWHAT OF AN EMPHASIS 
ON POSSIBLE CONVECTION ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE...ESPECIALLY MONDAY AS MODELS CONTINUE TO BRING WEAK 
DISTURBANCES ACROSS THIS REGION PRIOR TO UPPER RIDGE FULLY 
ESTABLISHING ITSELF. KEPT OROGRAPHIC POPS GOING ACROSS MAJOR TERRAIN 
FEATURES THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST WHICH FAVORS A SLIGHT 
DRIER REGIME FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF 
UPPER RIDGE. CONCERNING TEMPERATURES STAYED CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE 
BLEND EARLY IN THE PERIOD WHILE USING NUMBERS A LITTLE LOWER THAN 
SUGGESTED MID TO LATE WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
