HAVE ALSO INCREASED CLOUD COVER...ESPECIALLY NORTHEAST SECTIONS.
TEMPERATURE FORECAST LOOKS GOOD.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME HIGH CLOUDS MOVING IN 
ESPECIALLY NORTH ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY.  THIS SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY WILL PASS BY TO OUR NORTH...BUT WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO 
WARRANT SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS NORTH.  INSTABILITY NOT 
IMPRESSIVE...BUT EXPECT MORE IN THE WAY OF CONVECTION TODAY THAN 
YESTERDAY.  WILL GO WITH LOW CHANCE POPS NORTH...SLIGHT CHANCE 
SOUTH.  WILL KEEP SOME LOW POPS INTO EARLY EVENING HOURS...THEN DRY 
LATER ON TONIGHT.  WILL MAKE A FEW TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS...BUT OVERALL 
THEY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW 
BUILDING HEIGHTS THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM. DID NOT CHANGE 
FORECAST THROUGH THIS PERIOD WHICH FEATURES SOMEWHAT OF AN EMPHASIS 
ON POSSIBLE CONVECTION ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE...ESPECIALLY MONDAY AS MODELS CONTINUE TO BRING WEAK 
DISTURBANCES ACROSS THIS REGION PRIOR TO UPPER RIDGE FULLY 
ESTABLISHING ITSELF. KEPT OROGRAPHIC POPS GOING ACROSS MAJOR TERRAIN 
FEATURES THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST WHICH FAVORS A SLIGHT 
DRIER REGIME FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF 
UPPER RIDGE. CONCERNING TEMPERATURES STAYED CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE 
BLEND EARLY IN THE PERIOD WHILE USING NUMBERS A LITTLE LOWER THAN 
SUGGESTED MID TO LATE WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  96  73  96  74  95 /  20  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  93  72  94  73  94 /  20  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  93  71  94  72  96 /  20  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  88  65  91  67  92 /  30  20  20  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 050134
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
934 PM EDT SAT AUG 4 2007

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING ISOLATED SHOWERS TRACKING INTO MIDDLE 
KY AND TN AHEAD OF A SHORTWAVE.  SHOWERS UPSTREAM SHOULD CONTINUE TO 
DISSIPATE BEFORE THEY REACH OUR CWA. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR THE EVENING HOURS WITH DRY WEATHER 
EXPECTED AFTER MIDNIGHT.  DEBRIS CLOUDS WILL PROBABLY INVADE THE CWA 
LATE TONIGHT...BUT STILL EXPECTING A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY.  WILL ALSO 
LEAVE PATCHY DENSE FOG FOR TONIGHT.  TEMPERATURES ON TRACK...NO 
OTHER CHANGES NEEDED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...CONVECTION IS SLOW TO DEVELOP 
THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO WARMER MID-LEVEL TEMPERATURES. STILL EXPECT 
ISOLATED STORMS TO DEVELOP...MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. FOR 
TONIGHT...MUGGY CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKY AND 
CALM WINDS TO PRODUCE PATCHY FOG...SOME LOCALLY DENSE.

FOR SUNDAY...A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL RIDE EAST TO SOUTHEAST 
FROM THE OHIO VALLEY TO THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES WITH ASSOCIATED 
FRONT OVER SOUTH WV TO CENTRAL VA BY AFTERNOON. FRONT AND 
SHORT-WAVES WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR THE 
NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AND HIGH ELEVATIONS WITH SLIGHT 
POPS ELSEWHERE.

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...CONVECTION IS SLOW TO DEVELOP 
THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO WARMER MID-LEVEL TEMPERATURES. STILL EXPECT 
ISOLATED STORMS TO DEVELOP...MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. FOR 
TONIGHT...MUGGY CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKY AND 
CALM WINDS TO PRODUCE PATCHY FOG...SOME LOCALLY DENSE.

FOR SUNDAY...A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL RIDE EAST TO SOUTHEAST 
FROM THE OHIO VALLEY TO THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES WITH ASSOCIATED 
FRONT OVER SOUTH WV TO CENTRAL VA BY AFTERNOON. FRONT AND 
SHORT-WAVES WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR THE 
NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AND HIGH ELEVATIONS WITH SLIGHT 
POPS ELSEWHERE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY
AND SHORT WAVE ENERGY STILL NEAR VIRGINIA MOUNTAINS AND EXTREME
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MONDAY SO HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE POPS THERE
MONDAY. AFTER THAT UPPER LEVEL RIDGING STRENGTHENS ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA AT MIDWEEK AND ONLY ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS ARE
EXPECTED. THE GFS SHOWS THE RIDGE RETROGRADING TO THE WEST FOR THE
THURSDAY TO SATURDAY PERIOD WHICH MAY BRING THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE
NE AND EAST AS MOISTURE COMES AROUND THE UPPER RIDGE. FOR NOW WILL
KEEP LOW POPS SINCE ANY CHANGES WILL BE SLOW. INCREASING
THICKNESSES AS THE RIDGE MOVES OVERHEAD WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES
ABOVE NORMAL FOR BOTH HIGHS AND LOWS THROUGH THE EXTENDED.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 041408
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1007 AM EDT SAT AUG 4 2007

.DISCUSSION...FOG IS SLOWLY DISSIPATING GIVING WAY TO HAZY 
CONDITIONS. DESPITE THE HAZE...PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TODAY ALLOWING FOR 
TEMPERATURES TO WARM BETWEEN 90 AND 95 DEGREES ACROSS MOST OF THE 
VALLEY PRODUCING HEAT INDICES RANGING FROM 95 TO 100 DEGREES.

UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH 
RISING HEIGHTS AND THICKNESS. WARMER TEMPERATURES ALOFT WILL HELP 
LIMIT AREAL EXTENT OF CONVECTION TODAY...BUT SOUNDINGS SHOW PLENTY 
OF ENERGY FOR STORM DEVELOPMENT. FORECAST CAPES ARE AROUND 2000 J/KG.
DUE TO CONTINUED DRY AIR AT MID-LEVELS...DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WILL BE 
MAIN CONCERN...PER HWO.

PLAN ON LEAVING FORECAST INTACT.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NAM AND GFS FAIRLY CLOSE THROUGH 
THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH THE EXCEPTION OF NAM SHOWING A LITTLE MORE 
MOISTURE.  HAVE LEANED THAT WAY IN PRECIPITATION FORECAST AND HAVE 
INCREASED POPS FOR TODAY AND EARLY EVENING BASED ON PAST FEW DAYS 
COVERAGE.  TEMPERATURES ARE CLOSE AND BASICALLY WENT WITH A BLEND 
FOR GUIDANCE.  

ATMOSPHERE AGAIN VERY UNSTABLE WITH TYPICALLY ISOLATED SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...STAYED WITH SLIGHT AND LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AS MODELS TRY TO BRING THE TAIL END OF WEAK 
WAVE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIPPING A LITTLE CLOSER 
TO NORTHERN PORTION OF MRX FORECAST AREA IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
POSSIBLY GENERATING A COUPLE OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES IN OUR NEIGHBORHOOD. 
ON MONDAY NORTHWEST FLOW CONTINUES AROUND GRADUALLY STRENGTHENING 
RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. WHICH MODELS HINT MAY BRING ANOTHER 
WEAK VORT SOUTHEAST ACROSS THIS SAME PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA 
ALTHOUGH GRADUALLY TAPER PROBABILITY IN THIS AREA. FOR MUCH OF THE 
REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD REMOVED POPS ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
GREAT VALLEY AND SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AS MAJOR LEAGUE 
UPPER RIDGE PROGGED TO FIND A HOME OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN QUARTER OF 
THE NATION. STAYED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR OROGRAPHIC 
CONVECTION DURING THIS PERIOD. TRIED TO FOLLOW THERMONUCLEAR WARMING 
TREND SUGGESTED BY MEX MOS TO ACCOUNT FOR SUBSIDENCE UNDER UPPER 
RIDGE BUT AM A LITTLE CONCERNED THAT MAXES/MINS MAY BE A BIT ON THE 
HIGH SIDE SO UNDERCUT THE NUMBERS BY A DEGREE OR TWO.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  95  72  94  73  94 /  20  10  20  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  94  71  92  72  92 /  20  10  20  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN  94  70  92  73  92 /  20  10  20  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  90  63  91  66  89 /  20  10  30  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A LARGE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
ALOFT...CURRENTLY CENTERED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HIGH PLAINS WILL 
SLOWLY BUILD EAST INTO THE AREA.  END RESULT WILL BE SLOWLY INCREASING
THICKNESS AND HEIGHTS WITH HOT CONDITIONS ANTICIPATED OVER THE 
WEEKEND PRODUCING AFTERNOON HEAT INDICES BETWEEN 95 AND 105 DEGREES.

TYPICAL SUMMER-TIME MOISTURE WILL COMBINED WITH AFTERNOON HEATING TO 
PRODUCE ISOLATED-WIDELY SCATTERED CONVECTION...MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER
TERRAIN.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE
SINCE YESTERDAYS LONG RANGE FORECAST. UPPER LEVEL RIDGE CENTERED
OVER SOUTHERN PLAINS MOVES SLOWLY EAST TO THE LOWER MS VALLEY
MONDAY TO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHEAST TUESDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY WITH SOME RETROGRADING TO THE WEST POSSIBLE FRIDAY. A
WEAK FRONT IN THE OHIO VALLEY MOVING EAST WILL SEND AN IMPULSE
SOUTHEAST AROUND THE PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE WHICH SHOULD AFFECT THE
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY. BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL
BE ACROSS THE NORTHEAST HALF. AS THE RIDGE MOVES OVERHEAD MONDAY.
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MORE ISOLATED AND MAY ONLY OCCUR
OVER THE MOUNTAINS. WILL KEEP 20 PERCENT IN ALL AREAS FOR NOW BUT
LATER SHIFTS MAY WANT TO TAKE POPS OUT OF THE VALLEYS. HIGH
TEMPERATURES WILL STAY IN THE LOWER TO MID 90S WITH PERSISTENCE THE
BEST FORECAST.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 031418
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1018 AM EDT FRI AUG 3 2007

.DISCUSSION...EARLY MORNING FOG IS DISSIPATING GIVING WAY TO MOSTLY
SUNNY SKY. AREA SOUNDINGS SHOW AIRMASS WILL BE QUITE UNSTABLE THIS
AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH CAPES APPROACHING 3000 J/KG WITH LIS OF
-6 TO -7...SO PLENTY OF ENERGY FOR CONVECTION. MAIN FORCING WILL
REMAIN LOCAL TERRAIN. CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURE IS AROUND 90
DEGREES...SO THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL AROUND
2 PM...SIMILAR TO YDAS.

SOUNDINGS AND WATER VAPOR SHOWS MID-LEVEL DRY AIR WITH MDPI AROUND
1 OR GREATER...SO DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS WILL ONCE AGAIN BE A
CONCERN THIS AFTERNOON. WBZ ARE NEAR 12 KFT...WHICH IS HIGH...BUT
ENOUGH UPDRAFT ENERGY TO PRODUCE MARGINAL SEVERE HAIL WITH THE
STRONGEST STORMS. GIVEN CONTINUED HIGH PWS...LOCALLY TORRENTIAL
RAINFALL AND LOCALIZED FLOODING ARE ALSO A CONCERN. HAVE UPDATED
HWO TO REFLECT A RISK OF SEVERE WEATHER.

HAVE UPPED POPS TO 30-40 PERCENT FOR HIGHER TERRAIN AND 20 PERCENT
FOR THE VALLEY. TEMPERATURE FORECAST LOOKS GOOD.  HEAT INDICES WILL RANGE
FROM THE MID 90S TO NEAR 100 DEGREES.

HAVE A GOOD DAY...

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE...TYPICAL SUMMERTIME
FORECAST WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION MAINLY IN THE MOUNTAINS. STAYED
CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR MAX/MIN FORECAST.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DID NOT CHANGE VERY MUCH 
FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST DURING THIS PERIOD. NOT SURE IF 
ATMOSPHERE WILL BECOME SUPPRESSED ENOUGH TO REMOVE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS THROUGH THE LONG TERM SO KEPT THIS IDEA GOING. ALTHOUGH...GFS 
DOES TRY TO BRING CENTER OF UPPER RIDGE OVER THE REGION BY MID WEEK. 
MAINTAINED SLIGHTLY HIGHER 30 PERCENT POP ON SUNDAY AND ON THURSDAY 
AS MODELS SHOW POSSIBILITY OF THUNDERSTORM COMPLEXES DROPPING ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AROUND THE TOP OF UPPER 
RIDGE. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO EXTENDED TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGH THE 
PERIOD SHAVING A DEGREE OR TWO ESPECIALLY LATER IN THE PERIOD. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 030026
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
826 PM EDT THU AUG 2 2007

.DISCUSSION...WEATHER ALMOST SAME AS 24 HOURS AGO...STORMS
DEVELOPED IN HIGHER TERRAIN THEN DRIFTED SLOWLY SOUTHWEST.
OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES AND STRONG AFTERNOON INSTABILITY HELPED THE
STORMS SPREAD INTO THE VALLEY LOCATIONS. PULSE SEVERE STORMS DOWNED
SOME TREES WITH A COUPLE REPORTS OF 3/4 INCH OR LARGER HAIL. MOST
SEVERE DAMAGE WAS IN NRN BLOUNT COUNTY.

HOURLY TEMPS HAD DRIFTED WAY OFF THE MARK WHERE TORRENTIAL RAINS
HAD COOLED TEMPS...THUS AN UPDATE TO GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS.
UPDATED ZFPMRX ALSO...WITH A LATER UPDATE WHEN ALL STORMS DISSIPATE.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 021905

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT THU AUG 2 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)... VERY LITTLE CHANGE IS
EXPECTED IN THE WEATHER PATTERN OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS...SO A
PERSISTENCE FORECAST WILL BE FOLLOWED. THE USUAL AFTERNOON
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED IN THE MOUNTAINS...PLATEAU...AND
ELEVATED AREAS OF SW VA. THE MOVEMENT OF THE STORMS IS GENERALLY TO
THE EAST...SO SOME OF THE STORMS IN THE PLATEAU COULD MOVE INTO THE
VALLEY THIS EVENING. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE
VALLEY...WITH A CHANCE IN THE MTNS/PLATEAU/SW VA. ALL STORMS SHOULD
DISSIPATE BY MIDNIGHT. EXPECT PATCHY FOG AGAIN IN AREAS THAT
RECEIVE A SHOWER. TOMORROW LOOKS LIKE A CARBON COPY OF TODAY...WITH
HIGHS IN THE 90 TO 95 RANGE AND ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
IN THE AFTERNOON IN THE FAVORED AREAS. A MIDLEVEL RIDGE TO THE WEST
DOES BUILD INTO THE AREA SLIGHTLY TOMORROW...WHICH MAY SUPPRESS
CONVECTION A TAD MORE THAN TODAY.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN
PATTERN FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT WITH RIDGING OVER THE
SOUTH CENTRAL AND SOUTHEAST STATES. CONVECTION SHOULD STAY OVER THE
MOUNTAIN AREAS WITH LITTLE COVERAGE ELSEWHERE. WILL HAVE POPS AT
15 TO 20 PERCENT WHICH IS ABOVE GUIDANCE BUT FELT PERSISTENCE WAS
BETTER. RIDGE DOES STRENGTHEN A LITTLE SATURDAY BUT NAM/WRF STILL
SHOWS ACTIVITY DEVELOPING OVER THE MOUNTAINS. GFS SHOWS A WEAK
SHORT WAVE MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY SO KEPT SLIGHTLY
HIGHER CHANCE NORTH AND SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH. UPPER RIDGE STAYS
STRONG MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO
VALLEY THURSDAY SO HAVE 30 PERCENT CHANCE NORTH. FOLLOWING CLOSER
TO THE NAM/WRF GUIDANCE FOR LOWS AND HIGHS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT.
PERSISTENCE WOULD BE THE BEST WAY TO PUT IT FOR THE REMAINDER OF
THE FORECAST WITH HIGHS AND LOWS VERY CLOSE TO THE LAST FEW DAYS
HIGHS IN THE LOWER 90S AND LOWS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S FOR
VALLEY LOCATIONS.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1028 AM EDT THU AUG 2 2007

.DISCUSSION...
LOW LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE HAS SHIFTED FROM THE OHIO VALLEY TO
THE MI ATLANTIC AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS.
EXPECT THAT TODAY WILL BE SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY...WITH SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING OVER THE MOUNTAINS...PLATEAU..AND SW VA
THIS AFTERNOON. A FEW COULD BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE AS LOW LEVEL
LAPSE RATES ARE QUITE STEEP. YESTERDAY THE STEERING FLOW WAS EAST
TO WEST...WHICH PUSHED THE STORMS FROM THE MOUNTAINS INTO THE
VALLEY. DO NOT EXPECT THIS WILL HAPPEN TODAY AS THE FLOW IS WEAKER
AND MORE WESTERLY. THUS WILL KEEP THE VALLEY DRY. WILL ADD A
MENTION OF ISOLATED SHOWERS/TSTMS IN SW VA. HIGH TEMPS TODAY SHOULD
BE CLOSE TO YESTERDAYS HIGHS...IN THE 90 TO 95 RANGE IN THE
VALLEY.

AND EVENING.  MOST OF THE CWA SHOULD BE DRY TODAY.  WITH THE RECENT 
RAINFALL...WILL KEEP PATCHY FOG IN THE FORECAST FOR THE MORNING 
HOURS.  STAYED NEAR THE NGM/MET/MAV BLEND NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE 
AND ALOFT WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD. THIS DOG DAYS OF SUMMER PATTERN 
SHOULD RESULT IN WARM AND MUGGY CONDITIONS WITH ISOLATED CONVECTION 
EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING. LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED THROUGHOUT MOST 
OF THE ATMOSPHERE...WHICH SHOULD KEEP MOST OF THE ISOLATED 
CONVECTION OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HOWEVER...WILL MENTION SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS EVERYWHERE TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF ADDITIONAL 
DEVELOPMENT IN THE VALLEYS FROM TSTORM OUTFLOW. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN 
INDICATES THAT A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX WILL DEVELOP OVER THE 
UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY...AND TRACK TOWARDS THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS BY SUNDAY. THUS...WILL RAISE POPS A LITTLE ON SUNDAY 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND 
TOWARDS PERSISTENCE THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD...BUT WITH 
SLIGHTLY LOWER TEMPS ON SUNDAY DUE TO AN EXPECTED INCREASE IN CLOUD 
COVER.

LIGHT WINDS THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE ATMOSPHERE...THINK THAT ISOLATED 
CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS EACH DAY. 
THUS...WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR SOME DIURNAL ACTIVITY THROUGHOUT THE 
FORECAST PERIOD. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN INDICATES THAT MOISTURE WILL 
INCREASE OVER THE REGION ON SUNDAY...SO WILL EXPAND THE COVERAGE OF 
20 POPS A LITTLE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND 
TOWARDS PERSISTENCE THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD...SINCE THE AIR 
MASS IS NOT EXPECTED TO CHANGE MUCH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
813 PM EDT TUE JUL 31 2007

.DISCUSSION...DUE TO LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING...CONVECTION IS
WEAKENING AND EXPECT STORMS TO END BEFORE MIDNIGHT. CLOUDS WILL
ALSO THIN...BUT DUE EXPECT PATCHY DENSE FOG TO RE-DEVELOP BY
EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING...ESPECIALLY WHERE RAIN OCCURRED THIS EVENING.

OVERNIGHT LOWS LOOK GOOD.

HAVE A GOOD NIGHT.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED IN THE MOUTNAINS...SW 
VA...AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MOVEMENT OF THE STORMS WILL BE 
SLOWLY TOWARD THE SOUTHWEST. WITH LITTLE UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT...THE 
STORMS WILL REMAIN DISORGANIZED AND WILL DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET. 
DENSE FOG SHOULD BE CONFINED MAINLY TO THE AREAS THAT SEE A SHOWER. 
WILL MENTION SCATTERED TSTMS IN ELEVATED AREAS WITH ISOLATED IN THE 
VALLEY THIS EVENING. A LARGE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE TO OUR NORTH WILL 
SLOWLY DRIFT TO THE SOUTHEAST OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. AS THE HIGH 
DRIFTS CLOSER...MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW AN INCREASING MIDLEVEL 
INVERSION...WHICH SHOULD HELP TO FURTHER SUPPRESS CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT TOMORROW. WILL MENTION ONLY ISOLATED TSTMS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU. TEMPERATURES ARE ALSO EXPECTED TO BE WARMER 
TOMORROW AS 1000-850 THICKNESS INCREASES. GUIDANCE HAS SHOWN A 
SLIGHT COOL BIAS OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS...ESPECIALLY WITH MIN 
TEMPS...SO WILL HAVE TEMPS A FEW DEGREES ABOVE MOS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE AREA BRINGING DRY
WEATHER TO MOST OF THE AREA ON THURSDAY. MODELS INDICATING SOME
MOISTURE AND WEAK INSTABILITY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS...SO WILL GO WITH
20 POPS FOR SOME DIURNAL ACTIVITY THURSDAY. A SHORTWAVE APPROACHES
THE AREA ON FRIDAY. MOISTURE LIMITED AGAIN... SO WILL KEEP ONLY
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY. AREA OF LOW PRESSURE LINGERS ACROSS
THE REGION ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY BUT WITH MOISTURE LIMITED...WILL
KEEP ONLY 20 POPS GOING. A FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT PREVIOUS MODELS
BROUGHT INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY NOW APPEARS TO STALL OUT TO THE
NORTH BUT STILL ENOUGH UNCERTAINTY SO WILL CARRY 20 POPS FOR MONDAY
AND TUESDAY. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1046 AM EDT TUE JUL 31 2007

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION HAS BEEN
SLOWLY DRIFTING EAST OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE PRESENCE OF THIS
RIDGE MAY INFLUENCE OUR AREA BY SUPPRESSING AFTERNOON CONVECTION A
LITTLE MORE THAN YESTERDAY. HOWEVER WITH SURFACE DEWPOINTS AROUND
70 IN THE VALLEY AND PLENTY OF SURFACE HEATING THIS MORNING...THERE
SHOULD BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS. THE BEST
CHANCES LOOK TO BE IN ELEVATED AREAS OF THE MOUNTAINS SINCE THE
FLOW ALOFT IS WEAK. 1000-850 MB THICKNESS IS A LITTLE GREATER THAN
YESTERDAY..SO EXPECT HIGH TEMPS ABOVE YESTERDAYS HIGHS...MAINLY IN
THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S. TEMPS MAY NEED TO BE NUDGED UPWARD IN
SOME SPOTS. WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST TO REMOVE FOG AND AFTERNOON
WORDING.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

FORECAST...ALTHOUGH MAXES TODAY WILL PROBABLY BE A DEGREE OR TWO

LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ON BOTH TUESDAY 
AND WEDNESDAY. COULD CARRY THIS AREA WIDE BUT THIS COULD LEAD TO 
OVERFORECASTING COVERAGE AND WILL JUST KEEP CONVECTION IN THE MAJOR 
TERRAIN AREAS DUE TO ADDITIONAL HELP FROM OROGRAPHIC LIFT. 
CONCERNING TEMP FORECAST STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO THE GUIDANCE BLEND. 
HOWEVER...EDGED A LITTLE HIGHER ON MINIMUMS NIGHT PERIODS AND A 
LITTLE LOWER DAYTIME PERIODS DUE TO MOISTURE BOTH IN THE GROUND AND 
LINGERING IN THE LOWER ATMOSPHERE IN THE GASEOUS STATE. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THRU MONDAY)...THE UPPER TROF WHICH IMPACTED
THE AREA MUCH OF NEXT WEEK IS FINALLY WEAKENING AND MOVING OFF TO THE
EAST AND HIGH PRESSURE IS BUILDING BACK IN FROM THE WEST. THIS WILL
BRING A DRIER AND WARMER AIRMASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SOME SHOWER
ACTIVITY BEGINNING MAINLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THEN SLOWLY
SPREADING INTO SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND BY THE WEEKEND ACROSS THE
REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA AS THE STANDARD AFTERNOON AND EVENING
CONVECTION.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TREND TOWARDS PERSISTENCE WITH MINS TONIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 281927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT SAT JUL 28 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE BOUNDARY MOST 
NOTABLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA IS A WARM FRONT ALMOST CUTTING THE 
AREA IN HALF FROM SW TO NE. SHOWERS HAVE POPPED RANDOMLY BEHIND THE 
WARM FRONT WHERE AIRMASS HAS DESTABILIZED...WITH ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY TO DEVELOP SHORTLY. KEPT POPS AT 50 PERCENT IN 
THESE AREAS...BUT LOWERED SLIGHTLY NE OF THE WARM FRONT WHERE MORE 
STABLE CONDITIONS LINGER. DUE TO WEAK COLD AND WARM FRONTS KEPT AT 
LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN LATE TONIGHT. FAVORED PERSISTENCE 
OVER MOS CHOICES FOR MINS TONIGHT. 

FOR SUNDAY...WEAK LOW PRESSURE ALONG FRONTAL BOUNDARY LOOKS TO SET 
UP BEST (BUT WEAK) CONVERGENCE IN HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG TN-NC STATE 
LINE FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THUS...INCREASED POPS THOSE 
AREAS TO LOWER END OF LIKELY WHICH ALSO MESHED BETTER WITH POP/WX
GRIDS FROM GSP AND RNK. MOS HIGHS PROBABLY A BIT TOO WARM GENERALLY 
ON SUNDAY...ESPECIALLY NRN AND ERN AREAS...SO SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT MOS.

SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...POPS GRADUALLY DIMINISH FROM THE W-NW AS 
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY FINALLY SLIPS SE OF THE FORECAST AREA ON 
MONDAY. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS DEPICTED THIS WELL...SO LITTLE 
CHANGES MADE TO SUNDAY NIGHT OR MONDAY. AGAIN WENT WITH PERSISTENCE 
ON SUNDAY NIGHT MINS AND A MOS BLEND ON MAX TEMPS MONDAY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...PERSISTANT EAST COAST 
UPPER TROF SLIPS FAR ENOUGH AWAY FROM THE FORECAST AREA TO ALLOW FOR 
SEVERAL DAYS OF LITTLE OR NO PROBABILITY OF PRECIP DUE TO THE 
INTRODUCTION OF NORTHERLY COMPONENT TO THE FLOW AS WELL AS HIGHER 
PRESSURES AND SUBSIDING AIR. LOW LEVEL AIRMASS GRADUALLY MOISTENS 
MID TO LATE WEEK AS MOISTURE ADVECTION DEVELOPS AGAIN FROM THE 
ATLANTIC AND GULF OF MEXICO. ALSO UPPER TROF NEVER REALLY MOVES FAR 
ENOUGH AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN AND EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA SO MAINTAINED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR OROGRAPHIC DEVELOPMENT 
LEAVING MUCH OF THE GREAT VALLEY DRY. BY SATURDAY USED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA WITH LOW CHANCE POPS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS AS ATMOSPHERE CONTINUES TO SLOWLY MOISTEN AND DESTABILIZE. 
STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS WHICH FEATURE A WARMING TREND WITH 
INCREASED INSOLATION AND A LITTLE SUBSIDENCE TO BOOT.

FXUS64 KMRX 281359
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
959 AM EDT SAT JUL 28 2007

.DISCUSSION...REMNANTS OF CONVECTIVE COMPLEX HAVE EXITED SE TN INTO 
NW GA...LEAVING SOME MINOR WATER PROBLEMS IN THE URBAN AND SMALL 
STREAM FLOOD ADVISORY COUNTIES (MARION...HAMILTON AND SEQUATCHIE).
FORTUNATELY THE MOVEMENT WAS FAST ENOUGH TO GET THESE HEAVY RAINS 
OUT SOON ENOUGH TO AVOID ANY SIGNIFICANT FLOODING. RADAR ESTIMATES 
OF 1.5 TO 2.5 INCHES PER HOUR WERE CONFIRMED BY AN OBSERVER IN 
HAMILTON COUNTY WHO MEASURED OVER 2 INCHES OF RAIN IS JUST UNDER 1 
HOUR THIS MORNING. CHA AIRPORT ALSO RECORDED OVER 2 INCHES OF RAIN
WITH MOST FALLING AFTER 8AM EDT (12Z).

QUESTION NOW IS HOW MUCH CONVECTION RE-DEVELOPS THIS AFTERNOON...
WITH STABLE AIRMASS BEHIND THIS MORNINGS ACTIVITY. MODIFIED 12Z OHX 
AND RNK SOUNDINGS SHOW MUCH LESS INSTABILITY (POSITIVE CAPES OF 800 
TO 1200 J/KG AND -3 LIFTED INDEX) IF MAX TEMPS REACH THE 80S. AGREE 
WITH PREVIOUS SHIFT THAT SCATTERED WORDING AND 50 PERCENT POPS 
SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT.

WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX...FRESHEN GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS SHORTLY.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 280632
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 AM EDT SAT JUL 28 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
ALONG IT OVER SOUTHERN INDIANA. RADARS REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF 
LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN WITH SOME EMBEDDED THUNDER OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA...ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THIS SHORT WAVE EXITING THE FORECAST AREA BY LATER 
THIS MORNING...WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING IN THE 
AFTERNOON. WITH THIS COLD FRONT REMAINING NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON...THINK THAT CONVECTION SHOULD AGAIN REDEVELOP AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT...ALTHOUGH THIS MORNINGS RAIN SHOULD KEEP COVERAGE 
ONLY SCATTERED IN NATURE. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE LOWER 
THAN GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS WITH HIGHS TODAY (DUE TO EXTENSIVE CLOUD 
COVER AND SCATTERED PRECIP)...AND WILL TREND TOWARDS PERSISTENCE 
WITH LOWS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...REALLY NOTHING AT ALL HAS 
CHANGED SINCE THE LAST DISCUSSION...SO WILL PARAPHRASE THE FEW 
CHANGES MADE TO THIS PORTION OF CURRENT PACKAGE. UPPER TROF OVER 
NORTHEASTERN U.S MOVES ONLY SLOWLY OUT OF THE PICTURE THROUGH 
FRIDAY. EFFECTS ON THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
WILL BE MOSTLY FROM SUNDAY THROUGH THE WEE HOURS OF MONDAY. 
SHORTWAVE ROTATES AROUND UPPER LOW THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY PRODUCING 
A WEAK FRONT...WHICH WILL DROP INTO THE REGION. SLOW DEPARTURE OF 
WEAKENING UPPER TROF STALLS FRONTAL MOVEMENT...BUT LAYER HUMIDITY 
BEGINS TO DRY...SO GRADUALLY DECREASED POPS FOR CONVECTION ON MONDAY 
WITH IMPROVEMENT FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST AS FRONT DROPS OUT OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. INDICATIONS OF A WEAK BACK DOOR FRONT MIDWEEK... 
WHICH WILL PRODUCE A DRIER NORTHERLY FLOW AT THE SURFACE...SO 
DROPPED POPS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. UPPER RIDGE OVER WRN/CENTRAL 
U.S. NEVER REALLY DOES IMPRESS MUCH AND WONT BUDGE EASTWARD 
THURS/FRI...AND THIS ALLOWS NEXT CANADIAN LOW TO PRESS ITS WAY DOWN 
THE EAST SIDE OF RIDGE. LOBE ON THIS LOW WILL CREATE SOME 
NORTHWESTERLY LOW-LEVEL FLOW...WHICH IN TURN WILL CAUSE WEAK UPSLOPE 
INTO BLUE RIDGE...WHICH IN TURN WILL RAISE POPS THOSE DAYS TO ABOUT 
SLIGHT CHANCE. MADE VARIOUS TWEAKS IN MAX/MIN TEMPS AND RESULTING 
TEMP PROGRESSION...SIMPLY TO BE MORE IN LINE WITH LATEST MODEL 
BLENDS.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

257 PM EDT FRI JUL 27 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON

MOSTLY DIURNAL CONVECTION SATURDAY EVENING AND SUNDAY...WITH LITTLE 
CHANGES MADE TO FORECAST GRIDS AT THIS POINT. FAVORED CLOSER TO MOS 
BLEND FOR MINS TONIGHT...WHICH IS CLOSER TO PERSISTENCE AND BETTER 
THAN MOS LATELY. MESOSCALE COMPLEX MAKES SATURDAY HIGHS TRICKY...
BUT PCPN MAY DIMINISH AND ENOUGH CLEARING TO SUPPORT WARMER MAXES IN 
THE SOUTH...BUT CLOSER TO JUST UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S IN THE NORTH.
MOS BLEND LOOKED GOOD FOR SATURDAY NIGHT MINS...THEN GFS NUMBERS FOR 
SUNDAY MAXES.

HURRY TO EXIT THE NORTHEASTERN U.S THROUGH THE LONG TERM FORECAST 
WITH IMPACT ON THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY 
IN THE PERIOD. SHORTWAVE FEATURE ROTATES AROUND UPPER LOW THROUGH 
THE OHIO VALLEY INDUCING SURFACE WAVE ON SYNOPTIC SCALE FRONT 
DROPPING INTO THE REGION. WAVE SLOWS FRONTAL PROGRESS SO MAINTAINED 
IDEA OF LOW AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION ON MONDAY WITH 
IMPROVEMENT FROM NORTH TO SOUTH AS FRONT DROPS FURTHER SOUTH THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA. STAYED WITH THE DRY FORECAST FOR TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY AS NORTHERLY COMPONENT TO LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPS WITH 
SURFACE RIDGE BUILDING SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. USED SOME 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE TERRAIN ALONG NORTH CAROLINA BORDER FOR 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WHERE MODELS SHOW SOME INSTABILITY WITH MOISTURE 
AXIS WHICH IS ENHANCED WITH OROGRAPHIC LIFT. 


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
958 AM EDT FRI JUL 27 2007

.DISCUSSION...MODIFYING 12Z OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS FOR MAX TEMPS IN 
THE 80S TO LOWER 90S YIELDS MODERATE TO STRONG INSTABILITY TODAY
(POSITIVE CAPE OF 2000 TO 3500 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES OF AT LEAST 
-8 DEGS C).  HOWEVER...THE CLOSED UPPER LOW HAS STAYED WELL TO OUR 
NORTH...WITH SLIGHTLY WARMER MID LEVEL TEMPS PER 12Z UPPER AIR 
ANALYSIS.  SATELLITE PICS AND ANALYSIS DOES INDICATE A WEAK JET MAX 
DROPPING DOWN THE BACK SIDE OF THE UPPER LOW TOWARD THE CENTRAL AND 
SRN APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING...AND THERE IS SOME ENHANCED 
CONVECTION UNDERWAY ACROSS CENTRAL AND ERN KY.

CONVECTION MAY GET AN EARLIER START TODAY GIVEN MUCH LESS FOG AND 
LOW LEVEL CLOUDINESS THAN YESTERDAY.  HOWEVER...LACK OF A SURFACE 
FEATURE TO FOCUS DEVELOPMENT SUGGESTS THAT CHANCE POPS WITH 
SCATTERED WORDING IS SUFFICIENT.  OHX SOUNDING SHOWED FREEZING LEVEL 
AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS BOTH A LITTLE HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY...SO
HAIL THREAT IS PROBABLY TOWARD THE LOWER END OF SEVERE.  ISOLATED 
SEVERE STORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS IN EXCESS OF 50 MPH WILL BE MAIN 
THREAT.

WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX AND FRESHEN GRIDS/WEB PRODUCTS BY 11 AM EDT.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 270715
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT FRI JUL 27 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A 
WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT 
THIS COLD FRONT WILL QUICKLY MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY BY LATE TONIGHT...DUE TO NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS SHOULD DEVELOP AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON... 
BUT WITH A LACK OF A DECENT FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR CONVECTION... 
THINK THAT MAINLY TERRAIN-INDUCED CONVECTION SHOULD DEVELOP. MODELS 
KEEP HINTING THAT A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE COMPLEX (MCC) WILL DEVELOP 
AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT TODAY OVER THE MIDWEST...AND THEN QUICKLY 
MOVE SOUTHEAST TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA BY LATER TONIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY MORNING. THE GFS AND WRF MODELS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES 
WITH THE DEVELOPMENT AND ULTIMATE MOVEMENT OF THIS MCC...BUT THEY 
BOTH AGREE THAT ITS ASSOCIATED UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE SHOULD MOVE 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING. 
THUS...WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA FOR TONIGHT...AND AREAWIDE ON SATURDAY. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT MID-LEVEL WINDS WILL ONLY BE AROUND 20-30 KTS WITH 
THIS MCC...BUT THINK THAT SOME DAMAGING WINDS COULD BE GENERATED 
SINCE MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A FAIRLY DEEP MID-LEVEL AND LOW-LEVEL 
DRY AIR MASS TO HELP ACCELERATE THE DOWNDRAFTS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
BASICALLY TREND TOWARD THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS WITH HIGHS THROUGH 
THE PERIOD...BUT WILL TREND TOWARD PERSISTENCE WITH LOWS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER TROF OPENS AND MOVES 
SLOWLY AWAY FROM THE AREA, BUT DRAGS A POSITIVELY TILTED LOBE BEHIND 
IT, WHICH IN TURN DEVELOPS A WEAK FRONT (MORE OF JUST A WEAK 
SURFACE TROF) ACROSS THE AREA SUNDAY. THIS WILL ACT AS A FOCUSING 
MECHANISM FOR CONVECTION. LAYER MOISTURE NOT SUPER IMPRESSIVE, BUT 
LOW LEVEL DEWPOINTS STILL HIGH SO EXPECT SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. 
INDICATIONS ARE THAT STORMS OVER THE SOUTHERN AREAS MAY REACH SEVERE 
LEVELS WITH LIS AROUND -4, CONVECTIVE TEMPS IN THE LOW TO MID 80S,  
CAPES IN THE LOW 2000S, AND WIND VECTORS PRODUCING STORM MOTIONS 
SLIGHTLY TO THE RIGHT OF THE MEAN WIND. HAIL IS NOT (AT THIS TIME) 
EXPECTED TO BE LARGE, BUT WINDS COULD BE A PROBLEM, WITH RECENT 
RAINS HAVING MOISTENED THE GROUND IN MANY LOCATIONS THERE. 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL BE NEAR 2 INCHES AND K VALUES UP 
AROUND 35 SO WITH SLOW MOVING STORMS, SOME LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINS 
COULD RESULT. URBAN AREAS SHOULD BE ON THE ALERT, ESPECIALLY. 

THE FRONT WORKS ITS WAY THROUGH AND SLIGHT UPPER RIDGING BEGINS ON 
MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH DRIER AIR AND SUNNIER SKIES. LATER IN 
THE PERIOD A BACK DOOR FRONT IS HINTED AT BUT THIS IS SO FAR OUT IN 
TIME, IT IS NOT CERTAIN AT ALL.
&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
234 PM EDT THU JUL 26 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...LACK OF SURFACE FEATURE TODAY 
HAS CONVECTION FIRING MORE RANDOMLY...ALTHO SOME ORGANIZED OVER THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND HIGHER TERRAIN OF WRN NC AT THIS TIME. 
MOVEMENT IS EAST OR NORTHEAST AT 10 TO 15 MPH...MOVING AWAY FROM TRI 
AND TYS FOR NOW...WITH SLIGHT THREAT OF TSRA FOR CHA OVER NEXT FEW 
HOURS. A FEW STORMS MAY PULSE TO BRIEFLY SEVERE LEVELS WITH SMALL 
HAIL AND DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS THE MAIN THREATS. DUE TO RANDOM 
LOOK DECIDED TO LOWER POPS A BIT FOR REST OF THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING HOURS (BELOW 50 PERCENT COVERAGE). CLOSE TO MOS BLEND FOR 
MIN TEMPS...AND ADDED SOME PATCHY LATE NIGHT FOG...WITH POTENTIAL 
FOR IFR CONDITIONS AT ALL 3 TAF SITES.

FOR FRIDAY...GENERALLY EXPECT DIURNAL CONVECTION WITH ONCE AGAIN A 
RANDOM COVERAGE. LATEST MOS POPS WERE LOWER THAN PREVIOUS GRIDS...
BUT I KEPT POPS A BIT HIGHER IN THE TYPICALLY FAVORED TERRAIN AREAS. 
GFS MAX TEMPS WERE NOT FAR OFF THE BLEND OF MOS...AND CLOSELY 
FOLLOWED. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH 
DEVELOPING ACROSS THE EASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION WILL BE THE MAIN 
WEATHER FEATURE FOR THE EXTENDED. MODELS SHOW A FAIRLY STRONG 
SHORT-WAVE DIVING INTO THE DEVELOPING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY LATE FRIDAY WHICH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY 
FRIDAY MORNING. THICKNESS AND CORFIDI VECTORS SUGGEST OHIO VALLEY 
MCS WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE FORECAST FRIDAY NIGHT. HAVE UPPED 
POPS FOR THIS FEATURE WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES OF CONVECTION OVER 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA.

PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH AND FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA SATURDAY AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT AS UPPER TROUGH BECOMES MORE ESTABLISHED.  WILL KEEP 
LIKELY POPS FOR SATURDAY AND ..SO HAVE KEPT LIKELY POPS GOING.

FOR SUNDAY...UPPER TROUGH MOVES ONLY SLOWLY EAST TO THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...SO WILL ALSO KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING...HIGHEST POPS 
NORTHEAST SECTIONS.  SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE AREA 
FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...SO DRY CONDITIONS RETURN.

FOR THURSDAY...GFS SHOWS A BACK-DOOR FRONT MOVING INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION POSSIBLE. CONFIDENCE LOW FOR THIS 
FEATURE.

939 AM EDT THU JUL 26 2007

.DISCUSSION...AREA RADARS ALL CLEAR THIS MORNING WITH STABLE 
ATMOSPHERE (FOR NOW) AND RATHER WIDESPREAD FOG AND LOW CLOUDS AS 
NOTED ON THE LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS.  VALLEYS WELL DEPICTED 
FROM THE FOG  AND STRATUS CLOUD PATTERNS...BUT THE FOG AND LOW 
CLOUDS WERE LIFTING.

MODIFIED 12Z OHX SOUNDING FOR MAX TEMPS IN THE UPR 80S AND DEWPTS IN 
THE MID 60S...YIELDS MODERATE INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON WITH 
POSITIVE CAPES OF 1500 TO 2000 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES OF -6 DEGREES.
COLDER TEMPS ALOFT ARE TO OUR NORTH CLOSER TO THE OHIO VALLEY/ERN 
GREAT LAKES UPPER LOW...SO FREEZING AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS DONT 
GENERALLY FAVOR HAIL THREAT TODAY.  ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS WITH 
STRONG DOWNBURST WINDS SEEMS TO BE MAIN THREAT TODAY.

SURFACE BOUNDARY FROM YESTERDAY IS LACKING...ALTHO SATELLITE PICS 
AND 12Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW SOME UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT ON THE WAY.
ANOTHER IMPULSE OR SPEED MAX APPEARS TO BE MOVING AROUND THE BACK 
SIDE OF THE UPPER LOW THIS MORNING...AND COULD AFFECT AT LEAST NRN 
PARTS OF OUR AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  HOWEVER...GIVEN WEAK 
LOW LEVEL WINDS AND NO SURFACE BOUNDARY...WILL KEEP POPS AT 50 
PERCENT WITH SCATTERED WORDING FOR NOW.  

OTHERWISE...WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX TO REMOVE PATCHY DENSE FOG SHORTLY.
GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS WILL ALSO BE FRESHENED...ALTHO LIKELY JUST 
VERY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS NEEDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT THU JUL 26 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW MOVING SLOWLY 
NORTHWEST AS MODELS HAVE ADVERTISED FOR SEVERAL DAYS. IT IS ALSO 
PROGGED TO START ITS NORTHEAST MOVEMENT BY VERY LATE TONIGHT. 
HOWEVER, IT IS NOT NOW PROGGED TO OPEN UP AS IT ONCE WAS AND IS 
STILL A CLOSED LOW AS IT STARTS MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. THIS 
MAKES ONLY A LITTLE DIFFERENCE IN THE FORECAST IN THAT IT KEEPS 
DRAGS A WEAK LITTLE WARM FRONT TOWARD THE AREA OVERNIGHT. THIS THING 
IS NOT REALLY DYNAMIC ENOUGH TO BRING WIDESPREAD ORGANIZED SEVERE 
WEATHER TO THE AREA, BUT AGAIN WILL PRODUCE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDER WITH ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS, MAINLY WITH A 
DAMAGING WIND THREAT AND SOME PENNY TO QUARTER HAIL EVENTS.

I HAVE ACTUALLY DROPPED POPS A LITTLE TO ACCOUNT FOR THE SLIGHT 
LOWERING OF LAYER RH, AND THE PAUCITY OF CLOUDS AT THIS WRITING. 
HAVE ADDED MORNING PATCHY DENSE MORNING FOG, AND THIS WILL BURN OFF 
EARLY TURNING TO CUMULUS AND THEN TO TOWERING CU AND CBS PRETTY 
QUICKLY IN THE WARMTH OF THE AFTERNOON, MOSTLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN 
FIRST.

RAISED MAX TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO TODAY, AS WELL.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE
NORTHWESTERLY AS GREAT LAKES UPPER LOW SHIFTS EASTWARD. SCATTERED 
CONVECTION WILL BE MORE DIURNAL IN NATURE FRIDAY WITH LESS CLOUDS 
AND WARMER TEMPS. UPPED POPS FOR SAT AS PWS INCREASE TO ABOVE 2.00 
AND BULK SHEAR BECOMES RATHER IMPRESSIVE IN THE PREFRONTAL ZONE. 
BROAD SURFACE LOW PRESSURE AREA PROGGED TO MOVE SE THROUGH MRX CWA 
EARLY SUNDAY. SCATTERED CONVECTION LINGERS INTO THE EVENING HOURS. 
REMAINDER OF FORECAST BASED ON SURFACE PRESSURE BUILDING IN WITH 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY SE OF THE AREA. DRYING TREND EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH 
NEAR CLIMO TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EDT WED JUL 25 2007

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING A LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
EXITING OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES.  MOST OF THE ACTIVITY SHOULD BE OUT 
OF THE AREA BEFORE MIDNIGHT.  WILL UPDATE ZONE FORECAST TO LOWER 
POPS ACROSS THE AREA.  BUT WITH THE UPPER LOW ROTATING TO THE NORTH 
AND STILL SOME LINGERING MOISTURE...WILL KEEP 30 POPS ACROSS THE CWA 
FOR THE REST OF TONIGHT.  TEMPERATURES AND THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
ON TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH...
SURFACE TROUGH FROM SRN MIDDLE TN INTO NE TN...AND A FEW BREAKS OF
SUNSHINE...HAVE CAUSED WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON. A FEW STORMS HAVE PULSED JUST UP TO SEVERE
LEVELS...WITH VERY HEAVY RAINFALL ALSO NOTED IN A FEW COUNTIES
(SCOTT/CAMPBELL TN). MAX TEMPS GENERALLY HELD DOWN THIS AFTERNOON
DUE TO CLOUDS AND RAIN.

POP AND WEATHER GRIDS ADJUSTED TO CURRENT RADARS AND A SHORT TERM
FORECAST INTO THIS EVENING. OTHERWISE...KEPT AT LEAST SOME CHANCE
POPS ALL AREAS OVERNIGHT. FAVORED A BLEND OF MOS FOR MINS TONIGHT.

ON THURSDAY...UPPER LOW IS STILL VERY MUCH NEARBY AND UNSTABLE AGAIN
...SO FAVORED GOING WITH LOWER END OF LIKELY MOST AREAS ON POPS BY
THE AFTERNOON HOURS. WENT CLOSER TO MOS POPS AND MAX TEMPS ACROSS
SRN MOST AREAS...WHICH ARE FURTHER AWAY FROM THE UPPER LOW.  

FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...CONVECTION SHOULD BE MORE DIURNAL
IN NATURE...BUT CANT RULE OUT ISOLATED CONVECTION JUST ABOUT
ANYTIME. PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS WERE REASONABLE WITH
SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS. AGAIN...FAVORED WARMER MOS MAX TEMPS FOR SRN
AREAS...AND A MOS BLEND FOR MIN TEMPS.


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 250656
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 AM EDT WED JUL 25 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PERSISTENT UPPER LOW OVER OHIO. 
WEAK INVERTED TROF AT SFC FROM NEAR VICKSBURG TO LAKE ERIE, WITH 
WEAK SFC HIGH CENTERED NEAR SHENANDOAH VALLEY. SOME WEAK DRAINAGE 
WINDS WAFTING INTO TENNESSEE VALLEY AS A RESULT OF SFC HIGH. A SMALL 
AREA OF CONVERGENCE FORMED OVER SRN MID TN AND RESULTED IN SOME 
SHOWERS AND TSTMS DRIFTING SOUTHEAST TOWARD CHATTANOOGA. THESE WERE 
WEAKENING AT THIS WRITING, UPPER SUPPORT WAS ALSO WEAKER THIS FAR 
SOUTH. HOWEVER, ANOTHER SET OF SHOWERS/TSTMS WAS MOVING EAST OVER 
NORTHEAST TN AND THE ADJACENT VA BORDER, AND THIS AREA HAD A LITTLE 
GREATER UPPER SUPPORT IN THE FORM OF COLDER AIR ALOFT. LITTLE 
SERIOUS DYNAMICS IN EITHER AREA, SO LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND COOL 
AIR ALOFT THE DRIVING FORCES. THIS CANT LAST FOREVER.

FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT THE SITUATIONS ONLY REAL CHANGE WILL BE FOR 
THE UPPER OHIO LOW TO DRIFT SLOWLY TO THE NORTHWEST AND FILL IN 
SLIGHTLY. AT THE SFC, THE MAIN RESULT OF THIS WILL BE TO SHOVE A FEW 
ISOBARS AROUND WITH LITTLE CHANGE IN WIND DIRECTION OR STRENGTH.

HAVE KEPT WEATHER, CLOUDS, AND POPS MOSTLY THE SAME AS PREVIOUSLY, 
BUT HAVE TAKEN THE NEW BLEND OF GUIDANCE MAX TEMPS AND SLIGHTLY 
LOWERED THEM IN MOST AREAS AS THEY SEEMED TOO HIGH FOR THE CLOUDS 
AND RAIN TODAY. LEFT MINS ALONE TONIGHT.

AGAIN, AS YESTERDAY, MOST PLACES WILL NOT SEE MUCH RAIN, BUT THOSE 
WHO DO WILL GET BRIEF, ALBEIT MONSTROUS SHOWERS. DO NOT EXPECT 
FLOODING, ALTHOUGH IN HEAVILY URBANIZED AREAS SUCH AS DOWNTOWNS 
THERE COULD BE SOME MODERATELY PESTIFEROUS STREET FLOODING. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...ANOTHER WET DAY EXPECTED THU
AS SOUTHERN END OF UPPER LOW REMAINS OVER AREA. THE LOW SHIFTS NE ON FRI
AND AXIS MOVES EAST OF AREA WITH NW FLOW ALOFT. LAYER MOISTURE REMAINS
HIGH AS SURFACE RIDGE WEAKENS AND LOW LEVEL FLOW BECOMES SLIGHTLY STRONGER
FROM THE SW. SO A GOOD CHC FOR CONVECTION CONTINUES. LAYER MOISTURE 
INCREASES ON SAT AND SUN AS COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST
AND MOVES INTO AREA ON SUN. RAISED POPS AND CLOUD COVER AND LOWERED
TEMPS SAT. FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE SE OF AREA SUN NGT. FORECAST CALLS 
FOR A DRYING TREND AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
NOT A SURE THING THAT FRONT WILL COMPLETELY CLEAR THE AREA BUT
WILL ADJUST WITH LATER PACKAGES IN THE NEED ARISES.

900 PM EDT TUE JUL 24 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING ALONG A 
MEMPHIS TO CINCINNATI LINE...WITH NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND SCATTERED 
TSTORMS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS CONVECTION IS ASSOCIATED WITH A 
SHORT WAVE ROTATING AROUND AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE UPPER OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS UPPER LOW IS PROGGED TO ONLY SLOWLY DRIFT 
NORTHWEST OVERNIGHT...WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS CONTINUING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT...EXPECT SCATTERED CONVECTION 
TO CONTINUE OVERNIGHT.

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST LATER THIS EVENING TO REMOVE 
EVENING WORDING AND MENTION SCATTERED CONVECTION OVERNIGHT. WILL 
ALSO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 241908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT TUE JUL 24 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE FROM PREVIOUS 
PACKAGE. CURRENTLY SITS A WEAKENING SURFACE HIGH OVER THE CENTRAL 
APPS WITH CYCLONIC SURFACE FLOW OVER CENTRAL KY. SURFACE FLOW INTO 
SRN APPS TENDS TO BE CONFLUENT AND HAS BROUGHT INCREASING DEWPOINTS 
INTO AREA. WITH LOW DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS, AND QUASI-COLD AIR ALOFT 
IN UPPER TROF TO OUR NORTHEAST, LIFTED INDICES WILL STAY IN THE 0 TO 
-3 OR SO RANGE ALL NIGHT, AND THEN DROP AGAIN TO THE -2 TO -4 RANGE 
WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL TEND TO KEEP SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS GOING 
PERIODICALLY ALL NIGHT AND INTO TOMORROW. MOST OF THE CELLS ARE 
MOVING AT LEAST 20 KNOTS AND SO FLOODING IS NOT LIKELY, EVEN WITH 
THE RECENT HEAVY RAINS WEVE HAD. STILL, THE SMALLEST, MOST 
INNOCUOUS LOOKING CELLS HAVE PRODUCED QUICK, BODACIOUS RAIN AMOUNTS. 
LOOK FOR MORE OF THAT OVER NIGHT AND AGAIN TOMORROW. MAX TEMPS ON 
THE COOL SIDE AND MINS NEAR NORMAL FOR A NICE FEELING.

.LONG RANGE (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MORE OF THE SAME 
THROUGH ABOUT FRIDAY AFTERNOON AS THE MODELS DEPICT THE NORTHEASTERN 
LOW RETROGRESSING SLIGHTLY TO THE NORTHWEST, WHICH KEEPS US IN THE 
LOW DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS AT THE SURFACE, AND QUASI-COOL AIR ALOFT. 
AS THE LOW OPENS UP AND MOVES TO THE NORTHEAST, WE GET SLIGHT 
RIDGING AND SLIGHTLY LOWER POPS BY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. HOWEVER, 
RESIDUAL LOW LEVEL RH WILL KEEP A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS/TSTM EVEN THAT 
FAR OUT. ITS NOT UNTIL MONDAY/TUESDAY THAT THE REAL DRYING OCCURS 
AND WE BEGIN TO SEE A RETURN TO MORE TYPICAL SUMMER DOG DAY PATTERNS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 231846
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EDT MON JUL 23 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...
UPPER LOW CURRENTLY CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIAN REGION
PER WV SATELLITE LOOP CONTINUES TO INFLUENCE WEATHER OVER MUCH OF
THE EASTERN CONUS. OCCASIONAL SHORT WAVES ROTATING AROUND THIS
FEATURE CONTINUE TO ENHANCE DEVELOPMENT OF MAINLY DIURNAL
CONVECTION. MODELS/SREF GENERALLY AGREE THAT THE UPPER LOW WILL
MOVE VERY LITTLE THROUGH THE BULK OF THE SHORT TERM. TIMING THE
INDIVIDUAL WAVES AROUND THIS FEATURE WILL REMAIN PROBLEMATIC.
LATEST WRF AND GFS GUIDANCE ADVERTISE LIKELY POPS FOR THE
NORTHEASTERN ZONES ON TUESDAY. HOWEVER...ONLY ABOUT 50 PERCENT OF
THE SREF MEMBERS ARE PROJECTING MEASURABLE PRECIP FOR THAT AREA
TOMORROW. THUS HAVE OPTED TO UNDERCUT MODEL GUIDANCE POPS SLIGHTLY
AND TO TRUNCATE POPS IN THE NORTHEAST ZONES AT HIGH CHANCE. FOR
TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE VALUES APPEAR REASONABLE...ALBEIT HIGHLY
DEPENDENT ON THE AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE/CLEARING THAT OCCURS IN THE
SHORT TERM.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN TAKING THE CLOSED LOW OVER THE 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TO THE NORTH-NORTHWEST...AND MERGING IT WITH 
PROGRESSIVE TROUGH ON FRIDAY. HOWEVER CONFIDENCE IN THE MODELS IS 
LOW FOR THE LONG TERM SINCE SUCH A PATTERN IS HIGHLY ANOMALOUS FOR 
THE MIDDLE OF SUMMER. WITH THE LOW POSITIONED TO THE NORTH...SEVERAL 
SHORTWAVES WILL ROTATE AROUND THE LOW AND AFFECT OUR AREA. UPPER 
DIFFLUENCE IN THE ENTRANCE REGION OF A JET STREAK WILL SUSTAIN LIFT 
DESPITE WEAK INSTABILITY. THESE FEATURES ARE FAIRLY WEAK AND 
SUBTLE...BUT MOISTURE APPEARS PLENTIFUL...SO WILL HAVE POPS NO 
HIGHER THAN 60 PERCENT THROUGH THURSDAY. BEST CHANCES LOOK TO BE IN 
THE NORTH CLOSER TO THE LOW. FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...A RIDGE 
REMAINS OVER THE ROCKIES AND PLAINS WITH A TROUGH OVER THE EAST 
COAST. THIS WILL KEEP LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST. 
CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH ENOUGH AT THIS TIME TO PINPOINT ANY FEATURES 
THAT MAY BRING HIGHER POPS TO THE AREA. 


&&

INSTABILITY WILL ALLOW ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION TO

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...WEAK INVERTED TROUGH POKING UP 
INTO THE AREA...WHILE UPPER LOW IS CENTERED JUST TO OUR EAST AND

THE SOUTH.  BETTER CHANCE TOMORROW AS INCREASING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
LEADS TO MORE INSTABILITY...SO WILL GO SLIGHT CHANCE ALL ZONES BUT 
SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST...WHERE WILL CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS.  WILL TWEAK 
MOST MAV TEMPS UP A BIT IN THE SHORT TERM...BUT NO MAJOR ADJUSTMENTS 
PLANNED.  


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES ARE NOW IN SOMEWHAT BETTER AGREEMENT. UPPER LOW EXPECTED 
TO MEANDER AROUND THE CENTRAL APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH MOST OF THE 
LONG TERM PERIOD. ANTICIPATE THAT THIS FEATURE WILL ENHANCE MOISTURE 
AND INSTABILITY SUFFICIENTLY TO PROMOTE SCATTERED...MAINLY DIURNAL 
CONVECTION EACH DAY THROUGH THE PERIOD. GENERALLY FAVORED THE 
ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE FOR POPS AND A BLEND OF GFS AND ENSEMBLE MEAN 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS. AT ANY RATE...APPEARS TEMPS WILL GENERALLY 
AVERAGE SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMO THROUGH THE PERIOD AS THE NEGATIVE 
HEIGHT ANOMALIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER LOW PERSIST OVER THE 
REGION.

AIRMASS CONTINUING TO BUILD SOUTH ON THE BACK SIDE OF EASTERN 
SEABOARD UPPER TROF. WILL UPDATE TO ADD A FEW CLOUDS TO THE TERRAIN 
ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER AND ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA WHERE MODELS INDICATE INCREASING MOISTURE/LIFT AS UPPER 
TROF RETROGRADES AND DEEPENS INTO CLOSED LOW ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS AND UPPER OHIO VALLEY DURING THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 PM EDT SAT JUL 21 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE 
UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST WILL CUT OFF TO OUR EAST AND 
NORTHEAST IN THE SHORT TERM.  ATMOSPHERE RATHER DRY OVER OUR AREA AT 
THE MOMENT...BUT MODELS TRYING TO BRING SOME MOISTURE IN FROM THE 
EAST AND SOUTHEAST.  THINK BOUNDARY LAYER WILL BE SLOW TO MOISTEN 
UP...AND WHILE WITH COOLING ALOFT MAY BE ENOUGH WEAK INSTABILITY FOR 
A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM IN THE MOUNTAINS TOMORROW...NOT MUCH 
CONFIDENCE FOR THAT SO WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR NOW.  MAV TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE BOTH PERIODS...SO ONLY SOME MINOR TWEAKS. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...STILL SOME NAGGING 
UNCERTAINTY ABOUT THE EVOLUTION OF THE UPPER LOW THAT MEANDERS OVER 
THE CENTRAL APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. 
GFS STILL EVENTUALLY RETROGRADES THIS FEATURE WESTWARD. PROXIMITY OF 
THIS FEATURE WOULD SUGGEST AN ENHANCEMENT IN BOTH MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY FOR OUR FORECAST AREA THROUGH MUCH OF THE UPCOMING WORK 
WEEK. ENSEMBLES ARE NOT MUCH HELP AS A MAJORITY OF THE ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS MOVE THE UPPER LOW TOWARD THE NORTHEAST AND AWAY FROM OUR 
AREA. DUE TO THIS CONTINUED UNCERTAINTY...TENDED TO FAVOR THE 
ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE FOR BOTH TEMPS AND POPS. AS A RESULT...POPS 
ARE SOMEWHAT LOWER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE AND TEMPS ARE SLIGHTLY 
WARMER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EDT FRI JUL 20 2007

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT FINALLY STARTING 
TO MOVE A LITTLE FASTER AS IT PUSHES SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA...AND 
EXPECT IT TO BE SOUTH OF TENNESSEE BY THIS EVENING.  WILL NEED TO 
CARRY SOME LOW POPS FOR LATE THIS AFTERNOON IN THE SOUTH AND 
EAST...BUT  WILL GO DRY FOR TONIGHT PERIOD.  WITH DRIER AIR MOVING 
IN AND HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTH...EXPECT PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND A 
DRY DAY ON SATURDAY.  WILL MAKE ONLY MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS IN 
THE SHORT TERM.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAJOR AMPLIFICATION OF 
UPPER FLOW PROJECTED TO EVOLVE INTO THE DEVELOPMENT OF A CLOSED 
UPPER LOW OVER THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC REGION BY 00Z SUNDAY PER MODEL 
AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. UPPER LOW THEN PROJECTED TO SLOWLY RETROGRADE 
WESTWARD THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. HOWEVER...
THERE ARE SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES ON THE PLACEMENT OF THIS FEATURE
WHICH RESULT IN CONSIDERABLE UNCERTAINTY IN POPS...ESPECIALLY EARLY
NEXT WEEK. MANY ENSEMBLE MEMBERS KEEP THE UPPER LOW WELL NORTHEAST
OF OUR AREA. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY...AM INCLINED TO KEEP MENTION OF
PRECIP OUT OF FORECAST FOR MOST LOCATIONS UNTIL THE MIDDLE OF NEXT
WEEK FOR NOW. TRACK OF UPPER LOW WILL ALSO INFLUENCE TEMPS. TENDED
TO USE A BLEND OF GFS AND ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS BUT
AGAIN CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH WITH RESPECT TO TEMPS EITHER.

A JET SEGMENT DIGS SE ON BACKSIDE OF TROUGH RESULTING IN SOME UPPER 
DIFFLUENCE THIS AFTN ALONG DP BOUNDARY. MODELS DO NOT GENERATE ANY 
CONVECTION LINKED TO THESE FEATURES. POTENTIAL FOR CONVECTION SHOULD 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE DAY LIGHT HOURS ACROSS THE SOUTH PART OF MRX 
CWA. SKIES WILL CLEAR TONIGHT AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
FROM THE NW. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 5 TO 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL 
TONIGHT ESPECIALLY SW VA AND NE TN.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A HIGH AMPLITUDE RIDGE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE CENTRAL U.S. THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF 
THE EXTENDED WITH AN UPPER TROUGH IN PLACE OVER THE EASTERN PORTION 
OF THE COUNTRY.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTROL AREA WEATHER 
WITH A DRY AIR MASS FILTERING INTO THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND BEHIND 
TODAY/S COLD FRONT.  AS A RESULT...EXPECT TO SEE DRY AND SUNNY 
CONDITIONS THROUGH TUESDAY.  FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...MOISTURE 
WILL INCREASE OVER THE MRX CWA...AND WITH A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES 
ROTATING AROUND THE UPPER LOW...MAY SEE SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION... 
MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT THU JUL 19 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...MODELS DIFFER IN HANDLING OF 
COLD FRONT THAT PUSHES THROUGH THE AREA IN THE SHORT TERM.  NAM 
FASTER...AND CLEARS PRECIP FROM THE NORTH BY 12Z FRI.  THINK THE NAM 
IS A BIT FAST...SO WILL GO WITH MORE OF A GFS/NAM BLEND.  WILL GO 
WITH LIKELY POPS NORTH TONIGHT...AND INTO CENTRAL ZONES FRI 
MORNING...OTHERWISE CHANCE POPS. LOOKS LIKE HIGHEST AMOUNTS OF 
PRECIP WILL BE NORTHEAST AND NORTHERN PLATEAU.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
ARE IN NEAR UNANIMOUS AGREEMENT ON AN UNSEASONABLE AMPLIFICATION OF
THE UPPER FLOW OVER MUCH OF THE CONUS THROUGH THE UPCOMING WEEKEND
AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH A SHARP TROUGH DIGGING OVER THE
EAST AND AN EXPANSIVE RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE PLAINS STATES. THIS
UPPER FLOW CONFIGURATION IS PROJECTED TO DRIVE THE SURFACE COLD
FRONT TO NEAR THE GULF COAST...ALLOWING DRY NORTHERLY SURFACE FLOW
TO INVADE THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN. AS SUCH...HAVE CONTINUED DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE
WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. UPPER FLOW DEAMPLIFIES BY THE
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK INTO A MORE TYPICAL PATTERN FOR THIS TIME OF
YEAR. HAVE INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR TYPICAL DIURNAL
CONVECTION MAINLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR BOTH WEDNESDAY AND
THURSDAY. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE
VALUES THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 AM EDT THU JUL 19 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
THE MODELS HAVE SOME SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES THROUGH THE SHORT TERM 
PERIOD...WITH THE GFS BEING MUCH DRIER TODAY AND SLOWER WITH THE 
FROPA ON FRIDAY. WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW THE NAM SOLUTION...WHICH HAS 
VERIFIED BETTER OF LATE. WITH PW VALUES AROUND 1.7...A UPPER LEVEL 
DEFORMATION ZONE SEEN IN WV IMAGERY OVER THE AREA...AND OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES LINGERING FROM CONVECTION TO THE NORTH...EXPECT SCATTERED 
CONVECTION ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. SOME STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WILL 
AGAIN BE POSSIBLE. THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL 
PUSH SOUTH...AND MORE ORGANIZED CONVECTION ALONG A PRE-FRONTAL 
TROUGH SHOULD BEGIN TO ENTER NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. WILL BRING IN LIKELY POPS NORTH TONIGHT. THE NAM IS QUITE 
FAST WITH THE SOUTHWARD PROGRESSION OF THE TROUGH...AS IT SHOWS A 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BY 09Z AND DRIER AIR MOVING IN BY 12Z. WILL 
SLOW THIS DOWN A LITTLE AND CENTER THE HIGHEST POPS AROUND 12Z..WITH 
POPS LOWERING TO A CHANCE IN THE AFTERNOON. THE SURFACE COLD FRONT 
PUSHES THROUGH IN THE AFTERNOON...AND MUCH DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR 
SHOULD BE IN PLACE BY 00Z FRIDAY. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE 
SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA FRIDAY EVENING DUE TO UNCERTAINTY WITH 
THE TIMING OF THE FRONT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROF FINDS A HOME OVER THE EASTERN SEABOARD
DURING THE WEEKEND BEFORE SLOWLY WEAKENING WITH A GRADUAL SHIFT
AWAY FROM THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. TOWARD MIDWEEK. AT THE SURFACE
HIGHER PRESSURES BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THIS PATTERN WILL
ALLOW FOR A MAJOR LEAGUE DROP IN MEAN RH ALONG WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER
TEMPERATURES...AT LEAST EARLY IN THE PERIOD. BY MIDWEEK THE MERCURY
WILL CLIMB BACK ABOVE NORMAL AND HUMIDITY WILL SLOWLY BUILD. KEPT
CONVECTION OUT OF THE FORECAST AWAITING CONDITIONS MORE CONDUCIVE
TO DEVELOPMENT. STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE
FOR THE LONG TERM.

&&

EVENING BEFORE ENDING. GREAT LAKES SURFACE HIGH MOVES IN SATURDAY 
WHICH WILL BRING DRIER AIR AND COOLER TEMPERATURES TO THE FORECAST

ALSO DIG A LITTLE FARTHER SOUTH. UPPER TROUGH MAY CLOSE OFF INTO 
UPPER LOW SATURDAY NIGHT OR SUNDAY OVER THE NORTHEAST STATES. AS 
HIGH PRESSURE MOVES EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS BY MID WEEK NORTHWEST FLOW 
WILL GUIDE STORMS TOWARD THE NORTHERN CWA WITH A CHANCE FOR MORE 
THUNDERSTORMS. UPPER LOW MAY FORM TO THE NORTH EARLY IN THE WEEK AND 
HELP ENHANCE THIS THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE 
SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER FRIDAY WITH CLOUDS AND RAIN SO WENT CLOSER TO 
MAV NUMBERS. FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY HIGHS AND LOWS WILL BE 
COOLER WITH DRIER HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 180712
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 AM EDT WED JUL 18 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY IS BRINGING SHOWERS 
AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS TO WV. MOST OF THESE SHOWERS WILL PASS TO 
OUR NORTH. BEHIND THE TROUGH PASSAGE...THE MID AND UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
TURNS MORE TO THE WEST AND NORTHWEST...WHICH BRINGS DRIER AIR INTO 
THE AREA TODAY. THERE WILL STILL BE A DEFORMATION ZONE NEAR THE 
AREA...AND WITH SOME GOOD SURFACE HEATING...WE SHOULD SEE SCATTERED 
CONVECTION DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON. WITH A LACK OF UPPER LEVEL 
SUPPORT...THE CONVECTION SHOULD DIE NEAR SUNSET. THURSDAY LOOKS 
PRETTY SIMILAR TO TODAY...EXCEPT A LITTLE WARMER. ON THURSDAY NIGHT 
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER ONTARIO PUSHES SOUTHEAST...BRINGING A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT TOWARD OUR AREA. THE MODELS DIFFER 
GREATLY WITH THE TIMING OF THE MAXIMUM LIFT...WITH THE GFS SHOWING 
IT IN OUR AREA AROUND 12Z FRIDAY...AND THE NAM SHOWING IT AROUND 18Z 
FRIDAY. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE SLOWER SOLUTION AS THE GFS MAY BE 
INFLUENCED BY CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE 
RANGE LATE THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY OF TIMING. A 
DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR MASS WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A DRY PERIOD WITH AMPLIFIED EASTERN STATES UPPER TROF/WESTERN STATES 
RIDGE WHICH KEEPS UPPER LEVEL FLOW NORTHERLY AND LOW LEVEL FLOW 
EASTERLY ACROSS THE REGION. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A LITTLE BELOW 
NORMAL EARLY IN THE PERIOD MAINLY NORTHERN SECTIONS BUT SURFACE 
THROUGH UPPER LEVEL RIDGING DEVELOPS MONDAY AND TUESDAY ALLOWING FOR 
A GRADUAL WARMING TREND INTO THE END OF THE WEEK. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  89  71  91  72  83 /  30  20  30  50  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN  89  71  91  71  82 /  30  20  30  50  50

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 PM EDT TUE JUL 17 2007

.DISCUSSION...
LOTS OF CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON...BUT JUDGING FROM LAST NIGHT
WHEN THIS AREA WAS SOUTHWEST OF US...THIS CONVECTION WILL SLOWLY
DISSIPATE THIS EVENING. LINE OF CONVECTION CROSSING OHIO VALLEY NOW
MAY BE ABLE TO SURVIVE LONG ENOUGH TO MAKE IT INTO NWRN PART OF
AREA...SO I HAVE BUMPED UP POPS THERE. SO HAVE HIGHER POPS
SOUTH...WHERE BETTER EFFECTS OF DEFORMATION ZONE ARE LOCATED...AND
WEST...CONSIDERING AFOREMENTIONED LINE OF CONVECTION.

WILL SLOWLY DRY OUT POPS THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...THEN FAIRLY
STRONG FRONT PUNCHES THROUGH CWA SOMETIME AROUND THURSDAY NIGHT.
TODAYS MODELS ARE IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH TAKING FRONT TO NEAR
THE GULF COAST AND LEAVING THE AREA DRY THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF
THE FORECAST PERIOD.

HAVE STUCK CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS JUST A LITTLE COOLER THAN 
GUIDANCE ON INITIAL POST-FRONTAL COOL DOWN.


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 171355
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
954 AM EDT TUE JUL 17 2007

.DISCUSSION...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A DIFFUSE STATIONARY FRONT
ACROSS KENTUCKY WITH THETA-E RIDGE EXTENDING INTO THE NORTHERN THIRD
OF THE FORECAST AREA. A GOOD DEAL OF MID-LEVEL MOISTURE IS MOVING SLOWLY
NORTHEAST ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE WITH PWS INCREASING TO 1.7 TO 2 INCHES
OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY.

AREA SOUNDINGS SHOW AIRMASS WILL BE MODERATELY UNSTABLE THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH CAPES OF 2000-2500 J/KG. WBZ WILL BE QUITE A BIT 
HIGHER THAN YESTERDAYS...SO THREAT OF HAIL WILL BE REDUCED. 
HOWEVER...GIVEN MODERATE CAPES AND ABUNDANT MOISTURE...MAIN CONCERN FROM
AFTERNOON STORMS WILL BE DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS DUE TO PRECIPITATION
LOADING. SINCE STORM MOTIONS WILL BE SLOW (NEAR 5 MPH)...LOCALIZED FLASH
FLOODING IS POSSIBLE.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST REFLECTS CURRENT THINKING.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A WEAK LOW PRESSURE AREA REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE SOUTHERN 
MS VALLEY REGION...WITH A LONGWAVE TROUGH IS POSITIONED OVER NEW 
ENGLAND AND THE GREAT LAKES. THIS IS RESULTING IN A DEFORMATION ZONE 
OVER TN/KY AND THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WHICH HAS ACTED AS A FOCUS 
FOR AFTERNOON CONVECTION THE PAST FEW DAYS. MODELS ARE INDICATING A 
GOOD FEED OF GULF MOISTURE SPREADING INTO THE AREA TODAY...AND THIS 
MOISTURE COMBINED WITH THE LIFT FROM DEFORMATION SHOULD MAKE SHOWERS 
AND TSTMS LIKELY ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
INSTABILITY LOOKS LIMITED BY WEAK LAPSE RATES.. WENT A LITTLE ABOVE 
MOS GUIDANCE ON TEMPS TODAY AS THE MOS FORECAST OF OVERCAST CLOUDS 
LOOKS TOO PESSIMISTIC. ON WEDNESDAY THERE IS LITTLE CHANGE TO THE 
OVERALL PATTERN...THOUGH THE MIDLEVEL FLOW BECOMES MORE WESTERLY AS 
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES TO THE NORTH...CUTTING OFF THE FEED OF 
MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTH. ON THURSDAY THE ATLANTIC RIDGE BUILDS WEST 
ACROSS THE GULF COAST...WHICH SHOULD CONTINUE TO LIMIT THE SUPPLY OF 
DEEP MOISTURE. THUS WILL HAVE HIGH CHANCE POPS ON WEDNESDAY AND 
LOW/SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO 00Z RUN OF GFS DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE 
FORECAST WHICH CONTINUES TO FEATURE A COOL FRONT MOVING INTO THE 
REGION ON FRIDAY. SLIGHTLY EDGED POPS HIGHER FOR FRIDAY WITH GRADUAL 
DECREASE FROM NORTH TO SOUTH FRIDAY NIGHT AS FRONT MAKES PROGRESS TO 
JUST SOUTH OF THE SOUTHERN TENNESSEE BORDER BY 12Z SATURDAY. OF 
COURSE FRONT MAY NOT MAKE IT QUITE AS FAR SOUTH AS GFS DEPICTION AND 
STAYED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN PORTION OF CENTRAL EAST TENNESSEE AS WELL AS SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA ON SATURDAY FOR THIS 
POSSIBILITY. KEPT REMAINDER OF FORECAST DRY WITH HEALTHY UPPER TROF 
IN PLACE THROUGH THIS PERIOD. ALTHOUGH PROBABILITY MAY GRADUALLY 
INCREASE DURING THE EARLY PART OF THE NEW WORK WEEK AS GFS INDICATES 
FORMATION OF INVERTED SURFACE TROF ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WITH 
ASSOCIATED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN. STUCK FAIRLY CLOSE TO GFS MEX 
MOS TEMPS THROUGHOUT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  87  69  88  69  89 /  70  50  50  30  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  87  69  88  69  89 /  70  50  50  30  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN  87  69  88  69  89 /  70  50  50  30  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  86  66  86  66  87 /  60  40  50  30  40

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 161919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT MON JUL 16 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CONVECTION FIRING NEAR WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY THIS AFTERNOON IN
NORTHERN PART OF AREA. WEAKENING CAP SHOULD ALLOW MORE SCATTERED
CONVECTION IN OTHER PARTS OF THE REGION. MODELS SHOW BOUNDARY
LIFTING NORTH OF AREA FOR TUESDAY...AND DONT THINK CONVECTION
TODAY WILL HAVE ENOUGH OF A COLD POOL TO STRENGTHEN IT OR PUSH IT
VERY FAR SOUTH...SO WILL GO WITH MODELS THAT FRONT WILL NOT BE
AROUND TO ENHANCE PRECIP COMING UP FROM GULF.  

AS JUST MENTIONED LARGE AREA OF MOISTURE AND PRECIP NEAR GULF COAST
IS EXPECTED TO SURGE NORTHWARD AND BE IN THE AREA FOR TUESDAY WILL
GO WITH PRETTY HIGH POPS ACROSS THE SOUTH FOR TUESDAY. THE
ORGANIZATION FOR THIS PRECIP STARTS TO FIZZLE AND DRIFT EAST OUT OF
THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY...SO AM GOING WITH LOWER POPS FOR WEDNESDAY
EVEN THOUGH GFS MOS HAS POPS JUST AS HIGH FOR WEDNESDAY.  

THURSDAY LOOKS RELATIVELY QUIET...THEN NEXT FRONT IS DUE IN ON
FRIDAY. GFS DEVELOPS A WAVE ON THIS FRONT IN WRN TN THAT OTHER
MODELS DEVELOP MUCH FARTHER WEST. WILL IGNORE THIS WAVE...ALLOWING
THE FRONT TO PROGRESS FASTER THROUGH THE AREA AND TO PENETRATE
FARTHER SOUTH THIS WEEKEND. HAVE CONDITIONS DRYING OUT THIS WEEKEND
IN WAKE OF FRONT AND HAVE GONE COOLER/DRIER THAN MEX GUIDANCE
CONSIDERING FRONTAL POSITIONING FARTHER SOUTH.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  70  89  70  88  71 /  40  60  40  50  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  88  69  86  71 /  30  60  40  50  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN  68  89  69  88  70 /  40  60  40  50  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  63  88  66  85  67 /  40  50  40  50  30

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 161401
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT MON JUL 16 2007

.DISCUSSION...FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO THE NORTH EXTENDS TO NEAR THE 
KENTUCKY/TENNESSEE BORDER BUT IS VERY WEAK.  DEW POINTS DO NOT 
REALLY DROP OFF UNTIL THE OHIO RIVER.  SOME SHOWER ACTIVITY BREAKING 
OUT NEAR THIS BOUNDARY IN WEST VIRGINIA AND EXPECT THIS TO SPREAD 
WITH THE AFTERNOON HEATING TO INCLUDE SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN PART OF OUR WARNING AREA.

MORE MOISTURE CONVERGENCE ACROSS NORTHERN ALABAMA/GEORGIA WITH COME 
ASSOCIATED SHOWER ACTIVITY THERE WILL ALSO HELP TRIGGER CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF OUR FORECAST AREA.

ALL THIS SAID TO SAY THAT MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL SEE SOME 
SCATTERED AFTERNOON CONVECTION WITH SOME ISOLATED PULSE SEVERE 
ACTIVITY.  THE GREATEST THREAT AS USUAL FOR SUMMERTIME CONVECTION IS 
FOR DOWNBURST WINDS.

CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK SO NO CHANGES COMING.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...RADAR 
INDICATING AN AREA OF SHOWERS AHEAD OF A WEAK FRONT IN KY HAS 
DISSIPATED.  FRONT SHOULD CONTINUE TO WEAKEN AS IT MOVES INTO OUR 
AREA...ALONG WITH THE MOISTURE.  BUT STILL SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY 
TODAY...WILL CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SOME DIURNAL ACTIVITY TODAY.  
DEEPER MOISTURE ADVECTS IN ON TUESDAY ALONG WITH A SHORTWAVE PASSING 
THROUGH...WILL GO WITH HIGHER POPS FOR TUESDAY WITH BETTER MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE PASSES THROUGH THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY 
WITH SOME LINGERING MOISTURE AVAILABLE WITH MORE SCATTERED ACTIVITY 
POSSIBLE.  KEPT 40 POPS FOR WEDNESDAY.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...GFS STILL INDICATING A 
SERIES ON SHORTWAVES ROTATING OVER THE RIDGE.  WILL GO WITH LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY.  A FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE 
REGION ON FRIDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY.  LATEST GFS 
INDICATING FRONT OUT OF AREA BY SATURDAY.  WITH STILL SOME DOUBT ON 
TIMING...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY.  DRY WEATHER IS 
EXPECTED FOR SUNDAY.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  88  70  89  70  90 /  30  30  50  40  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  88  68  89  69  88 /  30  30  40  30  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN  88  68  89  69  88 /  30  30  40  30  40

DIMINISHES. HOWEVER...RUC MODEL SUGGESTS CONVECTION MAY LINGER
OVERNIGHT. THEREFORE...AM INCLINED TO KEEP LOW POPS IN FORECAST
OVERNIGHT AND MAKE NO CHANGES AT THIS TIME.

215 PM EDT SUN JUL 15 2007

.SHORT TERM  (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH 
SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION OCCURRING ALONG THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A TYPICAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN WILL DEVELOP 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS WEEK...WITH DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW ALONG 
THE WESTERN PERIPHERY OF A BERMUDA HIGH OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC 
KEEPING DEEP MOISTURE OVER THE SOUTHEAST. WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS DEVELOPING EACH DAY...SCATTERED CONVECTION SHOULD DEVELOP 
MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS...ESPECIALLY NEAR THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY THROUGH 
TUESDAY...SINCE UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS ARE PROGGED TO BE WEAK AND A 
WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY SHOULD REMAIN NORTH OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL MAINLY TREND TOWARD 
PERSISTENCE...SINCE THE AIR MASS SHOULD REMAIN UNCHANGED THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT WITH ONLY CONVECTION POSSIBLY KEEPING MAXES FROM BEING 
REACHED. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES WILL 
MOVE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...PROVIDING A CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD.  BEST CHANCE OF ACTIVITY WILL 
BE DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS.  ADDITIONALLY...MODELS NOW INDICATE A 
FRONT MOVING THROUGH AROUND THE SATURDAY TIME FRAME FOR CONTINUED 
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS.  HAVE DRIED THINGS OUR FOR SUNDAY BEHIND 
THE FRONT.  MODEL GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK GOOD AND DIDN/T STRAY FAR.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EDT SUN JUL 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY...WITH A MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
DEWPOINTS IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME LIGHT 
CONVECTION ACROSS CENTRAL AL AND CENTRAL GA NEAR AN OLD FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY...AND ALSO OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY NEAR THE COLD FRONT. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS AND A MODIFIED BNA 12Z SOUNDING INDICATE THAT A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WITH A HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER CONTENT 
WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. AS A RESULT... 
THINK THAT A FEW ISOLATED TSTORMS COULD BECOME SEVERE WITH STRONG 
GUSTY WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. A LACK OF TRIGGERING 
MECHANISMS SHOULD KEEP THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION FROM BECOMING TOO 
EXTENSIVE...SO THINK CURRENT FORECAST POPS ARE STILL APPROPRIATE.

CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK OVERALL...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MENTION OF MORNING PRECIP...AND TO TWEAK 
TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 AM EDT SUN JUL 15 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LONG WAVE TROUGH OVER EASTER NOAM 
TRAILS OFF OVER SOUTHEAST US, BUT STILL PROVIDES ENOUGH INSTABILITY 
TO ALLOW FOR A CHANCE OF PRECIP TODAY. BERMUDA-LIKE SURFACE HIGH TO 
EAST ALSO ALLOWS SOME DEEPER MOISTURE TO INVADE OUR EXTREME SOUTHERN 
SECTIONS ALONG THE GEORGIA AND ALABAMA BORDERS. HAVE INCREASED POPS 
DOWN THERE TO 40-50 RANGE, AND ALONG THE NORTHERN PLATEAU TO 
30S-ISH, WHILE KEEPING OTHER POPS LARGELY UNCHANGED. LOWERED MAX 
TEMPS A FEW DEGREES EVERYWHERE DUE TO CLOUDS EXPECTED TODAY. DO NOT 
EXPECT WIDESPREAD RAINS, BUT DO EXPECT BRIEF HEAVY DOWNPOURS UNDER 
THUNDERSTORMS. FFG VALUES STILL SO HIGH THAT FLOODING IS NOT LIKELY 
AT THIS POINT. WILL, AS EVER, KEEP AN EYE OUT, THOUGH.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS INDICATING MOISTURE 
INCREASING FROM THE SOUTH ON MONDAY AS A SHORTWAVE APPROACHES TO 
REGION...WILL GO WITH 40 TO 50 POPS WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE 
SOUTH.  DEEP MOISTURE LINGERING INTO MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS 
ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION...WILL GO WITH 40 TO 50 
POPS AGAIN ON TUESDAY...WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE MOUNTAINS.  GFS 
STILL INDICATING A SERIES ON SHORTWAVES ROTATING OVER THE RIDGE THE 
REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED.  WILL GO WITH LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.  BEST CHANCES WILL BE IN THE AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING HOURS WITH SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY EXPECTED.  STAYED 
NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH...WITH

DAYS. AS A RESULT...INSTABILITY WILL SLOWLY INCREASE EACH DAY WITH 
SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION POSSIBLE ON SUNDAY...AND AN EVEN BETTER 
CHANCE ON MONDAY AS DEEP MOISTURE BECOMES ENTRENCHED OVER THE ENTIRE

FORECAST PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE 
A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES WILL TRACK THROUGH THE REGION THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED TIME FRAME. DETAILS...ESPECIALLY TIMING AND TRACK...OF EACH 
WAVE REMAIN IN QUESTION...BUT IN GENERAL SHOULD SEE UNSETTLED 
WEATHER THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD. BEST...STRONGEST OF THE WAVES 
IS EXPECTED IN THE AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD...AROUND THE TUESDAY 
TIME FAME. OTHERWISE...BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION EACH DAY REMAINS 
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. OVERALL...MADE LITTLE IN THE WAY OF 
CHANGES TO CURRENT FORECAST AND STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
357 AM EDT SAT JUL 14 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER NORTHERN 
NS THIS MORNING WILL MOVE EAST AND PASS TO THE SOUTH OF OUR AREA 
TODAY. MODELS SHOW THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE AND LIFT REMAINING JUST 
SOUTH OF THE TN BORDER...BUT A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS IN THE SOUTHERN 
VALLEY AND SW NC CANNOT BE RULED OUT...SO WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE 
POP THERE. IF HIGH CLOUDS CAN BREAK ENOUGH...THERE COULD BE ENOUGH 
DESTABILIZATION FOR TSTMS IN THE SOUTH...WHILE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF 
THE AREA WILL BE CAPPED BY A MIDLEVEL INVERSION. EXPECT THAT THE 
HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING WILL GIVE WAY BY THE 
AFTERNOON...ALLOWING TEMPS TO RISE INTO THE MID TO UPPER 80S IN THE 
VALLEY. THE TROUGH WILL BE EAST OF THE AREA BY MIDNIGHT SO WILL END 
ALL POPS BEFORE THAT TIME. THERE DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE ENOUGH 
MOISTURE OR LIFT TO SUSTAIN SHOWERS OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS INDICATING MOISTURE 
INCREASING FROM THE SOUTH ON SUNDAY WITH THE NAM BRINGING MORE 
MOISTURE THAN THE GFS.  WITH THE DRY AIR IN PLACE...WENT WITH THE  
DRIER GFS AND KEPT ONLY 20-30 POPS FOR SUNDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES 
IN THE SOUTH.  A DEEPER TROUGH MOVES IN ON MONDAY BRINGING GOOD 
MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH IT.  WILL BUMP UP POPS TO HIGH CHANCES FOR 
MONDAY.  GFS INDICATING A SERIES ON SHORTWAVES ROTATING OVER THE 
RIDGE THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED.  WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR 
TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.  BEST CHANCES WILL BE IN THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING HOURS WITH SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY EXPECTED.  STAYED NEAR 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT FRI JUL 13 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A 
MORE HUMID AIR MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. 
LIGHT RAIN FROM EARLIER THIS AFTERNOON HAS JUST ABOUT EXITED THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH ITS ASSOCIATED SHORT WAVE...BUT WILL MAINTAIN 
SMALL POPS FOR THIS EVENING TO ACCOUNT FOR POSSIBLE ISOLATED 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT AS TEMPS WARM SOME MORE BEFORE SUNSET. 
DEWPOINTS SHOULD CONTINUE TO SLOWLY RISE OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS...AS 
SOUTHERLY FLOW BRINGS MORE MOISTURE INTO THE REGION. AS A RESULT... 
INCREASED INSTABILITY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC SHOULD 
RESULT IN SOME DIURNAL CONVECTION ON SATURDAY...WITH A CHANCE 
AREAWIDE ON SUNDAY AS DEWPOINTS AND INSTABILITY CONTINUE TO SLOWLY 
INCREASE. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES WILL 
MOVE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE EXTENDED. 
THIS WILL KEEP AN UNSETTLED WEATHER FORECAST GOING THROUGH THE 
PERIOD. WE WILL SEE AN INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD...AND WITH NORMAL DAYTIME INSTABILITY...BEST CHANCES OF 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS. AS A RESULT... 
WILL GENERALLY HAVE NEAR 30 POPS DAYTIME AND 20 POPS OVERNIGHT 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE EXTENDED. MODEL GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE AND 
WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES CLOSE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT FRI JUL 13 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY AND OVER THE CAROLINA COAST...WITH A WEAK AREA OF HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA IN BETWEEN THESE FRONTS. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL SOME SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ASSOCIATED 
WITH A DECAYING MCS AND AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. WITH A VERY DRY 
BOUNDARY LAYER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...MOST OF THIS RAIN IS 
EVAPORATING BEFORE REACHING THE GROUND...AS MOST OB SITES ARE
REPORTING VERY LIGHT RAIN OR SPRINKLES. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE 
FORECAST AREA IS CURRENTLY LOCATED UNDER THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION 
OF A 300 MB JET STREAK...WHICH IS HELPING TO CREATE SOME ADDITIONAL 
LIFT ACROSS THE REGION. THIS LIFT SHOULD CONTINUE INTO THE EARLY 
AFTERNOON HOURS BEFORE DIMINISHING AS THE SHORT WAVE EXITS THE 
REGION. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO RAISE 
POPS SOME TO ACCOUNT FOR THE BETTER COVERAGE OF RAIN. WILL ALSO 
LOWER MAXES SOME FOR THIS AFTERNOON...SINCE EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER 
SHOULD CONTINUE FOR AWHILE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
406 AM EDT FRI JUL 13 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME LIGHT RAIN FROM A DECAYING 
MCS IS MOVING ACROSS SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN EARLY THIS MORNING. THIS 
PRECIP WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF OUR AREA...MAINLY 
THIS MORNING...AND PROVIDE PLENTY OF MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS. 
MEANWHILE A SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER THE NRN MS VALLEY AND A JET STREAK 
OVER THE SRN GREAT LAKES REGION WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST...AND THESE 
FEATURES WILL AFFECT NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. THE NAM POSITIONS THE JET OVER THE MID 
APPALACHIANS...PUTTING SW VA AND NE TN IN THE ENTRANCE REGION AROUND 
00Z. RESULTING UPPER DIVERGENCE AND PASSAGE OF A VORT MAX SHOULD 
BRING SOME SHOWERS...THOUGH WITH INSTABILITY BEING VERY 
LIMITED...EXPECT COVERAGE TO BE ISOLATED. GFS ALSO SHOWS LESS LIFT 
THAN THE NAM WITH THE TROUGH PASSAGE. GIVEN THE AMOUNT OF CLOUD 
COVER TODAY...ESPECIALLY SOUTH...AND WEAK MID LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES...WILL ONLY MENTION ISOLATED TSTMS NORTH THIS AFTN WITH JUST 
SHOWERS ELSEWHERE. WARMEST TEMPS MAY BE IN THE NORTH TODAY WHERE 
SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS WILL BE POSSIBLE. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS BRING A WEAK 
SHORTWAVE INTO THE AREA LATE ON SATURDAY...BUT MOISTURE IS LIMITED.  
WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND OUR SOUTHERN 
COUNTIES WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY RESIDES.  A FRONT 
MOVES IN FROM THE NORTH ON SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT IT DISSIPATES BEFORE 
REACHING OUR CWA.  BUT MOISTURE ON THE INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH ON 
SUNDAY WITH A SERIES ON SHORTWAVES ROTATING OVER THE RIDGE THE 
REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED.  WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON FOR OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES...THEN CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE CWA FOR MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.  BEST CHANCES WILL BE IN THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS WITH SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY 
EXPECTED.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

928 PM EDT THU JUL 12 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CONVECTIVE SYSTEM BRINGING PRECIP TO WESTERN TN AND AREAS
SOUTH...AND IS WEAKENING AS IT MOVES EAST. WITH MUCH DRIER AIR IN
PLACE OVER OUR AREA...THINK WEAKENING TREND WILL CONTINUE AND DO
NOT EXPECT ANY THUNDER TO MAKE IT THIS FAR EAST TONIGHT.
HOWEVER...A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS OR SPRINKLES MAY MAKE IT INTO
SOUTHERN ZONES LATER TONIGHT AND EARLY TOMORROW...SO WILL ADD
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO THESE AREAS. WILL BEEF UP CLOUDS A BIT AS
WELL...AND MAKE A FEW OTHER TWEAKS TO THE DATABASE. UPDATE OUT
SOON.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT THU JUL 12 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN UNSEASONABLY STRONG COLD FRONT ALONG THE GULF 
COAST...WITH A COOL AND VERY DRY AIR MASS (FOR JULY) OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS DRY AIR MASS WILL INHIBIT ANY CONVECTION 
TONIGHT...AND SHOULD LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT 
TOMORROW AS AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. 
MODELS INDICATE SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY DEVELOPING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON...BUT LIMITED MOISTURE SHOULD 
KEEP ANY CONVECTION SCATTERED AT BEST. SOUNDINGS REVEAL A DEEP 
INVERTED-V SHAPED PROFILE IN THE LOWER-LEVELS...WHICH COULD HELP TO 
PRODUCE SOME STRONG GUSTY WINDS WITH ANY CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS. A 
TYPICAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN WILL THEN SETTLE OVER THE REGION FOR THE 
WEEKEND...WITH A BERMUDA HIGH OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC AND ISOLATED 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...ESPECIALLY 
NEAR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...GOING INTO A FAIRLY UNSETTLED 
WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE EXTENDED. AN UPPER TROUGH WILL BE OVER THE 
EASTERN U.S. WITH A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES AND A FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
MOVING THROUGH DURING THE PERIOD. MODEL AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY 
POOR AND CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON DETAILS BUT WILL GENERALLY CONTINUE 
WITH 20 TO 30 POPS THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD AND STAYED NEAR 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS.
