AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EDT THU JUL 12 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PERIOD AS SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. REGION REMAINS 
IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AS AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH REMAINS ANCHORED 
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE CONUS. MAIN CHALLENGE FOR THE SHORT 
TERM IS DECIDING ON POTENTIAL ONSET OF PRECIP BY LATE IN THE SECOND 
PERIOD AS QUITE EXTENSIVE DIFFERENCES EXIST BETWEEN GFS AND 
WRF...WITH GFS BRINING LIGHT PRECIP INTO OUR WESTERN TIER BY 12Z 
FRIDAY. WRF KEEPS AREA DRY PAST 12Z. INCLINATION IS TO FAVOR WRF AND 
KEEP THURSDAY NIGHT PERIOD DRY AS SREF TENDS TO SUPPORT THE WRF 
TIMING. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE CLOSELY.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...CONFIDENCE BECOMES 
GENERALLY LOW BEYOND SATURDAY...GIVEN DIFFERING MODEL SOLUTIONS.  
GFS MAY SUFFER FROM FEEDBACK AS IT OFFERS MUCH DIFFERENT TIMING 
OF ANY CONVECTIVE PRECIP...KEEPING DEEPER RH TO OUR SOUTH AND 
OFFERING A DRY DAY FOR SATURDAY. UPPER FLOW BECOMES WEAK SW WITH 
SOME TROUGHINESS FROM SRN PLAINS INTO LOWER MISS VALLEY BY SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY...AGAIN MAKING FOR A DIFFICULT FORECAST IN TIMING 
POSSIBLE WEAK IMPULSES ALONG WITH TYPICAL DIURNAL CONVECTION.

FOR FRIDAY THERE IS SOME AGREEMENT...WITH SOME WEAK UPPER LEVEL 
SUPPORT AND POSSIBLE SURFACE TROUGH...JUSTIFYING PREVIOUS 40 PERCENT 
POPS. A BLEND OF MODEL SOLUTIONS FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...AS WELL 
AS MESHING IN WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES GRIDS...SO MADE SOME SLIGHT 
ADJUSTMENTS TO PREVIOUS POP/WX GRIDS.

OTHERWISE...NO CHANGES MADE FROM MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WITH 
PRELIMINARY GRIDS MADE FOR NEW DAY 7 (THURSDAY). MAX/MIN TEMPS 
ADJUSTED IN LINE WITH LATEST GFSX MOS NUMBERS.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS

FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A BROAD UPPER 
TROUGH OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY WILL PUSH THIS FRONT THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THIS EVENING. DRIER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR WILL 
THEN SLOWLY FILTER INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT INTO

DENSE OR WIDESPREAD OVERNIGHT. THUS...WILL PLAN TO MENTION ONLY 
PATCHY FOG IN THE ZONES. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE VALUES ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS SHOW ANOTHER 
SHORT-WAVE ROTATING DOWN TO THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEAST UNITED STATES FOR FRIDAY. ASSOCIATED 
SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL SWEEP SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON PRODUCING SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 
LATEST GFS SOLUTION DIVERGES FROM OLD GFS ENSEMBLE AND ECMWF IN 
REGARD TO CONVECTION RETURNING FOR THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
THE NEW GFS IS MUCH MORE BULLISH.

WILL MAINTAIN FORECAST OF STALLING FRONT ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES
UNTIL NORTHEAST UPPER TROUGH LIFTS OUT BY EARLY NEXT WEEK, WHICH WILL
ALLOW RETURN OF MOISTURE BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR LATE
SUNDAY INTO NEXT WEEK. MAIN LIFTING WILL BE FROM LOCAL TERRAIN 
FEATURES.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED 00Z GFS TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

258 AM EDT WED JUL 11 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STILL ON TRACK FOR SIGNIFICANT

EXCEEDING TWO INCHES PER WRF) SO ANTICIPATE GENERAL RAINFALL TO

BY TONIGHT TAKING MOST OF THE PRECIP WITH IT. HAVE GENERALLY GONE 
DRY AFTER 00Z THURSDAY WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE FAR EASTERN 
MOUNTAIN ZONES. FOR TEMPS...HAD NO REASON TO SIGNIFICANTLY DEVIATE 
FROM GFS GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES 
MADE FOR THESE PERIODS TO FORECAST GRIDS...AS PATTERN STILL LOOKS TO 
HAVE UPPER RIDGE IN THE WEST AND LONG WAVE TROUGH IN THE EAST. A 
DECENT FRONTAL PASSAGE FOR WEDS NIGHT WILL BRING DRY AND WARM WEATHER
FOR THURSDAY. SHORTWAVE EARLY FRIDAY LOOKS TO BRING BETTER COVERAGE 
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THAN PREVIOUS GRIDS...SO FOR NOW 
INCREASED POPS TO JUST BELOW 50 PERCENT FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 

CONVECTION LOOKS TO BE MORE ISOLATED AND DIURNAL IN NATURE FROM 
SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...BUT NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO REMOVE LOW 
POPS WHERE THEY EXISTED IN GRIDS FOR NOW. WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL 
FLOW RETURNS BY TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY (NEW DAY 7)...SO SHOULD SEE
A SLIGHT INCREASE IN AT LEAST AFTERNOON/EVENING CONVECTION. ADDED 
SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS FOR WEDNESDAY...AND OTHERWISE JUST TWEAKED 
MAX/MIN TEMPS GRIDS IN LINE WITH 11/00Z GFSX MOS.

316 PM EDT TUE JUL 10 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...RADAR INDICATING 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA AHEAD OF A 
SHORTWAVE.  STILL SOME DECENT INSTABILITY AHEAD OF IT.  COULD SEE

THE EVENING HOURS.  BETTER CHANCE ARE EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY AS A 
FRONT TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION...ALONG WITH GOOD MOISTURE AND 
DECENT INSTABILITY.  LOW LEVEL JET ALSO INCREASING.  WILL GO WITH 
CATEGORICAL POPS FOR WEDNESDAY.  SHOULD ALSO SEE A BETTER CHANCE FOR 
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS.  STAYED NEAR MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A DEEP UPPER TROUGH 
WILL BE FIRMLY ENTRENCHED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HUDSON BAY WITH 
UNSEASONABLY COOL AIR OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND SPREADING INTO THE 
NORTHEAST UNITED STATES BY WEDNESDAY EVENING. A FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT 
COLD FRONT WILL BE JUST SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST BY WEDNESDAY 
EVENING WITH CONVECTION COMING TO AN END BEFORE MIDNIGHT. COLD FRONT 
WILL SETTLE SOUTH TO NEAR THE GULF COAST BEFORE BECOMING STATIONARY 
WITH DRIER AIR AND PLEASANT TEMPERATURES FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE 
WEEK AS SURFACE RIDGE AND NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT DOMINATES.

MEDIUM RANGE MODELS SHOW ANOTHER WAVE ROTATING AROUND DEEP UPPER 
TROUGH ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND NORTHERN OHIO VALLEY FOR FRIDAY.  
ASSOCIATED BOUNDARY WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FOR FRIDAY. 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED...BUT ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO 
PRODUCE A CHANCE OF MAINLY AFTERNOON-EARLY EVENING CONVECTION.

MODELS SHOW DEEP UPPER TROUGH LIFTING NORTHEAST. HOWEVER...OPERATIONAL
GFS SHOWS A WEAK SHEAR AXIS OVER THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY 
SUNDAY. CONFIDENCE OF THIS FEATURE IS LOW. WILL SHOW SOME RETURN 
MOISTURE AS NORTHEAST UPPER TROUGH LIFTS OUT WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
RETURNING FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK....

312 PM EDT MON JUL 9 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...RADAR INDICATING ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS FIRING UP AHEAD OF A SHORTWAVE...MAINLY 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE CWA.  WILL KEEP 30 POPS FOR OUR 
SOUTHERN ZONES AND THE MOUNTAINS AND 20 ELSEWHERE.  ACTIVITY SHOULD 
DIMINSH AFTER SUNSET WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.  MODELS 
INDICATE A DEEPER SHORTWAVE MOVING IN LATE TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.  
WILL ADD 20-30 POPS FOR LATE TONIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCES HOLDING 
OFF UNTIL TUESDAY.  STAYED NEAR MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH 
ACROSS EASTERN CANADA (SOUTHERN HUDSON BAY) WILL BE THE MAIN FEATURE 
OF INTEREST FOR THE FORECAST AREA FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED. 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY 
AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT PRODUCING THE BEST CHANCES OF WIDESPREAD 
CONVECTION. ENSEMBLES SHOW GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS FEATURES SO 
CONFIDENCE IS HIGHER THAN NORMAL WITH FROPA. WILL UP POPS TO LIKELY 
MOST LOCATIONS FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

FOR THURSDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND...FRONT STALLS ACROSS THE GULF 
COAST STATES WITH A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES RIDING ALONG THE BOUNDARY 
KEEPING CONVECTION ACTIVE...GENERALLY SOUTH OF CHA. WILL CALL FOR 
BEST CHANCES OF CONVECTION OVER THE SOUTHERN AND SOUTHEAST SECTIONS 
OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS FOR NORTH AND 
NORTHWEST SECTIONS.

DUE TO PATTERN CHANGE TO NORTHWEST FLOW AND AGREEMENT AMONG ENSEMBLES...
HAVE GENERALLY ACCEPTED GFX GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EDT MON JUL 9 2007

.DISCUSSION...RADAR INDICATING A FEW SHOWERS TRACKING ACROSS 
NORTHERN AL/GA WHICH ARE DISSIPATING AS THE MOVE NORTH INTO OUR 
CWA.  MOST OF ACTIVITY SHOULD STAY SOUTH TODAY WHICH IS HANDLED WELL 
BY THE CURRENT FORECAST...NO NEED TO CHANGE POPS FOR TODAY.   
TEMPERATURES ALSO APPEAR ON  TRACK.  WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE 
MORNING WORDING...REST OF FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...WEAK MID TO UPPER LEVEL 
CIRCULATION OVER OK THIS MORNING STARTING TO SPREAD A LITTLE 
MOISTURE EASTWARD INTO THE LOWER MISS VALLEY REGION...WHILE SKIES 
HOLDING GENERALLY MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY ACROSS OUR REGION.

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATED DEW POINT TEMPS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 
70S ACROSS EXTREME SRN PARTS OF EAST TN INTO SW NC...WHILE STILL 
FINDING MUCH LOWER DEW POINT TEMPS JUST IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S 
ACROSS SWRN VA. 

THINKING THAT ONCE AGAIN THE NAM-WRF IS OVERDOING CONVECTIVE 
PRECIPITATION IN ADVANCE OF THE WEAK UPPER LOW/TROUGH TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AS IT PERFORMED POORLY WITH THE GULF COAST SYSTEM OVER THE 
WEEKEND. THUS...WILL KEEP POPS RATHER LOW FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT
AND MOSTLY CONFINED TO SRN THIRD AND THE FOOTHILLS AND MOUNTAINS OF 
EAST TN. PREVIOUS POP GRIDS GENERALLY ACCEPTED WITH SLIGHT 
ADJUSTMENTS...TRENDED PRETTY MUCH IN LINE WITH GFS SOLUTION.

FOR TUESDAY...09/00Z GFS/NAM-WRF AND LATEST ECMWF SHOW SOME ENERGY 
OR WEAK IMPULSE TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE TUESDAY MORNING
...AND MOVING EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA IN THE AFTERNOON. 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS WELL TO OUR NORTH...BUT DAYTIME HEATING AND 
UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT MAY WARRANT LIKELY POPS FOR TUESDAY. FOR NOW
I INCREASED POPS TO NEAR 50 PERCENT ACROSS THE BOARD AND ADDED 
SCATTERED AREAL QUALIFIER. 

MOISTURE SLOWLY INCREASING PER MODEL TIME HEIGHTS...BUT THINK MAX 
TEMPS SHOULD REACH NEAR THE GFS MOS VALUES TODAY. MOS BLEND OR CLOSE 
TO GFS MINS TONIGHT...THEN A BIT COOLER ON TUESDAY IF SCATTERED 
CONVECTION DEVELOPS...SO STUCK CLOSE TO GFS MAXES FOR TUESDAY.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

MOISTURE EASTWARD INTO THE LOWER MISS VALLEY REGION...WHILE SKIES 
HOLDING GENERALLY MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY ACROSS OUR REGION.

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATED DEW POINT TEMPS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 
70S ACROSS EXTREME SRN PARTS OF EAST TN INTO SW NC...WHILE STILL 
FINDING MUCH LOWER DEW POINT TEMPS JUST IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S 
ACROSS SWRN VA. 

THINKING THAT ONCE AGAIN THE NAM-WRF IS OVERDOING CONVECTIVE 
PRECIPITATION IN ADVANCE OF THE WEAK UPPER LOW/TROUGH TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AS IT PERFORMED POORLY WITH THE GULF COAST SYSTEM OVER THE 
WEEKEND. THUS...WILL KEEP POPS RATHER LOW FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT
AND MOSTLY CONFINED TO SRN THIRD AND THE FOOTHILLS AND MOUNTAINS OF 
EAST TN. PREVIOUS POP GRIDS GENERALLY ACCEPTED WITH SLIGHT 
ADJUSTMENTS...TRENDED PRETTY MUCH IN LINE WITH GFS SOLUTION.

FOR TUESDAY...09/00Z GFS/NAM-WRF AND LATEST ECMWF SHOW SOME ENERGY 
OR WEAK IMPULSE TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE TUESDAY MORNING
...AND MOVING EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA IN THE AFTERNOON. 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS WELL TO OUR NORTH...BUT DAYTIME HEATING AND 
UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT MAY WARRANT LIKELY POPS FOR TUESDAY. FOR NOW
I INCREASED POPS TO NEAR 50 PERCENT ACROSS THE BOARD AND ADDED 
SCATTERED AREAL QUALIFIER. 

MOISTURE SLOWLY INCREASING PER MODEL TIME HEIGHTS...BUT THINK MAX 
TEMPS SHOULD REACH NEAR THE GFS MOS VALUES TODAY. MOS BLEND OR CLOSE 
TO GFS MINS TONIGHT...THEN A BIT COOLER ON TUESDAY IF SCATTERED 
CONVECTION DEVELOPS...SO STUCK CLOSE TO GFS MAXES FOR TUESDAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DEEP LOW FORECAST IN 
GREAT LAKES SHOULD KEEP WEATHER A LITTLE MORE UNSETTLED AND A LITTLE 
COOLER DURING THESE PERIODS SOUTHWARD INTO THIS AREA.  FORECASTING 
FRONTAL PASSAGES WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH MODERATE 
INSTABILITY EXPECTED BOTH DAYS.  HAVE GONE WITH HIGHEST POPS ON AND 
CLOSE TO THOSE DAYS.   ADDITIONALLY...WILL PROBABLY HAVE WEAK 
PERIODIC SHORT WAVES IN NWLY FLOW ALOFT THROUGHOUT THIS PERIOD TO 
HELP INCREASE CLOUDS AND POPS BETWEEN FRONTAL PASSES...SO ITS 
DIFFICULT TO FIND PLACES TO CUT POPS OUT DURING DAY TIME.  LOWEST 
POPS ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY NIGHT. 

FOR TEMPERATURES...WENT A LITTLE ABOVE GUIDANCE IMMEDIATELY PRIOR TO 
FRONTAL PASSAGES AND SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE FOR POST-FRONTAL TEMPS 
DUE TO BIASES OVER LAST 6 WEEKS OR SO.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT SUN JUL 8 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...A TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE
WILL LINGER ACROSS GA TONIGHT. THE TROUGH WILL WEAKEN AND DRIFT NE.
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD W FM THE ATLC INTO THE N GLFMEX THROUGH THE 
PERIOD. THIS RESULTS IN AN INCREASINGLY SW FLOW OVER THE MRX CWA. 
SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL MOVE IN THIS FLOW. A GOOD CHANCE OF PCPN 
MATERIALIZES TUE AND TUE NGT AS A STRENGTHENING WAVE MOVES UP IN 
ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH FROM THE NW. PREFER THE DRIER 
GFS THROUGH MON NGT THEN USED A BLEND TUE/TUE NGT. DPS MIX DOWN TO 
THE MID 60S IN THE AFTN BUT RISE BACK TO THE UPPER 60S/LOWER 70S 
OVERNIGHT. AFTN HEAT INDICES IN THE MID 90S WILL BE COMMON AFTER 
MUGGY MORNS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS INDICATING A 
SHORTWAVE ROTATING THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  SOME LINGERING 
MOISTURE AVAILABLE ALONG WITH SOME DIURNAL INSTABILITY.  WILL GO 
WITH CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY.  BEST CHANCES SHOULD BE IN THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.  A FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  SHOULD HAVE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE TO 
KEEP 30-40 POPS GOING FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  FRONT 
SHIFTS SOUTH OF THE AREA ON FRIDAY.  STILL MAY SEE SOME ACTIVITY ON 
EARLY FRIDAY...SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY MORNING.  
DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND CONTINUING INTO FRIDAY 
NIGHT.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE APPROACHES THE REGION ON SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY.  STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE THAT IS 
AVAILABLE...SO WILL GO WITH ONLY 20 POPS FOR BOTH DAYS.  STAYED  
NEAR GFSX/HPC FOR TEMPERATURES.

1030 AM EDT SUN JUL 8 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SATELLITE PICS HOW GENERALLY 
DRIER AIR WORKING INTO THE FORECAST AREA...WITH LOW PRESSURE WELL TO 
OUR SOUTH THIS MORNING AND MOVING ALMOST DUE EAST. THIS WAS CLEARLY 
BETTER DEPICTED BY THE 07/00Z GFS MODEL...ALTHOUGH SPOTTY CONVECTION 
DID AFFECT SE TN AND SW NC YESTERDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

MODELS IN BETTER AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH MAINLY LOW 
CHANCES OF DIURNAL CONVECTION ACROSS SOUTHERN THIRD OF FORECAST AREA 
AND ALSO IN THE SMOKY MTNS. DID LOWER POPS FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL 
HOURS GIVEN LATEST RADARS...AND ALSO DECREASED POPS SOME OVER 
CENTRAL PARTS OF THE AREA LATER THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON.

SOME DRYING ACROSS SE TN SHOULD EQUATE TO UPPER 80S OR NEAR 90 
DEGREES FOR CHA MAX (AFTER COOL 82 DEGS YESTERDAY). GENERALLY LEANED 
TOWARD A MOS BLEND FOR HIGHS TODAY AND LOWS TONIGHT.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...RIDGING BUILDS IN MORE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MONDAY BUT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE STILL 
ACROSS SOUTHERN SECTIONS AND MOUNTAINS. WILL DROP POPS FOR THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY BUT KEEP POPS SOUTHERN VALLEY AND 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS. A WEAK UPPER LOW OVER AR/MO MAY HELP BRING 
MOISTURE NORTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AND STRONGER SOUTHERLY 
FLOW FROM THE GULF AS UPPER HIGH BUILDS OVER FLORIDA AND THE EASTERN 
GULF WILL HELP. LOW CHANCE POPS ALL AREAS TUESDAY AND CONTINUE THE 
POPS WEDNESDAY AS UPPER TROUGHING IS OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND A 
COLD FRONT BEGINS TO DROP SOUTH FROM THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS FRONT 
MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY AND THEN BECOMES NEARLY 
STATIONARY THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST WHICH IS GOOD NEWS SINCE 
RAIN CHANCES WILL REMAIN HIGHER THAN THEY HAVE BEEN LATELY FOR 
SEVERAL DAYS. WILL FOLLOW MAV GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES WITH THE 
NAM/WRF TOO WARM MONDAY NIGHT AND TOO COOL TUESDAY WITH TOO MUCH 
CLOUD COVER AND PRECIPITATION.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 AM EDT SAT JUL 7 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY COULD BE 
DRAWN ACROSS NRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA...GIVEN THE DEW POINT 
TEMPS IN THE 50S OVER SWRN VA AND MID TO UPR 60S ACROSS SRN THIRD OF 
THE AREA THIS MORNING. OTHER FEATURE OF PERHAPS MORE CONCERN (AND 
CERTAINLY MORE DEVIATION ON MODELS HANDLING OF)...IS THE AREA OF 
LOW PRESSURE OVER SRN AR AND NRN LA. THINK THAT THE FRONT IS TOO 
WEAK OF A FEATURE...AND THE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TOO FAR AWAY TODAY
...SO LOOK FOR MAINLY SOME POSSIBLE DIURNAL CONVECTION OVER MAINLY 
SRN MOST AREAS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS 
LOOKED LIKE A GOOD COMPROMISE AND ALSO MESHED WELL WITH NEIGHBORING 
OFFICES GRIDS.

MODELS DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM SUNDAY ON WITH THE LOW PRESSURE 
AREA TO OUR SW...WITH A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE WET NAM-WRF AND MUCH 
DRIER GFS SOLUTION...GENERALLY TOWARD THE ECMWF SOLUTION. 

OTHERWISE...STILL NOTING A SIGNIFICANT COOL BIAS ON GFS MOS MAX 
TEMPS (GENERALLY AT LEAST 1 TO 3 DEGREES TOO COOL) ESPECIALLY FOR 
CHA AND TYS. THUS...KEPT HIGHS TODAY A LITTLE ABOVE THE GFS MAXES.
MINS TONIGHT NEAR A BLEND SEEMED BEST CHOICE...ALTHO CLEARER SKIES 
AND DRIER AIR OVER EXTREME NE TN AND SW VA FAVORS CLOSER TO COOLER 
GFS MINS THERE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WILL APPLY PERSISTENCE
FORECAST FOR SUNDAY AS MODELS DIVERGE WITH TRACK OF WEAK UPPER LOW
NOW OVER LOWER MS VALLEY. NAM/WRF BRINGS THIS SYSTEM QUICKLY
NORTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY BY SUNDAY AND THEN ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TO THE MID ATLANTIC SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY. THE GFS HAS THE UPPER LOW OR WEAKNESS MOVE JUST TO THE
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY AND INTO THE CAROLINAS SUNDAY
NIGHT. IT HAS THE PRECIPITATION CONFINED TO MAINLY SE TN AND SW NC.
MONDAY DRIER AIR MOVES IN WITH PRECIPITATION OUT. THE GFS BRINGS IN
ANOTHER WEAK UPPER LOW TOWARDS TN TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY BEFORE COLD
FRONT APPROACHES THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. WILL APPLY PERSISTENCE
FORECAST FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY AND COMBINE MODELS KEEPING LOW POPS
SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. FOR TEMPERATURES FOLLOWING
CLOSE TO THE WARMER MAV NUMBERS FOR HIGHS AND COOLER LOWS. NAM/WRF
NUMBERS RUNNING MUCH COOLER FOR MAXES BECAUSE OF CLOUDS AND
PRECIPITATION. GENERAL INCREASE IN POPS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY TO
CHANCE EVERYWHERE. NEXT FRONT THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY MAY PROVIDE MORE
WIDESPREAD RAIN BUT THIS TIME OF YEAR NOT THAT EXCITED ABOUT IT YET.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  89  70  90  70  92 /  30  20  30  10  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    90  68  90  70  91 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            89  67  90  69  92 /  10  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   88  64  89  65  90 /  10  10  10  10  10 
&&

252 PM EDT FRI JUL 6 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...A QUASI-STATIONARY

TRACKING S OF AREA RESULTING IN MINIMAL RAINFALL. A MORE NORTHERLY
TRACK IS POSSIBLE AND POPS COULD BE INCREASED WITH LATER PACKAGES. 
TEMPS WILL BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES ON THE WARM SIDE.  

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS BRING AN SHORTWAVE 
INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY.  LATEST RUNS INDICATING NAM BRINGING MORE 
MOISTURE AND IS MUCH QUICKER THAN GFS.  WITH A RIDGE PLACE WILL GO 
WITH THE SLOWER GFS...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR MONDAY.  WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY WITH THE 
DISTURBANCE MOVING THROUGH THE CWA.  UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWS ON 
WEDNESDAY.  SOME MOISTURE AND DIURNAL INSTABILITY EXPECTED WITH IT.  
WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS ON WEDNESDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.  A FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION ON 
THURSDAY.  SHOULD HAVE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE TO KEEP THE 30 POPS GOING 
FOR THURSDAY.  FRONT PUSHES OUT OF AREA ON FRIDAY WITH DRIER AIR 
FILTERING IN BEHIND IT.  MAY SEE SOME ACTIVITY EARLY ON FRIDAY...SO 
WILL GO WITH 20 POPS FOR FRIDAY FOR NOW.  STAYED NEAR GFS/HPC FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EDT FRI JUL 6 2007

.DISCUSSION...WILL UPDATE FORECAST TO INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY
ACROSS S PART OF MRX CWA. DIFFERENTIAL HEATING BOUNDARY SETTING
UP FOR THIS AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE...TEMPS OFF TO S SLOW START BUT
SHOULD RISE TO FCST MAXS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FAIR AMOUNT OF CONVECTION 
LINGERS AT FORECAST ISSUANCE...LIKELY ASSOCIATED WITH OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARIES AND SOME UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT FROM JET TO THE NORTH. THE 
SURFACE COLD FRONT...BASED ON 07Z SURFACE CHARTS...LOOKS TO STILL BE 
WELL TO OUR NORTH (POSSIBLY NOT EVEN INTO MUCH OF KY YET).  

SCATTERED COVERAGE OF TSRA CURRENTLY ACROSS ALL BUT SW VA...SE TN 
AND SW NC AREAS...COVERED IN GRIDS AND ALSO IN SHORT TERM FORECAST.
OTHERWISE...STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR POPS LATER TODAY INTO 
THE EVENING HOURS. MOS NUMBERS WERE VERY CLOSE FOR THURSDAY HIGHS...
SO STAYED CLOSE TO OR WITH GFS MOS FOR TODAY. FOR MINS...CHECKED 
LATEST MOS BIAS FOR MIN TEMPS AND MADE THOSE ADJUSTMENTS TO MOS FOR 
TONIGHT.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL HAVE 
DROPPED SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY MORNING BUT THE 
WEAKNESS IN THE UPPER FLOW TO THE WEST IS PROGGED TO BE OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST SATURDAY WITH SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING ALONG THE SOUTHERN 
BORDER. THIS MAY INTERACT WITH THE FRONT AND BRING IT BACK NORTH 
INTO THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. FOR SUNDAY MOISTURE WILL LINGER ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS SO ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE AS WEAKNESS IN UPPER FLOW 
CONTINUES. THURSDAY A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
SO THE CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION MAY INCREASE. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD.  &&

OVERTAKING FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND ENHANCING CONVECTION ACROSS MID KY.

EVENING AND WILL LIKELY WEAKEN AS IT PROGRESSES INTO THE DRIER 
AIRMASS OF THE EASTERN RIDGE. SHORT WAVE WILL CONTINUE TO TREK SE 
AND HEIGHTS OVER THE E TN VLY LOWER SLIGHTLY THROUGH SATURDAY. 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SAG SE INTO MRX CWA FRI AND LOSE IDENTITY OVR 
S PART OF CWA BY FRI EVE. WENT ABOVE BELOW CLIMO MOS POPS FOR FRI 
FEELING AIRMASS TSTMS A GOOD BET. FROM THIS POINT ON FAVOR A GFS 
SOLUTION...SIMILAR TO HPC...WHICH DEPICTS A WEAK WAVE AT TAIL OF 
BOUNDARY VCNTY TX. THIS WAVE WORKS NE ALONG BOUNDARY AND MAY 
INCREASE CLOUDS AND CONVECTION ACROSS S PART OF MRX CWA SAT AND SAT 
NGT.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS INDICATING WAVE 
PUSHING THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY WITH THE NAM INDICATING THE 
DEEPEST MOISTURE ACROSS OUR CWA.  WILL GO WITH THE DRIER GFS AND 
KEEP SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE APPROACHING ON MONDAY.  
LATEST RUN DRIER THAT PREVIOUS ONE...BUT WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS GOING FOR NOW.  AN INVERTED TROUGH APPROACHES THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY AND LINGERS INTO WEDNESDAY.  BETTER MOISTURE AND DIURNAL 
INSTABILITY ALSO EXPECTED WITH IT.  WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS ON 
BOTH TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING HOURS.  A FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION ON LATE THURSDAY.  
MAY BE LATE IN THE DAY BEFORE ARRIVING...BUT WITH ADD 30 POPS FOR 
THURSDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 051433
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EDT THU JUL 5 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. EAST EDGE OF KY
MORNING CONVECTION LOSING STEAM WHILE STRENGTHENING TO THE WEST. 
THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD MAKE ITS WAY IN MRX CWA LATER TODAY FAVORING 
NORTHERN LOCALES. SON 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD 
SLOWLY SAG SOUTHWARD INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE 
SHORT TERM.  ASSOCIATED MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL ACCOMPANY THE 
BOUNDARY AND CONVECTION CURRENTLY REMAINING JUST TO OUR NORTH.  
OVERALL...NOT IMPRESSED WITH SYSTEM...THOUGH BEST CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION REMAINS OVER NORTHERN AREAS AND HAVE INCREASED POPS TO 
LIKELY IN SOME NORTHERN LOCATIONS.  HOWEVER...COHESIVE BOUNDARY AND 
CONVECTION WILL STRUGGLE TO PUSH INTO SOUTHERN AREAS AND WILL KEEP 
POPS LOW HERE.  

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS SHOW WEAK COLD FRONT 
MOVING SLOWLY SOUTH ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA FRIDAY. WILL MAINTAIN A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR THE SOUTH 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR FRIDAY.

WEAK RIDGING FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY BEFORE FRONTAL BOUNDARY
RETURNS NORTH ALONG WITH INCREASING TROPICAL MOISTURE FROM THE
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY FOR MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. HAVE
INCREASE POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE VARIETY FOR MONDAY NIGHT
AND TUESDAY. WOULD INCREASE POPS MORE...BUT CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW
ON HOW MUCH MOISTURE RETURNS NORTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.
GFS SEEMS OVER-DONE ON MOISTURE RETURN.

ANOTHER FRONT MAY MOVE TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA BY MID-WEEK NEXT
WEEK...SO HAVE CONTINUED POPS INTO WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE
WITH THIS SYSTEM LOW.

HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  

LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE 
WEAKENING COLD FRONT WILL PUSH SOUTH INTO THE REGION DURING THE LATE 
THU INTO FRIDAY TIME FRAME.  MODEL TREND...ESPECIALLY WITH THE 
GFS...HAS BEEN DRIER WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND GIVEN THE DROUGHT WE ARE 
IN WILL ONLY CARRY CHANCE POPS THU AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
NORTH...SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE ALL ZONES FRIDAY.  
GFS INDICATES DRIER AIR OVER THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK.  WHILE CERTAINLY CAN NOT RULE OUT ISOLATED 
CONVECTION...ESPECIALLY OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN...WILL NOT ARGUE 
WITH CURRENT FORECAST AND WILL KEEP THINGS DRY UNTIL MONDAY...WHEN 
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE NORTH AND MOUNTAINS. WILL CARRY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES TUE AS NEXT WEAK FRONT MAY BE 
APPROACHING.  WILL NOT ARGUE MUCH WITH GFS MOS TEMPS...JUST A FEW 
TWEAKS HERE AND THERE.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 031857
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EDT TUE JUL 3 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES ACROSS 
THE WESTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY WITH A TROUGH ALONG THE EAST COAST. 
UPPER FLOW AROUND THE LARGE RIDGE IS TAKING A SYSTEM FROM THE UPPER 
MIDWEST INTO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES. DEEPER MOISTURE LIES ALONG THE 
GULF COAST NEAR AN OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY. ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE 
IN THE LOW LEVELS. THIS HAS KEPT THE FORECAST AREA PARTLY TO MOSTLY 
CLOUDY WITH MILD TEMPERATURES TODAY. DEW POINTS HAVE RISEN FROM THE 
50S IN THE NORTH YESTERDAY TO THE LOWER 60S TODAY. AT MID AFTERNOON 
TEMPERATURES WERE ONLY IN THE UPPER 70S TO THE LOWER 80S. NAM/WRF 
AND THE RUC SHOWING WEAK SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING DOWN FROM THE GREAT 
LAKES THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. NO SHOWER ACTIVITY HAS DEVELOPED 
YET BUT AIRMASS IS SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE AND IF TEMPERATURES WARM A FEW 
MORE DEGREES CONVECTION MAY DEVELOP BEFORE EVENING. WEDNESDAY 
CONDITIONS LOOK TO BE NEARLY THE SAME BUT WITH A LITTLE MORE SUN AND 
SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES SO ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
ARE AGAIN POSSIBLE DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LINGERING MOISTURE 
WILL BRING SCATTERED PRECIPITATION MAINLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.  THE NEXT SOMEWHAT ORGANIZED 
SYSTEM SWINGS THROUGH THE REGION ON THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY WITH 
INCREASING RAIN CHANCES BUT THIS LOOKS FAIRLY WEAK...SIMILAR OR 
EVEN A LITTLE WEAKER THAN LAST WEEKS FRONT.  THE WEEKEND AT THIS 
TIME LOOKS MAINLY DRY WITH MOISTURE AGAIN RETURNING BY MONDAY WITH 
INCREASING POPS.  

FOR GUIDANCE MODELS CLOSE AND APPEAR REASONABLE SO NO MAJOR 
DEVIATION.

FXUS64 KMRX 030129
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
929 PM EDT MON JUL 2 2007

.DISCUSSION...STILL A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS LINGERING ACROSS MAINLY 
THE UPSLOPE AREAS.  FAIRLY STABLE ACROSS THE AREA.  THINK THE 
ACTIVITY WILL DIMINISH BY MIDNIGHT...SO WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR THE REST OF TONIGHT.  WILL CONTINUE TO 
HANDLE REMAINING SHOWERS WITH NOWCASTS.  REST OF FORECAST LOOKS ON 
TRACK...NO OTHER CHANGES NEEDED. 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES HAD BROUGHT DRIER AIR TO MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA EXCEPT THE EXTREME SOUTH WHERE DEW POINTS WERE IN THE 
MID 60S TO NEAR 70 THIS AFTERNOON. AN INVERTED TROUGH OVER EAST 
TENNESSEE AND THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS HELPED TO ENHANCE CONVERGENCE 
IN THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS CAUSING SCATTERED SHOWERS TO DEVELOP IN THE
SOUTHEAST TN AND SW NC MOUNTAINS BY NOON TODAY AND THEN HAVE BEEN 
PERSISTENT IN POLK AND CHEROKEE COUNTIES. EXPECT THESE SHOWERS TO 
CONTINUE INTO EARLY EVENING BEFORE ENDING WITH SOME POSSIBLE 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS. HOWEVER WITH TEMPERATURES ONLY 
IN THE MID 80S AT BEST INSTABILITY IS LIMITED SO THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
BE BRIEF. CROSS SECTION DATA FROM NAM/WRF AND GFS INDICATES PLENTY 
OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TODAY...TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY SO EXPECT 
EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER TODAY TO SLOWLY DECREASE TONIGHT AND REFORM 
TUESDAY. HAVE WORDED SKY CONDITIONS PARTLY CLOUDY TONIGHT. GFS 
INDICATES MOISTURE THINNING TUESDAY SO HAVE MOST AREAS MOSTLY SUNNY. 
WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AROUND...MORE HEATING AND SOME WEAK IMPULSES 
MOVING SOUTHEAST IN NORTHWEST FLOW HAVE KEPT ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS. WITH SOME CLOUDS TONIGHT WILL STAY WARMER FOR LOWS AND GO 
CLOSE TO THE HIGHER MAV NUMBERS FOR MAXIMUMS TUESDAY.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

SOUTH OF THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND KEEPING THE FORECAST AREA DRY.

ENTIRE REGION AS THE WEEKEND APPROACHES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
820 PM EDT SUN JUL 1 2007

.DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS HAVE WEAKENED WILL LOSS OF HEATING.  
HAVE CANCELLED THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH.  ACTIVITY HAS SHIFTED 
SOUTH...WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE WATCH AND ALSO LOWER RAIN 
CHANCES FOR THE REST OF TONIGHT.  REST OF FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...THE 
FRONT ACROSS THE CWA IS LOCATED JUST NORTH OF KNOXVILLE AND INTO THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES. PRECIP THIS EVENING WILL BE CONFINED 
MAINLY ALONG AND TO THE SOUTH OF THE FRONT. GENEROUS INSTABILITY 
WILL LEAD TO A THREAT OF SOME SEVERE STORMS...MAINLY PRODUCING 
DAMAGING WINDS. MODELS ALSO SHOW A VORT AXIS MOVING ACROSS THE AREA 
THIS EVENING...WHICH SHOULD KEEP SOME SHOWERS IN THE SOUTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA PAST MIDNIGHT. IN THE NORTH...DRIER AIR HAS 
MADE ITS WAY INTO THE AREA WITH DEWPOINTS DROPPING INTO THE 50S. THE 
FRONT WILL GRADUALLY PUSH SOUTH OVERNIGHT...AND SHOULD BE NEAR THE 
GA/AL BORDER BY MORNING. AS THE HIGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES BUILDS 
DOWN OVER THE CAROLINAS AND THE TENNESSEE VALLEY...AN INVERTED LOW 
LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE APPALACHIANS TOMORROW. THE LIFT IN 
THE NAM APPEARS WAY OVERDONE...AS IT GIVES CATEGORICAL POPS IN THE 
SOUTH. WILL STAY CLOSER TO THE CHANCE POPS IN THE GFS...AND CONFINE 
THEM MAINLY TO THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. NAM TEMPS ARE ALSO 
TOO COOL...AND THE WARMER GFS MOS WILL BE PREFERRED. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
THE FRONT ACROSS THE CWA IS LOCATED JUST NORTH OF KNOXVILLE AND INTO 
THE NORTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES. PRECIP THIS EVENING WILL BE CONFINED 
MAINLY ALONG AND TO THE SOUTH OF THE FRONT. GENEROUS INSTABILITY 
WILL LEAD TO A THREAT OF SOME SEVERE STORMS...MAINLY PRODUCING 
DAMAGING WINDS. MODELS ALSO SHOW A VORT AXIS MOVING ACROSS THE AREA 
THIS EVENING...WHICH SHOULD KEEP SOME SHOWERS IN THE SOUTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA PAST MIDNIGHT. IN THE NORTH...DRIER AIR HAS 
MADE ITS WAY INTO THE AREA WITH DEWPOINTS DROPPING INTO THE 50S. THE 
FRONT WILL GRADUALLY PUSH SOUTH OVERNIGHT...AND SHOULD BE NEAR THE 
GA/AL BORDER BY MORNING. AS THE HIGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES BUILDS 
DOWN OVER THE CAROLINAS AND THE TENNESSEE VALLEY...AN INVERTED LOW 
LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE APPALACHIANS TOMORROW. THE LIFT IN 
THE NAM APPEARS WAY OVERDONE...AS IT GIVES CATEGORICAL POPS IN THE 
SOUTH. WILL STAY CLOSER TO THE CHANCE POPS IN THE GFS...AND CONFINE 
THEM MAINLY TO THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. NAM TEMPS ARE ALSO 
TOO COOL...AND THE WARMER GFS MOS WILL BE PREFERRED. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE APPALACHIANS WILL KEEP A FEW SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS MONDAY EVENING OTHERWISE
SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR AND TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER WITH
LOWER DEW POINTS THANKS TO HIGHER PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY AND
NORTHEAST. TUESDAY NORTHWEST FLOW NORTH OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL
KEEP MOST OF FORECAST AREA DRY. MODELS WANT TO BRING THE TAIL END
OF SHORTWAVE THATS CURRENTLY ON THE CANADIAN BORDER AND NORTHERN MN
AROUND LARGE SOUTHWEST US UPPER RIDGE INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS
LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT WHICH COULD AFFECT SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA BUT FOR NOW KEEPING IT DRY AND JUST HAVING SLIGHT CHANCE
POPS IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS. WEDNESDAY AS MOISTURE INCREASES WITH
MORE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HAVE ADDED POPS TO ALL AREAS BUT STILL SEE
MOSTLY LATE AFTERNOON CONVECTION FROM HEATING. THURSDAY AND FRIDAY
A COLD FRONT MOVING AROUND UPPER RIDGE APPROACHES AND MOVES INTO
THE REGION. KEEPING THE WEEKEND DRY FOR NOW WITH FRONT JUST TO THE
SOUTH. HOWEVER THIS TIME OF YEAR FRONTS TEND TO WEAKEN AND FALL
APART SO DIURNAL POPS MAY HAVE TO BE ADDED LATER. GENERALLY
FOLLOWED THE HIGHER MINS WITH THE NAM/WRF FOR LOWS SOUTH WITH A
BLEND NORTH MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY NIGHT AND THE WARMER MAV OR
SLIGHTLY HIGHER FOR HIGHS TUESDAY AND BEYOND.

958 AM EDT SUN JUL 1 2007

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE FRONT LOCATED ACROSS THE AREA...BETWEEN
TYS AND TRI AND WEST ACROSS NORTHERN MIDDLE TN. PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE REMAINS IN PLACE TO THE SOUTH OF THE FRONT...AND WITH
PLENTY OF SURFACE HEATING...INSTABILITY WILL BE ADEQUATE. MODIFIED
12Z OHX SOUNDING GIVES SBCAPE VALUES AROUND 2000 J/KG BASED ON
FORECAST MAX TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS. IN ADDITION...OUTFLOW FROM STORMS
IN WEST TN SHOULD HELP SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON
IN SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN...WHICH WOULD LIKELY MOVE EAST INTO THE
SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND VALLEY THIS EVENING. POPS WILL BE RAISED IN
THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA THROUGH MIDNIGHT...AND WILL KEEP THE
NORTHERN HALF DRY.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

MAV TEMPS.    

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...TREND OF DRIER AND SLIGHTLY 
COOLER AIR CONTINUES FOR MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE FIRST 
COUPLE DAYS OF THE WORK WEEK. HOWEVER WILL KEEP A SLIGHT THROUGH LOW 
CHANCE FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WHERE MOISTURE AND SOME INSTABILITY LINGER. 
BY WEDNESDAY ATMOSPHERIC INSTABILITY STRENGTHENS TO A DEGREE AND 
RETURN FLOW SLOWLY MOISTENS THE LOW LEVELS SO STAYED WITH A SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. STILL THE BEST CHANCE IN THE 
SEVEN DAY PERIOD WILL BE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS AN UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH AMPLIFIES ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. DRIVING ANOTHER COOL FRONT 
INTO AND THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. MAINTAINED LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
THE EVENT AND KEPT POPS OUT FOR SATURDAY BEHIND THE FRONT. STAYED 
PRETTY CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE THROUGH THE PERIOD.

NEAR THE SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT IN CENTRAL KY. CONVECTION HAS ALSO 
DEVELOPED IN THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AREA. THE BEST INSTABILITY IS IN

CONVECTION HAS ALSO DEVELOPED IN THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AREA. THE BEST 
INSTABILITY IS IN THE SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THAT RECEIVED 
MORE SUN THIS MORNING. WILL HAVE TO WATCH THIS AREA FOR STRONG TO 
SEVERE STORMS...WITH DOWNBURST WINDS BEING THE MAIN THREAT. EXPECT 
THAT THE PRECIP CHANCES WILL TAPER OFF IN THE NORTH THROUGH THE 
EVENING AS THE FRONT MAKES SLOW SOUTHWARD PROGRESS. WILL HAVE A 
MENTION OF SCATTERED STORMS IN THE EVENING...AND ISOLATED AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. ON SUNDAY THE FRONT SHOULD BE SOMEWHERE ACROSS THE 
AREA...AND LOWER DEWPOINTS WILL MAKE THEIR WAY INTO THE NORTHERN

COOLER DRIER AIRMASS ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY.
MONDAY MODELS STILL HINTING AT LINGERING MOISTURE ACROSS TN AND NC
MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN PLATEAU. COLD FRONT TO THE SOUTH ALSO WEAK
AND LIKELY WASHING OUT. WITH THE HEATING OF THE DAY ISOLATED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE THESE AREAS. TUESDAY LOOKS TO BE
DRY WITH MORE STABLE AIR IN THE VALLEYS AND ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR
ISOLATED LATE AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TN AND NC
MOUNTAINS. WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY A COLD FRONT WILL DROP SLOWLY
SOUTH FROM THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. CONVECTION
SHOULD BECOME SCATTERED IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENINGS THURSDAY AND
FRIDAY. LEFT SATURDAY DRY AS FRONT IS SOUTH OF FORECAST AREA.
NIGHTTIME TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHTS
ESPECIALLY NORTHEAST HALF OF FORECAST AREA AS DEW POINTS DROP TO
THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S. DEW POINTS AND AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES RISE
BY MIDWEEK AHEAD OF NEXT FRONT.

.DISCUSSION...
A 13Z SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE FRONT HAS MOVED SLOWLY SOUTH...AND
IS LOCATED THROUGH CENTRAL KY AND SOUTHERN WV. MIDLEVEL CLOUDS ARE
PRODUCING SOME LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS CENTRAL AND NORTHERN PORTIONS
OF THE AREA THIS MORNING. THIS CLOUD COVER WILL PREVENT AS MUCH
DESTABILIZATION...AT LEAST CENTRAL AND NORTH...AS WE HAVE SEEN THE
PAST FEW DAYS. IT WILL ALSO HOLD MAX TEMPS BACK...ESPECIALLY
NORTH...SO WILL LOWER FORECAST MAX TEMPS TODAY WITH THE UPDATE. IN
THE SOUTH...THERE IS MUCH LESS CLOUDINESS...AND THIS AREA IS MORE
LIKELY TO SEE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP IN THE AFTERNOON.
WILL MAKE SOME SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS...RAISING THEM IN THE
SOUTH BUT STILL IN THE CHANCE RANGE. WITH SURFACE HEATING IN THE
SOUTH...CAPES WILL APPROACH 2000 J/KG...SO SOME ISOLATED SEVERE
STORMS WILL AGAIN BE POSSIBLE.

ACROSS MUCH OF THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION PRESSING AIRMASS 
BOUNDARY WELL INTO THE DEEP SOUTH. MAINTAINED IDEA OF SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY AS MOISTENING OF THE LOCAL AIRMASS 
OCCURS AS WINDS BECOME SOUTHERLY ON THE BACK SIDE OF RETREATING 
SURFACE RIDGE. DID NOT CHANGE PREVIOUS FORECAST FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY WHICH FEATURE SLIGHT INCREASE IN PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION 
AS ATMOSPHERE BECOMES A LITTLE MORE UNSTABLE AS MOISTURE INCREASES 
AHEAD OF YET ANOTHER FRONTAL BOUNDARY DUE IN THE FORECAST AREA ON 
FRIDAY. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE WITH

.DISCUSSION...
12Z SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE SURFACE FRONT LOCATED ACROSS THE
OHIO VALLEY...WITH A TROUGH JUST EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS AND
ACROSS NORTHERN GA TO CENTRAL AL. THE 12Z OHX SOUNDING SHOWS A
LITTLE MORE MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY THAN YESTERDAY...WITH A MODIFIED
SOUNDING TO 89/67 GIVING MUCAPE VALUES NEAR 2000 J/KG. A MIDLEVEL
SHEAR AXIS OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL ALSO PUSH SOUTH TODAY...AND
PROVIDE ADDITIONAL LIFT FOR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. THUS EXPECT
BETTER PRECIP COVERAGE TODAY...AND WILL KEEP THE CURRENT FORECAST OF
LIKELY POPS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 1000-850 THICKNESS FROM THE
OHX SOUNDING IS ALSO HIGHER THAN THE PAST FEW DAYS...SO WILL RAISE
HIGH TEMPS SLIGHTLY WITH THE UPDATE...INTO THE LOWER 90S IN THE
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. HOWEVER CLOUDS ACROSS THE NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE AREA SHOULD KEEP HIGHS THERE BELOW 90.

FXUS64 KMRX 290721
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT FRI JUN 29 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A MUGGY AIR MASS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES NEAR TWO 
INCHES. AS A RESULT...EXPECT SOME SCATTERED SEVERE TSTORMS THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS AND LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF 
THE NATION IS PROGGED TO PUSH THIS COLD FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
BY THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH SHOULD HELP INCREASE THE AREAL COVERAGE OF 
CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND 
TOWARD THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS TODAY (WHICH HAVE VERIFYING PRETTY 
WELL LATELY)...AND WILL CONTINUE WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST IN 
REGARDS TO MINS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...COOL FRONT SLOWS DOWN 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY AS LOW FORMS ON THE FRONT OVER 
MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND SLOWLY SHIFTS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. STAYED WITH STRATIFICATION OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH 
THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE SOUTH FOR THE SLOW MOVEMENT AND POSSIBLE 
DEVELOPMENT NEAR THE BOUNDARY SATURDAY. KEPT THE IDEA OF DECREASING 
PROBABILITIES FOR CONVECTION THROUGH THE DAY INTO THE EVENING AS 
HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDS SOUTH OUT OF THE GREAT LAKES PRESSING FRONT 
INTO THE DEEP SOUTH. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND HIGHER SURFACE 
PRESSURE WILL ALLOW FOR A DRY SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY PERIOD. HOWEVER 
BY WEDNESDAY LOW LEVEL RIDGING SLIPS FAR ENOUGH SOUTHEAST THAT 
MOISTURE RETURN HAS DEVELOPED AGAIN ON SOUTHERLY WINDS ON THE BACK 
SIDE OF SURFACE HIGH. THEREFORE KEPT THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING 
FOR CONVECTION AND THEN STAYED WITH A LOW CHANCE POP NORTH WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH ON THURSDAY AS MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INCREASE 
AHEAD OF ANOTHER FRONT MAKING ITS WAY THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. 
CONCERNING TEMP FORECAST BASICALLY TRENDED A LITTLE WARMER THAN MEX 
MOS AS HIGH SUN ANGLE IN EARLY JULY AND SLIGHTLY LESS HUMID AIRMASS 
SHOULD HEAT FAIRLY EFFICIENTLY ESPECIALLY EARLY IN THE WEEK. 
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
856 PM EDT THU JUN 28 2007

.DISCUSSION...STORMS HAVE VARIED GREATLY IN INTENSITY THIS EVENING
...AIDED BY A VERY BUOYANT ATMOSPHERE (POSITIVE CAPES NEAR 2000 J/KG
PER 00Z OHX/RNK SOUNDINGS). AN ABUNDANCE OF OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES NOTED 
ON RADAR AND SATELLITE PICS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...HAVE ALSO
CERTAINLY AIDED RE-DEVELOPMENT AND INTENSITY. THESE BOUNDARIES HAVE 
VARIED IN SCALE FROM ABOUT ONE COUNTY SIZE TO MULTIPLE COUNTIES.

GOOD COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS CONTINUES FROM NE PARTS OF 
MIDDLE TN EASTWARD ACROSS THE NRN PLATEAU...WITH THIS ACTIVITY 
MOVING ALMOST DUE EAST TO AFFECT MUCH OF NE TN AND SW VA OVER THE 
NEXT FEW HOURS. HAVE UPDATED GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS ALREADY DUE TO 
HOURLY TEMPS DRIFTING FAR OFF WHERE STORMS HAVE OCCURRED. WILL 
MONITOR RADAR TRENDS OVER THE NEXT HOUR...WITH GOOD POSSIBILITY OF 
NEEDING TO INCREASE POPS OVER NRN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AND 
KEEP SCATTERED AREAL QUALIFIER. NOT SURE IF I WILL BE ABLE TO 
COMPLETELY REMOVE POPS ANYWHERE OVERNIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT THU JUN 28 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED IN A CONVERGENCE ZONE IN THE PLATEAU 
THIS AFTERNOON. SOME OF THE STORMS WILL BE STRONG ENOUGH TO PRODUCE 
SOME DAMAGING WINDS AND MAYBE SOME SMALL HAIL. THE EASTWARD MOVEMENT 
OF THE LINE OF STORMS WILL BRING THEM INTO THE VALLEY THIS EVENING. 
STORMS ARE DIURNALLY DRIVEN...AND SO THEY SHOULD DISSIPATE SOMETIME 
AROUND MIDNIGHT. FRIDAY AGAIN LOOKS VERY SIMILAR TO TODAY...BUT THE 
APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH AND WEAKENING ATLANTIC RIDGE SHOULD ALLOW 
FOR BETTER COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TOMORROW AFTERNOON. 
WILL CONTINUE THE CURRENT FORECAST OF LIKELY POPS. SOME ADDITIONAL 
MORNING CLOUDINESS MAY ALSO SHAVE A FEW DEGREES OFF HIGH 
TEMPS...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHERN SECTIONS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL LIKELY BE ONGOING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA FRIDAY EVENING AS UPPER TROUGH BRINGS A COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY. LOOKS LIKE ISOLATED STORMS COULD BE SEVERE AGAIN WITH 
DAMAGING WINDS AND MARGINALLY SEVERE HAIL. LOCALIZED HEAVY RAIN IS 
POSSIBLE TOO. THE SPEED AND THE STRENGTH OF THE FRONT WILL AFFECT 
RAIN CHANCES ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. THE NAM/WRF IS A LITTLE 
FASTER AND NOT AS STRONG WITH THE FRONT. PREFER THE GFS SO WILL KEEP 
50 PERCENT POPS SOUTH SATURDAY TAPERING TO AROUND 30 PERCENT CHANCE 
ACROSS SW VA EARLY IN THE AFTERNOON. HAVE BROUGHT POPS TO 20 PERCENT 
FOR SOUTHEAST HALF SATURDAY NIGHT. DRIER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND FRONT 
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AS SURFACE HIGH MOVES DOWN FROM THE 
GREAT LAKES AND UPPER TROUGH LIES ALONG THE APPALACHIANS AND EAST 
COAST. HIGH AND LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER UNTIL 
TUESDAY OR WEDNESDAY. WEDNESDAY RIDGING TAKES OVER AND WILL CONTINUE 
WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM HEATING. 
PRECIPITATION MAY BE CONFINED ONLY IN THE TERRAIN AREAS BUT WILL LET 
LATER SHIFTS MAKE A DECISION TO TAKE POPS OUT OF THE VALLEYS. A 
SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY AS A 
FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE OHIO VALLEY.

A PERSISTENCE FORECAST CONTINUES AS CONDITIONS HAVE CHANGED LITTLE
TODAY FROM THE PAST FEW DAYS. SURFACE DEWPOINTS ARE A LITTLE HIGHER
AT CHA THIS MORNING...PROBABLY DUE TO PRECIP THERE YESTERDAY
EVENING. THE PARAMETERS FROM THE 12ZOHX SOUNDING ARE ALSO VERY
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY...WITH CAPE PERHAPS SLIGHTLY HIGHER TODAY. SO
SCATTERED PULSE THUDNERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED AGAIN TODAY...FORMING
MAINLY IN THE MOUNTAINS AND THE PLATEAU. SLIGHTLY HIGHER MOISTURE
CONTENT COULD RESULT IN A LITTLE BETTER COVERAGE THAN YESTERDAY. A
FEW STORMS COULD PRODUCE DAMAGING WIND GUSTS. THE ONLY CHANGE IN
THE MORNING UPDATE WILL BE TO REMOVE THE MENTION OF MORNING WORDING FROM
THE ZFP.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT THU JUN 28 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR INDICATING A FEW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND KY ALONG A WEAK BOUNDARY 
DRIFTING SLOWLY EAST.  SATELLITE INDICATING PERSISTENT COLD CLOUD 
TOPS WITH THEM. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THIS MORNING.  BETTER 
CHANCES ARE EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY INCREASING.  COULD SEE A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  RECENT RAIN FROM 
YESTERDAY SHOULD BRING MORE PATCHY FOG THIS MORNING.  NOT WIDESPREAD 
ENOUGH FOR AN ADVISORY.  TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO 
YESTERDAY...WHICH IS HANDLED WELL BY THE GUIDANCE SO DIDNT STRAY 
TOO FAR.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH BRINGING A COLD FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...AS A 
BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DIGS OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. 
THIS COLD FRONT WILL HELP TO INCREASE THE COVERAGE OF CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...WITH MODERATE INSTABILITY 
DEVELOPING ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY THE AFTERNOON. IN 
ADDITION...THE PRECIPITABLE WATER CONTENT OF THE LOCAL AIR MASS IS 
PROGGED TO RISE TO AROUND TWO INCHES. AS A RESULT...WILL CONTINUE 
WITH LIKELY POPS EVERYWHERE FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AND 
ALSO EXPECT A BETTER COVERAGE OF SEVERE STORMS WITH DAMAGING 
DOWNBURST WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. THERE STILL REMAINS SOME 
QUESTION ABOUT HOW QUICKLY THIS COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
REGION ON SATURDAY...AND WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST ON 
SATURDAY SINCE FRONTS TYPICALLY MOVE A LITTLE SLOWER THAN PROGGED 
DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS ACROSS THE 
REGION FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH DRY AND SLIGHTLY COOLER CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED. THE MOST NOTICEABLE CHANGE SHOULD BE THE LOWER DEWPOINTS 
BY SUNDAY...RESULTING IN LESS MUGGY CONDITIONS AND LOWER MINS AT 
NIGHT. ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA 
BY MID WEEK...ALTHOUGH THE MODELS ARE SHOWING SOME DISCREPANCIES 
WITH THE EXACT TIMING. FOR NOW...WILL KEEP SLIGHT POPS IN THE 
FORECAST FOR THE 4TH OF JULY.

FXUS64 KMRX 261829
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
227 PM EDT TUE JUN 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...
CONVECTION A LITTLE ON THE SUPPRESSED SIDE RIGHT NOW BUT SURFACE 
WILL CONTINUE TO HEAT UP. APPARENTLY UPPER RIDGING WITH AXIS EAST OF 
THE WFO IS HAVING MORE OF AN INFLUENCE ON SUPPRESSING DEVELOPMENT 
WHICH IS WHAT WE WERE FORECASTING TO OCCUR FOR THIS TIME PERIOD A 
FEW DAYS AGO. THE BEST COVERAGE IS IN THE TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER. MAY TWEAK PREVIOUS FORECAST FOR TONIGHT BASED ON 
TRENDS. BASICALLY STAYED WITH SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR 
CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY BUT BUMPED UP MAJOR TERRAIN AREAS DUE TO 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT. CONCERNING TEMPERATURE FORECAST STAYED QUITE CLOSE 
TO BLEND OF GUIDANCE.
 
.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO GIVE WAY ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY AS AN UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST. EXPECT 
ANOTHER ROUND OF SCATTERED TO ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON 
THURSDAY...WITH THE BEST CHANCES NORTH WHERE INSTABILITY WILL BE A 
LITTLE BETTER. MOISTURE ADVECTION INCREASES ON FRIDAY AHEAD OF THE 
TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONT. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES RISE 
TO OVER 1.7 INCHES WITH MLCAPES NEAR 1500 J/KG...AND MODELS SHOW A 
PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH OVER THE AREA ON FRIDAY. GIVEN THE 
INSTABILITY...SOME POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE STORMS WILL EXIST. WILL 
RAISE POPS TO LIKELY IN THE NORTH. THE FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA 
FRIDAY NIGHT...AND MORE STABLE AIR SHOULD BEGIN TO INFILTRATE THE 
NORTH ON SATURDAY. THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL BE MOVING THROUGH ON 
SATURDAY...SO HIGHEST POPS WILL BE IN THE SOUTH. THE FRONT WILL PUSH 
THROUGH THE AREA AND END ALL POPS BY MIDNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT.

THE UPPER TROUGH WILL BE EAST OF THE AREA...AND HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
SLOWLY DROP SOUTH OUT OF CANADA...BRINGING DRIER AIR TO THE REGION. 
SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WILL BE DRY WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR TO 
SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT TUE JUN 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS CONTINUES 
TO SHOW A STRONG BERMUDA HIGH OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC EXTENDING 
ACROSS MOST OF THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION...WITH A WARM AND 
MUGGY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. OVERALL...LOCAL AIR MASS HAS 
NOT CHANGED MUCH SINCE YESTERDAY...AND EXPECT TODAY TO BE VERY 
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A MODERATELY UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS DEVELOPING AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE TSTORMS AS A DRY BOUNDARY LAYER (INVERTED-V 
SHAPED SOUNDING) LINGERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS DRY BOUNDARY 
LAYER SHOULD AGAIN HELP TO PRODUCE STRONG DOWNBURST WINDS WITH SOME 
STORMS...AND WITH AN OVERALL HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER CONTENT NEAR 
1.75...SOME STORMS MAY PRODUCE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. AS FOR 
TEMPS...SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE TO MAKE FORECASTING THE 
MAXES TRICKY...AND WILL GENERALLY KEEP TODAYS MAXES NEAR THE 
AVERAGE MAX TEMP FROM THE PAST FEW DAYS. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...DIURNAL INSTABILITY REMAINS 
FAIRLY HIGH ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY BUT MOISTURE AND LIFT REMAINS 
WEAK. SHOULD SEE MORE SCATTERED AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS 
ON BOTH WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. COLD FRONT DROPPING INTO AREA ON 
FRIDAY...BRINGING AN INCREASE OF MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH IT. WILL GO 
WITH HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY. FRONT LINGERING INTO SATURDAY... 
WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE 
SOUTH NEARER THE FRONT. FRONT SHIFTING SOUTH OUT OF THE AREA ON 
SATURDAY NIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN ON SUNDAY. DRY WEATHER 
IS EXPECTED ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

PLAY AND HAVE LOWERED POPS BEHIND THE SYSTEM.  TEMPERATURES WILL SEE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 AM EDT MON JUN 25 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
BERMUDA HIGH OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC EXTENDING OVER THE ENTIRE 
SOUTHEAST...WITH A WARM AND MUGGY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 60S EVERYWHERE. OVERALL...NOT MUCH HAS CHANGED 
SINCE YESTERDAY...AND EXPECT A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS TO 
DEVELOP AGAIN OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS 
A RESULT...WILL PLAN TO RAISE POPS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE TSTORMS. MODEL SOUNDINGS AGAIN REVEAL A DRY 
INVERTED-V BOUNDARY LAYER...WHICH SHOULD AGAIN RESULT IN STRONG 
DAMAGING WINDS WITH SOME STORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL CONTINUE WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST SINCE THE LOCAL 
AIR MASS REMAINS UNCHANGED FROM YESTERDAY. THINK THAT ONLY SCATTERED 
CONVECTION COULD POSSIBLY KEEP MAXES FROM REACHING YESTERDAYS 
VALUES. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MORE OF THE SAME. THE RIDGE 
BUILDS AS THE MODELS HAVE INDICATED FOR WHAT SEEMS LIKE MONTHS. 
BERMUDA HIGH AFFECTS SOUTHEAST US WHICH WILL KEEP CURRENTLY RISING 
DEWPOINTS HIGH THROUGH MID-WEEK. POPS NOT ALL THAT HIGH, AND OVERALL 
QPFS WILL STILL BE ON THE LOW SIDE, BUT SPOTS WILL GET HEAVY RAIN, 
PERHAPS EVEN FLOODING AS HAPPENED TONIGHT. FOR INSTANCE, OAK RIDGE 
TRACED OUT, WHILE TYS GOT 0.81. SO THE HAVES WILL STILL HAVE AND 
THE HAVE-NOTS WILL HAVE NOT. 

LAPSE IN POPS LATER IN WEEK, BUT FRONT APPROACHES AREA BY THIS 
WEEKEND WHICH WILL GIVE ANOTHER ROUND OF TSTMS/SHOWERS. ADJUSTED 
MAX/MIN TEMPS TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT TO MORE IN LINE WITH GFS. 
OTHERWISE, NO CHANGES TO FORMER PACKAGE.
&&

225 PM EDT SUN JUN 24 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...CELLS POPPING RATHER 
QUICKLY NOW MAINLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS...WITH POTENTIAL TO 
PULSE TO SEVERE LEVELS. ACTIVITY TODAY DOES NOT HAVE AN E TO W OR NW 
TO SE ORIENTATION...SO WEAK BOUNDARY HAS PROBABLY DISSIPATED OR 
MOVED NORTH OF THE AREA. UPPER LOW OVER SRN IL/SRN IN/W KY PLUS 
STRONG HEATING...SHOULD RESULT IN SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS INTO 
THE EVENING HOURS. PREVIOUS GRIDS WERE ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY BUT STILL 
LOOKED GREAT.

ADJUSTMENTS MADE FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WERE TO REMOVE MOST 
AREAS AND TIME PERIODS WHERE A DRY FORECAST WAS NOTED. THE DEPTH OF 
MOISTURE AND STRONG HEATING THESE PERIODS JUSTIFIES 20 TO 40 PERCENT 
POPS UNTIL TUESDAY...WHERE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WERE USED ACROSS THE 
BOARD...DUE TO LESS MOISTURE AND BUILDING OF UPPER RIDGE.

FOR TEMPS...A MOS BLEND FROM NAM-WRF WITH GFS LOOKED BEST FOR MINS.
CONTINUED TREND OF GOING A DEGREE OR SO ABOVE THE MOS FOR MAX TEMPS
...BASED ON MOS PERFORMANCE LATELY (INCLUDING TODAY AS 17Z TEMP GRID 
HAD TO BE RAISED FROM 1 TO 3 DEGREES IN MOST AREAS).


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER RIDGE FORMS ACROSS 
THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC REGION WITH EXTENSION WEST INTO THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON WEDNESDAY. MODELS SHOW ATMOSPHERE BECOMES 
SLIGHTLY MORE MOIST AND UNSTABLE DURING MID WEEK SO GRADUALLY 
INCREASE AREAL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY WITH HIGHEST POPS FRIDAY/SATURDAY AS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY BUILDS SOUTH INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. TAPERED POPS BACK SOMEWHAT ON SUNDAY AS FRONTAL 
POSITION MAY HAVE FINALLY MOVED SOUTH TO NEAR THE SOUTHERN TENNESSEE 
BORDER. OF COURSE AT THESE EXTENDED TIME PERIODS DETAILS ARE MURKY 
AND FRONT MAY STALL OVER THE FORECAST AREA. FORECAST WILL BE 
ADJUSTED FOR GREATER DETAIL IN THE COMING DAYS. STAYED RATHER CLOSE 
TO SUGGESTED TEMP GUIDANCE.

NEXT FEW HOURS.

AT THE SURFACE...THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY HAS BECOME VERY TOUGH TO 
LOCATE...AS DEW POINT TEMPS HAVE RISEN INTO THE LOWER 60S AS FAR 
NORTH AS SW VA.  MODIFIED OHX AND RNK 12Z SOUNDINGS PRODUCE MODERATE 
INSTABILITY WITH POSITIVE CAPE VALUES OF 1500 TO 2500 J/KG.  LOOKS 
LIKE A FEW STORMS WILL PULSE UP THIS AFTERNOON AND BRIEFLY GO SEVERE 
(HAIL AND DOWNBURST THREAT) BEFORE COLLAPSING GIVEN THE VERY WEAK 
WINDS ALOFT.

THE CURRENT RAIN CHANCES LOOK GOOD WITH HIGHEST CHANCE NORTHEAST 
DOWN TO SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE FAR SOUTHWEST (SEQUATCHIE VALLEY).
TEMPS OFF TO A GOOD START ALREADY...SO SHOULD SEE HIGHS NEAR 
PERSISTENCE NUMBERS LIKE YESTERDAY.  WILL UPDATE THE ZFPMRX AROUND 
11 AM EDT TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING...AND CHECK HOURLY CONDITIONS 
AGAINST GRIDS FOR POSSIBLE UPDATE TO OTHER WEBSITE PRODUCTS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

SOUTHWEST VA BY THIS AFTERNOON...BEFORE ULTIMATELY WASHING-OUT BY 
TONIGHT. MODELS INDICATE THAT A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL 
DEVELOP OVER PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...WITH 
SCATTERED CONVECTION AGAIN DEVELOPING...ESPECIALLY NEAR THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. THUS...WILL MENTION THE 
HIGHEST POPS ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. WITH A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND A DRY INVERTED-V BOUNDARY LAYER ON THE MODEL 
SOUNDINGS...THINK THAT A FEW ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS WITH DAMAGING 
WINDS AND LARGE HAIL WILL AGAIN BE POSSIBLE. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY TREND TOWARD A PERSISTENCE FORECAST...BUT WITH HIGHER MINS 
ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA AS DEWPOINTS SLOWLY RISE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS HAVE BEEN ADVERTISING 
THE SAME THING FOR DAYS. UPPER RIDGE ESTABLISHES ITSELF OVER EASTERN 
CONUS WITH SFC BERMUDA-LIKE HIGH PRESSURE OFFSHORE. THIS OPENS UP 
THE SOUTHEAST TO MORE MOISTURE THROUGH MID WEEK. SOMETIME AROUND 
FRIDAY, A FRONTAL ZONE MOVES SOUTHEAST TOWARD REGION, BUT TIME OF 
YEAR WOULD KEEP ITS BEHAVIOR A LITTLE ON THE UNPREDICTABLE SIDE THIS 
FAR IN ADVANCE. WILL GO WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST PACKAGE AND KEEP 
CHANCE POPS IN FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. ALSO, TWEAKED MAX TEMPS 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY TO BE MORE IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EDT SAT JUN 23 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SIDE TRACKED A BIT BY 
ISOLATED TO WIDELY SCATTERED STORMS THAT DEVELOPED OVER THE PAST HOUR
...AND RAPIDLY PULSED UP TO SEVERE LEVELS. PENNY SIZE HAIL WITH 
STORM IN ROANE COUNTY...AND HALF DOLLAR SIZE HAIL ALONG RHEA AND 
MEIGS COUNTY LINE WHERE STORM WAS EVEN MORE DEVELOPED. DEWPOINT 
TEMPS IN THE LOW TO MID 60S ACROSS E TN COUNTIES...AND THESE STORMS 
MAY BE FIRING ON THE ACTUAL OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY.

FOR TONIGHT...RAISED POPS A BIT FOR PLATEAU COUNTIES AND KEPT AT 
LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ALL AREAS THROUGH MIDNIGHT...AS ACTIVITY 
SHOULD BE MAINLY DIURNAL. GFS MOS MINS HAVE BEEN QUITE CLOSE LATELY
SO NO REASON TO STRAY FROM.

SUNDAY THRU MONDAY...MOISTURE INCREASES SLIGHTLY WITH THE EXPECTED 
INCREASE IN INSTABILITY BOTH DAYS...SO AT LEAST SOME DIURNAL 
CONVECTION...ALTHO COVERAGE SHOULD BELOW 50 PERCENT. LOW LEVEL FLOW 
BECOMES MORE SOUTHERLY BY MONDAY AFTERNOON...SO EXPECT BETTER LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE CONVERGENCE THEN. THUS...ADDED AND/OR INCREASED POPS 
FOR THESE PERIODS. STILL THINK WARMEST MOS MAX TEMPS WILL VERIFY 
BEST THRU SUNDAY...THEN THE MOISTURE INCREASE MAY KEEP MAX TEMPS 
CLOSER TO GFS FOR MONDAY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...RIDGE ESTABLISHES 
ITSELF ACROSS THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC REGION WITH EXTENSION WEST INTO 
THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY 
DURING WHICH TIME GRADUALLY INCREASE AREAL COVERAGE OF CONVECTION 
FROM TERRAIN AREAS OF SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE ON TUESDAY THROUGH MUCH OF 
THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES ON WEDNESDAY. BY THURSDAY RIDGE HAS 
SHIFTED FAR ENOUGH EAST TO WARRANT RAISING POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA AS SOUTHERLY FLOW ON BACK SIDE OF RIDGE AND INCREASING 
INSTABILITY AHEAD OF STRENGTHENING EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF ALLOWS 
FOR BETTER CHANCE FOR CONVECTION. BY FRIDAY SURFACE COLD FRONT MAKES 
ITS WAY INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
AND WENT AHEAD AND TRIED TO ALERT THE RECREATING PUBLIC TO THE 
POSSIBILITY OF MORE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION IN ASSOCIATION WITH COLD 
FRONT BY USING 30-40 PERCENT POPS AREA WIDE. FRONT MAY NOT BE ABLE 
TO MAKE IT ALL THE WAY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS LATE IN JUNE 
SO KEPT CHANCE POPS GOING ON SATURDAY. STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE TEMPS WHICH KEEP 90 DEGREE HEAT GOING THROUGH MID WEEK 
BEFORE DROPPING BACK INTO THE 80S LATE WEEK IN DEEP MOISTURE REGIME 
AHEAD OF FRONT.

1025 AM EDT SAT JUN 23 2007

.DISCUSSION...12Z OHX/RNK SOUNDINGS MODIFIED FOR HIGHS IN THE 80S TO 
LOWER 90S YIELDS UNSTABLE CONDITIONS...WITH POSITIVE CAPE OF 1000 TO 
1500 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES OF -5. HOWEVER...A SIGNIFICANT TRIGGER 
DOES SEEM TO BE LACKING TODAY...SUCH THAT 20 TO 30 PERCENT CHANCES 
ARE QUITE SUFFICIENT. LITTLE TO NO SHEAR WITH FREEZING AND WET BULB 
ZERO HEIGHTS ALSO QUITE HIGH...SO NOT MUCH THREAT OF ANY STRONG 
STORMS.

THE WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER IOWA TO UPPER MIDWEST STATES MAY NOT 
AFFECT OUR CHANCES OF CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION...AS MODELS AGREE ON 
THIS FEATURE WEAKENING AND STAYING WELL TO OUR WEST WITH TIME. AT 
THE SURFACE...LATEST 13Z CHART SHOWS WEAK FRONT TO OUR SOUTH AND 
ANOTHER OVER MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. MOST CONVECTION THIS MORNING IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH WARM AIR ADVECTION NE OF THE MISSISIPPI VALLEY FRONT.

THUS...FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK FOR TODAY WITH JUST A COSMETIC 
UPDATE TO ZFPMRX PRODUCT TO REMOVE AFTERNOON WORDING. WILL ALSO 
FRESHEN GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS IF HOURLY CONDITIONS DRIFT TOO FAR 
FROM REALITY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION. BOTH THE GFS AND WRF MODELS SEEM TO AGREE 
THAT THE LOCAL AIR MASS WILL BE TOO DRY TO SUPPORT ANY POSSIBLE MCS 
ACTIVITY FROM THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. THUS...WILL CONTINUE WITH 
ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARD A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST...BUT WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER MAXES ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. MINS SHOULD BE HIGHER TONIGHT 
AREAWIDE AS DEWPOINTS CONTINUE TO SLOWLY RISE. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN FEATURE IS MODERATE TO 
STRONG UPPER RIDGE OVER CENTRAL U.S. NORTHWEST FLOW ON FRONT SIDE OF 
RIDGE IS AFFECTING THE REGION AND ALLOWING SOME WEAKNESSES IN THE 
FLOW TO FLOW THIS WAY. HOWEVER, INSTABILITY, MOISTURE, AND LIFT ARE 
ALL QUITE LIMITED AND THIS WILL CONTINUE INTO MIDDLE OF WEEK. RIDGE 
WILL BUILD AND MOVE SLIGHTLY EAST. FEATURES TAKE ON A QUASI-BERMUDA 
HIGH CHARACTER AND EXPECT INCREASE IN RH, TEMPS. STILL INSTABILITY 
WILL BE LIMITED AND THIS WILL INHIBIT CONVECTION. POPS WILL REMAIN 
AT MID SUMMER LEVELS WITH MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE RANGES THROUGH PERIOD.
DROUGHT CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

300 PM EDT FRI JUN 22 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH 
MCS CONTINUES TO GENERALLY WEAKEN AS IT MOVES SE. REMNANTS OF THE 
UPPER LEVEL CIRCULATION HAVE YET TO PASS ACROSS THE EXTREME NE PARTS

HAVE BEEN LEFT ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. 

ATMOSPHERE STARTING TO DESTABILIZE ACROSS THE AREA AS MAX TEMPS HAVE 
REACHED 80S TO LOWER 90S...THUS WONT TOTALLY GIVE UP ON SOME 
CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION DEVELOPING THIS EVENING. HOWEVER...VISIBLE 
SATELLITE PICS SHOWED THE BEST DEVELOPING CUMULUS CLOUDS WELL TO OUR 
WEST OVER SW KY AND W TN...WHERE THE BEST LOW LEVEL THETA-E VALUES 
WERE NOTED. GIVEN THE NW FLOW ALOFT...AND MODELS POOR HANDLING OF 
WHERE MCS ACTIVITY HAS BEEN DEVELOPING AND OCCURRING TODAY...WONT 
LIMIT RAIN CHANCES TO JUST DIURNAL.

FOR SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY...NOT VERY CONFIDENT THAT THE WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH WILL ACTUALLY DROP INTO OR THRU OUR FORECAST 
AREA. HOWEVER...NW FLOW ALOFT AND DAYTIME INSTABILITY WILL JUSTIFY 
TOKEN POPS OF ROUGHLY 20-30 PERCENT OVER THE WEEKEND. GOING WITH OR 
ABOVE THE WARMEST MOS MAX TEMPS HAS WORKED WELL...EVEN TODAY WITH 
DEBRIS CLOUDS FROM MCS ACROSS NRN AREAS...SO CARRIED THIS INTO THE 
WEEKEND AS WELL. HAVE NOT NOTICED ANY REAL MOS BIAS FOR MIN TEMPS
...SO STUCK CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR MINS EACH NIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODEL DEPICTION OF RIDGE 
POSITION A BIT FARTHER EAST THAN WHAT WAS OFFERED YESTERDAY FOR THE 
MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. LOOKS A LITTLE LESS 
SUBSIDENT AND A LITTLE MORE HUMID. THERE MAY BE ENOUGH OROGRAPHIC 
LIFT TO WORK WITH SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY TO ALLOW A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM TO FORM ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE OR THE MAJOR TERRAIN 
AREAS SO KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION HERE. ATMOSPHERE MOISTENS 
MORE SIGNIFICANTLY ON THURSDAY WITH INDICATION OF WEAK SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY AS NORTHEASTERN U.S. TROF STRENGTHENS. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
MAKES ITS WAY INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AND BROADBRUSHED LOW 
CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE BOARD FOR POSSIBLE FROPA. DID NOT STRAY TOO 
FAR FROM GUIDANCE TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 AM EDT FRI JUN 22 2007

.DISCUSSION...MAIN FEATURE OF CONCERN IS THE MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE 
SYSTEM (MCS) ACROSS MUCH OF INDIANA AND OHIO THIS MORNING. THIS 
SYSTEM WILL BE ENCOUNTERING A DRY AIRMASS OVER THE TN VALLEY AND SRN 
APPALACHIANS TODAY...ALTHO MODIFIED 12Z OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS DID 
INDICATE SOME INSTABILITY (POSITIVE CAPES OF 800 TO 1000 J/KG AND 
LIFTED INDICES OF -3 TO -5) FOR AFTERNOON HIGHS IN THE 80S TO LOWER 
90S. FREEZING AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS REMAIN ON THE HIGH SIDE...
WITH SOUNDINGS SHOWING SOME POTENTIAL FOR STRONG DOWNBURST WINDS.

SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES THAT THE MOST UNSTABLE AIRMASS WILL BE 
ASSOCIATED WITH LOW LEVEL THETA-E RIDGE ACROSS WRN KY AND NW TN...
WHICH IS WHERE THE BEST CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT HAS BEEN THIS MORNING.
THUS...CLEARLY AT LEAST A CHANCE OF AFTERNOON CONVECTION FOR PARTS 
OF OUR REGION (PLATEAU/SW VA/NE TN) WHERE CHANCE POPS ARE IN THE 
FORECAST. 

CLOUDS ON EASTERN END OF MCS ARE DISSIPATING...BUT DEBRIS CLOUDINESS 
MAY AFFECT MAX TEMPS FOR SW VA AND NE TN. WILL MONITOR RADAR AND 
SATELLITE TRENDS...WITH ZFPMRX UPDATE AND A FRESHENING OF GRIDS AND 
WEB PRODUCTS SHORTLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A MESOSCALE 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OCCURRING ALONG IT OVER CENTRAL ILLINOIS. WITH 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...THIS MCC SHOULD CONTINUE MOVING SOUTHEAST 
ALONG THE COLD FRONT AND INTO SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN BY THIS 
AFTERNOON. MODELS INDICATE THAT A DRY AIR MASS WILL LINGER OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT WITH SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY 
DEVELOPING. THUS...WHILE THE DRIER AIR OVER THE FORECAST AREA MAY 
WEAKEN THE MCC SOME AS IT APPROACHES...THINK THAT THERE WILL BE 
ENOUGH FUEL TO GENERATE SOME ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT AS 
THE MCCS AREA OF VORTICITY MOVES ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT...WILL PLAN TO RAISE POPS INTO THE 
CHANCE CATEGORY ACROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. WILL ALSO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME ISOLATED SEVERE TSTORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL IN 
THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. AS FOR TEMPS...AN EXPECTED INCREASE 
IN CLOUD COVER OVER THE FORECAST AREA SHOULD KEEP TEMPS A LITTLE 
COOLER (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY) MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...REALLY SMALL TWEAKS TO 
FORECAST. ADJUSTED QPFS DOWN A HAIR IN NEAR TERM (SATURDAY). NOT TO 
SAY THAT SOME THUNDERSTORMS WILL NOT DROP A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF 
RAIN ON A SPECIFIC SPOT...BUT MEAN AREA QUANTITIES WILL BE VERY 
SMALL. NO DROUGHT BUSTING RAINS IN SIGHT. RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD 
AS SUMMER INVADES. IF SPRING WAS ANY INDICATION...SUMMER WILL BE 
BRUTAL. THIS NEXT WEEK HINTS AT ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS AND LITTLE RAIN. 
LOOKS LIKE AUGUST ALREADY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN    92  65  92  66  94 /  10  10  20  20  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN      90  64  88  65  91 /  20  20  20  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN              90  64  89  64  95 /  20  20  20  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN     85  58  85  60  89 /  30  30  30  30  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT THU JUN 21 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WATER VAPOR SATELLITE 
PICS SHOW A VERY DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH ANY CONVECTION WELL UPSTREAM TO OUR NW OVER THE 
UPPER MIDWEST STATES. NOT MUCH WAY FOR EVEN ANY DEBRIS CIRRUS CLOUDS 
TO REACH US OVERNIGHT. EXPECT CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT WITH MINS LIKELY 
TO BE NEAR GFS MOS VALUES OR A COUPLE OF DEGREES ABOVE GIVEN SLIGHT 
COOL BIAS FROM LAST NIGHT.

MODELS STILL HINT AT SOME ORGANIZED CONVECTION TO EVENTUALLY DEVELOP 
IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT...BUT TIMING SUCH FEATURES IS UNCERTAIN...AND 
ALSO WOULD SEEM THAT ANY APPROACHING SYSTEMS WOULD BE WEAKENING UPON 
NEARING OUR FORECAST AREAS. HOWEVER...DO AGREE WITH NEIGHBORING 
OFFICES AND GENERAL TREND IN MOS GUIDANCE FOR BEST CHANCES (STILL 
RATHER LOW THOUGH) OF RAIN ACROSS OUR NRN MOST AREAS THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT. BY SATURDAY...KEPT THE BROADBRUSH OF 20-30 PERCENT POPS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...SURFACE BOUNDARY MAY PUSH 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA AND LEAVE EVEN LESS CHANCES FOR SATURDAY. 

OTHERWISE...FOLLOWED THE RECENT TREND FOR MAX TEMPS AT OR JUST ABOVE 
THE WARMEST MOS...GIVEN MOS COOL BIAS ON HIGHS OF LATE. DEW POINT 
TEMPS WERE BLENDED FROM GFS AND NAM-WRF...KEEPING LOWER DAYTIME 
VALUES DUE TO DRY AIRMASS AND MIXING.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAINTAINED SOME 
CHANCE POPS NORTHERN ZONES WITH SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH SATURDAY NIGHT 
AS MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW WEAK SHORTWAVES DROPPING SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH BACKDOOR COLD FRONT IN 
THE VICINITY. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ON SUNDAY AS 
ATMOSPHERE NOT ENTIRELY STABILIZED WITH BUILDING EASTERN STATES 
RIDGE. RIDGING EXERTS INFLUENCE MONDAY AND TUESDAY AND KEPT POPS OUT 
OF THE FORECAST FOR MOST OF THE AREA WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE 
TERRAIN AREAS IN TENNESSEE AND WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA ON MONDAY AND 
THEN MAINLY SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE ON TUESDAY. RIDGE EDGES SLOWLY EAST 
ALLOWING FOR INCREASINGLY SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL COMPONENT TO THE FLOW 
SO CRANKED UP SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO GET THE CONVECTION GOING 
AGAIN DURING THIS LATE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. GUIDANCE TEMPS 
INDICATE WARMING TREND WITH STRENGTHENING RIDGING FOR SUNDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY WITH INCREASING HUMIDITY AND WEAKENING SUBSIDENCE PRODUCING 
SLIGHTLY LOWER MAX TEMPS ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

...THEN BLEND A CHOSEN FOR THURSDAY NIGHT MINS GIVEN SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGE (COOLER) FROM LATEST GFS MOS.

DRY FOR THIS PERIOD.  WILL HOLD OFF ON POPS FOR FRIDAY.  BUT WILL 
START POPS ON SATURDAY AS WEAK FRONT AND SHORT WAVE APPROACH AND 
MOVE THROUGH THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST.  HAVE DRIED OUT DEWPOINTS 
SOMEWHAT IN THE WAKE OF THE FRONT THIS WEEKEND...BUT BUILD THEM BACK 
UP EARLY NEXT WEEK.

FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY TRYING TO STAY ON WARM SIDE OF GUIDANCE FOR 
HIGH TEMPS...BUT FELT LIKE GFX POST-FRONTAL NUMBERS WERE A LITTLE 
TOO WARM FOR THIS WEEKEND.

MOVES IN LATER THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE 60S AT THIS
TIME. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN FROM THE NORTHWEST TODAY AND
SKIES SHOULD CLEAR QUICKLY THIS MORNING. RAINFALL AMOUNTS YESTERDAY
WERE HELPFUL BUT GROUND STILL QUITE DRY AND EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO
REACH THE MID 80S TO NEAR 90 IN THE VALLEYS WITH COOLER 70S FOR THE
MOUNTAINS. GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE WARMER GFS MOS TODAY FOR HIGHS. 
TONIGHT LOWS WILL BE IN THE 50S AS DRIER AIR REPLACES THE MOIST
AIR IN PLACE NOW.

LEVEL RIDGE WILL REMAIN FIXED OVER THE SOUTHWEST TO SOUTH CENTRAL
CONUS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES SE
ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH FRIDAY. SHORT WAVE ENERGY TRAVELS EAST OVER
RIDGING AND THEN DROPS SE INTO OH VLY ON SAT. MCSS ARE LIKELY TO
DEVELOP ON NE EDGE OF RIDGE AND APPROACH THE MRX CWA FROM THE NW
THIS WEEKEND. LOW CONFIDENCE IN EXACT PATH OF THESE SYSTEMS WITH
GREAT VARIABILITY IN MODEL THICKNESS PATTERN THIS RUN. BUMPED UP
CLOUD COVER AND POP CHC N AREAS. PWS INCREASE TO ABOVE NORMAL FOR
THE WEEKEND SO WIDELY SCT AFTN TSTMS ON TAP AREAWIDE. SHORT WAVES
SHEAR OUT OR SHIFT SE OF AREA BY MON AND RIDGING BUILDS IN THROUGH
NEXT MID WEEK. PWS REMAIN HIGH MON SO HAVE MENTION OF ISOLD
DIURNAL TSTMS. AFTER A COOL FRI MORNING TEMPS WILL CLIMB TO A FEW
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH TUESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
158 PM EDT TUE JUN 19 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS IN
ADVANCE OF A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS
AFTERNOON INTO THE EARLY EVENING HOURS. AT PRESENT IT APPEARS MOST
AREAS WILL SEE BETWEEN A QUARTER AND HALF AN INCH WITH SOME AREAS
RECEIVING A LITTLE MORE...MAINLY IN THE NORTHERN PART OF THE AREA.
ISOLATED 1 INCH OR MORE SHOWERS MAY ALSO ACCOMPANY THIS LINE.

RAIN SHOULD CLEAR OVERNIGHT AND SUNNY SKIES RETURN FOR WEDNESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A MID TO UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL BE NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE 
CENTRAL CONUS THIS PERIOD...PUTTING THE APPALACHIAN REGION IN A 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW PATTERN. A SURFACE HIGH WILL BE OVER THE AREA 
FROM WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...PROVIDING DRY WEATHER AND WARM 
TEMPERATURES. THE UPPER RIDGE GIVES WAY SLIGHTLY ON SATURDAY AS A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH ROUNDS THE RIDGE. THE GFS IS LIKELY OVERDEVELOPING 
THIS FEATURE DUE TO CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK FROM AN MCS OVER THE 
PLAINS...BUT OTHER MODELS DO SHOW AT LEAST A WEAK TROUGH APPROACHING 
FOR THE WEEKEND. CONFIDENCE IS LOW IN TIMING SUCH A FEATURE...SO 
WILL LEAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN FOR BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. THE 
UPPER RIDGE SHIFTS TO THE EAST ON MONDAY AND WILL BE OVERHEAD ON 
TUESDAY...SO HOT AND DRY CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED FOR THE 
BEGINNING OF THE NEXT WORK WEEK.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 191500
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1055 AM EDT TUE JUN 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...THE COLD FRONT IS DIFFICULT TO DETECT IN ANYTHING 
OTHER THAN THE WIND FIELD AND APPEARS TO BE LOCATED ALONG THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER.  SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN ADVANCE OF THE 
FRONT ARE CURRENTLY IN MIDDLE TENNESSEE...AND WILL LIKELY ADVANCE 
SOME THEN MOVE THROUGH WITH THE UPPER LEVEL DISTRUBANCE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

DIFFERENCES IN THE MODELS LEAVE SOME QUESTIONS ABOUT THE FORECAST.  
EARLIER MODELS INDICATED MUCH OF THE MOISTURE WOULD BE CUT OFF BY 
THE MCS CURRENTLY MOVING THROUGH NORTH MISSISSIPPI...HOWEVER LATEST 
NAM INDICATES THAT SYSTEM DISIPATING ALLOWING THE MOISTURE TO MOVE 
INTO THE AREA.  IF THIS OCCURS...RAINFALL AMOUNTS WOULD GENERALLY BE 
AROUND A HALF INCH WITH HIGHER AMOUNTS IN NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.  IF 
THE MCS HOLDS TOGETHER AND CUTS OFF THE MOISTURE...A TENTH INCH 
WOULD BE MORE LIKELY.

ALL THIS TO SAY THAT EITHER WAY...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS ON 
TRACK AND NO CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING. SURFACE 
TROUGH OR PSEUDO WARM FRONT LAYS ALONG S TN RVR VLY. COLD FRONT 
REMAINS WEST OF THE MID MS RVR VLY EARLY TODAY. TWO SHORT WAVE 
BEGINNING TO PHASE VCNTY N MS/W TN WHILE MAIN TROUGH EXTENDS S INTO 
N CNTRL PLAINS. THIS IS PRECURSOR TO LIKELY PCPN EVENT TODAY AND 
TONIGHT ACROSS THE AREA. LOW LEVEL BOUNDARY IN THE WARM SECTOR WILL 
MOVE NORTH THROUGH THE TN VLY TDY. PWS INCREASE TO NEAR 2.00.  AS 
SHORT WAVES MOVE EAST...SUFFICIENT LIFT SETS UP OVER E TN/S APPS 
LATER THIS AFTERNOON. PCPN COVERAGE SHOULD BECOME WIDESPREAD BY LATE 
AFTN. CLOUD COVER WILL HOLD TEMPS DOWN TO LIMIT DESTABILIZATION BUT 
INSTABILITY WILL BECOME MODERATE. TEMPS ALOFT RELATIVELY WARM AND 
SHEAR IS WEAK SO SEVERE TSTMS NOT ANTICIPATED. SHORT WAVES MOVE 
THROUGH AREA THIS EVENING. MEAN TROUGH AND COLD FRONT MOVE EAST 
THROUGH AREA LATE TONIGHT. PCPN CONTINUES UNTIL AROUND DAY BREAK. 
DESPITE DROUGHT CONDITIONS RAINFALL AMOUNTS COULD RANGE FROM ONE 
HALF TO ONE INCH. MUCH IS DEPENDENT ON HOW MUCH DEEPER CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE SOUTH ROBS AVAILABLE MOISTURE.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AFTER COLD FRONT TUESDAY 
NIGHT RIDGING TO THE WEST WILL BRING HIGHER PRESSURE WITH A 
NORTHWEST FLOW TO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WEDNESDAY WITH DRIER AIRMASS 
AND NORTHERLY WINDS.  MODELS DROP DEW POINTS 10 TO 15 DEGREES INTO 
THE 50S.  GFS/WRF MODEL GUIDANCE HAS HIGHS IN LOWER TO MID 80S 
WEDNESDAY WITH NGM SEVERAL DEGREES HIGHER.  RAISED CURRENT GRIDS A 
DEGREE OR TWO WHICH ARE CLOSE TO THE NGM GIVEN DRY GROUND AND DRY 
AIRMASS AND DID THE SAME THURSDAY.  LARGE SCALE PATTERN HAS UPPER 
RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL STATES BUT A LOBE EXTENDS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEAST WITH TROUGHS IN THE NE AND NW THROUGH THE WEEKEND.   
PATTERN CHANGES SLIGHTLY OVER THE WEEKEND AS A WEAK TROUGH/FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH THE NORTHWEST FLOW TO GIVE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS.  MONDAY THE RIDGE STRENGTHENS EVEN MORE OVER THE 
OHIO VALLEY SOUTH TO THE GULF COAST.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

THE TN VLY TDY. PWS INCREASE TO NEAR 2.00.  AS SHORT WAVES MOVE 
EAST...SUFFICIENT LIFT SETS UP OVER E TN/S APPS LATER THIS 
AFTERNOON. PCPN COVERAGE SHOULD BECOME WIDESPREAD BY LATE AFTN. 
CLOUD COVER WILL HOLD TEMPS DOWN TO LIMIT DESTABILIZATION BUT 
INSTABILITY WILL BECOME MODERATE. TEMPS ALOFT RELATIVELY WARM AND 
SHEAR IS WEAK SO SEVERE TSTMS NOT ANTICIPATED. SHORT WAVES MOVE 
THROUGH AREA THIS EVENING. MEAN TROUGH AND COLD FRONT MOVE EAST 
THROUGH AREA LATE TONIGHT. PCPN CONTINUES UNTIL AROUND DAY BREAK. 
DESPITE DROUGHT CONDITIONS RAINFALL AMOUNTS COULD RANGE FROM ONE 
HALF TO ONE INCH. MUCH IS DEPENDENT ON HOW MUCH DEEPER CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE SOUTH ROBS AVAILABLE MOISTURE.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AFTER COLD FRONT TUESDAY 
NIGHT RIDGING TO THE WEST WILL BRING HIGHER PRESSURE WITH A 
NORTHWEST FLOW TO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WEDNESDAY WITH DRIER AIRMASS 
AND NORTHERLY WINDS.  MODELS DROP DEW POINTS 10 TO 15 DEGREES INTO 
THE 50S.  GFS/WRF MODEL GUIDANCE HAS HIGHS IN LOWER TO MID 80S 
WEDNESDAY WITH NGM SEVERAL DEGREES HIGHER.  RAISED CURRENT GRIDS A 
DEGREE OR TWO WHICH ARE CLOSE TO THE NGM GIVEN DRY GROUND AND DRY 
AIRMASS AND DID THE SAME THURSDAY.  LARGE SCALE PATTERN HAS UPPER 
RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL STATES BUT A LOBE EXTENDS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEAST WITH TROUGHS IN THE NE AND NW THROUGH THE WEEKEND.   
PATTERN CHANGES SLIGHTLY OVER THE WEEKEND AS A WEAK TROUGH/FRONT 
MOVES THROUGH THE NORTHWEST FLOW TO GIVE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS.  MONDAY THE RIDGE STRENGTHENS EVEN MORE OVER THE 
OHIO VALLEY SOUTH TO THE GULF COAST.      



&&

FXUS64 KMRX 181842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT MON JUN 18 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...AN UPPER LOW OVER THE GREAT
PLAINS STATES IS CREATING MINOR UPPER LEVEL DISTRUBANCES THAT ARE
MOVING ACROSS THE REGION. THESE IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE DAYTIME
HEATING IS CAUSING SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON THAT WILL
CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING HOURS THEN DIMINISH AS THE HEATING OF THE
DAY DECREASES. A SURFACE FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS UPPER FEATURE
WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA ON TUESDAY BRINGING AN INCREASED CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS ON TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE SURFACE COLD FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA
ON TUESDAY NIGHT. THE MODELS SEEM TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT NOW THAT
THE FRONT WILL HAVE ENOUGH OF A PUSH BEHIND IT TO CLEAR THE
MOUNTAINS. POPS WILL TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO EAST TUESDAY
NIGHT...WITH NO POPS AFTER 12Z WEDNESDAY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
SETTLES OVER THE AREA WITH A DRY NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT ON WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY. WILL REMOVE THE MENTION OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AS
FORECAST SOUNDINGS ARE STABLE AND DRY. TEMPS COOL SLIGHTLY BEHIND
THE FRONT...WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S...BUT 90S CAN BE EXPECTED AGAIN
BY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY IN THE VALLEY. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND
SURFACE FRONT APPROACH THE AREA SATURDAY...MOVING THROUGH ON
SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY. CONFIDENCE IS LOW WITH SUCH SMALL SCALE
FEATURES THIS FAR OUT...BUT WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN FOR
THE WEEKEND.
