AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
225 PM EDT SUN JUN 17 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA WILL 
BEGIN TO SHIFT EAST ON MONDAY.  WITH ATMOSPHERE RATHER DRY OVER THE 
AREA EXPECT SKY TO BE CLEAR TONIGHT.  MODELS INDICATE MOISTURE WILL 
BEGIN TO INCREASE TOMORROW...BUT THINK INSTABILITY WILL STILL BE 
LIMITED AND WITH LACK OF SIGNIFICANT FORCING...WILL KEEP CURRENT DRY 
FORECAST FOR NOW WITH POPS BELOW 15 PERCENT.  WILL TWEAK SOME MAV 
TEMPS UP A BIT FOR TOMORROW...BUT OVERALL NO MAJOR ARGUMENT WITH MAV 
GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT EVENT STILL 
ON TRACK FOR LATE TUESDAY/EARLY WEDNESDAY AS NORTHERN STREAM SHORT 
WAVE AND SURFACE COLD FRONT APPROACH THE AREA. WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW 
GFS GUIDANCE POPS FOR THIS EVENT AS THEY SEEM REASONABLE...BUT WILL 
TRUNCATE POPS AT LIKELY RATHER THAN THE CATEGORICAL POPS THAT GFS 
PROJECTS FOR THE SOUTHERN TIER.

MAIN UNCERTAINTY FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD STILL REVOLVES AROUND HOW 
FAR SOUTH/EAST THE FRONT WILL PROGRESS. OPERATIONAL MODELS AND MOST 
ENSEMBLE MEMBERS SUGGEST FRONT WILL PUSH PAST THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS WHICH IS QUESTIONABLE GIVEN TIME-OF-THE-YEAR 
CLIMATOLOGY. AT ANY RATE...SUSPECT FRONT WILL LINGER CLOSE ENOUGH TO 
HELP TRIGGER TYPICAL DAILY DIURNAL CONVECTION. THUS CONTINUED SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE DAY-TIME PERIODS THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM. 
FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE WITH SOME 
INFLUENCE FROM GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE.

TEMPS...TENDED TO USE A BLEND OF GFS AND GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE 
WITH TWEAKS BASED ON EXPECTED DEGREE OF CLOUD COVER/CONVECTION.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
515 AM EDT SAT JUN 16 2007

.DISCUSSION...WEAK IMPULSE APPROACHING AREA FROM THE NORTH THIS 
MORNING. MODELS SHOW WEAK DIVERGENCE ALOFT MAINLY THIS MORNING.
WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE ON WESTERN PERIPHERY OF SFC RIDGE
WILL CONTINUE EAST OF THE PLATEAU MOST OF TODAY. LAST BUT NOT LEAST 
ISOLATED SHOWERS PERSISTING ON MRX RADAR SO ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
CWA WIDE.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW LEVEL TROUGH REMAINS JUST NW OF 
AREA THIS MORNING. THIS FEATURE IS PROGGED TO MOVE SE INTO THE 
MOUNTAINS BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON. INFLUENCE OF UPPER TROUGHING FROM 
THE NE IS PROGGED TO WEAKEN AS HEIGHTS BUILD IN FROM THE WEST LATER 
THIS AFTERNOON. THIS RESULTS IN DECENT MID LEVEL WARMING AND A 
FORMIDABLE CAP. KEPT AND SLIGHTLY RAISED POPS TODAY OVER SMOKYS AS 
DESTABILIZATION AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT SHOULD SUPPORT SCATTERED 
CONVECTION. WESTERN AND CENTRAL AREAS MAY NEEDED TO BE BUMPED UP 
WITH UPDATE IF OVERALL EASTERN PROGRESSION OF SYNOPTIC FEATURES IS 
TOO FAST. TEMPS ABOUT A DEGREES WARMER THAN FRIDAY WITH TEMPS 
REMAINING AT OR BELOW NORMAL ACROSS NE AREAS. WEAK RIDGING BUILDS IN 
TONIGHT WITH NO SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ELEMENTS OF NOTE.

LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGE IN CONTROL THROUGH THE 
EARLY PART OF THE EXTENDED.  CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW ON 
TIMING/POSITION OF APPROACHING SYSTEM FOR MID WEEK.  HOWEVER...WILL 
CONTINUE WITH THE IDEA OF MAIN BAND OF PRECIP PUSHING IN ON TUESDAY 
AND WILL CONTINUE SCATTERED POPS INTO TUESDAY NIGHT.  WEATHER 
REMAINS UNSETTLED THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED WITH OCCASIONAL 
LOW POPS FORECAST AS A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVES TRACK THROUGH THE AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT FRI JUN 15 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE

DOWN FROM THE NORTH.  THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD DIMINISH DURING THE

KEEP POPS BELOW 15 IN THE VALLEY AND JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY 
SOME MINOR TWEAKS. 
   

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN ISSUE FOR THE LONG TERM IS 
TIMING AND EXTENT OF MID-WEEK SYSTEM. AFTER MAINLY TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS THROUGH EARLY WORK WEEK...GFS CONTINUES TO ADVERTISE 
APPROACH OF UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE COLD FRONT BY LATE TUESDAY/EARLY 
WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...THERE CONTINUES TO BE PROFOUND DIFFERENCES 
BETWEEN MEDIUM-RANGE MODELS AND VARIOUS ENSEMBLE SUITES ON THE 
AMPLITUDE AND TIMING OF THIS EVENT. THE GFS SOLUTION OF PUSHING THE 
SURFACE FRONT THROUGH AND WELL SOUTH OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
SEEMS SOMEWHAT UNLIKELY GIVEN THE TIME OF YEAR...BUT GFS HAS BEEN 
FAIRLY CONSISTENT WITH THIS PROGRESSION FOR SEVERAL RUNS. BASED ON 
THIS UNCERTAINTY...AM INCLINED TO NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES FOR 
CONSISTENCY SAKE UNTIL THE EVOLUTION OF THIS EVENT BECOMES MORE 
CLEAR.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  89  65  93  66 /  20  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  87  60  90  65 /  20  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  89  59  93  64 /  20  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              56  83  55  88  58 /  20  10   0   0   0

HEATING WILL AGAIN MATERIALIZE ALONG THIS BOUNDARY. AREA REMAINS 
UNDER SW END OF UPR NE CST COAST TROUGH. DONT EXPECT A SIGNIFICANT 
SHORT WAVE TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA TDY HOWEVER RELATIVELY COOL TEMPS 
CONTINUE IN THE MID LEVELS. LAYER RH HAS BEEN CREEPING UP. THIS 
COUPLED WITH AFTERNOON HEATING RESULTS IN GOOD DESTABILIZATION AND A 
CONTINUED SLIGHT RISK FOR SOUTHWARD MOVING STRONG TO SEVERE TSTMS. 
WILL USE PERSISTENCE FOR TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN WEATHER 
PATTERN FOR SATURDAY WITH WEAK SHORT WAVE ROTATING THROUGH AND 
PROVIDING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF CONVECTION OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  
HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST ON SUNDAY AND WILL DOMINATE AREA WEATHER 
THROUGH MONDAY.  THERE CONTINUES TO BE DISCREPANCIES ON TIMING IN 
INCOMING SYSTEM FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...WILL TREND FORECAST 
TOWARDS GFS.  GFS BACKING OFF ON ON WAVE PROGGED THROUGH ON THURSDAY 
AND LOWER POPS A BIT.  KEPT TEMPS NEAR GUIDANCE.

FXUS64 KMRX 141842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT THU JUN 14 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...UPPER TROUGH REMAINS ANCHORED OFF 
THE NEW ENGLAND COAST WITH OCCASIONAL DISTURBANCES ROTATING AROUND 
THE WESTERN PERIPHERY OF THIS FEATURE. THESE DISTURBANCES TEND TO 
ENHANCE DIURNAL CONVECTION. THE COINCIDENCE OF ANY OF THESE 
DISTURBANCES WITH PEAK HEATING WILL DETERMINE COVERAGE AND INTENSITY 
OF DIURNAL CONVECTION. FOR FRIDAY...HAVE OPTED TO GO SLIGHTLY ABOVE  
GFS GUIDANCE FOR POPS ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN GIVEN THE 
PROXIMITY OF THE UPPER TROUGH. HOWEVER AS NOTED SECONDARY 
DISTURBANCES AROUND THE UPPER LOW WILL HAVE THE GREATEST INFLUENCE 
ON COVERAGE. FOR TEMPS...HAVE NO REASON TO SIGNIFICANTLY DEVIATE 
FROM GFS GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DRY CONDITIONS RETURN BY 
THE WEEKEND AS UPPER LOW OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST OPENS UP AND IS 
ACCELERATES EASTWARD...ALLOWING UPPER RIDGE TO BUILD INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS SCENARIO IS SHORT LIVED HOWEVER AS UPPER 
PATTERN BECOMES MORE PROGRESSIVE AND UPPER RIDGE MOVES EAST. SOME 
DISCREPANCIES IN TIMING APPROACH OF NEXT SYSTEM FROM THE WEST. 
GENERALLY TENDED TO FAVOR GFS ENSEMBLES WHICH PROJECTS BEST POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY. FOR TEMPS...STAYED CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE FOR THE MOST 
PART.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 140737
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT THU JUN 14 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A CLOSED LOW OFF THE NEW ENGLAND COAST WILL REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY 
THROUGH TONIGHT. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH NOW OVER NEW ENGLAND WILL MOVE 
SOUTH AND CROSS OUR AREA THIS EVENING...BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. WHILE SURFACE HEATING WILL GENERATE SOME 
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED STORMS IN OUR AREA THIS AFTERNOON...EXPECT 
THAT MORE ORGANIZED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP ALONG A 
SURFACE TROUGH AND RESIDUAL OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES LOCATED ACROSS 
EASTERN KY AND SOUTHERN WV. MODELS SHOW THE GREATEST INSTABILITY IN 
THIS AREA. THE STORMS WILL MOVE TO THE SOUTH...AFFECTING SW VA AND 
NE TN IN THE EVENING. THUS WILL HAVE HIGHEST POPS FROM AROUND 22Z TO 
MIDNIGHT IN THE NORTH. STEEP LAPSE RATES AND MLCAPE OVER 1000 J/KG 
IN THE NORTH WILL PROVIDE A THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS. MOS POPS HAVE 
BEEN TOO LOW THE PAST FEW DAYS...AND WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS 
NORTHEAST. MOS TEMPS HAVE ALSO BEEN TOO COOL...SO WILL HAVE HIGHS 
TODAY A FEW DEGREES ABOVE MOS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
USED A SOLUTION SIMILAR TO THE 00Z GFS MODEL FOR THE EXTENDED
WHICH FEATURES AN UPPER TROF/CLOSED LOW WHICH IS STILL HANGING
AROUND OVER THE ATLANTIC COAST THROUGH SATURDAY. THIS MEANS DECENT
INSTABILITY AND LIFT STILL IN STORE FOR FRIDAY AS VORT MAXIMA STILL
PLENTIFUL ON THE BACK SIDE OF UPPER TROF. THEREFORE CHANCE POPS
WARRANTED THROUGH EVENING HOURS FRIDAY TAPERING OFF AFTER MIDNIGHT.
UPPER TROF WEAKENS AND GRADUALLY SHIFTS EAST ON SATURDAY AS
ADVERTISED RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA. HOTTEST DAY
FORECAST TO OCCUR ON SUNDAY AS RIDGE AXIS MOVES ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND APPALACHIANS. KEPT CONVECTION OUT OF THE
FORECAST ON MONDAY AWAITING BETTER INFLUX OF HIGHER DEWPOINT AIR
WHICH RETURNS ON SOUTHERLY WINDS TUESDAY AHEAD OF MIDWEST UPPER
TROF AND ASSOCIATED FRONT. WENT WITH HIGHEST CHANCE POPS FOR
WEDNESDAY AS BELIEVE SURFACE COOL FRONT WILL MOVE A LITTLE SLOWER
THAN MODEL SOLUTION. STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS FOR THE
LONG TERM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION UPDATE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
800 PM EDT WED JUN 13 2007

.DISCUSSION...COMPLEX OF THUNDERSTORMS/SHOWERS HAS MOVED SOUTHWEST 
ALONG THE VALLEY FROM THE NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA. SOME STORMS 
HAVE BEEN NEAR SEVERE LIMITS, WITH AN ISOLATED SEVERE ONE. EXPECT 
STORMS/SHOWERS TO WEAKEN AFTER SUNSET, EVENTUALLY DYING OUT IN THE 
NIGHT. SOME CLOUDS WILL REMAIN OVER MOST AREAS, BUT IN AREAS OF THE 
VALLEY WHERE RAIN HAS FALLEN AND SIGNIFICANT POST-OUTFLOW COOLING 
HAS OCCURRED, SOME PATCHY FOG WILL FORM WHICH WILL DISSIPATE AFTER 
SUNRISE. WILL ISSUE UPDATE TO ZONES TO RAISE POPS IN CENTRAL VALLEY 
AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE WHERE STORMS HAVE NOT OCCURRED YET, AND 
LOWER THEN IN THE NORTHEAST SECTIONS WHERE MOST OF THEM HAVE MOVE 
OUT. LEFT MIN TEMPS ALONE, BUT ALTERED TEMP/DEWPOINT PROGRESSION TO 
ACCOUNT FOR COOLER CURRENT TEMPS.

259 PM EDT WED JUN 13 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...NOT TOO MUCH CONVECTION SO

BIT MORE INSTABILITY AS WELL AS DEWPOINTS EDGE SLIGHTLY HIGHER.  
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTHWEST TO HIGH CHANCE FAR NORTHEAST 
ZONES.  WILL NOT ARGUE MUCH WITH MAV TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LOW OFF THE 
NEW ENGLAND COAST BEGINS TO WEAKEN THROUGH THE PERIOD AND BEGINS TO 
MOVE TO THE NORTHEAST BY LATE SATURDAY.  THIS WILL BRING AN END TO 
THE WEAK SHORT WAVES ROTATING AROUND THIS LOW WHICH HAVE TRIGGERED 
THE SHOWERS THROUGH SW VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS.  HAVE LEFT 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY IN THE 
NORTHEAST FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY THEN DRY FOR SATURDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY WITH THE NEXT UPPER SYSTEM MOVING IN SOMETIME TUESDAY OR 
WEDNESDAY FOR THE NEXT POSSIBLE WEATHER MAKER.  AT THE PRESENT TIME 
AM GOING UNDER GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR THAT SYSTEM AS IT IS A FEW DAYS 
OFF AND THE MODELS HAVE VARIED ON HANDLING THIS PERIOD.

FOR TEMPERATURES HAVE STUCK CLOSE TO GUIDANCE AS NOTHING THE HANG A 
CHANGE ONTO.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 130703
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 AM EDT WED JUN 13 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
SOME RESIDUAL SHOWERS FROM A DECAYING MCS ARE MOVING SOUTHWEST ALONG 
THE APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING. MOST OF THE PRECIP SHOULD DISSIPATE 
BY THE TIME IT REACHES OUR AREA...BUT WILL LEAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
IN THIS MORNING. TEMPS WILL BE TRICKY TODAY AND DEPEND ON HOW MUCH 
MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS HOLD TOGETHER. BETTER PRECIP CHANCES COME 
THIS AFTERNOON WITH SURFACE HEATING AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE. LAPSE 
RATES ARE NOT AS STEEP AS YESTERDAY AS THE UPPER LOW HAS MOVED 
AWAY...AND MOISTURE REMAINS LIMITED BUT DOES INCREASE THROUGH THE 
DAY. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS NORTHEAST AND IN THE MOUNTAINS. ON 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON/NIGHT ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES 
ACROSS...SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY...COOLING THE MIDLEVELS AND PROVIDING 
UPPER DIVERGENCE. WILL HAVE CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE AREA. AN UPPER TROUGH AXIS FROM THE CLOSED LOW OFF THE NEW 
ENGLAND COAST CONTINUES TO EXTEND OVER THE AREA INTO FRIDAY...WHICH 
WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...WITH HIGHEST 
CHANCES EAST. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
UPPER LOW FINALLY MAKES ENOUGH PROGRESS EAST AWAY FROM THE
FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY TO ALLOW FOR HIGHER PRESSURE OVER THE
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. IN THIS REGIME THE DRIER AND
MORE STABLE ATMOSPHERE WILL LEAD TO A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE AND
BUILDING HEAT THROUGH MONDAY WITH VERY LIMITED PROBABILITY OF
PRECIPITATION. RIDGE SHIFTS SLOWLY EAST BY TUESDAY AND INCREASING
SOUTHERLY COMPONENT AT ALL LEVELS LEADS TO MOISTURE ADVECTION AHEAD
OF THE NEXT UPPER TROF WHICH MIGRATES INTO THE NORTHERN CENTRAL
STATES AT THIS TIME. INCREASING INSTABILITY PROVIDES FOR POSSIBLE
CONVECTION ON TUESDAY AND MAINTAINED CHANCE POP FROM PREVIOUS
FORECAST. STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH
LONG TERM.

FXUS64 KMRX 130005
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
757 PM EDT TUE JUN 12 2007

.DISCUSSION...OUTER FRINGE OF COLD CORE MID LEVEL CIRCULATION SLIDING
SW ALONG PAST SE CORNER OF MRX CWA. THIS FEATURE COUPLED WITH AFTN 
HEATING RESULTED IN WIDESPREAD STRONG TO SEVERE CONVECTION...MAINLY
ACROSS THE CAROLINAS. DEEPEST MOISTURE REMAINS EAST OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT
BUT INCREASES WEDNESDAY ACROSS THE AREA AS MOISTURE PUSHES IN FROM 
THE NE. WILL CANCEL SVA.0388 FOR CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES AND DROP 
POPS ACROSS THE MRX CWA. ISOLATED CONVECTION REMAINS POSSIBLE BUT 
COVERAGE SHOULD REMAIN BELOW 20 PERCENT. CONVECTIVE AREA MOVING SW 
INTO N VA SHOULD REMAIN NE OF AREA OVERNIGHT. ALSO DUE TO DRY 
BOUNDARY LAYER HAVE TWEAKED MINS DOWN A COUPLE DEGREES. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOPING 
OVER NORTHEAST ZONES...WHERE AIR MASS HAS DESTABILIZED AND A SHORT 
WAVE IS MOVING THROUGH.  HOWEVER...MOISTURE IS LIMITED AND MAIN AREA 
OF LIFT WILL TRACK TO OUR EAST.  AS A RESULT...COVERAGE SHOULD 
REMAIN LOW THOUGH THERE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR STAY STORMS TO BRIEFLY 
BECOME QUITE STRONG...POSSIBLY EVEN SEVERE.  CAN NOT COMPLETELY RULE 
OUT A STRAY STORM SLIDING INTO THE TN VALLEY...BUT CHANGES ARE LOW 
ENOUGH WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR NOW.  ANY STORMS OVER THE AREA 
SHOULD DIMINISH QUICKLY WITH SUNSET.  ON WEDNESDAY...WILL SEE 
CONDITIONS SIMILAR TO TODAY...WITH AFTERNOON INSTABILITY...MAINLY 
OVER ELEVATED AREAS...AND ANOTHER SHORT WAVE ROTATING THROUGH THE 
REGION.  HOWEVER ...WILL HAVE POPS SLIGHTLY HIGHER AS SHORT WAVE 
EXPECTED TO TRACK A LITTLE FURTHER INTO THE MRX CWA. 

LONG TERM  (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER LOW OFF 
NORTHEAST COAST SPINS AWAY ACCORDING TO MODELS AND DROPS WEAK SPOKES 
OF VORTICITY AND INSTABILITY WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, AND FRIDAY SO HAVE 
SLIGHTLY INCREASED POPS IN THOSE TIME PERIODS MAINLY OVER EASTERN 
PORTIONS OF FORECAST AREA, IN MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER TERRAIN OF 
NORTHEAST. THE LOW FINALLY OPENS UP AND IS ABSORBED BY HUDSON BAY 
TROUGH. CENTRAL NOAM RIDGE MOVES EAST ACROSS EASTER U.S. BY LATER 
FRIDAY, SO THE WEEKEND LOOKS DRY. UPPER RIDGE MOVES EAST TO COAST BY 
MONDAY-TUESDAY TIME FRAME WITH LOOK AT NEXT TROUGH DROPPING OUT OF 
CANADA INTO MIDWEST LATER TUESDAY. INCREASE OF MOISTURE FROM SOUTH 
ON TUESDAY SO WENT WITH CHANCE POPS MOVING NORTH ACROSS THE AREA 
THEN. LEFT TEMPS LARGELY UNCHANGED FROM PREVIOUS PACKAGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  63  88  65  86  64 /  10  10  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    60  86  63  84  62 /  10  20  20  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN            61  87  63  84  61 /  10  10  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   56  83  58  81  57 /  10  20  30  30  30

TROUGH. CENTRAL NOAM RIDGE MOVES EAST ACROSS EASTER U.S. BY LATER 
FRIDAY, SO THE WEEKEND LOOKS DRY. UPPER RIDGE MOVES EAST TO COAST BY 
MONDAY-TUESDAY TIME FRAME WITH LOOK AT NEXT TROUGH DROPPING OUT OF 
CANADA INTO MIDWEST LATER TUESDAY. INCREASE OF MOISTURE FROM SOUTH 
ON TUESDAY SO WENT WITH CHANCE POPS MOVING NORTH ACROSS THE AREA 
THEN. LEFT TEMPS LARGELY UNCHANGED FROM PREVIOUS PACKAGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 120700
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT TUE JUN 12 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLOWLY MOVE EAST FROM THE GREAT LAKES TO
NEW ENGLAND THROUGH THE PERIOD. ALOFT...A CLOSED LOW WILL REMAIN
NEARLY STATIONARY OFF THE NEW ENGLAND COAST...AND A SERIES OF
SHORTWAVE TROUGHS WILL ROTATE AROUND THIS LOW. THE FIRST WILL PASS
THROUGH TODAY...MAINLY AFFECTING THE NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF OUR
AREA. THOUGH MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED...COOL MIDLEVEL TEMPS WILL
RESULT IN STEEP LAPSE RATES AND SBCAPE NEAR 1000 J/KG NORTHEAST AND
IN THE MOUNTAINS. WILL INCLUDE CHANCE POPS IN THOSE AREAS...WHICH
IS WELL ABOVE MOS. THE VALLEY AND PLATEAU WILL BE MORE STABLE AND
SHOULD STAY DRY. MODELS SHOW SOME INCREASING MOISTURE ON WEDNESDAY
BUT NOT MUCH INSTABILITY OR LIFT...SO WILL JUST HAVE A SLIGHT
CHANCE POP NORTHEAST. A SECOND SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES THE AREA
THURSDAY EVENING/NIGHT...AGAIN GIVING STEEP LAPSE RATES IN THE
NORTHEAST. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS WITH THIS FEATURE. TEMPERATURES
SHOULD GENERALLY BE NEAR NORMAL FOR THE PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS CONTINUE TO DEPICT VORT MOVING SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS ON THE BACK SIDE OF SLOWLY DEPARTING EASTERN SEABOARD
UPPER TROF FOR FRIDAY. STAYED WITH LOW CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION
GENERALLY EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WHILE DROPPING WESTERN
PORTION INTO THE SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY. BY SATURDAY MODELS SHOW
UPPER RIDGING STRENGTHENING OVER SOUTHEASTERN U.S. AS UPPER TROF
EDGES JUST OFF ATLANTIC COAST BY 00Z SUNDAY. USED A SLIGHT CHANCE
POP FOR POSSIBLE CONVECTION EASTERN ZONES WHERE DEEPER
MOISTURE/BETTER INSTABILITY PROGGED. STAYED ON THE DRY SIDE FOR THE
WEEKEND THROUGH MONDAY AS UPPER RIDGE ESTABLISHES ITSELF ACROSS THE
EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION. TWEAKED MIN/MAX TEMPS TOWARD NEW MEX
MOS GUIDANCE WHICH INCLUDES A WARMING TREND COMPLIMENTS OF
SUBSIDENCE AND INCREASING INSOLATION.

FXUS64 KMRX 111907
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EDT MON JUN 11 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH TO OUR 
EAST COULD CARRY OVER A FEW SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE MRX 
CWA...MAINLY OVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS THIS EVENING.  OTHERWISE...MID 
TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO SLOWLY SHIFT SOUTHWARD...
WITH SKIES BECOMING CLEAR BY MORNING.  ON TUESDAY...EXPECT OUR AIR 
MASS TO BECOME SOMEWHAT UNSTABLE WITH LESS CLOUD COVER FOR STRONGER 
DIURNAL HEATING.  AS ANOTHER WAVE MOVES THROUGH TO OUR EAST...MAY 
SEE ISOLATED CONVECTION WITH BEST CHANCES OVER ELEVATED TERRAIN.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER LOW OVER ATLANTIC 
PRODUCING A SERIES OF TROFS OVER MID-ATLANTIC STATES WHICH WILL 
ROTATE OVER REGION THROUGH WEEK. WEAK BACK DOOR FRONTS CROSS AREA. 
NOT STRONG ENOUGH TO PRODUCE MUCH WIDESPREAD INSTABILITY AND, HENCE, 
DROUGHT BUSTING RAINS, BUT STILL ENOUGH TO ALLOW TERRAIN ENHANCED 
THUNDERSTORMS AND SHOWERS, MAINLY OVER NORTHEAST SECTIONS AND IN 
MOUNTAINS. BELIEVE AS INSTABILITY INCREASES SOMEWHAT (CAPES UP 
AROUND 2000) BY MIDWEEK, MIGHT SEEM ISOLATED BORDERLINE SEVERE 
STORMS AS HAS BEEN THE CASE WITH SIMILAR STORMS RECENTLY. AS UPPER 
LOW FINALLY DRIFTS EAST, UPPER RIDGE TO WEST ASSERTS ITSELF FROM 
MIDWEST INTO REGION ON WEEKEND. SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE POPS EACH DAY 
UNTIL SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WHICH, AT THIS TIME, LOOK DRY. TEMPS LOOK 
OK FROM PREVIOUS PACKAGE AND IN LINE WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES 
THOUGHTS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 110750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT MON JUN 11 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE IS 
LOCATED OVER SOUTHERN GA AND THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE THIS 
MORNING...WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH AXIS EXTENDING NORTH TOWARD THE 
APPALACHIANS. A SOUTHEAST FLOW WILL ADVECT MOISTURE FROM THE 
ATLANTIC TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY. SOME WEAK LOW LEVEL 
LIFT ENHANCED BY UPSLOPE FLOW SHOULD PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE MOUNTAINS...AND ESPECIALLY SW NC. THERE WILL 
ALSO BE SOME INSTABILITY IN THE VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON WITH LI AROUND 
-3...SO WILL INCLUDE A LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP OUTSIDE THE 
MOUNTAINS. SOME BROKEN MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS SHOULD HOLD TEMPS 
BACK A BIT FROM PREVIOUS DAYS...WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S IN MOST SPOTS. 
WILL KEEP LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR THE EVENING HOURS...BUT 
WITH THE LOSS OF SURFACE HEATING AND HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTH 
BUILDING SOUTHWARD...ANY PRECIP SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA AROUND 
MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE TROUGH PUSHING INTO 
REGION ON TUESDAY...MOISTURE LIMITED...BUT SOME INSTABILITY COULD 
BRING SOME DIURNAL ACTIVITY ON TUESDAY...WILL GO WITH 20-30 POPS FOR 
TUESDAY...WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE MOUNTAINS.  MODELS BRING 
AN UPPER LOW TRACKING INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY.  BEST MOISTURE 
REMAINING TO THE EAST OF OUR CWA...BUT STILL DECENT INSTABILITY 
EXPECTED.  WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH AND MOUNTAINS WHERE THE BEST 
MOISTURE IS EXPECTED.  UPPER LOW LINGERING TO THE EAST OF OUR CWA ON 
THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY WITH IMPULSES ROTATING THROUGH OUR AREA.  
BEST MOISTURE REMAINS TO THE EAST...WILL KEEP 20-30 POPS GOING FOR 
THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE MOUNTAINS.  
RIDGE BUILDS IN ON SUNDAY...BRINGING A RETURN OF DRY WEATHER ACROSS 
THE CWA.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 101832 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED FORECASTER INITIALS
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT SUN JUN 10 2007

.SHORT TERM  (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES...AND 
EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL 
THAT A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM HAS DEVELOPED OVER THE OZARKS 
REGION NEAR A STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE 700-500 MB ISOHEIGHT 
PATTERN WOULD SUGGEST THAT THIS MCS WILL MOVE SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON 
(WHERE THE BEST INSTABILITY ALSO RESIDES) AND STAY WEST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT ANOTHER MCS WILL 
DEVELOP OVER CENTRAL MISSOURI LATER TONIGHT...AS THE NOCTURNAL 
LOW-LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS OVER THE PLAINS. THE 700-500 MB ISOHEIGHT 
PATTERN WOULD SUGGEST THAT THIS MCS WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST TOWARDS 
SOUTHEAST TN BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. FOR SOME REASON...THE GFS MODEL 
WEAKENS THIS MCS QUICKLY BY AFTERNOON...EVEN THOUGH THERE SHOULD BE 
SOME MARGINAL TO POSSIBLY MODERATE INSTABILITY IN PLACE AHEAD OF THE 
SYSTEM AS IT NEARS THE CHATTANOOGA AREA. FEEL THAT THE GFS SOLUTION 
IS UNREALISTIC (MODELS USUALLY CANT HANDLE MCSS VERY WELL ANYWAY) 
AND THINK THAT AN MCS MAY AFFECT SOUTHEAST TN BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. 
WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL INTRODUCE CHANCE POPS ON MONDAY AFTERNOON 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC. IN ADDITION...EASTERLY FLOW 
OVER THE CAROLINAS AND A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN 
ATLANTIC WILL INCREASE MOISTURE ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS...PRODUCING 
SOME CONVECTION ON MONDAY OVER THE MOUNTAINS AND POSSIBLY OVER THE 
VALLEYS. IN ADDITION...WILL INCLUDE POPS ON TUESDAY AS MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY CONTINUE TO INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARD A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER MAXES DUE TO AN EXPECTED 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH TO OUR EAST 
WILL ROTATE THROUGH A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES ON WEDNESDAY PROVIDING A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIMITED CONVECTION MAINLY OVER OUR EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS. ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVES MOVING THROUGH THE UPPER TROUGH 
WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK THROUGH THE REGION. THE RESULT WILL BE AN 
UNORGANIZED COUPLE OF ROUNDS OF ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS/ 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. MODELS HINTING AT A 
BREAK BETWEEN WAVES ON SUNDAY...SO FOR NOW WILL GO WITH DRY 
CONDITIONS. GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  64  90  64  88  62 /  10  30  20  20  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    65  88  65  86  63 /  10  20  20  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN            63  88  63  87  62 /   0  20  20  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   59  84  59  84  58 /  10  20  20  20  20 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT SUN JUN 10 2007

.SHORT TERM  (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES...AND 
EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL 
THAT A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM HAS DEVELOPED OVER THE OZARKS 
REGION NEAR A STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE 700-500 MB ISOHEIGHT 
PATTERN WOULD SUGGEST THAT THIS MCS WILL MOVE SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON 
(WHERE THE BEST INSTABILITY ALSO RESIDES) AND STAY WEST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT. GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT ANOTHER MCS WILL 
DEVELOP OVER CENTRAL MISSOURI LATER TONIGHT...AS THE NOCTURNAL 
LOW-LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS OVER THE PLAINS. THE 700-500 MB ISOHEIGHT 
PATTERN WOULD SUGGEST THAT THIS MCS WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST TOWARDS 
SOUTHEAST TN BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. FOR SOME REASON...THE GFS MODEL 
WEAKENS THIS MCS QUICKLY BY AFTERNOON...EVEN THOUGH THERE SHOULD BE 
SOME MARGINAL TO POSSIBLY MODERATE INSTABILITY IN PLACE AHEAD OF THE 
SYSTEM AS IT NEARS THE CHATTANOOGA AREA. FEEL THAT THE GFS SOLUTION 
IS UNREALISTIC (MODELS USUALLY CANT HANDLE MCSS VERY WELL ANYWAY) 
AND THINK THAT AN MCS MAY AFFECT SOUTHEAST TN BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. 
WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL INTRODUCE CHANCE POPS ON MONDAY AFTERNOON 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC. IN ADDITION...EASTERLY FLOW 
OVER THE CAROLINAS AND A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN 
ATLANTIC WILL INCREASE MOISTURE ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS...PRODUCING 
SOME CONVECTION ON MONDAY OVER THE MOUNTAINS AND POSSIBLY OVER THE

INSTABILITY CONTINUE TO INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO TREND TOWARD A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER MAXES DUE TO AN EXPECTED 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH TO OUR EAST 
WILL ROTATE THROUGH A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES ON WEDNESDAY PROVIDING A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIMITED CONVECTION MAINLY OVER OUR EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS.  ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVES MOVING THROUGH THE UPPER TROUGH 
WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK THROUGH THE REGION.  THE RESULT WILL BE AN 
UNORGANIZED COUPLE OF ROUNDS OF ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.  MODELS HINTING 
AT A BREAK BETWEEN WAVES ON SUNDAY...SO FOR NOW WILL GO WITH DRY 
CONDITIONS.  GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK GOOD AND STAYED CLOSE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 AM EDT SUN JUN 10 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH A 
DRIER AIR MASS (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY) ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
MODEL AND MORNING BNA SOUNDINGS CONTINUE TO INDICATE A CAPPING 
INVERSION AROUND 800 MB...WHICH SHOULD SUPPRESS ANY POSSIBLE 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. MAX TEMPS THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD BE FAIRLY 
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY...WITH ONLY A FEW CUMULUS CLOUDS DEVELOPING IN 
THE AFTERNOON. 

CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE OVERALL...BUT WILL 
UPDATE TO REMOVE MORNING FOG WORDING.

FXUS64 KMRX 100800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SUN JUN 10 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL 
BRINGING ANOTHER WARM AND DRY DAY TODAY.  STILL A FEW AREAS OF 
SHALLOW MOISTURE THIS MORNING...WILL KEEP PATCHY DENSE FOG IN THE 
FORECAST FOR THE MORNING HOURS.  DRY WEATHER CONTINUES TONIGHT.  A 
WEAK IMPULSE TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY.  MOISTURE 
LIMITED...BUT A LITTLE INSTABILITY EXPECTED...WILL CARRY DIURNAL 
POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  ANOTHER 
SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH ON TUESDAY.  GFS BRINGING MORE MOISTURE 
INTO THE AREA THAN THE NAM.  WITH THE DRY AIR IN PLACE...PREFER THE 
DRIER NAM.  WILL KEEP ONLY 20 POPS FOR MORE DIURNAL ACTIVITY FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS...THEN DRY EVERY ELSE ON TUESDAY.  STAYED GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...MODELS TRACK AN UPPER LOW 
INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY.  MOISTURE LIMITED BUT STILL SOME 
INSTABILITY...WILL CONTINUE THE DIURNAL POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS ON 
WEDNESDAY.  UPPER LOW ROTATING INTO THE CAROLINAS ON THURSDAY...WILL 
GO WITH 20-30 POPS FOR THURSDAY WITH THE BEST POPS IN THE NORTH AND 
THE MOUNTAINS WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE LINGERS.  UPPER LOW TRACKS 
NORTHEAST ON FRIDAY...WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY.  UPPER 
LOW TRACKS NORTH INTO VA ON SATURDAY WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE ACROSS OUR CWA...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON 
SATURDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 091851
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT SAT JUN 9 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS THAT THE COLD FRONT HAS PUSHED THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA...WITH DEWPOINTS DROPPING INTO THE LOW TO MID 60S AND LIGHT 
NORTHWEST WINDS. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL THAT CLOUDS HAVE GRADUALLY 
DIMINISHED AS DRIER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND THE FRONT. NORTHWESTERLY 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO BRING DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. ON MONDAY...EASTERLY 
FLOW OVER THE CAROLINAS WILL SLIGHTLY INCREASE MOISTURE OVER THE 
APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF ISOLATED 
DIURNAL CONVECTION FOR THE MOUNTAINS. AS FOR TEMPS...MINS SHOULD BE 
LOWER THE NEXT FEW NIGHTS WITH DRIER AIR IN PLACE...AND WILL TREND 
TOWARD A PERSISTENCE FORECAST WITH MAXES. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THROUGH THE EARLY 
EXTENDED...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. 
WITH A COUPLE OF WEAK IMPULSES ROTATING THROUGH TO OUR EAST.  AS A 
RESULT...WILL MAINLY SEE WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE AREA 
THOUGH THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIMITED CONVECTION OVER OUR 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS FROM DAYTIME HEATING AND WEAK LIFT FROM PASSING 
WAVES.  BY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...REMNANTS OF A WEAKENING SYSTEM WILL 
AFFECT THE AREA.  AT THIS TIME...THIS APPEARS TO BE RATHER 
UNORGANIZED WITH POOR MODEL CONSISTENCY.  OVERALL...SHOULD SEE 
SUFFICIENT INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND ENERGY TO CONTINUE ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED POPS FOR THIS PERIOD WITH SLIGHTLY LOW POPS INTO SATURDAY. 
HAVE KEPT TEMPERATURE FORECAST NEAR GUIDANCE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    62  88  60  88  61 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN            62  88  60  88  61 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   58  86  55  86  55 /   0   0   0   0   0

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 AM EDT SAT JUN 9 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT STILL WEST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...AND GENERALLY ALONG A MEMPHIS-TO-NASHVILLE-TO- 
PIKEVILLE KY LINE. THIS COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY MOVE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES 
MORE NORTHWESTERLY. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT A STRONG MID-LEVEL 
CAPPING INVERSION (BETWEEN 800 AND 600 MB) WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY...WHICH SHOULD SUPPRESS ANY POSSIBLE CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE FRONT. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE 
AREA OF LOW CLOUDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...BUT THINK 
THAT SOME BREAKS WILL DEVELOP BY THIS AFTERNOON AS HEATING PROMOTES 
SOME VERTICAL MIXING. 

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MORNING FOG WORDING.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 090737
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT SAT JUN 9 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT REMAINS TO OUR 
NORTHWEST...DELINEATED BY A DEWPOINT GRADIENT ALONG THE OHIO VALLEY. 
PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS OVER THE AREA...WITH LOW CLOUDS 
AND FOG FORMING IN MANY LOCATIONS. WILL MENTION PATCHY FOG THIS 
MORNING. CLOUDS WILL LIFT THROUGH THE MORNING BE PARTLY CLOUDY BY 
AFTERNOON. THE FRONT WILL WORK ITS WAY SOUTH...AND DEWPOINTS WILL 
LOWER THROUGH THE DAY. HIGHS WILL BE IN THE 80S TO NEAR 90 SOUTH. 
WITH DRY AIR ALOFT AND HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN...EXPECT THAT 
CONDITIONS WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING 
TONIGHT...AND WILL MENTION AREAS OF FOG....

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING 
DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY.  INSTABILITY INCREASING ON MONDAY...BUT 
MOISTURE STILL LIMITED...WILL KEEP ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR DIURNAL 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE MOUNTAINS ON MONDAY. A SHORTWAVE ROTATES 
THROUGH THE REGION ON TUESDAY ALONG WITH HIGHER INSTABILITY...BUT 
MOISTURE STILL LIMITED...WILL CARRY ONLY 20 POPS FOR TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON FOR THE MOUNTAINS AGAIN.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH 
ON WEDNESDAY ALONG WITH BETTER MOISTURE.  WILL CARRY 20 POPS FOR THE 
ENTIRE CWA.  ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH TRACKS THROUGH ON THURSDAY.  
BETTER MOISTURE EXPECTED ALONG WITH SOME INSTABILITY.  WILL CARRY 
CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY.  A FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY.  
WILL KEEP 20-30 POPS FOR FRIDAY WITH THE BEST POPS IN THE NORTH 
WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE RESIDES.  STAYED NEAR  MAV GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 081835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT FRI JUN 8 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT STRETCHING FROM NEAR INDIANAPOLIS 
SOUTHWEST TO NEAR LITTLE ROCK...WITH A VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
DEVELOPING OVER THE PLATEAU BETWEEN THE FIRST AND SECOND LINES OF 
CONVECTION. THE INITIAL LINE OF CONVECTION OVER THE GREAT TN VALLEY 
HAS REMAINED BELOW SEVERE CRITERIA SO FAR...BUT THINK THAT THE 
SECOND LINE OF CONVECTION (CURRENTLY OVER MIDDLE TN) WILL LIKELY 
PRODUCE SOME SEVERE WEATHER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATER THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY 
TONIGHT AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ZONAL. IN FACT...THIS FRONT 
SHOULD BISECT THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...WITH ISOLATED 
CONVECTION AGAIN POSSIBLE ON SATURDAY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST NC. THE FRONT SHOULD EVENTUALLY PUSH SOUTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA BY SUNDAY MORNING...WITH DRY WEATHER RETURNING ON SUNDAY. AS 
FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARD A PERSISTENCE FORECAST TONIGHT AND 
SATURDAY...WITH LOWER TEMPS EXPECTED BY SATURDAY NIGHT AS SLIGHTLY 
DRIER AIR MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE. THIS WILL KEEP MOST AREAS 
DRY AND WARM...THOUGH MAY SEE SOME ELEVATED CONVECTION LATE 
AFTERNOON BOTH DAYS. COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE REGION DURING THE 
REMAINDER OF THE TIME FRAME. SYSTEM APPEARS TO BE A BIT UNORGANIZED 
AS IT MOVES INTO THE AREA...BUT SHOULD BRING IN ENOUGH MOISTURE AND 
LIFT FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPS.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 081333
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 AM EDT FRI JUN 8 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH A WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
WITH HIGH DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S. SATELLITE IMAGES 
REVEAL SOME CONVECTION OCCURRING AHEAD OF THE FRONT ACROSS THE LOWER 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND OZARKS...MOVING EAST TOWARD THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY. A MODIFIED MORNING SOUNDING FROM NASHVILLE REVEALS THAT A 
VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS (CAPES AROUND 3500 J/KG AND LIS AROUND -6) 
WILL DEVELOP LATER THIS AFTERNOON...WITH A CLASSIC INVERTED-V 
PROFILE IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER. IN ADDITION...A DEEP MID-LEVEL LAYER 
OF DRY AIR AND STEEP LOW-LEVEL LAPSE RATES SHOULD ALL COMBINE TO 
PRODUCE STRONG DOWNBURST WINDS WITH THIS AFTERNOONS CONVECTION. 
LARGE HAIL WILL ALSO BE A CONCERN DUE TO THE VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
EXPECTED.

CURRENT FORECAST SEEMS TO HAVE EVERYTHING COVERED WELL...BUT WILL 
UPDATE THE FORECAST TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING AND TO MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF DAMAGING WINDS WITH SOME STORMS.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 080725
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT FRI JUN 8 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA WILL BE 
SUPPRESSED TO THE SOUTH AS A TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND 
OHIO VALLEY TODAY. ADVECTION OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE 
SURFACE COLD FRONT ALONG WITH SURFACE HEATING WILL RESULT IN 
GENEROUS INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON. MODELS INDICATE MLCAPE VALUES 
APPROACHING 3000 J/KG ACROSS THE AREA AROUND 18Z...WITH LI AROUND 
-5. MIDLEVEL DRY AIR...HIGH DOWNDRAFT CAPE...AND STEEP LOW LEVEL 
LAPSE RATES SUGGEST THE MAIN SEVERE THREAT WILL BE DAMAGING 
DOWNBURST WINDS...THOUGH WITH THE HIGH CAPE LARGE HAIL WILL ALSO BE 
POSSIBLE. WOULD PREFER TO SEE STRONGER UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS TO AID 
LIFT FOR A BETTER THREAT OF SEVERE...THE UPPER JET AND TROUGH STAY 
WELL NORTH...BUT GIVEN THE INSTABILITY THAT WILL BE IN PLACE...ONLY 
WEAK BOUNDARIES WILL BE NEEDED FOR CONVECTIVE INITIATION. THE SEVERE 
THREAT SHOULD DIMINISH AFTER 00Z AS THE FLOW TURNS NORTHWESTERLY 
BEHIND A SURFACE TROUGH PASSAGE. HIGH TEMPS SHOULD BE A BIT COOLER 
THAN YESTERDAY DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND LIKELY PRECIP...IN THE UPPER 
80S TO LOWER 90S IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SURFACE TROUGH LINGERING 
INTO SATURDAY MORNING ALONG WITH SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE AND LIFT...  
WITH DRY AIR PUSHING IN BY AFTERNOON.  WILL CARRY 20 POPS FOR ONLY 
THE MORNING HOURS ACROSS THE CWA.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS BRINGING 
DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  INSTABILITY INCREASING 
ON MONDAY...BUT MOISTURE STILL LIMITED...WILL CONTINUE WITH ONLY A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR DIURNAL THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE MOUNTAINS ON MONDAY. 
A SHORTWAVE ROTATES OVER THE RIDGE ON TUESDAY ALONG WITH HIGHER 
INSTABILITY...BUT MOISTURE STILL LIMITED...WILL CARRY ONLY 20 POPS 
FOR TUESDAY. A FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS 
INTO THURSDAY.  BETTER MOISTURE EXPECTED ALONG WITH SOME 
INSTABILITY.  WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH DAYS.  STAYED NEAR  
MAV GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 080152
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 PM EDT THU JUN 7 2007

.DISCUSSION...EVEN WITH TEMPERATURES UP AT THE 9 PM 
OBSERVATION...GOOD DEW POINT DEPRESSIONS WILL ALLOW FOR RAPID 
COOLING OVER THEN NEXT FEW HOURS AND CURRENT LOW TEMPERATURES APPEAR 
REASONABLE.  GOOD MOISTURE RETURN WILL SEE CLOUDINESS INCREASING 
LATER TONIGHT WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS TOMORROW AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING.  MOST OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA IS UNDER A 
SLIGHT RISK THREAT FOR TOMORROW.  SEE MEMHWOMRX FOR DETAILS. 


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT 
SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED WARM FRONT 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST KY AND NORTHEAST TN...WITH DEWPOINTS BEGINNING TO 
SLOWLY RISE AT TRI-CITIES. SURFACE MOISTURE LEVELS SHOULD SLOWLY 
INCREASE TONIGHT...AS SOUTHERLY 850 MB FLOW CONTINUES AHEAD OF AN 
UNSEASONABLY STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER 
VALLEY. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT A STRONG CAPPING INVERSION 
WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPRESS CONVECTION THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING...BUT 
THEN WEAKEN BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE EARLY EVENING HOURS...WITH 
SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT BY LATE FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON. ALTHOUGH WIND FIELDS AND UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS ARE PROGGED 
TO BE WEAK WITH THIS FRONT ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY...A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SO 
THINK THAT SOME SEVERE TSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE. WITH THE UPPER- 
LEVEL FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL FRIDAY NIGHT...THIS COLD FRONT WILL 
SLOWLY DOWN QUITE A BIT AS IT ENTERS THE FORECAST AREA. THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY SHOULD BECOME ORIENTED WEST-TO-EAST AND LINGER ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY. AS A RESULT...WILL 
LEAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SOME CONVECTION IN THE FORECAST ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...A HOT 
AND HUMID AIR MASS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON 
FRIDAY...WITH THE COLD FRONT BRINGING MAINLY JUST A CHANGE IN WIND 
DIRECTION AND SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR BY SATURDAY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE 
TO CONTROL AREA WEATHER ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. HOWEVER...ON MONDAY... 
WE COULD SEE SOME ISOLATED HIGHER ELEVATION DIURNAL CONVECTION. 
CURRENT RUN OF THE GFS SLOWING APPROACHING FRONTAL SYSTEM. THOUGH 
CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH...ESPECIALLY ON TIMING...HAVE LOWER POPS 
TUESDAY TO AROUND 20 PERCENT AND INCREASE POPS WEDNESDAY TO NEAR 30. 
WEATHER WILL REMAIN UNSETTLED INTO THURSDAY AS ANOTHER FRONT MOVES 
IN. MODEL GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE AND DID NOT STRAY FAR.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN    70  92  70  90  64 /   0  40  40  20   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN      69  90  69  88  62 /   0  40  40  20   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN              69  90  69  88  62 /   0  40  40  20   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN     64  89  65  86  58 /   0  40  40  10   0 
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EDT THU JUN 7 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS CONTINUES TO SHOW A WEAK WARM FRONT BETWEEN 
KNOXVILLE AND TRI-CITIES...WITH DEWPOINTS GRADUALLY RISING BEHIND 
THE FRONT ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN. THIS WARM FRONT IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY 
MOVE NORTH INTO THE MID ATLANTIC REGION TODAY...AS SOUTHERLY WINDS 
DEVELOP AHEAD OF AN UNSEASONABLY STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS. MODEL SOUNDINGS AND MORNING BNA SOUNDING CONTINUE 
TO REVEAL A STRONG MID-LEVEL CAPPING INVERSION...WHICH SHOULD SUPPRESS 
ANY POSSIBLE CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

CURRENT FORECAST OF MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL UPDATE THIS MORNING TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE 
LATEST TRENDS.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 070729
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EDT THU JUN 7 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BENIGN WEATHER EXPECTED TO 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE SHORT TERM IN SPITE OF SLOW INCREASE IN 
MOISTURE...ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTHERN TIER...PER MODEL AND SREF 
CONSENSUS. HOWEVER...INSTABILITY STILL UNIMPRESSIVE AND MENTION OF 
ANY POPS WAS LEFT OUT. WINDS EXPECTED TO INCREASE SOMEWHAT AS 
GRADIENT BETWEEN DEPARTING SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OFF THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD AND APPROACHING TROUGH FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS INCREASES. 
FOR TEMPS...HAD NO REASON TO DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM GFS GUIDANCE 
AS IT APPEARS REASONABLE GIVEN THE EXPECTED SCENARIO.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...STILL APPEARS THAT THE
BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION (PCPN) WILL BE FRIDAY NIGHT...AHEAD OF
THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT. MODELS DIFFER A BIT ON TIMING...SO KEPT
JUST IN HIGHER CHANCE RANGE FOR NOW. ATMOSPHERE BECOMES MODERATELY
UNSTABLE AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SO A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS
QUITE POSSIBLE...ALTHOUGH WIND FIELDS LOOK MORE SUPPORTIVE OF
SEVERE STORMS TO OUR NORTH OVER PARTS OF THE OHIO VALLEY. 

ON SATURDAY THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY BECOMES MORE EAST TO WEST ORIENTED
...WITH SEVERAL MODELS STILL INDICATING SOME DRYING FROM THE NORTH
RATHER EARLY SATURDAY (EXCEPT FOR NAM-WRF WHICH HANGS TO MOISTURE A
BIT LONGER). 07/00Z MOS GUIDANCE OFFERS VERY LOW SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
ACROSS THE BOARD (EVEN NAM MOS) ON SATURDAY...SO ADJUSTED GRIDS TO
REFLECT THIS DRYING FROM THE NORTH. NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES TO OUR
NORTH AND EAST ALSO MADE THESE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS...TRENDING TO A
DRY FORECAST FOR MOST OF SATURDAY.

ANY CONVECTIVE PCPN FOR MONDAY LOOKS ISOLATED AT THIS POINT...WITH 
CHANCES INCREASING BY TUESDAY...AS GENERALLY ADVERTISED ALREADY IN
OUR FORECAST GRIDS. OTHERWISE...KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR
WEDNESDAY (ALTHO GFS IS TRENDING WETTER INTO THURSDAY NOW). SOME
PRELIMINARY GRIDS MADE FOR NEW DAY 7...WITH CHANCE POPS AND NEAR
CLIMO TEMPS. MAX/MIN TEMPS FOR OTHER DAYS WERE ADJUSTED IN LINE
WITH THE LATEST GFS/GFSX MOS GUIDANCE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             91  70  90  69  88 /  10  10  30  40  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  92  68  91  67  87 /   0  10  30  40  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       92  68  91  66  87 /   0  10  30  40  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              89  62  89  65  85 /   0  10  30  40  30

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 070118
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT WED JUN 6 2007

.DISCUSSION.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE DOMINATE WEATHER 
MAKER...OR NON MAKER...FOR THE NEAR TERM.  FORECAST ON TRACK SO NO 
CHANGES PLANNED.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT 
SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED WARM FRONT ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA...AS EVIDENCED BY THE LARGE DEWPOINT GRADIENT BETWEEN 
CHATTANOOGA AND KNOXVILLE. THIS WARM FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE 
NORTH TONIGHT WITH MOISTURE LEVELS INCREASING...AS SOUTHERLY FLOW 
CONTINUES ACROSS THE REGION AHEAD OF A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT A CAPPING 
INVERSION AROUND 700 MB WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...WHICH 
SHOULD SUPPRESS ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. IN ADDITION...AN UPPER 
RIDGE WILL STRENGTHEN ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST ON THURSDAY...WHICH WILL 
HELP TO ALLOW TEMPS TO RISE INTO THE 90S ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
BRINGING A COLD FRONT INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY FRIDAY EVENING... 
WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF IT BY FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON. MODELS ALSO INDICATE MODERATE INSTABILITY WILL DEVELOP 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SO THINK THAT SOME SEVERE TSTORMS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WESTERN STATES UPPER LOW 
OPENS AS IT MIGRATES EAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. BY 12Z 
SATURDAY. SYSTEM COLD FRONT BUILDS SLOWLY SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA SATURDAY KEEPING THE CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ALIVE ESPECIALLY 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA THROUGH THE LATE 
AFTERNOON HOURS WHILE STABLE AND DRIER AIR ALLOWS FOR RAIN FREE 
WEATHER LATE IN THE DAY. COOL FRONT DROPS INTO THE DEEP SOUTH ON 
SUNDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS SOUTH THROUGH THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS KEEPING DRY REGIME GOING FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE 
WEEKEND. LOW LEVEL FLOW EVENTUALLY GOES SOUTHERLY AS SURFACE RIDGING 
PRESSES FARTHER EAST OVER THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD AND ANOTHER UPPER 
TROF AND FRONTAL SYSTEM BUILD EAST INTO THE PLAINS STATES. MODELS 
DEPICT OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY EDGING BACK NORTHEAST INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA FOR THE FIRST THREE DAYS OF THE WORKWEEK. USED SLIGHT THROUGH 
CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION WITH THE HIGHEST PROBABILITY IN PLACE FOR 
TUESDAY AS BOUNDARY RIDES NORTH THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA WHILE 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY DROPS SOUTHEAST FROM THE GREAT LAKES. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN    64  93  69  93  69 /   0   0   0  30  40 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN      62  92  68  92  68 /   0   0   0  30  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN              61  92  68  92  68 /   0   0   0  30  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN     54  90  63  90  63 /   0   0   0  30  40 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 061406
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EDT WED JUN 6 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
SOUTHERN TN BORDER...WITH A SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR MASS MOVING INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA. PATCHY FOG FROM EARLIER THIS MORNING CONTINUES TO 
EVAPORATE...AND SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES ACROSS 
MOST OF THE REGION. THIS FRONT IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY MOVE BACK NORTH 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AS A WARM FRONT...AS SOUTHERLY WINDS 
DEVELOP AHEAD OF A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS AND THE MORNING BNA SOUNDING INDICATE A CAPPING 
INVERSION AROUND 700 MB...WHICH SHOULD SUPPRESS ANY CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT WITH THE FRONT LATER THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

CURRENT FORECAST OF MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL UPDATE THIS MORNING TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE 
LATEST TRENDS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 060705
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EDT WED JUN 6 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY WEATHER RETURNS AS UPPER 
TROUGH DEPARTS AND UPPER RIDGE BUILDS BACK INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN 
CONUS. MODEL TIME HEIGHTS DEPICT DRYING AT ALL LEVELS ALONG WITH 
STRONG SUBSIDENCE AS THIS PROCESS UNFOLDS. FOR TEMPS...INCLINED TO 
GO ON THE HIGH SIDE OF GUIDANCE IN THE FIRST PERIOD GIVEN THE 
EXPECTED ABUNDANT SUNSHINE AND RISING HEIGHTS AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
IN.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONSISTENT WITH
THURSDAY BEING DRY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER AS UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO
BUILD ACROSS THE REGION. HOWEVER...SURFACE RIDGE SHOULD HAVE
ALREADY SHIFTED EAST TO ALONG OR OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST...WHICH
ALLOWS A FAIR AMOUNT OF MOISTURE RETURN BY FRIDAY DAYTIME. POPS ON
FRIDAY MAY NEED TO BE INCREASED...ESPECIALLY FOR THE LATE AFTERNOON
AND EVENING AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT. PROBABLY THE BEST
INSTABILITY THAT WE HAVE SEEN OF LATE FOR FRIDAY PM HOURS WITH
CAPE REACHING 1500 TO 2000 J/KG. FOR NOW...I INCREASED SKY COVER TO
BE MORE CONSISTENT (AND MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS) FOR FRIDAY
NIGHT...BUT KEPT POPS IN THE CHANCE CATGEGORY.

FRONT LOOKS TO STRETCH EAST TO WEST BY 12Z SATURDAY...WITH 00Z GFS
DGEX AND ECMWF ALL SHOWING SOME DRYING FOR NRN PARTS OF THE
FORECAST AREA BEHIND THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
IN ALL AREAS FOR NOW THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON...BUT WE MAY BE
ABLE TO REMOVE POPS FOR SW VA AND NE TN IN THE NEXT FORECAST
PACKAGE OR SO. RIDGE ALOFT AND SURFACE SHOULD PROVIDE DRY AND WARM
CONDITIONS FOR SUNDAY...AS PREVIOUSLY ADVERTISED.

TIMING ANY FOCUS FOR CONVECTION ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY SEEMS
UNCERTAIN AT THIS POINT...SO NO CHANGES MADE FOR THOSE PERIODS.
DID ADJUST MAX AND MIN TEMPS JUST A BIT IN LINE WITH 06/00Z GFS MOS
GUIDANCE. ALSO...ADDED SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS FOR NEW DAY 7
(WEDNESDAY) WHICH WOULD APPEAR TO BE ANOTHER DRY DAY WITH RIDGING
DOMINATING. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       89  61  90  68  90 /   0   0  10  10  30

FXUS64 KMRX 060217 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1017 PM EDT TUE JUN 5 2007

.DISCUSSION...
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE AREA HAVE REMAINED BELOW
SEVERE LEVELS. COVERAGE AND INTENSITY HAS BEGUN TO DIMINISH WITH
SUNSET. THE PRECIP SHOULD END AROUND 06Z AS THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS
MOVES THROUGH. WILL KEEP THE CURRENT POPS RUNNING UNTIL 06Z...THEN
TAPER OFF POPS AFTER 06Z. WILL ALSO UPDATE FOR TEMPERATURES...WHICH
ARE COOLER THAN FORECAST IN THE NORTH DUE TO THE SHOWERS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 051857
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EDT TUE JUN 5 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...MODELS BRING A SHORTWAVE INTO 
THE REGION THIS EVENING.  RADAR SHOWING ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FIRING IN MIDDLE TN AND KY AHEAD OF IT.  SHOULD SEE 
SCATTERED ACTIVITY MOVING INTO OUR CWA LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING AS THE SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH.  MOISTURE IS LIMITED...WILL 
CARRY ONLY 20-30 POPS FOR TONIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH 
WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  WITH THE DECENT INSTABILITY 
EXPECTED...COULD SEE MORE STRONG STORMS AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING.  DRIER WEATHER PUSHES IN QUICKLY LATE TONIGHT AS HIGH 
PRESSURE FILTERS IN.  MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED FOR  
WEDNESDAY WITH A LITTLE MORE STABLE CONDITIONS. STAYED NEAR GFS 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINT TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH
FRIDAY AHEAD OF THE NEXT SHORT-WAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS LATE THIS WEEK. INCREASING HEIGHTS AND MID-LEVEL 
WARMING WILL PRODUCE HOT AFTERNOONS FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK WITH 
LITTLE TO NO CONVECTION.

BY FRIDAY...INCREASING SOUTHWEST WINDS AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT 
MOVING INTO THE WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL HELP PULL LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE BACK INTO THE REGION.  FROPA IS EXPECTED FOR LATE FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS ALONG AND AHEAD
OF FRONTAL PASSAGE.

LATEST GFS IS SIMILAR TO THE ECMWF IN PULLING FRONT SOUTH OF THE 
AREA FOR SUNDAY BEFORE PULLING BOUNDARY BACK NORTH AS A WARM FRONT
MONDAY AND TUESDAY. WILL CALL FOR DRY CONDITIONS FOR SUNDAY WITH 
RETURN OF CONVECTION FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK AS BOUNDARY PULLS BACK 
NORTH.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             61  91  65  91  69 /  20  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  59  87  63  90  69 /  20  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       59  87  62  90  69 /  20   0  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              56  81  51  89  64 /  30  10  10  10  10


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 051350
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 AM EDT TUE JUN 5 2007

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT FORECAST ON TRACK.  WILL UPDATE ZONES TO 
REMOVE MORNING SHOWER CHANCES FOR THE MOUNTAINS.  NO OTHER CHANGES 
PLANNED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SPOTTY SHOWERS HAVE 
MOVED EAST OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...LEAVING SOME 
CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS. THE WEAK FRONT APPEARS TO HAVE NOT PUSHED 
EAST ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS MORNING (NO CHANGE IN DEW 
POINT TEMPS FROM PLATEAU EASTWARD)...BUT VAD WIND PROFILES DO SHOW 
DEEP WESTERLY WINDS ABOVE THE SURFACE ON THE ORDER OF 20 TO 30 
KNOTS...WHICH SHOULD PROVIDE SUFFICIENT MIXING TO INHIBIT ANY AREAS 
OF SIGNIFICANT FOG THIS MORNING. REMOVED ANY MENTION OF SHOWERS FROM 
THE EARLY TO MID MORNING FORECAST GRIDS.

THE CYCLONIC UPPER LEVEL FLOW AND DAYTIME HEATING JUSTIFY LOW 20-30
PERCENT POPS FOR MAINLY THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS...AND 
PERHAPS THE LINGERING WEAK FRONT/TROUGH MIGHT AID DEVELOPMENT. I 
WENT ALONG WITH THE NAM-WRFS DEPICTION OF A SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVE 
DROPPING ESE THIS EVENING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY REGION...WHICH 
SUPPORTS CONVECTION CONTINUING TO OUR NORTH AND POSSIBLY AFFECTING 
SW VA AREAS BEYOND MIDNIGHT. THIS STILL JUST WARRANTS LOW CHANCE 
POPS GIVEN DIMINISHING INSTABILITY WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEAT. 
THINKING IS THAT ALL CONVECTION SHOULD HAVE DISSIPATED OR MOVED WELL 
EAST OF OUR FORECAST AREA BEFORE 12Z WEDNESDAY.

OTHERWISE...I DONT AGREE WITH MOS GUIDANCE THAT MAX TEMPS WILL COOL 
BY A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES TODAY...GIVEN A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE 
AND WESTERLY WINDS. THUS...I WENT 2 TO 3 DEGREES ABOVE THE GFS MOS 
HIGHS...WHICH WAS ABOUT THE AMOUNT OF ERROR GFS MOS HAD FOR MONDAY 
MAX TEMPS. GFS MOS MINS TONIGHT SEEMED REASONABLE...BUT WERE A 
LITTLE ABOVE PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID.  

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

$$

GH/TG

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EDT TUE JUN 5 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SPOTTY SHOWERS HAVE MOVED EAST OUT 
OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...LEAVING SOME CONVECTIVE DEBRIS 
CLOUDS. THE WEAK FRONT APPEARS TO HAVE NOT PUSHED EAST ACROSS THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS MORNING (NO CHANGE IN DEW POINT TEMPS FROM 
PLATEAU EASTWARD)...BUT VAD WIND PROFILES DO SHOW DEEP WESTERLY 
WINDS ABOVE THE SURFACE ON THE ORDER OF 20 TO 30 KNOTS...WHICH 
SHOULD PROVIDE SUFFICIENT MIXING TO INHIBIT ANY AREAS OF SIGNIFICANT 
FOG THIS MORNING. REMOVED ANY MENTION OF SHOWERS FROM THE EARLY TO 
MID MORNING FORECAST GRIDS.

THE CYCLONIC UPPER LEVEL FLOW AND DAYTIME HEATING JUSTIFY LOW 20-30
PERCENT POPS FOR MAINLY THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS...AND 
PERHAPS THE LINGERING WEAK FRONT/TROUGH MIGHT AID DEVELOPMENT. I 
WENT ALONG WITH THE NAM-WRFS DEPICTION OF A SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVE 
DROPPING ESE THIS EVENING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY REGION...WHICH 
SUPPORTS CONVECTION CONTINUING TO OUR NORTH AND POSSIBLY AFFECTING 
SW VA AREAS BEYOND MIDNIGHT. THIS STILL JUST WARRANTS LOW CHANCE 
POPS GIVEN DIMINISHING INSTABILITY WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEAT. 
THINKING IS THAT ALL CONVECTION SHOULD HAVE DISSIPATED OR MOVED WELL 
EAST OF OUR FORECAST AREA BEFORE 12Z WEDNESDAY.

OTHERWISE...I DONT AGREE WITH MOS GUIDANCE THAT MAX TEMPS WILL COOL 
BY A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES TODAY...GIVEN A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE 
AND WESTERLY WINDS. THUS...I WENT 2 TO 3 DEGREES ABOVE THE GFS MOS 
HIGHS...WHICH WAS ABOUT THE AMOUNT OF ERROR GFS MOS HAD FOR MONDAY 
MAX TEMPS. GFS MOS MINS TONIGHT SEEMED REASONABLE...BUT WERE A 
LITTLE ABOVE PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID.  


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS 
RETURN FOR MID WEEK WITH TEMPS CLIMBING TO BACK ABOVE CLIMO AS UPPER 
RIDGE AGAIN BUILDS OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS. UPPER RIDGE FLATTENS 
SOMEWHAT BY LATE FRIDAY ALLOWING A WEAK FRONT TO APPROACH PER MEDIUM 
RANGE MODEL/ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. WESTERLY FLOW PERSISTS THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND PERMITTING WIDELY SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION TO 
DEVELOP...MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN. UPPER RIDGE REMAINS 
SOMEWHAT SUPPRESSED TO THE SOUTH EARLY NEXT WEEK PUTTING 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE. 
MODELS/ENSEMBLES SUGGEST SOMEWHAT BETTER COVERAGE OF DIURNAL 
CONVECTION AND HAVE GONE WITH CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY PM BEFORE 
TAPERING OFF BY TUESDAY MORNING. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY WENT WITH GFS 
GUIDANCE WHICH KEEPS TEMPS ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  62  90  64  89 /  20   0  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  82  59  85  61  90 /  20  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       82  58  86  61  90 /  20  10   0  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 041903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT MON JUN 4 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MODELS BRING A SHORTWAVE INTO 
THE AREA THIS EVENING.  RADAR ALREADY INDICATING A FEW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING IN MIDDLE TN AND KY AHEAD OF IT.  NOT MUCH 
MOISTURE AVAILABLE...SO WILL GO WITH ONLY 20 TO 40 POPS FOR TONIGHT 
WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE RESIDES.  
ANOTHER DISTURBANCE TRACKS IN LATE TUESDAY.  BETTER CHANCES SHOULD 
HOLD OFF UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL KEEP 20 TO 30 POPS FOR THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS WITH SOME DIURNAL ACTIVITY POSSIBLE.  BEST CHANCES  
IN THE NORTH AGAIN WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE LINGERS.  STAYED NEAR MAV 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS AND WRF SHOW ANOTHER
SHORT-WAVE ROTATING AROUND NORTHEAST UPPER LOW FOR TUESDAY NIGHT SO HAVE
KEPT A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE NORTHERN 
TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...UPPER RIDGE STRENGTHENS OVER THE FORECAST
AREA WITH INCREASING THICKNESS AND MID-LEVEL CAP. END RESULT WILL BE 
MOSTLY DRY AND HOT CONDITIONS FOR MID-WEEK. SURFACE HIGH MOVES EAST 
OF THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT WITH INCREASING BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE 
FOR FRIDAY. HAVE INCLUDED A SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE OF DIURNAL 
CONVECTION FOR FRIDAY FOR MAINLY THE HIGHER TERRAIN DUE TO 
INCREASING MOISTURE.

FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS NORTHERN 
CANADA WILL HELP DRAG A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND BECOME 
NEARLY STATIONARY OVER KENTUCKY OR NEAR THE KENTUCY-TENNESSEE STATE-
LINE. GFS SHOWS PLENTY OF BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE RETURNING FOR NEXT 
WEEKEND (EVEN THOUGH DEWPOINTS SEEM A LITTLE TOO HIGH) AND WITH 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY CLOSE TO FORECAST AREA...HAVE INCLUDED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE-CHANCE OF MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION. BEST CHANCE WILL BE 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA DUE TO CLOSER 
PROXIMITY TO THE FRONT.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 041334
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
934 AM EDT MON JUN 4 2007

.DISCUSSION...FOG HAS DISSIPATED...WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE FROM 
THE MORNING PERIOD.  OTHERWISE...FORECAST ON TRACK...NO OTHER 
CHANGES NEEDED.  

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK IMPULSE MOVING 
ACROSS AL AND MID/E TN EARLY THIS MORNING...WITH A FEW SHOWERS 
REDEVELOPING OVER CENTRAL PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THESE SHOWERS 
MOVED EAST AND PASSED NEAR OQT AND TYS...BUT ABOUT TO DISSIPATE AT 
FORECAST ISSUANCE. SKIES HAD PARTIALLY CLEARED UNTIL THIS NEW 
CONVECTION DEVELOPED...WITH SOME LOCALLY DENSE FOG NOTED IN THE 
CENTRAL VALLEY (QUITE DENSE FROM MORRISTOWN TO JEFFERSON CITY AND 
DOWN TO NRN PARTS OF SEVIER COUNTY). ADDED AREAS OF PATCHY DENSE FOG 
TO GENERALLY ALL AREAS THAT RECEIVED SOME RAINFALL YESTERDAY...AND 
PARTIAL CLEARING OCCURRED EARLY THIS MORNING. THE FOG IS ALSO 
HIGHLIGHTED IN OUR SHORT TERM FORECAST.

GENERALLY DRIER AIR WORKING INTO THE REGION TODAY...AND SHOULD SEE 
AT LEAST PARTIAL SUNSHINE AFTER AREAS OF FOG DISSIPATE. AMOUNT OF 
INSTABILITY IS NOT IMPRESSIVE...SO THINK THAT ANY CONVECTION WILL BE 
MORE ISOLATED IN NATURE THIS AFTERNOON. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR 
WEST SEEMS TO HAVE STALLED ACROSS WRN KY AND W TN...WITH NOT MUCH 
SUPPORT AT 850 MB LEVEL...EXCEPT FURTHER NW INTO THE MID MISS AND 
WRN OH VALLEY REGIONS.

ONE FEATURE THAT MAY HELP TO INCREASE CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND STORMS 
BY LATE AFTERNOON INTO EARLY EVENING...IS THE UPPER LOW OVER THE 
WESTERN GREAT LAKES THIS MORNING. SHORT RANGE MODELS SEEM TO DEPICT 
A SHORTWAVE DROPPING SE OUT OF THE OPENING UPPER LOW...WHICH WOULD 
APPEAR TO AFFECT AT LEAST NRN PLATEAU TO SW VA AREAS BY 00Z TO 06Z
TUESDAY. THIS CONVECTION SHOULD BE WEAKENING WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME 
HEAT...SO JUST INCREASED POPS THIS EVENING NEAR JKL AND CRW FORECAST 
AREA BORDERS. NAM/WRF INDICATES 850 MB THETA E RIDGE AND DECENT LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE THIS EVENING.

OTHERWISE...MAX TEMPS TRICKY AS NOTED YESTERDAY WITH A WIDE RANGE 
FROM CHA TO TRI. DECIDED TO STICK CLOSE TO GFS MOS IN THE SOUTH WERE 
DRIEST CONDITIONS LINGER...AND A BIT OF A MOS BLEND ELSEWHERE. MOS 
MINS TONIGHT WERE CLOSE AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED...BUT THESE VALUES 
WERE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID.


&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

352 AM EDT MON JUN 4 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK IMPULSE MOVING ACROSS AL 
AND MID/E TN EARLY THIS MORNING...WITH A FEW SHOWERS REDEVELOPING 
OVER CENTRAL PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THESE SHOWERS MOVED EAST 
AND PASSED NEAR OQT AND TYS...BUT ABOUT TO DISSIPATE AT FORECAST 
ISSUANCE. SKIES HAD PARTIALLY CLEARED UNTIL THIS NEW CONVECTION 
DEVELOPED...WITH SOME LOCALLY DENSE FOG NOTED IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY 
(QUITE DENSE FROM MORRISTOWN TO JEFFERSON CITY AND DOWN TO NRN PARTS 
OF SEVIER COUNTY). ADDED AREAS OF PATCHY DENSE FOG TO GENERALLY ALL 
AREAS THAT RECEIVED SOME RAINFALL YESTERDAY...AND PARTIAL CLEARING 
OCCURRED EARLY THIS MORNING. THE FOG IS ALSO HIGHLIGHTED IN OUR 
SHORT TERM FORECAST.

GENERALLY DRIER AIR WORKING INTO THE REGION TODAY...AND SHOULD SEE 
AT LEAST PARTIAL SUNSHINE AFTER AREAS OF FOG DISSIPATE. AMOUNT OF 
INSTABILITY IS NOT IMPRESSIVE...SO THINK THAT ANY CONVECTION WILL BE 
MORE ISOLATED IN NATURE THIS AFTERNOON. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR 
WEST SEEMS TO HAVE STALLED ACROSS WRN KY AND W TN...WITH NOT MUCH 
SUPPORT AT 850 MB LEVEL...EXCEPT FURTHER NW INTO THE MID MISS AND 
WRN OH VALLEY REGIONS.

ONE FEATURE THAT MAY HELP TO INCREASE CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND STORMS 
BY LATE AFTERNOON INTO EARLY EVENING...IS THE UPPER LOW OVER THE 
WESTERN GREAT LAKES THIS MORNING. SHORT RANGE MODELS SEEM TO DEPICT 
A SHORTWAVE DROPPING SE OUT OF THE OPENING UPPER LOW...WHICH WOULD 
APPEAR TO AFFECT AT LEAST NRN PLATEAU TO SW VA AREAS BY 00Z TO 06Z
TUESDAY. THIS CONVECTION SHOULD BE WEAKENING WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME 
HEAT...SO JUST INCREASED POPS THIS EVENING NEAR JKL AND CRW FORECAST 
AREA BORDERS. NAM/WRF INDICATES 850 MB THETA E RIDGE AND DECENT LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE THIS EVENING.

OTHERWISE...MAX TEMPS TRICKY AS NOTED YESTERDAY WITH A WIDE RANGE 
FROM CHA TO TRI. DECIDED TO STICK CLOSE TO GFS MOS IN THE SOUTH WERE 
DRIEST CONDITIONS LINGER...AND A BIT OF A MOS BLEND ELSEWHERE. MOS 
MINS TONIGHT WERE CLOSE AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED...BUT THESE VALUES 
WERE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...GREAT LAKES TROUGH STILL THE
MAIN FEATURE AT START OF THIS PERIOD WITH A WEAK FRONT LOOKING TO
PUSH THROUGH THE AREA TUESDAY. HAVE LEFT IN SOME LIGHT POPS FOR
TUESDAY DUE TO SLIGHT INSTABILITY AND FROPA. FORECAST TURNS DRY FOR
WEDNESDAY AS TROUGH EXITS AND RIDGE BEGINS TO BUILD IN FROM WEST.
ALL MODELS SHOW DISTURBANCE TRACKING THROUGH REGION LATE WED/WED
NIGHT...WRF MOS SHOW POPS...BUT ALL OTHER MODELS CHECKED KEPT AREA
DRY DUE TO LACK OF MOISTURE. WILL NEED TO WATCH FOR THIS FEATRURE
AND AVAILABLE MOISTURE IN LATER PERIODS.

RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD LATER IN THE WEEK AND INTO THIS WEEKEND.
DONT SEE REASON MEX POPS ARE AT OR ABOVE CLIMO DURING THIS PERIOD.
THINK THAT DEW POINTS IN MOS ARE TOO HIGH FOR THIS SITUATION
CONSIDERING CURRENT DEW POINTS ALONG GULF...GULF WATER TEMPS...HOW
AFTERNOON DEW POINTS FELL DURING LAST RIDGE...AND FACT THAT 00Z GFS
INITIALIZED DEW POINTS VERY POORLY IN PLAINS THROUGH WESTERN GULF.
HAVE KEPT FORECAST MOSTLY DRY DURING RIDGE EVENT...THOUGH DID KEEP
LIGHT POPS FOR SUNDAY THAT WERE ALREADY THERE SINCE IT IS STILL 6
DAYS AWAY.

FOR TEMPS HAVE KEPT PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE IN EARLY PERIODS...BUT
HAVE GONE ABOVE GUIDANCE ON MAX TEMPS IN LATER PERIODS BY A COUPLE OF
DEGREES AND HAVE G0NE COOLER THAN GUIDANCE ON MIN TEMPS IN LATER
PERIODS DUE TO THE EXPECTED LOWER DEW POINTS THAN MODELS FORECAST.

FXUS64 KMRX 031913
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT SUN JUN 3 2007

.SHORT TERM....SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CLOUD 
SHIELD AND LIGHT SPRINKLES HAVE HELD DOWN TEMPS ACROSS NE PART OF 
MRX CWA TODAY. NW-SE UPPER SHEAR AXIS BISECTS E TN. WEST OF THE AXIS 
UNDER PARTLY SUNNY SKIES...TEMPS WARMED UP NICELY ALLOWING FOR 
DESTABILIZATION AND CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. BULK SHEAR THIS EVENING 
WILL AID IN CONTINUED CONVECTION. MID LEVEL DRYING FROM THE WEST 
MOVES IN SHORTLY AFTER LOSS OF HEATING AND PCPN WILL DROP OFF THIS 
EVENING SW TO NE. THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE SHORT TERM...MID 
LEVEL LOW SLOWLY MOVES EAST AND FILLS OVER GREAT LAKES. CAROLINA LOW 
SLOWLY GETS ABSORBED BY THIS FEATURE. SURFACE FLOW IS SW-W WITH W-NW 
UPR FLOW ACROSS S APPALACHIANS...MON THROUGH TUE NIGHT. SCT 
CONVECTION POSSIBLE MAINLY IN THE EVENING HOURS AS ONGOING 
CONVECTION MARCHES SE INTO THE AREA LATE EACH DAY. TEMPS NEAR 
NORMAL. LEANED TOWARD COOLER WRF FOR MAXS.

.LONG TERM....LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK FRONT
LINGERS ACROSS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY ALONG WITH SOME INSTABILITY. 
BEST MOISTURE REMAINS TO THE NORTH...SO KEPT WEDNESDAY DRY.  RIDGE
BUILDS IN ON THURSDAY BRING DRY WEATHER ON THURSDAY.  ANOTHER FRONT
PUSHES IN FROM THE NORTH ON FRIDAY AND LINGERS TO THE NORTH OF THE 
CWA ON SATURDAY.  SOME INSTABILITY ALSO EXPECTED...BUT RIDGE KEEPS 
BEST MOISTURE TO THE NORTH OF OUR CWA.  MAY SEE AN ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORM  ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING IN THE 
NORTH...BUT WILL KEEP THE ENTIRE AREA DRY FOR NOW.  A WEAK SHORTWAVE 
ROTATES OVER THE RIDGE ON SUNDAY...ALONG WITH MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY...WILL ADD 20 POPS FOR DIURNAL ACTIVITY ON SUNDAY.  BEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE BEST MOISTURE IS EXPECTED.  STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.  


&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 031506
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1055 AM EDT SUN JUN 3 2007

.DISCUSSION...AXIS OF SHORT WAVE TROUGH NW OF BARRY LOW MOVING NE OF
THE MRX CWA THIS MORNING. MID/UPR LEVEL CLOUDS AND LIGHT RAIN HAS KEPT
TEMPS DOWN NE AREA THIS MORNING. REGENERATING SHOWERS AND TSTMS OVER 
E KY THIS MORNING APPEAR TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH WEAKENING SHEAR AXIS
THAT MAY SHIFT INTO SW VA WHILE CONTINUING TO WEAK. KEPT THE LIKELY 
POPS GOING IN THOSE AREA. FARTHER S...CLOUDS ARE THINNING AND TEMPS 
ACROSS CENTRAL AND SOUTHER AREAS WILL RISE ACCORDINGLY
...DESTABILIZING ATMOSPHERE FOR THIS AFTERNOON. GOOD TSTM COVERAGE
CAN BE ANTICIPATED MOVING IN FROM THE WEST LATER TODAY. NO MODEL
OF CHOICE. SON  

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CIRCULATION ASSOCIATED WITH 
REMNANTS OF T.S. BARRY HAS BEEN SPREADING SOME SHOWERS WESTWARD FROM 
NE GA AND THE CAROLINAS. NOTE SURE HOW MUCH OF THESE SHOWERS ARE 
ACTUALLY SPILLING ACROSS THE MTNS...BUT A LINE OF MODERATE TO 
BRIEFLY HEAVY SHOWERS DID DEVELOP ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES 
NEAR OQT AND TYS. THESE SHOWERS MOVED SW THEN S AND WERE ABOUT TO 
DISSIPATE. 

LATER THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON...REMNANTS OF BARRY MOVE FURTHER NE 
UP THE COAST...AND MAY ALLOW PARTIAL BREAKUP OF CLOUDS TO ALLOW 
ATMOSPHERE TO DESTABILIZE AHEAD OF THE UPSTREAM TROUGH AND WEAK COLD 
FRONT TO THE WNW. SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY AND LIFT FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS...AT LEAST SCATTERED IN COVERAGE. PREVIOUS FORECAST 
GRIDS AND POPS LOOKED GOOD OVERALL. DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE MUCH 
THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS...GIVEN WEAK WIND FIELDS THIS MORNING...
THEN UNIDIRECTIONAL WESTERLIES WITH LITTLE SPEED SHEAR THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING WHEN BEST INSTABILITY IS EXPECTED.
FREEZING LEVEL AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS REMAIN ON THE HIGH SIDE AS 
WELL.

OTHERWISE...GFS MOS PERFORMED WELL FOR YESTERDAY MAXES...AND GIVEN 
MASS OF MID AND HIGH CLOUDS...THEN CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION (PCPN)... 
I WENT CLOSE TO THE COOLER GFS HIGH TEMPS FOR TODAY. A BLEND OF MOS 
FOR MINS TONIGHT SEEMED BEST BET.

LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF PERIOD 
LARGE GREAT LAKES LONG WAVE TROUGH HAS CONTROL OVER AREA AND WITH 
RELATIVELY COOL MID LEVEL TEMPS KEEPS A THREAT OF SOME DEEP 
CONVECTION. ON TUESDAY A WEAK COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO SWEEP 
THROUGH THE AREA AS WELL AND MID LEVEL TEMPS COOL EVEN MORE. 
ALSO...NUMEROUS WEAK SHORTWAVES WILL SWEEP THROUGH THE AREA...SO 
WILL LEAVE SOME POPS IN DURING THIS PERIOD WITH HIGHER POPS NORTH 
AND LOWER POPS SOUTH.

STARTING WEDNESDAY THE TROUGH RECEDES AND A RIDGE BEGINS TO BUILD 
INTO THE AREA. LATE IN THE WEEK MODELS DIVERGE WITH SOME MODELS 
HOLDING RIDGE STRONG IN AREA THROUGH SATURDAY WHILE OTHER MODELS SAG 
RIDGE FARTHER SOUTH ALLOWING US TO GET IN TO WLY OR NWLY MID LEVEL 
FLOW AND LESS OF A CAPPING INVERSION.  WILL GO WITH RIDGE SCENARIO 
...PER HPC GUIDANCE...AND MAKE FORECAST DRY FOR THE LATTER HALF OF 
THE WEEK.  WARMED UP HIGH TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE GUIDANCE 
DURING FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK AS WELL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  83  63  86  61  85 /  50  30  10   0  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  81  62  84  59  81 /  40  50  20  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN  81  61  84  59  81 /  50  50  20  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  76  59  79  57  76 /  60  50  30  20  30

...PER HPC GUIDANCE...AND MAKE FORECAST DRY FOR THE LATTER HALF OF 
THE WEEK.  WARMED UP HIGH TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE GUIDANCE 
DURING FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK AS WELL.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 021923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT SAT JUN 2 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...02/12Z GFS RUN CLOSE
TO NHC TRACK OF T.D. BARRY SO HAVE LEANED SHORT TERM FORECAST TOWARD
THIS SOLUTION. THIS IS DRIER AND COOLER THAN THE WRF AND SREF.
SURFACE RIDGING AND RELATIVELY STABLE AIRMASS REMAINS OVER AREA THIS
AFTERNOON. THE RIDGE AXIS WILL WEAKEN AND MOVE NORTH TONIGHT AS 
BARRY LOW TRACKS NE TO NEAR MYRTLE BEACH SUNDAY MORNING. MID LEVEL
TROUGH STEERING BARRY WILL MOVE ACROSS EAST PART OF MRX CWA TONIGHT
HELPING TO DRAW SOME PCPN ACROSS NE TN/SW VA INTO SUNDAY MORNING. 
BARRY CONTINUES TO TRACK NE ON SUNDAY AND SURFACE FLOW RESPONDS TO 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESSURE FALLS AND SHIFTS TO NW-W. ATTENTION QUICKLY 
TURNS TO WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHING FROM THE NW. A SOLID LINE OF 
CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE WITH THIS FEATURE BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON BUT LIFT
AND INSTABILITY APPEAR LIMITED AT THIS TIME. LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
MOVES SLOWLY EAST THROUGH GREAT LAKES FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE SHORT 
TERM. STRENGTHENING JET SEGMENTS DIGGING SE THROUGH THIS TROUGH MAY 
HELP INCREASE PCPN CHC MON AND MON NGT THOU NO GOOD HANDLE ON TIMING
FOR THIS PACKAGE.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A WEAK FRONT PASSES THROUGH 
ON TUESDAY.  MOISTURE DECREASING ALONG WITH THE INSTABILITY. WILL 
KEEP 20-30 POPS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY EVENING.  BEST CHANCES 
SHOULD BE IN THE NORTH AGAIN WHERE BEST MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  THE 
FRONT LINGERS ACROSS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY AND PUSHES TO THE NORTH 
OF OUR CWA ON THURSDAY.  STILL SOME INSTABILITY ON BOTH DAYS...BUT 
WITH THE DEEPEST MOISTURE TO THE NORTH...KEPT WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY 
DRY.  ANOTHER FRONT PUSHES IN FROM THE NORTH ON FRIDAY AND LINGERS 
ON SATURDAY...ALONG WITH SOME INSTABILITY...WILL ADD 20 POPS FOR 
DIURNAL ACTIVITY FOR BOTH DAYS.  BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH AGAIN 
WHERE BEST MOISTURE IS EXPECTED.  STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  


&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 021437
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EDT SAT JUN 2 2007

.DISCUSSION...WILL MAKE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO FORECAST. THICK MID 
LEVEL CLOUD COVER SHOULD PERSIST MOST OF TODAY. HAZY CONDITIONS
WILL CONTINUE WITH WEAK MIXING EXPECTED. TWEAKED TEMPS DOWN
AND DP/S UP DUE TO CLOUD COVER. LOW-MID LEVEL RIDGING IN PLACE.
MID-UPR LEVEL RIDGE WEAKENING AND WILL CONTINUE TO MOISTEN AS T.S. 
BERRY TRACKS NE. LEFT 20-30 POPS IN PLACE. SOME WEAK DESTABILIZATION 
THIS AFTERNOON COULD TRIGGER SCT ACTIVITY. ALSO WILL MONITOR 
CONVERGENCE ALONG WESTERN EDGE OF SFC RIDGE WHICH COULD PROVIDE
MORE COVERAGE MAINLY ALONG PLATEAU. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DECENT RAINS YESTERDAY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING...BUT RADAR PRECIPITATION PRODUCTS STILL SHOWED A HIT 
AND MISS PATTERN...WITH ONLY ONE TAF SITE (TYS) RECEIVING MEASURABLE 
RAINFALL.

LOTS OF MID AND HIGH CLOUDS MOVING NORTH INTO THE TN VALLEY AND SRN 
APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING...ASSOCIATED WITH T.S. BARRY. THIS WILL 
INCREASE MOISTURE BUT ALSO LOWER MAX TEMPS TODAY...WHICH MADE 
SIMILAR MOS MAX TEMPS REASONABLE. MOS POPS DROPPED SHARPLY...BUT I 
EXPECT ENOUGH INSTABILITY AND AREAS OF LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE FOR AT 
LEAST SOME DIURNAL CONVECTION. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS WITH 20 TO 30 
PERCENT POPS WILL BE CONTINUED FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...ALTHO DID 
ADJUST TYPE TO SHOWERS THIS MORNING AND LATE TONIGHT WHEN ATMOSPHERE 
IS MORE STABLE. ADDED PATCHY AREAS OF FOG EARLY THIS MORNING...DUE 
TO AREAS OF RAIN YESTERDAY...OTHERWISE STILL A CONSIDERABLE AMOUNT 
OF SMOKE AND HAZE...ALTHO PERHAPS NOT AS WIDESPREAD AS PAST FEW DAYS.

UPPER LOW ASSOCIATED WITH T.S. BARRY WILL BE SLIGHTLY WEST OF THE 
OFFICIAL SURFACE TRACK OF BARRY...AND POSSIBLY BE A FACTOR LATE 
TONIGHT. FOR THIS REASON...CARRIED AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
OVERNIGHT. UPSTREAM TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED WEAK COLD FRONT SHOULD 
PROVIDE AT LEAST SCATTERED CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION INTO SUNDAY 
NIGHT...WITH ANY RAINFALL CERTAINLY WELCOMED  


LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AT BEGINNING OF PERIOD 
REMNANTS OF T.S. BARRY AND NEG TILT SHORT WAVE ARE LIFTING AWAY FROM 
AREA...WHICH SHOULD LEAVE SUNDAY MORNING FAIRLY QUIET. MODELS IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT AIR MASS FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AHEAD OF WEAK COLD 
FRONT WILL BE MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH MLCAPE VALUES APPROACHING 
1000 J/KG. WOULD EXPECT INITIAL DEVELOPMENT IN EQUIV POT TEMP AXIS 
IN W TN IN THE EARLY AFTERNOON AND ALSO IN LOCAL AREA IN HIGHER 
TERRAIN. STORMS IN W TN WILL LIKELY FORM A LINE AHEAD OF FRONT. 
TIMING OF LINE INTO E TN STILL UNCERTAIN...BUT PROBABLY LATE 
AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING...BETWEEN TIMINGS OF SLOWER WRF AND 
FASTER GFS.

COULD END UP WITH A SOME SEVERE STORMS...ESPECIALLY IF TIMING OF
LINE OF STORMS IS NEAR PEAK HEATING. WOULD GO WITH HIGHER POPS IF
MORE CONFIDENT AS TO TIMING OF STORMS WHETHER AFTERNOON OR EVENING
PERIODS.

UPPER TROUGH TAKES HOLD FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY WITH MINIMAL AMOUNTS
OF INSTABILITY BUT NUMEROUS WEAK WAVES OF LIFT RACE THROUGH OHIO
VALLEY AND UPPER TN VALLEY. WILL LEAVE POPS IN BUT SHOULD BE MUCH
LESS COVERAGE AND STRENGTH THAN SUNDAY. 

STARTING WEDNESDAY...NEW RIDGE STARTS TO BUILD INTO AREA FOR
REMAINDER OF WEEK. HAVE GONE ABOVE GFS MOS MAX TEMPS FOR THESE DAYS
SINCE IT HAS CONSISTENTLY LAGGED IN WARMING UP ENOUGH IN WARM
SPELLS LAST COUPLE OF MONTHS. NOT TOO FAR FROM GUIDANCE TEMPS
ELSEWHERE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  83  63  83  62  81 /  20  20  40  30  30

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 011901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT FRI JUN 1 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...RIDGE AXIS FROM THE 
EAST REMAINS ACROSS THE AREA. EASTERLY FLOW IN THE 850-700MB LAYER 
ON SOUTH SIDE OF RIDGE ADVECTING MOISTURE INTO MRX CWA. HIGHER 
HUMIDITY COUPLED WITH AFTN DESTABILIZATION HAS KICKED OFF SCT SLOW 
MOVING TSTM ACTIVITY WHICH WILL CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING HOURS. LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE SE GLFMEX WILL MOVE TO NR TAMPA 
BY SAT EVENING. THE 850-700MB FLOW THAT BROUGHT US THE MOISTURE TDY 
WILL CYCLONICALLY CURVE IN RESPONSE TO LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. ALSO 
AXIS OF MID LEVEL SHORT WAVE HELPING TO STEER DEVELOPING LOW MOVES 
NE INTO MRX AREA BY SAT EVENING, THIS LEAVES MRX CWA WITH DRIER 
AIRMASS AND LOWERING PW/S FOR SAT AND SAT NGT WITH SCT AIRMASS TYPE 
CONVECTION AT BEST. SUNDAY AND SUN NGT...COLD FRONT APPROACHES FM 
THE NW...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES NE ALONG THE CAROLINA COASTS. 
PREFRONTAL FLOW WILL LIKELY SHIFT W IN FAVOR OF LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WHICH DOES NOT HELP TO INCREASE PCPN COVERAGE OR AMOUNTS. INCREASED 
MOISTURE IN THE MID/UPR LAYER HELPS BRING PW/S BACK UP. SOME LIFT 
VCNTY OF FRONT WILL PRODUCE SCT CONVECTION INTO SUNDAY NGT.
  

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH TRACKS 
THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY WITH DECENT MOISTURE AND LIFT...ALONG 
WITH SOME INSTABILITY...WILL KEEP 20-30 POPS GOING FOR MONDAY AND 
MONDAY NIGHT...WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE THE BEST 
MOISTURE LINGERS.  CHANCES SHOULD DECREASE AFTER SUNSET ON MONDAY 
NIGHT WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING.  MOISTURE DECREASING ON 
TUESDAY...BUT STILL SOME INSTABILITY EXPECTED....WILL KEEP 20-30 
POPS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY EVENING.  BEST CHANCES SHOULD BE IN THE 
NORTH AGAIN WHERE BEST MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  A FRONT APPROACHES 
FROM THE NORTH ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS TO THE NORTH OF OUR CWA ON 
THURSDAY.  STILL SOME INSTABILITY ON BOTH DAYS...BUT WITH THE 
DEEPEST MOISTURE TO THE NORTH...KEPT WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY DRY.  
HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY.  STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.  




&&
