000 
FXUS64 KMRX 011501
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT FRI JUN 1 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. RIDGING HOLDING
ON FOR A TAD LONGER. ATMOSPHERE MOISTENS UP ABOVE THE BOUNDARY LAYER
AND DESTABILIZES THIS AFTERNOON SO CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY MAY FINALLY 
RISE TO SCATTERED COVERAGE BY THIS EVENING. STEERING WEAK SO SLOW
MOVERS COULD DRENCH ANY FORTUNATE LOCATIONS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NAM-WRF 00Z MODEL RUN SEEMS TO BE 
AN OUTLIER IN PRODUCING A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN DIURNAL CONVECTION 
TODAY.  SOME LINGERING VERY SPOTTY LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS NE TN AND SW 
VA SHOULD DISSIPATE OR MOVE NORTH OUT OF THE AREA SHORTLY.  SINCE 
THE PATTERN DOES NOT CHANGE SIGNIFICANTLY UNTIL ARRIVAL OF MUCH MORE 
MOISTURE FROM THE EASTERN GULF COAST ON SAT AND SUN...WILL STAY TRUE 
TO PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR POPS AND WEATHER FOR BOTH TODAY AND TONIGHT 
(WHICH IS ALSO IN LINE WITH A BLEND OF THE NGM AND GFS MOS GUIDANCE).
TEMP VERIFICATION PROGRAM SHOWS A SIGNIFICANT COOL BIAS ON MAX TEMPS 
LATELY...SO STAYED CLOSER TO PERSISTENCE AND WARMER MOS HIGHS TODAY. 
NO CLEAR CUT OR SIGNIFICANT BIAS NOTED ON MIN TEMPS...SO STUCK CLOSE 
TO PERSISTENCE.

RAIN FOR THE WEEKEND SHOULD BE WELCOMED BY ALL...GIVEN THE EXTREMELY 
DRY MONTH OF MAY THAT HAS ENDED.  PRELIMINARY CLIMATE NUMBERS FOR 
PRECIPITATION INDICATED THAT TRI HAS EXPERIENCED THE DRIEST MONTH OF 
MAY (0.76 INCHES) ON RECORD...THE DRIEST SPRING SEASON (5.67 INCHES)
ON RECORD...AND THE DRIEST YEAR SO FAR ON RECORD (8.29 INCHES SINCE 
JAN 1ST 2007).  NUMBERS FOR CHA INDICATED 5TH DRIEST MAY (1.34 
INCHES)...3RD DRIEST SPRING SEASON (7.27 INCHES)...AND THE 2ND 
DRIEST YEAR (11.83 INCHES).  NUMBERS FOR TYS NOT AS CLOSE TO RECORDS 
EXCEPT FOR YEARLY TOTAL RAINFALL SO FAR OF JUST 12.81 INCHES BEING 
THE 4TH DRIEST YEAR ON RECORD.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...PATTERN CHANGING BRIEFLY 
DURING PERIOD AS GREAT LAKES UPPER TROUGH TAKES HOLD OF REGION 
THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK...BUT LATE IN PERIOD...RIDGE STARTS TO BUILD 
BACK INTO AREA.  DECENT CHANCE OF SOME PRECIP THIS WEEKEND...BUT IT 
APPEARS VAST MAJORITY OF PRECIP WILL BE EAST OF AREA.  ORGANIZED 
LIFT SHOULD BE MAXIMIZED ON SATURDAY BUT MAINLY SOUTH AND EAST OF 
AREA.  FOR SUNDAY...ORGANIZED LIFT WILL BE WELL TO EAST...BUT STILL 
SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HANGING AROUND AS WEAK COLD FRONT ENTERS 
AREA.  LOOKS LIKE SUNDAY AFTERNOON MIGHT HAVE INSTABILITY VALUES AS 
HIGH AS 1000 J/KG.  THEN CONVECTION MOVES TO EAST.  TRIED TO FIND 
PLACES TO CUT OUT POPS AFTER THIS SYSTEM...BUT IT WAS DIFFICULT AS 
SHORT WAVES ROTATE THROUGH AREA ABOUT EVERY 12-18 HOURS THROUGH 
TUESDAY.  FINALLY DRIED EVERYTHING OUT BY WEDNESDAY AS UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS BACK IN.

WITH PATTERN CHANGE...NOT AS CONFIDENT COOL BIAS OF MODELS ON HIGH 
TEMPS WILL BE AS OBVIOUS...SO WENT CLOSER TO GUIDANCE ON HIGHS THAN 
HAVE BEEN RECENTLY.  MIN TEMP GUIDANCE LOOKED GOOD...SO STAYED 
PRETTY CLOSE THERE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  90  65  82  65  83 /  10  10  40  30  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  89  64  80  63  80 /  20  20  40  40  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN  88  64  82  63  80 /  20  20  40  40  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  86  60  81  59  75 /  30  20  40  40  60 

&&

APPEARS VAST MAJORITY OF PRECIP WILL BE EAST OF AREA.  ORGANIZED 
LIFT SHOULD BE MAXIMIZED ON SATURDAY BUT MAINLY SOUTH AND EAST OF 
AREA.  FOR SUNDAY...ORGANIZED LIFT WILL BE WELL TO EAST...BUT STILL 
SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HANGING AROUND AS WEAK COLD FRONT ENTERS 
AREA.  LOOKS LIKE SUNDAY AFTERNOON MIGHT HAVE INSTABILITY VALUES AS 
HIGH AS 1000 J/KG.  THEN CONVECTION MOVES TO EAST.  TRIED TO FIND 
PLACES TO CUT OUT POPS AFTER THIS SYSTEM...BUT IT WAS DIFFICULT AS 
SHORT WAVES ROTATE THROUGH AREA ABOUT EVERY 12-18 HOURS THROUGH 
TUESDAY.  FINALLY DRIED EVERYTHING OUT BY WEDNESDAY AS UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS BACK IN.

WITH PATTERN CHANGE...NOT AS CONFIDENT COOL BIAS OF MODELS ON HIGH 
TEMPS WILL BE AS OBVIOUS...SO WENT CLOSER TO GUIDANCE ON HIGHS THAN 
HAVE BEEN RECENTLY.  MIN TEMP GUIDANCE LOOKED GOOD...SO STAYED 
PRETTY CLOSE THERE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  90  65  82  65  83 /  10  10  40  30  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  89  64  80  63  80 /  20  20  40  40  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN  88  64  82  63  80 /  20  20  40  40  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  86  60  81  59  75 /  30  20  40  40  60 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT THU MAY 31 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...RIDGING OVER AREA 
WEAKENING AS HIGH PRESSURE MOVES EAST. MEAGER RETURN FLOW UNDERWAY 
WITH MORE CLOUD COVER AND HIGHER DP/S AND MIN TEMPS AHEAD. PCPN 
COVERAGE A TAD BETTER THIS EVENING WITH HOPES OF DECENT PCPN 
COVERAGE THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. LAYER RH INCREASES FRIDAY AND PCPN 
CHANCES CONTINUE TO RISE. GFS/WRF SOLUTIONS BEGIN TO DIVERGE BY 
FRIDAY AFTN. DEVELOPING TROUGH OVER EAST GLFMEX IS MOVED BY GFS INTO 
FL BY FRI NGT. WRF MOVES SYSTEM NORTH WHICH GREATLY INCREASES PCPN 
COVERAGE AND AMOUNTS ACROSS S APPALACHIANS. WILL LEAN TOWARD GFS 
SOLUTION FOR POPS. MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY BECOME INCREASINGLY 
FAVORABLE FOR CONVECTION WHILE LIFT IS LIMITED. CHC POPS INTO SAT 
NGT MAY BECOME ELEVATED TO LIKELY IN LATER PACKAGES.  
 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS BRING A FRONT INTO 
THE REGION ON SUNDAY.  DECENT MOISTURE AND LIFT AHEAD OF IT.  SOME 
INSTABILITY ALSO INDICATED WITH IT.  WILL KEEP 40-50 POPS FOR SUNDAY 
AND SUNDAY NIGHT WITH BEST CHANCES IN THE EVENING HOURS.  UPPER 
TROUGH FOLLOWS ON MONDAY ALONG DECENT MOISTURE AND LIFT...ALONG WITH 
SOME INSTABILITY...WILL KEEP 40 POPS GOING FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY 
NIGHT.  MOISTURE DECREASING ON TUESDAY...BUT SOME INSTABILITY 
EXPECTED....WILL KEEP 30 POPS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY EVENING.  
MOISTURE DECREASING WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...BUT STILL SOME 
INSTABILITY BOTH DAYS.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS FOR SOME DIURNAL ACTIVITY.  STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 311426
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 AM EDT THU MAY 31 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. AIRMASS FINALLY
BEGINNING TO MODIFY. MID AND HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE WORKING INTO THE 
AREA. HOWEVER LOW LEVELS REMAIN DRY AND DEPICTED VERY WELL IN 12Z 
FFC SOUNDING. TEMP/DP SPREAD A BIT TIGHTER THEN WED BUT FEEL ENOUGH 
AFTN SUNSHINE WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO RISE TO FCST MAXS. A FEW SPRINKLES 
PSBL BUT BEST CHC FOR ISOLATED CONVECTION REMAINS ACROSS THE NE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THICKER SMOKE FROM SOUTHERN FIRES GETTING CLOSE 
TO SE TN...WILL MONITOR AND ISSUE STATEMENTS IF NECESSARY. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VERY ISOLATED CONVECTION TO OUR 
NORTHEAST DIMINISHING...STAY LIGHT SHOWER/SPRINKLE WEST...BUT 
CONTINUED DRY ACROSS THE MRX CWA EARLY THIS MORNING.  HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES AS DOMINATE INFLUENCE ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE SHORT 
TERM...THOUGH SOME WEAKENING EXPECTED.   WILL SEE SCATTERED HIGH 
CLOUDS CONTINUE TO PUSH THROUGH THE AREA TODAY WITH SOME MINOR LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES EXPECTED.  ISOLATED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL BE POSSIBLE ONCE AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON...MAINLY NORTHERN AREA 
WITH MOST LOCATIONS DRY.  

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL WEAKEN ALLOWING TWO SYSTEMS 
TO MOVE ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. NORTHERN STREAM UPPER 
TROUGH WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES-NORTHEAST UNITED STATES THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH 
ASSOCIATED WEAK COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY LATE 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT.

SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE (TROPICAL SYSTEM) WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
EXTREME SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES INCREASING THE SUB-TROPICAL
MOISTURE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS WEEKEND. THE INCREASE
SUB-TROPICAL MOISTURE ALOFT AND WEAKENING MID-LEVEL CAP WILL ALLOW
DIURNAL CONVECTION TO DEVELOP FRIDAY AND ESPECIALLY DURING THE WEEKEND.
HOWEVER...COVERAGE WILL REMAIN SCATTERED AT BEST.

AS WEAK FRONT APPROACHES AND MOVES ACROSS THE REGION MONDAY AND
TUESDAY...COVERAGE OF THE STORMS WILL INCREASE PRODUCING THE BEST
CHANCE OF CONVECTION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

300 PM EDT WED MAY 30 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING ACROSS

SLIGHTLY BETTER ON THU ALONG TN MNTS. OTHERWISE...A FEW MORE CLOUDS 
WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA FM THE SW. SOME SMOKY CONDITIONS FROM 
SOUTHERN FIRES COULD WORK NE INTO THE AREA BUT WILL LEAVE OUT 
OF FORECAST FOR NOW.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...GENERAL AGREEMENT 
AMONG OPERATIONAL MODELS/SREF/ENSEMBLES THAT UPPER RIDGE WILL 
GRADUALLY DEAMPLIFY AND BE DISPLACED BY UPPER TROUGH APPROACHING 
FROM THE WEST. THIS WILL ALLOW AT LEAST SOMEWHAT BETTER CHANCES FOR 
PRECIP...ALBEIT STILL MAINLY SCATTERED AND DIURNAL IN NATURE. BEST 
CHANCES APPEAR TO BE LATE WEEKEND/EARLY NEXT WORK WEEK. PRECIP 
CHANCES WILL GRADUALLY DECREASE INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK AS 
UPPER TROUGH AXIS SHIFTS EAST OF THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS ENSEMBLE GUIDANCE AS THE OPERATIONAL 
GFS GUIDANCE APPEARS TOO COOL IN SPITE OF HEIGHT FALLS ASSOCIATED 
WITH DEPARTING UPPER RIDGE/APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH. OVERALL...DID 
NOT MAKE ANY WHOLESALE CHANGES TO PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST PACKAGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 AM EDT WED MAY 30 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. DP GRADIENT
AND SOME POOLING OF MID LEVEL MOISTURE EXTENDS ACROSS NE PORTION OF 
MRX CWA. ISOLATED CONVECTION POSSIBLE ALONG THAT BOUNDARY THIS AFTN. 
SMOKE FROM SOUTHERN FIRES GETTING CLOSE TO SW TIP OF MRX CWA BUT 
SHOULD NOT SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCE VISIBILITY. MAV/LAV DATA CONTINUES 
TOO COOL FOR DRY CONDITIONS. PERSISTENCE AND CURRENT FCST MAX LOOK
GOOD. SON

PREVIOUS FORECAST:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PERSISTENT UPPER RIDGE OVER EASTERN 
U.S. AND WILL SEE LITTLE CHANGE IN AREA WEATHER FOR THE SHORT TERM.  
DIURNAL CONVECTION POSSIBLE LATE AFTERNOON OVER MAINLY NORTHEAST 
ZONES.  HOWEVER...WITH CONTINUED DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE AND MINIMAL 
DIURNAL INSTABILITY...CONVECTION...IF IT DEVELOPS ...WILL BE VERY 
ISOLATED.  IT WILL BE ANOTHER WARM DAY WITH AFTERNOON HIGHS REACHING 
INTO THE UPPER 80S AND LOW 90S FOR MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING INTO 
THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND A WEAK SHORT-WAVE MOVING NORTHEAST FROM THE 
SOUTHERN GULF OF MEXICO ARE THE TWO FEATURES OF INTEREST THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED. ECMWF/UKMET MODELS SEEM TO BE THE MODELS OF CHOICE IN 
REGARD TO THE NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH. THESE MODELS ARE SLOWER THAN 
THE GFS AND HANG UP THE ASSOCIATED FRONT WEST AND NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. 

I HAVE LOW CONFIDENCE IN REGARD TO THE GULF OF MEXICO WAVE AND FEEL 
THE AFFECTS WILL BE MINIMAL FOR THE FORECAST AREA. 

END RESULT...WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY
NEXT WEEK AS FRONT APPROACHES THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE INCREASES. AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WILL CONTINUE TO TREND
ABOVE GFSX GUIDANCE HIGHS GIVEN THE VERY DRY SOIL MOISTURE CONDITIONS.

LETS CROSS OUR FINGERS FOR SOME RAIN...

FXUS64 KMRX 291829
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT TUE MAY 29 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...AMPLIFIED UPPER RIDGE 
FEATURING POSITIVE HEIGHT ANOMALIES OVER MUCH OF THE EASTERN CONUS 
CONTINUES TO PERSIST OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN QUADRANT OF THE COUNTRY. 
THUS NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES EXPECTED THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. LOW- 
LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS SOMEWHAT LIMITED. HOWEVER...ISOLATED TO 
WIDELY SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION AGAIN POSSIBLE FOR TOMORROW FOR 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES. GFS 
GUIDANCE TEMPS AGAIN APPEAR SLIGHTLY TOO COOL FOR TOMORROWS HIGHS 
BASED ON PREVIOUS VALUES IN PERSISTENT PATTERN. THUS HAVE BUMPED UP 
THE GFS GUIDANCE VALUES SLIGHTLY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS INDICATE THAT 
THE SURFACE HIGH AND UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE ALONG THE EAST COAST WILL 
DRIFT A LITTLE TO THE EAST BY THURSDAY. THIS SHOULD ALLOW MOISTURE 
TO SLOWLY INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...AS SOUTHERLY FLOW 
DEVELOPS OVER THE REGION. AS A RESULT...EXPECT ISOLATED DIURNAL 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BEGINNING 
THURSDAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH SATURDAY. BY SUNDAY...A WEAK COLD 
FRONT SHOULD BE APPROACHING THE TN RIVER VALLEY...SO WILL SLIGHTLY 
INCREASE POPS FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. GFS MODEL AND ENSEMBLE 
MEANS INDICATE THAT AN UPPER TROUGH WILL DEVELOP OVER THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION BY MONDAY...WITH POSSIBLE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
DEVELOPMENT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. LATEST INDICATIONS ARE THAT 
THIS UPPER TROUGH MAY LINGER ACROSS THE MIDWEST THROUGH THE MIDDLE 
OF NEXT WEEK. AS A RESULT...WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS 
THROUGH TUESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL SLIGHTLY COOL MAXES AND WARM 
MINS A FEW DEGREES EACH SUCCESSIVE DAY...AS MOISTURE AND CLOUD COVER 
SLOWLY INCREASE. 
&&

MUCH INSTABILITY EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON.  WILL HAVE MENTION OF 
SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE FAR NORTHEAST ZONES CLOSER TO THE DISSIPATING 
BOUNDARY...SINCE MOISTURE MAY BE SLIGHTLY BETTER THERE.  WHILE 
ISOLATED CONVECTION CAN NOT BE TOTALLY RULED OUT ELSEWHERE...IF IT 
OCCURS SHOULD BE LESS THAN 15 PERCENT COVERAGE SO WILL HAVE ONLY A 
SILENT POP.  WILL MAKE ONLY MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN WEATHER 
PATTEN THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED.  THE STRONG UPPER 
RIDGE WILL REMAIN THE DOMINATE FEATURE FOR CONTINUED DRY AND WARM 
CONDITIONS.  THERE WILL BE LOCALIZED LATE DAY INSTABILITY MAINLY 
OVER OUR NORTHEAST THROUGH THIS TIME FRAME...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH 
OCCASIONAL LOW POPS TO COVER ANY LATE AFTERNOON CONVECTION THAT MAY 
DEVELOP.  MODELS INDICATE THE RIDGE WILL WEAKEN AND SHIFT SOUTHEAST 
DURING THE LATTER HALF OF THE PERIOD.  QUESTION DEGREE TO WHICH THIS 
WILL OCCUR...BUT MAY BE ENOUGH TO ALLOW INCOMING SYSTEM TO APPROACH 
THE AREA THIS WEEKEND.  AS SUCH...WILL CONTINUE ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED POPS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  PERSISTENCE LOOKS GOOD FOR 
TEMPS...ONLY MADE MINOR TWEAKS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  89  59  89  62  88 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    88  59  88  62  87 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN            89  59  88  62  87 /  10   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   86  56  87  60  86 /  10   0   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT MON MAY 28 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MODELS AND SREF GENERALLY AGREE 
THAT UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN ANCHORED OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. THUS PERSISTENCE APPEARS TO CONTINUE TO BE 
THE BEST APPROACH FOR THE FORECAST. CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR THIS EVENING. APPEARS DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL 
BE EVEN MORE LIMITED TOMORROW...EVEN IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN...AS LOW 
LEVELS BECOME EVEN DRIER PER MODEL TIME-HEIGHT SECTIONS. THUS LEFT 
MENTION OF ANY POPS OUT OF THE FORECAST TOMORROW FOR ALL AREA. ALSO 
WENT WITH PERSISTENCE FOR TEMPS...WHICH MEANS SLIGHTLY HIGHER 
FORECAST TEMPS THAN THE PROJECTED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A BERMUDA HIGH ALONG THE 
ATLANTIC COAST WILL COMBINE WITH A STRENGTHENING UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE 
TO PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH MOST OF 
THE WEEK. SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION MAY BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS LATER THIS WEEK AS MOISTURE SLOWLY INCREASES. HOWEVER... 
LAYER OF MOISTURE APPEARS RATHER SHALLOW ON MODEL SOUNDINGS...SO AM 
NOT TOO OPTIMISTIC ABOUT RAIN CHANCES UNTIL THE WEEKEND WHEN A WEAK 
COLD FRONT APPROACHES. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN CONTINUES TO SLOW DOWN 
THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THIS COLD FRONT...AND AM LEFT WONDERING 
IF THE FRONT WILL EVER ARRIVE. WILL PLAN TO KEEP SLIGHTLY HIGHER 
POPS IN THE FORECAST FOR THE WEEKEND...AS THE UPPER RIDGE IS PROGGED 
TO WEAKEN WHICH SHOULD ALLOW THE COLD FRONT TO SLOWLY APPROACH THE 
FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL CONTINUE WITH A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST THROUGH FRIDAY...WITH SLIGHTLY LOWER TEMPS FOR THE WEEKEND 
DUE TO AN EXPECTED INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND CLOUD COVER.

WILL KEEP POPS BELOW 15 PERCENT FOR TONIGHT.  WILL TWEAK SOME MAV 
TEMPS UP SLIGHTLY...BUT NO MAJOR CHANGES.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE THROUGH UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING PERSISTS WELL INTO THE LONG TERM FORECAST PERIOD KEEPING THE 
DRY AND VERY WARM WEATHER PATTERN GOING. MAINTAINED SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS ACROSS A SMALL PART OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA ON TUESDAY DUE TO 
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WHICH SHIFTS SOUTH THROUGH THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS. FOR WEDNESDAY DROPPED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AS RIDGING 
DEPICTED TO STRENGTHEN A BIT AS MEAN RH DECREASES SOMEWHAT. 
INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE INCREASE GRADUALLY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AND 
USED SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR MAJOR TERRAIN AREAS THURSDAY AND 
THEN BROAD BRUSHED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION ON FRIDAY. 
UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED COOL FRONT DEPICTED TO MAKE SLOW PROGRESS 
INTO AND THROUGH FORECAST AREA OVER THE WEEKEND SO APPLIED LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR BETTER LIFT AND MOISTURE ADVECTION WITH SYSTEM. 
AGAIN WENT TOWARD HIGH END OF GUIDANCE MAX TEMPS EARLY IN THE 
FORECAST PERIOD AND TRENDED CLOSE TO SUGGESTED MEX MOS FOR THE 
REMAINDER WHILE STAYING RATHER CLOSE TO GUIDANCE MIN TEMPS.

INTO THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT TRAILING 
SOUTHWEST TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. WILL INCLUDE CHANCE POPS FOR

.DISCUSSION...

SHOWN IN THE 12Z FFC SOUNDING. THIS IS RESULTING IN HAZY CONDITIONS

THIS AREA. SURFACE DEWPOINTS ARE ALSO HIGHER TODAY THAN THE PAST
FEW DAYS...IN THE UPPER 50S AND LOWER 60S. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW
DECENT INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON WITH CAPE APPROACHING 1000 J/KG
AT TRI. MIDLEVELS ARE MORE STABLE AT CHA. WILL EXPAND THE AREA OF
ISOLATED SHOWERS TO INCLUDE THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AREA AND THE
NORTHERN VALLEY. WILL ALSO INCREASE COVERAGE TO SCATTERED IN SW VA
WHERE THE NAM SHOWS THE BEST INSTABILITY AND CONFLUENT LOW LEVEL
WINDS. TEMPERATURES APPEAR ON TRACK AND WILL NOT BE CHANGED.

MEDIUM CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON FRIDAY AS MODELS 
CONTINUE TO SHOW UPPER TROF PROGRESSION THROUGH THE EASTERN U.S. 
SLOWED FRONTAL MOVEMENT DOWN A LITTLE FOR SATURDAY KEEPING A SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR CONVECTION GOING MAINLY SOUTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FOREAST

TEMPERATURE FORCAST ABOVE GUIDANCE FOR THE LONG RANGE FORECAST.

306 PM EDT SAT MAY 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...
A FEW SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF NE TN...SW 
VA...AND THE SMOKIES. THEIR MOVEMENT DOES APPEAR TO BE SLOWLY TO THE 
EAST IN A WEAK STEERING FLOW...SO EXPECT THAT THEY WILL REMAIN 
CONFINED TO THE MOUNTAINS. WILL INCLUDE A MENTION OF ISOLATED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THESE AREAS AND IN THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU. THE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA TODAY WILL SHIFT 
SLIGHTLY TO THE EAST. THIS MAY HELP CREATE A MORE SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
AND ALLOW HIGHER DEWPOINTS TO ADVECT INTO THE AREA. MODELS SHOW A 
LITTLE MORE INSTABILITY TOMORROW AS WELL...SO WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP IN THE MOUNTAINS...NE TN...SW VA...AND NORTHERN PLATEAU 
IN THE AFTERNOON. HIGH TEMPERATURES FOR THE PAST FEW DAYS HAVE 
VERIFIED HIGHER THAN MOS GUIDANCE...LIKELY DUE TO THE DRY 
CONDITIONS...SO WENT WITH HIGHS TOMORROW ABOVE MOS...BETWEEN 85 AND 
90 OUTSIDE THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF
NEXT WEEK SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN FIRM ACROSS THE
SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN
GREAT LAKES INTO FAR NORTHEAST UNITED STATES SUNDAY AND MONDAY WILL
PULL A COLD FRONT INTO THE SOUTHERN OHIO VALLEY/CENTRAL
APPALACHIANS. DUE TO THE PROXIMITY OF THE FRONT AND ASSOCIATED
HIGHER LOW LEVEL MOISTURE-CAPES...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED DIURNAL
CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA-NORTHEAST TENNESSEE-
NORTHERN PLATEAU BOTH MONDAY AND TUESDAY. ELSEWHERE...LITTLE TO NO
CHANCE OF CONVECTION.

THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS AGREE WITH A MORE SUBSTANTIAL UPPER TROUGH 
MOVING INTO THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR LATE NEXT WEEK. COLD 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR FRIDAY...SO HAVE 
INCREASED POPS TO CHANCE AREA-WIDE. LATER SHIFTS WOULD NEED TO UP 
POPS ONCE TIMING OF FROPA IS MORE CERTAIN.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER RIDGE HOLDING FAST IN 
EARLY PARTS OF FORECAST.  SOME SHOWERS DEVELOPED AND PERSISTED

BECOMING LESS AND LESS FAVORABLE FOR SUSTAINED VERTICAL MOTION...SO

SLOWLY FADE THROUGH THE MORNING.

POP VALUES LOWER THAN MENTIONED IN FORECAST...EVENT IN MOUNTAINS.  
FOR SUNDAY...SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS ACROSS THE NORTH BUT STILL NOT 
HIGH ENOUGH TO MENTION ON ZONE FORECAST.

MODEL STILL RUNNING TOO COOL ON HIGH TEMPS...HAVE GONE ABOVE 
GUIDANCE FOR SAT AND SUN BY 1-2 DEGREES.


.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...NORTHERN PLAINS SHORTWAVE 
RIDES OVER THE TOP OF THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. UPPER RIDGE PRODUCING 
ONLY MINOR SUPPRESSION OF THE FEATURE. THEREFORE...STAYED THE COURSE 
WITH DRY FORECAST WELL INTO MID WEEK WITH CONTINUATION OF ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES. THERE IS SOME HOPE FOR RAIN TOWARD THE END OF 
THE WEEK AS PACIFIC UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONT ARE 
PROGGED TO MAKE PROGRESS INTO THE EASTERN U.S. THERE IS SOME 
SKEPTICISM AS TO THE STRENGTH OF THIS SYSTEM AND ITS ABILITY TO 
BREAK DOWN SOUTHEASTERN STATES RIDGE SO KEPT POPS IN SLIGHT CHANCE 
RANGE AT THIS LATER PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. WENT A FEW DEGREES 
HIGHER THAN SUGGESTED MAX TEMP GUIDANCE WHILE STAYING A LITTLE 
CLOSER TO MIN THROUGH THE PERIOD.

DAYTIME HEATING. HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE REGION WILL BRING DRY 
WEATHER OVERNIGHT. TEMPERATURES LOOK ON TRACK...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

HIGHS TOMORROW IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS. NO

INVERSION REMAINS IN PLACE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
WILL REMAIN ANCHORED OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
EXTENDED.  AS A RESULT...THE DRY AND WARM WEATHER PATTERN WILL 
CONTINUE OVER THE MRX CWA THROUGH AT LEAST WEDNESDAY.  ON THURSDAY 
THE RIDGE BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST AND A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
APPROACH FROM THE WEST.  HOWEVER...MODELS AND RUN TO RUN IN POOR 
AGREEMENT IN TIMING...STRENGTH AND POSITION OF SYSTEM.  HAVE 
ADJUSTED FORECAST AND LIMITED PRECIP OVER THE AREA ON THURSDAY AND 
KEPT POPS LOW ON FRIDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 AM EDT FRI MAY 25 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AN
ISOLATED TERRAIN INDUCED SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM IS POSSIBLE...BUT
COVERAGE LESS THAN 10 PERCENT. PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND VERY DRY SOIL
MOISTURE WILL AGAIN ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM QUICKLY THE NEXT TWO
DAYS. IVERIFY SOFTWARE SHOWS GUIDANCE HIGHS ARE RUNNING A DEGREE TO
TWO TOO COOL...SO HAVE UPPED MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES A BIT THE NEXT
TWO DAYS.

HAVE ALSO LOWERED AFTERNOON DEWPOINTS BELOW GUIDANCE GIVEN THE 
CONTINUED DROUGHT CONDITIONS. AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL DROP
INTO THE MID 20S TO LOWER 30S THE NEXT TWO DAYS CONTINUING THE CONCERN
FOR ONGOING WILDFIRES.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER AREA 
EXPECTED TO HOLD ON TIGHT THROUGH MOST OF FORECAST.  TOWARD END OF 
PERIOD...TROUGH MOVING ACROSS PLAINS MAY START TO AFFECT 
AREA...HOWEVER GFS COULD BE OUTLIER WITH MORE POWERFUL  
INTERPRETATION OF THIS SYSTEM...SO HESITANT TO JUMP INTO ANY 
SIGNIFICANT POPS. AM HOLDING ZFP POPS OFF UNTIL THURSDAY AT THIS
POINT.

FOR TEMPS DURING THIS PERIOD...EXPECT WARM WEATHER TO CONTINUE.  
SINCE MARCH MODELS HAVE SHOWN A STRONG COOL BIAS ON MAX TEMPS DURING 
WARM SPELLS...AVERAGING ABOUT 3-4 DEGREES TOO COOL...SO WILL 
CONTINUE THIS TREND AND FORECAST ON THE HIGH SIDE OF GUIDANCE FOR 
MAX TEMPS. FOR MIN TEMPS THERE IS MUCH LESS OF A TREND...WILL GO 
CLOSER TO GUIDANCE...ALTHOUGH WILL GO ABOVE GUIDANCE TOWARD END OF 
PERIOD WHEN DEW POINTS SHOULD BE SURGING WITH APPROACHING TROUGH.

FRONTAL BOUNDARIES WILL BE HARD PRESSED TO PUSH MUCH SOUTH OF THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY.  AS A RESULT...THERE WILL BE ONLY A VERY SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF A STRAY MOUNTAIN SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM DURING THE LATE 
AFTERNOON HOURS BUT MOISTURE IS LIMITED AND INSTABILITY MINIMAL SO 
FOR NOW WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY THROUGH MID WEEK.  MODELS WANTING TO 
BRING IN NEXT SYSTEM BY THE END OF THE PERIOD.  HOWEVER...RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY QUIET POOR AND CONFIDENCE IS LOW.  HAVE WENT DRY FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND PUSHED LOW POPS BACK INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.

DIURNAL CONVECTION ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS BY THE FIRST OF NEXT WEEK... 
BUT WITH SOUNDINGS REVEALING ONLY A SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE...WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST THROUGH TUESDAY. MOISTURE IS PROGGED TO 
INCREASE BY WEDNESDAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WHICH SEEMS TO 
JUSTIFY INCLUDING A SLIGHT CHANCE POP. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL CONTINUE 
WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...WITH 
TEMPS REMAINING ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. ...

EXPECTED TO REACH ANY FURTHER SOUTH THAN THE OHIO VALLEY.  
HOWEVER...THE CURRENT GFS RUN DOES BRING A FRONTAL PASSAGE THROUGH 
ON WEDNESDAY.  CONFIDENCE IS VERY LOW WITH THIS FEATURE AS IT IS A 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGE FROM PRIOR RUNS AND WILL HOLD OFF ON INTRODUCING 
ASSOCIATED PRECIP UNTIL I SEE SOME CONSISTENCY.  THEREFORE...HAVE 
KEPT FORECAST AREA DRY THROUGH THE PERIOD FOR NOW AND STAYED CLOSE 
TO GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EDT WED MAY 23 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE WEATHER FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE WITH 
ONLY A FEW SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHEST TERRAIN EXPECTED TODAY.  NO 
CHANGES PLANNED TO THE FORECAST.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TO TRACK THROUGH THE REGION TODAY ALONG WITH SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY.  BEST MOISTURE STAYS TO THE EAST OF OUR CWA...PLUS WITH 
THE DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE...PROBABLY WONT SEE MUCH PRECIPITATION. 
WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS FOR THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING WHERE THE BEST INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE LINGERS.  SHOULD 
BE DRY ELSEWHERE.  STAYED NEAR GFS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A TYPICAL PATTERN FOR MID- 
SUMMER WILL ESTABLISH ITSELF OVER MOST OF THE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE 
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. A BERMUDA HIGH WILL SET-UP OVER THE WESTERN 
ATLANTIC BY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...AND WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE MUCH 
OF THE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. ZONAL UPPER-LEVEL 
FLOW WILL ALSO CONTINUE ACROSS THE NATION THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT 
WEEK...WHICH WILL PREVENT ANY COLD FRONTS FROM MOVING FURTHER SOUTH 
THAN THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. AS A RESULT...DRY CONDITIONS WILL 
UNFORTUNATELY PERSIST THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL CONTINUE WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THROUGH EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...WITH TEMPS REMAINING ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. ...

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 PM EDT TUE MAY 22 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...DROUGHT CONDITIONS 
PREVAILING WITH DEEP MIXING DURING THE DAY BRINGING DOWN DRIER AIR

DONT EXPECT DEW POINTS TO DROP AS MUCH WEDNESDAY.

FORECAST AREA THINK SCATTERED CONVECTION COULD FIRE NEAR RIDGETOPS 
WEDNESDAY.  BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON DEEP ELY TO SELY FLOW SHOULD TAKE 
ANY DEVELOPMENT SLOWLY DEEPER INTO OUR AREA.  HOWEVER...WITH DRY 
NATURE OF CURRENT SITUATION...FIGURE ON DOWNPLAYING CHANCES OF 
PRECIP AND QPF OVERALL.

SMOKE OVER GA TODAY SHOULD CONTINUE TO WAFT ITS WAY INTO SE TN/SW NC 
THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT.  VSBYS NOT EXPECTED TO GET LOW ENOUGH TO 
MENTION IN ZONES...BUT DID INCLUDE IN KCHA TAF IN 18Z ISSUANCE.

.LONG TERM  (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A STRAY 
SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM MAY LINGER OVER FAR NORTHERN AND EASTERN ZONES 
EARLY WEDNESDAY EVENING.  OTHERWISE...CONTINUED DRY ACROSS THE MRX 
CWA.  HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED.  
HOWEVER...THERE IS A WEAK WAVE AROUND THE FRIDAY TIME FRAME AND AN 
APPROACHING FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT STAYS TO OUR NORTH DURING THE 
WEEKEND AND ANOTHER LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY.  MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY QUITE LIMITED ACROSS OUR AREA AND WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY 
THROUGHOUT.  GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

FXUS64 KMRX 221449

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1049 AM EDT TUE MAY 22 2007

.DISCUSSION...
BACKDOOR FRONT SNEAKING INTO NORTHEASTERN PARTS OF AREA...BRINGING
HIGHER DEW POINTS. MODIFIED SOUNDING OVER KTRI FOR 18Z GOT ABOUT
400 J/KG OF INSTABILITY...SO WOULD EXPECT CU OR EVEN CONGESTED CU
TO BUILD UP IN THAT AREA...BUT WILL HOLD OFF ON INTRODUCING ANY
POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON UP THERE. ALSO...ANY CONVECTION DEVELOPING
IN EASTERN UPSLOPE FLOW SHOULD DRIFT AWAY FROM AREA.

HAVE LOWERED HIGH TEMPS IN THAT AREA DUE TO HIGH HUMIDITY AND
DISSIPATION OF HEAT THROUGH BUILDING CUMULUS. ALSO HAVE RAISED DEW
POINTS AND MINIMUM TEMPS TONIGHT IN THAT AREA.

IN OTHER END OF AREA...KCHA...WATCHING SMOKE IN GA CREEPING CLOSER.
3-4 MILE VSBYS ABOUT 60 MILES SOUTH OF CWA RIGHT NOW. TRAJECTORIES
SHOW FLOW HEADING TOWARD KCHA...BUT WILL LIKELY THIN OUT SOME
BEFORE CROSSING INTO AREA. FOR AVIATION FORECAST...WILL CONSIDER
SOME SMOKE IN TAF FOR NEXT ISSUANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT TUE MAY 22 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT STRETCHING FROM NEAR CINCINNATI SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. HOWEVER...ONLY THE 
ISOBARS REVEAL THE LOCATION OF THIS FRONT...WITH NOT MUCH OF A 
CHANGE IN TEMPS...DEWPOINTS...OR WINDS BEHIND IT. THIS FRONT SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO LOSE ITS IDENTITY TODAY...WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS ONLY 
REVEALING SOME SHALLOW MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH IT. WITH NOT MUCH 
INSTABILITY EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AND AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE REMAINING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WILL PLAN TO KEEP THE FORECAST DRY FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...HIGHS SHOULD CONTINUE TO BE A 
LITTLE WARMER TODAY THAN YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A WEAK FRONT IS EXPECTED TO 
TRACK ALONG THE MOUNTAINS ON WEDNESDAY. BEST MOISTURE REMAINS TO THE 
EAST OF THE CWA...BUT WITH SOME INSTABILITY EXPECTED...WILL KEEP 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS ON WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. SHOULD 
BE DRY ELSEWHERE. RIDGING RETURNS BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY. 
A WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE REGION ON FRIDAY...MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY TOO LIMITED TO ADD ANY PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR FRIDAY. 
GFS INDICATING A FRONT DROPPING IN FROM THE NORTH AND LINGERING 
ACROSS OUR NORTHERN ZONES ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. BEST MOISTURE 
REMAINS TO THE NORTH OF THE CWA...SO WILL KEEP THE DRY FORECAST 
GOING THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE WEST 
ON MONDAY. BETTER MOISTURE HOLDS OFF UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT...SO WILL 
KEEP MONDAY DRY FOR NOW. STAYED NEAR GFS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EDT MON MAY 21 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...BIG HIGH FROM SURFACE TO MOON 
OVERHEAD. DRY. ONLY THING TO FORECAST IS WHAT IS *NOT* GOING TO 
HAPPEN. BACK DOOR FRONT WILL NOT MAKE IT IN TO HERE FROM NORTHEAST, 
THOUGH THE PRESSURE FIELD WILL JUMP A HAIR UP AND THE GRADIENT,  
ALBEIT VERY WEAK, WILL TEND TO TURN THE WINDS IN THE NORTHEAST 
SECTIONS TO THE SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE SURFACE HIGH IN THE 
MID-ATLANTIC STATES. TERRAIN WILL KEEP THEM FROM TURNING, THOUGH, 
AND THEY WILL END UP LIGHT AND VARIABLE IN DIRECTION. 

MODELS ADVERTISING SOME LIFT, AN INCREASE IN BOUNDARY LAYER RH, AND 
SOME INSTABILITY MAINLY NORTHEAST OF A CARTER COUNTY-WISE COUNTY 
LINE, OUT IN THE LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON PERIOD, BUT THEYVE DONE 
THIS BEFORE AND NOTHING HAPPENED. HAVE DROPPED POPS FOR TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN 
CONTROL OVER THE REGION THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED.  A WEAK IMPULSE 
ROTATING THROUGH THE HIGH COMBINED WITH WEAK DIURNAL INSTABILITY 
COULD POTENTIALLY GENERATE A STRAY SHOWER/THUNDERSTORM OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS FAR NORTH AND EAST ON WEDNESDAY...BUT MOISTURE REMAINS 
LIMITING FACTOR.  A FEW BITS OF LIFT AND OCCASIONAL LATE DAY 
INSTABILITY EXPECTED THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...BUT WITH 
CONTINUED LACK ON MOISTURE...WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY THURSDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 AM EDT MON MAY 21 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUING ACROSS MOST OF THE SOUTHEAST. THIS COLD FRONT IS NOT 
EXPECTED TO MAKE MUCH PROGRESS TO THE SOUTH TODAY...AS AN UPPER- 
LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS MOST OF THE EASTERN PART OF THE NATION. 
THUS...THINK THAT THIS FRONT WILL REMAIN NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA 
THROUGH TONIGHT...AND WILL NOT MENTION ANY PRECIP CHANCES. AS FOR 
TEMPS...HIGHS SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER TODAY COMPARED TO 
YESTERDAY...WITH THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE FORECAST AREA.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...PERSISTENT SUMMER-LIKE PATTERN 
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AS UPPER RIDGE HOLDS STRONG OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN CONUS. MODELS AND ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT 
MOISTURE WILL INCREASE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON 
WEDNESDAY AS SOUTHEAST FLOW COMMENCES AROUND PERIPHERY OF UPPER 
RIDGE CENTERED OVER PENNSYLVANIA AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OFF THE 
EASTERN SEABOARD. HOWEVER...THIS FLOW WILL GENERALLY BE DOWNSLOPE IN 
NATURE FOR THIS SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. THUS BELIEVE GFS POPS ARE 
SOMEWHAT OVERDONE AND WERE UNDERCUT TO SLIGHT CHANCE OVER MOST OF
THE FORECAST AREA. UPPER RIDGE DEAMPLIFIES SLIGHTLY BY LATE IN THE
WORK WEEK ALLOWING SURFACE FRONT TO APPROACH OUR AREA.
HOWEVER...APPEARS THAT ONCE AGAIN FRONT WILL NOT PROGRESS THIS FAR
AND NO ORGANIZED PRECIP EVENT IS ANTICIPATED THROUGH THE LONG TERM
PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES FAIRLY
CLOSELY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 210018
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
820 PM EDT SUN MAY 20 2007

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE WEATHER FOR 
THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE.  NO CHANGES PLANNED TO CURRENT FORECAST.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...ANOTHER GREAT 
AFTERNOON ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH BEAUTIFULLY CLEAR SKIES AND 
PLEASANT TEMPS FOR MID MAY. RIDGE HAS BUILT IN AND PUSHED THE NW 
FLOW ALOFT FURTHER NE OF THE SRN APPALACHIANS...SUCH THAT WE DONT 
EXPECT MUCH IN THE WAY OF CLOUDS FOR NE AREAS LATE TONIGHT. 
THUS...SKY COVER WAS DECREASED LATE TONIGHT AND ALSO THRU MONDAY 
AFTERNOON...ALTHO WENT PARTLY SUNNY ACROSS SW VA MONDAY TO BETTER 
MESH WITH THE AMOUNT OF CLOUD COVER FROM NEIGHBORING OFFICES TO THE 
NORTH AND EAST. 

ATMOSPHERE LOOKS VERY STARVED FOR ANY MOISTURE...AS IS THE GROUND 
GIVEN LARGE RAINFALL DEFICITS FOR THE YEAR...SO DECIDED TO REMOVE 
THE MINIMAL POPS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON IN THE EXTREME NE ZONES.
WEAK FRONT TO THE NORTH...EVEN IF SLIPPING THIS FAR SOUTH...DOES NOT 
LOOK TO BE ENOUGH OF A FEATURE TO WARRANT POPS. FOR TEMPS...WENT FOR 
A COMBO OF MINS AND MAXES THAT GAVE THE GREATEST DIURNAL RANGE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...RIDGE. DRY. HOT. BUT TO 
ELABORATE...IT LOOKS MORE LIKE A JULY-LIKE BERMUDA HIGH THAN A 
PROGRESSIVE MULTI-WAVE PATTERN IN THE HEIGHT OF SEVERE WEATHER 
SEASON. DEWPOINTS LOW, TEMPS HIGH, SKIES CLEAR. AND THE RIDGE JUST 
BUILDS OR STAYS PUT THROUGH THE WEEKEND, BASICALLY. THERE IS SOME 
INDICATION THAT LATER IN THE WEEK A BACK DOOR FRONT MIGHT SLIP IN 
BUT IT LOOKED LIKE THE LAST ONE MIGHT, TOO, AND IT WONT. LEFT TEMPS 
ALONE, DROPPED CLOUDS DOWN, DECREASED POPS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  48  86  50  85  56 /   0   0  10  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  82  51  83  57 /   0  10   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  46  84  50  84  54 /   0  10   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  42  80  49  82  53 /   0  10  10  20  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 AM EDT SUN MAY 20 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH TEMPS AND 
DEWPOINTS A LITTLE HIGHER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING 
COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. THIS HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL GRADUALLY WEAKEN 
TODAY...BUT CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS SHOULD CONTINUE INTO 
TONIGHT. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY RISE A FEW DEGREES HIGHER 
TODAY COMPARED TO YESTERDAY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE 
EASTERN CONUS AND BECOMES DOMINANT FEATURE THROUGH MOST OF THE 
UPCOMING WORK WEEK. MODELS STILL PORTRAY WEAK BACK-DOOR COLD FRONT 
PUSHING INTO OUR FAR NORTHEASTERN TIER ON MONDAY. MOSTLY DIURNAL 
CONVECTION ACCOMPANIES THIS FEATURE PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE 
CONSENSUS. THIS SEEMS POTENTIALLY OVERDONE GIVEN THE POSITION OF 
UPPER RIDGE AXIS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AND THE DRY 
CONDITIONS THAT HAVE PREVAILED RECENTLY. NEVERTHELESS...CONTINUED 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THAT AREA TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS PROJECTED 
DIURNAL CONVECTION MOSTLY FOR CONSISTENCY SAKE. ORGANIZED SYSTEM 
THAT WAS PROJECTED FOR LATE IN THE WORK WEEK HAS BEEN DELAYED UNTIL 
NEXT WEEKEND AT THE EARLIEST PER LATEST MODEL/ENSEMBLE DATA AS
UPPER RIDGE PERSISTS. THUS GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED TO
CONTINUE FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE. FOR TEMPS...STAYED CLOSE TO
GFS GUIDANCE FOR THE MOST PART AS NO CLEAR SIGNAL WAS NOTED IN
ENSEMBLE PROFILE.

FXUS64 KMRX 200105
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EDT SAT MAY 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...LOOKING AT PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...NOTHING NEW TO ADD.  
TEMPERATURES APPEAR ON TRACK SO NO CHANGES PLANNED TO FORECAST.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...SURFACE RIDGE EXPECTED 
TO SETTLE ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. ONLY 
PROBLEM NOTED IS THE AREA OF LOW TO MID CLOUDS IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT 
THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH LOOKS LIKELY TO CLIP SW VA AND NE TN LATER 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. IF THESE CLOUDS THIN OR DISSIPATE...THEN 
WE ARE LEFT WITH A VERY DRY AIRMASS AND NEAR CALM WINDS. CURRENT DEW 
POINT TEMPS ARE BELOW COOLEST MOS MIN TEMPS...SO I WILL BANK ON 
CLEARING SKIES LATER TONIGHT AND GO A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW THE GFS 
MOS MINS. TOSSED IN SOME PATCHY FOG TOWARD DAYBREAK OVER BODIES OF 
WATER WHERE FOG WAS NOTED THIS MORNING.  

OTHERWISE...RIDGE BUILDING IN ON SUNDAY WITH WESTERLY LOW LEVEL 
WINDS AND LOTS OF SUNSHINE...TO NUDGE MAX TEMPS UP INTO THE 70S TO 
LOWER 80S.


.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...H5 RIDGE BUILDS 
STRONGLY OVER EASTERN U.S. THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING, BUT HAS 
POSITIVELY TILTED TROF TO THE EAST OVER THE ATLANTIC. TROF BRINGS 
DOWN SURFACE HIGH FROM HUDSON BAY AND STALLS IT JUST OFFSHORE FROM 
NEW ENGLAND. THIS HIGH DROPS IN THE BACK DOOR AROUND WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON, WITH A HINT OF PRECIP POTENTIAL, MOSTLY IN THE FAR 
NORTHEAST REACHES. FROM THEN THROUGH SATURDAY, ITS MAINLY SOLAR 
DRIVEN SLIGHT CHANCES IN THE AFTERNOONS, UNTIL THE NEXT SYSTEM 
KNOCKS DOWN THE RIDGE ENOUGH SUNDAY TO ALLOW SOME ORGANIZED CYCLONIC 
ACTIVITY IN AGAIN.

TEMPS OK, ADJUST MAXES SLIGHTLY UP IN AREAS WITH LESS CLOUDS FURTHER 
SOUTH, WITH MINS REMAINING MOSTLY THE SAME.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 AM EDT SAT MAY 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ACROSS KY THIS 
MORNING WITH CLEAR SKIES THE RULE.  ONLY FEATURE OF INTEREST OR 
CONCERN IS THE PATCHY DENSE FOG THAT DEVELOPED ALONG AREA LAKES AND 
STREAMS IN SW VA...NE TN AND THE CENTRAL VALLEY.  THIS DENSE FOG IS 
LIFTING AND DISSIPATING WITH VISIBILITY UP TO 5 MILES AT TRI. 

FORECAST FOR TODAY LOOKS ON TRACK WITH SLIGHTLY WARMER HIGHS...ALTHO
12Z RNK SOUNDING STILL ONLY SUPPORTS 60S AT BEST.  SHOULD NOT BE ANY 
NEED TO UDPATE THE ZFPMRX PRODUCT...BUT WILL CHECK HOURLY CONDITIONS 
AT 10 AND 11 AM TO SEE IF GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS NEED ANY 
ADJUSTMENTS.

ENJOY THE BEAUTIFUL WEEKEND

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 AM EDT SAT MAY 19 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER EASTERN KY...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD 
AIR MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH TONIGHT... 
RESULTING IN CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS. AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER 
THE MID ATLANTIC STATES WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MOVE NORTHEAST 
TODAY...WHICH WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO RISE A FEW DEGREES HIGHER TODAY 
COMPARED TO YESTERDAY.


.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RELATIVELY QUIET WEATHER 
PATTERN EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. 
MODELS AND ENSEMBLES CONTINUE TO ADVERTISE A BACK DOOR COLD FRONT 
MOVING INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE ON MONDAY. 
SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT EXPECTED TO WARRANT CONTINUATION OF 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NEAR THE BOUNDARY. UPPER LONG WAVE RIDGING
BUILDS INTO THE EASTERN CONUS BEFORE THE NEXT ORGANIZED SYSTEM
APPROACHES ON THURSDAY. STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY WITH THE TIMING OF
THIS SYSTEM AS ENSEMBLES ARE GENERALLY SLIGHTLY SLOWER. ANTICIPATE
NARROWER DIURNAL TEMP RANGE AS MOISTURE SLOWLY INCREASES THROUGH
THE UPCOMING WEEK. OVERALL...DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO
PREVIOUS FORECAST PACKAGE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 AM EDT FRI MAY 18 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MIDWEST AND EXTENDING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW CENTERED OVER THE 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY DRIFT EAST 
TODAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL FAIRLY STEEP LAPSE RATES AGAIN FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON...BUT MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE TOO LIMITED FOR ANY 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. HIGH PRESSURE BECOMES CENTERED OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...WITH EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS 
DEVELOPING IN ITS UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS. AS A RESULT...TEMPS IN 
SOME SHELTERED VALLEY AREAS OF THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU... 
SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...SMOKY MOUNTAINS...AND SOUTHWEST NC MAY 
FALL INTO THE 30S...WITH SOME PATCHY FROST POSSIBLE AROUND SUNRISE. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...GENERALLY DRY WEATHER 
EXPECTED THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. WEAK BACK-DOOR COLD FRONT 
DIPS INTO OUR NORTHEASTERN ZONES ON MONDAY AND PROVIDES A POSSIBLE 
FOCUS FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION. THIS DIURNAL SCATTERED CONVECTION
IS PROJECTED TO CONTINUE INTO MID WEEK...MAINLY IN THE HIGHER
TERRAIN. HAVE INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THOSE AREAS TO
ACCOUNT FOR THIS ACTIVITY. NEVERTHELESS...NO ORGANIZED SYSTEM EXPECTED
UNTIL AT LEAST LATE IN THE PERIOD AND EVEN THAT IS QUESTIONABLE
BASED ON MARGINAL SUPPORT OF THE GFS BY VARIOUS ENSEMBLES.
CONTINUED CHANCE POPS FOR NEXT THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT HOWEVER. FOR
TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOW GFS GUIDANCE CLOSELY.

FXUS64 KMRX 171927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT THU MAY 17 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WERE DEVELOPING OVER EASTERN KY BETWEEN LEX
AND JKL...MOVING EAST TO SOUTHEAST. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD CLIP SW VA
AND EXTREME NRN PARTS OF EAST TN AT LEAST THIS EVENING...DUE TO
STEEPENING MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES AND A SLIGHT AMOUNT OF SURFACE
BASED INSTABILITY. STRONGEST STORMS MIGHT BE CAPABLE OF SMALL
HAIL...BUT THREAT OF SEVERE WEATHER SEEMS UNLIKELY.

CARRIED NEAR MOS POPS FOR SW VA AND NE TN...WITH POPS MOSTLY ALONG
AND NORTH OF I-81. CONTINUED DRY FORECAST AS BEFORE FOR SE TN AND
SW NC...ALTHO SOME RAINS WOULD CERTAINLY BE WELCOMED FOR THOSE AREAS.

OTHERWISE...RIDGE BUILDS INTO FORECAST AREA BEHIND THIS DEPARTING
UPPER LOW...WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.
DRY GROUND CONDITIONS WOULD SUPPORT A LARGE DIURNAL TEMPERATURE RANGE
...AND I GENERALLY WENT WITH GFS MOS TEMPS WHICH REFLECT THIS. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MEAN FLOW REMAINS 
NORTHWESTERLY THROUGH MONDAY AS UPPER TROUGH HOLDS ITS POSITION OVER 
THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. SURFACE RIDGE SLIDES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA 
ON SUNDAY KEEPING FORECAST DRY WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE. 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW PULLS A BACKDOOR FRONT SOUTH THROUGH THE 
NORTHEASTERN STATES INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY MONDAY. HOWEVER 
FRONT HAS LITTLE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH AND THEREFORE KEPT FORECAST 
DRY ON MONDAY. UPPER RIDGE FINALLY GIVES PERSISTANT TROUGH A SHOVE 
AND BUILDS ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES. WARM AIR ADVECTION DEVELOPS 
ALLOWING TEMPS TO CLIMB A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL ON TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY AS FORECAST AREA AWAITS ARRIVAL OF NEXT UPPER TROF AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM LATER IN THE DAY AND DURING THE 
EVENING THURSDAY. USED SLIGHT AND SMALL CHANCE POPS AT THIS EXTENDED 
PERIOD OF THE FORECAST TO DESCRIBE POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION WITH 
THIS SYSTEM.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 170733 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED HEADER
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 AM EDT THU MAY 17 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT MOVED EAST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA LAST EVENING BRING AN END TO THE MEAGER RAINFALL WE 
RECEIVED YESTERDAY. TEMPERATURES HAVE ALREADY DROPPED INTO THE UPPER 
40S TO MID 50S THIS MORNING WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. A FEW CLOUDS 
ARE LINGERING ALONG THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND IN SW VA. HIGHER 
PRESSURE OVER THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES AND UPPER MIDWEST WILL BUILD 
SLOWLY SOUTHEAST TODAY. HOWEVER AN UPPER LOW WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST 
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY AND IT WILL DEEPEN THE UPPER TROUGH OVER 
THE EASTERN STATES. A VORTICITY MAXIMUM ACROSS SOUTHERN LAKE 
MICHIGAN IS HELPING TO INITIATE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS CENTRAL 
IN. ANOTHER VORTICITY LOBE WILL DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF IT AND MOVE 
INTO SW VA AND NE TN THIS AFTERNOON. THIS SHOULD DEVELOP SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THESE AREAS. WITH COLD TEMPERATURES ALOFT HAIL IS 
ALSO POSSIBLE. RIGHT NOW DO NOT EXPECT LARGE HAIL WITH INSTABILITY 
LACKING. BEST TIME FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE LATE 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING AND POSSIBLY CONTINUE INTO THE EARLY 
MORNING ACROSS SW VA CLOSER TO THE UPPER LOW. FOLLOWED THE COOLER 
HIGH TEMPERATURES AND HIGHER POPS OF THE NAM TODAY. THINK THAT 
CLOUDS MOVING IN BY LATE MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON WILL DELAY 
HEATING IN THE NORTHEAST. FOLLOWED A NAM/GFS BLEND TONIGHT. THE 
SOUTHERN THIRD WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR BUT THE NORTHEAST MAY HAVE 
CLOUDS ALL NIGHT WHICH MAY HOLD TEMPERATURES UP A FEW DEGREES.       

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS MOVES 
EAST THROUGH AREA EARLY ON FRIDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
FROM THE NORTHWEST. SOME LOW LEVEL CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY DRIZZLE WILL 
AFFECT NE AREAS...OTHERWISE A COOL DAY CAN BE EXPECTED. HIGH 
PRESSURE WEAKENS OVER THE AREA THROUGH SUNDAY. OPENED UP DIURNAL 
TEMPS RANGE A DEGREE OR TWO FOR DRY CONDITIONS. A WEAK FRONT LEANS 
INTO THE AREA FROM THE NE ON MONDAY. HIGH PRESSURE REBUILDS INTO THE 
AREA FROM THE NE THROUGH WEDNESDAY. CLOUDS WILL LIKELY STACK ALONG 
NC SIDE OF THE MNTS WITH ISOLATED MAINLY AFTN TSTMS PSBL BUT WILL 
KEEP FCST DRY FOR NOW.   
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

231 PM EDT WED MAY 16 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...COOL FRONT LIES APPROXIMATELY 
FROM GA/TN/AL LINE UP PLATEAU/WRN VLY TO THE KY/VA LINE. TEMPS 
WARMER BEHIND FRONT BECAUSE OF SUNSHINE, BUT DEWPOINTS 
SIGNIFICANTLY LOWER. ALMOST MORE OF A DRY LINE. THIN LINE OF SHOWERS
MOVING ALONG FRONT SHOULD EXIT AREA BY ABOUT 21Z. SOME RESIDUAL 
SHOWERS OR EVEN VIRGA MAY REMAIN LINE EXITS, BUT WILL DISSIPATE 
TONIGHT. MUCH DRIER AIR WILL CROSS AREA OVERNIGHT AND MOST OF 
THURSDAY, WITH SMALL VORT MAX CROSSING NORTHERN PORTIONS IN THE 
MID-DAY TO LATE AFTERNOON TIME PERIOD. DO NOT EXPECT MUCH RAIN WITH 
THIS VORT. ITS TOUGH TO BEAT A DROUGHT DOWN.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH
WILL EXIT THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS FRIDAY ENDING THE CHANCE OF
WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS FOR NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST
AREA. A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA
FOR THIS WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...A BACK-DOOR COLD
FRONT WILL MOVE INTO AREA BY MID-WEEK. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF DIURNAL
THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATE TUESDAY
AND WEDNESDAY. DUE TO THE PERSISTENT DROUGHT CONDITIONS...HAVE KEPT
CHANCE OF CONVECTION OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR NOW. 

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...HAVE TRENDED A LITTLE WARMER THAN GUIDANCE
HIGHS THROUGH THE PERIOD GIVEN THE DRY SOIL CONDITIONS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 160739
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 AM EDT WED MAY 16 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT STRETCHES FROM NEAR 
DETROIT SOUTHWEST ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY THROUGH AR AND INTO 
EAST TX. THE PRE FRONTAL TROUGH OUT IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT WAS 
PRODUCING SCATTERED SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS SOUTH 
CENTRAL KY AND MIDDLE TN. THIS AREA OF PRECIPITATION WAS DECREASING 
AS THE ATMOSPHERE HAS STABILIZED FROM EARLIER TONIGHT. THE SHOWERS 
SHOULD REACH THE NORTHERN PLATEAU IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS BUT DO NOT 
EXPECT MUCH INITIALLY. MODELS IN AGREEMENT THAT MAIN TIME OF 
PRECIPITATION WILL BE FROM 12Z ON WITH STRONGER SHORTWAVE AND BETTER 
LIFT. AIRMASS IS SOMEWHAT UNSTABLE THIS MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON 
BUT BECOMES STABLE BY MID AFTERNOON WITH THE PRECIPITATION MOVING IN 
WITH THE FRONT. WILL ONLY HAVE ISOLATED OR SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS IN ZONE WORDING. BY 00Z TONIGHT FRONT WILL BE TO THE 
EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA AND ONLY A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS WILL 
CONTINUE LATER INTO THE EVENING. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING ARE IN 
THE UPPER 50S TO UPPER 60S WITH A MODERATELY STRONG SOUTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT. RAISED HIGHS A FEW DEGREES AND AM A LITTLE WORRIED WITH SOME 
BREAKS TEMPERATURES MAY REACH NEAR 80 SOUTH AND MID 70S EASTERN HALF 
BEFORE PRECIPITATION MOVES IN. LATEST RUC MODEL THROUGH 18Z ONLY 
SHOWING A TENTH OR SO INCH OF PRECIPITATION. MUCH COOLER AND DRIER 
AIRMASS BEHIND THE COLD FRONT TONIGHT WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO 
DROP INTO THE 40S TO LOWER 50S AND UPPER 30S IN THE MOUNTAINS AS 
SKIES CLEAR.    

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MIDLEVEL TROUGH WITH 
NOTABLE COLD CORE SLIDES SE APPROACHING E APPALACHIANS ON THU. 
RELATIVELY HIGH MOISTURE IN THE POST SURFACE FRONTAL AIRMASS. 
INCREASED PCPN CHC THU A BIT CENTRAL AND N AREAS. NAM IS DEEPER AND 
SLOWER WITH MID LEVEL TROUGH POSITION THU EVENING WHICH COULD RESULT 
IN EVEN BETTER PCPN CHC N AREAS INTO THU NIGHT. CAA IMPRESSIVE INTO 
FRI WITH SINGLE DIGIT H85 TEMPS AREAWIDE AND NEAR 0 ACROSS SW VA. 
FRI MAX TEMPS WILL BE AROUND 8-12 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. ADDITIONAL 
LOW LEVEL WRAP AROUND MOISTURE MAY PRODUCE ISOLATED UPSLOPE AND 
INSTABILITY TYPE SHWRS NE AREAS ON FRI. SW AREAS WILL SEE MORE SUN 
AND NOT BE QUITE AS COLD. SURFACE RIDGE SLIDES SLOWLY INTO AREA FOR 
REMAINDER OF WEEKEND WITH NEUTRAL TEMPERATURE ADVECTION. WARM RETURN 
FLOW BEGINS EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH ISOLATED SHOWERS POSSIBLE ALONG THE 
NC BORDER BUT WILL LEAVE FCST DRY FOR NOW.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT TUE MAY 15 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...
MODELS AND SREF ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH TIMING THE
WEDNESDAY PRECIP EVENT INTO AND OUT OF OUR AREA. PRECIP SHOULD
BEGAN TO ENCROACH ONTO THE PLATEAU AROUND 12Z AND PROGRESS ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA BY 18Z. TIME OF DAY COUPLED WITH ONLY SLIGHT
INSTABILITY AND RELATIVELY WEAK DYNAMICS SHOULD LIMIT THUNDERSTORM
ACTIVITY. SOME THUNDER POSSIBLE HOWEVER AND WILL CONTINUE TO
MENTION IN ZONES. MOST OF PRECIP SHOULD BE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS
BY 00Z THURSDAY. FOR TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE APPEARS REASONABLE BASED
ON ANTICIPATED PROGRESS OF SYSTEM AND WAS FOLLOWED CLOSELY.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
MIDLEVEL TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO DROP THURSDAY MORNING AS THE 500 
MB TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE AREA. COOL TEMPS ALOFT AND SOME SURFACE 
HEATING IN THE MORNING WILL PRODUCE STEEP LAPSE RATES SUFFICIENT FOR 
SCATTERED SHOWERS ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. LIFT WILL ALSO 
BE ENHANCED BY DIVERGENCE IN THE ENTRANCE REGION OF THE UPPER 
JET...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW FOR SOME ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS. THE BEST 
INSTABILITY REMAINS IN THE NORTH CLOSER TO THE 500 MB TEMPERATURE 
MINIMUM...SO WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS THERE WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE 
CENTRAL AND NO POPS IN THE SOUTH. THE TROUGH AXIS WILL BE EAST OF 
THE AREA BY MIDNIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT...ENDING RAIN CHANCES.

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...A LARGE AND SLOW MOVING HIGH PRESSURE 
RIDGE WILL SHIFT FROM THE CENTRAL UNITED STATES TO THE ATLANTIC 
COAST. THIS WILL KEEP DRY WEATHER OVER OUR AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW NORMAL ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AS COOL AIR 
BEHIND THE TROUGH WILL LINGER...BUT THE AIR MASS WILL MODERATE TO 
NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES BY SUNDAY. A MORE SOUTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPS 
ON MONDAY AS THE HIGH MOVES EAST...WHICH WILL WARM TEMPERATURES 
ABOVE NORMAL.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LAYER RIDGING SLIDES EAST

TOO LOW FOR MENTION IN CURRENT FORECAST. LOW LEVELS REMAIN DRY AND 
GOOD MIXING ON TAP FOR THIS AFTN. EXPECT GUSTY WINDS AND WENT A 
COUPLE DEGREES HIGHER THAN MOS FOR MAX TEMPS. COLD FRONT APPROACHES 
FM NW TONIGHT. DEEP MOISTURE AND LIFT TIGHTLY ALIGNED NEAR FRONT. 
CONVECTION SHOULD BEGIN MOVING INTO NW PART OF CWA LATE TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT
WITH BRINGING COLD FRONT THROUGH FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY WITH DECENT
COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS AND DRAGGING A SIGNIFICANT
TROUGH INTO THE EASTERN STATES. FOR THE END OF THE WEEK. A CLOSED
UPPER LOW WILL DEEPEN THE TROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY REINFORCING
THE COOLER TEMPERATURES. ONLY CHANGED THE TIMING SLIGHTLY WEDNESDAY
LOWERING POPS A LITTLE EARLY IN THE MORNING. PUT HIGHEST POPS IN
THE AFTERNOON WEDNESDAY. NAM HAS AIRMASS MODERATELY UNSTABLE ALONG
THE MOUNTAINS WITH GFS BRINGING PRECIP IN A LITTLE EARLIER AND NOT
AS UNSTABLE. BEST AREA FOR THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE IN THE EASTERN
MOUNTAINS BUT LEFT CHANCE IN FOR ALL AREAS IF TIMING SLOWS ANY.
COULD SEE ONE HALF INCH OF RAIN OR MORE WHICH WOULD BE GOOD FOR THE
DRY GROUND. PRECIPITATION MOVES OUT QUICKLY WEDNESDAY EVENING AS
FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE AGAIN
THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS UPPER SYSTEM TRACKS ACROSS WITH
THUNDER AGAIN POSSIBLE BUT RAINFALL COVERAGE MORE SPOTTY AND
AMOUNTS PROBABLY LIGHT. SKIES CLEAR LATER THURSDAY NIGHT AND
SURFACE HIGH WITH ORIGINS IN CANADA WILL BRING SUNNY SKIES AND
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE WEEKEND. COOLEST NIGHTS WILL
BE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH LOWS IN THE 40S. TROUGH MOVES EAST BY
THE END OF THE WEEKEND SO TEMPERATURES WARM TO NEAR NORMAL. RIDGE
OF HIGH PRESSURE STILL IN PLACE WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY AND
PRECIPITATION OUT OF THE PICTURE THROUGH MONDAY.

230 PM EDT MON MAY 14 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...
ONE MORE DAY OF TRANQUIL WEATHER IN THE OFFING AS SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE SLOWLY RETREATS EASTWARD. RETURN FLOW SHOULD ALLOW
DEWPOINTS TO SLOWLY RECOVER ALTHOUGH RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL
REMAIN QUITE LOW PER MODEL GUIDANCE. FOR TEMPS...HAD NO REASON TO
SIGNIFICANTLY DEVIATE FROM GFS GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY EVENING...AND 
CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS IN MIDDLE TN MAY CLIP THE NORTHERN PLATEAU 
COUNTIES. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP THERE BEFORE MIDNIGHT. 
POPS WILL RISE OVERNIGHT AS THE FRONT PUSHES SOUTHEAST. THE TIMING 
OF BEST LIFT AND MOISTURE IN THE NAM AND GFS IS BETWEEN 12Z AND 
18Z...AND WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS IN THIS TIME FRAME. INSTABILITY IS 
LACKING...WITH ONLY THE SOUTHERN VALLEY GETTING A LI BELOW 0 ON 
WEDNESDAY. THUS WILL MENTION ONLY A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS NORTH 
AND CENTRAL. DYNAMICAL FORCING IS ALSO WEAK AS THE SURFACE FRONT IS 
WELL OUT AHEAD OF THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. THE FRONT SHOULD BE 
THROUGH THE AREA BY 00Z AND WILL END MOST POPS BY THEN...EXCEPT FOR 
A LOW CHANCE IN SW NC/TN MTNS IN THE EVENING. ADVECTION OF COLD DRY 
AIR WILL ENSUE WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WHICH SHOULD GIVE MOSTLY CLEAR TO 
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AFTER MIDNIGHT.

MODELS SHOW THE 500 MB TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE AREA ON THURSDAY. 
COOL TEMPS ALOFT AND SOME SURFACE HEATING IN THE MORNING WILL 
PRODUCE STEEP LAPSE RATES SUFFICIENT FOR SHOWERS THURSDAY AFTERNOON. 
AS MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED AND LARGE SCALE DYNAMICAL FORCING WILL 
BE WEAK...EXPECT THE SHOWERS TO BE SCATTERED. THE NAM SHOWS A DEEPER 
TROUGH AND THUS HAS MORE PRECIP FARTHER SOUTH THAN THE GFS...BUT AT 
THIS TIME WILL KEEP POPS JUST IN NE TN AND SW VA. THE TROUGH AXIS 
WILL BE EAST OF THE AREA BY MIDNIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT...ENDING RAIN 
CHANCES.

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...A LARGE RIDGE WILL SHIFT FROM THE 
CENTRAL CONUS TO THE EAST COAST...WHICH WILL KEEP OUR AREA DRY EACH 
DAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN BELOW NORMAL ON FRIDAY AS COOL AIR 
BEHIND THE TROUGH WILL BUILD SOUTH...BUT THE AIR MASS WILL MODERATE 
TO NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES BY SUNDAY. A MORE SOUTHERLY FLOW 
DEVELOPS ON SUNDAY AS THE HIGH MOVES EAST...WHICH WILL WARM 
TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.

GEM/CANADIAN ENSEMBLES REMAIN AT LEAST 12 HOURS SLOWER WITH THE
PROGRESSION OF THIS SYSTEM. OPERATIONAL GFS HAS BEEN RELATIVELY
CONSISTENT WITH THE TIMING OVER THE PAST SEVERAL RUNS AND HAS
SUPPORT FROM BOTH THE GFS AND NOGAPS ENSEMBLES. THUS WILL NOT MAKE
ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST WITH RESPECT TO TIMING
ISSUES. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE WITH INFLUENCES
FROM ENSEMBLE TRENDS FACTORED IN. TEMPS ARE PROJECTED TO AVERAGE
NEAR TO SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMO FOLLOWING PASSAGE OF COLD FRONT ON
WEDNESDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             61  85  55  82  56 /  10   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  57  80  52  80  55 /  10   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  81  50  81  54 /  10   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              53  77  42  78  51 /  10   0   0   0   0

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EDT SAT MAY 12 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE SE 
THROUGH THE AREA TODAY WITH A LARGE TROUGH AXIS PUSHING SE INTO THE 
APPALACHIANS LATE TONIGHT. SURFACE FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH INTO AREA 
TODAY AND CONTINUE TO PRESS SOUTH OVERNIGHT. LITTLE CHANGE TO 
CURRENT FORECAST. AIRMASS DRIES OUT SOME IN WAKE OF INITIAL SHORT 
WAVE. HOWEVER...PREFRONTAL AIRMASS DESTABILIZES SUFFICIENTLY TO 
ALLOW FOR WIDELY SCATTERED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTN. 
PCPN SHOULD MOVE OFF TO THE SE THIS EVENING. THICKNESS VALUES DOWN 
FROM FRI SO TEMPS NOT AS WARM BUT STILL AROUND 5 DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO 
THE REGION ON SUNDAY AND DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH TUESDAY.   
THERE REMAINS SOME DISCREPANCIES IN MODELS REGARDING THE TIMING OF A 
WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY.  
BEST PRECIP CHANCES STILL APPEAR TO BE CENTERED AROUND WEDNESDAY AND 
WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR THIS PERIOD.  THE SYSTEM EXITS WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND WILL SEE A RETURN TO A DRY...QUIET WEATHER PATTERN FOR 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  STAYED NEAR MODEL GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 120111
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT FRI MAY 11 2007

.DISCUSSION...FAIRLY GOOD COVERAGE OF SHOWER ACTIVITY FROM KNOXVILLE 
WEST AND SOUTH THIS EVENING.  EVEN WITH SUNSET AND THE ACCOMPANING 
DECREASE IN HEATING FOR DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORMS...SCATTERED SHOWER 
AND SOME THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY IS STILL ONGOING AND WILL LIKELY 
CONTINUE FOR THE NEXT 2 TO 3 HOURS.  SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS ARE EVEN 
POSSIBLE TO LINGER AFTER MIDNIGHT.  THE CURRENT FORECAST REFLECTS 
THIS POSSIBILITY NICELY...SO NO CHANGES PLANNED AT THIS TIME.  IF 
ACTIVITY DIMINISHES MORE RAPIDLY THAN EXPECTED...MAY UPDATE AFTER 10 
P.M.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SOME CONVECTION 
HAS FIRED EARLY THIS AFTERNOON...MAINLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE 
PLATEAU AND SW NC.  THINK NAM OVERDONE WITH PRECIP FOR TONIGHT AND 
SATURDAY...GIVEN FACT THAT IT IS HANDLING CURRENT SITUATION RATHER 
POORLY.  GFS DEPICTION OF CURRENT PRECIP BETTER...AND GIVEN DROUGHT 
OVER THE AREA...AND WITH LITTLE IN THE WAY OF ORGANIZED 
FORCING...THINK ITS DRIER SOLUTION LOOKS MORE REALISTIC. DO NOT 
EXPECT WEAK FRONT TO HAVE MUCH CONVERGENCE WITH IT...WITH LIGHT 
NORTH WINDS AHEAD OF IT.   WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FROM THE 
NORTH DOWN INTO THE CENTRAL VALLEYS FOR TONIGHT...WITH CHANCE POPS 
IN THE SOUTH AND MOST OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS.  WILL GO WITH 
MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SATURDAY...EXCEPT CHANCE IN HIGHER TERRAIN 
AREAS SOUTH.  WILL GENERALLY GO ABOVE MAV TEMPS TONIGHT...NEAR MAV 
VALUES FOR TOMORROW.  


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...DRY...TRANQUIL WEATHER 
CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD PER 
MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. THE MAIN EXCEPTION WILL BE MID WEEK 
WHEN A WEAK COLD FRONT AND UPPER SHORT WAVE TROUGH APPROACH THE 
AREA. STILL APPEARS BEST CHANCES FOR ANY PRECIP WILL OCCUR WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON ALTHOUGH THE CANADIAN GEM/CANADIAN ENSEMBLES ARE SOMEWHAT 
SLOWER WITH THIS EVENT. GENERALLY FAVORED THE GFS/GFS ENSEMBLE 
TIMING...ALTHOUGH THE DISCREPANCIES CAST SOME DOUBT ON THE EXACT 
TIMING. AT ANY RATE...THIS EVENT DOES NOT APPEAR EXCEPTIONALLY WELL 
ORGANIZED AND PRECIP WILL LIKELY BE SCATTERED IN NATURE. THUS CHANCE 
CATEGORY POPS STILL SEEM APPROPRIATE. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY USED A 
BLEND OF GFS AND GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE VALUES WHICH WERE 
RELATIVELY CLOSE FOR THE MOST PART. APPEARS TEMPS MAY ACTUALLY FALL 
TO SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMO AFTER PASSAGE OF NEXT WEEKS COLD FRONT 
BASED ON THE GFS/ENSEMBLE GUIDANCE AS TROUGHING/NORTHWEST FLOW 
BECOMES ESTABLISHED OVER THE EASTERN CONUS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  88  61  84  55 /  30  20  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  85  58  79  52 /  20  20  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       63  88  57  81  51 /  20  20  10   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              58  83  51  78  44 /  20  20  20   0   0

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDING SW

BOUNDARY ACROSS SW PORTIONS OF MRX CWA WILL MIGRATE NE SOME TDY. 
WEAK RIDGING ALOFT WITH VERY WEAK STEERING WINDS THROUGH THE LAYER. 
A SHORT WAVE WILL PUSH SE INTO THE AREA TNGT. PWS HAVE BEEN ON THE 
RISE. MORE DEBRIS CLOUD COVER TDY SHOULD HOLD TEMPS A COUPLE DEGREES 
COOLER THAN THU. AIRMASS BECOMES SUFFICIENTLY UNSTABLE THIS AFTN TO 
SUPPORT GOOD TSTM COVERAGE. STORM MOTION WILL BE VERY SLOW AND TO 
THE SE. MOS TEMP #S CLOSE AND USED BLEND. LEANED TOWARD HIGHER NAM 
POP #S.   


.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SYSTEM WILL BE SLOWLY 
PUSHING SOUTH THROUGH THE REGION SATURDAY FOR CONTINUED SCATTERED 
CONVECTION ACROSS THE AREA.  A DRY AND STABLE AIR MASS WILL MOVE IN 
WITH HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY BUILDING INTO THE AREA SUNDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY.  POOR CONSISTENCY WITH INCOMING MID WEEK SYSTEM AND 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON TIMING BUT WILL KEEP LOW POPS IN FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT WITH BEST PRECIP CHANCES ON WEDNESDAY AND DRY THURSDAY.  MODEL 
GUIDANCE LOOKS GOOD AND WILL STAY CLOSE THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.DISCUSSION...WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A SINGLE SHOWER IN MEIGS

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...NOTHING ON RADAR SO 
FAR IN OUR AREA...BUT AM HESITANT TO REMOVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THAT 
WE HAVE GOING IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR THIS EVENING...SO WILL LEAVE 
AS IS FOR NOW.   APPEARS BETTER INSTABILITY AND A BIT MORE MOISTURE 
TOMORROW...BUT STILL EXPECT LITTLE IN THE WAY OF ORGANIZED 
FORCING...SO CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES...BUT WILL BACK DOWN TO 30 IN THE 
VALLEY AND 40 IN SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN.  WILL ONLY MAKE A FEW 
MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...CONDITIONS REMAIN 
SOMEWHAT UNSETTLED THROUGH EARLY WEEKEND AS WEAK FRONT DRIFTS
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. UPPER FLOW AMPLIFIES AND
FRONT IS PUSHED SOUTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA BY LATE SATURDAY PER
MODEL AND SREF CONSENSUS. DRY...STABLE AIR MASS PERSISTS BEHIND
FRONT INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK WHEN ANOTHER WEAK FRONT
APPROACHES THE AREA. APPEARS WEDNESDAY WILL BE THE BEST CHANCE OF
PRECIP WITH THIS FEATURE BUT EVEN THIS EVENT DOES NOT LOOK VERY
ORGANIZED AT THIS TIME. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE
VALUES CLOSELY.

FXUS64 KMRX 100643
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 AM EDT THU MAY 10 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...
WEAK HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION
BETWEEN A COASTAL LOW AND A CLOSED LOW OVER TEXAS. THE ILL-DEFINED
FLOW OVER OUR AREA WILL RESULT IN A PERSISTANCE FORECAST FOR
TEMPERATURES TODAY. AS THE MODELS ARE INDICATING A LITTLE MORE LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY TODAY THAN YESTERDAY...WILL HAVE A
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MENTIONED...MAINLY IN
THE ELEVATED AREAS OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU. ANY CONVECTION
THAT DOES DEVELOP WILL BE DIURNALLY DRIVEN AND DISSIPATE AFTER
SUNSET.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
THE RIDGE WEAKENS ON FRIDAY AS A TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE
NORTH...WHICH ALLOWS FOR A LITTLE BETTER INSTABILITY AND WEAK LOW
LEVEL CONVERGENCE FRIDAY AFTERNOON. ORGANIZED CONVECTION STILL
SEEMS UNLIKELY WITH A WEAK FLOW ALOFT...SO WILL KEEP POPS IN THE
CHANCE RANGE THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. THE WEAK TROUGH CROSSES THE
AREA ON SATURDAY FROM NORTH TO SOUTH...GIVING BETTER PRECIP CHANCES
IN THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA. BEHIND THE TROUGH...ANOTHER HIGH
PRESSSURE RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA ON SUNDAY...WITH DRY
WEATHER EXPECTED THROUGH TUESDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  88  63  85  62  83 /  10  10  50  30  30

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EDT WED MAY 9 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...LOOKS LIKE WE WILL BE BETWEEN 
THE UPPER LOW TO OUR SOUTHEAST...TROUGH TO OUR WEST AND ANOTHER TO 
OUR NORTH...WITH WEAK UPPER RIDGING REMAINING OVER OUR AREA THROUGH 
THURSDAY.  SHOULD BE DRY AND MAINLY CLEAR TONIGHT.  SURFACE 
DEWPOINTS HAVE BEEN RISING...AND WITH INCREASING MOISTURE MAY BE 
ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTH AND PLATEAU AREAS.  WILL CARRY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THESE AREAS. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AS MOISTURE
CONTINUES TO INCREASE FROM THE WEST AS BROAD TROUGH MOVES INTO THE
MS VALLEY THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR A FEW SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS LATE THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS ALL AREAS. THE ACTIVITY SHOULD BE DIURNAL IN NATURE
TOO.  SUBTROPICAL LOW TO THE SOUTHEAST SHOULD DRIFT SLOWLY SW
TOWARDS FLORIDA THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY AND HAVE NO AFFECT ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA.  A LOW PRESSURE AREA IN NORTHEAST CANADA AND
TRAILING COLD FRONT INTO THE OHIO VALLEY FRIDAY MORNING WILL MOVE
SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY.  MOISTURE WITH THE BROAD
TROUGH TO THE WEST AND THE SHORTWAVE ENERGY AHEAD OF THIS FRONT
WILL INCREASE THE SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM THREAT FRIDAY AND
CONTINUE THE CHANCE INTO SATURDAY. THE FRONT SHOULD MOVE SOUTH OF
THE FORECAST AREA LATE SATURDAY. LOWS SHOULD BE MILD THURSDAY
NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF THE FRONT WITH HIGHS
CONTINUEING IN THE LOWER 80S IN THE VALLEYS. THERE WILL BE
SLIGHTLY COOLER DRIER AIR BEHIND THE FRONT SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS
HIGH PRESSURE FROM CANADA MOVES INTO THE NE AND MID ATLANTIC
STATES.  A NEW FRONT DROPS DOWN INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY AND INCREASING MOISTURE WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW BRINGS BACK
THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.
&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...

INTO OUR EASTERN COUNTIES...BUT SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR TODAY.
HIGHS TODAY WILL REACH THE UPPER 70S TO MID 80S...AND SIMILAR
TEMPS ARE EXPECTED THURSDAY. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL BE IN THE 50S
TONIGHT AND THURSDAY NIGHT. THE MODELS INDICATE A LITTLE MORE LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE AND WEAK INSTABILITY MOVING IN FROM THE WEST ON
THURSDAY AS THE SURFACE HIGH SHIFTS TO THE EAST. WILL INCLUDE A
SLIGHT CHANCE POP THURSDAY AFTERNOON IN THE PLATEAU COUNTIES.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THE RIDGE ALOFT WEAKENS ON FRIDAY AS A TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE
NORTHWEST. WEAK LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND MLCAPES OVER 1000 J/KG
SHOULD RESULT IN SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON
FRIDAY. WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE TROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...PRECIP
CHANCES DECREASE ON SATURDAY...BUT WILL KEEP A SLIGHT/LOW CHANCE
POP IN THE SOUTH TO BETTER FIT WITH NEIGHBORS. A HIGH PRESSURE
RIDGE WILL KEEP THE AREA DRY ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. A RETURN FLOW OF
GULF MOISTURE BRINGS A CHANCE OF PRECIP ON TUESDAY.

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. DRY AIRMASS IN

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...MAIN WEATHER FEATURE 
REMAINS A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL U.S.  
UPPER LOW OFF THE EAST COAST WILL SLOWLY SHIFT WESTWARD...ROTATING 
THROUGH OCCASIONAL MID TO HIGH CLOUDS ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS.  
OTHERWISE...WITH ABUNDANT DAYTIME SUNSHINE AND SLOWLY INCREASING DEW 
POINTS...WILL SEE WARMING TREND CONTINUE THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.  
GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE AND WILL KEEP TEMPS CLOSE.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...AT START OF PERIOD DEEP RIDGE 
HAS BROKEN DOWN AND CONVECTION STARTING TO THREATEN AREA FROM WEST.  
WITH SURFACE DEW POINTS RECOVERING SOMEWHAT BY THAT TIME...THINK 
THERE MAY BE A FEW STORMS POPPING THAT AFTERNOON ON THE PLATEAU TO 
WEST...SO HAVE SOME LOW POPS THERE.  AS FRONT PUSHES SOUTHWARD ON 
FRIDAY BETTER POPS ACROSS THE AREA...AND ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS FOR 
SATURDAY.  THIS SET OF MODELS SEEMS TO PUSH FRONT FARTHER SOUTH...SO 
HAVE TRIMMED POPS ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY AND HAVE DRIED DEW POINTS OUT A LITTLE AS WELL.  MOSTLY DRY 
WEATHER EXPECTED MONDAY...BUT MOISTURE AND NEXT FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
SHOULD BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO WARRANT POPS FOR TUESDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...

CIRRUS...CLEAR SKIES. EXPECT TEMPS TO BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER TODAY
THAN YESTERDAY...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S...AND
WARMER AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY...REACHING THE MID 80S IN THE SOUTHERN
VALLEY. RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL BE LOW AGAIN TODAY...IN THE 20%
RANGE...BUT WINDS WILL BE LIGHT AND DEWPOINTS ON THE RISE ON
WEDNESDAY. 

.LONG TERM...
THE UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN ON THURSDAY AS THE LOW OFF THE
ATLANTIC COAST RETROGRADES AND A TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST.
THOUGH SYNOPTIC SCALE FORCING IS WEAK...THE BREAKDOWN OF THE RIDGE
AND INCREASING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY BE ENOUGH TO PRODUCE ISOLATED
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. A SURFACE THROUGH
MOVES THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY...AND MAY GIVE SLIGHTLY BETTER
CHANCES OF SHOWERS...THOUGH THE LIFT REMAINS QUITE WEAK. A RIDGE
BUILDS INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST ON SUNDAY...WHICH SHOULD GIVE
DRY WEATHER FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE NEXT WORK WEEK. WILL HAVE
TEMPS A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
225 PM EDT MON MAY 7 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO 
DOMINATE AREA THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.  DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE WITH 
GENERALLY CLEAR SKY AND DEW POINTS IN THE 25 TO AROUND 40 DEGREE 
RANGE.  THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A WIDE DIURNAL TEMPERATURE RANGE WITH 
WARM DAYS AN COOL NIGHT.  ADDITIONALLY...THE COMBINATION OF LOW DEW 
POINTS AND WARM DAYTIME TEMPERATURES WILL RESULT IN LOW RELATIVE 
HUMIDITIES CAUSING SOME FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS...HOWEVER...WIND 
SHOULD REMAIN LESS THAN 10 MPH.  

.LONG TERM  (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AT ONSET OF THIS TIME 
PERIOD...RIDGE IS FOUND OVER AREA BETWEEN TROUGH TO WEST AND 
WEAKENING LOW TO EAST.  THIS RIDGE IS EXPECTED TO BREAK DOWN IN THE 
LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK AND BY SATURDAY MORNING ALL SIGNS OF THE 
RIDGE ARE GONE AND BROAD TROUGHINESS SLOWLY FORMS IN AREA.

WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAGS INTO AREA AS WELL AND IS NOT EXPECTED TO 
MAKE IT TOO FAR TO THE SOUTH. WILL KEEP POPS IN AREA FROM THE 
WESTERN AREAS ON THURSDAY TO ALL AREAS THROUGH THE END OF THE 
PERIOD.  LATER PERIODS WILL HAVE A NORTH TO SOUTH GRADIENT OF 
INCREASING POPS...GETTING CLOSER TO FRONTAL BOUNDARY.  HAVE THUNDER 
IN FORECAST THROUGH SATURDAY...BUT CHANGE OVER TO SHOWERS IN 
POST-FRONTAL AIR MASS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...BUT WITH FRONT NOT TOO 
FAR AWAY...MIGHT NEED TO PUT IN THUNDER AS TIME GETS CLOSER.

HAVE GONE A FEW DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE ON SUNDAY MAX TEMP AS COOLER 
AIR SHOULD BE FILTERING INTO REGION AND CLOUDS SHOULD STILL LINGER 
NORTH OF FRONT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 AM EDT MON MAY 7 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN OMEGA BLOCK PATTERN OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS WILL KEEP THE AREA DRY FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER NEW ENGLAND WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD TO THE 
SOUTHWEST. SOME CLOUDS IN SW NC AND SE TN THIS MORNING WILL 
DISSIPATE WITH MIXING AND ADDITIONAL DRY AIR ADVECTION FROM THE 
NORTHEAST. SKIES SHOULD BE CLEAR ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA BY NOON. 
HIGHS WILL BE MAINLY IN THE 70S WITH 60S IN THE MOUNTAINS. RELATIVE 
HUMIDITIES WILL BE QUITE LOW TODAY FOR FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS...IN 
THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 20S...THOUGH WINDS WILL BE LESS THAN 10 MPH FROM 
THE NORTHEAST. TEMPS SHOULD DROP OFF QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET IN THE DRY 
AIR MASS...WITH LOWS TONIGHT IN THE 40S. ...

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
REGION WILL BRING DRY WEATHER INTO THURSDAY.  LOW DEW POINT  
TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY WILL PRODUCE RELATIVE HUMIDITIES IN THE 
20S...BUT WINDS WILL BE LIGHT WHICH SHOULD REDUCE FIRE DANGER.  
HUMIDITIES INCREASE THE REST OF THE WEEK.  MODELS INDICATE A CLOSED 
LOW TRACKING INTO THE CAROLINAS ON WEDNESDAY...BEST MOISTURE REMAINS 
TO THE EAST...SO WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY DRY.  A FRONT 
APPROACHES THE AREA ON THURSDAY NIGHT....WILL ADD 20 POPS FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND KEEP THE 20 POPS GOING FOR FRIDAY.  FRONT LINGERS 
ACROSS THE AREA ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...WILL KEEP THE CHANCE POPS 
FOR SATURDAY AND ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY WITH LESS 
MOISTURE AVAILABLE.  STAYED NEAR MAV GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 061844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EDT SUN MAY 6 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CURRENT DRY AIR MASS FROM 
NORTHEAST IS PUSHING SLOWLY BUT INEXORABLY DOWN THE VALLEY, THROUGH 
THE MOUNTAINS AND STARTING TO AFFECT THE PLATEAU, EVEN. DEWPOINTS 
NORTHEAST VALLEY IN THE LOW 50S AND IN VIRGINIA IN THE 40S AND UPPER 
30S ALREADY. IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY, THEY ARE STILL IN 
THE LOW 60S, BUT THE CLOUDS ARE ERODING QUICKLY AS THE COLD 
ADVECTION TAKES OVER. EVEN IN CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES, NC 
DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE 50S. DO NOT EXPECT FOG OF ANY KIND TONIGHT, AND 
EXPECT THAT CLOUDS WILL PRETTY MUCH DISSIPATE BY SUNSET, IF THEY 
ARENT GONE NOW.

TEMPS WILL BE CHILLY WITH LOW DOWN IN THE UPPER 30S IN NORTHEAST 
MOUNTAINS AND PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA, WITH 40S AND 50S THE 
FURTHER SOUTH ONE GOES. JUST ENOUGH WIND OR WEAK MASS TRANSPORT TO 
PREVENT TEMPS FROM FALLING TO FREEZING IN ISOLATED HIGHER VALLEYS UP 
NORTH OR IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY LOW SPOTS. STILL, TEMPS WILL BE BELOW 
NORMAL FOR THE FIRST WEEK OF MAY AND TENDER OUTDOOR PLANTS SHOULD BE 
COVERED. 

SUNDAY TEMPS WILL REBOUND QUICKLY WITH AMPLE SUNSHINE. NORMAL TO 
ABOVE NORMAL HIGHS, BUT NOT HOT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE IN 
PLACE OVER THE EASTERN U.S. THROUGH THURSDAY FOR CONTINUE DRY 
CONDITIONS.  UPPER LOW TO OUR EAST DURING THIS TIME FRAME PROGGED TO 
DRIFT WEST TOWARD MRX AREA...MAIN AFFECT FROM THIS SHOULD BE 
OCCASIONAL CLOUD BANDS...ASSOCIATED PRECIP SHOULD REMAIN TO OUR 
EAST.  NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHING AREA ON FRIDAY.  TIMING/POSITION OF 
SYSTEM REMAINS IN QUESTION AND CONFIDENCE LOW ON DETAILS...WILL KEEP 
20-30 PERCENT POPS IN PLACE FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AS SYSTEM MOVES 
THROUGH.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...AS MODELS HAVE ADVERTISED THE

ACROSS AREA. RAIN SHOWERS MOVING EAST, BREAKING UP, AND DIGGING A 
LITTLE SOUTH. LOWER POPS OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND SW NC WERE A GOOD 
CALL. TEMPS WERE A LITTLE HIGH IN THE FORECAST SO ADJUSTED THEM DOWN 
EARLIER TODAY. WILL KEEP WITH ADJUSTED TEMPS OVERNIGHT. 

ONLY REAL CHANGES MADE WERE TO DROP POPS SLIGHTLY TONIGHT AND THEN 
GRADUALLY FADE THEM OUT BY EARLY SUNDAY AS BACK DOOR FRONT MOVES IN 
FROM NORTHEAST. SUNDAY WILL, BE DEFINITION, BE IN A POST COLD 
FRONT AIRMASS, BUT WITH DRIER AIR AND MORE SUNSHINE WILL BE WARMER 
THAN TODAY. WHILE THE RAIN RECEIVED THE LAST FEW DAYS IS NOT A 
DROUGHT BUSTER BY ANY MEANS, IT IS VERY WELCOME. WORST HIT DROUGHT 
STRICKEN DID NOT RECEIVE THE HIGHEST AMOUNTS, WHICH IS TYPICAL OF A 
PROLONGED DROUGHT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN 
CONTROL SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY FOR A RETURN TO DRY WEATHER.  
MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT WITH TIMING...STRENGTH...ORGANIZATION AND 
POSITION OF SYSTEM PROGGED INTO THE AREA FOR THE END OF THE WEEK.  
FOR NOW...WILL HAVE GENERALLY 20 TO 30 POPS FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY 
WITH BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIP FRIDAY NIGHT.

RAINERS WITH LIMITED HAIL AND SOME WIND GUSTS. ADJUSTED POPS UP 
TONIGHT FROM LIKELY IN THE SOUTH TO NEAR CATEGORICAL IN THE 
NORTHEAST. GIVEN A SLIGHT LOWERING IN THE HOURS AROUND SUNRISE, THEN 
BACK UP TO MOSTLY CAT SATURDAY. ADJUSTED TEMPS TONIGHT AND SATURDAY 
TO MATCH A BLEND.

CHANCE POPS SATURDAY EVENING AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES OFF.

THIS MORNING. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS THIS MORNING...THEN BRING POPS 
UP TO LIKELY IN THE SOUTHERN HALF THIS AFTERNOON. SCATTERED TO 
BROKEN MIDLEVEL CLOUDS THIS MORNING SHOULD ALLOW ENOUGH SURFACE 
HEATING FOR TEMPS TO REACH BETWEEN 75 AND 80 IN THE VALLEY...WITH 
DECENT INSTABILITY WITH SCAPE VALUES NEAR 1000 J/KG. AN 850 
CONVERGENCE AXIS AND 500 MB VORT MAX MOVE THROUGH BETWEEN 00Z AND 
12Z...AND WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA IN THE 
EVENING. PRECIP SHOULD TAPER OFF IN SOUTHERN SECTIONS AFTER MIDNIGHT 
AS THE VORT MAX MOVES NORTHEAST....

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHORTWAVE PASSING THROUGH 
ON SATURDAY WITH DECENT MOISTURE IN PLACE.  WILL BUMP UP POPS TO 
LIKELY FOR SATURDAY.  SOME INSTABILITY IS ALSO TO EXPECTED...BUT THE 
SHEAR IS TOO WEAK FOR ANY SEVERE STORMS.  MOISTURE DECREASING ON 
SATURDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP SOME CHANCE POPS FOR THE EVENING HOURS... 
THEN ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE AFTER MIDNIGHT.  SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE 
LINGERING INTO SUNDAY MORNING...BUT THE SHORTWAVE IS EAST OF THE 
CWA...SO WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ON SUNDAY 
NIGHT...KEEPING SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY DRY.  A FRONT PUSHES 
INTO REGION ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH THE DRY AIR IN PLACE...WILL 
HOLD OF THE ONSET OF PRECIPITATION UNTIL THURSDAY.  ONLY LIMITED 
MOISTURE IS ADVERTISED...SO WILL KEEP ONLY 20 POPS FOR THURSDAY.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK COLD FRONT CURRENTLY
