SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AREAS OF TENNESSEE WILL
SEE THE GREATEST POSSIBILITY OF RAINS WITH SOME SCATTERED SHOWER
ACTIVITY OVER THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CERTAINLY EXPECT A GENERAL 
INCREASE IN THE AMOUNT OF CONVECTION FROM FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT
...BUT DETERMINING HOW HIGH CHANCES SHOULD BE AND WHEN IS STILL 
TRICKY.  THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY...HARD TO PLACE EVEN TODAY...LOOKS TO 
BE SO WEAK THAT LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WILL ALSO BE WEAK. THUS...NOT
CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO ADJUST POPS MUCH FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR THESE 
PERIODS...GIVEN CURRENT POPS THAT WERE QUITE CLOSE TO MOS BLEND AND 
ALSO TO NEIGHBORING OFFICES GRIDS.

UPPER RIDGE STILL LOOKS TO REBUILD ACROSS THE REGION FROM SUNDAY 
INTO WEDNESDAY...ALTHO CANT RULE OUT ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION ON 
SUNDAY. INTRODUCED SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS FOR THURSDAY (NEW DAY 7) 
...WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AND TEMPS CONTINUING ABOVE CLIMO.

OTHERWISE...JUST MINOR MAX/MIN TEMP ADJUSTMENTS IN LINE WITH THE 
03/00Z GFSX MOS GUIDANCE.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH 
SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT OVER EASTERN KY 
AND SOUTHERN WV. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY APPROACH 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN THIS EVENING...WITH SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY CREATING SOME ADDITIONAL SCATTERED CONVECTION. THIS COLD 
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY AROUND SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN ON THURSDAY...WITH WEAK INSTABILITY ALLOWING SCATTERED 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP EACH DAY THROUGH FRIDAY...MAINLY DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. WILL PLAN TO KEEP POPS HIGHEST ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...DUE TO THE PROXIMITY OF THE FRONT. 
AS FOR TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE AND WILL 
GENERALLY FOLLOW...EXCEPT ON FRIDAY WHEN PERSISTENCE SEEMS TO BE THE 
BETTER OPTION.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROF MIGRATES SLOWLY 
EAST AND WILL BE MOVING ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE ON SATURDAY. ALSO... 
BACK DOOR FRONT WILL HAVE DROPPED SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
PROVIDING A BOUNDARY FOR LIFT SO BLANKETED THE REGION WITH MEDIUM 
CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION THROUGH THE DAY. UPPER LOW MOVES AWAY TO 
THE SOUTHEAST BY 12Z SUNDAY AND LOWERED PROBABILITIES DOWN TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE WITH REMOVAL FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. UPPER RIDGING BUILDS ACROSS 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. MONDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY AND MAINTAINED A DRY FORECAST IN THIS REGIME. STAYED CLOSE 
TO GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLOWLY BEGIN

PRECIPITATION TO WORK INTO THE REGION. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE
TEMPERATURE NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LOW SPINNING TO 
OUR WEST OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS THIS MORNING...SHOULD DRIFT EAST 
AND WEAKEN THE UPPER RIDGE BY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. THE OTHER 
FACTOR WILL BE THE WEAK COLD FRONT SLIPPING SOUTH WITH TIME...BUT IT
IS VERY DIFFICULT TO PLACE AT THIS TIME. THUS...I AM HESITANT TO 
MAKE MAJOR CHANGES TO POP AND WEATHER GRIDS...ALTHO CLEARLY THE 
HIGHER MOS POPS FOR THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT MAY VERY WELL BE 
JUSTIFIED. FOR NOW...I NUDGED POPS UP ON THURSDAY ACROSS NE PLATEAU 
AND SWRN VA AREAS TO BETTER MESH WITH LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS 
FROM JKL AND RLX...SINCE THESE AREAS SHOULD BE VERY NEAR TO FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY INITIALLY.

OTHERWISE...FRESHENED MANY MAX AND MIN TEMP GRIDS WITH OR CLOSE TO 
NEW GFS/GFSX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS BACK ACROSS THE 
REGION ON SUNDAY INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...SO OTHER THAN SPOTTY DIURNAL 
CONVECTION...FELT IT WAS SAFE TO KEEP OUR DRY FORECAST GOING INTO 
TUESDAY. ADDED SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS FOR WEDNESDAY...THE NEW DAY 
SEVEN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

258 PM EDT TUE MAY 1 2007

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...RIDGING REMAINS ACROSS THE 
REGION...SO DRY WEATHER SHOULD CONTINUE TONIGHT.  A FRONT TRACKS IN 
FROM THE NORTH ON WEDNESDAY BRINGING INCREASED MOISTURE AND LIFT.  
DRY AIR IN THE LOW LEVELS SHOULD HOLD OFF THE ONSET OF PRECIPITATION 
SO KEPT THE BEST CHANCES IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS.  BEST CHANCES WILL 
BE IN THE NORTH...WHERE BEST MOISTURE LINGERS WITH THE FRONT.  ALSO 
SOME INSTABILITY EXPECTED...WILL KEEP THUNDER IN THE AFTERNOON.  
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A LITTLE COOLER TOMORROW WITH INCREASED 
CLOUDS...STAYED NEAR THE BLEND NUMBERS.  DEW POINTS AND RELATIVE 
HUMIDITIES SHOULD BE A LITTLE HIGHER TOMORROW WHICH SHOULD HELP WITH 
THE FIRE DANGER.

.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH TUE)...WEAK FRONT WILL LINGER OVER 
THE REGION THROUGH SATURDAY...BUT EXACTLY WHERE IT WILL BE AT ANY 
GIVEN TIME IS STILL UNCERTAIN.  APPEARS IT WILL HAVE A HARD TIME 
MAKING IT VERY FAR SOUTH INTO OUR AREA AT LEAST INITIALLY...AND 
APPEARS BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP WILL BE IN THE NORTH WED NIGHT THROUGH 
THU NIGHT.  GFS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH PRECIP...BUT THINK THE NAM LOOKS 
MORE REALISTIC THROUGH THU NIGHT...SO WILL GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAV 
POPS FOR THOSE PERIODS.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH AND CHANCE ELSEWHERE SATURDAY.  BY 
SUNDAY...RIDGING ALOFT AND HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FROM THE 
NORTHEAST AND EAST SHOULD DRY THINGS OUT SOMEWHAT...SO WILL KEEP 
SUNDAY DRY. DRY WEATHER SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT MON APR 30 2007

.SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STILL UNDER NW FLOW ALOFT...BUT A 
VERY DRY AIRMASS WITH RIDGE BUILDING EASTWARD. CLEAR SKIES ABOUND 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WITH TIME HEIGHT SECTIONS SHOWING NOT 
HARDLY ANY MOISTURE INCREASE AT ALL UNTIL WELL AFTER 12Z TUESDAY.

THUS...ONLY A TEMPERATURE FORECAST AS TO HOW WARM TO GO FOR MAX 
TEMPS TODAY. WENT VERY CLOSE TO GFS MOS NUMBERS...EXCEPT FOR CHA 
WHERE THE SLIGHTLY HIGHER BLEND WAS CHOSEN (ALTHOUGH NOT NEAR 
FWC MOS OF 91 DEGS). CLEAR SKIES AND VERY LIGHT WINDS TONIGHT
WITH DRY AIRMASS FAVORED THE COOLER GFS MIN TEMPS...WHICH ALSO
SEEMED A BETTER CHOICE GIVEN MIN TEMP PATTERN OF PAST FEW NIGHTS.

NOTICED THAT AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES FELL A BIT BELOW MOS VALUES ON 
SUNDAY...SO KEPT THE PREVIOUS GRID LOOK OF LOWER THAN MOS DEW POINT 
TEMPS FOR TODAY. LOWEST AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES MAY HOVER EITHER SIDE 
OF 25 PERCENT...BUT DONT EXPECT MUCH SUSTAINED WIND SPEEDS. RECENT 
RAINS ALSO INDICATE NO SIGNIFICANT FIRE DANGER THREAT FOR NOW.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE HOLDS ON
TUESDAY WITH VERY WARM TEMPERATURES. CHANGES OCCUR BY WEDNESDAY AS
MODELS BRING A COLD FRONT FROM THE NORTHEAST INTO THE AREA WITH
INCREASED MOISTURE AT ALL LEVELS. SOME OF THE MOISTURE WILL COME
FROM WEAK UPPER LOW MOVING INTO THE MS VALLEY. AS DEW POINTS
INCREASE AND WITH WARM DAYTIME TEMPERATURES THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE
POSSIBLE. THE NAM SHOWS MODERATE INSTABILITY WITH HIGH WET BULB
ZERO HEIGHTS AND RELATIVELY LIGHT WINDS ALOFT. THE GFS IS MORE
UNSTABLE WITH HIGHER LIS TO -7 AND CAPES ABOVE 2000 J/KG BUT
SIMILAR WITH WINDS ALOFT AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS. PRECIPITABLE
WATER VALUES RISE TO AROUND 1.0 TO 1.5 INCHES SO SOME STORMS COULD
PRODUCE HEAVY RAIN. AFTER WEDNESDAY NAM/DGEX KEEPS FRONT JUST TO
THE SOUTH WITH DRIER AIR MOVING IN FROM HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTH.
NAM/DGEX KEEPS UPPER LOW WEAKER AND TO THE WEST WITH RIDGING
STRENGTHENING BY THE WEEKEND. WILL COMPROMISE AND HAVE ONLY SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS THURSDAY BUT WITH THE UNCERTAINTY OF THE UPPER LOW AND
WHERE IT GOES HAVE POPS THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

LINGERING PATCHY LOW TO MID CLOUDS SHOULD BE GONE BY DAYBREAK...THEN 
LOOK FOR JUST FEW CUMULUS CLOUDS IN THE SOUTH...AND FEW TO SCATTERED 
CUMULUS CLOUDS NRN AREAS. PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TO REACH NEAR THE GFS 
MOS MAX TEMPS...WHICH WERE JUST ABOUT RIGHT ON FOR SATURDAY HIGHS.

KMRX VAD WIND PROFILE (VWP) SHOWS BRISK WEST WINDS OF 25 TO 35 KNOTS 
ABOVE THE SURFACE...THUS CARRIED LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR FOR TAF SITES 
THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...SURFACE WINDS SHOULD NOT EXCEED 5 TO 15 MPH 
LATER TODAY AS RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST. MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT 
AND MOS MINS QUITE CLOSE AND ACCEPTED...WITH WINDS BECOMING LIGHT 
AND VARIABLE OVERNIGHT.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...RIDGING AT THE SURFACE AND 
ALOFT KEEPS FORECAST AREA DRY AND WARM THROUGH TUESDAY. FORECASTING 
HIGHS IN THE 80S ALMOST ALL LOW ELEVATION SITES. MOISTURE MOVING 
AROUND THE RIDGE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES DOWN IN TO THE 
MID ATLANTIC MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WHILE A WEAK CLOSED UPPER LOW 
MOVES INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH INTO 
THE OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY AND MOISTURE WILL GET CAUGHT UP WITH IT FROM 
THE UPPER LOW. THE FORECAST AREA WILL HAVE INCREASED WARM SOUTHWEST 
WINDS AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO THE MID AND 
POSSIBLY UPPER 80S. FOR THE WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY PERIOD COLD 
FRONT MOVES ACROSS AREA WEDNESDAY AS UPPER LOW MOVES TOWARD LOWER MS 
VALLEY. THE AIRMASS BECOMES QUITE UNSTABLE SO SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT. THE NE TN/SW VA AREA 
MAY DRY OUT AS THE FRONT MOVES SOUTH BUT MOISTURE WITH THE UPPER LOW 
WILL BRING MORE MOISTURE IN THURSDAY. THE FRONT LOOKS LIKE IT COULD 
BECOME STATIONARY TO THE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY. 
HOWEVER ANOTHER UPPER LOW BEHIND THE FIRST ONE MOVES INTO THE MS 
VALLEY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. WITH THIS SCENARIO WILL KEEP THE CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS GOING THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  82  53  84  56  86 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    77  50  82  57  85 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            79  50  83  56  85 /   0   0   0  10  10
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   74  45  81  52  83 /   0   0   0  10  10
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
408 AM EDT SUN APR 29 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHOWERS ON BACKSIDE OF DEPARTING 
TROUGH HAD DISSIPATED OR MOVED SE OUT OF THE REGION THIS MORNING. 
ALTHO THE SHOWERS WERE QUITE SPOTTY...THE ASSOCIATED CLOUDS AND 
LIGHT WESTERLY SURFACE WINDS HAD LIMITED MUCH FOG DEVELOPMENT. KEPT 
IN PATCHY EARLY MORNING FOG...JUST NEAR AREA BODIES OF WATER IN ANY 
SECTIONS THAT MEASURED SOME LIGHT QPF IN THE PAST 24 HOURS.

LINGERING PATCHY LOW TO MID CLOUDS SHOULD BE GONE BY DAYBREAK...THEN 
LOOK FOR JUST FEW CUMULUS CLOUDS IN THE SOUTH...AND FEW TO SCATTERED 
CUMULUS CLOUDS NRN AREAS. PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TO REACH NEAR THE GFS 
MOS MAX TEMPS...WHICH WERE JUST ABOUT RIGHT ON FOR SATURDAY HIGHS.

KMRX VAD WIND PROFILE (VWP) SHOWS BRISK WEST WINDS OF 25 TO 35 KNOTS 
ABOVE THE SURFACE...THUS CARRIED LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR FOR TAF SITES 
THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...SURFACE WINDS SHOULD NOT EXCEED 5 TO 15 MPH 
LATER TODAY AS RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST. MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT 
AND MOS MINS QUITE CLOSE AND ACCEPTED...WITH WINDS BECOMING LIGHT 
AND VARIABLE OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...RIDGING AT THE SURFACE AND
ALOFT KEEPS FORECAST AREA DRY AND WARM THROUGH TUESDAY. FORECASTING

TN/SW VA AREA MAY DRY OUT AS THE FRONT MOVES SOUTH BUT MOISTURE
WITH THE UPPER LOW WILL BRING MORE MOISTURE IN THURSDAY. THE FRONT
LOOKS LIKE IT COULD BECOME STATIONARY TO THE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST
AREA THURSDAY. HOWEVER ANOTHER UPPER LOW BEHIND THE FIRST ONE MOVES
INTO THE MS VALLEY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. WITH THIS SCENARIO WILL
KEEP THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS GOING THROUGH THE END
OF THE FORECAST.

PATCHY FOG PSBL...MAINLY ACROSS THE N 2/3 OF MRX CWA. SUN-MON NGT
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST. DRY CONDITIONS WITH A MILD
WARMING TREND. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE LINGERS ACROSS 
THE REGION BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY.  A WEAK FRONT PUSHES 
INTO THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  MOISTURE LIMITED SO WILL KEEP ONLY 20 
POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  FRONT LINGERS ACROSS THE 
REGION ON THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY ALONG WITH BETTER MOISTURE ALONG 
WITH SOME INSTABILITY...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY.  BEST CHANCES SHOULD BE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
HOURS.  STAYED NEAR MAV/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 281344
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 AM EDT SAT APR 28 2007

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED POPS TODAY TO HANDLE LARGER AREAL COVERAGE
OF MOSTLY LIGHT PCPN. TEMPS AND WIND ON TRACK. SON
 
PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...INTERESTING THAT 24 HOURS LATER 
(28/00Z) MODELS HAVE SHIFTED INITIAL WEAK CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION 
(PCPN) MUCH FURTHER NORTH...WHICH WOULD NOT SUPPORT PCPN SPREADING 
INTO SRN ZONES AT ALL THIS MORNING. LATEST SATELLITE PICS AND RADAR 
SHOW WEAK RETURNS OVER SRN TIP OF IL INTO WRN KY MOVING ESE...AND 
ASSOCIATED WITH VORT MAX WHICH MODELS MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
LATER TODAY. HOWEVER... SINCE DEPTH OF MOISTURE IS NOT VERY 
IMPRESSIVE...AND JUST MARGINAL INSTABILITY...DECIDED TO KEEP POPS AT 
40 PERCENT OR LESS. ALSO... REMOVED THE HIGHER POPS ACROSS SRN ZONES 
AND WENT CLOSER TO NEW MOS POPS WHICH ARE BELOW 30 PERCENT FOR CHA 
AND RHP.

WONT TOTALLY RULE OUT THUNDER...WITH DAYTIME HEATING AND COOLING 
MID LEVEL TEMPS...SO KEPT IN SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER WORDING FOR 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. FAVORED GFS MOS MAX TEMPS GIVEN 
PERFORMANCE ON FRIDAY HIGHS. DECREASED SKY COVER A BIT TONIGHT AND 
WENT WITH GFS MOS FOR MINS...ALTHO MIN TEMP GUIDANCE NUMBERS WERE 
ALL QUITE CLOSE AND ACCEPTABLE. 

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING SETTLES 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND BRINGS A QUICK WARMING TREND FOR 
SUNDAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK. FOLLOWED THE 
WARMER MET GUIDANCE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT EXCEPT FOR TRI CITIES 
WHICH IS USUALLY THE COOLEST SPOT IN THE NORTHEAST ON CALM NIGHTS. A 
SYSTEM MOVING AROUND THE RIDGE MAY BRING A FEW CLOUDS TO THE 
NORTHEAST SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY OTHERWISE NO WEATHER 
CONCERNS UNTIL WEDNESDAY. MONDAY AND TUESDAY AND POSSIBLY WEDNESDAY 
SHOULD BE EVEN WARMER IN THE UPPER 70S TO MID 80S AS HEIGHTS RISE 
EVEN MORE WITH RIDGE IN PLACE. WEDNESDAY A COLD FRONT DROPS SOUTH 
OUT OF THE OHIO VALLEY COMBINES WITH MOISTURE ROTATING AROUND A WEAK 
UPPER LOW MOVING WEST FROM THE LOWER MS VALLEY. THIS WILL BRING A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR WEDNESDAY. THE FRONT 
SHOWS LITTLE MOVEMENT INIATIALLY THEN MAY WASH OUT AS UPPER LOW 
DRIFTS EAST. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  74  51  80  52  83 /  30  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    71  50  77  52  82 /  30  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN            71  48  77  52  83 /  30  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   69  47  74  43  79 /  30  10   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT FRI APR 27 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...BROAD LOW PRESSURE 
TROUGH OVER NE QUAD OF U.S. H85 TROUGH WITH COOLER TEMPS WILL MOVE 
SE THROUGH MRX CWA TNGT. STRATOCU DECK WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS 
THE AREA IN ADVANCE OF THIS TROUGH. ISOLATED SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE 
...MAINLY ACROSS NE AREAS TONIGHT. TEMPS WILL BE COOLER BUT 
MODERATED BY CLOUDS. MID/UPR LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL DIG SE INTO MID 
TN SAT MORNING AND THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPS ON SAT EVE. THIS WILL 
PHASE WITH ANOTHER H85 COOL TROUGH TROUGH FM THE NW. SCT SHWRS ON 
TAP IN ADVANCE OF THESE FEATURES WITH ISOLD TSTMS PSBL DUE TO AFTN 
LAPSE RATES. SUN AND SUN NGT SFC HIGH BUILDS IN SLIGHTLY FROM THE SW 
WITH CONTINUED NW FLOW ALOFT. TEMPS NEAR NORMAL.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER RIDGE TRACKS THROUGH 
THE REGION ON MONDAY BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.
A WEAK FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  MOISTURE LIMITED SO 
WILL KEEP ONLY 20 POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  FRONT 
LINGERS ACROSS THE REGION ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY ALONG WITH BETTER 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS 
DURING PEAK INSTABILITY.  STAYED NEAR MAV/HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 271446
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1040 AM EDT FRI APR 27 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. WEAK LOW LEVEL
TROF NW OF AREA WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA THIS EVENING AND THROUGH THE 
AREA TONIGHT. STRATOCU DECK WILL REMAIN FAIRLY SOLID. SOME BREAKS IN 
CLOUDS AIDED BY OFF PLATEAU DOWNSLOPING WILL ALLOW FOR TEMPS TO RISE 
TO FCST MAXS. ISOLATED SHOWERS REMAIN POSSIBLE ACROSS NE PART OF MRX 
CWA TDY. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN AREA OF MOSTLY LIGHT RAIN 
SHOWERS SHOULD END ACROSS EASTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE 
DAYBREAK...WITH FORECAST GRIDS FRESHENED FOR THIS DECREASE IN POPS 
EARLY THIS MORNING. ALSO LOWERED POPS FOR THIS MORNING...AND KEPT 
JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS ALL BUT SE 
TN AREAS. COLD FRONT THROUGH MUCH OF THE PLATEAU AND SEQUATCHIE 
VALLEY WILL MOVE EAST OF THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON.

SOME LINGERING MOISTURE AND DAYTIME HEATING JUSTIFIED KEEPING LOW 
POPS (SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS) IN GRIDS INTO THE EVENING HOURS... 
THEN WENT DRY LATER TONIGHT. WILL NEED TO WATCH FOR TIMING OF WEAK 
IMPULSES LATE TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...BUT A BREAK IN ANY WIDESPREAD 
OR MEASURABLE RAINS LOOKED GOOD.

OTHERWISE...CURRENT TEMPS WERE GENERALLY MILD AND SEVERAL DEGREES 
ABOVE THE NAM-WRF MOS...SO I FAVORED HIGHER MOS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY 
WHERE ANY SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED. A MOS BLEND OR HIGHER MINS 
FAVORED TONIGHT DUE TO AMOUNT OF CLOUDINESS.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK SYSTEM MOVING 
SOUTHEAST IN NORTHWEST FLOW DEEPENS TROUGH OVER EASTERN US AND 
REINFORCES COOLER WEATHER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY. MODELS 
TRENDING WETTER ON POPS SO RAISED THEM MORE IN LINE WITH NAM CHANCE 
POPS. HIGHS SATURDAY SHOULD BE ABOUT THE SAME AS TODAY WITH 
CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS AND WEST WINDS. AFTER SATURDAY SYSTEM MOVES 
THROUGH SKIES WILL CLEAR AS RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHEAST. 
WARMING TREND AND DRY SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. RIDGE BEGINS TO BREAK 
DOWN AROUND MID WEEK AS SYSTEM DEVELOPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
AND FRONT DROPS SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. GOOD CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  70  52  70  50  78 /  10  10  40  20   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    69  50  70  50  76 /  20  20  40  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            69  50  70  49  76 /  20  20  40  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   69  48  67  45  73 /  30  20  30  20  10

SEQUATCHIE VALLEY WILL MOVE EAST OF THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON.

THEN WENT DRY LATER TONIGHT. WILL NEED TO WATCH FOR TIMING OF WEAK

OR MEASURABLE RAINS LOOKED GOOD.

ABOVE THE NAM-WRF MOS...SO I FAVORED HIGHER MOS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY 
WHERE ANY SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED. A MOS BLEND OR HIGHER MINS

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK SYSTEM MOVING
SOUTHEAST IN NORTHWEST FLOW DEEPENS TROUGH OVER EASTERN US AND
REINFORCES COOLER WEATHER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY. MODELS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT THU APR 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...FROM ALL ACCOUNTS AND FROM 
INITIALIZATION...GFS IS THE MODEL OF CHOICE, THOUGH IN MANY RESPECTS 
NAM IS SIMILAR. TIMING OF FRONTAL PASSAGE BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z 
TONIGHT LOOKS GOOD. FRONT APPEARS TO LIE OVER CENTRAL KY, ACROSS 
MIDDLE TN, INTO NORTHERN AL WITH PRESSURE FALLING AHEAD AND 
DEWPOINTS FALLING BEHIND. BAND OF RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH CONVERGENCE 
AROUND PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH HAS MOVED FASTER THAN EXPECTED AND BECOME 
MORE SPOTTY. SOME PLACES RECEIVED HEAVY RAIN FOR EXTENDED PERIODS 
BUT SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU NEEDED 
THAT AND COULD SOAK IT UP. OTHERWISE ITS BEEN NICE SOAKER, MUCH 
NEEDED.

HAVE LOWERED POPS TONIGHT AS DRY SLOT IN WV IMAGERY MOVES OVER AREA 
AND FRONT MOVES OUT. HAVE ALSO DROPPED TEMPS A HAIR TONIGHT AS 
CLOUDS THIN A LITTLE. ADJUSTED WINDS TO ACCOUNT FOR FRONTAL PASSAGE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW LIFTING OUT 
OF AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT WITH DECREASING MOISTURE BEHIND IT.  WILL 
CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR EVENING HOURS AND DRY AFTER MIDNIGHT.  
MODELS BRING A SHORTWAVE INTO THE REGION ON SATURDAY.  WILL KEEP 
CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY WITH HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE SOUTH WHERE 
BEST MOISTURE TRACKS.  MOISTURE DECREASING BY SATURDAY NIGHT AS 
SHORTWAVE TRACKS TO THE EAST...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR THE EVENING 
HOURS THEN DRY AFTER MIDNIGHT.  RIDGE BUILDS IN ON SUNDAY BRINGING 
DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE 
APPROACHES THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON 
TIMING WILL KEEP ONLY 20 POPS FOR WEDNESDAY.  STATIONARY FRONT 
LINGERS INTO THURSDAY...WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL 
KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY.  STAYED NEAR MAV/HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES....

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
232 AM EDT THU APR 26 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHOWERS WITH SOME OCCASIONAL 
EMBEDDED THUNDER OVER CENTRAL TN IS MOVING NORTHWARD WITH THE 
OVERALL LINE HAVING A VERY SLOW PROGRESSION TO THE EAST.  EXPECT 
THIS CONVECTION TO REACH INTO THE MRX CWA AROUND SUN UP...SLOWLY 
SPREADING EAST ACROSS THE AREA DURING THE MORNING HOURS.  FRONT 
REMAINS WELL WEST OVER CENTRAL MO AT THIS TIME AND SHOULD SEE 
ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT...WHICH WILL MOVE THROUGH OUR AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON.  AS A RESULT...BASICALLY ALL LOCATIONS HAVE A VERY 
GOOD CHANCE OF MEASURABLE PRECIP AND HAVE THEREFORE INCREASED POPS 
TO 100 PERCENT TODAY.  OUR AIR MASS WILL DESTABILIZE THIS AFTERNOON 
WITH LI/S OF -3 TO -5...AREAS OF CAPE NEAR 1000 AND DECENT 
SHEAR...THERE WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR STRONG TO SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS LATE MORNING AND AFTERNOON.  ADDITIONALLY...WILL SEE 
WINDS INCREASE ACROSS THE REGION WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE... 
PROVIDING LOCALLY BREEZY CONDITIONS.  PRECIP WILL DIMINISH FROM WEST 
TO EAST OVERNIGHT AS THE FRONT PULLS AWAY FROM THE AREA.  STAYING 
CLOSE TO MODEL GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD 
LINGER OVER THE AREA FRIDAY AS UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH PULLS 
NORTHEAST.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH AND CENTRAL...AS 
THERE MAY BE ENOUGH MOISTURE AND LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY FOR SOME 
SHOWERS.  NAM AND GFS DISAGREE ON HANDLING OF WAVE DROPPING THROUGH 
THE PLAINS.  NAM SOLUTION LOOKS SUSPECT...SO WILL LEAN TOWARD GFS 
IDEA OF BRINGING IT OVER US SATURDAY.  WILL INCREASE POPS FOR SAT TO 
CHANCE SOUTH AND CENTRAL...AND LINGER SLIGHT CHANCE INTO SAT NIGHT 
WITH THIS FEATURE.  A BUILDING UPPER RIDGE AND HIGH PRESSURE AT THE 
SURFACE SHOULD PROVIDE DRY CONDITIONS WITH A WARMING TREND FOR 
SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...WILL KEEP  SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR 
WEDNESDAY AS IN CURRENT FORECAST.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 260103
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT WED APR 25 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
OZARKS REGION...WITH A WARM FRONT EXTENDING FROM WEST-TO-EAST ACROSS 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. REGIONAL RADARS REVEAL SCATTERED CONVECTION 
AHEAD OF A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH OVER MISSISSIPPI...BUT NO ECHOES 
ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. MODELS INDICATE THAT 
CONVECTION WILL BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE 
TN RIVER VALLEY LATER THIS EVENING...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
MOVES ACROSS THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS CONVECTION SHOULD 
APPROACH THE SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATE TONIGHT TOWARDS 
SUNRISE...AND THEN CONTINUE MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA ON THURSDAY. BOTH THE WRF AND GFS MODELS INDICATE FAIRLY STEEP 
LOW-LEVEL (0-1 KM) LAPSE RATES ALONG WITH STRONG LOW-LEVEL HELICITY 
VALUES OVER EAST TN DURING THE MORNING HOURS ON THURSDAY. AS A 
RESULT...THINK THAT A FEW ISOLATED TORNADOES MAY BE POSSIBLE LATE 
TONIGHT ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN...AND ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
ON THURSDAY. IN ADDITION...BOTH MODELS REVEAL THE DEVELOPMENT OF A 
FAIRLY STRONG 850 MB JET (AROUND 50 KTS) BY LATE TONIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY...ALONG WITH LOW WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS AND STRONG 700-500 
MB WINDS. WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND... THINK THERE WILL BE A GOOD 
CHANCE FOR SEVERE TSTORMS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY...AND HAVE UPDATED THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION 
THESE POSSIBILITIES.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL UPDATE TO BE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH CLOUD COVER.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

300 PM EDT WED APR 25 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...LOW LEVEL RIDGE CONTINUES TO 
SPAN ACROSS THE EAST PART OF MRX CWA. 850-700 MB LAYER REMAINS VERY 
DRY. THIS DRY AIR MIXED DOWN THIS AFTERNOON ALLOWING TEMPS TO CLIMB 
NICELY WITH VERY LOW DPS ALONG AND EAST OF THE TN/NC STATE LINE. THE 
PRESSURE GRADIENT IS TIGHTENING ACROSS THE AREA AS PRESSURE FALLS 
ALONG A WARM FRONT ORV THE OH RV CLY AND LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM BEGINS 
MOVING NE INTO UPR MS RV CLY TONIGHT. BREEZY SW WINDS WILL DECOUPLE 
SOME OVERNIGHT AS LOW LEVEL COOLING INVERSION SETS UP. MIN TEMPS WILL 
REMAIN WARM AND SIMILAR TO WED MORN. GFS MODEL APPEARS TOO 
AGGRESSIVE WITH PCP CLUSTER MAINTAINING STRENGTH AND MOVING NE INTO 
AREA EARLY THU. PREFER A SOLUTION CLOSER TO THE WRF WHICH KEEPS BULK 
OF CONVECTION CLOSER TO FRONTAL ZONE WHICH WEAKLY MOVES ACROSS 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THU AFTN. THERE IS A SLIGHT RISK FOR SV TSTMS AS 
AIRMASS WILL BECOME LOW-MODERATELY UNSTABLE PRIOR TO ONSET OF 
CONVECTION. LAYER SPEED SHEAR ALSO MODERATELY STRONG. 
 
.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE 
LINGERS BEHIND FRONT AS UPPER LOW TRACKS NORTH OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. CONTINUED LOW POPS THROUGH SATURDAY TO ACCOUNT 
FOR THIS WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE FIELD. REMAINDER OF LONG TERM PERIOD 
APPEARS DRY AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS BACK INTO THE REGION. TEMPS SHOULD 
MODERATE TO ABOVE CLIMO BY EARLY NEXT WEEK AS THIS PROCESS EVOLVES. 
INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NEXT TUESDAY AS BOTH GFS AND 
ENSEMBLES PROJECT INCREASING MOISTURE INTO THE AREA AS NEXT SYSTEM 
APPROACHES. GENERALLY DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PREVIOUS 
GRIDS/FORECAST PACKAGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

1010 AM EDT WED APR 25 2007

.DISCUSSION...MINOR CHANGE TO TODAYS FORECAST. REDUCED CLOUD COVER
FOR THIS AFTERNOON. BUMPED TEMPS AND WIND UP SLIGHTLY TO ALLOW FOR
FOR SUN. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONFIDENCE IS QUITE LOW FOR SHORT 
TERM.  SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH TO OUR NORTH MAY BRING A FEW 
SHOWERS OVER NORTHERN AREAS TODAY...BUT MAIN PRECIP THREAT REMAINS 
WELL NORTH OF THE AREA.  MAIN CONCERN IS THAT MODELS REMAIN IN POOR 
AGREEMENT IN TIMING OF INCOMING FRONT WITH GFS SEVERAL HOURS FASTER 
THAN NAM.  CURRENT LINE OF CONVECTION IS JUST WEST OF TN/S WESTERN 
BORDER.  MAY SEE SOME CONVECTION FROM THIS FEATURE REACH INTO THE 
MRX CWA THIS AFTERNOON AND WILL HAVE SOME LOW POPS TO COVER.  THIS 
LINE WILL NEED TO BE MONITORED AND POPS MAY NEED TO BE INCREASED IF 
LINE MOVES IN FASTER AND HOLDS TOGETHER LONGER THAN ANTICIPATED.  
MAIN FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP COULD PUSH INTO THE 
REGION POSSIBLY AS EARLY AS OVERNIGHT AND HAVE INCREASE POPS TO 
CHANCE CATEGORY FOR THIS.   GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK GOOD AND STAYED 
CLOSE.

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS HAVE BEEN 
INCONSISTENT ON TIMING OF MAIN BAND OF PREFRONTAL PRECIP FOR 
THURSDAY.  PREVIOUS TREND OF SLOWING IT DOWN HAS BEEN REVERSED...AND 
CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ON TIMING. THINK A COMPROMISE BETWEEN FASTER GFS 
AND SLOWER NAM LOOKS REASONABLE...AND STILL LOOKS LIKE SEVERE 
WEATHER WILL BE A POSSIBILITY.  AFTER CATEGORICAL POPS THU...WILL GO 
LIKELY NORTHEAST AND CHANCE ELSEWHERE THU NIGHT...THEN WITH UPPER 
TROUGH STILL OVER THE AREA WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH TO CHANCE 
NORTH POPS FOR FRIDAY.  ANOTHER WEAK WAVE MAY AFFECT THE AREA 
SATURDAY...SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING...THEN DRY SUNDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 241922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT TUE APR 24 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SCATTERED SHOWERS AND A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE MOVED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. A 
FEW AREAS HAD BETTER COVERAGE ALONG THE TN/KY BORDER AND ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TN. AIRMASS HAS BECOME UNSTABLE WITH DEWPOINTS RISING INTO 
THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S AND TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 70S. A 
DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WAS BRINGING A 
STRONG SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FLOW OF MOISTURE INTO THE MS AND TN 
VALLEYS TOWARD A WARM FRONT ACROSS KY. THINK THE MORE CONCENTRATED 
AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE ALONG THE NORTHERN TN 
BORDER AND INTO SW VA DURING THE EVENING AND THEN DECREASE 
OVERNIGHT. THE COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE EAST DURING THE NEXT 24 
HOURS AND ONLY REACH AR AND WESTERN LA BY EARLY WEDNESDAY EVENING. 
SHOULD BE LOWER CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY WITH 
THE BEST CHANCES EXTREME NORTH. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ON THE WARM 
SIDE PROBABLY WARMER THAN TODAY. I GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE WARMER MAV 
GUIDANCE FOR WEDNESDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S.   

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT THE FORECAST AREA WILL REMAIN DRY WEDNESDAY NIGHT... 
AS A WARM FRONT REMAINS ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM STRENGTHENS OVER THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. 
HOWEVER...WILL PLAN TO KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR TWO IN 
THE WEDNESDAY NIGHT FORECAST...SINCE THERE MAY BE SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY LINGERING OVER THE AREA. BOTH THE WRF AND GFS MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE STRONG LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM ON THURSDAY...WITH CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY BEGINNING TO 
AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA AROUND NOON. MARGINAL INSTABILITY...ALONG 
WITH A STRONG LOW-LEVEL JET AROUND 50 KT...SHOULD COMBINE TO PRODUCE 
THE POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE TSTORMS. THIS INITIAL CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY 
APPEARS TO DEVELOP ALONG A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH...WITH THE ACTUAL COLD 
FRONT REMAINING WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL LATER THURSDAY 
NIGHT. IN FACT...WRF MODEL INDICATES CONVECTIVE REDEVELOPMENT AGAIN 
ON THURSDAY NIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT ALONG THE COLD FRONT. THUS...WILL 
KEEP POPS HIGH IN THE FORECAST THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. A BROAD 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO CONTINUE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
THROUGH SATURDAY...SO WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SOME 
LINGERING SHOWERS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD SETTLE OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD... 
WITH DRY WEATHER AND SLIGHTLY ABOVE-NORMAL TEMPS EXPECTED AS AN 
UPPER RIDGE ALSO BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD AND 
WILL NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM THEM.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.DISCUSSION...AREA OF SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS MOVING FROM 
MIDDLE TN INTO SE BRINGING MUCH NEEDED RAINFALL TO THIS AREA AS 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVES EAST THIS MORNING. SATELLITE SHOWING THIS 
AREA IS EXPANDING AS IT MOVES EAST. LATEST RUC MODEL SHOWS SHORTWAVE 
ENERGY WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS SOUTHERN TN TODAY AND THEN SOUTHEAST 
INTO NW GA TONIGHT.  WILL BRING POPS UP TO LIKELY FOR KNOXVILLE 
SOUTH AS THE ACTIVITY MOVES IN. ANOTHER SMALL AREA IN SOUTHWEST VA 
MAY CONTINUE TO HAVE SHOWERS ALL DAY TOO AS SHORTWAVE ENERGY TRACKS 
ACROSS IT...SO RAISING POPS THERE TO LIKELY. THERE HAS BEEN SOME 
EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS THIS MORNING SO WILL KEEP THE CHANCE IN FOR 
THEM. HIGH TEMPERATURE FORECAST LOOKS GOOD EVEN WITH MILD MORNING 
TEMPERATURES AS CLOUD COVER SHOULD BE EXTENSIVE ALL DAY LIMITING 
TEMPERATURE RISES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 AM EDT TUE APR 24 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK FRONT NEAR THE OHIO RIVER  
SHOULD NOT MAKE IT MUCH FURTHER SOUTH BEFORE BECOMING STATIONARY 
TODAY.  MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT THAT SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION IN THE SHORT TERM.  FORCING NOT 
IMPRESSIVE...BUT DECENT MOISTURE AND WEAK FORCING SHOULD BE ENOUGH 
TO GO WITH POPS IN THE MID CHANCE TO LOW LIKELY RANGE TODAY...AND 
CHANCE TONIGHT.  APPEARS THERE WILL BE SOME LIMITED INSTABILITY...SO 
WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER. MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE 
OVERALL TODAY AND TONIGHT.        

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...TUESDAY/S SHORT WAVE WILL BE 
MOVING AWAY FROM THE AREA WITH A LOW APPROACHING FROM THE WEST...SO 
WILL LEAVE SOME LOW POPS WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL REACH INTO THE AREA THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT.  
MODELS SHOWING SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES WITH TIMING OF SYSTEM...WITH 
GFS A GOOD 6 HOURS FASTER THAN THE NAM.  WHILE CONFIDENCE IS LOW... 
WILL SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE AND TREND TIMING TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING WITH LIKELY POPS.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO FRIDAY AND 
WILL KEEP SOME LOW POPS FOR THE PERIOD.  A WEAK WAVE MOVES THROUGH 
TO OUR SOUTH ON SUNDAY...AND WILL INTRODUCE A LOW POP FAR SOUTHERN 
ZONES TO COVER.  STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT EXTENDED.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT MON APR 23 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO SINK TO 
THE SOUTH ALLOWING A COLD FRONT TO APPROACH THE MID MS VALLEY THIS 
AFTERNOON. THE LEADING EDGE OF HIGHER DEW POINTS...LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE IN THE FORM OF A WEAK SHORTWAVE WAS MOVING SLOWLY EAST 
ACROSS CENTRAL KY AND WESTERN TN WITH A FEW SHOWERS WEST OF 
NASHVILLE. SKIES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA HAVE BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY 
WITH TEMPERATURES REACHING THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S. MOISTURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO INCREASE TONIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY. STILL LOOKS LIKE A FEW SHOWERS MAY REACH THE SOUTHWEST 
SECTIONS BEFORE MORNING AS LIFT INCREASES LATE TONIGHT AS A 
SHORTWAVE APPROACHES. AIRMASS STILL LOOKS MARGINAL FOR CONVECTION 
BUT WITH THE POSSIBILITY FOR ELEVATED CONVECTION...WILL INCLUDE 
ISOLATED THUNDER TONIGHT. MODELS BRING MORE SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVE 
EAST ACROSS TN TUESDAY SO RAISED POPS A LITTLE MORE SOUTHWEST AND 
WEST AND WITH INSTABILITY AXIS FAR TO THE WEST ONLY HAVE SLIGHT 
CHANCE THUNDER. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH MOVING A WARM FRONT NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA INTO 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY NIGHT...AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
STRENGTHENS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND CREATES A STRONG SOUTHERLY 
WIND FLOW OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. WITH SOME MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY EXPECTED OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WILL PLAN TO KEEP A 
CHANCE FOR SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. 
BOTH THE WRF AND GFS MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE EASTWARD 
PROGRESSION OF THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS... 
AND NOW DELAY THE ONSET OF ITS ASSOCIATED PRECIP FOR THE FORECAST 
AREA UNTIL LATER IN THE DAY ON THURSDAY. ON FRIDAY...A BROAD UPPER 
TROUGH WILL COMBINE WITH SOME WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE TO PRODUCE SOME 
LINGERING LIGHT PRECIP. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN INDICATES ANOTHER UPPER 
TROUGH AND CHANCE FOR RAIN ON SATURDAY...BUT WILL IGNORE THIS 
SOLUTION FOR NOW SINCE THIS IS THE FIRST RUN TO SHOW IT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD 
AND WILL NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM THEM. 
&&

WEDNESDAY WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR -SHRA/TSRA IN THE MORNING WITH 
SMALL CHANCE ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATER IN THE DAY DUE TO

VALLEY FRONTAL SYSTEM. RAISED PROBABILITIES TO LIKELY CATEGORY BY 
THURSDAY MORNING AS SYSTEM COLD FRONT BUILDS TOWARD THE FORECAST 
AREA. STAYED WITH A CHANCE OF A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM THURSDAY 
NIGHT AS SLOW MOVING SYSTEM PROGRESSES EAST. USED SLIGHT AND SMALL 
CHANCES FOR A SHOWER ON FRIDAY AS GFS CONTINUES TO HANG ONTO A 
TRAILING VORT DROPPING INTO THE BACK SIDE OF UPPER TROF. HIGHER 
PRESSURE AND A NORTHWEST FLOW LEADS TO A DRY WEEKEND FORECAST.

THE LONG TERM.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...

AGAIN BE CLEAR TONIGHT AND DEWPOINTS WILL BE RISING...BUT A LIGHT

FORMATION. A TROUGH WILL PASS TO THE NORTH ON MONDAY...AND WE MAY 
SEE SOME HIGH CLOUDS ALONG WITH SOME SCATTERED CU...BUT WITH WARM 
MIDLEVEL TEMPS AND WEAK UPPER LEVEL FORCING...NO PRECIP IS EXPECTED 
DURING THE DAY.

OHIO VALLEY WILL COME UP STATIONARY ACROSS KY BY TUESDAY MORNING.

PREVIOUS NIGHTS LOWS. WRF/GFS NOW HAVE MORE LIFT AS SHORTWAVE
ENERGY MOVES THROUGH THE TN VALLEY TUESDAY SO RAISED POPS TO CHANCE
STILL BELOW LIKELY GUIDANCE IN FOR EAST CENTRAL TN. MODELS NOW
FASTER WITH MAIN STORM SYSTEM LATER THIS WEEK WITH GFS 6 TO 12
HOURS QUICKER. BRIEF LULL TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS SYSTEM TO
THE WEST STRENGTHENS RIDGE OVER THE EAST TEMPORARILY. MAY SEE THE
WARMEST TEMPERATURES OF THE WEEK WEDNESDAY. INCREASED POPS MORE WEDNESDAY
NIGHT INTO THURSDAY WITH LIKELY POPS IN CENTRAL SECTIONS. FRONT
MOVES THROUGH SLOWLY THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER WEAK
SHORTWAVE FRIDAY COULD GIVE NORTHERN SECTIONS MORE RAIN. THERE
MAYBE A BRIEF BREAK FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY BUT THEN TROUGH
DEEPENS AHEAD OF MORE SHORTWAVE ACTIVITY MOVING IN FROM THE
NORTHWEST...WITH ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.
RIGHT NOW BEST CHANCE FOR STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE AHEAD OF THE
FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT SAT APR 21 2007

.SHORT TERM...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA WILL BEGIN TO SHIFT TO THE 
EAST TONIGHT. WITH CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS...TEMPS SHOULD DROP
QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET...AND BOTTOM OUT IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S.
WENT A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN MOS FOR LOWS TONIGHT. WITH THE RIDGE
TO OUR EAST TOMORROW...A LIGHT SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS...WHICH
SHOULD WARM TEMPS UP A FEW DEGREES HIGHER THAN TODAY...IN THE 75 TO
80 RANGE ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
UPPER RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES STILL STRONG BUT A WEAK COLD
FRONT MOVES INTO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES AND MS VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT
AND EARLY MONDAY. NOT MUCH AFFECT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
AND VICINITY EXCEPT FOR A FEW HIGH CLOUDS AND A SOUTHWEST FLOW
ALOFT WHICH WILL WARM MINIMUM TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES AND MORE
SIGNIFICANTLY AT THE USUAL EXPOSED LOCATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS.
MONDAY WILL HAVE A LITTLE MORE CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE NORTH AS LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES AHEAD OF FRONT MOVING INTO OHIO VALLEY
WITH THE WESTERN PART NOT MOVING VERY FAR SOUTH. THE MAIN ENERGY
WITH THE SYSTEM TRACKS ACROSS THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO
VALLEY. HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO SUNDAYS EVEN WITH A
FEW MORE CLOUDS AS SOUTHWEST WINDS INCREASE. MONDAY NIGHT SHOULD
SEE MORE VARIABLE CLOUDS AND EVEN WARMER TEMPERATURES WITH
SOUTHWEST FLOW CONTINUING. FRONT MOVES LITTLE AND DO NOT WANT TO
ADD CHANCE OF RAIN AS OF YET ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE A FEW SPRINKLES
NORTH. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WEAK LIFT AND SHORT WAVE ENERGY MAY BE
ENOUGH FOR A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS WARM FRONT WILL BE TO
THE NORTH AND SOUTHERLY TO SOUTHWEST FLOW CONTINUES. NOT TOO
CONFIDENT OF ANYTHING SIGNIFICANT. MAIN SYSTEM MOVES INTO FOUR
CORNERS AREA MONDAY NIGHT. LOW DEEPENS ACROSS SOUTHERN PLAINS
TUESDAY. THE SYSTEM SLOWLY WEAKENS WEDNESDAY AS IT MOVES EAST.
STILL LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY
AHEAD OF FRONT LINGERING INTO FRIDAY. SATURDAY ANOTHER FRONT WILL
HEAD TOWARD TN CONTINUING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS OR THUNDERSTORMS. &&

BEEN BROKEN TODAY...SOME LIGHT FOG FORMATION WILL BE POSSIBLE AND

THAT IT WILL BE WIDESPREAD OR DENSE ENOUGH TO MENTION IN THE ZONE
FORECAST. TEMPS WILL WARM NICELY INTO THE 70S TOMORROW UNDER SUNNY
SKIES AND A BUILDING RIDGE ALOFT.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...TROUGH OVER THE
WESTERN STATES CONTINUES WITH UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST AND
TENNESSEE VALLEY SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. FIRST IMPULSE MOVES
FROM PLAINS STATES INTO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES AND MS VALLEY
SUNDAY. THIS WILL HELP INCREASE SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. AIRMASS WILL STILL BE DRY WITH
TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES WARMER. WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE INTO
THE TN VALLEY AT THE TAIL END OF SYSTEM TO THE NORTH BUT JUST
EXPECT CLOUDINESS RIGHT NOW. THE FRONT MAY MOVE INTO KY AND BRING A
FEW SPRINKLES TO THE NORTHERN SECTIONS BY TUESDAY MORNING. WILL
KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY INTO
WEDNESDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCE IN THE NORTH AND NORTHWEST. HIGH
PRESSURE STAYS STRONG ACROSS SOUTHEAST STATES. THE MAIN SYSTEM AND
TROUGH APPROACH THE MS VALLEY WEDNESDAY AND THEN CROSSES INTO TN
THURSDAY. EXPECT MORE SIGNIFICANT SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM THREAT BY
LATE THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY AS PRE FRONTAL ACTIVITY MOVES IN FIRST
AND THEN THE FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL
REMAIN MILD WITH LOWS WARMING BECAUSE OF CLOUDS BY TUESDAY AND
HIGHS A LITTLE LOWER AT THE END OF THE WEEK FROM PRECIPITATION.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   44  76  47  80  50 /  0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     44  73  46  78  50 /  0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             43  74  45  77  49 /  0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    40  72  40  77  43 /  0   0   0   0   0

1025 AM EDT FRI APR 20 2007

.DISCUSSION...
EARLY MORNING STRATUS OVER NE TN/SW VA HAS LIFTED AND MIXED INTO A
CU FIELD. OBJECTIVE SURFACE ANALYSES SHOW A SURFACE THETA-E RIDGE
REMAINS ACROSS THIS AREA...SO EXPECT THAT MOST OF THE CU TODAY WILL
BE IN THIS AREA. DRY AIR ENTRAINMENT WILL RESULT IN THE CU BECOMING
MORE SCATTERED THROUGH THE DAY. THE REST OF THE AREA MAY SEE
SCATTERED CU BUT CURRENT MOSTLY CLEAR WORDING WILL SUFFICE.
TEMPERATURES ARE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT NEED TO BE CHANGED...SO THE
UPDATE WILL BE ISSUED JUST FOR SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO SKY COVER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT FRI APR 20 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW CLOUDINESS OVER NORTHEASTERN 
PORTION OF THE AREA ASSOCIATED WITH DEPARTING UPPER LOW SHOULD 
DIMINISH...LEAVING MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS ALL ZONES BY THIS 
AFTERNOON.  WITH UPPER RIDGE GRADUALLY BUILDING EAST INTO THE 
REGION...SHOULD BE DRY TONIGHT WITH A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY.  MAV TEMPS 
LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL...SO WILL NOT STRAY MUCH.    

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT 
BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE WEEKEND. UPPER TROF WILL 
MIGRATE NORTHEAST FROM THE PLAINS STATES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO 
THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY SUPPRESSING THE 
RIDGE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. FRONTAL BOUNDARY ASSOCIATED WITH THIS 
SYSTEM WILL DROP SOUTH INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. WITH BOUNDARY 
MOVING TOWARD THE REGION...KEPT SOME SLIGHT AND SMALL CHANCE POPS 
FOR DEVELOPMENT OF A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM WITH HIGHER PROBABILITY 
NEAR THE FRONT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. BY WEDNESDAY NORTHEASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF 
MOVES AWAY AND EYES TURN TO PLAINS STATES UPPER TROF/CLOSED LOW AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM. WITH APPROACH OF UPPER TROF...FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY BUILDS NORTH AS A WARM FRONT. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
-SHRA/TSRA GOING ON WEDNESDAY FOR SMALL POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION IN 
STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF PLAINS SYSTEM. USED HIGHER 
CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY AS UPPER TROF AND COLD FRONT PRESS EAST 
INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. STAYED A LITTLE 
CLOSER TO MAV/MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE FOR THE LONG TERM FORECAST.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 200109
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT THU APR 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE LOW HAS MOVED OFF TO THE SE. UPR TROUGH AXIS 
JUST EXITING AREA TO THE SE. CLOUD COVER HAS CLEARED BUT AREA OF 
STRATOCU WILL MOVE IN FROM THE NW OVERNIGHT. ADJUSTED SOUTHERN DPS 
DOWN A BIT TO FIT CURRENT OBS. MIN TEMPS LOOK GOOD. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE AREA ARE 
DEVELOPING IN A SURFACE THETA-E RIDGE AND CONVERGENCE WITH COOLING 
TEMPS ALOFT AS A CLOSED LOW MOVES OVERHEAD. EXPECT THAT MOST OF 
THESE STORMS WILL REMAIN BELOW SEVERE LIMITS AS SHEAR IS NOT STRONG 
AND INSTABILITY IS WEAK...BUT SOME SMALL HAIL CANNOT BE RULED OUT. 
AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES AWAY...WARMER AND DRIER AIR WILL ADVECT INTO 
THE AREA IN THE MIDLEVELS. RAIN CHANCES WILL DECREASE THROUGH THE 
EVENING...AND EXPECT THAT ALL PRECIP WILL BE GONE BY MIDNIGHT. LOW 
CLOUDS UPSTREAM IN THE OHIO VALLEY WILL LIKELY COVER MUCH OF THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT. DAYTIME MIXING 
SHOULD ERODE THESE CLOUDS BY MID MORNING...LEAVING MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES FOR THE REST OF THE DAY.

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...GFS AND NAM TRY TO 
HOLD ON TO SOME LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AS TROUGH ALONG THE 
EAST COAST EXITS FRIDAY NIGHT. WILL BE CONSERVATIVE ON FORECAST IN 
THE EAST AND KEEP WORDING PARTLY CLOUDY. RIDGING ALOFT WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE THOUGH WILL TAKE CONTROL THIS WEEKEND WITH 
SUNNY SKIES AND WARM TEMPERATURES. TROUGH DIGS IN ACROSS THE WEST 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. LEAD SYSTEM REACHES THE NORTHERN AND 
CENTRAL PLAINS SUNDAY WITH RIDGE STAYING STRONG ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEAST. THE STRONGEST PART OF THE SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE GREAT 
LAKES WITH A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY MONDAY. THE COLD 
FRONT SAGS DOWN INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TUESDAY. THE BEST CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. 
ANOTHER SYSTEM DEVELOPS BEHIND THE FIRST SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE FOUR 
CORNERS TUESDAY AND SOUTHERN PLAINS WEDNESDAY. THE PREVIOUS SYSTEM 
MAY BECOME A WARM FRONT JUST TO THE NORTH AND THEN AS THE NEXT 
SYSTEM APPROACHES LATE THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY THERE WILL BE A MORE 
SIGNIFICANT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. FOLLOWED A NAM/GFS 
BLEND FOR TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
952 AM EDT THU APR 19 2007

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE ANALYSES INDICATE A THETA-E RIDGE FROM THE SAVANNAH RIVER
ACROSS WESTERN NC AND NE TN/SW VA THIS MORNING. WEAK LOW PRESSURE
IS CENTERED OVER THE KY/WV/VA BORDER. VISIBLE SATELLITE INDICATES
CONVECTIVE TOWERS FORMING IN THIS AREA...WITH A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS
SHOWING UP ON RADAR. AS THE CLOSED MIDLEVEL CIRCULATION OVER
SOUTHERN INDIANA MOVE SOUTHEAST...LAPSE RATES WILL INCREASE OVER
OUR NORTHEAST SECTIONS...INCREASING THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. WITH A WEAK WIND PROFILE AND MARGINAL
INSTABILITY...SEVERE WEATHER SEEMS UNLIKELY...BUT SOME SMALL HAIL
WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THE COOL TEMPS ALOFT. WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS
WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS IN THIS AREA. IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY
AREA...MUCH DRIER AIR WITH WARM MIDLEVEL TEMPS WILL PREVENT ANY
SHOWERS FROM DEVELOPING...AND WILL REMOVE THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP
THERE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 AM EDT THU APR 19 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A CLOSED LOW WILL TRACK SOUTH 
ACROSS THE REGION TODAY...MAINLY ACROSS OUR NORTHERN SECTIONS.  
DECENT LIFT AND MOISTURE ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...WILL 
KEEP LIKELY POPS FOR TODAY WITH LOWER POPS TO THE SOUTH WHERE LESSER 
MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  SOME WEAK INSTABILITY IS ALSO EXPECTED...SO 
WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE AFTERNOON 
HOURS.  UPPER LOW TRACKS TO THE EAST TONIGHT...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
FOR THE EVENING HOURS...THEN DRY AFTER MIDNIGHT.  STAYED NEAR MAV 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A STRONG UPPER RIDGE IS 
PROGGED TO BUILD ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH 
MONDAY...BRINGING DRY CONDITIONS AND A WARMING TREND TO THE FORECAST 
AREA. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN CONTINUES TO INDICATE THAT A WEAK COLD 
FRONT WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON 
MONDAY. THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD STALL-OUT OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...BEFORE RETREATING NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT IN ADVANCE OF A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS. WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXPECTED TO BE IN THE 
VICINITY OF THE FORECAST AREA...WILL CONTINUE WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR CONVECTION ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 PM EDT WED APR 18 2007

.DISCUSSION...LIGHT SHOWER ACTIVITY ON THE DECLINE. WILL RESTORE
OVERNIGHT FORECAST TO LOW CHC OF SHOWERS. WEAK COLD FRONT WILL DROP 
SOUTHEAST INTO THE AREA BY DAY BREAK. MIN TEMP FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. 
CHC TSTMS FOR THU N AREAS ON TRACK. SON
 
PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
AREA RADARS SHOW PRECIP FALLING FROM MIDLEVEL CLOUDS...HOWEVER WITH 
DRY LOW LEVELS...SURFACE OBS SHOW LITTLE PRECIP REACHING THE GROUND. 
WILL KEEP A SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE POP IN CENTRAL AND NORTH TO ACCOUNT 
FOR SOME LIGHT SHOWERS...WITH NORTHERN AREAS HAVING THE BEST 
CHANCE...BUT AMOUNTS WILL ONLY BE A FEW HUNDREDTHS AT BEST. 

A CLOSED LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION THIS AFTERNOON WILL TRACK 
SOUTH ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT. THIS SYSTEM BECOMES ELONGATED NW
TO SE...AND CROSSES OUR NORTHERN SECTIONS THURSDAY. POSITIVE
VORTICITY ADVECTION ALONG WITH COOL MIDLEVEL TEMPERATURES WITH THE
LOW WILL CREATE AN AXIS OF LIFT ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN...MAINLY IN
THE AFTERNOON. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS IN THIS AREA. IN THE SOUTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF OUR
AREA...MIDLEVELS WILL BE MUCH WARMER AND DRIER...SO WILL NOT HAVE
ANY PRECIP MENTIONED THERE. FOR TEMPERATURES...WILL LEAN TOWARD
WARMER MET NUMBERS IN THE SOUTH WHERE SUN IS MORE LIKELY...AND
TOWARD COOLER MAV NUMBERS NORTH WHERE CLOUDS WILL BE THICKER.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO THURSDAY EVENING...MAINLY OVER NORTHEASTERN 
ZONES...AS THE SYSTEM EXITS THE AREA.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE 
REGION ON FRIDAY AND WILL CONTROL AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  
A WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE REGION ON MONDAY WILL SETTLE TO 
OUR NORTH.  MAIN MOISTURE AND LIFT REMAIN NORTH...BUT MAY SEE SOME 
SHOWERS DROP INTO OUR AREA AND WILL KEEP A LOW POP IN THE FORECAST 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  RIDGING ON WEDNESDAY.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 181419 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1019 AM EDT WED APR 18 2007

.DISCUSSION...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL CROSS THE AREA TODAY...BRINGING A CHANCE OF
SHOWERS. 12Z RAOBS AND ACARS SOUNDINGS THIS MORNING SHOW THAT THE
LOW LEVELS REMAIN VERY DRY. ALTHOUGH THE PRECIP COVERAGE ON RADAR
APPEARS WIDESPREAD...THE SURFACE OBS INDICATE SCATTERED COVERAGE AT
BEST. THUS QPF WILL BE VERY LIGHT...ONLY A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF AN
INCH. THE BEST CHANCES OF MEASURABLE RAINFALL ARE IN NORTHERN
SECTIONS IN AN AREA OF 700 MB AND 500 MB CONFLUENCE. THE UPDATE
WILL RAISE POPS NORTH TO 50% AND LOWER POPS SOUTH TO 30%. SKIES
WILL BE CLOUDY THROUGH THE DAY...PREVENTING MUCH SURFACE HEATING
EXCEPT FOR THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SW NC. WILL LOWER TEMPS A FEW
DEGREES...MAINLY IN NORTHERN SECTIONS.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH MOVING AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW SOUTHEAST ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN ON THURSDAY. SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE COLDER AIR 
ALOFT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS UPPER LOW MAY PRODUCE ENOUGH INSTABILITY 
TO WARRANT MENTIONING TSTORMS. A STRONG UPPER RIDGE THEN BUILDS 
ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND A 
WARMING TREND EXPECTED THROUGH THE FIRST OF NEXT WEEK. A WEAK COLD 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY...BEFORE STALLING-OUT AND RETREATING NORTH 
AS A WARM FRONT BY TUESDAY NIGHT. THUS...WILL CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

WINDS WILL BE WEAKER TODAY THAN YESTERDAY. DRY CONDITIONS AND MOSTLY 
SUNNY SKIES SHOULD COMBINE FOR A NICE WARM-UP TODAY...WITH TEMPS 
RISING TO NEAR NORMAL LEVELS. A WEAK CUT-OFF UPPER LOW WILL APPROACH 
THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT...BRINGING AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS A 
SMALL CHANCE OF LIGHT SHOWERS. WILL PLAN TO TREND TEMPS A LITTLE 
WARMER THAN GUIDANCE TONIGHT...WITH THIS EXPECTED CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SHORTWAVE ROTATING THROUGH 
THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY ALONG WITH A SURFACE TROUGH...SHOULD HAVE 
SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT TO BUMP UP POPS TO 50 PERCENT FOR 
WEDNESDAY.  SURFACE TROUGH LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WILL 
KEEP BEST POPS IN THE NORTH WHERE BEST MOISTURE RESIDES.  UPPER LOW 
DROPPING INTO REGION ON THURSDAY...WILL KEEP BEST CHANCES IN THE 
NORTH AGAIN WHERE DEEPEST MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE.  UPPER LOW SHIFTING 
EAST ON THURSDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP THURSDAY NIGHT DRY FOR NOW.  
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN ON FRIDAY BRINGING DRY AND WARMER WEATHER 
FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.  GFS INDICATING A FRONT APPROACHING ON 
MONDAY...WILL ADD 20 POPS FOR MONDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

246 AM EDT MON APR 16 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES...WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT A STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY...WHICH WILL RESULT IN STRONG WEST-TO-NORTHWEST 
WINDS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA. AS A RESULT...WILL CONTINUE THE WIND 
ADVISORY TODAY FOR SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...THE MOUNTAINS AND 
SOUTHWEST NC...BUT ALSO INCLUDE THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA IN A 
LAKE WIND ADVISORY. THESE WINDS SHOULD QUICKLY SUBSIDE AFTER 
SUNSET...SO WILL LET THE WIND ADVISORIES EXPIRE AT 6 PM EDT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE WARMER THAN GUIDANCE TODAY ACROSS THE 
VALLEY ZONES...SINCE DOWNSLOPING WESTERLY WINDS OFF OF THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU SHOULD CREATE SOME ADIABATIC WARMING IN THE 
VALLEY. 


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...GENERALLY BENIGN WEATHER WITH 
NEAR-CLIMO TEMPS STILL IN STORE THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD. THE 
EXCEPTION REMAINS MID WEEK AS A WEAK SYSTEM APPROACHES FROM THE WEST 
FOLLOWED CLOSELY BY AN UPPER SHORT WAVE TROUGH MIGRATING FROM THE NORTH 
AROUND PARENT UPPER LOW OFF THE NORTHEASTERN COAST. STILL APPEARS 
THIS EVENT WILL NOT BE VERY SIGNIFICANT...ALTHOUGH GFS GUIDANCE POPS 
ARE ALREADY LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL FOR WEDNESDAY. DID NOT JUMP ON 
THESE HIGH POPS AT THIS TIME...BUT DID RAISE POPS TO CHANCE CATEGORY 
(UP FROM SLIGHT CHANCE) ON WEDNESDAY.  SLIGHT COOLING TREND SUCCEEDS 
EVENT ON THURSDAY BEFORE WARMING TREND BRING TEMPS TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE
CLIMO BY LATE IN THE PERIOD PER LATEST GFS GUIDANCE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
921 PM EDT SUN APR 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...STEADY PRECIPITATION HAS NOW ALMOST MOVED OUT OF THE
FORECAST AREA WITH SOME WEAKER SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVING SOUTH
SOUTHEAST FROM THE GREAT LAKE AND OHIO VALLEY LATE THIS EVENING TO
THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. THE BULK OF THE SNOW HAS OCCURRED ALREADY
WITH REPORTS OF FLURRIES IN MOST OF THE HIGHER ELEVATION SITES.
LATEST RADAR SHOWING SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION MOVING INTO WESTERN
SECTIONS. WILL CONTINUE SNOW ADVISORY THROUGH EARLY MORNING. ONLY
HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL THE SNOW STICK AROUND AS TEMPERATURES HAVE
ACTUALLY RISEN A FEW DEGREES AT THE LOWER ELEVATIONS AFTER THE
STEADY PRECIPITATION HAS ENDED. ALSO WIND SPEEDS HAVE INCREASED
FROM WEST TO EAST WITH STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT BEHIND DEEP EXITING
LOW PRESSURE AREA ALONG THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC COAST AND THIS IS HELPING
TEMPERATURES STAY UP. AS COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES OVERNIGHT
TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY FALL BACK TO JUST ABOVE FREEZING AT THE
LOWER ELEVATIONS BY MORNING. ALSO SOME CLEARING HAS WORKED INTO WESTERN
SECTIONS BUT EXPECT WITH CLOUDS MOVING SOUTH FROM KY SKIES WILL
REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY THROUGH THE NIGHT.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

     CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     POLK...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...NORTHWEST CARTER...
     NORTHWEST GREENE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...SULLIVAN...
     UNICOI...WASHINGTON TN.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...SYNOPTIC SCALE LIFT
STILL OCCURRING IN ADVANCE OF THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH THIS AFTERNOON 
...BUT THIS SHOULD BE GONE BY THE EVENING HOURS LEAVING LOW LEVEL
FORCING AS THE STRONG LOW LEVEL NW WINDS CONTINUE. MOISTURE
WRAPPING AROUND AND THE UPSLOPE FLOW...PLUS FALLING TEMPS...SUPPORTS
OUR SNOW ADVISORY. HAD A REPORT OF 1 INCH AT CLINGMANS DOME IN THE
SMOKIES...BUT STILL THINK MAIN ACCUMULATIONS WILL OCCUR ABOVE 2500
FEET AND HEAVIEST AMOUNTS UP TO 4 INCHES ABOVE 4000 FEET. DEPTH OF
MOISTURE BECOMES MUCH MORE SHALLOW THIS EVENING...AND NOT HIGH
ENOUGH (OR COLD ENOUGH AT TOP OF SATURATED LAYER) TO ALLOW ICE
NUCLEATION FOR GOOD SNOW GROWTH. 

WILL CARRY SNOW ADVISORY THROUGH 4AM AND WIND ADVISORY THROUGH 4PM
MONDAY. MIN TEMPS NEARLY STEADY OVERNIGHT...THEN FAVORED COOLER
HIGHS MONDAY WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE BLOCKING PATTERN HAS BEEN 
DETRIMENTAL WITH A LITTLE MORE WILD WEATHER THAN WE WOULD LIKE TO 
SEE IN MID APRIL. THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT WE MAY BE ABLE TO BENEFIT 
FROM A MOST PLEASANT RIDGE THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST 
PERIOD  COMPLIMENTS OF THE OMEGA BLOCK. THERE IS A MINOR FLY IN THE 
OINTMENT AT MID WEEK INCLUDING THE PERIOD TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY DAYTIME AS MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
MOVING ACROSS THE REGION ALONG WITH A MODICUM OF MOISTURE SO WILL 
KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING HERE. WAS ABLE TO GO WITH A DRY REGIME 
THEREAFTER...AWAITING ARRIVAL OF PACIFIC TROF. TEMPERATURE FORECAST 
WAS A STRUGGLE AS IT WAS APPARENT THERE WERE TWO DIFFERING THEORIES 
ON HOW FAST TO RID THE REGION OF THE OFFENDING COLD SNAP. WENT AHEAD 
AND STAYED A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE SLOW WARM UP GROUP CONCERNING 
TEMPS IN THE LONG TERM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

1003 AM EDT SUN APR 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...LOW LEVELS...EVEN FROM 850 MBS DOWN...STILL APPEAR TOO 
WARM FOR ANY SNOW THIS MORNING ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA. 12Z OHX 
SOUNDING WAS ABOVE FREEZING JUST IN THE LOWEST 1000 TO 1500 FEET.
EXPECT HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO POSSIBLY MIX WITH OR GRADUALLY CHANGE TO 
WET SNOW BY MID AFTERNOON...THUS SNOW ADVISORY LOOKS GOOD.

HIGHER FIRE WEATHER OBSERVATION SITES JUST STARTING TO SHOW 
INCREASING WINDS...ALMOST INTO LOWER END OF ADVISORY CRITERIA.
HOWEVER...AREA RADAR VAD WIND PROFILES DONT REALLY SHOW ANYTHING 
HIGHER THAN NW AT 25 KNOTS FROM KOHX. DECISION TO EXTEND WIND 
ADVISORY THROUGH ALL OF MONDAY LOOKS GOOD...AS TIGHT PRESSURE 
GRADIENT LINGERS AND MUCH BETTER MIXING EXPECTED. THUS...WIND 
ADVISORY ALSO ON TRACK AND WILL BE CONTINUED AS IS.

STEADY TEMPS AT BEST...OR SLOWLY FALLING AS FORECAST REFLECTS.
SHOWERS INCREASING IN COVERAGE AGAIN THIS MORNING...WITH SOME 
DRIZZLE ALSO NOTED. CURRENT POPS LOOK GOOD IN LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL 
RANGE. WILL UPDATE FORECAST GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS SHORTLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT SUN APR 15 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
ELONGATED AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A 
WIDESPREAD AREA OF SHOWERS OVER THE REGION. WRF AND GFS MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MOVING THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
MOUNTAINS THIS MORNING...AS A HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
OVER THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY SWINGS INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE SCATTERED SHOWERS 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AS LAPSE RATES STEEPEN WITH THE COLDER AIR 
ALOFT. THIS COLDER AIR ALOFT WILL HELP CREATE SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATER TODAY...GENERALLY ABOVE 2500 FEET. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT TEMPS WILL REMAIN ABOVE -10 CELSIUS THIS 
AFTERNOON IN THE PRECIP INITIATION REGION AROUND 700 MB...SO NOT 
THAT CONFIDENT THAT RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW QUICKLY THIS AFTERNOON. 
TEMPS IN THIS PRECIP INITIATION REGION LOWER QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET 
THIS EVENING...SO THINK THAT SNOW WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS DEFINITELY BY THIS EVENING. WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES 
BEGINNING THEIR SNOW ADVISORIES/WARNINGS AROUND NOON...WILL GO AHEAD 
AND BEGIN A SNOW ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA 
AND EAST TN AT NOON AS WELL. IT APPEARS THAT ONE TO THREE INCHES 
WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. TEMPS 
SHOULD REMAIN TOO WARM IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS FOR ANY ACCUMULATIONS. 
WILL ALSO CONTINUE THE WIND ADVISORY FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...AND EXTEND IT THROUGH THE ENTIRE DAY ON MONDAY AS WINDS 
AGAIN INCREASE FOR MOST OF THE DAY. 


.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...GENERALLY QUIET WEATHER 
PATTERN IN STORE THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD. WEAK SYSTEM AFFECTS 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY MID WEEK...BUT REMAINS QUITE
UNIMPRESSIVE PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE PROJECTIONS. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS
IN BEHIND THIS SYSTEM AND PERSIST THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE LONG
TERM. TEMPS ARE PROJECTED TO MODERATE FROM BELOW CLIMO EARLY IN THE
PERIOD TO ABOVE CLIMO BY NEXT WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 PM EDT SAT APR 14 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...QUITE AN INTERESTING MIX
OF WEATHER FOR THESE PERIODS...LOTS OF SHOWERS AND A FEW STORMS
TONIGHT...FOLLOWED BY STRONG WINDS SUNDAY INTO MONDAY MORNING AND A
GOOD CHANCE OF SNOW FOR SW VA AND NE TN SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH
MAINLY SUNDAY NIGHT.

WARM FRONT HAS LIFTED NORTH INTO NE CORNER OF MS EXTENDING SE INTO
NRN AL...WITH SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY NORTH OF THIS SURFACE
BOUNDARY PRODUCING ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS INTO SE TN. MAIN AREA OF
SHOWERS HAS PROGRESSED STEADILY EASTWARD FROM MIDDLE TN AND KY
...AND FINALLY MOVED INTO THE WRN TWO THIRDS OF OUR FORECAST AREA.
HOWEVER...THREAT OF FLOODING RAINS STILL LOOKS GREATLY DIMINISHED
AS BULK OF OUR AREA HAS EXPERIENCED SERIOUS DOWNSLOPING E-SE LOW
LEVEL FLOW INTO THE EARLY AFTERNOON HOURS. OBSERVATION SITES IN
HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS SHOW WINDS AND GUSTS HAVE DECREASED...SO WILL
LET WIND ADVISORY EXPIRE AT 4PM EDT. MAY NEED TO CLOSELY WATCH SE
TN AND SW NC AREAS DUE TO PROXIMITY TO WARM FRONT INTO THE EARLY
EVENING HOURS...FOR POSSIBLE ISOLATED STRONG TO MARGINAL SEVERE
STORMS. 

OTHERWISE...ATTENTION TURNS TO SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT FOR MORE
SIGNIFICANT WEATHER IN THE FORM OF WINDY CONDITIONS AND SNOW
SHOWERS ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE DEPARTING STRONG LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM. DECIDED TO ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR SW VA/NE TN AND THE
MTN ZONES ALONG THE TN/NC STATELINE...RUNNING FROM 11 AM EDT SUN
THRU 11 AM EDT MON.

NOT CONFIDENT ON ACCUMULATING SNOWS FOR LOWER ELEVATIONS SUNDAY
AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY NIGHT...ALTHO MOISTURE IS CERTAINLY AVAILABLE
WITH STRONG LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW. FOR NOW...INCREASED SNOW
AMOUNTS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS THAT TYPICALLY EXPERIENCE SNOW
UNDER THESE CONDITIONS...ENDING UP WITH A 1 TO 3 INCH SNOWFALL 
MAINLY ABOVE 2500 FEET ACROSS SW VA/NE TN INCLUDING THE SMOKIES.
WILL NOT ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY YET (MAINLY 3RD PERIOD EVENT)...BUT
WILL ISSUE ANOTHER SPS. THESE SNOW AMOUNTS ARE CONSISTENT WITH WWD
GRAPHICS AND GRIDS FROM NEIGHBORING OFFICES.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LOW INCHES
SLOWLY EAST INTO THE ATLANTIC DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE WORK
WEEK KEEPING COLD AIR ADVECTION GOING AS NORTHERLY FLOW CONTINUES
ON BACK SIDE OF FEATURE. FORECAST REMAINS DRY TUESDAY AND UNSETTLED
WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY AS A COUPLE OF DISTURBANCES MAKE THEIR WAY
ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. MAY BE ABLE TO KEEP FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY DRY WITH SLOW MOVING UPPER RIDGE REPLACING OFFENDING
EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF. CONCERNING TEMPS GENERALLY EDGED FORECAST
VALUES A LITTLE BELOW GUIDANCE DUE TO SLOW EXIT OF UPPER TROF.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
944 AM EDT SAT APR 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...AREA RADAR VAD WIND PROFILES PROVIDING USEFUL 
INFORMATION THIS MORNING ON TWO FEATURES...1) DOWNSLOPE FLOW INTO 
CENTRAL AND NRN PARTS OF THE TN VALLEY AS KGSP/KMRX/KFCX HAVE E-SE 
FLOW AT THE LOWEST LEVELS WHICH SHIFTS TO S-SW BY 4 TO 5 THOUSAND 
FEET AGL...AND 2) STRENGTH OF LOW LEVEL JET WITH KOHX SHOWING A 50 
TO 60 KNOT JET OVER MIDDLE TN (AROUND 30 TO 40 KNOTS OVER E TN).

THE DOWNSLOPE FLOW HAS REALLY HINDERED OUR RAINFALL POTENTIAL FOR 
EARLY TODAY...BUT RADAR LOOPS DO SHOW GOOD COVERAGE OF SHOWERS 
HEADED OUR WAY FROM MUCH OF KY...MIDDLE TN AND NRN AL. THE THREAT OF 
FLOODING RAINS DOES LOOK GREATLY DIMINISHED GIVEN THE STRONGER 
CONVECTION WELL TO OUR SOUTH OVER CENTRAL AND SRN MISSISSIPPI...
PLUS THE FACT THAT A FAIRLY WELL DEFINED BACK EDGE OF MAIN PCPN AREA 
HAS ALREADY CLEARED W TN.

NAM-WRF SEEMED TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THE LOW LEVEL JET OVER 
MIDDLE TN WHICH IS PROGGED TO WEAKEN TO AROUND 40 KNOTS OVER E TN 
THIS AFTERNOON...THEN SHIFT WELL TO OUR EAST BY THIS EVENING. HAVE 
NOTICED INCREASING WINDS FROM OBSERVATION SITES ABOVE 2500 FEET.
THUS...WIND ADVISORY ISSUED EARLIER WILL BE ALLOWED TO CONTINUE AS 
ADVERTISED THROUGH 4PM EDT TODAY.

FOR THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE...WILL FOCUS A GOOD DEAL OF ATTENTION ON 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH COLD AIR 
ADVECTION AND UPSLOPE LOW LEVEL WINDS GENERATING A THREAT OF SOME 
LIGHT SNOWFALL FOR HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA...NE TN AND SMOKIES.

WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX...FORECAST GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS SHORTLY...WITH 
SOME CONCERN THAT WE MIGHT NOT REACH FORECASTED HIGHS TODAY.

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 AM EDT SAT APR 14 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER NORTHERN LOUISIANA...WITH A WEST-TO- 
EAST ORIENTED WARM FRONT EXTENDING ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH. MODELS ARE 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE NORTHEASTWARD MOVEMENT OF THIS SYSTEM 
TODAY...WITH THE CENTER OF THE LOW PROGGED TO MOVE OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE BULK OF THE RAINFALL 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM SHOULD DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE LOW PRESSURE 
CENTER...ALONG AN INVERTED TROUGH WHICH WILL DEVELOP NORTH OF THE 
LOW ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. BOTH MODELS INDICATE A STRONG LOW- 
LEVEL SOUTHERLY 850 MB JET...ALONG WITH STRONG UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS 
AND LIFT AS DIFLUENCE ALOFT STRENGTHENS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. AS 
A RESULT...IT APPEARS THAT A WIDESPREAD BENEFICIAL RAINFALL WILL 
DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH THE HIGHEST RAINFALL 
TOTALS LIKELY TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST NC. BECAUSE OF THE EXTENDED DROUGHT CONDITIONS... 
FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE VALUES ARE HIGH FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...ESPECIALLY OVER SOUTHEAST TN. IN ADDITION...CONVECTION OVER 
THE LOWER MS VALLEY APPEARS TO BE STRENGTHENING SOUTH OF THE TN 
BORDER...AND THINK THAT THIS CONVECTION MAY LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE THAT CAN BE ADVECTED NORTH INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
SOUNDINGS ALSO REVEAL A STABLE AIR MASS OVERALL FOR THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH NOT MUCH ELEVATED INSTABILITY. THUS...WHILE STRONG 
UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS SHOULD BE ABLE TO PRODUCE SOME THUNDER ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...THINK THAT SHORT-TERM CONVECTIVE RAINFALL 
WILL NOT BE A SIGNIFICANT PROBLEM TODAY...ALTHOUGH THE LONG-TERM 
RAINFALL TOTALS WILL BE HIGH (AROUND ONE TO TWO INCHES OVERALL...WITH 
LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS UP TO FOUR INCHES). FOR ALL OF THESE 
REASONS...WILL NOT ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH FOR TODAY...BUT WILL CONTINUE 
THE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL. IN ADDITION...WILL MENTION LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL 
POSSIBLE IN THE ZONES. BOTH THE WRF AND GFS MODELS INDICATE A 
STRONG 850 MB JET AROUND 50 TO 60 KNOTS TODAY...SO WILL CONTINUE THE 
WIND ADVISORY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN 
TO RAISE MAXES A LITTLE ACROSS CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON...TO ACCOUNT FOR SOME POSSIBLE ADIABATIC WARMING FROM 
THE SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS DESCENDING DOWN THE MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...TROUGH AXIS OF HIGHLY AMPLIFIED 
UPPER TROUGH WILL SWING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON 
SUNDAY. COLDER AIR AND UPSLOPE FLOW WILL INDUCE SNOW SHOWERS IN
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BY LATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. DRYING TREND
WITH MODERATING TEMPS IN THE OFFING BY EARLY WORK WEEK AS UPPER
TROUGH PULLS AWAY AND UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST ALLOWING
SIGNIFICANT HEIGHT RISES. MID-WEEK SYSTEM NOW LOOKS RATHER
DISORGANIZED CASTING SOME DOUBT ON SIGNIFICANCE OF THIS SYSTEM.
CONTINUED LOW POPS FOR CONSISTENCY SAKE. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS
GUIDANCE FAIRLY CLOSELY FOR TEMPS WHICH SHOULD APPROACH CLIMO BY
LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD.


&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
957 PM EDT FRI APR 13 2007

.DISCUSSION...A VERY DYNAMIC STORM SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS THIS EVENING WITH A FAIRLY DEEP UPPER TROUGH.
FRONTOGENETIC FORCING AT 700MB ACROSS KENTUCKY EXTENDING INTO THE
FORECAST AREA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR PRODUCING A BAND OF LIGHT RAIN
OVER NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHERN VIRGINIA.

LATEST NAM AND GFS SHOW INCREASING BOUNDARY LAYER JET...CURRENTLY
OVER THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY...MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA
AFTER MIDNIGHT. THE INCREASING 850MB JET (NEARING 50 KNOTS SATURDAY
MORNING) WILL INCREASE THE ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE REGION TOWARD
AFTER MIDNIGHT/TOWARD DAYBREAK. ALSO...GFS SHOW QUITE STRONG UPPER
LEVEL DIFLUENCE MOVING INTO THE REGION AS WELL. CONVECTION OVER THE
WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL LIKELY MOVE INTO THE CENTRAL AND
SOUTHERN AREAS OF THE FORECAST BY DAYBREAK EVEN THOUGH INSTABILITY
IS LIMITED. STRONG KINEMATIC FORCING WILL HELP OVER COME LACK OF INSTABILITY.
HAVE INCLUDED THUNDERSTORMS OVER MOST OF THE AREA SATURDAY
MORNING...EXCEPT FOR THE NORTHEAST SECTIONS.

DUE TO THE INCREASING 850MB JET...HAVE ALSO ISSUED A WINDY ADVISORY
FOR THE HIGHER EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST
NORTH CAROLINA FOR MOST OF THE DAY SATURDAY.

&&

     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EDT FRI APR 13 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...PRECIPITATION HAS BEEN VERY 
PATCHY AND UNORGANIZED THIS AFTERNOON...WITH AN OCCASIONAL 0.01 INCH 
NOTED ON ASOS. EXPECT THIS PATTERN TO PERSIST THIS EVENING WITH WARM 
AIR ADVECTION/WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT PRODUCING MORE PATCHY LIGHT RAIN 
THAT MOVES EAST IN THE NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. LOW PRESSURE MOVING 
INTO LOWER MISS VALLEY REGION TOWARD MORNING SHOULD EVENTUALLY 
SPREAD A SOLID AREA OF CONVECTIVE PCPN INTO WESTERN PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...THUS TRENDED INTO PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS TOWARD 
MORNING. 

CONTINUED CATEGORICAL POPS FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT 
THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS SHOULD BE MAINLY TO OUR SOUTH WHERE BEST 
INSTABILITY WILL OCCUR. SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE SURFACE BASED AND ELEVATED 
OVER SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT NOT SO FOR SW VA AND 
NE TN (WHERE WORDED AS JUST A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS). AMOUNT OF 
RAINFALL FROM THIS SYSTEM IS A CONCERN...WITH OUR AREA NOW INCLUDED 
IN THE SLIGHT RISK OF EXCEEDING FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE. I WILL LIKELY 
ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT AND HIGHLIGHT SOME SIGNIFICANT 
RAIN FROM SATURDAY MORNING INTO SUNDAY MORNING...BUT NOT CONFIDENT 
ENOUGH THAT A FLOOD WATCH IS WARRANTED YET. MAIN REASONS ARE THAT 
SUCH STRONG TO SEVERE CONVECTION OVER THE GULF COAST STATES MAY 
INHIBIT RAIN AMOUNTS THIS FAR NORTH...PLUS A BRIEF PERIOD OF SE LOW 
LEVEL WINDS SATURDAY THAT WOULD PRODUCE DOWNSLOPE EFFECT. 

WILL ALSO MENTION THE MOISTURE AND MUCH COOLER AIR ON BACKSIDE OF 
SYSTEM FOR SUNDAY...WHICH MAY LEAD TO SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AS EARLY AS SUNDAY AFTERNOON...THEN POSSIBLY FOR LOWER 
ELEVATIONS OF NORTHERN AREAS SUNDAY NIGHT.

GFS MODEL SEEMED TO HANDLE SYSTEM WELL...AND ITS MOS TEMPS WERE 
REASONABLE ESPECIALLY FOR MAX TEMPS EACH DAY...THUS CLOSELY 
FOLLOWED.  


.LONG TERM...SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...DEEP UPPER TROF/UPPER LOW 
DROPS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES AND DRIVES STEADILY 
EAST THROUGH SOUTHERN NEW ENGLAND BY MID WEEK. POTENT STORM SYSTEM 
HAS MORE THAN ENOUGH WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND DYNAMIC LIFT WITH VORT 
ENERGY ROTATING AROUND THE BACK SIDE OF SYSTEM TO KEEP PRECIP GOING 
WELL SUNDAY NIGHT AND SOME CONTINUATION ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE THROUGH MID DAY MONDAY. WINTER TYPE WEATHER 
IS NOT OVER YET AS THIS SYSTEM WILL PULL SUBFREEZING AIR INTO THE 
REGION ALLOWING FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SNOW SHOWERS MAINLY ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND HIGHER TERRAIN NEAR THE NORTH CAROLINA 
BORDER. FORECAST AREA DRIES OUT MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH DAYTIME 
PERIOD TUESDAY. MAINTAINED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH THURSDAY DAYTIME PERIOD AS AN UNSETTLED PATTERN STILL IN THE 
WORKS FOR MID TO LATE WEEK AS MODELS SHOW A NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN 
STREAM SHORTWAVE TRAVERSING THE EASTERN STATES. SOME UNCERTAINTY AS 
TO HOW MUCH LIFT WITH MAIN SURFACE WAVE TRACKING ALONG THE GULF 
COAST SO KEPT POPS QUITE LOW FOR NOW. USED A DRY FORECAST FOR FRIDAY 
AWAITING NEXT UPPER TROF DUE OVER THE WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1002 AM EDT FRI APR 13 2007

.DISCUSSION...GFS MODEL DOING THE BEST JOB WITH THE LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION (PCPN) MOVING QUICKLY EAST ACROSS TN AND NRN AL THIS 
MORNING. THIS PCPN IS LIKELY NOT REACHING THE SURFACE IN MANY AREAS 
AND THE INTENSITY OF RETURNS IS LIKELY OVERDONE DUE TO BRIGHT 
BANDING ASSOCIATED WITH MELTING LEVEL. 850 MB ANALYSIS USING GFS 
DATA DOES REVEAL FRONTOGENESIS ALIGNED VERY WELL WITH CURRENT RADAR 
ECHOES. THIS FORCING/LIFT IS PROGGED TO MAINLY LIFT NORTH OF OUR 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT POSSIBLY STILL CLIPPING SW VA 
AREAS. CLOUDS HAVE INCREASED RAPIDLY THIS MORNING. WILL REMOVE THE 
AFTERNOON WORDING ON POPS...AND ALSO CONSIDER SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS
ALTHO RAINFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD STAY ON THE ORDER OF TRACE TO A FEW 
HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH.

FOR THE WEEKEND...THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS SEEMS VERY LOW AT THIS 
POINT...AND TOTAL QPF OVER THE WEEKEND MAY BE DIMINISHED BY 
DOWNSLOPE FLOW INITIALLY AND THE FACT THAT SUCH STRONG CONVECTION 
WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES (AND THEREFORE REDUCE 
MOISTURE INFLOW TO OUR REGION). COLD AIR AND POTENTIAL FOR AT LEAST 
LIGHT SNOW LATE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY...WHICH WILL BE LOOKED MORE INTO 
WITH THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX SHORTLY AND ALSO FRESHEN GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS 
AS NEEDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 AM EDT FRI APR 13 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY... 
WITH A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER NEW MEXICO. HIGH CLOUDS 
SHOULD GRADUALLY INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...FROM THIS 
DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. WRF MODEL 
INDICATES SOME FRONTOGENETICAL FORCING DEVELOPING ACROSS SOUTHEAST 
TN THIS AFTERNOON...AS SOUTHERLY 850 MB WINDS CREATE AN UPPER-LEVEL 
WARM FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THE SURFACE WARM FRONT SHOULD 
REMAIN SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH TONIGHT...BUT WILL ADD A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AS THE UPPER- 
LEVEL WARM FRONT MOVES NORTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THE WRF AND 
GFS MODELS INDICATE SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES WITH THE BULK OF THE 
PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AS IT MOVES EAST 
ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH TONIGHT. WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE PREVIOUS 
FORECASTS TREND...WHICH IS SIMILAR TO THE FASTER GFS SOLUTION. AS 
FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TODAY...BUT 
SLIGHTLY WARMER TONIGHT DUE TO THE EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER EXPECTED.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER FLOW REMAINS QUITE 
AMPLIFIED THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. MAJOR SYSTEM AFFECTS 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION REGION ON SATURDAY. STILL SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES IN TIMING BETWEEN WRF...GFS AND SREF...BUT APPEARS EVENT
WILL BE CENTERED AROUND 00Z SUNDAY. SIGNIFICANT QPFS ALSO SEEM
PROBABLE ALTHOUGH WAS SOMEWHAT CONSERVATIVE WITH QPFS.
NEVERTHELESS...APPEARS THAT RAINFALL MAY APPROACH AN INCH OR MORE
GENERALLY OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE WHOLE EVENT. SEVERE
WEATHER NOT A GREAT CONCERN AT THIS TIME AS FORECAST SOUNDINGS
INDICATE A FAIRLY STABLE PROFILE. DID INCLUDE CHANCE THUNDER
HOWEVER AS DYNAMICS MAY BE STRONG ENOUGH TO OVERCOME LACK OF
INSTABILITY. MUCH COLDER AIR FOLLOWS DEPARTING SYSTEM ON SUNDAY
WITH ENOUGH WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE TO KEEP SCATTERED PRECIP AROUND.
SOME PRECIP MAY CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
OF THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES SUNDAY NIGHT.

A DRY PERIOD WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF THE WORK WEEK 
BEFORE ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES EARLY WEDNESDAY. THIS SYSTEM DOES 
NOT APPEAR TO BE AS SIGNIFICANT AS THIS WEEKENDS SYSTEM IN TERMS OF 
WIDESPREAD SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL AT THIS TIME. TEMPS WILL MODERATE 
FROM WELL BELOW CLIMO ON SUNDAY TO NEAR CLIMO BY LATE IN THE LONG 
TERM PERIOD. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE CLOSELY FOR TEMPS.

344 PM EDT THU APR 12 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...STILL GETTING SOME STRONG

WILL LET LAKE WIND AND WIND ADVISORIES RUN THE COURSE UNTIL 6PM EDT

AFTERNOON...I DID NOT PLAY UP WINDS MUCH IN TONIGHTS FORECAST.
EXPECTING WINDS TO STAY UP ENOUGH TO INHIBIT ANY FROST FORMATION...
BUT MAY ISSUE A SHORT SPS FOR MY SMOKY AND NRN TN MTN GROUPS WHERE
TEMPS MAY DIP BELOW FREEZING FOR AN HOUR OR TWO TOWARD MORNING.
WINDS AND PATCHY CLOUDS OVER THE NORTH FAVORED GOING ABOUT A DEGREE
ABOVE GFS MOS MINS.

OTHERWISE...FRIDAY LOOKS MOSTLY DRY...BUT LOW POPS WERE CARRIED
FROM NW AREAS DOWN TO NO POP NEAR GSP AREAS...FOR CONTINUITY AND TO
MATCH NEIGHBORS FORECAST GRIDS. WARM FRONT DEVELOPING SEEMS TO BE
THE FEATURE THAT GFS KEYS ON DEVELOPING WIDESPREAD LIGHT QPF. THIS
MAY BE OVERDONE...IF SO SIGNIFICANT SHOWERS MAY HOLD OFF UNTIL
EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS ON SATURDAY DOES
NOT APPEAR TOO GREAT AT THIS POINT...AS SURFACE LOW TRACKS MOSTLY
ALONG THE GULF COAST STATES.

FAVORED WARMER THAN MOS TEMPS FOR HIGHS FRIDAY DUE TO SOME WARM AIR
ADVECTION LATE IN THE AFTERNOON...AND ALSO AFTER SEEING MAX TEMPS
WARMER THAN MOS FOR TODAY. MINS FRIDAY NIGHT WOULD APPEAR TO BE
MUCH MILDER THAN 12/12Z MOS NUMBERS CAME IN...ALTHO FAR NE AREAS
MIGHT BE IN THE 40S. THUS...I BLENDED MORE WITH THE MUCH MILDER
MINS THAT WERE IN THE PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID FOR FRI NIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...ACTIVE WEATHER 
PATTERN TRANSITIONS FROM THUNDER THREAT EARLY SATURDAY NIGHT TO RAIN 
SHOWERS AND THEN A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS AS UPPER TROF 
INTENSIFIES OVER THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEASTERN STATES.  
POLAR AIRMASS WILL BE YANKED BACK INTO THE REGION ON THE BACK SIDE 
OF UPPER TROF FOR THE BEGINNING OF THE NEW WEEK WITH TEMPERATURES 
AROUND 15 TO NEARLY 20 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL AGAIN. SOME MODERATION 
OCCURS TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY BUT TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE BELOW 
NORMAL BY SEVERAL DEGREES. IT WILL ALSO BE AN UNSETTLED PERIOD AS AN 
UPPER TROF PROGRESSES EAST ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. WITH A SURFACE 
WAVE MOVING EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. KEPT PROBABILITIES 
AT 20 PERCENT FOR WEDNESDAY ALL THE WAY THROUGH THURSDAY DAYTIME 
PERIOD FOR POSSIBILITY OF RAIN SHOWERS. TRENDED TOWARD MEX MOS TEMP 
GUIDANCE.
