AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT THU APR 12 2007

.SHORT TERM..(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT HAS MOVED WELL EAST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA WITH DRIER DEWPOINTS AND COOLER TEMPERATURES 
SLOWLY MOVING INTO THE REGION. CHA AND RHP SHOW DENSE FOG WITH 
VISIBILITIES LESS THAN 1/4 MILE. SATELLITE SHOWS ONLY PATCHY DENSE 
FOG ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.  ALSO...AS DRIER AIR ADVECTS INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY...AREA OF FOG WILL DIMINISH EARLY THIS MORNING...SO 
WILL NOT ISSUE A DENSE FOG ADVISORY.

PRESSURE GRADIENT REMAINS TIGHT ENOUGH TO SUPPORT 850MB WINDS OF 30 
TO 40 KTS TODAY...SO WILL ISSUE A LAKE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE VALLEY AND
PLATEAU...AND WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS.

NAM AND GFS SHOW SOME 850MB MOISTURE MOVING INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
TODAY...SO WILL KEEP THOSE AREAS PARTLY CLOUDY WITH GENERALLY MOSTLY 
SUNNY ELSEWHERE.  SOME HIGH AND MID CLOUDS TONIGHT...BUT OVERALL A 
MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY FORECAST. WINDS SEEM TO REMAIN HIGH 
ENOUGH TO KEEP FREEZE POTENTIAL LOW...EXCEPT FOR THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OR HIGH VALLEYS. WILL HOLD OFF ISSUEING A FREEZE WARNING 
FOR NOW SINCE A HARD FREEZE IS NOT ANTICIPATED.



.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FORECAST CENTERED AROUND 
EVOLUTION OF 4 CORNERS LOW EARLY FRI AND HOW IT MARRIES WITH 
NORTHERN ENERGY OVER THE WEEKEND...FINALLY BECOME NOTABLE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OFF THE NE U.S. CST EARLY NEXT WEEK. FORECAST TIMING
STRENGTH AND PCPN TYPES WILL LIKELY BE ADJUSTED THROUGH AN ACTIVE 
WEATHER WEEKEND. FRIDAY SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGES ACROSS THE AREA 
FROM THE NW. ISENTROPIC LIFT LATE ON FRI COULD SPREAD SOME LIGHT 
RAIN INTO THE NORTHERN AREAS OF THE MRX CWA. LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
BEGINS TO TAKE SHAPE OVER MS RVR VLY WITH INVERTED TROUGH WORKING 
NE INTO THE TN VLY. SEVERE WEATHER A GOOD BET OFF TO THE SW OF MRX 
CWA. WIDESPREAD CONVECTION SHOULD WORK ITS WAY INTO THE AREA SAT. SEVERE
THREAT WILL LIKELY EXTEND INTO SE TN/SW NC...THE NORTHERN EXTENT OF 
THREAT AREAS WILL DEPEND HOW SYSTEM EVOLES. 850 MB JET STILL VERY 
STRONG BUT WEAKER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. WINDY CONDITIONS SETTING UP 
FOR THE MOUNTAINS. SURFACE LOW SHOULD GET EAST OF THE AREA LATER ON SAT
BUT UPR LOW CENTER REMAINS TO THE WEST. PCPN CHC REMAINS FAIRLY HIGH 
THROUGH SAT NGT. BREEZY CONDITIONS AGAIN ON SUNDAY AS LOW 
STRENGTHENS TO THE NE. PCPN CHC LOWERS SUN BUT PCPN CHC AND TYPE 
LATE SUN AND EARLY MON TEASING WITH DECENT SNOW AMOUNTS ACROSS SW 
VA/NE TN. MODEL FREEZING LEVEL ONLY DIPS DOWN TO SFC OR NEAR SFC
BRIEFLY BUT THIS COULD END UP BEING UNDERDONE. EVENTUALLY THE SYSTEM 
WILL MOVE FAR ENOUGH EAST TO ALLOW HIGH PRESSURE TO BUILD BACK INTO 
AREA FROM THE WEST.  
SETTING UP.

326 PM EDT WED APR 11 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...PREFRONTAL CONVECTION SLOWED 
DOWN A BIT THIS AFTERNOON...BUT CURRENTLY MOST OF THE WESTERN HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. ISENTROPIC LIFT AND ELEVATED INSTABILITY HAS 
RESULTED IN LINGERING ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WITH THIS ACTIVITY.

FURTHER WEST...NEW DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE COLD FRONT WAS AIDED BY 
EARLIER BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER...WITH MAIN AXIS OF LOW LEVEL 
INSTABILITY IN THIS AREA RUNNING N-S FROM ERN MS/WRN AL ACROSS W 
PARTS OF MIDDLE TN INTO WRN KY/SRN IL AND IN. OHX HAS HAD A COUPLE 
REPORTS OF SEVERE HAIL IN THEIR SRN COUNTIES...AND ALSO FEEL THERE 
MAY BE A THREAT OF WINDS GUSTS OF 45 TO 55 MPH WITH STRONGEST 
CONVECTION IN AT LEAST WRN PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS 
EVENING. 40 TO 50 KNOT LOW LEVEL JET AND 70 KNOT MID LEVEL JET PER 
KHTX VAD WIND PROFILE...PLUS APPROACHING CONVECTION WITH COLD FRONT
...SO DECIDED TO EXTEND THE LAKE WIND AND WIND ADVISORIES THROUGH 
8PM EDT (7PM CDT) TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...DRY WEATHER 
CONTINUES INTO THURSDAY NIGHT.  A WARM FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA 
LATE FRIDAY...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE NORTHERN ZONES 
FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE RESIDES.  A COLD FRONT 
FOLLOWS ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND LINGERS INTO SATURDAY.  SHOULD HAVE 
AMPLE MOISTURE AND LIFT TO CARRY LIKELY POPS FOR BOTH FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY.  SOME INSTABILITY EXPECTED...WILL KEEP MENTION FOR 
THUNDER...BUT BEST INSTABILITY STAYS TO THE SOUTH OF THE CWA.  UPPER 
TROUGH FOLLOWS ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  STILL DECENT MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE...SO WILL KEEP HIGH POPS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND CHANCE 
POPS FOR SUNDAY MORNING.  DRIER WEATHER IS EXPECTED BY SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON.  RIDGE BUILDS IN ON SUNDAY NIGHT...BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE APPROACHES ON 
WEDNESDAY...WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY.  STAYED NEAR 
GUIDANCE/HPC FOR TEMPERATURES.

WILL NEED TO WATCH APPROACHING STORMS FOR AT LEAST POTENTIAL TO 
BECOME STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING.
IF WE CAN GET BREAKS IN CLOUD COVER...LIKE CURRENTLY OVER W TN...
THEN POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE WOULD BE ENHANCED.

OTHERWISE...FORECAST AND GRIDS APPEAR TO BE VERY MUCH ON TRACK THIS 
MORNING.  WILL CHECK HOURLY CONDITIONS AND UPDATE GRIDS AND WEB 
BASED PRODUCTS IF NEEDED.  FOR ZFPMRX...PLAN TO JUST REMOVE ANY 
MORNING OR AFTERNOON WORDING IN AN UPDATE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT WED APR 11 2007

.SHORT-TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NEGATIVELY TILTED UPPER TROUGH
WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY TODAY INTO
TONIGHT. A 110+ KNOT JET AT 300MB WILL MOVE FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS
TOWARD THE TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEY WILL PRODUCE STRONG DIFFLUENT FLOW
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY LATER TODAY. THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE ON THE 
SOUTHERN FRINGE OF THE DIFLUENT FLOW ALOFT. STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER 
JET WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA TODAY WITH 850 MB JET OF 45 TO 
50 KNOTS. I AM CONCERNED THAT A LITTLE MORE BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS 
TODAY DUE TO DOWNSLOPE FLOW INTO THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY 
WILL ALLOW THE STRONG WINDS TO MIX DOWN INTO THE VALLEY. WILL ISSUE 
A WIND ADVISORY AREA-WIDE...EVEN THOUGH THE STRONGEST WINDS WILL BE 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

AS FOR RAIN AND THUNDER CHANCES...NAM AND RUC MODELS SHOW STRONG 
BOUNDARY LAYER JET PULLING IN LOWER AND MID 50S DEWPOINTS INTO THE 
REGION THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING IN ADVANCE OF COLD FRONT. 
DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH BREAKS OCCUR TODAY...ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO 
PRODUCE SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. ALSO EXPECT MODERATELY STRONG 
ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE AREA AS WELL. WILL MAINTAIN CAT POPS 
AREA-WIDE.

PRECIPITATION WILL COME TO AN END SOON AFTER FROPA THIS EVENING WITH 
COOLER AIR RETURNING TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN
FROM THE NW THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. PRESSURE GRADIENT REMAINS TIGHT 
BETWEEN DEPARTING LOW AND BUILDING PRESSURE SO THURSDAY WILL BE 
BREEZY. TEMPS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. ACTIVE PATTERN 
SETTING UP FOR THE WEEKEND. MODEL UNCERTAINTY DEPICTED AS 4-CORNERS
CUTOFF LOW FLIRTS WITH PHASING WITH A NORTHERN SHORT. BEST BET IS 
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVR MS RVR VLY LATE ON FRI WITH COLD 
FRONT EXTENDING WELL IN GLFMEX. GFS DEPICTS 70 KT WARM SECTOR LOW 
LEVEL JET PUSHING INTO MID TN VLY EARLY SAT. BREEZY CONDITIONS ON
TAP WITH WATCHFUL EYE NEEDED ON TSTMS EARLY SAT. COLD FRONT SWEEPS 
THROUGH AREA LATE SAT AS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DRIFTS OVER CNTRL APPS
BEFORE MOVING OFF THE COAST ON MONDAY. WRAP AROUND MOISTURE WILL 
PERSIST OVR NE MRX AREA SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. COLD AIRMASS OVR E 
CANADA WILL BUILD DOWN INTO AREA WITH LIGHT SNOW PSBL NE 
AREAS/SMOKYS INTO MON MORN. RIDGING BUILDS IN TUE BUT TEMPS WOULD DO 
WELL TO GET UP TO CLIMO.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT TUE APR 10 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE HIGH PRESSURE AREA OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING 
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. AREA RADARS INDICATE SOME LIGHT RAIN OVER 
ALABAMA ASSOCIATED WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF A WARM FRONT OVER 
THE GULF COASTAL REGION. THIS AREA OF RAIN SHOULD CONTINUE TO SLOWLY 
MOVE NORTHEAST OVERNIGHT...AND WILL PLAN TO RAISE POPS SOME FOR 
TONIGHT. SOUNDINGS REVEAL THAT A DRY AIR MASS REMAINS IN PLACE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...SO IT SHOULD TAKE AWHILE FOR 
THE DRY BOUNDARY LAYER TO MOISTEN UP FOR MUCH MEASURABLE RAIN. AS A 
RESULT...EXPECT ONLY LIGHT RAIN BEFORE SUNRISE WITH AMOUNTS LESS 
THAN A TENTH OF AN INCH. TEMPS FOR TONIGHT LOOK TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
NOTICED THAT MODELS INDICATE A FAVORABLE SCENARIO TOMORROW FOR 
DOWNSLOPE WINDS ALONG THE WESTERN SLOPES OF THE APPALACHIAN 
MOUNTAINS. SOUTH TO SOUTHEAST WINDS ALONG WITH A DECENT LOW-LEVEL 
INVERSION EXTENDING ABOVE THE MOUNTAIN RIDGES SHOULD COMBINE TO 
PRODUCE SOME ADIABATIC WARMING IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY 
AREAS. AS A RESULT...WILL PLAN TO RAISE MAX TEMPS FOR TOMORROW AT 
KNOXVILLE AND TRI-CITIES TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
207 PM EDT TUE APR 10 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...
NO MORE FREEZING TEMPS TO WORRY ABOUT THROUGH THE SHORT TERM...BUT 
NOW FOCUS CENTERS ON TIMING POPS ASSOCIATED WITH APPROACHING SYSTEM. 
MODELS ARE GENERALLY SLIGHTLY SLOWER WITH ONSET OF PRECIP THAN 
PREVIOUS RUN...PROJECTING ONLY LOW POPS FOR THE FIRST PERIOD IN MOST 
AREAS. APPEARS THE GREATEST CHANCE OF PRECIP WILL OCCUR IN THE 18Z 
WED TO 00Z THU TIME FRAME FOR MOST AREAS. GENERALLY FAVORED TIMING 
OF SREF. ALSO APPEARS PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS WILL GENERALLY BE FAIRLY 
LIGHT...WITH QPF GENERALLY AROUND 0.5 INCHES EXPECTED. PRECIP 
SHOULD EXIT THE AREA BY 12Z THURSDAY AS UPPER TROUGH PULLS AWAY. FOR 
TEMPS...WENT SLIGHTLY ABOVE GFS GUIDANCE IN THE FIRST PERIOD WITH 
THE EXCEPTION OF THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES WHERE A DELAY IN ARRIVAL OF 
CLOUDS MAY ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP NEAR GUIDANCE. GFS GUIDANCE APPEARS 
REASONABLE FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD PERIODS AND WAS FOLLOWED CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...PROVIDING DRY 
WEATHER WITH A WARMING TREND. HIGHS WILL BE IN THE 60S ON 
THURSDAY...AND INTO THE 70S IN MOST SPOTS ON FRIDAY. AS THE RIDGE 
MOVES EAST FRIDAY NIGHT...A STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW WITH ACCESS 
TO THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL ADVECT MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. MIDLEVEL 
NEGATIVE THETA-E ADVECTION OVER WARM MOIST SURFACE AIR WILL LEAD TO 
UNSTABLE CONDITIONS ON SATURDAY. THIS COMBINED WITH GOOD UPPER 
DIVERGENCE AND A 50 KT LOW LEVEL JET WILL LEAD TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS ON SATURDAY...WITH A POTENTIAL FOR SOME SEVERE 
STORMS. FROPA IN THE GFS IS AFTER 00Z SUNDAY...WITH SOME MOISTURE 
WRAPPING AROUND THE CLOSED LOW OVER LAKE ERIE ON SUNDAY. WILL KEEP 
CHANCE POPS IN THE NORTH INTO SUNDAY. THE AIRMASS BEHIND THE 
DEPARTING LOW IS NOT TERRIBLY COLD...AND OVERNIGHT LOWS SHOULD 
REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING SUNDAY NIGHT. A REX BLOCK PATTERN OVER THE 
WESTERN CONUS WILL KEEP A PERSISTENT DRY PATTERN THROUGH TUESDAY 
WITH NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EDT TUE APR 10 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT 
THIS MORNING. SW VA/NE TN AND SW NC RANGE FROM THE MID 20S TO LOWER 
30S. THE N PLATEAU AND E TN CENTRAL VALLEY HAVE A RANGE OF TEMPS IN 
THE 30S BUT SOME AREAS CONTINUE TO FLIRT WITH A FREEZE. SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO MOVE TO THE EAST TODAY. A SHORT WAVE WILL 
MOVE EAST INTO THE AREA TODAY. MAIN EFFECT TODAY WILL BE INCREASING 
AND LOWERING UPPER AND MIDDLE CLOUD DECKS. FAIRLY STRONG WAA GETS 
GOING LATE ESPECIALLY ACROSS S PART OF MRX CWA AS ELAVATED WARM 
FRONT WORKS ITS WAY DOWN. LOW LEVEL JET AND LAYER MOISTURE CONTINUE 
TO INCREASE TONIGHT AS WARM FRONT MOVES N THROUGH THE AREA. SHORT WAVE
APPROACHES FROM THE WEST LATE TONIGHT SETTING UP DIFFLUENT FLOW 
ALOFT. THESE FAVORABLE INGREDIANTS ARE NOT ACCOMPANIED BY VERY 
STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT OR MID LEVEL LAPSE RATES. DESPITE EVER 
CLIMBING POP CHC TOWARD MORNING...RAINFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD BE PALTRY. 
TODAY HIGHS WILL BE WARMER BUT CONTINUED BELOW NORMAL. TONIGHT MINS 
FALL LITTLE TO NEAR NORMAL.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL
MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS TO THE OHIO VALLEY-LOWER
GREAT LAKES WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MODERATELY STRONG BOUNDARY
LAYER JET WILL PULL SOUTHERLY MOIST WINDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
FOR WEDNESDAY WITH DECENT ISENTROPIC LIFT. ALSO...LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH
LEFT FRONT QUAD (LEFT EXIT REGION) OF A 130 KNOT JET WILL MOVE ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF FROPA DURING THE EVENING.
WIDESPREAD RAIN IS ANTICIPATED AREA-WIDE WEDNESDAY. INSTABILITY
STAYS SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH ONLY A SMALL AREA OF CAPE NOTED
AT CHA DURING THE EARLY EVENING. WILL KEEP THUNDER OUT OF THE FORECAST
FOR NOW.

SOON AFTER FROPA WEDNESDAY NIGHT...DRIER AIR WILL DECREASE THE
CLOUDS FROM WEST TO EAST WITH SUNSHINE RETURNING AREA-WIDE FOR
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. UPPER RIDGE WILL RE-ESTABLISH ITSELF OVER THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY AHEAD OF THE NEXT STRONGER UPPER TROUGH. THICKNESS
AND 850MB TEMPERATURES WILL INCREASE WITH WARMER TEMPERATURES
ANTICIPATED FOR THE END OF THE WEEK.

FOR LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...NEXT UPPER TROUGH AND
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA. TIMING OF FROPA IS A
LITTLE SLOWER WITH THE ECMWF COMPARED TO THE GFS. NCEP IS TRENDING
TOWARD THE SLOWER SOLUTION WHICH WILL ALLOW MORE MOISTURE TO ADVECT
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. WILL NEED TO WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL OF
SEVERE WEATHER SATURDAY AFTERNOON-EVENING AS THE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY
AHEAD OF FROPA IS IN QUESTION.

FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...ANOTHER DEEP UPPER TROUGH SWINGS INTO THE
REGION WITH MUCH COOLER WEATHER FOR SUNDAY WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS.

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT MON APR 9 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MAIN ISSUES FOR THE SHORT TERM 
ARE TEMPS TONIGHT AND POPS TUESDAY. GFS GUIDANCE HAS BEEN RUNNING 
TOO COLD THE PAST SEVERAL NIGHTS. THUS...TEND TO DISREGARD COLDER 
GFS GUIDANCE FOR TONIGHT AND INSTEAD FAVOR WARMER NAM (MET) 
GUIDANCE. AT ANY RATE...NOT ANTICIPATING TEMPS TO BE ANY COLDER 
TONIGHT THAN LAST NIGHT AS WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH THE AREA 
PRODUCING AT LEAST SCATTERED CLOUD COVER. WILL ISSUE ANOTHER FREEZE 
WARNING BUT ONLY FOR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA AS 
WELL AT THE NORTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES.

ON TUESDAY...SYSTEM APPROACHING FROM THE WEST WILL SPREAD INCREASING 
CLOUD COVER INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. HOWEVER...ANY LIGHT 
RAINFALL WILL INITIALLY BE FALLING FROM A HIGH CLOUD DECK AND HAVE 
TO OVERCOME DRY LOWER LAYERS. BASED ON THESE FACTORS...FAVOR LOWER 
GFS GUIDANCE POPS IN THIS REGARD AS IT APPEARS ANY MEASURABLE 
PRECIP WILL NOT OCCUR UNTIL AFTER 00Z WED. FOR TEMPS ON 
TUESDAY...AGAIN FAVORED MET GUIDANCE AS ITS COOLER VALUES SEEM MORE 
REASONABLE BASED ON THE ANTICIPATED INCREASING CLOUD COVER AND 
POTENTIAL EVAPORATIVE COOLING FROM LIGHT RAIN FALLING INTO DRY 
LOWER LAYERS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS HOLDS OFF NEXT 
SYSTEM UNTIL THE WEE HOURS OF WEDNESDAY. INSTABILITY STILL VERY LOW 
AS TEMPS COOL AND AIR DRY. THIS SYSTEM MUST OVERCOME VERY DRY AIR 
BEFORE ACTUALLY DROPPING ANY PRECIP ON THE GROUND. BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON POPS LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL MOST AREAS, BUT DROP OFF 
QUICKLY TO CHANCE AGAIN BY LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WITH WARMING TREND 
IN BOTH MINS AND MAXES, ALL PRECIP WILL BE LIQUID. NEXT SHOT AT 
PRECIP WILL BE THURSDAY WITH SYSTEM IN NORTHERLY STREAM JUST 
BRUSHING OUR UPPER SECTIONS. THEN ANOTHER SHOT SATURDAY, BUT 
OBVIOUSLY THAT OUTLOOK CAN CHANGE BY THE NEXT SEVERAL MODEL RUNS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

305 AM EDT MON APR 9 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK LOW LEVEL RIDGE OVER MRX CWA 
THROUGH SHORT TERM. MID AND UPR JETS NEARLY ZONAL. UPR JET CORE 
REMAINS NORTH OF AREA. MID LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS ACROSS TN TODAY AND 
SHIFTS E TONIGHT. MID/UPR LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTS ACROSS AREA EARLY 
TODAY MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHERN AREA. LAYER DRIES OUT THIS EVENING. 
SHORT WAVE APPROACHES FROM W LATE TONIGHT BUT SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE 
SHOULD REMAIN W OF AREA. TEMPERATURES MODERATED EARLY TODAY BUT 
SHOULD SEE ABOUT A 5 DEGREES WARM UP FROM SUNDAYS READINGS. GOOD 
RADIATION CONDITIONS EARLY TONIGHT. NAM/GFS MOS HAS BEEN 
CONSISTENTLY TOO COOL ON MINS SO MIN FCST ON THE HIGH SIDE. THIS 
DOES RESULT IN SOME FREEZING TEMPS ACROSS MRX CWA BUT CURRENT FREEZE 
EPISODE AND DURATION OF FREEZING TONIGHT SHOULD NOT REQUIRE AN 
ADDITIONAL FREEZE WARNING.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...TEMPERATURES SHOULD CONTINUE 
TO WARM LITTLE EACH DAY THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK AS THE COLD 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST.  A WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL TRACK 
JUST TO OUR SOUTH LATE IN THE DAY TUESDAY AND MAY GENERATE SOME 
ISOLATED SHOWERS FAR SOUTHERN ZONES.  THIS IS IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT 
WEATHER SYSTEM WHICH SHOULD REACH INTO THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT.  
SYSTEM APPEARS A BIT UNORGANIZED BUT WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND 
LIFT...ASSOCIATED PRECIP WILL SPREAD FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST 
OVERNIGHT WITH BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVER OUR NORTHEASTERN AREAS 
INTO THURSDAY MORNING AS THE SYSTEM EXITS THE AREA.  A SHORT WAVE 
SLIDES THROUGH TO OUR NORTH ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...BUT 
SHOULD REMAIN DRY OVER OUR AREA.  THE NEXT SYSTEM REACHES INTO THE 
REGION FOR THE WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
225 PM EDT SUN APR 8 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SHORT WAVE ENERGY SLIDING BY TO 
OUR SOUTH EXPECTED TO BRING SOME HIGH AND MID CLOUDS LATTER HALF OF 
TONIGHT INTO TOMORROW.  BIG QUESTION IS HOW MUCH...AND WHAT WILL BE 
EFFECT ON TEMPS.  THINK AT LEAST SOUTHERN AREAS WILL BE BROKEN TO 
OVERCAST BY LATE TONIGHT...AND THESE CONDITIONS WILL LAST INTO  
MONDAY MORNING.  STILL MAY BE QUITE A FEW CLOUDS AROUND EVEN DURING 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS.  CAN NOT RULE OUT A SPRINKLE OR TWO ESPECIALLY 
SOUTH MONDAY...BUT LIFT LOOKS WEAK ENOUGH TO LEAVE FORECAST DRY FOR 
NOW.  WITH EXPECTED CLOUDS...WILL GENERALLY GO A BIT ABOVE GFS MOS 
TEMPS TONIGHT.  STILL SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR FREEZE WARNING...SO 
WILL LEAVE NPW AS IS.  SOME RECORDS LOWS IN DANGER AS 
WELL...ESPECIALLY AT CHA AND TRI. 


.LONG TERM...MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SLOW WARMING TREND 
STILL ON TRACK PER LATEST MODEL AND ENSEMBLE DATA. HOWEVER...APPEARS 
MONDAY NIGHT WILL STILL BE UNSEASONABLY COLD WITH TEMPS GENERALLY 
BELOW FREEZING ACROSS THE AREA. A WEAK UPPER WAVE WILL TRANSLATE  
THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT BUT MOISTURE IS LACKING AND LIFT WEAK 
TO NON-EXISTENT PER MODEL TIME-HEIGHTS. THUS NOT ANTICIPATING ANY 
PRECIP WITH THIS FEATURE AND SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT GFS GUIDANCE POPS. 
PRECIP CHANCES INCREASE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS NEXT SYSTEM 
APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. KEPT POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY HOWEVER 
AS FEATURE DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE PARTICULARLY WELL ORGANIZED. AFTER 
A BRIEF RESPITE ON FRIDAY...ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES ON SATURDAY. 
THIS SYSTEM APPEARS BETTER ORGANIZED THAN THE WEDNESDAY SYSTEM. 
HOWEVER...TIMING UNCERTAINTIES PRECLUDE GOING WITH POPS ANY HIGHER 
THAT CHANCE AT THIS TIME. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED GFS ENSEMBLE 
MEAN GUIDANCE. TEMPS ARE PROJECTED TO MODERATE TO ABOVE CLIMO BY 
LATE WORK WEEK BEFORE ANOTHER COOLING TREND NEXT WEEKEND.

FROM THE WEST BUT SHOULD ONLY SKIRT ACROSS S PART OF MRX CWA.

.DISCUSSION...DRIER AIR SLOWLY REPLACING THE MOIST LAYER JUST ABOVE

FORECAST MINS LOOK GOOD. WILL UPDATE FREEZE WARNING AND MAKE A FEW 
COSMETIC CHANGES TO ZONE FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EDT SAT APR 7 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTHEAST WILL 
SLOWLY LIFT NORTHEAST AWAY FROM THE AREA TONIGHT AND 
SUNDAY...ALLOWING HEIGHTS TO BEGIN TO RISE OVER OUR AREA. CLOUDS 
DIMINISHING OVER THE AREA AS EXPECTED...AND WITH LOW LEVEL FLOW 
FORECAST TO BE MORE WESTERLY TONIGHT THAN LAST NIGHT ANTICIPATE LESS 
LOW CLOUDINESS TONIGHT.  SOME HIGH CLOUDS MAY MOVE IN TONIGHT 
ESPECIALLY SOUTH...BUT OVERALL WITH WEAKENING WINDS AND LESS IN THE 
WAY OF CLOUDS TONIGHT WILL BE QUITE COLD...AND EXPECT RECORD LOWS TO 
BE REACHED FOR ALL OF OUR REPORTING SITES.  SUNDAY SHOULD BE A BIT 
WARMER THAN TODAY...BUT STILL WELL BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR. RED FLAG WARNING FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING IS 
MARGINAL...BUT WILL LET IT REMAIN AS IS FOR NOW.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SLOW WARMING TREND IN 
STORE AS BROAD EASTERN CONUS UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO DRIFT NORTHEAST
AND AWAY FROM THE REGION. THIS WILL ALLOW HEIGHTS TO CONTINUE TO
RISE MODESTLY THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...TEMPS WILL
STILL AVERAGE BELOW CLIMO UNTIL AT LEAST THE LATTER PART OF THE
LONG TERM.

MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AND ENSEMBLES APPEAR TO BE COMING INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT ON TIMING NEXT SIGNIFICANT EVENT BY MID-WEEK. APPEARS MAIN 
EVENT WILL BE ON WEDNESDAY WITH SCATTERED PRE-FRONTAL PRECIP 
POSSIBLE TUESDAY NIGHT. GENERALLY FAVORED GFS ENSEMBLE GUIDANCE FOR 
POPS. ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHES BY NEXT SATURDAY PER MODEL AND 
ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS AFTER A DRY LATE WORK WEEK.

.SHORT TERM UPDATE

UPDATE TO ISSUE SNOW ADVISORY FOR TN MNTS. BANDS OF MODERATE SNOWFALL
WILL RESULT IN LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS. HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD SEE A FEW 
INCHES THIS MORNING.

 (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS AND 
FLURRIES SHOULD TAPER OFF QUICKLY THIS MORNING. ANTICYCLONIC 
CURVATURE ALREADY TAKING SHAPE AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN THROUGH 
TONIGHT. UPSTREAM SINGLE DIGIT DPS WILL WORK THERE WAY INTO THE AREA 
WITH GOOD MIXING EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON. UPGRADED WATCH TO A RED 
FLAG WARNING FOR MARGINAL YET POTENTIALLY DANGEROUS FIRE CONDITIONS. 
EASTER MORNING 2007 MAY VERY WELL SET NEW RECORD LOWS FOR APRIL. CAA 
BEGINS TO WEAKEN HOWEVER LESS CLOUDS AND SOME DECOUPLING WILL ALLOW 
TEMPS TO DRIVE HARD TONIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
830 PM EDT FRI APR 6 2007

.DISCUSSION...VORT DROPPING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
EVENING WITH SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WITH SOME FLURRIES IN LOWER 
ELEVATIONS IN THIS AREA. WILL RAISE POPS ACROSS THIS AREA AND USE 
THE SNOW SHOWER WORDING FOR HIGHER TERRAIN AND ADD SOME FLURRIES 
ELSEWHERE. ACCUMULATION IN THE EARLY STAGES EVEN IN THE TERRAIN 
APPEARS TO BE MAINLY ON THE GRASS THANKS TO A NICE PERIOD OF WARMTH 
IN THE PAST COUPLE WEEKS. QUITE A BIT OF VIRGA APPARENT WITH RATHER 
EXTENSIVE RADAR RETURNS AND WITH LITTLE PRECIP REPORTED AT THE 
SURFACE ACROSS MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA. THERE MAY 
BE A SNOW FLURRY HERE AND THERE OVER MUCH OF THE NON MOUNTAINOUS 
PART OF THE FORECAST AREA EVEN THOUGH TEMPS ARE STILL SEVERAL 
DEGREES ABOVE FREEZING AND MAY ADD A FLURRY. DUE TO THE SPEED OF THE 
SYSTEM...DONT BELIEVE FLURRIES WILL BE AROUND FOR TOO LONG TONIGHT.
WILL SHIP FREEZE WARNING BACK OUT AS TEMPS END UP WELL BELOW 
FREEZING. FIRE WEATHER WATCH ALREADY IN PLACE FOR SATURDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 PM EDT FRI APR 6 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD HIGH PRESSURE IS 
BUILDING SOUTHEAST FROM THE PLAINS FROM SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA WHILE 
AT THE SAME TIME A COLD UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IS SPINNING OVER EASTERN 
CANADA AND SENDING VORTICITY LOBES AROUND IT INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. A 
STRONGER LOBE/SHORTWAVE SHOULD CLIP NE TN AND SW VA LATER THIS 
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT AND BRING A CHANCE FOR SNOW TO THAT AREA. NAM 
MODEL GIVES THE AREA AROUND 2 INCHES OF SNOW OVERNIGHT BUT DECIDED 
THAT WAS A BIT OVERDONE AND LEFT ABOUT AN INCH IN THE GRIDS IN THE 
EXTREME NE. SOME HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS IN THE NE COULD GET A LITTLE 
MORE. WILL GO WITH LOWS TONIGHT SEVERAL DEGREES COLDER THAT THIS 
MORNING BUT STAY ON THE HIGHER END OF GUIDANCE. CLOUDS AND WINDS  
WILL AGAIN BE A FACTOR AS IT WAS THIS MORNING WITH TEMPERATURES 
POSSIBLY NOT DROPPING TO CURRENT FORECAST. RELATIVE HUMIDITIES DROP 
TO BELOW 25 PERCENT WITH THE COLD DRY AIR AND WINDS WILL PICK UP TO 
15 TO 20 MPH BEHIND TONIGHTS SYSTEM SO HAVE ISSUED A FIRE WEATHER 
WATCH FOR SATURDAY ALL AREAS. WILL LET MIDNIGHT SHIFT DECIDE WHETHER 
TO GO WITH A WARNING.   

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...GENERALLY DRY WEATHER 
WITH SLOWLY MODERATING TEMPS IN STORE THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. STILL 
APPEARS THAT RECORD LOW TEMPS WILL BE IN JEOPARDY FOR BOTH SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY. STILL SOME TIMING UNCERTAINTIES WITH NEXT SIGNIFICANT 
EVENT WHICH APPROACHES BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. GFS SOMEWHAT 
FASTER THAN PREVIOUS RUN...WHILE CANADIAN STILL PROJECTS MAIN EVENT 
FOR WEDNESDAY. GFS ENSEMBLES PROJECT MAIN EVENT WILL OCCUR BETWEEN 
06Z AND 18Z WEDNESDAY. DUE TO THIS UNCERTAINTY...OPTED TO MAKE NO 
CHANGES TO PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST WITH RESPECT TO POPS. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES CLOSELY. TEMPS ARE 
PROJECTED TO MODERATE TO NEAR CLIMO BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 AM EDT FRI APR 6 2007

.DISCUSSION...HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS MOVED INTO THE EASTERN 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AFTER MIDNIGHT THIS 
MORNING WHICH KEPT SOME TEMPERATURES FROM DROPPING BELOW FREEZING. 
HOWEVER LOOKING AT RAWS SITES ALMOST ALL REPORTED TEMPERATURES BELOW 
32. TEMPERATURES HAVE NOW WARMED TO FREEZING AND ABOVE SO AM 
CANCELING THE FREEZE WARNING FOR THE MORNING. HIGH AND MID LEVEL 
CLOUDINESS SHOULD CONTINUE TO STREAM ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FROM 
THE WEST AND NORTHWEST. THE CLOUDS IN SOUTHERN AREAS ARE AHEAD OF A 
WEAK SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND CLOUDS MAY MOVE DOWN 
FROM THE NORTH AROUND UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER EASTERN CANADA AND THE 
EASTERN GREAT LAKES. SLOWED TIMING OF WEAK SYSTEM LATE TODAY AND 
LOWERED RAIN CHANCES ABOUT 5 PERCENT FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST. UPDATE 
OUT SOON. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE
TN...NONE
VA...NONE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT FRI APR 6 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE TO CURRENT FORECAST. 
LARGE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGES FROM CANADA THROUGH THE CENTRAL 
U.S. INTO THE GULF OF MEXICO. STRENGTHENING MID LEVEL JET WILL MOVE 
EAST INTO THE MRX CWA TODAY BRINGING MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS. SOME 
VIRGA MAY BE PRESENT AS THIS FEATURE PUSHES IN. THE JET CORE WILL 
SHIFT SOUTH OVER THE SOUTHERN TN VLY TONIGHT. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
WILL INCREASE IN NW FLOW THIS EVENING. A GOOD CHUNK OF THIS MOISTURE 
WILL BE COLDER THAN -10C SO GOOD WINTER-LIKE SNOW FORMATION IS 
EXPECTED. SNOW FALL SHOULD BE LIGHT AND LIMITED TO NE PORTIONS OF 
MRX CWA. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN WELL BELOW NORMAL. APRIL 7 SAT 
MORNING RECORD LOWS ... NORMAL
CHA 28 1952 ... 45
TYS 26 1950 ... 44
OQT 25 1952 ... 42
TRI 21 1982 ... 40

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD CANADIAN SURFACE HIGH 
WILL BE THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...PROVIDING 
GENERALLY DRY AND COOL CONDITIONS.  HOWEVER...A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES 
ROTATING AROUND AN UPPER LOW WELL TO OUR NORTH MAY BRING IN 
OCCASIONAL CLOUDS.  THERE IS A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE A STRAY SHOWER MAY 
MOVE THROUGH BUT MAIN MOISTURE AND ENERGY STAY WELL NORTH AND CHANCE 
TOO LOW AND WILL NOT MENTION IN FORECAST.  THERE REMAINS MUCH 
INCONSISTANCY WITH INCOMING SYSTEM AROUND THE TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY TIME 
FRAME...ESCPECIALLY IN TIMING AND TRACK.  WILL TREND GRIDS TOWARDS 
CURRENT GFP RUN BUT CONFIDENCE REMAINS QUITE LOW.   A WARMING TREND 
BY THE END OF THE WEEK WILL PUT ASSOCATED PRECIP AS RAIN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT THU APR 5 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER CENTRAL 
CANADA...AND EXTENDING SOUTH OVER MOST OF THE UNITED STATES. THIS 
UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT WITH NORTHWEST WINDS. IN FACT...RECORD LOWS COULD BE 
BROKEN TOMORROW MORNING ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA (EXCEPT 
SOUTHEAST TN). RECORDS LOWS FOR TOMORROW MORNING INCLUDE CHA (27)... 
TYS (29)...OQT (29) AND TRI (27). SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL THAT 
CLOUDS HAVE SCATTERED ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON...BUT HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD GRADUALLY INCREASE LATE TONIGHT 
INTO FRIDAY...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE MIDDLE OF 
THE NATION. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL 
PRODUCE SOME LIGHT PRECIP ACROSS MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA (INCLUDING THE SMOKIES). TEMPS WILL LIKELY BE TOO WARM 
IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS FOR MUCH SNOW...BUT THINK THAT A LIGHT 
DUSTING OF UP TO AN INCH WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET. IT APPEARS THAT FREEZE WARNINGS WILL 
LIKELY HAVE TO BE ISSUED FOR SEVERAL CONSECUTIVE MORNINGS THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DRY BUT USEASONABLY COOL
WEATHER REGIME EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND INTO
EARLY NEXT WEEK. NEXT SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM APPROACHES BY LATE
TUESDAY/EARLY WEDNESDAY PER MEDIUM RANGE MODEL AND ENSEMBLE
CONSENSUS...WITH THE HIGHEST PROBABILITY PROJECTED BETWEEN 12Z
WEDNESDAY AND 06Z THURSDAY. HOWEVER...SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES IN
TIMING AND PLACEMENT OF SYSTEM DECREASES CONFIDENCE SOMEWHAT. FOR
TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE SINCE THERE WAS NO CLEAR
SIGNAL IN THE ENSEMBLE DATA TO SUGGEST OTHERWISE. WIDER-THAN-AVERAGE
SPREAD AMONG ENSEMBLE MEMBERS PRECLUDED MUCH HELP BY LATE IN THE
LONG TERM PERIOD HOWEVER.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER CENTRAL CANADA AND EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS MOST OF THE 
UNITED STATES...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY AND EXTENDING SOUTH ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. 
THESE CLOUDS WILL LIKELY LINGER FOR AWHILE OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL PLAN TO BE A LITTLE MORE PESSIMISTIC 
WITH SKY CONDITIONS IN THESE AREAS. 

OTHERWISE...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK. WILL GO AHEAD AND 
UPGRADE THE FREEZE WATCH FOR TONIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING TO A FREEZE 
WARNING...SINCE IT APPEARS LIKELY THAT FREEZING TEMPS WILL OCCUR 
ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 AM EDT THU APR 5 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)... 
CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE A COUPLE DEGREES ABOVE THE PREVIOUS
FORECAST...SO THE FREEZE AREA MAY NOT BE AS EXTENSIVE AS THE
CURRENT WARNING INDICATES...HOWEVER AT THIS POINT WILL LEAVE THE
WARNING AS IS. LOW CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH COLD ADVECTION WILL
AFFECT OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES THIS MORNING. HOWEVER THE LAYER OF
MOISTURE IS QUITE THIN PER 00Z BNA SOUNDING AND AREA ACARS
SOUNDINGS...SO THE CLOUDS WILL LIKELY BECOME SCATTERED WITH DAYTIME
MIXING. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL BE WEAKER TONIGHT...SO WITH
LIGHTER WINDS AND CONTINUED COLD ADVECTION THROUGH THE DAY...TEMPS
SHOULD DROP TO NEAR FREEZEING OR BELOW ACROSS THE AREA. WILL KEEP
THE FREEZE WATCH AS IS FOR TONIGHT...MAINLY TO AVOID CONFUSION WITH
TWO WARNINGS.

A CLIPPER DIVES SOUTHEAST OUT OF CENTRAL CANADA ON FRIDAY. POSITIVE
VORTICITY ADVECTION...UPPER DIFFLUENCE AT THE NOSE OF THE POLAR
JET...AND VERY COLD TEMPS ALOFT SHOULD PRODUCE SCATTERED SHOWERS IN
THE NORTH AND IN THE MOUNTAINS FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY
NIGHT. VERY STEEP LAPSE RATES AND AN UPSLOPE FLOW AROUND 30 KTS
WILL FAVOR MOUNTAIN LOCATIONS FOR SOME SNOW SHOWERS. WILL LEAN MORE
TOWARD THE HIGHER POPS OF THE MAV VS. THE DRIER MET. A VERY COLD AIR
MASS BUILDS INTO THE AREA ON SATURDAY BEHIND THE SYSTEM...AND LOWS
WILL LIKELY BREAK RECORDS OVER THE WEEKEND.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE THROUGH MONDAY AS A TROUGH
REMAINS OVER THE EAST COAST. A RIDGE BEGINS TO BUILD ON
TUESDAY...RESULTING IN A WARMING TREND. ADVECTION OF LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE INTO THE AREA BEGINS TUESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF A CLOSED LOW
THAT FORMS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS IN FOR
WEDNESDAY WITH THIS SYSTEM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
841 PM EDT WED APR 4 2007

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST SATELLITE AND OBSERVATIONS SHOWING LOW STRATUS CLOUDS ACROSS 
KENTUCKY WILL STAY NORTH OF MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT...
EXCEPT FOR PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. HOWEVER...THIN CI/CS CLOUDS
ARE MOVING ACROSS MOST OF TENNESSEE...BUT MODELS SHOW HIGH CLOUDS
REMAINING THIN AND MAINLY SOUTH OF THE REGION TONIGHT. END RESULT...
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT. WINDS HAVE STARTED TO DECOUPLE WITH SPEEDS
GENERALLY BETWEEN 5 AND 10 MPH. I AM CONCERNED THAT CONTINUED DECOUPLING
WILL OCCUR OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY SHELTERED VALLEYS...THAT WILL ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO DROP A LITTLE MORE THAN PREVIOUSLY ANTICIPATED.

HAVE LOWERED MINS MOST LOCATIONS BY A CAT AND HAVE EXPANDED FREEZE
WARNING TO COVER THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AND MOST OF THE
SOUTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES FOR TONIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 041933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 PM EDT WED APR 4 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...COLDER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO 
PUSH INTO THE REGION TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  BIG QUESTION IS HOW 
MUCH IN THE WAY OF LOW CLOUDS MAKE IT INTO OUR AREA.  RIGHT NOW 
EXPECT CLOUDS TO INCREASE OVER NORTHERN AREAS TONIGHT...PERHAPS AS 
FAR SOUTH AS SOME CENTRAL ZONES.  EXPECT CLOUDS WILL RETREAT ONCE 
AGAIN DURING THE DAY TOMORROW. OTHER ISSUE IS FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES.  AFTER MAKING SOME CALLS...IT HAS BEEN DECIDED TO 
START THE FREEZE PROGRAM NOW INSTEAD OF WAITING FOR THE NORMAL 
CLIMATOLOGICALLY BASED DATES DUE TO THE RECENT EXTENDED PERIOD OF 
VERY WARM TEMPS AND HOW FAR ALONG VEGETATION IS AT THIS POINT.  
TEMPERATURES IN THE VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL PROBABLY NOT REACH 
CRITERIA TONIGHT...BUT TEMPERATURES OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
SHOULD DIP WELL INTO THE 20S.  WILL ISSUE FREEZE WARNING FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE NORTHERN PLATEAU FOR 
TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...TROUGH WILL
CONTINUE ACROSS EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY THROUGH THE WEEKEND
WITH MUCH BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH EASTER. LOWS THURSDAY
NIGHT/FRIDAY MORNING SHOULD DROP BELOW FREEZING IN ALL AREAS AS
COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES WITH SURFACE HIGH DROPPING SOUTHEAST
FROM CANADA INTO NORTHERN PLAINS. HAVE ISSUED FREEZE WATCH FOR
THURSDAY NIGHT. RIDGING CONTINUES ACROSS THE WESTERN STATES WITH
SYSTEM MOVING OVER IT INTO THE CENTRAL US FRIDAY WITH MOISTURE
MOVING EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY. GFS DEEPENS TROUGH OVER THE EAST
LATE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY AND A SHORTWAVE MAY PRODUCE A LITTLE RAIN
AND SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY ACROSS THE NE SECTION OF THE FORECAST
AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. SKIES CLEAR AGAIN SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
WITH LOWS STILL DROPPING INTO THE 20S WITH HARD FREEZES. PATTERN
FINALLY CHANGES EARLY NEXT WEEK AS TROUGH SHIFTS EAST AND UPPER
FLOW FLATTENS OUT. A SIGNIFICANT LOW DEVELOPS ACROSS THE CENTRAL US
BY MID WEEK INCREASING THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND PROBABLY THUNDERSTORMS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  37  57  32  54  29 /   0   0  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    33  54  29  49  25 /   0   0  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            33  55  28  50  25 /   0   0  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   34  51  25  47  23 /  10  10  10  20  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FREEZE WATCH FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     FREEZE WARNING FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 10 AM EDT THURSDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 041050
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
650 AM EDT WED APR 4 2007

DISCUSSION...DROPPED POPS THIS MORNING AS PRECIP IS WELL TO THE 
SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
COLD FRONT ADVANCING AT A RAPID PACE ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND NOW 
MOVING TOWARD THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WITH SWATH 
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS STRETCHING FROM SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. RAIN WILL END 
ACROSS THE REGION EARLY THIS MORNING AS COOLER AND DRIER AIR FILLS 
IN BEHIND FRONT. UPPER LEVEL TROUGHING STRENGTHENS ACROSS MUCH OF 
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS SOUTH FROM CANADA INTO THE DEEP SOUTH. PLENTY OF 
COLD AIR ADVECTION TO SEND TEMPERATURES TUMBLING TO CHILLY 20 TO 25 
DEGREE BELOW NORMAL VALUES WITH THE COLDEST PERIOD FRIDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY. THERE WILL EVEN BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SNOW SHOWERS IN THE 
TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSSEE AND THE 
SMOKY MOUNTAINS FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT AS A SHORT WAVE TROF ROUNDS 
THE BASE OF MASSIVE UPPER LEVEL TROF. TEMPERATURES REBOUND GRADUALLY 
LATE IN THE LONG TERM FORECAST PERIOD AS UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES 
ZONAL AND PACIFIC TROF PRESSES EAST. STAYED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
A SHOWER TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF 
APPROACHING TROF.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  67  38  57  33  53 /  10   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  64  35  53  28  50 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  63  34  53  28  49 /  10  10  10  10  10

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 040125
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EDT TUE APR 3 2007

.DISCUSSION...PREFRONTAL TROUGH CONTINUES JUST W OF MRX CWA. 
CONVECTIVELY INDUCED PRESSURE COUPLET DROPPING SE INTO TROUGH FROM 
KY. EXPECT SCT POSSIBLE SVR CONVECTIVE THIS EVENING ALONG CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. DECENT INSTABILTY AXIS AND INCREASING LOW LEVEL SSW JET
BUILD INTO THE AREA FM THE SW AROUND MIDNIGHT. HAVE INCREASED POPS 
TO CATEGORICAL OVERNIGHT FOR WIDESPREAD CONVECTION ALONG SOUTHEASTWARD
MOVING FRONT. UPDATE TO ADD TOR WATCH #117 FOR SW AREAS. TSTM WATCH
PSBL SOON NE AREAS. SON  


PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT.  AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A LINE OF CONVECTION 
HAS FORMED WILL WILL TRACK EAST ACROSS THE MRX CWA THIS 
EVENING/OVERNIGHT.  STRONGEST LIS...CAPE ETC WILL BE WEST OF OUR 
AREA.  HOWEVER...SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY PARAMETERS AS WELL AS 
MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE OVER THE REGION TO CONTINUE THE CONVECTION 
THROUGH OUR AREA.  SOME OF THESE STORMS MAY REACH SEVERE LEVELS.    
AN SPS HAS BEEN ISSUED TO NOTIFY OF THE POTENTIAL.  ADDITIONALLY... 
WINDS WILL INCREASE WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...WITH BREEZY TO 
LOCALLY WINDY CONDITIONS EXPECTED.  THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
FAIRLY QUICKLY OVERNIGHT WITH A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS 
POSSIBLE MAINLY EASTERN ZONES IN THE MORNING.  BEHIND THE FRONT... 
STRONG COLD ADVECTION WILL BRING IN MUCH COOLER AIR.  WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES ARE ONLY EXPECTED TO REACH INTO THE UPPER 50S 
TO MID 60S.

LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH TUES)...UPPER LOW FORECAST TO SHIFT 
EAST FROM THE GREAT LAKES...THEN REMAIN IN THE NEW ENGLAND VICINITY 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  COLD NORTHWEST FLOW WILL CONTINUE OVER OUR 
REGION DURING THIS TIME.  ONE SHORT WAVE MOVING DOWN IN NORTHWEST 
FLOW MAY INCREASE CLOUDINESS OVER THE AREA THU NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY...BUT APPEARS ANY PRECIP WILL STAY TO OUR WEST AND SOUTHWEST. 
OTHER PIECES OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND THE LOW SHOULD 
HAVE THE MOST IMPACT FURTHER NORTH. WHILE TIMING AND PLACEMENT OF 
THESE SHORT WAVE FEATURES IN UNCERTAIN...AND CERTAINLY CAN NOT RULE 
OUT POSSIBILITY OF SHOWERS/SNOW SHOWERS AT SOME POINT ESPECIALLY 
MOUNTAINS AND NORTH...CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ENOUGH AT THIS POINT TO 
INTRODUCE TO THE FORECAST SO WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR NOW THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND. A BIT OF A WARM UP SHOULD BEGIN ON MONDAY AS THE UPPER 
LOW DEPARTS AND COLD ADVECTION ENDS. A WEAK SYSTEM MAY AFFECT THE 
REGION BY TUESDAY...SO WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  57  65  38  60  33 /  70  20   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  63  36  55  31 /  70  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  53  62  32  56  30 /  70  20  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  52  59  31  51  27 /  70  40  10  10  10

.DISCUSSION...STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT.  
AHEAD OF THE FRONT...WE WILL SEE SUNNY WARM CONDITIONS THROUGH MUCH 
OF THE AFTERNOON.  LATE THIS AFTERNOON A LINE OF CONVECTION 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA.  
THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD REACH INTO THE MRX CWA DURING THE EVENING 
HOURS.  WITH DECENT INSTABILITY...CAPE AND SHEAR AND A 40KT 850MB 
JET THERE IS A POTENTIAL FOR STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS DURING 
THE EVENING.  AN SPS HAS BEEN ISSUE COVERING THE SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS THREAT.  ALL IN GOOD SHAPE IN CURRENT FORECAST...NO 
UPDATES ANTICIPATED.



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 030720
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 AM EDT TUE APR 3 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...
HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SUBTROPICAL JET OVER THE TX COAST 
WILL SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING. AS THE JET TRANSLATES EAST 
THERE SHOULD BE PLENTY OF SUNSHINE BY THE AFTERNOON...AND HIGHS 
SHOULD REACH THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S IN THE VALLEY. SURFACE 
DEWPOINTS BEGIN TO RISE WITH A STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF 
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. EXPECT THAT 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP NEAR THE MS VALLEY IN THE AFTERNOON AND 
TRACK EAST...REACHING THE PLATEAU BY THE EVENING. UPPER DIVERGENCE 
BETWEEN THE SUBTROPICAL JET AND POLAR JET IS MAXIMIZED AROUND 03Z 
WHILE THE 850 MB JET INCREASES TO AROUND 40 KTS. ALTHOUGH THE BEST 
INSTABILITY WILL BE TO OUR WEST IN THE AFTERNOON...SBCAPE REMAINS 
NEAR 1000 J/KG IN THE EVENING...AND THE STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL JET 
PRODUCES 0-1 KM SHEAR AROUND 30 KTS. COMPOSITE PARAMETERS SUCH AS 
EHI AND SCP SUGGEST SUPERCELLS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE EVENING IN 
THE PLATEAU...WITH LARGE HAIL THE MOST LIKELY THREAT...AND AN 
ISOLATED TORNADO POSSIBLE. SPC HAS PLACED THE WESTERN HALF OF THE 
AREA IN A SLIGHT RISK...AND WILL ISSUE AN SPS FOR THAT AREA TO 
HIGHLIGHT THE THREAT OF SEVERE WEATHER. THE COLD FRONT MOVES QUICKLY 
THROUGH THE AREA BETWEEN 10Z AND 14Z...AND WILL END POPS ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE AREA BY 14Z WEDNESDAY. COLD ADVECTION BEHIND THE FRONT WILL 
LIKELY PREVENT MUCH OF A RISE IN TEMPERATURES ON WEDNESDAY...WITH 
LOWS TUESDAY NIGHT IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S AND HIGHS WEDNESDAY IN 
THE LOWER TO MID 60S. WITH CLEAR SKIES...TEMPS WEDNESDAY NIGHT COULD 
FALL BELOW FREEZING...MAINLY IN THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER LOW MIGRATES STEADILY 
EAST THROUGH THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES INTO NEW ENGLAND THROUGH 12Z 
FRIDAY BUT THEN ITS PROGRESS COMES TO A HALT AND REMAINS IN THE 
VICINITY UNTIL SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY TIME FRAME. THIS PROVIDES FOR 
PLENTY OF COLD AIR ADVECTION WITH MINOR SHORTWAVE FEATURES DROPPING 
SOUTH OUT OF CANADA. MUCH OF THE IMPACT ASSOCIATED WITH THESE WAVES 
APPEARS TO AFFECT MAINLY POINTS NORTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
INCLUDING THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WHERE 
MOISTURE IS A LITTLE DEEPER. STAYED JUST BELOW 15 PERCENT POP DURING 
THIS PERIOD AWAITING LATER MODEL RUNS FOR BETTER FOCUS ON WEEKEND 
SITUATION. EDGED TEMPS DOWN A BIT ACCORDING TO NEW MEX MOS GUIDANCE 
WHICH FEATURES TEMPS 15 TO 20 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  82  59  66  36  59 /  40  70  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  81  59  63  35  54 /  30  70  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  81  58  63  32  57 /  40  70  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  78  56  60  32  52 /  20  70  20  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 021904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON APR 2 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE AREA WEATHER TONIGHT 
PROVIDING CLEAR SKIES AND MILD WEATHER.  A COLD FRONT WILL BE 
APPROACHING THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  WILL SEE CLOUDS INCREASE...BUT 
ASSOCIATED PRECIP SHOULD NOT REACH INTO THE AREA DURING THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS.   HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE WITH SOME LOW POPS 
TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO COVER ANY CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS OUT AHEAD OF 
THE FRONT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...

FLATTENING UPPER RIDGE GOES ZONAL BY LATE TUESDAY NIGHT WITH COLD 
FRONT MOVING IN FROM NORTHWEST. GFS AND NAM APPEAR TO MOSTLY AGREE 
ON TIMING OF FROPA DURING THE WEE HOURS OF WEDNESDAY MORNING, BUT 
THEIR DEPICTIONS OF THE STRENGTH OF THE UVV ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
FRONT DIFFER DRAMATICALLY. THE GFS IS NOTICABLY WEAKER THAN THE NAM, 
WHICH ITSELF APPEAR WAY TOO STRONG. WILL THEREFORE GO WITH A BLEND 
OF THE TWO (LEANING MORE TOWARD THE NAM) ON THE STRENGTH OF THE 
SYSTEM, AND THE NAM ON TIMING.

THIS ALL MEANS THAT POPS WILL QUICKLY INCREASE TUESDAY EVENING INTO 
WEDNESDAY MORNING, WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THE CALL. HOWEVER, 
THE MAIN INSTABILITY (-8 LIS AND 352 SFC THETA E) REMAIN WAY BACK 
OUT WEST OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY AND EVEN AROUND THE ARKLATEX 
REGION. AS THE SYSTEM MOVES EAST, WE GET SOME DECREASE IN OUR 
STABILITY, BUT THETA ES ONLY RISE TO THE UPPER 320S. RH IS NOT 
THAT IMPRESSIVE, EITHER. WILL CONSEQUENTLY RAISE POPS FROM THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF TUESDAY AFTERNOON RAPIDLY TO LIKELIES TUESDAY 
EVENING AND NIGHT, AND RAMP QUICKLY DOWN AGAIN WEDNESDAY MORNING, TO 
BASICALLY NADA WED AFTN. AMOUNTS WILL VARY, BEING MOSTLY LIGHT, BUT 
SOME SPOTS UNDER THE STRAY THUNDERSTORM WILL GET MODERATE TO VERY 
BRIEF HEAVY RAIN. NO FLOODING EXPECTED, BUT WE SURE NEED THE RAIN.

LATER, AS THE COLD AIR ADVECTION MOVES IN BEHIND THE FRONT, 
THICKNESSES DROP TO 540 DM ACROSS THE NORTH HALF OF FORECAST AREA BY 
THURSDAY, COLD ENOUGH TO SNOW, THEORETICALLY. HOWEVER...BIG 
HOWEVER...RH IS BASEMENT DRY ALL DAY THURSDAY. IT DOES INCREASE A 
LITTLE FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY BUT UVV IS LIMITED. CAVEAT: DURING THIS 
TIME, THICKNESS VALUES DROP TO 530 AS FAR SOUTH AS THE GEORGIA LINE, 
WITH 519 IN SOUTHWEST VA. H5 TEMPS ARE ALSO IN THE -20S CELSIUS, SO 
WOULD NOT RULE OUT SOME FLURRIES OR EVEN SNOW SHOWERS UP NORTH, BUT 
THAT IS ON THE METEOROLOGICAL HORIZON AND AM NOT WILLING TO CLIMB 
OUT ON THAT LIMB JUST YET. WILL PASS THIS INFO ON TO SUCCESSORS FOR 
FURTHER CONSIDERATION.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  58  81  58  66  34 /  10  30  60  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  56  80  56  64  33 /  10  20  60  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  56  80  55  64  33 /  10  20  60  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  52  78  54  62  30 /  10  20  60  30  10

AREA LATE TUESDAY.  DECENT MOISTURE AND LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH

TUESDAY AFTERNOON.  BEST CHANCES SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL TUESDAY 
NIGHT.  STILL PRETTY GOOD DYNAMICS WITH THE FRONT AS IT TRACKS 
THROUGH ON TUESDAY NIGHT...WILL BUMP UP POPS TO LIKELY FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT.  FRONT PUSHING EAST ON WEDNESDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR 
THE MORNING HOURS...DRY WEATHER RETURNS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.  AN 
UPPER LOW TRACKS TO THE NORTH OF THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND

FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  GFS SHOWING A SHORTWAVE 
APPROACHING THE REGION ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...BEST MOISTURE 
STAYS OUT OF OUR CWA...SO WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE 
APPROACHING THE REGION ON SATURDAY...BEST MOISTURE STAYS TO THE 
NORTH SO WILL KEEP SATURDAY DRY TOO.  DRY WEATHER CONTINUES INTO 
SUNDAY.  COOLER TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED ON THURSDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT SUN APR 1 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS CONTINUES TO SHOW A WEAK COLD FRONT REMAINING WELL WEST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA...GENERALLY OVER THE LOWER OHIO AND MS RIVER 
VALLEYS ALONG A LOUISVILLE TO MEMPHIS LINE. A VERY MOIST AIR MASS 
REMAINS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH HIGH DEWPOINTS IN THE 60S. 
LOCAL RADARS REVEAL THAT MOST OF THIS MORNINGS CONVECTION HAS 
EXITED THE FORECAST AREA...WITH ONLY ISOLATED SHOWERS LINGERING. GFS 
AND RUC MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE SOME SCATTERED CONVECTIVE 
REDEVELOPMENT LATER THIS AFTERNOON...AS THE LOCAL AIR MASS BECOMES 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE. IN FACT...LATEST MSAS DATA ALREADY REVEALS LIS 
OF -3 OVER SOUTHEAST TN. UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS APPEAR TO BE WEAK AS 
THE UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL. THUS...THINK THAT ANY CONVECTIVE 
REDEVELOPMENT WILL BE SCATTERED IN COVERAGE. MODELS ALSO INDICATE 
THE GREATEST AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY IN THE LOWER-LEVELS...ALONG WITH 
STRONG LOW-LEVEL HELICITY VALUES (100 TO 200 M2/S2). AS A 
RESULT...THINK THAT SOME SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE POSSIBLE LATER THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...ALONG WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A FEW ISOLATED 
TORNADOES. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO WASH-OUT OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA LATER TONIGHT...WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS CONTINUING ON MONDAY. AS A 
RESULT...WENT WARMER THAN GUIDANCE WITH TEMPS TONIGHT AND MONDAY... 
AS DEWPOINTS SHOULD ALSO REMAIN HIGH ALONG WITH MORE SUNSHINE 
EXPECTED ON MONDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS REMAIN SOMEWHAT 
INCONSISTENT WITH TIMING OF INCOMING SYSTEM LATE TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH BEST CHANCE OF FRONTAL PASSAGE AND 
ASSOCIATED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY NIGHT. UPPER LOW LIFTS OUT 
AND POSITIONED ITSELF WELL TO OUR NORTH ON THURSDAY...AND A SHORT 
WAVE TRACKS THROUGH TO OUR SOUTH AROUND THE FRIDAY TIME FRAME. THESE 
DO HAVE THE POTENTIAL OF GENERATING SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS...BUT MAIN 
MOISTURE AND LIFT APPEAR TO STAY OUT OF OUR AREA AT THIS TIME AND 
WILL THEREFORE...CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST THURSDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 AM EDT SUN APR 1 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE LOWER OHIO 
AND MS RIVER VALLEYS...WITH A VERY WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. CURRENT RADARS INDICATE A LARGE AREA OF RAIN WITH 
SOME EMBEDDED THUNDER OVER THE FORECAST AREA...AND THINK THIS AREA 
OF CONVECTION WILL SLOWLY EXIT THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY AFTERNOON. 
WITH THE COLD FRONT REMAINING WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON...THINK THAT SCATTERED CONVECTIVE REDEVELOPMENT WILL OCCUR 
BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. WATER VAPOR SATELLITE 
IMAGERY ALSO REVEALS A WELL-DEFINED MID-LEVEL DRY SLOT OVER WESTERN 
SECTIONS OF THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WHICH THE MODELS SUGGEST WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATER THIS AFTERNOON. AS A RESULT...A 
MARGINALLY (TO POSSIBLY MODERATELY) UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS EXPECTED TO 
DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS FRONT OVER THE FORECAST AREA...PARTICULARLY IN 
THE LOWER LEVELS. IN ADDITION TO THIS LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY...MODELS 
INDICATE ALOT OF LOW-LEVEL HELICITY THIS AFTERNOON (UP TO 200 
M2/S2)...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN. AS A RESULT...THINK THAT 
SOME ISOLATED TORNADOES MAY BE POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...AND HAVE UPDATED THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION 
THIS POSSIBILITY. 

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE TO 
REMOVE MORNING WORDING...AND TO RAISE TEMPS A LITTLE TO ACCOUNT FOR 
THE POSSIBILITY OF MORE SOLAR WARMING WITH SOME CLOUD BREAKS 
EXPECTED.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHOWER ACTIVITY HAS BEEN

WEAK SURFACE CONFLUENCE UNDER A MID LEVEL FRONT. WILL HAVE 
CATEGORICAL POPS THIS MORNING WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE SPLIT FRONT. 
WITH MARGINAL ELEVATED INSTABILITY...ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
REMAIN A POSSIBILITY THIS MORNING. RAIN CHANCES WILL DECREASE BY THE 
AFTERNOON AS MID LEVEL DRYING ENSUES BEHIND THE MID LEVEL 
FRONT...HOWEVER WITH THE SURFACE FRONT LAGGING WELL BEHIND AND 
PERHAPS A LITTLE SURFACE HEATING...THE INSTABILITY INCREASES THIS 
AFTERNOON. THUS EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO REDEVELOP THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH BEST CHANCES IN THE SOUTH WHERE INSTABILITY WILL BE 
A LITTLE HIGHER...BUT COVERAGE SHOULD REMAIN SCATTERED AS THE 
SYNOPTIC SCALE FORCING WILL BE WEAK. POPS LOWER TO A SLIGHT CHANCE 
IN THE EVENING...AND END AFTER MIDNIGHT. WITH THE FRONT REMAINING TO 
OUR WEST...BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE SHOULD BE PLENTIFUL...SO EXPECT A 
LOW STRATUS DECK TO FORM OVERNIGHT. 
...

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...FRONT PUSHING EAST OF THE 
AREA ON MONDAY.  NAM INDICATING SOME MOISTURE LINGERING INTO

ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA LATE TUESDAY.  DECENT MOISTURE AND 
LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH IT...ALONG WITH SOME INSTABILITY. WILL CONTINUE 
WITH 20 POPS FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT.  STILL PRETTY GOOD DYNAMICS WITH THE FRONT AS IT TRACKS 
THROUGH ON TUESDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP THE 50 POPS ON TUESDAY NIGHT.  
FRONT PUSHING EAST ON WEDNESDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR THE 
MORNING HOURS...DRY WEATHER RETURNS WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  AN UPPER LOW 
TRACKS TO THE NORTH OF THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY... 
BEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR 
THURSDAY.  GFS SHOWING A SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...BEST MOISTURE TO THE SOUTH OF OUR AREA 
SO WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE APPROACHING THE REGION 
ON SATURDAY...BEST MOISTURE STAYS TO THE WEST SO WILL KEEP SATURDAY  
DRY TOO.  COOLER WEATHER IS EXPECTED ON THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT SAT MAR 31 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE OZARK AND ARKLATEX REGION. 
CURRENT LOCAL RADARS ARE DEVOID OF ANY CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT WILL MAINTAIN A SLIGHT CHANCE POP AROUND 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS DUE TO THE LOCAL AIR MASS BECOMING SLIGHTLY 
UNSTABLE. WRF AND GFS MODELS SEEM TO BE COMING INTO BETTER AGREEMENT 
WITH A SLOWER EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THIS COLD FRONT TONIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY. BOTH MODELS SHOW THE COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING TIME FRAME ON 
SUNDAY. IT STILL APPEARS THAT STRONG CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY OVER THE 
WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS EVENING...WILL WEAKEN 
AS IT MOVES EAST TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT. 
ONLY WEAK INSTABILITY IS EXPECTED OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA...SO DONT THINK THERE WILL BE MUCH OF A SEVERE TSTORM THREAT 
OVERNIGHT. THE HIGHEST RAIN CHANCES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA APPEAR 
TO BE DURING THE MORNING HOURS AROUND SUNRISE...WITH SOME SCATTERED 
CONVECTIVE REDEVELOPMENT EXPECTED ALONG THE COLD FRONT IN THE LATE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. WRF AND GFS MODELS HAVE SOME 
DISAGREEMENT WITH THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE AVAILABLE IN THE AFTERNOON 
FOR REDEVELOPMENT ALONG THE COLD FRONT...BUT OVERALL...IT APPEARS 
THAT THERE WILL BE LESS CONVECTIVE COVERAGE IN THE AFTERNOON 
COMPARED TO THE INITIAL MORNING CONVECTION. IF ENOUGH WARMING OCCURS 
AND ENOUGH LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE LINGERS IN THE DRY SLOT BEHIND THE 
INITIAL MORNING CONVECTION...THINK THAT SOME SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE 
POSSIBLE WITH THE AFTERNOON CONVECTIVE REDEVELOPMENT. DRIER 
CONDITIONS RETURN BY MONDAY...WITH WARMER TEMPS SINCE WINDS REMAIN 
SOUTHWESTERLY AND SKIES CLEAR BEHIND THIS WEAK COLD FRONT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND HIGHER THAN GUIDANCE TONIGHT AND SUNDAY WITH HIGH 
DEWPOINTS...SOME DAYTIME BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER...AND A DELAYED 
FRONTAL PASSAGE EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...TIMING REMAINS IN QUESTION 
WITH A COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON 
TUESDAY. FRONTAL PASSAGE SHOULD PUSH THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY. WILL KEEP HIGHEST POPS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT. THE FRONT 
SHOULD EXIT THE AREA LATE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WITH DRY CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED WEDNESDAY NIGHT. COOLER AIR PUSHES IN BEHIND THE FRONT WITH 
AN UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH. THIS LOW MAY PRODUCE OCCASIONAL BANDS OF 
CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY A STRAY SHOWER OR TWO. FOR NOW...PRECIP CHANCES 
ARE MINIMAL AND WILL KEEP THINGS DRY THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT OVER THE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 AM EDT SAT MAR 31 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHOWERS THAT MOVED ACROSS SW VA 
EARLIER THIS EVENING HAVE DISSIPATED AS THEY MOVED INTO A MORE 
STABLE AIR MASS. SCATTERED TO BROKEN MID LEVEL CLOUDS BLANKET THE 
AREA...AND WILL LIKELY REMAIN THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY...BUT WARM 
ADVECTION WITH A STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW SHOULD PUSH TEMPS WELL 
INTO THE 70S THIS AFTERNOON. STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES AND MLCAPE 
NEAR 500 J/KG IN SW VA SHOULD LEAD TO SCATTERED TO ISOLATED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IN NORTHERN LOCATIONS AND IN ELEVATED AREAS. THE 
LOW LEVEL JET INCREASES TO 40-50 KTS OVERNIGHT...AND UPPER 
DIFFLUENCE INCREASES AS WELL AS THE RIDGE ALOFT MOVES EAST. THIS 
WILL BRING AN INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
OVERNIGHT...THOUGH INSTABILITY WILL BE MINIMAL WITH SURFACE HEATING 
LOST. TIME FRAME FOR CATEGORICAL POPS WILL BE 06Z TO 15Z WITH THE 
PASSAGE OF THE MID LEVEL FRONT...WHICH IS FOLLOWED BY DRYING ALOFT. 
THE SURFACE FRONT LAGS BEHIND...MOVING TO THE PLATEAU BY AFTERNOON 
AND STALLING THERE. SURFACE INSTABILITY INCREASES IN THE 
AFTERNOON...THOUGH THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS WILL BE QUITE DRY. WILL 
LOWER POPS TO A CHANCE SUNDAY AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...FRONT TRACKS TO THE EAST 
OF THE APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY NIGHT BRINGING DRIER WEATHER BY LATE 
SUNDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR THE EVENING HOURS THEN KEEP 
IT DRY AFTER MIDNIGHT.  NAM INDICATING SOME MOISTURE LINGERING INTO 
MONDAY MORNING...WILL FOLLOW GFS AND KEEP MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT 
DRY.  ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA LATE TUESDAY.  DECENT 
MOISTURE AND LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH IT...ALONG WITH SOME INSTABILITY. 
WILL CONTINUE WITH 20 POPS FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND CHANCE POPS FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT.  STILL PRETTY GOOD DYNAMICS WITH THE FRONT AS IT 
TRACKS THROUGH ON TUESDAY NIGHT...WILL BUMP UP POPS TO 50 PERCENT 
FOR TUESDAY NIGHT.  FRONT PUSHING EAST ON WEDNESDAY...WILL KEEP 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE MORNING HOURS...DRY WEATHER RETURNS WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.  COOLER AND DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 301853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT FRI MAR 30 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD AIR DAMMING WEDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
CAROLINAS...WITH DRY AIR ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...BUT DEWPOINTS 
ARE SLOWLY RISING WITH LIGHT SOUTHWEST FLOW. LOCAL RADARS ARE DEVOID 
OF ANY CONVECTION RIGHT NOW...BUT THINK SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION 
WILL BE POSSIBLE AS THE AIR MASS BECOMES SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE. LOCAL 
AIR MASS SHOULD AGAIN BECOME SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE TOMORROW...ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...SO WILL CONTINUE LOW CHANCE 
POPS FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE SHOWING SOME TIMING 
DIFFERENCES WITH THE PROGRESSION OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT THIS 
WEEKEND. WRF MODEL REVEALS A SLOWER MOVEMENT THAN THE GFS MODEL... 
WHICH SEEMS MORE REALISTIC SINCE THE MAIN UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS WITH 
THIS SYSTEM MOVE NORTH INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION. THE ABSENCE OF 
ANY STRONG UPPER-LEVEL PUSH FURTHER SOUTH SHOULD CAUSE THE COLD 
FRONT TO MOVE SLOWER TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...WITH 
FRONTAL PASSAGE PROBABLY NOT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING. AS A RESULT... 
EXPECT A SCENARIO WHERE CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY OVER THE WESTERN 
SECTIONS OF THE TN RIVER VALLEY MOVE (AND WEAKEN) INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT ON SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE 
REDEVELOPMENT AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. THE GFS MODEL IS INDICATING THAT CONVECTION WILL BECOME 
MORE WIDESPREAD OVER THE DEEP SOUTH ON SUNDAY...WHICH MAY LIMIT THE 
ACTUAL AMOUNT OF CONVECTION FURTHER NORTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
HOWEVER...THE WRF MODEL DOES NOT SUPPORT THIS SCENARIO...AND WILL 
MAINTAIN FORECAST CONSISTENCY FOR NOW BY KEEPING A MENTION OF LIKELY 
POPS ON SUNDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARD GFS GUIDANCE FOR 
TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...BUT WILL TREND HIGHER FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY WITH HIGH DEWPOINTS...EXTENSIVE CLOUDS...AND A DELAYED 
FRONTAL PASSAGE EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WILL HAVE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND 
WILL BE BETWEEN WEATHER SYSTEMS ON MONDAY. A COLD FRONT APPROACHES 
THE AREA LATE TUESDAY...BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. SOME CONVECTION MAY LINGER 
INTO WEDNESDAY AS THE FRONT EXITS THE REGION. AN UPPER LOW WILL BE 
TO OUR NORTH ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  THIS MAY GENERATE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF SOME SHOWERS OVER NORTHERN ZONES...BUT FEEL THIS CHANCE IS 
TOO LOW TO MENTION IN THE FORECAST AT THIS TIME.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN    56  79  60  73  53 /  10  20  60  60  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN      57  78  59  73  52 /  20  20  60  60  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN              56  78  59  73  52 /  20  20  60  60  30

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS COLD AIR DAMMING ACROSS THE 
CAROLINAS...WITH DRIER AIR IN THE FORECAST AREA COMPARED TO 
YESTERDAY. LOCAL RADARS REVEAL A FEW SHOWERS ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN 
NEAR THE REMNANTS OF A WEAK COLD FRONT. THETA-E ANALYSIS INDICATES 
THAT THIS DIFFUSE FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD BE ORIENTED FROM NORTH-TO- 
SOUTH OVER THE PLATEAU INTO SOUTHEAST TN. LIGHT SOUTHWEST WINDS ARE 
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP TODAY...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE BUILDING 
ACROSS THE REGION. AS A RESULT...THINK THAT TEMPS WILL BE A LITTLE 
WARMER THAN FORECAST...SO WILL PLAN TO RAISE MAXES A LITTLE. THIS 
SOUTHWEST FLOW SHOULD SLOWLY PUSH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...AND WITH SOME WEAK INSTABILITY 
PROGGED TO DEVELOP...WILL ADD A MENTION OF ISOLATED CONVECTION FOR 
THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 300759
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
359 AM EDT FRI MAR 30 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A BACKDOOR COLD FRONT APPEARS TO 
BE LOCATED BETWEEN TYS AND TRI THIS MORNING...WITH FALLING DEWPOINTS 
BEHIND THE FRONT TO THE NORTH. TO THE SOUTH...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE CAD WEDGE EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS IS PUSHING WEST 
ACROSS GA...AND ALL THE MODELS AGREE THAT THIS MOISTURE WILL 
PROGRESS NORTHWARD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS MORNING. HOW LONG 
THESE CLOUDS PERSIST WILL AFFECT THE TEMPERATURES. EXPECT SOME 
EROSION TO OCCUR BY THE AFTERNOON...BUT WENT SLIGHTLY BELOW MOS 
GUIDANCE...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S. THE FRONT WASHES OUT 
BY THE EVENING AND A SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS OVER THE AREA. THE 
MODELS SHOW A WEST TO EAST THETA-E GRADIENT ACROSS SW VA OVERNIGHT 
WITH LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE. THIS RESULTS IN SOME LIGHT QPF FROM THE 
MODELS...AND SOME HIGH POPS IN THE NORTH. THOUGH MOISTURE IS 
SUFFICIENT...THE MOS POPS APPEAR WAY TOO HIGH AS FORCING IS WEAK 
UNDER THE MIDLEVEL RIDGE. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN SW VA 
AND NRN TN COUNTIES OVERNIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MOISTURE INCREASING ACROSS 
OUR NORTHERN ZONES ON SATURDAY MORNING...WILL GO WITH LOW CHANCE 
POPS ACROSS OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES AND SLIGHT POPS IN THE CENTRAL AND 
DRY IN THE SOUTH.  A COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION LATE SATURDAY 
NIGHT.  THE GFS IS QUICKER THAN THE NAM IN BRINGING THE FRONT INTO 
OUR CWA.  PREFER THE SLOWER NAM AND WILL HOLD OFF HIGHEST POPS UNTIL 
SUNDAY WHEN BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT ARRIVES.  FRONT TRACKS TO THE 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY NIGHT BRINGING DRIER WEATHER BY 
LATE SUNDAY NIGHT.  DRY WEATHER CONTINUES INTO MONDAY AND MONDAY 
NIGHT.  ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA LATE TUESDAY.  DECENT 
MOISTURE AND LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH IT...ALONG WITH SOME 
INSTABILITY...WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUES INTO 
THURSDAY.   


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT THU MAR 29 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...MODELS SHOWING FAIRLY TIGHT SFC 
PRES GRADIENT OVER MOUNTAINS AS BACKDOOR HIGH SLIPS IN FROM EAST. 
HOWEVER, SFC WINDS AT THIS TIME DO NOT MATCH UP WITH PICTURE MODELS 
PAINT OF VERY TIGHT GRADIENT OVER THE AREAS RAWS SITES OR ANY OTHER 
OBS LOCATIONS. BELIEVE THAT MODEL SFC PRES GRADIENT PICTURE IS 
THEREFORE OVERBLOWN. WILL DROP WIND SPEEDS A CAT EVERYWHERE 
OVERNIGHT. SLIGHT CHANCE POPS LOOK OK FOR OVERNIGHT PERIOD WITH 
SLIGHT DECREASE OF CLOUD COVER FROM CURRENT FORECAST. HAVE DROPPED 
OVERNIGHT LOWS A DEGREE OR TWO IN THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE 
AREA WITH DECREASED WIND SPEEDS AND FEWER CLOUDS. HAVE KEPT WINDS UP 
A LITTLE IN THE NORTHEAST SECTION WHERE THE EFFECTS OF THE WEAK COLD 
AIR DAMMING ARE MORE APPARENT, HENCE ALSO KEPT MIN TEMPS UP 
SLIGHTLY, MORE IN LINE WITH BLEND TEMPS AND PREVIOUS FORECAST.

.LONG TERM(FRIDAY NIGHT THOUGH THURSDAY)...UNSETTLED WEATHER THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND WITH THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE REGION SLOWLY SHIFTING 
EAST OVER THE AREA BY SUNDAY.  A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT WAVES MOVE 
THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY FOR SOME ISOLATED 
SHOWERS/CONVECTION.  A COLD FRONT PUSHES THROUGH ON SUNDAY FOR A 
BETTER CHANCE OF CONVECTION.  SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD END 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND WE WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS IN ZONAL FLOW ALOFT 
THROUGH EARLY TUESDAY.  THE DISCREPANCY WITH TIMING...BUT CURRENT 
THINKING IS THE NEXT FRONT SHOULD SLIDE IN TUESDAY AFTERNOON/TUESDAY 
NIGHT.  DRY WEDNESDAY WITH ANOTHER SYSTEM APPROACHING THE AREA FOR 
THURSDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 290709
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 AM EDT THU MAR 29 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER FLOW REMAINS QUITE AMPLIFIED 
OVER THE CONUS WITH DEEP TROUGHS ALONG THE NORTHEASTERN ATLANTIC 
COAST AND OVER THE INTERMOUNTAIN WEST. AMPLIFIED UPPER RIDGE EXTENDS 
FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO TO THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES REGION. AT THE 
SURFACE...A WEAK NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST ORIENTED FRONT CONTINUES TO 
SAG SLOWLY THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS FRONT MAY HAVE A 
DIFFICULT TIME PROGRESSING MUCH FARTHER AS BECOMES IMPEDED BY UPPER 
RIDGE. EVEN THOUGH THIS FRONT WILL BE LURKING IN OUR GENERAL 
AREA...FORCING APPEARS WEAK AND BELIEVE PRECIP WILL AGAIN BE MAINLY 
SCATTERED AND DIURNAL IN NATURE. AS A RESULT...SIGNIFICANTLY 
UNDERCUT GFS GUIDANCE (LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL) POPS IN THE FIRST 
PERIOD AND KEPT IN CHANCE CATEGORY. APPEARS COVERAGE WILL BE EVEN 
LESS IN THE SECOND PERIOD AS DIURNAL CONVECTION DISSIPATES AND UPPER 
RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE REGION.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS THE
REGION ON FRIDAY WITH COOLER TEMPS...BUT NOT BUYING THE 20 TO 60
PERCENT MOS POPS FOR FRI AND FRI NIGHT. CANT RULE OUT A VERY
ISOLATED SHOWER DURING PEAK HEATING...BUT SEEMED WISE TO KEEP
CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS AND NEIGHBORS FOR DRY WEATHER THOSE
PERIODS. 

NEXT SYSTEM FOR THE WEEKEND SEEMS GENERALLY ON TRACK WITH MODELS
CONSISTENT ON PERHAPS BEST RAIN CHANCES FIRST HALF OF SUNDAY...
BUT SEEMS STILL A BIT FAR OUT IN TIME TO JUSTIFY LIKELY POPS. 
A MINOR CHANGE WAS TO DROP LOW POPS ON MONDAY...GIVEN LATEST MOS
AND NEIGHBORING OFFICES ALSO DRY. THIS SEEMED A GOOD MOVE GIVEN
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND SOME DRYING BEHIND THE WEEKEND SYSTEM.

SHOWERS LOOK TO RETURN LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...WITH
OPERATIONAL GFS MODEL RUN ADVERTISING SOME MUCH COOLER 850 MB TEMPS
BEHIND THAT SYSTEM. HOWEVER...THIS MAY JUST EQUATE TO SLIGHTLY
BELOW CLIMO TEMPS BY WEDNESDAY AND ESPECIALLY ON THURSDAY. 

MAX AND MIN TEMPS WERE GENERALLY ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY EACH DAY TOWARD
THE 29/00Z GFSX MOS NUMBERS...AND SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS WERE ADDED
FOR THE NEW DAY 7 (THURSDAY).

.DISCUSSION...
DUE TO THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING...CONVECTION IS DISSIPATING

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 281918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT WED MAR 28 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ORIENTED GENERALLY ALONG A 
INDIANAPOLIS TO CHARLESTON WV LINE...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR 
MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. LOCAL RADARS REVEAL THAT SCATTERED 
CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND ADJACENT 
VALLEY AREAS...ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE AND 
DAYTIME HEATING. MOST OF THIS CONVECTION SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH 
WITH THE SETTING OF THE SUN...BUT THE PROXIMITY OF THE COLD FRONT TO 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN SHOULD HELP TO CONTINUE SCATTERED 
CONVECTION ACROSS THESE AREAS TONIGHT. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO 
CONTINUE SLOWLY MOVING SOUTH ON THURSDAY...WITH ADDITIONAL SCATTERED 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING ALONG IT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT THE AIR MASS WILL BE MORE STABLE ON THURSDAY...ALONG 
WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE BUILDING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
THUS...WILL KEEP POPS LOWER ON THURSDAY (COMPARED TO TODAY) ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO BUILD ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND COOLER TEMPS 
EXPECTED. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROF DRAGS A COLD 
FRONT TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY AND GRADUALLY RAISED POPS 
LEAVING THE MORNING DRY WITH WEST THROUGH EAST GRADIENT OF SLIGHT 
AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION POSSIBLY TRIGGERED BY WEAK 
DISTURBANCE AHEAD OF FRONT. RATCHET UP THE PROBABILITY FOR 
-SHRA/TSRA SATURDAY NIGHT WITH HIGHEST CHANCE POP ON SUNDAY WHEN 
FROPA OCCURS. TRIED TO KEEP MONDAY DRY BUT GFS KEEPS SOME WEAK 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY ALIVE IN THE WSW FLO ALOFT AND HPC BOUGHT INTO THIS 
IDEA. THUS SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR A -SHRA ON MONDAY. WAS ABLE TO KEEP 
MONDAY NIGHT DRY AWAITING ARRIVAL OF NEXT UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED 
SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM. USED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION IN 
THE WARM SECTOR ON TUESDAY AND RAISED TO LOW CHANCE TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY FOR SYSTEM FROPA. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
TEMPS IN THE LONG TERM.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 281404
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT WED MAR 28 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ORIENTED WEST-TO- 
EAST ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND WEST VIRGINIA...WITH 
UNSEASONABLY MILD TEMPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. CURRENT AREA 
RADARS REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION ACROSS MIDDLE TN ASSOCIATED 
WITH A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. THIS CONVECTION HAS BEEN ONLY 
SLOWLY MOVING NORTHEAST...AND THINK THAT IT WILL MAINLY STAY 
NORTHWEST OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT COULD AFFECT THE NORTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THE COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY IS 
PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE SOUTH TODAY...AND BE LOCATED AROUND SOUTHWEST 
VA BY SUNSET. THIS MOVEMENT MAY BE TOO QUICK CONSIDERING THERE IS 
NOT MUCH UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT TO PUSH THIS FRONT SOUTH. HOWEVER... 
WILL PLAN TO KEEP RAIN CHANCES HIGHER ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON...AND THE LATEST 12Z BNA SOUNDING ALREADY 
REVEALS A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS ACROSS MIDDLE TN. THUS... 
EXPECT SOME CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON WITH THE POTENTIAL 
FOR A FEW STRONG STORMS...BUT WILL LOWER RAIN CHANCES SOMEWHAT SINCE 
EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER THIS MORNING SHOULD HELP TO LIMIT THE AREAL 
COVERAGE OF THIS CONVECTION.

OVERALL...WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO LOWER POPS SOME 
AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 280736
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 AM EDT WED MAR 28 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAKENING UPPER WAVE STILL 
PROJECTED TO PASS THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE 
FIRST PERIOD. MODELS AND SREF GENERALLY AGREE THAT PRECIP COVERAGE 
WILL BE QUITE EXTENSIVE WITH THE GREATEST COVERAGE IN THE NORTHERN 
ZONES. HOWEVER...PRECIP AMOUNTS STILL DO NOT APPEAR VERY IMPRESSIVE 
AT THIS TIME. UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE EXITS AND UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
BACK IN DURING THE SECOND PERIOD. ANY LINGERING PRECIP WILL BE 
MAINLY CONFINED TO THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES BY LATE IN THE SECOND 
PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...EVEN THOUGH GFS GUIDANCE HAS BEEN RUNNING A 
LITTLE COOL RECENTLY...GENERALLY FOLLOWED THOSE VALUES CLOSELY 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS WIDESPREAD PRECIP SHOULD LIMIT DIURNAL 
WARMING SOMEWHAT.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MINOR POP ADJUSTMENTS
FOR THU MORNING AS WEAK FRONT SAGS SOUTH...RAISING POPS FOR JUST
THAT BRIEF PERIOD ACROSS SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN TO MESH BETTER
WITH LATEST MOS POPS. DONT EXPECT THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO BE THE
MAIN FOCUS FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT LATER THURSDAY...FAVORING THE
LOOK OF THE NAM-WRF FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THIS
SUPPORTS JUST SLIGHT CHANCE OR CHANCE POPS FOR THE REST OF THURSDAY
...AND KEEPING A DRY FORECAST FOR THURSDAY NIGHT. NRN AREAS WILL
NOTICE QUITE A COOLING OF HIGH TEMPS ON THU...WITH ONLY SLIGHT
CHANGES MADE TO PREVIOUS TEMP GRIDS FOR THU AND THU NIGHT.

RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS REGION QUICKLY AGAIN ON FRIDAY...THEN GIVES WAY
TO THE APPROACHING TROUGH AND COLD FRONT BY LATE SATURDAY. TIMING
OF THIS SYSTEM LOOKED CLOSE ENOUGH AT THIS POINT...SO NO CHANGES
MADE. MAX AND MIN TEMPS WERE GENERALLY ADJUSTED CLOSER TO LATEST
GFSX MOS GUIDANCE...BUT NOT COMPLETELY WHERE A BLEND OF OLD AND NEW
GUIDANCE PRODUCED CLOSER AGREEMENT WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES. 

OTHERWISE...SOME PRELIMINARY ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO TUE NIGHT AND
ADDED NEW DAY 7 (WED) GRIDS...WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS LATE TUE
NIGHT INTO WED. NEXT SHIFT CAN LOOK AT THIS AGAIN AND MAKE SOME
IMPROVEMENTS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
908 PM EDT TUE MAR 27 2007

.DISCUSSION...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PRODUCING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN WEST TN
AND MISSISSIPPI WIIL LIFT TO THE NORTHEAST AND CROSS OUR AREA LATE
TONIGHT AND TOMORROW MORNING. DESPITE THE LOSS OF SURFACE
HEATING...SURFACE INSTABILITY WILL REMAIN OVERNIGHT WITH MLCAPE
VALUES BETWEEN 500 AND 1000 J/KG FORECAST BY THE NAM AND THE RUC.
LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES ALSO REMAIN FAIRLY STEEP ABOVE THE SURFACE.
THUS THE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY TO OUR WEST SHOULD BE ABLE TO
SUSTAIN ITSELF OVERNIGHT. EXPECT THAT AS UPPER DIVERGENCE
INCREASES WITH THE APPROACH OF THE TROUGH...SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD INCREASE IN MIDDLE TN...WHICH WOULD GIVE THE
HIGHEST CHANCES OF RAIN TONIGHT IN THE PLATEAU COUNTIES. WILL
MENTION SCATTERED PRECIP THERE WITH ISOLATED IN THE VALLEY. TEMPS
APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK FOR LOWS MAINLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S.

NORTHEAST OUT OF THE PLAINS...ALONG WITH ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT
WILL BRING CHANCE FOR PRECIP DURING THE WEEKEND. STILL A LOT OF
UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING FOR THIS SYSTEM...BUT THINK GFS IDEA LOOKS
REASONABLE. WILL GO WITH POSSIBILITY OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS SAT
THROUGH SUNDAY...AND WILL HAVE HIGHEST POPS SAT NIGHT. DRY MONDAY
AND TUESDAY FOR NOW.

FXUS64 KMRX 271400
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT TUE MAR 27 2007

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED THIS MORNING.  FORECAST ON TRACK.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AFTER SEEING ANOTHER DAY OF RECORD 
HIGHS AND SUCH VERY MILD TEMPS THIS MORNING...SEEMS WISE TO GO A 
DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE THE WARMEST MOS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY. IF THE 
CONSIDERABLE MID AND HIGH CLOUDS THIN ANY AT ALL LATER THIS MORNING
...THEN 70S AND 80S SHOULD PREVAIL YET AGAIN. RECORD HIGHS FOR THIS 
DATE WOULD NOT APPEAR TO BE IN JEOPARDY...86 AT CHA IN 1910...84 AT 
TYS IN 1910 AND 82 AT TRI IN 1989. THUS...WILL NOT ADD NEAR RECORD 
HIGH WORDING TO ZFPMRX.

OTHERWISE...RAIN CHANCES MAY BE FINALLY HEADED UPWARDS...BUT MY 
CONFIDENCE IS TOO LOW TO GO CHANCE POPS JUST YET...PREFERRING TO 
UNDERCUT MOS POPS (ESPECIALLY GFS MOS POPS WHICH HAVE BEEN MUCH TOO 
HIGH LATELY). BEST AREA FOR ANY CONVECTION WOULD APPEAR TO BE THE 
WESTERN MOST SECTIONS...WHERE HIGHEST THETA-E TEMPS AND INSTABILITY 
ARE PROGGED FOR LATE THIS AFTERNOON...AND ALSO BETTER LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE CONVERGENCE (ALTHO WEAK) WAS NOTED. THESE AREAS GET UPPER 
LEVEL SUPPORT AS DIVERGENCE ALOFT DEVELOPS THIS EVENING WITH THE 
APPROACH OF A WEAK IMPULSE MOVING INTO WESTERN SIDE OF THE UPPER 
RIDGE. THUS...I CONTINUED THE SLIGHT POPS OVERNIGHT FOR PLATEAU 
COUNTIES. IF NO PRECIPITATION OCCURS AT MOS SITES...THEN TRACK 
RECORD GENERALLY SUPPORTED ABOVE GFS MOS MINS AT CHA AND TYS...BUT 
NEAR OR BELOW GFS MOS MINS FOR TRI AND RHP.

DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE THE WARMEST MOS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY. IF THE

DATE WOULD NOT APPEAR TO BE IN JEOPARDY...86 AT CHA IN 1910...84 AT 
TYS IN 1910 AND 82 AT TRI IN 1989. THUS...WILL NOT ADD NEAR RECORD 
HIGH WORDING TO ZFPMRX.

OTHERWISE...RAIN CHANCES MAY BE FINALLY HEADED UPWARDS...BUT MY 
CONFIDENCE IS TOO LOW TO GO CHANCE POPS JUST YET...PREFERRING TO 
UNDERCUT MOS POPS (ESPECIALLY GFS MOS POPS WHICH HAVE BEEN MUCH TOO 
HIGH LATELY). BEST AREA FOR ANY CONVECTION WOULD APPEAR TO BE THE 
WESTERN MOST SECTIONS...WHERE HIGHEST THETA-E TEMPS AND INSTABILITY 
ARE PROGGED FOR LATE THIS AFTERNOON...AND ALSO BETTER LOW LEVEL

THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON WEDNESDAY RESULTING IN UPPER 
RIDGE BEING SUPPRESSED. HOWEVER...MAIN DYNAMICS WITH THE SHORT WAVE 
WILL REMAIN NORTH OF THE AREA PER OPERATIONAL MODELS AND SREF. AS 
SUCH..APPEARS PRECIP WILL BE SCATTERED IN NATURE. THUS HAVE UNDERCUT 
GFS GUIDANCE POPS ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. UPPER FLOW 
BECOMES HIGHLY AMPLIFIED BY THURSDAY AS DEEP TROUGH DRIFTS SOUTH 
ALONG THE ATLANTIC COAST AND RIDGE AMPLIFIES OVER THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY. THIS WILL PUSH A BACK-DOOR COLD FRONT INTO OUR NORTHEASTERN 
ZONES RESULTING IN SOMEWHAT COOLER AIR FOR THOSE AREAS.

NEXT ORGANIZED SYSTEM WILL APPROACH IN THE LATE SATURDAY/EARLY 
SUNDAY TIME FRAME AS MORE SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST FROM 
THE CENTRAL PLAINS. APPEARS TEMPS WILL COOL SLIGHTLY BUT STILL 
REMAIN SOMEWHAT ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD.
