000 
FXUS64 KMRX 260702
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 AM EDT MON MAR 26 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PERHAPS TWO POINTS TO MAKE ARE 
THAT ONCE AGAIN THERE WAS VERY LITTLE IF ANY CONVECTIVE PCPN 
ANYWHERE NEAR OUR FORECAST AREA YESTERDAY...AND THAT THE 26/00Z GFS 
MODEL LOOKS MUCH TOO WET INITIALLY FROM 00Z THROUGH 12Z TODAY.
THIS WOULD MAKE THE GFS MOS POPS APPEAR TO BE MUCH TOO HIGH FOR TODAY
...WHEN SENSIBLY CONSIDERING THAT ONLY MINOR CHANGES IN THE AIRMASS 
HAVE OCCURED FROM YESTERDAY. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES ARE 
INCREASING FROM YESTERDAY...BUT MOST OF THIS CAN BE ATTRIBUTED TO 
THE INCREASE IN MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS THAT ARE MOVING ENE 
THROUGH THE UPPER RIDGE. GREATER SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY NOTED FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT PATTERN WOULD JUST SEEM TO SUPPORT 
ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS. THUS...POPS
WERE REMOVED FROM THE VALLEY LOCATIONS AND LOWERED TO SLIGHT CHANCE 
ELSEWHERE.

FOR TEMPS...MID AND HIGH CLOUDS ARE HOLDING MIN TEMPS SEVERAL 
DEGREES ABOVE 24 HOURS AGO...SUCH THAT LNP WAS A VERY MILD 70 
DEGREES AT 06Z WITH A LOT OF LOW TO MID 60S NOTED AS WELL. THIS 
MAKES THE COOL HIGHS FROM GFS MOS SUSPECT (LIKELY BIASED BY THE 
EXAGGERATED CONVECTIVE QPF)...SO I OPTED FOR A BLEND OF THE NGM AND 
NAM-WRF MOS HIGHS (WHICH WILL BE A FEW DEGS BELOW YESTERDAY BUT 
STILL VERY NEAR RECORD HIGHS OF 84 AT CHA...83 AT TYS AND 82 AT TRI).

MINS TONIGHT GENERALLY ACCEPTED NEAR A BLEND OF SIMILAR MOS...EXCEPT
TO UNDERCUT TRI AND RHP BASED ON PERSISTENT PATTERN THOSE LOCATIONS 
OVER THE PAST FEW NIGHTS.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...FAIRLY GOOD SHORT WAVE 
WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE TO JUSTIFY 
POPS.  WARM FRONT LINGERING IN THE AREA THROUGHOUT MUCH OF THE 
PERIOD BUT BASED ON LAST SYSTEM HAVE LOWERED POPS TO SUB 15 PERCENT 
AND HAVE TAKEN PRECIP OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR MUCH OF THE NEXT FEW 
DAYS.  NEXT GOOD CHANCE OF PRECIP FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY.

STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE VALUES FOR MAX AND MIN TEMPERATURES.


&&

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...STATIONARY FRONT

INCREASE OF MOISTURE...WIDELY SCT TSTMS A BETTER POSSIBILITY
...ESPECIALLY ACROSS HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE SOME OROGRAPHIC LIFT WITH 
ADD TRIGGER. RIDGING SUPPRESSES SE THOUGH TUESDAY. SIMILAR PCPN CHC 
HOWEVER MODEL DEPICTED PWS SLIGHTLY LOWER.

THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...ALONG WITH DECENT MOISTURE...LIFT 
AND INSTABILITY...WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  BEST CHANCES SHOULD BE IN THE NORTH WHERE THE BEST 
MOISTURE LINGERS.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY...MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY LIMITED...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT.  A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES THE REGION LATE FRIDAY...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
FRIDAY...WITH BEST CHANCES HOLDING OFF UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY AS FRONT PUSHES THROUGH THE CWA.  MOISTURE DECREASING  
BEHIND THE FRONT...BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND

FXUS64 KMRX 251512

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1111 AM EDT SUN MAR 25 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. SUNNY SKIES AND NEAR RECORD HIGH 
TEMPS THIS AFTN. WILL MONITOR BOUNDARY JUST NE OF AREA FOR 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON 

SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGE HOLDING ACROSS EASTERN STATES 
THIS MORNING WITH JUST SOME PATCHY HIGH CLOUDS THINNING AS THEY MOVE 
EAST THROUGH THE RIDGE. AIRMASS REMAINS WARM AND RELATIVELY 
DRY...ESPECIALLY BELOW 750 MBS AS NOTED ON EVENING OHX AND RNK 
SOUNDINGS. MOS DEW POINT TEMPS WERE A BIT HIGH COMPARED TO CURRENT 
OBSERVATIONS...ESPECIALLY OVER NE TN AND SW VA...SO MADE THESE 
ADJUSTMENTS AGAIN THIS MORNING.

MAX TEMPS SHOULD EASILY REACH 70S TO MID OR UPPER 80S...WITH RECORD 
HIGHS FOR TODAY BEING 87 AT CHA...88 AT TYS AND 85 AT TRI. MY CCF 
NUMBERS WOULD BE A RECORD HIGH FOR CHA AT 88 DEGS...BUT FALL 1 TO 3 
DEGREES BELOW RECORDS ELSEWHERE.

REACHING THESE WARM HIGHS DOES GENERATE SOME INSTABILITY LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING...AND LOW LEVEL FLOW IS WEAKLY 
CONVERGENT IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN NEAR RNK AND GSP FORECAST AREAS
(WHERE SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS WERE NOTED). THUS...ADDED SOME 
VERY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS (ABOUT HALF OF GFS MOS VALUES) TO EASTERN 
PARTS OF RUSSELL AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES OF SW VA...NRN TN MTNS AND 
SMOKY MTNS FOR GRID PERIODS FROM 21Z TO 01Z.  

FOR MIN TEMPS TONIGHT...WENT CLOSE TO SIMILAR MOS NUMBERS...EXCEPT 
FOR UNDERCUTTING CHA AND TRI GIVEN DRY AIRMASS...LIGHT WINDS AND 
PAST FEW NIGHTS MIN TEMPS.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A BACKDOOR COLD FRONT WILL 
REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY WITH MODELS SHOWING WEAK-MODERATE INSTABILITY OVER THE 
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE FORECASTS AREA. CONVERGENCE 
ALONG STATIONARY FRONT WEAK AND GIVEN DROUGHT CONDITIONS PRODUCING 
LOWER LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LEVELS...FEEL ANY AFTERNOON-EVENING 
CONVECTION WILL BE ISOLATED. WILL UNDER-CUT GUIDANCE.

FOR WEDNESDAY...FIRST IN SERIES OF UPPER SHORT-WAVES WILL SLAM INTO
PERSISTENT SOUTHEAST UPPER RIDGE. MODELS SHOW UPPER RIDGE WEAKENING 
SOME AS WAVE RIDES THE RIDGE AXIS PRODUCING STRONGER BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW.
WILL UP POPS SOME...BUT FEEL EXTENDED MODELS ARE OVER-DOING CHANCES GIVEN
CONTINUED DROUGHT CONDITIONS.

FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...UPPER RIDGE RE-ESTABLISHES ITSELF AHEAD OF
MUCH STRONGER UPPER TROUGH MOVING FROM THE ROCKYS INTO THE PLAINS STATES
FOR LATE INTO THE WEEK. AT THE SAME TIME...WEDGING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS
WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD DRIER AIR INTO THE REGION...SO LITTLE IF ANY
CONVECTION ANTICIPATED.

FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...UPPER TROUGH MOVES NORTH OF THE AREA...BUT
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL PULL EAST ACROSS THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY MORNING PROVIDING THE BEST CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...DECIDED TO GO A DEGREE OR TWO HIGHER THAN GFS
MOS HIGHS GIVEN CONTINUED DRY GROUND CONDITIONS AND UNSEASONABLY WARM
THICKNESS VALUES. FRIDAYS HIGHS MAY BE CLOSER TO 80 FOR CHA THAN GFS
MOS NUMBERS NEAR 70.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  56  84  57  82 /  10  10  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  85  57  80  58  81 /  10  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       86  55  80  57  81 /  10  10  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              83  51  78  54  79 /  10  10  10  10  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 AM EDT SUN MAR 25 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGE HOLDING ACROSS EASTERN 
STATES THIS MORNING WITH JUST SOME PATCHY HIGH CLOUDS THINNING AS 
THEY MOVE EAST THROUGH THE RIDGE. AIRMASS REMAINS WARM AND 
RELATIVELY DRY...ESPECIALLY BELOW 750 MBS AS NOTED ON EVENING OHX 
AND RNK SOUNDINGS. MOS DEW POINT TEMPS WERE A BIT HIGH COMPARED TO 
CURRENT OBSERVATIONS...ESPECIALLY OVER NE TN AND SW VA...SO MADE 
THESE ADJUSTMENTS AGAIN THIS MORNING.

MAX TEMPS SHOULD EASILY REACH 70S TO MID OR UPPER 80S...WITH RECORD 
HIGHS FOR TODAY BEING 87 AT CHA...88 AT TYS AND 85 AT TRI. MY CCF 
NUMBERS WOULD BE A RECORD HIGH FOR CHA AT 88 DEGS...BUT FALL 1 TO 3 
DEGREES BELOW RECORDS ELSEWHERE.

REACHING THESE WARM HIGHS DOES GENERATE SOME INSTABILITY LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING...AND LOW LEVEL FLOW IS WEAKLY 
CONVERGENT IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN NEAR RNK AND GSP FORECAST AREAS

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT SAT MAR 24 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE TO 
CURRENT AIRMASS AND FORECAST. MID LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS NORTHWARD INTO 
AREA TONIGHT AND SUNDAY. A SHORT WAVE MOVES EAST SUPPRESSING RIDGE 
SOUTHWARD BACK INTO MRX CWA FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INCREASE MONDAY AFTN. WEAK LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE SETS UP ACROSS NE AREAS AS OLD SURFACE BOUNDARY IS 
PUSHED W INTO AREA BY BUILDING PRESSURE TO THE NE. ISOLATED 
TSTMS ON TAP...MAINLY FOR THE ELEVATED AREAS OF NE TN/SW VA INTO MON 
EVE. OTHERWISE POPS TOO LOW TO MENTION IN FORECAST. TEMPERATURES 
WILL REMAIN WARM.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS BRING A SHORTWAVE 
INTO THE AREA ON TUESDAY...ALONG WITH SOME INSTABILITY...MOISTURE 
LIMITED...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY 
NIGHT.  DEEPER SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY... 
ALONG WITH DECENT MOISTURE AND LIFT...WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THE 
AREA ON THURSDAY...MOISTURE LIMITED...WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT.  A COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE 
AREA LATE FRIDAY...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY...WITH 
BEST CHANCES HOLDING OFF UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY 
MORNING AS FRONT PUSHES THROUGH THE CWA.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON AS THE FRONT TRACKS EAST OF THE CWA.  STAYED NEAR 
HPC/MAV GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 241518
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1115 AM EDT SAT MAR 24 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FLATTENING OF UPPER RIDGE HAS 
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT FROM THE TN VALLEY/SRN APPALACHIANS NORTH TO THE 
GREAT LAKES. THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS STILL A GOOD DISTANCE TO 
OUR NORTH...GENERALLY ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH A DIP ACROSS W VA 
THEN SE TO VA COASTAL AREAS. MUCH LESS CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION 
OCCURRING THIS MORNING IN THE VICINITY OF THE WEAK FRONT THAN 24 
HOURS AGO. THUS...MODELS WERE TOO GENEROUS IN SPREADING LIGHT QPF 
THIS FAR SOUTH. INTERESTING THAT NAM-WRF MODEL FROM 23/00Z RUN WAS 
WETTER THAN GFS...BUT NOW 24 HOURS LATER...24/00Z GFS RUN IS WETTER 
THAN NAM-WRF. NOT SURE WHY THE FLIP-FLOP...BUT VERY LIMITED LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE...ONLY SLIGHT INSTABILITY LATE TODAY...AND NO FOCUS 
FOR ANY DEVELPOMENT OTHER THAN WEAK FRONT AND DAYTIME HEATING. 
SO...A SENSIBLE FORECAST OF MAINLY DRY EXCEPT FOR 15-20% POP LATE 
TONIGHT IN THE FAR NE AREAS. BETTER INSTABILITY SUNDAY...BUT STILL 
SEEMS TO LACK ANY DEEP MOISTURE AND A TRIGGER/FOCUS.

OTHERWISE...DECREASED SKY COVER IN GRIDS FOR ESPECIALLY SRN AREAS.
CLOSE TO GFS MOS ON HIGHS TODAY...THEN A BLEND OF MOS FOR MINS 
TONIGHT...ALTHO DID UNDERCUT TRI MIN TO GIVE MORE OF THE RANGE NOTED 
PAST FEW NIGHTS FROM CHA AND TYS TO TRI MIN. 

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN STRONGER 
SUNDAY AS WEAK BOUNDARY MAY MOVE SOUTHWEST INTO NE TN. INSTABILITY 
IS GREATER BUT DECIDED TO KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS OUT OF SUNDAY FOR NOW. TEMPERATURES STILL VERY WARM 
AND FOLLOWED BLEND OF WRF/GFS. RIDGE BEGINS TO BE PUSHED SOUTH 
MONDAY WITH MOISTURE AND COOLER AIRMASS TRYING TO MOVE FARTHER WEST 
MONDAY. THINK THERE WILL BE BETTER CHANCE TO GET SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FORMING OR MOVING SOUTHEAST INTO AREA AROUND THE RIDGE 
FROM THE NORTH. NEW LOW PRESSURE AREA DEVELOPS AND DEEPENS OVER THE 
ROCKIES TUESDAY WITH STRONG LOW LEVEL FEED OF MOISTURE INTO MS 
VALLEY SPREADING EAST INTO TN VALLEY AS SURFACE HIGH SHIFTS EAST AND 
RIDGE GETS SHOVED TO THE SOUTHEAST OVER FLORIDA AND THE SOUTHERN 
GULF. THIS PATTERN CONTINUES THROUGH THE WEEK WITH A COLD FRONT 
FINALLY MOVING INTO MIDDLE TN BY LATE FRIDAY. WILL HAVE SLIGHT TO 
CHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST AND 
CONTINUED MILD DAYS AND NIGHTS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  82  53  83  54  78 /  10  10  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    80  57  82  56  78 /  10  10  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN            81  55  83  55  79 /  10  10  10  10  20

FRONT FINALLY MOVING INTO MIDDLE TN BY LATE FRIDAY. WILL HAVE

FORECAST AND CONTINUED MILD DAYS AND NIGHTS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT FRI MAR 23 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...WARM TEMPERATURES
CONTINUE AS FRONT BOUNDARY REMAINS NORTH OF AREA. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES EAST...NORTH OF AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD. LATE IN THE 
PERIOD THE HIGH PRESSURE WEDGES DOWN THE EAST SIDE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS. MID LEVEL RIDGING FROM THE SOUTH REMAINS SUPPRESSED
AS IMPULSES MOVE EAST NORTH OF THE AREA THROUGH SAT NGT. SUNDAY MID 
LEVEL RIDGING BUILDS THROUGH AND NORTH OF THE AREA. IMPULSES WILL 
DRAG MID/UPR LEVEL MOISTURE WELL NORTH AND SOMEWHAT SOUTH OF THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WITH CLOUD COVER MAINLY AFFECTING THE NORTH HALF OF 
THE MRX CWA. PCPN CHCS REMAIN VERY LOW WITH BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS
EARLY SUNDAY MORNING AS WEDGING PUSHING FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO NE 
AREAS.   

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WARM FRONT LINGERS ACROSS THE 
AREA ON MONDAY ALONG WITH SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE...WILL KEEP 20 POPS 
FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT.  A SHORTWAVE APPROACHING ON TUESDAY.  
MOISTURE MORE LIMITED THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...BUT WITH KEEP LOW CHANCE 
POPS IN FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY EVENING...THEN 20 POPS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS ACROSS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY... 
KEEPING MOISTURE TO THE WEST OF OUR CWA...WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT DRY FOR NOW.  A FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION LATE 
THURSDAY...WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND 
NIGHT.  BEST CHANCES SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL FRIDAY AS FRONT PUSHES 
INTO THE CWA. STAYED NEAR HPC/MAV GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 231511
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EDT FRI MAR 23 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EXPECT UPPER RIDGE TO FLATTEN A 
BIT TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT ANY THREAT OF MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION 
LOOKS TO BE MAINLY TO OUR NORTH. LATEST RADAR AND SATELLITE PICS 
SHOW A WEAKENING AREA OF CONVECTION MOVING EAST ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY...AND THINKING IS THAT NAM-WRF IS OVER ZEALOUS IN SPREADING 
PRECIPITATION SE INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED...WITH FORECAST SOUNDINGS NOT GENERATING 
MUCH IF ANY SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY. THERE ARE VERY WARM TEMPS 
ALOFT WHICH CREATES A CAP AND SOME NEGATIVE BUOYANCY TO OVERCOME.

THUS...KEPT THE FORECAST FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT TRENDED TOWARD THE 
DRIER GFS MODEL SOLUTION...WITH JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS SW VA 
AND EXTREME NRN PARTS OF CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES.  NGM MOS OUT 
PERFORMED OTHER MOS GUIDANCE FOR THU MAX TEMPS...BUT NGM/GFS HIGHS 
WERE QUITE CLOSE AND A GOOD CHOICE FOR TODAY. FEW SPOTS MAY TOP 80 
DEGREES TODAY...BUT NO RECORD HIGHS APPEAR TO BE IN JEOPARDY (CHA 86/
TYS 85/TRI 79).  DECIDED TO GO WITH A MOS BLEND FOR MINS RATHER THAN 
COOLER GFS MOS...GIVEN AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
PCPN FOR TONIGHT. 

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WARM UPPER RIDGE FLATTENS 
A LITTLE SATURDAY BUT REMAINS ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES FOR THE 
MOST PART THIS WEEKEND. STATIONARY BOUNDARY ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY 
AND MID ATLANTIC WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO SW VA TO GIVE MORE 
CLOUDINESS AND A SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS. HEIGHTS RISE SLIGHTLY 
SATUDAY AND SUNDAY SO HIGHS ARE EXPECTED TO REACH THE LOWER 80S MOST 
PLACES. THIS COULD REACH A RECORD AT TRI CITIES ON SATURDAY. 
FOLLOWED MAV GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS THIS WEEKEND CONSIDERING THAT IT HAS 
BEEN VERY DRY THIS MONTH. HIGH PRESSURE STRENGTHENING ALONG THE EAST 
COAST SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY MAY MOVE MOISTURE BACK TOWARDS THE 
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST FROM THE BOUNDARY SATURDAY SO HAVE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS MONDAY. UPPER LOW ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST MOVES INTO 
THE MS VALLEY AS A BROAD TROUGH/COLD FRONT. SOUTHERLY FLOW INCREASES 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AS FRONT APPROACHES. 
THE FRONT MAY NOT GO THROUGH BEFORE IT MOVES BACK NORTH AS WARM 
FRONT WEDNESDAY BECAUSE OF THE STRENGTH OF THE RIDGE. CHANCE POPS 
WILL STAY IN FORECAST THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. THURSDAY HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS BACK IN. TEMPERATURES SHOULD STAY MILD MONDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY BUT NOT AS WARM AS THE WEEKEND DUE TO MORE CLOUD COVER AND 
SHOWER ACTIVITY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  80  54  83  53  83 /   0  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    79  55  82  55  82 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            80  55  82  55  82 /  10  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   77  51  80  51  79 /  10  10  10  10  10

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 230824
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
424 AM EDT FRI MAR 23 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EXPECT UPPER RIDGE TO FLATTEN A
BIT TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT ANY THREAT OF MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION
LOOKS TO BE MAINLY TO OUR NORTH. LATEST RADAR AND SATELLITE PICS
SHOW A WEAKENING AREA OF CONVECTION MOVING EAST ACROSS THE OHIO
VALLEY...AND THINKING IS THAT NAM-WRF IS OVER ZEALOUS IN SPREADING
PRECIPITATION SE INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED...WITH FORECAST SOUNDINGS NOT GENERATING
MUCH IF ANY SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY. THERE ARE VERY WARM TEMPS
ALOFT WHICH CREATES A CAP AND SOME NEGATIVE BUOYANCY TO OVERCOME.

THUS...KEPT THE FORECAST FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT TRENDED TOWARD THE 
DRIER GFS MODEL SOLUTION...WITH JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS SW VA 
AND EXTREME NRN PARTS OF CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES.  NGM MOS OUT 
PERFORMED OTHER MOS GUIDANCE FOR THU MAX TEMPS...BUT NGM/GFS HIGHS 
WERE QUITE CLOSE AND A GOOD CHOICE FOR TODAY. FEW SPOTS MAY TOP 80 
DEGREES TODAY...BUT NO RECORD HIGHS APPEAR TO BE IN JEOPARDY (CHA 86/
TYS 85/TRI 79).  DECIDED TO GO WITH A MOS BLEND FOR MINS RATHER THAN 
COOLER GFS MOS...GIVEN AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
PCPN FOR TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WARM UPPER RIDGE
FLATTENS A LITTLE SATURDAY BUT REMAINS ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES
FOR THE MOST PART THIS WEEKEND. STATIONARY BOUNDARY ACROSS THE OHIO
VALLEY AND MID ATLANTIC WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO SW VA TO GIVE MORE
CLOUDINESS AND A SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS. HEIGHTS RISE SLIGHTLY
SATUDAY AND SUNDAY SO HIGHS ARE EXPECTED TO REACH THE LOWER 80S
MOST PLACES. THIS COULD REACH A RECORD AT TRI CITIES ON SATURDAY.
FOLLOWED MAV GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS THIS WEEKEND CONSIDERING THAT IT
HAS BEEN VERY DRY THIS MONTH. HIGH PRESSURE STRENGTHENING ALONG THE
EAST COAST SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY MAY MOVE MOISTURE BACK TOWARDS
THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST FROM THE BOUNDARY SATURDAY SO HAVE A
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS MONDAY. UPPER LOW ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST
MOVES INTO THE MS VALLEY AS A BROAD TROUGH/COLD FRONT. SOUTHERLY
FLOW INCREASES LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AS
FRONT APPROACHES. THE FRONT MAY NOT GO THROUGH BEFORE IT MOVES BACK
NORTH AS WARM FRONT WEDNESDAY BECAUSE OF THE STRENGTH OF THE
RIDGE. CHANCE POPS WILL STAY IN FORECAST THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.
THURSDAY HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN. TEMPERATURES SHOULD STAY
MILD MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY BUT NOT AS WARM AS THE WEEKEND DUE TO
MORE CLOUD COVER AND SHOWER ACTIVITY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  80  54  83  53  83 /   0  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    79  55  82  55  82 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            80  55  82  55  82 /  10  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   77  51  80  51  79 /  10  10  10  10  10 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMRX 221916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT THU MAR 22 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE RIDGES WSW FM ATLC THROUGH THE DEEP SOUTH. FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
LAYING DOWN IN THE OH RVR VLY. A FEW SPRINKLES POSSIBLE TONIGHT 
ACROSS SW VA AS PCPN AREA TO THE NW DISSIPATES. MID LVL LOW OVR SW 
U.S. BUILDS RIDGE NORTHWARD OVR TN VLY THROUGH PERIOD. LATE FRI 
THROUGH EARLY SAT A WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE NORTH 
PART OF THE MRX CWA. THIS WILL RESULT IN LOW CHC POPS MAINLY ACROSS 
SW VA INTO SAT MORNING. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY BUILDS SOUTHWARD EAST 
OF THE MNTS BEHIND THE SHORT WAVE SAT AND SAT NGT. TEMPS AND HUMUDITY 
REMAIN ON THE HIGH SIDE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WARM FRONT LINGERING ACROSS 
OUR NORTHERN ZONES ON SUNDAY...NAM BRINGING DECENT MOISTURE FURTHER  
SOUTH THAN GFS...WENT WITH THE DRIER GFS AND KEPT SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT DRY FOR NOW.  WARM FRONT SAGS BACK INTO AREA ON MONDAY ALONG 
WITH SOME WEAK INSTABILITY...WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR THUNDERSTORMS ON 
MONDAY.  MOISTURE INCREASES ON MONDAY NIGHT AS SHORTWAVE 
APPROACHES...WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  
SHORTWAVE PUSHING EAST OF AREA ALONG WITH DEEPEST MOISTURE ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR ONLY THE EVENING 
HOURS...THEN 20 POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT AND INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING.  
RIDGE BUILDS IN ON WEDNESDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  NEXT DISTURBANCE APPROACHES LATE THURSDAY...WILL 
ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MAV GUIDANCE 
FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 221454
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 AM EDT THU MAR 22 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH WILL MOVE INTO THE 
SOUTHEAST U.S. TODAY WITH AN OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY REMAINING TO OUR 
NORTH.  A STRAY SHOWER IS POSSIBLE FAR NORTHERN ZONES BUT CHANCE TOO 
SLIGHT TO MENTION.  EVEN WARMER TEMPERATURES EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON 
WITH MANY VALLEY LOCATIONS REACHING INTO THE MID TO UPPER 70S.  
TONIGHT...A WEAK IMPULSE SLIDES ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY...AND 
WILL BRING IN ANOTHER BAND OF CLOUDS.  FOR NOW...WILL ONLY MENTION A 
FEW SPRINKLES POSSIBLE ACROSS OUR EXTREME NORTH.

LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...WEAK COLD FRONT TO OUR NORTH MAY SAG 
CLOSE ENOUGH FOR A FEW SHOWERS OR THUNDERSTORMS IN OUR NORTHERN 
ZONES FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO SATURDAY...SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS THOSE AREAS.  OTHERWISE...RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE REGION KEEPING 
THINGS MAINLY DRY AND WARM OVER MUCH OF THE AREA.  BY EARLY IN THE 
WEEK...A SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL BE APPROACHING ALONG WITH A WEAK 
COLD FRONT.  STILL QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING THIS 
SYSTEM...BUT LOOKS LIKE MON NIGHT AND TUESDAY MAY BE BEST CHANCE FOR 
PRECIP...SO WILL GO CHANCE POPS DURING THOSE PERIODS...WITH SLIGHT 
CHANCE MON AND TUE NIGHT.  DRY WED FOR NOW BEHIND THIS SYSTEM.  


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 220026
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
830 PM EDT WED MAR 21 2007

.DISCUSSION...A BEAUTIFUL NIGHT ON TAP.  SOME MID AND HIGH CLOUDS 
PRESENT AND TEMPERATURES HOLDING IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S SO 
FAR.  DEW POINTS GENERALLY IN THE MID AND UPPER 40S WHICH IS WHERE 
THE CURRENT FORECAST HAS THE OVERNIGHT LOWS SO THEY SEEM 
REASONABLE.  NO CHANGES IN CURRENT FORECAST PLANNED.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS SOUTH OF AREA THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. WARMING 
TREND CONTINUES. CURRENT DPS RUNNING PRETTY HIGH BUT EXPECT SOME 
DRYING LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. DO NOT EXPECT STRONG 
LOW LEVEL INVERSION TO SET UP AGAIN TONIGHT SO WIDESPREAD DENSE FOG 
NOT ANTICIPATED. ISOLATED LIGHT SHOWERS POSSIBLE THIS EVENING ACROSS 
NE TN/SW VA BUT CHC TOO LOW TO MENTION IN FORECAST. 

.LONG TERM...(THU NIGHT THROUGH WED)...GENERALLY PLEASANT WEATHER 
WITH ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS EXPECTED THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD AS 
UPPER RIDGE PERSISTS OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. THE ONLY EXCEPTION IS A 
SHORT WAVE TROUGH THAT SWING THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. STILL QUITE A 
BIT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH RESPECT TO TIMING AS MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
REMAIN IN DISAGREEMENT. THUS HAVE CONTINUED TO SPREAD CHANCE POPS 
ACROSS SEVERAL PERIODS EVEN THOUGH EVENT WILL LIKELY NOT LAST THAT 
LONG. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED ENSEMBLE GUIDANCE THROUGH THE 
LONG TERM PERIOD ALTHOUGH DIFFERENCE WITH GFS GUIDANCE IS VERY SMALL 
FOR THE MOST PART.


&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 211341
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 AM EDT WED MAR 21 2007

.DISCUSSION...FOG IN THE PROCESS OF MIXING OUT. INVERSION IS AROUND 
1500 FEET. SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL INCREASE TODAY. PERIODS OF SUNSHINE
WILL AID IN THE GOOD WARM UP. INCREASED WINDS SOME IN GRIDS AND 
RAISED MAX TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES ESPECIALLY IN NORTHERN AREAS. A 
WEAK LOW LEVEL TROUGH HAS KICKED OFF SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS THIS 
MORNING. THIS FEATURE WILL EXIT TO THE NORTH BY THIS AFTERNOON. A 
WEAK MID LEVEL TROUGH WILL APPROACH THE AREA FROM THE WEST THIS 
AFTERNOON. SLIGHT CHANCE FOR LIGHT SHOWERS CONTINUES ACROSS NE 
AREAS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREAS OF FOG DEVELOPING OVER THE 
MRX CWA THIS MORNING...SOME LOCALLY DENSE FOG IS POSSIBLE WITH 
VISIBILITIES BELOW A QUARTER MILE.  OTHERWISE...A FEW SHOWERS LINGER 
ACROSS EXTREME NORTHEAST AREAS EARLY THIS MORNING.  THESE SHOULD 
EXIT THE AREA THIS MORNING...THEN A WEAK IMPULSE RIDING ALONG AN OLD 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH MAY GENERATE SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS 
OVER NORTHERN ZONES THIS AFTERNOON.  TONIGHT LOOKS DRY.  GUIDANCE 
LOOKS REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.


LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...SHOULD BE DRY THU...THEN MODELS 
CONTINUE TO DEPICT A WEAK COLD FRONT SAGGING TOWARD NORTHERN PORTION 
OF AREA BY FRIDAY.  HOW FAR SOUTH THIS FRONT WILL MAKE IT IS 
PROBLEMATIC...GFS GENERALLY KEEPS IT NORTH OF OUR AREA...BUT CLOSE 
ENOUGH THAT PROBABLY NEED AT LEAST SOME LOW POPS FRIDAY INTO 
SATURDAY IN NORTHERN ZONES.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THOSE 
AREAS.  BY MONDAY GFS DEPICTS A WEAK COLD FRONT MAY BE APPROACHING 
FROM THE NORTHWEST...PASSING THROUGH OUR AREA TUESDAY.  WILL CARRY 
LOW CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WITH THIS FEATURE MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  77  52  77  52  79 /  10  10   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  74  50  77  52  77 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  75  51  78  51  78 /  10  10  10  10  10

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 202351 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
750 PM EDT TUE MAR 20 2007

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE RIDGE FROM CENTRAL PARTS OF E TN INTO SW VA 
THIS EVENING...WITH LIGHT NE WINDS GENERALLY NOTED AT THE SURFACE.
KMRX VAD WIND PROFILE SHOWS LIGHT SW WINDS FROM OFF THE SURFACE TO 
AROUND 850 MBS...THEN WESTERLIES UP TO 500 MB LEVEL.  RADAR RETURNS 
SUGGEST THAT MOST PRECIPITATION MAY BE FORMING ALONG A WARM FRONT
...AND GENERALLY TRACKING NE OUT OF THE REGION THIS EVENING.

SHORT RANGE MODELS...INCLUDING LATEST RUC...INDICATE THAT COVERAGE 
OF SHOWERS SHOULD DECREASE AFTER THIS EVENING...THEN JUST SLIGHT 
CHANCE SE TN TO PERHAPS 30 OR 40 PERCENT POPS FOR FAR NE AREAS 
SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT FOR OVERNIGHT. 

WILL LET CURRENT FORECAST GRIDS OF UP TO 60 PERCENT POPS RUN THROUGH 
LATE EVENING...THEN WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX (WITH LOWER POPS) AND ALSO 
FRESHEN FORECAST GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS.  MAY ADJUST HOURLY TEMPS 
AND DEW POINTS SLIGHTLY BEFORE MAIN UPDATE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

000
FXUS64 KMRX 201927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT TUE MAR 20 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT APPEARS TO 
HAVE MOVED LITTLE TODAY AND IS STILL OVER SOUTHERN KY THIS 
AFTERNOON. SOUTHERLY WINDS AHEAD OF THE FRONT ALLOWED TEMPERATURES 
TO RISE INTO THE 60S TO LOWER 70S AREAWIDE. A SMALL AREA OF SHOWERS 
PRODUCING LIGHT RAIN WAS OVER THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND MOVING EAST 
NORTHEAST TOWARD THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY. WEAK VORT MAXES 
AND SOME LIFT WILL CONTINUE THROUGH EVENING AND SHOULD CONCENTRATE 
SHOWERS FROM I-40 NORTHEAST TOWARD VA BEFORE DECREASING LATER 
TONIGHT. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE TOO. THE ATMOSPHERE SHOULD 
DRY OUT LATER TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS FRONT TO THE NORTH WEAKENS 
AND RIDGING STRENGTHENS TO THE SOUTH. DECREASED POPS TONIGHT FROM 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST. ONLY HAVE POPS NORTHEAST SECTIONS WEDNESDAY. 
GENERALLY FOLLOWED WRF/GFS BLEND FOR TEMPERATURES BOTH TONIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY.   


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...WARM FRONT LIFTS
NORTH OF THE REGION LEAVING A MOISTER AND WARMER AIR MASS IN PLACE.
A SERIES OF VERY WEAK UPPER DISTRUBANCES WILL SWING THROUGH THE
AREA WHICH MAY TRIGGER A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS BUT BASICALLY NOT
ENOUGH AT THIS TIME TO PUT RAIN IN EVERY DAY. DID INCREASE POPS A
LITTLE ON FRIDAY IN THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE
NEXT BIGGER CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION IS SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY
WHEN THE UPPER LOW THAT IS CURRENTLY DEVELOPING OF THE CALIFORNIA
PACIFIC COAST FINALLY SWINGS THROUGH WITH AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT.
LEANED MAINLY TOWARDS GFS FOR GUIDANCE AND GFS ENSEMBLE AVERGE FOR NUMBERS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000
FXUS64 KMRX 201431
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EDT TUE MAR 20 2007

.DISCUSSION...WEAK COLD FRONT APPEARS TO LIE OVER SOUTHERN KY THIS 
MORNING. LIGHT SOUTHERLY WINDS AND WARMER TEMPERATURES ARE SOUTH OF 
THE BOUNDARY AND LOW CLOUDS AND FOG LIE NORTH OF THE FRONT IN KY. 
SOME LIGHT RAIN IS OCCURRING TO THE NORTH AND WEST OVER EASTERN KY 
AND MIDDLE TN BUT ELSEWHERE NO RAIN IS SHOWING UP ON RADAR ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. THE FRONT IS EXPECTED TO SAG SOUTH INTO NORTHERN 
SECTIONS OF TN BEFORE STALLING...AND THEN LIFT BACK NORTH AS A 
WARM FRONT TONIGHT. BEST CHANCES OF RAIN BASED ON TRACK OF CURRENT 
PRECIPITATION AND FRONT LOCATION WILL BE WEST CENTRAL AND NORTHERN 
SECTIONS WITH SLIGHTLY LOWER CHANCES SOUTH AND EXTREME EAST. THE 
FRONT WILL SHIFT BACK TO THE NORTHEAST TONIGHT AS A WARM FRONT. 
FORCING FOR PRECIPITATION NOT THAT GREAT SO WILL STILL HAVE CHANCE 
POPS ALL ZONES TODAY. WILL CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE THUNDER CENTRAL 
AND SOUTH. CURRENT TEMPERATURES ARE 3 TO 5 DEGREES ABOVE GRIDS SO 
WILL HAVE TO ADJUST UPWARD OTHERWISE ONLY MINOR CHANGES TO POPS AND 
DEW POINTS. UPDATED ZONES OUT IN THE NEXT HOUR.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 PM EDT MON MAR 19 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SKIES WERE PARTLY TO 
MOSTLY CLOUDY TODAY AS MOISTURE CONTINUES TO INCREASE AHEAD OF COLD 
FRONT MOVING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED INTO THE 
60S AS WELL MUCH WARMER THAN YESTERDAY. THE WARMING WAS HELPED BY 
SOUTHWEST WINDS WHICH HAVE INCREASED THIS AFTERNOON. SUSTAINED WINDS 
OF 10 TO 20 MPH WITH GUSTS UP TO 30 MPH ARE OCCURRING AT MID 
AFTERNOON ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS THE GRADIENT TIGHTENS BETWEEN 
THE FRONT AND DEPARTING HIGH PRESSURE TO THE SOUTHEAST. LINE OF 
PREFRONTAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IS SLOWLY MARCHING SOUTHEAST 
TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. BELIEVE THIS WILL DECREASE 
IN INTENSITY AND SPEED TOWARD SW VA AND NORTHERN TN LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. EXPECT FRONT TO MOVE TOWARD THE AREA BUT NOT 
QUITE MAKE IT BEFORE MORNING. STILL INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY NORTH 
AND NORTHEAST WITH POSSIBLE THUNDER TO THE NORTH. TUESDAY IS MORE 
UNCERTAIN AS FRONT SAGS SOUTH AND THEN MIGHT BECOME STATIONARY BY 
THE END OF THE DAY. MORE CLOSELY FOLLOWED NAM POPS TONIGHT WITH 
LIKELY IN THE NORTH AND TUESDAY THINK BEST CHANCE POPS WILL BE TO 
THE NORTHWEST. PUT RAIN CHANCES SLIGHTLY LOWER THAN BOTH NAM/GFS 
GUIDANCE CENTRAL AND SOUTH TUESDAY.     


.LONG TERM...A SERIES OF FRONTS MOVE ACROSS THE AREA WITH 2
BECOMING EAST/WEST ORIENTED ACROSS THE AREA. THE FIRST IS THE
FRONTAL SYSTEM IN THE SHORT TERM AND ANOTHER ON FRIDAY. WITH THE
FIRST SYSTEM THE RAINS SHOULD BE ENDING TUESDAY NIGHT.  IF THE SECOND
SYSTEM FOLLOWS THE CURRENT FORECAST...WE MAY SEE SOME RAINS ON
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY ASSOCIATED WITH IT THEN SOME MORE ON SUNDAY AS
IT MOVES NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT COLD
FRONT WHICH WOULD MOVE IN VERY LATE MONDAY. AT THE PRESENT
TIME...NONE OF THE SYSTEMS LOOK LIKE BIG RAIN MAKERS.

BUT MIGHT NOT EVER MAKE IT ACROSS TN BORDER. SOUTHERN SECTIONS MAY
EVEN MISS OUT ON ANY MEASURABLE RAIN. DROPPED HIGHS A FEW DEGREES
TUESDAY WITH EXTENSIVE CLOUDS. GRADUALLY DECREASING POPS TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS FRONT MOVES BACK NORTH. RIDGING STRENGTHENS
ACROSS THE EAST COAST AND SOUTHEAST FOR THE END OF THE WEEK INTO
THE WEEKEND SO KEPT REST OF THE FORECAST DRY. TEMPERATURES WILL
WARM TO ABOVE NORMAL AS WELL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 PM EDT SAT MAR 17 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SHOWERS HAVE DISSIPATED ACROSS THE NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON...THOUGH EASTERN PORTIONS OF RUSSELL AND WASHINGTON 
COUNTIES MAY SEE SOME ADDITIONAL FLURRIES. WITH THE LOSS OF SURFACE 
HEATING...SCATTERED CU OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA WILL 
DISSIPATE. HIGH AND MIDLEVEL CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER JET
AND CHANNELED VORTICITY OVER THE MS VALLEY WILL CROSS THE AREA THIS
EVENING. HOWEVER SKIES SHOULD BE CLEAR BY MIDNIGHT AS THESE
FEATURES MOVE EAST. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND A RISING HEIGHTS
ALOFT WILL PROVIDE CLEAR SKIES FOR SUNDAY. WITH PLENTY OF SUN AND
NEUTRAL ADVECTION...HIGHS SHOULD REBOUND TO THE 50S IN THE VALLEY
WITH 40S NORTH AND IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...TROUGH THAT WAS OVER
THE EAST SHIFTS EAST SUNDAY NIGHT WITH SURFACE HIGH BEGINNING TO
SHIFT EAST AS WELL. SYSTEM IN CANADA DROPS DOWN TO THE GREAT LAKES
WITH FRONT MOVING INTO WESTERN GREAT LAKES. SHOULD SEE HIGH CLOUDS
INCREASE SUNDAY NIGHT WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPING ALOFT.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARMER EXCEPT POSSIBLY AT TRI CITIES AIRPORT
BUT EVEN THERE THE LOW MAY COME EARLY. COLD FRONT MOVES SOUTH
MONDAY TOWARDS FORECAST AREA BUT WENT ON LOW SIDE OF POPS DUE TO
UNCERTAINTY OF TIMING AND IF IT WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH DURING THE DAY
FOR SHOWERS TO BREAK OUT. MODELS SHOW RAPID MOISTURE INCREASE
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AND AM NOT SURE THAT IT WILL HAPPEN THAT
FAST. BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS FRONT
MOVES INTO TN THEN SHIFTS BACK TO THE NORTH AS WARM FRONT TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. UPPER TROUGH DIGS INTO THE WESTERN STATES TUESDAY
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY FOLLOWED BY RIDGING IN THE SOUTHEAST THURSDAY
THROUGH SATURDAY. ENDED RAIN CHANCES EARLY WEDNESDAY AND KEPT
FORECAST AREA DRY FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD WITH WARMING
TEMPERATURES AS RIDGING TAKES OVER. TEMPERATURES MAY BE EVEN WARMER
THAN CURRENT FORECAST DEPENDING ON CLOUD COVER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
942 AM EDT SAT MAR 17 2007

.DISCUSSION...
REPORTS OBTAINED ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN INDICATE MAINLY A DUSTING
OF SNOW IN LOWER ELEVATIONS...WITH A HALF INCH ACCUMULATION IN
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND IN WISE COUNTY VA. THE PRIMARY FORCING FOR
THE SNOW SHOWERS IS STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES NEAR 10 C/KM FROM
THE SURFACE TO AROUND 800 MB. RUC AND NAM MODELS MAINTAIN THIS
INSTABILITY THROUGH THE DAY...SO EXPECT THAT THE SHOWERS WILL
PERSIST INTO THE AFTERNOON. 850 MB TEMPS DO START TO WARM LATE IN
THE AFTERNOON...WHICH SHOULD DECREASE SHOWER COVERAGE AND
INTENSITY. WILL RAISE POPS IN SW VA AND NE TN...WITH MAXIMUM
ACCUMULATIONS NEAR ONE INCH. TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING CLOSE TO
FORECAST SO NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES ARE NEEDED TO TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT FRI MAR 16 2007

.DISCUSSION...CALLS TO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA REVEAL THAT RADAR ECHOES 
ARE MIXED LIQUID RAIN AND FLURRIES. ROADS ARE WET BUT NOT ICY. 
CLOUDS RAPIDLY THINNING, NARROWING, AND MOVING EAST OVER REMAINDER 
OF MOUNTAINS, NORTHEAST TENNESSEE, AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. WINDS 
STILL NORTH 5-10 MOST AREAS IN WESTERN SECTIONS ALONG PLATEAU AND 
VALLEY, SLIGHTLY STRONGER NORTHEAST OF THERE. DRIER AIR IS ADVECTING 
IN FROM NORTH, BUT TEMPS ARE GOOFY. WEAK WARM ADVECTION APPEARS TO 
BE OCCURING AT THIS WRITING. AS WINDS DROP MORE, BUT NOT LIKELY TO 
SUSTAINED CALM LEVELS, OVERNIGHT, MORE COOLING WILL OCCUR, BUT DO 
NOT THINK FOG IS LIKELY EXCEPT IN VERY ISOLATED LOCATIONS WAY DOWN 
LOW.

WILL THEREFORE LEAVE FORECAST AS IS. NO UPDATE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 PM EDT FRI MAR 16 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
LINGERING SHOWERS WILL EXIT THE NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE CWA IN THE 
NEXT COUPLE HOURS. THE BACK EDGE OF CLOUDS IN MIDDLE TN...CO-LOCATED 
WITH THE 500 MB TROUGH AXIS...WILL CROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING. 
EXPECT THAT MOST LOCATIONS WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR BY MIDNIGHT...EXCEPT 
FOR POSSIBLY SW VA. THE UPPER TROUGH IS REINFORCED BY AN UPPER JET 
OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS...PUSHING COLD AIR ALOFT TO THE SOUTHEAST. 
STEEPENING LAPSE RATES AND PVA ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN WILL BRING 
ANOTHER CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS LATE TONIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING. 
SOME ACCUMULATION WILL BE POSSIBLE IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND 
NE TN...BUT LESS THAN AN INCH IS EXPECTED ON AVERAGE. BY SATURDAY 
EVENING THE MID LEVEL THERMAL TROUGH MOVES EAST AND SHOWERS WILL 
LIKELY CEASE.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...COLD AIR TROUGH
MOVES EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT ENDING THE SNOW
SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHEAST AND WITH CLEAR SKIES DROPPING
TEMPERATURES BELOW FREEZING. NE TN AND SW VA AND THE MOUNTAINS WILL
SEE LOWS IN THE UPPER TEENS TO LOWER 20S. TRANSITORY HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WITH WARMING TEMPERATURES THOUGH
STILL BELOW NORMAL AND FREEZING TEMPERATURES AGAIN SUNDAY NIGHT
ACROSS THE NORTHEAST. NW FLOW BRINGS SYSTEM DROPPING SOUTH OUT OF
CANADA INTO THE GREAT LAKES MONDAY. COLD FRONT MOVES INTO OHIO
VALLEY WITH MOISTURE AHEAD OF IT ACROSS TN VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT.
COLD FRONT STALLS JUST NORTH OF FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AND THEN
MOVES BACK NORTH WEDNESDAY. NEW AREA OF LOW PRESSURE AND UPPER
TROUGH DEVELOPS EAST OF THE ROCKIES WEDNESDAY AND MOVES INTO THE MS
VALLEY FRIDAY. DECIDED TO KEEP WEDNESDAY THROUGH END OF THE WEEK
DRY WITH THE UNCERTAINTY OF THE SPEED OF THIS SYSTEM AND SLIGHT
RIDGING ALONG THE EAST COAST. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM NEXT WEEK BACK
TO NEAR NORMAL FROM MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH HIGHS MOSTLY IN THE
60S AND LOWS IN THE 40S.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EDT FRI MAR 16 2007

.DISCUSSION...
PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH MIDLEVEL FRONTOGENESIS AND UPPER DIVERGENCE
IN THE JET ENTRANCE REGION WILL MOVE OUT OF THE AREA BY EARLY
AFTERNOON. THE BACK EDGE OF THE LOW CLOUD DECK IS MOVING EAST
THROUGH MIDDLE TN...AND EXTRAPOLATION OF THE CLOUD EDGE INDICATES
SOME CLEARING WILL OCCUR THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPS HAVE BEEN FALLING
WITH COLD ADVECTION...BUT WITH SOME SOLAR HEATING THIS
AFTERNOON...TEMPS SHOULD LEVEL OFF OR INCREASE
SLIGHTLY...ESPECIALLY WEST. POPS WILL BE REMOVED FROM MOST
LOCATIONS FOR THE AFTERNOON EXCEPT IN SW VA AND NE TN WHERE LOW TO
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WILL BE KEPT. ADJUSTMENTS WILL ALSO BE MADE TO
SKY AND TEMPERATURE GRIDS BASED ON THE LATEST OBSERVED TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 160738
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT FRI MAR 16 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO OUR 
SOUTHEAST WILL PULL NORTHEAST AWAY FROM THE AREA TODAY.  COLDER AIR 
WILL PUSH IN BEHIND THIS DEPARTING SYSTEM THIS AFTERNOON AND 
TONIGHT. PRECIP WILL DIMINISH FROM SW TO NE TODAY.  WITH COLD 
ADVECTION TONIGHT...LOW LEVEL WINDS AND THERMAL PROFILES LOOK 
FAVORABLE ENOUGH TO GO WITH CHANCE POPS FOR SNOW SHOWERS IN THE 
NORMALLY FAVORED AREAS.  WILL ALSO KEEP MORE CLOUDINESS AROUND 
DESPITE MODELS ATTEMPT TO DRY THINGS OUT FAIRLY QUICKLY.  GIVEN WIND 
TRAJECTORIES COMING FROM THE GREAT LAKES...THINK THERE WILL BE 
ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR QUITE A BIT OF CLOUDS AT LEAST NORTH ALONG WITH 
MENTIONED POPS.     

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...FORECAST STARTS OUT MORE 
LIKE THE WINTER SEASON WE SHOULD BE TRANSITIONING FROM AS CHILLY AIR 
A GOOD 15 TO 20 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL CONTINUES TO POUR INTO THE 
REGION WITH AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF SHIFTING SLOWLY EAST WHILE 
DEEPENING OVER THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATING 
AROUND THE BACK SIDE OF THE TROF WITH DEEP MOISTURE OVER SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MAY LEAD TO A CONTINUATION OF LIGHT 
SNOW SHOWERS ESPECIALLY IN HIGHER TERRAIN SATURDAY WITH CONCLUSION 
SATURDAY NIGHT. DRIER NORTHWESTERLY FLOW FILLS IN BEHIND TROF FOR 
SUNDAY WITH SURFACE RIDGE IN PLACE. THICKNESS BUILDS RAPIDLY 
ALLOWING MAX TEMPS TO APPROACH NORMAL FOR MID MARCH. THE WARMING 
TREND CONTINUES ON MONDAY AS LOW LEVEL FLOW GOES SOUTHERLY AHEAD OF 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT WHICH BUILDS SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY ON ITS 
WAY TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ON TUESDAY. USED SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
FOR THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU MONDAY AFTERNOON WHILE ADJUSTING UPWARD 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY INTO THE LOW CHANCE RANGE WITH FRONT IN 
PROGGED TO BE IN THE VICINITY. GFS SHOWS MORE AMPLIFICATION TO THE 
UPPER PATTERN TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WITH UPPER TROF 
APPROACHING THROUGH THE PLAINS STATES. FRONT GETS A PUSH BACK NORTH 
OF THE FORECAST AREA AS THIS HAPPENS AND USED A FANCY DECREASE IN 
POPS FROM SOUTH TO NORTH AS WARM SECTOR BUILDS INTO THE REGION. A 
SHOWER OF TWO MAY DEVELOP ON THURSDAY AS WEAK SHORTWAVE FEATURES 
RIDE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH IN SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT SO KEPT A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP IN THIS LATER PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. TRIED TO TREND 
TOWARD MEX MOS TEMPS BUT MADE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS IN PLACES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 160207
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 PM EDT THU MAR 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...SOAKING RAINFALL TO PERSIST MOST OF THE NIGHT. MID 
LEVEL LOW CIRCULATION OVER FL PANHANDLE APPEARS A BIT TIGHTER ON SAT 
PICS THAN MODEL DEPICTED WEAKENING. SURFACE LOW TAKING SHAPE VCNTY 
SW GA AND WILL CONTINIUE TO DEEPEN SLIGHTLY AS IT MOVES NE 
OVERNIGHT. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDING NORTHWARD INTO MRX CWA 
RESULTING IN VARIABLE WIND DIRECTIONS AND LIGHTER SPEEDS. THIS 
SHOULD RESULT IN LOWER CIGS AND VSBYS TIL FRONT MOVES INTO AREA. CAA 
BEHIND FRONT PRETTY STRONG AND UPSTREAM OBS RUNNING BELOW MOS 
GUIDANCE. FORECAST PROBLEM IS WHEN WILL THE FRONT MOVES EAST AND
AIRMASS CHANGE TAKES PLACE. WILL BANK ON THIS OCCURRING INTO THE 
DAYLIGHT HOURS ON FRI SO WILL RESIST TEMPTATION TO LOWER MINS 
TONIGHT. WILL REMOVE THUNDERSTORM WORDING FROM ZFPMRX AND REDUCE 
WINDS SPEEDS IN UPDATE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
THE COLD FRONT ACROSS KENTUCKY THIS AFTERNOON WILL PUSH SOUTH AND 
MOVE THROUGH OUR AREA LATE TONIGHT. AHEAD OF THE FRONT...MOISTURE 
CONVERGENCE AND A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL PRODUCE OCCASIONAL SHOWERS. 
THERE HAVE BEEN NO LIGHTNING STRIKES DETECTED SO FAR TODAY...BUT THE 
PRECIP IS LOOKING MORE CONVECTIVE OVER MIDDLE TN IN THE PAST FEW 
HOURS. OBJECTIVE ANALYSIS INDICATES LI NEAR ZERO IN MIDDLE TN AND 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THUS WILL ONLY INCLUDE ISOLATED THUNDER IN 
THE EVENING FOR THE WESTERN AND SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. FROPA 
IS SLOW...BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z THROUGH OUR AREA. ALIGNMENT OF THE 
FRONT TO THE UPPER FLOW SUGGESTS AN ANAFRONT STRUCTURE...SO SOME 
PRECIP AND OVERCAST SKIES WILL LIKELY PERSIST INTO FRIDAY MORNING 
BEHIND THE FRONT. BY AFTERNOON SOME DRIER AIR ALOFT WILL WORK INTO 
THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST...AND LOCATIONS IN SW VA AND THE PLATEAU 
MAY SEE SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS. POPS WILL TAPER OFF TO JUST A 
SLIGHT CHANCE EAST BY THE LATE AFTERNOON. WITH PLENTY OF CLOUDS 
REMAINING AND COLD ADVECTION BEHIND THE FRONT...TEMPS WILL LIKELY 
NOT RISE MUCH ON FRIDAY FROM OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE 40S AND 50S. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD AIR ADVECTION 
BEHIND TONIGHTS COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY 
WITH MUCH COLDER AND DRIER AIR WORKING IN. FREEZING LEVELS WILL DROP 
AND A CHANGEOVER TO SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS MAY OCCUR ACROSS PART OF 
SW VA AND THE NE TN MOUNTAINS BUT LEFT OVER MOISTURE LOOKS TO BE NOT 
SIGNIFICANT FOR MORE THAN TRACE AMOUNTS AT THIS TIME. THE MAIN 
AFFECT OF THE FRONT WILL BE TO DROP TEMPERATURES TO NEAR TO BELOW 
FREEZING FRIDAY NIGHT. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL KEEP CLOUD COVER 
AROUND IN THE MOUNTAINS AND NE TN/SW VA THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY 
SATURDAY WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THAT AREA IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 
40S. FARTHER SOUTH CLOUDS SHOULD BE MORE SCATTERED BUT WITH COLD AIR 
ADVECTION CONTINUING AS COLD UPPER TROUGH MOVES OVERHEAD AND SURFACE 
HIGH BUILDS SOUTH FROM THE GREAT LAKES TEMPERATURES WILL STRUGGLE TO 
REACH INTO THE 50S. AFTER A CLEAR COLD NIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT WHICH 
SHOULD BE THE COLDEST AND ALL AREAS BELOW FREEZING UPPER TROUGH 
SHIFTS EAST SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM A LITTLE. SOUTHWEST 
WINDS DEVELOP AS HIGH SHIFTS EAST AND A NEW COLD FRONT MOVES INTO 
THE OHIO VALLEY MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL RISE BACK TO NEAR NORMAL. 
NEXT FRONT MOVES THROUGH TUESDAY WITH CHANCE OF RAIN. WEDNESDAY 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE STRENGTHENS AND TEMPERATURES STAY 
MILD.         
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    48  51  33  50  28 / 100  30  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            46  53  32  49  27 / 100  30  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 151434 AAA

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1034 AM EDT THU MAR 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...
RAIN SHOWERS IN MIDDLE TN AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ARE ASSOCIATED
WITH A VORT MAX OVER WEST TN THIS MORNING. THIS FEATURE WILL TRACK
EAST AND SPREAD PRECIP INTO OUR AREA THROUGH THE AFTERNOON...AND
THE CURRENT FORECAST OF LIKELY POPS LOOKS GOOD. HEAVIEST PRECIP WILL
LIKELY HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER 00Z HOWEVER...ASSOCIATED WITH BETTER
LOW LEVEL FORCING NEAR THE COLD FRONT. INSTABILITY APPEARS
MINIMAL...WITH PLENTY OF CLOUDS LIMITING SURFACE HEATING. LATEST
NAM SHOWS THE BEST INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON TO OUR SOUTH AND
WEST...AND MAINLY THIS EVENING. WILL REMOVE THE MENTION OF THUNDER
FROM THE NORTH AND EAST THIS AFTERNOON. SOME ADJUSTMENTS WILL BE
NEEDED TO HOURLY TEMPS...BUT EXPECT THAT HIGHS WILL GENERALLY END
UP CLOSE TO THE CURRENT FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT THU MAR 15 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SATELLITE SHOWING UPPER LOW MOVING 
ACROSS LA.   SURFACE OBSERVATIONS INDICATE A COLD FRONT TRACKING 
INTO NORTHERN KY.  MODELS INDICATE AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND LIFT 
ACROSS OUR CWA TODAY AS THE FRONT SAGS SOUTH INTO OUR AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON.   WILL GO WITH 70 TO 90 POPS FOR TODAY...WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES IN OUR WESTERN ZONES. SOME WEAK INSTABILITY EXPECTED THIS 
AFTERNOON...WILL KEEP THUNDER IN THE FORECAST.  FRONT LINGERS ACROSS 
OUR AREA TONIGHT AS THE UPPER TROUGH ARRIVES...BRINGING DEEPER 
MOISTURE AND LIFT...WILL KEEP 90 POPS FOR TONIGHT.  STAYED NEAR 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM...LITTLE CHANGE FROM PREVIOUS PACKAGE. GFS IS MODEL OF 
CHOICE FOR THIS PERIOD. SIGNIFICANT WAVE PASSES BY LATE THURSDAY, 
WITH MUCH COOLER AIR BEHIND PUSHING MOISTURE OUT OF AREA BY LATE 
FRIDAY. LINGERING SHOWERS ON FRIDAY MORNING MOST AREAS WILL MOVE 
QUICKLY EAST BY AFTERNOON. STRONG LOW LEVEL COLD ADVECTION WILL DRY 
OUT AIR AND CLEAR SKIES BY FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING, MAKING 
FOR RETURN TO LATE WINTER LOWS SATURDAY MORNING. IT IS, AFTER ALL, 
NOT APRIL YET. HAVE LEFT POPS, CLOUDS, WX THE SAME BUT DROPPED 
FRIDAYS MAX TEMPS DOWN A FEW DEGREES AREA-WIDE, AS WELL AS THE LOWS 
ON SATURDAY, AS BELIEVE MODEL DATA A LITTLE TOO HIGH. TOO MANY 
CLOUDS ON FRIDAY, TOO FEW OVERNIGHT.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 150141
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EDT WED MAR 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...FOREAST ON TRACK. TEXT UPDATE TO ZFPMRX TO REMOVE 
PCPN WORDING. SURFACE RIDGE WILL HOLD ON FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS
THEN GIVE WAY TO APPROACHING SURFACE FRONT...DEEPER MOISTURE
AND GOOD PCPN CHC THU-EARLY FRI. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHOWERS AND A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED JUST NORTH AND WEST OF THE AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON. SOME OF THESE SHOWERS COULD AFFECT THE NORTHERN PLATEAU 
AND SW VA NEAR THE KY BORDER...BUT NO MORE THAN SCATTERED COVERAGE. 
AS THESE STORMS LACK UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT AND ARE PRIMARILY DRIVEN BY 
SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY...THEY WILL LIKELY DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET 
AND WILL END POPS BY MIDNIGHT. 

ON THURSDAY THE UPPER LOW OVER THE SRN MS VALLEY WILL MERGE WITH THE 
DEEPENING TROUGH OVER GREAT LAKES. MOISTURE FROM THE CLOSED LOW WILL 
SPREAD INTO OUR AREA FROM THE SOUTH IN THE MORNING. LIFT REMAINS 
WEAK UNTIL THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING WHEN THE TROUGH TO THE NORTH 
BEGINS TO SAG SOUTH. INSTABILITY WILL BE MARGINAL WITH LI BARELY 
UNDER ZERO IN THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. WILL 
MENTION ONLY ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS SOUTH AND WEST. LOWERING 500 MB 
HEIGHTS AND INCREASING UPPER DIVERGENCE AS THE JET MOVES SOUTH WILL 
PROVIDE CATEGORICAL POPS OVERNIGHT. THE FRONTAL PASSAGE IS DELAYED 
SLIGHTLY FROM THE UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN 
FRIDAY UNTIL THE FRONT IS THROUGH THE AREA BY THE AFTERNOON. COLD 
ADVECTION BEHIND THE FRONT WILL LIMIT HIGH TEMPS ON FRIDAY TO THE 
50S IN MOST LOCATIONS. 

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WE WILL BE BETWEEN 
SYSTEMS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY FOR GENERALLY DRY AND MILD CONDITIONS.  
NEXT SYSTEM SHOULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE MRX CWA ON MONDAY...WITH BEST 
CHANCE FOR RAIN SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP SOME LOW POPS INTO 
TUESDAY WITH DRYING TREND ON WEDNESDAY.  GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK GOOD 
AND WILL STAY CLOSE.

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT WED MAR 14 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHOWERS AND A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED JUST NORTH AND WEST OF THE AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON. SOME OF THESE SHOWERS COULD AFFECT THE NORTHERN PLATEAU 
AND SW VA NEAR THE KY BORDER...BUT NO MORE THAN SCATTERED COVERAGE. 
AS THESE STORMS LACK UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT AND ARE PRIMARILY DRIVEN BY 
SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY...THEY WILL LIKELY DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET 
AND WILL END POPS BY MIDNIGHT. 

ON THURSDAY THE UPPER LOW OVER THE SRN MS VALLEY WILL MERGE WITH THE 
DEEPENING TROUGH OVER GREAT LAKES. MOISTURE FROM THE CLOSED LOW WILL 
SPREAD INTO OUR AREA FROM THE SOUTH IN THE MORNING. LIFT REMAINS 
WEAK UNTIL THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING WHEN THE TROUGH TO THE NORTH 
BEGINS TO SAG SOUTH. INSTABILITY WILL BE MARGINAL WITH LI BARELY 
UNDER ZERO IN THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. WILL 
MENTION ONLY ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS SOUTH AND WEST. LOWERING 500 MB 
HEIGHTS AND INCREASING UPPER DIVERGENCE AS THE JET MOVES SOUTH WILL 
PROVIDE CATEGORICAL POPS OVERNIGHT. THE FRONTAL PASSAGE IS DELAYED 
SLIGHTLY FROM THE UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN 
FRIDAY UNTIL THE FRONT IS THROUGH THE AREA BY THE AFTERNOON. COLD 
ADVECTION BEHIND THE FRONT WILL LIMIT HIGH TEMPS ON FRIDAY TO THE 
50S IN MOST LOCATIONS. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WE WILL BE BETWEEN 
SYSTEMS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY FOR GENERALLY DRY AND MILD CONDITIONS.  
NEXT SYSTEM SHOULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE MRX CWA ON MONDAY...WITH BEST 
CHANCE FOR RAIN SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP SOME LOW POPS INTO 
TUESDAY WITH DRYING TREND ON WEDNESDAY.  GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK GOOD 
AND WILL STAY CLOSE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1024 AM EDT WED MAR 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...
SOME TOWERING CU HAVE DEVELOPED IN NORTHERN MIDDLE TN AND SOUTHERN
KY...WHICH IS AN AREA OF HIGHER SURFACE THETA-E. BOTH THE NAM AND
RUC SHOW THE HIGHEST INSTABILITY AND SOME WEAK LOW LEVEL
CONVERGENCE IN THIS AREA AND TO OUR NORTHWEST...SO THE LOCATIONS
WITH THE GREATEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS/TSTMS WILL BE IN THE NORTHERN
PLATEAU AND SW VA. EXPECT THAT STORMS WILL WEAKEN AS THEY MORE
INTO MORE STABLE AIR...AND WILL MENTION ONLY ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS. WILL MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENTS TO POP/WX/QPF GRIDS.
TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING HIGHER THAN FORECAST IN SEVERAL
LOCATIONS...AND CLOUD COVER IS A LITTLE LESS THAN EXPECTED...SO
WILL MAKE A SLIGHT UPWARD ADJUSTMENT TO TEMPS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE AREA

LATE TONIGHT. BETTER MOISTURE AND LIFT SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL 
THURSDAY...BUT WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FOR TONIGHT. WITH 
CONSIDERABLE CLOUD COVER EXPECTED TODAY...WENT A LITTLE BELOW 
GUIDANCE FOR AFTERNOON HIGHS. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR LOWS 
TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THAT A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA FROM 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON. BOTH MODELS INDICATE 
SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY DEVELOPING ALONG THIS FRONT...SO WILL 
MENTION SOME THUNDER ON THURSDAY...BUT WILL KEEP THE EMPHASIS ON 
SHOWERS FOR NOW. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY SOME OVER THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY NIGHT...WHICH SHOULD INCREASE THE 
COVERAGE OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE THEN 
BUILDS INTO THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH SWINGING ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS ON SATURDAY. WRF MODEL IS 
NOT AS AMPLIFIED WITH THIS UPPER TROUGH AS THE GFS MODEL. WITH THIS 
IN MIND...WILL NOT MENTION ANY PRECIP ON SATURDAY...SINCE MOISTURE 
SHOULD ALSO BE LIMITED WITH THIS UPPER TROUGH. ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY...SO WILL KEEP A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST FOR THE MONDAY AND TUESDAY 
TIME FRAME.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
234 PM EDT TUE MAR 13 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ATMOSPHERE TRIES TO 
PRODUCE RAINFALL DURING THE SECOND HALF OF THE SHORT TERM AS UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGHING SLOWLY APPROACHES THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY. MOISTURE ADVECTION INCREASES MAINLY MID AND UPPER LEVELS AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT NOT IMPRESSIVE AS WEAK SHORTWAVE FEATURES RIDE 
ACROSS THE REGION IN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. THINK GUIDANCE POPS 
ARE A LITTLE ON THE HIGH SIDE AND STAYED UNDER. LEFT IN THE ISOLATED 
THUNDER AS SOME MODEL INSTABILITY NOTED. DID NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM 
GUIDANCE ALTHOUGH FOR MINS TONIGHT TRIMMED A DEGREE FROM LOWER 
ELEVATION POINTS IN THE GREAT VALLEY WHERE HIGHER DEWPOINTS/LOW 
LEVEL MIXING APPEAR TO BE A LITTLE TOO ZEALOUS FOR REALITY. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...EARLY IN THE PERIOD 
...FORECAST AREA REMAINS ON THE NW EDGE OF LARGE SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE RIDGING FROM THE ATLANTIC. WARM TEMPS WITH INCREASING UPPER 
MOISTURE THROUGH THU. EASTWARD MOVING CUT OFF LOW TRACKING A BIT S 
OF PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS. THE WEAKENING TROUGH AXIS WILL BE SOUTH OF E 
TN THU NGT. FRONTAL BOUNDARY DROPS INTO AREA FROM NW BY EARLY FRI AS 
MAIN JET STREAM CARVES TROUGH ACROSS OH RVR VLY. TIMING OF BEST PCPN 
CHC CURRENTLY THU EVE THROUGH EARLY FRI. GFS QPF VERY OPTIMISTIC 
WITH EVENT WITH 6HR AMOUNTS IN EXCESS OF ONE INCH. MUCH LESS 
RAINFALL IS EXPECTED AT THIS TIME. REINFORCING JET SEGMENT DIGS INTO 
UPPER TROUGH LATE ON FRIDAY AS TROUGH SHARPENS AND MOVES NORTHEAST OF THE 
AREA FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEKEND. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
IN BEHIND THE FRONT ON FRI AND BECOMES CENTERED OVER THE AREA ON 
SUNDAY. THIS TRANSLATES TO A WARMER SOLUTION ACROSS THE AREA FOR THE 
WEEKEND AS BEST CAA QUICKLY MOVES OFF TO THE NE. BUMPED UP TEMPS A 
CATEGORY AND RUNNING BELOW GFS MOS GUIDANCE. HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS SE 
WITH RIDGING WELL WEST INTO THE N GLFMEX. THE RETURN OF GOOD 
MOISTURE FROM THE GULF STILL NOT IN THE FCST PICTURE AND LOW POPS FOR 
LATE MON INTO TUESDAY MAY BE OVERDONE AS NEXT FRONT SAGS INTO AREA.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS

YESTERDAY. CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL SOME MID TO HIGH LEVEL

CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. AS FOR TEMPS... 
WILL TREND TOWARD THE WARMER NGM MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS TODAY...WITH 
SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS EXPECTED. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACHING 
THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY....MOISTURE INCREASING ACROSS THE AREA...BUT 
RIDGE KEEPING BEST MOISTURE TO THE WEST. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING 
FOR WEDNESDAY WITH BEST CHANCES IN THE WEST.   SOME INSTABILITY ALSO 
EXPECTED...WILL ADD THUNDER IN FOR WEDNESDAY.  MOISTURE INCREASING 
ON THURSDAY AS FRONT NEARS...WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS IN FOR LATE 
THURSDAY WITH BEST CHANCES EXPECTED ON THURSDAY NIGHT AS FRONT 
PUSHES THROUGH.  UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWS IN FRIDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE 
POPS FOR MAINLY THE NORTHERN AREAS.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TRACKS 
THROUGH ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR OUR NORTHERN AREAS ON FRIDAY NIGHT...THICKNESSES 
INDICATE COULD SEE WINTRY MIX IN THE MOUNTAINS.  EXCEPT FOR SOME 
MORNING FLURRIES...DRIER WEATHER RETURNS ON SATURDAY AND CONTINUES 
INTO SUNDAY.  ANOTHER FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACHES ON MONDAY...BRINGING 
ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EDT MON MAR 12 2007

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE WEATHER 
TONIGHT THOUGH IT WILL BE WEAKENING TOMORROW AND INTO WEDNESDAY.  
CURRENT FORECAST STILL ON TRACK SO NO CHANGES PLANNED.

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE RIDGE GRADUALLY 
SLIPS SOUTHEAST AWAY FROM THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE PERIOD WITH 
WEAKENING UPPER LOW PROGGED TO MOVE AT A SNAILS PACE FROM WESTERN 
TEXAS TO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY 00Z THURSDAY. THIS RESULTS 
IN ADVECTION OF MOIST AIR WHICH EVENTUALLY BECOMES DEEP ENOUGH IN 
ISENTROPIC REGIME TO REQUIRE THE USE OF CHANCE POPS WHICH USED ON 
WEDNESDAY FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A SHOWER OR TWO (HIGHEST CHANCE ON 
THE PLATEAU). MOST EXCELLENT WARMTH TO CONTINUE WITH HIGHS WELL 
ABOVE NORMAL AND STAYED NICE AND CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND CONCERNING 
TEMP FORECAST.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WEAKENING SHORT WAVE 
TROUGH MOVES EASTWARD THROUGH TN VLY THROUGH THU. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE RIDGE CONTINUES TO WEAKEN OVER AREA. WAA AND LAYER RH 
INCREASES IN SW FLOW. PCPN CHC INCREASES WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND BECOMES 
LIKELY THU AND THU NGT...AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY APPROACHES. LIFT AND 
INSTABILITY LOOK MARGINAL AT THIS POINT SO WILL LEAVE OUT 
THUNDERSTORM MENTION. DIGGING JET PUSHES FRONT THROUGH THE S 
APPALACHIANS EARLY FRI. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BUT REMAINS 
CENTERED WEST OF AREA. RESULTING NORTHERLY FLOW WILL DRAG SOME LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE THROUGH NE PART OF MRX CWA. SCT SHOWERS AND A FEW 
FLURRIES POSSIBLE INTO SAT MORNING MAINLY ACROSS SW VA. RIDGE SLIDES 
EAST THROUGH AREA ON SUNDAY. ANOTHER ROUND OF PCPN SETS UP IN 
PREFRONTAL ENVIRONMENT BY LATE MONDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

239 AM EDT MON MAR 12 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WITH A DRY 
AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL

AND THINK THAT ONLY A FEW HIGH THIN CLOUDS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARD 
THE WARMER NGM AND WRF MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS WITH SOUTHERLY WINDS AND 
NEAR-FULL SUNSHINE EXPECTED. 


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAIN ISSUE FOR THE LONG TERM 
REMAINS SYSTEM THAT APPROACHES BY MID WEEK. STILL APPEARS THAT 
THURSDAY WILL HAVE THE GREATEST CHANCE OF PRECIP AS UPPER 
TROUGH/SURFACE FRONT SWINGS THROUGH THE AREA. MOISTURE INCREASES 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON WEDNESDAY AS SYSTEM ADVANCES 
EASTWARD FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS. HOWEVER...APPEARS GFS GUIDANCE 
POPS ARE OVERDONE AS SREF GENERALLY DOES NOT SUPPORT THE GFS 
WIDESPREAD PRECIP PROJECTION. THIS PLUS THE DRY REGIME WEVE 
EXPERIENCE RECENTLY MAKES IT UNLIKELY THAT ANYTHING MORE THAN 
SCATTERED PRECIP WILL OCCUR. WILL KEEP POPS IN CHANCE CATEGORY FOR 
WEDNESDAY AT THIS TIME. IN THE MEANTIME...HEIGHT RISES PORTEND 
WELL-ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS FOR EARLY WORK WEEK. TEMPS WILL TEND TO FALL 
BELOW CLIMO FOLLOWING PASSAGE OF SURFACE COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY...BUT 
A RETURN TO DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED THROUGH NEXT WEEKEND.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT SUN MAR 11 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK.  NO CHANGES PLANNED.


.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SKIES HAVE CLEARED ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA WITH DRIER AIR DROPPING RELATIVE HUMIDITIES INTO 
THE TEENS TO MID 30S. BOUNDARY LAYER HAS DRIED SO MUCH THAT DONT 
EXPECT ANY PATCHY FOG LIKE THIS MORNING. WENT CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR 
MINS...WHICH MAY NEED TO BE WATCHED GIVEN MID AFTERNOON DEW POINT 
TEMPS. SURFACE RIDGE DROPPING SLOWLY SE FROM THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
SHOULD CREATE A WEAK EASTERLY FLOW IN THE LOW LEVELS...BUT VALLEY 
WINDS MAY DECOUPLE OR STAY LIGHT NE OVERNIGHT. POSSIBLE FOR A FEW 
CLOUDS TO DEVELOP TOWARD DAYBREAK ACROSS SOUTHERN AND EASTERN MOST 
ZONES...OTHERWISE MOSTLY CLEAR.

LOW LEVEL FLOW TURNS WEAK SW TO W BY MONDAY AFTERNOON...WHICH
SHOULD ADVECT IN SLIGHTLY HIGHER DEW POINT TEMPS...AND ALSO CREATE
A QUITE WARM AFTERNOON. FAVORED AT OR JUST ABOVE THE GFS MOS MAX
TEMPS GIVEN PAST FEW DAYS. BLEND FOR MINS LOOKED GOOD FOR MONDAY
NIGHT...THEN DRY AND EVEN WARMER ON TUESDAY...AS CLOSED UPPER LOW
OVER NM/TX REMAINS WELL TO OUR WEST AND SW LOW LEVEL FLOW
STRENGTHENS SLIGHTLY.

FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS WILL BE THE RELATIVELY LOW RH PERCENTAGES
MONDAY AFTERNOON...BUT THE SW TO W SURFACE WINDS SHOULD REMAIN
LIGHT. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
GRADUALLY TRANSITIONS TO SOUTHWEST AS UPPER LOW ADVANCES SLOWLY EAST 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
WEAKENING WHILE PHASING WITH NORTHERN STREAM SYSTEM. THIS LEADS TO 
INCREASED MOISTURE AND TEMPERATURE ADVECTION FOR ABOVE NORMAL WARMTH 
AND INCREASING CHANCE FOR RAIN WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS COLD 
FRONT PRESSES SLOWLY SOUTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY (HIGHEST 
POP ON THURSDAY). FRONT DEPARTS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND WAS ABLE TO DROP OUT POPS FOR A DRY BUT COLDER SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY AS NORTHWEST FLOW ESTABLISHES ITSELF


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             45  73  47  75  51 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  70  47  73  51 /   0   0   0  10  10

WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD ACROSS THE REGION AND BECOME CENTERED OVER 
THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY TONIGHT. AS A RESULT...EXPECT DRY 
WEATHER WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS TODAY AND TONIGHT. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARD THE WARMER GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...SINCE THESE NUMBERS HAVE BEEN VERIFYING BETTER 
LATELY. 


.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...DRY WEATHER WITH ABOVE CLIMO 
TEMPS IN STORE FOR EARLY WORK WEEK AS RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT
CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE REGION. NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES BY MID
WEEK. INCONSISTENCIES IN TIMING WITH THIS SYSTEM CONTINUE IN LATEST
GFS RUN...AND ENSEMBLES REMAIN QUITE CHAOTIC PRECLUDING MUCH HELP.
WILL CONTINUE LOW CHANCE POPS OVER AN EXTENDED TIME PERIOD TO COVER
TIMING UNCERTAINTIES. TEMPS WILL REMAIN ABOVE CLIMO UNTIL PASSAGE
OF SURFACE FRONT WHEN TEMPS WILL FALL WELL BELOW CLIMO LATE IN THE
LONG TERM PERIOD. GFS GUIDANCE TEMPS GENERALLY APPEAR REASONABLE
AND DID NOT DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM THOSE VALUES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 PM EST SAT MAR 10 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...ONLY SYSTEM TO POSSIBLY

PREVIOUS GRIDS. DID DECREASE POPS AND WORD AS CHANCE OR SLIGHT
CHANCE ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC AREAS...WHERE MODEL QPF IS BARELY
MEASURABLE. KEPT A SMALL AREA OF LIKELY (60 PERCENT) POPS FOR SW VA
EARLY TONIGHT...AND CARRIED SCATTERED WORDING WHERE CHANCE POPS
WERE USED IN MOST REMAINING AREAS. REMOVED SUNDAY MORNING POPS.

OTHERWISE...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SPREADS ACROSS MUCH OF THE
EASTERN STATES INTO MONDAY...PROVIDING DRY AND WARM WEATHER.
AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL FALL INTO THE 20 PRECENT RANGE
...BUT AT LEAST WINDS LOOK TO BE VERY LIGHT WITH SURFACE HIGH
BUILDING IN FROM THE NORTH.

FOR MOS...UNDERCUT MOS POPS FOR TONIGHT. WENT ABOVE MOS HIGHS BOTH
DAYS GIVEN PAST PERFORMANCE...DRY AIRMASS AND WESTERLY WINDS ON
MONDAY. MINS LOOKED REASONABLE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...ATMOSPHERE REMAINS DRY 
IN THE EARLY PART OF THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH SURFACE RIDGING 
CUTTING OFF MOISTURE RETURN FROM THE GULF. EVENTUALLY MOISTURE DOES 
RETURN BY MID WEEK IN TIME FOR SOME SHORTWAVE ENERGY AND A FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WHICH REQUIRES RAISING POPS FROM SLIGHT EARLY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING TO MEDIUM CHANCE BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS SURFACE WAVE DRAGS 
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA. DRIER AND COLDER NORTHWEST FLOW CREATES 
A COOLER BUT UNEVENTFUL END OF THE WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 AM EST SAT MAR 10 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A WEAK WARM FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY LINGERING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. DEWPOINTS REMAIN LOW 
NORTH OF THIS BOUNDARY ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...BUT 
SOUTHERLY WINDS SHOULD HELP TO ADVECT MOISTURE INTO THE NORTHEAST 
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON. THE COLD FRONT OVER 
THE MS RIVER VALLEY IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. BOTH THE GFS AND WRF MODELS 
REVEAL WEAK LOW-LEVEL CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF THIS FRONT...WITH WEAK 
UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS AS WELL. THUS...ONLY EXPECT A FEW SCATTERED 
SHOWERS TODAY...MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. AS 
FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE WARMER THAN GFS GUIDANCE SINCE THIS 
HAS BEEN THE TREND LATELY. HOWEVER...INCREASED CLOUD COVER TODAY 
SHOULD HELP TO KEEP MAXES LOWER THAN YESTERDAY. 


.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS HAVE BACKED OFF ON THEIR 
EARLIER PROJECTION OF KEEPING UNSETTLED WEATHER THROUGH EARLY WORK 
WEEK AND NOW ADVERTISE A RETURN TO DRY WEATHER ON SUNDAY PERSISTING 
THROUGH MID WEEK. NEXT SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM WILL APPROACH IN THE LATE 
WEDNESDAY/EARLY THURSDAY TIME FRAME. STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY AS 
ENSEMBLES PROJECT BEST CHANCE TO OCCUR LATER ON THURSDAY. AS 
SUCH...HAVE NOT MADE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO POPS FOR THIS TIME 
FRAME. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO AVERAGE ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH MOST OF THE 
LONG TERM BEFORE FALLING TO SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMO FOLLOWING PASSAGE 
OF SURFACE COLD FRONT LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

DEWPOINTS THROUGH THE DEEP SOUTH AS WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHIFTS
SLOWLY EAST ACROSS NORTHERN GULF COAST. AT THE SAME TIME WEAK COLD
FRONT DROPS STEADILY SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY WITH ARRIVAL ON
THURSDAY. NOT A GREAT DEAL OF CONFIDENCE HERE AS WEAK FORCING NOTED
IN MODEL SOLUTIONS AT THIS TIME SO STAYED WITH SLIGHT AND LOWER
CHANCE POPS FOR UNSETTLED MID TO LATE WEEK PERIOD. USED A DRY AND
SOMEWHAT COOLER FORECAST FOR FRIDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

BY SUNRISE TOMORROW...WITH A FEW PRE-FRONTAL SHOWERS POSSIBLE ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TN AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT AS A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
APPROACHES.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SERIES OF WEAK UPPER WAVES 
COUPLE WITH A DIFFUSE...NEARLY STATIONARY SURFACE BOUNDARY OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WILL KEEP WEATHER SOMEWHAT UNSETTLED 
OVER THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK PER MODEL AND SREF 
CONSENSUS. ANY PRECIP IS EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT AND SCATTERED HOWEVER 
AS MOISTURE PROFILE REMAINS UNIMPRESSIVE PER MODEL TIME-HEIGHT 
SECTIONS. ANOTHER PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER FOLLOWS FOR MID WEEK BEFORE 
ANOTHER POSSIBLY MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM APPROACHES BY EARLY 
THURSDAY. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF UNDERCUTTING POPS ON SATURDAY...
GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD
AS ENSEMBLES SUPPORT ITS SOLUTION FOR THE MOST PART.

.DISCUSSION...A WEAK UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM THAT BROUGHT SOME CLOUDS TO 
THE AREA IS MOVING OFF TO THE EAST WHICH SHOULD RETURN THE REGION TO 
SUNNY SKIES.  HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER NORTHEAST U.S. BEGINNING 
TO SLOWLY GIVE WAY TO A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT PLAINS 
REGION.  SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL BRING INCREASING MOISTURE AND WARM 
TEMPERATURES TO THE AREA TODAY INTO TOMORROW.  A COLD FRONT WITH THE 
LOW PRESSURE AREA WILL TRIGGER SOME LIGHT SHOWERS IN THE REGION 
TOMORROW INTO SATURDAY NIGHT.  FORECAST FOR TODAY STILL LOOKS GOOD 
WITH MILD SPRING LIKE TEMPERATURES AND MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES.  

FORECAST FOR SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT WILL BE INTERESTING AS THE 
SYSTEM WILL BE LIMITED IN MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY SO LIKELYHOOD OF 
RAIN IN QUESTION.  WILL TACKLE THAT QUESTION WITH THE AFTERNOON 
FORECAST.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
SOUTHERN TN BORDER...WITH A DRY AIR MASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EST THU MAR 8 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE/VORT
MAX HAS SPUN EAST INTO W TN AND N MS THIS AFTERNOON...AND MAY
PRODUCE A BRIEF PERIOD OF SCATTERED TO BROKEN CLOUDS FOR SRN AREAS
LATER TONIGHT. ALSO...PAINTED IN A FEW CLOUDS OVER FAR ERN AREAS
DUE TO WEAK SE LOW LEVEL FLOW COMING AROUND THE SURFACE RIDGE.
DRY FORECAST LOOKS GOOD FOR TONIGHT...AND GENERALLY FAVORED MILDER
MINS FOR SRN AREAS AND SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT MOS FOR SW VA AND NE TN
WHERE LESS CLOUDS WILL OCCUR.

A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUDS LINGERS FOR FRIDAY WITH SOME AFTERNOON
CUMULUS CLOUDS POSSIBLE...ALTHO HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD THIN WITH
PASSAGE OF WEAK SHORTWAVE. MOS OFFERS MAX TEMPS A FEW DEGREES BELOW
TODAYS HIGHS...WHICH IS REASONABLE BUT MAY NOT OCCUR IF HIGH CLOUDS
DIMINISH EARLY ENOUGH.

MOISTURE AND CLOUDS CONTINUE TO INCREASE FRIDAY NIGHT AS BETTER
SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW DEVELOPS AHEAD OF THE NEXT FRONTAL SYSTEM.
HOWEVER...LOOKS SAFE TO KEEP FORECAST DRY UNTIL SATURDAY DAYTIME.
GFS MODEL MAY BE OVERDOING MOISTURE RETURN AND PRECIPITATION...
SO I TRENDED MORE TO A MOS BLEND FOR LOWS/HIGHS FRIDAY NIGHT AND
SATURDAY...AND ALSO UNDERCUT GFS MOS POPS CONSIDERABLY FOR NOW. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY MEANDERS NEAR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA ON SUNDAY WHILE A 
DISTURBANCE PRESSES SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. 
MONDAY/TUESDAY TIMEFRAME. BASICALLY A PERIOD OF MODEL UNCERTAINTY 
WITH DIFFERING SOLUTIONS BUT MAINTAINED SOME CONTINUITY WITH A SMALL 
BIT OF POP TO DEAL WITH POSSIBILITY OF ENOUGH LIFT AND MOISTURE TO 
CREATE A FEW -SHRA DURING THIS PERIOD. LATER MODEL RUNS WILL BRING 
MORE FOCUS TO THIS TRANSITIONAL PERIOD (WINTER TO SPRING) WHERE 
PRESSURE GRADIENTS BECOME MORE RELAXED WHILE THE JET RETREATS TO 
HIGHER LATITUDES. TRENDED TOWARD THE HPC SOLUTION WHICH ALLOWS FOR A 
DRY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

247 PM EST WED MAR 7 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEAK PRESSURE FALLS ACROSS

FRONT HAVE GENERALLY HELD AROUND 15 TO 20 MPH WITH SOME GUSTINESS 
EXCEEDING 25 MPH AT TIMES. THIS PLUS LOWER THAN EXPECTED DEW POINT 
TEMPS AND SLIGHTLY HIGHER MAX TEMPS...HAS YIELDED DANGEROUS FIRE 
WEATHER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON. WILL LET OUR PREVIOUSLY ISSUED 
SPSMRX PRODUCT CONTINUE TO COVER THE SITUATION...BUT MAY FRESHEN IT 
UP WITH THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE. WINDS DIMINISH THIS EVENING AND A 
BLEND OR CLOSER TO GFS MINS LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT.

OTHERWISE...LATER PERIODS LOOK DRY AS RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
INTO THE REGION. HOWEVER...A WEAK DISTURBANCE PASSING TO OUR SW 
ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES THURSDAY NIGHT AND A WEAK RETURN OF 
SOUTHERLY FLOW AS SURFACE RIDGE SHIFTS EAST...WILL BRING MILDER MIN 
TEMPS AND INCREASING CLOUDS LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. MORE OF 
THIS CLOUDINESS LOOKS TO AFFECT SRN AREAS...BUT ABLE TO KEEP THE 
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW. CHOSE GFS MOS FOR HIGHS FRIDAY...AND A BLEND 
FOR HIGHS THURSDAY AND FOR MINS THURSDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT APPROACHING 
THE AREA ON SATURDAY...WENT WITH THE SLOWER NAM AND KEPT FRIDAY 
NIGHT DRY.  BEST MOISTURE REMAINS TO THE NORTH OF OUR CWA...BUT 
SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT ENOUGH TO CARRY CHANCE POPS ON SATURDAY.  FRONT 
LINGERS IN THE REGION ON SUNDAY...BEST MOISTURE TO THE NORTH 
AGAIN...BUT WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING INTO SUNDAY.  DRIER WEATHER 
PUSHING IN ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
TRACKING ACROSS THE GULF STATES ON TUESDAY THEN PUSHES NORTH ON 
WEDNESDAY...WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY.  STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

ITEMS. CURRENT DEW POINT TEMPERATURES WERE CONSIDERABLY LOWER THAN
FORECAST GRIDS...WITH SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO REFLECT LOWER DEW
POINTS AND HUMIDITIES. DONT THINK THAT WIND SPEEDS WILL GET MUCH
ABOVE PREVIOUS FORECAST GRID VALUES.

HOWEVER...BASED ON CALLS MADE TO TN/VA/NC FORESTRY OFFICIALS...WE
WILL ISSUE A FIRE DANGER STATEMENT DUE TO DRY CONDITIONS AND AT
LEAST BREEZY WIND SPEEDS THIS AFTERNOON.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SKIES RANGE FROM MOSTLY CLEAR

FEATURE FROM MI INTO OH AND PA WAS PRODUCING LIGHT SNOW. HIGH 
PRESSURE WAS OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES WITH LOWER PRESSURE OVER MO. 
A WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDED INTO THE TX PANHANDLE  AND A WEAK WARM 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY STRETCHED ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY INTO EAST 
TN. DEW POINTS ACROSS SW VA WERE IN THE TEENS THIS MORNING WITH MID 
20S TO MID 30S ACROSS MOST OF EAST TN AND SW VA. THE COLD FRONT WILL 
SLOWLY MOVE SOUTHEAST AND CROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING AND INCREASE WINDS FROM THE WEST TO SOUTHWEST. THE SYSTEM IN 
THE OHIO VALLEY WILL KEEP SKIES PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY ACROSS SW VA 
AND PART OF NE TN BUT DO NOT EXPECT ANY RAINFALL. WINDS SHOULD 
INCREASE FROM THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST TO 10 TO 15 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 
25 MPH IN THE AFTERNOON AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. MINIMUM RH VALUES 
SHOULD DROP TO AROUND 25 PERCENT IN SOME CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
EASTERN MOUNTAIN LOCATIONS. GENERALLY FOLLOWED A NAM/GFS BLEND FOR 
TEMPERATURES TODAY AND TONIGHT.        

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
RIDGE SOUTH INTO THE AREA WITH A WEAK INVERTED TROUGH TO THE SE. A 
WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE SE INTO THE MID TN VLY ON THU. SOME CLOUDS 
ACROSS S PART OF CWA ONLY CONCERN. SHORT WAVE MOVES EAST OF AREA FRI 
WHILE SFC RIDGING SLIDES SE ALLOWING FOR CONTINUED WARMING TREND. 
HIGH UNCERTAINTY WITH REMAINDER OF FORECAST. MAIN FLOW WELL NORTH OF 
AREA. MODELS VARY ON STRENGTH/POSITION OF SHORT WAVE/LOW DROPPING S 
DOWN ROCKIES. WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIDES LAZILY SE INTO OR NEAR 
MRX CWA ON SUNDAY. RAMPED UP POPS WITH A GOOD CHC SUNDAY MAINLY TO 
EMPHASIZE TREND. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN MON AND TUE. TEMPS 
ABOVE NORMAL AND POP CHCS TOO LOW TO MENTION.

REASONABLE BASED ON EXPECTED CONDITIONS AND WERE GENERALLY FOLLOWED
CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A FRONT WILL CROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND MOVE INTO OUR AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER SINCE THE MID AND UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL BE 
NORTHWESTERLY THE MOISTURE WILL BE VERY SHALLOW...BELOW 800 MB IN
MODEL CROSS SECTIONS. SOME WEAK LIFT MAY BE PROVIDED BY CONVERGENCE
WITH THE 850 MB TROUGH. WILL REMOVE POPS BUT MENTION A CHANCE OF
SPRINKLES IN SW VA WEDNESDAY EVENING.

THE 850 MB RIDGE TO OUR SOUTH WILL KEEP GULF MOISTURE CUT OFF FROM 
OUR AREA AND PROVIDE DRY WEATHER ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. THE RIDGE 
BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST ON FRIDAY NIGHT AS A WEAK TROUGH CROSSES THE 
PLAINS...BUT THE RIDGE HANGS ON ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST CONUS. A 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALLOWS FOR SOME MOISTURE RETURN ON SATURDAY...BUT 
THE BEST LIFT REMAINS TO OUR NORTH. THIS PATTERN OF A RIDGE TO OUR 
SOUTH WITH SHORTWAVES PASSING TO OUR NORTH PERSISTS THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...SO DETERMINING A MORE NARROW PERIOD OF HIGHER POPS IS 
DIFFICULT THIS FAR OUT. WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE POPS THAT 
ARE CURRENTLY FORECAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THE GFS HAS ALSO BEEN 
INCONSISTENT IN THE PLACEMENT OF A CLOSED LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS...WHICH LOWERS CONFIDENCE IN THE MODELS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
WILL KEEP MONDAY AND TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EST MON MAR 5 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...DRY/BENIGN WEATHER PATTERN 
EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS AREA REMAINS IN DRY 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. WEAK UPPER WAVE APPROACHES FROM THE NORTH 
TONIGHT...BUT ONLY AFFECT IS EXPECTED TO BE SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUD 
COVER...MAINLY IN THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES. GFS GUIDANCE TEMPS APPEAR 
REASONABLE AND WERE FOLLOWED CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
A CLOSED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE OVER EASTERN CANADA AND NEW 
ENGLAND...WITH A RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL CONUS. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
ROTATES AROUND THE LOW...TAKING A SURFACE LOW AND FRONT THROUGH THE 
OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ON WEDNESDAY. THE MODELS DIFFER 
WITH THE PLACEMENT OF THE FRONT. THE GFS HAS A STRONGER RIDGE ALOFT 
WHICH GIVES A STRONGER SURFACE HIGH OVER THE PLAINS THAT PUSHES THE 
FRONT TO OUR SOUTH. THE NAM IS LESS AGRESSIVE WITH THE 
FRONT...KEEPING IT ACROSS OUR NORTH...AND IS ALSO SLOWER AND DRIER. 
WILL LEAN TOWARD THE NAM BECAUSE OF ITS BETTER CONTINUITY WITH THIS 
SYSTEM. WILL HAVE ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN SW VA ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. 

RIDGING ALOFT WILL KEEP DRY WEATHER OVER THE AREA FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY. A SOUTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPS ON FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE HIGH MOVES 
TO OUR EAST. A FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA ON SATURDAY AS AN UPPER 
TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. GFS HAS SHOWN POOR 
CONSISTENCY IN THE DETAILS FOR THE WEEKEND...SO WILL HAVE ONLY A 
SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE POP THROUGH MONDAY.

CHANCE POPS FOR THIS TIME PERIOD FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. A 
RETURN TO DRY WEATHER EXPECTED NEXT SUNDAY AS WAVE/FRONT EXITS THE 
AREA.

EARLY PORTION OF THE LONG TERM. A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT WAVES WILL 
TRANSLATE THROUGH THIS FLOW. HOWEVER...IT APPEARS AT THIS TIME THAT 
MOST OF THE EFFECTS WILL REMAIN NORTH AND EAST OF OUR FORECAST AREA. 
FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE FAIRLY CLOSELY. DID BUMP 
UP GFS GUIDANCE MAX TEMPS ON FRIDAY A FEW DEGREES AS VIRTUALLY ALL 
OF THE NCEP ENSEMBLE MEMBERS PROJECTED HIGHER HEIGHTS THAN THE 00Z 
GFS.

LIGHT PRECIP BUT THE MERCURY APPEARS TO LEVEL OFF FAIRLY QUICKLY 
BEHIND FROPA. WILL SEND UPDATE OUT AROUND 02Z ACCOUNTING FOR SOME 
MINOR TWEAKS TO GRIDS AS WELL AS REMOVAL OF WIND ADVISORY.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...UPPER LOW CENTERED TO OUR 
NORTHEAST WILL CONTINUE TO PULL NORTHEAST...BUT WAVE ROTATING AROUND

FLOW...LOOKS LIKE SOME MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN 
THE USUAL HIGHER ELEVATION UPSLOPE AREAS...PERHAPS AN INCH OR TWO BY 
THE TIME IT WINDS DOWN SUNDAY AFTERNOON. LAKE WIND ADVISORY LOOKS 
GOOD AS IS FOR NOW...WITH EXPIRATION TIME OF 9 PM EST.    


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...GENERALLY DRY WEATHER 
EXPECTED THROUGH MUCH OF THE LONG TERM. INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR FRIDAY AS SOME ENSEMBLE MEMBERS SUGGEST A WEAK SOUTHEASTERN 
CONUS DISTURBANCE COULD SPREAD A LITTLE LIGHT PRECIP INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MORE SIGNIFICANT FEATURE APPROACHES BY LATE 
SATURDAY...AND INTRODUCED CHANCE POPS FOR THAT TIME FRAME. FOR 
TEMPS...HAD NO REASON TO SIGNIFICANTLY DEVIATE FROM GFS GUIDANCE AS 
ENSEMBLES GENERALLY SUPPORTED THE GFS.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MID LEVEL CLOUDS AND SPRINKLES

TODAY. WINDY CONDITIONS ON TAP INTO THE EVENING HOURS. LOW LEVELS

PERCENT MAKING RECENT RAINS A DECENT MEMORY. A TROUGH OF LOW 
PRESSURE USHERS IN A LOWER LAYER COLD AIRMASS FROM THE NW THIS 
EVENING. H85 TEMPS DROP TO BELOW -10C. MOISTURE IS SUFFICIENT FOR 
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN 1/3 OF MRX CWA FAVORING 
UPSLOPE REGIONS. SURFACE RIDGING CONTINUES ACROSS THE AREA FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST SUNDAY AND MONDAY. DRY CONDITIONS LEAD TO 30 DEGREE DIURNAL 
RANGE WITH BELOW NORMAL MIN TEMP MON MORN.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
SLIDES S INTO THE AREA BY EARLY TUESDAY. SOME MID LEVEL MOISTURE IN NW
FLOW WILL THROW SOME MID CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA BUT SURFACE BOUNDARY
MAINLY THE LEADING EDGE OF NEW HIGH PRESSURE AIRMASS BUILDING IN 
FROM THE NORTH. BOUNDARY WILL QUICKLY RETREAT NORTH AS A WARM FRONT 
BY WEDNESDAY. MAIN JET STREAM NEARLY ZONAL AND WELL NORTH OF AREA 
SUPPORTING GOOD WARM UP. MODEL DIFFER GREATLY ON SHORT WAVE ENERGY
MOVING FROM E PAC ACROSS S 1/3 OF U.S. THROUGH THE WEEK. WILL KEEP 
FORECAST DRY UNTIL A CLEARER SOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM MATERIALIZES.
