.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...UPPER LOW OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES WILL MOVE SLOWLY NORTHEAST IN THE SHORT TERM.  SOME WEAK SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND THE LOW MAY BRING SOME CLOUDS 
TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTH...THEN A STRONGER SHORT WAVE AND 
A SURGE OF COLDER AIR WILL BEGIN SPREADING CLOUDS BACK INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE NORTH AND WEST SATURDAY AFTERNOON.  WILL GO CLOSER TO THE 
SLOWER NAM SOLUTION...SO WILL KEEP CONTINUE TO KEEP PRECIP OUT 
SATURDAY FOR NOW AS IN PREVIOUS FORECAST.  WILL NOT STRAY 
FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WRAP AROUND MOISTURE
SATURDAY NIGHT WILL BRING A CHANCE FOR SOME VERY LIGHT RAIN OR SNOW
TO THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA. ANY ACCUMULATIONS WILL
BE LIMITED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND GENERALLY LESS THAN ONE
INCH...IF ANYTHING. A COUPLE OF VERY MINOR IMPULSES SWING ACROSS
THE REGION OVER THE NEXT WEEK BUT EXPECT ONLY A SLIGHT INCREASE IN
CLOUDINESS WITH EACH SYSTEM.  

TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN MILD WITH SOME GRADUAL INCREASES AS THE
WEEK PROGRESSES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
605 AM EST FRI MAR 2 2007

.DISCUSSION...UPDATE TO DROP WIND ADVISORY. GRADIENT RELAXING BRIEFLY
AS SHORT WAVE RIDGE MOVES THROUGH. WINDS WILL BECOME STIFF AGAIN 
THIS AFTERNOON AND LAKE WIND OR WIND ADVISORIES MAY NEED TO BE 
POSTED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT AND PRECIPITATION 
HAS MOVED EAST OF THE AREA. SURFACE LOW MOVING NE INTO W GREAT LAKES
TODAY. SHORT WAVE SFC RIDGE WILL MOVE EAST INTO AREA TODAY SO WINDS 
SHOULD DROP OFF BELOW ADVISORY CONDITIONS. POST FRONTAL AIRMASS FROM 
THE WEST RELATIVELY WARM AND DRY. RIDGE WILL QUICKLY FLATTEN AS LOW 
LEVEL TROUGH...A REFLECTION OF STRENGTHENING JET ACROSS TN AND LATER 
KY...APPROACHES FROM THE WEST LATER TODAY. GRADIENT WILL AGAIN 
TIGHTEN RESULTING IN BREEZY SW WINDS. THIS MAY REQUIRE A LAKE WIND 
ADVSRY FOR THE MNTS THIS AFTERNOON BUT WILL NOT ISSUE AT THIS TIME 
TO AVOID CONFUSION WITH CURRENT WIND ADVSRY. A FEW SPRINKLES OR 
FLURRIES POSSIBLE ACROSS SW VA TONIGHT AS TROUGH MOVES THROUGH BUT 
CHCS TOO LOW TO MENTION AT THIS TIME.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AS AN UPPER LOW LIFTS OUT OF 
THE REGION...IT WILL ROTATE THROUGH A WEAK WAVE SATURDAY NIGHT.  
MAIN LIFT AND MOISTURE WILL REMAIN NORTH BUT WILL KEEP SOME LOW POPS 
NORTH AND IN SOME EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES.  A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. WILL VERY SLOWLY WORK EASTWARD THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED.   A COUPLE OF WEAK IMPULSES WILL SLIDE THROUGH THE UPPER 
FLOW BUT SHOULD TRACK TO OUR NORTH AND EAST.  WILL THEREFORE... 
EXPECT GENERALLY DRY AND MILD CONDITIONS THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
802 PM EST THU MAR 1 2007

.DISCUSSION...CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION GENERALLY CONTINUES TO WEAKEN 
THIS EVENING...EVEN THE PRE-FRONTAL ACTIVITY THAT IS NOW MOVING EAST 
INTO THE VALLEY AND NORTHEAST PLATEAU COUNTIES.  TRAILING ACTIVITY 
TO THE WEST ALONG THE COLD FRONT IS A BIT WEAKER THAN PRE-FRONTAL 
SHOWERS AND STORMS.  LIGHTNING STRIKES DIMINISHING...BUT THINK THERE 
WILL BE AT LEAST ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS FOR REST OF THE EVENING... 
BUT NOTHING ANYWHERE NEAR SEVERE.  NO REPORTS OF ANY TREES DOWN SO 
FAR WITH A REPORT OF A BACKROAD CLOSED IN DUNLAP OF SEQUATCHIE 
COUNTY FROM COMBINED RAINFALL FROM THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON.

GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS WERE UPDATED ALREADY...DUE TO HOURLY TEMPS 
AND DEW POINT TEMPS DRIFTING OFF FROM CURRENT OBSERVATIONS.  ZFPMRX 
PRODUCT IS STILL IN GOOD SHAPE.  WILL FRESHEN GRIDS AND FORECAST 
PRODUCTS AGAIN LATER THIS SHIFT...WAITING FOR CONVECTION TO DIMINISH 
OR ACTUALLY END WITH PASSAGE OF COLD FRONT.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EST THU MAR 1 2007

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...A VERY DYNAMIC SYSTEM WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. STRONG
UPPER LEVEL FORCING IN THE FORM OF ISENTROPIC LIFT...BOUNDARY LAYER
CONVERGENCE...UPPER JET STRUCTURE PRODUCING DIVERGENCE ALOFT
ASSOCIATED WITH LEFT EXIT REGION. ALSO COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS
THE REGION LATE THIS EVENING/EARLY MORNING. STRONG SOUTHERLY
BOUNDARY LAYER JET WILL CONTINUE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
UNTIL AFTER FROPA. WILL MAINTAIN WIND ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS WITH ALREADY REPORTS OF STRONG WINDS. FOR THE VALLEYS...
WEDGE OVER THE AREA WILL HELP KEEP THE STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS
ABOVE THE SURFACE. HOWEVER...AS SURFACE TROUGH PASSES AND
CONVECTION MOVES THROUGH ENOUGH MIXING WILL OCCUR TO GET RID OF
BOUNDARY LAYER WEDGE...SO AN HOUR OR TWO OF STRONGER WINDS UP TO
35-40 MPH GUSTS POSSIBLE EVEN IN THE VALLEYS AND PLATEAU AREAS THIS
EVENING.

FOR FRIDAY...FRONT MOVES QUICKLY EAST WITH PRECIPITATION ENDING
EARLY FRIDAY MORNING BEFORE SUNRISE. CLEARING SKIES AND MILDER
CONDITONS ANTICIPATED DUE TO RETURN OF SUNSHINE.

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...UPPER TROUGH AXIS
MOVES EAST OF THE AREA BUT NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT REMAINS. A SERIES
OF WEAK SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION...BUT MOISTURE IS
LIMITED AND KEPT MOST LOCATIONS DRY...EXCEPT FOR THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. A SHORT-
WAVE MAY PRODUCE SCATTERED RAIN-SNOW SHOWERS SATURDAY NIGHT. AT THE
SURFACE...RIDGING WILL BE THE DOMINANT FEATURE.

FXUS64 KMRX 011525
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 AM EST THU MAR 1 2007

.DISCUSSION...
A LARGE AREA OF RAIN AND EMBEDDED CONVECTION IS MOVING RAPIDLY
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS AREA OF PRECIPITATION IS
DUE TO ISENTROPIC LIFT...BOUNDARY LAYER CONVERGENCE NOTED AT 850
MB...AND STRONG UPPER JET ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES PLACING AREA
UNDER FAVORED LEFT EXIT REGION. ELEVATED INSTABILITY IS PRODUCING
THUNDERSTORMS OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE...SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE INTO NORTHERN
GEORGIA. THIS AREA OF PRECIPITATION WILL PERSIST ACROSS MUCH OF THE
FORECAST AREA TODAY...HOWEVER...DOWNSLOPE WINDS OF THE APPALACHIANS
WILL LIMIT PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS ACROSS THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY.

MAIN PROBLEM IS POTENTIAL OF SEVERE CONVECTION LATE TODAY AND THIS
EVENING AS WARM FRONT MOVES NORTHEAST ERODING THE LOW LEVEL WEDGE
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. LATEST SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES SHOW
THIS WEDGE REMAINING OVER MOST OF THE AREA THROUGH THE DAY AND NOT
ERODING UNTIL JUST BEFORE PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH PASSAGE THIS EVENING.

CAPES WILL BE LIMITING FACTOR FOR SEVERE CONVECTION...ESPECIALLY
AREA NORTH AND EAST OF TYS. HOWEVER...HIGH SHEAR ENVIRONMENT AND
STRONG BOUNDARY LAYER JET WILL MAIN POTENTIAL OF DAMAGING WINDS
ASSOCIATED WITH BOW ECHOES AND LARGE HAIL. ISOLATED TORNADO OVER
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AS POSSIBILITY...BUT GREATEST THREAT FOR LARGE
TORNADO OUTBREAK WILL BE ACROSS ALABAMA AND CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
GEORGIA LATE TODAY DUE TO PROXIMITY OF WARM FRONT AND INSTABILITY.

HAVE MADE SOME CHANGES TO HIGH TEMPERATURE FORECAST FOR TODAY AND
ADDED STRONG DAMAGING WINDS-HAIL TO SOUTHERN THIRD OF FORECAST AREA TODAY.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 AM EST FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 AM EST FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST 
     POLK...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 010802
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST THU MAR 1 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)... SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED IN WEST TN AND NRN MS...ASSOCIATED
WITH THE NOSE OF THE UPPER JET AND STRONG THETA-E ADVECTION JUST
NORTH OF THE SURFACE WARM FRONT. THIS CONVECTION WILL BEGIN TO
AFFECT OUR WESTERN COUNTIES BY 10Z. EXPECT THAT THERE WILL BE TWO
MAIN SURGES OF PRECIP TODAY. THE FIRST WILL SOME DURING THE DAY AS
THE 850 MB JET STRENGTHENS AND ADVECTS WARM MOIST AIR OVER THE
SURFACE WARM FRONT. THE CONVECTION WILL BE ELEVATED DURING THE
DAY...AND THUS LESS LIKELY TO PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SEVERE
WEATHER...THOUGH SOME HAIL AND ISOLATED STRONG WIND GUSTS WILL BE
POSSIBLE. THE WARM FRONT WILL PUSH FROM SOUTH TO NORTH ACROSS THE
AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON...CAUSING SURFACE DEWPOINTS TO RISE
RAPIDLY INTO THE 50S. A SECOND ROUND OF PRECIP WILL COME WITH THE
PASSAGE OF THE SURFACE COLD FRONT BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z. THESE STORMS
WILL LIKELY BE IN THE FORM OF A SQUALL LINE AND WILL BE SURFACE-
BASED...AND THUS MORE LIKELY TO PRODUCE DAMAGING WIND GUSTS. AN
ISOALTED TORNADO CANNOT BE RULED OUT IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. NAM
SBCAPE IN THE EVENING REACHES 500-700 J/KG...THOUGH THE SREF MEAN
SHOWS LESS INSTABILITY. HOWEVER NOT MUCH INSTABILITY WILL BE NEEDED
FOR SEVERE WX GIVEN THE STRONG DYNAMICAL FORCING. WILL ISSUE AN SPS
FOR THE SEVERE THREAT. THE WIND ADVISORY WILL BE CONTINUED FOR THE
MOUNTAINS. THE COLD FRONT CLEARS THE AREA BY 09Z AND WILL END ALL
POPS AROUND 12Z FRIDAY.

WITH THE CLOSED LOW REMAINING OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION AND THE 
FLOW ALOFT REMAINING WEST TO SOUTHWEST OVER OUR AREA...A STRONG 
SURGE OF COLD AIR DOES NOT FOLLOW THE FRONT...SO TEMPS WILL REMAIN 
ABOVE NORMAL FOR FRIDAY. A TROUGH ROTATES AROUND THE LOW AND WILL 
CROSS OUR AREA ON SATURDAY/SATURDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE REMAINS LIMITED 
WITH THE SYSTEM SO WILL KEEP POPS IN THS SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE RANGE. 
INCREASING COLD ADVECTION SATURDAY NIGHT MAY DROP TEMPS ENOUGH FOR A 
CHANGE TO SNOW IN THE NORTH BEFORE THE PRECIP ENDS. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...EASTERN STATES UPPER TROF 
MOVES OFFSHORE BY 12Z MONDAY ALLOWING FOR AN END TO THE 
FLURRIES/SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE SUNDAY MORNING. UPPER RIDGING 
BECOMES SUPPRESSED SOUTH INTO THE SUBTROPICS BY 00Z TUESDAY WITH 
ZONAL FLOW DEVELOPING. WEAK BACKDOOR FRONT TRIES TO DROP INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY WEDNESDAY WITH LITTLE IMPACT AS LOW LEVEL 
FLOW ACROSS SOUTHEAST STATES REMAINS EAST TO NORTHEASTERLY. STAYED 
RELATIVELY CLOSE TO SUGGESTED MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE DURING LONG 
TERM. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EST WED FEB 28 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...QUIET NOW BUT STORM
SYSTEM TRUDGING THIS WAY THAT SHOULD SPREAD PRECIP AND STORMS INTO
AREA TOMORROW AND TOMORROW NIGHT. EXPECTING WINDS TO PICK UP INTO
ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR TN/NC MOUNTAINS BOTH PRE-FRONTAL AND POST-
FRONTAL.

MOST OF PRECIP SHOULD BEGIN AS LIGHT RAIN...BUT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
SHOULD BE SURGING BACK INTO AREA THURSDAY...MAKING THURSDAY
AFTERNOON AND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE AIRMASS UNSTABLE. INSTABILITY NOT
EXPECTED TO GET EXTREME...BUT COULD GET SOME SEVERE STORMS...WITH
MAIN THREAT BEING OUTFLOW WINDS.

HAVE NOT CHANGED MUCH FOR TEMPERATURES FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST AND
GUIDANCE.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...BASICALLY DRY PERIOD WITH 
THE EXCEPTION OF POSSIBLE WRAP AROUND FLOW FROM THE VERY INTENSE LOW 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT THAT PASSES THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT.  THE 
MOST LIKELY TIME FOR THIS WRAP AROUND MOISTURE TO IMPACT THE 
FORECAST AREA IS SATURDAY NIGHT.  THE MODELS HAVE BEEN GOING BACK 
AND FORTH ON THE POSSIBILITY OF THIS MOISTURE FEEDING INTO THE 
REGION WITH THE CURRENT RUN BACKING OFF ON IT.  HAVE PLAYED THE 
MIDDLE OF THE ROAD AND LEFT THE PRECIPITATION IN FOR NOW BUT IF 
LATER RUNS CONTINUE THIS TREND...IT MAY NEED TO BE REMOVED.  

OTHER QUESTION IN THE PERIOD IS ON TUESDAY.  06Z GFS RUN INDICATED 
THE POSSIBILITY OF VERY LIGHT PRECIPITATION ON TUESDAY BUT CURRENT 
RUN BRINGS THAT INTO QUESTION.  LEAVING THAT PERIOD DRY FOR NOW WITH 
SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUDINESS.  

NO REASON TO DEVIATE GREATLY FROM GFS TEMPERATURES SO WILL BE NEAR 
THEM FOR GUIDANCE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST WED FEB 28 2007

.DISCUSSION...LOOKING AT THE HOURLY TEMPS FORECAST AND THE CURRENT 
OBS...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK.  VISIBLE SATELITE SHOWS 
VERY LIMITED CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE REGION.  NO CHANGES PLANNED TO 
CURRENT FORECAST.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE OVER THE APPALACHIANS WILL SHIFT EAST TO THE
ATLANTIC COAST TODAY. PLENTY OF SUN ALONG WITH INCREASING WARM
ADVECTION WILL PUSH TEMPERATURES WELL INTO THE 60S IN MOST
SPOTS...WITH HIGHS AROUND 70 IN THE SOUTH. HIGH CLOUDS WILL BEGIN
TO INCREASE LATE IN THE DAY AS THE UPPER JET APPROACHES. ADVECTION
OF WARM MOIST AIR INCREASES RAPIDLY OVERNIGHT AS THE 850 MB JET
STRENGTHENS TO 50-60 KTS. LOW LEVEL DRY AIR IS OVERCOME BY THE
SOUTHERLY MOISTURE TRANSPORT BY 12Z...AND WILL INCREASE POPS
QUICKLY AROUND THIS TIME. INSTABILITY IS MAINLY ELEVATED THROUGH
MUCH OF THE DAY...BUT BECOMES MORE SURFACE BASED BY THE EVENING.
STRONG UPPER LEVEL FORCING ACTING ON WEAK INSTABILITY (LI -1 TO -3)
SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT FOR THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA
THURSDAY EVENING JUST AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. VERY STRONG SHEAR
AND STRONG WINDS ALOFT MAY PROVIDE A SLIGHT THREAT OF SEVERE
STORMS. THE GFS REMAINS SLIGHTLY FASTER IN PUSHING THE COLD FRONT
THROUGH THE AREA...HOWEVER BOTH MODELS PLACE THE COLD FRONT WELL
EAST OF OUR AREA BY 12Z FRIDAY...SO WILL REMOVE THE POPS FROM THE
NORTHEAST FRIDAY MORNING.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
THE LARGE CLOSED LOW REMAINS OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION FRIDAY
NIGHT. AS THE LOW BEGINS TO MOVE EAST A TROUGH DIGS SOUTHWARD ON
SATURDAY. PVA AND COLD TEMPS ALOFT WILL PROVIDE A CHANCE OF PRECIP
FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...MAINLY IN NORTHERN
SECTIONS. MOISTURE IS LIMITED WITH THE SYSTEM AS THE FLOW ALOFT
REMAINS WESTERLY. A CHANGE TO SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE AS THE PRECIP
ENDS LATE SATURDAY NIGHT. HEIGHTS BEGINS TO RISE ON SUNDAY AS A
LARGE RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE EASTERN CONUS...WHICH KEEPS THE
REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST DRY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  71  48  66  41  62 /   0  20 100 100  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  45  66  42  57 /   0  10 100 100  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  66  44  64  39  57 /   0  20 100 100  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  65  40  65  42  54 /   0  10 100 100  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 280301
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...RETRANSMISSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EST TUE FEB 27 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FROM 
THE NORTH. WINDS SLACKENING. CURRENT DPS TWEAKED DOWN AND CURRENT
TEMPS TWEAKED UP TO AFFECT RH IN GRIDDED DATA. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL KEEP THE AREA DRY AND MILD TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  
THIS WILL CONTINUE THE ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WITH 
HIGHS EXPECTED TO REACH WELL INTO THE 60S THROUGH THE TN VALLEY.  
THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  
WILL SEE CLOUDS INCREASE...BUT NOT EXPECTING MAIN BAND OF SHOWERS TO 
REACH THE MRX CWA DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  HOWEVER...WILL HAVE 
SOME LOW POPS...MAINLY SOUTH AND WEST ZONES...IN CASE ANY SHOWERS 
PUSH INTO THE AREA WELL IN ADVANCE OF THE SYSTEM.  

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...DEEP LOW PRESSURE AREA WILL 
BE LOCATED IN MO THURSDAY MORNING WITH AN EXPECTED WARM FRONT 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD STILL BE WEST OF THE 
MS RIVER EARLY IN THE MORNING. MOISTURE AND LIFT INCREASE 
DRAMATICALLY THURSDAY MORNING AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. PREFER THE 
SLIGHTLY SLOWER GFS WITH THE START TO PRECIPITATION THURSDAY. HIGHS 
WILL BE TRICKY WITH THE STRONG WARM ADVECTION AND TIMING OF 
PRECIPITATION. FOLLOWED CLOSE TO MAV GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS. BOTH MODELS 
BRING FRONT THROUGH THE AREA BETWEEN 00Z AND 06Z FRIDAY. STRONG 
SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS THURSDAY MAY REQUIRE A WIND ADVISORY OR 
WARNING FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS. BEST 
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE FROM LATE AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING 
AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. HEAVY RAIN IS POSSIBLE WITH THE HIGHEST 
AMOUNTS FORECAST FOR SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WHERE A COUPLE OF 
INCHES MAY FALL THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. BEHIND THE FRONT THERE 
MAY BE A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS EARLY FRIDAY OTHERWISE SKIES SHOULD 
CLEAR WITH STILL MILD TEMPERATURES. A SECONDARY COLD FRONT FRIDAY 
NIGHT SHOULD COOL TEMPERATURES DOWN TO BELOW NORMAL READINGS BUT 
ONLY HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN DUE TO THE EARLIER FRONT TAKING 
THE MOISTURE. COLD UPPER LOW OVER GREAT LAKES KEEP SKIES MOSTLY 
CLOUDY AND COOL AS ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM PIVOTS AROUND IT SATURDAY AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH AT THE TAIL END OF 
THE SYSTEM FOR A CHANCE OF SNOW SUNDAY MORNING ACROSS HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND THE NORTH. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THE END OF THE 
WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.          
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  35  69  48  65  45 /   0   0  40  90  90 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    33  64  44  67  45 /   0   0  20  90  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN            33  65  45  66  45 /   0   0  20  90  90 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   29  62  38  65  44 /   0   0  10  90  90 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

WILL BE LOCATED IN MO THURSDAY MORNING WITH AN EXPECTED WARM FRONT 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD STILL BE WEST OF THE

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.DISCUSSION...BENIGN WEATHER PATTEN IN PLACE AS A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE REGION TODAY.  THIS WILL ALLOW 
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES TO WARM WELL ABOVE NORMAL WITH VALLEY TEMPS 
EXPECTED TO REACH INTO THE UPPER 50S AND 60S.  ALL ON TRACK IN THE 
CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE MORNING/AFTERNOON TYPE 
WORDING.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 270744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 AM EST TUE FEB 27 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE MS VALLEY THIS MORNING WILL SLIDE
TO THE EAST AND CROSS THE AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. SOME MORNING
CLOUDS IN THE CENTRAL TN VALLEY ASSOCIATED WITH CHANNELED VORTICITY
AT 500 MB WILL DISSIPATE THIS MORNING AS THE VORT AXIS MOVES EAST.
TEMPS SHOULD WARM INTO THE 60S IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
VALLEY...WITH 50S ELSEWHERE. BUILDING HEIGHTS ALOFT AND AN
INCREASING SOUTHERLY FLOW SHOULD PROVIDE EVEN WARMER TEMPERATURES
FOR WEDNESDAY...WELL INTO THE 60S IN MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE
MOUNTAINS AND APPROACHING 70 AT CHA.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
HIGH AND MIDLEVEL CLOUDS INCREASE WEDNESDAY EVENING WITH THE APPROACH
OF A STRENGTHENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS. A SOUTHERLY LOW
LEVEL JET WILL ADVECT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE AREA LATE
WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY MORNING...AND WILL BRING SOME CHANCE POPS
INTO THE WEST BEFORE 12Z THURSDAY. INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT AND
UPPER DIVERGENCE WILL BRING POPS UP TO LIKELY AFTER 12Z...THEN
CATEGORICAL AFTER 18Z. INSTABILITY IS WEAK BUT SHEAR IS VERY
STRONG...THUS WILL HAVE JUST A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. THE GFS IS
SLIGHTLY FASTER THAN THE NAM TO BRING THE COLD FRONT THROUGH...BUT
IN EITHER CASE THE POPS WILL DROP QUICKLY AFTER 06Z AS MIDLEVEL
DRYING ENSUES. 

A SHORTWAVE TROUGH ROTATING AROUND THE DEEP CLOSED LOW OVER THE
GREAT LAKES WILL SWING THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY
NIGHT. MOISTURE IS FAIRLY LIMITED WITH THE SYSTEM BUT A STRONG VORT
AXIS AND UPPER JET DYNAMICS SHOULD PRODUCE AT LEAST A CHANCE OF
PRECIP...WITH RAIN ON SATURDAY AND RAIN OR SNOW SATURDAY NIGHT. A
LARGE RIDGE WILL KEEP THE AREA DRY THROUGH THE REST OF THE FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  65  33  69  50  65 /   0   0   0  40  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  33  65  46  65 /   0   0   0  30  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN  61  33  64  45  63 /   0   0   0  30  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  57  29  62  40  64 /   0   0   0  20  80

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 262013
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 PM EST MON FEB 26 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...A WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE 
THROUGH TO THE NORTH OF THE MRX CWA THIS EVENING.  THIS WILL BRING 
BANDS OF MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA.  HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN OVERNIGHT FOR CONTINUED TRANQUIL WEATHER THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM.  AS A RESULT...WE WILL SEE DRY CONDITIONS WITH TEMPERATURES 
RISING ABOVE NORMAL ON TUESDAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS USED FOR GUIDANCE
VALUES AND ONLY A LITTLE DEVIATION. A FAIRLY STRONG WARM FRONT/COLD
FRONT COMBINATION MAKING ITS WAY INTO THE REGION THURSDAY INTO
FRIDAY WITH SOME ISENTROPIC RAIN ON THURSDAY AND THUNDERSTORMS
POSSIBLE THURSDAY NIGHT IN ADVANCE OF THE COLD FRONT.  

NEXT WEATHER MAKER SATURDAY NIGHT. THE COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY WILL
USHER IN SOME COLD AIR AND THE UPPER LOW THAT IS ASSOCIATED WITH
THE COLD FRONT WILL BRING A GOOD SHOT OF WRAP AROUND MOISTURE INTO
THE REGION ON SATURDAY NIGHT WITH A CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION. AT
THIS TIME HAVE WORDED AS RAIN OR SNOW BUT IF ANY PRECIPITATION
FALLS IT WILL MORE LIKELY BE IN THE FORM OF SNOW. THE BIGGER
QUESTION THAN ACTUAL FORM IS WHETHER IT WILL OCCUR OR NOT.
REMAINDER OF FORECAST PERIOD LOOKS TO BE DRY AT THIS TIME.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  37  64  35  65  48 /   0   0   0  10  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  34  59  33  62  44 /   0   0   0  10  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN  34  59  32  61  44 /   0   0   0  10  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  31  56  30  59  39 /  10   0   0  10  20

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 260920
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 AM EST MON FEB 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MOISTURE TRAPPED BELOW A MIDLEVEL 
INVERSION IS RESULTING IN A STRATOCU DECK ACROSS THE AREA THIS 
MORNING. ACARS SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THIS CLOUD DECK IS NOT VERY 
THICK...ABOUT 1000-1500 FEET. THE MODELS DO SHOW SOME MIDLEVEL DRY 
ADVECTION WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE AREA AFTER SUNRISE...SO EXPECT 
THAT THIS CLOUD DECK WILL DISSIPATE AROUND THAT TIME. CONSIDERABLE 
HIGH CLOUDINESS OVER THE CENTRAL US ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER JET 
AND SOME CHANNELED VORTICITY WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA BY THE 
AFTERNOON...GIVING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES. THE VORT AXIS CROSSES THE 
NORTHERN PORTION OF THE AREA TONIGHT...BUT PRODUCES NO LIFT...AND 
MOISTURE IS LACKING OUTSIDE OF A THIN MIDLEVEL LAYER. WILL REMOVE 
THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ON 
TUESDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. A FRONT 
APPROACHES ON LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR OUR WESTERN ZONES FOR LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  BEST CHANCES SHOULD 
HOLD OFF UNTIL THURSDAY WHEN BETTER MOISTURE AND LIFT PUSHES IN WITH 
IT.  50-6KT LOW LEVEL JET IS ALSO EXPECTED ON THURSDAY ALONG WITH 
SOME WEAK INSTABILITY...WILL ADD THUNDER TO THE FORECAST FOR 
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY EVENING.  FRONT LINGERS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT... 
WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT.  SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR 
ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION.  THE FRONT IS EAST OF THE AREA ON FRIDAY 
WITH MOISTURE DECREASING BEHIND IT.  WITH UPPER LOW NEARBY...WILL 
KEEP CHANCE POPS IN FOR FRIDAY WITH BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  
UPPER LOW TRACKS NORTH ON FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY DRY.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE MOVES IN ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP SATURDAY 
NIGHT AND SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  61  37  63  35  65 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  57  35  60  33  62 /   0  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  56  34  58  32  61 /   0  10   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  51  32  57  30  59 /   0  10   0   0  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EST SUN FEB 25 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST APPEARS GENERALLY ON TRACK AS UPPER LOW
REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION. TROUGH AXIS
HAS EXITED TO THE EAST...TAKING SCATTERED PRECIP WITH IT. WILL
UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE EVENING POPS. TEMPS APPEAR REASONABLE BASED
ON TRENDS AND LATEST GUIDANCE. NO OTHER CHANGES WARRANTED AT THIS
TIME.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             38  60  38  58  35 /  10  10  10   0   0

300 PM EST SUN FEB 25 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE FORECAST AREA...GENERALLY ALONG 
A MIDDLESBORO TO KNOXVILLE TO CLEVELAND LINE. CURRENT LOCAL RADARS 
ARE DEVOID OF ANY CONVECTION...BUT LATEST MSAS DATA INDICATES THAT 
SOME WEAK INSTABILITY IS DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THIS FRONT ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. THUS...THINK THAT SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE LATER THIS AFTERNOON BEFORE THIS 
COLD FRONT COMPLETELY EXITS THE AREA. BREEZY SOUTHWEST WINDS ALONG 
THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD DIMINISH RAPIDLY AFTER SUNSET...AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BEGINS TO BUILD INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE FRONT. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION WILL 
CONTINUE TO ROTATE CLOUDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND MONDAY. 
A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE ON MONDAY NIGHT WILL THEN CREATE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SOME LIGHT PRECIP ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...TRENDED WARMER ON MONDAY WITH 
SOUTHWEST FLOW EXPECTED AND COOLER ON TUESDAY WITH NORTHWEST FLOW 
EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL FOR 
WEDNESDAY. NEXT SYSTEM OF CONCERN REACHES IN LATE THURSDAY/THURSDAY 
NIGHT. MODEL CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN POOR WITH HANDLING OF THIS 
SYSTEM...ESPECIALLY IN TIMING. THEREFORE...CONFIDENCE IS LOW AND 
WILL KEEP POPS AT CHANCE CATEGORY THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT WITH 
DECREASING POPS FRIDAY. UPPER LOW REMAINS POSITIONED WELL TO OUR 
NORTH SATURDAY AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP STAYS NORTH AS WELL WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN SUNDAY...SO WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR THE 
WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 AM EST SUN FEB 25 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER WESTERN TN WITH A 
LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS OCCURRING ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. EARLIER SURFACE OBS FROM CROSSVILLE AND CALLS TO THE 
SMOKIES REVEAL THAT STRONG DAMAGING WINDS OCCURRED OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS EARLIER THIS MORNING...BUT THE CONVECTION THIS MORNING 
WAS EVIDENTLY NOT DEEP ENOUGH TO DESCEND THESE WINDS INTO THE 
VALLEYS. MODELS REVEAL THAT THESE STRONG 850 MB WINDS WILL MOVE EAST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA BY MID MORNING...SO WILL PLAN TO CANCEL THE 
WIND ADVISORY AND HIGH WIND WARNING THIS MORNING (ALTHOUGH BREEZY 
WINDS WILL CONTINUE THIS AFTERNOON BUT REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY 
CRITERIA). THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO BE ON THE PLATEAU BY MID 
AFTERNOON...WITH THE WRF MODEL INDICATING A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THE FRONT. THE GFS MODEL IS NOT AS 
UNSTABLE...BUT FEEL THAT CONVECTIVE REDEVELOPMENT SHOULD OCCUR THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH CLEARING SKIES NOTED AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT ON 
SATELLITE IMAGES (WHICH WILL PROVIDE GOOD AFTERNOON HEATING). TSTORM 
COVERAGE THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD BE MORE SCATTERED IN COVERAGE...AND 
THINK THAT SOME HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH A FEW 
OF THE STRONGEST STORMS. WILL ALSO PLAN TO RAISE MAXES FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON SINCE MINS WERE WARMER THAN EXPECTED THIS MORNING...AND A 
WARM SOUTHWEST WIND FLOW ALONG WITH AT LEAST PARTIAL SUNSHINE ARE 
EXPECTED FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...RADAR INDICATING WIDESPREAD

CHANCES FOR TONIGHT AND INTO MONDAY MORNING.  BEST CHANCES WILL 
REMAIN ACROSS OUR NORTHERN ZONES WHERE DEEPEST MOISTURE RESIDES.

CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT WITH BEST CHANCE NORTH.  THICKNESSES 
INDICATE SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE MONDAY NIGHT...MAINLY ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON TUESDAY.

WEDNESDAY...WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT DRY.  A FRONT 
APPROACHES ON THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO FRIDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE 
POPS FOR BOTH DAYS.  SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID 
PRECIPITATION.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE MOVES IN ON SATURDAY...WITH 
STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP SATURDAY DRY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
225 PM EST SAT FEB 24 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM STRENGTHENING OVER THE 
PLAINS...WITH HIGH PRESSURE ENTRENCHED ALONG THE EASTERN SEABOARD. 
MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE PROGRESSION OF THIS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TONIGHT...WITH THE BULK OF THE PRECIP NOT EXPECTED 
UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT AND PROBABLY MORE TOWARDS SUNRISE. WRF MODEL 
CONTINUES TO INDICATE THAT THE COLD FRONT WILL NOT COMPLETELY EXIT 
THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON. THIS SEEMS REASONABLE 
TO EXPECT SINCE A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS WILL 
BECOME NEGATIVELY-TILTED TONIGHT...LIKELY RESULTING IN A SLOWER 
EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THIS SYSTEM. BOTH MODELS CONTINUE TO DEVELOP 
A STRONG 850 MB JET (BETWEEN 50 AND 70 KTS) AFTER MIDNIGHT 
TONIGHT...AND WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY (AND HIGH WIND 
WARNING ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS) TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF 
THESE STRONG WINDS DESCENDING DOWN INTO THE VALLEYS BY CONVECTION 
LATER TONIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT. STRONG WINDS WILL BE A CERTAINTY 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET...BUT HIGHER WINDS IN 
THE VALLEYS WILL DEPEND ON HOW STRONG THE LINE OF CONVECTION LATER 
TONIGHT REMAINS AS IT ENTERS THE FORECAST AREA. SURFACE-BASED 
INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT APPEARS WEAK AT BEST FOR THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE INDICATING SOME 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY. IN FACT...A LARGE AMOUNT OF ELECTRICAL 
ACTIVITY HAS DEVELOPED WAY AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT OVER THE WESTERN 
TN RIVER VALLEY WHERE ELEVATED INSTABILITY RESIDES AS WELL...SO 
THINK THAT THERE MAY BE A LITTLE MORE COVERAGE OF TSTORMS LATER 
TONIGHT. SURFACE-BASED INSTABILITY INCREASES ON SUNDAY...ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA. WILL MENTION ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE REDEVELOPMENT 
ON SUNDAY...WITH SOME HAIL POSSIBLE SINCE THE FREEZING LEVEL WILL BE 
LOW. HOWEVER...TSTORM COVERAGE ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON SHOULD BE MORE 
SCATTERED IN COVERAGE. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH 
SLOWLY PULLS AWAY FROM THE REGION ON TUESDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING IN ON WEDNESDAY. TIMING OF NEXT SYSTEM REMAINS IN QUESTION 
BUT SHOULD AFFECT THE AREA THURSDAY TO FRIDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
FOR THIS PERIOD WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCE THURSDAY NIGHT. PRECIP 
SHOULD BE ALL RAIN BUT AIR MASS DOES BECOME SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE AND 
MAY NEED TO ADD THUNDER AS DETAILS BECOME MORE CLEAR WITH FUTURE 
MODEL RUNS. STAYED NEAR GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES THROUGHOUT.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER 
THE PLAINS...WITH A COOL AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
CURRENT RADARS REVEAL SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION WITH LIGHTNING 
STRIKES OVER NORTHERN AL AND SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN...ASSOCIATED WITH AN 
OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY (WHICH EXTENDS INTO SOUTHEAST TN) AND SOME 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY ABOVE 700 MB. AREA SOUNDINGS ALSO REVEAL SOME 
OF THIS ELEVATED INSTABILITY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL PLAN 
TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO MENTION SOME LOW CHANCE POPS 
ACROSS THE SOUTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA TO ACCOUNT FOR 
THIS CONVECTION. WILL ALSO MENTION INCREASING CLOUDINESS EVERYWHERE 
AS CLOUDS GRADUALLY INCREASE FROM THE MS RIVER VALLEY. SOUTHERLY 
WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH THE RESULTING DOWNSLOPE FLOW EXPECTED TO PRODUCE 
WARM TEMPS IN THE VALLEY. AS A RESULT...THE WARM HIGHS THAT ARE 
CURRENTLY FORECASTED APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT CHANGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 AM EST SAT FEB 24 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MIDLEVEL CLOUDS WILL INCREASE 
THROUGH THE DAY AS THE RIDGE AXIS ALOFT SHIFTS EAST AND THE CLOSED 
LOW OVER THE PLAINS APPROACHES. A VERY STRONG SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL 
JET ON THE ORDER OF 60-70 KTS AT 850 MB WILL PROVIDE ADVECTION OF 
WARM MOIST AIR INTO THE AREA TONIGHT. THIS WARM ADVECTION PATTERN 
WITH A STRONG LLJ TENDS TO PRODUCE VERY HIGH WINDS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS...AND WILL ISSUE A HIGH WIND WATCH FROM 9 PM TONIGHT UNTIL 
NOON SUNDAY. EXPECT THAT A WIND ADVISORY WILL BE NEEDED FOR AT LEAST 
THE PLATEAU AND SW VA TONIGHT...AND PERHAPS THE VALLEY TOO...BUT 
WILL LEAVE THIS FOR THE DAY SHIFT AS IT WILL BE WELL INTO THE SECOND 
PERIOD BEFORE THE WINDS PICK UP. THE GFS BRINGS PRECIP INTO THE AREA 
FASTER THAN THE NAM...BUT THIS APPEARS TO BE RELATED TO CONVECTIVE 
FEEDBACK PROBLEMS FROM THE CONVECTION TO OUR WEST. WILL BRING POPS 
UP THROUGH THE EVENING...BUT CATEGORICAL POPS HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. DOWNSLOPING EFFECTS MAY HOLD PRECIP BACK EVEN LONGER IN NE 
TN/SW VA. THERE APPEARS TO BE A DISCONNECT BETWEEN THE STRONGEST 
DYNAMICAL LIFT AND THE BEST 
INSTABILITY...WHICH WILL PREVENT A WIDESPREAD SEVERE WEATHER EVENT 
IN OUR AREA. THE STRONGEST LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND UPPER 
DIFFLUENCE OCCUR AROUND 12Z...BUT INSTABILITY IS VERY LIMITED AT 
THIS TIME AND IS MAINLY ELEVATED. LAPSE RATES STEEPEN IN THE 
AFTERNOON AS TEMPS COOL ALOFT AND THE DRY SLOT MOVES 
OVERHEAD...HOWEVER THE WINDS ALOFT BECOME MUCH WEAKER. THE GREATEST 
THREAT FOR DAMAGING WINDS IS MOST LIKELY LATE TONIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING 
WHEN LOW-TOPPED SHOWERS COULD PULL THE STRONG WINDS ALOFT DOWN TO 
THE SURFACE. LOW WET-BULB ZERO HEIGHTS AND STEEP LAPSE RATES MAY 
GIVE A SMALL THREAT OF HAIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON BUT THUNDERSTORM 
COVERAGE IS EXPECTED TO BE SCATTERED.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LOW TRACKS 
THROUGH THE OH VALLEY ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...WILL KEEP LOW 
CHANCES FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND INTO MONDAY MORNING.  BEST CHANCES 
WILL REMAIN ACROSS OUR NORTHERN ZONES WHERE DEEPEST MOISTURE 
RESIDES. THICKNESSES INDICATE SOME SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA ON SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING.  UPPER LOW SHIFTS NORTH ON MONDAY NIGHT 
PULLING MOST OF THE MOISTURE NORTH... WILL KEEP TUESDAY DRY.  WEAK 
SHORTWAVE ROTATES AROUND THE UPPER LOW AS IT SHIFTS EAST ON TUESDAY 
NIGHT.  MOISTURE LIMITED...SO WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY DRY.  A FRONT 
APPROACHES ON THURSDAY AND LINGERS INTO FRIDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE 
POPS FOR BOTH DAYS.  SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID 
PRECIPITATION.  

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 232030
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST FRI FEB 23 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING ACROSS MOST OF THE EASTERN 
PART OF THE NATION...WITH A VERY DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE PROGRESSION OF THE 
NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ON SATURDAY...BUT ARE BEGINNING TO SHOW 
SOME DIFFERENCES BY SUNDAY. WRF MODEL REVEALS A SLOWER PROGRESSION 
OF THE COLD FRONT ON SUNDAY...WITH ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE 
REDEVELOPMENT LATER IN THE DAY ON SUNDAY. FEEL THAT THIS WRF 
SOLUTION IS BETTER THAN THE FASTER GFS SOLUTION...SINCE BOTH THE GFS 
AND WRF MODELS INDICATE THAT A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE 
PLAINS WILL BECOME NEGATIVELY-TILTED ON SATURDAY NIGHT. AS A 
RESULT...THINK THAT THIS NEGATIVELY-TILTED TROUGH WILL CAUSE THE 
SYSTEM TO MOVE SLOWER TO THE EAST ON SUNDAY. RIGHT NOW IT STILL 
APPEARS THAT THE MAIN BAND OF CONVECTION WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT...BUT SCATTERED 
SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING BEFORE 
THIS MAIN PRECIP BAND ARRIVES. BOTH MODELS CONTINUE TO REVEAL A 
STRONG 850 MB JET (BETWEEN 50 AND 70 KTS) AFTER MIDNIGHT ON SATURDAY 
NIGHT. INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT APPEARS WEAK AT BEST 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...AND EXPECT THE CONVECTION OVER THE MS 
RIVER VALLEY TO WEAKEN AS IT MOVES EAST SATURDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER... 
STRONG GUSTY WINDS WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THIS WEAKENING 
CONVECTIVE LINE AS IT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
INSTABILITY ACTUALLY INCREASES ON SUNDAY AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. WILL PLAN TO MENTION ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE 
REDEVELOPMENT ON SUNDAY...WITH THE IDEA THAT THE COLD FRONT WILL NOT 
YET BE COMPLETELY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE SUNDAY AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO SPIN TO 
OUR NORTH...WRAPPING IN SOME CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY A STRAY SHOWERS 
OVER NORTHERN ZONES ON MONDAY. THE LOW SHIFTS EAST ON TUESDAY WITH A 
RIDGE OF HIGH OVER THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY. CONFIDENCE IS LOW... 
ESPECIALLY ON TIMING OF NEXT SYSTEM...WHICH SHOULD PUSH THROUGH 
AROUND THE THURSDAY/FRIDAY TIME FRAME. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS FOR 
THIS PERIOD...CENTERED AROUND THURSDAY NIGHT. GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOKS 
REASONABLE AND WILL STAY CLOSE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 230931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
431 AM EST FRI FEB 23 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE 
DRIFTING ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. WINDS WILL BE LIGHTER AND LESS GUSTY 
THAN YESTERDAY...MAINLY 10 TO 20 MPH. DEWPOINTS WILL DROP AGAIN AS 
DRY AIR ALOFT MIXES TO THE SURFACE...BUT THE DROP SHOULD NOT BE AS 
DRAMATIC AS YESTERDAY DUE TO THE LIGHTER WINDS AND MORE UNIFORM 
BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE. EXPECT AFTERNOON RH VALUES AROUND 20%. 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE WINDS WILL APPROACH 20 MPH COULD HAVE 
ELEVATED FIRE DANGER TODAY AND WILL HEADLINE THIS IN THE FWF. SKIES 
WILL BE CLEAR MOST OF THE DAY...WITH INCREASING CIRRUS EXPECTED IN 
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS MOVES 
OVERHEAD. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...RIDGE SHIFTS TO THE EAST ON 
SATURDAY.  DRY CONDITIONS SHOULD PREVAIL BUT CLOUDS SHOULD BEGIN 
MOVING IN AHEAD A FRONT TRACKING IN ON SATURDAY NIGHT.  FRONT BRINGS 
AMPLE MOISTURE AND LIFT AHEAD OF IT.  GOOD DIFFLUENCE ALOFT ALONG 
WITH A 60-70 KT LOW LEVEL JET WILL ENHANCE LIFT...WILL BUMP UP POPS 
TO 80 PERCENT FOR SATURDAY NIGHT.  FAIRLY STABLE AIRMASS BY THE TIME 
THE FRONT REACHES OUR CWA ON SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT WITH THE STRONG 
SHEAR...MAY STILL SEE SOME SEVERE STORMS MOVING THROUGH.  FRONT 
TRACKS EAST OF AREA ON SUNDAY...BUT MAY STILL A PRETTY GOOD COVERAGE 
EARLY SUNDAY...WILL KEEP LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS FOR SUNDAY 
MORNING...THEN LESSER CHANCES BY AFTERNOON.  UPPER LOW TRACKS 
THROUGH THE OH VALLEY ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...WILL KEEP LOW 
CHANCES FOR OUR NORTHERN ZONES...THICKNESSES INDICATE THEY MAY SEE 
SOME SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  UPPER LOW SHIFTS NORTH ON 
MONDAY NIGHT PULLING MOST OF THE MOISTURE NORTH...WILL KEEP MONDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT DRY.  NEXT DISTURBANCES APPROACHES 
THURSDAY...WILL KEEP  CHANCE POPS ON THURSDAY.  

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

330 PM EST THU FEB 22 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE CAROLINAS...WITH BREEZY WEST 
TO NORTHWEST WINDS CONTINUING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THESE WINDS 
SHOULD QUICKLY DECREASE AFTER SUNSET AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS ACROSS 
THE REGION. WITH BREEZY WINDS...DRY RHS AND LOW FUEL MOISTURE 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE AN SPS TO ADDRESS THE 
POTENTIAL HIGH FIRE DANGER UNTIL SUNSET. A STRONG COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH BOTH THE 
GFS AND WRF MODELS INDICATING THE BULK OF THE PRECIP AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THIS FRONT APPEARS WEAK FOR THE FORECAST 
AREA...ALTHOUGH A STRONG 850 MB JET (IN EXCESS OF 50 KTS) IS PROGGED 
TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT. AS A RESULT OF THESE HIGH 
WINDS...THINK THERE WILL STILL BE A POSSIBILITY OF SOME SEVERE 
WEATHER LATE SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL MENTION ONLY A CHANCE FOR 
TSTORMS AT THIS TIME...SINCE THE OVERALL AIR MASS APPEARS TO BE 
STABLE...BUT FEEL SOME ELEVATED THUNDER WILL BE POSSIBLE. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WIDESPREAD SHOWERS WITH A 
POSSIBLE STRAY THUNDERSTORM WILL EXIT THE AREA ON SUNDAY.  A FEW 
ISOLATED SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVER THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY 
MONDAY MORNING...MAINLY OVER THE FAR NORTHEAST ZONES.  CONFIDENCE IS 
LOW FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD DUE TO POOR CONSISTENCY.  
HOWEVER...A WEAK IMPULSE MAY SLIDE ACROSS THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT.  
FOR NOW...WILL LEAVE DRY WITH JUST A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUD 
COVER.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH THE 
NEXT SYSTEM MOVING IN ON THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 AM EST THU FEB 22 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...DRY WEATHER REGIME 
RETURNS AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. MAIN CONCERN IS WINDS IN THE FIRST PERIOD AND EARLY 
SECOND AS GRADIENT BETWEEN AMPLIFYING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN 
GREAT LAKES AND APPROACHING UPPER RIDGE INCREASES NORTHWEST FLOW. 
APPEARS WINDS OVER NORTHEASTERN MOUNTAINS WILL REACH ADVISORY 
CRITERIA...AND SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA COUNTIES WILL REACH LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY CRITERIA. ANTICIPATE WINDS TO DECREASE DURING THE SECOND 
PERIOD. GFS GUIDANCE TEMPS APPEAR REASONABLE AND GENERALLY DID NOT 
STRAY FAR FROM THOSE VALUES.

PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING ACROSS PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA
...ALTHO CERTAINLY NOT NEARLY AS WIDESPREAD AS NOTED ACROSS CENTRAL
AND ERN KY. WILL COVER THIS PATCHY FOG IN SHORT TERM FORECASTS.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES
SEEM GENERALLY CONSISTENT AND IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH THE DEEP
TROUGH AND STRONGER COLD FRONT TO AFFECT THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT
INTO SUNDAY. TEMPTED TO PLAY UP THE THUNDERSTORMS A BIT MORE IN THE
GRIDS...BUT WILL LET LATER SHIFTS ADD AREAL QUALIFIER (SCATTERED)
IF NEEDED. WE WILL CONTINUE TO HIGHLIGHT AT LEAST A FEW STRONG
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE SATURDAY EVENING IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER
OUTLOOK (MEMHWOMRX). DID SHOW A SLIGHT DECREASING POP TREND IN THE
FORECAST GRIDS FROM THE WEST STARTING SUNDAY AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE
...JUST VERY SLIGHT TEMP ADJUSTMENTS IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS.

MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...DRY FORECAST CARRIED ON FOR MONDAY
THROUGH WEDNESDAY...ALTHO A TRACE PRECIPITATION EVENT MIGHT OCCUR
IN THE FAR NE AREAS MONDAY OR TUESDAY BEHIND THE EXITING STRONG LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM. MAX TEMP PATTERN STILL LOOKS TO BE NEAR OR
SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMO NORMS SW VA/NE TN TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE FOR SE TN
AND SW NC. ENSEMBLES AND VARIOUS MODELS START TO STRAY FROM ANY
DEFINITIVE PATTERN FOR THESE PERIODS...SO I OPTED NOT TO BLINDLY
POPULATE TEMP FIELDS WITH THE LATEST GFSX MOS NUMBERS. INSTEAD
STAYED SOMEWHAT TRUE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS...WITH MINOR ADJUSTMENTS AS
NEEDED TO MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS.  

NEW DAY 7 (THURSDAY)...FOR NOW...INDICATES POSSIBLE SYSTEM QUITE
SIMILAR TO SUNDAYS. THUS...INTRODUCED AS INCREASING CLOUDS AND
CHANCE POPS.

TO BECOME LESS-DEFINED OVERNIGHT. AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE LATER 
THIS EVENING WILL POSSIBLY TRIGGER SOME ADDITIONAL CONVECTION...BUT 
THINK THAT IT WILL BE ISOLATED IN COVERAGE WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME 
HEATING. ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL QUICKLY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
TOMORROW MORNING...BRINGING BREEZY NORTHWEST WINDS BY THE AFTERNOON 
BUT NOT MUCH OF A CHANGE IN TEMPS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS 
THE REGION FOR MOST OF THE DAY ON THURSDAY AND INTO FRIDAY. AS FOR 
TEMPS...ALL THREE SETS OF GUIDANCE ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS 
SHIFTS EAST ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. ON SATURDAY WHILE DEEP MID 
LATITUDE CYCLONE PRESSES NORTHEAST TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES. RESULTING 
WEATHER INCLUDES A DECENT DRY DAY SATURDAY WITH INCREASING CHANCE 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. TAPER THE 
POPS BACK TO SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE BY SUNDAY NIGHT WITH SYSTEM 
COLD FRONT MAKING ITS WAY ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS DURING THE NIGHT. 
KEPT REMAINDER OF FORECAST DRY AWAITING THE ARRIVAL OF NEXT 
AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF ON DAY 8 OR 9. TRIED TO STAY NEAR MEX MOS 
THROUGH THE PERIOD BUT HAD TO MAKE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EST WED FEB 21 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY) VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE TROUGH APPROACHING THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FROM THE WEST IS CURRENTLY GENERATING
SCATTERED CONVECTION ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. TROUGH AXIS
PROJECTED TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA BY LATE MORNING TAKING THE BULK
OF THE PRECIP WITH IT. WILL CONTINUE TO INDICATE A LESSENING POP
TREND WITH TIME FROM WEST TO EAST. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED
CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE WHICH SEEMS REASONABLE.

LIGHTNING STRIKES DIMINISHING AND SURFACE BASED LIFTED INDICES
BECOMING POSITIVE...BUT A FEW THUNDERSTORMS LINGER (PROBABLY SOME
ELEVATED INSTABILITY). A REPORT OF SMALL HAIL RECEIVED FROM MORGAN
COUNTY...SO AN SPS WAS ISSUED TO COVER THIS POSSIBILITY WITH
ACTIVITY ACROSS NRN PLATEAU. OTHERWISE...DOUBTFUL IF ANY
THUNDERSTORMS WILL REMAIN BY 6AM EST...SO SHORT TERM FORECAST WILL
BE USED FOR ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS EARLY THIS MORNING RATHER THAN
IN ZFPMRX.

.LONG TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT MAY EASE
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA...OR BECOME SO DIFFUSE THAT IT WILL BE
DIFFICULT TO LOCATE IT BY THIS EVENING. HOWEVER...DID ADD A SLIGHT
CHANCE OF SHOWERS EARLY THIS EVENING FOR THE NRN AND SMOKY MTNS OF
EAST TN. NOT MUCH IF ANY COLD AIR ADVECTION NOTED...SO NUDGED MIN
TEMPS UP A BIT IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS.

RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE STILL LOOKS TO BUILD IN AND DOMINATE
THURSDAY THRU SATURDAY...SO JUST SOME SLIGHT TEMPERATURE
ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO GRIDS. NORTHERLY SURFACE WINDS MAY BRING DOWN
HIGHS TEMPS SLIGHTLY ON FRIDAY...BEFORE SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW
DEVELOPS AGAIN ON SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE STRONGER COLD FRONT FOR THE
WEEKEND. TIMING OF CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION...INCLUDING SOME
THUNDERSTORMS...APPEARED ON TRACK FOR SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.

DECREASED POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT LEADING INTO OUR DRY FORECAST FOR
MONDAY. DONT SEE A SIGNIFICANT THREAT OF PRECIPITATION TUESDAY...
ALTHO A FEW RAIN OR SNOW SHOWERS MIGHT BE POSSIBLE DUE TO COLD AIR
ADVECTION AND LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW. ADDED SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS
FOR THE NEW DAY 7 (WEDNESDAY)...WHICH LOOKS TO BE DRY WITH
TEMPERATURES NEAR SEASONAL NORMALS IN THE NORTH AND AROUND 5 TO 8
DEGREES ABOVE IN THE SOUTH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 AM EST TUE FEB 20 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VERY INTERESTING CURRENT 
TEMPERATURE PATTERN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...VARYING FROM CHILLY 
20S WHERE WINDS DECOUPLED AND SKIES HAVE REMAINED MOSTLY CLEAR TO
MID AND UPPER 40S ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND IN THE CENTRAL 
AND SRN VALLEY WHERE SW WINDS OF 7 TO 15 MPH ARE BLOWING. LOW CLOUD 
DECK AROUND 5000 FEET IS ADVANCING NE FROM MIDDLE TN/NRN AL AND NW GA
THIS MORNING...SO TEMPS MAY ACTUALLY RISE BY DAYBREAK IN THE CHIILY 
AREAS. AREA RADARS ARE SHOWING SOME WEAK RETURNS SPREADING NE INTO 
THE SW HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT IT SHOULD BE EXTREMELY 
DIFFICULT FOR MORE THAN A SPRINKLE TO REACH THE SURFACE EARLY THIS 
MORNING...GIVEN MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS AND CURRENT DEW POINT TEMPS 
ONLY IN THE TEENS AND 20S.

FOR THE FORECAST...SLIGHTLY DELAYED THE ONSET OF ANY SIGNIFICANT 
PRECIPITATION UNTIL MID TO LATE AFTERNOON...WHEN MY POPS BUILD TO 
LIKELY CATEGORY. CURRENT TEMPS WERE SO MILD WHERE MIXING IS OCCURING 
THAT I WENT WITH OR JUST ABOVE THE WARMER MOS CHOICES. KEPT AS 
SHOWERS FOR TYPE TODAY. HOWEVER...LOOKS TO BE SOME UPPER LEVEL 
SUPPORT WITH JET MAX PROVIDING UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE THIS EVENING 
AND SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY. BEST LIFT SEEMS TO FALL AROUND 00Z TO 
06Z PERIOD ALSO...SO I ADDED ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS TO WESTERN HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. PREVIOUS CATEGORICAL POPS THIS EVENING ALSO 
LOOK GOOD...WITH POPS DECREASING AFTER MIDNIGHT. WENT CLOSER TO A 
MOS BLEND FOR LOWS TONIGHT WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.


.LONG TERM...(WED THROUGH MON)...SHORT WAVE TROUGH THAT PRODUCES 
LATE TUESDAY PRECIP EVENT RAPIDLY PULLS AWAY DURING THE THIRD 
PERIOD...TAKING PRECIP WITH IT. UPPER RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK. THIS WILL ALLOW 
TEMPS TO CLIMB TO ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH THE BULK OF THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD. DRY WEATHER WILL ALSO PERSIST UNTIL SUNDAY WHEN AN AMPLIFIED 
UPPER TROUGH/CLOSED LOW ADVANCES EASTWARD FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE FAIRLY CLOSELY FOR BOTH TEMPS AND POPS AS 
ENSEMBLES GENERALLY SUPPORT ITS SOLUTION THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
407 AM EST MON FEB 19 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WIND AND SUNSHINE YESTERDAY LIKELY 
MELTED MOST OF OUR SNOW COVER...EXCEPT FOR NORTHEAST AREAS WHERE 
CLOUDS HELD IN LONGER AND HEAVIER SNOW FELL. UNDERCUT MOS HIGHS SOME 
IN AREAS WHERE LAST VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS AND SNOW COVER GRAPHICS 
INDICATED MORE LEFTOVER SNOW COVER FOR TODAY. GOOD LOW LEVEL WARM 
AIR ADVECTION COMES IN WITH INCREASING SW WINDS THIS AFTERNOON...AND 
WITH LITTLE TO NO SNOW COVER OVER NRN AL OR NW GA...THE SRN VALLEY 
COUNTIES SHOULD WARM NICELY INTO THE MID TO UPPER 50S.

OTHERWISE...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AT THE 
SURFACE WILL SLIP SOUTHEAST AND SURFACE GRADIENT WILL INCREASE AHEAD 
OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT. THINKING IS THAT GFS MAY BE A LITTLE 
TOO FAST WITH INCREASING CLOUDS TONIGHT...AND TOO ZEALOUS WITH 
DEVELOPMENT OF LIGHT RAIN. THUS...KEPT JUST THE VERY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR EXTREME WRN COUNTIES LATE TONIGHT...AND DRY ELSEWHERE.

MIN TEMPS WILL BE TRICKY GIVEN THE INCREASING CLOUDS LATE AND SW 
SURFACE WINDS NOT DECOUPLING IN ALL AREAS AFTER SUNSET. COOLER GFS 
MOS MINS LOOKED BEST FOR ERN AREAS WHERE WINDS WILL BE LIGHTEST AND 
CLOUDS ARRIVE LAST...AND A BLEND WITH THE MILDER NAM-WRF MOS MINS 
ELSEWHERE. 

PATTERN CHANGING AND TEMPS WARMING FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK LOOKS 
GREAT...EXCEPT PERHAPS TO FANS OF WINTER WEATHER.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS BRING WEAK SYSTEM
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY. THERE IS SOME WEAK INSTABILITY
WITH THE SYSTEM AND GOOD SHEAR. NAM SHOWS STRONG LIFT AND ABUNDANT
MOISTURE BUT GFS DOES NOT HAVE THE MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT AT THE
SAME TIME. DECIDED NOT TO PUT THUNDER IN WITH DEW POINTS ONLY
REACHING THE MID 40S IN THE SOUTH AND INCONSISTENCIES BETWEEN THE
MODELS. SOUTHWEST WINDS THOUGH WILL HELP THE TEMPERATURES WARM
EVEN WITH ANTICIPATED SHOWERS. PREFERRED THE WARMER MAV NUMBERS.
BOTH NAM/GFS BRING FRONT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT WITH SKIES CLEARING
QUICKLY WEDNESDAY. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE WITH RIDGING
ALOFT WILL HELP TEMPERATURES RISE INTO THE 60S THROUGH THE END OF
THE WEEK. A DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE MS
VALLEY SATURDAY AND OPEN THE GULF. STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL
CAUSE SHOWERS TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE TENNESEE VALLEY SATURDAY
THROUGH SUNDAY. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH SUNDAY AND
THUNDERSTORMS MAY OCCUR AHEAD OF IT. CURRENT GFS MODEL RUN IS
SPEEDING SYSTEM UP SEVERAL HOURS WHICH MAY MEAN FRONT MOVES THROUGH
EARLIER BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP TIMING THE SAME.

THURSDAY NIGHT.  NEXT DISTURBANCE APPROACHES THE AREA LATE FRIDAY.  
WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY FOR 
NOW.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WHEN 
BETTER MOISTURE ARRIVES. THICKNESSES INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD 
BE ALL LIQUID ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. COLD FRONT PUSHING INTO  
THE AREA ON SUNDAY.  GFS INDICATING DECENT MOISTURE AND LOW LEVEL 
JET AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON SUNDAY...ALONG WITH SOME INSTABILITY... 
WILL ADD CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AND INCLUDE THUNDER IN THE 
FORECAST.  SHOULD HAVE A NICE WARMING TREND THIS WEEK.  STAYED CLOSE 
TO HPC FOR TEMPERATURES WHICH WAS BELOW MEX GUIDANCE FOR MOST OF THE 
PERIOD.



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 181648
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1145 AM EST SUN FEB 18 2007

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED FORECAST TO DROP SNOW WARNINGS IN TN MNTS.
FORECAST ADJUSTED TO REDUCE CLOUD COVER AND LOWER SNOW CHC. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
.SHORT TERM...(TODAY)...MOST INTERESTING AND SIGNIFICANT WEATHER IS 
LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES ON BACK SIDE OF THE EXITING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM. HAD THOUGHT BRIEFLY ABOUT ENDING ADVISORIES AND 
WARNINGS OVER WESTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY (INSTEAD OF 
7AM EST ENDING TIME)...BASED ON MODEL DATA AND LATEST RADAR OR 
SATELLITE PICS. HOWEVER...AFTER A FEW CALLS MADE TO THOSE COUNTIES 
(ESPECIALLY NRN PLATEAU AND SEQUATCHIE VALLEY COUNTIES)...SEEMS THAT 
THE SNOW MAY BE JUST A LITTLE MORE WIDESPREAD AND AT LEAST LIGHT 
INTENSITY THAN AREA RADAR LOOPS WOULD INDICATE. ANOTHER FACTOR THAT 
FAVORS CONTINUING THE PREVIOUS ENDING TIMES LATER THIS MORNING...IS 
THE VERY HAZARDOUS ROAD CONDITIONS NOTED GENERALLY ACROSS MOST IF 
NOT ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING.

OTHERWISE...WILL CONTINUE TO SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT THE GFS MOS MAX TEMPS 
FOR TODAY...GIVEN TRACK RECORD OVER PAST FEW DAYS AND DECENT AMOUNT 
OF SNOW COVER IN MANY AREAS. KEPT POP GRIDS CLOSE TO PREVIOUS 
FORECAST AND WELL ABOVE 18/00Z MOS...BASED ON RADAR AND CALLS MADE.
WAS A BIT CONCERNED ABOUT STRENGTH OF W-NW SURFACE WINDS TODAY...
BUT KMRX AND KHTX VAD WIND PROFILES (VWPS) SHOW LOW LEVEL JET 
DECREASING TO 25 KNOTS. WIND GRIDS FOR TODAY WERE FRESHENED WITH THE 
NAM12 MODEL DATA...WHICH MIGHT BE A TAD HIGH ON SPEEDS...BUT DID 
MESH WELL WITH NEIGHBORING WIND SPEEDS TO OUR EAST FROM GSP AND 
RNK.  

.LONG TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AFTER PRECIPITATION ENDS
GFS IS QUICK TO CLEAR CLOUD COVER WITH NAM/WRF HOLDING ONTO THE LOW
LEVEL CLOUDINESS MOST OF THE NIGHT IN THE NE AS FLOW FROM THE NW
CONTINUES TO BRING IN FEED OF MOISTURE. THINKING THAT CLOUDS MAY BE
STUBBORN AND CONTINUE NORTHERN HALF. ANOTHER FACTOR IN LOW
TEMPERATURE FORECAST IS STRONG NW TO W WINDS THAT SHOULOD DROP OFF
DURING THE EVENING AS PRESSURE GRADIENT RELAXES. GUIDANCE VALUES FOR
TONIGHT ARE MOSTLY IN THE 20S. WENT BELOW GUIDANCE SEVERAL DEGREES
NE WITH SNOW COVER ON THE GROUND AND ANTICIPATED CLEARING BEFORE
MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE MOVING EAST ALONG THE GULF COAST AND COLD
UPPER TROUGH EXITING TO THE NE WILL HELP THE REGION WARM UP INTO
THE 40S AND 50S MONDAY. ALSO A FACTOR WITH THE WARMUP IS A
SOUTHWEST WIND AHEAD OF DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE MOVING INTO THE
PLAINS AS COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE MID MS VALLEY LATE MONDAY. BOTH
NAM/WRF AND GFS BRING CLOUDS IN AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT.
SW FLOW ALOFT ALSO CONTINUES AND SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM
REACHING FREEZING EXCEPT POSSIBLY AROUND TRI CITIES. GUIDANCE GIVES
LOW CHANCE POPS TO MOST SITES LATE MONDAY NIGHT DECIDED TO BRING
JUST SLIGHT CHANCE INTO THE PLATEAU COUNTIES AND KEEP THE REST OF
THE FORECAST AREA DRY. RECENT SYSTEMS HAVE SLOWED DOWN SEVERAL
HOURS SO NOT WANTING TO SPEED THINGS UP YET. MODELS DIVERGE TUESDAY
WITH NAM MOVING SYSTEM THROUGH TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT DRYING
THINGS OUT WEDNESDAY. GFS IS SLOWER WITH SYSTEM AND CUTS OFF AN UPPER
LOW IN THE SOUTHWEST THAT GETS CAUGHT IN THE SW FLOW BRINGING
MOISTURE BACK NORTH OVER THE FRONT WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. WILL
KEEP FORECAST AS IS WITH THE RAIN MOVING OUT BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT.
NEW UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS ACROSS ROCKIES THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.
GULF OPENS UP AND SPREADS RAIN INTO THE REGION FOR DAY 7. RAISED
TEMPERATURES BASED ON NEW MOS GUIDANCE DAYS DAYS 4 THOUGH 7. 
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 181420
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 AM EST SUN FEB 18 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST UPDATED TO DROP SNOW WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES
OUTSIDE THE TN MNTS.SCT SNOW SHWRS AND FLURRIES WILL PERSIST MAINLY 
THIS MORNING. REPORTS OF 3-7 INCHES OF SNOW FROM THE GREAT SMOKY NP. 
UPSLOPE WINDS ARE FAVORABLE FOR SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS 
IN THE MNTS AND TRAVEL SHOULD REMAIN HAZARDOUS THROUGH THE DAY WITH 
SOME BLOWING SNOW SO LET WARNING STAND. OTHERWISE TWEAKED TEMPS 
DOWNWARD A DEGREE OR TWO TODAY PER CURRENT OBS. GOOD CAP AROUND 850MB. 
BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS EXPECTED ACROSS THE VALLEY BUT DECKS WILL BACK 
BUILD ALONG RIDGE TOPS AND FROM THE TN MNTS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
.SHORT TERM...(TODAY)...MOST INTERESTING AND SIGNIFICANT WEATHER IS 
LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES ON BACK SIDE OF THE EXITING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM. HAD THOUGHT BRIEFLY ABOUT ENDING ADVISORIES AND 
WARNINGS OVER WESTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY (INSTEAD OF 
7AM EST ENDING TIME)...BASED ON MODEL DATA AND LATEST RADAR OR 
SATELLITE PICS. HOWEVER...AFTER A FEW CALLS MADE TO THOSE COUNTIES 
(ESPECIALLY NRN PLATEAU AND SEQUATCHIE VALLEY COUNTIES)...SEEMS THAT 
THE SNOW MAY BE JUST A LITTLE MORE WIDESPREAD AND AT LEAST LIGHT 
INTENSITY THAN AREA RADAR LOOPS WOULD INDICATE. ANOTHER FACTOR THAT 
FAVORS CONTINUING THE PREVIOUS ENDING TIMES LATER THIS MORNING...IS 
THE VERY HAZARDOUS ROAD CONDITIONS NOTED GENERALLY ACROSS MOST IF 
NOT ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING.

OTHERWISE...WILL CONTINUE TO SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT THE GFS MOS MAX TEMPS 
FOR TODAY...GIVEN TRACK RECORD OVER PAST FEW DAYS AND DECENT AMOUNT 
OF SNOW COVER IN MANY AREAS. KEPT POP GRIDS CLOSE TO PREVIOUS 
FORECAST AND WELL ABOVE 18/00Z MOS...BASED ON RADAR AND CALLS MADE.
WAS A BIT CONCERNED ABOUT STRENGTH OF W-NW SURFACE WINDS TODAY...
BUT KMRX AND KHTX VAD WIND PROFILES (VWPS) SHOW LOW LEVEL JET 
DECREASING TO 25 KNOTS. WIND GRIDS FOR TODAY WERE FRESHENED WITH THE 
NAM12 MODEL DATA...WHICH MIGHT BE A TAD HIGH ON SPEEDS...BUT DID 
MESH WELL WITH NEIGHBORING WIND SPEEDS TO OUR EAST FROM GSP AND 
RNK.  

.LONG TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AFTER PRECIPITATION ENDS
GFS IS QUICK TO CLEAR CLOUD COVER WITH NAM/WRF HOLDING ONTO THE LOW
LEVEL CLOUDINESS MOST OF THE NIGHT IN THE NE AS FLOW FROM THE NW
CONTINUES TO BRING IN FEED OF MOISTURE. THINKING THAT CLOUDS MAY BE
STUBBORN AND CONTINUE NORTHERN HALF. ANOTHER FACTOR IN LOW
TEMPERATURE FORECAST IS STRONG NW TO W WINDS THAT SHOULOD DROP OFF
DURING THE EVENING AS PRESSURE GRADIENT RELAXES. GUIDANCE VALUES FOR
TONIGHT ARE MOSTLY IN THE 20S. WENT BELOW GUIDANCE SEVERAL DEGREES
NE WITH SNOW COVER ON THE GROUND AND ANTICIPATED CLEARING BEFORE
MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE MOVING EAST ALONG THE GULF COAST AND COLD
UPPER TROUGH EXITING TO THE NE WILL HELP THE REGION WARM UP INTO
THE 40S AND 50S MONDAY. ALSO A FACTOR WITH THE WARMUP IS A
SOUTHWEST WIND AHEAD OF DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE MOVING INTO THE
PLAINS AS COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE MID MS VALLEY LATE MONDAY. BOTH
NAM/WRF AND GFS BRING CLOUDS IN AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT.
SW FLOW ALOFT ALSO CONTINUES AND SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM
REACHING FREEZING EXCEPT POSSIBLY AROUND TRI CITIES. GUIDANCE GIVES
LOW CHANCE POPS TO MOST SITES LATE MONDAY NIGHT DECIDED TO BRING
JUST SLIGHT CHANCE INTO THE PLATEAU COUNTIES AND KEEP THE REST OF
THE FORECAST AREA DRY. RECENT SYSTEMS HAVE SLOWED DOWN SEVERAL
HOURS SO NOT WANTING TO SPEED THINGS UP YET. MODELS DIVERGE TUESDAY
WITH NAM MOVING SYSTEM THROUGH TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT DRYING
THINGS OUT WEDNESDAY. GFS IS SLOWER WITH SYSTEM AND CUTS OFF AN UPPER
LOW IN THE SOUTHWEST THAT GETS CAUGHT IN THE SW FLOW BRINGING
MOISTURE BACK NORTH OVER THE FRONT WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. WILL
KEEP FORECAST AS IS WITH THE RAIN MOVING OUT BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT.
NEW UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS ACROSS ROCKIES THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.
GULF OPENS UP AND SPREADS RAIN INTO THE REGION FOR DAY 7. RAISED
TEMPERATURES BASED ON NEW MOS GUIDANCE DAYS DAYS 4 THOUGH 7. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    33  22  52  36  55 /  30   0  10  10  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN            34  22  51  37  54 /  20   0  10  10  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   31  16  46  30  50 /  60  10  10  10  40

.DISCUSSION...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND TROUGH AXIS IS MOVING THROUGH

AREA AND IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE 1 TO 3 INCHES ACROSS MUCH OF THE

FAVORED UPSLOPE CONDITIONS.  VARIOUS SNOW WARNINGS AND SNOW 
ADVISORIES ARE IN EFFECT OVERNIGHT FOR MANY LOCATIONS...SEE 
MEMWSWMRX FOR DETAILS.  THE SNOW WILL SLOWLY DIMINISH OVERNIGHT AS 
THE SYSTEM EXITS THE REGION.  HOWEVER...WITH UPSLOPE FLOW SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE OVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS FOR MUCH OF SUNDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST SAT FEB 17 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE LOW MOVING 
NORTHEAST AND FILLING OVER OH RVR VLY. COLD FRONT GAINING STEAM AND 
MOVING EAST THROUGH TN VLY THIS EVENING AND THROUGH S APPALACHIANS
OVERNIGHT. SHALLOW WAA HAS MOVED NE UP THE MRX CWA AND TEMPS HAVE 
RISEN TO THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S SOME LOCATIONS. PCPN TYPE MANY SNOW
WITH SOME MIXING OF SLEET. TEMPS SHOULD FALL BACK TO NEAR FREEZING 
EARLY THIS EVENING SOUTHERN AREAS. WEAKENING VORT OVER MID TN AND 
TROUGH AXIS WILL MOVE THROUGH AREA THIS EVENING. SAT IMAGES INDICATE 
A GOOD AMOUNT OF MID LEVEL MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE 
WHICH MOVES EAST OF THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. MID LEVEL MOISTURE IS 
ON THE DECREASE OVERNIGHT BUT UPSLOPE CONDITIONS BECOME FAVORABLE 
AFTER THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. SNOW AND WINTER ADVISORIES IN EFFECT 
THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING WITH 1 TO 3 INCHES GENERALLY EXPECTED. LIGHT 
AMOUNTS ON TAP FOR CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS WITH HIGHER AMOUNTS 
LIKELY ABOVE 3000 FEET. SEE WSWMRX. BREEZY CONDITION SUNDAY WITH 
CONTINUE BELOW NORMAL TEMPS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN QUICKLY 
ON SUNDAY WITH CLEARING SKIES BY AFTERNOON. RIDGE SLIDES SE ON 
MONDAY WITH INCREASED SWRLY LOW LEVEL FLOW. WAA CONTINUES MON NGT
WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN W AREAS LATE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACHES ON 
TUESDAY.  WITH A RIDGE IN PLACE...WENT WITH THE SLOWER NAM.  DECENT 
MOISTURE AHEAD OF IT...WILL KEEP 30 POPS FOR TUESDAY.  WITH ABUNDANT 
MOISTURE AND LIFT AVAILABLE...WILL KEEP 50 POPS GOING FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT. THICKNESSES INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  FRONT PUSHING OUT OF AREA ON LATE 
WEDNESDAY...WITH MOISTURE SHIFTING TO THE SOUTH.  WILL LOWER POPS ON 
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR ONLY 
WEDNESDAY EVENING...THEN DRY AFTER MIDNIGHT. RIDGE BUILDS IN 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT.  NEXT 
DISTURBANCE APPROACHES THE AREA LATE FRIDAY.  WITH STILL SOME 
UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING...WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW...BUT WILL ADD 
CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WHEN BETTER MOISTURE 
ARRIVES. THICKNESSES INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID ON 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. SHOULD HAVE A NICE WARMING TREND NEXT  
WEEK.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 171538
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST SAT FEB 17 2007

.DISCUSSION...LATEST MODEL RUNS SUPPORT CURRENT FORECAST. FIRST ROUND
OF SNOW HAD BETTER THAN EXPECTED COVERAGE BUT AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN 
LIGHT. PREFRONTAL WAA THIS AFTERNOON WILL HAVE IMPLICATIONS ON SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS MAINLY ACROSS S PLATEAU. MAY HAVE TO EXTEND SNOW 
ADVSRY DOWN PLATEAU. WILL DECIDE SHORTLY. TN MNTS MAY BE UPPED TO 
HEAVY SNOW WARNING WITH AFTERNOON PACKAGE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:  
SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...17/00Z GFS HAS SLOWED DOWN THE 
ARRIVAL OF PRECIPITATION WITH THE APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
FROM 24 HOURS AGO...BUT IS STILL A FEW HOURS FASTER THAN LATEST 
NAM-WRF MODEL. CLOUDS ARE JUST BEGINNING TO ARRIVE OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA WITH ANY WINTRY PRECIPITATION STILL WELL TO OUR WEST AND JUST 
INTO FAR WESTERN PARTS OF KY AND TN. WILL COMPROMISE SOME AND JUST 
SLIGHTLY DELAY THE START OF SNOW (AND SOME RAIN SRN AREAS) FROM 
PREVIOUS GRIDS...WHICH WAS CONSENSUS FROM NEIGHBORING OFFICES AS 
WELL.

PREVIOUS SNOW AMOUNT GRIDS AND SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT STILL SEEM 
IN THE BALL PARK OVERALL...SO ONLY SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO SNOW 
AMOUNTS...MAINLY IN THE FIRST 6 HOUR GRID FROM 12-18Z TODAY WHERE 
AMOUNTS WERE LOWERED DUE TO LATER START. DECIDED TO RUN WITH 3 SNOW 
ADVISORY AREAS...STAGGERED SLIGHTLY IN STARTING AND ENDING TIMES 
FROM WEST TO EAST. SNOW ADVISORIES FOR THE NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES...
SWRN VA...NE TN AND THE NRN/SMOKY MTNS. CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES 
WONT GET MORE THAN A DUSTING LATE TODAY...AND POSSIBLY AN INCH OR 
SO TONIGHT...WITH SIMILAR THINKING FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF POLK 
COUNTY TN INTO CHEROKEE/CLAY COUNTIES OF NC. LATER SHIFTS CAN 
RE-THINK THIS...AS WELL AS POTENTIAL FOR NRN AND SMOKY MTNS AREAS TO 
POSSIBLY GET JUST ABOVE OUR 4 INCH CRITERIA (WHICH WOULD JUSTIFY A 
WARNING). OTHERWISE...PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES HIGHEST OVER SE TN 
AREAS...BUT MODELS DEPICT MUCH LIGHTER QPF THAT FAR SOUTH...PLUS I 
SEE LIKELIHOOD THAT A RAIN AND SNOW MIX SHOULD OCCUR FOR THOSE AREAS 
UNTIL AFTER SUNSET TODAY. 

SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES SHOULD LINGER AT LEAST INTO SUNDAY MORNING 
FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WHICH WAS REASONING TO CARRY SNOW ADVISORY 
FOR NRN/SMOKY MTNS THROUGH LATE MORNING THERE. OTHERWISE...UNDERCUT
GFS MOS HIGHS AGAIN TODAY...GIVEN TRACK RECORD OVER PAST TWO DAYS.
MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY WERE QUITE CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

WSWMRX WILL QUICKLY FOLLOW ZFPMRX...AND PERHAPS A VERY BRIEF SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT FOR COUNTIES NOT IN AN ADVISORY.  

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SNOW MOVES OUT AS SKIES 
CLEAR FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST. COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL GRADUALLY 
DECREASE OVERNIGHT BUT STRONGER NW WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS OF SW VA 
AND NE TN WILL CAUSE WIND CHILL TEMPERATURES TO BE NEAR ZERO. SUNDAY 
NIGHT SHOULD BE THE LAST COLD NIGHT FOR AWHILE. EXPECTING SINGLE 
DIGITS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTH WITH TEENS TO LOWER 20S ELSEWHERE. 
WHERE THERE IS STILL SNOW COVER LOWS MAY BE EVEN COLDER. COLD UPPER 
TROUGH SHIFTS EAST MONDAY WITH FLOW BECOMING ZONAL. HIGH PRESSURE 
AND DRIER AIRMASS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO RISE TO MORE NORMAL 
HIGHS IN THE MID 40S TO LOWER 50S. ANOTHER SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS 
THE PLAINS WILL SPREAD CLOUDS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT 
AND TUESDAY. WARMER TEMPERATURES AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL CAUSE 
RAIN TO FALL TUESDAY AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. THIS PRECIPITATION MAINLY 
FROM ISENTROPIC LIFT. AHEAD OF THE FRONT TUESDAY NIGHT THE 
PRECIPITATION SHOULD BECOME MORE SHOWERY WITH POSSIBLY SOME THUNDER. 
THEN LINGERING MOISTURE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. NEWEST GFS 
MODEL RUN FASTER WITH ENDING PRECIPITATION ON WEDNESDAY. FOR 
CONTINUITY WILL KEEP CHANCE OF SHOWERS INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. DRIER 
AND MILD CONDITIONS RETURN THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS RIDGING ACROSS THE 
SOUTHWEST MOVES INTO THE SOUTHEAST.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  41 25 41 23 52 / 60 40 10  0 10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    38 23 35 20 50 / 70 60 20  0 10 
OAK RIDGE, TN            37 23 36 20 49 / 70 60 20  0 10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   36 21 31 15 45 / 80 80 50 10 10
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...HANCOCK...
     MORGAN...SCOTT TN.

     SNOW ADVISORY FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM EST SUNDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: HAWKINS...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST

FXUS64 KMRX 170909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
409 AM EST SAT FEB 17 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...17/00Z GFS HAS SLOWED DOWN THE 
ARRIVAL OF PRECIPITATION WITH THE APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
FROM 24 HOURS AGO...BUT IS STILL A FEW HOURS FASTER THAN LATEST 
NAM-WRF MODEL. CLOUDS ARE JUST BEGINNING TO ARRIVE OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA WITH ANY WINTRY PRECIPITATION STILL WELL TO OUR WEST AND JUST 
INTO FAR WESTERN PARTS OF KY AND TN. WILL COMPROMISE SOME AND JUST 
SLIGHTLY DELAY THE START OF SNOW (AND SOME RAIN SRN AREAS) FROM 
PREVIOUS GRIDS...WHICH WAS CONSENSUS FROM NEIGHBORING OFFICES AS 
WELL.

PREVIOUS SNOW AMOUNT GRIDS AND SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT STILL SEEM 
IN THE BALL PARK OVERALL...SO ONLY SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO SNOW 
AMOUNTS...MAINLY IN THE FIRST 6 HOUR GRID FROM 12-18Z TODAY WHERE 
AMOUNTS WERE LOWERED DUE TO LATER START. DECIDED TO RUN WITH 3 SNOW 
ADVISORY AREAS...STAGGERED SLIGHTLY IN STARTING AND ENDING TIMES 
FROM WEST TO EAST. SNOW ADVISORIES FOR THE NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES...
SWRN VA...NE TN AND THE NRN/SMOKY MTNS. CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES 
WONT GET MORE THAN A DUSTING LATE TODAY...AND POSSIBLY AN INCH OR 
SO TONIGHT...WITH SIMILAR THINKING FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF POLK 
COUNTY TN INTO CHEROKEE/CLAY COUNTIES OF NC. LATER SHIFTS CAN 
RE-THINK THIS...AS WELL AS POTENTIAL FOR NRN AND SMOKY MTNS AREAS TO 
POSSIBLY GET JUST ABOVE OUR 4 INCH CRITERIA (WHICH WOULD JUSTIFY A 
WARNING). OTHERWISE...PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES HIGHEST OVER SE TN 
AREAS...BUT MODELS DEPICT MUCH LIGHTER QPF THAT FAR SOUTH...PLUS I 
SEE LIKELIHOOD THAT A RAIN AND SNOW MIX SHOULD OCCUR FOR THOSE AREAS 
UNTIL AFTER SUNSET TODAY. 

SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES SHOULD LINGER AT LEAST INTO SUNDAY MORNING 
FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WHICH WAS REASONING TO CARRY SNOW ADVISORY 
FOR NRN/SMOKY MTNS THROUGH LATE MORNING THERE. OTHERWISE...UNDERCUT
GFS MOS HIGHS AGAIN TODAY...GIVEN TRACK RECORD OVER PAST TWO DAYS.
MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY WERE QUITE CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

WSWMRX WILL QUICKLY FOLLOW ZFPMRX...AND PERHAPS A VERY BRIEF SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT FOR COUNTIES NOT IN AN ADVISORY.  

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SNOW MOVES OUT AS
SKIES CLEAR FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST. COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL
GRADUALLY DECREASE OVERNIGHT BUT STRONGER NW WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS
OF SW VA AND NE TN WILL CAUSE WIND CHILL TEMPERATURES TO BE NEAR
ZERO. SUNDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE THE LAST COLD NIGHT FOR AWHILE.
EXPECTING SINGLE DIGITS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTH WITH TEENS TO
LOWER 20S ELSEWHERE. WHERE THERE IS STILL SNOW COVER LOWS MAY BE
EVEN COLDER. COLD UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS EAST MONDAY WITH FLOW
BECOMING ZONAL. HIGH PRESSURE AND DRIER AIRMASS WILL ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO RISE TO MORE NORMAL HIGHS IN THE MID 40S TO LOWER
50S. ANOTHER SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS THE PLAINS WILL SPREAD CLOUDS
INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. WARMER
TEMPERATURES AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL CAUSE RAIN TO FALL
TUESDAY AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. THIS PRECIPITATION MAINLY FROM
ISENTROPIC LIFT. AHEAD OF THE FRONT TUESDAY NIGHT THE PRECIPITATION
SHOULD BECOME MORE SHOWERY WITH POSSIBLY SOME THUNDER. THEN
LINGERING MOISTURE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. NEWEST GFS MODEL RUN
FASTER WITH ENDING PRECIPITATION ON WEDNESDAY. FOR CONTINUITY WILL
KEEP CHANCE OF SHOWERS INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. DRIER AND MILD
CONDITIONS RETURN THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS RIDGING ACROSS THE
SOUTHWEST MOVES INTO THE SOUTHEAST.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 162000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST FRI FEB 16 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...STRENGTHENING JET 
FROM THE N ROCKIES DIGS SE AND SETS UP W-E ACROSS DEEP SOUTH OF SAT. 
SFC LOW TRACKS SE THROUGH UPR MS VLY TONIGHT THEN WEAKENS MOVING E 
ACROSS OH VLY SAT. CLOUDS THICKEN IN NW FLOW FROM ABOVE OVRNIGHT BUT 
TEMPS WONT NEED MUCH TIME TO PLUMMET AFT SUNSET. MOST AREAS WILL BE 
A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN THIS MORNING. 1000-850MB SW FLOW INCREASES 
IN RESPONSE TO SFC LOW ON SAT. MOS GUIDANCE DEPICTS A RAPID WARMUP 
EARLY IN DAY. FEEL THIS IS OVERDONE EXPECTING GOOD CLOUD 
COVER...VIRGA AND EVAPORATIVE COOLING WITH LOW WET BULBS IN PLACE. 
LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW WILL ADVANCE ACROSS THE AREA FROM THE NW 
EARLY SAT AFTERNOON WITH MOST GROUND TEMPS AT OF BELOW FREEZING TO 
ALLOW FOR LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS. SEE SPSMRX. MID LEVEL TROUGH AXIS AND 
SFC FRONT MOVE EAST THROUGH AREA SAT EVENING. HEAVIEST SNOWFALL 
SHOULD OCCUR BETWEEN 17/22Z AND 18/09Z. UPSLOPE SNOWS WILL DOMINATE 
SUNDAY MORNING. STAYED ON THE COOL SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE FOR SUN MAXS 
BUT THIS MAY BE TOO OPTIMISTIC PER THICKNESS HEIGHTS AND NW FLOW. 
CONTINUED BELOW NORMAL TEMPS SUNDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGE BUILDS INTO 
THE AREA ON MONDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON MONDAY AND MONDAY 
NIGHT.  NEXT FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACHES ON TUESDAY.  MOISTURE 
INCREASING AHEAD OF IT...WILL RAISE POPS TO 30 PERCENT FOR TUESDAY.  
WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE AND LIFT AVAILABLE...WILL CONTINUE WITH 
CHANCE POPS ON TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  BEST CHANCES 
SHOULD BE ON WEDNESDAY AS SURFACE AND UPPER LOWS TRACK THOUGH THE 
AREA.  THICKNESSES INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID ON 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...INCLUDING THE OVERNIGHT PERIODS.  GFS 
KEEPING THE UPPER LOW JUST TO THE EAST OF OUR CWA...WILL FOLLOW HPC 
LEAD WHICH CLEARS THE SYSTEM OUT QUICKER THAN GFS...SO ONLY KEPT 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE MORNING HOURS ON THURSDAY.  RIDGE BUILDS 
IN ON THURSDAY NIGHT...BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY. SHOULD HAVE A NICE WARMING TREND THIS WEEK.  STAYED NEAR 
HPC/MEX FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 161559
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST FRI FEB 16 2007

.DISCUSSION...SUNNY COLD DAY. TEMP ADVECTION NEUTRAL. DRY AIRMASS
AND SUNSHINE SHOULD LET TEMPS BRIEFLY SPIKE UPWARD THIS AFTERNOON. 
CURRENT MAX TEMPS MAY BE TOO OPTIMISTIC BY A DEGREE OR TWO BUT WILL 
LET STAND. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE VORT MAX MOVING INTO WRN TN 
AND NRN MS THIS MORNING IS PROGD TO MOVE QUICKLY ACROSS LATER THIS 
MORNING...BUT PASS MAINLY TO OUR SOUTH.  NOT MUCH MORE THAN 0.10 
INCH OF PRECIPITABLE WATER NOTED ON AREAL MODEL SOUNDINGS...SO I 
DONT EXPECT MUCH MORE THAN SOME PASSING MID AND HIGH CLOUDS EARLY 
TODAY (PROBABLY NO WORSE THAN PARTLY CLOUDY OVERALL).  TIME HEIGHT 
SECTIONS SHOW CONSIDERABLE SUNSHINE FOR THIS AFTERNOON...ALTHOUGH 
STILL A COLD AIRMASS IN PLACE AND NOTED THAT GFS MOS WAS 2 TO 4 
DEGREES TOO WARM FOR HIGHS YESTERDAY.  THUS...I STAYED CLOSER TO THE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER MOS BLEND FOR HIGHS TODAY.

GFS MODEL BRINGS PRECIPITATION IN FASTER ON SATURDAY THAN NAM-WRF...
BUT LOOKS SAFE TO KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR TONIGHT.  WILL INCREASE 
CLOUDS FROM THE NORTHWEST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...AHEAD OF THE FAST 
MOVING SHORTWAVE DROPPING INTO THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY DAYBREAK
SATURDAY.  THE INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND DEVELOPMENT OF SW SURFACE 
WINDS LATE TONIGHT SEEMED TO FAVOR THE NOT AS COLD MIN TEMPS WHERE 
DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED IN MOS CHOICES. 

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS NOW BRINGING IN 
NEXT SYSTEM THAT DROPS DOWN FROM THE NORTHWEST A FEW HOURS EARLIER 
WITH THE GFS ABOUT 6 TO 12 HOURS EARLIER THAN NAM/WRF. THICKNESSES 
AND 850 MB TEMPERATURES STILL POINTING TO A MOSTLY SNOW EVENT FOR 
THE FORECAST AREA. SOUTHERN VALLEY LOCATIONS MAY WARM INTO THE 40S 
SO SOME RAIN MAY FALL THERE BEFORE CHANGING TO SNOW BY EVENING 
SATURDAY NIGHT. AMOUNTS LOOK LIKE GENERALLY LESS THAN 2 INCHES AT 
THE LOWER ELEVATIONS WITH AMOUNTS OF POSSIBLY 4 TO 5 INCHES AT THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN SW VA AND EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS. SYNOPTIC SNOW 
WILL TRANSITION TO SOME UPSLOPE LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE 
THROUGH SUNDAY IN THE EASTERN AND NORTHERN AREAS. CLOUDS INCREASING 
SATURDAY AND EARLIER START TO SNOW MAY KEEP HIGHS A FEW DEGREES 
LOWER THAN CURRENT FORECAST. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL OCCUR 
BEHIND SYSTEM SUNDAY SO LOWERED HIGHS A FEW DEGREES TO MATCH CLOSER 
TO NAM GUIDANCE. MOST PLACES WILL STAY IN THE 30S WITH SOME SNOW 
COVER WITH HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE 20S. UPPER TROUGH BEHIND 
WEEKENDS SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEAST MONDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BRIEFLY 
BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST. THE FLOW BECOMES MORE 
ZONAL. A WEAK FRONT APPROACHES TUESDAY AND TEMPERATURES CONTINUE TO 
WARM. AFTER THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. 
RIDGING ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST CONTINUES THE WARMER AND DRIER WEATHER 
FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK.
&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST THU FEB 15 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...LARGE SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE...CURRENTLY CENTERED OVER KS....WILL CONTINUE TO SLIDE 
SOUTH THROUGH OK/TX INTO THE NW GLFMEX BY FRI AFTN. RIDGE CONTINUES 
THROUGH TN VLY WITH DRY AND COLD AIRMASS IN PLACE. SHORT WAVE OVR KS 
THIS AFTN WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS N TN VLY TNGT. MID LEVEL MOISTURE IS 
LIMITED. A FEW FLURRIES ARE POSSIBLE BUT MEASURABLE SNOWFALL NOT 
EXPECTED. CLOUDS WILL HELP SOME TO LIMIT OVRNGT COOLING BUT 
WIDESPREAD TEENS CAN BE EXPECTED. A STRONGER TROUGH DIGS SE INTO TN 
VLY SAT AFTN. SFC LOW PROGGED TO FILL AS IT TRAVELS EAST INTO THE OH 
RVR VLY SAT WITH STRETCHING COLD FRONT MOVING SOUTHEAST THROUGH TN 
SAT AFTN. MODERATE MOISTURE IN THE SNOW GROWTH ZONE SHOULD ALLOW 
MOST FOLKS TO SEE SNOW. SAT AFTN BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS AT CROSSOVER 
TEMPS SO PRECIP TYPE EARLY MAY BE MIXED BUT SHOULD CHANGE TO ALL 
SNOW SAT EVENING. SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH AND MID LEVEL MOISTURE 
DROPS DRAMATICALLY THURSDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MOISTURE LINGERING INTO 
SUNDAY...WITH SOME UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE...WILL KEEP LOW 
CHANCES FOR SUNDAY...MAINLY DURING THE MORNING HOURS.  WITH ONLY 
LIMITED MOISTURE AVAILABLE...PROBABLY WONT SEE MUCH ADDITIONAL 
ACCUMULATION ON SUNDAY.  DRY WEATHER PUSHES IN ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
LINGERS INTO MONDAY.  NEXT FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACHES ON TUESDAY.  
WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY AND THEN GO WITH 30/40 POPS 
ON TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS SYSTEM INCREASES 
MOISTURE ACROSS THE REGION.  THICKNESS INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD 
BE ALL LIQUID ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...INCLUDING THE OVERNIGHT 
PERIODS.  DRIER WEATHER RETURNS ON THURSDAY...WILL KEEP SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR MAINLY THE MORNING HOURS.  STAYED NEAR HPC/MEX FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 AM EST THU FEB 15 2007

.DISCUSSION...WILL LOWER CLOUD COVER AND DROP FLURRIES FOR THE 
AFTERNOON PERIOD. MID LEVEL CLOUDS SHOULD MOVE IN EARLY THIS 
EVENING. WILL NUDGE TEMPS UPWARD TO ACCOUNT FOR EXTENDED MINUTES OF 
SUNSHINE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FEW POCKETS OF FLURRIES WILL 
CONTINUE OVER THE MRX CWA EARLY THIS MORNING WITH A STRAY BAND OF 
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  THIS MAY PRODUCE A 
DUSTING OF SNOW IN SOME AREAS.  VERY COLD TEMPERATURES REMAIN IN 
PLACE OVER THE REGION.  A FEW BREAKS IN CLOUDS COVER EXPECTED THIS 
AFTERNOON...WHICH WILL HELP OFFSET CONTINUING COLD ADVECTION.  
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED INTO RANGE FROM MID 30S SOUTH TO 
MID 20S NORTH.   IT WILL BE ANOTHER COLD NIGHT...WILL STAY NEAR 
GUIDANCE WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS GENERALLY IN THE TEENS ACROSS THE 
VALLEY AND SINGLE DIGITS OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.

LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...SHOULD BE DRY FRIDAY WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE AREA...BUT STILL ON THE COLD SIDE. MODELS CONTINUE 
TO SHOW A CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM APPROACHING FOR SATURDAY/SATURDAY 
NIGHT.  GFS CONTINUES TO BE FASTER THAN NAM WITH THIS SYSTEM...WITH 
BULK OF PRECIP ON SATURDAY WITH THE GFS AND SATURDAY NIGHT WITH THE 
NAM.  AGREE WITH HPC THAT GFS LOOKS A BIT FAST...SO WILL GO WITH A 
COMPROMISE...KEEPING BULK OF PRECIP FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON/EARLY 
SATURDAY NIGHT.  PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD BE FAIRLY LIGHT...BUT WILL GO 
WITH LIKELY POPS IN NORTH AND CENTRAL WITH THIS SYSTEM AS THINK MANY 
AREAS WILL MEASURE.  IT LOOKS COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW ALOFT...WITH 
BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS THE ONLY LIMITING FACTOR.  TEMPS SHOULD STAY 
LOW ENOUGH THAT WITH BOUNDARY LAYER DEWPOINTS EXPECTED TO BE FAIRLY 
LOW...THINK MUCH OF THE PRECIP WILL BE SNOW...BUT STILL MAY BE SOME 
RAIN IN WARMER VALLEY AREAS...ESPECIALLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON.  EXPECT 
SOME LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS INTO SUNDAY...THEN DRY ON MONDAY.  NEXT 
SYSTEM APPROACHES BY MIDWEEK.  SOME PRECIP MAY ARRIVE BY TUESDAY 
WITH ADVANCE ISENTROPIC LIFT...BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP DRY UNTIL 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  WITH WARMER AIR ARRIVING...THIS SYSTEM 
LOOKS TO BE MAINLY RAIN.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
