AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 AM EST THU FEB 15 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FEW POCKETS OF FLURRIES WILL 
CONTINUE OVER THE MRX CWA EARLY THIS MORNING WITH A STRAY BAND OF 
LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  THIS MAY PRODUCE A 
DUSTING OF SNOW IN SOME AREAS.  VERY COLD TEMPERATURES REMAIN IN 
PLACE OVER THE REGION.  A FEW BREAKS IN CLOUDS COVER EXPECTED THIS 
AFTERNOON...WHICH WILL HELP OFFSET CONTINUING COLD ADVECTION.  
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED INTO RANGE FROM MID 30S SOUTH TO 
MID 20S NORTH.   IT WILL BE ANOTHER COLD NIGHT...WILL STAY NEAR 
GUIDANCE WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS GENERALLY IN THE TEENS ACROSS THE 
VALLEY AND SINGLE DIGITS OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.

.LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...SHOULD BE DRY FRIDAY WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE AREA...BUT STILL ON THE COLD SIDE. MODELS CONTINUE 
TO SHOW A CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM APPROACHING FOR SATURDAY/SATURDAY 
NIGHT.  GFS CONTINUES TO BE FASTER THAN NAM WITH THIS SYSTEM...WITH 
BULK OF PRECIP ON SATURDAY WITH THE GFS AND SATURDAY NIGHT WITH THE 
NAM.  AGREE WITH HPC THAT GFS LOOKS A BIT FAST...SO WILL GO WITH A 
COMPROMISE...KEEPING BULK OF PRECIP FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON/EARLY 
SATURDAY NIGHT.  PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD BE FAIRLY LIGHT...BUT WILL GO 
WITH LIKELY POPS IN NORTH AND CENTRAL WITH THIS SYSTEM AS THINK MANY 
AREAS WILL MEASURE.  IT LOOKS COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW ALOFT...WITH 
BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS THE ONLY LIMITING FACTOR.  TEMPS SHOULD STAY LOW 
ENOUGH THAT WITH BOUNDARY LAYER DEWPOINTS EXPECTED TO BE FAIRLY 
LOW...THINK MUCH OF THE PRECIP WILL BE SNOW...BUT STILL MAY BE SOME 
RAIN IN WARMER VALLEY AREAS...ESPECIALLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON.  EXPECT 
SOME LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS INTO SUNDAY...THEN DRY ON MONDAY.  NEXT 
SYSTEM APPROACHES BY MIDWEEK.  SOME PRECIP MAY ARRIVE BY TUESDAY 
WITH ADVANCE ISENTROPIC LIFT...BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP DRY UNTIL 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  WITH WARMER AIR ARRIVING...THIS SYSTEM 
LOOKS TO BE MAINLY RAIN.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST WED FEB 14 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE UPPER MID WEST WILL SLIDE SOUTH THROUGH PERIOD.
RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WITH CAA CONTINUING
ACROSS THE MRX CWA. DOWNSLOPING OFF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU HAS 
ERODED STRATO-CU THIS AFTERNOON. CLOUDS WILL LIKELY FILL BACK IN 
OVERNIGHT AS WINDS SLACKEN. CAP REMAINS IN PLACE BUT LOW LEVEL RH 
DECREASES BY THU MORNING. MID LEVEL JET OVR TX WILL STRENGTHEN 
AND ELONGATE INTO A LONG FETCH S OF THE AREA THROUGH THU. THIS WILL 
BRING IN MID LEVEL CLOUDS FROM THE W. TEMPS WILL BE COLD. MINS WILL 
BE HELD UP SOME BY WINDS AND CLOUDS.  

.LONG TERM...(THU NIGHT THROUGH WED)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE LONG TERM. A 
COUPLE OF NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVES WILL AFFECT THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS EARLY FRIDAY AND AGAIN LATE SATURDAY. EVEN THOUGH THESE 
WAVES APPEAR QUITE VIGOROUS...MOISTURE IS LACKING. THUS CONTINUED 
DRY FOR FRIDAY AND ONLY CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY AT THIS TIME. DRY 
WEATHER RETURNS FOR THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK AS UPPER FLOW 
DEAMPLIFIES INTO A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW. SIGNIFICANT HEIGHT RISES 
SUGGEST AT LEAST SOME MODERATION IN TEMPS...ALBEIT STILL GENERALLY 
BELOW CLIMO. ANOTHER RELATIVELY WEAK SYSTEM APPROACHES BY MID WEEK 
PER MODEL/ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. THUS INTRODUCED CHANCE POPS FOR NEXT 
WEDNESDAY. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE CLOSELY FOR BOTH POPS AND 
TEMPS AS NO CLEAR SIGNATURE WAS APPARENT IN THE VARIOUS ENSEMBLE 
RUNS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 AM EST WED FEB 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...A COLD VALENTINES DAY. POST FRONTAL DRY AND VERY COLD 
AIRMASS MOVING INTO AREA. LIGHT SNOWS WILL MAINLY AFFECT UPSLOPE AREAS
THIS AFTERNOON AS BRISK NW WINDS CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING. 
WIDESPREAD TEMPS IN THE 20S. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING 
ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING.  ASSOCIATED BAND OF SHOWERS WILL 
CONTINUE TO PUSH EAST AHEAD OF THE FRONT EARLY THIS 
MORNING...EXITING THE AREA LATE MORNING.  WITH THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE...WINDS WILL INCREASE OVER THE AREA...PROVING BREEZY 
CONDITIONS THROUGH THE MRX CWA TODAY.  BEHIND THE FRONT...MUCH 
COLDER AIR WILL PUSH IN.  WITH STRONG COLD ADVECTION...SHOULD SEE 
TEMPS FALL SOMEWHAT DOING THE MORNING HOURS WITH SOME INCREASE THIS 
AFTERNOON.  AS A RESULT...EARLY MORNING PRECIP...AHEAD OF THE FRONT 
WILL BE RAIN...WITH ANY LINGER SHOWERS BEHIND THE FRONT SLOWLY 
TURNING TO SNOW.  RESIDUAL MOISTURE AND UPSLOPE FLOW WILL KEEP SOME 
SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND PORTIONS OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THROUGHOUT THE AFTERNOON.  A FEW FLURRIES MAY 
CONTINUE FAR NORTHEAST OVERNIGHT.  WITH COLD AIR CONTINUING TO 
FILTER IN...OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL FALL INTO THE TEENS AND LOW 20S 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA.

LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...UPPER TROUGH THAT SWINGS ACROSS THE 
REGION THU NIGHT WILL NOT HAVE MUCH MOISTURE TO WORK WITH...SO JUST 
EXPECT SOME MAINLY HIGH AND MID CLOUDS THU AND THU NIGHT.  HIGH 
PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE WILL PROVIDE A QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE 
FRI...BUT IT WILL STILL BE ON THE COLD SIDE.  NEXT SYSTEM IS A 
CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM FOR SATURDAY/SATURDAY NIGHT.  QUITE A BIT OF 
UNCERTAINTY IN EXACT TRACK AND TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...BUT WILL KEEP 
CHANCE POPS FOR SAT AND SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE FOR SAT NIGHT.  ANY 
PRECIP MAY BE SNOW IN NORTH AND HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT BOUNDARY LEVEL 
TEMPS MAY BE WARM ENOUGH FOR SOME RAIN SAT AFTERNOON IN SOUTHERN AND 
CENTRAL VALLEY LOCATIONS.  AFTER SOME LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS 
SUN...SHOULD BE DRY MON INTO TUE.

ADJUST POP AND WEATHER GRIDS BY AROUND 9PM EST TO BETTER REFLECT 
CURRENT RADAR.  REMAINDER OF FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK WITH VERY 
LIMITED SNOW CHANCES VERY LATE TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 132021
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST TUE FEB 13 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...COMPLICATED FORECAST THIS 
EVENING AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ACROSS WESTERN TN AND KY WITH COLD 
FRONT EXTENDING TO THE SOUTH SOUTHWEST THROUGH MS MOVES SLOWLY NE. 
ALSO A NEW LOW PRESSURE AREA WAS DEVELOPING ACROSS SOUTHERN GEORGIA. 
A NEARLY SOLID AREA OF CONVECTION WAS ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND EXTENDED 
INTO AL THIS MORNING BROKE UP AS IT MOVED INTO EAST TN THIS 
AFTERNOON. THIN CLOUD COVER NE OF TYS ALLOWED THE WARMER AIR ALOFT 
TO MIX DOWN FROM THE WARM SW FLOW OVER THE AREA. TEMPERATURES SHOT 
UP INTO THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S IN THE NE HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. PATCHY LIGHT RAIN HAS FALLEN ACROSS NE SECTIONS AND JUST AREAS 
OF LIGHT RAIN ELSEWHERE. EXPECT THE LULL IN PRECIPITATION TO 
CONTINUE LATE THIS AFTERNOON AS CONVECTION ACROSS THE FL PANHANDLE 
AND SOUTHERN GA ROBS THE AREA OF THE BETTER GULF MOISTURE. NEW 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT IN NORTH MS AND SW TN 
SHOULD INCREASE IN COVERAGE AS THEY SPREAD INTO MIDDLE TN AND THEN 
EAST TN THIS EVENING. KEPT THE CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS GOING ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN FORECAST AREA INTO THE EVENING AS THE CONVECTION COULD 
MOVE INTO SE TN BEFORE WEAKENING THIS EVENING AND THE AREA WILL 
STILL BE AHEAD OF THE FRONT. AFTER THE FRONT PASSES THROUGH LATE 
THIS EVENING TO AROUND 14/06Z TEMPERATURES WILL DROP DRAMATICALLY 
AND THE RAIN SHOWERS SHOULD CHANGE OVER TO SNOW BY MORNING. STILL DO 
NOT EXPECT MUCH ACCUMULATION DUE TO THE WARM TEMPERATURES 
TODAY...MELTING AT FIRST AND THE DEEPER MOISTURE MOVING OUT IN THE 
MORNING. HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY SEE AROUND AN INCH OR POSSIBLY TWO AT 
THE HIGHEST PEAKS. HIGHS WEDNESDAY WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB MORE THAN 
A FEW DEGREES AND MAY STAY STEADY OR FALL SLIGHTLY WITH STRONG COLD 
AIR ADVECTION. RIGHT NOW WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS LOOK TO BE BELOW 
WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA.              

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A LARGE DOME OF 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH FRIDAY...BRINGING 
A RETURN TO DRY AND UNSEASONABLY COLD CONDITIONS. A FAST-MOVING 
CLIPPER SYSTEM ON SATURDAY WILL BRING A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA...BUT ONLY LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED. 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL DEVELOP BEHIND THIS COLD FRONT FOR SATURDAY 
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...CREATING ADDITIONAL SCATTERED SNOW 
SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY IN THE UPSLOPE AREAS OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 
ANOTHER FAST-MOVING CLIPPER SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY...BRINGING LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS AGAIN.

MOVING IN SHORTLY. WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS DEVELOPING THOUGH AND 
POSSIBLE BREAKS IN PRECIPITATION THIS AFTERNOON WILL KEEP THE HIGHS

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CENTER OF LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM

AIR...SO WHILE THERE MAY BE SOME SNOW SHOWERS LATE ESPECIALLY NORTH 
AND HIGHER TERRAIN...APPEARS TO NOT BE MUCH OF A THREAT OF 
SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATION FOR OUR AREA EVEN IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
TONIGHT.

WILL LINGER OVER THE MRX CWA INTO WEDNESDAY AS THE WEATHER SYSTEM 
EXITS THE AREA.  WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND UPSLOPE FLOW WILL KEEP A 
FEW POCKETS OF LIGHT SNOW/FLURRIES MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN INTO 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  ZONAL FLOW ALOFT THURSDAY BRINGS THROUGH A VERY 
WEAK WAVE AND EXPECT MAINLY ASSOCIATED CLOUDS WILL ACCOMPANY IT.  
NEXT SYSTEM SHOULD PUSH INTO THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND PROVIDING A 
MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW ACROSS THE REGION.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 122017
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST MON FEB 12 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...SYSTEM SLOWLY MAKING 
ITS WAY TOWARD AREA WITH OVERCAST CONDITIONS OVER MOST OF THE AREA 
ALREADY. PROFILES ALREADY WILL ABOVE FREEZING IN ALL AREAS...SO NOT 
CONCERNED ABOUT ANY SNOW OR FREEZING RAIN THROUGH THIS PERIOD. DUE 
TO DRY AIR...COULD BE A BRIEF PERIOD OF SLEET FOR ANY AREAS THAT GET 
SOME PRECIP THIS EVENING...BUT EXPECT IT TO BE BRIEF ENOUGH TO NOT 
INCLUDE IN FORECAST.

LIFT ALREADY GETTING SOME LIGHT RAIN GOING IN NORTHEASTERN 
SECTIONS...THIS AREA SHOULD BE SLOWLY LIFTING TO THE NORTH OUT OF 
AREA THIS EVENING. AFTER THIS BOUT...COULD BE A WHILE UNTIL NEXT 
ORGANIZED PRECIP AFFECTS THE AREA...AROUND DAYBREAK IN WESTERN 
AREAS. TUESDAY LOOKS WET FOR MOST OF AREA AND SHOULD TRANSITION FROM 
LIGHT RAIN TO MORE SHOWER ACTIVITY IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AS 
WELL AS ALONG THE FRONT. AIR MASS MIGHT GO MARGINALLY UNSTABLE 
BRIEFLY DURING THIS TIME...BUT TIMING OF FRONTAL PASSAGE...LATE 
TUESDAY NIGHT...NOT GOOD FOR GETTING THERMODYNAMICS AND DYNAMICS 
ALIGNED...SO JUST STICKING WITH SHOWERS.

DEEP MOISTURE SWEEPING QUICKLY OUT OF AREA AS COLDER AIR BEHIND 
FRONT ENTERS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT...SO CHANCES FOR SNOW NOW MINIMAL... 
AND MAINLY UPSLOPE AFTER THE END OF THIS PERIOD. HAVE NOT STRAYED 
TOO FAR FROM GUIDANCE TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS 
PROGGED TO BE LOCATED ACROSS THE MID ATLANTIC STATES BY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING...WITH SOME WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. ANY RESULTING PRECIP SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT WITH SOME UPSLOPE 
FLOW CONTRIBUTING TO A FEW LINGERING RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEAST FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK...BRINGING A RETURN TO A COLD AND 
DRY ARCTIC AIR MASS. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN CONTINUES TO INDICATE THAT 
A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY... 
BRINGING SOME LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS. THUS...WILL PLAN TO KEEP LOW 
CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST FOR SATURDAY. A FAST-MOVING CLIPPER 
SYSTEM IS CURRENTLY PROGGED TO APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY

EXTENDED MODELS HAVE BEEN INCONSISTENT LATELY.

AND WEST OF OUR AREA THROUGH TONIGHT. HOWEVER...EXACTLY WHERE THE 
BAND OF ISENTROPIC LIFT PRECIP WILL SET UP TODAY INTO TONIGHT IS 
STILL PROBLEMATIC. GIVEN UNCERTAINTY...WILL KEEP LOW POPS IN NORTH 
AND CENTRAL FOR TODAY...AND WHILE WILL DROP POPS CONSIDERABLY MOST 
AREAS FOR TONIGHT...WILL STILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH TO HIGH

AREA FOR TUESDAY AS SURFACE LOW MOVES NORTHEAST FROM THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE WITH MOST EXCELLENT ABOVE 
NORMAL WARMTH EVEN ON TUESDAY. LOW LEVELS WARM SUFFICIENTLY TO 
CREATE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF THUNDERSTORMS 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY. LOW BUILDS 
NORTHEAST THROUGH THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY LATE EVENING DRAGGING 
MOST OF THE DEEPER RH EAST. HOWEVER AS ARCTIC AIR FLOWS INTO THE 
REGION TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY HAD TO USE CHANCE AND SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW WITH HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE TERRAIN 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER AS 
USUAL. DRIER AND MUCH COLDER NORTHWESTERLY FLOW IN STORE THURSDAY. 
AIRMASS MODIFIES SLIGHTLY BY FRIDAY BUT CHANCE FOR PRECIP BACK IN 
THE FORECAST FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AS ANOTHER UPPER TROF DROPS 
SOUTHEAST OUT OF CENTRAL CANADA IN CLIPPER FASHION. USED THE 
STANDARD MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW WITH HIGHEST CHANCE POP SATURDAY 
NIGHT.

323 PM EST SUN FEB 11 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA TODAY WILL GIVE WAY TONIGHT. SKIES 
WILL BE CLEAR THROUGH THE EVENING WITH SOME HIGH AND MID LEVEL 
CLOUDS MOVING IN LATE AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM APPROACHES. SLIGHTLY 
HIGHER DEWPOINTS AND PERHAPS A LITTLE MORE MIXING WILL KEEP LOWS 
HIGHER THAN LAST NIGHT...IN THE 20S IN MOST SPOTS. TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD WARM NICELY ON MONDAY AS THE HIGH MOVES EAST AND A SOUTH TO 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW DEVELOPS. SHOULD SEE A GOOD AMOUNT OF SUN AS WELL 
AS THICK LOW CLOUDS DONT MOVE INTO OUR WESTERN COUNTIES UNTIL MID 
AFTERNOON. THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SW NC COULD REACH THE UPPER 50S. 
ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BRING LOW CLOUDS INTO THE WEST IN THE MID 
AFTERNOON. THE STRONGER LIFT STAYS MAINLY TO OUR NORTH ON 
MONDAY...BUT BOTH THE NAM AND THE GFS SHOW SOME PRECIP IN THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA BEFORE 00Z. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS IN 
THOSE AREAS LATE IN THE AFTERNOON WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... 
WARM UP CONTINUES MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS LONG COLD PERIOD ENDS 
TEMPORARILY AS DEVELOPING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND DEEPENING LOW 
PRESSURE AREA SLOWLY MOVE EAST OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND INTO 
THE LOWER MS VALLEY. A MUCH MILDER NIGHT MONDAY NIGHT AS THICK CLOUD 
COVER MOVES IN AND SOUTHERLY WINDS INCREASE OUT AHEAD OF SURFACE LOW 
MOVING INTO THE TN VALLEY. BOTH MODELS BRING SURFACE LOW ACROSS 
FORECAST AREA LATE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AND ALSO DEVELOP A 
SECOND LOW EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WHICH MOVES OFF THE EAST COAST 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY. HEAVIEST RAINFALL MOVES INTO OHIO 
VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT WITH FORECAST AREA ON SOUTHERN EDGE OF INITIAL 
PRECIPITATION AREA. AS LOW MOVES EAST TUESDAY RAINFALL SHOULD PICK 
UP AND MAY BECOME MORE SHOWERY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
NAM/WRF SHOWING SOME INSTABILITY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND GOOD SHEAR  
SO THUNDERSTORMS ARE A POSSIBLILITY IN THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA 
BUT WILL NOT PUT IN THE FORECAST JUST YET. TOTAL RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
THOUGH DO NOT LOOK THAT HIGH. TUESDAY NIGHT COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH 
WITH VERY COLD AIRMASS MOVING IN FROM THE NORTHWEST AND ENOUGH 
LEFTOVER MOISTURE FOR SOME SNOW. BEST CHANCE OF ACCUMULATING SNOW 
WILL BE IN THE NORTH AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WITH WARM TEMPERATURES 
MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING THINK SNOW WILL HAVE DIFFICULTY 
ACCUMULATING ON SURFACES. ONLY FORECAST LOWS TO REACH BELOW 32 ON 
THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...SW VIRGINIA AND THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF 
EAST TENNESSEE AS FREEZING LEVEL DROPS TUESDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE PULLS 
OUT QUICKLY WEDNESDAY. HIGHS WEDNESDAY WILL ONLY BE A FEW DEGREES 
WARMER THAN LOWS WITH STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION. 

THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED COLD UPPER LOW MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT BRUSHING THE NORTHERN AREAS WITH 
SOME CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY FLURRIES AND ARCTIC HIGH MOVES INTO THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN STATES KEEPING THINGS COLD. ANOTHER CLIPPER 
SYSTEM MOVES SOUTHEAST FROM CANADA AT THE END OF THE WEEK AND 
SPREADS CLOUDS AND A CHANCE OF SNOW OR RAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

AREA INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. ANOTHER MASS OF COLD AIR WILL MOVE IN
BEHIND THIS SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THE RAIN SHOULD
CHANGE TO SNOW FROM WEST TO EAST TUESDAY NIGHT AS FREEZING LEVELS
DROP. A COUPLE INCHES COULD FALL IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND
NORTHERN SECTIONS BEFORE IT ENDS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. DRY NORTHWEST
FLOW WILL CONTINUE THE REST OF THE PERIOD WITH VARIABLE CLOUDS AND
COLDER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES. GFS MODEL TRYING TO SHOW MOISTURE
MOVING INTO THE RIDGE THURSDAY BUT THINK AIRMASS WILL BE TO DRY FOR

FXUS64 KMRX 092017
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 PM EST FRI FEB 9 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...WEAK VORT MAX HAD MOVED INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH SOME ENHANCEMENT JUST NOTED ON 
INFRARED SATELLITE PICS. HOWEVER...LOW LEVELS REMAIN VERY DRY WITH 
CURRENT DEWPOINT TEMPS GENERALLY IN THE MINUS 5 TO PLUS 5 FARENHEIT 
RANGE. THUS...WEAK RETURNS ON AREA RADARS ARE MAINLY A LOWERING MID 
DECK OF CLOUDINESS WITH LITTLE IF ANY PRECIPITATION (PCPN) REACHING 
THE SURFACE. STILL A LITTLE BETTER MOISTURE TO OUR SOUTH...SO KEPT 
IN A MENTION OF SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES EARLY ACROSS SRN TIER OF 
ZONES. JUST GOT A REPORT OF LIGHT SNOW/FLURRIES IN THE JONESVILLE VA 
AREA...WHICH IS COVERED IN CURRENT GRIDS THROUGH 23Z...AS WELL AS 
LATEST SHORT TERM FORECAST.

OTHERWISE...LIKED THE PREVIOUS DECREASING CLOUDS IN THE GRIDS 
TONIGHT...AND ALSO KEPT MIN TEMPS UP A BIT CLOSER TO SLIGHTLY HIGHER 
MOS MINS WHERE DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED. MOS HIGHS TODAY WILL END UP 
BEING GREATER THAN 5 DEGREES TOO WARM. MORE SUNSHINE LOOKS IN THE 
OFFING FOR SATURDAY...BUT 925 TO 850 MB TEMPS DONT WARM VERY 
SIGNIFICANTLY...SO I UNDERCUT THE GENERALLY MILDER GFS MOS MAX TEMPS
FOR HIGHS TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS 
TO MOVE EAST SUNDAY. SOME THIN HIGH CLOUDS MAY SPREAD IN SATURDAY 
NIGHT BUT TEMPERATURES SHOULD STILL FALL INTO THE TEENS TO MID 20S. 
CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE SUNDAY AS EASTERN TROF FLATTENS OUT 
AND WESTERN RIDGE BUCKLES. MOISTURE QUICKLY SPREADS FROM THE PLAINS 
TO THE MS VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT AND INTO THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE 
VALLEYS MONDAY. LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS JUST EAST OF THE ROCKIES 
SUNDAY AND THEN MOVES INTO MS VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE FROM THE 
GULF MOVES NORTH INTO THE MS AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS SUNDAY NIGHT. 
AIRMASS STILL DRY AT THE LOWER LEVELS SUNDAY BUT SHOULD MOISTEN 
RAPIDLY SUNDAY NIGHT. PREFER SLOWER MAV WITH POPS BUT FOLLOWED 
WARMER WRF/NAM MINIMUMS. WITH THICK CLOUD COVER MOVING IN SUNDAY 
NIGHT LOWS MAY COME BEFORE MIDNIGHT. WARM AIR ALOFT WILL KEEP MOST 
OF THE INITIAL PRECIPITATION AS RAIN EARLY MONDAY BUT COLD AIR MAY 
BE TRAPPED IN THE VALLEYS OF NORTHEAST TN AND SW VA AND CAUSE A 
LITTLE SNOW BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN. FREEZING LEVELS FALL LATE 
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AND THIS COULD BRING A FEW INCHES OF SNOW TO 
THE MOUNTAINS OF SW VA AND THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS. THE AMOUNTS WILL 
DEPEND ON HOW MUCH MOISTURE IS LEFT AT THE END. RAINFALL AMOUNTS MAY 
BE A COUPLE INCHES AS WELL IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY. A WEAK SYSTEM FOLLOWS THE STRONGER SYSTEM MOVING OUT EARLY 
WEDNESDAY. PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS WERE SLOWER BRINGING SYSTEM IN 
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW IN 
THE FORECAST FOR NOW.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             23 45 24 49 36 / 10 0 0 10 50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  20 41 19 46 34 /  0 0 0 10 30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       20 42 20 46 33 /  0 0 0 10 30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              16 37 13 42 31 / 10 0 0 10 20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST FRI FEB 9 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...APPEARS BETTER MOISTURE WITH 
DISTURBANCE MOVING THROUGH REGION TODAY WILL STAY TO OUR SOUTH. A 
BIT OF LIGHT PRECIP MAY SNEAK INTO SOUTHERN AREAS...SO WILL 
INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THERE.  A LOOK AT SOUNDINGS INDICATES 
ANY PRECIP COULD FALL AS LIGHT SNOW/SLEET OR RAIN...WILL MENTION ALL 
THREE IN FORECAST.  WILL MENTION POSSIBILITY OF FLURRIES IN SOME 
CENTRAL ZONES...THEN JUST MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR THE NORTH TODAY.  CLOUDS 
SHOULD DIMINISH TONIGHT AS DRIER AIR MOVES IN.  WILL REMAIN ON THE 
COLD SIDE...WILL JUST MAKE A FEW MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS WHICH 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...PERSISTANT EASTERN STATES 
UPPER TROF FINALLY WEAKENS A BIT DURING THE FIRST PART OF THE LONG 
TERM FORECAST ALLOWING FOR A DRY WEEKEND AND A SUBTLE WARMING TREND. 
THE NEXT SYSTEM TO BRING A CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION EMERGES ACROSS 
THE PLAINS STATES BY 12Z MONDAY INDUCING LOWER SURFACE PRESSURE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. USED HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR INCREASING 
ISENTROPIC LIFT AS TEMPERATURE AND MOISTURE ADVECTION STRENGTHEN 
AHEAD OF APPROACHING SURFACE LOW. MAINTAINED LIKELY POPS FOR TUESDAY 
AND TUESDAY NIGHT AS LOW MAKES ITS WAY EAST ON A TRACK NEAR THE 
SOUTHERN TENNESSEE BORDER. THIS SCENARIO INVOLVES SOME FROZEN 
PRECIPITATION ESPECIALLY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. DIDNT TRY TO 
GET TOO FANCY WITH PRECIP TYPES AT THIS TIME RANGE SO JUST USED THE 
RAIN/SNOW CONCEPT. SYSTEM EXITS BY 12Z WEDNESDAY WHICH KEPT DRY. 
CONTINUED WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR THURSDAY AS ACTIVE SOUTHERN 
STREAM KEEPS THREAT FOR PRECIP ALIVE TOWARD THE END OF THE WEEK IN 
CHILLY AIRMASS PROGGED TO RESIDE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1018 PM EST THU FEB 8 2007

.DISCAUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...BOTH NAM AND GFS IN CLOSE 
AGREEMENT KEEPING THE NEXT 24 HOURS DRY AND COOL.  THIS IS VERY 
REASONABLE WITH STRONG HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE REGION.  DID 
NOT DEVIATE MUCH FROM GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...WEAK SYSTEM MOVING 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST STATES WILL MOVE OUT TO SEA FRIDAY NIGHT. SHORTWAVE 
ENERGY BEHIND THIS SYSTEM WILL KEEP CLOUD COVER IN MOST OF THE NIGHT 
BUT SHOULD HAVE SOME CLEARING BEFORE MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING 
IN FROM THE NORTHWEST SHOULD GIVE THE REGION A NICE WEEKEND ALTHOUGH 
TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE BELOW NORMAL. THE FIRST SIGNIFICANT 
TROUGH IN AWHILE DEVELOPS ACROSS THE ROCKIES SUNDAY. LOW PRESSURE 
DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MOISTURE MOVING UP FROM THE GULF SPREADS FROM THE MS VALLEY INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY MONDAY. THE SURFACE LOW AND COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH TUESDAY. GFS LOOKS OVERDONE WITH PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS. 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM UP ENOUGH FOR A MOSTLY RAIN EVENT. THE 
AIRMASS LOOKS TO BE TOO STABLE RIGHT NOW FOR THUNDERSTORMS BUT WILL 
NEED TO WATCH FOR LATER RUNS TO SEE HOW DEEP THE LOW BECOMES AND ITS 
TRACK. THERE IS A POSSIBLILITY OF A LITTLE SNOW EARLY MONDAY AND 
ALSO DURING THE NIGHTIME HOURS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND LATE 
TUESDAY AS COLDER AIR MOVES BACK IN. ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM WILL PASS 
THROUGH THE AREA THURSDAY.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 081520
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EST THU FEB 8 2007

.DISCUSSION...CLOUD COVER HOLDING IN MUCH STRONGER THAN PREVIOUSLY 
INDICATED SO HAVE INCREASED CLOUD COVER.  TEMPERATURES LOOK 
REASONABLE SO WILL LEAVE THEM ALONE.

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...INVERTED 
TROUGH LINGERING ACROSS THE AREA TODAY.  SATELLITE SHOWING MID 
CLOUDS MOVING IN WITH IT.  TOO DRY IN THE LOW LEVELS FOR ANY 
PRECIPITATION...BUT WILL BRING A BROKEN CLOUD DECK EARLY TODAY.  
CLOUDS SHOULD DECREASE BY THIS  AFTERNOON.  SHORTWAVE APPROACHING 
LATE TONIGHT.  TOO DRY FOR ANY PRECIPITATION...BUT SCATTERED CLOUDS 
SHOULD RETURN FOR TONIGHT.  STAYED NEAR MAV GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA INTO THE WEEKEND...BRINGING DRY AND 
TRANQUIL CONDITIONS. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN STILL INDICATES AN 
INCREASE IN MOISTURE ON SUNDAY...ALTHOUGH NOT AS MUCH AS YESTERDAYS 
RUN. THUS...WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PRECIP ON 
SUNDAY AND AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS. A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS 
STILL PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER TEXAS ON MONDAY...BUT THE LATEST MODEL 
RUNS INDICATE THAT THIS LOW WILL TAKE MORE OF A NORTHERLY TRACK 
TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY MORNING. THIS SCENARIO SHOULD 
RESULT IN WARMER TEMPS AND HELP TO ENSURE THAT MOSTLY RAIN OCCURS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. IN FACT...WITH THIS MORE NORTHERLY 
TRACK...SOME INSTABILITY WORKS ITS WAY INTO SOUTHEAST TN ON TUESDAY 
MORNING. HOWEVER...WILL LEAVE OUT A MENTION OF THUNDER SINCE THE GFS 
MODEL ONLY RECENTLY INDICATED THIS MORE NORTHERLY TRACK. WILL WAIT 
AND SEE IF LATER RUNS CONTINUE TO SHOW THIS MORE NORTHERLY TRACK... 
OR RETURN TO THEIR PREVIOUS SOUTHERLY TRACK ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EST WED FEB 7 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. MID LEVEL
CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE OVERNIGHT. BANDS OF LIGHT SNOW
FLURRIES MOVING SE THROUGH KY SHOULD WEAKEN AS THEY MOVE ACROSS 
SW VA/NE TN. TEMPS IN LINE WITH LATEST GUIDANCE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...MIDLEVEL MOISTURE OVER MO/SRN 
IL/WRN KY ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER LEVEL JET AND MID LEVEL 
CONFLUENCE WILL TRACK OVER THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA 
TONIGHT...PROVIDING CLOUDY SKIES. AREA RADARS SHOW SOME LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION...BUT SURFACE OBS INDICATE NOTHING REACHING THE 
GROUND. NAM AND GFS FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE NEAR SATURATION 
ABOVE 750 MB. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF FLURRIES ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA. A ZONE OF CONVERGENCE AT 850 MB AND WEAK 
ISENTROPIC LIFT GENERATES SOME PRECIP JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY MORNING. WILL NOT HAVE ANY PRECIP MENTIONED WITH THIS 
FEATURE AS IT REMAINS TO OUR SOUTH. CLOUDS SHOULD BE DECREASING 
THROUGH THE DAY...SO HIGHS SHOULD REACH INTO THE 40S IN THE VALLEY 
WITH 30S ELSEWHERE. 

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH SATURDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS.  
CONSISTENCY POOR FOR REMAINDER OF EXTENDED...MAINLY REGARDING TIMING 
AND TRACK OF INCOMING SYSTEMS AND CONFIDENCE IS LOW.  HOWEVER...WILL 
TREND TOWARD CURRENT GFS RUN AND HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY 
FOR WEAK SYSTEM MOVING THROUGH.  STRONGER SYSTEM PROGGED INTO THE 
REGION LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY WITH SOME LINGERING SHOWERS IN 
WEDNESDAY.  TEMPERATURES PROFILE INDICATING THIS SHOULD BE MAINLY A 
RAIN EVENT.  AS FOR TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD...MAIN ARCTIC COLD 
SHOULD STAY NORTH WITH ONLY MINOR PUSHES INTO THE AREA...KEEPING OUR 
TEMPS NEAR TO SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 071425 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 AM EST WED FEB 7 2007

.DISCUSSION...
SURACE COLD FRONT HAS PASSED THROUGH THE AREA THIS MORNING.
RESULTING COLD ADVECTION IS CAUSING TEMPERATURES TO DROP...AND OUR
HIGHS TODAY HAVE MOST LIKELY HAVE ALREADY BEEN REACHED. A NORTHWEST
FLOW OFF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WILL LIKELY CAUSE A DOWNSLOPING
EFFECT THAT WILL KEEP THE VALLEY WITH AT LEAST PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES
THROUGH THE DAY. THE BALANCE BETWEEN SOLAR HEATING AND COLD
ADVECTION WILL BE TRICKY...BUT EXPECT THAT TEMPS WILL EITHER BE
NEARLY STEADY OR DROP A BIT FROM CURRENT OBS. UPDATE WILL ADJUST
TEMPERATURE TRENDS AND REMOVE LOW POPS IN THE NORTHEAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  51  30  48  26  46 /  10  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  23  45  24  44 /  20  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  45  22  44  24  43 /  10  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  39  22  40  18  40 /  20  10   0   0   0

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 070922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
425 AM EST WED FEB 7 2007

.UPDATE...LOCAL RADARS HAVE NOT SHOWN MUCH REDEVELOPMENT OF PRECIP 
UPSTREAM OF THE FORECAST AREA AND LOCAL OBS REVEAL THAT WINDS HAVE 
RAPIDLY DECREASED BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. THUS...HAVE CANCELLED THE 
ADVISORIES AND UPDATED THE ZONE FORECASTS TO REMOVE THE WINTER 
WEATHER AND WIND ADVISORY HEADLINES.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE 
AREA WITH STILL SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE LINGERING...MAINLY THIS 
MORNING. NOT MUCH SHOWING UP ON RADAR...BUT WILL KEEP SOME LOW POPS 
IN FOR THE MORNING HOURS. BEST POPS IN THE NORTH WHERE BEST MOISTURE 
RESIDES. SOUNDINGS STILL INDICATE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW OR LIGHT 
FREEZING RAIN IN THE NORTH...WILL KEEP WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY GOING 
UNTIL 8 AM. STILL A FEW PLACES WITH STRONG WINDS IN THE CENTRAL AND 
NORTH...BUT THEY SHOULD CONTINUE TO DECREASE THIS MORNING. WILL KEEP 
WIND ADVISORY GOING...BUT LET IT EXPIRE AT 6 AM. DRY WEATHER RETURNS 
TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA INTO THE WEEKEND...BRINGING DRY CONDITIONS. 
BULK OF THE ARCTIC AIR ASSOCIATED WITH THIS HIGH SHOULD STAY 
NORTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH TEMPS REMAINING ONLY SLIGHTLY 
BELOW NORMAL (A LITTLE WARMER THAN PREVIOUS DAYS). LATEST GFS MODEL 
RUN INDICATES A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER TEXAS ON 
SUNDAY...WHICH MAY BRING SOME LIGHT PRECIP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
THIS LOW SHOULD STAY SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE MOST PART... 
WITH ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS TEXAS ON MONDAY. 
THIS NEXT SYSTEM SHOULD BRING A BETTER CHANCE FOR PRECIP...WITH THE 
EXTENDED MODELS INDICATING THAT TEMPS WILL RISE ABOVE FREEZING 
AREAWIDE...RESULTING IN ALL RAIN. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN     51  30  48  26  46 /  10  10   0   0   0

311 AM EST WED FEB 7 2007

.SHORT TERM...SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH THE AREA WITH STILL SOME

WILL KEEP WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY GOING UNTIL 8 AM.  STILL A FEW 
PLACES WITH STRONG WINDS IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTH...BUT THEY SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO DECREASE THIS MORNING. WILL KEEP WIND ADVISORY GOING... 
BUT LET IT EXPIRE AT 6 AM.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA INTO THE WEEKEND...BRINGING DRY CONDITIONS. 
BULK OF THE ARCTIC AIR ASSOCIATED WITH THIS HIGH SHOULD STAY 
NORTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH TEMPS REMAINING ONLY SLIGHTLY 
BELOW NORMAL (A LITTLE WARMER THAN PREVIOUS DAYS). LATEST GFS MODEL 
RUN INDICATES A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER TEXAS ON 
SUNDAY...WHICH MAY BRING SOME LIGHT PRECIP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
THIS LOW SHOULD STAY SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE MOST PART... 
WITH ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING ACROSS TEXAS ON MONDAY. 
THIS NEXT SYSTEM SHOULD BRING A BETTER CHANCE FOR PRECIP...WITH THE 
EXTENDED MODELS INDICATING THAT TEMPS WILL RISE ABOVE FREEZING 
AREAWIDE...RESULTING IN ALL RAIN.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...MID LEVEL VORT CONTINUES TO 
MOVE RAPIDLY SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. SNOW STARTED 
MAKING IT THROUGH THE DRY LOW LEVEL AIRMASS EARLIER IN THE AFTERNOON 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORY COVERS A POSSIBLE ONE TO THREE INCH ACCUMULATION ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. 
PROBLEMS RESULT AS AN 85H JET AROUND 50-60 KTS (WIND ADVISORY 
PRODUCTS CREATED FOR TONIGHT) PRODUCES THERMONUCLEAR WARMING. THIS 
WARMING IS WELL UNDERWAY ACROSS THE MID SOUTH LATE THIS AFTERNOON. 
SO IT BECOMES A RACE TO SEE IF THE WARMING WILL OBLITERATE THE 
CHANCE FOR FROZEN/FREEZING PRECIP ENTIRELY OR PERHAPS WILL SLOW THE 
SNOWFALL EVENT DOWN AND MIX WITH FREEZING RAIN TO CREATE THE 
FORECAST THAT I ISSUED. HOPEFULLY THE LATTER OCCURS AND THE ADVISORY 
CORRECTLY ADVISES FOR SLIPPERY ROADS IN THE AFFECTED AREAS. PRECIP 
WRAPS UP AS SNOW ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
WEDNESDAY MORNING AS LIFT RAPIDLY MOVES AWAY AND DRIER NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW BEGINS. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS IN THE SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...FRONT SAGGING SOUTH 
OF CWA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  MID TO UPR LEVEL MOISTURE MOVES ACROSS 
THE AREA ON THU. WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT NORTH OF OLD BOUNDARY MAY 
BRING LIGHT RAIN ACROSS S PART OF MRX CWA THU EVE/NGT. LEANED 
FORECAST SLIGHTLY AWAY FROM THE GFS ALLOWING MORE INFLUENCE OF LARGE 
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE AND CLEARER SKIES THROUGH WEEKEND. UNDERCUT GFS 
TEMPS OVER THE WEEKEND AS WELL. INVERTED TROUGH WORKS ITS WAY 
NORTHWARD INTO THE AREA BY MON AFTN. THIS WILL INCREASE TEMPS AND 
MOISTURE INTO MONDAY NGT. GOOD CHANCE OF RAIN TUE AS LOW DEVELOPS 
OVR DEEP SOUTH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST TUE FEB 6 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI AND OHIO 
RIVER VALLEYS...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. CURRENT RADARS REVEAL SOME LIGHT ECHOES MOVING ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING...BUT FEEL THIS IS MOSTLY VIRGA 
BECAUSE OF THE DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE (AND NO REPORTS OF SNOW FROM 
SURFACE OBS). A FAST-MOVING CLIPPER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED 
TO MOVE FROM THE NORTHERN ROCKIES TODAY INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
BY TONIGHT...BRINGING SOME LIGHT WINTRY PRECIP ACROSS MAINLY THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. WRF AND GFS MODELS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM...BUT SHOW SOME 
SLIGHT DIFFERENCES IN THEIR VERTICAL TEMP PROFILES (WHICH WILL 
AFFECT THE TYPE OF WINTRY PRECIP EXPECTED FOR THE AREA). OVERALL... 
IT APPEARS THAT MOSTLY SNOW WILL DEVELOP ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA...BUT 
SOME FREEZING RAIN WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE THIS EVENING AS A STRONG 
SOUTHWEST 850 MB JET (IN EXCESS OF 50 KTS) ADVECTS WARMER AIR ALOFT. 
THE LEADING EDGE OF THIS ABOVE-FREEZING AIR ALOFT SHOULD SET-UP OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA THIS EVENING...SO WILL MENTION SOME FREEZING RAIN BUT 
THINK THAT MOSTLY SNOW WILL OCCUR. BOTH MODELS SHOW THE BULK OF THIS 
PRECIP MOVING NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA INTO WV...BUT THINK THAT 1 
TO 3 INCHES OF SNOW WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE OVER SOUTHWEST VA. MODELS 
ALSO REVEAL SOME CONDITIONAL SYMMETRIC INSTABILITY (RESULTING IN 
POSSIBLE SNOW BANDING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS OF 
EXTREME NORTHEAST TN)...SO WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WINTER WX ADVISORY 
FOR THESE AREAS BEGINNING LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT. WITH 
THIS SYSTEM QUICKLY EXITING THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY...THINK 
THAT SNOW AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LIMITED TO ADVISORY LEVEL (1-3).

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...FRONT SAGGING SOUTH OF 
CWA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SOME MOISTURE LINGERING...BUT WILL KEEP 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT DRY FOR NOW. A CLIPPER SYSTEM PUSHING THROUGH ON 
THURSDAY...WILL ADD 20 POPS FOR SNOWSHOWERS FOR THURSDAY MORNING FOR 
OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES. REST OF AREA SHOULD REMAIN DRY BUT CLOUDY. 
GFS INDICATING AN INVERTED TROUGH PUSHING INTO AREA ON THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY. BEST MOISTURE REMAINS SOUTH...SO WILL KEEP 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW. SHORTWAVE TRACKS INTO AREA ON 
SATURDAY. BEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...BUT WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR 
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT FOR OUR NORTHERN ZONES AND THE 
MOUNTAINS. DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON SUNDAY ALONG WITH WARMER 
TEMPERATURES. WARMING TREND CONTINUES INTO MONDAY ALONG WITH THE 
NEXT DISTURBANCE. SHOULD BEGIN AS LIQUID PRECIPITATION ON MONDAY 
BEFORE CHANGING TO A WINTER MIX ACROSS OUR NORTHERN AREAS ON MONDAY 
NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EST MON FEB 5 2007

.DISCUSSION...COLD HIGH PRESSURE WITH VERY DRY AIR CONTINUES ACROSS 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. NORTHWEST UPPER FLOW 
IS BRINGING MID LEVEL MOISTURE FROM THE PLAINS AND LOWER OHIO VALLEY 
INTO THE REGION. SKIES ARE PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY AS A RESULT. 
TEMPERATURES ARE STILL DROPPING HOWEVER DUE TO THE DRY AIR IN PLACE. 
DEW POINTS ARE FROM NEAR 0 TO 10 BELOW. TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE 
TEENS AND 20S AND WILL DROP TO THE SINGLE DIGITS IN THE NORTH AND 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WINDS HAVE DROPPED INTO THE 5 TO 10 MPH RANGE 
PRODUCING WIND CHILLS IN THE SINGLE DIGITS. MOISTURE WILL NOT 
SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE UNTIL TOMORROW DUE TO VERY DRY AIR IN PLACE. 
WITH TEMPERATURES UP NORTH ALREADY NEAR FORECAST LOWS WILL LOWER 
MINIMUMS THERE A FEW DEGREES. OTHERWISE NO CHANGES TO FORECAST.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...DESPITE INCREASE IN MID

ASSOCIATED LOW AND MID LEVEL MOISTURE UNFORTUNATELY HAS A COLD 
ATMOSPHERE TO WORK WITH AND THEREFORE SNOW LIKELY TO OCCUR IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS WELL AS THE MOUNTAINS 
BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA WHERE SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATION MAY OCCUR. 
MIXED PRECIP RESULTS ACROSS MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST 
AREA AS LOW LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION DEVELOPS AHEAD OF OFFENDING 
SYSTEM. PRECIP SHOULD BE FAIRLY LIGHT AS ATMOSPHERE WARMS AND MIXES 
WITH OR CHANGES TO RAIN FOR MUCH OF THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY. 
THIS EVENT STILL 30 HOURS INTO THE FUTURE AND FORECAST FOR THIS 
NORTHWEST FLOW/CLIPPER SYSTEM A LITTLE UNCERTAIN. AT ANY RATE PRECIP 
ENDS FOR MOST OF THE AREA BY NOON WEDNESDAY. TWEAKED MAX TEMPS BACK 
A BIT BELOW GUIDANCE FOR WEDNESDAY BUT STAYED CLOSE DURING REMAINDER 
OF SHORT TERM. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...12Z RUN OF THE GFS 
CAME IN MUCH COOLER THEN THE 00Z RUN. THIS APPEARS TO BE A GOOD 
TREND CONSIDERING SNOW COVER AND CURRENT UPSTREAM T/TD PLOTS. GFS 
POSSIBLY GETTING A BETTER HANDLE ON LOW LEVEL AIRMASS. HAVE ADJUSTED 
EXTENDED FORECAST TO BE MORE IN LINE WITH DGEX AND HPC SOLUTIONS. 
LIGHT PCPN MAY CONTINUE BRIEFLY WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT WILL LEAVE OUT 
OF FORECAST FOR NOW. FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD BE JUST S OF MRX CWA ON 
THU. WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT SETS UP ALONG GA BORDER THU AND THU NGT. 
WILL CARRY LOW CHC POPS FOR THAT PERIOD IN THE SOUTH. REINFORCING 
COLD SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH ON SAT. LIGHT SNOWS EXPECTED LATE SAT INTO 
SAT NGT FOR FAVORED UPSLOPE LOCATIONS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

AND WV THIS MORNING. AS A RESULT...WILL PLAN TO KEEP A MENTION OF 
SNOW FLURRIES ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA THIS MORNING. THIS COLD AIR MASS 
TODAY WILL BE THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON...WITH TEMPS STRUGGLING 
TO RISE INTO THE 20S AND 30S ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. WILL PLAN TO 
KEEP THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY GOING UNTIL 11 AM THIS MORNING...AS 
WIND CHILL VALUES WILL LIKELY REMAIN BELOW -5 DEGREES ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...NEXT IN A SERIES OF WEAK 
NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVES ARRIVES TUESDAY NIGHT. APPEARS MOISTURE 
WILL AGAIN BE RATHER LIMITED WITH THIS SYSTEM...BUT APPEARS THE
NORTHERN TIER WILL BE MOST AFFECTED BY THIS FEATURE. PRECIP TYPE IN
QUESTION AS WARMER AIR ARRIVES IN THE MID-LEVELS. REMAINDER OF LONG
TERM ALSO LOW CONFIDENCE AS GFS HAS DISPLAYED POOR RUN-TO-RUN
CONSISTENCY AND ENSEMBLE SPREAD IS TOO GREAT TO BE OF MUCH HELP.
GENERALLY HAVE JUST GONE WITH GFS GUIDANCE FOR BOTH POPS AND TEMPS.
SOME MODERATION IN TEMPS EXPECTED AS UPPER FLOW DEAMPLIFIES.
HOWEVER...TEMPS WILL STILL STRUGGLE TO REACH CLIMO.

AIR FROM THE NORTHWEST SETTLING OVER THE REGION. TEMPERATURES ARE IN 
THE UPPER TEENS THROUGH THE TWENTIES AT MID EVENING. DEW POINTS HAVE 
ALREADY DROPPED TO BE 0 AND 10 DEGREES IN MANY LOCATIONS. WINDS HAVE 
DECREASED AT THE LOWER ELEVATIONS TO AROUND 10 MPH OR LESS BUT 
CONTINUE ABOVE 10 MPH AT ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET AND AT EXPOSED 
LOCATIONS IN THE VALLEY. SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR WITH JUST A FEW 
DEPARTING CIRRUS OVER THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE. THE CLOSEST LOW CLOUDS ARE IN THE OHIO VALLEY. MID AND 
HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE IS MOVING INTO MID MS VALLEY. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
INDICATING NW WINDS OF 15 TO 35 KNOTS TO CONTINUE ABOVE 2000 FEET 
LATE TONIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING. WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE SINGLE 
DIGITS TO MID TEENS WIND CHILL READINGS WILL DROP BELOW ZERO SO WIND 
CHILL ADVISORY BE IN EFFECT FOR THE TN MOUNTAINS UNTIL MONDAY 
MORNING. WILL UPDATE CURRENT FORECAST TO LOWER CLOUD COVER UNTIL 
LATE TONIGHT. UPDATING TEMPERATURE AND DEW POINT GRIDS TO MATCH 
CURRENT READINGS.  
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WIND CHILL ADVISORY FROM 11 PM MONDAY TO 11 AM EST TUESDAY FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 PM EST SUN FEB 4 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...ANOTHER FAST DISTURBANCE
TONIGHT WHICH IS REALLY MOISTURE STARVED SO TRIMMED POPS BACK TO
FLURRIES AND ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS FOR PARTS OF SW VA...NRN MTNS
AND SMOKIES EARLY MONDAY. NAM-WRF WINDS HAVE BEEN TOO STRONG PAST
COUPLE OF DAYS...SO LOWERED THOSE SPEEDS AND MIXED SOME GFS VALUES
IN AS WELL. HOWEVER...SEEMS THAT I KEPT SPEEDS UP ENOUGH WITH
FALLING TEMPS TO JUSTIFY A WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR THE SMOKIES AND
NRN MTNS OF TN. RAN THIS ADVISORY FROM 11 PM TO 11 AM MONDAY...
WHICH GENERALLY WAS THE PERIOD OF COLDEST WIND CHILLS. VALUES WILL
BE MARGINAL ANYWHERE WINDS DECOUPLE...SO WILL RUN A RANGE OF 5
ABOVE TO 15 BELOW ZERO IN THE ZONES AND WSWMRX.

OTHERWISE...RELATIVE HUMIDITIES STAY ABOVE RED FLAG WARNING
CRITERIA WITH WIND SPEEDS MARGINAL ANYWAY AFTER TOMORROW.

MATCHING MOS GUIDANCE FOR MINS TONIGHT PUT ME OUT OF TOLERANCE WITH
NEIGHBORS SLIGHTLY...SO UNDERCUT GFS MOS BY A DEGREE OR TWO TO
MESH BETTER. FAVORED A BLEND FOR HIGHS MONDAY...CLOSE TO GUIDANCE
MONDAY NIGHT...THEN A BLEND ON TUESDAY DUE TO MODEL DIFFERENCES
BETWEEN NAM-WRF AND GFS. GFS FASTER WITH PCPN AND WARMER...BUT FOR
NOW KEPT FORECAST AS A COMPROMISE ON PCPN CHANCES AND HIGH TEMPS
ALSO. SHOULD WARM ENOUGH FOR NOT ALL SNOW BY AFTERNOON.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...YET ANOTHER ARCTIC FRONT 
RIPS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT WITH WEAK SHORTWAVE AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE WAVE CREATING ENOUGH LIFT FOR THE MENTION OF SOME 
-SHSN ALONG WITH A BIT OF -SHRA ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY EARLY IN 
THE EVENING. EVENT PRETTY MUCH OVER BY 12Z WEDNESDAY WITH SURFACE 
RIDGING. STAYED WITH THE ISENTROPIC LIFT/OVERRUNNING MOIST 
ATMOSPHERE OVER COLD LOW LEVEL AIRMASS IDEA FOR FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY 
AS SURFACE WAVE RIDES NEAR THE GULF COAST CREATING A SMALL CHANCE 
FOR -SHSN/-SHRA BEFORE ENDING BY 12Z SUNDAY. TRIED TO STAY CLOSE TO 
MEX MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD BUT CONTINUE TO BE 
MOLDED INTO COLDER TEMPERATURES BY NEIGHBORING OFFICES.

.DISCUSSION...CALLED AROUND TO OUR NE PLATEAU COUNTIES AND WISE CO VA

SHOULD BE SHORT-LIVED. THUS...WILL PROBABLY KEEP POPS AS IS IN THE 
CHANCE CATEGORY BUT MAY ADD SCATTERED WORDING. SNOW IS SO DRY THAT 
MIGHT NOT EVEN MELT DOWN TO MORE THAN 0.01 INCH.

OTHER ITEM OF CONCERN IS WINDS ALOFT WITH KHTX AND KMRX VAD WIND 
PROFILES (VWP) SHOWING AROUND 30 TO 40 KNOTS TO MIX DOWN TODAY.
MONITORING WINDS FROM AVAILABLE OBSERVATION SITES SO FAR SUPPORTS 
OUR CURRENT 15 TO 25 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 35 MPH...WHICH WILL BE BELOW 
ADVISORY CRITERIA. RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES ARE STAYING MUCH ABOVE 
RED FLAG WARNING CRITERIA...AND WIND CHILL VALUES ARE ALSO ABOVE 
ADVISORY LEVELS. 

WILL UPDATE ZFPMRX AND FRESHEN GRIDS/WEB PRODUCTS SHORTLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 AM EST SUN FEB 4 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT STRETCHING FROM BECKLEY WV TO MEMPHIS TN...WITH TEMPS IN 
THE 20S ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE 
SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WITH AN UPPER- 
LEVEL SHORT WAVE TRIGGERING SOME LIGHT SNOW ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF 
OF THE AREA. CURRENT RADARS ALREADY REVEAL SOME LIGHT SNOW ACROSS 
CENTRAL KY WITH THIS SHORT WAVE...AND THINK THAT THIS PRECIP WILL 
MAINLY AFFECT SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN THIS MORNING. WITH COLD 
TEMPS...EXPECT A HIGH LIQUID TO SNOW RATIO WITH THIS EVENT. 
HOWEVER...ANY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA SHOULD REMAIN 
LESS THAN AN INCH...SINCE A DRY AIR MASS REMAINS IN PLACE AND THIS 
SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH THE REGION. BREEZY WINDS SHOULD 
DEVELOP AGAIN TODAY WITH STRONG 850 MB WINDS MIXING DOWN TO THE 
SURFACE IN THE AFTERNOON. TEMPS WILL STILL HAVE A HARD TIME RISING 
THIS AFTERNOON...AND THINK THAT HIGHS WILL BE A LITTLE COOLER THAN 
YESTERDAY WITH MORE CLOUDS EXPECTED. GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT 
ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT...BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR 
SOME LIGHT SNOW. 


.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD AND RELATIVELY DRY
WEATHER EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. A
SERIES OF WEAK NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVES WILL CONTINUE TO
TRANSLATE THROUGH THE EASTERN CONUS LONGWAVE TROUGH. THESE WAVES
WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY VERY LITTLE MOISTURE. BELIEVE GFS GUIDANCE
POPS ARE OVERDONE AND HAVE GENERALLY KEPT MENTION OF POPS OUT OF
THE FORECAST. THE EXCEPTION IS TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY
INTO SATURDAY AS AT LEAST SOME ENSEMBLE MEMBERS SUPPORT MENTIONING
POPS. MODELS/ENSEMBLES CONTINUE TO ADVERTISE A MAJOR
DEAMPLIFICATION OF UPPER AIR FLOW OVER NORTH AMERICA BY LATE WORK
WEEK...RESULTING IN SIGNIFICANT HEIGHT RISES OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. SHOULD SEE AT LEAST SOME MODERATION IN TEMPS LATE IN
THE LONG TERM. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE CLOSELY WITH THE
EXCEPTION OF MINOR TWEAKS BASED ON ENSEMBLE TRENDS.

345 PM EST SAT FEB 3 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...TWO MINOR DISTURBANCES IN
THE UPPER FLOW...EACH FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER SURGE OF COLD AIR...WILL
AFFECT THE REGION. FIRST ONE TONIGHT HAS A LITTLE BETTER MOISTURE
...ALTHO STILL SOMEWHAT SHALLOW. TIME HEIGHTS AND SOUNDINGS ONLY
SHOWED MOISTURE HIGH ENOUGH TONIGHT ACROSS SWRN VA TO TAP INTO SOME
ICE NUCLEATION POTENTIAL. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES ARE ONLY AROUND
0.15 INCH IN THIS VERY DRY ARCTIC AIR...AND 12Z MODEL RUN HAS EVEN
LESS QPF THAN PREVIOUS 00Z OR 06Z DATA. THUS...I WAS SKEPTICAL
ABOUT PLAYING THIS EVENT UP MUCH AT ALL. DID INCREASE POPS IN OUR
TYPICAL HORSESHOE PATTERN WHERE WE CAN GET A DUSTING WITH THIS TYPE
OF FEATURE...AND PERHAPS MORE SO TO BETTER MESH WITH NEIGHBORING
OFFICES GRIDS.

SIMILAR FEATURE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY LOOKS REALLY STARVED FOR
MOISTURE...SO ONLY 20 PERCENT POPS OVER PARTS OF NORTHEAST AREAS.
WENT CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR MINS...BUT UNDERCUT TOWARD THE COLDER
BLEND ON HIGH TEMPS.  

WILL NEED TO WATCH WIND CHILL VALUES AFTER TONIGHT...MAINLY IN
HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS...FOR POSSIBLY DROPPING INTO WIND CHILL
ADVISORY RANGE. WILL ALSO MONITOR WIND SPEEDS PLUS DRY AIR FOR
POSSIBLE FIRE DANGERS.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROF 
HOLDS IT POSITION KEEPING FRIGID TEMPERATURES IN PLACE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. FLOW IS RELATIVELY DRY WITH ONLY 
LIMITED WEAK SHORTWAVE LIFT UNTIL LATE IN THE WEEK. THEREFORE COLD 
DRY WEATHER EXPECTED UNTIL FRIDAY/SATURDAY TIMEFRAME WHEN SHORTWAVE 
TROF RIDES EAST ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH WITH POSSIBLE ISENTROPIC LIFT 
CREATING THE SLIGHT POSSIBILITY OF SNOW AND RAIN.

IN THE PERIOD. SIGNIFICANT HEIGHT RISES OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ARE PROJECTED TO ACCOMPANY THE FLOW DEAMPLIFICATION. IN 
THE MEANWHILE...COLD...DRY POLAR AIR WILL PERSIST IN NORTHWEST FLOW 
OVER THE REGION WITH OCCASIONAL WEAK SHORT WAVES AFFECTING THE AREA. 
TIMING THESE INDIVIDUAL EVENTS REMAINS PROBLEMATIC. NOT EXPECTING 
ANYTHING VERY SIGNIFICANT WITH THESE WAVES ANYWAY AS MOISTURE WILL 
REMAIN A LIMITING FACTOR. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE TRENDS FOR 
POPS BUT KEPT POPS IN THE SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY. ALSO STUCK
CLOSELY TO GFS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS WITH THE EXCEPTION OF LATE IN THE
PERIOD WHEN TEMPS WERE BUMPED UP SLIGHTLY BASED ON LATEST ENSEMBLE
TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 020736
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 AM EST FRI FEB 2 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE...WITH A COLD FRONT 
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME MIXED PRECIP 
ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ASSOCIATED WITH AN 
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. THIS SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEAST 
INTO SOUTHEAST KY THIS MORNING...WITH PRECIP AFFECTING MAINLY THE 
WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST TODAY. TEMPS REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING MOST 
EVERYWHERE IN THE FORECAST AREA (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3000 FT). THUS...THE LATEST OBS HAVE REPORTED A MIX 
OF RAIN AND SNOW THIS MORNING...AND THINK THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE 
THIS MORNING WITH LITTLE OR NO SNOW ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED. THE ONLY 
AREAS THAT MIGHT HAVE SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS UP TO AN INCH 
WOULD BE THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST VA 
ALONG THE BLACK MTN RANGE. TEMPS ARE ACTUALLY EXPECTED TO RISE INTO 
THE LOWER 40S BY EARLY THIS AFTERNOON...BEFORE A COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH THE REGION. THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD BRING A DECREASE IN 
CLOUDS TONIGHT...AND COLD TEMPS IN THE TEENS AND LOWER 20S BY 
SUNRISE.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER 
LEVEL FLOW CHARACTERIZED BY SHARP RIDGE IN THE EASTERN PACIFIC AND A 
BROAD LONGWAVE TROUGH OVER MOST OF THE CONUS EAST OF THE ROCKIES IS 
EXPECTED TO PERSIST BEFORE DEAMPLIFYING BY LATE IN THE LONG TERM
PERIOD. THIS WILL ALLOW CONTINUED NORTHWEST FLOW AND WELL BELOW
CLIMO TEMPS FOR THE MOST PART. OCCASIONAL WEAK NORTHERN STREAM SHORT
WAVES WILL CONTINUE TO TRANSLATE THROUGH THIS BROAD CYCLONIC FLOW.
TIMING THESE INDIVIDUAL SHORT WAVES WILL BE PROBLEMATIC.
HOWEVER...MOISTURE WILL BE A LIMITING FACTOR AND NONE APPEAR
CAPABLE OF PRODUCING A SIGNIFICANT PRECIP EVENT.

POLAR VORTEX IS PROJECTED TO RETREAT NORTHWARD LATER NEXT WEEK 
COINCIDENTAL TO THE DEAMPLIFICATION OF THE EASTERN PACIFIC RIDGE 
ALLOWING HEIGHTS TO RISE MODESTLY OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
HOWEVER...TEMPS WILL GENERALLY REMAIN WELL BELOW CLIMO THROUGH THE 
LONG TERM. GFS GUIDANCE VALUES APPEAR TO REPRESENT A REASONABLE 
BLEND OF THE ENSEMBLE MEMBERS AND WERE GENERALLY FOLLOWED CLOSELY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST THU FEB 1 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...INITIAL WINTRY EVENT 
HAS ABOUT MOVED EAST OF THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...
THUS ENDING WARNINGS/ADVISORIES AT 4PM EST WORKED WELL. A PNSMRX 
WAS ISSUED WITH WHAT LIMITED SNOWFALL REPORTS WE HAD COLLECTED.

ATTENTION THEN TURNS TO APPROACHING SHORTWAVE/VORT MAX UPSTREAM FOR 
LATER TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY. SEEING SOME ENHANCEMENT ON IR SATELLITE 
PICS OVER AR/SE MO BUT LITTLE PRECIPITATION AS OF YET. A FEW 
PROBLEMS WITH THIS SYSTEM ARE...1) MODELS SEEMED TO INCREASE QPF 
QUITE A BIT FROM THE PREVIOUS RUN (AND SENSIBLY THINKING THAT THIS 
IS SOMEWHAT QUESTIONABLE)...2) TEMPS HAVE WARMED TO OR JUST ABOVE 32 
DEGREES ACROSS ALL BUT PARTS OF SWRN VA UNDER THE LOW LEVEL WARM AIR 
ADVECTION TODAY...AND 3) EXPECT TEMPS TO HOLD NEAR STEADY OVERNIGHT 
GIVEN CURRENT DEW POINT TEMPS AND CONSIDERABLE CLOUDINESS IN PLACE 
WITH MORE TO COME ASSOCIATED WITH SHORTWAVE FEATURE.
 
PRECIPITATION EARLY TONIGHT WOULD ALMOST HAVE TO FALL IN LIQUID FORM 
AS LIGHT RAIN...BUT WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION TOWARD MORNING I DID 
INTRODUCE PROBABILITIES OF SNOW. NE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES INTO 
LEE AND WISE COUNTIES OF SWRN VA MIGHT GET A DUSTING TO LESS THAN 1 
INCH BETWEEN 09Z AND 12Z FRIDAY. THEN THERE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR 
ADDITIONAL LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN OUR TYPICAL HORSESHOE PATTERN 
FROM THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS OF E TN ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF 
SWRN VA...BUT FOR NOW I WILL WORD AS UP TO 2 INCHES OF SNOW ACCUMS 
POSSIBLE AND NOT ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY. PLAN TO ISSUE A BRIEF SPSMRX 
TO MENTION THIS SYSTEM IN A BIT MORE DETAIL.

THREAT OF ANY MEASURABLE PCPN CONTINUES TO DECREASE FRIDAY NIGHT...
AND LITTLE IF ANY CHANGES WERE MADE TO THOSE GRIDS. DECIDED TO 
UNDERCUT MOS FOR HIGHS FRIDAY GIVEN THE AREAS OF PCPN AND STRONG 
COLD AIR ADVECTION IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS. OPTED FOR COLDER MOS MIN 
TEMPS FRIDAY NIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL FLOW REMAINS 
NORTHWESTERLY THROUGH THE LONG TERM WHICH ALLOWS FOR MORE TAPPING OF 
ARCTIC AIR. THIS WILL KEEP TEMPS SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL 
ESPECIALLY NEXT WEEK. SHORTWAVE ENERGY SHOULD BE ABLE TO KEEP SLIGHT 
TO LOW CHANCE PROBABILITIES FOR SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AND THEN AGAIN SUNDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. BONE CHILLING LOW DEWPOINT ARCTIC AIR WILL 
KEEP THE REGION DRY UNTIL THURSDAY AS TEMPERATURES MODERATE JUST A 
BIT. COULD BE A RAIN/SNOW MIX WITH THIS EVENT AS SOME WEAK WAA 
INDICATED. OF COURSE THIS LATE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST IS FANTASY 
LAND WITH CHANGES CERTAIN DURING THE COMING DAYS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
510 AM EST THU FEB 1 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...SNOW HAS DEVELOPED ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AND IS RAPIDLY SPREADING 
NORTH. TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S AREAWIDE. HIGH 
PRESSURE HAS SHIFTED OFF THE EAST COAST AND A LOW PRESSURE AREA 
ALONG THE GULF COAST WAS SPREADING MOISTURE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEAST AND INTO EAST TENNESSEE AND THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
MODELS SHOW STRONG LIFT THIS MORNING ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
PART OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH A JET MAX MOVING FROM THE MS VALLEY 
TO JUST EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS BY TONIGHT. AS THE SNOW STARTS 
SURFACE WINDS ARE SHIFTING TO THE SOUTHWEST. VAD WIND PROFILE SHOWS 
SOUTHWEST WINDS TO ABOUT 5 THOUSAND FEET. MODELS TRY TO BRING IN 
WARMER AIR THIS MORNING ESPECIALLY KNOXVILLE SOUTH AND THIS COULD 
CHANGE THE SNOW TO FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN. 
FARTHER NORTH THE PRECIPITATION WILL BE MAINLY SNOW. THE SURFACE LOW 
IS EXPECTED TO MOVE NORTHEAST BUT STAY FAR TO THE SOUTH. LATE TODAY 
AND TONIGHT MODELS SHOW DEEPENING MOISTURE AS A WEAK FRONT NOW 
ACROSS THE MID MS VALLEY APPROACHES. AS TEMPERATURES RISE JUST ABOVE 
FREEZING DURING THE DAY THEY WILL DROP SLOWLY DOWN TO NEAR FREEZING 
AND THE RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW IN MOST PLACES AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
HAVE EXTENDED THE WARNING AND ADVISORY AREAS TO 4AM FRIDAY. THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA MAY SEE ABOUT THE SAME AMOUNT OF SNOW 
TONIGHT. PREFERRED THE COOLER MET NUMBERS FOR HIGHS TODAY AND 
DROPPED TEMPERATURES TO FREEZING AND SLIGHTLY BELOW TONIGHT FROM 
KNOXVILLE NORTH. SOUTHERN AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS LOOK TO 
STAY JUST ABOVE FREEZING TONIGHT. CHANGED THE WSW IN THOSE AREAS TO 
AN ADVISORY ENDING LATE TODAY BASED ON THE HIGHER QPF AMOUNTS TODAY 
AND LIGHTER AMOUNTS TONIGHT WITH SECOND SYSTEM AND WARMER 
TEMPERATURES.    

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODEL DIFFERENCES WITH 
MID/UPR JET SOLUTION EARLY IN PERIOD. WILL FOLLOW CLOSE TO GFS WHICH 
STRENGTHENS JET OVR TN VLY FRI THEN SHIFTS THE JET CORE EAST OF THE 
MNTS EARLY SAT. THE NAM SOLUTION IS FARTHER N AND APPEARS TOO WARM 
FOR MRX CWA. SCT SNOW AND RAIN SHWRS ACROSS THE AREA FRI ENDING 
ACROSS NE TN/SW VA FRI NIGHT. NAM/GFS 850 MB TEMPS FOR SAT MORN ARE 
NEARLY 10C APART. -3/-13C. WENT WITH LOW TO MID 20S OVERALL FOR SAT 
MORN. ENTRANCE REGION OF UPR JET AND INCREASED MOISTURE WILL SUPPORT 
SCT SNOWS MAINLY FOR SW VA. A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA ON 
MONDAY FOLLOWED BY A VERY COLD AIRMASS FOR REMAINDER OF EXTENDED 
PERIOD. ABOVE FREEZING TEMPS WILL BE BRIEF AND ONLY ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS OF TN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
938 PM EST WED JAN 31 2007

GULF SYSTEM GETTING ITS ACT TOGETHER AND HEADING TOWARD AREA. 
DYNAMICALLY...THIS SYSTEM IS FAIRLY WEAK...MAINLY RELYING ON 
ISENTROPIC LIFT WITH WARM ADVECTIVE RETURN FLOW ON BACK SIDE OF LOW 
LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE. AT MID AFTERNOON TODAY...RADAR OVER WESTERN 
GULF LOOKED LESS THAN IMPRESSIVE...BUT LAST SIX HOURS LIFT HAS BEEN 
INCREASING AND RADAR SCREENS HAVE BEEN FILLING IN RAPIDLY ACROSS LA 
AND SRN MS...SOURCE OF OUR PRECIP.

00Z NAM SOUNDINGS HAVE INITIALIZED VERY WELL...BUT SURFACE TEMP 
INITIALIZED A LITTLE TOO WARM IN SOME AREAS.  LOOKED AT PRESENT 
TIMING OF INITIAL PRECIP...BOTH IN MODELS AND EXTRAPOLATION...
LOOKS LIKE ONSET OF PRECIP ROUGHLY AS FOLLOWS...KCHA 09Z-10Z...
KTYS 11Z-12Z...KTRI 13Z-14Z.  WILL UPDATE SNOW WORDING IN ZONE 
FORECAST AS NEEDED IN NORTHEAST TO DELAY ONSET OF PRECIP.

STILL LOOKING LIKE ONSET WILL START AS SNOW EVERYWHERE...BUT TURNING 
TO LIQUID OVER SOUTHERN HALF OF AREA DURING THE DAY.  THINKING THAT 
DURATION OF FREEZING RAIN WILL BE SHORT OVERALL...AS COLD SURFACE 
AIR DOESNT SEEM TO BE DAMMED INTO AREA...BETTER CHANCE OF THAT ON 
OTHER SIDE OF APPALACHIANS.  THEREFORE...THINK SURFACE TEMPS WILL 
RISE ABOVE FREEZING DURING THE DAY WHERE PRECIP TURNS TO SLEET OR 
RAIN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
346 PM EST WED JAN 31 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...12Z GFS/NAM-WRF 
MODELS GENERALLY ADVERTISE SIMILAR TIMING OF WINTRY PRECIPITATION 
(PCPN) WITH NAM-WRF SHOWING A SLIGHTLY BETTER BREAK (BUT STILL 
BRIEF) IN THE PCPN LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON OR EARLY THURSDAY EVENING.

WE WERE NOT CONVINCED THAT SUFFICIENT WARMING ALOFT WILL OCCUR ON 
THURSDAY TO CHANGE MUCH OF THE PCPN TO A MIX IN ALL AREAS. WARM 
LAYER ALOFT LOOKED TOO SHALLOW AND NOT WARM ENOUGH...SUCH THAT SNOW 
AND/OR SLEET SHOULD CONTINUE TO BE THE DOMINATE PCPN TYPE DURING THE 
DAY THURSDAY. HOWEVER...STILL ALLOWED A MIX OVER THE CENTRAL AND 
MUCH OF THE SRN VALLEY AREAS. WARNING AREAS WERE EXPANDED AND 
AMOUNTS KEPT SIMILAR...ALTHO PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL RUN 
QUITE HIGH WITH THIS EVENT...BUT ANY MIX WILL INHIBIT SNOW/ICE 
AMOUNTS. INCLUDED SEQUATCHIE VALLEY COUNTIES INTO HAMILTON AND RHEA 
DUE MAINLY TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THOSE AREAS.

DUE TO THE RAPID RE-DEVELOPMENT OF ADDITIONAL WINTRY PCPN THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...DECIDED TO RUN THE WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES THRU 
MIDNIGHT. MAY BE ABLE TO CANCEL SOME AREAS EARLIER TOMORROW...
ESPECIALLY IF A DECENT BREAK IN THE PCPN OCCURS.

OTHERWISE...WENT WITH GFS MOS ON MINS TONIGHT AND THURSDAY NIGHT...
SINCE THESE WERE GENERALLY THE COLDER VALUES OF CHOICE. UNDERCUT MOS 
HIGHS ON THURSDAY. HAZARD GRIDS HAVE BEEN MADE FOR SOME TIME...AND 
THE WSW MAY BE ISSUED PRIOR TO ZFPMRX OR JUST SHORTLY AFTER.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH 
ON FRIDAY.  SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE LINGERING IN MAINLY IN THE 
MORNING HOURS.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR THE NORTH AND SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE SOUTH.  SOUNDINGS INDICATE MAY STILL SEE 
FREEZING PRECIPITATION IN THE MORNING.  MOISTURE SHOULD BE TOO 
LIMITED FOR SIGNIFICANT ADDITIONAL ICE OR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS.  
ISOLATED SNOWSHOWERS LINGER IN THE NORTHERN AREAS ON FRIDAY NIGHT 
WITH DRY WEATHER RETURNING ON SATURDAY.  A CLIPPER SYSTEM IS 
EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH THE NORTHERN AREAS ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR ALL SNOW.  A FRONT MOVES INTO THE 
REGION ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...WILL KEEP LOW POPS FOR BOTH 
PERIODS...SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW.  UPPER TROUGH PUSHES 
THROUGH ON MONDAY NIGHT...WILL LIMIT POPS FOR ONLY THE NORTHERN 
AREAS WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE LINGERS.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON 
TUESDAY AND LINGERS INTO TUESDAY NIGHT.  ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES ON 
WEDNESDAY...SHOULD BE LATE IN THE DAY...SO KEPT WEDNESDAY DRY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 AM EST WED JAN 31 2007

.DISCUSSION...MAIN CONCERNS ARE OF COURSE BY THIS TIME THURSDAY AS 
THE WINTRY WEATHER EVENT WILL BE UNDERWAY.  FORECAST FOR THURSDAY 
AND THURSDAY NIGHT APPEARS TO BE GENERALLY ON TRACK...AWAITING 
INCOMING 31/12Z MODEL DATA.  DECISIONS TO BE MADE THIS AFTERNOON 
WILL INVOLVE TWEAKS TO PRECIPITATION TYPES...AS WELL AS AMOUNTS OF 
ANY ICE AND/OR SNOW.  THE POTENTIAL FOR CHANGING TO RAIN OR A MIX BY 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON IN PERHAPS ALL BUT SW VA AND EXTREME NRN PARTS OF 
E TN...STILL COMPLICATES AMOUNTS.  WE WILL DEFINITELY ISSUE 
ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS...AS APPLICABLE...FOR THE WINTER STORM WATCH 
AREAS AT LEAST WITH THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

OTHERWISE...FOR TODAY...WILL PROBABLY NEED TO LOWER MAX TEMPS IN 
SOME AREAS AS CURRENT TEMPS ARE LAGGING BEHIND HOURLY TEMPS IN THE 
GRIDS.  OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS FROM 12Z TODAY DONT SHOW POTENTIAL 
FOR WARMING OUT OF THE 20S TO UPPER 30S...SO THIS FURTHER SUPPORTS 
LOWERING HIGHS A BIT.  NO SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN CLOUDS EXCEPT 
PERHAPS WRN MOST AREAS THIS AFTERNOON...SO AT LEAST SOME SUNSHINE TO 
HELP TEMPS WARM.

FXUS64 KMRX 310939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST WED JAN 31 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...AT THE SURFACE A COLD FRONT 
HAS MOVED ALMOST TO THE ATLANTIC COAST WITH HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING 
IN OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND MOVING INTO THE OHIO AND 
TENNESSEE VALLEYS. COLD AIR ADVECTION WAS STARTING TO RELAX WITH 
NORTHWEST WINDS OF 10 TO 20 MPH STILL OCCURRING ONLY IN SW VA AND 
THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN AND SW NC. TEMPERATURES HAD DROPPED INTO 
THE TEENS TO LOWER 20S WITH SINGLE DIGIT DEW POINTS. SOME SNOW 
FLURRIES OCCURRED OVERNIGHT WITH A STRONG SHORTWAVE PASSING THROUGH 
AND IT WAS NOW ABOUT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. SKIES WERE MOSTLY 
CLEAR EXCEPT ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA EARLY THIS MORNING. SKIES SHOULD 
BECOME CLEAR BY MID MORNING AS SHORTWAVE EXITS AND SURFACE HIGH 
MOVES IN. TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL BE SLOW TO WARM WITH COLD AIR 
ADVECTION CONTINUING THIS MORNING. KEPT HIGHS IN THE MID 30S NORTH 
TO LOW 40S SOUTH. THE REAL TROUBLE STARTS TONIGHT AS A STRONG 
SOUTHWEST FLOW FROM ABOUT 850 MB ON UP BRINGS IN MOISTURE AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT TO THE EASTERN TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
AT THE SURFACE THERE WILL BE TRAPPED COLD AIR. TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
DROP BELOW FREEZING THIS EVENING AND THEN STAY STEADY OR SLOWLY RISE 
BUT STAY BELOW FREEZING WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE TEENS AND 20S. BOTH 
MODELS BRING CLOUDS IN BY EVENING AND SATURATE THE ATMOSPHERE ENOUGH 
FOR PRECIPITATION BETWEEN 6 AND 12Z WITH THE NAM/WRF A COUPLE HOURS 
SLOWER. BELIEVE THE PRECIP SHOULD START OUT AS SNOW EVEN IN THE 
SOUTH AND SHOULD REACH THE EASTERN AND NORTHERN SECTIONS BY MORNING. 
HAVE CONTINUED WINTER STORM WATCH FOR NORTHERN PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND ADDED SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE 
AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. UP TO THREE INCHES OF SNOW IS POSSIBLE 
BY THURSDAY MORNING IN SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AND THE 
SMOKIES.      

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE LOW MOVES TO SOUTH 
ALABAMA BY THURSDAY EVENING. THIS FEATURE WILL PUMP MOISTURE 
NORTHWARD COUPLING WITH MID LAYER MOISTURE AND UPR SUBTROPICAL 
MOISTURE FROM THE SW. WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION A GOOD BET. 
PRECIPITATION TYPE REMAINS A BIG PROBLEM FOR THURSDAY. FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS DANCE JUST A DEGREE OR TWO ON WARM SIDE OF 0C LINE UP TO 
6000 FT. MODELS INDICATING MOST SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL RISE TO 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE FREEZING. IF THESE VALUES COME IN A COUPLE OF DEGREES 
COOLER...FREEZING RAIN THREAT MAY DRAMATICALLY INCREASE. FOR NOW 
STAYED WITH GOOD SNOWFALL EARLY IN THE PERIOD. 850 MB WARM TONGUE
SHOULD AID IN CHANGEOVER TO RAIN BY THU AFTN. SNOW GROUND COVER MAY
BECOME SLUSHY BUT MODEL QPF SUPPORTS HIGH END SNOW AMOUNTS IN 
CURRENT WSW. SFC LOW TREKS TO THE NE AS MID LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS SE 
OF MRX CWA. SECOND JET SEGMENT STRENGTHENS FM AR TO E KY PROVIDED 
LIFT ALONG LOW LEVEL TROUGH WHICH SLIDES SE INTO MRX THU NGT AND 
FRI. PCPN WILL LIKELY CHANGE BACK TO ALL SNOW BEFORE ENDING ACROSS 
NE MRX CWA ON FRI. BROAD TROUGHING CONTINUES OVER E U.S. THROUGH 
PERIOD KEEPING A LOCK ON COLD PATTERN. IMPULSES IN THE NW FLOW WILL 
LIKELY BRING SCT SN SHOWERS FROM TIME TO TIME ACROSS N PART OF MRX 
CWA THROUGH THE WEEKEND. A CLIPPER MAY BRING MORE WIDESPREAD 
COVERAGE ON MONDAY.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...DRY WEATHER EXPECTED TO 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PER MODEL AND SREF CONSENSUS. 
VIGOROUS NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE CONTINUES TO TRANSLATE THROUGH 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. LACK OF MOISTURE WITH THIS FEATURE 
PRECLUDES POPS...BUT REINFORCEMENT OF COLD AIR WILL FOLLOW TONIGHT. 
TEMPS AGAIN EXPECTED TO BE WELL BELOW CLIMO AS THE REINFORCING COLD 
AIR BECOMES ENTRENCHED. SHOULD START TO SEE HIGH CLOUDS ADVECT INTO 
THE AREA DURING THE SECOND PERIOD AS NEXT MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM 
APPROACHES. FOR TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE APPEARS REASONABLE AND WAS 
FOLLOWED CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...WHAT A MESSY
FORECAST. SOME MINOR BUT EXTREMELY SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES BETWEEN
THE NAM AND GFS FORECASTS IN THE WEDNESDAY NIGHT-THURSDAY
TIMEFRAME. GFS FASTER AND A LITTLE COOLER AT THE OFFSET AND THIS IS
SIGNIFICANT ENOUGH TO GENERATE MORE SNOW OVER THE REGION. GFS
GENERALLY HANDLES ISENTROPIC LIFT SITUATIONS BETTER SO HAVE LEANED
HEAVILY IN THIS DIRECTION FOR THE FORECAST.  

TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO CLIMB INTO THE EVENING THURSDAY AND MANY
AREAS WILL SWITCH OVER TO RAIN THE POSSIBLY CHANGE BACK TO LIGHT
SNOW LATE THURSDAY NIGHT OR FRIDAY MORNING.

TWO MORE SMALL SYSTEMS SWINGING THROUGH...ONE OVER THE WEEKEND AND
ANOTHER AROUND TUESDAY.  

THE NEXT SITUATION TO PAY CLOSE ATTENTION TO IS THE POTENTIAL FOR
SIGNIFICANT COLD AIR FILTERING INTO THE REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
438 AM EST TUE JAN 30 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE OVER N 
MI THIS MORNING WITH COLD FRONT EXTENDING SSW THROUGH W TN. LOW 
PRESSURE WILL SLIDE SE INTO PA WITH COLD FRONT MOVING EAST THROUGH 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON. DECENT WAA IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT
YET LEANED TOWARD COOLER MOS VALUES OF THE WRF. ENOUGH MOISTURE AND LIFT
ASSOCIATED WITH FRONT TO MENTION LOW CHC OF LIGHT SNOW ALONG AND N OF
THE TN/KY/VA BORDER WITH FLURRIES CONTINUING EXTREME NE AREAS 
TONIGHT. CAA TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES SE 
ACROSS THE AREA. WIDESPREAD TEMPS IN THE TEENS TONIGHT. DRY AIRMASS 
IN PLACE WED SO LEANED TOWARD HIGH SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE WHICH STILL 
LEAVES TEMPS AROUND 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW 
OVR TX WED NGT WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BEGIN 
WORKING IN OVERNIGHT. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL PRODUCE LIGHT SNOW THAT 
WILL ADVANCE E INTO THE AREA. SURFACE LOW MOVES ENE THROUGH THE 
DEEP SOUTH ON THU. ELEVATED WAA WILL CHANGE PCPN TYPE TO RAIN DURING 
THE DAY ON THU FM SW-NE. CHANCE OF HAZARDOUS WINTER WEATHER ON THE 
RISE SINCE MANY LOCATIONS WILL REMAIN AT OR BELOW FREEZING MUCH OF 
THU. PWS JUMP TO .75 SO PCPN RATES WILL LIKELY BECOME MODERATE AT 
TIMES. SNOW WILL CHANGE TO FREEZING RAIN BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN BY 
THU AFTN. PCPN AMOUNTS AND FREEZING RAIN DURATION COULD RESULT IN 
ICE ACCUMULATIONS OF ONE TENTH OF AN INCH TO AS HIGH AS ONE QUARTER 
OF AN INCH. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS OF NE TN AND SW 
VA APPEAR TO BE AROUND 1-2 INCHES AT THIS TIME. CONFIDENCE IN THE 
PCPN EVENT IS HIGH. THE TEMPERATURE PROFILE OF THE BOUNDARY LAYER ON 
THU WILL DETERMINE THE EXTENT OF THE WINTRY WEATHER POTENTIAL.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THURSDAY NIGHT
WRF MODEL SHOWS ELEVATED WARM LAYER SHOULD HAVE SCOURED OUT MOST
OF THE SUB FREEZING AIR NEAR THE SURFACE EXCEPT ACROSS THE
NORTHEAST SECTIONS...MAINLY VALLEYS ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA AS COLD
FRONT APPROACHES. COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH AND PRECIPITATION WILL DECREASE
DURING THE NIGHT. GFS DEVELOPS SURFACE LOW MORE AND HAS IT FARTHER
SOUTH THAN THE WRF. GFS A LITTLE TOO QUICK WITH COLDER AIR LATE
THURSDAY NIGHT. PREFER WRF SOLUTION OF DELAYING THE UPPER TROUGH
AND COLDER AIR ALOFT UNTIL FRIDAY. KEPT LOWS THURSDAY NIGHT
GENERALLY ABOVE FREEZING. WEAKENING SHORTWAVE ENERGY WILL MOVE
ACROSS TN VALLEY AS TROUGH DIGS SOUTH WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS
AND POSSIBLY SNOW SHOWERS AS FREEZING LEVELS LOWER. HIGHS SHOULD BE
IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S. HIGH PRESSURE FROM CANADA BUILDS
SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE PLAINS AND INTO THE SOUTHEAST BY SATURDAY AND
CONTINUES SUNDAY WITH ANOTHER COLD AIRMASS. LOWS ARE EXPECTED TO
DROP INTO THE TEENS TO NEAR 20 AGAIN SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY
NIGHT. A COUPLE OF SHORTWAVES WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST WITH NW UPPER
FLOW FROM SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA INTO THE PLAINS AND THE TN VALLEY
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AND WITH TEMPERATURES STILL COLD ANOTHER
CHANCE OF SNOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
228 PM EST MON JAN 29 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...BRIEF LULL EXPECTED THROUGH 
THE SHORT TERM IN CONTINUED PROGRESSIVE UPPER AIR PATTERN. MAIN 
ISSUE IS THE EFFECT THE NEXT IN A SERIES OF WEAK...FAST-MOVING 
NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVES WILL HAVE LATE IN THE SHORT TERM. 
MOISTURE WITH THIS FEATURE IS PROJECTED TO BE VERY 
LIMITED...CONFINED TO A SHALLOW LAYER AROUND 850 MB PER MODEL TIME 
HEIGHT SECTIONS. LIFT ALSO UNIMPRESSIVE. BASED ON THESE 
PARAMETERS...APPEARS THAT CLOUDS WILL BE ABOUT THE ONLY IMPACT OTHER 
THAN ANOTHER REINFORCEMENT OF COLD AIR BEING USHERED IN. FOR 
TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE APPEARS REASONABLE AND WAS CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...A CONTINUED COOL 
PERIOD WITH PERIODIC RE-ENFORCING BLASTS OF COLD AIR EVERY FEW 
DAYS.  SOME OF THESE BLASTS WILL BE ACCOMPANIED WITH 
PRECIPITATION...THE MOST NOTABLE ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.  
AS ALWAYS THIS TIME OF YEAR...THE BIG QUESTION WILL BE THE EXACT 
TIMING WHICH WILL IMPACT PRECIPITATION TYPE.  

GFS AND NAM FAIRLY DIFFERENT WITH GFS FASTER AND WITH MORE 
LIKELYHOOD OF SNOW.  RIGHT NOW LEANING TOWARDS THAT SOLUTION AND 
WILL ISSUE AN OUTLOOK UNDER THE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT HEADING TO 
DISCUSS PROBABILITY AND POSSIBLE ACCUMULATIONS.  RIGHT NOW THINKING 
IS FOR VERY LIGHT AMOUNTS WITH KNOXVILLE NORTHWARD AROUND 1 
INCH...TAPERING UP TO THE TRI-CITIES AREA WHERE 1-2 INCHES 
POSSIBLE.  2-4 INCHES IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKIES AND 
OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.  FEEL THAT SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE WILL BEGIN 
AS SNOW THEN SWITCH OVER TO RAIN EARLY IN THE MORNING WITH VERY 
LITTLE ACCUMULATION WITH THE POSSIBLE EXCEPTION OF MONTEAGLE AND 
LOOKOUT/SIGNAL MOUNTAIN.

ANOTHER SHOT AT WINTRY PRECIPITATION LATE WEEKEND BUT WILL LEAVE 
THAT TO LATER PERIODS TO NARROW DOWN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EST SUN JAN 28 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE LOWER 
MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH VERY COLD AND DRY AIR MOVING INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA ON BREEZY NORTHWEST WINDS. RADAR REVEALS SCATTERED 
SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUING ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. THE VERY COLD AIR THIS 
EVENING HAS RESULTED IN A HIGH SNOW/LIQUID RATIO (20:1)...WITH SOME 
MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS DEVELOPING IN THE VALLEYS. SATELLITE IMAGES 
INDICATE THAT THE AXIS OF THIS UPPER TROUGH IS CURRENTLY OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...WITH SOME COLDER CLOUD TOPS SEEN OVER THE MOUNTAINS 
AS UPSLOPE FLOW CONTRIBUTES TO THE LARGE-SCALE LIFT. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS EVENING...WITH SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY RAPIDLY DECREASING IN THE 
NEXT FEW HOURS AND WINDS GRADUALLY DIMINISHING OVERNIGHT. THUS... 
WILL LET THE SNOW ADVISORY CONTINUE UNTIL MIDNIGHT...BUT WILL LIKELY 
LET IT EXPIRE ON TIME. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST LATER THIS EVENING TO 
REMOVE EVENING WORDING AND REMOVE ADVISORY HEADLINES. REST OF THE 
FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 281936
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 PM EST SUN JAN 28 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...COLDER AIR CONTINUES TO PUSH IN 
THIS EVENING...WITH UPPER TROUGH SWINGING ACROSS.  LIMITED 
MOISTURE...BUT WITH STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES AND UPSLOPE FLOW 
STILL APPEARS NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE SNOW AREAS MAY BE ABLE TO 
SQUEEZE OUT A COUPLE OF INCHES OF HIGH RATIO SNOW.  WILL CONTINUE 
WSW FOR NOW.  EXPECT SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES TO RAPIDLY DIMINISH LATE 
THIS EVENING...WITH NOT MUCH ACTIVITY AFTER MIDNIGHT.  OTHER CONCERN 
IS WIND CHILL VALUES...WHICH SHOULD REACH ADVISORY CRITERIA OVER 
SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN LATE TONIGHT/EARLY MON MORNING.  APPEARS AT THIS 
TIME THAT VALUES BELOW -5 WILL BE RARE EXCEPT OVER THE HIGHEST 
PEAKS...SO WILL HANDLE WITH SPS RATHER THAN AN ADVISORY FOR NOW.  
SHOULD SEE PLENTY OF SUNSHINE ON MONDAY...BUT WILL REMAIN ON THE 
COLD SIDE.   


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...LONG TERM CONTINUES TO 
BE A LOW CONFIDENCE ENDEAVOR AS TIMING INDIVIDUAL EVENTS REMAINS
PROBLEMATIC AT BEST. APPEARS MEDIUM-RANGE MODELS AND ENSEMBLES ARE
IN SOMEWHAT REASONABLE AGREEMENT THAT A SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WILL
APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FROM THE SOUTHWEST WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. HAVE GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE NCEP (GFS) ENSEMBLES DEPICTION
OF THIS EVENT PROJECTING THE GREATEST CHANCE OF PRECIP IN THE LATE
THURSDAY/EARLY FRIDAY TIME FRAME. PRECIP TYPE ALSO IN QUESTION.
HAVE NOT TRIED TO GET TOO DETAILED WITH PRECIP TYPE...ADVERTISING
ONLY RAIN AND/OR SNOW AT THIS TIME.

HAVE OPTED TO GO DRY FOR THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM AS THE NCEP 
ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ARE IN NEAR UNANIMOUS AGREEMENT WITH THAT TREND. 
HOWEVER...A FEW OF THE OPERATIONAL MODELS AND SOME ENSEMBLE MEMBERS 
FROM OTHER MODELS PROJECT POSSIBLE PRECIP LATE IN THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD. SO CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH THAT DRY WEATHER WILL PREVAIL THEN 
EITHER.

AT ANY RATE...APPEARS AMPLIFIED RIDGE WEST/BROAD TROUGH EAST UPPER 
AIR PATTERN WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE LONG TERM RESULTING GENERALLY 
IN BELOW CLIMO TEMPS...PUNCTUATED BY BRIEF MODERATING TRENDS 
PRECEDING APPROACHING SYSTEMS. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE 
CLOSELY FOR TEMPS. A SLIGHT MAJORITY OF THE NCEP ENSEMBLE MEMBERS 
DEPICT SOME RELAXATION OF THE AMPLIFIED UPPER AIR FLOW THE FOLLOWING 
WEEK SUGGESTING SOME MODERATION IN TEMPS POSSIBLE. WILL HAVE TO SEE 
IF THIS TREND CONTINUES OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL MODEL RUNS.

TEMPS AROUND -15C IN THAT LEVEL. AVAILABLE MOISTURE WILL BE 
SUFFICIENT FOR GOOD FLUFFY SNOW PRODUCTION TONIGHT ACROSS THE SNOW 
ADVISORY AREA. WIDESPREAD WIND CHILL READINGS IN THE SINGLE DIGITS 
TONIGHT. WINDS ARE PROGGED TO SLACKEN LATER TONIGHT BUT A WIND CHILL 
ADVISORY MAY BE REQUIRED WITH A LATER PACKAGE. LEANED TOWARD COOLER 
WRF MOS FOR TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES 
TO PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION ON MONDAY WITH FLOW ALOFT BECOMING 
ZONAL.  CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW FOR REST OF EXTENDED AS A SERIES OF 
WEAK DISTURBANCES MOVE THROUGH.  THE FIRST OF WHICH WILL BE A WEAK 
SHORT WAVE TRACKING THROUGH TO OUR NORTH ON TUESDAY FOR A FEW 
ISOLATED SHOWERS FAR NORTHERN/EASTERN ZONES.  WEATHER STAYS FAIRLY 
UNSETTLED THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD AND TIMING OF SYSTEMS 
IN QUESTION.  CURRENTLY WILL HAVE COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY AND ANOTHER LOW PUSHING IN AROUND THE 
FRIDAY TIME FRAME.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...A SECOND SURGE OF COLD AIR 
WILL MOVE IN MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT WITH A SLOW MODERATION FOR MID 
WEEK.

FXUS64 KMRX 280149
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
850 PM EST SAT JAN 27 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT EXTENDING FROM THE UPPER 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY SOUTHWEST TO NEAR NASHVILLE AND MEMPHIS. SUB- 
FREEZING COLDER AIR REMAINS OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY 
THIS EVENING...BUT MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS COLDER AIR MASS WILL 
REACH THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNRISE. SUB-FREEZING AIR ALOFT WILL MOVE 
OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS SOONER...WITH LIGHT RAIN CHANGING OVER 
TO LIGHT SNOW SHORTLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. LOCAL RADARS ARE CURRENTLY NOT 
SHOWING MUCH PRECIP OVER THE FORECAST AREA OR UPSTREAM OVER WEST AND 
MIDDLE TN. BOTH THE GFS AND WRF MODELS INDICATE THAT MOISTURE WILL 
REMAIN LIMITED OVERNIGHT...BUT UPSLOPE FLOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
WILL LIKELY CREATE ADDITIONAL PRECIP OVERNIGHT AS AN UPPER-LEVEL 
SHORT WAVE SWINGS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 

OVERALL...PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LIGHT OVERNIGHT...BUT WILL 
CONTINUE THE SNOW ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE A COUPLE 
OF INCHES OF SNOW COULD ACCUMULATE BEFORE SUNRISE. A STRONG UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH ON SUNDAY SHOULD TRIGGER ADDITIONAL SNOW SHOWERS...AS 
LOW-LEVEL LAPSE RATES STEEPEN. ALL IN ALL...WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST 
THIS EVENING MAINLY TO FRESHEN-UP THE WORDING...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A 
LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 272024 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST SAT JAN 27 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...TOUGH FORECAST IN THE SHORT 
TERM WITH FIRST SHORT WAVE AND FRONT MOVING THROUGH TONIGHT...THEN 
STRONG SURGE OF COLDER AIR DURING DAY SUNDAY AND ANOTHER SHORT WAVE 
LATE SUNDAY. LIMITED MOISTURE...AND FAST SPEED OF FEATURES WILL 
LIMIT PRECIP AMOUNTS.  PRECIP SHOULD START AS RAIN MOST AREAS 
TONIGHT...THEN MIX WITH AND CHANGE TO SNOW FIRST IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN...THEN WORKING DOWN IN ELEVATION.  PRECIP MAY END BEFORE 
CHANGING OVER IN SOME VALLEY LOCATION.  PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL BE 
LIGHT...BUT MAY PICK UP A COUPLE OF INCHES OF SNOW OVER SOME OF THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS BY MORNING.  SHOULD SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS AND 
FLURRIES TOMORROW...BUT THERE MAY NOT BE MUCH ACTION UNTIL LATER IN 
THE AFTERNOON WHEN LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES REALLY STEEPEN.  MOISTURE 
AGAIN WILL BE LIMITED...AS TRAJECTORIES DO NOT FAVOR GETTING MUCH 
GREAT LAKES MOISTURE INVOLVED.  MAY AGAIN PICK UP AN INCH OR TWO IN 
SOME OF THE FAVORED TERRAIN AREAS.  WILL ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY FOR 
MUCH OF SW VA AND OUR NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS FROM MIDNIGHT 
TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT.   

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWER 
ACTIVITY EXPECTED TO DIMINISH SUNDAY NIGHT AS LOW-LEVEL
MOISTURE...LAPSE RATES AND UPSLOPE FLOW MAGNITUDE SLOWLY ABATE PER
MODEL TIME HEIGHT SECTIONS. PERSISTENT UPPER FLOW PATTERN OF
RIDGING ALONG THE WEST COAST AND A BROAD LONGWAVE TROUGH ACROSS
MOST OF THE CONUS EAST OF THE ROCKY MOUNTAINS IS EXPECTED TO
CONTINUE THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE LONG TERM PER MEDIUM RANGE
MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. THIS SUGGESTS CONTINUED BELOW-CLIMO
TEMPS WITH A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT WAVE TROUGHS MOVING THROUGH BASE
OF LONGWAVE TROUGH. THE FREQUENCY AND SPEED OF THESE SHORT WAVES
MAKES TIMING HIGHLY UNCERTAIN. THEREFORE...HAVE MAINLY RELIED ON
GFS GUIDANCE BLENDING WITH ENSEMBLE TRENDS LATE IN THE LONG TERM
PERIOD.
