AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST SAT JAN 27 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MID LEVEL LOW OVER N TX THIS 
MORNING OPENS TODAY AND MOVES EAST THROUGH THE TN VLY TONIGHT. GOOD 
WARM AIR ADVECTION IN ADVANCE OF SYSTEM. MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES EARLY 
WILL RESULT IN A PLEASANT DAY WITH WIDESPREAD TEMPS IN THE 50S WITH 
SOME 60S. HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE MOVES IN RAPIDLY THIS EVENING. LARGE 
RAIN SHIELD WILL AFFECT MOST AREAS BY MIDNIGHT. SURFACE COLD FRONT 
MOVES SE THROUGH AREA TONIGHT IN WAKE OF DEPARTING SHORT WAVE. 
PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE RAPIDLY TO SNOW ACROSS MOST AREAS BEFORE 
DAYBREAK. DEEPER MOISTURE DECREASES EARLY ON SUNDAY SO SIGNIFICANT 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE NOT EXPECTED. SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES WILL 
CONTINUE ON SUNDAY AS SOME ADDITIONAL MID LEVEL MOISTURE MOVES EAST 
ACROSS AREA IN ADVANCE OF A DEEP TROUGH THAT SWINGS THROUGH LATER ON 
SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL STRUGGLE TO WARM UP MUCH ABOVE FREEZING 
SUNDAY. BRISK NW WINDS WILL RESULT IN WIND CHILLS IN THE 20S.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPSLOPE CONDITIONS WILL 
CONTINUE INTO MONDAY NIGHT...KEEPING A FEW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS GOING  
OVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  OTHERWISE...DRY CONDITIONS WITH COLDER AIR 
CONTINUING TO SLIDE THROUGH THE REGION.  OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL FALL 
INTO THE TEENS ACROSS THE VALLEY WITH SOME SINGLE DIGITS EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS.  WITH LOCALLY BREEZY CONDITIONS...SOME LOCATIONS COULD 
SEE WINDS CHILLS OVER HIGHER TERRAIN AROUND ZERO.  WILL BE BETWEEN 
SYSTEMS MONDAY WITH A SLOW MODERATION OF TEMPERATURES.  CONFIDENCE 
IS LOW FOR REST OF EXTENDED.  WILL CONTINUE WITH IDEA OF WEAK WAVE 
TRACKING THROUGH TO OUR NORTH ON TUESDAY AND ANOTHER STRONGER SYSTEM 
MOVING THROUGH AROUND THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  HAVE KEPT TEMPS NEAR 
GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST FRI JAN 26 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SHOULD SEE A CLEAR SKY 
TONIGHT AS ATMOSPHERE REMAINS RATHER DRY.  EXPECT HIGH 
CLOUDS AND THEN MID CLOUDS TO INCREASE TOMORROW AFTERNOON AHEAD OF 
THE NEXT COLD FRONT.  WHILE MOISTURE WILL INCREASE...ANY PRECIP 
SHOULD HAVE A HARD TIME MAKING IT TO THE SURFACE BY LATE SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON GIVEN DRY AIR INITIAL PRECIP WOULD HAVE TO FALL THROUGH 
AND WITH BETTER LIFT LOOKING LIKE IT WILL STAY TO OUR WEST AND 
NORTHWEST...SO WILL JUST GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH AND WEST 
ZONES LATE.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE...SO NOT MUCH ARGUMENT 
THERE.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN ISSUE FOR THE 
LONG TERM IS EXTENT AND TYPE OF PRECIP FOR SATURDAY NIGHT. MODELS
AND SREF STILL IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS
SYSTEM...OTHER THAN SLIGHT TIMING DIFFERENCES (NAM/WRF SLIGHTLY
SLOWER THAN GFS). APPEARS AT THIS POINT THAT THIS WILL BE PRIMARILY
A RAIN EVENT IN THE VALLEY LOCATIONS BUT ENDING AS SNOW. IN SPITE
OF LIKELY POPS MOST LOCATIONS...THIS EVENT DOES NOT APPEAR VERY
SIGNIFICANT WITH GFS...NAM/WRF AND ALL SREF ENSEMBLE MEMBERS
PROJECTING LESS THAN 0.1 INCH QPF. THUS INCLINATION IS TO NOT ISSUE
ANY WATCHES AT THIS TIME.

UPSLOPE FLOW SETS UP FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WITH ACCOMPANYING 
SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN. GENERALLY DRY ALBEIT COOL 
WEATHER RETURNS FOR EARLY NEXT WORK WEEK BEFORE ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM 
APPROACHES ON LATE TUESDAY. MODELS DIVERGE SOMEWHAT AT THIS POINT 
AND HAVE OPTED TO FAVOR ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE POPS. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE AND ADJUSTED SLIGHTLY BASED 
ON ENSEMBLE TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 AM EST FRI JAN 26 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...QUIET CONDITIONS EXPECTED THROUGH 
THE SHORT TERM WITH HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUING TO BUILD INTO THE 
REGION.  HEIGHT RISES AND GOOD HEATING SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO 
RISE INTO THE MID 40S TO LOWER 50S ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS 
AFTERNOON.  DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE WILL ALLOW LOWS TONIGHT TO FALL 
INTO THE 20S ACROSS MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST 
ON SATURDAY WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING THROUGH FOR SATURDAY 
NIGHT.  THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH FAIRLY QUICKLY...SPREADING A MIX OR 
RAIN AND SNOW ACROSS THE AREA.  PRECIP SHOULD BE MAINLY SNOW LATE 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING.  HIGHER ELEVATION MAY SEE ONE TO 
TWO INCHES OF SNOW BY THE TIME THE SYSTEM EXITS ON SUNDAY.  WEAK 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND UPSLOPE FLOW MAY KEEP SOME ISOLATE LIGHT 
SNOW OR FLURRIES FAR NORTH SUNDAY NIGHT.  CONFIDENCE LOW FOR THE 
REST OF THE EXTENDED.  A WEAK WAVE TRACKS THROUGH TUESDAY/TUESDAY 
NIGHT AFFECTING MAINLY NORTHERN ZONES.  ANOTHER STRONGER SYSTEM 
PUSHES THROUGH AROUND THE THURSDAY TIME FRAME.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EST THU JAN 25 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...SURGE OF COLD AIR WILL CONTINUE 
TO PUSH INTO THE AREA EARLY THIS EVENING...THEN WILL BEGIN TO SHIFT 
EAST.  CURRENT RADAR AND OBS SHOW A DIMINISHING TREND FOR THE SNOW 
SHOWERS/FLURRIES.  EXPECT THIS TREND TO CONTINUE...SO WILL DROP SNOW 
ADVISORY EARLY.  ANY LEFTOVER SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES SHOULD END 
THIS EVENING...WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN SW VA AND THE 
TN MOUNTAINS...AND SHOULD SEE CLEARING SKY. WIND CHILLS MAY REACH TO 
NEAR OR BELOW -5 LATE TONIGHT OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT 
DO NOT THINK IT WILL BE WIDESPREAD AND PERSISTENT ENOUGH TO ISSUE A 
WIND CHILL ADVISORY.  SHOULD BE A DRY DAY FRI WITH PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE...ALONG WITH MILDER AFTERNOON TEMPS.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK REASONABLE FOR BOTH TONIGHT AND FRIDAY.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...GENERALLY QUITE 
WEATHER EXPECTED THROUGH THE LONG TERM WITH THE EXCEPTION OF 
OCCASIONAL SHORT WAVE TROUGHS PASSING THROUGH THE REGION. FIRST 
SHORT WAVE APPROACHES LATE SATURDAY PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE 
CONSENSUS. MODEL GUIDANCE POPS ARE RELATIVELY HIGH FOR THE SATURDAY 
NIGHT PERIOD...AND HAVE NO REASON NOT TO BELIEVE THEM. ACTUALLY WENT 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE GUIDANCE FOR THAT TIME FRAME BASED ON UNANIMOUS 
AGREEMENT AMONG OPERATIONAL MODELS AND SREF. ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE 
APPROACHES LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD...BUT TIMING DIFFERENCES 
BETWEEN MODELS AND ENSEMBLES LOWERS CONFIDENCE REGARDING POPS. AFTER 
A BRIEF WARMING TREND ON SATURDAY...TEMPS WILL GENERALLY TEND TO 
REMAIN BELOW CLIMO THROUGH THE LONG TERM.

343 AM EST THU JAN 25 2007

.DISCUSSION...
A FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE FROM THE OHIO VALLEY...CENTRAL
APPALACHIANS TO VA/NC BY LATE TODAY. DECENT COLD AIR ALOFT
ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM WILL PRODUCE SCATTERED-BROKEN SNOW
SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH BEST LIFT
ALONG THE NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES DUE TO NORTHWEST FLOW.

AFTER COORDINATION WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES...HAVE ISSUED A SNOW
ADVISORY FOR PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHERN-CENTRAL
MOUNTAINS OF FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE. SNOWFALL OF 1 TO 2 INCHES
EXPECTED...MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

ACROSS TRI...FLURRIES AND SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS ANTICIPATED
TODAY...BUT PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS VERY LIGHT WITH NO SNOW
ACCUMULATION.

SHORT-WAVE WILL EXIT THE AREA THIS EVENING WITH CLEARING AND COLD
CONDITIONS.

A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS
THE GULF COAST STATES FOR SUNDAY WITH A NORTHERN STREAM WAVE MOVING
EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. ANOTHER RE-ENFORCING COLD FRONT WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE MOVES ACROSS LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY WITH A
CHANCE OF SNOW/RAIN SHOWERS. AT THIS TIME...PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS
WILL BE LIMITED SINCE LITTLE IF ANY PHASING BETWEEN THE NORTHERN
AND SOUTHERN STREAM WAVES.

FOR THE EXTENDED...A SERIES OF ALBERTA CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEMS MAY
PRODUCE SOME LIGHT SNOW NEXT WEEK...BUT MOISTURE LIMITED.

FXUS64 KMRX 242019
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EST WED JAN 24 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...ANOTHER SHORT WAVE IS 
FORECAST TO DROP INTO THE EASTERN LONG WAVE TROUGH TONIGHT AND THU.  
A REINFORCING SURGE OF COLD AIR WILL PUSH INTO THE REGION THU...AND 
WITH THE NORTHWEST FLOW AND COLDER AIR THERE SHOULD BE SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS AND FLURRIES.  APPEARS THAT MODEL LOW LEVEL THERMAL AND 
MOISTURE PROFILES ARE NOT IDEAL FOR A MAJOR SNOW SHOWER EVENT.  WILL 
GO WITH FLURRIES IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY...SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND NORTHERN VALLEY...WITH POPS UP TO 50 PERCENT 
FOR SOME OF THE MORE FAVORED HIGH TERRAIN.  EXPECT AT LEAST SOME 
ACCUMULATION IN THE USUAL LOCATIONS...SO WILL MENTION AN INCH OR 
TWO.  WITH CONFIDENCE STILL FAIRLY LOW...AND WITH THIS BEING MAINLY 
A PERIOD TWO EVENT...WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY ADVISORY...AND JUST 
CONTINUE THE SPS.  WITH COLD ADVECTION AND EXPECTED CLOUD COVER WILL 
UNDERCUT GFS MOS TEMPS A BIT FOR THU...BUT WILL GO CLOSE FOR 
TONIGHT.   

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LONG WAVE TROUGH
SHIFTS EAST THURSDAY NIGHT WITH MOISTURE DECREASING ALTHOUGH
ANOTHER HALF INCH OR MORE SNOW MAY FALL IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
THROUGH THE EVENING. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. RIGHT NOW EXPECTING WINDS TO
STAY BELOW ADVISORY LEVELS BUT WITH TEMPERATURES DROPPING INTO THE
SINGLE DIGITS AND TEENS ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NORTH WIND
CHILL READINGS WILL BE BELOW ZERO THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY
MORNING. FOLLOWED A BLEND FOR LOWS FRIDAY MORNING AND THE COOLER
NAM GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUING THROUGH
THE MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AND THIS
WILL CAUSE A NICE WARMUP BEFORE THE NEXT SYSTEM DROPS DOWN IN THE
NORTHWEST FLOW FROM CENTRAL CANADA AND COMBINES WITH MOISTURE IN
THE SOUTHERN STREAM FROM AN UPPER LOW THAT MODELS SHOW TO MOVE FROM
WESTERN MEXICO INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS FRIDAY NIGHT AND THEN
COMBINE WITH THE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES SATURDAY. SATURDAY
SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY WITH CLOUDS INCREASING SATURDAY NIGHT AND
PRECIPITATION DEVELOPING BY SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO BE
COLD ENOUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY FOR SNOW AS UPPER FLOW
COMES FROM THE NORTH. A SECONDARY SURGE OF COLD AIR AND MOISTURE WILL
SWING THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT WITH ANOTHER CHANCE OF SNOW MAINLY
NORTH. AIRMASS DRIES OUT BRIEFLY MONDAY AND THEN ANOTHER SHORTWAVE
TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT DROPPING FROM THE NORTHWEST WILL GIVE
ANOTHER CHANCE OF SNOW. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY COLD FROM SUNDAY
THROUGH MIDWEEK.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
223 AM EST WED JAN 24 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
LIGHT SNOW ASSOCIATED WITH A VORT MAX ACROSS KENTUCKY MAY CLIP OUR
NORTHERN BORDER TODAY. DO NOT EXPECT MUCH OF ANY ACCUMULATION WITH
THIS CLIPPER...AND WILL HAVE ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP ALONG OUR
NORTHERN FRINGE. WILL UNDERCUT MOS TEMPS TODAY AS TEMPS THIS
MORNING ARE COLDER THAN FORECAST AND CLOUDS SHOULD INCREASE THROUGH
THE DAY. A DEEPER AND COLDER UPPER TROUGH WILL SWING THROUGH THE
AREA TONIGHT AND THURSDAY. UPPER DIVERGENCE INCREASES AS THE UPPER
JET SHIFTS EAST AND MIDLEVEL TEMPERATURES DROP SHARPLY. THIS WILL
RESULT IN LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES AROUND 9-10 C/KM ON
THURSDAY...AND ALONG WITH AN UPSLOPE 850 MB WIND AROUND 30 KTS
SHOULD PRODUCE A GOOD CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS IN SW VA AND THE
MOUNTAINS. THE NAM SHOWS DEEPER MOISTURE AND THUS HIGHER POPS THAN
THE GFS. WILL FOLLOW THE NAMS HIGHER POPS. AMOUNTS ARE UNCERTAIN
AT THIS TIME...BUT WILL KEEP AMOUNTS UNDER FOUR INCHES AS AN AREAL
AVERAGE IN SW VA AND THE MOUNTAINS. SOME HEAVIER SNOW BURSTS COULD
PRODUCE ISOLATED HIGHER AMOUNTS. WILL ISSUE AN SPS TO HIGHLIGHT
THIS. WILL ALSO INCLUDE A MENTION OF SUB-ZERO WIND CHILLS IN THE
MOUNTAINS ON THURSDAY NIGHT...AS LOW TEMPS COULD APPROACH SINGLE
DIGITS AND WINDS OF 20 TO 30 MPH IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THE FLOW ALOFT BECOMES MORE WESTERLY ON FRIDAY...AND A SHORTWAVE
TROUGH APPROACHES ON SATURDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS WITH THIS
FEATURE. ANOTHER SURGE OF ARCTIC AIR WILL PUSH TOWARD THE AREA ON
SUNDAY. PATTERN APPEARS FAVORABLE FOR ANOTHER NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW
SHOWER EVENT ON SUNDAY NIGHT...WILL INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
FOR NOW. TEMPS MONDAY WILL LIKELY BE WELL BELOW NORMAL. YET ANOTHER
CLIPPER APPROACHES FOR TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT...AND WILL SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS IN FOR THAT SYSTEM.

PRECIPITATION WILL TAKE A NUMBER OF FORMS RANGING FORM LIQUID TO

RELATIVELY LIGHT AND THE SNOW EVENTS WILL GENERALLY BE TRACE AMOUNTS 
WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME MINOR...LESS THAN 2 INCHES...IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN COOL WITH EACH OF THE

LIGHT PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH A CHANNELED VORT MAX HAS ENDED.
MOISTURE TRAPPED BELOW A STRONG INVERSION AT 850 MB WILL HOLD THE
CLOUDS IN PLACE THIS MORNING. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THE
INVERSION WEAKENING THIS AFTERNOON...SO BY THIS EVENING WE SHOULD
SEE AT LEAST PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES. HOWEVER MIDLEVEL CLOUDS WILL BE
INCREASING AGAIN LATE TONIGHT WITH THE APPROACH OF A CLIPPER FROM
THE NORTHWEST. COOLING TEMPS ALOFT ALONG WITH A VERY STRONG JET
STREAM OVERHEAD WILL BRING SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOWER CHANCE POPS
BEGINNING WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 850 MB TEMPS DROP LATE WEDNESDAY
NIGHT...WHILE WINDS AT THAT LEVEL ALSO INCREASE TO 30+ KTS FROM THE
NORTHWEST. THIS UPSLOPE FLOW ALONG WITH LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES ON
THE ORDER OF 9 C/KM WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE
NORTHERN HALF AND THE SMOKIES THROUGH THURSDAY. THERE WILL LIKELY
BE A LARGE TEMPERATURE DIFFERENCE FROM CHA TO SW VA AS 850 MB TEMPS
RANGE FROM -1 C TO -13. THE WIND CHILL WILL ALSO BE A FACTOR WITH
LOWS THURSDAY NIGHT IN THE TEENS AND NORTHWEST WINDS 20 TO 35 MPH.
WILL HIGHLIGHT THIS IN THE HWO.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
A RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE REGION ON FRIDAY...ALLOWING
TEMPERATURES TO RECOVER TO NEAR NORMAL BY SATURDAY. THE RIDGE
FLATENS AS IT MOVES EAST AND A SHORTWAVE TROUGH CROSSES THE AREA ON
SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON SATURDAY NIGHT
AND SUNDAY AS CONFIDENCE IS LOW WITH SUCH SHORTWAVE FEATURES. A
MORE SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTHEAST FROM CANADA ON SUNDAY
NIGHT...BRINGING ANOTHER SHOT OF COLD AIR FOR MONDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  50  30  52  29  47 /  10  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  29  48  28  43 /  10  10  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  47  30  48  27  43 /  10  10  10  20  10

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SHORTWAVE DEEPENS TROUGH

SHORT WAVE SHOULD GIVE THE MOUNTAINS A DUSTING TO ABOUT AN INCH OF
SNOW LATER TONIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING BUT VALLEY LOCATIONS ARE
EXPECTED TO SEE JUST CLOUDY SKIES BUT MAYBE A SNOW FLURRY IN THE
CENTRAL VALLEY LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY. SKIES WILL STAY
CLOUDY TONIGHT BUT SHOULD HAVE SOME BREAKS TUESDAY AS THE LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE MOVES OUT. LOWS TONIGHT WILL DROP SLOWLY TO AROUND
FREEZING IN THE VALLEYS AND AS LOW AS MID 20S AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS.
WITH SOME WIND AND LOW CLOUDS FOG SHOULD NOT BE A PROBLEM. HIGHS
TUESDAY WILL BE NEAR NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR IN THE 40S TO
NEAR 50.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...A NUMBER OF 
RE-ENFORCING SHORT WAVES MOVING THROUGH THE AREA OVER THE NEXT FEW 
DAYS.  SOME SMALL AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE OFF AND ON ASSOCIATED WITH 
THESE AND SOME SNOW FLURRIES ARE POSSIBLE AS THEY MOVE THROUGH.  
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN COOL INTO THE WEEKEND AS THESE SHORT WAVES 
ARE EMBEDDED IN A LARGER UPPER TROUGH WITH STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW.  
HELD CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE WITH SOME MINOR DEVIATIONS ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  PRECIPITATION NUMBERS THERE MUCH LOWER THAN 
EXISTING FORECAST AND FUDGED UPWARD TO ACCOUNT FOR THESE 
DIFFERENCES.

FOR THE MOUNTAINS EXPIRE AT 3 PM. MODELS INDICATE THAT TEMPS WILL 
STAY ABOVE FREEZING TONIGHT...SO WILL MENTION ONLY RAIN FOR TONIGHT. 
A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY

FORECAST THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. AS FOR TEMPS...MOS GUIDANCE IS IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD AND LOOKS REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...CONFIDENCE REMAINS QUITE LOW 
FOR EXTENDED PERIOD...MAINLY IN TRACK AND TIMING OF SYSTEM MOVING 
THROUGH THE REGION AROUND THE WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY TIME FRAME. CURRENT 
GFS RUN NOW TAKES MAIN LIFT AND MOISTURE TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST. WILL 
KEEP POPS FOR THIS PERIOD BUT WILL LOWER SLIGHTLY. MODELS HINT AT A 
COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED... 
STRONGEST OF WHICH IS PROGGED INTO THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE 
AND TRACK OF SYSTEM UNIMPRESSIVE AND WILL HAVE ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS NORTH AND EAST. THE REST OF THE EXTENDED WILL KEEP DRY.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A HIGH PRESSURE AREA WEDGED ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER THE GULF COASTAL REGION. TEMPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA HAVE 
REMAINED WARM AND GENERALLY ABOVE FREEZING THIS MORNING. CALLS FROM 
AROUND THE FORECAST AREA REVEAL THAT SOME RAIN MIXED WITH SLEET IS 
STILL BEING OBSERVED ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TN. 
ALSO...REPORTS FROM THE SMOKIES INDICATE THAT TEMPS AT NEWFOUND GAP 
ARE BELOW FREEZING. THINK THAT A SUB-FREEZING AIR MASS OVER THE 
CAROLINAS IS SPILLING OVER THE MOUNTAINS THROUGH SOME OF THE PASSES. 
WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL KEEP THE WINTER WX ADVISORY GOING 
ACROSS THE FAR EASTERN TN BORDER AREAS...BUT CANCEL IT ELSEWHERE. 
TEMPS SHOULD CONTINUE TO SLOWLY RISE THROUGHOUT THE DAY AS A WARM 
AIR ADVECTION PATTERN CONTINUES. WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST 
THIS MORNING MAINLY TO FRESHEN UP THE WORDING...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A 
LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 210810
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EST SUN JAN 21 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ALTHOUGH AREA RADARS SHOW PRECIP 
OVER MUCH OF THE AREA...VERY LITTLE IS REACHING THE GROUND AT THIS 
TIME. MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT REMAINS CONFINED TO ABOVE 5 KFT. 
SURFACE TEMPS HAVE BEEN HOLDING ABOVE FREEZING IN MOST LOCATIONS 
EXCEPT SW VA AND NE TN...BUT AS THE LOW LEVELS COOL FROM 
EVAPORATION...TEMPS WILL LIKELY DROP A LITTLE. THE WET-BULB ZERO 
LINE IS CURRENTLY LOCATED FROM MORGAN COUNTY TO KNOXVILLE THROUGH 
BLOUNT COUNTY...SO THERE IS STILL SOME ICING POTENTIAL NORTH OF THIS 
LINE. THE 00Z OHX SOUNDING INDICATES A DEEP ABOVE-FREEZING 
LAYER...WHICH MAY ALSO COOL SLIGHTLY FROM EVAPORATION. THE WARM NOSE 
AND SURFACE TEMPS SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL RAIN IN THE SOUTHERN 
AND CENTRAL VALLEY. PRECIP IN THE ADVISORY AREA IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN 
AS LIGHT RAIN AND/OR SNOW WITH A QUICK CHANGE TO SLEET AND THEN 
FREEZING RAIN AS WARM ADVECTION IN THE 850-700 MB LAYER INCREASES. 
THE SURFACE WET-BULB ZERO LINE RETREATS QUICKLY AND SHOULD BE NORTH 
AND EAST OF OUR AREA BY NOON. THUS BY THE AFTERNOON THE CHANCES OF 
FROZEN PRECIP WILL BE NIL. FORTUNATELY...THE BEST LIFT HOLDS OFF 
UNTIL THE AFTERNOON. HAVE TRIMMED BACK THE END TIME OF THE ADVISORY 
TO NOON. SOME LIGHT SNOW AND SLEET ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE IN 
THE ADVISORY AREA...UP TO ONE INCH...WITH A LIGHT GLAZE OF ICE 
POSSIBLE ON TREES AND ELEVATED SURFACES. DO NOT EXPECT MAJOR 
PROBLEMS WITH ROADS...BUT CAUTION IS ADVISED. THE RAIN SHOULD TAPER 
OFF AFTER 00Z...AND STRONG MIDLEVEL DRYING SHOULD END ALL PRECIP 
BEFORE SUNRISE. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKS 
INTO THE REGION ON MONDAY...MOISTURE LIMITED...WILL CARRY ONLY 20 
POPS FOR RAIN FOR MONDAY.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE APPROACHES ON MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  BEST MOISTURE TO THE NORTH...WILL KEEP 20 POPS 
GOING MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY FOR OUR NORTHERN ZONES.  A FRONT 
MOVES INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY AND LINGERS INTO THURSDAY.  
MOISTURE AND LIFT INCREASES WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS SURFACE LOW NEARS.  
WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY MORNING AND CHANCE 
POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY.  THICKNESSES INDICATE 
A WINTER MIX ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT THEN ALL SNOW ON 
THURSDAY.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON FRIDAY.  GFS INDICATING ANOTHER 
FRONT APPROACHING ON SATURDAY...MOISTURE LIMITED...SO WILL KEEP 
SATURDAY DRY FOR NOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...NO CHANGES PLANNED AT THIS TIME. AREA RADAR MOSAIC

AFTER MIDNIGHT. STILL EXPECTING SOME LIGHT FREEZING PRECIP MAINLY
IN THE NORTHERN TIER OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS SUCH...CURRENT
FORECAST APPEARS REASONABLE AND NO CHANGES ARE WARRANTED AT THIS
TIME.

LCM









000 
FXUS64 KMRX 201933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EST SAT JAN 20 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM BEGINNING TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE 
TEXAS GULF COASTAL REGION...WITH HIGH CLOUDS STREAMING NORTHEAST 
TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. THE GFS AND WRF MODELS HAVE EVIDENTLY 
AGREED TO DISAGREE WITH THE TIMING OF PRECIP FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY 
MORNING. THE GFS MODEL STILL REVEALS A FASTER SOLUTION AND BRINGS 
PRECIP INTO THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. THE WRF MODEL INDICATES 
THAT PRECIP WILL NOT BEGIN UNTIL AFTER SUNRISE SUNDAY MORNING... 
WHICH WOULD LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF WINTRY PRECIP FOR THE AREA AS TEMPS 
SLOWLY WARM DURING THE DAY. WILL CONTINUE ALONG THE PATH OF LEAST 
REGRET BY STICKING TO THE FASTER GFS SOLUTION...AND MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF WINTRY PRECIP LATE TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING. BOTH 
MODELS STILL INDICATE THAT A STRONG SOUTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW 
(IN THE 850 TO 700 MB LAYER) WILL PUNCH WARM AIR ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA...SO THIS IS A SITUATION WHERE THE MOUNTAINS SHOULD WARM UP 
QUICKER THAN THE VALLEYS. THIS WARMER LAYER ALOFT WILL COMPLICATE 
PRECIP TYPES IN THE MORNING...AS THE COLDER AIR IN THE VALLEYS IS 
SLOW TO RETREAT. IT STILL APPEARS THAT TEMPS WILL RISE ABOVE 
FREEZING BY THE AFTERNOON...BUT OF COURSE...SOUTHWEST VA WILL BE THE 
LAST TO WARM ABOVE FREEZING AND CHANGE OVER TO RAIN (PROBABLY NOT 
UNTIL EARLY AFTERNOON). OVERALL...IT APPEARS THAT A LIGHT SLEET AND 
FREEZING RAIN MIXTURE (WITH LIGHT ICE ACCUMULATIONS) WILL BE 
POSSIBLE OVER THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA 
OVERNIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING...ALTHOUGH IT SHOULD BE SHORT-LIVED. 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...PRECIP WILL LIKELY BEGIN AS 
LIGHT SNOW SINCE A DEEPER SUB-FREEZING AIR MASS WILL RESIDE IN THESE 
NORTHERN AREAS. SOME MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS (OF 1 TO 2 INCHES) 
WILL BE POSSIBLE (MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA)...BEFORE THE SNOW 
GRADUALLY CHANGES OVER TO SLEET AND THEN FREEZING RAIN. SOME MINOR 
ICE ACCUMULATIONS (OF 1/10 INCH OR LESS) WILL BE POSSIBLE BEFORE THE 
FREEZING RAIN CHANGES OVER TO RAIN AS TEMPS WARM ABOVE FREEZING. AS 
FOR TEMPS...TONIGHTS MINS REMAIN TRICKY TO FORECAST...SINCE CLOUD 
COVER SHOULD HELP TO KEEP TEMPS FROM FALLING TOO QUICKLY...BUT 
EVAPORATIVE COOLING PROCESSES (DUE TO THE VERY DRY AIR MASS IN 
PLACE) AT THE ONSET OF THE PRECIP WILL LIKELY CAUSE SOME ADDITIONAL 
COOLING (WHICH IS USUALLY NOT FULLY ACCOUNTED FOR BY THE MODELS). 
WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN FOR TEMPS TO BE AROUND FREEZING 
IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS...BUT DEFINITELY ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN AREAS. WITH LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS EXPECTED IN THE MORNING... 
THINK THAT AN ADVISORY WILL HANDLE THE SITUATION. NOT SURE ABOUT 
WHETHER THE SMOKIES WILL NEED AN ADVISORY (DUE TO THE STRONG WARM 
AIR ADVECTION EXPECTED ALOFT)...BUT AT THIS POINT...WILL PLAN TO 
KEEP THINGS AS IS. ONCE TEMPS RISE ABOVE FREEZING ON SUNDAY...THINK 
THAT RAIN WILL BE THE PREDOMINATE PRECIP TYPE THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. 
A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ON MONDAY WILL LIKELY KEEP CLOUDS AND A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PRECIP IN THE FORECAST THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW POPS 
FAR NORTH ON TUESDAY AS A WEAK WAVE TRACKS THROUGH TO OUR NORTH. 
CONFIDENCE IS QUITE LOW FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH 
POOR MODEL CONSISTENCY. NEXT SYSTEM LOOKS TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION 
AROUND THE THURSDAY TIME FRAME. MOISTURE AND LIFT LOOKS MUCH MORE 
SIGNIFICANT THIS RUN AND TIMING AND POSITION STILL IN DOUBT. WILL 
INCREASE POPS A BIT FOR THIS SYSTEM AND HAVE POPS OF 20-40 PERCENT 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY FOR A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 192013
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST FRI JAN 19 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE OZARKS...WITH HIGH 
CLOUDS CONTINUING TO STREAM ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DUE TO AN 
ACTIVE SOUTHERN JET STREAM. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE 
SOUTHWEST IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG THE GULF 
COAST ON SATURDAY. THE GFS AND WRF MODELS STILL INDICATE SOME TIMING 
DIFFERENCES WITH THE ONSET OF PRECIP FOR THE FORECAST AREA...WITH 
THE GFS MODEL REVEALING A FASTER SOLUTION BY BEGINNING PRECIP ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TN LATE SATURDAY EVENING. WRF MODEL INDICATES THAT PRECIP 
WILL NOT BEGIN UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING...WHICH WOULD LIMIT THE 
AMOUNT OF WINTRY PRECIP FOR THE AREA AS TEMPS SLOWLY WARM DURING THE 
DAY. THINK THAT THE BEST THING TO DO AT THIS POINT IS GO WITH THE 
GFS SOLUTION (PATH OF LEAST REGRET)...AND MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF 
WINTRY PRECIP ON SUNDAY MORNING. BOTH MODELS INDICATE A STRONG AND 
WARM SOUTHWESTERLY 850 MB PUNCHING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...SO 
THIS IS A SITUATION WHERE THE MOUNTAINS SHOULD WARM UP QUICKER THAN 
THE VALLEYS. ALSO...THIS WARM 850 MB LAYER WILL COMPLICATE PRECIP 
TYPES IN THE MORNING...AS THE COLDER AIR IN THE VALLEYS IS SLOW TO 
RETREAT. OVERALL...FEEL THAT RAIN WILL DEVELOP MOST EVERYWHERE BY 
LATE MORNING...AS TEMPS SLOWLY RISE. BUT OF COURSE...SOUTHWEST VA 
WILL BE THE LAST TO WARM AND CHANGE OVER TO RAIN...PROBABLY NOT 
UNTIL EARLY AFTERNOON. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS THAT A LIGHT FREEZING 
RAIN/SLEET MIXTURE WILL DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL 
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...THERE IS STILL SOME 
QUESTION ABOUT HOW COLD TEMPS WILL ACTUALLY BE BY SUNRISE SUNDAY 
MORNING IN THE SOUTHERN AND EVEN CENTRAL AREAS. EVAPORATIVE COOLING 
PROCESSES WILL OCCUR DURING THE ONSET OF THE PRECIP...SINCE A VERY 
DRY AIR MASS WILL BE IN PLACE. WITH THIS IN MIND...THINK THAT SOME 
LIGHT ICE ACCUMULATIONS AROUND A TENTH OF AN INCH OR LESS MAY 
DEVELOP SUNDAY MORNING ACROSS MAINLY THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. IN ADDITION...THERE MAY BE SOME LIGHT 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA OF AN INCH 
OR TWO. ALL OF THIS TRANSLATES INTO ADVISORY CRITERIA AMOUNTS...SO 
WILL CONTINUE WITH A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THE 
SITUATION. ONCE TEMPS RISE ABOVE FREEZING ON SUNDAY...THINK THAT 
RAIN WILL BE THE PREDOMINATE PRECIP TYPE THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEATHER SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO 
PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION ON MONDAY...PROVIDING SOME LINGERING 
SHOWERS DURING THE MORNING HOURS. A WEAK WAVE TRACKS THROUGH TO OUR 
NORTH EARLY TUESDAY...MOISTURE AND LIFT QUITE LIMITED AND WILL HAVE 
ONLY SOME LOW POPS NORTHERN ZONES. ANOTHER WEAK WAVE MOVES THROUGH 
AROUND THE THURSDAY TIME FRAME AND WILL AGAIN KEEP POPS LOW AND 
CONFINED TO NORTHERN LOCATIONS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN    28  47  34  46  41 /   0   0  40 100  70 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN      24  45  31  42  38 /   0   0  30 100  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN              25  45  31  42  39 /   0   0  30 100  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN     20  42  27  40  35 /   0   0  30 100  80

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 182015
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST THU JAN 18 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...LIGHT SNOW AND OR
FLURRIES POSSIBLE TONIGHT AS THE COLD AIR FILTERS INTO THE REGION
AND THE CLOUDS SLOWLY ERODE. CLOUDS MOSTLY GONE BY MID-DAY FRIDAY
THEN BEGIN A RETURN SATURDAY AFTERNOON IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT
WEATHER MAKER. BOTH GFS AND NAM CLOSE ON HANDLING THE NEXT SYSTEM
AND LEANED MAINLY TOWARDS GFS. SATURDAY NIGHT WILL SEE A BEGINNING
OF THE PRECIPITATION IN THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE FORECAST AREA
SLOWLY SPREADING ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA.  

THE BIG ISSUE WITH THE SYSTEM SATURDAY NIGHT...AND MOVING INTO THE
LONG TERM PERIOD...WILL BE HOW QUICKLY THE PRECIPITATION SPREADS IN
BEFORE TEMPERATURES BEGIN TO WARM. HAVE ISSUED A SPECIAL WEATHER
STATEMENT DEALING WITH THE UNCERTAINTIES FOR THIS SYSTEM. THE BIG
ISSUE IS THAT UNCERTAINTY BUT THE NECESSITY FOR THE PUBLIC TO BE
AWARE OF THE POSSIBLE THREAT.

UNDERCUT LOWS ON SATURDAY NIGHT A LITTLE DUE TO THE EVAPORATIONAL
COOLING THAT LIKELY WILL OCCUR AS THE PRECIPITATION BEGINS.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WEATHER SYSTEM MOVING THROUGH 
THE REGION ON SUNDAY.  TIMING OF SYSTEM WILL BE FACTOR IN PRECIP 
TYPE...AS WILL TEMP PROFILE.  A WIDE RANGE OF PRECIP TYPES WILL BE 
POSSIBLE AS THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH.  AT THIS TIME...LOOKS LIKE 
CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEY WILL SEE A MIX OF SLEET/FREEZING RAIN EARLY 
MORNING...TURNING TO MAINLY RAIN FOR THE AFTERNOON.  PRECIP WILL 
MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN VALLEY DURING THE MORNING...PROVIDING MAINLY 
SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN INTO THE AFTERNOON...SLOWLY MIXING 
WITH/CHANGING TO RAIN LATE IN THE DAY.  HIGHER TERRAIN GENERALLY A 
MIX OF OF SNOW AND SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN.  A MIX OF PRECIP SHOULD 
DIMINISH IN COVERAGE SUNDAY NIGHT WITH SOME LINGERING INTO MONDAY.  
CONFIDENCE IS LOW FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED.  CURRENT THINKING IS 
WE WILL BE GENERALLY BETWEEN SYSTEMS TUESDAY WITH UNSETTLED WEATHER 
RETURNING FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER 
THAN GUIDANCE MOST PERIODS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST THU JAN 18 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OFF THE 
SOUTHEAST GA COAST...WITH ABOVE-FREEZING TEMPS ACROSS MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA EXCEPT FOR A FEW SPOTS IN SOUTHWEST VA. SATELLITE 
IMAGES REVEAL THAT AN ACTIVE SOUTHERN JET STREAM WILL CONTINUE TO 
BRING AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON. AREA RADARS REVEAL THAT THE BULK OF PRECIP REMAINS EAST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA...MAINLY OVER THE CENTRAL CAROLINAS...WITH ONLY 
VERY LIGHT ECHOES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. IN FACT...MOST OF THIS 
PRECIP IS PROBABLY NOT REACHING THE GROUND WITH A DRY LOW-LEVEL AIR 
MASS IN PLACE. MODELS INDICATE THAT PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
COASTAL LOW WILL REMAIN EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON...AS 
THE LOW MOVES NORTHEAST UP THE CAROLINA COAST. 

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MENTION OF 
MORNING PRECIP...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST 
TRENDS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 180853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 AM EST THU JAN 18 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN ISSUE FOR THE SHORT TERM IS 
POPS IN THE FIRST PERIOD. PLUME OF SOUTHERN STREAM MOISTURE 
CONTINUES TO STREAM JUST SOUTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA. WEAK NORTHERN 
STREAM SHORT WAVE WILL PULL SOME OF THAT MOISTURE NORTHWARD DURING 
THE FIRST PERIOD. MODEL GUIDANCE DEPICTS RATHER HIGH POPS WITH OUR 
SOUTHEASTERN-MOST ZONES APPROACHING LIKELY CATEGORY. HOWEVER...DRY 
SURFACE LAYER COUPLED WITH UNIMPRESSIVE LIFT AND MOISTURE PROFILES 
SUPPORT THE CONCLUSION THAT THE GUIDANCE POPS ARE SOMEWHAT OVERDONE. 
SREF ALSO SUPPORTS THE LOWER POPS SCENARIO OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. 
THUS WILL CONTINUE TO DOWNPLAY POPS...ESPECIALLY NORTH AND WEST OF 
THE MOUNTAIN ZONES. UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE TROUGH AXIS SWINGS 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING THE SECOND PERIOD. WILL 
CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE NORTHEASTERN AND MOUNTAIN ZONES 
AS A BRIEF PERIOD OF UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS IS POSSIBLE.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...NO MAJOR CHANGES MADE FOR
THESE PERIODS...ALTHO AS TYPICAL...MODELS SHOW SLIGHT VARIANCES
FROM RUN TO RUN CONCERNING THE POTENTIALLY MORE SIGNIFICANT WINTERY
EVENT FOR SUNDAY INTO EARLY MONDAY. 18/00Z GFS RUN HAS TRENDED JUST
A BIT WARMER AND FASTER WITH PRECIPITATION (PCPN) DEVELOPING OVER
THE GULF COAST AND LOWER MISS VALLEY REGIONS. DID ADD SOME LOW POPS
JUST BEFORE DAYBREAK SUNDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. WARMER
MODEL RUN STILL OFFERS A MIX OF WINTRY PCPN TYPES...WITH GFS
SOUNDINGS INDICATING MAINLY RAIN OR SNOW EARLY SUNDAY FOR SE TN/SW
NC...GENERALLY A MIX OF RAIN/SNOW/SLEET FOR CENTRAL VALLEY AND
SMOKIES...AND PRIMARILY SNOW OR SLEET FOR NE PLATEAU/SW VA/NE TN
AREAS. THE WARMER AIR COULD POSE A LIGHT FREEZING RAIN THREAT EARLY
IN ANY SHELTERED VALLEYS...BUT OF COURSE THIS EVENT IS STILL TOO
FAR OFF TO JUSTIFY DETAILING PCPN TYPES...SO DECIDED TO STICK CLOSE
TO PCPN TYPES AS EARLIER ADVERTISED FOR LATER SUNDAY INTO MONDAY
MORNING. POPS AT HIGH CHANCE OR LOW LIKELY ALSO GOOD FOR NOW.

OTHERWISE...POPS LIMITED TO MAINLY NRN AREAS AND SMOKIES FRIDAY
LOOKED GOOD...BUT DID INCREASE WIND SPEEDS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS
NEAR RNK AND GSP ON FRIDAY. ENSEMBLES AND 18/00Z GFS SHOWING A
SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT TO AFFECT THE REGION TUESDAY...SO
POPS WERE ADDED TO ANY DRY AREAS FOR TUESDAY...WHICH ALSO BLENDED
BETTER WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES. CLOUDS...PCPN AND COLD AIR
ADVECTION AT TIMES MADE ME QUESTION THE WISDOM IN BLINDLY
POPULATING MAX TEMPS WITH NEW 18/00Z GFSX MOS VALUES...SO JUST SOME
TWEAKS ONE WAY OR ANOTHER FOR NOW.

WILL FRESHEN OUR SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT NEXT...WITH ALL TEXT AND
WEB PRODUCTS ALREADY ISSUED FOR THIS PACKAGE. THANKS TO NEIGHBORING
NWS OFFICES FOR COORDINATION


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             45  34  47  26  45 /  30   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  42  30  44  25  43 /  30  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       44  30  45  24  45 /  10  10  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 172009
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST WED JAN 17 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND 
MID ATLANTIC STATES...EXTENDING ACROSS MOST OF THE EASTERN PART OF 
THE NATION. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL EXTENSIVE CLOUDINESS ACROSS THE 
DEEP SOUTH...AS AN ACTIVE SOUTHERN JET STREAM CONTINUES FROM OVER 
THE EASTERN PACIFIC. GFS AND WRF MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
DEVELOPING A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OFF THE SOUTHEAST GA COAST LATE 
TONIGHT...WITH A VERY DRY AIR MASS REMAINING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
ISENTROPIC LIFT IS PROGGED TO INCREASE OVER GA AND THE CAROLINAS 
LATE TONIGHT...AS A COLD AIR DAMMING WEDGE DEVELOPS OVER THE 
CAROLINAS. THE NORTHWESTERN EDGE OF THIS PRECIP IS EXPECTED TO BRUSH 
SOUTHWEST NC AND FAR EASTERN TN TOWARDS SUNRISE...BUT PRECIP AMOUNTS 
SHOULD REMAIN LIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A WARM 850 MB LAYER 
ABOVE FREEZING AT SUNRISE...SO THINK THAT ANY PRECIP WOULD BE IN THE 
FORM OF RAIN OR FREEZING RAIN. WITH THE DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE... 
EXPECT SOME EVAPORATIVE COOLING OF THE ATMOSPHERE AS PRECIP BEGINS. 
BOTH MODELS INDICATE THAT WET BULB TEMPS WILL BE BELOW FREEZING 
AROUND SUNRISE ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA...BUT TEMPS SHOULD 
QUICKLY RISE ABOVE FREEZING BEFORE NOON. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT MENTIONING LIGHT ICING 
POSSIBLE IN SOME AREAS OF SOUTHWEST NC AND FAR EASTERN TN TOWARDS 
SUNRISE. A COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO QUICKLY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING. MOISTURE IS EXPECTED 
TO BE LIMITED WITH THIS FRONT...SO WILL KEEP ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR SNOW ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...FORECAST AREA SHOULD BE 
DRY ON SATURDAY AWAITING NEXT SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WHICH ADVANCES 
TOWARD THE MIDWEST SATURDAY NIGHT. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE EMERGES NEAR 
THE LOUISIANA COAST SUNDAY MORNING AND MOVES NORTH NORTHEAST TO THE 
CAROLINA COAST BY 12Z MONDAY. DIDNT TRY TO GET TOO FANCY WITH 
PREDICTING NUMEROUS VARIED PRECIP TYPES AS ATMOSPHERE COLD ENOUGH 
FOR FROZEN PRECIPITATION MAINLY SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MID DAY MONDAY. 
RAISED POPS FOR THE EVENT FOLLOWING THE GUIDANCE PROVIDED BY GFS. 
USED GOOD CHANCE FOR SUNDAY AND LIKELY POP FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AS 
SURFACE LOW/SHORTWAVE TROF BUILD ACROSS THE REGION. HELD ONTO SOME 
CHANCE AND SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITIES FOR RAIN/SNOW INTO DAYTIME 
PERIOD MONDAY. NEXT FEATURE OF INTEREST IS WEAK WAVE AND SURFACE 
FRONT DUE ON TUESDAY WHICH APPEARS TO IMPACT MAINLY NORTHERN 
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH EMPHASIS IN THE TERRAIN SO USED 
SLIGHT AND CHANCE POPS FOR RAIN/SNOW FOR THIS FEATURE WHICH DEPARTS 
BY LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON LEAVING FORECAST DRY REMAINDER OF EXTENDED.
STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO MEX MOS CONCERNING TEMPS.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 170902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 AM EST WED JAN 17 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...GENERALLY DRY WEATHER EXPECTED 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS SOUTHERN STREAM MOISTURE GETS SHUNTED 
SOUTH TEMPORARILY PER MODEL/SREF CONSENSUS. SHORT WAVE RIDGE WILL 
TRANSLATE THROUGH THE REGION ERODING LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE AS IT 
APPROACHES. HOWEVER...PROJECTED UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE WILL LIKELY 
KEEP SCATTERED HIGH CLOUDS OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA PRECLUDING 
COMPLETELY CLEAR SKY CONDITIONS. MAIN CONCERN CENTERS AROUND LATE 
SECOND PERIOD WHEN SOUTHERN STREAM MOISTURE WORKS BACK INTO THE 
SOUTHERN TIER. MODELS AND SREF DEPICT COASTAL FEATURE FORMING DURING 
THIS TIME FRAME WITH LIGHT PRECIP NUDGING UP AGAINST OUR 
SOUTHEASTERN COUNTIES. HOWEVER...UNDERCUT GFS GUIDANCE POPS SOMEWHAT 
GIVEN EXPECTED DRY AIR IN THE LOW LEVELS WHICH WILL HAVE TO BE 
OVERCOME. FOR TEMPS...HAVE NO REASON TO SIGNIFICANTLY DEVIATE FROM 
GFS GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SOME FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT
CHANGES MADE FOR THURSDAY...BUT CLEARLY THE MOST INTERESTING AND
POTENTIALLY SIGNIFICANT WEATHER EVENT IS STILL SHAPING UP FOR
SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. AN SPS WILL BE ISSUED TO HIGHLIGHT THIS
POSSIBLE WINTER WEATHER EVENT.

BOTH 17/00Z GFS AND NAM-WRF MODELS DEVELOPING WEAK SURFACE TROUGH
OR LOW PRESSURE JUST OFF THE SE COAST WED NIGHT INTO THU...WITH
SOME SLIGHT DIFFS ON HOW FAR WEST AND NORTHWEST PRECIPITATION FROM
THIS FEATURE SPREADS. SREF LENDS A SLIGHT BIT OF CREDIBILITY TO THE
MORE AGRESSIVE NAM-WRF THAN DRIER GFS LOOK FOR OUR AREA...ALTHO QPF
AS FAR W/NW AS OUR AREA MAY NOT AMOUNT TO MUCH AT ALL. THUS...WE
COMPROMISED SOME FOR LATE WED NIGHT INTO THU...AND INTRODUCED
SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR ALL BUT OUR NE PLATEAU COUNTIES
INTO LEE AND WISE COUNTIES OF SW VA. PCPN-TYPE FROM THICKNESS TOOL
CLOSELY FOLLOWED FOR TYPE OF PRECIPITATION (PCPN).

VERY TEMPTED TO REMOVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FROM FRI AND FRI NIGHT
...AS I DONT SEE MUCH FORCING FOR PCPN (OTHER THAN SOME LOW LEVEL
UPSLOPE IN A FEW AREAS...MAINLY SW VA AND NE TN). HOWEVER...OPTED
TO SPEND MORE TIME ON SUNDAY INTO MONDAY PERIODS AND LET DAY SHIFT
TAKE ANOTHER LOOK AT THE EARLIER PERIODS OF THE EXTENDED.

OTHERWISE...THE MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM IS STILL ADVERTISED COMING
INTO PLAY BY SUNDAY MORNING. GFS SEEMS CONSISTENT FROM 24 HOURS IN
DEVELOPING A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY
AND TRACKING IT NE TOWARD THE CAROLINAS AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON
SUNDAY NIGHT. COLD AIR IN PLACE IN THE LOW LEVELS...AS WELL AS
PARTIAL THICKNESSES...OFFER A WINTRY MIX WITH SOME POTENTIAL FOR
SIGNIFICANT SNOWS FURTHER NORTH INTO OUR FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...
THIS IS A DAY 5 EVENT...SO MUCH TIME FOR THE TRACK...STRENGTH AND
TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM TO CHANGE.

POP AND WEATHER GRIDS CHANGED TO BRING THE PCPN IN SLIGHTLY EARLIER
ON SUNDAY...AND TEMPS WERE ADJUSTED A BIT FOR MOST DAYS AND NIGHTS
IN THE EXTENDED IN LINE WITH LATEST GFSX MOS AND NEIGHBORS UPDATED
GRIDS.

.DISCUSSION...

CLOUDS SHOULD ERODE FROM THE TOP DOWN AND END ANY REMAINING PRECIP.
THE LOW LEVEL WINDS WILL ALSO VEER TO A MORE NORTHERLY DIRECTION
AFTER 06Z...LESS FAVORABLE FOR UPSLOPE ENHANCEMENT. WILL CONTINUE
A MENTION OF FLURRIES IN SW VA...SW NC...AND THE TN MOUNTAINS...BUT
NOTHING MEASURABLE IS EXPECTED SO POPS WILL BE REMOVED.

DRY.  ANOTHER WEAK FRONT APPROACHES ON TUESDAY...BUT MOISTURE IS

FXUS64 KMRX 160909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
409 AM EST TUE JAN 16 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...OPERATIONAL MODELS AND SREF ARE 
IN RELATIVELY GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. COLD FRONT 
CURRENTLY MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA WITH LIGHT PRECIP 
LINGERING BEHIND FRONT. MODEL TIME HEIGHTS DEPICT DRY AIR INTRUSION 
IN THE MID-LEVELS WITH LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE PERSISTING THROUGH THE 
FIRST PERIOD. ANTICIPATE CLOUDS TO PERSIST BUT PRECIP DIMINISHING 
THROUGH THE DAY. NON-IDEAL UPSLOPE FLOW REGIME AS LOW-LEVEL FLOW IS 
PROJECTED TO BE MAINLY NORTHERLY. WILL CONTINUE TO DOWNPLAY 
SNOWFALL. CLOUDS EXPECTED TO BEGIN TO BREAK UP DURING THE SECOND 
PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STUCK CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE VALUES.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS MODEL AND ENSEMBLES
IN FAIR AGREEMENT WITH NAM-WRF MODEL UNTIL THURSDAY...THEN SOME
UNCERTAINTY DEVELOPS IN THE PATTERN EXPECTED FROM THURSDAY INTO THE
WEEKEND. HOWEVER...BOTH GFS AND NAM-WRF GENERALLY AGREE ON WARM AIR
ADVECTION DEVELOPING OVER FL-GA-CAROLINAS AND AN AREA OF LIGHT RAIN
DEVELOPING AND SPREADING NE. MOST OF THIS RAIN IS PROGGED TO STAY
SOUTH AND EAST OF OUR FORECAST AREA...THUS DECIDED TO KEEP OUR
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. 

NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE FOR FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT...OTHER
THAN TO SLIGHTLY ADJUST TEMPS IN LINE WITH 16/00Z GFS MOS. THESE
PERIODS LOOK MOSTLY DRY WITH A VERY TOKENISH 20 PERCENT POP
SUFFICIENT IN MOST AREAS.

THE MORE TROUBLESOME CHANGES HAD TO BE MADE FOR SUNDAY INTO MONDAY
...WHICH WERE NECESSITATED FOR A WETTER TREND IN GFS MODEL FOR THESE
PERIODS (ACCEPTED BY GENERALLY ALL NEIGHBORING OFFICES). A LARGE
AREA OF WARM AIR ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT IS NOW PROGGED TO
DEVELOP ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON SUNDAY AND SPREAD NE 
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. THIS IS FASTER THAN THE 850 MB TEMPS CAN
RECOVER ABOVE ZERO DEGREES CELSIUS...MAINLY ACROSS NE TN AND SWRN
VA AREAS. BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS AND SURFACE TEMPS WOULD APPEAR TO BE
COLD ENOUGH TO POSSIBLY ALLOW A WINTRY MIX TO OCCUR. DID NOT PLAY
THIS UP TOO MUCH JUST YET...BUT DID ALLOW FOR SOME 20 TO 40 PERCENT
POPS SUNDAY NIGHT AND A MENTION OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN POSSIBLE.
DAY SHIFT CAN LOOK THIS OVER AGAIN...CHECK FOR CONTINUITY...AND
POSSIBLY INCREASE POPS FOR MONDAY ABOVE THE SLIGHT CHANCE VALUES.

FXUS64 KMRX 150933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
433 AM EST MON JAN 15 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER SRN INDIANA THIS MORNING WITH TRAILING COLD FRONT STILL WELL TO 
OUR WEST (HAVING JUST EASED EAST OF MEM TO DYR LINE). INCREDIBLY 
MILD 08Z TEMPS ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA...RANGING FROM LOW 60S AT 
CHA AND RHP TO A COOLER 46 DEGS AT TRI.

ONE MISSING WEATHER ITEM THIS MORNING...LIKE PAST FEW MORNINGS...IS 
ANY RAINFALL. NOT EVEN ANY SPRINKLES LIKELY UNDER STILL MOSTLY MID 
TO HIGH CLOUDS...WHICH HAD THINNED OVERNIGHT TO REVEAL STARRY SKIES.
BASED ON CURRENT RADAR AND SATELLITE PICS...DECISION WAS MADE TO 
SLOW DOWN THE ARRIVAL OF ANY SIGNIFICANT RAIN/SHOWERS UNTIL MAINLY 
THIS AFTERNOON (FOLLOWING THE LEAD OF THE 15/00Z NAM MODEL). GFS 
SEEMS MUCH TOO FAST IN SPREADING LIGHT SHOWERS EAST INTO OUR REGION 
THIS MORNING. STILL PAINTED IN HIGH POPS WESTERN MOST AREAS BY THIS 
AFTERNOON...INCLUDING LEE AND WISE COUNTIES OF SWRN VA TO MESH WITH 
HIGHER POPS FROM JKL. THINKING SHOWERS WILL ARRIVE SO LATE TO MTN 
ZONES THAT HIGH CHANCE POPS WILL BE SUFFICIENT IN THOSE EASTERN MOST 
AREAS. A LATE ARRIVAL OF RAIN TODAY...VERY MILD TEMPS TO START THE 
DAY...AND A MIX OF SUNSHINE AT LEAST EARLY...WHICH ALL FAVORS GOING 
ABOVE THE WARMER MOS MAX TEMPS FOR HIGHS TODAY. A FEW SPOTS MIGHT 
EVEN TOP UPPER 60S AGAIN TODAY...BUT STAYED BELOW 70 DEGREES SINCE 
GFS MOS ONLY GAVE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S.

FRONTAL PASSAGE LOOKS TO BE THIS EVENING...THEN POPS SHOULD START TO 
DECREASE FROM THE WEST BY MIDNIGHT. ADJUSTED POP/WX GRIDS TO REFLECT 
THIS AND ALSO BETTER MATCH UP WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES GRIDS. MAY 
GET COLD ENOUGH BY 09Z FOR A CHANGE OVER TO LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OR 
FLURRIES ACROSS OUR NE PLATEAU COUNTIES...AS WELL AS LEE AND WISE 
COUNTIES OF SWRN VA. HIGHER ELEVATIONS MIGHT GET A LIGHT SNOWFALL 
TUESDAY...BUT GROUND WILL BE VERY WARM GIVEN PAST SEVERAL DAYS OF 
MUCH ABOVE NORMAL HIGHS...SO MOST SNOW SHOULD JUST FALL AND MELT.

THANKS TO NEIGHBORING NWS OFFICES FOR COORDINATION THIS MORNING.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...LONG ANTICIPATED COLD FRONT
WILL BRING MUCH COLDER AIR TO THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TUESDAY MORNING. EXPECT HIGH TEMPERATURES TO
BE EARLY IN THE DAY AND NEAR THE LOWS MONDAY NIGHT AS STRONG COLD
AIR ADVECTION BRINGS A MORE WINTER LIKE DAY TO THE FORECAST AREA.
FREEZING LEVELS WILL DROP TO NEAR THE SURFACE NORTH TO AROUND 2000
FEET SOUTH AND THE RAIN SHOWERS WILL CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS IN THE
MOUNTAINS. MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS AS WELL.
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH AND WITH THE WARM TEMPERATURES
THE LAST FEW DAYS THAT SNOW WILL MELT EXCEPT AT ELEVATIONS ABOVE
2500 FEET. EVEN AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS DEEPER MOISTURE WILL BE
DECREASING QUICKLY TUESDAY SO ONLY A DUSTING TO AROUND AN INCH OF
SNOW WILL ACCUMULATE. THE WARM GROUND WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE AT
HIGHER ELEVATIONS TOO. DRY AND COLD AIRMASS SETTLES OVER THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY WEDNESDAY WITH TEMPERATURES ONLY SLOWLY
MODERATING. A WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY BUT EXPECT
PRECIPITATION TO STAY TO THE NORTH AND SOUTH. THE UPPER LEVEL COLD
TROUGH OVER EASTERN CANADA DEEPENS FRIDAY INTO EARLY SATURDAY WITH
SHORT WAVES MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS TO THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE ON THE EDGE OF
THIS FEATURE SO HAVE KEPT THE CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW IN.
TEMPERATURES WILL STAY SEASONABLY COOL. HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE
BACK IN SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY WITH SKIES CLEARING.
&&

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...BEST FORCING AND

HAS BEEN HOLDING UP EASTWARD ADVANCE OF FRONTAL BOUONDARY AND

THESE TROUGHS BUT THIS FEATURE REMAINS WELL WEST OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ON MON. SFC PRESSURE FALLS IN ADVANCE OF THE JET OVER 
OH RVR VLY TNGT AND MON. HAVE BACKED OFF ON PCPN TIMING ONCE AGAIN
EXPECTING BEST CHANCES MON AFTN AND MON NGT. EXPECT FRONTAL PASSAGE 
MON NGT BUT GOOD CAA DOESNT REALLY KICK IN UNTIL TUE. RAIN WILL 
CHANGE TO OR BECOME MIXED WITH SNOW ON TUESDAY WITH SURFACE TEMPS 
TOO WARM FOR ANY SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATION. A NORTHERLY SURGE OF COLD 
AIR WITH A GREAT LAKES SOURCE REGION KEEPS THE CHANCE OF SNOW GOING 
TUESDAY NIGHT MAINLY ACROSS NE TN/SW VA. THIS MAY BE UNDERDONE IN 
MODEL PROGS AND CURRENT FORECAST BUT TOO EARLY TO TELL.  

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  GFS INDICATING A 
WEAK FRONT PUSHING INTO THE REGION ON FRIDAY AND LINGERING INTO 
SATURDAY...MOISTURE LIMITED BUT WILL ADD SLIGHT POPS FOR FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY.  COLD AIR PUSHES IN ON FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL MENTION SNOW 
FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  NOT MUCH MOISTURE AVAILABLE...SO  
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE MINOR AND LIMITED TO THE UPSLOPE AREAS. 
ANOTHER FRONT PUSHING INTO REGION ON SUNDAY...BEST MOISTURE HEADS 
SOUTH OF OUR AREA...WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW.  STAYED NEAR 
MEX/HPC FOR TEMPERATURES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EST SUN JAN 14 2007

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO REDUCE CLOUDS AND POPS FOR TODAY. ALSO
NUDGED MAXS TEMPS UPWARD MAINLY SOUTHERN AREAS. RECORD HIGH TODAY
FOR TRI IS 67 AND MAY BE TIED OR BROKEN. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STILL WAITING FOR RAIN OF ANY 
SORT TO ACTUALLY REACH OUR FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WITH PATTERN 
ALMOST THE SAME OVER PAST FEW DAYS WITH RAIN WELL TO OUR WEST AND 
NORTH. LOWER CLOUD DECK AND VERY LIGHT S TO SW SURFACE WINDS KEEPING 
TEMPS THIS MORNING VERY MILD...ACTUALLY RUNNING NEAR OR ABOVE 
TYPICAL HIGHS FOR MID JANUARY

CONTINUED HIGHER POPS FOR NE PLATEAU AND SW VA TODAY AND TONIGHT...
BUT STILL BELOW LIKELY EXCEPT FOR SLIM AREA NEAR JKL TO MESH WITH 
MUCH OF SE KY (WHERE SOME LIGHT RAIN MAY OCCUR). ELSEWHERE...PREFER 
TO STAY AT OR BELOW A BLEND OF MOS POPS FOR MY AREA...WITH CHANCE 
NORTH TO SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH TODAY. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY MAY DRAW 
CLOSE ENOUGH BY DAYBREAK MONDAY TO WARRANT AN INCREASE IN POPS...
ALTHO THREAT OF MEASURABLE RAIN FOR MOST OF AREA IS STILL UNCERTAIN.
THUS...KEPT POPS MAINLY IN CHANCE CATEGORY. EXPECT LIGHT RAIN 
INSTEAD OF SHOWERS UNTIL MONDAY DAYTIME WHEN COLD FRONT MOVES EAST 
INTO THE REGION.

WARM TEMPS AT 850 MBS AND POSSIBLE BREAKS OR THINNING OF HIGH CLOUDS 
TODAY...THUS WONT GET BRAVE AND UNDERCUT MOS HIGHS FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON. MOS MAX AND MIN TEMPS QUITE CLOSE AND ACCEPTED.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH 
UPPER TROUGH IN SOUTHERN ROCKIES FINALLY PUSHES COLD FRONT THROUGH 
FORECAST AREA MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. RAISED POPS TO CATEGORICAL 
FOR MONDAY AND MOST AREAS MONDAY NIGHT. COLDEST AIR DOES NOT REACH 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL TUESDAY AND CURRENT MODELS ARE 
WARMER THAN PREVIOUS. ONLY EXPECTING A LIGHT DUSTING OF SNOW IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN TUESDAY. THERE MAY BE A FEW 
SNOW SHOWERS AREA WIDE TUESDAY EVENING BUT THE MOISTURE WILL BE 
RAPIDLY EXITING AND DO NOT SEE MORE THAN TRACE AMOUNTS. TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER MONDAY THAN TODAY MAINLY DUE TO 
RAINFALL. LATEST GFS MODEL KEEPS SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE ACROSS SOUTH 
TEXAS WEDNESDAY AS UPPER LEVEL LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN 
ROCKIES AND ANOTHER ONE BEHIND IT DEEPENS THE TROUGH AND BRINGS A 
SURGE OF MOISTURE FROM THE GULF TO THE NORTHEAST OVER THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY. THINK THIS IS A LITTLE FAST GIVEN THE SIZE AND STRENGTH OF 
THE COLD HIGH THAT WILL MOVE IN AT MID WEEK. WARMED TEMPERATURES A 
FEW DEGREES FOR THE THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY PERIOD AND INCREASED 
SKY COVER BUT KEPT IT DRY FOR NOW.

FXUS64 KMRX 131536
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST SAT JAN 13 2007

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO FORECAST. SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL EXIT 
AREA TO THE NE THIS AFTERNOON. REDUCED PCPN CHC AND CLOUD COVER 
SLIGHTLY FOR THIS AFTERNOON. ALSO NUDGED MAXS TEMPS UPWARD. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PATTERN HAS CHANGED VERY LITTLE IF 
ANY OVER PAST 24 HOURS...WITH RIDGING STILL QUITE STRONG ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEAST STATES. BEST WARM AIR ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT 
REMAINS WELL TO OUR WEST AND NORTHWEST THIS MORNING...AS WELL AS 
LATER TODAY AND GENERALLY TONIGHT ALSO. SURFACE DEW POINT TEMPS HAVE 
RISEN SLIGHTLY...BUT 07Z VALUES WERE STILL RUNNING SEVERAL DEGREES 
BELOW ANY OF THE LATEST MOS GUIDANCE VALUES. VERY LIGHT WINDS THE 
RULE AND 07Z SURFACE TEMPS WERE RUNNING SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW GRID 
VALUES AND MOS AT MOST LOCATIONS. THESE ADJUSTMENTS WERE MADE TO 
GRIDS WITH DEW POINT TEMPS LOWERED BY A FEW DEGREES IN GRIDS FOR 
TODAY.

GIVEN THE LACK OF FORCING AND INSTABILITY...ONCE AGAIN THE POPS WERE 
TRIMMED BACK FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. GAVE A TIGHTER GRADIENT FROM 
NORTH TO SOUTH...WITH HIGHEST VALUES FOR OUR NE PLATEAU AND SW VA 
COUNTIES TO MESH WITH HIGHER POPS FROM JKL (NWS JACKSON KY). THINK 
THAT ANY RAIN AMOUNTS WILL BE VERY LIGHT...THUS QPF GRID AMOUNTS 
WERE LOWERED TO NOT MORE THAN A FEW HUNDREDTHS WHERE HIGHEST POPS 
WERE USED. DECIDED TO BE QUITE STINGY WITH LIKELY POPS FOR NOW...SO 
THE LIKELY POPS WERE LIMITED TO A NARROW AREA NEAR KY STATE LINE AND 
JUST FOR TONIGHT.

FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY...EXTENSIVE MID AND HIGH CLOUDINESS SHOULD 
INHIBIT REACHING THE MID 60S TODAY...SO OPTED TO UNDERCUT MOS 
GUIDANCE BY AN AVERAGE OF 2 OR 3 DEGREES. LIGHT SOUTH WINDS OR NEAR 
CALM WINDS AGAIN TONIGHT IN ANY AREAS THAT DECOUPLE...WHICH SHOULD 
FAVOR THE COOLER GFS MOS MIN TEMPS.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS STILL INDICATING RIDGING
HOLDING STRONG ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES SUNDAY WITH MOST OF THE
SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVING NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS NORTHEAST
ACROSS THE LOWER TN VALLEY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. WILL KEEP SLIGHT
CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS AND LOW QPF AMOUNTS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.
EXTENSIVE CLOUDINESS AND SOUTHWEST FLOW AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT
KEEPS MILD TEMPERATURES AROUND THROUGH MONDAY. STILL LOOKS LIKE
MONDAY THE FRONT WILL START MOVING TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA AND
PASS THROUGH DURING THE AFTERNOON. TOTAL QPF AMOUNTS FOR THE NEXT
THREE DAYS MAY ONLY BE ABOUT ONE HALF TO ONE INCH SOUTH AND EAST
AND ONE TO ONE AND ONE HALF INCHES NORTHWEST. COLDER AIR FILTERS IN
BEHIND COLD FRONT LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT BUT EXPECT
TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING. BEST
CHANCE OF SNOW WILL BE TUESDAY MORNING AND WITH WARM GROUND
TEMPERATURES DO NOT THINK SNOW WILL STICK EXCEPT AT HIGHER
ELEVATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS. MOISTURE MOVES OUT QUICKLY LATE
TUESDAY AS ARCTIC AIRMASS MOVES IN. SKIES WILL CLEAR WEDNESDAY AND
CONTINUED DRY AND COLD TEMPERATURES WILL LAST THE REST OF THE WEEK.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

359 AM EST SAT JAN 13 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PATTERN HAS CHANGED VERY LITTLE 
IF ANY OVER PAST 24 HOURS...WITH RIDGING STILL QUITE STRONG ACROSS 
THE SOUTHEAST STATES. BEST WARM AIR ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT 
REMAINS WELL TO OUR WEST AND NORTHWEST THIS MORNING...AS WELL AS 
LATER TODAY AND GENERALLY TONIGHT ALSO. SURFACE DEW POINT TEMPS HAVE 
RISEN SLIGHTLY...BUT 07Z VALUES WERE STILL RUNNING SEVERAL DEGREES 
BELOW ANY OF THE LATEST MOS GUIDANCE VALUES. VERY LIGHT WINDS THE 
RULE AND 07Z SURFACE TEMPS WERE RUNNING SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW GRID 
VALUES AND MOS AT MOST LOCATIONS. THESE ADJUSTMENTS WERE MADE TO 
GRIDS WITH DEW POINT TEMPS LOWERED BY A FEW DEGREES IN GRIDS FOR 
TODAY.

GIVEN THE LACK OF FORCING AND INSTABILITY...ONCE AGAIN THE POPS WERE 
TRIMMED BACK FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. GAVE A TIGHTER GRADIENT FROM 
NORTH TO SOUTH...WITH HIGHEST VALUES FOR OUR NE PLATEAU AND SW VA 
COUNTIES TO MESH WITH HIGHER POPS FROM JKL (NWS JACKSON KY). THINK 
THAT ANY RAIN AMOUNTS WILL BE VERY LIGHT...THUS QPF GRID AMOUNTS 
WERE LOWERED TO NOT MORE THAN A FEW HUNDREDTHS WHERE HIGHEST POPS 
WERE USED. DECIDED TO BE QUITE STINGY WITH LIKELY POPS FOR NOW...SO 
THE LIKELY POPS WERE LIMITED TO A NARROW AREA NEAR KY STATE LINE AND 
JUST FOR TONIGHT.

FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY...EXTENSIVE MID AND HIGH CLOUDINESS SHOULD 
INHIBIT REACHING THE MID 60S TODAY...SO OPTED TO UNDERCUT MOS 
GUIDANCE BY AN AVERAGE OF 2 OR 3 DEGREES. LIGHT SOUTH WINDS OR NEAR 
CALM WINDS AGAIN TONIGHT IN ANY AREAS THAT DECOUPLE...WHICH SHOULD 
FAVOR THE COOLER GFS MOS MIN TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS STILL INDICATING RIDGING
HOLDING STRONG ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES SUNDAY WITH MOST OF THE
SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVING NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS NORTHEAST
ACROSS THE LOWER TN VALLEY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. WILL KEEP SLIGHT
CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS AND LOW QPF AMOUNTS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.
EXTENSIVE CLOUDINESS AND SOUTHWEST FLOW AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT
KEEPS MILD TEMPERATURES AROUND THROUGH MONDAY. STILL LOOKS LIKE
MONDAY THE FRONT WILL START MOVING TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA AND
PASS THROUGH DURING THE AFTERNOON. TOTAL QPF AMOUNTS FOR THE NEXT
THREE DAYS MAY ONLY BE ABOUT ONE HALF TO ONE INCH SOUTH AND EAST
AND ONE TO ONE AND ONE HALF INCHES NORTHWEST. COLDER AIR FILTERS IN
BEHIND COLD FRONT LATE MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT BUT EXPECT
TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING. BEST
CHANCE OF SNOW WILL BE TUESDAY MORNING AND WITH WARM GROUND
TEMPERATURES DO NOT THINK SNOW WILL STICK EXCEPT AT HIGHER
ELEVATIONS IN THE MOUNTAINS. MOISTURE MOVES OUT QUICKLY LATE
TUESDAY AS ARCTIC AIRMASS MOVES IN. SKIES WILL CLEAR WEDNESDAY AND
CONTINUED DRY AND COLD TEMPERATURES WILL LAST THE REST OF THE WEEK.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  64  48  67  52  65 /  20  30  20  40  70 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN    63  50  66  51  64 /  20  30  30  40  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN            63  51  65  51  62 /  40  50  40  50  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   62  45  63  47  64 /  30  40  30  40  70

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST FRI JAN 12 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
TAKING ITS TIME GETTING SITUATED OVER 4 CORNERS REGION EARLY THIS 
WEEKEND. SURFACE RIDGE FROM ATLC INTO GA SLOWLY SUPPRESSES SOUTHWARD 
THROUGH PERIOD. UPPER PATTERN SLIGHTLY MORE AMPLIFIED THAN PREVIOUS 
MODEL RUNS. THIS HOLDS ONTO THE MID LEVEL RIDGING FROM THE SOUTH 
WHICH KEEPS BEST LIFT AND MOISTURE TO THE WEST THROUGH NORTH OF THE 
MRX CWA. HAVE CONTINUED TREND TO REDUCE POPS OVER THE WEEKEND. 
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA BEST BET FOR RAIN. AIRMASS TODAY A LITTLE 
BEHIND ON EXPECTED WAA. VIRGA...LOW DPS ...EVAPORATIVE COOLING HAD 
SOME AFFECT ON TEMP RISE BUT WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMP TREND STILL IN 
PLACE THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.   

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...FRONT PUSHING INTO AREA ON 
MONDAY.  DECENT MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS ACROSS 
THE ENTIRE CWA ON MONDAY.  FRONT LINGERS ACROSS THE AREA ON MONDAY 
NIGHT.  LATEST MODELS DELAY COLD AIR UNTIL TUESDAY...SO WILL KEEP 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR LIQUID PRECIPITATION MONDAY NIGHT. COLDER 
AIR PUSHES IN ON TUESDAY...MAY SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON TUESDAY AND TUESDAY EVENING.  THINK VALLEY WILL 
BE TOO WARM FOR ANY TO MENTION SNOW ON TUESDAY...BUT MAY SEE A MIX 
BY TUESDAY EVENING.  SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL PROBABLY BE TOO WARM 
FOR MUCH ACCUMULATION.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC FOR TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 121518
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EST FRI JAN 12 2007

.DISCUSSION...MRX CWA ON NW EDGE OF SURFACE RIDGE. LOW LEVEL AIRMASS
BEGINNING TO MOISTEN UP. SMALL JET SEGMENT MOVING ENE ACROSS MID TN 
TO SW VA THIS AFTN. THIS IS BEST FOCUS FOR LIFT AND PCPN IN THE NEAR 
TERM. WILL MAKE MINOR ADJUSTMENT TO GRIDS TO DROP SLIGHT CHC PCPN
FOE SE AREAS THROUGH TONIGHT EXPECTING SPRINKLES AT BEST. ALSO TWEAKED
TONIGHTS MINS UP A DEGREE OR TWO. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER AIR PLOTS FROM 12/00Z SHOW 
A LARGE AREA OF WARM AIR ADVECTION RESULTING IN ISENTROPIC LIFT FROM 
THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER EAST INTO WESTERN PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS DEPICT WEAK RETURNS OVER WEST HALF OF TN AND MUCH OF KY 
THIS MORNING...BUT PER SURFACE OBSERVATIONS NOT MUCH PRECIPITATION 
REACHING THE SURFACE. ANOTHER FACTOR LIMITING THE THREAT OF SOME 
MEASURABLE RAINFALL IS THE VERY LOW DEW POINT TEMPERATURES ACROSS E 
TN...SW VA AND SW NC (CURRENTLY HOLDING IN THE 20S AND 30S). LOWERED 
DEW POINT TEMPS TO START TODAY BELOW PREVIOUS GRIDS AND 12/00Z MOS 
...TO BETTER MESH WITH REALITY. KEPT MORNING POPS AT JUST SLIGHT 
CHANCE AND LIMITED TO NE PLATEAU AND WESTERN MOST PARTS OF SW VA. 
AFTERNOON POPS KEPT ONLY AS LOW CHANCE NORTH TO SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH 
GIVEN ONLY WEAK FORCING AND LACK OF INSTABILITY.

POPS WERE ALSO LOWERED FOR TONIGHT DUE TO SAME REASONING...AND IN 
LINE WITH LATEST MOS AND UPDATED POP/WX GRIDS FROM NEIGHBORING 
OFFICES. A CONSIDERABLE AND STEADY FETCH OF MID TO HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDINESS UNDERWAY...WHICH COMPLICATES MAX TEMP FORECAST. GFS MOS 
PERFORMED WELL YESTERDAY...SO TRENDED VERY MUCH TOWARD GFS HIGHS.
GFS MINS LOOKED VERY REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT AND CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW 
BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION ALONG THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE 
FORECAST AREA SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA 
AS SHORTWAVE ENERGY RIDES NORTHEAST IN SW FLOW ALOFT AROUND 
SOUTHEASTERN STATES UPPER LEVEL RIDGE. ABUNDANT MOISTURE FROM THE 
SOUTH WILL KEEP SKIES CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY AND TEMPERATURES MILD 
WITH HIGHS MOSTLY IN THE 60S AND LOWS IN THE 40S AND 50S THROUGH 
SUNDAY NIGHT. UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE ROCKIES SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY AND SLOWLY MOVES EAST. COLD FRONT MOVES INTO MID MS VALLEY 
AND OHIO VALLEY SATURDAY BUT BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY TO THE WEST 
AND NORTHWEST OF THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL MONDAY. PRECIPITATION 
AMOUNTS SHOULD NOT BE THAT GREAT UNTIL MONDAY WHEN MAIN SHORTWAVE 
MOVES FROM THE PLAINS TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES BY MONDAY AFTERNOON 
AND PUSHES THE FRONT THROUGH BY MONDAY NIGHT. LARGE ARCTIC AIRMASS 
SET TO MOVE IN BEHIND THIS SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. HAVE 
CHANGED FORECAST TO KEEP THE CHANCE OF SNOW IN THROUGH TUESDAY. BEST 
CHANCE OF ACCUMULATING SNOW SHOULD BE ACROSS VIRGINIA AND THE HIGHER 
MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN AND POSSIBLY THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AS 
TEMPERATURES MAY NOT DROP TO FREEZING UNTIL SUNRISE AND THEN THE 
DEEPER MOISTURE IS EXPECTED TO MOVE OUT QUICKLY DURING THE DAY 
TUESDAY.
&&

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE

UPDATE TO INCREASE CLOUD COVER AND TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE IN ALL ZONES.

244 PM EST THU JAN 11 2007

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...MID LEVEL RIDGE 
MOVES EAST ACROSS GLFMEX THROUGH PERIOD. SURFACE RIDGE SLIDES EAST 
INTO ATLC THIS WEEKEND WITH RIDGE AXIS SUPPRESSING S INTO EXTREME SE 
GA AS FRONTAL BOUNDARY CREEPS TOWARD AREA FM NW. MID/UPR LEVELS 
BECOME INCREASINGLY MOIST AS SUB TROPICAL MOIST FROM THE EAST 
PACIFIC ADVECTS INTO AREA. OVERALL FORECAST IS FOR CLOUDY SKIES AND 
WARM TEMPS. A FEW MID LEVEL IMPULSES AND 1000-850 MB CONVERGENCE 
WILL PRODUCE SOME FAIRLY WIDESPREAD PCPN THROUGH PERIOD BUT FAVORING 
AREAS TO THE WEST OF THE MRX CWA. BEST CHC FOR PCPN OCCURS ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EXTREME SW VA ON SAT AS IMPULSE 
MOVES NE THROUGH E KY. STAYED BELOW MOS POP GUIDANCE THROUGH PERIOD 
AWAITING BETTER DEFINED TRIGGERS THIS FAR EAST. TEMPERATURES WELL 
ABOVE NORMAL ESPECIALLY AFTER TNGT. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...FRONT LINGERING ACROSS 
REGION PUSHES NORTH OF CWA ON SUNDAY...BUT WILL KEEP HIGH CHANCE 
POPS IN FOR SUNDAY WITH STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING.  FRONT 
SAGS SOUTH ON LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND LINGERS INTO MONDAY.  WITH 
DECENT MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS FOR THE 
WESTERN COUNTIES ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND ACROSS THE ENTIRE CWA ON 
MONDAY.  COLDER AIR FILTERS IN BEHIND THE FRONT ON MONDAY NIGHT.  
MOISTURE LIMITED...BUT MAY SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS ON MONDAY NIGHT.  SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL PROBABLY BE 
TOO WARM FOR MUCH ACCUMULATION.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRINGING 
DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.  STAYED NEAR MEX/HPC FOR 
TEMPERATURES.

FXUS64 KMRX 111519
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 AM EST THU JAN 11 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SOME THIN CIRRUS 
ACROSS AREA TODAY. TEMPS OFF TO A SLOW START BUT SHOULD REACH FCST MAX
THIS AFTERNOON. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BE 
THE DOMINATE WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE REGION TODAY...PROVIDING 
CLEAR SKIES AND WARMER TEMPERATURES.  AS THE NEXT SYSTEM BEGINS TO 
APPROACH THE AREA LATE TONIGHT...WINDS WILL INCREASE...BECOMING 
LOCALLY BREEZY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN AND CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INVADE 
THE AREA.  WITH WARM SOUTHERLY WINDS AND CLOUD COVER...OVERNIGHT LOW 
WILL GENERALLY BE IN THE 30S FOR MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.

LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...SLOW MOVING FRONTAL SYSTEM TO AFFECT 
THE REGION THIS WEEKEND...SAGGING TOWARD US FROM THE NORTH AND 
NORTHWEST...BEFORE A MORE SIGNIFICANT WAVE MOVES ALONG THE FRONT AND 
FINALLY PUSHES THE FRONT THROUGH OUR AREA SOMETIME IN THE EARLY 
MONDAY TIME FRAME.  HOW FAR SOUTH THIS FRONT SAGS TOWARD OR INTO OUR 
AREA IS PROBLEMATIC AT THIS POINT. THINK THE FRONT WILL MAKE ITS 
CLOSEST APPROACH AND POSSIBLY EVEN PUSH INTO THE AREA ON 
SATURDAY...BEFORE LIFTING BACK NORTH WITH THE APPROACH OF THE WAVE.  
THE UNCERTAINTY IN THE EVOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM MAKES TIMING PRECIP 
DIFFICULT.  WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRI AFTERNOON...THEN 
GO HIGH CHANCE SOUTHEAST TO LIKELY ELSEWHERE FRI NIGHT...AND LIKELY 
ALL ZONES SAT.  BY SUN WILL JUST GO WITH CHANCE POPS AS EXPECT FRONT 
TO HAVE LIFTED FURTHER NORTH...THEN LIKELY MON MORNING WITH COLD 
FRONTAL PASSAGE.  MAY SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS 
SYSTEM MON NIGHT AS COLDER AIR PUSHES IN. WILL GO DRY TUE AND WED 
FOR NOW.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  57  39  62  50  62 /   0  10  20  70  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  36  61  48  59 /   0  10  20  70  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN  55  38  60  46  58 /   0  10  20  70  70

FXUS64 KMRX 110138
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
840 PM EST WED JAN 10 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS OBSERVED 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL 
COOLING CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT. TEMPS ARE FALLING QUICKLY THIS 
EVENING...AND WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST TO LOWER MINS A 
LITTLE IN SOME AREAS.

232 PM EST WED JAN 10 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH COOL TEMPERATURES 
TONIGHT WITH GRADUAL WARMING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE RIDGE AXIS EXTENDS 
FROM THE ATLANTIC WESTWARD THROUGH GEORGIA. MID/UPR RIDGING OVER 
GLFMEX EXTENDS NORTHWARD INTO TN VLY. WAA CONTINUES WITH MEAN SWRLY 
FLOW. ISENTROPIC LIFT STARTS UP BUT WILL LEAVE POPS OUT OF FRIDAY 
FOR NOW WITH MENTION OF INCREASING CLOUDS. LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DROPS 
INTO 4 CORNERS REGION ON SAT. SYSTEM SHOWING SIGNS OF BEING ANOTHER 
SLOW MOVER. FCST TIMING BASED ON CURRENT PROGS BUT MAY NEED TO BE 
SLOWED DOWN WITH LATER MODEL RUNS. FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND BEST 
ISENTROPIC LIFT SET UP W AND N OF AREA THROUGH EARLY SUNDAY. GOOD 
RAINFALL COVERAGE AND AMOUNTS APPEAR LIKELY NEAR THE BOUNDARY BUT 
PCPN CURRENTLY LOOKS HIT AND MISS THIS FAR EAST FAVORING THE NW MRX 
CWA FRI NGT THROUGH SAT NGT. DEVELOPING SFC LOW MOVES NE FROM MID MS 
RVR VLY TO OH RVR VLY BY SUN NGT. SFC FRONT MOVING E INTO 
APPALACHIANS EARLY MON WITH BEST PCPN CHCS SUN NGT THROUGH MID DAY 
MONDAY. CAA GET GOING MON NGT AND SCT SHWRS WILL BECOME MIXED WITH 
OR CHANGE TO SNOW BEFORE ENDING...ESPECIALLY ACROSS NE TN/SW VA. 
UPPER TROUGH AND SFC RIDGE SLIDE SE INTO AREA REMAINDER OF PERIOD. 
COLD AIRMASS SHOULD MODIFY SOME BEFORE GETTING HERE BUT EARLY TO MID 
WEEK TEMPS LOOK SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.

FXUS64 KMRX 101448
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 AM EST WED JAN 10 2007

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE HAS BUILT INTO THE REGION CLEARING SKIES 
COMPLETELY WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE EXTREME NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE 
FORECAST AREA.  HAVE UPDATED FORECAST TO REMOVE BECOMING WORDING IN 
A FEW GROUPS.  NO OTHER CHANGES PLANNED.


..PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...THE QUICK MOVING WINTER SYSTEM HAS EXITED 
THE AREA.  HOWEVER...UPSLOPE FLOW OVER THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND 
SOME RESIDUAL ENERGY OVER FAR NORTHERN ZONES MAY GENERATE A FEW 
LINGERING FLURRIES EARLY THIS MORNING.  NO ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS 
ARE EXPECTED AND CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY DECREASE ACROSS THESE AREAS 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY.  OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE 
REGION WILL PROVIDE GENERALLY CLEAR SKIES AND DIMINISHING WINDS.  
WITH LIGHT WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES IN PLACE FOR TONIGHT...EXPECT GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING AND ANOTHER COLD NIGHT WITH TEMPS FALLING INTO 
TEENS AND 20S. 

.LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE EASTERN US 
WILL KEEP THE AREA DRY THU...WITH QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE.  APPEARS 
SLOW MOVING FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL BE AFFECTING THE AREA FOR THE 
WEEKEND.    FRONT WILL BE TO OUR NORTHWEST...WITH MOISTURE STREAMING 
UP IN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW AHEAD OF IT FRIDAY...BUT HOW QUICK ANY 
PRECIP WILL ARRIVE STILL PROBLEMATIC.  THINK BEST COURSE FOR NOW IS 
TO JUST INCREASE CLOUDS AND KEEP FORECAST DRY UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT.  
WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE WEEKEND...ALTHOUGH THERE SHOULD 
BE SOME PERIODS OF TIME WHEN NO PRECIP IS OCCURRING...HOW LONG AND 
WHEN STILL TOO UNCERTAIN TO PINPOINT. ONCE THE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH 
SOMETIME AROUND SUN NIGHT...COLDER AIR WILL PUSH IN.  MAY SEE SOME 
SNOW SHOWERS MON NIGHT...THEN WILL GO DRY FOR TUE AS HIGH PRESSURE 
EXPECTED TO BUILD IN.  LACK OF MODEL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY LEADING 
TO FAIRLY LOW CONFIDENCE FOR LAST COUPLE OF PERIODS OF THE FORECAST. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  24  52  35  59 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  46  25  54  35  59 /   0   0   0  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 092041
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
341 PM EST TUE JAN 9 2007

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A FAST-MOVING COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. THESE SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH WITH THE 
SETTING OF THE SUN...BUT UPSLOPE FLOW IN THE MOUNTAINS WILL LIKELY 
KEEP SOME SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS GOING A LITTLE LONGER INTO THE 
EVENING. SOME OF THESE SNOW SHOWERS MAY CREATE A BRIEF ADDITIONAL 
ACCUMULATION OF UP TO AN INCH IN SOME AREAS WHERE TEMPS REMAIN NEAR 
FREEZING. WILL GO AHEAD AND CONTINUE THE SNOW ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST 
VA UNTIL 8 PM THIS EVENING...ALTHOUGH EXPECT ACTIVITY TO REMAIN 
SCATTERED WITH ANY ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS CONFINED TO MAINLY 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WITH SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE POSSIBLY 
LINGERING ACROSS ROADWAYS TONIGHT...THINK THAT SOME ICING MAY OCCUR 
AS TEMPS FALL QUICKLY BELOW FREEZING. WILL ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER 
STATEMENT TO MENTION THIS POSSIBILITY. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND LOOK REASONABLE. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH ZONAL FLOW RETURNING THURSDAY WITH A DRY AIRMASS IN
PLACE. COLDEST NIGHT WILL BE WEDNESDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE VALLEYS
WITH A LITTLE WARMING POSSIBLE ON THE PLATEAU WITH SOUTH WINDS
BEGINNING. TROUGH ON THE WEST COAST IS IN PLACE THURSDAY WITH LEE
SIDE LOW EAST OF THE ROCKIES FORMING AND MOISTURE BEGINS TO MOVE INTO
THE CENTRAL STATES. A SOUTHERLY TO SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL DEVELOP AND
WARM TEMPERATURES CONSIDERABLY ABOVE WEDNESDAY. STRONG HIGH
PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHEAST SHOULD KEEP SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY. IT
LOOKS LIKE RAIN WILL SPREAD INTO THE OHIO VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT AND
FRIDAY BUT UPPER LEVEL RIDGING AND THE SURFACE HIGH ALONG THE MID
ATLANTIC SEABOARD WILL STAY PUT AND KEEP THE DEEPER MOISTURE OUT
UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT. GULF MOISTURE SPREADS NORTH INTO MS VALLEY
FRIDAY AND WORKS ITS WAY EAST INTO THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY FRIDAY
NIGHT. UPPER LEVEL LOW AND TROUGH HANGS BACK OVER THE ROCKIES
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH FORECAST AREA ON FRINGE OF RAIN AREA AS
COLD FRONT FRIDAY AND SATURDAY STAYS FAR TO THE NORTHWEST. BEST
CHANCE OF RAIN AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE JUST AHEAD OF THE
FRONT SUNDAY WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S AND SOME GOOD WINDS ALOFT
AND SOME UPPER LEVEL INSTABILITY. ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE THUNDER
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. COLDER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND THIS
SYSTEM AND ADDED SOME SNOW IN LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 AM EST TUE JAN 9 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A FAST-MOVING COLD FRONT ALONG THE 
PLATEAU WITH SNOW SQUALLS OCCURRING AHEAD IT ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. THESE SNOW SQUALLS HAVE ALREADY PRODUCED SOME ACCUMULATIONS UP 
TO AN INCH ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...AND GENERALLY LESS THAN 
AN INCH ACROSS CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS. THIS BAND OF SNOW WILL 
QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WITH SCATTERED 
ACTIVITY EXPECTED BEHIND THE FRONT FOR THIS AFTERNOON. IN 
ADDITION...UPSLOPE FLOW IN THE MOUNTAINS ALONG WITH STEEP LAPSE 
RATES WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS IN THESE 
AREAS. MODELS STILL INDICATE THAT TEMPS IN THE VALLEYS WILL RISE 
SOME THIS AFTERNOON...SO A MIXTURE OF SNOW AND RAIN SHOWERS APPEARS 
POSSIBLE SOUTH OF A CROSSVILLE TO KNOXVILLE LINE. 

OVERALL...THE CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK. WILL PLAN TO 
CONTINUE THE SNOW ADVISORIES...BUT MENTION ONE TO FIVE INCHES IN THE 
MOUNTAINS WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE ON THE HIGHEST PEAKS. 
OTHERWISE...WILL TWEAK THE FORECAST A LITTLE IN REGARDS TO TEMPS AND 
WINDS TO REFLECT CURRENT TRENDS.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...SNOW ADVISORY UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS... 
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST 
     GREENE...UNICOI.

VA...SNOW ADVISORY UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...WISE.

FXUS64 KMRX 090855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EST TUE JAN 9 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FAST MOVING CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL 
TRACK THROUGH THE REGION TODAY.  MOUNTAINS SHOULD SEE MAINLY SNOW 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM...VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL RANGE FROM 
MAINLY RAIN SOUTH TO A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW CENTRAL AND NORTH.  LOW 
LEVEL LAPSE RATES STEEPEN BRIEFLY WITH CAPES APPROACHING 70 AS THE 
SYSTEM APPROACHES.  THIS MAY CAUSE SOME BANDING OF SNOW.  WITH A 
WARM GROUND AND DAYTIME HEATING...MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL SEE 
LITTLE TO NO SNOW ACCUMULATIONS...HOWEVER...LOCALIZE SQUALLS MAY 
PRODUCE ISOLATED MEASURABLE SNOWFALL.  MOUNTAINS SHOULD SEE A COUPLE 
OF INCHES OF SNOW AS THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH...GENERALLY 1 TO 4 
INCHES WITH HIGHER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE OVER THE HIGHEST TERRAIN.  A 
SNOW ADVISORY IS IN PLACE.  BY THIS EVENING...THE SYSTEM WILL BE 
EXITING THE AREA AND WINDS WILL BECOME NORTHWESTERLY...PROVIDING 
DECENT UPSLOPE FLOW FOR SOME ADDITION LIGHT MOUNTAIN SNOW FALL.  AS 
THE LOW MOVES THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON...WINDS WILL INCREASE ACROSS 
THE AREA...BECOMING BREEZY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.  BEHIND THE 
SYSTEM...COOL AIR WILL PUSH IN WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS DROPPING INTO THE 
20S.


.LONG TERM...(WED THROUGH MON)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE AREA WED AND THEN OFF TO THE EAST. DRY CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED WED AND THU...WITH A WARMING TREND. STILL LOOKS UNSETTLED 
FOR THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY AS A SLOW MOVING SYSTEM AFFECTS THE 
REGION.  WILL GO DRY FRIDAY...AS THINK FRONT WILL STILL BE RATHER 
FAR OFF TO OUR NORTHWEST AND EXPECT PRECIP TO BE MORE IN VICINITY OF 
FRONT.  WHILE THERE MAY BE SOME PRECIP FREE PERIODS DURING THE FRI 
NIGHT THROUGH MON PERIOD...NO CONFIDENCE IN SPECIFYING WHEN OR HOW 
LONG.  FOR NOW WILL CONTINUE TO GO WITH CHANCE POPS...EVEN THOUGH AT 
THIS POINT IT LOOKS FAIRLY CERTAIN TO RAIN AT LEAST SOME OF THESE 
PERIODS...WILL WAIT UNTIL LATER TO GO WITH HIGHER POPS AS EVOLUTION 
OF THIS SYSTEM BECOMES CLEARER.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  43  23  44  23  52 /  30  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN  42  24  44  23  54 /  30  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  39  20  39  18  52 /  60  20   0   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 082040
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 PM EST MON JAN 8 2007

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS EXTENDING 
NORTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM LOCATED 
OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS FAST-MOVING CLIPPER SYSTEM IS 
EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTHEAST TONIGHT INTO THE OH AND TN RIVER VALLEYS 
BY SUNRISE. GFS AND NAM MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
PROGRESSION OF THIS SYSTEM...AND BOTH HAVE INCREASED THE AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE EXPECTED WITH IT. BOTH MODELS ALSO REVEAL SOME NEGATIVE 
EQUIVALENT POTENTIAL VORTICITY VALUES OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WHICH 
WOULD INDICATE THAT THERE COULD BE SOME CONVECTIVE PRECIP WITH THIS 
EVENT. STEEP LAPSE RATES ON THE MODEL SOUNDINGS WOULD FURTHER 
SUPPORT THIS POSSIBILITY. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY NOON...WITH THE SYNOPTIC/CONVECTIVE 
EVENT TRANSITIONING TO MAINLY AN UPSLOPE EVENT BY THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING WITH STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS EXPECTED. WARM GROUND AND NEAR- 
SURFACE TEMPS IN THE VALLEYS SHOULD LIMIT ANY POSSIBLE SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS...ALTHOUGH UP TO AN INCH COULD QUICKLY ACCUMULATE IN A 
FEW AREAS WITH ANY POSSIBLE SNOW SQUALLS. 

OVERALL...THINK THAT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD MAINLY OCCUR IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE COLDER TEMPS AND UPSLOPE FLOW WILL BE MORE 
CONDUCIVE TO ACCUMULATIONS. BECAUSE OF THE POSSIBLE CONVECTIVE 
ELEMENT OF THIS EVENT...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WATCH FOR THE MOUNTAINS 
WHERE ONE TO SIX INCHES COULD ACCUMULATE...MAINLY ABOVE 2500 FEET 
(AND EVEN LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS ON THE HIGHEST PEAKS). WILL ISSUE 
AN ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST VA WHERE AMOUNTS SHOULD GENERALLY BE 
AROUND ONE TO FOUR INCHES. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL UNDERCUT MOS GUIDANCE 
SOME FOR TOMORROW...BUT EVEN THEN...TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN WARM IN THE 
VALLEYS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...COLD UPPER TROUGH ACROSS 
THE EASTERN US DEPARTS BY WEDNESDAY MORNING AND COLD AIR ADVECTION 
WILL END DURING THE DAY AS FLOW BECOMES MORE WESTERLY. TEMPERATURES 
MAY STRUGGLE TO GO MUCH ABOVE FREEZING IN SW VA AND THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF EAST TN WITH ANY SNOW COVER. AIR MASS IS DRY AND SO
THERE SHOULD BE FULL SUN. WEDNESDAY NIGHT LIGHT SOUTHERLY FLOW SHOULD
DEVELOP OVER THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU SO EXPECT LOWS TO BE A FEW 
DEGREES WARMER THERE...OTHERWISE ANOTHER COLD NIGHT IN THE VALLEYS. 
RIDGING AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE ROCKIES MOVES 
THROUGH TN VALLEY THURSDAY AND THIS WILL WARM TEMPERATURES ABOVE 
NORMAL ONCE AGAIN. EXPECT SOME HIGH CLOUDINESS THURSDAY BUT DEEPER 
MOISTURE WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL FRIDAY. FRIDAY IS THE TRANSITION DAY 
AND LOOKS LIKE THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE AFTERNOON AND MORE 
LIKELY EVENING WITH RAIN CENTERED ACROSS MS AND LOWER OHIO VALLEY 
UNTIL AROUND 06Z SATURDAY. THIS SYSTEM LOOKS TO BE SLOW MOVING AND 
ANOTHER WARM ONE WITH RAIN ACROSS THE AREA. WILL HAVE TO WATCH 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS BECAUSE THE RAIN COULD LAST THROUGH MONDAY.         
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR MOVING 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON BREEZY WESTERLY WINDS. SATELLITE IMAGES

BUT MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES SHOULD PREVAIL THIS AFTERNOON AS DRIER AIR 
FILTERS IN. AS FOR TEMPS...HIGHS THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD BE AROUND TEN 
DEGREES BELOW YESTERDAYS VALUES.

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MORNING 
PRECIP WORDING...AND TO TWEAK SKY WORDING AND TEMPS A LITTLE.
