AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EST MON JAN 8 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ANY LINGERING LIGHT PRECIPITATION 
WILL QUICKLY EXIT THE AREA THIS MORNING...WILL ONLY CARRY LOW POPS 
NORTHEAST ZONES. CLOUDS SHOULD CLEAR FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST 
FAIRLY QUICKLY AS WELL.  CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM APPROACHING LATE 
TONIGHT.  SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES BETWEEN NAM AND GFS...THINK A 
BLEND LOOKS REASONABLE.  SHOULD SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS ESPECIALLY 
AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND MAY SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS WORKING INTO THE AREA 
LATE.  WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS LATE CENTRAL AND 
NORTH...EXCEPT LOW CHANCE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA ZONES.  ONLY 
MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS IN THE SHORT TERM.       

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...NICE LITTLE SHORTWAVE TROF 
WITH SURFACE REFLECTION BUILDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AND 
EXITS TUESDAY NIGHT PRIOR TO DAYBREAK WEDNESDAY. FAIRLY COLD AIR 
ALOFT ASSOCIATED WITH TROF AND SHOULD BE ABLE TO GENERATE SOME SNOW 
SHOWERS. TERRAIN AROUND 2500 FEET AND ABOVE IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND THE TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA MAY PICK UP 
AROUND AN INCH OF ACCUMULATION BEFORE ALL IS SAID AND DONE TUESDAY 
NIGHT. THE -SHSN SHOULD BE MIXED WITH -SHRA ACROSS LOWER ELEVATIONS 
IN THE FORECAST AREA AND DONT EXPECT ANY ACCUMULATION IN THESE 
AREAS DUE TO THE FACT THAT THE GROUND HAS A LITTLE TOO MUCH HEAT 
ENERGY FROM THE RECENT BEAUTIFUL MILD PERIOD. PRESSURE GRADIENT A 
LITTLE TIGHT ON TUESDAY AND THEREFORE A BIT ON THE BREEZY SIDE 
ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. FORECAST STAYS DRY WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL WEDNESDAY WITH WARM AIR 
ADVECTION GETTING UNDERWAY BY THURSDAY UPPER FLOW GOES SOUTHWESTERLY 
AGAIN. FRONTAL BOUNDARY DROPS SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY 
DURING THE WEEKEND AND WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE ADVECTION/ISENTROPIC 
LIFT AND A FEW WEAK SHORTWAVE PASSAGES MAINTAINED SLIGHT THROUGH LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A -SHRA. THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT IT 
APPEARS THAT WE CAN ENJOY ANOTHER RELATIVELY MILD WEEKEND WITHOUT 
HAVING TO MENTION SNOW AT THIS LATE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST.

FXUS64 KMRX 071948
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EST SUN JAN 7 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...
A BAND OF SHOWERS WITH A FEW EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE
ACROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING. THE STRONGER STORMS MAY HAVE THE
POTENTIAL TO MIX STRONG WINDS ALOFT DOWN TO THE SURFACE...AND THESE
WILL HAVE TO BE MONITORED FOR POSSIBLE WARNINGS. THE HEAVIEST
PRECIP IS EXPECTED TO BE OUT OF THE AREA BY 06Z...WITH ONLY SOME
LINGERING LIGHT SHOWERS AFTER THAT. THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS SWINGS
THROUGH BETWEEN 12-15Z...AND WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE NORTHEAST ON
MONDAY MORNING UNTIL IT CLEARS THE AREA. 

DRY AND COOL AIR WILL BUILD IN ON MONDAY AHEAD OF A CLIPPER THAT
WILL AFFECT US ON TUESDAY. THE MODELS HAVE SOME DIFFERENCES WITH
THE SYSTEM...THE GFS BEING STRONGER WITH THE POLAR JET ON THE WEST
SIDE OF THE TROUGH AND THUS IT BRINGS COLD AIR ALOFT FARTHER SOUTH
THAN THE NAM. THE GFS SHOWS AN OMEGA BULLS-EYE OVER THE AREA 12Z
TUESDAY WHICH IS LIKELY OVERDONE. WILL GO WITH THE PRECIP COVERAGE
SHOWN IN THE GFS BUT LOWER THE AMOUNTS. THE SHOWERS WILL BE DRIVEN
MAINLY BY INSTABILITY CREATED BY VERY COLD MIDLEVEL TEMPS AROUND
-30 C...WHICH PRODUCES 925-850 MB LAPSE RATES NEAR 9 C/KM IN SW VA.
WILL RAISE POPS TO HIGH CHANCES IN SW VA TO A SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE
CENTRAL VALLEY AREA. SOME ACCUMULATION WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NE TN AS THERE COULD BE SOME QUICK
BURSTS OF MODERATE SNOW...BUT ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE HARD TO COME BY
ELSEWHERE DUE TO THE WARMTH OF THE GROUND. DRYING AND WARMING ALOFT
WILL LIKELY END ANY SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
A RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY..AND SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE WILL SHIFT FROM THE MS RIVER VALLEY TO OFF THE ATLANTIC
COAST. THIS WILL BRING A RETURN OF WARMER TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE
END OF THE WEEK. DEEP MOISTURE SPREADS ACROSS THE MS VALLEY REGION
ON THURSDAY NIGHT AS AN UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES...BUT REMAINS TO
OUR WEST THROUGH FRIDAY. THE RIDGE BREAKS DOWN ON FRIDAY
NIGHT...GIVING A SLIGHT CHANCE POP. THE 00Z AND 06Z GFS KEPT THE
PRECIP TO OUR WEST...BUT THE 12Z RUN SHOWS A MORE PROGRESSIVE
PATTERN AND BRINGS A COLD FRONT THROUGH ON SUNDAY. WILL HAVE CHANCE
POPS IN SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY BUT WILL NOT JUMP ON THE STRONG
PUSH OF COLD AIR IN THE 12Z RUN JUST YET.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EST SUN JAN 7 2007

.DISCUSSION...RAIN IS SPREADING NORTH RAPIDLY THIS MORNING ACROSS SE 
TN AND SW NC. LOW PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE ACROSS NORTH MS IS 
BRINGING COPIOUS MOISTURE NORTHEAST INTO THE TN VALLEY THIS MORNING. 
IN ADDITION TO THE RAIN OVER THE SOUTH A LARGE MASS OF RAIN IS 
MARCHING EAST FROM NORTHERN MIDDLE TN SOUTHWEST TO NW AL. THERE IS 
STRONG FORCING ALOFT AS WELL. SOUNDINGS AND MODEL DATA SHOWING  
SOUTHWEST WINDS OF 50 KTS AND HIGHER AT 850 MB AND 30 TO 40 KNOTS AT 
925 MB. WINDS ARE BEGINNING TO INCREASE ON THE PLATEAU AND WILL 
LEAVE CURRENT WIND ADVISORY IN PLACE FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
HEAVY RAIN STILL POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING AT TIMES AHEAD 
OF SURFACE LOW WHICH IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH MIDDLE TN THIS 
AFTERNOON AND INTO OHIO AND THEN INTO E KY AND OH THIS EVENING. NEW 
RIVER GUIDANCE KEEPS RIVERS BELOW FLOOD BUT MAY BE CLOSE FROM THOSE 
COMING IN FROM NC. FFG FOR 3 HOURS FROM 1.5 TO 2.5 INCHES AND 6 
HOURS AROUND 2 INCHES SO THINK FLOODING WILL BE ISOLATED SINCE TOTAL 
RAIN FROM LATE THIS MORNING TO 06Z MONDAY WILL AVERAGE AROUND 1.5 TO 
2 INCHES FOR THE CWA. CURRENT TEMPERATURES IN THE MOUNTAINS SEVERAL 
DEGREES ABOVE HOURLY GRIDS WHICH SHOULD LOWER AS RAIN BEGINS. UPDATE 
OUT SOON TO ADJUST WIND WORDING. WILL ALSO REISSUE WIND ADVISORY 
AFTER ZONE UPDATE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST SUN JAN 7 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE QUITE WET 
TODAY INTO TONIGHT...AS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS INTO THE 
AREA...THEN OFF TO THE NORTHEAST TONIGHT. GOOD FEED OF MOISTURE FROM 
THE GULF WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND SHOULD BE A PERIOD OF FAIRLY STRONG 
FORCING.  INSTABILITY NOT IMPRESSIVE...BUT MAY BE ENOUGH WITH THE 
STRONG DYNAMICS FOR A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER.  EXPECT SOME HEAVY 
RAIN THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THINK SPEED OF SYSTEM WILL LIMIT AMOUNTS 
SOMEWHAT.  A LOOK AT FFG SHOWS MOST 3 AND 6 HOUR VALUES IN THE 1.5 
TO 2.5 INCH RANGE...SO WHILE SOME ISOLATED WATER PROBLEMS MAY 
OCCUR...DO NOT THINK IT WARRANTS A FLOOD WATCH AT THIS TIME...BUT 
WILL MENTION IN HWO. HOWEVER...THIS CERTAINLY BEARS WATCHING.  LOOKS 
LIKE WINDS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF E TN WILL BE STRONG ENOUGH FOR A 
WIND ADVISORY THIS AFTERNOON INTO EARLY THIS EVENING...SO WILL ISSUE 
WITH THIS PACKAGE.  PRECIP WILL TAPER OFF TONIGHT...AND MAY ACTUALLY 
SEE A FEW SNOW SHOWERS MIXING IN OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN LATE 
TONIGHT AS COLDER AIR PUSHES IN. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO ONLY SOME MINOR TWEAKS.   

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THERE MAY BE A FEW LINGERING
-SHRA/-SHSN FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MONDAY 
MORNING. HOWEVER PRECIP WRAPS UP BY MID DAY WITH A LULL IN THE 
ACTION UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT MONDAY NIGHT AS CLIPPER SYSTEM DROPS 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. STRONG CAA AND 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT LEADS TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF -SHSN IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AS WELL AS MUCH OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. IN LOWER ELEVATIONS A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND 
SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD OCCUR IN WARMER TEMPERATURE PROFILE. THERE COULD 
BE SOME MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATION IN THE MOUNTAINS. KEPT THE CLIPPER 
EVENT GOING THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WITH PRECIP ENDING BY 12Z WEDNESDAY. FORECAST 
AREA ENJOYS A PERIOD OF RIDGING WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. MOISTURE 
ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AS 
MORE AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF BUILDS EAST INTO THE PLAINS STATES AND 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW STRENGTHENS. USED SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POP FOR SATURDAY AS UNSETTLED WEATHER RETURNS 
FOR NEXT WEEKEND. STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH 
THE LONG TERM FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
217 PM EST SAT JAN 6 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
A SURFACE FRONT LOCATED OVER THE AREA HAS BROUGHT MOSTLY CLOUDY
SKIES THIS AFTERNOON. A TROUGH ACROSS THE OK PANHANDLE WILL MERGE
WITH ANOTHER TROUGH OVER THE ROCKIES TONIGHT. AS THESE DISTURBANCES
MERGE OVER THE PLAINS...SURFACE CYCLOGENESIS WILL BEGIN NEAR
LOUISIANA. THIS LOW WILL TRACK NORTHEAST AND CROSS OUR AREA ON
SUNDAY. MOISTURE ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM
WILL BRING PRECIP INTO OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES AROUND 12Z...AND
OVERSPREAD THE AREA AND INCREASE IN INTENSITY THROUGH THE DAY. WILL
MENTION HEAVY RAINFALL IN THE AFTERNOON WHEN UPPER DIVERGENCE AND
LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE ARE MAXIMUZED. STORM TOTAL QPF COULD BE NEAR
2 INCHES...BUT THE RAPID SPEED OF THE SYSTEM SHOULD LIMIT AMOUNTS.
DRYING BEGINS QUICKLY AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND WILL END POPS BY 12Z
MONDAY.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
COLD ADVECTION WILL DROP HIGH TEMPERATURES BACK ON MONDAY TO THE
40S. SOME RESIDUAL LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY GIVE PARTLY TO MOSTLY
CLOUDY SKIES IN THE MORNING. ON MONDAY NIGHT AN UPPER JET AND
CHANNELED VORTICITY APPROACH THE AREA. THE DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH
WILL RESULT IN COLD TEMPS ALOFT AND STEEP LAPSE RATES AROUND 7
C/KM. MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED BUT AN UPSLOPE COMPONENT AND THE
INSTABILTY MAY PRODUCE SOME RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS IN THE NORTHERN
PORTIONS OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE LOW CHANCE TO
SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE.

A RIDGE OVER THE AREA WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY
THROUGH FRIDAY WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND. THE 12Z GFS SHOWS A
STRONGER RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST WHICH KEEPS PRECIP TO OUR
NORTHWEST THROUGH SATURDAY...WHEREAS THE 06Z GFS BROUGH PRECIP IN
ON FRIDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

330 AM EST SAT JAN 6 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL PUSH 
THROUGH THE REGION TODAY.  LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL NOT BE MUCH FORCING 
WITH THIS FEATURE...AND MAINLY JUST LOW LEVEL MOISTURE.  EXPECT

GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE BOTH PERIODS.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WEATHER PATTERN EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD WILL CONTINUE TO BE ACTIVE WITH ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TROF AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW EXPECTED TO SHIFT NORTHEAST FROM THE WESTERN 
GULF OF MEXICO ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY BRINGING ANOTHER 
HEALTHY BIT OF RAIN. SYSTEM EXITS BY DAYBREAK MONDAY WHICH ALLOWS 
FOR A BRIEF BREAK IN THE ACTION MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT AS DRYING AND 
HIGHER PRESSURES KEEP PRECIP AWAY. NEXT SHORTWAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST 
OUT OF CANADA IN CLIPPER FASHION. THIS FEATURE HAS SUFFICIENT COLD 
AIR TO WORK WITH TO MIX SOME -SHSN IN WITH A BIT OF RAIN WHICH WILL 
MAINLY BE A CONCERN FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE BUT FOR NOW USED A BROADBRUSH TECHNIQUE FOR 
WHAT APPEARS TO BE AN INSIGNIFICANT EVENT. THE AREA FINALLY GETS 
ANOTHER EXTENDED BREAK FROM PRECIP WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH 
RIDGING DEVELOPING AND TEMPERATURES REBOUNDING BACK TO A FEW DEGREES 
ABOVE NORMAL FOR MID JANUARY.

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 PM EST FRI JAN 5 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED
OVER MIDDLE TN THIS AFTERNOON AND OUT AHEAD OF IT WAS A VERY MILD
AIRMASS WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S TO LOWER 70S AS FAR NORTH AS
SW VA. IS IT THE MIDDLE OF WINTER A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION WAS
OVER GA AND MOVING ACROSS WESTERN SC AND NC. SCATTERED SHOWERS WERE
MOVING INTO NE TN AT THE EXTREME NORTHERN EDGE OF THE CONVECTION.
TO THE SOUTH AND BEHIND THIS ACTIVITY ONLY A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS WERE
SEEN. HOURLY RAINFALL AMOUNTS TO THE EAST OF MRX ARE UP TO ONE HALF
INCH WITH THE SHOWERS OTHERWISE AROUND A TENTH OF AN INCH OR LESS.
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT OF MOVING PRECIPITATION OUT THIS
EVENING AS FRONT MOVES EAST AND DISSIPATES. SURFACE LOW OVER IN
WILL MOVE NE INTO SOUTHERN CANADA BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. UPPER
TROUGH WITH FRONT MOVES THROUGH TONIGHT AND AIR MASS BEGINS TO DRY
OUT. HOWEVER ANOTHER LOW IS EXPECTED TO FORM ALONG THE FRONT AND
APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE SATURDAY. UPPER FLOW FROM THE
SOUTHWEST AND SURFACE WINDS FROM THAT DIRECTION WILL KEEP IT MILD
TONIGHT. EXPECTING LOWS ONLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S. WITH PARTIAL
CLEARING ALREADY THIS AFTERNOON ADDED PATCHY FOG LATE TONIGHT AND
SATURDAY. FOLLOWED THE HIGHER MET GUIDANCE ON SATURDAY.
CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S ALTHOUGH A
FEW SPOTS MAY REACH 70 LIKE TODAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE ROCKIES TODAY TRACKS EAST AND INITIATES 
CYCLOGENESIS ALONG THE LOUISIANA COAST ON SATURDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE 
ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BRING LIGHT PRECIP INTO THE 
CHATTANOOGA AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. AS THE UPPER TROUGH 
APPROACHES...THE LOW LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS AND THE PRECIP WILL 
INCREASE IN INTENSITY AFTER 12Z SUNDAY. DIVERGENCE WITH THE UPPER 
JET WILL BE MAXIMIZED IN THE AFTERNOON...AND THE RAIN COULD BE HEAVY 
AT TIMES. STORM TOTAL RAINFALL AMOUNTS COULD BE NEAR 2 INCHES IN OUR 
NC COUNTIES. WILL RAISE POPS TO 100% SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING. THE GFS KEEPS SOME LIGHT PRECIP IN THE NORTHEAST AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...BUT THIS APPEARS TO BE OVERDONE AS FORECAST SOUNDINGS 
SHOW RAPID DRYING ABOVE 800 MB BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z. WILL END ALL 
POPS BY 12Z. 

BEHIND THE TROUGH PASSAGE...A PUSH OF COLD AIR WILL DROP TEMPS BACK 
TO NEAR NORMAL FOR MONDAY. FOR TUESDAY THE GFS HAS TRENDED FARTHER 
SOUTH WITH THE JETSTREAM AND DEEPER WITH THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH. THERE 
IS ALSO SOME MOISTURE TEH EXTENDS UP TO 700 MB WITH THE TROUGH THAT 
CROSSES OUR NORTHERN ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. JET DYNAMICS 
AND COOLING ALOFT MAY BE ADEQUATE FOR SOME RAIN SHOWERS IN THE 
AFTERNOON...CHANGING TO SNOW SHOWERS AFTER SUNSET TUESDAY NIGHT. 
WILL KEEP POPS LOW AT THIS TIME...LOW CHANCE TO SLIGHT CHANCE. COLD 
ADVECTION TUESDAY NIGHT WILL BRING A DECENT SHOT OF COLD AIR...WITH 
LOWS TUESDAY NIGHT IN THE LOWER/MID 20S AND HIGHS WEDNESDAY IN THE 
UPPER 30S TO MID 40S. THE FLOW ALOFT REMAINS PROGRESSIVE...AND A 
LARGE RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE EAST COAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THIS 
WILL KEEP THE AREA DRY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH GRADUALLY WARMING 
TEMPERATURES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

SW NC. SOME SHOWERS WERE MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND VALLEY 
COUNTIES AT THIS TIME. CLOUD TOPS WERE WARMING ON THIS CONVECTION 
AND EXPECT IT TO CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY WEAKEN AS IT MOVES INTO MORE 
STABLE AIR OVER SE TN AND SW NC BUT A LITTLE ELEVATED INSTABILITY 
MAY PRODUCE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS. VERY LIGHT RAIN HAS MOVED ACROSS 
THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA ASSOCIATED WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT 
MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA. TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS AT 
THIS HOUR ARE A FEW DEGREES OFF AND WILL ADJUST HOURLY TRENDS. WEAK 
COLD FRONT ACROSS WEST TN THIS MORNING WILL MOVE INTO EAST TN THIS 
AFTERNOON AND SLOWLY DISSIPATE TONIGHT. STILL THINK THERE WILL BE 
SHOWER ACTIVITY ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA BUT AMOUNTS AND 
DURATION MAY NOT BE VERY LONG EXCEPT ACROSS THE SOUTH. CURRENT  
FORECAST OF CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND HIGHS IN THE MID TO 
UPPER 60S LOOK GOOD. WILL INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY FOR LATE MORNING 
OVER THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS OTHERWISE NO OTHER CHANGES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST FRI JAN 5 2007

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREA OF RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH  
ISENTROPIC LIFT MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA AT THE MOMENT. THE 
BULK OF THIS SHOULD LIFT NORTH OF THE AREA THIS MORNING.  
DISSIPATING COLD FRONT WILL PUSH IN THIS AFTERNOON...BUT FORCING 
WITH THIS FEATURE LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE UNIMPRESSIVE.  POPS ARE 
SOMEWHAT PROBLEMATIC FOR TODAY.  GUIDANCE GIVING VERY HIGH POPS..AND 
WHILE TOTAL DURATION OF PRECIP MAY BE LOW IN SOME AREAS...THINK MOST 
LOCATIONS WILL MEASURE TODAY...SO WILL NOT ARGUE MUCH WITH MAV 
POPS.  WITH DEWPOINTS AND TEMPS UNSEASONABLY HIGH...LOOKS LIKE THERE 
MAY BE SOME WEAK INSTABILITY...SO WILL INSERT SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDER FOR TODAY. TONIGHT PRECIP SHOULD PULL OUT FAIRLY 
QUICKLY...SO DRY SOUTHWEST...LIKELY POPS EARLY NORTHEAST.  MAV TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY A FEW MINOR TWEAKS. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...FORECAST STARTS OUT DRY WITH 
SOME SUNSHINE TO BOOT. HOWEVER...IN ACTIVE PATTERN YET ANOTHER WAVE 
OF LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE NORTHEAST FROM THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO 
CARRYING WITH IT A FAIR AMOUNT OF MOISTURE TO PRODUCE MORE SHOWERS 
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT WITH CATEGORICAL POPS DURING THE 
DAY SUNDAY TAPERING BACK TO LOW CHANCE POPS BY EARLY MONDAY MORNING. 
MAINTAINED HPC DEPICTION OF DRY FORECAST DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE 
LONG TERM PERIOD WITH TEMPERATURES DROPPING BACK CLOSER TO NORMAL AS 
UPPER LEVEL FLOW FINALLY BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY TAPPING THE CHILLY 
POLAR SOURCE REGION.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 050255
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EST THU JAN 4 2007

.DISCUSSION...LOWER LEVEL AIRMASS ACROSS NE 2/3 OF MRX CWA SLIGHTLY 
DRIER THAN EXPECTED AT THIS TIME. WARM FRONT REMAINS S OF AREA SO 
ADDITIONAL COOLING WILL BE POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT SO HAVE LOWERED MINS 
NE VALLEY AREAS OVERNIGHT. IN THE SOUTH TEMPS SHOULD BE STEADY OR 
RISE BEFORE DAY BREAK. WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT SUPPORTS WIDESPREAD 
RAINFALL OVERNIGHT WITH MODERATE RAINFALL AMOUNTS EXPECTED ALONG THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...WEATHER SYSTEM NOW READY 
TO HEAD INTO AREA THIS EVENING AND LINGER IN THE AREA THROUGH 
FRIDAY.  THERE IS A WIND SHIFT AS THE SYSTEM PASSES THROUGH...BUT 
COLD FRONT AND COOLER WEATHER WILL HAVE TO WAIT UNTIL AFTER THESE 
PERIODS.

GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MODELS ABOUT TONIGHT BEING FULL COVERAGE OF 
RAIN...BUT FRIDAY GETS A LITTLE MORE SPOTTY AS SYSTEM CONTINUES TO 
WEAKEN AND LAST PARTS OF IT DONT CLEAR THE AREA UNTIL FRIDAY 
EVENING.  THINK MOST PLACES WILL GET RAIN FRIDAY...BUT MUCH MORE 
HIT-AND-MISS THAN THE PRECIP EXPECTED TONIGHT.  ALSO...AIR MASS 
BECOMES A LITTLE UNSTABLE...NOT PLANNING ON ANY THUNDER...WILL JUST 
WORD AS SHOWERS...BUT THIS SLIGHT INSTABILITY WILL ALSO LEAD TO MORE 
O SPOTTY COVERAGE.  NOT EXPECTING OVERLY HEAVY AMOUNTS OF RAIN IN 
THIS EVENT WITH 36 HOUR AMOUNTS RANGING FROM ABOUT 2/3 INCH IN THE 
EXTREME WESTERN PARTS OF THE CWA TO ABOUT 1/4 INCH IN THE NORTHEAST.

DID SOME MINOR TWEAKING WITH TEMPS...BUT ONLY A COUPLE OF DEGREES 
HERE THERE.  NO SNOW EXPECTED EVEN IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS FOR 
THIS EVENT.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
SATURDAY WILL BE A BRIEF PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER BEFORE THE NEXT 
SYSTEM APPROACHES. A DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AND PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES 
WILL PROVIDE WARM TEMPS IN THE 60S. CYCLOGENESIS BEGINS ALONG THE 
LOUISIANA COAST ON SATURDAY AS AN UPPER TROUGH INTERACTS WITH A 
FRONTAL ZONE IN THAT AREA. THE LOW TRACKS NORTHEAST AND ACROSS OUR 
AREA ON SUNDAY. THE NAM IS FASTER TO BRING DEEP MOISTURE AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT INTO THE AREA...SHOWING CHANCE POPS ON SATURDAY. 
WILL GO WITH THE SLOWER GFS AND KEEP SATURDAY DRY AS THE MODEL TREND 
OF LATE HAS BEEN TO SLOW THESE SYSTEMS DOWN. THE 850 MB THETA-E 
RIDGE AND THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET WILL BE OVER OUR AREA 
DURING THE DAY ON SUNDAY...AND WILL RAISE POPS TO LIKELY. THE LOW 
DEPARTS AFTER 00Z...AND WINDS VEER TO NORTHWESTERLY...ADVECTING 
DRIER AIR AND ENDING PRECIP SUNDAY NIGHT. 

THE REST OF THE FORECAST REMAINS DRY. TEMPS MONDAY WILL DROP TO NEAR 
NORMAL...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 40S TO LOWER 50S. ANOTHER SURGE OF 
COLD AIR WILL COME ON TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY AS A DRY SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH PASSES THROUGH. STILL...IT IS NOT AN ARCTIC AIR MASS...SO 
TEMPS ONLY FALL TO NEAR OR SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL. THE HIGH PRESSURE 
RIDGE SHIFTS TO OUR EAST ON THURSDAY...BRINGING MILD TEMPS BACK TO 
THE AREA. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  54  68  48  67  50 / 100  70  10  10  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  52  65  49  64  48 / 100  80  10  10  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN  53  66  48  65  47 / 100  80  10  10  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  48  65  46  63  44 / 100  70  30  10  30

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EST WED JAN 3 2007

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. CIRRUS SHIELD 
HAS ADVANCED OVER SOUTHERN 2/3RDS OF AREA AND SHOULD REMAIN BKN TO 
OVC SOUTHERN AREAS OVERNIGHT. STRATO-CU ADVANCING NORTHWARD AND WILL 
PRIMARILY AFFECT SW NC OVRNGT. TEMPS FELL FAST THIS EVENING BUT 
SHOULD SLOWLY FALL TO FCST MINS OVRNGT. 2.2 MAGNITUDE EARTHQUAKE
11 ENE KNOXVILLE @ 03/2305Z. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:  
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)... 
IN THE SHORT TERM...SATELLITE SHOWS BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE/CLOUDS
SPREADING NORTH ACROSS GEORGIA IN RESPONSE TO INCREASING SOUTHERLY
WINDS BEHIND EXITING SURFACE HIGH. MESO-NAM DEPICTS THE MOISTURE
FAIRLY WELL NEAR THE 925MB LEVEL. THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL
SPREAD MAINLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA PRODUCING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES AT CHA AND PLATEAU
OVERNIGHT.

RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL MOVE
EAST ALLOWING A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE TO MOVE EAST NORTHEAST 
FROM NORTHERN MEXICO TO ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES THURSDAY
AND FRIDAY. BOUNDARY LAYER JET WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THURSDAY WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT SPREADING INTO THE REGION
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. END RESULT...LIGHT RAINFALL WILL SPREAD 
INTO THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY AFTERNOON.

THICKNESS WILL REMAIN UNSEASONABLY WARM THROUGH THURSDAY WITH MILD
DAYS AND COOL NIGHTS.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT EXTENDING THROUGH A DEEPER LAYER WILL 
WORK THEIR WAY INTO THE AREA FROM THE SOUTHWEST THURSDAY EVENING. A 
LOW LEVEL JET NEAR 50 KTS WILL RESULT IN PEAK MOISTURE ADVECTION 
AROUND 06Z. WE WILL LIKELY SEE A LULL IN THE PRECIP AROUND 12Z AS 
THE ISENTROPIC LIFT AND THETA-E ADVECTION EXIT. 500 MB VORTICITY 
ADVECTION AND 300 MB DIFFLUENCE WILL BRING ADDITIONAL SHOWERS FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON...WITH FROPA COMING AROUND 00Z. THERE IS ALSO SOME SLIGHT 
MIDLEVEL COOLING...WHICH LOWERS THE LIFTED INDEX TO NEAR ZERO. THE 
NAM SHOWS A NEGATIVE SURFACE-BASED LI...WHILE THE GFS IS SLIGHTLY 
POSITIVE AND MORE ELEVATED. PREFER THE MORE STABLE GFS...AND WILL 
CARRY ONLY A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS IN THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL 
VALLEY IN THE AFTERNOON. POPS LOWER THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH NO 
PRECIP MENTIONED BY SATURDAY MORNING.

THE JET STREAM STAYS NEARLY STATIONARY FROM THE RED RIVER VALLEY 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND INTO NEW ENGLAND...SO THERE IS NOT MUCH 
COLD AIR TO PUSH INTO THE AREA ON SATURDAY. HIGHS WILL BE 15-20 
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL...IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S. AS THE UPPER TROUGH 
DEEPENS AND THE JET BEGINS TO MOVE EAST...ANOTHER LOW DEVELOPS OVER 
THE LOUISIANA COAST ON SUNDAY. THIS LOW TRACKS NORTHEAST AND UP THE 
APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS ON SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY. THE GFS HAS TRENDED 
SLOWER WITH THIS SYSTEM...CLOSER TO THE ECMWF. PUSHED POPS BACK TO A 
SLIGHT CHANCE AFTER MIDNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS 
AROUND 00Z MONDAY. THE SYSTEM DEPARTS BY MONDAY MORNING...AND THE 
AIR MASS BEHIND WILL ONLY LOWER TEMPS TO A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EST WED JAN 3 2007

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)... 
IN THE SHORT TERM...SATELLITE SHOWS BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE/CLOUDS
SPREADING NORTH ACROSS GEORGIA IN RESPONSE TO INCREASING SOUTHERLY
WINDS BEHIND EXITING SURFACE HIGH. MESO-NAM DEPICTS THE MOISTURE
FAIRLY WELL NEAR THE 925MB LEVEL. THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL
SPREAD MAINLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA PRODUCING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES AT CHA AND PLATEAU
OVERNIGHT.

RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL MOVE
EAST ALLOWING A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE TO MOVE EAST NORTHEAST 
FROM NORTHERN MEXICO TO ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES THURSDAY
AND FRIDAY. BOUNDARY LAYER JET WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THURSDAY WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT SPREADING INTO THE REGION
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. END RESULT...LIGHT RAINFALL WILL SPREAD 
INTO THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY AFTERNOON.

THICKNESS WILL REMAIN UNSEASONABLY WARM THROUGH THURSDAY WITH MILD
DAYS AND COOL NIGHTS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT EXTENDING THROUGH A DEEPER LAYER WILL 
WORK THEIR WAY INTO THE AREA FROM THE SOUTHWEST THURSDAY EVENING. A 
LOW LEVEL JET NEAR 50 KTS WILL RESULT IN PEAK MOISTURE ADVECTION 
AROUND 06Z. WE WILL LIKELY SEE A LULL IN THE PRECIP AROUND 12Z AS 
THE ISENTROPIC LIFT AND THETA-E ADVECTION EXIT. 500 MB VORTICITY 
ADVECTION AND 300 MB DIFFLUENCE WILL BRING ADDITIONAL SHOWERS FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON...WITH FROPA COMING AROUND 00Z. THERE IS ALSO SOME SLIGHT 
MIDLEVEL COOLING...WHICH LOWERS THE LIFTED INDEX TO NEAR ZERO. THE 
NAM SHOWS A NEGATIVE SURFACE-BASED LI...WHILE THE GFS IS SLIGHTLY 
POSITIVE AND MORE ELEVATED. PREFER THE MORE STABLE GFS...AND WILL 
CARRY ONLY A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS IN THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL 
VALLEY IN THE AFTERNOON. POPS LOWER THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH NO 
PRECIP MENTIONED BY SATURDAY MORNING.

THE JET STREAM STAYS NEARLY STATIONARY FROM THE RED RIVER VALLEY 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND INTO NEW ENGLAND...SO THERE IS NOT MUCH 
COLD AIR TO PUSH INTO THE AREA ON SATURDAY. HIGHS WILL BE 15-20 
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL...IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S. AS THE UPPER TROUGH 
DEEPENS AND THE JET BEGINS TO MOVE EAST...ANOTHER LOW DEVELOPS OVER 
THE LOUISIANA COAST ON SUNDAY. THIS LOW TRACKS NORTHEAST AND UP THE 
APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS ON SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY. THE GFS HAS TRENDED 
SLOWER WITH THIS SYSTEM...CLOSER TO THE ECMWF. PUSHED POPS BACK TO A 
SLIGHT CHANCE AFTER MIDNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS 
AROUND 00Z MONDAY. THE SYSTEM DEPARTS BY MONDAY MORNING...AND THE 
AIR MASS BEHIND WILL ONLY LOWER TEMPS TO A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST WED JAN 3 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID 
ATLANTIC STATES...WITH TEMPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ACTUALLY CLOSE 
TO NORMAL THIS MORNING. THIS WILL CHANGE AS SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS 
ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS HIGH TODAY...BRINGING WARMER TEMPS AND 
HIGHER DEWPOINTS INTO THE REGION FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. IN 
FACT...MIN TEMPS SHOULD BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER EACH SUCCESSIVE 
NIGHT AS THE DEWPOINTS RISE. LATEST GFS AND NAM MODEL RUNS ARE IN 
BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE PROGRESSION AND TRACK OF THE NEXT LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER TEXAS TONIGHT. RAIN SHOULD BEGIN TO 
SPREAD NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY...AS 
ISENTROPIC LIFT STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM. A STRONG UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLDER AIR 
ALOFT BRINGING LIS CLOSE TO ZERO. THUS...WILL MENTION OF A CHANCE 
FOR THUNDER LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING. THIS UPPER 
TROUGH IS PROGGED TO PUSH MOST OF THE RAIN OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA 
BY FRIDAY NIGHT. 

UPPER-LEVEL FLOW REMAINS SOUTHWESTERLY INTO THE WEEKEND...WITH 
UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE. IN FACT...TEMPS 
SHOULD BE AROUND TWENTY DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL ON SATURDAY AHEAD OF A 
WEAK COLD FRONT. GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT AN ACTIVE SOUTHERN JET 
STREAM WILL QUICKLY BRING ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEAST BY LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.

AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE 
FORECAST PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE.

AS EARLY AS LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND RAISE TO LIKELY EVERYWHERE 
LATER THURSDAY EVENING. CONCERNING TEMPS GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE BLEND EXCEPT FOR THURSDAY NIGHT MINS WHICH APPEARED TO BE 
SEVERAL DEGREES TOO COOL.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SOUTHWEST FLOW AND ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE THROUGH THE EXTENDED. THREE PRECIP 
PRODUCING FEATURES SHOULD BE REALIZED THROUGH THE PERIOD. THE FIRST 
IS DEPARTING AND WEAKENING SYSTEM ON FRIDAY. THE NEXT IS A 
RELATIVELY ZONAL DAMPENING SHORT WAVE THAT MOVES FROM THE MID MS RVR 
VLY TO THE SOUTHERN OH RVR VLY ON SAT BRINGING A CHANCE OF PCPN SAT 
AND SAT EVE FAVORING THE NORTHERN MRX CWA. THE THIRD IS A SHORT WAVE 
AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE TROUGH MOVING NE FROM THE LWR MS RVR VLY TO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON SUN NGT/MON MORN. TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM 
IN QUESTION BUT BEST PCPN CHC APPEARS EARLY MON.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EST TUE JAN 2 2007

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS AND EXTENDING EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL SOME LINGERING CLOUDS ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY THAT ARE TRAPPED AGAINST THE APPALACHIANS UNDER A MID-LEVEL 
INVERSION. THINK THAT THESE CLOUDS SHOULD BE SLOW TO ERODE THIS 
MORNING...SINCE VERTICAL MIXING WILL BE LIGHT. THUS...WILL MENTION 
DECREASING CLOUDINESS IN ALL ZONES FOR TODAY. UNSEASONABLY WARM 
CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL 
DAYS...AS ZONAL FLOW ALOFT KEEPS COLD ARCTIC AIR WELL NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. GFS AND NAM MODELS INDICATE SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES 
WITH THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM PROGGED TO DEVELOP ACROSS TEXAS ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. FOR NOW...WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO 
MODEL SOLUTIONS BY BRINGING RAIN INTO THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST ON THURSDAY. GFS MODEL INDICATES SOME SLIGHTLY NEGATIVE 
LIS ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY NIGHT WITH THE APPROACH 
OF AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW. THUS...WILL PLAN TO MENTION A CHANCE FOR 
TSTORMS ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY NIGHT. 

THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SHOULD EXIT THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY... 
WITH THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW REMAINING SOUTHWESTERLY. AS A RESULT... 
UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE INTO THE WEEKEND WITH 
TEMPS AROUND TWENTY DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL BY SATURDAY. GFS MODEL 
INDICATES THAT AN ACTIVE SOUTHERN JET STREAM WILL BRING ANOTHER LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM INTO THE REGION BY SUNDAY.

AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE 
FORECAST PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE.
